reviews.author: Carlson Z.
reviews.description: We booked the whiskey tour for $15 per person and had a great time on a lazy Sunday afternoon. Our tour guide was incredibly knowledgeable and was able to answer all our questions. I felt like I got a lot out of the tour and now have a basic grasp of how whiskey is made.   The distillery is pretty small and they currently sell bourbon and gin as their bread and butter, both of which you'll get to sample at the end of the tour. Highly recommended to check it out as it's just a fun atmosphere.

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: The best whiskey tour I have been on!   I booked a tour to surprise my boyfriend. When we arrived, the place didn't have electricity or AC due to an electrical issue in the area.   Rather than cancel, they treated us to some complementary drinks to make up for the electrical and AC issue.   The staff was very friendly, professional, and turned a bad situation into a very fun and amazing time. Couldn't have imagined it being any better!   The guide was very knowledgeable, the tour was insightful, and the tasting at the end was great! Go support this local Austin business!

reviews.author: Mikhael W.
reviews.description: Our guide was pretty freaking awesome. I don't remember her name but she was a pretty red head with cool tattoos. I'm a tequila girl so I wasn't too eager to learn how gin and bourbon are made, but she really had my attention the entire time!   We were in a group of 10 which was just right. Everyone could get a few questions in if they wanted...laid back...chill...ITS AUSTIN!  Now, to the best part....and boy I was a bit disappointed. I've been on several tours in distilleries and the tasting at the end could get you about 2 shots away from tipsy. Typically there are about 4 samples....1.5-2 ounces each.....  Here....there were 2 samples with 1.5 ounces TOTAL!  I know all they do is gin and bourbon but can a SISTA have a bit more?! The tour is around $15pp, but I'd be happy to pay the standard $30-$40 for a tad bit more licka.    The gin and bourbon are still yummy!  Get a cocktail.....The old fashioned will have you stumbling!

reviews.author: Tony P.
reviews.description: Good austin outdoor spot. Came here for Sunday drag brunch bingo.Good time and the drag host was pretty funny and friendly. Dog friendly. Got an old fashioned for 6 bucks so that was a solid deal. Didn't get any good but it looked like a bunch of fried options which my friends seemed to enjoy. It was about 60% full on a Sunday afternoon. I will say that the music was way too loud during the bingo so that made it hard to talk. Outside of bingo, the volume was fine. Overall I'd recommend it. If not, St Elmo brewing is next door.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: So, we decided to just stick with tasting their liquor instead of getting drinks. They don't have tasting flights, but they do have an option to order a taste of any of their liquors for $2 each. That's not bad at all. We were able to taste the whiskey and gin. The two year whiskey was the winner. I did see some yummy cocktails that I would love to try in the near future.   They have inside and outside seating. The outside patio has a cover for shade, but you do have areas where you can get sun   There's a food truck on site.   Parking is available on site, but shared with the other businesses. For those that want to make an afternoon or day out of your visit, the other businesses are all drink or food related.

reviews.author: Katie S.
reviews.description: Maybe the Bummer and Lazarus distillery on treasure island in San Francisco has bumped my taste in gin up a bit, but this place was pretty alright.  Considering they only have one gin, I think this place is still workin on it. I didn't try the whiskey so that's probably what this place hits outta the park.

reviews.author: Mark J.
reviews.description: Wow.. I have tried a number of Texas whiskeys and while they are all pretty good, they tend to have quite a bite since they don't have time to age. Still Austin has one of the smoothest Texas whiskeys I have had. They also have a nice gin. Their tap room is nice and the staff was great.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: Employees are friendly and extremely knowledgeable about their products.  Knowing very little about the best ways to drink whiskey, I really appreciated the education they gave me and the ideas.  I absolutely love their Straight Bourbon Whiskey!

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: Really great atmosphere. Cute decor. They have their own made gin and bourbon and offer $2 tasters of each.

reviews.author: Malinda F.
reviews.description: Still one of our favorite outdoor hang outs!! But have to like gin or bourbon  Bearded guy food truck had awesome snacks!

reviews.author: Ken M.
reviews.description: We enjoyed the whiskey tour and the group agrees it was the best and most knowledged guide, Jason, and presentation we have seen.  Very educational despite having toured many others.   Very exciting to have Still here in Austin and the gin and whiskey's were all great.  Can't wait to try their newest creations.

reviews.author: Cynthia D.
reviews.description: Wow. This place is making some serious showstopper whiskey. Buttery and caramely and ever so lightly sweet, it's so satisfying to sip on this while listening to my vinyl collection, which I've decided is my latest "thing."  They are currently running a live music series, which is how I became aware of them -- they often do cool giveaways with samples to promote local musicians.

reviews.author: Kory C.
reviews.description: My wife and I have been on many of the Bourbon Trail tours in Kentucky, so we know what a "good" tour looks like. Jason did an excellent job of showing us around the distillery, while providing great details of the distilling process. While Still Austin knows it isn't a mega distillery, it embraces that and makes the tour and experience feel personalized. We were able to sample several different whiskeys and one gin, and we even sampled a few unreleased items, which were all very good. My wife and I would recommend this tour to everyone. Thanks Still Austin for a great experience!

reviews.author: Bethany S.
reviews.description: Still Austin is my favorite Texas bourbon, the distillery and tasting room did not disappoint. Take the tour of the distillery with Jason. He's super fun and informative. Fantastic drinks in the tasting room!

reviews.author: Rishma P.
reviews.description: This is our usual hangout spot with our friends and we love it! It's a chill spot where you can have a drink, eat great food and it's not too overcrowded. However our experience today was really disappointing and it was simply based of the service provided. I wish I got the gentleman's name because he was awesome and his drinks were well balanced. There was a female bartender who made the drinks extremely sweet and when we asked to have them remade, she was extremely rude and confrontational in her demeanor. The other male bartender took it upon himself to remake our drinks and when he tasted what she had served us, he also agreed with the taste being off. Kindness goes a long way and I wish she adopted a more graceful attitude.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: Cool establishment with great product, be careful of glass containers purchased a bottle to bring home and shattered in Transportation. Not sure if it was specific to the containers they used as other bottles purchased from other distilleries did not.

reviews.author: Markeisha T.
reviews.description: This was a hidden gem. Loved the scenery. They have a food truck, everything done electronic through the QR code. Drinks were amazing you can tell they like there product.

reviews.author: Spencer S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed the tour and the opportunity to not only sample Still Austin bourbon and gin, but to try it in various mixed drinks.  Barbara is incredibly knowledgeable and enthusiastic as a tour guide and in her knowledge of the product. The home town feel of the staff coupled with the loyalty to their state and region in all of their ingredients and products is outstanding.    I highly recommend Still Austin bourbon and gin!

reviews.author: Laura A.
reviews.description: Great brunch with cocktails and phenomenal food! No food pics because we scarfed it down!  The Queen Mary cocktail will change your life.

reviews.author: Shannon D.
reviews.description: Take the tour!  Really informative and a lot of fun.  Cocktails were amazing.  Fun atmosphere too.

reviews.author: Charles M.
reviews.description: Great local distillery. Enjoyable spirits and a great atmosphere with even better people. Do yourself a favor and check them out!!

reviews.author: T. M.
reviews.description: We went for a "comedy" event and beers. 3 beers to choose from and we weren't impressed.  The comedian they brought in tried to pass off self- loathing, sexually disgusting monolog as comedic humor. Someone please tell him he's not funny in the slightest. The staff are not at all personable. This place doesn't even rise to the dive bar level.  Pop a Natural Light at home and you'll have a better time.

reviews.author: Shari F.
reviews.description: Great little place! Good conversation, good drinks, and great prices too. I look forward to visiting again. Thanks!

reviews.author: Jack G.
reviews.description: I've been going to this awesome little distillery for years. Great staff. Great outdoor and indoor space to just chill. My only issue is their recent partnership with Forrest Rogness to brew beer. Not only has he failed in the past, he is a disgusting human being.   Come for the spirits, cocktails, and atmosphere. Avoid the beer.   Love this place!!!!!

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: Wanted to try something new yesterday and decided to give this place a shot. We drove up to a small manufactured building and the end of a street  with some questionable establishments nearby.  Just inside of the building is a simple bar and small seating area. The employees are friendly and offer us tastings. We try each of their three offerings: silver rum, Pecan Street Rum, and their whiskey. I can't say I have discerning taste when it comes to rum or whiskey but I enjoyed them.  We ordered three cocktails from their menu (drinks are $6 each or 3 for $15) and took them to their back seating area. It was very no frills and reminiscent of a garage or basement man cave, with old leather sofas and a dart board. The drinks were all really tasty and could definitely be dangerous. We saw that they included generous pours for the liquor yet we could barely taste the alcohol.  We only remained at the distillery for about a half hour because there wasn't much else to do there. No food and no outdoor seating.  Not a bad place to go if you want to grab a couple of drinks and patronize a local distillery but if they'd like to keep customers there longer, the owners will have to invest in helping create more of an experience.

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Driving up we questioned going in but we're happy we did. Excellent drinks and very friendly staff.   We got to sample a silver rum, pecan street rum and whisky: all were delicious.   Not much to say about this place as we were only a guest of theirs for 30 minutes, didn't feel like a place we could spend a afternoon.  Worth checking out if in the area but wouldn't drive an hour to get there.   5 stars on the quality of the drinks and friendly staff, loosing one star for the man cave feel. We would go back if in the area.

reviews.author: Linda C.
reviews.description: Found this gem online and made a day trip. the distillery has limited hours, but are very accommodating to meet you for a sale. Michael was very helpful and informative on the phone, as well as at the distillery. Bought the Pecan Rum and Single Malt Whiskey. The rum was made into a American Dreamsicle, a recipe on the website with additional tips from Michael onsite. Excellent. Looking forward to enjoying the whiskey. Great service, great product

reviews.author: James L.
reviews.description: Spirit of Texas Distillery in Pflugerville, Tx My wife had a "Bold Fashioned" 2 star out of 5 It needs something creamy or sweet to bring it together. It completely burries the whiskey. However, the coffee flavor is out of nowhere and sticks out like a soar thumb.  I had the Spirit of Texas Pfluger Single Malt Whiskey  3 star out of 5 stars Had it neat, they don't serve it in a  Glencairn so if you're a noser, bring your own. It's a much better mixer whiskey than it is neat in my opinion. However, I did get about a 3oz pour so... Booya! (The picture is after I drank about 3/4's of it, lol)  Also tried their "famous" Pecan street rum, not a big fan of rum but this was actually decent. Given the choice I wouldn't buy it for myself but I would drink it if offered.  The distillery itself was tiny with not many places to sit. Even their tasting room was mostly a few couches with only a few tables. With that said, it was quite cute and had quazi sports bar vibe.   The staff was friendly and very happy to let us sample and make suggestions based on our tastes.   Overall, I'd come back.

reviews.author: Niki K.
reviews.description: Honestly, I'm disappointed in this place. My hubs and I went for the first time here to see a comedy tour which the distillery hosted. The place itself is very small and decent enough- definitely no frills of any kind. They were hosting the comedy tour which was being held outside in their backyard space but they didn't have any of the tables and chairs set up for the patrons. Ppl were grabbing the picnic tables and moving them over to the stage...like shouldn't mngmt have done that ahead of time?? As far as their whiskey and rum, we did not care for it at all. After the reviews, I guess I just expected more. We kept trying it in different types of drinks and it just tasted like cheap stuff. Not to mention their prices! We had exactly 6 mixed drinks. Our tab was $70 before tip. That's $11.50 a drink! Y'all, this place is backwoods Pfluggerville not the dang Domain! I pay $11-$13 for my drinks at the Domain. So, $11.50 for this place was ridiculous. We will definitely not be back. And if you see an advertisement for the comedy tour- skip it. The first comedian was not very good (he had a whole table walk out and leave during his performance. Ouch.), the 2nd was decent but not in any way worth a $70 bar tab.

reviews.author: Gage R.
reviews.description: The employees are very friendly and fun to chat with. The liquor is excellent. The cocktails are creative and delicious. The lounge area is relaxing and comfy. On top of all that, the prices are surprisingly chill.  If you live in Pflugerville and enjoy alcohol, this is a place you need to visit.

reviews.author: Troy W.
reviews.description: A cool small business that just started to slang beers in addition to signature cocktails, Best whiskey in Texas (not my opinion, but fact). I heard a woman say that the drink she ordered NEEDS to be advertised as the cure for the common cold. Huge outdoor venue with a stage. Super friendly staff.

reviews.author: Christopher W.
reviews.description: My girlfriend tried to surprise me for my birthday weekend by taking me to your location in which she double checked your hours on yelp prior to arriving. When we were walking up the steps we noticed that there was an open sign lite up and when we walked in the bar tender said they have to close for an hour because he is the only one there and needs to help the band setup..... sounds like poor planning on the managements side. He said someone keeps changing their hours on Yelp but not sure about that hmm. Anyways he invited us back to see the show at 7 as they open back up for that, but was looking to have a drink and not be drowned out by a loud band. Maybe we will try your place again some time .....

reviews.author: Derek S.
reviews.description: My rating only speaks to the liquor itself. My in-laws went in and were raving of their distillery experience when they walked into my house. My wife's uncle dropped a bottle of single-malt whiskey on my counter and I decided to pour a neat glass after I poured 3 others for my guests. I really let this whiskey sit on the back of my tongue and savored the flavor. This is hands down the best whiskey I have ever had. I am more of a blended whiskey guy but the sweetness of this whiskey is absolutely perfect. I have my mixing whiskey, but this is definitely my sipping whiskey. There is definitely a strong vanilla taste going on with chocolate, but finishes hard with a good wood. Since having it, I am trying to find a way to get in there and pay my respects, but his review will have to do for now.

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: This a very cool place with a cool vibe. My son, Mike Hershey, distills award-winning whiskey and rum there. He's also the bartender and he, along with the owner, are friendly and welcoming. They have Friday night events, often with food trucks. Check out their Facebook  page.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Great rum and whiskey! The whiskey is very complex (especially for only having aged for 2 years!) and I'm excited for the launch of their 4 year whiskey later this month! The rums are fantastic and unexpectedly smooth. Much love for this place and their drinks!

reviews.author: Amber E.
reviews.description: Awesome local hang out spot.  Amazing drinks and rotating food options (catering and food trucks).  Brand new stage with live music.  Family friendly and pet friendly.

reviews.author: Jack S.
reviews.description: This is a great little distillery where some really great spirits like Pfluger Single Malt Whiskey, Pecan Street Rum, and Straight Silver Rum are fermented, distilled, aged and bottled.   There is a cocktail bar where the spirits produced are used to create awesome mixed drinks. Usually, there is a really relaxed atmosphere with a lounge area, darts, shuffleboard and various kinds of music. Food trucks come on Fridays and there are live bands in the outdoor venue a few times a month. Sometimes, the distillery hosts special events for the public and also for private groups. Spirit of Texas Distillery is pet and family friendly.

reviews.author: Kim S.
reviews.description: First time here. Cutie little place. Nice rims and whiskeys. Was here for an event....sounds like they do a few throughout the course of the year.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: Exceptional staff, knowledgeable and personable, committed to making everyone's experience awesome.

reviews.author: Lucy S.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere with friendly and knowledgeable staff, Spirit of Texas is a fun time! The food truck out front is also delicious! It's a great little distillery that packs a lot of flavor

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow! I can't believe I forgot to review this place.  Drinks are great, atmosphere is chill. All outdoor seating but they have fans, fire pits, outdoor games and the owner has a ranch with cool animals next door.   A must see!

reviews.author: K S.
reviews.description: Good liquor and good atmosphere. As mentioned, plenty of space to spread out.   However, there's no simple way to just stop by to pick up a bottle. Even if you're not buying a mixed drink or anything that requires work other than handing you a bottle and paying for it you have to stand in the line that's serving cocktails and drinks.   Further, when you do get service, it's been rather dismissive the last few times we went. Expect to spend time there- no way to quickly pop in, grab merch and a bottle and leave.

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Took my second trip out to treaty oak and was not disappointed with the day spent here. Treaty Oak is the kind of place that you want to spend the entire day at, and you totally can! What I love about it too is that it's a massive space with so much to do while on the grounds. It even has a playground where the kids can play, and an indoor space with plenty of TVs to watch football on game day.  We started off with a tasting, which you can either do Gin or Whiskey. I actually highly recommend the tasting, it's only $10 a person but gives some great background on how each different flavor/bottle is created and made. You also can put the $10 towards a bottle if you end up wanting to buy one to take home.  We then went into the bar area and got drinks, which is a huge variety of cocktails! They have plenty of picnic tables, and multiple boards for cornhole on the grounds. The restaurant on site it BBQ and was amazing! We got the brisket sandwich and pork sandwich and loved them both. What I also loved about it, was that there's multiple places where you can get drinks, foods, etc. on the grounds but your tab stays open for everything. Love this place and highly recommend making a day trip out of it if you haven't been!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Here for a wedding reception. Top notch facility with top notch service. Bartenders were great! Exceptional craft cocktails all around. Catered BBQ was spot on.   Highly recommended for your special event. We'll be back for a visit.

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: A gem in the Hill Country area. Great outdoor seating with plenty of room for kids and adults to run around and play. Pet friendly.  We had the white sangria... which was just perfect for a summer afternoon with some brisket nachos that were yum yum yum! The kiddo had a blueberry lemonade with mac n cheese that disappeared in so little time. He couldn't stop exclaiming how good it was.  We'll definitely be back to try out the cocktail bar for a date night.  They didn't have live music but they were playing music of varying genre throughout the evening. Great way to relax and leave your stresses behind.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Treaty Oak Distillery in Dripping Springs is a great Texas distillery getting most things to make their bourbon and gin from around Texas. It has great covered patios and outdoor space throughout the property with a delicious restaurant- Alice's Restaurant, a tasting room, and a covered bar/lounge as well as an outdoor stage and small playground. We did the tour and tasting which allowed us to see the inner workings of the distillery. Cody was an excellent tour guide answering all our random questions as he showed us around the distillery. And I bought an old barrel, which I have wanted in my house for quite some time. I would highly recommend you get over there...today! Such a great time. Thanks Treaty Oak!!

reviews.author: David S.
reviews.description: I made a reservation weeks in advance for a tour at this distillery. When I arrived after a 3 hour flight and a 45 minute drive I notice everything is closed. When I call someone Answers and tells me in these exact words " we are closed today and we're refunding everyone there money" without any regard to anyone's time. Not professional at all completely ruined my day after planing our hole day around this.

reviews.author: Liana W.
reviews.description: I want to give this business a better review but unfortunately they had some major issues.  We went last weekend on Sunday and there was a sign to scan the QR code the for menu, we waited in a long line to order food, once everyone got to the cashier she told us that only the brunch menu was being served (it was like 2pm or something).   So everyone had to quickly change their order!   Talk about poor communication!! It should say on the menu very clearly what's being served.   Then, I tried to order vegetarian nachos but my cashier told me they were sold out of beans and that I should just get chips and queso instead, so I did. THEN my brother in law who ordered after me got his nachos which were vegetarian bean nachos (not meat like he ordered). I said "they told me they were sold out!" Again, bad communication.  Then, my brother in law ordered sangria and got a big pitcher, my dad went to order the same thing and they gave him HALF the size. So weird and confusing.   This place seems very confused internally and each worker seems to have their own message.  Also nothing for gluten-free vegans on the menu.

reviews.author: Lance O.
reviews.description: Does Heaven touch earth anywhere? There is a beautiful place in the Texas Hill Country where the grain meets glass and the bourbon is distilled on site alongside a menu that will make any true Texan proud.   Classic features paired perfectly with great service and a family friendly vibe. This is great might, great food and a little slice of Heaven here tonight in the Hill Country.

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Another great distillery to add to the list when in Dripping Springs! This place is huge and perfect for a group or date or even solo! So much space for you, your kids, and your dog! Bring the family! LoL  It was actually recommended to me at my last stop, and I love me some bourbon and whiskey so it was a no brainer. However, if bourbon isn't your thing they also have options for the gin, vodka and non alcoholic lovers in your group! Something for everyone I'd say!   That being said, I took off a star mostly because the line was stupid long. They definitely could have, and should have had more than just one single file line for us to get a drink, I spent half my time in line.   That being said though, once I got my drink and was able to enjoy the drink and the vibe it was great! They have live music and a restaurant if you get hungry and I ended up getting the day tripper drink! I loved it, it was so good. I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: I'm back home in FL whining about how upset I am that we can't just go to Treaty Oak anytime we want! :(   Seriously, grab your gang and head over to this literal farm full of whiskey and great BBQ. If you don't get the brisket nachos, you're making the biggest mistake of your life. But don't eat too much, or you'll be too full for the delicious drinks!   The vibe is relaxed, the food feels almost TOO good for the rustic setting and the live music is pure Texas charm. I could stay here all day!

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: The grounds are very nice. Plenty of room to spread out. Lots of picnic tables available in the shade. A playground. The food at the restaurant was pretty decent, if a little expensive. The staff inside the restaurant are very friendly, but it all seems very inefficient.  The reason for the 3 star review is really that both of the drinks we ordered were cocktails that are premade and then dispensed. They were....ok? A little too sweet and a lot too weak. I couldn't taste the whiskey/bourbon in either of them. For $9/drink at a distillery, I just expected better drinks made to order and I left feeling disappointed. If we had known the drinks we ordered were batch cocktails, we would have tried to order something else, but there was nothing on the menu to denote that.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: I headed out to Treaty Oak pretty reluctantly the other day. I'd been invited out there for a friends birthday and the idea of heading all the way to Dripping Springs on a hot Saturday afternoon to try bourbon (which in general all tastes like burning to me) wasn't really my idea of a great time. Man, I was wrong. First off, they have a wide selection of spirits, everything from gin and vodka to wine and beer. The setting is bucolic with wide open spaces and clusters of shade trees. A friendly staff, great bbq (try the brisket nachos) and some tasty signature cocktails (try the Pineapple Express) made for a great afternoon that turned into a lovely evening. Did I mention they also had live music? I will be back.

reviews.author: Shourjo D.
reviews.description: A really nice setup: good bbq and similar food offerings alongside their own whiskey and gin offerings.  Seriously, the cocktails are worth it, as is visiting the beautiful property and spending an afternoon there with friends.  Each time I've been, I've really enjoyed the Hill Country Dreaming cocktail.  Also, the root beer they make is delicious and will totally hit the spot on a hot day.

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: We love this place!  The drinks are always yummy and very innovative ideas - the frozen ones are my favorite!  And the FOOD!!!  My favorite item is the Cold Trio appetizer!  It is delicious!  But, the atmosphere is what is really cool!  It's spread out - dogs are welcome - and it's beautiful!  If you are in the area - you should definitely check it out!  If not, it's worth the drive!

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: If your looking for some outdoor patio vibes during this gorgeous spring weather then this is your place! Just about 30-40 minutes outside of Austin lies this beautiful distillery. There's so much space and more than enough seating but even on the weekends this place can get pretty busy. As for food you can expect Texas bbq from this place as I tried both the brisket and Turkey which were both very good. If your not a booze person they also have their own in house wines and beer but if you do like a good cocktail I'd recommend hill country dreaming. Im anticipating come back here to check this place out in the evening for some live music or Sunday brunch!

reviews.author: Hannah M.
reviews.description: CAN I LIVE HERE?! I am obsessed with this place. The restaurant had some of the best food I've ever eaten (their Mac is addictive) and all of the staff was amazing. Zach was our main server but they all work as a team so you were never once waiting around. The drinks were great, the bakery items were great and I think I've already said enough about the food. This is first on my list next time I'm in town!

reviews.author: Kaeleigh S.
reviews.description: The perfect spot for a sunny day hang, celebration activity, or date! We came for my best friend's bachelorette weekend and we are so glad we did!!   Parking was ample and so were the picnic tables! We didn't do a tour but put our name in for lunch at the restaurant, Alice's. It was about a thirty minute wait on a Saturday around 1, which really went unnoticed because we just grabbed drinks at the Cocktail Bar and sat in the open seating area until they called us saying it was ready. There was live music, lots of space and tables , cornhole, and you could go do a distillery tour too.   The bartenders were helpful in finding a gluten free drink option for me, as well as our waitress at Alice's. Our waitress was especially friendly and attentive--didn't get her name but a recent HS grad going to UT! She made sure to ask about gluten and dairy free options for me, and there were plentiful. Everyone devoured their food and were happily satisfied. I had a delicious club sandwich on gluten free bread with some salt and pepper chips. SO good. I also loved the white sangria.   All in all, I am so glad we found it and the bride said it was the perfect way to spend our day. We definitely will be back!

reviews.author: Riley C.
reviews.description: Very mediocre place.  There were unsupervised children running barefoot on tables, a bartender who gave me the worst drink in the books after I didn't ask for it, and a sorry excuse for aesthetic with old trucks and a fire pit. Also don't try the food, it's not good. Brisket tastes like it was smoked for 1 hour and nacho cheese was out of a can.

reviews.author: Denniz S.
reviews.description: The food, the cocktails (they are sooooo GOOD!!), the biggy canvas painting. I love it all. Treaty Oak is accommodating to everyone. We bring our toddler and she runs around on the playground while we eat and drink. They have sports on the TV inside a/ indoor dining. A tasting room and tons of outdoor seating.  If the weather is nice and we have friends in town treaty oak is an absolute obligatory stop.

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: If you look up the definition of 'hidden gem', you will see a picture of Crowded Barrell Whiskey and their Fang and Feather tasting room. Period.  What's the big deal you ask? Let me offer a few reasons to stop in:  - whiskey tasting flights of 4 for only $11   - also offering other gin or vodka mixed drinks  - great tasting room with some cool, historical architectural elements   - wonderful deck under the shady oaks to enjoy the quiet Hill Country ambiance  - for beer or wine lovers, they also offer those (and snacks) in an adjacent  building  So this is simply a great stop off the beaten path if you are headed out to the Hill Country or just want something different that is just down 1826.

reviews.author: Christina G.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem, tucked away in the hill country. This spot is funded and supported by crowdsourcing. Very cool concept. You'll more than likely have new products to sample every time you visit. There are flights and a great variety of coctails. Today, there were 5 whiskeys to pick from. Only outdoor seating. The scenic views are amazing. I recommend walking around and checking out the grounds.  Friendly service, great drinks and chill environment. I'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Eleanor C.
reviews.description: A little piece of heaven off the beaten path. Definitely stop in for an Eleanor New Fashioned! It's the best twist off a classic you'll ever have. These people are awesome!

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: We had a stop here on our dripping springs tour. If you like whiskey, this is the place for you. The whiskey tour itself wasn't that impressive, but you do get to taste whiskey right out of the barrel which is really cool.

reviews.author: Kevin S.
reviews.description: Absolutely fantastic. Had a private tasting with Daniel and Emma. Got to meet Rex, Fancy Dan, John and Brianna. One of the best days I've had. The whiskey is a bit young, but pretty good.

reviews.author: Kate R.
reviews.description: I'm gluten free so could not do a whisky sample. My husband did and enjoyed enough to buy a bottle. If you're not into whisky, there's a trailer on the property that serves beer, wine and some mixed drinks, plus snacks! Great outdoorbtables, lights, etc. Pretty

reviews.author: Marzio O.
reviews.description: This is really for Fang and Feather since the Distillery was closed when I went.  The Eleanors do NOT disappoint! Nor did the Black Walnut Cocktail mixed by the affable and amiable Richard.  I figured to spend about an hour or so but instead closed the joint down! The bourbon is delicious and as a Magnificent Bastard it was a real trip to find my name on the Wall of Magnificence.  The grounds are lovely and well worth wandering. If you get the chance to stop in and sample the whiskey you will NOT be disappointed! If you are a Magnificent Bastard, it is so much fun to see where our favorite videos are shot.  Alas, I couldn't finagle my way into the Vault! ;)

reviews.author: Jeremiah D.
reviews.description: Amazing pilgrimage to drink magnificently! I was in town for a work trip and had to visit the physical location where two of my favorite YouTube channels are recorded. The whiskey was delicious, the tasting room/patio didn't disappoint, and Daniel even spent some time chatting. Still blown away by the experience.

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: This is, quite simply, and awesome little place, nestled in an awesome little spot, surrounded by beautiful country, and serving awesome whiskey.  I had seen the videos on YouTube, and I had some time before my flight out of Austin, so I drove up on a Friday, had a cigar while I waited for the place to open (they have seating for cigar smoking on the porches!), and then sampled some of their wares.  It's excellent, and I really can't say more than that.  Try the whiskey neat, or in a drink - everything we tried was wonderful.

reviews.author: Kim M.
reviews.description: We spent an incredibly pleasant evening with co-owner Daniel, his wonderful wife Katie, bartender Emma and the wider team at Crowded Barrel this week. Delicious whiskies and cocktails, outstanding property which was both beautiful and comfortable. If you're able to make the trip you'll have a terrific time, and if you're a magnificent bastard you'll have the time of your life!

reviews.author: Grant M.
reviews.description: Everything about these guys is first rate!  The tasting experience, the education, the environment and most importantly, the Whiskey!   I hear they make good cocktails too if that's your thing.

reviews.author: Brent M.
reviews.description: We had a fantastic afternoon at crowded barrel. The bourbon is delicious and the cocktails are really good too. The property and the deck are beautiful with lots of seating. My favorite thing was the people though. So welcoming and friendly. Definitely check it out if you're a whiskey fan!

reviews.author: Jenny P.
reviews.description: Went there for a wedding was a very beautiful location, staff was great! We are from California and will definitely come back next time we are here in Austin!

reviews.author: R L.
reviews.description: Being a MB, it's not hard to imagine that I love this place and the people who make it happen. If anyone is curious about what joining the tribe looks like, check out the Whisky Vault and Whisky Tribe...it's a great group of people who love learning about and enjoying whiskey. Join us!  Crowded Barrel is nestled in the beautiful Hill Country of TX and we enjoy sitting on the deck and tasting what's up for the day. If you are curious and want to learn more about whiskey, you will enjoy this adventure.

reviews.author: K. B.
reviews.description: Great place off the beaten path located at the Wizard Academy.   Wonderful tree covered wood deck and gear drinks.

reviews.author: Charles G.
reviews.description: Found this jewel in the hill country Sunday and the place and patio are awesome!  The views are amazing and the bourbon was smooth.

reviews.author: Jon C.
reviews.description: First! Big fan of the whiskey vault. If I make down to the Austin area, I'll drop in for sure.

reviews.author: Christine Y.
reviews.description: I'm in love with Fierce Whiskers! The main interior tasting room and bar area is gorgeous with deep tones of dark blues, leather and wood textures, and moody lighting. The large glass doors open up to a spacious outdoor seating area. The drink menu is fairly priced with cocktails that allow you to taste their very own whiskey, gin, and rum. If you prefer straight whiskey, they have flights/tasting samplers you can ask about.  I loved the food truck parked in their lawn (Char ATX) with delicious yakitori (Japanese meat on skewers).  They have tours of their facilities which sound really interesting. I think those tours are about $15/person (please verify with Fierce Whiskers for most up-to-date pricing).  Good-sized parking lot  This place is a hidden gem. Drive past Meanwhile and head straight to Fierce Whiskers. ;-)

reviews.author: Joanna S.
reviews.description: Super excited about what's going on here and what's to come! We visited while in ATX for our anniversary. Sophie gave us an incredible tour of the distillery. She was excellent and we learned a lot! The interior of the main tasting room is so beautiful and well thought-out with details we learned from the tour. The drinks were superbly made and delicious. Definitely will be back when visiting in the future :)

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: Came here for a distillery tour and stayed to enjoy the taproom. The tour is $15 and includes a tasting. Fair warning their whiskey is new aged and won't be ready to be bottled for sale for another 2+ years. This made the tasting a littleeeee rough, but I learned a lot about whiskey so it was worth it. The tasting room is really nice and they have a great cocktail list - standard and seasonal. They host events regularly and there is a food truck on site.

reviews.author: Heeteak C.
reviews.description: This is the first time this place. Cool tour and awesome bar. Still getting thing ready for full on bourbon sell but theyvhave a lot of great drinks. Must come by and experience it.

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: Very cool new spot! I went on the tour and learned so much! They are using state of the art, green distilling techniques that were super interesting to learn about. Beautiful interior and on a beautiful plot of land for outdoor drinking. And Great cocktails of course!

reviews.author: Matthew N.
reviews.description: Such a cool local Austin spot. Disappointed I have to wait 3 -4 more years to buy a bottle. If you are looking for something different to do go check it out!

reviews.author: Linda H.
reviews.description: I have never felt more minimized for being a woman, more reduced. Standing next to blacked out men (drunk), being cut off told I'm raising my voice for simply responding. While I'm four drinks behind. This place is the definition of Trump Texas. It's disgusting!!

reviews.author: Yer M.
reviews.description: My friends and I did a tour. Sophie was an awesome guide and I learned a lot. Thanks!

reviews.author: Lesley R.
reviews.description: Great way to spend an afternoon with family, friends and loved ones. Informed tour guide, great history and amazing cocktails.

reviews.author: Ari D.
reviews.description: What a great find! Drinks are tasty, beautiful space and very friendly staff. I recommend the Marshmallow World, feels like the holidays!

reviews.author: Makenzie E.
reviews.description: We went for a tour and had a great time! Sofia was our tour guide and was very informative. The distillery was very clean and the bar area was very nicely decorated. The bartenders were excellent and helped us with drink recommendations. I absolutely recommend coming out here!! Will be back!!

reviews.author: Shea B.
reviews.description: Went on the whiskey tour and our guide was great, awesome place! We had a great time and will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Thep T.
reviews.description: New distillery in Austin proper. We did a tour of the facility, sampled some whiskey and rye. Worth checking out before they full open with cocktail bar and picnic grounds

reviews.author: John D.
reviews.description: We had a great tour with Sophie. We got to hear all about the distillery's history, as well as its future. Definitely a must do in S. Austin!

reviews.author: Rachel B.
reviews.description: I love Whiskey and my wife mentioned we needed to check out Fierce Whiskers. Harry was so knowledgeable and going through the whole process was so interesting. The alcohol is good and I am excited to see how the product changes. Check out Fierce Whiskers. Do the tour, have a drink and enjoy the nice place. They also have a Yakitori truck. We will check that out next time.

reviews.author: Justin P D.
reviews.description: Sophie was an amazing host  + beautiful facility and tasting room! Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Kristoffer K.
reviews.description: From pick up, to drop off the experience was phenomenal! Spacious, clean, and comfortable. An unplanned stop to provide a bathroom break before arriving at our destination was provided upon our request and was greatly appreciated. We ended up losing one of our group and our Driver allowed us to wait and look for them. Additionally, a phone was lost in the furniture and again our Driver provided concern, patience, and assistance in order to retrieve the seemingly stuck device. I have now ridden with this service three times and every time has been beyond excellent.

reviews.author: Julia F.
reviews.description: We used ThunderDome over this past Memorial Day Weekend and had a fantastic experience. Daniel was incredible to work with. He was quick to provide a quote and answer any questions leading up to our trip, and was early to pick us up. 38 of us fit comfortably in the 40 person bus along with all of our belongings. The bus was clean, speakers were great, and Daniel truly went above and beyond for our group. We'll definitely be using ThunderDome for all of our future trips!

reviews.author: Traci S.
reviews.description: Daniel was awesome!  Right from the start he was quick to respond with a quote, details, etc.  Easy to work with and has the little extras like coolers, ice, waters, etc. that went above and beyond.  He was prompt, professional, a safe driver, accommodating and just an overall solid guy.  Would highly recommend for a group large or small!

reviews.author: Kristie L.
reviews.description: AMAZINGGGGG SERVICE! We looked into several party buses around the Austin area and compared quotes. Daniel beat everyone's price AND provided ice and cups when that didn't even cross our minds! THANK YOU THUNDERDOME SO MUCH FROM CAPITOL CHEVY! Definitely using your services in the future! The whole process was smooth, and overall satisfying!

reviews.author: Caitlyn L.
reviews.description: ThunderDome Party Bus was great - Daniel was knowledgeable, friendly and super easy to work with. Couldn't recommend him/ThunderDome enough!

reviews.author: Monika G.
reviews.description: I have used Daniel and ThunderDome Party Bus two years in a row and they are awesome! They're communication is reliable and fast. The morning of, he always calls to let you know he is on time and ask if there are any last minute questions. I've recommended his bus to all of my friends. Everyone has always enjoyed their experience!

reviews.author: Brielle A.
reviews.description: Probably the best quote I got in Austin, especially since the cost included everything we needed! They were even able to make two drop off locations for our party which was really awesome! My friends loved the inside of the bus and we had a great night out, will definitely use again in the future!

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: ThunderDome was awesome! Tony arrived on time and supplied exactly what we were told. He even helped us set up the Bluetooth system for us to play our music. The bus was clean, cool, and ready to party! We took it to a river float for my bachelorette party and it was perfect. Tony even stopped on the way home for a bathroom break. I will definitely book with ThunderDome the next time I need a party bus.

reviews.author: Christa E.
reviews.description: My group of 16 had an amazing time on the Thunderdome Party Bus! Daniel was super accommodating, easy to work with, and a genuinely nice guy. I highly recommend this company for your next group night out. Tip: Go ahead and book an extra hour to whatever you think you'll need - you won't want to get off at the end of the night, it's that much fun!

reviews.author: Maggie S.
reviews.description: We wanted to book a party bus to do a distillery tour. I did not have a lot of information on the distilleries and Daniel was incredibly helpful when figuring out where we should go. We had 19 people on the bus and we had SO much fun. The bus was super clean, Daniel was great and we had the best time. We originally had the bus for 5 hours but Daniel was nice enough to let us add an additional hour to our trip for just a small charge. I would recommend ThunderDome Party Bus to anyone.   We definitely want to plan another trip in the summertime to go floating.  Thanks Daniel!!!

reviews.author: Angelie E.
reviews.description: I booked thunderdome party bus to take a big group of us to float the river. The bus was on time, and even made accommodations to pick up a second group at a different stop. The bus itself was spacious and clean, and everyone had an awesome time! Once we were done floating, the bus conveniently picked us up at the exit of the river. I would highly recommend Thunderdome for big group parties.

reviews.author: Martin G.
reviews.description: This review is long overdue.  I booked the Thunderdome Party Bus for a bachelor party back in May 2017.  The bus was perfect!! Seated our group of 15 comfortably.  The stereo system was bumping, and Daniel, our amazing driver, had no issue with us turning it up to 11.  Our group was most guys in their 30's and Daniel gave us good recommendations on spots to check out that were age appropriate.  In between spots, Daniel drove me to a gas station to help me restock on beer. He even came in and helped me carry and load beers into the coolers.  Great communicate from Daniel from beginning to end, and he someone found the perfect spot to pick us up on busy Rainey St at the end of the night.   Great value and great experience.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Fana T.
reviews.description: Great sotol, hip environment, nice and clean. Kelsey our server was lovely, will come back for the river Rita next time.

reviews.author: Jill C.
reviews.description: First time trying Sotol, and there wasn't a cocktail on the menu that wasn't incredibly delicious. We sat outside in the lovely fall weather, enjoyed some acoustic tunes by a talented duo with a female vocalist, and tried several cocktails -- all of which we enjoyed. My friend tried the frozen Bartender's Choice which was like a frozen apple cinnamon cocktail, and I tried the Comanchero, the Yipping Coyote, and the Rugged Flower. Each were so smooth and well-balanced. This place not only makes a flavorful Sotol with a smooth, clean finish but transforms it into mouth-watering mixology masterpieces!   Aside from the bus loads of out-of-town tourists who looked like they were part of an Instagram filter for an "Ashley/Ashleigh" compilation (complete with brimmed hat, scarf, and boots), this place is a must-visit if you're in Austin. Couple it with a trip to nearby Fredericksburg and you've got yourself an amazing day!

reviews.author: Mahesh P.
reviews.description: This is their Sotol Tasting Room. Which may not seem all that great, but boy howdy, is it ever! They've got their sotol, of course, but also a whole bunch of (sotol and other) cocktails, food, and a pretty cool outdoor space with plenty of place to chill. Best of all, there's pretty much always some sort of musician doing their thing (this *is* Austin after all!)  If only it wasn't a decent drive away....

reviews.author: Rosario F.
reviews.description: My friend who knows all the hot spots invited me here during the stricter COVID times. It's a heck of a drive but I was really impressed with how lovely this place is. Very Instagramable location with the truck outside and the silo.   PARKING I went when it was pretty busy. I found parking but I did have to wait for like 5 minutes so cars could clear the road. It gets pretty tight once the parking spots are all full. It's all free. A lot of cars parked on the road. Just be careful crossing the road.   FOOD When I was here they only had one food truck. The options were limited. The prices were a bit too high for the food options available. I didn't try it out. My friends ordered a few things and they felt the food was just ok. I'm not sure on the current food status here.   AMBIANCE  They only had outdoor seating when I was here because of COVID. I sat on the covered outdoor seating which was great since it was around summertime. It was HOT! Really cute tables, friendly/helpful staff, and live music! I don't remember his name but there was a gentleman playing guitar and singing. He was fantastic!   DRINKS I ordered 3 drinks. The first two were the Comanchero and the third was The Copperhead. I'm glad I stopped there. They are strong!   I'm giving it four stars because I felt like the size of the drinks didn't coincide with their prices. I hope I get to stop by here again. It's a bit of a drive for me. It's a really beautiful drive though. Keep kicking butt y'all! I want to try everything!!

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Finally decided to take a day trip down to dripping springs and had to finally stop at Desert Door. To start, this place is designed so beautifully. I wish I could steal the décor and put it into my own home. Both the inside and out were so inviting, I don't know how someone could go and not spend hours enjoying the ambiance, food, and drinks. What I thought was so cool about Desert Door was that they educated you on what you were drinking and the history of Sotol. What I did not know, is that they are actually the only Sotol distillery in the US.  We started off with the Sotol flight, and two drinks. Although we did enjoy tasting the Sotol by itself, it was a lot to start the afternoon off with! We also ordered the The Copperhead (my personal favorite of the day), the River Rita, and the Sotol'd Fashioned. I loved each drink but the copperhead was definitely the star of the day, which was a Sotol version of an espresso martini. They also have a food truck on site serving out very unique food. We ordered the tacos and vegan "queso" and both really surprised us by how unique and amazing it was. We loved this trip out to Desert Door, and will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Corianne O.
reviews.description: Honestly great environment. Good drinks AND live music. So much fun. Really loved the drinks and the tequila. Nicole gave us our drinks and she had the absolute best service. If you can request her, I would. 10/10 experience.

reviews.author: Deborah C.
reviews.description: So glad we stopped by Desert Door on our way to a Getaway cabin.  The mixed drinks are on point! The entire staff were so friendly. Cozy/desert vibe inside! Huge outdoor covered area with plenty of picnic benches and  lounge seating.  I can't remember who our server was but she was freakin awesome! She brought our pup a pupsicool (bone broth frozen pup treat) to keep cool and occupied lol. Pup also sported a DD bandanna : )  We didn't order any food from the food truck, but appreciated the option to order quick bites.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: I'm generally not a huge fan of tasting rooms and find them gimmicky and far from truly experiencing the spirit of the spirit. See what I did there.   But every rule has its exception, or exceptional. Desert Door is a destination in itself. Beautiful southwestern interiors and stylish furniture. The space is cozy but didn't feel crowded, though every table was full. They do have a large patio for outdoor seating and bigger groups.   Now, the sotol. I had never heard of it and didn't know what to expect. The best way I can describe it is an agave spirit, clear, between a vodka and a tequila in its thickness/smoothness. In plain English, it's delicious.   We did the tasting flight, which was a great way to get introduced to a new spirit, followed by a round of cocktails. The cocktails were excellent and reasonably priced.   They also had a lovely food truck on site but we didn't have enough time to try it.

reviews.author: Meaghan S.
reviews.description: Ended up at Desert Door after a lunch at Saltlick. Doot, the host, got us seated right away at a cozy soft seating area outside. Great patio vibes: chill, mist fans going , and live music about to start. Inside is nice too, super clean and cute/trendy.   The sotol is great and their cocktails are delicious, as well as unique. Had a difficult time deciding which one to get but our attentive and extremely friendly waitress, Nicole strayed me the right way with the Comanchero. Hubs got the ranch water (served in a Topo Chico, gotta love that)!   Nicole our waitress and Erin the bartender are solid assets at this establishment! Thank y'all for a great Saturday afternoon!

reviews.author: CARLA B.
reviews.description: OMG!  Where do I start.  Stumbled across this gem riding to the Salt Lick in Driftwood.    Staff was great with explaining Sotols and provided amazing  recommendations.    The Sotol Flight is great.  My fav was the Gin forward Sotol as I have gravitated towards Gin in the last few months   Love band outside play with amazing indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Mckenna R.
reviews.description: OMG this place was something we happened to stumble upon and it is a Austin must! This is a great cocktail bar that is modern and very desert chic. We are so so happy we stopped here and will be buy thing their Stool back home to make our own delicious Palomas. Also whatever their berry cocktail is, is a must try.

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: Loved hanging out here! Meryl was absolutely amaizing and look after us really well.  She made the visit really enjoyable!

reviews.author: Shelly M.
reviews.description: Had an amazing hour enjoying sotol cocktails! Erin and Nicole are amazing. So glad we decided to stop in and can't wait to come back with friends! Facility is gorgeous and has a beautiful West Texas vibe. Can't wait to enjoy music on the porch!

reviews.author: Erin D.
reviews.description: Just left here with our crew! Here for a wedding and this place was recommended to us. It did not disappoint. Kelsey was the BEST waitress. She was so nice, helpful, and friendly. We all talked about her and how great she made our experience. The drinks were awesome and the vibe of the place is great. Highly recommend you come here! Be sure to request Kelsey for the best service!

reviews.author: Melissa M.
reviews.description: Our favorite spot in the Dripping Springs / Driftwood area. Obsessed with all the cocktails - specifically the comanchero. Obsessed with the interior decor  - please do my house next. Obsessed with all the servers - Nicole, Kelsey + Erin* are WONDERFUL. This place is the best!!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful, can't-miss distillery in Texas Hill Country!   We were absolutely shocked by how much we loved Sotol after trying it first as a standalone shot. And they sure know how to do a cocktail, too! I got the River Rita and it legit blew my mind.   Sit and stay awhile, listen to the live music on the patio and if you need to cool down, the interior is a WHOLE mood.   Be sure to visit their gift shop to buy an adorable handmade clay shotglass (SO CUTE) and a bottle of their famous Sotol.   The staff was also astoundingly friendly and the kind of people you want to hang out with.

reviews.author: Hannah K.
reviews.description: This place is great! Good food, great service, even better drinks. Kelsey was our server and she was so friendly and attentive! We'll definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Ang B.
reviews.description: I would give this place 10 stars if I could. Love these folks and I know some day we'll go out there and there will be a wait, for now it's still somewhat of an unknown. We've only had wonderful cocktails and bought several bottles of Sotol from them. I like that it has less carbs than tequila! Anyway, the choice of food truck out there is solid (Eden).  I wish I could live next door!

reviews.author: Michelle R.
reviews.description: If you want a unique drink, great atmosphere and amazing staff.... Go here. We were able to get different but classic drinks and cozy up to fireplace. The food truck made the best fries and quest, perfect for sharing.

reviews.author: Anh N.
reviews.description: So glad we finally stopped in to DD! Great distillery with ample patio and outdoor seating! Loved all of their cocktails. They also have live music.  Try the food truck Eden West on site, their quail bites are delish!

reviews.author: Brittney T.
reviews.description: So fun! This place is huge and dog friendly.   They have flights and all sorts of different cocktails for you to try. I do love vodka - so this distillery is a lot of fun.    The staff is fun and knowledgeable. They made a lot of good recs for drinks.    They have a little food stand inside for some small bites.   Would recommend to stop by if you're in Austin!

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Finally I was able to make it out to the distillery with my good friend early on a Saturday so that we could get some direct tasting vodka notes from Deep Eddy themselves rather than me taking shots at bars around Austin.  Parking was easy for us but do note that we showed up around 11:20AM on a Saturday so we didn't have any issues.  The later you arrive parking could be a thing and you may have to wait/stalk someone who is leaving to get a spot. Also as the day got later there were many buses and charter vans parked in the front and roundabout chilling out as the company they are driving around are inside getting down too.  Cocktails in a paper cup runs $8 with plenty to choose from the menu that is thoughtfully laid out in sweet, sours, spicy, etc. A nice mason jar with the Deep Eddy logo is $12 and slightly larger.  Do know that they will not refill your mason jar after you buy your first one so be prepared to be clanking around the distillery with your extra mason jars if you keep going the $12 route. Also be careful with your glass too - I saw many people let that mason jar slip out of their hands and the mason jar just crash on the concrete floor. So sad! Also frozen drinks / cocktails can only be purchased downstairs so be ready to wait in a little line if it is busy.   Loved the areas to sit inside the tasting room and even in the 2nd large downstairs area.  The pillows, decor, and the small touches around the sitting areas on the first floor are super cute and selfie-worthy.  I can imagine in the winter, with the large fireplace going, this space is cozy AF!  We didn't go outside at all as it was super hot in July but it looked like there are plenty of tables, shade, and seating for some large groups both in the front, side, and back areas.  After 2 cocktails in a mason jar we were feeling a good buzz and knowing we still had to trek back home (south Austin) we cut it off there. By the time we left around 2pm the place was buzzing with people, all 3 bars had 10+ waiting to be served, and I wasn't planning on waiting to close my tab in a long line.  I was super surprised to find out you can close your tab at the merch area with the cashier there so don't fret and add in that mug, stickers, shirts, bar additions, and Deep Eddy cool pool lady in red signage to your basket to check out while you close out your tab. You will save yourself some time and be out of there in a jiffy!  We plan to come back especially now knowing they are opened on Thursdays at 11am!!!!

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Deep Eddy Vodka Tasting Room is a great spot to hang with friends while sipping any number of their flavored vodkas. My favorite is probably the peach vodka and they have many cocktails to choose from. We went on a Sunday where there were local vendors there too as well as live music. Head to Dripping Springs for the great tasting room. Unfortunately, the distillery near Buda is not one that is open to the public, so the tasting room is where to go.

reviews.author: Angela R.
reviews.description: We started our bachelorette day here. The Bloody Mary was so yummy! I got it spicy. Sometimes they're a hit and miss but here... not a chance. The bartender made it to perfection! I also loved my souvenir glass I got to bring home with me. The vibe and atmosphere of this tasting room is super chill and cozy. 10/10 recommend !

reviews.author: Valerie V.
reviews.description: Wonderful space for great and unique cocktails. Both indoor and outdoor seating are roomy and spread out. They were already decorated for Christmas when went today 11/6. I loved the Spring Sling and the Ruby Red one with the jalapeño. Definitely a must do in the Austin area if your are distillery and brewery

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Like I was saying earlier, I find tasting rooms gimmicky and this one is a perfect example of it.   We chose to come here because I have deep respect for Deep Eddy as a company for their commitment and contributions to the local community. They've gone above and beyond again and again. Respect!  The tasting room is a large hall, with flights consisting of tiny cups of flavored vodka. You don't taste the actual spirit because the fruity flavors are so sweet.   The "Colombian" food options on-site is a joke. It's an old school concession stand (movie theater of the 80s style) with heat lamps keeping nacho chips warm on a folding table. Don't expect tacos or empanadas.  The space, both indoors and outdoor, is quite large. And they have a cute performance stage inside.  We stayed a total of 15 minutes.

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: A lovely farewell brunch was held here in the tasting room. There was ample seating both indoors and out. The bartenders were attentive and the drinks were tasty too. We'd like to return and sample other beverages.

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Spacious - great for large groups!  Food - one small food truck  Drinks - the vodka is a bit harsh; personally preferred the cranberry flavored vodka best (smoothest). Bartenders are very friendly and fast but the drinks are simply made and during Covid they are all touching the mint in their hands by smacking it. Id rather a gentle crush/roll in a glass... felt a bit gross (others commented too).  Wish there was live music Saturday afternoon at 4  Games outside like giant connect 4 etc  Parking- gets full on weekends so a bit tight  The decor was cute  Sheriff at the door to handle anyone getting a little too cray

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: My Husband surprised me with a day-date to Dripping Springs, Texas. I am a huge fan of Deep Eddy Vodka and this was an amazing way to try all of the flavors.  The set-up is gorgeous and feels so clean when you walk in. You get a behind the scenes taste of where the best Texas vodka comes from. The staff was kind and knowledgeable. They answered any questions we had about the drinks. I ordered a $10 flight and my Husband got the Orange dreamcicle drink. You have the option to get your drink in a mason jar as a keep sake.  There is a great gift shop on site, so we got matching shirts because we are cheesy like that.  There was a delicious food truck out front that had Vegan and Meat Eater options available. I like that they cater to both.   There is so much to do in the surrounding area. We went thrifting and enjoyed the nature that Hill Country has to offer.

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: Huge fans of Deep Eddy's grapefruit vodka.  Great with soda for easiest of easy beach drink.  Fun first stop before three winery visits nearby.    They have a responsible pandemic process in place managing number of folks going through and requiring masks.    Highly recommend Deep Eddy's as first stop when in Dripping Springs.  Cheers y'all

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed our short visit to the Deep Eddy distillery. We are already big fans of Deep Eddy's vodka and all of their flavors, so we had no doubt we would enjoy our time there. The cocktails they serve at their bar are innovative and refreshing. I ordered the Spring Sling and he ordered the Austin Mule. We both enjoyed the drinks next to the patio where they had multiple groupings of chairs spread out on the lawn. Other than drinking, there's not much else to do here, but it's definitely a lively place to enjoy a drink with friends! Our bartender was also very kind and helped us choose the right cocktails for each of us.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: The Deep Eddy Tasting Room is making some delicious cocktails! We found ourselves here with friends on a Saturday afternoon. The weather was perfect and they have a nice little patio area. The spot is family friendly meaning you can bring your kids, but there isn't a lot for them to do except run around in the patio area. I would have liked if the patio area was fenced off and not open to the parking so I could relax a bit more. I had to keep a close eye to make sure my kid didn't wander off. I enjoyed both of the drinks I tasted and would definitely stop in here to explore more of the tastings, but will likely leave the kid at home next time.

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: No complaints here. You can take home the souvenir cup or jar whenever you order. Try the Texas tea and you won't regret it. Everything here is made to order with frozen drinks being located downstairs. The service is also great! We went on a Sunday and had a wonderful experience. They also have a nice selection of merchandise.

reviews.author: Ara A.
reviews.description: Excellent service, great drinks with all their offerings. They don't charge for mock tails which is very nice if you don't want alcohol.

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: In our multiple trips to central Texas, we kept missing Deep Eddy although we tried each time; just unlucky timing. FINALLY this past weekend we got there when they were open! Oh we were so excited and the place lived up to the hype. The seating atmosphere both inside and out is very roomy and comfortable. All the staff is friendly and easy-going. Everywhere including the bathrooms were incredibly clean. The cocktails... the cocktails are downright amazing. They're inventive, delicious, and fresh. You're going to have a hard decision to make no matter what kind of drinks you like... I actually ended up ordering two at once because I couldn't decide! On the way out, we stopped at their little gift shop and man do they pack that area with goodies! Talk about variety and options. The shirts are awesome and made very well to boot, and they have tons of other merch. I left with a soft tanktop, a wicked fun tin can that I plan on using for a cactus or succulent vase, a magnet, and a collapsible dog bowl! We'll be back every chance we get. Loved it, loved everything, love the vodka.

reviews.author: Garrett F.
reviews.description: Definitely go during the week no crowds. Get as many flights as your table can handle. Upgrade your first drink to get the mason jar!  Merch area needs works, better options, pricing. Looks like the area was an afterthought.  Overall we had a great time. No tours still, Covid.

reviews.author: Kylie W.
reviews.description: If you have the time definitely a cool spot to check out. Indoor and outdoor seating with a little gift shop. Got some flights to taste and a frozen drink

reviews.author: Riley B.
reviews.description: ‼PSA: NEVER go to the Deep Eddy's Vodka Tasting Room!!‼ HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED AS A REGULAR DEEP EDDYS ENTHUSI  My friends and I went out to celebrate Maddy Montgomery's 22nd birthday and were harassed by the manager for being "underage".   The whole group willingly gave our ID's for inspection and the birthday girl's ID was "questionable", so she was taken to a cop car by a Sheriff, put in the back and questioned.  While Maddy was at the cop car getting her ID verified, the rest of the group had our full drinks/cups (that we paid for and were able to take home), snatched out of our hands. We all requested a refund for the drinks and were denied??  After the Sherriff verified that Maddy's ID was real, the manager proceeded to threaten tresspassing charges against us??   I have never experienced anything like this and would love to be contacted/reimbursed for the mistake that was clearly made.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Our Jeep club organized an event at this establishment, anticipating a fun and enjoyable experience.  Wrong!  I will preface that this whole COVID thing has still, for some reason, has some still on edge.  However, this place has taken it to new heights.  While the great state of Texas has opened to 100%, this place seems to have missed that memo.  We literally got yelled it for actually standing up at our tables and told that if we do stand to have a mask on.  Additionally, we got yelled at for moving a table.  The guys exact words were "I'm picky where our furniture is placed."  Additionally, if you want to get a beverage, you actually have to MAKE A RESERVATION just to go in get one.  That is ridiculous!  By the way, the Hays County police are on site to enforce all of this over-the-top nonsense.  Most of us stayed for a single drink and then left for better and more fun pastures.  It's obvious that this place has forgotten all about who the consumer is and how we should be treated.  Not only will we never go back, but I am never going to purchase any of their products again.  By the way...the Jeep community here in Texas is very tight-knit and we will talk...

reviews.author: Holly T.
reviews.description: This was nice and the drinks were great. It was crowded so keep that in mind and call ahead. No one was wearing masks...including myself. Normally, I would though and as an afterthought, I probably should have.  Just FYI, whatever your choice.

reviews.author: Ayca U.
reviews.description: Great wines selection to try from, all gluten free.  Friendly service and highly recommend the charcuterie and cheese - great presentation   Clean and well kept Must try

reviews.author: Ria G.
reviews.description: I'd give this place 5 stars for the interior and overall vibe, but only 3 stars because we were a bit disappointed with the wine itself.   The atmosphere is lively with board games and great decor inside, and a food truck and lots of picnic tables outside for large groups.   However, my group ordered 2 different red wines and 1 sparkling white wine and felt that the wines were lacking in flavor and very watery. Maybe this is how Austin wine is, but if you're looking for deeper, richer flavored wine, I would go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Aditi P.
reviews.description: 10/10 holistically on this place. Everything from wine, environment and experience were on point. We had a group of girls in for a bachelorette and the service did not disappoint. The owners have an amazing story telling ability when it comes to their wine. The ambiance of interiors down to the charcuterie presentation is all thoughtful.

reviews.author: Sametra B.
reviews.description: Pretty laid back spot. A nice spot to grab a quick glass of wine with a friend or 2. For a locally ran winery, I'd say it's worth going for sure. The menu selection for cheese variations are subpar. We did try some octopus and squid, which was an interesting discussion over some glasses of wine. You can only imagine how these convos went lol! All in all, I highly recommend stopping in for an interesting glass or two. Cheers to more wine!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Ok so I accompanied my boyfriend to the brewery and distillery nearby, so of course we had to stop for the obligatory glass of wine for me.  I was not going to get any snacks, but their cheese and charcuterie board was calling my name.  We both got the tasting. Each of us got different wines. Our favs were the Tempranillo, Grenache and spaghetti western. You can get all your wines at once or one at a time. I suggest getting them all at once because staff can get busy.  The cheese and charcuterie board paired well with our wines and it was definitely the perfect snack. Loved the cheese selection. The bread sprinkled with olive oil made my day cause who doesn't love bread They have inside and outside seating available. Parking is onsite, but shared with other businesses.

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: Went to Austin for a short solo trip and what a nice surprise. This place was so cool and chill. The service was great, the tables were well spread out, the flight and snacks did not disappoint.   I had the:  Friends with Benefits Opening Ceremony Gerwuz  Vermentino   All a selection of whites and sweets.   I would highly recommend this place to get a taste of Austin and also enjoy a quiet spot.

reviews.author: Stefany W.
reviews.description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was just a nice place to relax, drink some wine and read a book which is exactly what I did. I came with a friend and we enjoyed trying all the various wine they had to offer.   They also apparently had a monthly oyster pop up which was fun. I ended up ordering some and they were delicious! Highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Krystle U.
reviews.description: My partner and I first found their wine at Travis Heights Wine and Spirits and fell in love w the malbec, so we decided to visit the winery. The first time we came here, they had a private event going on so that was sad. The second time, we got here a few hours early so they hadn't opened - that's our fault. Finally, our third attempt was fruitful!  The service here is super chill and on top of things. We 2 flights so we got to taste a good variety of samples. Great pours. We ended up leaving w one of their best bottles and now we're saving it for a special occasion.   We got (ranked from 'pour me another' to meh): *Violet Crown *Tempranillo Nuevo *Vermentino *Red-Nat *Picpoul *Piquette - this seems to be a star here but we personally hated it - tasted a bit like dilute pickle juice  A bottle we had before coming to this place was their Hill Country Rosso and that's still my favorite.  As far as COVID safety goes, the tables are super spread out, the staff wears masks at all times, and everything seems clean.   This place is super cool and what seems to be a hidden gem.

reviews.author: Jenni N.
reviews.description: Very cute tasting room within an industrial area. You would not think there would be a place like this there. The Yard is the location and they have several business including this winery, a distillery, a brewery, and a few other places. The wine was good and the cheese and charcuterie board was a good size. I'd like to give 5 stars, but we had to ask for napkins, no plates given either. It was also a bit messy inside. Not sure if they were re-organizing or what. But friendly staff, good wine, and cute space! I recommend a stop in!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I stopped here to enjoy some new wine and some pizza from Lil Nonna's. I made reservations on the way there. During the 'rona, it is recommended to ensure you can get a spot.   My hubby and I did a wine flight a piece. We tried all the reds, the rose, and white wine (Vermentino). We ended up buying a bottle of Malbec to take home which we both had enjoyed. Note, the staff was very knowledgeable and helpful.   I really like the atmosphere of the winery as it is inside a warehouse where they make their own wine and buy their grapes. The winery has a few things to eat or you can buy pizza from Lil Nonna's. The pizza takes awhile but you can always purchase online and set a date. If you are done at the winery you can also bar hope in the area for beer, cocktails, and whiskey.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: It's simple, if you're not pretentious and you like natural wine, you'll enjoy this place. Industrial spot located in the Yard, great natural lighting and some benches outside for the big groups. A truly gorgeous selection with some fantastic small plates as well- tinned seafood, quality cheeses and bread, etc. Always an enjoyable time.

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: We each ordered flights. The staff was knowledgeable, quick, and polite which made the experience even better!

reviews.author: Alec B.
reviews.description: Awesome winery, love that it's so close to the city. All the staff was super friendly and knowledgeable about the wine selection. They had several really good wines, my favorites were the Violet Crown and GSM.

reviews.author: Mike L.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our visit here,  the staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  A must visit when near b Austin.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
