reviews.description: Star service and a non-judgmental space. I dig you, Austin Winery!  We decided on Austin Winery after we had plans to go to Spokesman next door for some beers. Unfortunately, Spokesman had an event going on that looked a little noisy and full for our study date, hence the change in venues. The winery was very spacious and lofty--I love that in an industrial winery! We asked if we could move a table (to plug in to their only one outlet--score!) and do some computer work with their wifi. The gal at the tasting room was fantastically wonderful. She gave us a large smile and told us to do whatever we wanted. Wonderful service alone will get me to come back. That's for sure.  We each got a flight of wine to try, and got down to it until they closed. They have a good selection of whites, rose's and reds, so fret not friends. All is provided. They also have some light bites like cheeses and charcuteries, so you can definitely go with that if you're hungry. The tastings were a little pricey compared to what you might get at a wine tasting out in the vineyards (I used to work in the industry), but you're paying for the convenience of being in South Austin and lots of space to hold conversations, play board games and just be with your groups. They have loads of seating and an upstairs area (that a Bachelorette party was using). Restrooms are clean and wifi is strong. We also walked home with some Brose (a hilarious take on rose especially because it was a women-lead winery effort). Clean, classy and airy space.

reviews.author: Kan C.
reviews.description: Cute place. Not a huge fan of the wines but the food was great.  Will try again ! Maybe my pallet was off

reviews.author: Hailey W.
reviews.description: Very cool industrial spot. Lots of good wine options and there was a food truck. Good spot to visit during covid due to availability of outdoor seating

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: This place has a great vibe and both indoor and outdoor seating.  The staff are friendly and knowledgeable.  Lil' Nonna's pizza truck is right outside of the door and has fantastic pizza - try the VBR!  The bummer is they only have Texas wines and I am not a fan.  I tried 5 different options and truly am not a fan.  I would love if they had other options.

reviews.author: Jeannine K.
reviews.description: Cool facility but overpriced with impatient staff that seemed unwilling to give any info on their wines.

reviews.author: Amy F.
reviews.description: Liked sitting outside to distance, but the benches were a little rickety. The inside had a great vibe - hope to come back when it's safer to be out and about!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Meridian Hive is expanding and growing up!  It's great to see quality local businesses thrive. The experience at Meridian Hive has changed.  There is now a wide selection of meads to taste, and you have to pay for a tasting.  There are different tasting flights you can select from on the menu, or you can try it all for $15.  The place is no longer quiet and sleepy, it is busy and buzzing.  They need to re-organize themselves to be able to better handle the traffic.  They need a separate line for those just coming in to fill growlers, and those enjoying a tasting experience and interested in learning about the different meads and the process.  The two staff members were friendly, but were rushed to serve others.    The mead is still as delicious as always, and they are planning to even start canning some of it! They are also re-branding and their growlers now have their new modern logo.  I just hope they keep the awesome art on their bottles.  I love the genius artistic bottle labels.  For the first time they also had a meat and cheese plate that you could order. Something new they were trying out.  It was tasty!  They should definitely keep it.   They also now have a loyalty program that earns you discounts. Also, be sure to check out the board as they have reoccurring monthly events like Friday board game night!!

reviews.author: kelsey w.
reviews.description: Owner Mike is super nice and informational. We had a groupon for a tour which is think Matt have been a bit different than what we expected. It isn't a very big layout so there isn't much to see but overall a really nice laid back place to hang out. The mead is pretty cool...kind of tasted like a cross between a wine and a cider with more of a craft beer audience. The honeys they offered to taste were lovely.

reviews.author: Geeta A.
reviews.description: They lied to us about being dog-friendly. NOT DOG-FRIENDLY!   My husband and I were in town from Austin with our 2 pups. I called and asked if they were dog-friendly, they said yes. When we got there, I walked in and asked if they were dog-friendly, they said yes. My husband and our 2 pups walked in, grabbed a flight, and played a game. After an hour, I ordered another drink while he took the pups out for a bathroom break. He texts me "They won't let me back in."  Apparently they weren't actually dog-friendly, and the bartender lied, or at best had mis-information. They offered us their outdoor picnic table, but there was broken glass everywhere. They comped the drink I had just ordered, but really should have comped everything. We wouldn't have gone if we would have known that we weren't welcome.   That said, this isn't a terrible place to spend a rainy afternoon if you're from Austin. They have games and flights. Their draft meads all kind of taste the same, but the recent elderflower LTO was pretty good. We're from Dallas, and I won't waste an afternoon here again.

reviews.author: Courtney W.
reviews.description: Meridian Hive Meadery is pretty cool! I hadn't tried mead until this year when I tried some of Meridian Hive's stuff at the Mueller Farmer's Market. We bought a growler from them and we were always determined to fill it back up, but we always seemed to go to the farmer's market when they weren't there. Darn.   No more worrying about that, though, because now they have a building for all your mead needs! I always seem to gravitate toward the Rhapsody, because it has blackberries in it, and I love anything and everything blackberry. Meridian Hive will let you try anything for free, which is great. Some day, I'm going to branch out and try all of their stuff instead of just getting the Rhapsody.   They also have several different kinds of honey for you to sample, which was really cool. You can purchase various things here, like growlers, glasses, and metal signs, if you're into those sorts of things. They sell their mead by the growler or by the bottle, depending on what you order and have much you want. There isn't a ton of seating, as they seem to be a newer operation, but I didn't find that to be a problem. They also have some board games out for anyone to play, which I thought was a nice touch. Unfortunately, they don't have any food here yet. I don't know if they allow you to bring food in, but it wouldn't hurt to ask if that's something you are dying to know. The ladies who were working the day I visited were very sweet and super willing to answer any and all questions.   Funny story: this place is basically right down the street from my old office. I bet a mead buzz would have made work more enjoyable, but now I never have to find out. No complaints here!

reviews.author: Jocelyn F.
reviews.description: Highly recommend! They have knowledgeable and friendly staff with a great atmosphere. Great variety of meads of all different flavors and sweetness levels. It is highly affordable and a great alternative to other alcohols. Try a flight of their still meads and draft meads. Only good things to say about this establishment!

reviews.author: James G.
reviews.description: Not only a delicious and unique twist on mead (awesome traditional mead as well!) but top notch service too! They have great events like movie showings, game nights, etc. I highly suggest you come check it out - they even provide a free education on all the ins-and-outs of mead.

reviews.author: Molly L.
reviews.description: Having never tried mead before in my life, I was a little hesitant to try this place, and I can say I am quite happy I did try it. I sampled a few different meads and ended up ordering one that was a blackberry flavor, it was absolutely delicious , not too sweet which had been my worry when it came to mead. All of the other flavors I tasted were yummy as well. The atmosphere is a open warehouse. They provide some board games to keep you entertained which made me and my friends quite happy . The employees were very knowledgeable and friendly as well.

reviews.author: Charlie S.
reviews.description: Cool place.  You can bring your own bottles or growlers.  Their pricing is based on liters.  Not all of their mead is available on tap.  Some is pre-bottled.   It's all good.

reviews.author: Jason D.
reviews.description: Amazing experience, and the atmosphere is the best part of it. Great vibe with great lighting, warm friendliness, great staff, and an overall welcoming feel that has to be cultivated and nurtured.

reviews.author: Len S.
reviews.description: We went yesterday afternoon and celebrated national mead day (who knew there was such a day?) they had a breakfast food truck and a musician playing.  They have 10 plus meads on tap.  We tried the hoppy one, lemon one and blackberry one.  All were excellent.  Was a cool place.  Only open weekends

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: I really enjoy coming here Fridays after work with some friends. They have some really great classic meads as well as nice draft meads. They also have EA collection of board games that you can play while you're drinking. I just wish that they had more hours.

reviews.author: Bianca B.
reviews.description: Where to start...maybe with the word Fabulous or Flavorful is best. Each and every mead they have I tasted and found to be delicious. From refreshing and crisp to aromatic and fruity. Definitely give them a try.

reviews.author: J S.
reviews.description: My first time trying mead and I love it! Friendly and knowledgeable staffs.  My favorite is the colossus and om.

reviews.author: Collin G.
reviews.description: I'm not a local to Austin, but this place was recommended to me by a local and they were not wrong. This place is awesome. I was shocked how few people were there on a Saturday afternoon. The employees were very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. Absolutely love this place. It's just a great place to gather around, drink some mead, and hang out with friends.

reviews.author: Kelseigh R.
reviews.description: Warning: Apple Maps puts this on the wrong side of the road. It's on the South side, East most unit.  Once we finally found the place, we were greeted quite quickly and taken back for sampling. Immediately we were treated to generous samples of *everything.* Samples just kept coming until we had tasted the entire lineup.   Evan ran us through everything with great explanations and loads of information. As any good teacher, he snuck in repeats of information in different ways to help cement it.   He took us on the grand tour. It doesn't look like much since it's small, but there's a lot of information and a lot to learn. Evan was great at tailoring his tour to our level of expertise: two of us with Mead and home brewing experience and two n00bs.   Apparently they distribute from San Antonio to DFW and they've only really been on the market for a year and a half! Their prices reflect their quickly growing popularity, but it's well worth it. They have a Mead for everyone and even honey to sample.  The staff was able to tell us about a lot of events as well. The Texas Mead Festival isn't too far away from Austin and it's in September. The world festival is in Longmont, Colorado. They also make appearances at local farmers markets as well.

reviews.author: Rachel F.
reviews.description: Great experience and amazing staff. Shared a full flight tasting with the boyfriend, and was walked through all the flavors and styles patiently. We even came in towards the end of the day, and didn't feel rushed or anything. Fun place to visit and easy to get to.

reviews.author: Wendy K.
reviews.description: Loved the sweet meads. The grand opening was great and it was wonderful hanging pie with friends. Got to see people I have not seen in a long time. Reasonable prices and friendly service!

reviews.author: Tasa B.
reviews.description: This is a hidden gem! By far the best mead I have ever tried! I would recommend it to anyone. I will be back!

reviews.author: Kristen G.
reviews.description: This was quite the surprising little spot. We went on a Friday after work for an old movie premier they were doing at the brewery and were very pleasantly surprised on what we walked into... GREAT I promise!! Not only is everyone there extremely knowledgeable about the brand but they are friendly and accommodating. If you are an avid mead drinker or want to try it for the first time Meridian Hive is where you need to go. We went for a taste and left knowing that they made a forever customer.

reviews.author: Dorothy M.
reviews.description: This place is well kept and clean. Trucks are too. Good people. Friendly place. Dogs are welcome. Don't go during Halloween due to the haunted house next door you won't find parking.

reviews.author: Roz S.
reviews.description: Our visit to the Dripping Springs Distillery was extraordinary. We hosted a group of 12, many were visiting from the UK. The tour and tasting was fantastic. Talon, our tour guide was so knowledgeable, engaging and witty. We started with drinks prior to the tour and Miley was so outgoing and welcoming. The follow up lunch and drinks topped off the afternoon. The food was delicious and our server Jake was so accommodating. Everyone enjoyed the beautiful grounds and tried their luck with the cornhole boards. It became a bit of a competition! The group said the day was superb and the quality of the gin rivaled the best from across the pond.

reviews.author: Carlos V.
reviews.description: My wife and I had scheduled a tasting and tour of the distillery several weeks before we were arriving in Austin.  Unfortunately, our plane flight was cancelled the day of our arrival.  We were very disappointed.  I called the manager, Kristi Quick, and she accommodated us completely.  Seldom do you see such actions any more.  She took some time our of her busy day to let us sample the spirits and even gave us some great local restaurant recommendations for lunch and dinner!  Her gracious hospitality was very much appreciated.  This is now going to be my vodka of choice...

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Dripping Springs Distilling is just now opening its spanking new tasting room, patios, entertainment venue and production facility, and it is splendid. I went there four years ago, when the tasting room was essentially the lobby to the distillery. While I great.y appreciated what they were doing with their gins and vodkas, the ambience was like drinking in the lobby of Atscott manufacturing in Pine City, Minnesota. This new facility reshuffles the entire deck.  It has taken them a while to complete, but it was worth it. The new venue is spectacular -- well designed, comfortably modern, spacious and welcoming. It's not only a tasting room, it's also a credible restaurant with an interesting menu, specials, and a exceptionally friendly staff.  We went on the second weekend of the 'soft 'opening', but they seemed to have already worked all the kinks out. They were welcoming and prompt and attentive. Our server, Jack, went out of his way to answer questions, including about plantings on the grounds and ingredients in the dishes, and to offer suggestions about cocktails.   I had the street taco daily special and an Electric Lady cocktail. My companion had the jalapeño cornbread muffins and a French 75. The street tacos were small but fully packed. The spice mix could have been spicier,  it then I like hot. The flavors though were indeed special. Nothing dominated, so you could appreciate the protein and still enjoy the comity cheese and the light drizzle of sour cream. The tortillas were a bit small, but you expect that in a street taco. My friends jalapeño corn muffins were excellent. A well constructed corn muffin with one slice of jalapeño that came up and kicked your butt on the after palate. There were plenty of them, so we took lots home for later. The regular entre menu is interesting enough (two different pot pies, additional comfort type foods) that I'll be back.  I should not forget the flight of spirits. I've always respected their two gins, and I often buy them as they are available at Twin and Specs. Very solid, unpretentious and well crafted. I'm not a vodka guy, but my friend liked their offerings. Their 1876 bourbon still needs some maturation and work though. But such is the case with whiskey.   The full grand opening is coming up, with all the hoopla expected. Once the noise is past, Dripping Springs Distilling, with its multiple brands and spirits, will be a destination you'll want to add to the itinerary.

reviews.author: Mark S.
reviews.description: Only go here if you like amazing food, drinks and people!  Otherwise this place isn't for you. Only ask: later hours on Fridays!

reviews.author: Marya B.
reviews.description: This was a fun afternoon outing for us.  We had tasted the orange vodka at a local restaurant, and we were intrigued at what else they had to offer.  We booked a tour, which turned out to be very informative and Talon was a great guide!  The only (teeny) downfall of the tour was the distillery was operational that day and was a little noisy and difficult to hear our guide.  We enjoyed a cocktail and lunch on the patio.  I had the Basil Sour and my husband had an Old Fashioned.  We both had the grilled cheese and tomato soup.  Everything was delicious!

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: This place is amazing. The food, drinks, service, landscaping, and all the above we nothing short of awesome. If you're in the area and are looking for a good distillery to visit, then I highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Terra B.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time at the Dripping Springs Distillery. Talon led us on a great tour and tasting, and then we enjoyed great drinks and lunch. I actually commented to my husband that everyone we encountered there was positive and friendly, which can be rare these days. Highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Alex B.
reviews.description: The tour was great and our tour guide was awesome. It was great to see a distillery that truly cares about their products and that people enjoy them. Will definitely go back. Dripping spring will be my choice of vodka now saw a lot of previous review commenting on size but has plenty of room indoor and outdoor. We enjoyed sitting and having a cocktail for awhile after the tour.

reviews.author: Heather A.
reviews.description: We had a great experience at Dripping Springs Distiller.  Not only was the tour interesting but the staff really went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  The tasting was wonderful, especially the vodkas- so smooth.  We look forward to visiting again soon.

reviews.author: Kathleen K.
reviews.description: A tour/tasting at Dripping Springs Distillery was such a fun way to spend a Saturday afternoon.  Our guide Talon was so informative and we learned so much and had a lot of fun!  The vodka was amazing especially the Orange!  The grounds are amazing too--thank you!

reviews.author: Matt P.
reviews.description: Great venue to visit.  The tour was informative and everyone was super friendly....not to mention good drinks and food.  Poking forward to bringing more out of town guests there.

reviews.author: Morgan J.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out and have awesome craft cocktails and delicious food.  The tour and tasting is well with it too.  Love this place!

reviews.author: Twisted Texas T.
reviews.description: Lovely space, friendly folks, great spirits. The new renovations are beautiful, and the quality of the product hasn't change at all! Great place to spend a couple hours relaxing.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Still awesome as always, but even better. You don't need appointments to visit anymore and they have a great indoor/outdoor seating area where you can enjoy cocktails. They also make whiskey now. There is alot of construction onsite to build a restaurant and much more.

reviews.author: Samuel B.
reviews.description: Cute little spot. On the outskirts of Dripping Springs. Simple and clean. Taste some vodkas and their new Bourbans

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: This is a cool distillery. They have several cocktails for $8 each on Thursday to Saturday. There are tables and chairs inside the distillery. It is worth stopping when going on a distillery tour. There is lots of parking and the staff is very friendly. However they do not have food.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: This was a fun way to kill an hour or so on a Saturday. The tour is very simple. You walk to see the stills and they do a quick run through on how they make their vodka and gin. You can see how they soak the herbs for the gin and how they do their bottling. It was interesting to learn how labor intensive their orange vodka is to make since they hand zest the orange rinds.   Obviously, the highlight is the tasting. You get to sample their vodkas, gins, and their brand new 1876 bourbon.   All in all a fun tour and tasting. I was super happy to get the last bottle of their first release batch of their 1876 bourbon after the tasting and the gal doing the tasting was great as well.   For $11 you get the tour, tasting, and a shot glass.

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: Best vodka hands down. The grey goose of Texas and not to compare with grey goose because grey goose can't come close to Dripping Springs vodka. Great tour and staff are very friendly.

reviews.author: Ali C.
reviews.description: I love their vodka.  My husband and I did the $7.00 tasting.  You get 6-7 samples and get to try all of their product.  They have 3-4 vodkas and a couple bourbons.  The vodka is so smooth.  You can tell they use high quality water!    My family is a Tito's family but after coming to the tasting, I bought 5 bottles for my family members. We'll be using Dripping Springs vodka from now on!

reviews.author: Amie M.
reviews.description: Great indoor/outdoor space. Friendly staff and a great cocktail! I choose the Gin Rickey with the Dripping Springs Artisan Gin, cucumber, limeade and sparking water. It was crisp and refreshing and the fun was super smooth. 5 star gin drink in my book!

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: What a great find! I wish we'd found it sooner. Fantastic service from Scott and Jim. Delicious cocktails. Great dog-friendly patio with plenty of seating and beautiful fireplace. You can bring in your own food. There are two delicious restaurants right next door, too.

reviews.author: Kelsie G.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem! The drinks were creative and delicious. Bartender, Celeste, was super friendly and knowledgeable. Would highly recommend! My only request would be more sports channels.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: This is a wonderful addition to the great white north area! A boutique distillery serving up their own vodka, gin, agave, and my favorite their 17 whiskey.   When you visit the old fashioned and margherita is a must to start.   It's bring your own food or snacks and according to Scott the owner food trucks and live music are coming soon.   C'mon by and have a beautifully hand crafted cocktail.

reviews.author: JoAnna C.
reviews.description: I cannot believe I haven't stopped in here before last night!!  I have been wanting to try their vodka, and send a bottle back with my daughter- gift from home. We ended up sitting and having a drink and bought 4 bottles!! Scott and the staff were so friendly and welcoming. They don't have food, but allow you to bring your own food in!  We will definitely be back!!!

reviews.author: Matt L.
reviews.description: Decided to try this place out because it was a local distillery. we will be back time and time again. We wanted to buy a bottle for the upcoming 4th of July weekend. and we got to try 4 of their selections. The texagave, gin, triple session and whiskey. I was happy with all of them.  Texagave is their "tequila". I thought it had a great taste and would make a great margarita. My wife, who is a tequila drinker, wasnt too fond of it, but I loved it and it would make a great add to any bar.  Gin. It tasted twice as good as Tanqueray but with half the bite/harshness. we bought 2 bottles. Will be back for all the Gin needs.  Whiskey. If youre a fan of Gentleman Jack youll love this! super smooth and mellow. I thought it was good (im a bourbon drinker), just not the Super Oaky flavor that Im used to. too mellow for my taste.  Triple Session. This was by far the most impressive and different spirit I tried. Think of a triple sec (orange and sweet flavor) but with actual alcohol in it. I think it is 41% and it tastes fantastic over ice, not to harsh, not to sweet (by triple sec standards) but just right. Cant beat if for less than 15 bucks a bottle at total wine.  I cant wait till I try the rest of their spirits. Go in and try them, you will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Luke N.
reviews.description: Leanderthal Distilling is a great spot to sit down and have a drink with friends and family. Scott (the founder) was very welcoming and showed us the different spirits that they had to offer.   The TexAgave is perfect for people that like tequila, the 17 Whiskey is great for the bourbon drinker, and Whit's Gin is really tasty too.  I didn't have a chance to try all of them but I'm sure the others not mentioned are great.   Some of us ordered the Bill Pickett Bulldog which was made with their JavaGave Coffee Liqueur and it was like Kahlua and Milk but way better. Highly recommend that drink!  Most of their drinks are $4!

reviews.author: Greg O.
reviews.description: My wife and I stumbled across this place on a Sunday.  The owner,  Scott,  happened to be inside,  noticed us reading the stuff on the door and unlocked the door,  invited us in for a tour and taste of all their products.   We've been serious fans ever since.   I've had everything they make and all of their products are GREAT. My current favorite is 17, a bourbon,  but that is a limited run.    For Christmas, I got several people to go in for me and buy some 17 to give out as gifts.  I also bought their products available at participating liquor stores as gifts.  I distributed them to about 8 people total.  It was a mix of 17, Leanderthal Vodka, TexAgave, Triple Secession and Javagave.  Some recipients were serious liquor connisuer's,  others just liked a cocktail now and then.  All thoroughly enjoyed what they got and added it to their regular liquor rotations.  Leanderthal has since opened a tasting room where you can get cocktails made with all their products,  and are free to bring in outside food to munch on,  as they don't necessarily have food on site.  Although Scott has a creative work around with that by having a food truck occasionally.   They also give samples of all their products as well.   Their craft cocktails are GREAT!  And they are very affordable for top shelf cocktails.    If you like any type of liquor, Scott has a great version of it.  Everyone there are super friendly too.    Great place to go and hang out.   Only downside is you can only buy 2 bottles per adult every 30 days.   Awesome place!!

reviews.author: Ashley T.
reviews.description: I visited once and instantly this became my new favorite spot. The owner and the other man making drinks behind the bar were so great. Friends and I tried most of the menu between the four of us and every drink was great. Their liquors are unique and delicious. I love any drink that uses whole, natural ingredients- no mixers in this place, and who can beat $4-5 drinks that taste this good?!  Making it BYOFood is so great, I'm only worried that this spot will get so popular that it will outgrow its space. Can't wait to go back

reviews.author: MICHELE V.
reviews.description: I moved Leanderthal from my'Try' category to my 'favorite' category. But don't come here  and ruin the atmosphere, please! Great drinks. Walking distance of 'bring your own food' deliciousness. QUIET! No loud distracting music. This is now going to be my monthly getaway. And my next move? Write to my congressman to change the law prohibiting me from purchasing more than two bottles from these guys per 30 days. Distributers, get lost!

reviews.author: Meagan S.
reviews.description: My husband and I wandered in here for a date night and we were not disappointed! We had some free tastings and a couple of excellent drinks. My favorite was the margarita. It is probably the best one I've ever had! We can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Love this place. They have live music too so check their calendar! Great relaxing vibe.  Great drinks, great staff, and tons of games to play with friends:) just wish they had paper straws. We loved Ashley the bartender on staff. Super friendly and made sure we loved our drink choices (all the drinks here are great).  Special note: They also rescued a baby cow named Moonshine who is like a little puppy- she loves some pets and will lick your hands a few chickens running around too.   Drink suggestions: great bloody Mary's! I also really like their passion fruit vodka!  Food: mmmk they have the best Mac and cheese! This is a must here. It's super smokey I loved it. They have lots of meat options too.  They have fans blowing water/misting you in the heat and twinkle lights everywhere.  Kid friendly? Yup, although I didn't see any when I went they gave a big play structure behind the car!  Parking on site

reviews.author: Josh B.
reviews.description: This place is an absolute knockout.   We went as a thing to do while staying nearby, and wow! We will go back just to hang out some more.   We got there for lunch time and to try a cocktail and eat BBQ as it's really near the local RV park. The vodka is delicious. They offer samples and have a broad selection of flavor profiles. We tried a good number of cocktails each of which was fantastic and flavorful. Jackie the bartender was wonderful to talk to and kept my wife ms drink full, my kids happy with mock tails and unsold me on a bottle of vodka, and a cinnamon vodka ( I hate cinnamon). Catfish, the master distiller came by the bar and had some awesome stories and insights into how Planet Rock became a thing.   If that's not enough to get you there for a taste, the BBQ truck does great food. Get the Texas Twinkie. The ribs were great as was the quesadilla and the stuffed potato but trust me, get yourself a Twinkie.   If you are anywhere nearby try this place. It's pet, child, and adult friendly. And they have live music. How can you go wrong?

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem out on Hudson Bend. Catfish is distilling some of the best vodka anywhere, and his staff are mixing up cocktails that rival the trendiest places downtown. And this is all in a laid-back, dog-friendly, wear your comfy jeans, no pretension atmosphere. It's like hanging out in someone's backyard... if that someone had great live music, acrobats, and world class spirits.  And while all the drinks are amazing (you seriously can't go wrong), the Bloody Mary selections are out of this world.

reviews.author: Jacqueline L.
reviews.description: Such a cute find! We bring most of our out of town guests here. Live music on the weekend, friendly staff. Near Lake Travis. Only vodka is served here FYI!

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: What a fantastic venue!! So much open space, seating, fire pits, heaters, swings...great stage with live music... Delicious vodka cocktails served up by really fun bartenders...BBQ food truck on site. Dog-friendly, family-friendly...clean bathrooms. We can't wait to go back!!  (*Covid note - not many masks were worn, but there's plenty of space for social-distance and hand sanitizer placed on several tables)

reviews.author: Kimberly S.
reviews.description: My husband I spent the afternoon at Planet Rock Vodka Distillery and had an amazing time! We are visitors to Austin and Planet Rock was recommended by a local family last night at dinner, so wanting to experience local places rather than tourist spots, we decided to give it a try. It did not disappoint! I have to say that we enjoyed the BEST Bloody Mary we've ever had! Planet Rock's vodka is so smooth and with the added Bloody Mary mix combination and a piece of brisket, heaven! Service was excellent and the live music by Sharon Bourbonnais was very enjoyable also. I'm thinking we'll be back before heading home!

reviews.author: Kendall M.
reviews.description: This place is very disrespectful to its neighbors. We asked kindly for them to keep it at a respectful noice level and they did until around 10PM on a Thursday and they started blasting it.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: This place had the feel of my backyard, with a great musician, food and of course vodka infused drinks. Highly recommend. Don't forget to pet the baby cow.

reviews.author: L.R. L.
reviews.description: Fun place to get the demonic alcohol that has served to drive me to ruination and lead directly to dissolution to my many human and extra terrestrial relationships.  The demon vodka is a terrible mistress that can weaken your soul, lead you astray and give you many hangovers. The prices of vice, in its many forms.  But I ask, are we to avoid the rich experience of human vice, or is this pursuing human vice that gives us meaning?  Good vodka enables the philosopher that resides in each of us.  Many adventures await us as the consequences of our choices.  Vodka is a choice. Choose wisely.

reviews.author: Karen N.
reviews.description: Just discovered this jewel near home. Great drinks and food. Fantastic service and folks.  We'll be baxk soon. Love you Catfish and Jenna!!

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: Great bbq and some of the best infused vodka drinks I've ever had.  Music venue is the perfect size for a killer laid back Central Texas evening.  Here's my checklist for your afternoon- 1. Have a killer drink. 2. Have some killer bbq. 3. Say hi to Catfish, the master distiller. He's the one with the magnificent beard and the hearty laugh likely by the bar. 4. Pet a chicken (there are a few running around)  5. Say what's up to Moonshine, their mini zebu cow that thinks he's a dog.  Can be seen chasing squirrels or prancing around the grounds.  If you're looking for an afternoon to enjoy a perfect slice of some of the best things Central Texas has to offer, this is your spot.

reviews.author: Victoria I.
reviews.description: This is a casual venue with clean bathrooms - a total win! It really is a fantastic place were you can catch some live music. Plus, they have the best BLT infused vodka!

reviews.author: Alejandro S.
reviews.description: Amazing vodka and whiskey! We came for a tour one Saturday afternoon and received the best hospitality throughout our visit! Anthony and Logan were awesome hosts and made us really feel welcomed. Their vodka is incredibly smooth and definitely one of the most enjoyable whiskey's I've ever had. I highly recommend you make the trip to visit as you won't regret getting the chance to sample their alcohol and meet Anthony and Logan! Will definitely swing by again, next time I'm in town.

reviews.author: Alan S.
reviews.description: Happened upon this distillery after leaving a day trip in the area, walked in without an appointment just to see if we could get in, and Logan was so welcoming and friendly. Very great backstory, and he was very generous with the sampling, just an enjoyable, fun, warm, gathering. The whiskey and vodka are top notch, I wish these guys the best of luck and hope to see their product everywhere. They really love what they do.

reviews.author: J M.
reviews.description: The best smoothest vodka you can buy in Texas is from Banner Distilling in Manor. The distillery is down a small road off of 973 and once you reach there it is like an oasis. Both Anthony and Logan are great to talk with, and they share their story of the handcrafted vodka and wheat whiskey. Going to visit the Banner Distillary is like taking a little vacation during the day. Thanks guys !

reviews.author: Jennifer E.
reviews.description: A two man operation making vodka and whiskey.  I contacted them via Facebook messenger to set up a time to come out for a tour.  I had no idea how small they were.  I had found them via some post on Instagram.  I am very happy we were able to spend time with them.  Anthony gave us the tour but Logan was there as well.  They give you a taste of both of their products while explaining their history and their process.  They have grand ideas on how to move forward as well.  Both men have full time day jobs.  They have done everything for this company.  Including building the building you are standing in.  Extremely interesting.  We have gone to a few distilleries and the tours can be a tad repetitive but this one was very enjoyable.  We are grateful they took the time to give us a tour.  Every minute they are with you they are not working on their business.  I wish them nothing but success. Worth your time if you are in the area and can get an appointment.

reviews.author: Kierian Q.
reviews.description: This distillery was amazing.  Local guys that are so friendly and accommodating. As soon as you arrive they make you feel as if they've always known you!! Family and pet friendly establishment w GREAT spirits.  Beautiful scenery, bring your camera!!! Their vodka is so smooth!! I'm a vodka "snob", not even the top shelf brands can compete w banner! The tour was great and so were the cocktails!! I took two bottles home and I will be coming back w all my friends and family!!!!!  Thanks

reviews.author: K B.
reviews.description: Some great Pizza... the toppings are plentiful and the CRUST... oh the crust is so good. Not like any other Pizza I have had. They said that the dough is a family recipe.... wherever it came from I am glad. You gotta try it.  The only improvement would be if they had a coal fired pizza (like in NYC) to give that great coal flavor.  Oh yes... their Vodka is very good too. ;-)

reviews.author: Cynthia D.
reviews.description: Love the concept of this place -- a distillery and pizza restaurant located in a warehouse district off the freeway between Pflugerville and Hutto. Grab an inside picnic table and enjoy the fresh air coming in through the open garage-style door. There is a oversized Connect Four game and cornhole for the kids to play. Plenty of fans mean the inside stays cool.   We tried the watermelon cucumber vodka drink, which was tasty. We also tried a classic cheese pizza and a pesto-sausage-olive pizza. Both were good, but could have used a little kick of flavor -- spice? Seasoning? Next time I would love to try the deep dish. Leave 30-45 mins for bake time.

reviews.author: Christina P.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a pizza place that has amazing pizza you have found it!! This place is small but has extremely delicious pizza amazing customer service bathrooms are clean a nice little small place for kids to play the environment is just perfect we got two pizzas from there and talk about I will never want any other pizza for a long time!! they don't have beer but they do b AE their distillery vodka that's amazing talk about putting Tito's to shame!!

reviews.author: Vanthoun I.
reviews.description: This restaurant is make me sad for waiting my order, and I've been place an order for almost an hour with cashier. still not ready yet, when I ask them for a couple time but they said is almost ready. I don't know why they're cooking for long for just only two pizza. When people front of me just waiting for like 20min. This is sh*t. I place an order at 5:32pm-6:30pm.

reviews.author: Bobbi l.
reviews.description: Dine in or to go pizza and vodka daiquiris! We have been several times. Still need to try the deep dish. The dough is homemade and wonderful. My favorite was the mambo Italiano pizza with garlic white sauce instead of pesto. Oh And if you squeeze some lime into the cherry daiquiris it tastes like a cherry limeade, I am hooked. So delicious!

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Amazing family owned business! The pizza crust is to die for!! They also brew their own vodka and it is very smooth. They have many different flavored drink options that use their vodka in them. Also the cannolis  *chefs Kiss*

reviews.author: A S.
reviews.description: We're so happy that we've found a great pizza place that also has great deep dish pizza. Best deep dish in Austin.

reviews.author: Kevin L.
reviews.description: This place has it right... all the way down to me eating the crust. If the pizza isn't enough... that vodka puts Tito's to shame. Great food, great family, and great service.

reviews.author: Jon W.
reviews.description: Pizza is the best in town.  I know pizza I eat it 5 times a week.  Anthony's , Via 313 , Homeslice etc    This ( hand tossed ) has a unique flavor that will keep you coming back . Hands down my new favorite place.  Just wish they'd open more hours.

reviews.author: Mariahlyne B.
reviews.description: Very hidden, but sooooo good. We pulled up to the place and it was a cool concept for a pizza place. Good pizza :) a little pricy, but the pizza was huge. Also, the daiquiris are perfectly mixed and good as well. Will be returning for sure:)

reviews.author: Angela A.
reviews.description: Literally the best pizza! Fresh ingredients. Amazing sauces and crust! Not to mention the vodka distillery and daiquiri's! Must try! We love this place and are so happy this is in our neighborhood! About to order from there now as a matter of fact!

name: Sidecar Tasting Room
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: Went today with friends. Had the red wine flight...rose', montepulciano and the Tempranillo...liked them all but not enough to buy.  Had the meat and cheese plate...yum.   Ann (sommelier) was sweet and knowledgeable.  Flagship winery is Big Springs winery (which we visited today as well)   BUY LOCAL  SUPPORT LOCAL

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: Had a great time at Sidecar. Stopped in for lunch and a flight of wines as our first stop in Dripping and really enjoyed the setup. Lunch is from a food truck (trailer) on site. My group tasted reds and whites and all were very tasty. Food was good - had burgers and they were good quality. Setup was nice with covered tables outdoors or an indoor option. I didn't check out the brewery onsite but did see some guys partaking in the brews. I would not hesitate to return.

reviews.author: Cory Jo M.
reviews.description: Super cool environment and beautiful decor! The vibe here was awesome! The wine was okay. I like sweet wine and the wine flight was dry so I didn't enjoy it like a wished I would've.

reviews.author: Lacy B.
reviews.description: This place is so cute!!! Amazing service. Delicious empanadas. Love the rosè! We sat outside under the oak trees and enjoyed the scenery. Perfect first stop of our bachelorette weekend!

reviews.author: Tiffany Y.
reviews.description: Visiting from California and we wanted to go wine tasting and this was a winery nearby so we decided to give it a try. No regrets! Anne was very welcoming and friendly. She also gave us information on other wineries/breweries/distilleries to try. I had the $15 flight of reds and she also gave me an extra cup of red wine, Needy B*tch, I ended up buying a bottle! I finally found a great bottle of red that I actually enjoy, sad that I can't get it shipped to me in California. Drippin' Sweet is also great, bought a bottle as well. Love the descriptions given to the wines it made them sound all delicious. And they were! (According to all the ones I tried).

reviews.author: Jules A.
reviews.description: This little place is amazing!! A very welcoming and clean environment and have a nice selection of wines. Also the cheese and meat platter is so good!!  We stopped by on our way to Dallas. You definitely have to check it out!

reviews.author: Tracy M.
reviews.description: Great little place to go taste and snack! We had a flight of the white and red and they were great. We had one of each of the empanadas and all three were so good! I'm not sure where they get those things but they are amazing. My favorite was the bbq one. They also have games you can play. Would be a good place for a date!

reviews.author: Jeanette D.
reviews.description: Pretty good wine tasting. We did the red wine tasting. My favorite wine was the Tranquillo wine. $15 for 3 wines which is a little weak for wine tasting but the cool ambience made the trip worth it and the portions weren't weak.

reviews.author: Briana N.
reviews.description: Talk about southern hospitality. So we came here from a airbnb in dripping springs. It was a little far for an Uber to pick us up, but we got one. So we are there enjoying wine glasses, wine flights, food, the atmosphere. Everything about this place is so cute and amazing. But trying to get an Uber home seemed unlikely. Everyone kept cancelling on us and the bartender Ann or Annie (plus the last two customers) kept telling us that we were not gonna walk the 2 miles home. Annie made sure that we stayed till she closed and literally DROVE US BACK TO THE AIR BNB!!!. She was the sweetest thing and didn't even want to take any money from us. We had a back and forth of take it, no keep it, take it!! Haha I'm 80% sure I got the money in her cupholder before I left but I was the tipsy one so who knows haha. I really hope I did because driving us back to our Airbnb was above and beyond.

reviews.author: Mallory Y.
reviews.description: Absolutely great place to stop by if you are in the Dripping Springs area. The service was top-notch and the decor is really eclectic! They have wine flight options or you can enjoy a glass if you chose. The server was incredibly knowledgeable and had great recommendations for everyone in our group. She let us try what we wanted before committing to our drink of choice. I ended up going to wine cocktail called the Texas Kiri and it fresh rosemary in it which I though was a nice touch! They also have live music outside and plenty of areas to sit and enjoy listening to it. Definitely try this place out!

reviews.author: Jenni S.
reviews.description: Super cute little place in drippings springs, but I wasn't a huge fan of the wine. Sad, because I really wanted to love it. Maybe next years harvest will be better!

reviews.author: Tanna L.
reviews.description: My friend and I were looking for a bar to hang out at. We came across Sidecar. Everyone is so friendly and enjoy the time we spent here.

reviews.author: Steven A.
reviews.description: Great experience for a weekend visit by friends from out of town. They had a great selection of delicious wines as well as live indie folk music. Will definitely come back and would recommend!

reviews.author: Jesse M.
reviews.description: Being in the Industry, it was a pleasant surprise to visit the Sidecar Tasting Room! Claire was an awesome Host, knowledgeable about the wines, and gave great info on recommendations. Clean and tasteful Wine Bar and I enjoyed the Red Flight! Took a few bottles home to enjoy!

reviews.author: Marilyn M.
reviews.description: Great ambiance, really good wines! We did the tasting and bought a bottle to take home! Hide gem in Dripping Springs!

reviews.author: Jennifer E.
reviews.description: We were in town for another winery quarterly wine pick up party.  That winery no longer allows you to open your bottles of wine at the party or allow dogs.  As such, it wasn't a great day.  We decided to go some place else.  We showed up around 4pm on a Sunday and had the entire place to ourselves. It is so cute.  I love the decorations and the vibe. We did the wine tasting which is $7 or waved if you buy a bottle of wine.  Megan was wonderful.  She was full of information and funny.  We had such a wonderful time we decided to join Bell Springs wine club.  Three bottles a quarter. No sign up fee. They have a wine pick up party that allows you to bring your dogs.  20% discount the first year and the discount increases every year you are a member.  Free wine tasting for you and four people either at Side Car or the winery itself. You also get to pick which three bottles you want. We signed up on the spot. What is NOT to like! We enjoyed many of their wines but really it was Megan.  She made us feel so welcomed and was so friendly.  Bell Spring treat her right, she is a HUGE asset to you.  We can't wait to attend our first wine pick up party.  Hope to make it to first Thursday soon and hang out at the Side Car.  If we lived in Dripping Springs this would be a weekly stop for us.  What a great place in this sleepy town.  We are so glad to part of their wine club and excited for the many cool events moving forward.  This should be a place to stop if you are in Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Paige M.
reviews.description: LOVED the atmosphere! Such a cute place and great dry whites. The girl working there had a wonderful personality.  She was so easy to talk to and very knowledgeable. If I'm just hanging out, looking for a nice place to chill with a glass, this will be it!

reviews.author: Peter V.
reviews.description: This place has a great selection and wonderful staff. Claire (taller with blonde hair) is absolutely fabulous. She really gets to know the clients. Also very knowledgeable. I recommend the Needy Bitch red wine.

reviews.author: Aaron M.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and wonderful selection of wines. Don't let the road it's one stop you from enjoying this spot.

reviews.author: Claire P.
reviews.description: This was the perfect stop off while driving through. They had good wine, good service and great ambiance. We would definitely recommend to anyone driving through Dripping Springs.

name: Revolution Spirits
address: 12345 Paul's Valley RdBldg G and H

reviews.author: Alvin D.
reviews.description: good drinks, good food, good folks!  so I first came here on a Sunday and was disappointed to learn that I wouldn't be able to buy any bottles - so came back the next day!  but that first visit got me hooked. once we sat down we had a little baby flight presented to us...I've never had a gin this good at room temperature. it was so surprising! I was also really intrigued by the damiana, and generally enjoyed the cocktails we tried. also, was pleasantly surprised that the kitchen food was also quite good. all in all if I lived here I'd hang out on the weekends.

reviews.author: Charlene P.
reviews.description: I've been here twice and I have to say they are just the nicest people! The sprits are amazing as well. Cocktails are very well priced. Stop by. You won't be disappointed!

reviews.author: A E.
reviews.description: This is a chill place. Tried to go to Jester King down the road (and didn't get to, for the 2nd time in a row cause it's always so damn busy) so decided to go here instead. Glad we did! They were very attentive to us as soon as we came in, and we loved the complimentary tasting flight. Ended up buying a bottle of the coffee liquor we can't find at the liquor store. And I love the virgin pineapple drink they made for my toddler. Matt was fantastic! Very attentive, not pushy. Good vibes all around.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: It's gin and gin cocktails. Not my thing but since I drug hubby to wine tasting had to give a little. Nice space indoor and out. Friendly staff. Dog friendly. Hubby and other patrons raved about the cocktails.

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: This just a covid update. These guys are the shnt when it comes to keepng their customers safe. Frequent sanitizing, rejecting anti-mask morons, and STILL they providing kick ass service and product. They've recently added food service and arguably have some of the best bbq in the area. If u haven't been, ur missing out BIG time.

reviews.author: Anastasia D.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this place after a visit to Jester King on a Sunday. There was no one there, creating both a serene and deserted vibe. The tasting was free, while the cocktails were in the $8-10 range. The gin, coffee liqueur and pecan liqueur were amazing! However, because it was Sunday, we couldnt buy bottles, which was very disappointing. The cocktails were a bit of a let down that didnt let the spirits shine. The best was the gingery take on a White Russian. The service was very friendly and attentive, yet again, we were the only customers. I definitely recommend picking up a bottle of their gin and liqueurs if you can find them!

reviews.author: Tim G.
reviews.description: Upon walking in they gave us a flight to taste their liquors. This place is a hidden gem and will soon explode. I'm so happy to have experienced this place. Their home made liquors and sodas made for a great day. But then they had amazing food. BBQ 2 lb turkey leg awesome queso. The only issue I had was that I couldn't try more because I was driving. I will be absolutely making this a reoccurring stop.

reviews.author: Ray R.
reviews.description: Love the drinks and now BBQ available! Outdoor seating with heaters. Had several  hot and cold cocktails, all were fantastic. Brought home excellent brisket, ribs, and chili con queso. Amazing what these guys are doing here.

reviews.author: Maria M.
reviews.description: Excellent gin - we bought a bottle with their homemade tonic as well and it an absolutely delicious. The tasting was a pleasant surprise!   Free cocktail and tasting was included with a stamp from Jester King down the street, so glad we stopped in.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Stopped by after checking out Last Stand and I was really impressed by what these guys are producing here: High-quality gin and other spirits, and beautifully crafted artisan cocktails. These folks are some real artisans who are passionate about the craft they're putting out there.  Now is a great time to be in the Austin with so many talented chefs, artisans, and craftsmen putting out some really great products out there! There's no doubt in my mind that Revolution Spirits will soar into greatness.

reviews.author: Elaine M.
reviews.description: Visited here on a Sunday.  We loved the super friendly staff and the spirits too!  Upon entering the tasting room they asked if we had ever been before.  When we answered no they immediately brought over for a tasting - no charge.  We enjoyed most of the different offerings.  Then we picked out some cocktails to enjoy - both with their gin.  Daughters was with grapefruit and mine with cucumber.  We also purchased a cheese plate which we were told was made up for them from the local grocery store.  Nonetheless, we enjoyed our cocktails out on the picnic tables and had quite a lovely time.    Not being from Texas we were unaware of the law prohibiting liquor sales on Sundays.  We certainly would have bought a bottle if  we could have.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: We hit the jackpot when we found this place. Not only is there a liquor pretty good, but the staff is super nice. The area is pretty small, so it's not ideal for big groups, but don't let that deter you. After our tasting, they offered us a free cocktail. If you're a fan of coffee, you must try their cafecito or chocolate cafecito spirit. My favorite was their gin. If you like mezcal, try to their gin reserve in mezcal barrel. Definitely a must when you're in the area

reviews.author: Aparna B.
reviews.description: While we were sipping our ciders at Argus pondering about where we should go next, Revolution Spirits popped up on Yelp and so we of course headed there without any second thought!  This place is really amazing!! There was quite a bit of crowd as it was saturday but we were still given a great deal of attention during our tasting! My favorite was the cafecito coffee liquer and the chocolate cafecito. They're so good, that I could probably drink an entire bottle all by myself!  The best part of this place is the amazing people who own/work here and they didn't even charge us for the tastings and also gave us a free cocktail made with their gin!! So as appreciation from our end for all that they did and shared with us, we gave a nice tip :)!! Definitely, going to look for Revolution on my next trip to Spec's!

reviews.author: Sarah W.
reviews.description: You have to come here - if you have never had a gin you can sip room temperature without a mixer, you have never had a good gin.  Beautiful floral gin, wonderful amaro, and the most amazing other items.

reviews.author: Suzanne H.
reviews.description: Its sooooOooo smooooth. Gin is excellent and tasting is generous! The guys are informative and friendly. My only complaint is the place isn't air conditioned...but Gin= EXCELLENT, SUPERB, LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!

reviews.author: Chris C.
reviews.description: Avoid the crowds, get the good stuff.   This place is small, but the selection is pretty solid--everything from fruit liquors to their flagship gin and several mixers. Best of all there was no need to pay $$ upfront for a tour--just walk in and start tasting and talking.   The gin was the standout here, but all the stuff we tried was excellent except for their own cherry-limeade mixer--that was kind of a letdown, but the alcohol itself was great.   Can easily walk from here to Last Stand Brewing and Argus Cidery. There was a food truck outside as well.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Everything was done right - great customer service, clean flow for visitors, and the quality and uniqueness of the distilled liquor itself was great. To elaborate, samples were provided for the different options of their distilled liquor while an explanation of the flavors was provided, which was particularly beneficial for the 100 proof gin such has notes of grapefruit, lavender, and juniper. They also have a coffee liquour which is 50 proof, so a bit stronger than the traditional but still very sweet and flavorful. Even after the tasting, it was a nice place to hang out and was well ventilated and shaded.

reviews.author: Cait K.
reviews.description: Excellent local distillery!  My favorite alcohols were the gin and cafecito; also, the tonic they use (Springwood) which I had in a GandT I ordered after the tasting is also locally produced and top-notch.  The cherry on top is that the distillers are extremely friendly and knowledgeable.  Will be visiting again soon.

reviews.author: Vicki M.
reviews.description: We loved this place.  We stopped by during the last hour last Friday eve as one set of customers was leaving.  John Henry, owner, was so very friendly.  Had a delightful time talking with him about his distillery and spirits while sampling as well as general conversation later at our table.  We were given samples of gin, amaro, and two coffee liqueurs.  All were very good.  We then picked our cocktails, which he made and brought to our table.  Very tasty and reasonably priced.  We were not rushed out and time was not even mentioned by the owner.  I realized it was 15 min. after closing so we finished our drinks and bought some small size bottles.  We will be back!

reviews.author: Thom And Vicky H.
reviews.description: Revolution is a tiny little gem manned by some very knowledgeable and passionate makers. Upon visiting, we found their doors swung open to a single long room that had spirit-making equipment and two booths set up.  At the first booth, we had complimentary tastings and a saga-sharing session with their amiable bartender. The tastings were amazing: their hibiscus gin and tonic cocktail was incredible (the taste you crave days afterward). After the tasting, you can meander on to taste some of their specialty liquors (fruity ones too). We found their eau de vivre to be phenomenal, lovely aroma and as smooth as butter. Would highly recommend stashing oodles of their spirits away for safekeeping!

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: This is a must stop place. Don't drive by without going inside for a sample. The vodka is so smooth. The creams are out of this world and the elderflower liquor is perfect for a spritzer or to sweeten that mixed drink from Brad. I can just drink it on its own but I am tough like that.

reviews.author: Kristy C.
reviews.description: The place has great potential. Very cute and good drinks.  But they have a long way to go when it comes to customer service.  The bar tender seemed to be really put out that we were even there.  Didn't welcome us, when we asked if we needed to go to the register part of the bar to order,  he looked at his phone and rudely said, I'll be with you in a min. Then continued to be annoyed that he had to take our order. The place was empty only 1 pinter group of 4 so wasn't like he was super busy.  They even said he didn't really seem to want to be there and definitely didn't want to be taking our orders.  The AC was also very lacking we were all fanning ourselves with the menu which seemed to be the best use of the menu since he didn't want to serve us. The sink in the women's bathroom barley had water coming out if it and they were out of toliet paper but we dare not ask the 1 bar tender as that would have really put him over the top. I wouldn't recommend this place and if I was the owner I'd want to know how bad my employee is. No wonder there was no one inside.

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: Just a quick update (which I intended to post in December).  Stinson is alive and well in their new digs--now fronting FM 150. Much more spacious. It'll be a great space to spend an afternoon once the pandemic ends.  Call ahead if you want to pick up some of their fabulous Texas Holiday Nog, but remember, only 2 bottles per person per month.  Careful though and drink responsibly. This is not your father's Oldsmobile eggnog. It will sneak up on you and kicks you in the noggin like a freakin' mule.

reviews.author: Claire A.
reviews.description: Quiet little distillery to visit down south, great selection of cocktails. Was hoping to find some wine as well but was told the wine is mainly used for the brandy. This place had board games, friendly staff and is dog friendly! Highly recommend checking it out. Planning to come back when they restock their whiskey and egg nog

reviews.author: Karie B.
reviews.description: I have loved this place in the past.  Drinks were always measured and made to perfection-  delicious!!  The two female bartenders we have had in the past were amazing.   However I think they missed the mark on this expansion.  Sadly this is NOT the same place.  Total different vibe.  The new 'bar manager'  (a dude) made me a Mojito that I couldn't drink. He also told my husband that he is planning a lot of new drinks to put on the menu

reviews.author: Deborah M.
reviews.description: We went on a distillery drive in Dripping Springs and this was our last but BEST stop!  We sampled and bought the premium vodka and then went back and got the coffee based liquor Carajillo and the Texas Holiday Nog.  I highly recommend these and a trip out there to visit the friendly staff.  I might have to buy the holiday rum based egg nog for all my friends for the holidays!

reviews.author: Laryssa B.
reviews.description: This spot is a Awesome. When driving from Austin to San Antonio, we stopped for bbq up the road and then came here to taste. All the liquors were good, the cocktails were too. The gentlemen working were friendly and knowledgeable. (Also patient with all our questions)   We bought two bottles of the Carajillo, which is ten times better than any baileys or other coffee liqueur we've ever tasted.   These guys had a great playlist rocking, and the wood wall behind the bar is beautiful!

reviews.author: Taylor W.
reviews.description: Won't waste your money on this place, service was terrible, female bartenders are rude

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Cool place with great staff. I had never tried anything like this before and a nice change of pace from the wineries. They have a neat setup inside a metal building. It's not the easiest place to find but would be a great place to just hang out for awhile. They have some outdoor seating and corn hole games set up too. Really different experience.

reviews.author: Joe B.
reviews.description: So, stopped in at Stinson's and met a couple of the owners.  There is so much to love about the place.  Good drinks. Original takes on standards like their take on the margarita: The Brandyrita.  Had a great time. But the star of the show was their Texas Brandy, and the Carajillo, which made me a fan.  Can't wait to go back and find out what else they have cooked up.   Great stuff.

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: A cool little distillery with very friendly staff. Quaint and chill spot to have a drink and relax. My friend and I went on a whim after eating at the Salt Lick and seeing signs to this distillery. We hung out for an hour. We talked with the staff, drank a dram, and played some corn hole. Great little spot with awesome drinks. As a whiskey guy, that's what I wanted to try, but it wasn't ready. Nevertheless, brandy was good. Great time at an awesome location with good people.   Enjoy.

reviews.author: Michael G.
reviews.description: Come check out Stinson Distilling. Amazing drinks and staff. Lots of refreshing drinks in this hot heat.

reviews.author: Arian E.
reviews.description: There is only one downside to this place: they make you bring your own funnel for doing Rumstands from the big jugs.  Otherwise this is a fantastic young distillery and one of the best after-hours swingers hangouts in Austin!!!  You can't loose with booze!!!

reviews.author: Kelvin T.
reviews.description: Elderflower liquor is legit! Highly recommend! And try the Citrus Fizz. Had to pull around the back of the building to part and enter the tasting room. Good setting!

reviews.author: Nicole C.
reviews.description: Delicious variety of alcohols to try and great mix drinks. We also had a tour of the distillery process. Tried the Passionate Lady, Citrus Fizz, and reserve tasting- all very good! Love the tasting room decor and environment!

reviews.author: Rafael V.
reviews.description: Love this place. Best mojitos around. Vodka and rum are really off the charts amazing.  The inside is nice and cool and you can play games while you drink. People that go are very personable.

reviews.author: Al G.
reviews.description: Great little secret of Driftwood. These cocktail concoctions are simply amazing. If you want a place that's unique and specializes in great spirits this is your go to stop!

reviews.author: Wanida S.
reviews.description: Lots of choices and table games. It's hot out but they have a big fan to help keep you cool. We will be back soon.

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: We passed by this place heading to the Drip yesterday and since I'd never heard of it, I immediately yelped it.  A new distillary only about 10 minutes from my Casa?  Hell yes, I'm curious.  And I'll admit I became even more curiouser after reading Arian's review....I intended to ask them about this "one of the best after-hours swingers hangouts in Austin!!!" sitch.    The tasting room was a little hard to find as it's around the back of this little warehouse strip but it's open and spacious and we were only the 2nd couple there on a Friday evening.  We were warmly greeted and bellied up to the bar.  Our bartender (and all the staff I think) are in the Stinson family.  She was very friendly and gave us all the history of the place and explained each tasting in length.  They are currently offering a tasting of 4 of their liquors for $7 (these served quaintly in communion cups) and have cocktails they can serve as well.  We sampled everything (of course), the vodka, the white rum and dark rum, the elderflower liquor (think St Germaine) and the Holiday Nog.  She also threw in a sampling of their Bailey's style coffee liquor that's not quite "ready" yet.  I immediately fell in love with the Holiday Nog, which doesn't actually have any egg in it (thank goodness) and is made more with rum than whiskey (again, thank goodness).  This will go great with holiday gatherings.  I will keep an eye on their FB page for release of that coffee liquor!  All of their bottles run in the $25 range.  Hubby and I each had a cocktail, him the mojito and me the Citrus Fizz, and both were made well and were tasty.  We also bought several of their cocktail glasses as they are sturdy heavy glass, perfect for Bourbon.  Which, btw, they are still perfecting their whiskey recipe and will offer that in the future as well.    We really enjoyed talking to everyone and after getting a little liquid courage, I did ask about the swinger's parties.  She laughed and said that was just a friend making jokes....I wonder......

reviews.author: Dewey L.
reviews.description: We came across this distillery accidentally, and so glad we found it.  It may not look like much on the outside, but inside, the drinks were great.  Nice variety and options.  Will definitely return!

reviews.author: Carl W.
reviews.description: The owner Colonel Phil W is a true American patriot. His drinks all have names that conjure up military maneuvers of yesteryear. He cares deeply about this country and is willing to defend it even in the face of a lousy subpoena issued to him by Cheney's witch hunt from the House select committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol. Jeez. Why don't these libtards give up already! They should instead enjoy a refreshing beverage from the establishment owned by Colonel Phil Waldron. A man who realized the election was rigged and had constructed a plan for throwing out the results. What an American hero!!

reviews.author: Delia S.
reviews.description: Let me preface my review by saying that I'm not an avid beer drinker and only like non-hoppy varieties. I can't really comment on their beer other than to say, the three I tried were not to my liking, but what I can say is that I love this place!  I've been here twice now, with friends, and with my man and both times have been great!  The place is spacious and covered in tree canopies with a sprinkle of fire pits, Adirondack chairs and picnic tables. The service is good and the mules are divine. I love that they serve cocktails as well as beer so there is something that I like and something for the beer drinkers, like my boo.   We were lucky on both occasions to have great weather and this time around, live music. I've been to several of the breweries and distilleries along Fitzhugh and so far, this is my favorite.

reviews.author: Rodolfo R.
reviews.description: What a disgusting excuse for an establishment. If you like the bitter taste of sedition and treason with your drinks then feel free to patronize this "s-hole" of an establishment, as a true American... I prefer to spend my American dollars elsewhere.

reviews.author: Chris L.
reviews.description: I didn't care for the place or the drinks at all.  The staff was rude and one of them insulted my wife when she asked for some more ice.  Will not return when I'm back in Texas

reviews.author: Kevin D.
reviews.description: This place is a joke.  Spirits taste like rubbing alcohol and staff are incredibly rude.  Much better places to drink in the area.

reviews.author: Robert B.
reviews.description: Many people are saying that it's just Costco booze sold as house-made, and the owner is a traitor.

reviews.author: Bill D.
reviews.description: This place is owned by a seditionist traitor, a person complicit in attempting to subvert the results of the last election and install a dictator. He dishonors himself and his military service, having taken an oath to defend the constitution and then taking a big dump on it. I'd say shame on him, but people like him know no shame. There are much better places than this to spend your drinking money

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: So long and short. Rock solid 5 stars.   Our waitress Chloe was super sweet and delivered us a round of all 4 rums. The Gold had a little bite to it, but all were delicious.   The wife's hurricane was potent but delicious.   I snagged a raddler which was a little different to a traditional one, but delicious and dangerous as you can probably down 6 before the Lord almighty gets the news.   The brew house and distillery are open and outside seating is abundant.   Bring your 4-legged friends for the ride as they are super dog friendly!!!!  You would have to be drunk and mad to pass this place when visiting Dripping Springs. Wait...they might be able to take care of that for you...responsibly of course.   So. Great drinks? Check. Great staff? Check. Great atmosphere? Check? VETERAN OWNED BUSINESS?!? Affirmative. God Bless y'all for your service.   Rock solid 5 stars.

reviews.author: Tia H.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem!! We stopped in by chance, having never heard of it, and we're so pleasantly surprised. Not only is the owner a super friendly fella, but the alcohol is legit on point. I don't remember the last time I had such a smooth vodka. And the hurricanes- wow. So. Freaking. Good. The place is adorable, by the way. Super super cute. Veteran owned is a huge plus. We'll be going back again and again.

reviews.author: Maine R.
reviews.description: Literally bugs floating in our beer, this place is disgusting!

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: I'm giving them a three star, because I like the location and that there is outdoor seating... And that the staff is attentive. Otherwise I probably would not come back here, the drink I got was literally all syrup and made me extremely sick to where we had to leave... Kind of completely ruined the day. My boyfriend enjoyed the drink he ordered, which I believe was the hurricane. They have a wing food truck that you can order from, unfortunately we didn't get to try it because the drink made me so sick. We plan to go back in try the wings and will review the wing food truck. Great location for the spot, nice and relaxing... Just be careful what you order and avoid anything that has syrup in it.

reviews.author: Thomas C.
reviews.description: Thirst quenching beer. Great cocktails. Superior customer service. Everything is fresh and home-made. Definitely a must visit location. Can't wait for our next visit

reviews.author: Paula M.
reviews.description: Just go!! It is awesome!! For those of us that would prefer vodka over beer but have friends that love beer. This is the place!!

reviews.author: Tara S.
reviews.description: Had beverages here this weekend! AMAZING! Excellent service and drinks on point! We had the pirates punch and then a couple of their other cocktails...all were worth it!

reviews.author: Julie R.
reviews.description: We stopped here after to trying to get into the cluster called Deep Eddies. This was a hit, the cocktails were amazing. We decided to buy a whole bottle of vodka. The atmosphere was amazing, lots of trees, lots of space and delicious wings! Our friends enjoyed the craft cocktails! We highly recommend if you want a wonderful experience! Skip Deep Eddies and spend your time and money here!

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: Staff, management are super friendly and the big red one salty is the bomb of drinks. Always have great music and love their outdoor setting. A cigar lounge next door, fire pits and food makes this distillery a great venue.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: We made our first run to One Shot on a Friday afternoon recently and thoroughly enjoyed it. They are presently distilling rum and vodka and brewing several varieties of beer.  My spouse tried a Big Red One with salt -- a vodka drink -- and a Cuba Libre.  She was pleased with both. I had their amber and liked it so much I had another.  They have a clever solution to social distancing. The two young, friendly order takers are stationed under a canopy at the edge of the parking lot by their outside seating. You place your order with them, and one goes inside to fetch your drinks. There are plenty of shade trees and picnic benches so it's a pleasant experience. The owner , Phil, came out to say hi to a fellow vet (me). Nice, congenial guy.  The Dripping Wings food truck is stationed there now, so I went back for an order for dinner. Excellent wings, particularly the Asian sweet and spicy.  Glad to have a new convenient venue to enjoy.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: We decided to get out of the house today and do a little driving. Came across this place in Dripping Springs, and stopped for some drinks. Nice, large, shaded outdoor area with lots of oak trees and picnic tables.  I had the Cuba Libre cocktail that has Star Bullet rum, splash of lime, and coke. Delicious!  Husband loves IPAs and had the Panzer IPA, said it was great.  Inside of distillery and brewery were closed, but they have two food trucks on site. Service was awesome and friendly. Would come back!

reviews.author: Robyn G.
reviews.description: I love hanging out here.  Awesome outside seating and Dripping Wings is also there.  I'm a fan of their amber beer but they make delicious drinks as well!

reviews.author: David H.
reviews.description: This is truly one of a kind! There are so many amazing things to say about One Shot. The owners and staff are so personable! Great drinks and wonderful location! This is one of the most memorable places I have ever been to!

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Great stop on your trip to Dripping Springs. A family owned and run business. The owners are super friendly, and it's such a relaxing atmosphere. I had the blackberry smash with vodka and it was so good. They have the option of vodka or gin in your cocktail depending on your preference.   Definitely a great way to spend a day!

reviews.author: Dave M.
reviews.description: We spent the weekend visiting distilleries and this was very disappointing.   It's not busy at all but they still gave us gin instead of vodka.  It would be okay to play some music as it's awkwardly quiet due to the lack of patrons.  Finally, the people at the counter seemed annoyed with people overall.  Another couple in  the parking lot stopped us and asked if we had the same bad experience so it was not just us.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: Had a great stop here. The blackberry smash was amazing. The Helen's were amazing too. They are very eco friendly, affordable and yummy. And the people were friendly. Win win win trifecta! We left with four bottles.

reviews.author: Jeff P.
reviews.description: Family owned and operated distillery makes for a welcoming experience.  Not like other local "corporate" locations.   Patio is large with plenty of comfortable chairs.   Vodka and Gin are amazing.   My wife enjoyed the Gin sample which was truly surprising.   She a vodka gal.   This is a must stop.  Bypass the corporate spots and come here first.
