reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Definitely a hidden place with a great view! Glad we stopped at this place after seeing a sign off the side of the road and following a winding path down to see this gem.  Very homey vibes with a great patio for outdoor seeing that just has a fantastic view of the hill country. Decently priced drinks consisting of either gin or vodka.  Seating is pretty limited inside, but the outdoor space is just amazing and honestly makes the experience really that much better. I'd highly recommend 'The Bullfrog' with vodka. Tasty drink, but not overpowering and has a nice kick (smooth vodka that doesn't burn like gasoline).  P.S. They have some cool looking merch! Make sure to take a look at their terrariums...they are wicked!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Frog Pond Distillery was a pleasant surprise.  I have been wanting to come here for a while now, but always drive-by, and don't get a chance to turn around.  However, this time I made a trip purposefully to stop in.  I am glad I did.  Frog Pond is a family-owned business and passion project. The entire family was behind the bar the day my friend and I stopped in except for mom and I think a daughter.  The family owns the land and has slowly overtime built the tasting room and production area themselves.  They currently make a vodka and gin.  They offered us a free sip of each to determine which we would prefer in one of their handcrafted cocktails.  Both had a nice flavor profile that blends well in cocktails.  Their cocktails were creative and they mentioned the family came up with the recipes together.  The cocktails were delicious and very reasonably priced.  Their space has a fun modern 50's theme.  They have an outdoor patio you can sit back and relax on a nice day.

reviews.author: Rachel A.
reviews.description: This is a family run business, which is a major plus!   Love supporting local, small family operated businesses. Their vodka is top notch and their featured cocktails are great.  The views from the porch are amazing and so serene. Definitely coming back for another round.

reviews.author: Anastacia R.
reviews.description: My friends and I were doing distillery/brewery tours in Dripping Springs for a cute birthday celebration. We tried Deep Eddy's but they were closed so we decided to give Frog Pong a try and we were not disappointed! The guys at the front were helpful and kind. The drinks were so affordable and flavorful, I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Wanida S.
reviews.description: I've always wanted to stop in and check this place out. It's got a great view and their vodka and gins were tasty. They weren't overpriced and had great service. **only open on the weekends.

reviews.author: Arko G.
reviews.description: On our way to a wedding, we stopped by for a cocktail, and this was the perfect spot. We were debating between here and Deep Eddy, and we picked here for a more off the beaten path option and chill atmosphere. And we were definitely not disappointed. The staff were very helpful and welcoming and knowledgeable about their product. Outdoor seating is spacious with impressive views. Cocktails were highly affordable and very tasty. Unfortunately, tours were closed due to COVID, but we hope we can come back for tours some time soon!

reviews.author: Christina M.
reviews.description: What a nice change of pace from the better known distillery down the road. Instead of an overcrowded atmosphere with way overpriced drinks, this place is relaxing and affordable. There's a great wrap around porch to take in the landscape around you, while sipping a delicious cocktail. I definitely recommend stopping in if you're in the area!

reviews.author: Glenn R.
reviews.description: What a beautiful facility!  Stopped in for their grand opening and was amazed at such a sparkling clean, friendly place.  It's very obvious that a lot of careful thought has gone into this place. The actual distillery is incredible. The whole place is just beautiful. Even on a scorching Texas Summer day, there's a strong breeze out on the porch.  It's a very "Austin-esque" type place, down-home and friendly. Although I don't drink, my wife enjoyed a cocktail very much and we bought a bottle to take home. They had some nice lemonade and infused water for me too.  Great design of the logo, bottles and everything. Really worth stopping in if you're in the area or just feel like a nice drive from Austin.

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: While driving into Dripping Springs for an anniversary get away we spotted this beautiful building set near 290, decided to turn in and see what it was. We weren't disappointed, Super cute place, nice patio to hang out on while sipping lovely cocktails. Really reasonably priced drinks (mixed drinks either $5 or $6 depending on choice). Has an area to play games out front, and indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Steve T.
reviews.description: They put advertising stickers on your car without permission, which is astonishing. I left the one on my trunk and added a sticker that says "sucks" under it. Unbelievable that they would do this.

reviews.author: Christiana F.
reviews.description: I stopped by after a recommendation from one of the wineries in the area. The owners were very welcoming and their drinks were fantastic! I ended up buying a bottle of gin on the way out. It was chilly and the sun was going down so we weren't able to sit outside but the view was great and seems like a fun spot during the summer.

reviews.author: Lochness P.
reviews.description: Delicious drinks! Vodka is super smooth. I recommend the Helen! And the patio with the view is beautiful!

reviews.author: Claire K.
reviews.description: Walked in was greeted and made to feel like I was in my own home. If my home was a sweet Distillery like the Frog Pond. Patio and chair were peace on Earth. With a amazing Texas Breeze. And the Gin and Tonic was just perfect. My sister got the cocktail of the day with lavender and gin and it was amazing. Color and all. I highly recommend a stop to this Local Distillery. They are A must try.

reviews.author: Carey D.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem. We started off at another well known distillery down the road and googled what else was close by and found this awesome little spot with a great view. They make small batches of vodka and gin at the distillery and make a few different drinks to try. Their porch was a great place to hang out while playing giant jenga and relaxing. I noticed cornhole as we walked in as well. We watched deer randomly wandering in the distance. The drink I had was great, a cranberry vodka fizz, so I had another. The indoor space is fairly small and the patio could fit maybe 30 people comfortably. It was not crowded at all when we were there on a Sunday afternoon. We'll go again next time we're in Austin!

reviews.author: Devin C.
reviews.description: I am very new to the Gin world, but I was truly in need of an alternative to Dark liquors. I heard about this place from a coworker and decided to take a chance. I am very happy to say that the product that they are offering, not only the liquor, is amazing. They couldn't have picked a better location to place their distillery. The hills of Texas, day or night, make relaxing on the patio with the variety of gin and vodka cocktails that much more relaxing. The bright pops of color when you venture inside of the distillery are such a delight and really made my girlfriend and I feel happy to be in such a welcoming place.   The gin was delicious and I plan to buy more bottles very soon. Don't think that my lack of praise for the vodka means that it isn't good (I am just not a fan of vodka..rough nights in college) but I definitely suggesting venturing out to this family run, local organization. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: Love this place!! Their gin and vodka are amazing. Their cocktails are on point. The views are phenomenal. I am never going back to deep Eddy's when frog pond is right here?!?

reviews.author: E R.
reviews.description: Good pours, tasty rum, a lovely shaded deck to sit out on, and congenial staff. Perfect spot for a quick cocktail or a wind down and a nice chat.

reviews.author: Pam S.
reviews.description: Great spot to enjoy a drink and relax! We arrived on a Thursday afternoon. Bartender greeted us warmly and talked to us about the rums are made. I appreciated feeling welcomed in spite of the lack of traffic in the out there location. We ordered drinks and sat among the trees on their awesome deck for a bit. My husband bought all three varieties when we left. Worth a visit!

reviews.author: Raymond J.
reviews.description: Been here twice now and really just stopped this time to get their bourbon filled chocolates for my guests on our drive by.  Great place to seat and enjoy the outdoor country view and have a drink.  Sample their Bourbon and have some chocolate filled Bourbon.  Come visit this place when you are near by

reviews.author: Jazz C.
reviews.description: The rum was delicious! The guy behind the bar was so nice and welcoming. It's a great place to relax and enjoy a delicious drink! There's lots of outdoor space perfect for social distancing.

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: During a recent car club event, I called Cypress Creek from a restaurant in Wimberley to tell them our arrival was eminent. The lady on the other end of the call was quite nice suggesting they had PLENTY of space for our cars to park.  Well, they weren't wrong. Quite possibly the best photo opportunity of the entire weekend. Our attendees overlooking 24 cars perched in the beautiful trees of Hays County overlooking some of Mazda's genius. Free samples of crafted rum too?   I'd call that a win! Owners were quite attentive as soon as we arrived. Telling us the story of the brand; walking us through each tasting. Some drinks were ordered; maybe a bottle or two bought. Not sure we were the most receptive group being on a car tour in the Hill Country. Service was excellent!

reviews.author: Dolly S.
reviews.description: Such a nice staff.  We were i Impressed by his knowledge.  He was very compliant the tasting was good they serve 3 different varieties we enjoyed the vanilla. The gentleman was very helpful for other things to do in the area.

reviews.author: Dustin C.
reviews.description: Tucked away behind Wimberely mear Jacobs Well stands a small distillery with a small bar and large patio.   They offer free samples of the three different whiskeys with one of them being bourbon barrel aged using Rebecca Creek barrels.   The staff was friendly and well informed on the products. Currently they are distributing to smaller local stores and will start distributing to more stores in the future.   As it is August right now we couldn't tour the distillery because it was too hot but we were informed that the tours would start in October when it cools off.   The bottles are decently priced for hand crafted rum like this.   There are plenty of tables and chairs for groups, drink cocktails were decently priced, and property is a great change from the city.

reviews.author: Rach C.
reviews.description: We made lots of stops in the area and this was by far my favorite! We made it about an hour before they closed and the guy at the bar was so nice and welcoming. The patio area in the trees was beautiful and they had this nice swing. I had the drink with the pineapple and vanilla rum.....sooooo good! It was so good my husband grabbed a bottle so we can drink it at home. If you're touring the area i would recommend coming here early and just enjoying the scenery and the lovely conversation with the guy at the bar!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: We found this place on our way to Jacobs well. This place has great drinks and a great atmosphere. The rum is  very good. We did not take the tour, but it is offered. They have a food truck on site. Their mojito was refreshing. They even let me be part of the cocktail making process. The owners were super friendly. For those that want to taste before buying, they offer free rum tastings.

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.description: I cant' say enough good things about this place. It is in the middle of Hill Country, and it was our last stop before heading home.   Personally, I'm not a big rum drinker, it is too sweet for me, but it tastes great in mix drinks, and they have some  great and fancy mix drinks here.   Swing by and hang out on their patio, it will be great!

reviews.author: Samuel V.
reviews.description: This place is awesome. Not only do you get to enjoy some very delicious rum, but the scenery is beautiful. My fiance and I really enjoyed getting to hang out on the raised deck and just relax for a little while. The guy at the bar was really polite and knowledgeable. Will definitely come back.

reviews.author: Kelsey D.
reviews.description: Give these hard working folks your money! The rum is delicious, affordable and local. The owner gave us a quick, free tasting so we could decide what kind of rum we wanted in our cocktails. Do yourself a favor and spend an hour or two sitting on the gorgeous upper deck catching the breeze and catching a buzz!

reviews.author: Mallory M.
reviews.description: Family run rum distillery. We visited on a weekday and were the only ones there. Great customer service! If you like rum, then this is definitely worth checking out for a tasting!

reviews.author: Amber N.
reviews.description: The vanilla rum is fantastic. Perfect place to spend the afternoon to relax and have a drink. Patio sitting is great. Lots of shade

reviews.author: Katy B.
reviews.description: This place is the cutest, most quaint little gem.  If there's a local distillery, I always want to try out their goods.  I didn't expect it to be at someone's home, though!  Not that it's a bad thing.  Rum, for me, is a take it or leave it type spirit.  I typically use it only in cocktails.  I don't think I've ever wanted to sit down with a glass of rum.  Now bourbon?  That's a different story.    On arrival, I just expected a tasting only, but they actually make cocktails.  They have a small menu, or you can request whatever you want from the mixers they have.  Mojito?  Of course.  Want to go dive with a great rum and just some Coke?  They won't judge you for that, either.  They make their own version of Rumchata in house and it was SO DELICIOUS.  For real.  And they'll give you the recipe.    Pick your favorite of the three varieties: Crystal, Gold, Vanilla and buy a bottle.  Then pick up a bottle of vanilla extract.  If you don't cook, make your mom very happy.  That stuff is fantastic.  In the hotter months, don't be a jerk and demand a tour of the actual distilling barn.  We all know how distilling works.  If not, the internet is your friend.  They don't want to be in the high temperatures, and neither do you.  Let them explain the process to you while you sip a nice, cool drink instead.

reviews.author: Lindsey C.
reviews.description: Stumbled upon this little gem by accident when we were looking for a winery, it was a happy find! Friendly people, good rum, and a good deck! It was a little expensive and no tours are offered but the tastings are free which is a nice change to the other places we have been.   Make sure you try the vanilla rum and take a turn on the tree swing! My nephew loved it.   Wish they would have more signs.... the first was easy, then we were feeling lost.

reviews.author: Michele G.
reviews.description: The best part of this distillery is the location...a country vibe that is beautiful. Now for the bad news...The rum is a strange flavor. I have been to other rum distilleries and have never stumbled upon such a "harsh" flavor that could never be drank alone. That being written we decided to have a drink on the patio...I'm glad alcohol kills germs because the guy serving us had the dirtiest hands and fingernails I have ever seen in my life and I have children. For example when he grabbed our glasses from the cabinet it left a dirty grip mark. I was pretty much grossed out. It's too bad because again the location is great.

reviews.author: Deji M.
reviews.description: How sweet is David, distiller, maker, and bottler of Cypress Creek Reserve? Let's examine the facts:. -- He led us through a tour of his small but highly functional distillery. -- He answered all of our questions about the process he uses, and even showed us some of the machine parts he's made. -- His wife made us two (nicely sized) tasters: a mojito, and another thing I drank even faster than the mojito that tasted like a lemon drop.  $5 each later, we skipped right down to Wimberley Valley Spirits to get ourselves a bottle, because the law is mean and David can't sell any of the goods on the premises.  Stupid Republicans, or something.  Now we check out our unopened souvenir, plotting and planning, totally giddy that we pulled into that questionable-looking lot with the signage for rum. Who were we to say no?

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: This last Friday I went to the distillery to taste their rum. All three of their rums are VERY tasty. I purchased a bottle of the aged rum. The owner's daughter-in-law (I can't remember her name) was very friendly and very knowledgeable on the rum. She made the tasting fun, and I highly recommend anyone in area to go visit. I know I'll be back!

reviews.author: Ali E.
reviews.description: Love the vanilla rum! Make a side trip on the way home from Stonewall to pick up a bottle!

name: Goodnight Loving Vodka Distillery + Tasting Room

reviews.author: Victoria T.
reviews.description: Goodnight Loving Vodka is definitely the most smooth vodka I've ever had. The tasting room is also fun and beautifully designed. Definitely worth a day trip. Dogs are welcome too.

reviews.author: Vicki M.
reviews.description: My husband and I were on a weekend getaway when we came across GoodNight Loving Vodka. After we found our way in through the secret entrance we were immediately greeted by co founder Tim Osburn and invited up to the ultra cool 70s style bar for some tastings. Frank Sinatra playing in the background and Great conversation kept us there longer than we planned on but what an experience!!! I even went home with my bottle signed by Tim ... Loved our visit so glad we made the stop ...

reviews.author: Zack C.
reviews.description: Super smooth Texas hill country vodka! The tasting room is an amazing mid-century modern throwback with a relaxed vibe. Definitely an awesome stop on a Saturday!

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Great place, great people, great vodka.  Tim and the crew are dedicatEd to creating a top-shelf product with incredible customer care.

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: Such a cute place! Loved the outdoor and indoor areas. Brewery is right next door and you can order from either and pay at one. Wine was good too!

reviews.author: Ara A.
reviews.description: They have a winery and a brewery which is great when you have a group with people who like different taste. Lots of games and seating areas. You can have a flight or the tasting menu, lots options.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: My friends and I had such a fun time this past Saturday! Wine and beer is well priced, and the space is great to spend a summer day with your friends. I really liked the rosé wine, and my friends and I ordered truffle fries from the food truck. The only thing I would change about our experience is that I wish we had made a reservation 24 hours in advance because you can't order charcuterie boards and wine flights without one.   Everyone is really nice, and on a chilly day, they even have blankets. I highly recommend making the trek out here!

reviews.author: Jaclyn L.
reviews.description: It's beautiful! The rose is perfect for a summer day, there was live music, food truck, axe throwing and an amazing outdoor landscape!   A wonderful summer day spent here!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: We had a great time relaxing in the beautiful sunshine at Bell Springs! There is a winery and a brewery on site so everyone likely has an option they'll like = Best of both worlds. They have plenty of outdoor seating, which you could choose to sit in the sun or under the trees in the shade. We split a glass of rose and their sweet white and I would recommend either one. The sommelier was super sweet and helped us choose our wines. Would definitely recommend a stop here to relax and enjoy nature with a glass of wine in hand!

reviews.author: Anthony L.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to hang out with friends!   The wine is pretty good. We shared a bottle of Rosé. The real appeal of this place is the setting itself. There is ample outdoor seating under big shade trees! It's a pretty place.  There is also a brewery on site, but I cannot speak to the quality of the beer. We stuck with wine on this trip. I would definitely come back and try other wines and the beers offered!

reviews.author: Luke P.
reviews.description: Completely unacceptable management. For about 2 hours a group of individuals where shouting at two tables, yelling sexually explicit language, swearing profusely, and were clearly unable to drive. At a place that prides itself in a family atmosphere, where kids are running around playing in the grass and trees, this is completely unacceptable. I am looking forward to management/ownership response to this review. In a region where wineries, breweries and distilleries are a dime a dozen, plenty of opportunities to take my business elsewhere when we come visit.  What should really concern the owners and management about what happened at Bell Springs is the fact that:  1) The Hays County sheriff was called after the incident because it was so egregious. Enough of these reviews and they will be lining up outside the parking lot for DWIs.  2) The staff (7:00 pm on 6/19) did absolutely nothing to cut off a clearly over-intoxicated group that was negatively impacting people around them  3) The staff's response (blonde and burnette hostesses), ver batim, to the vulgar language and rowdiness was "free speech" and "you are the problem - I know those people".  Fantastic - best of luck in your future endeavors . Your stellar response caused one of our group to cancel their wine membership.

reviews.author: Shanita F.
reviews.description: They have three long tables for guests to sit and enjoy the tasting. It snowed the weekend we went, so of course we were inside. However, they do have an outdoor patio, bar and high bar seating. The outdoor seating probably really nice in good weather.   Call ahead or make reservations online. It's very easy and they do allow you to amend reservations over the phone.   They produce really great wine and there's a great selection to choose from. The staff is very knowledgeable about their wines and answered all of our questions. Testing comes with a **small** array of cheeses, nuts and crackers.

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: This is a beautiful winery. Plenty of tables spread around the grounds under trees. Lots of room for kids to run around out there. We sat up on the patio with our dog and enjoyed a lovely wine tasting. We chose the solo tour which was $15 for 5 generous pours of delicious wine. All the staff we interacted with were very friendly and helpful. The one low point is the food truck. We got the currywurst for $10 which was good, but not a large enough serving for the price. The more upsetting part was the pretzel we got (also $10, which is very expensive). The prestel was small, hard (even though it was supposed to be a soft pretzel), and flavorless. The mustard cheese dip did its best to save it, but it wasn't enough.

reviews.author: Alexa S.
reviews.description: Cute spot and their brewery next door is awesome too! Bell Springs is in a nice location and it is so green! The wine is yummy, tastings are nice sized pours! Only reason I am giving 4 stars is because when you make a reso for wine tasting and charcuterie, don't expect a lot of cheese and meats HA! It was so small, we were cracking up. I would recommend bringing your own snacks and food! Otherwise, awesome spot and I can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery and relaxing porch. However most wines are sourced from Lubbock and not from Austin.  montepulciano is from the region and pretty bold.

reviews.author: Jalise F.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed my visit here. I'm not much of a wine drinker but they were able to answer any questions I had about the wine. Also it was snowing when I went and that made the experience all the better. Will most definitely return on my next trip to Texas!

reviews.author: Anna O.
reviews.description: Nothing  but amazing things to say! We recently hosted our Dripping Springs 10 Year High school reunion at Bell Springs Winery and it was a great experience. Nate and Laura were wonderful to work with and they took care of everything making it super easy for me. The location is perfect and off the main road and the layout of the outdoor and indoor areas are well suited for any size group. Defiantly consider Bell Springs for your next event!

reviews.author: Manuela A.
reviews.description: What a little surprise! I liked their porch and plenty of outdoor seating. They have a great brewery on location so there is something for everyone. They did generous pours of 3 wine tastings for $20. We got a bottle of Cab with grapes from Washington state. No surprise as Texas cab grapes do no yield good wine. We enjoyed our time here!

reviews.author: Anna M.
reviews.description: I have been here numerous times and always had an awesome experience but today was the most unacceptable experience I have ever had ANYWHERE. I was here with my family, parents, and my brothers family with a total of 5 kids (not unusual to see kids here). While here, we became aware of a group that was likely overserved and using foul/vulgar language that we tried to ignore for a long time. Once we heard the phrase "fat c*ck" at a ridiculous volume my husband asked them to please keep it down, which resulted in a huge altercation with various threats/insults from their end. Despite their behavior management still allowed them to stay. What's worth noting is multiple people had already complained about this group and others joined my husband in attempting them to quiet down- so they were affecting loads of people at the winery. Eventually things calmed down and the argument broke, but as we were leaving they said loudly for us to hear "I'm so glad that douchebag is leaving" so I gave them the finger as I was walking away (I will concede this was adding fuel to the fire but I was so fed up at this point) and they screamed to me "FUCK YOU MOM" across the grass. Managements response? Free speech allows them to say whatever they want. Apparently this nice hill country spot is going for the dirty 6th vibe. Save your money and go somewhere with enough pride to expel those who can't keep it together while I use my own right to free speech to notify everyone this place doesn't care about their patrons.

reviews.author: Michael P.
reviews.description: Understaffed.  Cannot manage overserved men and women who are creating bad examples for family customers there as members to enjoy the facilities.  Staff is useless.  Take my membership; we are out.  There are many Other places to enjoy.

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: I am a resident of Dripping Springs and have been a frequent patron of Bell Springs Winery. I found this family-friendly venue to be welcoming and beautiful. It was for this reason that I suggested that my kids, with their families, join my husband and me for a Father's Day celebration on Saturday evening, June 19th. When we arrived just before 5 pm, we found a good picnic spot in the shade near the bag game. We all noticed, or rather heard, a very boisterous group of 12 to 15 people sitting near the brewery. As the evening progressed, and I am assuming more alcohol was consumed, the group became louder and more profane. We attempted to ignore them, but soon it was impossible due to the volume and the increasingly prevalent and disgusting language. At that point, and because we had 5 young children with us, my son-in-law went over to the group and respectfully asked them to turn down the volume so that my Grandchildren would no longer be exposed to words like "F*ck and C*ck". He was immediately met with a barrage of personal slurs and threats. 2 staff members (2 young ladies, one light-haired and the other dark-haired) working that evening came over to the group, however, incredibly, the inebriated party was allowed to remain on the premises. Shortly after, every family packed up and went home, including our group.  When walking to the parking lot to leave, a particularly vile young woman yelled obscenities at my son-in-law and daughter. I turned around and went over to the group. When I arrived, I was also barraged with a variety of slurs and called a "C*nt". Once again, the 2 female staff members came over to the table to intercede. At this point, the dark-haired staff member shared with me that she "knew the group" of offenders, which helped me understand why these folks had not been asked to leave. If you happen to know staff, you can act like filthy pigs, with the knowledge that your actions will have no repercussion, regardless of the profoundly negative impact on everyone else looking to enjoy wine and food with their families.  To add insult to injury, staff had the unmitigated gall to suggest that I was the problem, not the drunk and vulgar group. When I questioned staff (dark haired young lady) why they permitted such obnoxious behavior from any patron, she suggested that hurling profanity toward others was protected under free speech. Staff continually suggested that our "conversation was over", indicating that they wanted me to leave. Clearly, the privilege of free speech isn't applied equally to all patrons visiting Bell Springs.  In the past 15 months, I have recommended Bell Springs to dozens of family and friends. Now, I plan to exercise my right of free speech in every forum available to tell acquaintances and strangers alike about my experience, advising that Bell Springs is not worthy of anyone's patronage.

reviews.author: Robert R.
reviews.description: The wine was good.  The lawn for tasting was ample.  The amount of things to do was tremendous.  I highly recommend this, but the wine is a little over priced for its taste and quality.

reviews.author: Genette G.
reviews.description: One star is too much for this place. I have seen several people treated badly. Everyone who works there look down on people. I have witnessed people harrased and the winery does nothing about it.

reviews.author: Amanda B.
reviews.description: Owner is very rude and unprofessional. He was very short with me and disrespectful. I feek bad for the staff as they are not trained well and over worked.

reviews.author: D H.
reviews.description: We loved our wine tour with Taste of the Hills. We visited three wineries with two other couples on the tour. Each stop was unique and Jodie was especially knowledgeable and friendly. She is completely worth trying the tour!   Bonus: we got engaged after the tour!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Jodie was the best!  I found Taste of the Hills on yelp.  I messaged Jodie in April to see what her pricing and availability was for Memorial Day weekend and she responded quickly. Paid deposit through venmo and paid the other half day of our tasting. We did one winery, one distillery and one brewery. She gave us a small history of each of the places we went too. Her cheese board setup was amazing! Very sweet and easy going. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Chandler W.
reviews.description: Jodie made my day all I could have dreamed of. Her bus is super nice, well air conditioned and plenty of space, her knowledge of each winery was very cool to hear and she made sure we were always comfortable! On a warm summer day we were kept cool, fed, and full of wine! Must book with Jodie for a trip around the hill country. Delicious wine and charcuterie board! Thank you Jodie!

reviews.author: Cheryl J.
reviews.description: OMG, Jodie is FaNtAsTiC! My bff and I were on our annual girl's trip and wanted to book a wine tour before we left the Hill Country of Texas. We were staying in the adorable town of Wimberley so I researched tours in the area.  Jodie's Taste of the Hills Tour got great reviews and went to wineries close to the Wimberley area. The day of the tour ended up being chilly and rainy. As soon as Jodie pulled up with her spectacular shuttle-like van she was out like a flash with pretty umbrellas for us! We went to 3 different wineries which we thoroughly enjoyed! After the first one, we returned to Jodie's vehicle and she had a gorgeous tray for us of cheese,  sausage,  crackers,  grapes,  olives, dips.....simply divine!!! The tour was also just the 2 of us and we loved that Jodie still did ALL of this for a tour that I believe takes up to 12 people! The next time we plan a trip to the Hill Country we are going to do one of Jodie's Beer tours!! We had such great conversations with Jodie too! Thank you sooooo much for the GREAT time! Sooooo much fun!

reviews.author: Samantha K.
reviews.description: The owner, Jodie, went above and beyond to make sure my birthday with 12 of my friends and family was a moment to remember and it was just that. She recommended the best of Driftwood and ended up going to Driftwood Estate Winery and Vista Brewery. We spent around 5 hours commuting, tasting, and even an impromptu cellar tour. Thanks again, Jodie! I highly recommend Taste of the Hills to everyone.

reviews.author: Kyle D.
reviews.description: Amazing tour!!! My wife and I came into Wimberley during Spring Break to relax from teaching and this was the perfect trip to do so! Jodie made us all feel like we were old friends, even though we had never met anyone else on the bus.  She was very detailed with the stories of each winery, and explained all the different varietals, answering our every question along the way. The bus was very comfortable and clean, and she stored each bottle we purchased until the trip was over, but we could have had the bottles on the bus had we chosen to.  The wineries all seemed to know her, so they were expecting us and were incredibly friendly. We were not rushed anywhere, and still managed to make it back into town to enjoy shopping on the square.  My wife and I were pretty hungry by the time we had lunch, since we didn't have breakfast, but the tapas style lunch was perfect for the glass of wine we purchased to have with it. The lunch was delicious and filling.  Overall this was an amazing experience and I will be recommending this tour to everyone I know.

reviews.author: Jeffrey R.
reviews.description: Jodie is an exceptional chauffeur.  We had a blast for a friend's birthday! She knew all the great stops and her ride is smooth, comfy, and had a great sound system. We had so much fun!

reviews.author: Sona E.
reviews.description: This wine tour with Jodie is a must.  We got Serenity Inn on a Wednesday so we were lucky to be on the wine tour with only one other couple.  Jodie is such a pleasant and inviting soul. She asked about each person's preferences as to be able to personalize the tour and pick which wineries she decided to take us too.  She is very knowledgeable of the town and the wineries.  The lunch she provides is just amazing. By the time we were done I felt like I had made an incredible new friend. I can't wait to go back and do more tours.

reviews.author: Amber N.
reviews.description: This was such an incredible experience. Jodie picked us up at the Serenity Farm House Inn. She was so friendly and knowledgeable and super sweet. She knew all the best places to go. The picnic lunch she provided was amazing. I wouldn't change a thing about today. I would love to bring some friends and do it all over again.

reviews.author: Brooke K.
reviews.description: Myself,  my Aunt and my cousin took Jodie's winery tour yesterday and had an absolute blast! Jodie really personalized the tour based on our taste in wines. She has an extensive knowledge of wines, the wineries, the towns, etc. Our favorite part was lunch because of the views and the wonderful spread that was provided for us. I highly recommend this tour and in fact will probably we doing it again, soon, I hope.

reviews.author: Amber D.
reviews.description: Perfect - the highlight of our trip!  Jodie was the best, most fun, knowledgeable and coordinator.  We went to Driftwood, Duchman and Fall Creek Vineyards.  We were fortunate enough to have great people touring with us, and it made the tour all the more fun.  She prepared the best picnic lunch I've ever had.  Sugar Shack cake balls, meats, cheeses, crackers, hummus, a goat cheese something served on crackers (that I LOVED, and I hate goat cheese), spinach feta rolls, and I'm sure I'm forgetting something.  She was fully prepared for everything.  Boxes for the wine we bought, umbrellas in case in rained (it didn't), plenty of water...this wine tour couldn't have been more perfect if she tried.  Thanks, Jodie!

reviews.author: Charles J.
reviews.description: Jodie was amazing!  Very knowledgeable and informative.  Has some great stories and makes it very fun.  And the wineries she took us to were fantastic!  I've been to some bad wineries and the Wimberley area has a lot of options and can be daunting to do yourself.  Plus, nice to have a driver.  . Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anita Y.
reviews.description: Jodie was amazing! She asked what our preferences in wine were and brought us to wineries that best fit our palate. She had a delicious charcuterie board waiting for us. Super friendly and very knowledgeable on various places in Wimberley. I highly recommend Jodie!!!

reviews.author: Gwen L.
reviews.description: This was a Fantastic tour. The winery's were lovely and Jodie was the perfect host. Would do it again and recommend to anyone visiting Wimberly.

reviews.author: Amer S.
reviews.description: Jodie was an amazing host and she really made the evening perfect for my wife's 40th birthday! She took us to amazing tasting locations, she knew everyone and we received first class service. She even helped with dinner reservations! It really was an amazing evening largely due to Jodie and the exceptional service she provides! If you are looking for a fantastic wine tour, get in touch with Jodie and she will ensure that happens.

reviews.author: Vicky W.
reviews.description: Ahhhh! So very relaxing! Jodie Meyer knew all the tourists' names and made sure we got to know each other. She provided an excellent variety of foods including a hot portion and gluten-free (just in time `cause I was lit after the 1st vineyard). The three vineyards for that day were selected based on the wine preferences of the tourists that day (A+ perk). We never felt pushed or obligated to buy wines, but we all did because they were very good (!), and Jodie kept our purchases organized and stored for us. She also gave a good background on each vineyard and on the Wimberley area in general. We learned a lot about Wimberley and wine and were able to get tipsy knowing Jodie was an excellent driver of her comfy bus. And have you been to Wimberley? That hilly countryside is beautiful!

reviews.author: Linz N.
reviews.description: We recently went on a fabulous wine tour with Jodie on 4/15 and had a great time!  Our tour was originally scheduled for 10:30a, but got pushed back to 1:15p due to shuttle trouble (we had the option to receive our money back, but actually liked the later time).  We stopped at three wineries, including Driftwood Estate and Duchman Family Winery.  The views at all of the wineries varied, but each were unique to their locations.  Jodie provided an amazing picnic-style lunch, including a charcuterie (meat and cheese) board, chicken salad, nuts, walnut and feta salad, grapes, chocolate cake balls, bottled water, etc. At the second stop, Jodie was kind enough to call in people's orders to Salt Lick BBQ and had it all ready to take home by the third stop.  We can't wait to return again!

reviews.author: Debbie V.
reviews.description: Fantastic wine tour with a knowledgable , fun and personable guide. Jodi made our first wine tour experience a memorable one. Nice travel accommodations   We went to 3 local wineries chosen by our wine preferences. She provided a great tapas lunch and even accommodated the gluten free guests.  I would highly recommend   I will be coming back and doing it again!

reviews.author: Stephanie H.
reviews.description: My mother and I had the most amazing time with Jodi. She was a perfect tour guide and took us to three great wineries. She gave us a lot of background information on the wineries as well as the town of Wimberley. She had a delicious assortment of snacks for us to munch on while we rode to and from each winery. She helped package our wine purchases and brought us umbrellas as it started to rain. She even went the extra mile, literally, and drove us back to our hotel since it was raining as we had walked to our meeting spot earlier in the day. We had another couple on the tour with us which was really nice since we had people to mingle with. It was a very personal experience and I felt as though we were all just great friends spending an afternoon together. Who needs Napa, everything is better in Texas!!! We will definitely be repeat customers.

reviews.author: Lindsey W.
reviews.description: My husband surprised me for a birthday getaway to Wimberley, and we went on this wine tour and had the best time! I had been on another wine tour before in Wimberley, but Jodie made this tour worth it. She knew exactly where to go and even suggested certain wines at each location!   The length of the tour was the perfect amount of time as well. I would definitely recommend this tour and can't wait to go back and visit again!

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: You never know where your gonna find a distillery and or brewery these days. Yep folks, it's another #carclublife post. The club along with friends from Dallas and San Antonio headed east after the Texas Independence Day Parade. Libation education started at Derelict Airship AKA Violet Crown Spirits just west of Bastrop.   You've hear of strip mall chic? Think business park chic! Quite similar to my friends over at Desert Door in Driftwood. Matt was an excellent host explaining the history behind each of their offerings. Let's start with Absinthe. Banned for many years in the US and parts of Europe, small batch distilleries have been popping up in the US since 2007.   The anise flavor is quite strong and it's recommended you cut it with water. I've heard sugar cubes are common as well. Other in house offerings include an Elderflower and Jasmine Liqueur. Girlfriend and I's personal favorite was the Jasmine and we took home a bottle to pair up with other local spirits. A top notch experience from start to finish. Our group is excited to see this company grow. See y'all soon!

reviews.author: Jaime G.
reviews.description: Jessica was amazing! We stopped in during a trip to Bastrop and were so impressed with their service and products. We were able to sample the whole line of products and learned a lot about their process and the history behind absinthe and the Violet Crown Spirits. Worth a trip if you're in Bastrop or driving through!

reviews.author: Erin C.
reviews.description: Big thank you for the hand sanitizer from Carl R Darnall Army Medical Center! We appreciate you!!!

reviews.author: Carolyn S.
reviews.description: Best little brewer in Texas!  Might be small but big on flavor and specialty brews!  Great place to visit if you're around Austin!!

reviews.author: Bruce K.
reviews.description: I'm pretty sure that you can't buy your vodka here but they definitely make it here. Hand-distilled and made in small batches with old-fashioned pot-stills. It's the bizness.  Interestingly, the vodka is made with yellow corn, rather than potatoes or wheat (or milk whey, in Vermont). The facility is the State of Texas' first legal distillery, they have gown quite a bit and crank out 500 cases an hour and dominate the US vodka market with 7.1% share.  May I suggest a TitoRita? 1.5 ounces Tito's Vodka, 0.5 ounces orange liqueur, 1.5 ounces fresh lime juice, 1.5 ounces fresh lemon juice and 0.5 ounces of simple syrup. Put it all into a shaker with ice, mix it up and pour into a martini glass.  That's probably too many carbs for me. My drink is called a "Skinny Bitch" and it's Tito's with club soda and a slice of lime. Delicious and cool.  [Review 13302 overall, 620 of 2020.]

reviews.author: Daniel B.
reviews.description: Titos must be an Austin thing. Haven't seen it or heard of it outside of Texas.  Ain't better than Grey Goose that's for sure.

reviews.author: Terri P.
reviews.description: Clint was a total professional and a wonderful driver.  At our first stop he ordered a different vehicle so everyone felt more comfortable.  What a surprise when he told us!  Didn't see that coming.  Three great tastings with good friends.  Discovered some very nice 2015 Texas wines.  The grapes have matured immensely since 2008 and glad to finally enjoy some good Texas wines.   Can't recommend this company any lower than *****!  Thank you Discovery Wine Tours for a memorable afternoon.

reviews.author: Carlin L.
reviews.description: Used Discover Texas Wine Tours for a 30th birthday. John, our driver, was wonderful. He called me a couple of days before to introduce himself and to confirm the pickup details. He also called me the day of and was on time. He made sure we were settled at each location and made it a great experience. Felt very safe - John wore a mask the whole time. Also, Kathie helped plan the itinerary. She's familiar with the wineries and distilleries in the area, and was very friendly. Couldn't recommend them more!

reviews.author: Lori M.
reviews.description: A.wonderdul time, from reservation phone call to driving away from the limo.once the 6.5 hour tour ended.  John was our driver...we knew from the get-go we were in good hands.  Discover Wine chose the wineries for us and all were unique, fun and obviously tasty (as was the restaurant they selected).  We'll be back!

reviews.author: Lynlee S.
reviews.description: Our driver John was amazing!!! Very sweet and professional. Gave excellent service and ensured my group of 2 had a great time at each location we choose. Booking with the owner Kathy was easy and she ensured the whole private tour experience was exactly what we wanted. Could not have had a better time!!! John the drive wore a mask the whole time and gave us a detailed tour of town while he drove! Excellent and safe driver. Perfect perfect perfect! Thank you!! If you want an intimate experience with lots of sights and great food and drink, chose this company to take you!!!!!

reviews.author: Lindsey H.
reviews.description: I was so impressed with this tour the first time we booked that I had to book it for another party! Well, this time it wasn't as impressive. I don't know if the business has just gotten bigger than the owners can handle but communication was subpar. It took several calls and emails to get answers sometimes.   At our first tour, Kathie took tons of photos and would pose us at the wineries. This tour, we had to prompt her. It was a cloudy day so not the best for outdoor pics but I was disappointed we took most of them ourselves or had to ask her to take the pictures.   Our tour was April 11, it is now almost 2 mths later I haven't received the few pictures we took. I emailed twice and have finally heard back that the SD is apparently not working. I'm not sure why I had to email to find this out, seems like this info should have been divulged as soon as the problem presented itself.   I hate to downgrade the star review but my second time with this company just wasn't as epic as the initial tour I took with them. The wineries all seem to love this company though.

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: I would recommend you take your money elsewhere. The owner Cathy is the rudest person to deal with  and doesn't know manners or customer service. She is unprofessional and just straight out rude. Highly suggest on another place to go to.

reviews.author: Barbara H.
reviews.description: We had a small group of three, but did it right with a Discover Texas Wine Tour limousine. DTWT was very accommodating, scheduled the wineries we wanted to see, ordered the lunches, and then confirmed our selections a couple of days prior to our tour. At the last minute after visiting with a couple in our third stop, we changed our fourth stop to a different winery. Jason (our driver) was happy to accomodate us. My only regret is that we didn't choose a few wineries a little further out of town, so we could spend more time in the limo listening to our Willie Nelson songs. Jason was awesome, and I highly recommend this tour.

reviews.author: Vicki C.
reviews.description: We started researching half-day wine tours for my BFF's bachelorette party several months in advance and chose this company because of its good reviews and cancellation policy (full refund up to 7 days in advance).   First, the bad news. The booking process is way more arduous than it should be. My initial discussion about the tour plans happened over the phone, so I asked for a written, e-mail confirmation of what we had discussed - specifically how the deposit and refund policies work. It took me more than three weeks to get that first e-mail confirmation of our booking and deposit payment. I then went back and forth, back and forth, back and forth with the company, hammering out the details, like setting a pickup location and our choices for the winery stops. Many times, three weeks would pass and I'd have to make multiple attempts before I would get a response to my e-mails. Sometimes, the responses would be incomplete and we'd repeat the process of trying to get information confirmed. Seriously a pain for an experience that costs $129 per person.   Now, the good news. The online payment portal for each attendee was a breeze to use and eliminated the need to handle money all through one person. As for the actual tour itself, we couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our driver, Bobby, was on time and wonderful on the day of the tour. He was funny and polite and had good knowledge of the area. Also, very importantly, he was a good and safe driver! The Mercedes bus we took was very clean and spacious, and they provided water, cups and napkins. They also allowed us to bring our own food onto the bus. The three wineries we visited, Driftwood Estate, Duchman and Fall Creek, were all accommodating and fun. The views were lovely and we never felt rushed and made it back on time. It was raining when we got back to our car, and Bobby was so nice and helped us get our stuff back into our car in the pouring rain.   All in all, despite a wonderful wine tour, I'm not sure I would recommend this company, only because I spent way too much time hounding them throughout the booking process. While the wine was excellent, I NEEDED to drink after dealing with their horrible communication. Discover Texas Wines should strongly consider re-evaluating their communication practices and hire more people to keep up with the demand for their service. It's the only way they will stay competitive in the long-run!

reviews.author: Tara K.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience with Discover Texas Wine. Kathie was wonderful to coordinate with, and took care of all our tour requests. Howard was a great driver and had fun music. Lunches were very tasty. Would definitely recommend for any bachelorette party.

reviews.author: Abby S.
reviews.description: We had the BEST time today on a wine tour for a bachelorette!! "Magic Mike" was the best driver and so much fun. Very reasonable price for the amount of time we spent, and an awesome car. Thank you!!!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: We booked a wine tour to Dripping Springs for my bachelorette party. It was so great! Our driver, Roy, is what made it all so wonderful! I would highly recommend him!! He took lots of photos for us and kept us cool with cups of water.  We went to Driftwood Estate (beautiful views and grounds), Duchman family winery (beautiful Tuscan architecture), and Driftwood (had the best wines!). We did a half day and it was the perfect amount of time.   Couldn't have been any better! Thanks Roy!!!

reviews.author: Cyn H.
reviews.description: Had a great time on my stretch limo wine tour.  Hawk's Shadow was the favorite of the wineries we visited.  Bobby was our driver. Polite and helpful and knew to not be too chatty. Made our wine tour effortless and fun. An event to remember!

reviews.author: Carly J.
reviews.description: Wonderful private winery tour with Amanda.  So much fun!  Amanda was awesome and knowledgeable.  We had a great time!

reviews.author: Calley N.
reviews.description: We used this company for  a bachelorette weekend the company was extremely hard to work with. Communication with the company was extremely difficult. However, Mike (magic mike) completely turned a ruined weekend around. He was so nice and fun he sang to us and played guitar. I have never met a more generous and kind person. It might take you sending 3 emails to get responses from the company but definitely use Mike for your tour!

reviews.author: Kate E.
reviews.description: First off our driver, Roy, was the absolute best! He picked us up on time, was incredibly friendly, and funny even though we were a bachelorette party and knowing the possibility of it getting crazy with 7 girls. Seriously, request Roy. He made the trip a blast. There was cold water for us in the bus. Oh did I mention it's a Mercedes bus? Super nice! An AUX cable was available to play our own music too. The selection of wineries was amazing, perfect mixture between red and whites/dry and sweet, so every one of us could have something tasty. The drive was beautiful and not too far out of Austin. Overall, I am very impressed with this tour and the wonderful employees. Would definitely go again.

reviews.author: Jessica J.
reviews.description: I booked a Discover Texas Wine Tour last weekend for a Bachelorette Party. It was amazing! We had such a great time despite the somewhat unpleasant weather. Noel was so great and answered any questions we had before the tour. He was so accommodating and recommended some great wineries to us! I would definitely book with them again and recommend them to friends!!

reviews.author: Becca R.
reviews.description: Held an event with Discover Texas Wine Tour for my business and wanted to thank them again for a wonderful day. We booked this as part of a fundraiser/auction and it was such a success. The bus was wonderful, the driver was great and everything was timed perfectly. Highly recommend Discover Texas Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Dominique S.
reviews.description: Absolutely do not recommend using this company. I made the reservation back in January, gave my card for deposit and was told I'd be emailed a link for everyone to pay. Over the next two months I called and emailed asking about the link so my friends could pay their part and I was repeatedly told they were having issues. Okay fine, no big deal- I also emailed again saying we can just pay the day of if the link wasnt working and never received a response. The day before our tour, as I was driving from Dallas to Fredericksburg I get a call from Some guy at the company and he seemed very annoyed with me saying no one had paid yet. Um.. I'm sorry I didn't realize you finally sent it after months of my asking. (He had sent it the day before calling me to tell me no one had paid) The vehicle I requested was not the one that showed up. The driver Julia was late bc she did not write the address down correctly. We also had 3 girls cancel last minute, so we were down to 5 instead of 8. Considering there minimum is 5 I wasn't expecting that to be a problem but Julia felt the need to bring it up multiple Times as if it caused some inconvenience for her. Rude people, horrible communication.

reviews.author: Kyle D.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our full day tour! None of our group had been to the Texas wine trail, and our Driver Roy was absolutely spot on picking our 4 stops. Roy was a true gentleman and really took good care of our group all day long, making this a truly great experience. Noel was very helpful in booking us, even with a last minute addition to our party. I will be using these guys again in the future, and would recommend anyone who is looking for a first time trip to do the same.

reviews.author: Holly T.
reviews.description: What a fantastic time! Organizing a full day wine tour for 50 people in the Texas Hill Country may not sound like an easy task, but Noel at Discover Texas Wine Tours made it smooth and most importantly, unforgettable. His main goal is to make sure everyone is comfortable and has a good time! Most companies were not able to host a group this size, but Noel made it happen. He made sure our bus was the best he could find, worked to have a lunch catered for us at one of the stops, set up private tastings with many of the wineries to accommodate a group our size, even stopped to let one of the guys who didn't drink wine buy some beer. I can't say enough good things about Noel and how hard he worked for our group. I highly recommend him and look forward to another tour with him soon!!

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours made my booking reservation easy and I'm a difficult customer. They worked with me on the wineries and Distillery the group chose to ensure that the time worked within our tour, so everyone could enjoy the tasting and lunch without feeling rushed. Austin Wine Tours also provided us with a great driver. I have to say our driver Charlie was awesome, he called before arriving, he was prompt and ensured we had everything before leaving the pickup spot. Charlie made our tour very comfortable, the ride to and from the wineries and Distillery was amazing. Charlie ensured that we were taken care of.  We will definitely be booking another tour with you folks and requesting Charlie.   Thank you again,  Laurie

reviews.author: Carli A.
reviews.description: 10/10 would recommend Austin Wine Tours! First off, booking and choosing our agenda was super easy and they even let me adjust the headcount when that changed. On the day of, I got a heads-up call to confirm the time and pickup location. We had a larger, rowdy group of gals on a bachelorette trip and our driver Song took SUCH good care of us! She immediately asked us what music we wanted to crank and encouraged all the "wooing" from the back of the van. She also offered to take pictures of us, scouted out the best locations for group photos and even took TONS of candid pics of us while we enjoyed the winery and distillery we went to. She helped with all of the logistics of checking in at each stop and making sure we were taken care of. She also let us make a pee stop on the way home...and overall she was just SUPER nice and was basically hyping us up the entire day, making sure the bride felt special and making sure we all had fun. By the end of the day we all felt like she was part of the crew. Thank you again Song!!

reviews.author: Laura R.
reviews.description: I booked a wine tour for my sisters bachelorette and we had such a great time! The wineries were beautiful and we were able to schedule a stop at the salt lick for our private tour. Kyle was the best tour guide ever!! He was very personable, took numerous pictures for us at each winery and made sure we were having fun! I would def. recommend if you are looking at different companies to pick Austin Wine Tours (ZWay Tours) since I called 5 others and they were the most accommodating with what we wanted for a private tour and their price beat most of the other ones too!  Would def. book them again and request Kyle!

reviews.author: Rakeba S.
reviews.description: Omg! We loved our experience with Austin Wine Tours! Our tour guide Kyle was amazing and made sure we had a great time. Kyle was on time and made sure we arrived safely to both our locations. Overall our experience was amazing and we will definitely book again.

reviews.author: Christopher Jon M.
reviews.description: We had a great time this past weekend with Austin Wine Tours. I initially booked online and didn't know what venues to go to at first but they recommended the ones that we ended up going to even though it was completely up to us where we wanted to go which I liked. We decided after to tastings to go eat at Salt Lick BBQ and the food was amazing and hit the spot in between tastings. After that we went to our final tasting at Fall Creek which was right across the street and the service there was great. It made our bachelorette party very fun and we didn't have to worry about anything other than having a good time which I liked.

reviews.author: Devin H.
reviews.description: The review that I left in regards to the services booked through Austin Wine Tours was in no way false. I will stand firm by what was written.   I even received a call back in May while on a business trip from the shuttle service company asking if we would pay the overtime for Hugo because AWT had not paid them yet. We even tipped Hugo an additional amount for his extra time spent with us.   The response just posted (almost 4 months later) is also extremely unprofessional and misleading. We were promised a great time for a bachelorette party and were let down. Plain and simple. Those employed by AWT that we spoke with were rude as well. Secondly, I never said that AWT hosted prom events/transportation. I was told that the company that is usually utilized was completely full (by Brad) and that prom happened to be a priority and the school bus that was sent was all they could get us even though we were promised a party bus.   At the end of the day we were completely dissatisfied with the services offered by AWT. Calling a client a bridezilla (who in fact actually never spoke to any AWT employee), claiming your company has gotten PTSD from our group and falsely accusing our group to be racist by saying we told "blackie to leave" is unprofessional and disrespectful amongst other things said in response to our reviews. All of those involved would be happy to discuss this event again in a professional manner since you mentioned that we were offered a full refund when that in fact was not true. We were offered maybe $350 (I could be wrong on this amount since we haven't heard/spoken to anyone from AWT for several months) in return if we removed our reviews.  As a company you should take responsibility instead of blaming others for your mistakes that way you can fix the problem and do better for future patrons. Especially since there has been no money refunded at this point.

reviews.author: Julie B.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours is one of the best limo tours to see the wine country we have been on to date!  They were not only flexible with our dates and our last-minute reservation, they even upgraded our package with no additional charge!  We were celebrating four birthdays and  wanted a girls night out  where no one had to drive. The limo driver was prompt and worked with us and our pick up and drop off times.  When one of us left the charger in the limo he even offered to drop it off... We Are definitely looking forward to using them in the near future!

reviews.author: Courtney M.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours is amazing! I just had a bachelorette party for my sister this past weekend and it was so smooth! From Sara's communication to Lance's chauffeuring day of, the entire experience was great. I highly recommend utilizing them, you'll be glad you did!

reviews.author: Blythe H.
reviews.description: If I could give this company a negative star review, I would!!! Completely unprofessional and was hung up on!! They sent an incorrect party bus for a bachelorette party, contracted out at last minute to another company (who were amazing), sent us to Deep eddys where we were turned away!!! Brad would NOT let me speak and kept interrupting me. The professionalism of this company was simply awful. And they still have not refunded anything from this trip!!! Disgusted and I will never recommend this company to anyone. Spend the extra money and go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Tara B.
reviews.description: We had such a great experience with Austin Wine Tours. They had everything taken care of for us, and our driver Lance was awesome! We went to Fall Creek and Duchman, Fall Creek was my favorite!

reviews.author: Linda T.
reviews.description: Booking our wine excursion was stress free the moment Sara answered the phone! Sara was very informative and laid everything out, giving us a doable timeline for the afternoon we wanted. The itinerary we received gave us a good idea of how long to spend at each venue. There were only 4 people in our group, so we were able to do a very flexible hourly option, with appointments at the wineries.  Since we had less than 5 passengers, our tastings weren't included (informed that going in) however, that did not deter our experience... it was awesome! Buying a bottle of wine at each venue was very affordable when we split the cost among us.  George, our driver, was professional and friendly; and the limo experience was awesome! You might want to bring snacks just in case someone gets a bit tipsy, but most wineries offer food of some kind. Thanks Austin Wine Tours, for making me look like a champ with my high maintenance friends... I'll be back!

reviews.author: Karen O.
reviews.description: After leaving the previous review, the company finally contacted me and issued a full refund.

reviews.author: Tanya R.
reviews.description: You can't go wrong in chosing this company for your tour. David was our guide and he was fabulous. He was very helpful in picking out which vineyards to go to. He did everything possible to ensure we had a great time. Even helped me with getting the best cake ever for a surprise.  You will be very happy!! We will definitely be back! Thanks for everything!!

reviews.author: Anjelah L.
reviews.description: My family and friends booked this tour for my birthday. We had 10 people in the bus and we couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our driver, David was AWESOME!! He had great recommendations and kept us (somewhat) on our schedule! He was a blast! Bus was super roomy and had everything we needed! We will be back and booking with open range again tours again!

reviews.author: J P.
reviews.description: What a great experience!  The 2 Davids were great. We booked this last minute due to the recent snow/ice storm and they were very flexible. We started at William Chris, headed to Pedernales and ended at Augusta Vin. The 15 passenger van was great for our group of 11. They offered water and took care of checking us in at each winery. David was a complete gentleman and carried all of our purchases and secured them in the van while we enjoyed our time tasting the different wines. He even dropped us off downtown so we would be on time for our dinner reservation.

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: I had a driver cancel on me 3 days before my trip. David was so friendly and squeezed in my group through a cancellation he had. He was so nice and really helped us out!!

reviews.author: Lisa D.
reviews.description: David was extremely instrumental in getting a wine tour pulled together, despite many places being shut down (or car-to-go only) due to the latest covid orders. We enjoyed his friendly banter, nice and clean van, and all of the places we went. Will definitely book with David again.

reviews.author: Lauren C.
reviews.description: Absolutely gorgeous day out and about with our guide Mark-he even took us to see the bats after three totally different experiences tasting frozen sangria, fine local wines and tasty beer selection which took us back to Germany! Each location they chose for us was better than the next. Thank you so much for taking us out on a Bad Moms Tour ‍

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Excellent company! Highly recommend! They were prompt and so accommodating for our party. Tour driver even went and picked up lunch for us while we were wine tasting. Don't hesitate to use them for your transportation needs!

reviews.author: Amye B.
reviews.description: Do NOT recommend! We booked a tour for 8 people and everything was a mess from the beginning. We were told we would be upgraded to a 15 passenger bus. A 15 passenger VAN showed up with a dent in the side and ripped seats. We were told we could bring coolers. We were only able to fit 8 adults in the van with our two coolers- no way we could've had another person in the van. None of the wineries had been scheduled yet and the ONE we had specifically requested was not available. We had to scramble ourselves to find wineries, in which we were promised everything would be done ahead of time. The meat and cheese tray that was promised was a small tray that was bought during the tour at a convenient store to feed 2 people. Our driver was great, however the owner did not deliver what was promised and we were highly disappointed. There are plenty of companies to choose from, and I would NOT recommend Open Range.

reviews.author: Shannon Z.
reviews.description: Open Range tours was perfect for our bachelorette wine tour. David was professional and personable. He cared that we were safe and having fun. Once our tour, extended an extra hour, drew to an end, David even recommended transportation for our evening fun. Would definitely recommend Open Range tours and will contact them for future visits.

reviews.author: Keith H.
reviews.description: Open Range Tours is a great company. We've had the owner, David, several times, and we've never been disappointed. He cares about his clients, and goes out of the way to make sure their experience in the wine country is the best it can be. We've used him so much, that we will never use another company when we're in the region. You can't do any better than Open Range, trust me.

reviews.author: Nicole N.
reviews.description: "Double Pimp D" aka David was absolutely phenomenal.  We had a group of 13 in San Antonio go wine tasting in fberg for the day.  He picked us up from San Antonio, drove us up to Hill Country and around to 3 wineries.  As this was my first Texas wine tour, he did an AMAZING job of helping us select which wineries would be a good fit for the group.  As we had a decent amount of guys with us- he suggest Garrison Brother's Distillery which ended up being a HUGE hit!  He was extremely professional, courteous and just an absolute delight to spend the day with!  He also has a wicked funny sense of humor.  He was also very accommodating and ordered and picked up lunch for us so we could continue to enjoy beautiful Hill Country.  I would use him again in heartbeat and highly, highly recommend him to anyone wanting to enjoy Texas Hill Country!  Thanks David!

reviews.author: B M.
reviews.description: David was very helpful in planning a last minute wine tour. He was attentive in making sure we had a great day! He picked places that were just right for what we wanted. Our driver, Lyn, made the day seamless and easy by being flexible and friendly. I would definitely use them again.

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Used David for my wedding at the Lodge and Country Inn Cottages. They had great communication and made the wedding a breeze. Would absolutely recommend them to do a wedding again. Thanks David!

reviews.author: Dustin M.
reviews.description: David is the man! My wife and I had such a great experience. He took us all over wine country. He had great stories and knew all the great places to go. We will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Morgan B.
reviews.description: Awesome experience. D'ann was very helpful and recommend the best wineries in town. JP was a great tour guide. They both went above and beyond to make our experience memorable. Highly recommend Open Range.

reviews.author: Marge B.
reviews.description: I arranged a Girls' Getaway to Fredericksburg, so naturally I wanted to do a wine tour. I contacted several tour companies. D'Ann was extremely responsive and gave me several suggestions of where to go. Since I'm a wine club member at quite a few wineries in the Hill Country, I opted to do a custom tour and made my own reservations. Greg, the owner (and D'Ann's husband) arrived on time and drove us to 3 wineries where we were able to enjoy a nice, relaxing afternoon. Greg was so friendly, helpful and accommodating. I would highly recommend Open Range Tours...thanks, D'Ann and Greg!!!

reviews.author: Casey F.
reviews.description: D'ann went above and beyond for the tour for my sister's bachelorette party!  There were some general issues with scheduling and logistics that were my fault, but she very kindly fixed everything!  Our driver David was on time, helpful, and a lot of fun.  They know a lot about the wineries and have personal relationships with the owners/managers/tasting staff.  David also went above and beyond by making an extra stop for shopping/pie-indulging and by dropping us off at our dinner restaurant so we didn't have to walk from the visitor center where he picked us up.  Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: My winery tour with open range was excellent. D'anne took great care of my group. She texted me several times to keep me updated on the tour and even gave me her personal cell number so that I could reach her anytime. Our driver, Bill, was right on time. He was knowledgeable and very friendly. I highly recommend them for your next tour.

reviews.author: Holly P.
reviews.description: We went to Fredericksburg for a girls trip and wanted to spend a day at the distilleries and breweries. David was fantastic to work with planning everything out. I wouldn't have changed any of that part. But, once the day rolled around we were met with a hiccup. The driver, not David like I was anticipating after multiple conversations, arrived in a mustang for 5 of us. Obviously that wasn't going to work so I was offered by the driver only to cancel or reschedule. Our trip was planned around spending our day out and about so cancelling wasn't an option for us. After a phone call to David, we were assured our day wasn't ruined just a bit delayed. The driver left and showed back up with an SUV and away we went. The driver wasn't interactive and she didn't seem to even be having a good day... It happens I get it but come on. Anyway, we made the best of our day and enjoyed ourselves. When we were dropped off, I tried to pay but she said to get with David. No problem but I did have a problem with her then saying that she'd go ahead and take the gratuity and that the standard is 20%. I didn't even know what our total cost was to figure 20% but asking for the gratuity before I even paid for the day was in poor taste. We did go ahead and tip, and well mind you, because that's the kind of people we are. I ended up calling David and finishing out the transaction and once again, he was a pleasure to deal with. Overall, we'll use them again because I appreciated David that much. But, I'll definitely make sure we don't have the same driver. 5 stars for David but 4 stars overall for the above mentioned.

reviews.author: Mandy G.
reviews.description: If you're looking to visit some wineries in the outskirts of Austin, I recommend it with Arlen!   Arlen was sweet, knowledgable, and funny. He picked us up from our Airbnb and drove us 45 mins out and back, while we blasted some rachet songs to sing haha. He would check in on us during the winery to see if we needed anything or have any questions, and he would offer to help us take multiple pictures. He also got one of the wineries to allow us to explore their cellars!   On our last day in Austin, he drove by our airbnb to pick up someone else and honked at us as we waited for our uber. We were all so happy to see him again, as we all enjoyed our experience with him.   I recommend Texas Tipsy Tours with Arlen ;)

reviews.author: Brittany Z.
reviews.description: I have so many wonderful things to say about this company. I set-up an appointment online to schedule a private driver to Fredericksburg. Ashley called right on time. She was friendly and very informative.  She helped make the experience exactly what I was looking for. I wanted less sweet wines and a winery with food options. Arlen was our diver and was so knowledgeable and friendly. He picked us up right at the hotel in Austin. I felt the price for the experience is definitely worth it. If you were considering this experience, I highly recommend this company. They care and that is important.

reviews.author: Rolanda H.
reviews.description: If your looking to visit wineries or distilleries in the  outskirts of Austin like Dripping Springs and the surrounding area I highly recommend Texas Tipsy Tours. They are organized and timely. If you're an out of towner like myself and decide to book accommodations in Austin they will pick you up from there and bring you back.   All of my future bookings I will definitely request Wade. He was very professional and personable, he made sure we were taken care of at each location on our tour. He also was more than happy to take our pictures along the way.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: We were on a girls trip and were lucky to have Arlen as our driver. He was exceptional, friendly and knowledgeable! He gave us great recommendations for places we were unsure about.

reviews.author: Stephanie T.
reviews.description: Y'all BOOK WITH THEM!!!!! I literally do not have one negative thing to say about this company. From the minute I called to book to the minute I said goodbye to our driver the day of the tour they were fantastic.   So when I called there actually weren't any times available. They worked with me to make sure they had a tour time and sprinter available for our group of 6. I had a million questions; they were patient and kind.   Our group was 6 but one of my friends asked if we could add an additional person. Reached out to TTT and they said sure no problem. Literally 3 HOURS LATER I got a call that another girl tested positive with covid and wouldn't be able to come with us obviously- they were so nice and made the switch back to 6. Very grateful for their exceptional customer service.   Day of our driver Bryant was early which was great! Got on the bus and let us have free range of the radio, answered any wine questions we had or any questions about Fredericksburg. He was a fantastic host. Always texted 15 minutes till our time at the winery was up and took as many pictures as we wanted. He was so sweet! He also made sure we were never thirsty or hungry. Which for a group of girls is very important- smart man! Haha   I've heard things about other companies having hidden fees and people getting charges after leaving Fredericksburg and we had none of that.
