Texas Tipsy Tours was very transparent with all of their pricing and they had no hidden fees.   Thank you TTT for making our trip perfect. You won't regret booking with them.

reviews.author: Mia L.
reviews.description: Sent a request in and received a response on a weekend afternoon in less than 5 minutes. Incredible customer service, they only fit up to 14 on their vehicles so we were unable to use them, but their owner takes quotes seriously!!

reviews.author: Kelly F.
reviews.description: My experience with Texas Tipsy tours was nothing short of perfect!!! From pickup to drop-off, Courtney (the owner) made our experience amazing! When I initially started inquiring about a tour a few months ago, many of the companies only offered private tours for a minimum of 4 people. However, Texas Tipsy Tours offers small group private tours (i.e. 2-3 people). This was perfect for me. She also made planning our trip so easy, and she promptly answered all of the questions I had.   On the day of the tour, she picked us up from our hotel in Austin in an Infiniti SUV (it was very clean too)! She even made a pit stop for me at a CVS on the way to our first winery. Throughout the 6 hour tour, she made sure we stayed on schedule. She even let us change a stop last minute because we wanted to check out a brewery!  One thing that was amazing was the comfort she provided! She allowed us to pick the music, provided phone chargers, and let us control the AC! She even opened our doors for us AND dropped us off/picked us up right in front of each place we went!  Overall, I highly recommend Texas Tipsy Tours, and I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Audrey C.
reviews.description: Wow!  What an amazing day our group of ladies had with Texas Tipsy Tours.  We chose the half day option and were picked up right at our vacation rental (Farmhouse on Elder Hill) We wanted to just stay nearby so we visited Driftwood Estate Winery and Fall Creek.  We were planning to also see Vista Brewing (all in Driftwood), but we chatted and laughed so much that we ran out of time and Eric, driver/owner was flexible with our change of plans and let us just extend our time enjoying the fabulous view at Driftwood Estate.  The tour service was absolutely awesome and professional.  Everything done with excellence.  Thank you Courtney and Eric!

reviews.author: Ally H.
reviews.description: Awesome experience for bachelorette. Seamless communication with manager Courtney. Helped us make a great itinerary-2 wineries and 1 distillery. Group loved every minute. Driver Keaton was so friendly and professional and best of all company was affordable. Can't recommend enough

reviews.author: Ashton M.
reviews.description: I booked a private wine tasting tour with Tipsy Tours for a bachelorette party and it was seamless right from the start! They took care of everything and even placed our lunch order for us in advance so it was ready when we arrived. It was honestly one of the best tour experiences I have ever had and already booked another tour with them for later this year!

reviews.author: Erin J.
reviews.description: We booked Texas Tipsy Tours twice in one weekend. I have taken quite a few van tours around the hill country and Texas Tipsy Tours sets themselves apart by not just being drivers but they truly host you the entire day. I will ALWAYS use this company going forward. We did a private charter from Driftwood to Austin, TX and back and Keaton our driver was a delight. He made sure we were picked up on time and each of our stops were easy and flexible. We did a mixed tour around Driftwood and Dripping springs the next day and our guide Eric executed the BEST DAY for us. He even picked up on what we were liking and recommended a change to our final stop to Vista Brewing and we were SO glad he did. At each stop he made sure we had plenty of water, snacks and chairs to enjoy the gorgeous venues. This is totally above and beyond what we would have expected from a driver. Courtney was so easy to work with and she helped make recommendations for our group ultimately making our weekend get away FLAWLESS. I promise if you don't use this company, you're wrong.

reviews.author: Chelsea C.
reviews.description: AWESOME! I worked with Courtney at TTT to plan my Husband's 30th birthday brewery tour. It was as easy as getting on the phone, explaining what I wanted, and Courtney took care of literally everything else. We picked the breweries we wanted and even included a food stop. She coordinated the bus pick up, drop offs, schedule, and even reserved tables for us at each stop. I love that we had our own bus (very nice one, by the way!), and had the flexibility to create our own tour based on beers and food my husband liked. It was the perfect Saturday in Austin! Payment was very easy as well - they sent me an invoice to my email and I was able to pay directly online for everything. Highly recommend, and thank you Texas Tipsy Tours!

reviews.author: Kylie H.
reviews.description: Texas Tipsy Tours was absolutely wonderful. They curated a wine tasting for my best friend's bachelorette, and were so helpful and knowledgeable. Courtney and Eric are just the sweetest people! Would highly recommend if you're looking for a relaxed tasting without the hubbub of big party buses, AND if you're looking for a more personalized experience with people who can really throw a party. Fredericksburg can be confusing because of the many, many options, so Courtney's expertise in the wineries proved incredibly helpful. Highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Christy C.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience with this tour company.  They were easy to work with and to plan our day.  We selected the premium wine tour and stopped at 3 wineries and picked up lunch at Hye Market.  The entire experience was well thought out and planned thoroughly.  Courtney is one of the owners and helped me figure out which wineries to taste.  Keaton was our driver and he was great!  I would definitely recommend this tour company.

reviews.author: Nancy R.
reviews.description: Our driver, Keaton, was amazing! He was so polite and kept us on schedule. The places we visited were amazing and so welcoming. Highly recommend!

name: Dripping With Taste Wine and Food Festival

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: This was my first, and sad to say, my last time doing this festival. A friend who had been a few times before highly recommended it and when I balked at the $40 (plus a $3.50 processing fee) "pre-event discount price" with the at the door price being $50, he assured me it was well worth it because there were so many great food and wine vendors, you get your money's worth.  This was absolutely NOT the case! Firstly, this whole thing just seemed disorganized at best and I am sorry, but for $50 ($40) they could have gotten a much nicer location than a dusty, stiflingly hot cattle stockyard!   As for what you get for $40, 6 drink tickets and 10 food tickets when drinks and food run you anywhere from 1 ticket for a meager barely 1oz pour for most of the wines to several tickets for very small portions of the food, you barely get $10 worth of food and drink! You can purchase ticket for $1 a piece, which is most definitely not worth the portions or pours you receive.   As for the vendors/vintners at the festival, there were not nearly as many as you would expect for the price point and the layout was just haphazard. Also, there were several vendors that were out of food by the time we got there just after 2pm...the "festival" was supposed to go until 6pm...so how the heck were vendors running out of things w/4hrs left!?!   The only highlight, for me at least, was the grape stomp, but even then, they ran out of tshirts to "stamp" with your grape-soaked footprints.   In any case, my $43.50 would have been better spent and enjoyed at an actual local restaurant where I could have gotten multiple full pours of wine and actual food instead of leaving this joke of a festival hungry, overheated, more sober than when I arrived, and feeling like I had just been scammed somehow. Lesson. Learned.   I am honestly shocked this "festival" has lasted 10yrs let alone one!

reviews.author: Valerie S.
reviews.description: I had a lovely time as the guest of a coworker. However, I felt like the overall value wasn't quite there for this event. Drink and food tickets went way too fast when some places asked for multiple tickets for less than an ounce of wine or a small sample of food. The actual value was about $1 per ticket. There were also some vendors that were somewhat rude or rushing. The whole point is to get business by having people try your product, right? Well there's some wineries I'd think twice about giving my money to after their lack of friendliness.   The options for food was more limited than I expected and many ran out of food even though we got there just an hour after the event started. There are lots of raffles going on and free koozies and pens galore. The arena was stuffy inside and though fresh near the doors you ran the risk of also eating dirt.   The music was good but there needed to be more sitting areas to relax and open a bottle of wine. I will definitely go back next year, but I do hope to see more offerings.

reviews.author: Ella D.
reviews.description: This was by far the most awful "festival" I have ever had the misfortune of wasting money on.   First of all, in 2012 it was held at the Texas Hill Country Olive Company. So all advertisements this year were of a gorgeous event at this lovely vineyard - The photos were of a classy event, surrounded by olive trees and rolling hills, adorable art booths scattered about the lovely property, smiling faces holding wine glasses. I was so excited based on what I was reading of the Olive Company event that I had my mother travel up 3 hours on the morning of Saturday the 14th to accompany me. Then I convinced another girlfriend of mine to join. We had our tickets in advance, $40.00 online purchase, and my girlfriend paid at the door - $50.00.   Now, regardless of where the ACTUAL event for 2013 was advertised as being held - between the advertisements on Yelp, on Facebook and scattered about Dripping Springs, it was VERY unclear to anyone coming from outside of town where the hell this event actually was.   So we arrived at the Texas Hill Country Olive Company to find no tents, no events, no nothing but a beautiful building surrounded by beautiful land. Inside there were very few customers. But we were greeted warmly, given amazing samples (DO go there and DO try their olive oils and balsamic vinegars and DO check out their $55.00 romantic date night packages).   Making the best of what was already frustrating, we had a few samples and they sent us on to the Dripping Springs Park Ranch - or something like that, up Ranch Road Twelve.   We were still optimistic until we saw the HUGE metal pavilion looming ahead, situated in the midst of probably two square miles of plowed up red dirt which will eventually be a parking lot. As we navigated in, driving through dirt among hundreds of cars, we noticed piles of dirt, bull dozers, caution tape... this entire venue was a.) an agricultural fair pavilion and b.) UTTERLY UNFINISHED.   I was mortified. I brought guests, I paid money, and we were supposed to be in the midst of lush, rolling hill country sipping wine and sampling cheese. Not walking through 300 yards of dirt to get to an unfinished metal building. This was already so embarrassing and already not worth the money.   We had to enter at the back of this enormous, godawful construction, walk through the art vendors, then across MORE dirt on the rodeo floor (where the paying guests tables were and the music) where we were given six drink tickets and ten food tickets. When we reached the one interior part of the building, we were encountered by swarms of casually dressed, generally rude, pushy guests who were buzzing around a square room with no proper traffic flow. There we found out that each drink ticket gave us ONE OUNCE of wine, which was poured by rude and distracted vendors. We also found that each food ticket did not entitle us to a sample - samples cost anywhere from 2 to 5 tickets. One ticket got you the likes of ONE chip with a dollop of something on it.   I was blocked and almost run over by a RUDE and completely OBLIVIOUS staff member who was blocking the only entrance to the tasting room. Other guests were hogging the only FIVE standing tables in the are, they'd put their purses up there and stand around and send other guests to get them samples, so there was no where to set down your things and you had to juggle a glass of wine, your tickets, your purse, and a plate of food and in order to eat it, back through the ONE door you went, down the stairs to the dirt on the rodeo arena floor.   We left without even using the tickets we had - not worth the paltry return for what we'd spent and what we had to endure to get there.   I will never return to this event. I want my money back from this event. The Dripping Springs Chamber of Commerce should be ashamed of the overall mess and disappointment this fiasco was - they don't deserve a dime of the money they raised from it.   TERRIBLE.

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: This is probably more of a 3.5 than a 4, but the low ratings to date are unjustified so I'm bumping it up.  I enjoyed the wide variety of beer, wine, and liquor to choose from, but I wish there were a few more food options. What made it worth the price of admission was the sommelier talk at 3:30 where there was no-ticket-required wine comparison tasting, and I learned a few things. Take advantage of those demos if you go next year. Also there were a few food stands with free samples no tickets required (pecans were a favorite, olive oil, chips and salsa, etc). I wish I had hit the liquor area sooner, they seemed to have generous pours. I may hit this event again next year, or I may not, but I definitely had a good time.

reviews.author: Miranda E.
reviews.description: This was disappointing. I've been to many similar food/wine tastings, but this one was very low value- you received drink and food coupons instead of the usual unlimited tastings most events provide. Also, expect to experience long lines in a hot event center. I'd recommend treating yourself to a nice dinner with wine over coming here.

reviews.author: Chrystal W.
reviews.description: I thought this was an awesome event!  Yes you had to pay $40 for entrance into the event.  For that money you receive a twin Iiquors reusable bag, some goodies inside the bag including a wine glass, 10 food tickets and 6 wine tickets.  Each wine ticket was good for a 1oz pour.  And the food tickets could be used at more than 10 food vendors for various amounts.  It is called Dripping with Taste because it is supposed to be a "taste" not a full glass or full meal.  I will tell you that I had plenty of food for my 10 tickets!  And got to try 6 different wines!    I will say that a previous post about volunteers having to work 2 hours and then getting unlimited food and drinks is absolutely false.  Volunteers had to work a minimum of 3 hour shifts but most worked many, many more hours not only the day of the event but also prior to the event and they got the same 10 food tickets and 6 alcohol tickets.  I learned a lot about local wineries, breweries, and distilleries and tasted some awesome food from some local restaurants that I had not yet eaten at.

reviews.author: Jared H.
reviews.description: If you choose to attend this festival, DO NOT PAY. You get 6 drink tickets and 10 food tickets for $40. 1 oz pours. That's about 1/6 of a glass of wine. So you pay $40 for a single glass of wine. HEB gave away 2 chips with salsa for 1 ticket, empanadas were 5 tickets. I was denied BUYING a bottle of water, so that the volunteers could have them.   This brings me to the point, if you want to go to dripping with taste, volunteer. They treat the volunteers far better than paying guests. They do their jobs for 2 hours then get to enjoy UNLIMITED drinks and food and get cool shirts that aren't available to buy to us regulars.   I was very unimpressed Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Brandy E.
reviews.description: I was really excited for this, but sadly disappointed. Paid $40 ticket, which included 10 food tasting tickets and 6 wine tasting tickets. Get there and see that almost every vendor is charging 2-5 tickets for food tasting and the wine tastings are  only 1 oz pours. What??! What did my $40 pay for?? A couple sample size appetizers and a few gargle-worth 's wine samples! Furthermore, it was inside and stifling!! I'd much rather pay a little more and get unlimited tastings, at least I'd feel like I got my money's worth. Sorry Dripping, won't be back. Huge disappointment.

reviews.author: Chris T.
reviews.description: They did a good job this year except for signage. There was a huge lack thereof at the back entrance where they were having everyone park when I arrived.  Everyone parking had no idea where to go. Other than that, the new Ranch/event center is nice. There were lots of vendors and lots to choose from. The tickets were more than enough to try things and the staff were friendly. Dripping Springs is a gorgeous city that should be visited by all.

reviews.author: Holmes S.
reviews.description: A piss poor event.   It was raining when we arrived, I know that no one can help that, but we were one of the first to arrive and we directed to park at the back end of a mud field. Instead of filling up the lot nearest the event, we had to walk though a water logged muddy field.   Then the signing up volunteers, one of the online register volunteers, was the rudest person I have met in a long time. She reminded me of one of the Orks from Lord of the Rings.   So you get 10 food tickets and 6 drink tickets. What you fail to learn until you have paid ($50) is that 10 food tickets doesn't mean 10 small samples, all of the samples were multiple tickets. Essentially, your $50 gets you two tacos and the six drink tickets equal about one glass of wine.   A truly crap festival.

reviews.author: Charlene N.
reviews.description: This year was my second year to attend the festival. I loved it. I did volunteer this year to help and I am glad I did. I saw more of what hard work goes into making it a success. I still had time to taste wine and food and work to help this year be more successful than the last. I had fun and really love this part of Texas. Perfect place and lot of hard work went into making this a fun day.  Good job all who make this happen!!!!

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: After reading the other reviews I felt that I had to write one myself. Just how many wine festivals have these people attended?!  I have attended literally dozens of wine festivals, mostly in California. Believe me that the Dripping with Taste Festival is, by far, the best value on the market. Spending $40 for the initial tickets is next to nothing compared to the analogous events in California. AND purchasing additional tickets for a buck each is very cheap compared to other such events.   I have attended the last two Dripping with Taste festivals and plan to continue to attend every year. I look forward to this event based on the quality of the event and the very, very low cost. Both years I have come away with the feeling that I got more than my money's worth and found several Texas wines to add to my wine cellar!

reviews.author: B L.
reviews.description: Went to this event for my birthday and...gee...what a rip.  Like the other person said its located at a huge agricultural pavilion for horse and gun shows.  I live in Drippings and saw this massive structure being erected.  Its quite the eye sore.  That'd be fine if it wasn't so expensive.  Worse, it is actually held in a tiny closed off indoor part of the complex that's maybe a 1/8th the size of the whole place.  Needless to say, it was over crowded, people packed in like sardines.  My family wanted to leave rather quickly because it just flat out sucked.  Some the vendors were generous some were stingy and acted like it was a chore to deal with you.  Stay away from this event.

reviews.author: Elizabeth N.
reviews.description: The last time I went to this event was several years ago and I was very disappointed with the venue and the offerings and had not gone back. I decided to try it again this year since it sounded like a great venue but I was very disappointed here as well. The place was nice and large but very hot and had a messy, red dirt floor. Really, I spent $40 on a cattle pen?  The wineries were nice but there were not enough food vendors and most were over-priced. My legs and feet were disgustingly dirty by the time we left. It also made me wonder how much of that dirt ended up on the food.  That's two out of two disappointments with that event and I will not be going back until a better location is used. If it happens a third time, well it will be third time and your out. There are plenty of nicer wine events around Texas that don't charge that much for entry and are much more fun.

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: We thoroughly enjoyed our day at Dripping With Taste. Having missed the event last year, we weren't sure what to expect at the new venue. Mother Nature decided that we needed some rain, and she was right! Though we were a little soggy when we arrived, that didn't dampen our spirits. We sampled food from most of the vendors, the quality was outstanding and we found everyone to be warm, friendly and knowledgable. As always, great wines, loved the beer garden, and glad to see the addition of spirits. The music added a nice ambience. We enjoyed our beer, wine and food sitting comfortably watching the shows. We had a wonderful day, we're looking forward to next year's Dripping With Taste. The Chamber should be very proud of this years event.

reviews.author: G C.
reviews.description: Definitely not worth your money. 50.00 per person with very little vendors for the money. 10 food tickets and 6 wine/spirit tickets. Filler vendors for example Sysco and HEB to make the place appear fuller. Don't do it.

reviews.author: Jonathan James R.
reviews.description: The night could not have gone any better. Vehicle was clean, music was perfect, and the service provided by the team was top notch. Any request that was made throughout the night was delivered on. I actually wish I could give 6 stars for a perfect evening.

reviews.author: Nick W.
reviews.description: George was amazing! We took went out to the Willam Chris Winery for the day and had the very best time going there and coming home with George. He is literally the best, nicest, and most fun driver we've had and will only use his services when we do trips like this. Thanks George!

reviews.author: Mitchel R.
reviews.description: Jason was fantastic! I highly recommend him to anybody looking to take a tour of wineries/distilleries.  Great communication, easy to work with, and deeply knowledgeable of the area. He made great suggestions, was flexible as needed, and took great care of us! He even got us a private tour of the cellar at Hawk's Shadow Winery.  Absolutely reach out to him if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Rick M.
reviews.description: Jason was very professional and did a good job planning the day. Could not have asked for a better experience.

reviews.author: Vinny P.
reviews.description: Great service! We did a brewery and distillery tour with Cool Bus ATX yesterday. Sam is the owner/driver and one thing she provides is unbelievable customer service. She's extremely easy to work with, provides a fun atmosphere on the bus and is very reasonable priced. I would highly recommend this service to anyone who's looking to get a group of friends together and tour around Austin.

reviews.author: Edwin T.
reviews.description: We had a 12 man bachelor party in Austin during Memorial Day weekend. The day we spent riding around in Cool Bus ATX was the absolute highlight of the weekend. Sam, the owner and driver, was unbelievable. Very accommodating, great driver, and super chill.   We planned to hit up the Salt Lick on the party bus and then venture around to some breweries afterwards. Sam made sure that the group got where we needed to be on time, had great suggestions for breweries, and made sure we were having as much fun as possible.  The bus is great. Fit everyone comfortably with enough room for a cooler in between all of us. Sam had her playlist turned up or she would hand over the AUX cord and we could play our tracks as loud as we wanted. The whole experience was incredibly laid back and worry free. I would absolutely recommend Cool bus ATX to anyone that wants to have a great time with a big group in Austin.   On a side note, if it is Sunday, make sure that you buy beer on Saturday because they don't sell it on Sunday before noon.   Thanks again, Sam!

reviews.author: Bailey S.
reviews.description: We just got back from an amazing weekend with Cool Bus ATX!! Sam, the owner, is very sweet and accommodating. The bus itself is awesome - lights, music (you can play your own music too!), plenty of seating, very well maintained and clean. Would recommend to everyone. Thanks again Cool Bus ATX!

reviews.author: Thad G.
reviews.description: Amazing tour, the level of service they provide is unmatched. I have been on multiple tours in Fredericksburg and this company by far is the best. Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Alexandra A.
reviews.description: 11/10 Recommended. Dianna and Lou were so friendly, funny and warm, which made our tour even better than anticipated. The van was so comfy and roomy with great AC and sound system. Throughout the tour they chatted with us and made us laugh, and y'all, they are so prepared before the trip. The snacks and beverages were tasty and helpful between venues. Definitely will be booking another tour next month. Highly recommended!

name: Keep Austin Wet Party Bus Rentals

reviews.author: Nicki O.
reviews.description: We booked for a bachelorette party wine tasting. I would most definitely recommend these guys!! The whole process was very smooth. Easy to reserve. Prompt pick-up on the day of. The bus was clean and comfortable. They took care of arranging all the stops on our wine tour. James, our driver, was fantastic! Most importantly, we made it home safely! Thanks Austin Wet Bus!!

reviews.author: Patrick M.
reviews.description: Santos set up the perfect wine tasting tour for our party.  The bus was so nice and clean.   Great experience.

reviews.author: Randy M.
reviews.description: Had a blast riding around on the Wet Bus! Booming system and watched The Anchorman on the big TV. The driver Pete was safe and fun throughout the trip while our friends were getting wasted-faced!

reviews.author: a j.
reviews.description: Our group of girls had so much fun on a vineyard tour with Keep Austin Wet!  My driver clearly had everything under control, so I was able to relax with my friends and start the party as soon as we got on the bus!  Our kids were so jealous when they saw the cool bus their moms' were leaving them in!  Honestly, the bus could have driven us anywhere and we would have had a good time, but Santos' attention to picking great vineyards and James' attnetion to keeping us on schedule made everything perfect!  Our group was different than most -- in that we wanted to take it slow and just relax and were not too concerned about whether we made it to all three destinations.  We also had some nursing moms and wanted to be sure everyone was accomodated.  James was very accomodating and once I conveyed that we were more relaxed he made sure we had all the time we needed.  I also felt like the driving was very safe and overall the attention to safety was as it should be.  The price was reasonable, as well.  All in All, Keep Austin Wet made our vineyard tour perfect!

reviews.author: Annie M.
reviews.description: What a great experience! I cannot speak highly enough about Austin Wet Bus. Santos was so enthusiastic about hosting our party, which was a welcome relief as that is not always the response you get from tour companies when you tell them you're a bachelorette party--no matter how well-behaved you may be! Our driver, James, was wonderful and so helpful the entire day, especially at the end when we elected to add another hour and an extra stop; he catered his recommendation to our needs (gluten intolerant guests + casual interest in beer and liquor) and we had an amazing experience. You can't beat the pricing, but for what we paid our experience definitely exceeded every expectation. Thank you so much for everything, and we look forward to using you again in the future!

reviews.author: Alexia P.
reviews.description: Planned a surprise Bachelorette weekend for my close friend this past November.  Throwing a surprise weekend is stressful enough but Woody was SUPER accommodating especially for being so last minute.  There were many tours that I could've chosen to stick with but Woody was so authentic about his services and was a person of integrity when it came to what he offered.  He personally picked us up from our little hotel we were staying at and drove us to all three of our tours. His tour bus was super clean and we all had a blast! He even offered to pick up some cheese and snacks at the HEB close by to have on the bus if we wanted! I really appreciated Woody taking the time to answer my numerous phone calls with questions I had as this is my first Bachelorette party I threw.  I HIGHLY recommend using Woody if anyone wants to have a great time and looking for someone to trust. I will be booking with you again Woody, thank you so much for everything!

reviews.author: Brad B.
reviews.description: Woody was great, our party had a wonderful time touring Fredericksburg wineries with him and he was very knowledgable about the area and the vineyards.  He has deep contacts at each location and was able to get a very large group into locations that have restrictions due to COVID.  We would all use Woody again when we go back to visit the Texas wine country.  Book with Woody you won't regret it.  Thanks Woody!!!

reviews.author: Christy S.
reviews.description: Blake was our driver; amazing sweet considerate young man! Go to narrow path and arrowhead wineries

reviews.author: Colleen F.
reviews.description: Wow! There are so many choices for wine tours in Fredericksburg that it can be a bit overwhelming. If you come across Fredericksburg Uncorked Wine Tours, stop your search and make the booking.   Organizing a wine tour for 18 girls as part of a bachelorette party was a breeze with Woody, the owner/operator of Uncorked. He gave great advice, offered competitive pricing (especially for the expectant mothers/non-drinkers in our group), and was easy to communicate with. Woody was incredibly patient during the lead up to our tour, and then was a funny, gracious, and attentive guide during our wine tasting experience.   Our tour was fantastic from start to finish, and I can't recommend Woody and the rest of the Fredericksburg Uncorked team highly enough. All (18) of us had the greatest time!

reviews.author: Meggan G.
reviews.description: We had the perfect day with Woody on the Texas 2 Step tour. He kept in touch with us from our booking up until the morning of the tour. He was very friendly, informative and kept us entertained. We learned so much about the area, got recommendations on places to go and heard some great stories along the way! He also made sure to take plenty of photos for everyone in the group. I highly recommend using his services for a great tour of wine country!

reviews.author: Geno C.
reviews.description: Great tour. Great customer service. Will love to go again and stay away from the routine from work.

reviews.author: Katie H.
reviews.description: Woody is amazing! Best driver and tour guide we've ever had.  Super friendly and personable.  Makes sure everyone is having the best experience.  Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: Woody was the best winery your host!! He took our group of 18 for a bachelorette party to three wineries and lunch was included. He took our pictures at each winery and also was very entertaining and extremely nice! He went out of his way to make sure we had a great time.

reviews.author: Kelsey M.
reviews.description: I've been to Fredericksburg twice on big girls trip, and woody was our guide both times - we won't ever go anywhere else! Book your tour, he picks you up and it's literally that easy!  Woody is very nice and knows Fredericksburg and the wineries so well. Don't go anywhere else!!

reviews.author: Julianne D.
reviews.description: Woody is the best guide ever! So accommodating, so nice, and very gracious. Such a great experience- he took such good care of us- I couldn't say enough great things!

reviews.author: Amy U.
reviews.description: This was an AMAZING experience!!! My husband and I are not about organized tours all that much, but this tour was not an organized group of people like a lot of tours are. He went out of his way to text us even before the tour and recommend places for us to go. We loved him so much we even hung out with him after the tour. He is an awesome tour guide and a blast to hangout with and knows anyone and everyone! Can't recommend this tour enough!

reviews.author: TC R.
reviews.description: Had an awesome day with my family and friends. Woody hit all the best spots and we got lit Woody is the man!

reviews.author: Rachael T.
reviews.description: I can't wait to get back to Fredricksburg and have Woody show me around! We had a large group of ladies and Woody took such great care of us. I would highly recommend his services to anyone heading to Fredricksburg!

reviews.author: Catherine T.
reviews.description: Woody was absolutely amazing , my boyfriend and I came into town Thursday 3/17/16 and I really wanted to find a tour for Friday . I called him Friday morning at 8:50 hoping I'd get a call back before the 10 am tour and I did ten min later and I was able to get on his first tour . I honestly called three or 4 more tours throughout the week and left messages and he is the only one that called me back. Not only did woody come through, he came through at the last minute when I thought We weren't going to make a tour.  He was funny , knowledgeable and overall a great guide. He even recommended a few things that weren't apart of the tour (Alamo Springs Cafe) which we ended up going to and was delicious.  Lunch was not included but the place we went to was pretty great for a sandwich . I'd hang out and grab a beer with woody any night !  Thank you for making my boyfriends birthday a good one !!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Woody was lovely and quickly became part of our group. He gave helpful insight into each winery and took so many pictures (patiently!) I wanted to dub him the class historian  Cannot recommend his services enough!

reviews.author: Sue F.
reviews.description: Woody is a funny,helpful, kind and an amazing guy. We were able to book one day in advance. He responded to my call right away and set us up with a 4 person private tour plus lunch. We all had a great time with lots of funny narratives. If you want to see a different side of Texas wineries, just call Woody. He will definitely hook you up.  What a great day with no worries.

reviews.author: Nelcy R.
reviews.description: Woody was nice at the beginning but there was miscommunication about lunch and he decided to take it upon himself to charge my credit card without my permission. I was upset and apparently he was too so he threw customer service out the window. I never agreed to Woody keeping my credit card information on file after he charged the wine tour for 11 girls (almost $1,300).   The driver Tommy was nice but he did nothing special and didn't know the basics of Woody's business. Had he known even a little bit about Uncorked Tours, there wouldn't have been confusion about lunch.   As far as the wine tour: William Chris and Lost Draw were my favorite wineries. Hye Market pretended we weren't there half of the time. Pontotoc was greedy with their pours.   Woody was very unprofessional and difficult to work with at the end. I would not recommend him. Book early to get the highest rated wine tours (2-3 months prior)!

reviews.author: Shannon M.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our wine tour with Bill! He was very knowledgeable and easy to talk to since the other half of our tour cancelled, so it was like a private tour for my boyfriend and I.  We really enjoyed the entire time and highly recommend booking a wine tour through Uncorked!

reviews.author: Brittany B.
reviews.description: We had such a great time with Woody! We were on a bachelorette trip with 15 ladies, and had plenty of room. He picked up our sandwich platters at H-E-B that morning, and set up a little outdoor picnic for us at the second winery. The bus was top of the line, he was a lot of fun, and we would definitely do it again!

reviews.author: Natalie A.
reviews.description: My friends and I went on a wine tour with Woody a few Sundays ago, and it was great! I tried to book for Saturday but the tour was full. I called the number provided on the website and had a great conversation with Woody. He set up the perfect private winery tour for me and my friends on Sunday, since Saturday was full. It was a really great and memorable experience and I would definitely consider doing it again! We had our own spacious limo that we could sip on wine we brought with us, as well as some we purchased at the wineries we visited, while driving from one vineyard to the next (drive time between each location was max. 15 minutes). Overall a great experience!

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: So first....let me say that our group totally dropped the ball on planning.  We reached out to Carla 3-4 weeks before but did not confirm until the week of the wine tour.   By the grace of the "wine" Gods, Carla could fit us in her schedule!  She is completely open to letting you choose your places or you can follow her lead!   She picked us up at our accommodations which were several miles outside of Fredricksburg.  We did introductions and she laid out the things that were already scheduled for the day.  On our way to the first winery, we decided to "reroute" the tour to hit some lesser known spots.  TBH, we were excited for Carla's recommendations.    Our first stop was Six Shooter because of their variety of dry wines, sweet wines and meads.  You have to try the Jalapeno shooter!!!  SO GOOD!   Second, we made our tour time at Real Ale and did a beer tasting. Third, she realized the majority of our groups like Whiskey, so we stopped at Andalusia Whiskey in Blanco!  This place met the needs of our entire group (even the non-whiskey drinker) and was by far the most unique stop of their day!  If you go here, try the Cherry Cola cocktail!   We stopped for lunch at Pecan Street Brewing in Johnson City, where we drank lots of water and had really great food.   Our last stop of the tour was Zero815 Winery which had a cool mix of wines and friendly staff.   At the end of the day, Carla made sure that we made it back to our accommodations safe and sound.  We had the very best time and she knows some of the coolest places that you might miss without her expertise.  She was extremely professional and very down to earth.  She was always around to help with recommendations or just to snap photos of the group!     We highly recommend doing a tour with Carla and Texas Wine and Spirit Tours!   You won't be disappointed!   We'll be booking with her again the next time we are in the area!

reviews.author: Alejandra R.
reviews.description: I scheduled 2 group tours with Texan wine tours with more than 6 weeks in advance. The first tour was CANCELLED THE VERY SAME DAY we were supposed to go to the wineries. I traveled with a group of friends from Houston just to go visit the wineries  They also cancelled the second tour that was scheduled 2 weeks later. Our  weekend plan got ruined thanks to their lack of professionalism.

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: I forgot to review this! But we did our tour with Carla in October and she was fantastic! Highly recommend.  Sending some people your way!

reviews.author: Haley H.
reviews.description: I cannot say enough good things about Carla and her touring company. Some girl friends and I came to Fredericksburg for a long weekend and did two back-to-back tours with her. The first tour on Friday was with another group and they had already decided to do wine so we were able to join in with them and had a blast touring the local wineries. She also took us to a local watering hole afterwards when we decided we all wanted to stay out for a bit longer. She was amazingly accommodating and super fun!! On Saturday we wanted to tour some distilleries and breweries and she helped us decide which ones were more along the atmosphere we were looking for. Carla is amazing and I can't recommend her enough!!

reviews.author: Stacey G.
reviews.description: I planned a bachelorette party for my best friend a few weeks ago. Leslee was amazing in setting up the perfect day for our group! She was always prompt in returning my emails and adjusting our itinerary to meet our needs. The weather wasn't the best the weekend of the tour, but Leslee made sure that we still had a fantastic time! I highly recommend D'vine Tours for a wonderful Hill Country experience!

reviews.author: Erin Y.
reviews.description: We had a blast! Leslee, the tour guide, is great. She knows the town and the people. The van is the nicest I've been in.

reviews.author: Megan B.
reviews.description: My best friend and sister planned a weekend bachelorette party for me complete with a wine and art tour. The weather was pretty bad that morning, so we started a little late, but the van that they have is really, really nice, clean, and spacious. She even has a little stool in case you need help getting into the van, and she helps everyone get in and get out. We went to three places around the Johnson City area. The first one was a quick tasting, the second one we learned A LOT about wine and got a lesson in how to properly drink wine, and at the third winery we got the most interesting history lesson about President Johnson and Lady Bird Johnson from the winemaker himself. Leslee personally knows the places and owners and was just the best tour guide. One of the places on the tour where we were supposed to also eat dinner at cancelled due to the weather, but Leslee was quick to find a different place for us to go to. She took us to a cute cafe in downtown Johnson City where we ate a ridiculously good dinner. We even went to Leslee and her husband's bar at the end of the day for one last drink and got a chance to meet her sweet daughter as well. I thoroughly enjoyed the tour with Leslee and highly recommend D'Vine Tours!

reviews.author: Susan B.
reviews.description: We did a private wine tour for my daughters 30th birthday and had a wonderful time.  Winding Road was accommodating and made excellent picks and recommendations for us.  They planned out all the logistics and kept us on track.  I would highly recommend this company!

reviews.author: Tammy B.
reviews.description: Jaston was so cheerful, professional, polite, knowledgeable and fun!! Katie put together a fabulous charcuterie tray that was such a nice touch mid tour!! We will definitely book another tour when back in the area!!

reviews.author: Polly M.
reviews.description: This was an amazing experience. Katie and Jaston are beyond accommodating to make the trip great. They have access to great vineyards, distilleries, and breweries. Will definitely be using them again in the future!

reviews.author: Michelle S.
reviews.description: This was our first time exploring wineries and our driver and guide Jaston was the absolute best! He was very knowledgeable about the areas and wineries. The places he chose for us were top notch and we will definitely use Winding Road again!

reviews.author: Maria D.
reviews.description: This was such a wonderful experience ! My second time coming . Our driver Austin is amazing I gotta give him "kudos " for being so patient with the crowds aNF being so graceful. The owners are amazing as well .  They are always truing to make things right if you feel a slight bit unhappy.  The tours were well worth it.  Every time I go I'm never disappointed. The  service is impeccable. There are three stops very rewarding and very well thought out and put together and the winery stops are spread out Enough to enjoy each place .

reviews.author: Thaddeus B.
reviews.description: This was a great experience, can't imagine touring with anyone else in the Hill Country.  Katie and Jaston extended every effort to fit everyone's plans together and were great communicating the plans and ensuring everyone was happy.  Done tours previously, but not had as much fun as this trip.  They have access to the good and interesting vineyards, in an area where new places pop up daily it seems.  The bus was comfortable, the ride was smooth, and the mood was great.  They have earned our business.

reviews.author: Leticia E.
reviews.description: Had a great time in Fredericksburg! The complimentary personal charcuterie tray was a very nice addition to the tour. The Winding Road bus is nice, clean, and well prepared for any weather (blankets, umbrellas, and water). I highly recommend Winding Road Wine Tours, and I will definitely be using their services again.

reviews.author: Kara G.
reviews.description: Best wine tour ever! My girlfriends and I booked a wine tour for my birthday. The owner, Katie, is beyond sweet! She made sure everything was perfect for us and we got the experience we were looking for. She even went out of her way to give me a list of fun things to do in the area since we aren't local. Jaston, our driver, was awesome! He was our photographer, server, driver, anything we needed he made sure we got it. We definitely will be using Winding Road Wine Tours in the future!

reviews.author: Mark W.
reviews.description: Wow, What an  incredible time my wife and I spent last Saturday touring the Texas wine country with the help of Katie from Winding Road Wine Tours. Her knowledge of the area was impressive.  We are already planning our next trip. Thanks Katie!

reviews.author: Kathy W.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time with Jaston on the wine tour. Katie was integral in helping plan our event. She even made a guest appearance at the end of trip. We loved every minute of it. Thanks for helping us put together the perfect Hill Country Wine Tour. We look forward to many more.

reviews.author: J A.
reviews.description: We had an awesome time with Jaston! He was very knowledgeable, accommodating and explained all aspects of of the tour. The bus was comfortable and super clean. We highly recommend this tour! Thanks Jaston!!

reviews.author: Becky D.
reviews.description: Just had an amazing wine tour with Jaston and Winding Road Wine Tours! Very accommodating, took all the pictures we asked and was very knowledgeable. Would recommend to anyone wanting to spend the day in wine country!

reviews.author: Katie O.
reviews.description: BEST WINE TOUR EVER! Billy is so acccomodating and thoughtful. The wineries that were on the tour had amazing wine and atmospheres. Most certainly  would tour with them again!

reviews.author: Adam S.
reviews.description: My wife and I took this tour and really enjoyed it. A relaxing afternoon in the hill country tasting delicious wines. Billy was a wonderful tour guide.

reviews.author: Jerry S.
reviews.description: Absolutely great trip!  Visited 3 vineyards and all 3 were phenomenal!  Billy with WR tours was a wonderful host!  100% recommend Winding Road Wine Tours!  His bus is very comfortable and very roomy!  And he knows a great deal about the wines!!  Will definitely come back to Wimberley and use Winding Road!!!!!!

reviews.author: Heather T.
reviews.description: Awesome day and Billy was a great  driver and organized everything perfectly.  We would love to do this again!!

reviews.author: Lori C.
reviews.description: We had a great time today with Billy.  A great time with friends for a bachelorette party. Wonderful safe driving, good food and wine!

reviews.author: Paula B.
reviews.description: This is a wonderful wine tour with Billy in the Texas Hill Country. Billy was on time, friendly and very knowledgeable! There were 7 of us on a family vacation trip and we wanted to have a fun but classy wine tour where we got our money's worth and then some. As a new resident to the area, it's important for me to know what high quality tour guides are available. Well, Winding Road Hill Country Wine Tours with Billy is definitely the way to go, folks.

reviews.author: Don M.
reviews.description: Looking to experience great Hill Country wines and barbecue - we had both taking Winding Road Wine Tours Salt Lick Sunday Wine Tour.  The tour picked us up in Gruene in a new luxury bus at 10:30. We were greeted by the tour owner Billy Martin.  The bus was very comfortable with a u shaped seating arrangement and a table in the aisle.  Should seat around 12 people comfortably. The bus has a great sound system that is Bluetooth enabled - Billy played whatever we wanted from sources such as Pandora and Napster music service. First stop was Driftwood Estate Winery. Driftwood has perhaps the best winery views in the Hill Country.  I really enjoyed the reds and came away with a bottle of Longhorn Red to enjoy at our next stop Salt Lick Barbecue. Yes, Salt Lick is byob. It was beginning to rain and Billy dropped us off near the check in stand. He's thought of his customer's needs providing us large golf umbrellas. It was busy with people waiting to be seated. However, he got us seated right away. Our final two wineries were Fall Creek right across the street from Salt Lick and then Wimberley Valley Winery. Fall Creek has solid wines and the service for our group was outstanding. Wimberley Valley Winery was an unexpected pleasure. Their tasting room is roomy and comfortable with plenty room at the tasting bars and a comfortable seating area facing a large stone fireplace. They have a variety of wines bottled on site along with other wines from around the world. The grounds were spectacular with numerous large shaded decks to enjoy a glass or bottle as you wrap up your tour.  What a great Sunday drinking Texas wines, eating Texas barbecue and meeting new friends!

reviews.author: Jaimie M.
reviews.description: Absolutely 5 star experience! Billy was a great host and we all had a blast celebrating our friend's bachelorette party. The bus is extremely accommodating with a great sound system, places for drinks and COLD a/c! (Which was great for the warm weather outside). We had an absolute blast! Thank you so much for taking such great care of us!

reviews.author: Mackenzie W.
reviews.description: I rented a party bus through this company a couple weeks ago. In the beginning, Robert was extremely accommodating and friendly. And our driver, Terrell, was great. We got dropped off at COTA for a show and had a great time!  But where it turned south was at the end of the night. I texted our driver 30 minutes before we needed to be picked up (like he requested) and he said no problem. Then we left the concert and were walking to the pickup spot where I gave him a call. He said he got in an accident but would only be 20 minutes and I said that's fine. 20 minutes roll by and I gave him a call again, no answer, but texted and said it would be another 20 minutes. We ended up waiting in the cold for almost an hour and well after most people had left COTA. Multiple people in our party ended up just taking ubers because they didn't want to wait. The whole point of a bus is so you don't have to wait.  The next day, I texted Robert saying we would like a refund for the extra hour we paid for waiting that we wouldn't have used if we had been picked up on time. He said he would call to discuss but never did. I've now sent him multiple emails - mind you, being incredibly nice about it. All I asked for was an hour refunded back - not the whole thing, not even half. But still no response.  The customer service level of this company is terrible should anything go wrong. So hire them at your own risk.

reviews.author: Neesh S.
reviews.description: Apologies for this review being so incredibly late but Austin Nites was the best! We had rented a party bus on pretty short notice to take a Bachelor Party to and from Lake Travis and Robert and team were amazing.   It was also Prom weekend so the schedule was packed for them but they still took care of us and worked with our schedule.   Our boat ended up staying out on the water longer than scheduled which through our plans all over the place and Robert was there waiting on time. Given his packed schedule, the driver did have to leave without us but Robert made sure to get me in contact with another service and they sent a bus over right away.   All in all, it was an incredible experience!

reviews.author: Snl H.
reviews.description: For $700+ for four hours we would have expected a better looking bus. Multiple dents around outside of bus. The AC barely working. Missing panels inside of bus missing or duct tape together.  Another party bus parked next to the one we had and it was so obvious how terrible looking our bus looked.   Can't believe owners would let this bus represent their company. Hope they use our $700 toward getting it fixed.   Driver was pleasant.

reviews.author: Orlando L.
reviews.description: Had a really great time, would definitely recommend. They did a great job with the event and everything went very smoothly and the price was way better than most other services.

reviews.author: Emersson N.
reviews.description: We took their 16 passenger bus to a soccer game from Austin to San Antonio. Everything was 5 stars, starting with the price and their awesome customer service. They also provided ice, cups and a cooler for us so we didn't have to worry about taking our own. I would definitely recommend them, and will do business with them again. Thank you Robert for the awesome service and thank you Walker (our driver) for keeping up with my crazy friends and brining us home safe.

reviews.author: Charli R.
reviews.description: I'm incredibly frustrated with this business.  We had spoken a couple times in the months before I decided to book and I initially felt great about potentially booking with these friendly people.  When it came time to book I called them and was told, once again, that our requested date was open and we talked out an agreement.  The owner tells me we're good to go, and that all he needed me to do now was to send him my information so that he could get a contract sent that same day.  I'd explained to him that I was booking this bus ride to and from a party boat, and that I would be booking with them that day as well.   SO, I get off the phone and send my info.  I call my party boat folks to let them know I've just confirmed my bus, and I'm ready for a boat.  I book with them based on my discussion with these guys and put down $400 to hold our reservation.  It's been two weeks since I last spoke with this company and they have ignored my calls, texts, voicemails trying to figure out why the contract hasn't come through.  Our event is next month, and at this point I've been researching new solutions, and unfortunately the new solution means I can't use the same boat company, and therefore I've lost my $400 deposit.  I did not have this money to lose, but after being ghosted by this company I guess I have to take the loss and move on.  They seem like nice people, and it takes A LOT to get on here and write a negative review, but this has caused me a lot of stress and I want to prevent this from happening to anyone else.  I hope at some point I find out a reasonable explanation and can revise this review, but not counting on it.  We'll see I guess.

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: Fist off I'm hyper paranoid about drinking and driving so I usually use Uber, Lyft etc to get around town when I wanna go out and when I'm probably going to have a few drinks! But how is that supposed to work when you have a huge group? I called austin nites party rentals for a few reasons 1. I love puns and 2. I'm am austinite and 3. My group was over ten people and we wanted to go out and have nothing to worry about. Great party bus, great personable driver, great experience definitely reccomend these guys!! DONT DRINK AND DRIVE!! Call someone you can trust call Austin Nites!!

reviews.author: Horacio R.
reviews.description: BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!  Robert did a solid job taking me and a bunch of my friends to Lake Travis and back on July 4th. His price was WAY lower than other companies I called, being the ONLY one that actually sticked to his regular prices during this busy day. He arrived early and was 100% responsive to my emails and phone calls. He arrive early to pick us up and was extremely friendly and professional. He helped us carry our coolers and accommodate everything on the bus.  The bus itself is amazing. Seats are stacked in two rows facing each other, which is great for dancing and socializing, since you are actually facing half of the crowd. The sound system is also very good. I almost feel that the bus trip was even more fun that the boat.   In summary, Austin Nites Ent. is the best on price/quality, Robert and his wife are responsive, professional and friendly, and the whole experience I had with them is positive. Would highly recommend anyone to use it, and will definitely consider using them again if I ever need to.  Thank you guys!!!!!

reviews.author: Lisa K.
reviews.description: What a great experience!  Driver was super awesome, the speakers were great and the bus was clean!!!!  We will definitely use them again!

reviews.author: Jerrod G.
reviews.description: They call you and say the bus is available and ask for a deposit over the phone.  But when we asked for a contract they go dark and won't respond. Their reviews are all their friends so not sure if this is a legitimate small business or not. There is another review on Facebook similar to our situation and she confirmed to us they went dark on her too.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: Great experience with Austin Nites! Robert and Melissa were super helpful, accommodating, on-time (actually, early) and friendly! Would definitely use again.

reviews.author: A H.
reviews.description: I have used Austin Nites for the last 5 years and Robert the owner does not disappoint. They are punctual, courteous and very reasonably priced. We have had many fun events on the Big Blue Bus (UT games, holiday and birthday parties) and Robert always comes away with new clients. I highly recommend Austin Nites for any event that requires transporting a group. The bus ride will be the best part of your event!

reviews.author: David A.
reviews.description: I was down in austin with 19 other guys and we needed transportation for the entire night.  Robert was a great communicator before we got to austin and before he picked us up.  He was 15 minutes early, and had the bus stocked with ice, etc.  The bus was really nice, and perfect for a night out on the town.  Would definitely use this service again!

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: For my daughters birthday/last school dance we booked service with Austin Nites Party Bus.  From booking the ride up until the end of the night everything went as planned.  Our driver, Jared, was professional and so great to the girls and I during the time he drove us around.  The owners, Robert and Melissa, promptly returned my calls/texts with any questions I had before the night of the booking. The fee for the evening was wonderfully priced compared to other companies I had called around and gotten quotes from.  I highly recommend Austin Nites Party Bus based on my experience with them.

reviews.author: Sybil E.
reviews.description: We rented a party bus from Robert for my brother's 30th birthday. They were one of the only companies I found that didn't increase their rates because of prom season. I called about 10 other companies looking for fun and safe travels with almost all of them being ridiculously overpriced to take advantage of the prom goers. Robert was very accommodating, professional, and had awesome rates. He called two days before the scheduled time of arrival to check in and verify everything was still good to go. He asked if there were any changes in the amount of people and offered a bigger bus just in case. Our drivers, Patrick and Joe were awesome! Patrick called me early the day of to verify everything and let me know he'd be there at 8 and then called again when they were almost to our pickup location. They arrived right on time with an awesome bus just for us. He had coolers with ice, a flat screen tv, music system, AC and even a bathroom in the back. What more could you ask for? Part of the evening was spent at Graham's Central Station in Pville. We didn't realize prior that Graham's doesn't serve food anymore and had to order pizza to the bus. Patrick gladly retrieved our pizza and brought it to us when it arrived. We all had a blast, felt safe and were taken care of. Highly recommend Austin NItes and shout out to Patty PartyWagon, if you had a Yelp page, I'd write a review for you too.

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: WARNING: We had a tight deadline to get to Lake Travis and the bus driver was 30 minutes late.  We had to take another bus or risk missing our charter.  He verbally offered to refund my money for his tardiness and then kept my funds and would not return them.  Now I am fighting to get those funds back.  LOOK ELSEWHERE.

reviews.author: Shani S.
reviews.description: What a wonderful time!  As a bachelorette "day party," we gathered together and hopped in the super roomy and comfortable All About Central Texas SUV and headed out on our journey.   Kim is extremely knowledgeable about each winery; the history, the best wines to try, the "wine club" or other bonus things each winery has.   We stopped in on 3 different wineries and Kim had made superb choices in each spot; from the wines to the view to the suggestions on what to try and how to make the most of our samples so everyone could try as many as possible (thanks for that tip, Kim!).   Be it an afternoon with a group of friends, or a romantic day for two, All About Central Texas is an outstanding choice.  Thanks for everything, Kim!

reviews.author: Donna D.
reviews.description: All about Central Texas was really great- Kim was so knowledgeable about the area and had great info on wine and Texas! I did the Fredericksburg tour and based on my wine preferences she had some great suggestions on which ones to stop in, there are so many! I even joined a wine club, the tastings were informative and she is just a lot of fun and I didn't have to worry about driving or directions and could enjoy the pours and some snacks.  I highly recommend All abt Central Texas tours, they are personable, you can really get to meet the others in these small groups- Thanks so much!

reviews.author: Sarita S.
reviews.description: This was a surprise bday gift and it didn't disappoint! Mike was awesome and friendly...took us to some really great spots and on gave us the grand tour through texas hill country! definitely the best way to go if you want to experience the best of the best! well done!!

reviews.author: Ana R.
reviews.description: Definitely recommend! From our initial inquiry to the tour itself they were so accommodating and flexible! I filled out an inquiry form and then was contacted right away. We booked a private tour for a couples trip. Alee was great in providing suggestions and making sure to fit what we wanted as part of the tour. We got to tour Hawk's Shadow, then had a tasting at Duchman and ended our tour with some delicious BBQ from Salt Lick, next to Salt Lick Cellars. Tom, our driver was so nice and flexible with our schedule. He reminded us of how much time we had but did not feel rushed at all. We'll definitely be booking Slowpokes for any future trips!

reviews.author: Alan A.
reviews.description: Amazing tour, Michael was a great host. He was so attentive and helped in every way. The tour was flexible and very fun. The children, 4 and 9, were entertained also. Michael asked many questions as to ensure the experience was what we wanted. Great time thank you so much.  Alan A US Army Ret.

reviews.author: Ana K.
reviews.description: Amazing wine tour. Our group was small but it was perfect. Linda really took care of us and was so much fun. You really need to check it out if you are looking at wine tours.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: This was soooo much fun! We did this for a bachelorette party and we had a blast! Lindsey was our Tour Guide/Bus Driver/Photographer/DJ/New Bestie! She was AMAZING!!!! I would highly recommend this Tour! We did Deep Eddie, Last Stand Brewing Company and Treaty Oak!

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: Linda was fantastic and this wine tour was great! I was with a bunch of rather rowdy girl friends and she was endlessly patient and took good care of us. We had a great time and I recommend this company!

reviews.author: Deryck Z.
reviews.description: Linda is the best!!!! We did a tour for a bachelorette party and it was prefect. The personal touch Linda added made it so wonderful. She provide a very nice lunch and snack trays. Everything about the tour went so smoothly and was planned our perfectly. We even were picked up at our rental house so no one had to drive after drinking. All the girls on the tour said they would defiantly do another tour with Slowpokes Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Thu F.
reviews.description: We have an annual girls trip and decided on a tour with Slowpokes Wine Tours.  There was a total of 8 girls on the tour with a couple that was paired with us and we were the perfect group.  Linda was the best tour guide anyone can ask for.  Our group had a blast and the lunch was an added bonus on the tour!  She kept us informed along the way and gave us the best details of each winery/distillery that we visited.  Linda was very personable and every location we visited had its own special charm!  Thanks for an amazing tour Slowpokes Wine Tours.

reviews.author: Kathy F.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a wonderful day set up by Linda at Slowpokes.  After talking with her she designed a day that was diverse and showed us a number of new things in the Dripping Springs area.  Our day included several of the high country wineries, one brewery and a visit to the quaint town of Wimberly. We highly recommend this group over  other Austin wine tour groups as they create a very personalized day and made sure everyone enjoyed the stops.   Our day started with lunch at Homespuns in Dripping Springs - excellent start to a beautiful day!  The Bloody Marys are highly recommended.

reviews.author: Brit F.
reviews.description: We recently completed a bachelorette party tour with Lindsey as our tour guide and it was the BEST! Lindsey chose our wineries very wisely; we started with lunch at Crowson (whose owner will drop incredible knowledge on you), enjoyed a rainstorm and a glass of red at the beautiful Ron Yates, and ended with cheese and BOOOOM wine at Hye Meadow Winery. It was lovely day of booze, conversation, and sisterhood. And, yes, we loved Lindsey so much she became a part of our wolfpack. Lindsey was fun, energetic, and knowledgeable about the area. I would definitely do this tour again!

reviews.author: April D.
reviews.description: I decided to surprise my mom with a wine tasting tour for her 60th birthday. Linda went above and beyond to make this tour special. She made a wine bottle with me and my moms photo on it with a sweet birthday message and quote.  She took so many photos of us, and really made us feel special. We were able to choose our wineries and she even picked us up and dropped us off at our BNB. She had the most amazing tapas tray, with cheese, mixed nuts, her special dip, crackers, breads and meats. She had this prepared and sat out for us at Wimberly winery,  halfway through the tour. At the end of this stop, she even had cupcakes for my moms birthday. I had actually called around different wine tours in the area and Slow Poke Wine tours offered the best value and I can tell you now, the best service. We wouldn't hesitate to do it again. This trip with my mom was priceless and so special. I thank you Linda for making an amazing memory for my mom and I.

reviews.author: Amanda W.
reviews.description: We used Slowpokes tour for my bachelorette party, Linda was great, she picked us up at the door of our rental house and had a perfect day planned for us. We went to a beautiful winery to begin and enjoyed a lunch spread while there; then we went to a distillery with AMAZING frozen mint juleps, outdoor games and great scenic views; finally we ended at the olive oil and balsamic producer for more snacks and great wine. Linda was very attentive to us and did a great job of keeping us on schedule without rushing us, she picked us up around 10:30AM and we returned around 4:30PM. Hope to enjoy this tour again in the future, a very diverse experience that I think even the guys would enjoy!

reviews.author: Mandy L.
reviews.description: I recently went on a bachelorette party with 9 girls with Slowpokes Wine Tours. It was absolutely perfect. Linda was so sweet and incredibly helpful. We didn't have to worry about anything! As soon as Linda picked us up she took care of everything. We just walked in and started having fun. She went above and beyond to make our day perfect.

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: Wow!  What a fantastic time!  Linda was on time, knowledgeable, NICE, funny, and showered us with attention.  She had everything taken care of - all we had to do is get off the van, taste wines and get back on again for the next stop. What service!  I highly, highly recommend Slowpokes and will definitely be seeing Linda again!

reviews.author: Julie G.
reviews.description: I could have sworn I wrote a review on here prior, but I JUST WENT ON MY SECOND slowpoke wine tour and it was just as wonderful as the first.  While a small group, Linda and Dave do an outstanding job of making everyone feel comfortable, no matter what the group size.  This time we went to 3 different venues and what a great experience.  They don't miss any detail.  They make the day enjoyable and relaxing.  Looking for the best wine tour in the Hill Country?  Look no further.  Slowpokes is the tour to book!

reviews.author: Trey C.
reviews.description: I used Slowpokes Winery Tours to go on a Hill Country wine tour on the day I got engaged, and I could not have asked for a better experience.  My now fiancée and I rode in the Model T Ford, which was all-original except for the brakes. I contacted Linda with any questions, concerns, and booking, and Linda picked up my fiancée in a Mercedes van.  We went to a great breakfast, and then David drove us around in the Model T Ford. The route was scenic, breathe taking, and beautiful.  The wineries we stopped at were great, and, the customer service from Linda and David was unbeatable.  They have a unique business that is more than just a van or limo driving you around to distilleries, breweries, or wineries (although they also have a Mercedes van option).  I am now going on another tour with them for a bachelor party, and they could not have provided more prompt replies to my requests for information related to travel, pick up at different locations, types of tours they offer, and pricing.  What a great business run by some truly nice and professional people who offer very reasonable pricing.  I plan to use their services again in the future.

reviews.author: Debbi R.
reviews.description: A Full and Wonderful Day   Our tour with Dale was fabulous. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it didn't take long to realize that not only is Dale a great tour guide, he's also a very personable and knowledgable man who makes you feel like an old friend.   The points of interest were superb and the last stop we made provided one of the best meals I've had in my life and most likely the best ribeye ever.   The day lasted longer than expected, but it was a wonderful day and ended up being just perfect. We are planning to use his rental venue for a retreat in the coming months and looking forward to it. I highly recommend his services.

reviews.author: Jaylan B.
reviews.description: First I would like to start with the facts.  1. We booked this tour months ago but unfortunately had to reschedule to a later date. (due to Covid19) This was not an issue for anyone attending the tour and the company got all $2800 paid for in full. 2. Yes $2800. We had 28 people in our group, It required two buses that were at their max capacity.  3. I would give a HUGE ZERO if I could.   The buses arrived at the pick up location 25 minutes early and expected us (all 28) to load up. Not all 28 people were even there yet. The male driver already seemed annoyed at this point.  We ended up pulling out at the agreed on time. When trying to leave the 2nd winery we couldn't. The drivers HAD LEFT and weren't there to pick us up. We waited outside in the sun outside for 30 minutes before they even got back.  But that unfortunately is not why I am writing this review   As we were loading the bus to go home the male driver said that would be charging us for a cleaning fee ($300) because someone spilt something on the floorboard. Pretty steep for a small spill that could be wiped up with a Clorox wipe but she agreed to pay it she sat down. Comments started to be exchanged about the steep fee and how the day had been complete chaos up until this point. The man began to get pretty heated and slammed the door. When he opened the door to his seat he said "who the f**k spilt something in my seat." Nobody had spilled something on his seat. Upon looking at the "spill" it appeared to be sweat from Him. He continued to cuss and yell and eventually told us to "get off his bus." We all piled off and the other bus also unloaded.  Now it is important to note the other driver said we didn't do anything wrong and that she didn't agree with how he was handling things. He told her he was in charge and that he would make the call. She became quiet after that. They ultimately left us there to find our own rides.  The male driver was rude and didn't speak unless spoken to the entire day. A beautiful day with amazing company was RUINED by this company and I will not recommend them to anyone!

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: I booked a birthday trip for 6 people, hoping to add 2 more. Dale told me I could book the trip for 6 and then add the 2. When I called to add the 2 he told me he would have to see if that was even possible. I didn't understand why after he assured me it would be fine and a sprinter van hold more than that. He had given the sprinter van to a larger crowd and downgraded us to an SUV without asking me (same price). I asked him when I would hear back and he said whenever he located another vehicle. I made some calls and found a better business who really wanted to host me and our guests. I called again to cancel with Dale and was told I am not the type of customer he would want. I guess a customer who wants to pay more money to add more people isn't good... very strange. Talking to a woman like that is not ok. I hope that he was having a bad few days and that he doesn't always behave like this, but I was really shocked how rude and unprofessional he was. Pros: I got my money back.

reviews.author: Blair B.
reviews.description: The owner/driver we had was terribly rude and very unprofessional. He only spoke when spoken to and when he did talk he seemed annoyed.  Do not waste your money on this company! I've had Uber drivers converse more than this "tour guide."  Worst experience ever by far!

reviews.author: Marcia H.
reviews.description: We were celebrating our wedding anniversary. The tour was nice. The driver was great! We visited some interesting wineries. Seeing the Texas wine country off the beaten path was well worth it. We would use this company again.

reviews.author: Doug E.
reviews.description: We had a great time.  Well worth the money our driver Laura was great.  She was helpful and was happy to be there.  When I do this again I won't change anything.  I would use the same driver and tour service.

reviews.author: Amanda G J.
reviews.description: One of the WORST experiences I have ever had with a "wine tour" company. I have been on many wine tours in my days, across different parts of Texas, and their unprofessionalism and lack of customer service and just blatant disrespect was appalling.   This "wine tour" had a total of two buses and a party consisting of 28 people. A group of people that I have known for years that have the utmost of respect and common courtesy for any company that they hire or work with.   From the start of our experience, both drivers were incredibly rude and unfriendly. The bus lacked any amenities one would think this "Premier Hill Country Wine Tasting Experience" would consist of.  The first winery.  * We arrived at the first winery at 10:48am to learn that the winery doesn't even open until 11:00am and that they WEREN'T expecting us at all... * Not the wineries fault. They were fantastic.  The second winery.  * Again, wasn't expecting us, causing us to have to sit at a tent down a road from the winery. Again, not the wineries fault, they handled it incredibly.  * When trying to leave the second winery, we couldn't. The drivers HAD LEFT and weren't there to pick us up. We waited outside in the sun outside for 30 minutes before they even got back.  The third winery.  * As we were loading the bus to go home, the male driver said that they would be charging us for a cleaning fee ($300) because someone spilled something on the floorboard. Pretty steep for a small spill that could be wiped up with a Clorox wipe, but she agreed to pay it. (*To clarify, open containers were allowed as stated on their website: "Consumption of alcohol on the bus is allowed unless there are minors present.") Minor spills like this are inevitable when providing a service as they do. Comments started to be exchanged about the steep fee and how the day had been complete chaos up until this point. The man began to get pretty heated and slammed the door. When he opened the door to his seat he said "who the f**k spilt something in my seat." Nobody had spilled something on his seat. Upon looking at the "spill" it appeared to be sweat from him. He continued to cuss and yell and eventually told us to "get off his bus." We all piled off, and the other bus also unloaded.  I know these times are hard, especially for small and locally owned businesses, and by no means and am I trying to make it harder for them; in fact, I am going above and beyond to support them. After yesterday, I do think that they need to take a step back and re-evaluate their actions and really think long and hard about what they do and why they do it. In the end, when providing a service, the client always comes first.
