reviews.author: Susan G.
reviews.description: Rick was AMAZING! He is the guide with the mostest - a gentleman with a servant's heart, excellent taste in wineries, and a plethora of knowledge about this  beautiful TX region. He is truly one-of-a-kind and I'm so glad we took this tour with him. Thanks, Rick - see you again soon!

reviews.author: Tiffany H.
reviews.description: This could not have been a better day! We highly recommend touring with Heart of Texas Wine Tours. We were so lucky to have found Dale Fortenberry. He is so knowledgeable about the area, the history and the vineyards. Dale went out of this way to accommodate the entire group of women with different tastes in wine. We all know that is not an easy feat, but he did it! Our next trip to the hill country will find us taking another exciting tour with Dale.  -Tiffany Raye

reviews.author: Christi C.
reviews.description: Absolutely best experience from beginning to end!   From ease of scheduling, picking us up on door step, and bringing us back, worry free.    Our driver Rick was great!  Shared info and answered all of our questions about the area.   He escorted us in to reserved tables at each location, pampered us all day!    Already planning our next trip with www.HeartOfTexasWineTours.com!  Thank you, Christi

reviews.author: Matthew V.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I had a fantastic time on this tour. To be honest, the cost seemed a bit high at first but having never been on a wine tour before and I really had no idea. Afterward I realize it was worth every bit of it. Dale picked us up at our BnB along with everyone else on the tour that day and we were off to the first tasting.  He seem to know everyone along the tour and at each place they were very welcoming and grateful to have our group. It really was a fun time and we had the chance to try many different wines that we would not have normally picked.  Lucky for us it was a beautiful day and everything was just perfect. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone interested in checking out some Texas wines, for a nice weekend getaway, or just to try something different.  It definitely helped that we had a good group of people who were also on the tour that day as well. It was a blast...I just wish we had taken more pictures.

reviews.author: Amy W.
reviews.description: Heads up - I'm only giving this one star so I can write a review. It would get a huge ZERO if I could rate it that way. First off, Dale is a pretentious, "underpaid monkey" as he likes to be called. He is rude, unprofessional, and has the audacity to 'hate mail' potential clients and I know I'm not the first one because I've seen the reviews! I don't have much else to say but be careful and do your research before spending any money on this place! The owner seems to not have a care in the world if it's not benefitting him. Also, be ready for rude phone calls and emails from Dale if he doesn't get his way. He was hard to get ahold of from the jump, not to mention I live out of town and couldn't wait for days in between responses. After not being able to make it to my appointment because he had failed to get back to me promptly, I proceeded on with my day. The next morning I wake up to the most rude, despicable email I've ever received. Just be careful and read reviews because from what I've read, if you want a beautiful wedding with NICE, FRIENDLY people, this isn't the place. I'll attach one of many emails. STAY AWAY FROM THE HEART OF TEXAS RANCH ALL TOGETHER!!!

reviews.author: Melody G.
reviews.description: Amazing time with a group of 7 of us girls. Our guide was Christy and she was outgoing and made us all feel like nothing was a bother for her. Picked us up at our hotel in Fredericksburg, went to pick up lunch, and then on to first of 4 wineries. She took care of everything. Even loaded up our bottles/goodies in the back of the bus and kept the AC on to keep it all cool.  Christy went above and beyond to keep everything organized, she set up our lunch, picked up our trash, offered to take us anywhere we wanted to go, and she kept us on time to all of our tastings. We bought a bottle of wine at the 3rd winery and drank in the bus on the way to the 4th. Lunch was a boxed lunch bought at local deli (very good). Everything was included. Everything was professional. The bus was large and comfy. Highly recommend this tour company!

reviews.author: Valarie M.
reviews.description: Dale was great getting everything organized and keeping us on track - and then also helping us change the schedule when we needed to.  very accommodating.  thanks Dale! you were a great host!

reviews.author: Erin K.
reviews.description: We had a great time on this wine tour celebrating my sister's bachelorette party. Dale was very prompt and polite returning my phone calls. He was also very accommodating as the number of girls going on the tour changed at the last minute. We went to Fat Ass, Six Shooter and Fiesta Vineyards which were a blast and everyone enjoyed the tastings. Our driver Rick was funny and a true gentleman. It was raining that day and he had an umbrella to escort everyone in and out of the tasting rooms so no one got soaked. One of the girls left their phone on the tour bus and Rick came back later that evening to return the phone even after we offered to meet him half way. We had a great time and would recommend this tour to anyone!

reviews.author: Tory H.
reviews.description: What a fun and relaxing time! The tour bus was very spacious and clean and the driver was very accommodating. The tour was carefully selected for us with every winery being better than the last! I cant wait to take another tour.

reviews.author: Keith R.
reviews.description: We paid nearly four hundred dollars and it was a joke. What was supposed to be a winery tour was a tour of places that sold wine. We went to a store in downtown marble falls, an art studio, a grocery store and at the very end an actual winery. This constituted our day.   This is NOT a day of going to wineries in the hill country. Everyone was disappointed on Valentine's day.   The guy who led the tour was nice but they clearly got kickbacks where we went.   When we went to lunch no one got their order and right when we were leaving this sandwich shop the tour guide asked, "everyone went to the tasting room, right?" We're talking about a sandwich place being a stop on the wine tour people.   Horribly disappointed. Considering tastings were at most $10 for each of the four "wineries" we went to, it was a rip off in value.  The company clearly avoided going to respectable wineries and instead went to dead end places where they could maximize their profit margin.   Avoid at all costs!!

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: We had a great time on this wine tour. I booked it only two days in advance and they took great care of us. I told Dale our tastes in wine and he sent us to three great wineries. We had the bus all to ourselves too! I would definitely use them again and recommend this company for all your wine touring needs!

reviews.author: Monica P.
reviews.description: Dale is great!! He helped us find some Texas wines that we actually like! We went to a few places I never would have thought to stop by and helped us pick out some good wines to try. He kept the ride fun even though we were with 2 other groups of people we didn't know. The van was comfy and well air conditioned and stocked with bottled water. Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Dawn N.
reviews.description: Even a rainy day couldn't dampen the amazing experience the Heart of Texas Wine Tours provided.  We visited four wineries and were treated like VIPs due to Dale's wonderful rapport with vineyard owners and staff.  Dale's knowledge of wine and  the specialities and uniqueness of each winery made the tour interesting and fun.  By the end of the day, I had not only made new memories, but new friends too!

name: Yellow Rose of Texas Wine Tours

reviews.author: Patti A.
reviews.description: Everything was great!  John, the owner was super cool.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: This business is run by a single creep who deceives his clients and thinks he can because it's "his business", even though what was PAID for was denied to us. He is running the business with very unprofessional interactions with his customers and partnering wineries. I would NOT recommend using this company.

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: I booked Yellow Rose 1 month out and had great communication with John, the owner. He ended up being our driver on our own private bus for a 40th birthday trip with 4 crazy girls. He was at our beck and call and did not complain once. We had 3 wine tour stops and then Luckenbach, and it was soooo fun!  All 3 places were each different than the other which gave us a great variety. Thank you John for a wonderful time!

reviews.author: M W.
reviews.description: Our group had a fabulous day with John at Yellow Rose Wine Tours!! It was so relaxing to sit back and enjoy the day with friends, all while knowing every detail had been taken care of.  This coming from a very "type A" personality is a huge 5 star! We did the "red rose" package, touring 3 wineries and had a few hours in Luckenbach.  John was friendly, fun and a great host. All we had to do is drink wine, visit with friends and enjoy the day! If you are looking for a fun experience, try Yellow Rose! We will be back next year to do it all over again!

reviews.author: Sasha F.
reviews.description: Do not use this "tour"!! It is cheaper to pay the tasting fees and hire your own driver. The owner is greedy and a complete A. We originally had 5 ladies who were going on the tour with us and one backed out. We didn't ask for a private tour and John (who I'm guessing is the owner) didn't tell us until we were already at the first location that he would stop the tour until we paid for a fifth person that wasn't there. No wonder he kept pushing cash, it was a complete rip off. It was either go home after that tour paying $125 a person..Or have two more tours while paying for a person who wasn't there. PS it's about $15 for the wine tastings. ($15x3=$45) It was not worth it. On a positive note, Gary at Hanhe Estates winery was amazing. Highly recommend this guy and his wine.

reviews.author: Michaela S.
reviews.description: A couple friends and I decided to go on the White Rose package and had a blast. We visited 2 wineries, a distillery, and a brewery. Our driver, John, was great. He made our experience in the Hill Country one to remember. He was very friendly and kept us on schedule without making us feel rushed. Overall we had a great day and would definitely book again!

reviews.author: Tiffany K.
reviews.description: We were very pleased with John our driver and Cindy's understanding of the wineries.  John helped us learn more about the area and really did a great job accommodating everyone.  Some of us picked up lunch and we ate it at the Fat Ass winery which I would highly recommend. Water was provided and the options at each winery covered all tastes.

reviews.author: Jordan H.
reviews.description: "Tour" is an awfully strong word. We were picked up and then drove for 45 minutes without our driver, John, saying a word about where we were going or how long it would take to get there. He then picked up 3 other people when it was supposed to be a private tour. He took us to the wineries but never said a word about where to go or what to do. He followed us around at the wineries and sat with us. He was 30 minutes late then forgot what the schedule was supposed to be and tried to keep us at the 2nd winery until 30 minutes after we were supposed to be home. He told us we could pay with cash or card, but he only actually took cash or PayPal, which put some people in a real bind. He hounded us about payment the whole time. It was awful and we will never do it again.

reviews.author: Kalena B.
reviews.description: This tour was amazing! I went with a bachelorette party and we had a lot of fun. Our tour guide was Brandon and he made sure that we were great. We got to play our own music on the ride from Austin and he picked amazing Texas barbecue for our lunch. Every winery we went to was delicious. I would highly recommend it to anyone!

reviews.author: Courtney H.
reviews.description: We had a great experience! We booked on short notice, but had a great time, and Brandon was very accommodating of our last minute trip. Come hungry on your tour because the barbecue lunch provided was spectacular! We were appreciative that Brandon was flexible with our tour schedule and ensured that we had a phenomenal time while on our tour! The tour had a nice mix of small, quaint wineries with an individualized experience, as well as more popular spots with an equally enjoyable guest experience.

reviews.author: Candy B.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb are an amazing duo. Very personable and easy to work with. They aim to exceed your wildest wine tour expectations! The transportation (van) was very clean and well-taken care of. We had the van to ourselves on the couple's tour but it can easily fit a big party!  Booking a couple's wine tour on their website was super easy (and I'm sure it would be for big groups too)! The date availability, cost estimate, and customizability is spot-on. The moment you book, they send you a comprehensive list of wineries and distilleries (!!!) with rankings of the view + wine. They also have great options for add-ons, such as a charcuterie board or stopping by for lunch mid-wine tour. Love that.  There's no doubt I would choose and recommend 830 Elevated again for any future wine excursions in Hill Country. Thanks again, Brayden and Deb :)

reviews.author: Emily H.
reviews.description: WOW....Just WOW!!!!  We had so much fun celebrating my sisters bachelorette weekend in Fredericksburg and 830 Elevated Wine Tours exceeded all of our expectations!!!  Deb (co-owner and our tour guide) was absolutely AMAZING and she made sure that we had everything we needed!!!  Seriously can't wait to book again next time we are in Fredericksburg and we have already decided it needs to be a yearly trip for us!   They were so informative and helpful with picking out which vineyards would be best for us and answered all of my questions quickly and with helpful details and suggestions!!

reviews.author: Viviana V.
reviews.description: 840 were so easy to work with from website to actual tour. We had the most courteous tour guide Brandon! He was a gem and treated us well! Will book with them again!

reviews.author: Nicole Y.
reviews.description: We had the absolute BEST time with Brayden on our tour. From start to finish everything was so easy and customizable to what we were looking for while planning our annual girls trip. Prices are incomparable with Five Star treatment on a PRIVATE tour. Right after booking we got an email with a list of the area wineries and restaurants that had notes and ratings so we could choose where we wanted to go. This is a private tour so Brayden picked us up right in front of our Airbnb and we were off. We toured four wineries and he kept us on schedule but never rushing us. After the tours we opted for the night service so he dropped us off on Main Street so we could grab dinner, sing some karaoke and when ready to be picked up to end the evening just had to shoot him a text and he was there. We just cannot say enough good things about this company. Do not second guess - book with Brayden and Deb

reviews.author: Kim M.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb did a FANTASTIC job hosting our small girls group! They offer private tours for the same price most other charge to fill up a limo or bus. They were on time and very accommodating, went as far as going to buy a stool for my friend who has trouble getting up and down the steps to the van. The wineries they took us to were exactly what we asked for. We never felt rushed and they handled everything for us and we never had to lift a finger to do anything. I would 100% recommend them and will definitely be using them again!

reviews.author: Kristin D.
reviews.description: We had a group of 10 girls book a wine tour through 830 Elevated this past weekend, and I could not more highly recommend this company!! They made the trip so easy, worry-free, and fun! Brayden and Deb were super communicative and gave us a wide variety of wineries to choose from. We ended up going to Baron's Creek, Signor, and Augusta Vin. Deb was our tour guide and took care of absolutely everything and was such a joy to be around. If you are headed to Fredericksburg and wanting to visit the wineries, you won't regret choosing to book through 830 Elevated!!

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: I came across 830 when our bed and breakfast cancelled our room and wine tour reservation (due to remodeling) a month before our 10 year anniversary trip to Fredericksburg. I believe they were on the city website as a recommended tour, but also Google directed me to them. Either way, I am so glad it happened this way - our experience with 830 was indeed elevated!!! The customized tour that Deb set up with me over the phone was exactly what my husband and I wanted - a distillery, a brewery, and a winery that made you feel like you were in Napa. Without even knowing us, Deb helped picked the perfect places for us to enjoy. Communication up until the tour and the day of the tour was prompt and courteous, always with our best intentions in mind (example: Deb texted us and offered to pick us up even earlier than planned due to the heat at one of the outdoor locations). The drive in between locations was full of great conversation, and we were thankful they provided cold water for us. The van was immaculate and the drive was very comfortable - I didn't know the luxury that a private vs public tour would offer! Deb was so knowledgeable (she's a local, of course!) and so sweet with helping us newbies figure out what to do. Her service went above and beyond, and she made us feel like celebrities. It was an absolute pleasure to work with them - do yourself the best favor and book with them!!

reviews.author: Kristen W.
reviews.description: We toured Fredericksburg with Brayden and he was very friendly, knowledgeable, and flexible with our requests. We were able to customize our winery stops which was not the experience we had previously with a different wine tour company. We spent the day with our group of four instead of getting shuttled around with strangers to fill seats (which I really prefer)! We requested a charcuterie board in the vehicle and Brayden picked it up while we were at one of our stops. We will definitely be back and use 830 Elevated for all of our future trips!

reviews.author: Pierre P.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb were amazing! We will for sure book with them in the future. They made the whole wine touring and tasting experience so easy. Great conversations and excellent customer service. If you are going to go Wine Tasting in Fredericksburg, BOOK WITH THEM!

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: My friends planned a bachelorette weekend for me that included the wine tour with 830 wine tours. We had such a blast and everything was above and beyond our expectations! Each stop was beautiful and the tastings were great! This was the highlight Of our trip! The owners are super nice and accommodated all of our requests and even had good suggestions for things to do and place to eat! We absolutely love them!! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Jonathan Y.
reviews.description: I like their hustle. Wife and I wanted a private custom tour (because COVID). But the best we could find was a limo driver that would charge us almost what it would for 4 people. Then we found 830 Elevated. They're filling a niche most tour companies aren't by providing an affordable private tour option for couples. They were great. Small, young company. They don't have deep knowledge on wine like veteran companies but they are personable in that they also tour wineries themselves and can share their inputs.

reviews.author: Casey C.
reviews.description: The worst experience. Here's my story-   I booked with this company over a month in advance prior to my trip to Fredericksburg for my fiancé and I's anniversary, as well as his birthday. After booking, the company was very communicative for the first few days. After the first few days, I did not hear a word from them until the week of our trip. I had told them a month in advance which places we wanted to go. The week of, they inform us that Augusta vin is not taking people for reservations. Which was fine, we went ahead with the other vineyard they had suggested. We had booked for a Saturday. That Friday at 3:00AM, they had informed us of a change of driver due to a family emergency which we completely understood, and now that our pickup time had changed to 11:30AM instead of 1:30PM. I wake up to that email Saturday still understanding, and we changed our plans to be at the pickup destination by 11:30AM. We are waiting there over 15 minutes for them to show, and no one does. We call, leave voicemails, and still hear from no one. 30 minutes passed, they send a TEXT MESSAGE informing us they aren't showing up for the entire time and that we are on our own for the entire day. LEAVING OUR PLANS FOR THE ENTIRE DAY RUINED. Incredibly horrid communication from this company. DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!!!! I seriously am understanding that situations happen in life, but they had guaranteed us a driver for the day regardless of what had happened. I was truly heartbroken to have not received a personal phone call from the company, instead they just send us a text that they are not coming. I have NEVER written a review for a company before, but this needed to be shared. We discussed the situation with multiple locals in the town, no one had ever heard of this company. Whatever you do, save your money and time.

reviews.author: Sara B.
reviews.description: 've been to places like this before (but for primarily beer rather than wine), and I love the setup - it's super fun. You get a card that's tied to your credit card to swipe or tap and then you have access to the wine you swiped for. Then you can get as much or as little as you want. It's a great way to try and explore new wines (and mead and some margarita inspired wines). Then you can load up on your favorite (what I did), or continue exploring. Really, two great options. Also, the guy working there was nice and very helpful. I've been telling people about how much I enjoyed coming here and recommending it.  Don't park in the paid parking next to Wanderlust if you can avoid it because it's stupidly expensive. Use that money on a Lyft or more wine.

reviews.author: Yanira D.
reviews.description: Came in to buy a bottle of wine, bartender came from the back and did not greet us and told us "we're closed" although it was 9:25 and they close at 10pm on Sundays   I recommend updating the hours if you're going to close over half an hour earlier than listed

reviews.author: Chastitie A.
reviews.description: Okay, this place is super cool!  If you're into wine, and good vibes without having to feel so fancy... please come here! 56 different wines on tap. Cute inside decor with so much local art, and a bad ass patio in the back with a food truck that serves authentic Italian food! The food truck owner was extremely personable and kind! He even gave us the breakdown of the different methods of how to cook pasta in all regions of Italy.   FYI, even though this is downtown, there is a private parking lot.

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: Came, drank, conquered (ok stretch on that last one)  We came for the Yelp elite event and tasted our heart out! The original location off 35 is so so cute the moment you walk in. I will say the location at first struck me as odd - but the moment you walk through the doors you are transported into this little artsy wine oasis.   The wines on tap are so fun to browse and the wall art is so Austin it makes you think you can buy them (i mean maybe you can?!). The seating is ample indoor AND a outdoor to give you any desired vibe. Will absolutely be back!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Found this place by chance. Stopped since we saw it served wine. We were happy to see that it was a serve your own wine type of place. Wine on tap is such a great idea.   They give you a card that you use to get your wine. You get charged by the ounce. They do have happy hour. They have a good selection of wines. For those that don't like wine, they have a handful options (margarita, old fashioned)   The place is cute and they have a nice outdoor patio. They had a food truck the day we went.   Con:  - the wine comes out pretty fast, so you have to be careful as it can add up quick. If you want to taste first, be quick at closing it.  - there's no way to figure out how many ounces you are serving yourself.

reviews.author: Damaris C.
reviews.description: This is the perfect place to try a new wine experience. When you walk in you're give a wine card which lets you self pour from a variety different types of wines! I recommend going on Wednesday for 1/2 glasses of wine!

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: From the moment we walked in we felt welcome! They were very friendly showing us how the process works. You could tell they were glad we were new.  They truly have great enthusiasm for their jobs and this business.  A new product even arrived and we were informed we came at a terrific time!   It was so easy to tap my Wanderlust card and release the wine. There's a great variety of wines to choose from, including wines from France, Spain, some sangrias and hard lemonade. Warning: make sure all the taps are closed before you insert your card. I didn't see that one was turned a bit and wine started trickling and money ringing up on my card.  Because it's not very bright, I didn't see the wine flowing. Lesson learned!   There's an interesting room off the patio for private events.  I'm jealous I couldn't pop in!   Happy to see the food truck. Mmm: truffle fries and bruschetta!  You MUST come visit this location!

reviews.author: Xiao Z.
reviews.description: Have been here for the elite event and saved this great place to hang out with friends. We went there for some wine and found out that they also have a food truck in the backyard serving cheese board. Perfect! We had a great night talking and enjoyed the drink with snacks!

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: What a cool little concept and space to drink wine in downtown Austin. Came here during happy hour last weekend with some friends and was overall impressed with the wine tasting here. There whole gimmick is you you can try any of the wines on the wall tap and your charged by the ounces you drink. I will warn you use a light touch on the taps as I learned the hard way the first try. Most of the wines were half off during happy hour which makes for a great deal and I also liked that there was a range of wines from across the globe and wasn't specific to one region. They also had patio seating an Italian food truck in case you get hungry. The only downside like most places downtown is the parking but I heard that's less of an issue at their east side location which I'm excited to try next!

reviews.author: Christina V.
reviews.description: I love a serve yourself wine bar! Wanderlust charges by the ounce and although it adds up pretty quickly, if you're able to pace yourself, you can have a whole evening of fun. I got out of there spending well under $50 for two people, so we really didn't go all that crazy.  Try a million different wines and mixed drinks! they give you a card at the entrance and it just rings up your total, then they charge you on the way out. We had an issue with a bunch of cork settling into one of our glasses and they were able to remove that pour from our tab. The only thing is that it's hard to keep track of your favorite pours because there are so many options.  There is also a ton of space to sit. They have inside seating/lounge tables, there is outdoor seating and there's also an additional event space which you can sit in. We sat in the event space with a large group and it was so comfy. I would love to return!

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: I love Wanderlust Wine Company! It's such a fun environment, and they have so many excellent wines to choose from! The downtown location is the perfect spot to hit up if you're transitioning your night from the east side to hanging out downtown. If you haven't been to the new Eastside location, it is seriously one of the coolest buildings in Austin. There is so much local art there!

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: Wanderlust is an ATX gem for sure. They have outstanding service and a great wine selection. I also really like their cocktails on tap, especially the lemonade seltzer that they have. Every time I have come in, Blake has always provided excellent customer service and understanding of the wine offerings. Overall, I will be back many more times to this place for their superb wine and service!  2 pro tips: Come in on Wednesdays for half off and make sure to try heal of the boot food truck.

reviews.author: Maurice H.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and great wine!! My go to on Wednesday's and any other day I want some good wine. The live performances makes my night I swear. If you're in the city and want some good wine, want to vibe with cool ppl and bob your head to some good music just stop by and grab your wanderlust card.

reviews.author: Kerri M.
reviews.description: I love the wine on tap concept and enjoyed choosing between all of the different wines at Wanderlust! When you walk in, they give you a separate card that you swipe before each one of your pours. I liked it because you could pour as much or as little as you wanted and it gave you the opportunity to try different wines without being committed to a full glass. Honestly, it reminded me of those self-serve frozen yogurt places. I also really liked the outdoor area - it was a great place to hang out with friends and we had a great time taking photos at the photo booth.  The only downside was that it was more expensive than I was expecting. They give you the price per ounce on the screen, but once you start pouring, it adds up VERY quickly. I could have spent the same amount of money on a way nicer and fuller glass of wine.  Overall, I enjoyed the concept and fun vibes. Would love to come back during their happy hour or something when things are half-priced!

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: "Froyo for wine"; Fun idea, smooth process, nice spot, bit pricey.   It's a charge by oz place, like Froyo with all of the taps requiring an RFID card that you get by associating with a credit card at the front desk. Place the card on the reader and pour what you want into your glass. They have over 50 different styles, including mead, white, red, dry/sweet, and some wine-based cocktail style drinks.  They typically range from $1-3+ per oz so you'll probably come out with a $5-10 glass (4 oz) which is pretty comparable to most places.  There is both indoor and outdoor seating; interior is mostly couch seating and outdoor is patio/bench with faux grass. You can also bring dogs. The outdoor is a bit noisy, especially since it backs to another bar and is right under 35 so it was nicer indoors than out.  I don't usually drink wine because it gives me headaches and I certainly felt it the next day even after just 2 small glasses; possibly because of tasting so many different kind, so beware! Nice for trying something new but possible to get sick if you're mixing so much.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Stopped into this downtown location after already visiting the location on Shady ln earlier in the week. I definitely enjoyed both locations for different reasons. I appreciate the way the wines are labeled in clear groupings so it's easier to just walk up and find what I'm wanting more quickly. They also have an Italian food truck in the back patio area. The truffle Parmesan fries were great and the pasta dish was a good portion. Lots of cute photo ops and decent areas of seating. I will say this location is much smaller and literally off the busy highway but still the experience they offer is worth checking out.

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: I came here not knowing what to expect. I knew there would be wines on tap, but didn't realize you poured your own. When you come in you get a card with your name on it that unlocks the tap. As you fill your glass it shows you how many ounces and the cost in real time. I loved this idea because I got to try many wines before committing. You're allowed as many glasses as you want at a time so I recommend doing a flight! There's indoor and outdoor seating with a food truck out back. I signed up for their rewards program and will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Courtney S.
reviews.description: What a fun place! It's not every day you come across a place with wines on tap. Wanderlust has so many options of all different kinds of wine. Red blends, dry white blends, bubbly, mead, etc. You name it, they have it!  When you arrive they swipe your card and give you another card, something like a hotel key card. You use this key card and swipe it before each self serve wine glass pour. The screen next to the tap will show you how many ounces you've filled up your glass and how much for the whole glass. The screen also shows how much each ounce of wine costs. Maybe I'm getting old and outdated but this was some cool technology! Probably the coolest, unique payment system I've ever seen!   There is a food truck on site with some seriously good pasta and appetizer types.   I can't speak to the parking situation since I walked from my location but I do believe there was a small parking lot.

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: I came here for the first time and the hospitality of the (im assuming) manager was really worth writing a yelp! The energy and the vibes were immaculate and everyone was very accommodating for my dog!   5 stars :)

reviews.author: Van N.
reviews.description: This place can be dangerous if you are by nature have slow reflexes and/or have a heavy hand. You my friend, are in charge of how much wine you drink. The fun part is you get to see how much you are spend at the same time! The funny part is if you're focusing on your glass pour (just to get it just right) you might look up after a while and notice your tab is $$$ after many many "maybe just a little" drinks. I love everything about this small space as well. It is very cozy and perfect for a girls night or a date night. We will 100% be back.

reviews.author: Nicolle M.
reviews.description: I really enjoy this Winery. They source grapes from California and Texas, but stick to what grapes from those regions do best. My favorite was their Russian River Valley Pinot and they had a special white from the green valley sub appellation I LOVED.   The tasting room is down to earth and simple- and expect a drop in by the owner! Great wines, friendly crew- recommend for the wine lover.

reviews.author: Viviana M.
reviews.description: Family owned and operated the atmosphere was really sweet with pictures of the family hung on the walls. If you're a Cowboys fan reserve the Cowboys table. At my tasting favorite was the 2018 Chardonnay. If you try Bent Oak you will not regret it so check it out! Joanne and Bryan were the best hosts.

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: Wow I was blown away by Bent Oak. It really does not look like much from the outside but my boyfriend and I decided to give it a try based on the reviews and we were not disappointed! We easily made a reservation on the website and came in at 2pm on a Saturday. They took out temperatures at the door and we were seated quickly.   We decided to go for the wine tasting first, 5 samples for $15 plus a stemless logo glass to take home! We really enjoyed trying the wines and enjoyed all of them. Our favorite was the Blanc du Bois because it was light and crisp but had a unique fragrant flavor from the floral notes and the apricot.   My only gripe was the reservation was only 45 minutes. I wish it could've been around an hour, we didn't get a chance to finish our wine or our charcuterie but it's not too big of a deal since we just took it back home. We also got another bottle of the Blanc du Bois to take home and they gave us a cute wine bag for the two bottles.   We will definitely be back again to try the rest of the wines!!

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: What a wonderful discovery on a lazy pre-Xmas Sat afternoon. Who would have thought you could find a boutique winery that rivals any that I've visited in Sonoma.   Do not despair as you pull into the generic industrial park hard off of Anderson Mill Road in the CP. Walk-in past the small lobby area and step into their beautifully decorated tasting room.  Since we were the only patrons we received VIP treatment from start to finish.   We opted for their premium tasting menu and selected all reds. I'm not a TX wine fan but Dylan, our sommelier, expertly guided us through our tasting and as we concluded our wonderful stay my mind was changed.   My favorite was the Alexandar Valley Cab will more than suffice if you enjoy a big traditional Cab with a strong finish.   Their Spanish Mourvedre version is deep and rich and has a surprisingly strong finish,   There are a number of "light" reds as well. We were not fans but appreciated the flavor and balance of these wines.   Bent Oak does offer cheese plates and other small plates to accompany your tasting. Check their social media as they have live music on certain days.   Wonderful wine, an intimate setting, and passionate knowledgeable folks equals a 5 star experience.

reviews.author: Claude W.
reviews.description: This was a real treat.  We looked for winery that was open before 4pm. We were staying in San Antonio and wanted to visit Austin TX. We found this place by searching best wineries near Austin. When we 1st arrived, it looked like a little store front in a strip mall. When we entered it was a whole different story. We were greeted by Debbie and Bryan who both turned out to be extremely gracious hosts.  They have wines grown in TX and CA. The TX grapes are grown in the High Plaines near New Mexico where it is warm during the day and cooler at night. I decided to do a tasting with only the TX wines.   The TX wine menu had 5 wines for the tasting menu. Started with the Chenon Blanc (quite nice with a buttery smoothness), proceeded to the Blanc de Bois, then the Roussanne (my least favorite), then switching to the reds starting with the Sangiovese and finally to the tempranillo.  The Tempranillo was my absolute favorite.    What really made this experience so nice was the wine Ambassador Debbie. She is just the nicest person who took good care of us. She also has a very nice sense of humor. Bryan was also very nice. He helped me pick out a few stainless steel wine stoppers. Bryan gave us great restaurant suggestions for Austin and San Antonio.  Do not be fooled with the entrance on the outside. It is misleading in the size and the value you receive on the inside.

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: The wine selection is truly delightful in an abundance. So happy to have this treasure in our community. Perfect for a low key date night or a nice peaceful book. Will absolutely be coming back.

reviews.author: Pat M.
reviews.description: Very nice atmosphere inside.   Help was very friendly.  Pizza bread was out of this world.  I would recommend

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: My experience with this winery has been amazing to say the least! Took two of my really good friends here today both who require wheelchair accessibility and felt very comfortable in the atmosphere. The reservation made ahead time was set up easily and the communication was quick and efficient through email. They were able to recommend a table that was best suited for us all to feel comfortable. It is very rare to actually be able to talk to the owners/wine makers about their products but they were the ones serving us the tasting! It really was a special experience not only for me but for my friends that have not gone out socially since the pandemic. Thank y'all so much for the inclusive atmosphere and making it such a memorable experience, we had a blast!

reviews.author: Vipul T.
reviews.description: Good luck with the attitude at the front desk and the fact that they won't pick up the phone for a reservation. Waste of our time driving here, if you are passing by I would look at other places for wine tastings.

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem! We were sitting at home on a Friday night, trying to find something to do. After a quick yelp search, we saw there was a winery up the street and open late. We decided to take a trip and check it out.  Driving up, you start to question if you are going the right direction but just keep going.   You walk in to this office center and are welcomed to the most friendly staff and environment.  Rarely do you get to sit down at a winery and speak to the head wine maker.   What really makes this place different is the fact that they have California and Texas wines. I'm no expert, but I've been told Texas grapes just don't compare.    The prices are great, and the options are plenty.  This will definitely be the family visit spot in the future.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: Wine: Only tried one wine, the tempranillo. It was fine, not as bold as they usually are. I smelled some of the whites, and they smelled very sweet so I passed. Didn't even look at pricing because of what the snacks cost.  Snacks: wow, expensive. Tried a bunch of them with a group, overall not worth the price. Particularly the truffles. It was $27 for a teensy box of 9 pieces of terrible chocolate. Waxy texture, did not melt when you eat it, chalky, bad flavor. Dark chocolate is my fave, so that's not the issue. Who knew chocolate could actually be yucky? It came from next door, glad we didn't go there after.   Service: very good, sweet ladies.  Ambience: not good. Outside it just looks like a store front, inside is super dark, no windows, and looks like a Kirkland's from the 90s.... everything is red, has fringe, pretty cheesy. Not eclectic, just ugly and full of stuff.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Living in Austin, this winery is located in our backyard. It's nice to be able to drive just 20 minutes and enjoy a good glass of wine, and meet the people who made it. I now have a place for out of town guests just spending the weekend to take a sip of Texas wine.  They focus on creating quality wines sourced from Texas and California grapes.  They do not blend grapes sourced from the two states together.  When you drink a bottle of Texas sourced wine, it is 100% Texas, and vice versa. Bent Oak has been around for about 3 1/2 years, and from what I have heard they are starting to find their stride.   When you enter the space, you will walk through the front gift shop to the back tasting room and production area.  They have gone to amazing strides to make a warehouse space homey. It feels like a Texas hill country family home.  We were warmly welcomed, and they even let us take our three well behaved dogs into the back area to sit and enjoy a tasting with us.  Everyone here was friendly and knowledgeable.    I was pleasantly surprised by the consistent quality of all their wines available to taste.  You can taste up to five wines from their menu.  The Blanc Du Bois was one of my stand out favorites.  There wasn't anything I didn't like on the menu.  I am not a fan of Chardonnay's but their California sourced Chardonnay was good.  Their reds were a bit young, but the Mourvedre from the Texas High plains was tasty and my favorite of the current options.  Medium bodied but with spicy fruity rich tones.  The Sangiovese was satiny smooth, but just needed some time.  I actually enjoyed their Texas wines more than the California options.    Clearly there is a reason why their wine club membership has a waitlist.  It's just a great group of people to hang out with.  It felt like being with family, and enjoying a great conversation over a nice glass of wine.  They are located next to Delysia chocolates towards the back of a warehouse area.  Wine and chocolate neighbors?  Yep, it's an amazing pairing.

reviews.author: Cindy L.
reviews.description: Stopped in yesterday. Always welcoming and we felt so safe especially with all the precautions they are taking. And if course great wines, can't wait to share the Cuvée with friends!!!

reviews.author: Jasmine M.
reviews.description: Great Winery with awesome wine! John (wine maker) was amazing! Super nice and attentive. We came here celebrating a bachelorette party, we arrived a bit late, but they were so accommodating. Definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Nanette L.
reviews.description: Great wine accompanied with paired bites...comfortable atmosphere  too come on my own and listen to music...would recommend for all ages.

reviews.author: Havalah W.
reviews.description: Whoa! what a cool find! we loved this place. the staff was awesome. the wine maker was around to say hey and make sure we were happy! we did a 5 wine flight and we were pleased. the cab was our favorite for sure. kids got a meat and cheese plate w some crackers. we will be back!

reviews.author: Carrie H.
reviews.description: Very friendly atmosphere and very close to 620 in Anderson Mill! Very nice wines from the Russian River area in California.  Kid friendly and lots of fun knick knacks and snacks to keep them entertained.

reviews.author: Dana O.
reviews.description: We pulled up to this winery and sat there dumbfounded for a few minutes as we had never experienced an "urban" winery!  We finally mustered the courage to go have a look inside this warehouse looking building.  What an incredible surprise!  We were warmly greeted and led into the tasting room where our eyes grew wide with wonder.  Themed tables, lounging areas, decor and a scuttle of people enjoying some of the most spectacular wine ever!    Everyone in there was so nice and the server we had was very knowledgeable.  My daughter promptly made sure everyone knew I was celebrating the 20th anniversary of my 30th birthday!  Our wine expert quickly informed the wine maker "John" and he came over to wish me a happy birthday and give me a taste of a special "not on the menu" wine.  All I can say is every single wine we sampled (8 in total) was superb!  I walked out after buying 4 bottles and was extremely happy!

reviews.author: Anders N.
reviews.description: Cozy winery in an unexpected place. Great service and excellent selection of wines. Highly recommend stopping by here! They even have live music while you enjoy your wine.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: We finally made it to the wine club.  Wines here are delicious.  Never overly sweet (no added sugar), and always served with a smile.  The owners are very kind and welcoming.  We were brought on a tour of the facility on our second visit and given numerous samples of fresh wine.  The atmosphere is pretty amazing as if you couldn't tell by the other reviews

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: This brewery is a 10/10 if Yelp let give this opinion I would. The bartender was absolutely amazing giving me amazing recommendations. The GM proceeded to stay late with us and show us the absolute best of the best mead I have ever had. He was amazing the bartender was amazing and if I ever re-vist Austin this is a must have on the to do list. Do NOT miss out on this amazing experience. Do not go to Austin beer works this place is literally 10x better if not more.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: I really like the beer here. I love the $18 flight and the pint glass you get to take home at the end is the coolest pint glass I've ever owned. Unfortunately, they do not allow dogs inside. As a dog owner who lives in the brewery district, this establishment is simply off my list anytime I go out with my little gal.   I do love this place but it's hard to give a perfect score to a place I can't frequent. Especially when they have ~10 competitors in a 5 minute radius and none of them share the same policy. As a result, I am updating my review from 5 to 4 stars.

reviews.author: Cynthia L.
reviews.description: I sampled a flight of their Belgian style beers and enjoyed them all. The staff was polite, and the food from the Emoji food truck was tasty and reasonably priced.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: Cool Staff, great beer, really good vibes all around.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: This place is on my Covid-19 safe list. They will continue to require masks.

reviews.author: Dan P.
reviews.description: Overall vibe: relaxed, quirky Austin  Service: good beer knowledge. Hillary was very nice at the counter.  Beer: excellent quality. Great Friday from raspberry wheat beer to Belgian style ale  Overall cleanliness: above average  Price: average for good craft beer

reviews.author: Chris T.
reviews.description: This is a nice stop. The entryway can get a slight bottleneck, just be patient. The beer is worth the wait. I got the seasonal raspberry beer that was brewed for owner daughter wedding, oh my gosh! Delicious and refreshing. I ended up buying a 6 pack to take home. I think it is gone now, but so good!

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Large spacious venue with plenty of outdoor seating as well. I love that have arcade games and foosball, fun spot for a group. Come thristy.

reviews.author: Alex C.
reviews.description: I'm a fan of dark Belgian style beer that's not too sweet so Adalbert's gets five stars right away.  I love the Philosophizer and the October Rust.  There seems to be good social distancing. There's hand sanitizer on the counter. Growlers are a possibility as are CDB sodas. The people are friendly and seem to know about the beer. I only discovered this place after the pandemic it started so I've never really spent time inside. But I've been sitting on my own porch enjoying it quite a bit and when things get back to normal I hope to spend a few hours at Adelbert's.

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: This was a great brewery to go to after work for drinks with friends or coworkers. I love the idea that's you are actually in the brewery itself.   The neat thing is that they have artwork that's for sale on the walls. The art adds character and is a large variety of different themes all from local artists.   No good is served inside the brewery but there is a really good food truck on the outside.   The beers are amazing and you can sample before you buy.  Liked this brewery and beers are very creative.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Love coming here and just hanging out. The bartenders are always very sweet and willing to let you try things before you get a whole glass. I always enjoy their IPAs. They have a food truck outside with I think chicken I usually just get the fresh popped popcorn it's delicious and great to snack on while drinking beer. They have a Nintendo Wii with Mario kart and two old-school arcade games they also have a Foos ball table and darts. There's also boardgames that you can check out with giving them your ID, an awesome place to hang out with friends, kids and dogs!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: I had my first Adelbert's beer through HEB, with their Naked Nun witbier. I have been hooked since then and finally made it into their tasting room.   It. Was. Heaven. They have an outdoors area that's shaded for those with doggos or who want to enjoy the heat and eat from their food truck. I had the Triple B, which was surprisingly crisp and floral for a belgian. They had a variety of beers which I wanted to taste, but we arrived late with one hour to spare before closing. That just means I need to pay another visit to truly enjoy the place.  They have a private parking area shared with neighboring businesses and strong wifi. The best part is the indoors games like 4-player Mario Kart (WHAT!), darts, and a bunch of board games. They also give free stickers, plus our lady taptender that day was so kind and welcoming.

reviews.author: Tisha T.
reviews.description: Met up with some work peeps for a happy hour of sorts. I originally didn't plan to attend since it's a brewery and I hate beer with a passion. However I checked out their site, saw they had some wine options and a food truck--so I happily tagged along. The bartender who greeted us gave us the rundown of everything. Served us with a smile and was very informative about the beers, of course. I had a great bottle of pinot grigio while my friends enjoyed the various beers available. I had a great time checking out the art that they have on the walls for sale. We also played a game of jumbo sized connect four and Mario Kart on the big screen. A large collection of board games are also available to borrow while hanging out enjoying your drink in the taproom. Very cool place, warm vibes. Great food truck on site as well.  Definitely will return soon and bring my beer drinking friends.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Really good beer at Adebert's. Lots of cool wood barrels and lots of people around for a fun Friday Night. At certain times you can challenge the bartender to a game of Mario Kart which is truly unique but just add the the overall great experience at Adelbert's

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: This place is great! Get the wristband if you're a first timer- only $15 for six "half pours" which are definitely more like 3/4 pours haha  The mango wit, naked nun, and hibiscus saison are AMAZINGGG.   Cool art, live music, food truck (although they left early, which sucked).  The only real disappointment? The brewery closes at 10- we coulda stayed all night!

reviews.author: Christian C.
reviews.description: Awesome beer, and a very chill location to hang out with friends and family.  Children are allowed as well, which is very convenient for fellow parents!  They've got a bunch of cool artwork from local artists, giant Jenga, a foosball table, and live music to keep you entertained.  They also have great food truck options during Taproom hours.    $14 for 6 half pours and a free pint glass is a pretty amazing deal, especially due to the quality and content of the beer.  If you're into light, crisper beers, try the Naked Nun or the Philosophizer.  If you like the darker stuff, the Black Rhino is your friend.  They also have some great sours!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Three words: Belgium style brews! Oh my goodness, where have you been hiding from me Adelbert's?! This is by far one of my most favorite craft breweries in all of Austin, if not in the United States. For those of you that really know me, you know that I L.O.V.E. Belgian beers...so much so that, yes, I traveled to Belgium JUST for the beers (okay, I ate some mussels and saw some pretty cool stuff too, but...). For those of you not in the know (no insult meant for those who are), Belgian style beers are pretty high in ABV, so amateurs enter gently. Just looking out for my Yeeps! :D  Adelbert's doesn't look like much at all from the outside. Tucked away in a warehouse district, it can a tad difficult to find, particularly at night - just look for the little white lights and the picnic tables outside. Park, walk through the plastic flat "doors" and you will discover a beautiful huge space with stacks and stacks of barrels, merchandise for sale, lots of local art hanging on the walls to purchase adds to the ambiance; plus games to play such as giant Jenga, foosball, and darts and that's one fine outing.   But the beer! Oh my gosh - the beer. Handcrafted at its best. So amazingly fantastic and such a great deal. On your first visit be certain to buy the 6 half pour (really close to full pours - yay) tastings for $13. You get to keep the glass and get $2 off beers when you bring it back on your next visit. Regular prices range from $4-6 a glass, which is phenominal in the first place for such high quality ale.   ALL great, two personal standouts for me were: *Flyin' Monks Quadrupel: 10.9%ABV, aged in rum barrels with hints of spice, deep, dark, and lovely. *Philosophizer Saison: An easy choice. 7.8% ABV, very mild carbonation with a hint of pepper. Fantastic.     To add some icing to this already oh so sweet find, the founder and brewmaster Scott and staff cannot be any more friendly or knowledgeable about the beers and brewery.   Highly highly highly recommend. Simply doesn't get better than this IMHO. Cheers!  TIPS:  *The brewery has a license so you can take a large bottle home for a reasonable price of about $9 to $12, which is average. They also sell retail at area Austin locations (visit their website for exact locations).  *Tours are available (see website for details).   *They typically have a food truck on site on Saturdays.  *Fido friendly pergola area - not allowed inside.

reviews.author: Sam V.
reviews.description: Ya'll are probably already aware of my latest and greatest obsession with collecting pint glasses from assorted breweries. For our first stop in Austin, we stopped by this unassuming warehouse. As we walked in, the live jazz band was jammin' and the beer taps were flowin'.   Michael and his bearded friend were fantastic bartenders. I really appreciated their hospitality. Michael instantly could tell I was new to this particular brewery and proceeded to explain the process to tasting their beer samples. He even noted that I had a minor with me and offered a brewed hibiscus tea for him. They really cater to all ages! We paid $13 for six half poured samples from a souvenir Belgian tasting glass. One yellow wristband later, my siblings and I were playing ping-pong and giant Jenga in the back of the warehouse.  The stringed lights on the ceiling made it feel welcome and homey. They had a wall of local art for sale ranging from $30-$300! I had my eye on a Sinatra painting, and as luck would have it, it was indeed the $300 piece lol. I stared at it longingly for most of the night, but couldn't bring myself to throw down on it. My favorite craft brews of the night were the Naked Nun and the Philosophizer. Brilliant names and great hoppy flavors.  Once it got too muggy in the taproom, we ventured out to get some grub. The food truck of the night was Emoji Grilled Cheese. (See their yelp site for my review) It was mouthwatering and delicious. We visited a couple other breweries throughout our trip, but Adelbert's was my all-time favorite.   Thanks for a great time!   -xoxoxo

reviews.author: Paul K.
reviews.description: Solid, well made beers ranging from wits to saisons to sours to pale ales and IPAs.  Nice range of beers, all done with style.

reviews.author: Geoffrey C.
reviews.description: From the outside, this place looks quite small but it's a lot larger than I thought. Seating inside and outside. Also, what kind of brewery would this be if they did not have board games to play as you drink?  The Mango Wit is good and refreshing. Mango flavor is not as present as I like, but the hint of it is good enough.

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: Good wines, excellent Argentinian cuisine.  Outside with live music, perfect Saturday afternoon.

reviews.author: Cesar V.
reviews.description: Please answer the phone. We've been trying to make a reservation since October, 2021, but haven't been able to speak with any of your employees. We also tried on line, but got no response.

reviews.author: JP C.
reviews.description: Good views... good wine... ok empanadas... ok customer service... and great cheesecakes.... was looking forward to having food but they were not cooking during our visit.   They had a two ban band which was perfect for the setting! Great outside seating!!! We got their at 3 and stayed for a few hours because of how it was nested in the hills with plenty of trees and shade.   Great place for a date, family, kids, dogs or a glass of wine for the day. We will be coming back and hopefully have traditional Argentine bbq next time.   Suggestion: serve espresso and/or coffee

reviews.author: Jane G.
reviews.description: Favorite place ever! Amazing food - come for the food and the wine is a bonus.  Argentinean beef grilled on open coal grill.  The atmosphere and hospitality are top notch.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: This is a gorgeous spot with fantastic Argentinian wine!  Met an old friend here tonight who I haven't seen much since she moved to Austin while I was here for a work trip and we had a fantastic time!  The wines are tasty and the winery has some great indoor and outdoor seating with fantastic views, way up on a hill. Definitely go check them out!  I've also reached out to the management to see if I can get wines shipped back to my home state of Georgia!!!

reviews.author: Camila G.
reviews.description: As soon as we arrived we were kindly greeted by the owner who suggested a few of our favorite types of wine. We hung out outside and enjoyed the beautiful weather while watching the lovely scenery. We ordered the center cut ribeye and it did not disappoint. Also, best truffle mashed potatoes I have ever had! Adrian, the Chef, was beyond magnificent- he took the time to listen and we really enjoyed his cooking and conversation

reviews.author: Arianexys A.
reviews.description: Wonderful views! The wine tasting experience is great. The chef is very enthusiastic and the food was delicious! Great spot for couples, and also pet friendly (saw some families with their dogs). Would come back!   Of note, during the afternoon there might be some mosquitoes in the outdoor area, but they were kind enough to provide us with insect repellent.

reviews.author: Michelle N.
reviews.description: When we first arrived here, it was a bit confusing on where we were allowed to park as there were to signs indicating a designated place for cars - we ended up just driving all the way up the hill and parking alongside the roundabout next to the entrance of the winery cabin.   We had a reservation for right when they opened, and luckily so - it became extremely busy later on in our visit, so be mindful if you're planning on coming here that it's popular!   Staff is extremely friendly and attentive - they accommodated our group and let us even switch some tables around since we were the first there.   El Gaucho has a smaller wine list than other wineries I've been to, but they also had a food menu that was unique to others.   Provoleta ($12.50, +prosciutto $2.00): Comes out on a hot skillet plate with some slices of bread on the side. Really flavorful in provolone, obviously, but the chimichurri gives a nice addition to the dish. Felt like the addition of prosciutto wasn't worth, however.   Empanadas (2pc - $12.50): They have an option between beef empanadas, or a black bean and plantain empanada. I tried both and they were delicious in their own ways. Some people may stray away from the non-meat option, but I quite liked it! I believe they served this with the same chimichurri that was on top of the Provoleta.   Light Flight  1. Chardonnay: Their description is 100% correct, if you don't prefer Chardonnay, you might change your mind after trying this! Super light and refreshing, really easy finish. 2. Chardonnay Reserve: Huge jump from the Chardonnay - seemed to taste more full.  3. Malbec Rose: Really great end to tie the first two together, the sweetness is subtle but still noticeable.  They have a lovely outdoor courtyard/backyard patio where more seating is available, but unfortunately the day we went, it had just rained meaning most chairs were wet. I would highly recommend trying to come on a sunny day as I think it'd be beautiful!

reviews.author: Ariel D.
reviews.description: Amazing location with warm hospitality and fantastic food.   If you want a taste of true Argentine flavor, this is the place to go.  Gracias, Chef Adrián!

reviews.author: Jeanne L.
reviews.description: This spot is one of my favorite places in the surrounding Austin area. It has unbelievably beautiful views, the owners and staff are so nice, and the wine is delicious. Sometimes they also have amazing live music. I've taken many friends here and my family as well and they all love it too.

reviews.author: Arlene G.
reviews.description: I never leave reviews. My husband and I came here for our honeymoon from Dallas, Tx. We were very excited, since we read great reviews. Honestly, I wouldn't spend the money on it, nor ever come here  again. There was only one lady working and no one helped us out at all.  They were originally going to set up something "special" since it was our honeymoon and it was not special at all. They were charging us $175 for literally a bottle of cheap champagne and a bowl of crackers and cheese. For what we paid for and what we got I don't recommend it at all.

reviews.author: Cathy L.
reviews.description: Very beautiful winery overlooking a gorgeous scenery of lush green trees and magnificent hills. Perfect place to come and relax with friends or family. The back area has an array of different seatings from couches to tables. There was also live music with, I think, the owner singing (who has a great soothing voice btw bravo).   There wasn't too many people when I went (Saturday Father's Day weekend) which I liked as everything was a lot calmer.

reviews.author: Cole U.
reviews.description: Don't sleep on this place! As we pulled up I had my doubts but was so surprised!!! They have an awesome selection-- got the sav blance and it was so refreshing. The food menu looked good but we didn't try any. The outdoor space is amazing!! So much space and awesome views.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow do I love this place! It's also on the way to pace Bend Park so I love to stop and have a bottle of wine and then go to pace Bend. I went during Covid so it was only bottle service but we absolutely love the bottle we got and the gentleman working with so sweet. Amazing views, relaxing atmosphere, I can't wait till everything is fully open and we can experience their food and wine tastings!

reviews.author: Sarah C.
reviews.description: I was introduced to this winery by an Argentinean friend and I have to say I am pleasantly surprised. This winery is not only very scenic but also has excellent wine. I've been to many Texan wineries that are pretty but have terrible wine so this winery was a surprise to me. I'd love to bring my friends back there!

reviews.author: S P.
reviews.description: Great "winery" with a beautiful setting. Food and service was amazing. Note that the wines aren't local to Texas but were tasty. Kid and dog friendly. Loved the live music.

reviews.author: Ryan C.
reviews.description: This place is magical! Chef is amazing, food is amazing. Real food not that crackers and cheese stuff. Peaceful and great outdoor space. Really recommend!! Great wine selection from Argentina. Winery on a hill with a deck patio that overlooks country side. If you listen carefully you can hear Willy Nelson serenading the mountains.

reviews.author: Melissa A.
reviews.description: This place was amazing! The view was great and the owner (Bennett) was very welcoming! The live music by a beautiful sunset is everything we needed.

reviews.author: Dory W.
reviews.description: We had an outdoor celebration of life during a rainstorm at El Gaucho Winery this past weekend. With out-of-town guests, no rain date, florals, and catering coming hell or high water, we had to roll with it.  I can't say enough good things about the team and how we worked together over a couple of weeks.  Everything from planning to last-minute setup changes (from the outdoor patio to the covered patio) and serving exceeded my expectations. Their willingness to do whatever they could to make our rainy day 25 person event a success and smile while they were doing it was phenomenal and refreshing. Our guests had a good time and loved the wine!

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: I love this place!! Beautiful winery located at the top of a hill in Spicewood, TX. This winery offers Argentinian wine and the owners are just fabulous. One of my favorite places to visit in the hill country.

reviews.author: Liza M.
reviews.description: Amazing wine bar in Steiner!  And they are open during this winter storm from 4-6 today.  They saved my day!  Hope they save yours too!  Shop local!  Everyone that works there is nice and helpful!

reviews.author: Niki S.
reviews.description: Where's my sixth star, I mean, glass of wine?! ;) Tucked away in the north Austin hills, this place is a gem, worth trekking over for if you have any excuse to be anywhere near it.  This is the type of place that a group could enjoy, a wine beginner wouldn't find intimidating, and a wine snob could also find something to please their pallet. Good selection of all types, but not intimidating.  THE STAFF ARE ALL SO FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL! I was given a few suggestions from the owner, and they were all so spot on, I loved every one I tried.   Love the clean but welcoming decor, and how everything feels approachable and interactive (Glasses for sale, books, etc) and there's even some outdoor seating for those feeling a fire pit (if memory serves correctly, but the night I was here, the rain kept everyone inside).   Bring some girls, a group, or just stop by on your way home for a friendly wine bar with the coziness that makes you want to curl up and order an entire bottle and chat with folks.

reviews.author: Sara S.
reviews.description: Steiner Ranch has been slow to develop despite its rapidly growing population so I was so happy to see a new wine bar open up. Sloan + Parker was the perfect place to catch up with my girl friends. We shared a bottle of Napa Cab, a charcuterie board and delightful conversation with the hosts. The decor is great, ambiance is fun and it was overall a nice experience. Sloan + Parker is a much needed addition to Steiner Ranch!

reviews.author: Jen R.
reviews.description: What an amazing experience and we can't wait to come back... weekly!  I'm from Indiana, husband from California. We moved here about 15 months ago and haven't found any amazing wines we enjoyed until today! Don't know if anyone else has had this issue in finding great wines, particularly Cabernet, in Texas, but we have! We came in and were welcomed with open arms and amazing conversation! In depth information of wines and tasting until we found the right glass to order.  After 15 months of living here we have finally found our "home" in regards to wine and friends! We will definitely  be back and can't wait to experience all they have to offer! Down to earth people and an experience you won't regret.  P.S. the decor is amazing!

reviews.author: Jennifer E.
reviews.description: A friend of mine that knows the owner and lives in Steiner invited me to a ladies night at this establishment. It was extremely loud and busy.  It is obvious that this area needs something like this.  As a woman owned business, I am happy to see it thrive.  Deep into Steiner Ranch, I am not sure people who live outside of the area would be seeking it out but worth the trip if you are into wine and want to check out the space.  Could be a good place for a celebration.  Steiner probably has enough people to support.  Rose, white, red, bubbles and brews.  Cheese plates.  You can buy bottles to take with you with various mustards, jams, etc in their pantry. Glad I got to experience this location and wish them all the luck moving forward.

reviews.author: Dani K.
reviews.description: Absolutely love Sloan + Parker. I'll admit that I'm pretty easy to please in the wine department, but I really do love all the wines I've tried! I appreciate that the wine list is ever changing and that the employees all do an amazing job with recommendations and descriptions. There is also a pretty large price range so you're able to choose a glass based on how much you'd like to spend, which is great for their range of customers. Now about the decor/atmosphere: I'd like to have my home designed to look similar to S+P. It's fun and new and modern but elegant and sophisticated at the same time. I wouldn't change a thing!   My favorite time to go is on a chilly evening. I love to be curled up by the fire on the patio with blankets (provided by S+P) and a big glass of cab with live music playing in the background. Come on! That's heaven!   Do yourself a favor and follow them on Facebook. They host great events, my favorite being Sip In SWEATS. You will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Kerry S.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! Peyton was an amazing host and knows the name of everyone that walks in. Incredible hospitality and ability to pinpoint you pallet to recommendations that will resonate with you. Hands down, five stars!

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: Fantastic place. They have a really nice wine selection plus a solid draft list for those seeking beer. Service is fantastic and they bringing in rotating local musicians as well. Highly recommend S+P.

reviews.author: Eric N.
reviews.description: Locally owned business that knows wine!  My wife and I love coming here for a drink and a bite then leaving with a bottle.  Our go-to place in the neighborhood

reviews.author: Ashley M.
reviews.description: I love S+P! It has a chic yet comfortable atmosphere and stellar wine and beer selections. It's a great place for a night out with friends and also perfect for date night. The owner really knows her stuff too! If you need a recommendation she can give you so many amazing suggestions.

reviews.author: Nate P.
reviews.description: Love coming here to relax (inside or outside on the patio) and get some glasses of wine. There are delicious beer options as well. They also have some snacking plates (cheese, charcuterie) and some other treats. If you're feeling indecisive, you can taste a wine before buying a glass (I find their descriptions to be spot on and helpful), and there's usually a few wine flight options on rotation.

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Came out for a networking group and had a great time. Will be bringing my wife back. She would love this place!

reviews.author: Nicholas V.
reviews.description: Beautiful property, great wine, and equally awesome food + service.   First time here. We didn't have any preconceived notions.   Normally I'm not a fan of Texas wines but their wine was fantastic and unique. The Spot and Love Magick stole our heart.   The food was super fresh. Got the salami and cheese board. Excellent.   Good atmosphere. Good service.   Cant wait to come back!

reviews.author: Danielle H.
reviews.description: Beautiful peaceful spot to enjoy our afternoon after a hike nearby. Wine was lovely too!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: We loved our time at Hamilton Pool Vineyards. The wine was all delightful, the food was delicious, ambience impeccable, and the servers were all as lovely as can be. The drive out was absolutely gorgeous and it was a gorgeous was to spend our Sunday afternoon. (Live music was a great touch.) highly recommend checking this place out.

reviews.author: Keith L.
reviews.description: Great spot after heading to Hamilton pool, met with the owner and had a great experience. The chief and workers were all very nice. They have several Texas wines and a nice area to sit out and enjoy them paired with small plates.

reviews.author: Russ J.
reviews.description: Service was God awful. Our server acted like we were an annoyance to serve and recited his 'script' with a sing song voice. Dropped the bread on the way and then didn't replace it until we we had finished the cheese and fruit. We still bought two bottles. Tonight we opened the more expensive bottle and it had turned. It was like vinegar. So incredibly disappointed. Hard pass.

reviews.author: Pam F.
reviews.description: The grounds are beautiful!  What a great backdrop for engagement photos or a wedding!  Take a tour, attend a farm class, or volunteer!  Have some fun!

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Love this place! The sparkling rose' wine is awesome. Food is awesome. Service top notch . For sure a cool place to come . They for sure are respectful of the covid rules. We will be back!

reviews.author: Kimmie P.
reviews.description: Was so excited to check out this place today. Our server was okay, but describing our wine as tasting like an aquarium was a turn off. Also, there was a kid camp going on and children threw water guns at our table while we dined as well as crawled around by our table. Not the experience we'd hoped for. Our server ghosted during our meal and left us waiting over 30 minutes to pay so we could leave. Wanted to love this place, as it is a beautiful property with so much potential. With a few tweaks, it could be so much more.

reviews.author: Liz H.
reviews.description: Service was poor, but wines were good. We had the basic tasting and tried 4 wines. We enjoyed the wines. They were not very busy, and our sever was not attentive.

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: A great winery!  This is a beautiful winery and a great stop if you plan on visiting the other winery nearby or salt lick BBQ. Everyone is exceptionally helpful, they have a very comfortable tasting room, but I felt the tasting was way overpriced, so I decided to just buy a bottle of the Fall Creek Vineyards Tempranillo to drink while the rest of the group had their tasting.   They have an impressive operation and make some wonderful wines, definitely worth the stop. Cheers!

reviews.author: Chica B.
reviews.description: I visited this vineyards Dec 23 in the afternoon.  We were the only one in the winery.  We received good attention from the staff.  The wine tasting was really good.  Got to get one of the bottles for a present and an edged glass to keep.  I plan to visit Texas in a near future and this is one place that I plan to come back again. Wine first and bbq later.  Of all of the wines Mourvedre was our favorite.

reviews.author: Nicolle M.
reviews.description: TLDR: relaxing atmosphere with nice white wines. Good on the spectrum of Texas wines but not on the level of French or Napa wines.  This is a great spot right across the street from salt lick. Parking lot is gravel but there's plenty of parking available. Hostess was extremely friendly and great conversation.  The wines themselves are good- we especially loved the Chardonnay and reserve wines. Based on Texas wineries, I have to say this is hands down one of the better vineyards. That being said, I have a deep love for Russian river valley wines (especially green valley pinots and Chardonnay's) and Texas grapes just don't measure up. Is that an unfair comparison? Probably.  Overall highly recommend visiting and supporting local. You'll want this on your wine tasting list of stops for sure, and best of all it's fairly close to Austin.

reviews.author: Trenna H.
reviews.description: If you're looking to have a nice day trip from Austin, Fall Creek is a great spot.
