I love coming out here for a wine tasting and enjoying the outside patio and having the vineyard to explore. The landscape is gorgeous and the staff are so knowledgeable and friendly.  Most importantly, the wine is delicious.    Pro tip- for an additional $8 you can add on an extra tasting of the ExTerra Tempranillo (usually a $100 bottle). It's amazing and a must try.

reviews.author: Sametra B.
reviews.description: The wine was amazing!!! Needless to say, we will be returning on our next trip to Austin. We are huge Cabernet fans and all of the wines were delicious. We took a few bottles home. When we tried the Tempranillo and it swept us off our feet. We have since found some of these wines in our local Houston Spec's.   The facility is clean and the grounds are well kept. The restrooms are also clean!!! Our host was simply amazing and went above and beyond to explain the process and enjoyed the discussion describing the notes we would/did experience. Really enjoyed the entire experience.

reviews.author: Kara G.
reviews.description: Fall Creek Vineyards totally exceeded our expectations! We have been super strict about staying home during COVID-19, but my #1 birthday wish was to get out ... in a safe way. With young children. My husband called Fall Creek ahead of time and was told that kids were allowed and that there was plenty of outdoor space.   We arrived around 2pm on a Wednesday afternoon and were greeted by a super friendly and knowledgeable gentleman. I wish I had grabbed his name, because he was seriously amazing. He let us know that a food purchase was required to be served on premise, which was not a problem at all because everything looked delicious (we chose a cheese platter), and gave us a wine menu as well.   We selected our own seats and were able to stay away from the party that came in after us. Our sommelier was so knowledgeable and provided everything in a COVID-19 safe way. He was also super sweet to our kids, even though our three year old was crushing crackers on the table (we cleaned up after him before we left but it was still so embarrassing).   All of the wines were delicious. We ended up leaving with their Tempranillo, their Sauvignon-blanc (vintners-selection) and two souvenir glasses.   We spent about an hour at Fall Creek, which ended up being the total highlight of my birthday, but could have spent more time there exploring their beautiful grounds  had we not had a dinner reservation.

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: Texas has great wines.  A short drive from Austin (right across from Salt Lick) you can spend a few hours in the vineyard, sit in the patio, or stay inside. Of course, there is wine tasting and a variety of bottles for sale.  Fall Creek makes wines in all price points. From the quite good inexpensive wines to award-winning bottles for people who really know their reds. I am a fan of their Tempranillo.  If you are in Austin, it's worth a visit!

reviews.author: Elise G.
reviews.description: TL;DR: Couldn't recommend this more for a safe way to spend the day with your friends during (and even not during!) Covid.  My mom's in town so I wanted to take her to a winery semi-close to Austin but not too far away. ENTER: Fall Creek. It's been recommended to me by several friends so figured I'd check it out for myself:  PROS: Seriously the nicest staff in the world. Thank you Daniel! Plenty of socially distanced tables and chairs in LOTS of different areas of the winery A bottle of their amazing Sauvignon Blanc - $22! Great snacks to accompany (I got Pimento cheese) They had live music on a Saturday with a full band. swoon! Across the street from Salt Lick if you want foods  CONS: Seriously none. Couldn't have asked for a more perfect day. Can't wait to visit again!   Pro tip: go to Desert Door nearby for more fun. :)

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: FCV at Driftwood is a nice little winery, with seating indoors and out. When we were visiting, there was only one other guest present (midday Tuesday). As a personal recommendation, if you're trying to social distance, I would suggest visiting here only during the weekdays when it's less busy, otherwise it may seem too crowded since the place is on the smaller side.  The food menu mainly consists of cheese and snacks that go well with wine but it's a little overpriced. The staff was nice but they were just there for the most part, nothing more to enhance our experience.   3/5 staff/service 4/5 nicely decorated interior and exterior 5/5 with the right company

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Good stop on your wine tour! We opted for two full glasses of their most standout wines and although it was much more expensive wine than I'm used to, we did get a generous pour. The backyard terrace is peaceful and has many seating options. I would've loved to see an option where you could do a wine tasting outdoors, perhaps the same way you order a beer flight. I saw this because wine tastings are only offered inside.

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: We didn't care for this place that much. The dining/patio area was nice but seemed like some of it was off limits (maybe party rooms). Wine offering was limited. We had a Chardonnay, Tempranillo and a Lescalo. They were just OK but it was the end of our day before heading to Salt Lick so that could have had an impact. One visit here was enough for us.

reviews.author: Me Y.
reviews.description: Entrance is nice yet when you go to the back it needs a little tending. Table tops were messy, landscaping needs a little touch up, I'm hoping it was just a little neglect we might try it again later.

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: The wine here is really delicious. They are only doing tastings inside. The tasting is a preset menu. You can order a glass and get food outside afterwards. The service is great and our waitress was very friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Erica G.
reviews.description: After 3 months of quarantine, two of us ventured out for a bff day of wine and views. Our 2nd stop was Falls Creek....it was so pretty with perfect sunny weather and enough seating inside and out. Covid is still among us so they offer hand santizers but you bring your own mask. Most patrons didn't have on of course once they had their wine in hand.   We opted to sit outdoors. Tables are 3-4 ft apart in some spots so choose within your comfort zone for social distancing. We grabbed a quick glass of wine and made our way to the next stop.   Looking forward to returning with the hubby this summer.

reviews.author: Tina M.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our tasting experience here! We will be back. Knowledgeable and gracious, this winery is a must do for anyone in the area that wants an amazing wine tasting experience.

reviews.author: Christina R.
reviews.description: Went to Fall Creek for a wine tasting prior to dinner at Salt Lick.  We were seated in the indoor patio which was extremely warm.  No water was offered.  We requested the tasting - 5 wines that are pre-selected, you aren't able to choose.  After the second (extremely small) pour, we had to request water.  Decided to order a couple of apps for the group..we were brought store made hummus and pimento cheese - still in the plastic container, propped on a plate with a wrapped package of crackers.  Had to request small plates, which seemed to surprise our server.  By the end of the tasting we were all sweating as the sun was beating down on us and there seemed to be no AC. The wines were okay, but the experience and service could have been much better.  I wouldn't return.

reviews.author: Roy C.
reviews.description: Wine tasting was $20 for 5 small pours.  Can't select wines to try, only had 5 bottles open and only one was what I would have wanted.  Food prices were also high.  Place was fairly full but I don't know why.  Wines we tasted were fair at best.  Too many good one in the area to waste your time here.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: This vineyard was a delightful second stop on our day drinking in the Driftwood area. The wine picked by my group was light , refreshing and the perfect compliment to have after we had made a lunch stop at a brisket place. We had been feeling stuffed but this wine was so light and enjoyable to help digest our food while we enjoyed their peaceful tranquil outdoor seating area near a cute little pond. We also took advantage of their photo opportunity landscapes.

reviews.author: Mariz V.
reviews.description: I've had my fair share of vineyards from local like Grape Creek in Fredericksburg then to Castello di Amorosa in Napa Valley. I was embarrassed after taking my family to experience the wine tasting here. Although, some of the wine were fairly tasty, but the serving was small compared to the vineyards I mentioned in the beginning. I had never been to a wine tasting with a pour stopper that was new to me. Mind you they charge $20 per person for wine tasting. We were observing a table near us that was getting extra pour from the pour stopper technique. We decided to order 2 cheese plates ($25/plate) that came in this container after we finished it, which was a small portion by the way. We noticed that the container said "Best By: 2/12" we visited 2/13. So we alerted our server she politely checked with the back she was told that it meant Arrived By, which to me was odd. If it was "Arrived By" I think that's what they would've put on the container but I guess just to shut us up.  As to COVID capacity the patio was full we couldn't wait to leave. This is my family and I's experience I wish it could've been better.

reviews.author: Manuela A.
reviews.description: Our favorite wine spot in Austin. Their Meritus is a winner every time. Cute and cozy spot, very picturesque and everyone who works here is super nice and knowledgeable.

reviews.author: Steven D.
reviews.description: One of our favorite places on the square! If you like wine at all, come here. Anthony and his crew makes it so fun. I learn something new every time we visit and I've never felt that "wine snob" view at all. Just great wines a and even better people.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: It's a lovely wine room.   Our wine guy was terrible. I'm guessing he was having a bad day. Or maybe we looked like we weren't big spenders. Who knows. He was very unwelcoming. We had to ask him questions he just didn't give us any information about the winery at all or the wine club. Must have been a bad friday for him.   I passed on getting a flight b/c of the wine guy. I got a glass of a red blend to go so I could shop around the square. The wine was fantastic. I was going to buy a bottle but found another place on the other side of the square.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: We've been through a handful of wine rooms and wineries around Central Texas this is a nice little quiet spot never really super crowded and delightfully not very loud so we could carry on a conversation the wine selection here is great but be prepared to spend a little bit more than you normally would we spent $28 for a bottle of Muscato which is pretty reasonable, But the people here we're super friendly and the service was great so for that price I must say I could do that again

reviews.author: Vaughn O.
reviews.description: Barons Creek was our first stop on a planned wine tasting adventure around the square. We were greeted by our sommelier Tom, seated, and the tasting process explained. Tom provided a charming mixture of highbrow wine knowledge and light humor as he took us through our tasting journey of 5 red wines. The wife liked all of the wines, and I liked all but one (a tempranillo). Never fear! Tom is here! Tom saved the day (and the Tres Primos reputation) by pouring us an extra taste, but instructing us to first chew a chocolate-covered coffee bean before pouring the wine across that bean in our mouths. This somehow transformed the flavour into something amazingly pleasing for us both!  We also ordered chicken empanadas, which were surprisingly delicious! For some reason we did not expect such flavor and complexity from a wine bar's kitchen. The empanada crust was crispy and flaky, with a filling of chopped chicken, onions and seasonings that burst into the mouth with each bite. This was no Tex-Mex kitchen empanada. Hats off Barons! Hats off!

reviews.author: Meghan A.
reviews.description: Visiting Georgetown...Was on a search for a search for a romantic day date and ran into this place. I am more than grateful to have walked into this place.   Chris was behind the bar and he welcomed us right away! The place provided social distancing and comfortability. Hubby and I just absolutely loved the service and feeling of what a wine tasting is meant to feel. Chris was so wonderful with the wine process.   Will be back for sure!

reviews.author: A H.
reviews.description: I'm so glad we chose Barons Creek over all the competition on the area. Anthony truly rolled out the red carpet and made our experience rememberal . Seven of us had the pleasure of tasting six different house made wines and delicious appetizers.

reviews.author: Anna-Maria C.
reviews.description: This place is a must-go on The Square. Not only are their wines delicious, the staff working there are amicable and knowledgeable. Chris especially helpful as he knows a lot about their wines and brings charisma to the already-inviting atmosphere. Definitely have to stop by for some vino!

reviews.author: Kim D.
reviews.description: We called ahead to see if they were open before driving an hour. They said they were open but neglected to tell us that their services were limited without reservations because of it being Valentine's weekend. We are new wine club members and felt like we were treated very rudely when we arrived. We loved our experience at Barons in Fredericksburg but would not recommend the Georgetown location. Our plan was to buy a case of the Boots wine but after they way were treated, we left our Boots behind.

reviews.author: J. S.
reviews.description: We spent an hour of fun here tasting wine but did not much care for their selection of provided wines. Barons had more of an uppity vibe to it, so maybe I wasn't picking up what they were putting down from the jump as I tend gravitate toward a more casual atmosphere... especially when it comes to wine tasting.   They were nice and helpful here and poured us a cup of Tempranillo and Crazy Train on our way out, to drink while we walked around the square. Both good wines but did not justify the price tag for us.

reviews.author: Josh O.
reviews.description: We love Barons Creek. Anthony is amazing and constantly ensuring guest have a great experience.  Thankful to have this in Georgetown.

reviews.author: T R.
reviews.description: Absolutely delightful service and atmosphere. It's so great to have a place on the square to enjoy wine. The bottles are a little pricier than expected (I think maybe you need to join the wine club?) but if you are looking for a solid enjoyable afternoon or evening out with friends, a nice cheese plate or a bite from the restaurant next door, and knowledgeable sommeliers who can find you something you will enjoy - you can't go wrong.

reviews.author: A. J.
reviews.description: Awesome place to have some wine.  Friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Ask all the questions about wine you want and they will have the answer.   Has piano in back.   Decor is nice and the place is super clean.   It's definitely a fun stop around the square.  Go have a glass or two!!!

reviews.author: Elizabeth K.
reviews.description: I don't know what I was expecting when I walked in, but I was blown away. It's beautiful inside. The wine counter/bar is long. There was live music. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. We did a wine tasting and then sat down with a glass. I'm really glad this is here. It's perfect.

reviews.author: Bailey B.
reviews.description: This place is super cozy and perfect to go to on a cooler rainy day, and not crowded at all; the server was polite and made a good choice when I asked him to surprise me after informing him I preferred drier spicier reds.

reviews.author: Kelly O.
reviews.description: Chris is amazing. He made our very first wine tasting experience incredible. We went as two couples and had a great time conversing with Chris and learning about the wines we were introduced to. 100% recommend.

reviews.author: Marco Antonio G.
reviews.description: Love the new location and all the wine hosts. Friendly, kind and eager to share their knowledge of wine. If you happen to stop by say hi to Anthony, he's an awesome person who knows a lot. And lets not forget the wine! So far we love all the wines and location and will keep coming back. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Blane W.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere. Cool vibe walking in. Presumptuous personality behind the bar. Extravagant prices. $15.16 for what looked like maybe 6 oz.  Wine was decent, yet no desire to return.

reviews.author: Travis H.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere.     However the wine was terrible.   The first red flag should be when the bartender says "we tell all our customers not to smell the wine".     Who says that?    Now I know why.    It smelt like, well I just cannot describe it.  I am a member of 6 wine clubs and have tasted my share of wines.   Definitely would not recommend this place especially when most of their wine is significantly overpriced at $40+ per bottle.

reviews.author: Mindy W.
reviews.description: We loved this winery! Chris hosted our tasting and was knowledgeable, friendly, and fun. He even made recommendations for local hot spots and wines to order at each restaurant. The wine was delicious and ambience was fantastic. They had live music when we went that really added to the atmosphere. I recommend and will go back!

reviews.author: Reynaldo B.
reviews.description: Wonderful atmosphere! Great wine! Keri was amazing at explaining all the tasting and we realized we had a very similar palate. Very friendly staff and welcoming. I'm enjoying it here!

name: Flat Creek Estate Winery and Vineyard

reviews.author: Jeff N.
reviews.description: Our party of 4 visiting from the Chicago area. We booked a 3 course meal and wine tasting.  Our server Katie was well versed and very personable. The founder of the winery, Madelyn, visited our table and we chatted for quite a while. Great plans for the future! Our meal was incredible. One person in our party said it was the best meal  she has ever had. That is quite a statement! We asked to see the chef.  Executive Chef Shawn graciously accepted our kudos and applause. We walked the property and will always remember the great experience and fabulous property views. Well done!

reviews.author: Susan E.
reviews.description: My daughter gave me the gift of her time, along with a 3-course meal and wine tasting, to honor a special occasion. We decided to make this a weekday outing, to minimize traffic and the possibility of large groups being at the winery.  We were promptly greeted and seated upon arrival. The dining room was largely empty, and we had superb service. This was our second visit to the winery, and we plan to return.   We tasted 7 wines in all, 3 of which were paired with the November menu of panzanella (a bread salad), fennel-crusted pork tenderloin, and cannoli. The wine pairings were excellent.   We were not big fans of the panzanella. It seemed to need additional ingredients to make it more interesting and less dry. The main course, however, was fabulous. The pork medallions were crusty and flavorful. The linguine accompaniment was wonderfully garlicky, making it almost possible to ignore that the pasta was overcooked. And the cannoli was excellent. I think of cannoli as a finger food; these mini cannoli were made pretty with their presentation but more messy to eat because of the chocolate sauce. The cannoli were served with a very good port wine.   All in all, we had a very nice meal and enjoyed the wines... which we drank. No spitting for us! We are not connoisseurs, but certainly enjoy good quality wine. Some of Flat Creek's are very good indeed.   This was not a cheap excursion, but the 2 hours we spent there were worth it. This would be a great place for a romantic date, and also worked well as a mother-daughter excursion. Flat Creek has other dining options that include pizza, and there's a disc golf course on the premises. Do make advance reservations for your visit, as this isn't a large establishment and can be a long (but pretty) drive from the Austin area.

reviews.author: Ileana P.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Totally worth it to do the tasting, food was amazing and the employees provided above and beyond expectation. All were so knowledgeable, gave great suggestions for the pairing with dinner. Can't wait to come back

reviews.author: Nancy C.
reviews.description: We always take our visitors here. Beautiful and the wine and food is very good. We also frequented the outdoor bistro during the height of the endemic as it is spacious and just a lovely and peaceful setting. They also have vegan cheese for their pizzas :)

reviews.author: Lisa M.
reviews.description: Yes please choose the appropriate experience for your family, because apparently my family did not ‍ we ate outdoors at the pavilion, there was no wine tasting involved....My advice  this place is not family friendly, possibly they aren't even friendly.......really we did not know that disc golf was available for children under 12, this might have been something that was mentioned to us when we asked what do you have that it family friendly. In addition your apology seems very condescending and not genuine at all.  How do you know that what we were envisioning? We just wanted to have a nice time with our grands, and we were talked down to, and you're still talking down to us....

reviews.author: Jayla M.
reviews.description: Had an amazing experience with friends. The food was good as well. We signed up for the 6 wine taste testing and it came with pizza and side salad. I really liked how Our host gave each different wines that fit us, therefore we weren't all forced to test the same stuff. We also got the opportunity to step outside and watch the sunset. Would definitely go back.

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: If you're visiting Marble Falls add this to your MUST DO list!  My girlfriend and I made our first trip to Marble falls this past weekend and are very happy to say we started the weekend off here at Flat Creek Estate.   We enjoyed the "Chef's 3 course experience" which was one of the best dining experiences we've ever had! 6 glasses of wine and a 3 course meal that took us on a  flavorful journey. At one point we felt like Remy in that scene from Ratatouille, the one where he pairs the strawberry with some cheese and feels fireworks... yes, it was really that good!  Carmen was a priceless part of the already amazing experience, she was so friendly, enthusiastic and helpful! Ask for her to be your server if you can!  We can't wait to come back to marble falls and visit here again, looking forward to next seasons wines and Chef's 3-course! Thank you guys!

reviews.author: Dee Y.
reviews.description: It hurts me to write this review. We truly want every small business to thrive. My family and I went to the Vineyard on a Friday afternoon for an intimate celebration of my husband's birthday with our mom, dad and children, it ended in my 5-year old little one being verbally attacked by a man in the pavilion, who identified himself as 'the owner'.   We decided to try the disc golf course, and we loved our experience with Casey, he is a gem! Very knowledgeable about disc golf, and very accommodating. We let him and Madelyn (the owner's wife) know we were celebrating a birthday. The course was fun, but ridden with fire ants, red ants, sticker burs and bull nettle. It was not the polished experience we were expecting. But still fun for our family.   We finished disc golf, and returned to the pavilion around 6:00pm.  We ordered a large dinner, but since we were not offered to sit in the main seating area, we sat under the outdoor pavilion. We were in the pavilion for less than 5 minutes, and the adults arranged tables so our family could sit together (there is no waiter in the pavilion so we had to move tables on our own). During those few minutes my two small children were playing under the pavilion, not causing any harm or damage, just laughing and trotting around like kids do outside (he is 5 and she is 7).   Out of no where a man started verbally attacking my 5-year old. This man who looked to be in his 70s, was sitting at a table drinking bottles of wine with 2 other people. He continued to yell at the top of his lungs scaring me and my babies. They came running to me asking me why the man was yelling and whistling at them. It broke my heart. A complete stranger was attacking them for no apparent reason.   After protecting them, my dad and husband approached the man who was yelling the obscenities. This is when he identified himself as 'the owner'. He told us our children were 'out of control' and we needed to get them under control. I asked them what they were doing to display out of control behavior, and he didn't say a thing, besides he had guests with him and they were disrupting his evening. My father let the man know if we were going to be patrons of his business, we would not tolerate his verbal abuse of our 5 and 7 year old children. My father also told him, "We don't yell at our kids like that and if he had a problem with the way our children were behaving he could have stood up and walked over while we were arranging our own tables and told us in a normal tone of voice the problem he saw."  After the incident, the man sat at his table continuing to drink wine for 45 minutes, and sadly never came back to our table to apologize to our children for scaring them because of his obscene behavior. As we left, both of my children continued to asked why he was so angry.   We now understand this pavilion is in 'the owners' front yard. On this evening Rick (the owner) had been drinking with friends and our family was interrupting their evening. His behavior not only made us feel the most unwelcome as paying customers, but was abusive and completely out of control, especially as 'the owner'.  We should have been able to have this conversation with the business owner. Unfortunately, he left the pavilion to go back to his house, and did not return or offer an apology.  ***Update in Response to Owners Apology Below***  Your apology ends with 'resolve any confusion or fears the children had regarding why they were reprimanded'. The main point of why this experience was so horrifying: No one should ever reprimand a 5-year old child, except that child's guardians. If there was an issue with a child's safety, that concern should have been directed to the guardians who were standing between the children and the owner. Never should a stranger, much less a 70-year old man who is consuming alcohol ever 'reprimand' a child, ever! Of course of case the outcome was severe harm to the child, in this case, our 5-year old was not in severe danger.  Regarding the excuse that you 'witnessed dangerous behavior, and you had to immediately intervene': If there are components of your business that are dangerous to patrons, you should immediately remove these hazards, so that they don't become a safety issue. If you feel your deck boxes are not safe, you should store them in a storage facility where patrons do not have access.   Regarding your comment that 'you wish to leave discipling to parents but are forced to intervene when there is a safety concern': We were a party of 4 adults, and we were less than 10 feet away from our children. While we were bussing our own tables and arranging furniture, we were not aware my 5- year old sat on the 'deck box' and got down by jumping off. This type of 'danger' (i.e. sitting on a sitting area, and jumping off something that is no more than 2 feet off the ground) should not elicit the response of 'discipline' by a stranger, or 'immediate' intervention.

reviews.author: Dave H.
reviews.description: A hidden gem in the hill country with beautiful grounds, friendly staff and an amazing array of wines and dishes. We tried the 3 course chef's dinner. We started with wine tasting followed by a spectacular wine pairing with each course. We hadn't really considered Texas wine as equivalent to Calif wines but we were wrong. All of the wines we sampled were great and because of that we ended up heading home with 14 bottles! The owner even stopped by to ask us about our experience which we gladly shared. Definitely worth experiencing this adventure.

reviews.author: Cyndi M.
reviews.description: My husband and I were staying in Marble Falls for a few days and this winery was suggested. Flat Creek Winery had a nice outdoor patio.  The inside seating was small and very loud so we chose to sit outside.  There was only one guy taking orders.  He was very nice and tried his best.  But, he needed help. My husband and I each chose wine tasting (we got 4 samples, but we didn't get to choose what we wanted to try), a glass of wine, and a pizza. We got our wine tasting and glass of wine immediately. We waited about 45 minutes before we got our pizza.  The pizza was delicious, but our wine was already gone.  Probably will not go back.

reviews.author: Kaitlyn L.
reviews.description: This was a great lunch spot for a Saturday!! Even though it's a ways off of the beaten path, the ambiance and food is amazing!!! The 4 of us did the pizza and tasting package which is the way to go! Sherry was delightful and chose our wines based on what WE like, not a set list. The chicken Florentine and the sundries tomato artichoke pizza are both recommendations. 10 out of 10

reviews.author: Chelsea Benny C.
reviews.description: Horrible service! Was told we could sit inside in just a few minutes, had us wait outside for 45 minutes and told us they forgot they had other tables to take care of, clearly had 3 empty tables. Been to a lot of wineries, worst experience ever at this one though!

reviews.author: Danielle R.
reviews.description: My friend and I went to celebrate my birthday. The service (Casey) was fantastic, but I wasn't crazy about most of the wines we tried. The food was okay. Service I'd rate 5 stars, but food and wine 2-3 stars.

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Covid/"reopening" June review.   Signage not great, and cell reception can be spotty, so be sure to download the map to your cell phone in advance.   Beautiful location and building. Plenty of parking.   Inside tables by reservation only. Nicely separated, no issues being close to other guests. Not the same for reception or table service.  Server was pleasant, but had zero concept of social distancing, no mask and was right in our faces each time we had an interaction.   Menu/tasting a little confusing. Basically you prepay $40 each and get whatever you want from the menu, including wine to drink there or to go. Most wines were available for tasting pours, but not all. Some wines good, some not so much. Liked the primitivo the most of the many we tried.   Very nice for the setting and service. Great set up for limited capacity, but they really need to work on wait staff protection.

reviews.author: Amber H.
reviews.description: We went for a wine tasting during a girls weekend but decided to just sit and have dinner instead. The baked Brie was great, but the "roasted" Brussel sprouts were truly just steamed and served on a sizzling cast iron skillet -- definitely NOT roasted. It honestly was a let down as "roasted" truly didn't mean roasted. The wine was great, service was great.... But food was just mediocre for the price.

reviews.author: Melanie G.
reviews.description: My husband and I had a fantastic experience at Flat Creek! During a weekend getaway to the Marble Fallas area from Dallas, we planned a day of wineries in Hill Country and Flat Creek was at the top of our list based on recommendations from friends. We wanted to experience the 3-course lunch but due to social distancing rules, reservations were hard to come by. We figured we'd take our chances and arrive as soon as they opened, and we were in lunch! We were able to be seated indoors right away by Madeleine who was just a delight! There was just one other party enjoying lunch, so we felt very catered to. Our server, David was also wonderful.  Even after our lunch, Madeleine brought us over to the outdoor patio area and gave us a couple of complimentary tastings of her a few of her fave white wines.  Hands down, our best winery experience. We bought two bottles and will be back soon!

reviews.author: Ann B.
reviews.description: We have been members at Flat Creek Estate for several years now and have been very pleased with their many offerings. However this past Friday, the owner and staff went way over and above! Our son wanted to propose to his girlfriend and he wanted it to be a surprise! She loves pizza and wine so we "planned" that day to have a late lunch at the winery. It had been inclement out the previous few days and the day of the weather was looking iffy. The staff worked with us on a variety of scenarios just in case. The afternoon turned up sunny and warm! We were to "meet up" them a little later so they headed to the winery for lunch. The chef made a heart-shaped pizza (one of the surprises) and the staff came up with the idea of putting the ring into a small to-go box so he could bring it to the table without her knowing. I had also dropped off a bouquet of flowers for staff to bring out after he had proposed to her. The photographer found a great vantage point, the pizza was made, he picked it up along with the ring, he set the pizza down on the table and opened it, got on his knee and proposed to her! After she said yes and they hugged and cried a bit, the staff brought out the bouquet, we showed up and the photographer took more photos, onlookers awww'd and cheered! It was really an over and above day for everyone working at Flat Creek Estate! Thank you for helping to make my son's proposal so special!

reviews.author: Corey F.
reviews.description: The staff was extremely nice and accommodating. One of the owners came and introduced herself which was very personable and we appreciated that. Our host was very knowledgeable and attentive. The winery was beautiful and the food was amazing. We will definitely be back and recommend friends.

reviews.author: Dianna G.
reviews.description: We enjoyed the 6 winewine tastings, salads and shared Pizza. We especiallylly like the petite sirah.

reviews.author: Kirk W.
reviews.description: I thought I had reviewed Flat Creek back when we first went there not long after they opened but I just realized that I hadn't, so better late than never.  Flat Creek is a special place for us as we saw the sign for it during our Miata club drive back in 2007. I contacted them a few days later, set up a tasting for the club, a bunch of us drove out there and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The vineyard itself and the architecture are fantastic, and it has grown a lot since they opened.   Everyone who works there is extremely friendly and helpful, the food was always tasty, they have a lot of fun events, and the wines are truly delicious.   We enjoyed it so much that we kept going back, became friends with the owners, and got married there in 2011. Flat Creek was very accommodating as we wanted it to be on a specific date that was the Sunday after Thanksgiving, and they made it work.  Our wedding video showcases the vineyard extremely well so if you want to watch it, you can click here. https://vimeo.com/34645652 We are biased of course, but our friend did an amazing job on it and we love to revisit it.

reviews.author: Mary Ann C.
reviews.description: We made a quick stop at this winery and enjoyed the view while having a glass of wine.  I chose a jammy Cabernet called Lone Star Cab that was perfect. They do wine tasting but I just opted for a glass of what I knew that I would enjoy.    The cafe was not open but they had items that paired well with wine.  I'm sure it is busy in the weekend.  The Cafe is small so get your food to go and enjoy one of the many cozy spots to view the vineyards.   The staff were very friendly and the store was very clean.  They have gifts as well.  If we were in town longer, We would have come back for lunch.    The road to the vineyard is gravel so drive slow.  Parking is free and plentiful.  Follow the signs as the vineyard is about a mile up from the main road.

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: The wife and I tasted a flight of 6 wines: including the Rose, Cab, Red Blend, Merlot, Sangovese, and Syrah.  They were all simply awful swill. Everyone of the varietals lacked depth, character and complexity.  Everyone of the reds tasted blah, and I mean blah. They all lacked the distinctive aroma and notes that each of the grapes are known for.  The Rose  lacked any minerality that one would expect, and was as bad as the others.  The tasting room experience was as bad as the wines. The server had zero personality or character either.  We came away with the same thoughts as we have from other Hill Country Wineries.  They should not, nor should they be attempting to produce well known wines, and in fact do a terrible version of Cabs, Merlots, and Chards.  They should stick to Italian varietals, as well as a few others that might be better suited to the Texas climate, even though most people have no idea about those varietals. I suppose its just marketing to attract people in to the tasting room, and once they get toasted enough it no longer matters, since once the minds fogs, its just pour me another.

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: We were recommended this place by a friend so we decided to check it out. It is in a very remote area which makes it nice. They are on a hill so that the outdoor seating has a great view.  We got 2 tastings and for the most part I enjoyed all of their wines. The Alamo Red was great and so was the Longhorn Red. My wife enjoyed the Chardonnay as well. The servers were very helpful and help guide us to their more popular wines.   We ended up buying a couple of bottles and really enjoyed the experience and the view. We plan on coming here again soon!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Gorgeous property...Hill Country vistas at their finest.  Lovely people running the place, too. The wine was fine but definitely not the sole reason to visit, so make sure you have a couple places you're bopping around to in the area. Cute little tasting glasses and there's a shop for kitschy items featuring a lot of wine puns.    I do think the crowd skews a bit older, so better suited for entertaining folks than a bach party!

reviews.author: Anna Q.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery 25 minutes from Wimberly! We stopped by during 4th of July and was surprised there wasn't more of a crowd. Strict 21+ policy (many signs warning you to turn back if you aren't 21!) but the servers were so nice and kind. We did a wine tasting which was $20 for 6 samples of white, red, and sweet wine. You can also split the sampling between people, which I shared with a friend. Server (I think her name was Julie) was so sweet and knowledgeable about the wine flavors and gave us recommendations and some history of the flavors. Our favorite was the Starry Night, or the Orange Muscat wine! A bit disappointed they didn't give chocolates or nuts during a wine tasting and overall felt a bit rushed through the process as more people showed up, but it was still a unique experience.   The patio has a beautiful view of the orchard, which is why we came here versus other wineries in the area. Outdoor seating is plentiful, many round tables for larger groups too. Definitely would've spent a good half of day out here sipping wine if it wasn't for the rain. The Bistro (food/restaurant area) was closed because of Covid so eat before you arrive so you don't get hangry or wine drunk! ;)

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: This was the second stop on our wine tour during our anniversary celebration. The ambiance is fantastic and is worth the visit to just get a bottle and enjoy the panoramic views.   Pro tip: they do not allow children, so know that before you go. I believe most of the poor reviews are about this fact, but if you are prepared beforehand it will help with the planning.

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: The Napa or Texas! It's totally different I know, I know however it's a sweet little place in Hill Country. Bring a few friends and drink a bottle outside under the tree shade. They have a nice bistro menu to pair with your wine.   Prices are really reasonable $25-50 a bottle. Nice selection of whites, reds, sweets. Enjoy.

reviews.author: Tayo F.
reviews.description: The view. You gotta see the view. Especially as the sun is going down. My picture doesn't so it justice but it it was amazing. There is of course the other great things like the food, the outdoor lights they put on when the sun goes down and the wine is pretty good too but none of that compares to the view. You'll know it when you see it.

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: This was the best winery of the 8 1/2 I made it to in Texas. All of the wines had a, well let's just say, flavor I am more accustomed to tasting. Prior to this place, everything I tasted was a mixture of sour fermented grapes. Not knocking Texas wines but they are just not my style. Maybe it needs an ice cube. Every wine here, ones that I tasted, is 100% Texan and done the way I think it is suppose to taste. Also, the view from the estate is beautiful. Very worth a stop for tasting and buying.

reviews.author: Phillip S.
reviews.description: As a wine club member I was told to not smoke in the parking lot. They just lost me as a longtime customer and I will tell everyone to not go there. VERY POOR customer service people, you just lost a lot of business over 1 cigarette. My friends and I will never be back.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Second time coming here and have not been disappointed. There was a small wait for wine tasting due to limited seating inside. They wipe down tables in between people and staff are all wearing mask. Plenty of space outside for proper social distancing and enjoying some wine. We grabbed a bottle and ate at the small restaurant they have there. Would recommend you make reservations if you want a view. Service was great and food was amazing. My favorite was the pizza, don't remember the name of it but it had honey on it and it was the perfect amount of sweetness. Never thought I would like a pizza with honey on it, now I can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: Driftwood winery was our first stop of wine tasting of the day. The view was what sold me. Perfect for pictures!! They have an outdoor sitting area where you can admire the views and the bottle that you order is brought to you by a server who wears a face shield and gloves.    My group ordered a bottle of the 2017 Newsom Cabernet Sauvignon and we were pleased with our choice. It was not dry like a Merlot but just right. This winery does not allow you to bring outside food only the food offered in their bistro outdoor facility. This was not an issue for us.   Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: The view here and ambience is absolutely amazing. We did a wine flight and then brought a glass to their seating area. Wine itself was just OKAY. The view is incredible. You get a take home glass with the tasting!

reviews.author: Matouš P.
reviews.description: We have been club members here in the past, and really loved it. We went an 75 minutes out of our way to stop in for a tasting to see what peaked our interest in their current offerings. We loved that they have so much beautiful outdoor space. That is something that was always a major draw for us at Driftwood.   We called ahead, let them know we had a pup with us, and wanted to do a tasting. They told us to come on in. (It was a Monday and the place was very slow)  Upon arrival they told us they will only to tastings inside? What? In the era of COVID? As for the dog, they said one of us could do a tasting.   Between the lack of customer service, unfriendly attitude, and most importantly lack of outdoor tastings we will never bother to come back. WAY too many options with just as beautiful of grounds, equally great wines, safe tasting environment, and more importantly good customer service.

reviews.author: Patricia V.
reviews.description: It was an awesome peaceful experience.  The wine was full of flavor and wonderful taste of wines. The property is so beautiful.  It would be a perfect location for a wedding or vows renewing. The winery also offers a small bistro and gift shop with great items to purchase. I will recommend Driftwood and will come back!

reviews.author: Olivia C.
reviews.description: Good wine, good scenery, but the lady checking us in made it bad. First, I'm 21 and so is my best friend. We went with her parents, and her dad likes to joke around. We shared our ID's (after already confirming with someone else that we are at least 21 and allowed to enter), and he made a joke about us having fake ID's. Obviously we don't have fake ID's, this lady could've scanned them and checked. Anyways, she then proceeded to yell at all of us about how we can't allow anyone under 21 in the winery, she even yelled "NO ONE IS ALLOWED IN HERE UNLESS THEY ARE TWENTY ONE, PERIOD," she really did say "period" which immediately made my friend and I annoyed. Just very mean and disrespectful. I understand that she was trying to enforce the rules but we are over 21 and she did not have to explain the rules in such a rude way. Even her coworkers seem to not like her that much, they gave her the side eye, like she's THAT lady at work.  Then we did the wine tasting and the lady who poured us our wine was absolutely lovely. So sweet, gentle, kind, and even in the wine tasting area we had a great view of the hills and nature around us. The wine was very good. we liked almost everything, and even bought a few bottles.  After this, we went to buy some bottles and a glass of wine, again meeting the lady from earlier. A hand washing towel that my friend bought wasn't scanning correctly snd she got VERY mad at my friend for it. She took out her frustration from the computer on my friend. She was basically yelling at her and telling her to get another hand towel of the same price, she was interrupting us, I was ready to snap at this lady. She was VERY rude the whole time. She got the entire room of customers quiet from her yelling at my friend. She was just clearly very frustrated but should not have taken it out on my friend, family and I. This winery is incredible, but her attitude, frustration, and behavior knocked my rating down from 5 to 3. I was gonna put a 2 because of her, but the winery was amazing, it deserved a 5, but this woman made a serene and calming experience a bad one. My friend and I are both 21 and it isn't our fault the computer messed up scanning a hand towel. There were a few more negative experiences we had with her but these were the worst ones. Even the other customers in the room who were complete strangers to us saw her being this rude, controlling, and mean and visibly for uncomfortable. This company would be a 5 star place without her ruining everyone's experiences.  EDIT: Her name is Aileen. I don't know how it's spelled but my friend that I mentioned remembered her name because we were planning to call the company and inform them about her rudeness to customers.

reviews.author: Harry C.
reviews.description: Great setting and wonderful view and good wine.  The bistro food is on scale of 2 out of 10.  I never tasted such poor quality food.  Even if you order a soft drink, you get it in a can, they don't even have ice.  If your looking for a meal, go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Holly N.
reviews.description: Really disappointed in the customer service at this winery. We called to see if reservations were required and what time the last tastings were served. The woman on the phone said no reservations needed and the last tasting was at 5:30pm (winery closes at 6pm). We walked up to the check in host at 5:31pm for him to say in a smug tone, "Oooh we just closed up".  I told him what the lady on the phone said and he said, "yeah sorry". I was surprised at the lack of hospitality as we would have been out of their way by closing time and were looking forward to supporting a local winery during these difficult Covid times.  Better luck next time I suppose but left a less than wonderful taste in my mouth. I'll wash that taste down with wine from another winery!

reviews.author: Chris P.
reviews.description: If you have a big group don't waste your time coming here. This establishment doesn't want your money. They made that clear today.

reviews.author: Alim B.
reviews.description: Great place. The service is amazing! Everyone that works there has a vast knowledge of the wines. I would recommend getting a membership as well! Totally worth it! Also the view is to die for!

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: This winery is so beautiful, I could live there.   The views are breathtaking, and the main house is absolutely impressive, I was so impressed with the property I had to explore it further on my own.   They have been operating since 2004 and turned the former residence into a tasting, event and sales space. The sunroom and patio are perfect for enjoying a tasing or a bottle of wine among friends.   I actually sampled all of the wines on my visit to the vineyard, of course my preference is red, but I found many of the whites quite refreshing. Although the pool is no longer used for swimming, it makes an excellent backdrop, stop in and set a spell! Cheers!

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Beautiful location next to an Italian restaurant (they aren't affiliated). We got food from them and ate at a picnic table outside the winery. We tried two whites and a red, fairly inexpensive for a glass of wine. I think I paid $6-$8 per glass.. and they were all delicious! The only struggle is to find a place to sit during a weekend.. took a bit of patience before we got a spot. Dog friendly outside, too :)

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: I'm a huge fan of the property and how much green space they offer and the nibbles offered are quite tasty (especially the truffle fries). I'm not weeping with joy from any of the wines but they're easy enough to drink.  It's particularly lovely for violet crown sunsets, so save it for your last stop if you're making the rounds in this neck of the woods.  They don't have any ice, which I find supremely odd being that it's Texas and they serve white wine! If you want to keep your wine chilled while sitting outside (they've got plenty of gorgeous trees to provide shade but shade is not a wine bucket!) the only way to do so is to drink it real fast while thinking cold thoughts.

reviews.author: Elizabeth D.
reviews.description: Lovely area and great tasting menu. They have lovely picnic tables outside to bring your own snacks or enjoy their pizza or charcuterie boards alongside bought bottles. I just wish they had some music playing it was very quiet like pin drop quiet. I feel as though that might add a more comforting ambience. However we enjoy it very much and the restaurant near by looked spectacular

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: This is a must-stop on your wine tour and where we began ours! The architecture alone is a photographer's paradise and the wine is wonderful.   We were a little disappointed to hear that, as of our visit in May, they weren't doing tastings due to Covid because I do think it can be done safely and would've made for a better experience. Otherwise, you either have to buy a full bottle or multiple bottles if you'd like a well-rounded understanding of their wines. We opted for a blend that we absolutely loved, described on the bottle as a "patchwork quilt of grapes." It was honestly worth every penny--so delicious!   We took our bottle and glasses outside onto the expansive lawn which is just perfect for picnics. They have lots of shaded tables under the old growth trees.   Perhaps for safer tastings they could serve them "beer flight" style with the informational flyer and direct you to sit outdoors so that you can still experience a handful of their wines without breaking the bank? That would make it a 5-star experience for me!

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: Duchman is one of my favorites around the area. The winery is simple and small but has an European charm.   I've done the tasting before and also just purchased wine by glass. Both are delightful. Tasting is nice for first timers to explore a variety of wines Duchman produces. Because of the tasting, I was able to find my favorite red and white wine of theirs. And for $10/tasting, it is such a steal!! (Price may have changed. This was based off of 2018). After my first visit, I just opt to get a bottle or glass of my favorite red and sip it on the patio taking in good wine, views, and company.   My friends and I always love to end our Hill Country winery trek at Duchman and drive over to Salt Lick after for good ol Texas BBQ.

reviews.author: Lisa L.
reviews.description: The winery is beautiful and the wine is ok but we didn't find the staff to be very friendly. We ordered two snacks and both left a lot to be desired. The watermelon was soggy and smooshed up. We tossed whether to bring it back or not, and finally I did. The girl brought me another one which was fresh. Why serve me the nasty one first?? Unfortunately our experience wasn't good.

reviews.author: Peyton M.
reviews.description: My friends and I had the pleasure of doing a wine tasting with Andrea. The wines tended to be lighter which was perfect for a hot Texan day in July! Later, we had a ton of fun chatting with Javier and some other staff while enjoying a bottle of their finest. Very fun time here and the entire property is beautiful!   The wine tasting was $17 per person.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: This was actually one of my favorite stops in our Driftwood wine tasting day. This particular winery has outdoor picnics for groups and benches for smaller groups for one to buy a bottle , bring some of your own food and enjoy their wines. During this pandemic time, this is the perfect scenario to drink wine while still practicing social distancing.   They do allow you to use the restroom with mask wearing enforced for you to go inside the building.   Their wine was light and refreshing. We chose  a white wine.   If you go near the end of the day you enjoy a nice sunset followed by lighted trees giving you a Christmas vibe. Up until that day , I never knew that Texas had a winery side like Driftwood but places like Duchman Family Winery proved to me that they do exist and they have really good wine too. Highly recommend you make a stop at this winery.

reviews.author: Ann R.
reviews.description: What a LOVELY VENUE! Absolutely adored our wine!  The staff was knowledgeable.  They aren't doing tastings due to Covid but u can buy a bottle and drink on premises.  We probably would have bought more if we could taste, we usually do.

reviews.author: Natalie L.
reviews.description: Awful. Went here for my 21st birthday celebration with a small group of friends. We were completely respectful and there for a wine tasting and there were rude remarks made about our age and backhanded comments along with nobody taking us seriously or serving us promptly.

reviews.author: Ren D.
reviews.description: Before our visit we were so excited to visit this place. It was a nice place out but if we felt ignored. They really have poor customer service. I had a review but it was taken down by yelp for whatever reason, I was so surprise when from rude employee message me on my yelp apologizing personally, and apparently there was a guy anonymously message me regarding my review to be reposted. Eventually found they are working together and engaging me on whatever conflict they have. Thus, proven that they really have poor customer service , very unprofessional.I wont be surprise if they will ask yelp to take my review down again.

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Not doing wine tasting due to COVID while others in the region have all started doing it. Even glass options would be good...but you can only buy bottles. Tried the rose and it was good. Made from locally sourced Sangiovese, which was a nice plus.

reviews.author: Carol B.
reviews.description: Over priced tasting . $17 tasting for very small pours of 6 wines . No water in tasting room. Had to go get it yourself . No crackers or palate cleansers . If it was a free tasting I wouldn't care as much . When I made reservation I was specific about food and was not given accurate info. You are not able to order food or eat during the tasting. Food only available to purchase after tasting was over. Servers poured wine on top of previous tasting . Missed poured twice . Server changed frequently and not consistent. They obviously are not organized to keep track of what wine we should be on . Huge red wine fan( live in Europe for 6 years ) was not a fan of  any of the reds . Surprisingly liked 2 of the whites, Beautiful atmosphere and building . A shame the tasting experience doesn't match . Could be so much better!!

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Nice stop just outside Austin for a wine tasting! The outside setting is very cool, spacious front lawn and some tables/chairs for hanging out. Dropped into this place for a quick wine tasting, consisting of 6 small pours of wine. The whites we tasted were all very smooth, not overly sweet but just the right amount of smooth and dry. Definitely recommend sampling all the whites if you have time, you won't be disappointed!  We didn't go check out Trattoria next door for food, but have been there in the past and pretty good Italian food, pairs well with the winery.  If you come here and the weather is looking good, you can expect a very scenic, picturesque spot to spend some time at!

reviews.author: Afshin D.
reviews.description: I live in California and only an hour away from Napa. I wasn't expecting anything close to what one would experience in Napa. However, I still wasn't fully pleased.   The only way I can imagine that someone would really enjoy it, is to bring your own picnic and use their outdoor seating area. This is of course conditioned on the weather and also whether or not there is gonna be any bachelorette party there during your visit. (We saw two when we visited and they were so loud and they had overtaken all the outdoor seatings)  We tried their tasting. It was only $15 which is relatively cheap. In Napa you pay 2-3x more than that in a good winery. They let you choose your own 5 wines out of their selection or go with their recommendation. The tasting overall was okay, nothing that I disliked and at the same time nothing wowed me. I'm not sure if I'm gonna go back there, but it was worth to try it once.

reviews.author: Ashley K.
reviews.description: Duchman is a great winery to visit near Austin that makes great wines.  I've recently been on a kick to learn more about and try Texas wines.  I've tried wine from several different Texas wineries in the past couple months (all purchased from wine stores) and Duchman is so far my favorite.  I prefer red wines and my favorite Duchman wines are the Aglianico and Sangiovese. Since the winery is so close to Austin, my husband and I decided to visit.  The grounds are beautiful - the perfect place for a picnic.  I appreciate the precautions they've taken due to COVID-19 too.  You can't go into the building (though they will let you in if you need to use the restroom), so they are set up outside selling wine by the bottle and require everyone to wear a mask.  There is plenty of space to picnic and social distance.  They sell some picnic meals on-site, but we brought pizza from Pieous, bought a bottle of wine, and had a lovely time relaxing at a picnic table in the shade.  I highly recommend visiting Duchman.  I'm happy there is a winery that makes great wines so close to Austin.  Even if you can't do a tasting during COVID-19, it is still worth the drive to drink wine in a pretty setting!

reviews.author: Em L.
reviews.description: My visit was 5 years. I opened of the bottles I got there finally... dammmmmmn! Its so good !  Go ! You won't regret.

reviews.author: Alice R.
reviews.description: Really beautiful property. We wanted to go to Salt Lick and wanted to find some other activities in the area so came here for a tasting before lunch. They do $15 for 6, which is pretty good, and was offering 5% off your total bill for following them on Instagram.   There's some beautiful benches set up outside to go with your glass of wine. It unfortunately seemed to be drought season when we visited so the actual grape plants were pretty bare. Once you step inside, there's a small room where the tastings happen and the shop where they sell bottles and all kinds of souvenirs. There unfortunately wasn't any seating indoors so we had to stand the entire time. If you walk in more, you can see barrels and label making rooms. Wish they had given us more history during our tasting but it was fun nonetheless.   It was pretty easy to get an uber out here from the city but be warned getting an uber out here may take a little while.

reviews.author: Devika D.
reviews.description: Staff was really friendly and explained all the wine choices to us. I went with my friends and we're not wine connoisseurs so that was super helpful. You order by the bottle. The outdoor area was beautiful and tables were all well distanced for covid.

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: We finally made it to the Wanderlust location on a Tuesday, ahead of leaving for a vacation, as were looking to spend a day just relaxing near home and day drinking. There are tons of choices of wine, and even more places to sit and relax! The staff explains the process to you, but after our first visit, we definitely realized there could have a little better thorough explanation, and notation made about the happy hour each day. My husband and I each received our own card for pours, even though we were on the same tab, so it's VERY easy to lose track of how much you are spending collectively, because your card only shows what YOU have spent so far. The choice to have small, medium and large pours is nice, because even though each wine has a description, you just don't know until you try it! There are several food truck options, but they don't open until later in the day. There are also some mead wines, and some non alcoholic options inside, as well as games to play! There are also dog-friendly areas and water bowls, which are always a plus for us!  Our only complaint was the staff; we arrived just after their posted opening time, but the door was locked. We walked around back, called out to anyone, and got no response. We left for a bit and came back and it was finally opened. We inquired about it with the long staff member after she finally appeared, after about 15 minutes of waiting, and she seemed to think we didn't know what we were talking about. And as I mentioned, the explanation was not very thorough, and we had to wait another 10 minutes to cash out because she kept disappearing. We chalked it up to an one-off thing, and let it go, but it was still quite strange. I would think busier times might be better!

reviews.author: Sara B.
reviews.description: This spot is like the original Wanderlust (put a credit card on file, and you get card to swipe for different wines on what is essentially as a pay per ounce buffet). With this buffet, you're paying more for the nice items, per ounce, though.  This location is larger, though, and more artistic both in the decor and the fact that they have performers there. Additionally, they have a larger selection at this location vs. the original location. That said, while it's a larger selection, there's less variety. At least when I went there they didn't have margarita-inspired wines or mead. If you loooove wine, then, this is the place for you (or if you're looking for a more creative atmosphere), but if not I'd recommend the other location.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I have been to this location back when it was Infinite Monkey Winery. I was sad they closed due to the 'Rona. Anyway, I am glad it is up back and running as Wanderlust.   Upon entering you can grab a glass of mead from the bar area or head into the winery to pay by the pour with your card. They have tons of wines to choose from to include sangrias. There are picnic tables inside and a small courtyard near the food trucks if you want to hang out outdoors.  They have a few food trucks on-site that will be opening soon. One of them was kind enough to pass out bread samples. I am gluten-free but my husband indulged in some delicious bread which he said was AMAZING.  Overall this is a cool little area with more to come to include a coffee place, brewery, and restaurant. I will be back for sure because the location is chill and the wine was good.

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: Location #2 for wanderlust wine did not disappoint!!    The two locations are wildly different it makes you do a double take - is this the same company?? But yes - they can do all the vibes with all the great wines.   This location has a huge barn area for massive parties and events, a cozy interior, and another even cozier private room. The bathrooms are beautiful and the place, although huge, is still absolutely comfortable due to the layout.

reviews.author: Jiyoon S.
reviews.description: Came here on a Tuesday, where it was extremely dead (maybe 15 people tops) and despite an awkward ambiance we had a good time! First off, the space is fantastic - huge lofted ceilings, seamless indoor/outdoor (perfect for COVID), visually interesting seating and art. The indoor portion comes loaded with comfy couches and armchairs which I can appreciate! A fantastic venue that I'm sure would've been much more vibrant during peak hours.  The service is great, really enthusiastic and knowledgeable sommeliers accompany with a great playlist. The wine selection here is decent, definitely a more robust and diverse selection than the downtown location.   Great location for large groups or a birthday party. Would totally come again (albeit on a busier night)!

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: Love the art deco! Variety of areas to seat, including a room with artificial grass. Large room has many picnic tables with transistor radios and manual typewriters adorning them.   Excellent selection of wine and sangria. Provides a great opportunity to try a variety of regions of wines that you would be unable to do in a restaurant setting. However, it is expensive.  I had less than a glass and a half and spent over $20.   There are 3 food trucks, but they were closed when we were there (Sunday).  This would be a great place for a group event or just a large group attendance (that happy hour people forget to RSVP for--this is the place to accommodate them!). It is so spacious in the main room.   Parking is an issue.  It's only available on the street: so carpool or rideshare.

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: I live right next door to the new Wanderlust and was too excited when I learned that they were doing their soft opening. My boyfriend and I came in after dinner one night to see the new location and grab a few drinks and I can definitely say that we'll be back. The wine isn't on tap just yet since they're still finishing up construction but there's still plenty of options and the staff is eager to help. We spoke to Ashley at the bar and she was amazing, she told us all about the building, the wines, events, and what was to come with the space. Not only was the wine great but the atmosphere is just unmatched. The building is decorated floor to ceiling with murals and graffiti art from local Austin artists. I can't wait to come back when the whole package is together!   COVID Precautions: Masks are encouraged and hand sanitizer was provided.

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: I love Wanderlust Wine Company! It's such a fun environment, and they have so many excellent wines to choose from! If you haven't been to the new Eastside location, it is seriously one of the coolest buildings in Austin. There is so much local art there! Plus, the drag shows on Sunday are Dope!

reviews.author: Angela G.
reviews.description: A great place to try different wines and hang out with friends! They have a ton of seating indoor and outdoor. I tried a Moscato and a Sangria, both of which were very delicious! Check them out on their half off days (Mondays).

reviews.author: Kia L.
reviews.description: The inside of wanderlust is so creative! This location decor has a graffiti, gritty feel? They also play a lot of hip hop/ rap which is not only refreshing but gives this place an authentic feel! There is only street parking at the Shady ln location so keep that in mind! Once you arrive you receive a Pour card that you can use to access each tap. They have white wine (Chardonnay, resiling,etc) and red wine varieties. They don't have food but there are separately operated food trucks! Overall I think the wine is a bit over priced but love this space for studying, exploring a creative outlet or chilling with a few friends. It's a VERY quiet space. There's outdoor and indoor seating. I will be back sometime I hope they host comedy or spoken word here... seems like an appropriate venue!

reviews.author: Xia M.
reviews.description: It's a little complicated pouring the tap in the beginning. But once you get the hang of it, you're in! I like the added perk of having a taco truck outback. The interior space is luxurious, and the outside sitting space is reminds me of a barn. You get the best of both worlds. I come here for the sangria, usually on tap #61 and #63, but by the time you're reading this, they may have changed the drinks. This could seem a bit pricey unless you go during a happy hour. When it's not 50% off happy hour on certain days of the week, then an average day will have 30% off from 3pm to 6pm.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: What a fun event. I love the idea of wine by the once. I'll go back for sure. I hope they open up a venue up north.

reviews.author: Joseph Y.
reviews.description: Great little spot with locations downtown and on the east side. Have been to both but we greatly prefer the East side location as it is considerably larger. We like to be able to bring our pup and there "outdoor" area is super pet friendly and is conveniently where all the wines to sample happen to be. The addition of 3 new food trucks is just the icing on the cake. Go check it out, you won't be disappointed!!!

name: The OASIS on Lake Travis
accommodations: Garage Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: sara h.
reviews.description: We were happily suprised at the upgrade in the quality of the service and the menu. We went three years ago and we were so disapointed with the food. We remember saying that even the french fries were horrible.  We had not been back since. We went tonight and the food was fantastic! The service was spot on.  It is now on our list of favorites. Nice job on turning things around!

reviews.author: Jackie G.
reviews.description: The scenery 10/10. The food 10/10 even though there is not much variety, the food was SPOT ON! Melissa was our wonderful server and she made the experience 10x better! She even took the time to go find us outside while we enjoyed the view so our food wouldn't get cold! I will most definitely be visiting on my next Austin trip! Dishes we ate that were very tasty: Beef fajita quesadilla, shrimp quesadilla, the super nachos, and a cheese burger

reviews.author: Jenny F.
reviews.description: Paying for the view  Place: It's a good place for family trip or just get together. The restaurant is surrounded by shops like coffee, ice cream, clothes , candies, photo hub and a lot more. BUT the most magnetizing place here is the view of the lake and the sunset.   Food: The food was not that special but became one because of the view and people/person you are with. Honestly if only the food we rating here, I'll give 3 not bad but not good as well.   Also expect long wait/line for the restaurant. While waiting we roamed around so we didn't really got bored. There's lot of shops and artist that offer their services like, caricature drawing.

reviews.author: Terri B.
reviews.description: Oasis, oh how I love you.   I've been coming to the Oasis for years, literally my whole life. It has always been amazing, and they have expanded it considerably since the fire. The outdoor decks are sprawling, so many places to take in that view. And y'all, it had the absolute most stunning view of Lake Travis.   I just lost my father and was in need of an escape and some fresh air. Today I brought my dad's convertible mustang out (I MAY have gone kinda fast) to have lunch on this perfect blue bird day. I definitely felt his presence out here with me.   My server was so friendly and had the best customer service. I really enjoyed her serving me. I ordered a swirl margarita and chips and queso which were delivered quickly. For lunch I had a mixed fajita with steak and shrimp, refried beans and the fixings. Food was delicious.   I love the art they have installed around the restaurant. Really gorgeous bronze sculptures and we'll appointed gardens.   Thank you for a perfect experience.

reviews.author: Jim H.
reviews.description: The Oasis is great for outdoor dining and has an amazing view of Lake Travis, especially during a sunset.  A couple of weeks ago, I visited Austin for a quick weekend getaway.  A small group of us came out for lunch and we didn't have to wait long because it was an early lunch and the weather was a bit cold.    PROS:  Even though the water level was a bit low, the view of Lake Travis was AMAZING!  Make sure to sit outside to be able to enjoy the view.  During the summer, it's worth it to make reservations during the sunset to get the most out of your experience.  The wait staff are super friendly and are attentive to all your needs.  CONS:  I will echo some of the other reviews on here and say the food is mediocre Tex-Mex at best.  We ordered the shrimp tacos, fish tacos and beef fajitas.  The tacos are decently seasoned, but the rice and beans are a bit bland and the dish overall was a bit cold.  The fajitas did come out nice and hot and the meat was seasoned well.  I will definitely be ordering the fajitas for the next time.  The drinks and desserts we ordered:  an Irish coffee, the Fantasy Chocolate Cake (which is a flourless chocolate) and the flan.  The Chocolate cake was surprisingly delicious while the flan was a bit too thick for my liking, but the flavor is really good.  The area surrounding the restaurant also has eclectic artwork to look at as well as small retail shops to explore.  Due to Covid each store has limited hours so you may want to call ahead to see if they're open.  Overall, it's a great area to sight see in Austin.  Especially if it's your first time.

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: ON LAKE TIME!   It was my last day in Austin and my brother wanted t show me something a little out of the ordinary. We had just been going shopping oh and drinking. I wanted to experience the nature side of Austin.   The Oasis on Lake Travis was the place for us to venture out too. My brother said he had not been to it before, but wanted to try it.   To my surprise it was something grand. Absolutely gorgeous views of the lake and the more upscale houses Austin has to offer.   My brother and my parents had had a bite to eat prior to coming here, but I had not. I went shopping a the Domain and they had gone eating. From what I have heard, The Oasis is good for drinking, but not so good for eating. Their food is honestly sub par at best.   We ordered some drinks and chips and guac for the table. But I wanted something a little more in my stomach. I got the grilled shrimp tacos. They were good. But I have definitely had better. The only thing was that they were super spicy. I was not expecting them to be that spicy. All of a sudden my tongue was sweating and I was uncomfortable with that.   This is a must stop for the views. The views are outstanding. But the food was not the best. The mojito I had was strong. It was like one sip and I was already feeling it.

reviews.author: TJ H.
reviews.description: The Oasis on Lake Travis is one of those tricky places where you have to average out the good with the bad to get a good idea of the place.  The good:  No question about it, the sunset is second to none, awesome views, awesome picturesque scene, and just about all of the outdoor seating has a great view of the scene. An additional positive, is the parking.  Easy to get to, plenty of free parking for the complex they are in, and even has valet parking if you prefer not to walk the 100 yards to the restaurant.  The not so good: I don't want to say the food was necessarily bad, it was just mediocre Mexican cuisine with a relatively small selection compared to your normal Mexican place.  To go along with the mediocre food is a price of about 1.5-2x what you would typically pay, but again you are here for the view not the food. The service also was not bad, but I think "nonchalant" would be the best way to describe it.  So the real question, would I recommend it? Yes I would but just go into it with the right mindset that you are going for the view, you are paying for the view and you will not be disappointed!  I would probably not go back if I am in Austin, but I am glad we went once.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: I don't get the hate. Are the prices high? Yes, but you're paying for the view/ambiance, not necessarily the food. Having said that, the food quality is pretty good and the service has always been good for me (though we are admittedly only there for weekend lunch service since we always have kids).   My shrimp tacos were well flavored and a good (yet not overflowing) portion. Menu wise they could definitely work on their beer selection - need more craft beers and some varied selection of beer styles.

reviews.author: Kristina B.
reviews.description: My friends and I wanted a nice dinner on one of our last nights in Austin. We got to Oasis on a Sunday night about 45 min before sunset and were told the wait would be about 30 min for outdoor seating. We ended up getting seated in like 15 min. The views here are truly unmatched and pictures don't do it justice.  We went to Oasis with the mindset that we were mostly going for the views and not really the food, given the reviews. However, we were actually pleasantly surprised that the food wasn't that bad - overpriced, yes, but not terrible if you get things other than the tacos.  We got quesadillas and burgers.
