The drive is a bit long from ATX but 100000% worth it.  I will be visiting back when the weather is nicer to also enjoy the vineyard next door

reviews.author: Charli V.
reviews.description: Had a great dinner with my partner the other night at Trattoria Lisina. We didn't have an appointment but were able to grab a table right away.  The driveway was hard to see coming off the road but I suppose this is due to the "dark sky" community. Albeit, Some extra signage would be nice.   We ordered meatballs as an appetizer and these were delicious! The garlic toast that comes with this dish is soooo tasty!   Focaccia and oil is complimentary, wish the bread was softer and less greasy but it was free..   We split the taglierini portofino. It was the right amount! The scallops in the dish was perfectly cooked, the shrimp may have been over seasoned but the lemon butter slightly cuts the seasoning.   Over all, We spent about $80 for our meal and 3 drinks.  We were pretty satisfied! Thanks for the great service and delicious Italian!

reviews.author: Anna T.
reviews.description: We had a large party and one of the waitstaff spilled an ENTIRE TRAY of iced water on one of our guests. We understand mistakes happen but NO ONE from management came to apologize and no concessions were made, not even a drink or the meal of the person who got soaked.   Poor management.   The meal was fine and we still have a generous tip despite leaving with horrible sense of proprietorship.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: We brought food from here to a table outside the winery nextdoor.. with wine from the winery. I think this is your best bet if you're looking to eat and be away from crowds (for COVID).  I have to say all the food was good. The linguini was my favorite, followed closely by the mashed potatoes. The breads (focaccia and garlic) were each tasty, i could eat that focaccia all dayyy.  The lasagna was good, a bit heavy for me, though.. but what do you expect with lasagna!  I'd probably skip the Caesar salad next time..  While not my favorite Italian food ever, the grounds are beautiful, and it's a great place to bring a date or some friends and have a picnic style meal with some wine ;)

reviews.author: Mark W.
reviews.description: This place is a visual feast--a beautiful building of European flavor with a substantial Vinyard nearby, surrounded by beautiful oak trees, and beautifully maintained gardens.  While it is not easy to get to, it is the only gourmet restaurant I know of that accommodates helicopters.  (We arrived by car.)  We have met Austin friends here several times and the food has always been excellent, but we all agreed that it is now even better than we had remembered it from pre-covid days.  Warm bread came early with a plate of olive oil and herbs for dipping.  The antipasto plate and the fried calamari were both excellent, with a spicy dipping sauce.  Our friend loved the pasta dish with sautéed scallops, and the 8 ounce filet that my wife and I shared  was the best of our eight decade lifetime.  We will be back again and again.

reviews.author: Ryan C.
reviews.description: Beautiful venue and setting but it's evident this restaurant is struggling from a personnel and management standpoint.  We drove 45min today (Sunday) and arrived before 11 AM - the place was completely empty.  We took a walk around the property and upon return checked in with the hostess for a party of 6.    We were shocked when she asked if we had a reservation.  Looking at the empty restaurant we politely asked if she was sure we needed one?  She mentioned they were short staffed and completely booked, but we could order take out.  Confused, considering the place still only had one table occupied, we left and went to a different venue.

reviews.author: Hilton S.
reviews.description: I must start by saying, Morgan is one of the best servers I have had in recent years.  She was attentive and knowledgeable without being aggressive.  She knew the menu perfectly and made great recommendations. We started with the asparagus salad and prosciutto pizza (upside down as Morgan recommended). The asparagus was grilled perfectly with a slight char to it. The pestos on the salad were amazing. The pizza was crisp and delicious. Honestly, it couldn't have been better. I then had the duck breast with cranberries and my dining partner had the ribeye.  Both were cooked perfectly and seasoned just right.  For dessert we got tiramisu.  It was light and delicious. The mascarpone was airy and lady fingers had just the right bit of liquor. The decor was a bit "overdone" for my taste, but I can't dare take away any points for my view on that. Really a solid 5.

reviews.author: Taye M.
reviews.description: Wow! Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. This is the place to go if you want Texas fancy. What I mean is it's a relaxed but beautiful place. The food is worth every penny.

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: We ordered a little bit of everything for my sisters birthday! Wish I had gotten more picture of the food, but we really enjoyed ourselves and the conversation. My favorite dish was the fettuccini Alfredo with shrimp. Highly recommend the tiramisu!

reviews.author: Mandy T.
reviews.description: Tuscan feel, amazing food and wine!  Loved the pasta lemon butter and shrimp.  Super delish and don't forget the tiramisu - so delish and huge helping

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: First ever dining experience at Trattoria Lisina.  We we did for a special occasion, a "mile stone birthday."  We drove 1-1/2 hours to get there!  Let's start with negatives (which I don't normally do!).  The most expensive menu item, aside from the bottle of wine, was a pistachio encrusted red snapper filet.  The fish was 2x over cooked, and was tough as leather.  The main problem was it's a filet, skin on, blood line still intact.  As a seasoned Gulf fisherman and chef, I know you need the blood line cut out of the filet, even the fishing guys on YouTube get that.  Great piece of fish, tough to cut even with the knife provided.  It's not all about presentation.  Issue raised with waiter (Joseph S), and "he could have the manager come over to discuss."  As a waiter, when the dish is bad, take it away and redo!  The craft cocktails were OK, not worth the $14-$15 price tag.  The star of the evening was the calamari fritti, which was great!  Fresh, hot, tartar and marinara sauces were on point, terrific.  The veal osso buco, the best in TX, by far!  There's something about fresh bone marrow!  Dessert was the tiramisu, which was awesome, until James S added to the bill.  Overall, Trattoria Lisina is a "destination" restaurant, but for the $$, it's not worth the hype.  Enjoy one of the Mandola locations in ATX, the food is better and the price tag is 80% less ...

reviews.author: Keith R.
reviews.description: A hidden gem nestled within in a vineyard in the hill country just a few minutes from our abode.   Definitely a must-go-to for special occasions in groups, or when looking for a cozy romantic setting.

reviews.author: Nicole B.
reviews.description: Driving to Trattoria Lisina from Austin is always a fun field trip out into a totally different part of Texas. No traffic, windy two lane roads and there you are, in a vineyard in the middle of nowhere. I'd have never guessed a place the size and class of Trattoria Lisina would be nestled in hill country like this.  The inside felt distinctly Houston/Dallas vibes: much more corporate and big scale than a little mom-and-pop, but in a good way. Nice and air conditioned with plenty of space too. Now for the food:  The focaccia they serve with garlic/herb olive oil is OUTSTANDING. I could have eaten it all night, so so good. Like fools we ALSO ordered garlic bread. The garlic bread was toasted baguette slices that were burnt and dried. No bueno. Also: how is one bread item the best thing on the menu and the other maybe the worst? Strange, but anyway, don't get the garlic bread when you have garlic oil and bread in your lap, overflowing. The calamari was ok but the entrees were amazing. The osso buco was SO TENDER and so full of flavor. It came with a little marrow spoon and was a huge portion. My husband got the crispy duck with polenta cakes and cranberry salsa and he was a big fan too.   The service was so nice and sweet and the setting was beyond stunning. I really liked my time here and would definitely take guests when they visit too!

reviews.author: Cynthia D.
reviews.description: This restaurant came highly recommended to us so we had high expectations.   First off, the free focaccia they give you is the bomb. Best item we ate all night.   We ordered garlic toast and it was BURNT. We were told that is how it normally is but we asked for it to be taken off of our ticket. All we could taste was char.   I had the fettuccine con prosciutto. It was ok. I would've preferred thinner prosciutto. I also added chicken and it seemed like it was frozen not fresh. Would I order it again,no.   We did also order the garlic potatoes and they were really good. They really only tasted like the cheese in them but they were great.   We ordered the tiramisu and chocolate caramel cake. Tiramisu is rum HEAVY and I mean it. The chocolate caramel cake was overly salty. I couldn't even eat it. I do normally like "salty" desserts so this was a bummer.   Service was ok. Took awhile for refills. Would I come back, probably not. Great ambiance but based on what we ordered we wouldn't come back.

reviews.author: Erin M.
reviews.description: Best upscale restaurant in the Austin south suburbs. Wonderful setting for kiddos as they have a play scale. Great to order a glass or three of wine and sit outside in the gorgeous venue. Everything tastes amazing and the service has a high level of attention. Been here 4-5 times with family and date night. Just love it!

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: A second (or maybe third) run at Trattoria Lisina. Owned by the Mandola family, it's a nicely isolated property with vineyards along the drive, play structures and other outside amenities, a pretty outdoor dining area with umbrellas for the tables and a vine covered facade that demands to be Italian. The inside if modern rustic upscale Italian. They are obscenely popular, so plan to make reservations well in advance. Don't expect to walk in and get a table.  Service today by Jeremy was impeccable. He was hyper attentive and considerate. One of our party has a citrus allergy, and he adapted wonderfully to that.  We started with fried calamari and some artichoke frittatas from the antipasti menu. The calamari was tasty and not over cooked, and the serving was the size of Cleveland. We never finished it. The frittelle al carciofi (artichoke fritters) were scrumptious and unique. What an interesting and creative use of artichoke. The spicey Mayo and marinara sauces were ordinary but fitting.  As it was brunch time, I had a Bloody Mary while she had their Sicilian margarita. Both were well executed. I chose the grilled asparagus salad for my main course. Nearly to die for. The asparagus was grilled just enough, crisp not mushy, beautifully presented, and the mixed greens were fresh, and the dried tomato pesto spiraled outside was rich. She had the Insalata Mista, a mixed greens salad with shrimp added. And she loved it. Since we'd indulged pretty heavily on the calamari and their incredible bread, Jeremy accommodated with a half size salad for her.  We'd intended to have a desert, but, since we'd been such greedy swine with the bread and artichoke fritters and calamari, we had to forego.   Trattoria Lisina lived up to their billing. Actually, they exceeded it. Well done, folks.

reviews.author: Scott D.
reviews.description: The only restaurant we visit on every trip to the Lone Star State of Texas. Beautiful Italian setting partially surrounded by vineyards with impeccable food that will more than please the palate.

reviews.author: Nancy G.
reviews.description: I made reservations for a girls day lunch and  was disappointed.  I've been here on several other occasion with food and waitstaff being spot on.  Today wasn't one of those days.   We were seated and immediately greeted by our waitress.  She left us with our menus  and within 2 minutes came back to as if we were ready to order.  We shared we hadn't had a chance to view the menu.  She returned within another few minutes, we had decided to order calamari to start with.  We ordered wine after the 4th time she stopped at our table.  We ordered our entree, she came by and asked if she could remove our plates as we're eating some of their delicious focaccia bread.  We let her know we were still working on it.  Another five minutes passed and she picked up the plates.  After about 10 minutes she came to see what plates she could remove.  This was how the rest of our lunch went. As for the food, the calamari was rubbery.  I had ordered pasta alla nino and the chicken seemed like it was a precooked fillet that been microwaved for too long with the pasta being hard on the ends.  They did right by taking it back and not charging me for it.  However, the waitress didn't ask if I'd prefer something else.

reviews.author: Mark K.
reviews.description: Lovely location for a date for anyone coming to Driftwood or living close by in the Buda/Kyle/S. ATX area. My wife and I came here for our anniversary a few months ago and loved it. Came back and brought some out of state guests and they loved it as well. Beautiful location, great food, and wonderful views if you're seated by a window. Service is always on point, and the staff is wonderful. Yes.. it is from the founder of Carrabba's, but this feels much more personable and more of a "pet project" on a winery - so don't go in with the mindset your getting chain Italian. Hint: the later you go, the fewer kids that are around, which lends itself to a more intimate dinner with less iPads.  As for the food - the lasagna is a favorite, and the artichoke fritters were excellent this go around. We always get the caprese and it's always so fresh, with wonderful burrata.

reviews.author: Marley D.
reviews.description: would not recommend, the owner knowingly harbored the  fugitive/insurrectionist Luke Coffee, aka the "High Five Cowboy" who assaulted Capitol Police with a crutch on J6. FTP.

reviews.author: Nicole W.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine was a fun experience for my husband and I. As I was reading some of the other reviews, I learned that you could make your own wine. I called ahead to see if there were any open appointments on a Friday afternoon and Jenny answered. She has a very fun, bubbly personality and told us to swing by anytime. We were able to taste several different wines before we decided what we wanted to make. We spent about 1-1.5 hours there. We look forward to designing our own wine bottle labels and returning in 6-8 weeks to bottle the wine.

reviews.author: Jen B.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place. The owner, Jenny, is the best. She's fun, friendly, thoughtful. All the staff are wonderful.   I've made many batches of wine here. The wine making process is really fun from tasting and selecting the wine you want, to making it and, the  funnest part, bottling. You can customize your wine label and they print it for you to put on the bottles.   You can bring your own snacks and get a bottle to enjoy.   I would highly recommend everyone to try making a batch of wine at water to wine. They make great Xmas gifts too.

reviews.author: Neshia R.
reviews.description: Let's start with how cute this place is! I walked in and felt like I had been invited into someone's home the staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable im from out of town and im so glad I made the stop here  before heading home! Ambience is nice 3 free wine tasting and the bottle prices are extremely reasonable and you can make your own wine. If you're looking for a place with a good vibe where everyone feels like family this is the place will return every time im in Austin!!

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine is perfect for so many occasions... date night, girls night, happy hour, a pop-in for a glass of wine, or a night of wine making/bottling with friends. We were sad when the Round Rock location closed down, but found this place to be a million times better. The decor is cute and thematic, with tons of inviting spots for seating, whether you're looking for a romantic spot for two, or some couches for a larger gathering. The best part is the staff - super friendly and helpful while we try to make the tough decision of what to drink or take home. The free samples help too!   Making our own batch of wine is a yearly tradition for us. We get together with friends to start the wine (which of course involves a good time trying the different wines first), design our own labels (or get help from W2W), throw a gathering to bottle the wine, then have bottles to hand out as wedding favors, Christmas gifts, or generic gifts.   We are club members, so we stop by at least monthly for a couple glasses of wine and to pick up our bottles to enjoy at home. Whether you're joining wine club, making a batch, or just stopping in for a glass or two, Water 2 Wine is a fantastic neighborhood gem. I only wish they were in my neighborhood!

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine is best described (at least as they themselves put it) as 'Build-a-Bear for Adults'!    I visited this establishment thinking it was a simple wine tasting spot.  Actually, they also provide services as your own personal vintner and label maker, where you can taste, create, and label your own wine!  While I have yet to try this full service out, the staff was very friendly, the wine (tried the whites only) was excellent, and you can palpably feel how fun the process is.  Definitely coming back to celebrate good times with a custom-made wine!

reviews.author: Joy W.
reviews.description: Ok, but why is this place SO cute?!  I went here for a wine tasting years ago with a girlfriend and as a fun catch up, we decided to meet back here.  What a fun tradition we want to continue!  The staff here is outstanding, they have great thought, and make you feel comfortable.  We had some neighbors at a different table order food in and  thought that was hilariously brilliant!  You are definitely recommended to buy a bottle as all winery's usually do, but this spot doesn't make you feel pushed to - which makes me want to buy another bottle.  I love that this is tucked away in the city and you don't have to go to the city limits to do a wine tasting.  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this to any and all of you!

reviews.author: Alexandra M.
reviews.description: Came here with friends who decided they wanted a wine baby and we tagged along to help them taste wines. It is a very laid-back tasting room. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Prices are reasonable and tasting is free. You can even make your own wine, which is exactly what we tagged along to do and that gets you 28-30 bottles. Highly recommend this place - Cheri and Jenny are so knowledgeable and make the whole process so easy and fun!  Only downside, no Texas wines... but this isn't necessarily a con -  all their wines are made on-site with grapes from various vineyards.

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: The wine they make is so tasty. They let you have three samples so that you can find the wine you would enjoy.  When I come here I always take home a bottle.  The staff is veery knowledgeable and friendly.  They also do custom labels if you buy I case I believe.

reviews.author: Maria G.
reviews.description: What a lovely place to sip some wine and worth doing the wine club membership if you like wine in the slightest even.  The staff are awesome. They make excellent suggestions whether you know what you're looking for or not. They can get you going in the right direction.  Sulfite free wine? Is my understanding. I don't know a lot about wine, but know that's a good thing to be free of. I can say the ports and fruity wines are a good dessert. My family and friends love the other wines.

reviews.author: Natasha C.
reviews.description: I just love this place !! They are so friendly and even if you are new they treat you like family. The wine is good and the cheese platter is huge ! One of my absolute favorite places I've discovered since moving to Austin !

reviews.author: Taylor T.
reviews.description: Went in not knowing what to expect from the store front but was pleasantly surprised. Personable and knowledgeable stuff and many wines to try! Your first 3 wine tastings are free and then a dollar per tasting after that. Additionally you can make you own wine which is a unique experience!

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: If you are a young couple, or an old couple, or an odd couple, and you decide you want a wine baby, you may be a bit worried about where, when and how to do that.  It's a big step and you should have nothing but the best for your Vino Bambino, so please look no further than Water 2 Wine, and Jenny in particular.  She is the BEST midwife for your wine labor.    We just had the best experience making, bottling and labeling our wine baby.  It was smoooooth sailing and immediately made me want another :)  When you decide to make your own wine, first, you'll get to sample the wines, ALL of them if you so wish.  I spent two afternoons sampling bunches of them and all the staff were generous and enthusiastic in helping me find which wine I wanted.  Then, you make an appt for conception.  It's fairly simple  and pleasurable.  Again, you can grab a glass of wine as you work, mixing the juice and water and yeast in a giant white bucket (Carboy), churning away for about 10 minutes and then your part is done for about 6 weeks!  The rest of the staff will ensure that your baby gestates comfortably and appropriately, testing its ph and sugars until its ready to be born.  Then the magic happens.  As the parent, you'll have full creativity in naming your baby.  In which case, you can pick any 3 images you like, decide the wording and color scheme and font of the label, email all that to Jenny and she'll print out the most perfect labels.  You can then invite a bunch of friends to witness and help in the birthing.  You can bring in all kinds of snack ems and the fine ladies at Water 2 Wine will immediately ply your guests with tastings of their wine and you can buy bottles (and bottles) to facilitate in the birthing process.  Everyone in your party can try their hand at filling bottles, corking bottles, melting the lid foils, and sticking on labels.  In the end, you'll have about 30 bottles of fantastic wine ( I recommend the Gruner!) to share and take home.    They make for fantastic house warming, business, wedding, new baby, Christmas, Hanukkah, etc gifts.  In fact, if you decide last minute you'd like to adopt a wine baby for Christmas, they keep a bunch already made and ready to label for your Christmas party or gifts.    Best thing was, our friends had so much fun and it was such a new experience for all of us that we WIN again as the hostess with the mostest.  And, even though I had grand plans of using this wine at our housewarming party, I doubt it'll last another 8-10 months so we may indeed make another baby next year.    Jenny and the rest of the staff really made this so much fun and interesting with all their cool contraptions and accomodated me with the music I wanted (got to have appropriate Edith Piaf wine birthing music!) and never left a wine glass dry in my group.    So grab your partner, in life, in business, in crime, and get to makin that baby! They're the best kind of babies, they don't puke or shit or cry and instead of causing you stress, they relieve it.  And in the end you'll have the coolest collectible bottles.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: I love this place! My husband and I come regularly, and  from the minute we walk in the door, it feels like we're visiting old friends. Jenny, Dustin and Cheri are knowledgeable, friendly and so much fun. Every visit is a good visit.

reviews.author: Stacy S.
reviews.description: Jenny was fantastic! First time here and we had a great time. Wine was amazing and the service was incredible.  Between my in laws and my husband we took a a few bottles home with us. We will be back for sure and would love a Cedar Park location!

reviews.author: Robert W.
reviews.description: Love this place! Great place to stop for a glass of wine and taste a few more after a long day of work!

reviews.author: Kate F.
reviews.description: Visited Water2Wine for my birthday this past December. LOVED IT! Cute, cute tasting room with tons of puzzles and activities, plus adorable furnishings. The menu was huge and the options would suit almost every taste. You can also print out custom labels for your bottles! TONS of fun for a big group, or an intimate outing. You can also bring your own appetizers to come sit and enjoy while tasting some delicious wines.

reviews.author: Jesse D.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine has taken your normal wine drinking experience and given it a unique spin by providing you the keys to the winery and letting you become the vintner. You make your own batch of wine, create custom labels, bottle it, and best of all, taste the fruits of your labor. By having you do this work on site they are able circumvent certain regulations resulting in less sulfites and other chemicals than store bought wines.  I have been visiting Water 2 Wine for about five years and actually created a batch with my wife and we gave the custom bottles of wine away as gifts at our wedding. The gifts were a hit.   Water 2 Wine imports their grapes and juices from other vineyards. This is not uncommon for vineyards in Texas as most don't grow enough grapes, if any, to meet their own demand. When you decide to make a batch this is where you will start. You will mix the juice, and depending on the type of wine you are making will add flavors like oak.  After you make the wine it will go in the back room for fermentation where the staff will guide the wine along over the next six to eight weeks changing containers around six times.  About two months later you will come back and bottle your wine. You add your label, fill the bottle, cork it and shrink wrap foil around the top. Like a good chef test tasting food a lot of quality assurance goes on during this process. This is a perfect event to bring along a group of friends. Hopefully you end up bottling more wine than you drink.   You don't have to make wine. Water 2 Wine is also a spacious wine bar, with a large selection of wine, where you can stop in just to drink some wine. All of the wine is made on site by the employees. They don't sell food but you are welcome to bring in food to eat with your wine. There are plenty of tasting options or you can buy by the glass or bottle. The staff is very friendly and have been one of my favorite aspects of every visit.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: Very friendly, exuberant staff.....check. Interesting concept (make your own wine!) and fun factor....sure, check. Free wine tasting (5 tastes offered).....check. Their "ready made" wines.....uh well, let's just say I do not believe you can make decent wine out of water; and from the wines I sampled it seems that's just what they are trying to do.

reviews.author: Linda M.
reviews.description: Attended a fun wine pairing class (groupon deal) -- a great time and highly recommended! I have an alcohol allergy (it's an Asian thing! ;-), so it's awesome to learn about and try some low sulfite wines. I'm not really a fan of wine (or alcoholic beverages in general) for obvious reasons, but if I were, I'd buy it all here! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Carie H.
reviews.description: The team at W2W knows their stuff. I'm only disappointed I didn't visit here earlier in life. The crew is helpful, knowledgeable and always friendly.   Whether it's a glass of vino after work, a place to gather on weekends with friends or a fun place to work remote during the week W2W has it all.   I always thought you could only make wine here and was surprised to learn it's also a wine bar and retail destination.   Stop by and challenge the team to find you the perfect glass- they won't disappoint.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: The food here is simple and delicious.  We had the half chicken which was fried in beef fat but no batter. Very crispy skin but tender on the inside. The spinach and mushrooms were well seasoned and delicious.  The Caesar salad was amazing. The dressing was delicious and the chicken on top was perfectly grilled. The flavor tasted like it has been brined for a while--perfectly salty and tender.  The brown butter cake was not very good and the fries were just alright.  Overall, food: 4.5/5 Service: 4/5  Very pricey but you pay for high quality ingredients.

reviews.author: Maddie B.
reviews.description: I was seriously disappointed by my experience here at salt and time which had been highly recommended to me by a friend. They missed pretty much every mark in terms of a good dinner experience. Let me elaborate.  We got there an hour before closing around 8pm, and were going to try to get in and out quick and didn't want to make them stay too late after closing. Well, we didn't have a choice because right off the bat we had to wait for menus for probably five minutes, waited another 10 for the waiter to come take our order, and when we finally placed our order probably 20 minutes had gone by so we put our whole order in at once.  We ordered the little gem Caesar-type salad, a ribeye (MR) and Teres Major (mr).  We waited (literally) 45 minutes for our salad!!! Waiter kept telling us it was coming and at the 40-min mark he asked "you guys still haven't gotten your salad?" Seriously!!!? It's your job to bring it to us and we've asked you about it three times now!  Keep in mind the restaurant was nearly empty by now. When we finally got it there was minimal apology and he seemed very nonchalant like it wasn't a big deal and turns out it wasn't even little gems. I grow little gems and serve them at the restaurant where I work and was super excited for them but this was just a regular iceberg wedge. After 1.5hrs of waiting at this point, steaks came out. Sauces were all wrong and not what we ordered and my steak was over cooked! Clearly medium and not medium rare since my partners was cooked correctly, there was an obvious difference. But at this point, being checked on by our waiter was a ten minute affair so we just shut up and ate it because it was getting late. There were no apologies, no comps, and the waiter kept trying to push us on dessert when we clearly were ready to leave. Dropped the check and proceeded to say "there's no rush!" ... yeah no sh*t I can tell that's definitely a motto here. And on top of that there was automatic 20% gratuity. I usually don't mind that, because most restaurant that do auto-grat have good service where I would've tipped 20% anyways. but it should not be a motivator for the servers to not give a crap about their tables like it is here.   The steaks tasted good but for the price, the horrible service and the inability to get orders right, this place was a total wash. You can get better steaks elsewhere for a cheaper price, where you actually enjoy your dining experience. Maybe in the future if they got new staff or management this place could be a really nice restaurant but for now, I can't recommend it.

reviews.author: Keith C.
reviews.description: Pretty miserable experience. There were at least 5 open tables when we sat down so they were not busy. It took 10 minutes for the waitress to give us a menu and immediately ask for our drink orders. 20 minutes later we get them. We've been here for 30 minutes and haven't gotten to place our order yet.   I order the $52 filet as did my friend. I ordered mine medium rare, he ordered his medium. His looked well done but he likes his meat well done so he didn't care. Mine however was completely raw on the inside. Not "cooked rare" raw. This thing was seared for maybe 10 seconds. It was also very tough. The waitress just dropped off our food and we were waiting for steak knives for 10 minutes until I walked to the hostess and asked for them.   I sent the steak back and it took at least 25 minutes to get it back. At this point so did not want to pay $52 for a reheated steak so I asked another waitress to grab me a burger instead so I could get the hell out of here. They come back with my steak, which was missing a piece, that had clearly been thrown into an oven or microwave to increase the internal temperature.   If you're coming here expecting an artisan or holistic steakhouse experience, go somewhere else. If you're looking for some $15 cocktails to drink in a gentrified strip mall butcher shop, this is the place for you!   My experience was so bad that I considered contacting my credit card for a refund. It was that bad.

reviews.author: Amy M.
reviews.description: One of the best butcher shops in town. Quality pork chops and steaks. Well priced for the quality. Have not seen a NY strip as well marbled as what they have and the pork chops only needed to be seasoned with salt and pepper they were so good!

reviews.author: Ken K.
reviews.description: Great pitcher shop as well as restaurant. Service is a little slow but worth the wait. The burger meat is fantastic. A perfect blend of fat and meat. It is incredibly flavorful. The fries they have are also wonderful. Super crunchy and yummy.

reviews.author: Jinhyung K.
reviews.description: Came here on a burger recommendation. It was a nice little place for brunch. I don't if I was just bad at finding it, but apparently they only have the brunch and dinner menu on the weekend. The lunch menu is only offered on weekdays so if you're wanting to come here for the lunch menu on the weekend, you are out of luck.   But their brunch menu still does offer a burger, the Butcher's Breakfast burger to be exact. It's pretty much the normal Butcher burger but with eggs and bacon added on, and i think cheaper too. I got it medium and it was a nice, hearty burger. It was a juicy, steak-y patty and the brioche bun was quite soft. I probably should've just taken the bacon and eggs out and eaten it separately though. It got a little to big for me.   Beef fat fries are a must try though. Nice soft potato filling, with a slight crisp. I might be wrong, but I tasted a hint of cinnamon and it had a quiet deep fried donut flavor that I am all too familiar with. Very addicting.   Came here on a 1PM Saturday and there was no wait, but I do here it does get crazy busy during dinner times so make sure you have a reservation. Our server was really sweet. The place overall had a calm and chill atmosphere and felt very clean.

reviews.author: Kelly F.
reviews.description: Great Prime Rib for Christmas, we selected the Wagyu beef and it was amazing! Easy ordering system and our order was ready right on time, easy pickup.  We get a little credit for the rosemary and salt rub but honestly you need the top quality beef to start. Thank you and we will be back.

reviews.author: Wayne N.
reviews.description: Best burger in town without a doubt. My friend was singing it's praises for a while and so a group of us showed up all ordering it. Go figure. But it lives up to the hype for sure. It's basically made from trimmings from the butcher shop, so it's ground pretty fresh, seasoned well and honestly tastes almost steak like from the cuts, so highly recommend medium rare or medium on the burger. It's also massive, so no chance you'll leave hungry. Some fresh veg and a nicely toasted bun round off the sandwich. I would also recommend adding some bacon at least to your burger, as it's crisp contrast and who doesn't like bacon.  As if that's not enough, the sides there are also A+. The beef fat fries have a lot of flavor, but also thick enough that you can appreciate the pillowy potato inside. The what I assume house made ketchup adds some needed acidity to all the food but jives well with everything. The shishito pepper app is also really good if you can tolerate a little bit of burn.  Service is a bit on the slow side at the restaurant, so I would definitely recommend getting a reservation if you can but also being patient and just enjoy the decor and conversations with people. The appetizers came out same time as the food too, so waiting an hour for food at 1pm on a Monday afternoon sounds a bit long, but good thing we had good company at least.

reviews.author: Lisa S.
reviews.description: Everything on the menu is tasty (our group got a wide range) but it's the reverence for the meat that makes this place stand out. Every steak fritte from here on out will be compared to this one. Also butcher shop on one side and wine store on the other. Perfection!!!

reviews.author: Keith K.
reviews.description: Wasn't overly impressed. Actually, we were a little disappointed. We expected much more. The server spoke too softly and mumbled a lot. It was very difficult to hear what she was trying to tell us. Even the younger guest with perfect hearing said they couldn't understand her. Then the food came. It was like the Goldilocks story. Some food was cold, some was overdone, and some was just right. Austin is a big place with many other places to try before we'll attempt to return here.

reviews.author: Jesus Y.
reviews.description: Two stars cause food taste good, my experience the place takes advantage and price everything possible, they charge me in my burger the tomatoes the lettuce, the ice tea 3 dollars and the refill 3 dollars and the small glass of no more then 12 oz has 60% ice .... They charge me the fries and they add a service fee of around 20% on a 2 person 2 meals .  I feel sorry for the waitress I can see she was hesitant about bringing stuff to the table probably cause she knows they charge for everything.... Btw the lobby is close and we had to eat outside with tons flies joining us

reviews.author: Brad G.
reviews.description: They served me a sirloin instead of a ribeye. Lol. Having worked in the industry I politely asked two people if I had been given a sirloin by mistake and they both said no. OMG.  All the servers were in a bad mood ... probably because of something happening with the restaurant. I thought outside would be charming, but it was full of flies.  The catchup was great, though.

reviews.author: m k.
reviews.description: Wine shop staffed by people who know almost nothing about the wine on the shelves and are there to ring up a register that also doesnt take cash.....what a joke.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Brunch today allowed me to check another big name off my list. I heard their Butcher's Burger is the best in Austin, so with nothing else calling to me off the menu, I had to try it. It was ok, I think? It was so tall and hard to eat that it was hard to really process and appreciate the flavor. They cooked it right, but the runny egg made the bun slide everywhere and mayo seemed like overkill. The Beef Fat Fries were pretty good, but not so good that I felt compelled to eat the whole serving. My favorite thing was the Charcuterie Plate that we split before the meal, especially the summer sausage, mortadella, and unidentifiable pink pickles. My friends loved their Steak and Eggs. I tried a bite of a friend's French Toast and would have gladly eaten more! While we were waiting for our food, browsing the butcher shop was interesting, and I liked seeing what products exist even if I wasn't in the market to buy anything. Service was attentive. I'm already planning on coming back again sometime because I know other carnivorous friends will love it. But now it's time for an afternoon nap!

reviews.author: Steven X.
reviews.description: Absolutely loved our meal at Salt and Time. I got their burger and it was fantastic. Cooked perfectly medium rare, juicy as can be, and with a bun that really held up. The reviews don't lie. GET THE BURGER. Oh and the fries were bomb too.   My wife got the BBLT (beef bacon), and I have to say, it was the best BLT I've ever had. On top of favor, the portion was ginormous. Though, it didn't hold up as well as a leftover.   All in all, highly highly recommend, especially once they open dine in. The patio seating is nice but way too hot during the summer

reviews.author: Mary Jane C.
reviews.description: I love look and feel of this place. It's very welcoming. I ordered the butcher's burger with fries and Swiss cheese. The first bite I almost fainted! The flavor was amazing! Wow! I have a favorite burger place in Hawaii called Teddy's and so far I haven't had anything tipped that until today. I normally don't get my burger med rare but damn it was good! From the ketchup and the fries to the burger! I loved it! My first experience was great! Too bad I'm an out of towner! I'd make this a regular spot!

reviews.author: Tatiana T.
reviews.description: Went last night for quick dinner and was absolutely blown away. First and foremost the Beef Tartare is probably one of the best beef tartares I have ever eaten in my life - the mix of flavor was just incredible, and the steak was perfectly diced! I could eat this everyday. Absolutely superb.  We also got the Cesar salad to start which was another hit. For the main we shared the Wagyu NY Strip, side of fries and broccolini, and the sweet corn agnolotti. My ONLY complaint was that there wasn't a larger portion of the agnolotti, delicious stuffed pillows of creamy sweet corn. Service was friendly and hospitable, will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Barbara P.
reviews.description: Salt and Time, in east Austin, is a wonderful butcher shop, as well as a great restaurant.  Covid brought the addition of the upscale butcher shop, complete with many house-made items, terrines and fine meats...very impressive selections.   During Covid they also expanded into a new patio for dining, complete with large overhead fans, which made a very pleasant setting on a warm evening.   My daughter and I enjoyed a really great Charcuterie Board, that included 4 wonderful house-made meats, accoutrements and sauces. We shared it and both loved it.  We also shared their absolutely delicious Butcher Burger, made from steak trimmings. It was cooked perfectly and served on a brioche bun with all the trimmings, and the best French fries we've had in a long time.    We will definitely return to this east side neighborhood gem!!

reviews.author: Abby A.
reviews.description: Best butcher shop in town! If you're looking for a specialty cut of meat, give this place a look. They'll likely have it or be able to source it for you, with enough notice. Whenever I'm craving a wagyu ribeye or NY strip, this is my first stop.

reviews.author: Robert R.
reviews.description: Amazing! Great local grub. Best Berger I've had in a while. I'll definitely be back again.

reviews.author: Larry E.
reviews.description: I love this quiet oasis away from the chaos of other places! The Barolo is really good and I grabbed another bottle today and also picked up a Pinot Grigio.  The wines do not have the chemicals that I don't think should be added. A wine should stand on its own!  "Custom wine without the chemicals"  Supremely good! I'm a wine snob as I was raised with it and also living and working around the world I was able to have some of the best wines in the world. No, I am not rich . Wines that are sent to the states are really jacked up in price and I was able to get what I wanted and bring it back. One thing I did learn is that you don't drink an expensive wine as a part of the meals but enjoy it on its own. I bought 2 bottles of Barolo to have with an Italian meal. It was a great fit. This little place has fulfilled the perfect fit! The lady who owns the place and makes the wine is quite nice and understand all of the above. I will be back!

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: The owner heavily supported the riot and charging of the senate today. She thinks BLM is a sham and is a major supporter of attacking protestors. Also doesn't believe in masks or covid.

reviews.author: Montalvo A.
reviews.description: This owner supports the terrorist who attacked he capitol today! Not a business I will ever support again!

reviews.author: Chuck C.
reviews.description: Just stopped in at this cool place after eating next door...nice wine tasting environment - great bar, good vibe, super cute dog, beautiful mural painted on the wall and a friendly owner.   Bought a bottle of the Tuscan blend on the recommendation of the owner - I will open, taste and add a review later - I'm only giving it 4 stars for now because I haven't tried the wine, but I like the place...more to come!

reviews.author: Marco G.
reviews.description: The owner openly supports terrorism, sedition, and chaos. Dont support this business.

reviews.author: Desiree S.
reviews.description: Sunday afternoon - the OPEN sign is on, we have just had a really great meal next door and I have always wanted to go into this place.   So, we walked in and no one was in there. Thought to myself...maybe they are in the back. Talked a little louder with my husband and daughter and the cute little dog that greated us.  Then this woman walks in and we made cordial small talk.  I asked if they were open because she seemed quite perturbed that we were inside. Confused because I had seen the open sign. I asked "Are you open?"  She said annoyed "We are getting there...."  We quickly walked out and will not grace those doors again!  Rudeness doesn't win! Love and kindness wins!!

reviews.author: Toni A.
reviews.description: Best wine I have had in a long time out of the United States. It has low tannins and robust flavors. Mary is the definition of a connoisseur. They do custom wine bottle labels and build gift baskets. MY FAVORITE!!! Her shop is filled with fun items and the cutest dog ever!!!

reviews.author: Becky M.
reviews.description: First winery on our Mom Daughter wine adventures in Austin.  Called ahead of time to get the scoop.  Immediately fell in love with Mary's sass.  Uber'd over and was not disappointed.  Although they don't serve food, she suggested a few restaurant take outs nearby and allowed us to bring in and eat there.  Mary does it all!  Wine maker extraordinaire she is!  Loved our first wine stop experience!

reviews.author: Joseph R.
reviews.description: This lady was so rude to my friend and I. You could tell she wanted nothing to do with us and tried to rush our tasting as fast as possible. She did not want to answer any of our questions and not once looked us in the eye. I'm not sure if she is a racist, homophobe, doesn't like young people, or all of the above but you could tell we were not welcome. I would never come here again and I continue to tell my friends and family to never come here too.

reviews.author: Nikki J.
reviews.description: I DO NOT like wine, and found two wines I LOVED! My husband who does not like wine either LOVED this wine. Place was small but family owned. I felt real relaxed and comfortable and enjoyed my tasting! Owner was so nice! Going to sign up for the monthly wine club because the wine was SO good. Defiantly recommend this place! Went with a bachelorette party and the owner was accommodating to all 13 of us, and found a wine each of us loved! Go for the GREAT wine!

reviews.author: Courtney W.
reviews.description: RUDE service and bad wine.  Menu isn't even accurate, i.e.: mislabeled as Italian wines but really French.  There are so many better places in the Austin area. Do not waste your time.

reviews.author: Lisa R.
reviews.description: This place seems to attract a lot of women's meet ups and networking groups, which is obviously why I know of it. The owner is jovial and the atmosphere is good for a casual meet up.

reviews.author: Samuel C.
reviews.description: I'm not a drinker.  I have a low tolerance for alcohol, and wine hits me particularly hard.  But I attended a group wine tasting here with a friend yesterday, and thus our tale begins...  I got there as the second serving of a six-wine tasting was progressing, and I was immediately struck by the smoothness of the wine that was being served at the moment, a Gewurtraminer.  Shortly after sipping that wine, I mentioned that I had almost no tolerance for alcohol.  Steve, the master of ceremonies for the tasting, told the group that Austin Custom Wineries did not add sulphites, the major cause of wine intolerance, into their wine as most wineries do for preservative purposes.  As a result, though the wines should be drunk within five years, the wines are eminently drinkable for even the lightest of weight drinkers like me.  Seriously, I can't even finish a bottle of beer (Shiner).  So I was able to partake in the tasting!  I didn't drink all of each of the wines, but I had more than I normally would have felt comfortable with (to avoid headaches), and I suffered absolutely zero ill effects.  It was amazing.    Also amazing: ACW's selection of dessert wines--ports and ice wines.  Maybe I'm just not a fancy wine connoisseur, but those dessert wines are drinkable and tasty.  And since they have no added sulphites, all I have to worry about is the alcohol content!

reviews.author: Scott K.
reviews.description: Was glad to finally visit this winery.  Met one of the owners.  He was very welcoming and gave us so much information about the wines his winery makes.  We tasted 6 wines for a $10 fee.  The grape juice is purchased and then the wine maker takes it from there to make several different wines.  The server gave generous pours to ensure we tasted the wines fully.  He used 6 separate wine glasses to ensure we tasted the different wines which I thought was nice.  Most wine places used the same wine glass to sample the wines.  We enjoyed visiting with the owner.  A very pleasant gentleman.  I really recommend visiting this winery with your friends.  If you don't know anything about wine, not to worry because the owner will make sure your wine tasting experience is a positive one.

reviews.author: Lisa T.
reviews.description: Been really happy with this group since finding them several years ago. While the recipes might have changed over the years, they never cease to bring a great selection out every year. The port wines have been some of our favorites, raspberry chocolate port in particular. My husband has always been a fan of their blackberry merlot. We moved north of Austin, but when ever we take a trip to south Austin area, this spot is a must stop! Don't forget to ask about their wine club too; it is a great way to sample the variety of flavors they bring out!

reviews.author: Georgia B.
reviews.description: This is a great place in the Sunset Valley area to stop in and take a break from the hustle and bustle of shopping. We get to sip on our favorites as well as try new ones...Malbec is our favorite so far!

reviews.author: Marian K.
reviews.description: I love this small winery, A great place to sit quietly for a good bottle of wine.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: We had intentions to get food next door and then saw this winery next door... never made it to the restaurant and stayed here instead. Got more than we bargained for when we walked in. Wonderful people working here, great environment and tasty wine. Will DEFINITELY be back here.

reviews.author: Karen H.
reviews.description: I got hooked on Austin Custom Winery due to the less amount of sulfolamides (I know I mis spelled that)!  Mary and Steve are excellent hosts... I love that they are patient and accommodating.  I also recently became a wine club member... Lots of perks, including getting to create my own wine label with custom picture!  So happy I found this AUSTIN business!

reviews.author: Jeremy R.
reviews.description: Consistent flavors and unique blends! The big nice bar is fun to sit at and the wine variety never ends. Every return is met with a new wine rolling out while still able to get there staple wines. The wine club is my favorite now getting on  a discount on bottles I'm buying anyway. I shall be back

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: How have I not reviewed the kind people at this wonderful establishment yet?  I so enjoy the the solace of their old farmhouse venue. And the great ciders they serve up certainly do not hurt the wallet or the ambience.  It's so relaxing sitting at the picnic tables out among the oaks listening to your favorite band. Strategically placed fans hidden among the trees aid in making the glade that doubles as a stage tolerable even on 90º days.  In these seemingly never-ending days of the pandemic, it's also refreshing to see the servers masking up indoors and out. I tend not to venture out too much for exactly that reason, but felt totally safe here even when ordering inside the tap room.  Maybe I should keep it a secret, but it's also one of those places you want to share exactly because it is so very special.

reviews.author: Kaci C.
reviews.description: Wonderful place! We went on a recommendation while we visited family. The ciders were great, as was the food. The only issue we ran into was that we ordered hummus, and the person taking our order didn't let us know that it didn't come with bread or anything else to eat it with. Considering we had just had a conversation with her about it being our first time there, we're about to present she didn't let us know that important bit of info. Not a big deal, and the person who brought us our food outside asked if we had ordered anything to eat it with and quickly brought us an order of a baguette.  Aside from the establishment itself, the vendors selling goods were all friendly and talented, and the other patrons of the establishment were friendly as well. We struck up several conversations with passers-by.  I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Ellen G.
reviews.description: We love Texas Keeper Cider! Their tasting room is out a ways from Austin, but is on the most lovely grounds. They often have wonderful live music and their drinks are absolutely perfect for a Texas summer. They are so refreshing. We got one of the picnic baskets and it was full of yummy cheese, sliced meats and bread. Highly recommend!  It is worth noting, they do not have a full lunch/dinner menu. They basically have an assortment of DIY charcuterie boards, which we really enjoyed. However, if you go expecting a full dinner you may be disappointed.

reviews.author: Devon G.
reviews.description: The cider, the wine, the live music! What amazing vibes! The staff is friendly and it has some farmhouse style that is warm and comfy. They have a layout showing how sweet items are and let you sample, so you pick the right one!  Parking is massive and close to the large lot that houses bee keeper.

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Pretty great ciders! Did the tasting. Eat before you go if you are a fatty like me. I wasnt too fond of the food although i love their jellies! Nice outside area ... dogs and children allowed.  They also have live music!( but I was just there for the cider‍)  Will definitely go again!

reviews.author: Marianne L.
reviews.description: I have been a long time fan of Texas Keeper Cider. I love the Tap Room, the grounds, the staff and especially the cider. The cider is dry and they make a wide variety of ciders to appeal to many palates.  They have successfully reopened the Tap Room and I decided to have my belated retirement party there. I was able to reserve a space for my large group and the staff was very attentive. If I had one criticism, it would be their food choices.  It's now a make your own picnic, and you choose cheeses, meats, and sides. It's not really a charcuterie tray, as they don't prep the plate.  The cheeses,  meats and bread all need to be sliced.  This made eating difficult with a large group. Most of my guests had to leave early so they could go eat somewhere else.  I know this new menu makes it easier for the staff, and they are a cidery, not a restaurant, but I miss their old menu.  I will still go to Texas Keeper Cider, but may not hang out as long.  (Or make sure I eat beforehand!) Overall, it's a beautiful South Austin gem.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: The ciders are essentially tribute to the apple gods, extremely generously priced, and the cidery is tucked away--makes for a great escape from the city of Austin!  Came on a rainy day with some girlfriends after dinner, and we LOVED it. It reminded me of Jester King Brewery because of the fact that it felt very off-road and secluded. If you're driving at night and a little too fast you might miss the entrance, so slow down as your GPS tells you you're near. The stone cobble walkway is so organic and lovely, that it felt like we were entering into a storytale cottage. Upon entering, everything screams wood and warm pinterest vibes. The three of us sat down at their tall barstool table, and started on our flight! What prices! Normally they do 5 for $9, but they tapped out of one of the selections so we did 4 for $7! Such a great price for the variety of ciders. I loved their hefeweizen + cider combo, and the first cider on their flight list (a name I forgot). Everything was so juicy and tasty, would highly recommend coming back.   The staff is very knowledgeable, and the lady doing the taptending that night was so sweet and helpful. She trusted that we knew which selection we were on during our flight. She also told us that there are five cideries in all of Austin! So for my cider lovers--let's hit all of them up.

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: I don't know why it took me so long to get here but now that I've been, I'll be telling everyone about it and making return trips! If you're a fan of Argus Cidery, you'll like this place. I do think Texas Cider Keeper is making cleaner ciders than Argus (nothing was infected or had off-flavors).   It's easy to miss the entrance, but it's right next to the cemetery! The outdoor space is very quaint but all Texas and has tons of picnic tables. The tasting room is beautiful with butcher block tables and plenty of seating.   We opted for the tasting flight menu which is five 2 oz. pours for $9. Their mainstay Texas Keeper Cider No.1 is dry, refreshing and well balanced. I'm not a fan of sweet ciders, so this was perfect.  I also really liked their Grafter Rose -- which is made with Rome apples and some grapes, which gives it the beautiful rose hue. It's also on the drier side, which is nice.   Our least fave of the five had to be the Cider Weizen, which had a bit too much coriander (and this is coming from a girl who LOVES coriander and hefeweizen beers).   The bartenders were all knowledgeable and really try to give you an explanation of each cider they're pouring (a la a wine tasting).   They also have a tempranillo wine on tap because in Texas it all falls under a "fruit fermentation" permit. Apples, wines, it's all the same permit.   I'll be making it a point to come here more often, and I would if traffic getting through downtown and south Austin traffic weren't so bad.

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: My new favorite place in Austin. Love everything about it.  It's basically the only Place I ever want to be. If you haven't been yet- get on the ball!  The cider is so delicious - nothing is overly sweet and they have a good assortment of dry and well-balanced choices. Their sampler is 9$ for 5 generous pours and is a great way to find the cider you like most. For us it's the rose, but the original is a close second. Your best bet is to purchase a bottle and drink affordably. You even get a discount when you purchase bottles to go (although I'm not sure if that's just at the end of the night - we've closed this place down a few times).   We are also big fans of the food. The carrots in a blanket are so yummy and very unique! A must-have. The curried egg salad is a go-to as well. It's made with eggs from their own chickens! They also add pickled veggies on the side which is always a win for me.   The location is so spacious and beautiful. Plenary of tables inside and out. Even a great view from one side where you can watch the sunset over the trees. I've enjoyed live music there and loved the tunes they were playing inside.

reviews.author: Matt H.
reviews.description: We went here with some friends for the first time. It's a beautiful place at night to sit out on the lawn under the string up lights with your dogs and enjoy some cider.  The bartender was awesome and more than glad to educate us on all the stuff that goes into making cider.  Our friends got this HUGE cheese board that was really well priced too.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: One year later I returned for their 1st Anniversary Party and release of The Grafter Blanc.  For $9.50 (w/fees) your ticket included your admission and 10 oz tulip glass (not the standard 12 oz tulip most breweries sell for $5-6). There were no drink tickets included; all cider and other offerings were for purchase only.  Certainly not the best deal in town....a town full of breweries with taproom festivities.  The Grafter Blanc is definitely my favorite of their ciders, with the perfect balance of acidity, tartness and dryness.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Wow! So before coming here I always assumed ciders as overly sweet and flavored froo-froo drinks for those who don't like beer. I have never felt so mislead before! Cider is made from apples (no matter what the flavor), and real, legit cider is found here! It isn't overly sweet and there are many different kinds! Some reminded me of wine and a not-so-Sweet cider mixed together.  At Texas Keep there is room to bring a large group, or even the dogs or kids to run around. There is a small indoor area with games and a huge outdoor area with room to move about and enjoy the Texas sun (or stars).  The people here really enjoy and are PROUD of what they do. They are excited to tell you the story behind the names of the ciders and what they entail. They have seasonals and guest bottles and taps. Normally I would feel gross trying something out of a bottle opposed to tap, but the whole experience was so eye-opening, I didn't care. They told me their 1 bottle of (maybe a 750ml cider) has about 10mg of sugar in it as opposed to he "cider" I knew such as Angry Orchard that has upwards of 50mg PER BOTTLE! Yowza- no wonder they were too sweet!  I was definitely iffy about coming here since they didn't serve "regular beer", but I'm definitely glad I stepped out of my comfort zone- and you should, too!  Only reason it's not 5 stars- the food "truck" setup (not a truck just a station) was out of food by 6:30p on a Saturday night. We had ordered 1 of the 4 items on the menu for our group to try. When we went back to order our favorites, they claimed they were out of everything and turned around and took 1 more order. Annoying. So we ordered a pizza and left early to meet the delivery man at home. Maybe have more food or more options and we would've stayed until the 9p close.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Such a gem that's tucked away in far South Austin/Manchaca! The. Best. Cider. It's fresh, crisp and abundant here. Even a little bit of mead on tap too. We've been here during all seasons of the year and the property is always gorgeous and inviting. Staff is so knowledgeable and helpful. The kitchen is Now built in to the main tasting room. The fresh house made popcorn is absolutely awesome. This is a family friendly establishment as well and very nice of them to accommodate young children in a pretty adult setting! We are very thankful and grateful and it certainly keeps us as loyal customers.

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a quick drive out to TKC on a Sunday. It was awfully hot and there was plenty of shade. We brought our dog too but he could not go inside which was challenging even for ordering. Our favorite cider is the No. 1! There was an event going on that sounded fun so we will definitely check out those options. We did not order food, just did a shared tasting. No one came outside to check on us or offer to pour and tell us about the cider which is common when visiting wineries with our dog and friends. It's a cute little spot for a weekend drive.

reviews.author: Liz S.
reviews.description: Súper cute romantic spot to come with your significant other or girlfriends.  The atmosphere is excellent.  They had live music on Saturday when we ran into this cute spot.  We ordered a flight of cider and had some garlic kettle corn, but regretted not getting the cheese plate because it would have been perfect with the acidity of the cider.  Zach, who served us, made our experience more memorable.  Definitely a spot to visit when in Austin.

reviews.author: Seela M.
reviews.description: This is a great place to bring out of town guests. The 9$ flight is lovely and a bargain. The grounds are beautiful and the staff friendly. You can hang out and play bird games or sit outside on picnic tables. The food is not quite  awesome yet, but decent if you want tot munch along with your cider. The ciders are dry dry dry and not gross apple soda tasting like Eastciders (barf). "Stillage" is amazing.

reviews.author: Vicktoria R.
reviews.description: Super tasty food. Drinks are tops and they have toys for kids in their outdoor area. Seating was nice and the misters keep it comfortable even in the summer heat.

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: I recently stopped by your venue for the first time and I have to say, it was so delightful that we are planning to return as soon as we can! The cheese board was delicious but the cider was out of the world! Your staff was incredibly friendly and helpful; the customer service was very nice! Until next time!

reviews.author: Kurt A.
reviews.description: This cidery is unique in that it has the best cider in Austin per dollar.  The Cider Noir, Grafter Blanc, and Cider Weizen are all delicious.

reviews.author: Joe B.
reviews.description: I've been here four times and will keep coming back. The location itself is beautiful - plenty of outdoor space surrounded by forest and a valley. The ciders are so much better than what you find in the beer aisle at the grocery store, and they have a surprisingly large selection. During the week, this is a great place for a quiet, relaxing evening. During the weekends, especially when they are hosting a festival or band, it's a different atmosphere (but still great) - lively and fun, a good place for friends to hang out if they're tired of the usual bar scene.  The only negative preventing Texas Keeper from five stars is the new food menu. While the ciders are fairly priced, the food is anything but. We ordered a cheese and meat tray for $20 and got a platter with barely enough for one person. When we asked for more crackers, they charged us $2 more. Hopefully, this new menu is still a work in progress and they will make adjustments until it is reasonable.

reviews.author: Annie T.
reviews.description: My family rode the North Pole Flyer, not so much for the Santa stuff since we have no children under 10, it was more for family fun. And it was a fantastic experience. The train was actually pretty cool, I've never been in a proper train before, I mean, it was old fashioned but still just a really really cool experience. We paid for the private suite and it was worth it, we also walked throughout the train which was a bit old west feeling. My favorite part was walking between cars to see the view unencumbered by windows.   We walked through all the cars (like most people on the train did) to see what the other cars were like. The giftshop car was the nicestest with big windows and plenty of room to walk around while balancing yourself on a rocking and rolling moving train.   Some of the private rooms give you an idea of what is was really like to ride a train across country with a sleeper car, teeny tiny shower, and narrow hallways. It was such a great experience.   Not sure why people complain about the views because mine were fantastic! I mean, c'mon. We live in Texas not Denver. I know what the hill country looks like. There's no mountains but where the hills meet the sky is expansive. It was beautiful.

reviews.author: Christina O.
reviews.description: Booked a sunset train ride for my husband and I and it was such a fun experience! We loved all the fun facts the volunteers had to share about the train cars and lifestyles of some of the riders back 100+ years. The sunset was magical and the night portion of the ride was really neat, having the moonlight illuminate the tracks in front of us. One of the cars is a dedicated gift shop/concession stand with a variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages to choose from. Everyone we came in contact with was so kind and made the experience that much more memorable. Overall such a great time - we would definitely book this experience again!

reviews.author: Roman H.
reviews.description: Their North Pole Flyer is like a joke. Don't waste your time and money, it is not worth it. Dirty cars, dirty seats, dirty windows with bleak scenery outside and Santa who gives a broken whistle. That is all for 2 hours trip. Even an obsessed with trains 4 years old was bored.  If you decide to go don't forget to take a mask or a respirator, it's hard to breathe inside because of dust.

reviews.author: Candice D.
reviews.description: We had a great time on the Beer Train last night that was advertised as a sunset tour that was 2.5 hours long.  Note that you have about 45 mins moving time, then 40 mins stopped for the engine to be brought from the back to the front and then 45 mins back again. You don't really see much of the sunset, and you aren't moving for 2.5 hours. They also assign seats ahead of time, some of the cars were nicer and louder than others, so just depends what you're looking for. The association was responsive on social media when I had questions, staff and crew on board were all very friendly. They dont really follow any of their own posted rules about masks, no personal coolers, etc. so just something to be aware of- but I think this also varied by car. Overall we had a great time and would go again!

reviews.author: Daniel P.
reviews.description: I'm pretty sure this is the tourism equivalent of chicken-and-waffles: another empty promise meant to separate me from my hard earned monies. Fortunately for me the plague was in top form. Was in the area looking for sustenance and 'Steam Train Association' showed on the map so I figured to pop in for a quick viddy before lunch. pulled up on a nearly empty lot, a shackled gate, and a locked door, the sign had the now common 'Closed for Plague' message which softened the blow of discovering "...that the train and rail yard are not open for public tours or photography" which meant the entirety of the museum was contained in the double-wide corner space in the strip. There's nothing inherently wrong with scenic train rides on vintage rolling stock, I've done it before and it's OK but that's just not my cup of meat. I was here for a bit of museuming but there was no museum to be had - nor postcarding nor touchable cars nor engines :-( sad face

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: My husband and I went on the Hill Country Flyer for our anniversary weekend and we were in the "Rippling Stream" train car. The Train itself is quite impressive and was my first time on a real train not subway. The First Class Coach option was really nice and the seats were spread out along with social distancing, we felt really comfortable. My only complaint was it was VERY cold outside and though they are climate controlled, it was really cold the first half of the ride - coming back was much more comfortable. I also wished the lay over time perhaps had been 3 hours to provide a little more browsing time in Burnet. It would be cute to do music in each train car from the era the train was made. Ours was built in the late 30's so it would be a nice little touch that's simple to do! They had complimentary snacks and drinks which was a plus. Can't wait to do it again in a private suite!

reviews.author: Rebecca O.
reviews.description: Was a waste of money from Cedar Park to Burnet....was suppose to be Hill Country Flyer...saw no Hill Country...just a lot of brush blocking scenery....but not much of that either...Burnet was quaint...but will drive next time...big disappointment..

reviews.author: Allegre N.
reviews.description: This was an excellent experience. We took the train from Bertram to Burnet for one of the special events (Wedding Oaks wine trip). The staff was friendly and seemed very knowledgeable about the history of each train car. If you have a chance to walk to the very last car and look out the back, I definitely recommend taking in that view. I would have loved to take a longer trip and will look for other chances to ride.  The website is a little hard to use. We would have really liked a private cabin for our trip but didn't see how to book that on the website.   I wish the volunteer in our car would have been a little less Chatty Cathy when we weren't talking about the ride. It was a bit of a distraction from our enjoyment of the ride. Also, riding during COVID was a bit out of our comfort zone already so we were sad to see at least two volunteers wearing their masks covering only their mouth, not their mouth and nose. The website goes into great detail about precautions and that is a basic one not being taken. (That being said, they did a great job with social distancing and I felt like the train was very clean.)

reviews.author: Mike H.
reviews.description: Enjoyed my first ASTA experience today.  Here's my recap:  - Purchased a First Class Lounge ticket so I had my own room in Rippling Stream  - Train left the station on time, arrived at Burnet on time, and left for Cedar Park on time.   We were only an hour late reaching Cedar Park because a car thought it could outrun the train, but it could not.  Once the accident reporting was complete the train resumed.   - Personal note:  I am a train nerd and love riding trains, so my threshold of being annoyed on a train is higher than most.  This will affect my review below.    THE GOOD:  - clean cars, fun to walk in between them, and if you're without children, the adults only first class cars are a must - Rippling Stream and Nambe.   Otherwise with kids, I would recommend the Maurice Beckham or Eagle Cliff.    - the trip itself is smooth and the volunteers are friendly and helpful.  You can tell they enjoy being there, informing and helping others.     - Burnet has an abundance of antique shops if that's you're thing.  Also the soups at the downtown coffee shop are wonderful.     - The shootout show in Burnet, while not having a worry about winning any acting awards, is fun for the kids and has a good ending.  They could trim some of the fat from it, and make it a more concise / engaging story - there were a few too many awkward pauses.  But I applaud the folks who are likely doing this for free.  And the kids loved it.     THE NOT SO GOOD  - The scenic ride - if you're from the area this should not come as a shocker - is not that scenic.  There's a great bridge over the San Gab river but otherwise it's unremarkable trees, backyards, roads, and strip malls.    But again, none of this bothers me that much because I'm on a train relaxing.    - Burnet:  This is a sleepy, very conservative town.  One sign to deter thieves in a store said, "We got an alarm.  We got video.  We got guns.  DON'T BE DUMB."    While the downtown is a short walk from the train station, 2.5 hours here is way too much time unless you love antiques.   There isn't much else.   And as far as lunch goes, I highly recommend walking a bit farther past the first couple restaurants or else you'll have long wait times.   I went to a deli just a couple blocks away and it had no line.      - Announcements:  there are few.  Nothing along the way to alert you to landmarks or scenic opportunities (there is really just one, the bridge over the river).   But it would be nice to hear more than the pre recorded departure / arrival ones.    - The warm soft drinks:  no one wants green tea or apple juice at room temp.  There was literally an ice bucket next to these (but for scoping ice).  A second one to put these beverages on ice would go a long way.    - Lack of variety in snacks:  for a first class experience, at least more than the mini lemon cakes and mini cinnamon rolls would be nice.  Some savory, perhaps?   - chairs in the RS lounge car are what you'd find at your local dentist's waiting room.  I expected something that would at least remain comfy for 1.5 hours at a time.      OVERALL. - for the price I paid, it's 4/5 stars.  I knew the scenery wasn't going to awe, so most of my ranking is based on the train experience inside.  The quibbles above are all minor; chill the drinks, add some pretzels, get someone to donate an old leather chair or 2, and be a bit more chatty with us.    Those who really ranked their train ride low usually fall into the following categories, so please take them with a grain of salt:  - a/c sucked because it was Austin in the summer (hopefully fixable but not all that surprising) - solution is to go when it's not hot, the 60 days out of the year it's under 99 degrees.  I also think they have ironed out most of the a/c issues by now.    - Burnet was terrible, Burnet food was terrible, etc.  It's Burnet.  There's a reason it's not as well known as Fredericksburg.  You walk a bit father to get away from the crowds, you cross check their list of lunch spots they give you when you board  with a quick glance of Yelp reviews and you roll the dice.    - scenery sucked, super ghetto, etc.   Maybe because I grew up in St Louis, but using the word ghetto here is laughable at best.  It's junky, yes.  Unkempt, sure.   And truly, if you live in the region, you should know better than to expect breathtaking views.  You've driven on 183 east of 35?.  Same views.   If you're from out of town I could see valid point here since the website pushes it hard that it's scenic - but us locals know how much lipstick you can put on this pig.   So go check it out!  But go First Class if possible.  And be flexible about being home on time; like with any train, delays can happen.

reviews.author: Lori Ann L.
reviews.description: We rode the Hill Country Flyer which departs from the Cedar Park station and goes to Burnet, Texas,  where there is a two-hour layover so that passengers can disembark, do some shopping or grab some lunch or both.   Before leaving, the Burnet Gunfighters put on a show which is free to passengers, although they do accept donations.   The scenery leaves a lot to be desired, however that is not something that the Steam Train Foundation can control, they have a designated track and can not control who builds subdivisions or places gravel pits along the route.   If you are looking for a beautiful scenic ride, this probably isn't for you.  However, if you want to experience riding on a passenger train, and learning about the history of the railroads, it is a great experience.
