You know, what a non-stupid person would do should they slothfully decide to close early since they dont work for a living.  My mother was incredibly upset by this lady's rudeness. When you run a service like this, you stay open until you no longer have a good flow of customers. Closing is at 4? Hi, if a bunch of people are coming in at 3:30 thru 4:00, you keep working. Lazy Texas people who inherited their property and think they work hard by paying others to harvest their crop and bottle it. Meritocracy, right? They are the class of people who make this state an impoverished mess.    Don't run a customer service business dependent upon people stopping by on a lark like a fascist regime. You don't get to do that. Then again, when you dont have a legitimate concern about how you pay your bills, i guess you can just work until you get bored with the whole work thing.   Go sell wholesale if you hate customers. Working for yourself does not mean you get any more freedom. You have are dependent on good will. And you don't have mine.  The lady tried to make up for her garbage attitude when i made my purchase. You know what? Have a blessed day, lady. A.BLESSED.DAY.  Tl;dr. There are other puveyors of Texas olive oil, particularly in south Texas. Do not waste your wine tasting trip here. If you want to support local, consider others who are hard-working enough to sell their products in Central Market.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: I will never recommend this place to ANYONE! The main older lady was very rude to my parents, as well as the other couple in front of us. I regret not reading the reviews before coming here because everyone is saying the same thing. We did a wine tasting (which was $10) and were barely served anything. My husband and I both left this place wondering how they are still in business. The wine was super expensive (not good at all), and they have horrible customer service. Listen to these reviews, people!

reviews.author: Teresa D.
reviews.description: Very limited services. I walked in to see if this facility was appropriate for sitting outside for a tasting. I was immediately met at the door because there was a "tour" in progress. There was no other option other to join the tour that was already in progress. The woman that met me right at the door was very un-hospitable.   The inside smells absolutely delicious, full of olive oil.  The grounds were beautiful.

reviews.author: Marina R.
reviews.description: Worst service ever. Mistreated. Was watched the entire time. Before I could even ask a question about the wine or olives, an employee firmly told me as she was finishing up with another set of customers that "I don't have time to answer your questions."  She then proceeded to hard sell our group to pay $10 for the "last minute" tour. And, to add insult to injury, as 2 of the 4 of us completed their purchases, both employees proceeded to exit the store and watch us walk to our vehicle and  drive off. I will never spend a dollar at your business.  Good luck to you.

reviews.author: Jennifer B.
reviews.description: Such a great tour. We failed to check the tour time and arrived a little late but they let us join the tour and tasting. It was terrific! The tour and history of olives was really interesting. Definitely try the balsamic and infused oils. The wine tasting was pretty brief compared to the olive portion but great none the less. The wines are dryer, not sweet. I thought they were great. A lot of the other local wineries wines are very sweet, but I really enjoyed these! You should absolutely plan to visit if in the area.

reviews.author: Krystle M.
reviews.description: Amazing olive oil. Wine was good but pourer was either grumpy or just to the point?! 5 samples, but we shared a tasting. Not worth the $10 as the pours were barely a "splash." You couldn't enjoy the swirl sniff taste ...

reviews.author: Kerry C.
reviews.description: We went here twice. The first time we went we had a group of 6 and showed up about 15 minutes before they closed. The guy there suggested we go to another place. He just didn't want to serve us so we left.   The second time we went there were 4 of us and it was in the middle of the day. While the wine is fine, the server was the single most rude person I've ever encountered at a winery. Just astounding how she could be that rude for the duration of the wine tasting. I will never go back and suggest no one ever go there. You cant drink the wine fast enough to over come they workers rudeness.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: We liked the olive oil a lot.  However... I think the "thorn" of this place is the owner.  He seems rather joyless in making something that could ideally fulfill the soul.  His 1 1/2 hour (yes, it's long) "tour" is mostly comprised of the history of the Olive, snarky political opinions, braggary of his past career in Silicone Valley, and a hatred for Texas AandM.   Not a place to take a kid. Seriously.  We sat and listened to him for well over an hour then briefly stood under two olive trees, looked at another one that was hurt in a storm, looked at the press machinery, and then did a "tasting." Like I said, the oil was good. I got the impression that the lady helping in the gift shop/tasting room didn't want to be there either. Basically I was confused why this man (and his 5th wife...no lie) were running this business and opening it to the public.  I walked away a little sad that something so wonderful like successfully growing beautiful trees to make a solid product could be reduced to something so joyless.

reviews.author: Alana C.
reviews.description: We were warned at great length that we could not even look at our cell phones during the tour which seemed odd when people might have a kid or babysitter or be waiting on something important from work to come through--I mean we are all adults...but I soon found out why.  Far less than an entertaining traditional tour, you sit and listen to someone talk more like a college class lecture, but with way too many rabbit trails of information that eventually make you tune out.  Like what a certain blizzard is called in different parts of the world, how accounting dates back to the Romans, etc.  I am passionate about olive oils and wine but learned too much about history and every other subject to even focus on what I wanted to know about olive oil. Or feel entertained.  The group I was with concurred.   There are 3 types of learners: auditory, visual, and tactile and the class is entirely sit and listen to one man talk for half of it then stand and listen by a tree then a press for the other half. So only appealing to auditory learners. And no audience engagement during the lecture.  At the end you actually get to see and touch. But they had no bread for us so we had to drink an olive oil and talk about it for 30 more minutes so I left before I tasted the other flavored oils as it had already been a full day of just listening to way too much info to retain.  In a very strict manner rather than entertaining with audience engagement.  And strict rules.  Obviously people tune out and begin looking at their cell phones so that's why they don't allow them.  Rather than making the tour entertaining so you dont' want to--It was in the hot sun as well so it was pretty miserable.  The olive oil was good but I've had better, it was a bit weak to me, we did the wine tasting as well and those were not acceptable to me.  I actually would recommend skipping the tour and talking to the staff as you taste the olive oil because they knew all of the information given on the tour without the lengthy side notes of things that should be shaved off for entertainment value.  And that's really the best part.    I don't think they like people very much though to be honest.

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Who here likes an hour and a half talk ab everything I ever learned ever?? If you raised your hand then step right up, produce $15 and hold on to your hat!  It went on so damn long I wanted to ask for a hall pass just to sneak to my car.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: A hidden mecca of olives.  In central Texas.  The Bella Vista Ranch was designed as a traditional Italian family farm and features the first commercially grown olives in Texas.  And the olives I sampled are Texas size and Texas good.  Apparently the crowd favorite is the bleu cheese stuffed olive.  We sampled a garlic stuffed olive that was really good.  The ranch also offers delicious balsamic vinegars and olive oils which go for around $17 a bottle.  My lips slurped the Fig Vanilla Balsamic over and over again.  I am sure I was sample cheating but that stuff is incredible.     This is also a working winery that produces several red and white varieties plus a Natural Blackberry Wine!  Yum.  Wine tastings are $5/per person.  I think the owner has a great thing going for him and a beauty of a property. Tours of the orchard happen on the weekend and include a wine tasting for $10/per person.

reviews.author: Jim L.
reviews.description: I can't believe only 5 people have reviewed this ranch. I have been back four times now and each time come away with a little more understanding of the narrative that is offered. While I purchased my typical bottles of olive oil - some for myself, some for holiday gifts - I did also indulge in some olive oil based soaps.   The olives and oil are fabulous. I am not as great a fan of their wines. They are not awful, just not with the properties I care for, typically. The in-laws found a favorite to take home, though.  The tour is still $10 and includes the wine tasting, which is a good deal.  Bottles of oil range from $16-$27 each, depending on size.  Soap is $6.99 a bar.  They also feature balsamic vinegars (not made there) and jars of olives, which are delightful as well.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: The speaker was very very rude.  Very long winded.  Made a point to tell us about his great computer career in California.  Do not go with children.  Was quite disappointed with this trip.

reviews.author: Ashley F.
reviews.description: Do not judge a book by its cover. Take one look at Jack and the humble grounds here at Bella Vista, and you'd never guess that he has olive friends he emails with back in Italy or that he can tell you all you'd ever want to know about the science and technique behind growing and processing olives.  I would highly recommend the tour - while there isn't much walking involved in this tour, my husband and I found it to be highly informative. And with Jack's red-blooded Texan sense of humor, it was a very entertaining education. Be sure to note the times of the tour (Sat @ 10am and 1pm, and Sun @ noon) since it's a group setup.   After the tour comes a tasting of several types of olive oil produced on site along with some of their balsamic vinegar offerings. While they also have wine offered, I'd recommend sticking with the olive oil - clearly what they specialize in. If you're only interested in tasting the oils/wines (not the tour), it's probably good to avoid arriving at the tasting room about an hour after each tour start since the tasting room isn't overly large and tends to fill up easily with the folks coming off the tour.

reviews.author: Alison T.
reviews.description: Super disappointed in the customer service.  Both the lady and the gentleman that run the place were very rude and short with us.  Their products are not made by them in Wimberley and when asked about that they became extremely defensive.  Beautiful place that has a lot of potential if they were friendly and cared about the experience people want from that kind of place... but the vibe is anything but friendly and welcoming.   When they started to bash a particular presidential candidate it killed it for us. Keep your opinions out of your business. Don't bother would be my recommendation.

reviews.author: Shannon G.
reviews.description: While I thought it was pretty interesting to learn about and taste boutique olive oil (as I'd never been to an olive ranch before) $15 per person does seem a little high when the actual tour is quite short and obviously the intention is that you're going to buy some stuff at the end, and all that stuff is small batch and quite pricey (understandably so.)  So it ends up  being more like $100 for two people when you include the olive oil you will want to buy plus the wine you might want to buy (some people seem to think it sucks, we liked some of it.)  But you will leave with a buzz on and some delicious olive oils!  The owners were away so their daughter gave the tour; I thought she was pretty funny and personable but there were some questions she couldn't answer but it was really no big deal (and she wasn't super long winded like the owner seems to be  but of course some people like that and some people don't.) It's also probably better when there are olives on the trees but it was still overall pretty interesting to see the different trees different olives grow up and hear some history and facts about olive oil production.  I liked hearing about the process and seeing the machinery. And of course I liked tasting the fresh olive oil, which was indeed super tasty and surprisingly spicy. Most of their oils are made from all different olives smushed together but they have one variety that's just made with one kind of olive which we got to try. They also had a blood orange infused oil that I'm now obsessed with; we bought some and later made some asparagus on the grill that had been rubbed with the oil, it was the most delicious asparagus ever! We also enjoyed the wine; we are not wine snobs in any way but we enjoyed what we had and bought a bottle just  because it's the polite thing to do. We sat out on the bench in front of the tasting room and enjoyed our wines and just had a lovely afternoon.   I will say that it gets a little hectic in the tasting room when people come in just for a tasting after a tour- I would say if you want just a tasting, don't come between 1:30-2:30 because it's going to get confusing!

reviews.author: Lyra S.
reviews.description: The tour was all talking with a look at a tree or two and a look at some equipment. If you want to hear the entire history of olives then this is for you. Personally I was falling asleep. The tour guide was rude and narcissistic.

reviews.author: Kristen C.
reviews.description: Wine tasting is $10 per person,  and it is by far the smallest sample I've ever been given in many years of wine tasting. What a rip off. Also the lady that did our tasting was really rude to us. Then, she basically berated a guy when he politely asked where he could dispose of his child's diaper. She was an older lady. I didn't catch her name, but I have a feeling she receives a lot of complaints. It was very awkward and so unprofessional. Never ever going back.

reviews.author: Leigh M.
reviews.description: The couple who own this place are fantastic characters. The wife is sweet and talkative. She was delighted to hear that we moved out here from San Francisco (that's where she grew up but couldn't  stand the fog). The husband is an old curmudgeon, but delightfully so. He worked in high-tech in Silicon Valley and moved out his last company to Austin in the early 90s, eventually leaving to grow olives and make wine.   it's not always the case that you visit a winery and the owners pour for you, so that was a treat. They are a very small production and a bit off the beaten path, so it was pretty quiet there too. A small group arrived just as we were leaving, but it was nothing like the bustling tasting rooms at nearby Driftwood Cellars.  The blackberry wine is actually good--you wouldn't necessarily guess that it's made of blackberry not grapes. And the other three reds we tasted were also nice.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: The customer service was amazing!  We were treated like family and enjoyed our experience tremendously.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here for wine tasting. You choose 5 different ones for $11, making this one of the more affordable options around this area. It comes out on a wooden board with stemless glasses. It would have been nicer if the servers gave a bit more description about each of the wines, but they were all very enjoyable.

reviews.author: Haley C.
reviews.description: Literally so good! We were the only people in there on a Monday just before close and the service was great. It was even happy hour and we didn't even know it! The wine tasting was great and a GREAT value during happy hour.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Meh. It was nothing special. No ambiance. Service was decent. Food was delicious. But overall the experience was just normal.

reviews.author: Eric P.
reviews.description: Ac, Texas tasty wines and friendly people.  What else can you ask for ?   We worth the $11 sampling price.

reviews.author: Oscar S.
reviews.description: Great place just to get away and have a good brew. Great wine stop... nice people nice atmosphere!! Thank you

reviews.author: Carole B.
reviews.description: Totally disappointed.  Asked for a menu...ordered a bottle of wine and 10 minutes later we go to order food to be told the kitchen is closed!!!  Really at 7:40?  You couldn't tell us that before wine was bought!?  So we get to sit there and drink wine while everyone around us are eating.  Never again!

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Nice place to sit and cool off in Wimberley. They have tons of wine samples, drinks and some small appetizers. Plus a wall full of snacks and specialty foods to bring home for that special occasion. I spun the way back wheel and got some pickled eggs. I made it normal (kind of) by adding some flavored pecans.

reviews.author: Chelsea G.
reviews.description: This place is a must! Super cute wine shop/country store with a very chill vibe. We did a wine tasting and a cheese plate and everything was perfect! We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Luis D.
reviews.description: Great little charcuterie board with good ambience and delicious drinks. This place is worth the trip to Wimberley!

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: A great place for sips, sauces, wine and more. Not only can you sample the sauces and dips but they offer wine tasting. They also have 35 craft beers. I definitely recommend stopping in.

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: Taste Buds is a cool little shop located in the tourist town of Wimberley, TX. It has been taken over my new owners and it had a name change, but most of what the former owners carried is still available, though some things are not; however, the new owners do offer some new things. They do offer some beers and wines, but my biggest interest is the hot sauces, salsa's, and pickles. They do offer some free samples and if you're not a chili head like me, be careful as the ghost pepper and the scorpion salsa's offer a very quick and very hot bite that will get your attention !!!!

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: LOVE this place!! The food and drink selection was fabulous! So excited for Buda!! I would like it if the employees wore their masks correctly though. One didn't have one at all, but had gloves and the others had them almost covering their mouths, but not their noses. Soon there will be a vaccine, but until then... please.

reviews.author: Joey M.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this place when we arrived in town and really glad we did. They serve tons of Texas wine and do wine tastings too. The other half of the building is stocked with cool Texas made dips and jarred goods. Our server was so nice and was easy to talk to! Also, we really appreciated that they were dog friendly! Overall a great place it's stop and check out while you're in Wimberley.

reviews.author: Joanna R.
reviews.description: Our first time here and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Quaint, welcoming stop before we walked around. Perfect place to stop in and relax, enjoy a glass, and a small bite to eat. Thank you Los Olivos for being a part of my Mother's Day weekend.

reviews.author: Wendy b.
reviews.description: We happened into this place by chance, and SO glad we did! Not only did Rylee take great care of us, she went above and beyond to make sure our Anniversary was fabulous! Home made secret champagne recipe and all! Cheers!

reviews.author: Elle L.
reviews.description: Quaint shop on main street. Small, wine bar with a few beer on tap. Small menu. Cheese trays look great. You can buy other gourmet items from their gift shop. Great service. Nice place to rest and cool down from shopping this historical downtown.

reviews.author: Tony T.
reviews.description: Ordered two of their sandwiches and they never came after 25 minutes.  Poor service, never checked in on, they were too busy serving a larger party who got there after is. Someone finally came to tell us our food was coming, 5 minutes later, nothing...we had enough and left.  Eating at Wimberly Cafe, much better food and service.

reviews.author: Ann J.
reviews.description: Super laid back and casual spot for epicurean gifts, wine tasting, beer tasting and even wine-a-ritas!! Be sure to get the queso and chips as well as a refillable winearita koozie bottle! The servers are all very friendly and knowledgeable. Overall just a great place to hang out for a bit and enjoy your evening.

reviews.author: Tim C.
reviews.description: Lots of goodies in this place, one of my weaknesses is pecans with just about anything on them....quite a collection of sauces including Silver Leaf from Missouri City....they need some Mikey V's.....

reviews.author: Sara W.
reviews.description: Here's how I describe my "George" experience- fun, exceptional service and above all else a really caring and wonderful person. I found him while I was searching for a driver to pick us up from NOLA at the end of my husbands birthday trip and he went above and beyond them ever since. Recently he waited hours for me at the airport while my flight was cancelled and I barely got on a standby flight landing at 2 am. George was there to pick me up when I was completely exhausted. I am so grateful! Thank you George.

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: George was awesome!  I booked an all day wine tour for a group of 5 and he made the experience perfect.  Here is what we experienced:  excellent communication, professionalism, great customer service, timeliness, easy-going attitude, clean vehicle, comfort, convenient amenities (charging cords), and fair pricing.  Thanks for an amazing day, George!  I highly recommend him and Watson Limos.

reviews.author: Lynn N.
reviews.description: Great service. Excellent drivers and system. Highly professional. Schedule accurately. Arrive early. Safe driving. Clean vehicles. Completely recommend.

reviews.author: Tony G.
reviews.description: In town for MotoGP weekend. Switched to Watson limo from utilizing random Lyft drivers. Wow. You get what you pay for. Our driver, Denis, was a gem. A true tour guide and storyteller. Let's add friend to the list now.  Denis was able to get us in and out of Circuit of the America's in minutes on Sunday. Whereas, on Saturday, the random Lyft drivers took 30+ minutes navigating through the thickest traffic. There is much less traffic on Saturday versus Sunday. Hats off to George and Denis of Watson Limosine. Great job gentlemen.

reviews.author: Jamie F.
reviews.description: THE ABSOLUTE BEST! George was so awesome for an all day private wine tour for myself and my girlfriends. Had such a great day, I have now used him for 2 work trips group sizes up to 30 people. Which were executed flawlessly the entire work trip. Thank you George and Dennis

reviews.author: Suzanne M.
reviews.description: We recently went to COTA (Circuit of the Americas) for my daughter's 13th Birthday to see Imagine Dragons. Understanding how chaotic it can be parking and then leaving when the event is over, we decided to hire a car service. We secured a nice Suburban with Watson Limousines of Austin. I briefly mentioned to George what we were celebrating. When he showed up to pick us up he rolled up in the Party Bus with flowers and sparkling cider along with champagne glasses for my daughter, with Imagine Dragons playing and lights going. It was so Awesome. It made my daughter's 13th Birthday something she will never forget. For anyone that has ever been to COTA, it is extremely chaotic getting to the stage and especially leaving. Normally, walking very long distances. George took all of that away for us. He dropped us off and picked us up at places that most services are unable to which put are walking to a minimum. He made our whole experience PERFECT!!! Thank you so much to George and Watson Limousines of Austin.

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: Gotta bump em up due to the fun and educational grand wine tasting they had yesterday!  Folks, me and my senior friend sampled twenty.five. wines!  Two outta three of their pourers really knew their stuff and gave us background on the wines.  They provided a "score sheet" for notes and I ended up buying 5 bottles, all in the $15 range.  My only complaint about the tasting was there were no palate cleansers offered.  No crackers, chocolates, no nothing and after about half they all start to run together.  So we ordered a cheese plate and took a break.  For $12, not too impressed with the cheese plate.  Four smallish chunks and a few bread slices.  Meh.  But we really enjoyed killing a coupla rainy day hours here.  Get on their email list so you won't miss the next one!

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: 100 great wines for under $25 is the theme.  A co-worker was playing so I went briefly and it was a nice little hangout. They only had 3 reds available by the glass, some interesting craft beers and cheese and jewelry in the back (?).  I don't think I'd go there for live music, but if I wanted to load up on nifty little wines...

reviews.author: Mark G.
reviews.description: Great 2 Hour tour with Jax as our guide. The bus  was comfortable, and we saw many of the local districts,.  Jax was excellent and gave us all tips on sightseeing, music venues, shopping, eating and unique local drinking establishments.  Highly recommended as the first thing you do in Austin to learn where you want to spend your time!

reviews.author: Annie W.
reviews.description: So very glad we went with this tour!! We were able to see all the main attractions for the city, as well as quite a few hidden gems we normally would have missed on our own. Our tour guide, Ike, was very knowledgeable about the city and had a wicked sense of humor. He was able to get everyone on the tour engaged and even remembered a few things about our home states to tie in to whatever attraction we were visiting. I would highly recommend this tour for anyone visiting Austin for the first time. Well worth the money!!

reviews.author: Feri J.
reviews.description: I took city of Austin tour with Even Ford  Was a great and fun tour with lots of interesting and informative information . Thanks Even

reviews.author: Vivian C.
reviews.description: My friends and I joined Austin Detours through a travel agency on the last day of our trip to Austin.  We met Marty and Tray at the visitor center and instantly felt welcomed for our BBQ and wine tasting tour!  Our group was small and Marty was very accommodating with getting us back to downtown to catch our flight home.  On the drive, Marty shared stories and knowledge of the bats under Congress bridge and the history of Salt Lick.  After our delicious meal at Salt Lick, Marty was able to get us access to the pit for photos.  Our 2 wine tasting stops were awesome.  We had enough time to enjoy each sip and take pictures of the establishments.  Next time I'm in Austin, I'll book another tour!  Thanks for the memories!

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: My husband and I did the BBQ and wine tasting tour. Marty was an amazing tour guide! He explained the BBQ process for various Austin BBQ establishments, which was very interesting, and also explained the wine making process. He gave recommendations for some of his favorites at each venue we visited and also ensured we got pictures. From the moment we met Marty, he was enthusiastic and had a ton of energy, so we knew we were in good hands. After the tour, he took the time to mark events in a local paper which were of interest to us during our remaining time in Austin. Marty and Austin Detours helped start our trip off on the right foot. We highly recommend this company!

reviews.author: Rachel F.
reviews.description: I did the Real Austin tour with Rose and the art tour with Chris. It was actually Rose's first solo tour and she was amazing at including everyone, keeping it interactive, and maintaining interest even though it was freezing. Most tours in other places just kind of lecture you but she was definitely more of an inviting conversationalist :) with Chris i was actually the only person that signed up for the tour so I got a more personalized view of Austin street art haha. His passion is obvious when he explains the stories behind the art and i learned soo much. I definitely recommend both tours because not only was it super fun but a car is the best way to see all of the random spots throughout Austin. Thanks Rose and Chris!

reviews.author: Cat G.
reviews.description: Ike took us on a fantastic Street Art Tour of Austin. He was friendly and pleasant  as well as super knowledgeable about all of the murals we saw. Being an artist himself, Ike was passionate about what public art means to a city. Would totally recommend this tour!

reviews.author: Josh I.
reviews.description: Our guide was Brent Bellinger. He was fantastic. He took us to 3 awesome venues that were all different with great live music. He gave us a ton of information about the city, venues, and restaurants that will help us better enjoy this wonderful city.  Thanks Brent!

reviews.author: Meg B.
reviews.description: Did the 2 hour daily tour with Ike and it was so much fun! You get to see a lot of the classic sights of Austin, but your tour can also be tailored a bit to interests of the group! It was super interactive and a fun way to spend two hours!

reviews.author: Liz S.
reviews.description: Can't say enough good things about the live music tour we took. Bobby S was the perfect guide-full of personality (the right amount), knowledge, and passion for his job. He kept us in time so we didn't miss anything and picked out fabulous music and venues to take us to. I would do this again in a heartbeat if I make it back to Austin.

reviews.author: Sharon W.
reviews.description: Steven was an amazing tour guide.  We took the tour on a Sunday morning and got to see the Capitol building without crowds and got around to many areas of the city with the ease of someone who knows the city inside and out.  Steven knows his stuff so well and adds his own professional level of humor to make the tour even more fun.  We found out about lots of places we will go on our next trip to Austin.  We took his recommendation for where to hear live music and enjoyed the afternoon at Saxon Pub.  After riding through various areas and get the lay of the land I was more comfortable driving around the city which was a big help for us.  I would recommend this tour to anyone traveling to Austin.  Take it early in your stay in Austin if possible.  Wonderful and worthwhile 2 hours.

reviews.author: J S.
reviews.description: We're locals who decided to play tourists for the day.  The 2 hour Real Austin tour was totally worth it  We had a wonderful time.  I was surprised to learn new things about Austin - I thought I knew it all.  Enjoyed seeing the sights and learning the history.  We love Austin but now I realize how cool Austin is. Thanks to Bobby - he has a great sense of humor and made it very entertaining.  Even our picky teenager loved it.  We'll be checking out the other tours to see what's available.  Go, you won't regret it.

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: I wonder if it's a new winery. The parking lot isn't as big as others but the space is very nice, benches and tables under trees. The inside is small because it's in a cottage so there's a sign saying one group at a time. The wines are from California. You can do a flight for $15 or a glass. We all chose a glass (8oz pour) whereas a tasting is 6 oz. loved our reds. There's a sculpture garden to stroll. Lovely place for convo. Also we tried the fat boy cheese spread w ritz crackers and it's so good!

reviews.author: April K.
reviews.description: We had a very pleasant experience at Parmeson! The wines are super high quality and very enjoyable. We had the Rose and the Sauvignon Blanc, both of which were outstanding. Tom and Katie are wonderful hosts and the garden setting is a delightful place to pause and relax. Highly recommended spot for fellow enophiles! We will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Natasha Z.
reviews.description: Charming little boutique place and a convenient stop on the way to Fredericksburg. However perhaps I will be a bit biased coming from California and having tried some of the best wines, the wine here is not something for a refined wine pallet. It's a cute little spot to check out and try out but not something that would leave you wanting more. Sauvignon Blanc was the best choice of the flight and the others did not leave me too excited.

reviews.author: Jeff A.
reviews.description: Stop by and see Tommy at Parmeson Wines!!!  Super wine at nice prices too...  all good but I really enjoy the red zin, Pinot and the rose in summer time!   The new Alberino is very good!! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Lauren C.
reviews.description: I keep meaning to post a review for this winery. My husband and I visited them a few weeks ago to celebrate a recent job interview. They have only recently opened up, so we had never heard of them before and were excited to try them out. They had a very cute tasting room with nice stone that also felt very homey. The tasting was $20 and you get to try 6 wines. $20 still feels a bit hefty for a tasting in Central Texas for me, but their pours were pretty generous and you're not being served by someone who looks like a teenager who couldn't care less about your experience (like what Becker has become). All of these wines are from Sonoma. Overall, we didn't love the tastings except for the Zinfandel and the Cabernet which were absolutely outstanding, but I don't typically love lighter-bodied red wines or most reds from Sonoma. The quality is great, but a few of the prices were just slightly higher than what we can personally justify - I absolutely loved the Cab but it was $60. The Zinfandel was more affordable at $39. Their Wine Club gives you 20% off purchases which is nice, but it is a 6-bottle quarterly shipment. The winemakers are the Parmesons themselves and we had the pleasure of getting to chat with them while we did our tasting. They are a wonderful couple who were very welcoming and lovely to chat with. We loved hearing their story of how they got into winemaking. I would highly recommend checking this place out!

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: Great wine and a great atmosphere! We joined their membership May 2020 and keep on making the drive out their for tastings and special events. We even purchased their wines for our wedding (white and red blend)!!! Highly recommend going out to do a tasting and hang out. Plus, there are tons of other places to check out for food, beer, and more wine nearby to make a day of it. Adam, the owner, has created a chill place to relax nestled in the back of the property surrounded by trees. Parking is super easy!

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: Semi new winery with very friendly staff and kids friendly. They have 6 wines to taste, 2 whites, 4 reds to include a table white and table red and a port. Favorite was the table white and the cuvée. The biggest reason for the 4 and not 5 stars was none were local grapes or wines.  Props for the kids toys and adult size connect four and Jenga.

reviews.author: Anthony L.
reviews.description: We added this place to the itinerary last minute and I am glad we did.   This location is not a vineyard itself. It's basically an outpost of the parent company in California. Based in Paso Robles, Graveyard Vineyards is a small producer. The wines offered are all grown and made in California.   We opted for the tasting. They offered 6 wines for $15. We enjoyed generous pours of 2 whites, 1 rose, 2 reds, and a dessert wine. All of them were very good! You can tell their not Texas wines (in a good way!).   The staff was incredibly helpful. They offered tastings outside and were very attentive! I would absolutely recommend stopping by if you're in the area.   If you can grab a Malbec, do it!

reviews.author: Andrea L.
reviews.description: Our family was in town from CA and we decided we would go wine tasting locally and try some Texas wines. The wineries prior, all staff wore masks which was nice since we had a couple high risk individuals in our group. When we arrived at Graveyard, the outside was not impressive, not exactly the winery ambience. Once we got inside, the male was not wearing a mask (ok... fine... mask mandate lifted.... ) but he then told me I could take off my mask standing about a foot away, and I told him no I can't, we have high risk individuals. He then said to go outside for the tasting which we did. But honestly, who tells people to take off their masks or suggest they take off their masks during a pandemic? He has noooo idea of our health conditions, concerns or even has the right to even suggest on the matter. I was definitely taken back.  Once we went outside the table was just covered in pollen and debris and leaves. We were all so itchy from all the leaves under the table. Just no grooming or landscaping or care given to the on-site property. It was not a relaxing atmosphere whatsoever, as mentioned prior, a parking lot view/feeling.  The female local staff member had superb customer service, but again, in our faces pouring wine with no mask on. Out of the wineries we went to that day, this is the ONLY place where they were mask free. Although the mask mandate was lifted, we're still in the midst of a major pandemic and felt other establishments honored that respectfully. We felt very safe at all the wineries prior.   Grapes not from Texas.   Pros: Wine was good.

reviews.author: Jon H.
reviews.description: This review is meant as an FYI to those people who are thinking about joining the Graveyard vineyards wine club.  Graveyard expects you to take three shipments and are unwilling to cancel your membership before you pay for, and receive three shipments.  I have received two shipments and did not want any more Graveyard wine.  When I reached out to the wine club, the response was "you are asked to received three shipments; you've had two.  Your third one is coming up."  I am going to be candid here.  I just don't care for the wines.  I know others like them very much.  My sister, who lives near the tasting room in Dripping Springs, loves the wine.  There is nothing wrong with the wine; I just don't care for it and I think two shipments is enough to make up my mind.  I conveyed my feelings to the wine club manager and her solution was to downgrade me from a 12-bottle shipment to a 6-bottle shipment.  I really don't mean to knock Graveyard.  But my suggestion is to buy a case of wine and try it before you join the club.  I want to emphasize that there is nothing wrong with the wine; it just does not align with my tastes.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Graveyard is a brand new addition to the winery community in Drip, having opened in late January. They are an offshoot of a parent winery in Paso Robles, CA. The wines they sell are all produced, bottled and shipped here from that operation. They do yet carry the entire CA inventory but do plan to increase the Texas offerings.   The wines available include a couple of Graveyard's more affordable blends - Paso Tombstone White and the red blend from that line. Both are pleasant, sippable blends at a very reasonable price point. The red was light slightly complex mix of common reds produced at the parent vineyard. They also stock Ascender, a credible Brut. Their estate Cab is actually very good- a lighter Cab with a nice effect on the palate.   The lounge itself is pleasant and airy without being pretentious. The staff, especially manager Adam, are all personable and informative.

reviews.author: Wendy B.
reviews.description: We had a great time at our spaced-out table outdoors. The trees there are gorgeous, but otherwise, the view and ambiance is more of the parking lot. It was a relaxing time playing checkers and sipping wine under the trees, though. Our server was wonderful and covid-safe. Unfortunately, one staff wasn't wearing a mask, even inside, but we didn't have to deal with him much. We really enjoyed the wines. I know they are based out of Cali, but it was still nice to get a decent sparkling wine at a Texas vineyard. They were all good, but that was a nice surprise.

reviews.author: Stephanie K.
reviews.description: Everything is stellar from the staff to the wine to the environment! You feel like you are at home in your living room drinking great wine and chatting with friends. Mindy, Caitlin and Adam are awesome! Scream has to be our favorite red!

reviews.author: Whitney B.
reviews.description: Epic wine! Very nice people! Great way to spend an afternoon. If you are looking for really good wine and a tasting this is your place!

reviews.author: Lindsey U.
reviews.description: Great wine and tasting menu! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be coming back soon!

reviews.author: Alyson F.
reviews.description: We were sadly under impressed with this new addition in Dripping. We were given a room temperature bottle of Rose and were told by the staff it was "the usual temperature they sold Rose." I don't know about you, but I crave a cold Rose in this Texas heat. They ship in all of their wines from California so you won't find any Texas wines here either. Without good customer service or outstanding wine, we won't be back.

reviews.author: Jeff K.
reviews.description: Not Texas sourced wines, but absolutely incredible! From their parent vineyard in Paso Robles, Adam and company have some stunning wines. Super nice folks, too! Our favorites are the Chardonnay ( not oaky), the red blend, and their insanely good Malbec. We've been back three times.... they're dangerously close to our home.

reviews.author: DeeAnn M.
reviews.description: Simply the best! Look no further for great wine. Graveyard has the best red wines you will taste in this region. The owners and staff are friendly and knowledgeable. The tasting room is comfortable and inviting. Do not leave without tasting the dessert wine that is like chocolate in a glass! It is all good here so just go !

reviews.author: Dave M.
reviews.description: Spectacular venue.   It's absolutely stunning.  People are great.  Not much else to say.  It's great.

reviews.author: Jen P.
reviews.description: Beer was fantastic, but highly recommend not ordering from the food truck.  $10 pretzel was cold and hard, sausage was ok but we'll be eating before visiting the brewery next time.  Brewery has great propery and enjoyed the shuffle board.  **update - left bells springs and went to Nomadic Brewing in Austin, highly recommend that the food truck at bells spring offering cold hard pretzels for $10 to chat with the pretzel making pretzelista at Nomadic...jalapeño cheddar pretzel was amazing...hot, soft and paired with delicious side of grainy mustard for half the price of bells springs horrible pretzel offering

reviews.author: Yvonne A.
reviews.description: Located in a beautiful area. The space is large and both with winery and beer sections are decorated nicely. Games to play both inside and out. Oh, and their IPA was pretty good too!

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: Wow! That is all I have to say. The wine tasting was great, service is outstanding and seating very comfortable. Overall, the environment is very welcoming.  The food truck run by Chef Massaro is a must. My husband and I ordered buffalo chicken, Korean bbq chicken, Cilantro dumplings and waffle fries. The food was beyond what I expected from a lunch truck, it is delicious! My husband and I will definitely be going back to order from Chef Massaro and if you go on Bell Springs Winery website, you will find the food menu and send a text with your order to Chef Massaro ahead  of time.

reviews.author: Jon G.
reviews.description: Great spot great beer.   Great people.  The variety of beer is astonishing for a new place very light and refreshing.  Truly love the cobe

reviews.author: Victoria T.
reviews.description: This was my first time going on a wine tour ever and I am happy to say it did not disappoint. The big charter bus picked us up downtown Austin and we headed to the wineries. I am not much of a wine person but after this tour, found out what wine I actually enjoy. Our tour guide was great and interactive with everyone on the tour and made sure we all enjoyed ourselves. Our bus driver was a pro driving those roads and I felt safe having him as my sober driver LOL. The BBQ lunch was pretty tasty and everything overall was great. I would definitely do it again.

reviews.author: Erica Z.
reviews.description: Texas Wino Boat Tour- Lake Travis  My family found this place on groupon.  Since it looked pretty cool we decided to plan a family trip.  The road trip there was very beautiful however finding the parking lot SUCKED!! Our truck 4WD barely made it down, I do not recommend going any further if you have a small vehicle because the lot is NOT paved.   The wait wasn't too bad. If you get stuck at the end of the line I recommend taking umbrellas!! There is limited seating on the bottom, so if you get stuck sitting at the top it's better to be safe.   The burgers grilled were delicious, the staff was friendly and funny and the music was pretty good.   Overall a very fun experience.   Ps. One toilet per boat and it's tall and nasty

reviews.author: Lisa S.
reviews.description: Just did the Sat tour to Fredericksburg and had a blast! Our tour guide TJ was so personable, knowledgable and very attentive to his guests. He made sure everyone was present and accounted for before we left each winery. You could tell he enjoys his job! Our bus driver Tanagay was amazing the way she maneuvered that bus into the tiniest of spaces!  The wineries we visited.. Mendelbaums,Tejas, FatAss and Vinovium were just so beautiful, fun and so so friendly! Each winery had a rep that made us feel so welcomed when we arrived. The fresh Italian meal was amazing and so delicious! I will definitely book again in the near future!

reviews.author: Brooke P.
reviews.description: I've been on two Texas Wino Tours so far with very different experiences!   2018: First tour I went on was a couple years ago, we had a great time from beginning to end! Bus ride smooth and seamless. Tour guide was awesome and energetic. I left this first tour thinking "I'll definitely come back!"  2021: This second tour was ROUGH. We went for my Bachelorette party for a wine tour out to Fredericksburg with a timeline of 11:30 - 6:30. Within the tour we were supposed to to visit 3 wineries, and Luckenbach.   Sadly, the bus driver ruined the experience by getting lost almost the entire day. Not only was she directionally challenged, but she drove like a NASCAR driver trying to make up for lost time; causing many people to become motion sick.   She somehow took a wrong turn in the morning, then we hit traffic from a wreck up ahead (I understand second part not her fault) we did not arrive at the first winery until 1:30pm. Stayed for about 40 minutes, then onto the next.   Second winery was great, had a BBQ lunch, atmosphere awesome and laid back. Stayed for about 1hr 15 minutes.  Third stop was to Luckenbach, we visited for about 35 minutes, then it was back on the bus at 5:15pm.   This is were it got a little crazy. Bus driver took a wrong turn and started going South, somehow ended 10 minutes North of San Antonio, then we were lost out in the middle of nowhere with no cell service.   It started to buzz around the bus that we were lost, and it took an 1 hr and 15 minutes before our tour guide even said anything over the intercom about us being lost!! Everyone was so annoyed because the tour guide proceed to say we could make it to the third winery even though the winery was about to close. (We would only be able to stay for 10 minutes) At this point it was 6:45pm already well past when we were supposed to be back in Austin.   Get ahold of this, we did not reach our drop off location in Austin until 7:50pm. At that point we were on the bus for 2 hrs a 15 minutes just riding around Texas.   Out of 8 hrs with them only 2.5 were spent outside.  It was sad to spend my whole Bachelorette party (especially on a beautiful day) on a Bus with terrible old music on replay, travelers in a bad mood, and everyone wanting to go home. :(

reviews.author: Lori M.
reviews.description: Great fun!  Was able to get the best pricing for a group event.  The tour leader, Anthony, was engaging and knowledgeable throughout and the driver very cautious and resourceful around a few foolish drivers.  A very well organized event and most certainly fun!

reviews.author: Tori B.
reviews.description: Truly,  I could not have imagined a better adventure. My sister and I wanted some special bonding time, and this provided that as well as many happy memories.  Our guide WAS AMAZING!   Robbie did a splendid job to ensure our safety as well as to make certain that we had fun. He was super knowledgeable and more than hospitable.   The wineries/vineries were ABSOLUTELY  perfect. 290 Vinery was my favorite stop. The people there were fantastic. I loved their selection of sweet wines, and there tapas were a perfect pairing.   Richard has created something truly special.

reviews.author: Andréa Z.
reviews.description: Texas Winos is a sure way to a great time!! From my first Fredericksburg Wine Tour in 2017, to Wino Boat Bashes, and my favorite, Wino Fest. You can't beat having all the organizing done for you and a designated driver. Hosts have always been lively and accommodating and Richard has been great to talk to at several events. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Shell A.
reviews.description: This was my second time booking with Texas Winos. We took the Fredericksburg Wine tour from San Antonio with the Italian meal choice. As always we had a great time! Bus was clean and well maintained. The guide Jordan was a fabulous host! Highly recommend him. The wineries and meal was great too! We even had a bonus stop at Hye Cider!

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Groupon review: I did not end up reserving or going on the tour, so I am giving a three-star rating to give them the benefit of the doubt. However, I went on Groupon to purchase their discounted tour for $200. That comes out to $50/person. When I went to checkout, they REQUIRED additional tasting room fees that came out to $140. (On Groupon, they write: "Wine tastings not included but available for an additional fee", so this is misleading.) In total, that comes out to about $85/person, which is MORE than they are currently charging per person on their website ($73 during their "summer sale"). Let me save you some time!

reviews.author: Frank R.
reviews.description: At first I didn't think it was going to be a big boat, more like a pontoon I was thinking but when my friend and I got there we were amazed by how big it actually was. The boat party didn't have as many people as it usually does but we got to know a bunch of cool people and had a great time! The crew was amazing and our host was the best. Lost a beer in the lake and one of the crew members lassoed it bag to the boat haha.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: On October 27, 2019, I went on a Boat Bash tour with some of my Yelp Elite Crew, "The Plus Ones" (an event created by us not associated with Yelp in any way). We spent the last warm October day on a two-story party barge out on Lake Travis. On this tour we were able to sit back and soak in the sun.  This tour is BYOB so there was no shortage of beverages that my crew and I enjoyed. The vast majority of this boat tour, we were docked, which I did not expect.   Boat Facts:  This is a 4 hour boat excursion.  This boat offered a slide at the top of the boat for those who wished to slip and slide into the waters of Lake Austin. Float Noodles are afforded. The boat is Bluetooth compatible so you can bring your own music to be played on the boat speaker system. Burgers are made on the boat (albeit greasy ones).  At the end of the tour, you and your crew are given Texas Winos Schwag.   Synopsis:  My crew and I had a good time but I would not recommend this tour if you are looking to go around Lake Travis as the tour is fairly stationary. In addition, if you have an aversion to greasy or heavy foods (like the burgers prepared on the boat), bring your own eats like I did. Total spent for this outing (not including tip) $29.00. This tour is what YOU make it.

reviews.author: Gnet A.
reviews.description: Texas Winos is doing great with coming up with great events like the party barge I recently went on. They grill up some food for you and you're on the boat having fun for 4hrs. You can bring your own drinks and cooler with whatever you want to bring in but try not to bring glass. Richard is very thorough with his planning and provides you with all and any info you may need to make sure you have nothing to worry and have everything you need.   This is not the first time I have been to one of his events. I have been to a wine tour that I loved and those that joined me as well. Ive also been to a wino fest which was held at the sterling event venue and that offered so many wineries to taste from along with what you can pair them with. They have so many different events and tours that you cant go wrong with any of them. It depends on what you're looking for and what vibe you want plus you always get some kind of swag/souvenirs.   I definitely recommend you try one of his events. You'll enjoy it all.

reviews.author: Nikki M.
reviews.description: Wanted to book a tour for my upcoming birthday and there were several offers online which confused me about the cost. I submitted an email for clarification and was assisted by Richard, he was AMAZING. He went above and beyond, offering my group the lowest rate, set up a link just for my party, and was very attentive. He was the epitome of true customer service...I can't wait to tour!

reviews.author: Elina J.
reviews.description: I have booked with these guys a few times and love their events! Richard is especially great with accommodating and taking care of anything you need. Highly recommend for any occasion!

reviews.author: Celia G.
reviews.description: The boat bash was so much fun! My group absolutely loved it. We're already planning another event. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Zach R.
reviews.description: Always a blast to cruise out and drink some wine with Texas Winos! If you're thinking about doing a tour with them, just do it! You wont regret it! Richard is the man and has always been extremely helpful when booking large groups. Can't wait until the next one!

reviews.author: Abbey G.
reviews.description: Winos barge was horriblleeeeeee!!!! We asked to be put on aux and they refused even though we sold out the entire boat....playing old songs and nothing we could vibe to and just being rude because we already paid. Just bad customer service in general. The other boat next to us had their music so loud we couldn't even hear our music and winos didn't care to help us make our music louder or even accommodate us. They don't believe in playing swear words or music before the 2000's it just was kinda a bummer bc we had 40 people who paid $29 each for just a burger and a bag of chips and crappy music?????? Idk 10/10 don't recommend

reviews.author: Joohyun W.
reviews.description: Do not recomment and will not return.  I had an amazing experience with Texas Winos in 2014. At that time, the tour was on a nice bus with friendly driver and tour guide. Based on this experience, I had recommended Texas Winos to many people.   Recently (2021) we were looking to do Fredericksburg winery tour so I again recommended to do it with Texas Winos.   The transportion was in a very uncomfortable van with water leaking/dropping out of AC unit that was attached at the back of the van.   The three wineries we visited weren't in Fredericksburg. Two were in Johnson city and one was in a location in between Fredericksburg and Johnson city. Other than the first winery in Johnson City we visitied, the other two wineries we visited didn't have vineyards in sight. They were just two big container area that seemed like where they store wine (so there wasn't any ambience of winery or vineyard. It was just a wine tasting). We didn't even take pictures at those two locations as there really weren't anything pretty or nice to take picture.  The lunch option provided was not the same as what was shown on the web site (there was no salad and the options were different). The lunch was provided at the second winery, which had a dog walking around table to table (begging for food).   Before the third winery, we were informed we will be visiting the brewery since there weren't many people joinning the tour (hence the small van like a super shuttle, the airport transportation van). However, we were only given 20min at the brewery although we were running early.   At the third winery, the driver decided to leave us (and note, there was no guide. So we were all by ourselves without anyone from Texas Winos) to pick up his neighbors from other winery (hence why we were given only 20min at the brewery). We were stranded at the 3rd location (which again didn't have any vineyard in sight to walk around or take pictures while we were waiting) just waiting for the driver to return long after the wine tasting was over. This eventually led us to get back to Austin later than expected.   I regret not checking reviews online before recommending this place. I had an amazing time couple years ago but it was the worst experience this time around. We were all just wanting to get back to Austin. There were many vineyards around that had nice ambience and pretty views but the second and thirs winery we went to were the ones that we honestly wouldn't have gone ourselves as they weren't really vineyards but just container area providing wine tasting.    Overall, not worth it.

reviews.author: Yery C.
reviews.description: First time doing a wine tour and we had a blast. Ronnie was amazing!! His energy is everything wouldn't want anyone else. The wine was sooo good. We had a blast most definitely book again n hopefully we have him again.

reviews.author: Brandy W.
reviews.description: Planned a girl's weekend, and a Texas Winos boat excursion was top on our list of things to do while in Austin. Boy oh boy did they not disappoint! The staff was kind, attentive, and accommodating. When I went down the slide, the captain recognized I had a little trouble in the water. He ensured I was safe. I was impressed by his attentiveness.  We had so much fun we went on the very next tour. I took my rod and reel and some bait.  Here  fishy  fishy

reviews.author: Lisa N.
reviews.description: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!!! We had a group of 11 people going to the wineries in Dripping Springs and Johnson City. Driver was rude from the start and then left us at the winery. Just left us stranded!!! There were no Ubers or Taxis so we had to call friends to come pick us up.  Police came and we filed a report. Stay far away from this limo service as they may leave you stranded too!!

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Express Limo bailed me out on my mid-pandemic wedding.  I needed a last second bus to take groomsmen from Airbnb to venue in Dripping Springs.  They responded immediately and after a few texts and a call, driver was sitting at our door in an awesome party bus.   Really great experience.

reviews.author: Blair N.
reviews.description: Would give 0/5 stars if I could. The guy was rude from the second he picked us up when we asked him to help us set up the Bluetooth. He then refused to take us home from the second winery which was an hour and a half away from where we live?? He said we were drunk even though 1. We hadn't even had 2 regular sized glasses of wine total and 2. Isn't that why you hire a driver?? So you don't drink and drive? He put his finger in my mom's face so close it was basically touching her nose. When my brother tried to calmly speak to him, the driver dramatically told him to back up because he was "dangerous" and started filming. The video he took will clearly show that no one was threatening him. The other people at the winery came up to us after and could not believe how he acted and that he just left us in the middle of no where. He also called the cops on us and then drove away laughing. What if one of us had a medical condition and needed to get home to take medicine? We had to call all of our friends to see if one of our friends could pick us up since there were no ubers / Lyfts. DO NOT EVER USE THIS COMPANY!!

reviews.author: Kaet S.
reviews.description: Absolutely disappointed in this company. The driver was dismissive of us from the start, we needed help setting up the Bluetooth speakers but he was clearly trying to rush us from the moment we got in the bus. At what was supposed to be the halfway point of our trip, the driver came into the winery and told the owner we were 'running late' and they needed to rush us out. This company had over booked themselves and instead of calmly talking to us to resolve the situation, they decided that abandoning a group of people - an hour and a half away from our destination - was the best course of action. The driver had also called the police after escalating the situation himself which was both unprofessional and a waste of the officers time. To add insult to injury, the driver was laughing while he drove away without us. We were lucky enough to have friends drive out and get us, but it was a terrible end to what was supposed to a fun experience. I would not recommend this company if you expect transport to be completed both to and from your destination.

reviews.author: Deanna J.
reviews.description: I was very pleased with the service.  They were prompt and confirmed pick up details along with ice needs a couple of times before service in case any changes were needed.

reviews.author: Pegah E.
reviews.description: Drivers are always courteous and on time, the cars are gorgeous and well maintained. Our driver was mike ; he had great defensive driving skills and quick reactions when needed. My friends and I would definitely choose this Express limo company again, for business or recreation. Thank you mike.

reviews.author: Jackson J.
reviews.description: There bus was great the driver was even better and we had a all around great time I highly recccomend this company if you are looking for a party.

reviews.author: William O.
reviews.description: Complete waste of money. To start they were over a half hour late. Then when they finally arrived the bus was dirty, falling apart and no A/C so it felt like we were in a sauna the whole time. Go somewhere else... anywhere else.

reviews.author: Whitney D.
reviews.description: Definitely recommend Austin Party Bus if you're looking for a party bus in Austin! Our group rented the 18 passenger bus for 13 people so we'd have a little extra space. Bus was on time and communication before hand was clear. Bus was clean and they had water and ice available when we got on.

reviews.author: James D.
reviews.description: We rented from these guys for a Bachelor Party and they were absolutely wonderful. It was a last-minute decision to book a bus so we ended up having two drivers, because they had to scheduled something at the last minute, and both were entirely friendly, professional and helpful. We wanted to find a bar with a mechanical bull and they helped us track one down. There communication was perfect, it was always easy to reach them and they were super flexible at the end of the night, allowing us to extend our trip for as many hours as we wanted for an hourly rate. In the end we only stayed out another hour, and they gave us the extra hour for free. Also, because it was a late booking, they offered us their 25 person bus for the 20 person bus rate.  The sound system was enough to give everyone permanent hearing loss and the dancing pole and hand holds proved to be incredibly robust and secure!  These guys are AWESOME, and I would DEFINITELY book from them again in a heartbeat.

reviews.author: Candyce W.
reviews.description: I booked this company for a surprise birthday celebration and I am so happy I did! Diana helped coordinate the stops and was patient in answering all my questions regarding planning. Kathy, the driver, was so sweet, great with communication, and being on time picking us up and dropping us off. The bus was super nice and everyone had a blast! I would recommend this company to anyone!

reviews.author: Philiph S.
reviews.description: My gf booked this bus for my birthday and we had an amazing time. The bus had great amenities and the driver was awesome! The kicker subwoofer and sound system was incredible. We had a blast and will definitely use this company again!!

reviews.author: Taylor T.
reviews.description: THESE GUYS ARE AWESOME! The bus arrived 15 minutes early and Peter answered all my questions every time I called. My bus driver was great and kept in touch with me through out the night. And, the bus was great! Good stereo system, cool lighting, and lots of ice and cups and all that good stuff. I will definitely be using these guys again for my next big event! They made my 22nd birthday a huge success (they did all of this on Halloween night!).

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Do not book with this Bus Company. They are a scam. We booked a bus and they never showed up. They have terrible communication for THEIR mistakes! Very disappointing and terrible service. Christopher is extremely rude and unprofessional. Do not waste your money or your time. If I could give them 0 stars I would.

reviews.author: Gillian G.
reviews.description: This company WILL rip you off. Terrible costumer service and refuses to give refunds for a bus that never showed up. DO NOT USE THIS SERVICE. I would give 0 stars if I could. Just horrible.

reviews.author: Brooke D.
reviews.description: SO MUCH FUN! Our group requested a bus for a river float birthday party! Our driver was extremely nice and funny. He actually gave us his cell number to call at anytime for pickup. We were able to dance and play music as loud as we wanted! The cooler was filled with tons of water and ice. They had Vegas style lights and a dance pole. It was so much fun that I will be booking for my bachelorette party!

reviews.author: randy e.
reviews.description: Terrible communications.  I sent in a request for more info but they never contacted me.  I replied to the email requesting a Yelp review with me telling me them that they never responded to my inquiry and that they didn't want me to post a review.  Now I've received two more requests to review them, so here's their review.

reviews.author: Annessa A.
reviews.description: We took a party bus this weekend to San Marcos for a river float and I am just blown away by how great this company was! Our driver was so accommodating and great. The bus itself was roomy and nice. They also provided ice, cups and water for the bus ride. Overall - everyone in my party was extremely pleased with our trip and experience with Austin Party Bus. We will definitely be using this company again next time we are in Austin! Thanks for making our Labor Day weekend an unforgettable one!

reviews.author: Vanessa M.
reviews.description: DO NOT hire this bus company. They will rip you off. Christopher needs to learn how to run a business and he needs to learn about customer service. He took our money and left us stranded because he never showed up to pick us up. Completely unprofessional and rude!

reviews.author: Sally M.
reviews.description: I called this business to inquire about a party bus rental. When I started to ask general questions, the man on the phone (unfortunately I did not get his name), kept telling me to refer to the website. When i asked him if he could please tell me his thoughts on how long the bus was needed for, etc over the phone because it was easier for me to do as I could not look at my phone at the time, he very rudely said "I just don't understand why you can't just look this up on our website."   I do not think it is too much to ask to provide basic information over the phone, and the snarky, rude comment was completely uncalled for and one of the more unprofessional customer service experiences I have had. Needless to say, I will not be using Austin Party Bus for my transportation.

reviews.author: Tara D.
reviews.description: Booked a limo bus to take 23 people to float the Guadalupe River in New Braunfels, six hours round trip.    Bus: The rate was so much better than every other place I found that I worried the bus would be shabby.  Not so.  Bench-style limo seating, hardwood floors, good sound system, and a pole for dancing.  My birthday guests were all impressed.   Service: Our driver Mike quickly answered every question I had in the weeks leading up to the event (and I had a lot).  He gave us an excellent rate, arrived on time, and was very polite and accommodating.  We were a loud, rowdy birthday crew, but he never seemed to mind.  The first toob place we visited was sold out, so he called another and even got us a group rate!    Overall: Very happy, no complaints.  I plan a few different party buses every year, and I will be using Sixth Street Rides from now on.

reviews.author: dana p.
reviews.description: My last memory of this bus involved a loud rendition of Wilson Phillips "Hold On" while grow-ups swung around the "dance pole." Indeed, this party bus was an excellent party on wheels.

reviews.author: Ari E.
reviews.description: I haven't even used the bus yet, but I've already had an excellent experience in customer service. Mike was incredibly accommodating for me and my group! I'll update my review in a few days once we actually use the bus, but I can definitely speak on the customer service being on point.

reviews.author: Sara W.
reviews.description: We purchased a MooLaLa deal for a 5hr wine tour from Sixth Street Rides for up to 15 people.  The deal was supposed to end before we were able to get the group together but Sixth Street Rides was very accommodating on extending our deal to March (2 months after the deal was supposed to expire).  Mike handled our requests including moving the date and giving us suggestions on where to go with complete respect and professionalism.  I received a confirmation the day before as well as our driver, Chris,  called us 20 mins before our pick up time.  We had a couple hiccups (including running late - as 15 girls tend to do - as well as running late at our last winery stop) but Chris handled it with the utmost patience and ease.    Honestly I couldn't have asked for a better company to use for our wine tour.  I highly recommend Chris and Matt over at Sixth Street Rides.

reviews.author: Rachel R.
reviews.description: "I had such an amazing 21st birthday party with Austin Party Bus. It's almost a year later and my friends still talk about how much fun they had. They all want party busses for their birthdays/graduation parties. My only complaint was the A/C did not work from the get go of the ride, my birthday was in May so it was pretty hot on that 22 person bus, but no one had a stroke so it was still a good time. Just make sure you get a bus with an A/C. Other than that, no complaints about this company. Driver was on time (11:00), and took us wherever we wanted to go. We had the bus for 4 hours which was more than enough time. Spent an hour or so on the bus, got dropped off down town for 2 hours, then rode it for the last hour and dropped people off back in west campus. It was perfect!"

reviews.author: Zachary P.
reviews.description: The driver was punctual and very accommodating.  This is the first time I have ever rented a party bus but when I need one again, Austin Party Bus will be the first place I look.

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: What a great little spot! Small quaint tasting room with a bit of wine related retail.   Right near the square and very close to Wimberley Cafe. Very reasonable tasting price at$7 for 6 wines. You can order the dry red flight, the white flight or the sweet flight. Most all the wines from the Escondido Valley in west Texas. This is were most of the grapes are grown in Texas anyway although not widely publicized. Lost Draw Cellars and William-Chris are two of our favorites. Really enjoyed both the red and white flights. The sweet flight is VERY sweet and all about fruit. One exception is the Choco-wine. Sounds really awful- chocolate wine!? I am NOT a sweet eater and don't really like chocolate but this is a perfect combination similar to non-dairy Baileys.   So enjoyed the owner-host that helped navigate the wine. Super personable and great to talk to. We'll return here again!

reviews.author: Karol M.
reviews.description: This little shop offers tastings from various Texas and other wineries, organized by a preset menu of either whites, dry reds, or sweet wines. You pay $7 for an etched glass promoting Wimberley as a Little Taste of Heaven (well, why not?), and that includes the tasting of all the wines from the menu of your choice.  There's room for about 6 or 7 people at a time to belly up to the antique bar (standing room only), and the sommelier/host pours for each group separately, explaining each wine and its history as he/she goes.   The afternoon my friend and I were there, we both tried the dry reds, and our host was knowledgeable and entertaining. There was not a bad wine in the bunch, although we each had our separate favorites. A lot of these wines are served by the glass or bottle in the local and regional restaurants, and you can buy them here more reasonably (about $22-36/bottle for the reds we tried) without having to visit each winery. They also have an entire wall of wine-related gift items and cute bar accouterments.  Definitely a place to put on your list to stop by during an afternoon of shopping in Wimberley. Be aware that like most of the shops, they close up for the day at 5PM.

reviews.author: Carmen P.
reviews.description: We called Hill Country Wine Shoppe and spoke to Jill. We wanted to order two bottles of wine for our Aunt and Uncle to help them celebrate their 55th wedding anniversary but we live in Tucson. We had stopped in the store during our last visit and found the shoppe to be welcoming and the owners charming. We told Jill want types of wine our relatives like. She suggested two wines, included a note from us, and facilitated the delivery. Our ralatives were very pleasantly surprised and they said the wines were delicious. We highly recommend this store! Thank you Jill!

reviews.author: Cody J.
reviews.description: The old bar is beautiful and from an old Willie Nelson movie, "Red Headed Stranger." Their "dry" red wines were not dry. They were all very fruit forward compared to the traditional tasting notes of the types they are serving. It's a cheap tasting at $7, and comes with a glass that is etched with "taste of heaven" and Wimberley on it.  Now, it's more of a shop, than a winery. So, don't expect to have a few glasses, sit down, or to use a restroom. The girl that was waiting on us was very young and knew very little about wine, and seemed to care very little. That's not the best wine experience! If I came back, it would be to show my boyfriend the bar. Overall, the wine was mediocre! So, it's kind of a one time thing!

reviews.author: Kori S.
reviews.description: A tasting here is a must do while visiting Wimberley!!! Great Texas wine selection - actually the BEST! After a tasting grab you some bottles and you won't regret it. William Chris is my go-to when stopping in. The Rodeo Red Malbec and Choco Noir are also hard to beat. Happy tasting!!!

reviews.author: Ann J.
reviews.description: The best wine we had on our trip was from Hill Country Wine Shoppe!! Don't get me wrong, there are plenty of great wineries and vineyards in the vicinity but Hill Country definitely finds the best. Stop in for a casual quick tasting and be sure to get a few bottles of your favorites. You won't tend to find these in the grocery store!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Take a break from shopping and enjoy some of our Texas wines. This tasting room offers several wines from around Texas. They do have a set list. You can only choose from reds, whites or sweets. The tasting comes with a free glass. It's a cute souvenir. The lady serving us that day was very knowledgeable and even gave us a history of each wine and winery with each pour. The tasting room is small and can get crowded. There's no sitting, but it's not a bother. They do sell some cute wine associated items. I ended up leaving with wine and extras. I can see myself going back when in Wimberley.

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: Terrific service, very knowledgable staff and delicious wines.  Go and taste and get some fabulous goodies.  A must visit when in Wimberley.

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: Just $7 buys a glass and tastings of five wines. Extraordinarily friendly host explained each wine and all the wine regions of Texas. A few great choices, all Texas grown.

reviews.author: Laurie S.
reviews.description: We did the tasting and left there with 6 bottles.  The ladies were very knowledgeable and helped us find what we like.  I must say, I really enjoyed the Choco Noir.  Pinot Noir and chocolate....amazing.  Need I say, I enjoyed my Sunday morning coffee/hot chocolate.   Thanks ladies.  Loved the experience!!!

reviews.author: Cody E.
reviews.description: Disappointed. Not greeted when entering and helped the person who came in after my girlfriend and I. I can't rank the wine because I was never served any.   No southern charm in this swanky.

reviews.author: Ashley A.
reviews.description: I was not impressed at all by the wine tasting here. I would recommend this place for the wine merchandise over the wine tasting/ wines. (I purchased a candle). It is a very small place with a bar that has no seating. They hand you a menu with with 3 lists of wine (Red, White andSweet) and tell you to pick one and they go down the list and give you a sample of each one off the list you chose. There was only 1 gentleman working at the time we myself and 2 friends went and he was too busy to even acknowledge us. We waited while he finished up with other customers then started the tasting.
