The man told us what we were drinking, which we read from the list, but other than that, seemed to have no other wine knowledge. A few times he told us about the wine maker who was featured in a magazine, or gave us facts about the prizes a wine had won, but no true wine knowledge about what we were drinking. I had to even ask for water to rinse my glass between tastings. He was just pouring wine after wine in my friends' glasses, even a white after a red! This was the strangest wine tasting I have ever done and to be honest, not something I would ever pay for. We had a gift certificate for a free tasting.   Bottom line, if you know anything about wine, I don't recommend it. If not, and you're just looking for a casual experience with a little wine involved, go for it.

reviews.author: Stephanie L.
reviews.description: My mom and I visited this place on a Thursday afternoon. It was so much fun! The guy working was so knowledgeable and entertaining and had us laughing the whole time. Delicious wine!

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: Stopped in with my family while on vacation. Great wines and good conversation with the man working at the time. It's worth your time to stop by!

reviews.author: K T.
reviews.description: I love this wine shop when the young girl was there.  She was fun and accomodating and we always bought more than one bottle.   However, when the owner is there, she is rude, condescending, and cheap.  Pours a few drops in a tiny cup.  I won't buy anything from her. ...and if she continues with that poor service, I won't ever go back.    So, let's see???  Act friendly and let people actually taste the wine...you get business. You act rude and give people cheap service ---- no business.  It is shocking to me that people have such poor business sense - especially in this economy.

reviews.author: Emily C.
reviews.description: We regularly go wine tasting here.  They only stock wines from Texas wineries that make batches too small to distribute to stores, plus one red and one white wine from Italy for the Italian restaurant goers across the street.  It's like visiting half a dozen wineries in one stop.  The wine lists change minimally throughout the year, though, and sometimes they can't get a particular winery's top products (ex. Sistercreek won't sell them their best blends).  Wine tasting is $7 per wine list (red, white or sweet), and each list includes ~8 wines.  Purchase 3 bottles and the tasting is free.  Purchase 6 bottles and 1 tasting is free + 10% off.  My husband and I usually taste both the red and white lists and walk away with 3-4 bottles of wine.  Each bottle is only a few dollars more than if bought at the wineries.  If you want to taste more than 1-2 types of wine, please be respectful and purchase a wine tasting.  They get a lot of foot traffic and can't give all their wine away.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: Had an amazing experience today at the Wine Shoppe. The wines are fantastic and the customer service is amazing. The two short hair blonde ladies go above and beyond for customer service. I learned a ton about Texas wines and how they are made.

reviews.author: john j.
reviews.description: Stopped by, last night.  The woman I was with asked for a sample of the Christmas Wine and was given a plastic goblet that held about an ounce, or more, of wine.  She ended up buying a bottle.  I asked about the blueberry wine and was asked if I'd like a sample.  I was given an ultra-mini, paper souffle cup to drink from.  I then asked for a sample of the mead.  Again, I got a mini-cup and, inexplicably, an extremely rude, "That's the last sample I can give you" from the owner.  Keep in mind that my friend got a sample, in a plastic goblet, that was five times the amount I received in the paper mini-cup.  She also bought a friggin' bottle of wine.  There was no excuse, ZERO, for the owner's rude way of treating me.  As I sipped the mead, groups of women came in and the owner was all over herself to serve them and strike up animated conversation.  I was amazed and angry.  Maybe there's more, here, than meets the eye, but that's not the point.  I should have been treated as well as the women customers.  I certainly wasn't.  I will never go back to this place.  You can count on that.  The reason I gave the two stars:  The owner was extremely knowledgeable about wines.  She did give me good information about sulfite content of the sweeter wines, comparing sulfite addition in wine to oatmeal addition in meatloaf.  Mitigating factor?: She did tell my friend that her store had been flooded by a broken refrigerator while she was visiting her husband in another state.  She struggled to reopen her store once she got back to town, just a day ago. Even so, her rude behavior cannot be excused.  FWIW, my friend told me that if this woman had responded to me, in the manner she did, before she, my friend, had purchased the bottle of Christmas Wine, she would not have completed the purchase.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: We had an amazing time! We used this party bus for a bachelorette party! Bus was super clean and fun. Our driver, Jonathan was AMAZING! Took us to picture spots around Austin and took our pictures each time with a smile on his face! We also booked this last minute and Jonathan was super accommodating! 10/10 recommend!

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: First, the Driftwood Bistro is on the grounds of Driftwood Estates winery, just off RR 12 south of Dripping Springs. There are several things to be said about that. First, be prepared for the rough, rocky driveway up the hill to the grounds. Once on top, though, the vista is splendid, especially as the sunset rolls across the hills beyond and the flats below. The grounds are lovely and spacious and pleasing. It is an exceedingly pleasing setting.  Beyond that, the Bistro is on one side of the hilltop and the wine house on the other. The Bistro doesn't have a liquor license, so you have to walk across the grounds to get a glass or bottle to go with your meal. An inconvenience. Their wines are middle of the road, and the selection of wines by the glass are very limited as far as whites go.  The Bistro has a pretty experimental and ambitious menu, with creative choices and options. We had the Caribbean Shrimp and Rice and the Open-faced Stuffed Avocado. The avocado dish was superb, with the featured avocado just the right level of ripeness, tender grilled chicken and a picante that was dynamite. The salsa Fresca and crema helped create a very satisfying entre. The flavors both blended and contrasted with each other. A very nice choice of a cool dish for a summer evening. The shrimp dish, on the other hand, was disappointing. It was tepid, to start with. And the shrimp had a very fishy flavor. The sautéed squash was credible, but overall it was disappointing.   Service was cordial. Lexi,our server, was very warm and welcoming and attentive. It was not her fault that the shrimp wasn't the proper temperature   The Bistro gets a 'maybe' on this visit, with hopes that they will improve on speed out of the kitchen and address that glitchy separation of wine bar and restaurant. The place has much going for it, and, if they can up their game, it will be a killer destination.

reviews.author: Alex P.
reviews.description: Could not have been better. Mauricio was super easy to reach, arrived on time both times, and was super flexible. He saved our trip.

reviews.author: Jeremy S.
reviews.description: Mauricio was incredible. Gave us a ride to and from lake Travis. Then a ride to COTA next day with no notice. Highly recommend for anyone around Austin.

reviews.author: Brian K.
reviews.description: Mauricio was a great driver. He came through for us at the last minute and saved our trip to the formula one race

reviews.author: Pat C.
reviews.description: We had a great experience traveling from Austin to Lake Travis and back with Mauricio. He arrived exactly when he said he was going to and helped us load up the van with all our stuff. We ended up staying out on the lake for an extra hour, and he was flexible with us changing our pickup time. Also, when someone forgot a cell phone in the car he was willing to meet us to return it. Very pleasant, convenient, and safe experience!

reviews.author: S R.
reviews.description: AJE transportation was great for our bachelorette party!! Did an amazing job, brought us 2 coolers for our boat ride, and was so communicative. Would absolutely recommend!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a reliable transportation service these are your people. Mauricio communicated with me quickly and clearly picking up 15 of us from the hill country of austin and drop us off at lake Travis. They also offer extra coolers if needed. But what I loved most what getting sent a video slide show of our trip! Excellent service! Thank you! Will definitely be using them again!

reviews.author: Jena E.
reviews.description: I hired Alba for my husbands 36th Birthday - we rented a yacht out on Lake Travis and needed transportation for the group to and from the marina. Alba was a delight to work with through the process- very responsive, friendly and professional. He made sure I understood what the timeline was and what to expect. He will also make a stop for you on the way if you need to pick up additional refreshments.  We actually stayed out past our projected return time and Alba was incredibly gracious and patient with us- I really appreciated that because it can be stressful planning large group outings and he really made it stress-free for me. I would recommend AJE Transportation to anyone looking for easy group transportation in Austin- he was stellar!

reviews.author: Jan M.
reviews.description: AJE Transportation and Mr. Ettie are the BEST!!!  He came to our rescue by going out of his way to provide last minute, transportation service for a bachelorette, winery tour last weekend.  He was on time, accommodating and a pleasure to deal with. Can't go wrong with him!  I would not hesitate to use him again.  5 STARS for sure!

reviews.author: Paul S.
reviews.description: Call AJE first!   Alba went above and beyond to help me figure out a ride for my friend's bachelor party.   He gave me recommendations for the weekend and was very easy to deal with.   You have to move fast though, I waited to book my trip with him until it was too late, but he still helped me and found me a ride with one of his competitors! You really don't see service like that anymore. I'm very impressed by Alba's commitment to customer service. Would absolutely recommend!

reviews.author: Laura T.
reviews.description: Alba was super friendly and accommodating!! We had planned our day for my friends bachelorette party and he was even going to add an extra stop for us! Our plans went south due to the weather and we unfortunately had to cancel our boat outing. He came quickly to our rescue, suggesting numerous additional options for the day. He drove us around to a vineyard and distillery without any additional fees. He was always checking in on us to make sure we were happy and having fun! I'd highly recommend him for his quick and efficient communication, flexibility, and attention to detail when it came to our needs. I'll 100% be booking his services again if I find myself with a large party in Austin again!

reviews.author: Matthew D.
reviews.description: Phenomenal experience with AJE transportation! Alba our driver went above and beyond with accommodating us for our bachelor party. He was on time made sure we were able to stop for refreshments along with breakfast and got us to the lake with 0 problems.   I highly recommend using AJE transpiration for your next trip!

reviews.author: Andrea M.
reviews.description: Alba chartered my girlfriends on a bachelorette party today. He was awesome and quick on his feet to find us solutions when the weather went sour today and changed our boat plans. He checked in so many times if we needed to stop for snacks or other suggestions for places to visit!

reviews.author: Beth P.
reviews.description: We just returned from a day long wine tour with Alba who owns AJE Transportation.  I would highly recommend his services.  He was flexible, attentive, knows the Spicewood area well and was able to give recommendations on wineries, distilleries, and restaurants.  He gave us a sample itinerary for the day and was easily able to modify this based on what we wanted to do.  He was courteous and kind and I will definitely book again with him.  Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Caroline B.
reviews.description: Alba was incredibly helpful leading up to our bachelorette trip to Austin. He was super reasonable with pricing and sent along restaurant and sight-seeing options before our trip.   The day of, he was right on time and beyond courteous in helping us get all of our stuff to the van. He even stopped on the way for us to grab food and alcohol.   Since the weather was iffy, Alba made sure to let us know that he was standing by and flexible with timing so he could bring us back to town early if we wanted.   The van was clean and comfy. I'd absolutely recommend him to anyone going to Austin and hope to use his services again soon. :)

reviews.author: Stephanie D.
reviews.description: Alba was really great and saved the day! We had a bachelorette party and because of the weather we had to change our plans -- not only was he super flexible and nice, but he had lots of great suggestions and helped us salvage the day with a lot of fun activities. He was really friendly, on time, and continuously checked in to make sure we were all comfortable and had what we needed. Not to mention was great about us listening to our own music and helping with literally anything! I would definitely recommend him for any group trips.

reviews.author: Taylor W.
reviews.description: AJE is the only way to travel when visiting Austin, TX! Alba is not only the most helpful with planning, he is also extremely punctual and accommodating, especially with large parties. 10/10 would use Alba and AJE again! Thank you for the memories and great conversation Alba!!!

reviews.author: Julian E.
reviews.description: Alba did a phenomenal job of providing transportation for myself and 10 friends to Lake Travis!  He was prompt, courteous, and very helpful finding a place to rent a boat and get supplies for our day on the lake.  I highly recommend Alba for transportation anywhere in Austin, especially if you are from out of town and value the insights of a local expert! A++ keep up the good work sir!

reviews.author: Adam W.
reviews.description: We can't say enough good things about Alba and his services. He transported me and eight friends to Lake Travis for a weekend boat trip. He was incredibly kind, helpful, thorough and prompt. He showed up fifteen minutes early at our place and helped us load into the car. Alba then brought us to a grocery store on the way so we could get supplies for the boat. He packed two coolers which we were able to bring on the boat - another big plus. And he was prompt and helpful in bringing us back home afterward.  As a bonus, he's incredibly knowledgeable about the surrounding area and was able to offer up tons of great suggestions. Last but not least, he's a really nice guy! 10/10, would definitely recommend Alba to anyone.

reviews.author: Tanya G.
reviews.description: Alba was great - see reviews below. Super accommodating and knowledgeable about the local area.

reviews.author: Amanda N.
reviews.description: Alba was a great driver. Very knowledgeable about the fun stuff to do around Austin. He took us to Dripping Springs and Spicewood for my Bachelorette party and we had a blast. Several girls said it was the best bachelorette party they had been to!! You can eat and drink alcohol on the van. I shopped around, and his 14 passenger van was the most reasonably priced. We went to Treaty Oak, Spicewood Vineyards and Poodie's!! Definitely recommend this company.

reviews.author: Erin Y.
reviews.description: Our group had a great experience with 360 Transportation this weekend! We needed rides for our Fredericksburg winery tour and Lake Travis boat party, and Jerral pulled through with punctual transportation at the best prices I could find!   Jerral was easy to coordinate with and even when there was a small hiccup with our ride back from the lake, he was communicative and very professional. He also went above and beyond with helping one of our group members re-park their car after we had already departed for the lake! The vehicles we rode in were also nice and clean.   Overall, our weekend wouldn't have been a success without 360 Transportation and I'll definitely be contacting them for any party bus/transportation needs in the future!!

reviews.author: Karla B.
reviews.description: We leased a mini bus to take us to and from the Rolling Stones show at COTA in November.  Jerral was helpful and worked with our schedule and requirements.  Our driver, AJ, was pleasant and patient and we were all very grateful for and appreciative of their expertise. Recommend!!

reviews.author: Morgan G.
reviews.description: Amazing night out with 360 Transportation. Aron was a wonderful driver and we loved the night out we had thanks to him and Jerral. I would recommend to anyone looking for professional transportation. Thank you!

reviews.author: Peter O.
reviews.description: They were 45 minutes late and didn't bother to communicate. I had to call them then they were late pick us up as well. Lost 30 minutes on the lake due to them being late.

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: I can't express enough how great of a job 360 Transportation did for my girlfriends surprise birthday trip. I had only scheduled two places to go but the owner recognized that we'd be very close to one of the best wineries in dripping springs and suggested we also go there as well. It was definitely the highlight of the evening and I'm so glad he recommended it. The driver was on time and courteous, he had no problem stopping for bathroom breaks to and from our destination. I'll be definitely using them for a upcoming business happy hour I have planned in two months. If you are looking for transportation at an excellent price they are a must in the Austin area.

reviews.author: Justin S.
reviews.description: Great experience! Jerral was easy to communicate with, the bus was great, our group of 17 easily fit with room to spare

reviews.author: Phillip S.
reviews.description: We ordered a limo bus for my daughter's wedding. The bus was beautiful, clean, on time and the driver was courteous. I could not of had a better experience for the guests that rode the bus to the wedding and back to the hotel.

reviews.author: Lizzy O.
reviews.description: Excellent service! Awesome driver! On time and super friendly!! Made the drive to us in Wimberly on a last minute basis. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: LETS MAKE POUR DECISIONS!   I am in Austin this week for a couple days. We are celebrating christmas as a family here in Austin this year.   My brother and I needed to get some alcohol for my parents before their arrival here tomorrow evening.   This store was very spread out and easy to find exactly what you are looking for. The staff is helpful too and they know where things are in the store too.   I have missed total wine as it is hard to come by when in AL due to liquidity laws. But we do have ABC stores.   I must say that they do card if you appear to be under 30. So myself, my brother and his girlfriend were all carded. But I am taking it as a compliment as yes I do look young.   I think my parent will be happy with what we got for them. :)   If you need an alcohol pick me up or a gift they have amazing gift sets too!   Wonderful experience here!

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: Total Wine and More has a wide variety of selections. I usually like to get a bottle of really great champagne for Christmas. After calling a few liquor stores in town, I find Total Wine the most versatile and dependable. More options and items in stock. Highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Joey E.
reviews.description: DO NOT USE ONLINE ORDER DELIVERY.  I recently learned a lesson using Total Wine and More's very ill-partnered delivery service.  Someone brought a wrong order in decent time to my house.  We noticed the erroneous bag together at my doorstep and she proceeded to take the delivery back to the store and my order is subsequently cancelled as I am informed by E-mail.  I wait an entire week and receive a refund 13 dollars less than my original payment.  I have spoken to customer service two weeks ago and they initiated a pass of my complaint to higher authority.  On my end, I have seen the same result as taking no action at all.  I am at a point now where it makes no more sense to spend any more time on getting my 13 dollars back as this as a fraction of what I can make spending that time actually working.  Total Wine online orders get all the thumbs down!

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: Thanks to Total Wine and More for being my go-to spirits supplier during the 'Rona.  I've only had need to use them for bottles of wine for special occasion during the pandemic. It's easy to shop online from their website to pickup curbside. Service is typically quick, accurate, and convenient. Curbside is free with a $35 order; otherwise a minimal service charge applies.  They were already my inside favorite based on the wonderful in-store atmosphere and experience. Being a solid citizen and not putting my health at risk to purchase adult beverages during the pandemic has won them a fan for life.

reviews.author: Curtis G.
reviews.description: In general, this is a good store to meet your wine and spirits needs.   However, today I noticed that they have added a junk charge for same day pickup - I am thinking that another store may want my business

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: 5 stars for this Total Wine location where I felt like the manager Robert became my best friend lol.  Came in here during Coronavirus and had a few odd items I couldn't find. An employee directed me to another employee who turned out to be the manager, and he personally walked me around the store and gave me his own personal opinions on which bottles to get. Amazing. This guy was super knowledgeable and helpful. I already love Total Wine as a brand and this location is now my favorite. I just wish this was the closest Total Wine to me!

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: If you are like me my drink of choice changes with the seasons, moods I have, and sometimes based on what holiday(s) are coming up. Total Wine is THE best place to come if you are like me - curious, excited to try something new, looking for some advice on what else I can try, etc then you have come to the right spot for your libations.  Ask any employee, I dare you, on what they suggest after telling them what you like. They will point you to some solid suggestions and even walk you over to that area where it is located. Total Wine has some very knowledgeable employees who are willing to walk you through the entire store if you requested that.   The prices are the best in the area for all of it - liquor, beer, wine, mixers, etc.  It's a one stop shop where you just might end up finding a cooler-than-the-one-you-have-at-home cocktail shaker or wine stoppers too.   Also, if you are looking to put together a gift last minute come here.  They have it all - bags, gift sets, tape, cute decor for bars, and whatnot here. It's super easy to roll up, park, and strut in to get a really cool and curated gift if you ask for some help.

reviews.author: Steve K.
reviews.description: This place is big.  Rows and rows of wines, beer, and liquor.  What I liked best is the hundreds of single beers.  I bought about 10 different IPA beers, and found couple new favorites. Good selection of snacks too.

reviews.author: Meagan B.
reviews.description: WOW! The store was super clean and well stocked. While all of the staff was friendly and asked if we needed help, I need to send a big shout out to Andrew ! He was so helpful with picking out our first bottle I went and searched for him to help pick out the second bottle. He helped us pick out an islay whiskey and a flavored whiskey and I was surprised at how knowledgeable he was on them .   In short nice store and the service was friendly knowledgeable and descriptive. Thanks again to Andrew!!

reviews.author: Harvey X.
reviews.description: A terrific store with (mostly) great selections and prices. I like that they have so many choices for wines and also a huge inventory of distilled spirits... plus quality beers, craft and imports. They've kept up with the mezcal boom, to my joy.  And there's always excellent single-malt Scotch options.  All I'd like to see more of is Greek wines (Kourtaki retsina, please!) and Portuguese madeira.  I still have to go to Spec's for those.     A tip of the hat to excellent and helpful staff. I always look for Belle up front, she is a delight!  I hope she's appreciated, managers!

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: Total Wine is a pretty nice liquor store where the store layout is very organized.  It also feels a little high end with taste testings and product placements.   They have a wide selection of liquor, wine, and beer.  I even found some exotics like moonshine from the TV show 'Moonshiners'.  And carry many local Austin and Texas brands.   My trip included finding a nice bottle of Rosé, bourbon and a few mini single serving bottles to sample. The staff was very nice.  For Texas residents they have a rewards program and a phone app.

reviews.author: P S.
reviews.description: Of all the wine and spirits store's I frequent, this store has the friendliest and most helpfull staff. The prices are great and the selection is good.

reviews.author: Xavier M.
reviews.description: #1 place to pickup my Beer and Spirits but what brings their score down for me is their shelf pricing on the beer side...seems like I alway get the shaft, getting charged more at the register than the price on the shelf...Beware, don't trust their price integrity, always verify.   I'm sure it's not on purpose, just poor manual processes...no checks and balances and I've seen it many times since they've been open...

reviews.author: Gur A.
reviews.description: Big shout out to manager Robert, who was extremely helpful with my situation, that happened on my last visit. He fully trusted me and didnt question or doubt me. Also your prices are best among the all the chain retailer we have around here. I was glad when Total Wine started in Austin / TX area. It was my fav store when i lived in Plantation FL 6-7 yrs ago.

reviews.author: Kyra H.
reviews.description: I wish I could make it 10 stars, no 20 stars, no endless stars! If I'm not home, I'm probably at Total! It is my home away from home.  My husband and I discovered Total Wine while living in California. Our store there was one that we went to every Saturday with our dog and we knew everyone who worked there. We were sad to be moving back to Austin because we didn't think there was a Total here. After a quick search, we found out there was this one on Brodie. We used to live north, but would make the trek down every weekend to see them. Now that we live south, we are there all the time.  We now have two dogs and they are the store mascots. Their picture is literally on the front door! When we walk in, us and the girls are welcomed with open arms.  Lisa is the best at working the wine tastings. She can tell you anything you want or need to know. Laurie is the sweetest and so helpful! Bob is always giving us the best recommendations. I wish I could name everyone, but will work on updating this review as I remember everyone's names. We feel like family when we are there. Total is the ONLY liquor store in my book. I have brought so many people to Total and they have nothing but nice things to say. They are helpful; if you can't find something they know exactly where it is. If they don't have it, they will see what they can do to get it in store. Their prices can't be beat! They are very knowledgeable; if you ask someone a question they don't know they will work endlessly to find the answer and store it for helping others in the future. I literally can't say enough about Total and their promise to hire amazing employees.

reviews.author: Hannah C.
reviews.description: Popped into Total Wine today to get the provisions for the coming corona zombie apocalypse and was browsing the wine section when I was approached by a very young looking TW team member named Gracie.  HOLY COW! Not only did this young woman have a deep deep knowledge of every varietal and suggestions on labels in a variety of price ranges- but she help me select a case of assorted wines, but wouldn't let me leave without one of her favorite bottles of Syrah.   When I was checking out at the cashier, she asked "Gracie helped you, didn't she? She has an encyclopedic knowledge of wines and impeccable taste."  Well, I just cracked open that bottle of Syrah and BLAMMO. I'm hooked.

reviews.author: Raine C.
reviews.description: Lupe, the front end manager, was SO HELPFUL!!!! I was looking for a small bag that fit the mini alcohol bottles for a gift and he walked around the whole store and gave us a bag that worked perfectly. Such an awesome guy!!! Thanks Lupe!!!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I use to check out Total Wine and More a lot when I lived in the DC metro area. I even attended a sweet Yelp wine and beer tasting event there in Fairfax, VA about two years ago.Total Wine sold me at that event and I was able to get some of my favorite beers. I love the fact I could do a mix and match 6 pack of anything I wanted.   Anyway, I wasn't feeling like Spec's on this particular day and wanted to see how Texas does Total Wine and more. Texas does it right. I was in awe and bewilderment as I toured the store. I ended up with of course more than I needed but no worries there.   I will note I found something there called a pocket shot. A pocket shot is made of plastic and looks like a Capri Sun container. It would of have been great to take to ACL the other weekend. So if you want to sneak or smuggle booze in I recommend buying those pocket shots.

reviews.author: Monique H.
reviews.description: Everyone has their favorite place to go and stock their bar. I've been a fan of Total Wine and More since they came to Austin. The staff is always friendly and I've never been steered wrong with a wine recommendation. I love that they have lots of tastings on the weekends and most recently, I went to one of their formal tastings with Orin Swift wines. It was more than works the $20 ticket price and I added to my wine knowledge base (and tasted delicious wines).

reviews.author: Ashley V.
reviews.description: Walking into this place can either be exciting or overwhelming depending on who you are I suppose. I had the latter experience. No worries though, Bob came to the rescue. He asked me a few simple questions and then helped me find 3 great red wines all under $20 a bottle.   Had the first one last night and it did NOT disappoint!   Bob rocks. That is all

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: I'm surprised I haven't been here sooner because I love their beer. There's ample seating indoors and outdoor, and they have a great selection of beer.   There was also a food truck that sold burgers, where you had to order at the bar. I would definitely come here again :)

reviews.author: Tristan B.
reviews.description: Solid beers, cool space. Bartenders are a little cold and the tap list while usually varied, can sometimes be a bit lacking.   That aside, still a solid vibe and a good place to meet up with friends.

reviews.author: Sherry P.
reviews.description: I like the set up and idea. Inside brewery and seating tables. Outside food truck. Order everything inside.  Comfortable atmosphere, good inside music, and great variety of beers. The tacos and burger are fantastic!   Get you a cold one!

reviews.author: Vanessa S.
reviews.description: A local staple. Everyone knows about this place so don't expect any one on one experiences. Great outdoor area, family friendly, and be on the lookout for events! Don't forget to walk on the right side of the bar for stickers and other treasures

reviews.author: Kasey F.
reviews.description: Visiting on a Sunday afternoon. Plenty of outdoor space. Nice and sunny with umbrellas and patio tables. I ordered a 4beer flight from the 25 or so they offered. They're all good so far. (My only disappointment is that they don't offer a sour. Please, make a sour!!)  Currently waiting on my food order. There's a taco truck here today.

reviews.author: Sam S.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a couple in the tent on a recent chilly Saturday afternoon. The beer is great and the variety of experimental beers makes for a fun beer day. Good beer people!

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Love this place and love that they have food trucks. Great indoor and outdoor seating as welll

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: I feel conflicted giving a fairly low rating given I consistently think of ABW as one of the top handful of breweries in Austin, but I'm giving this as a rating of the taproom experience moreso than a rating of their beers. I've also only gone during Covid, so I'm looking forward to giving them a try in the future when I can comfortably get the full experience.   Compared to other patios in the area I find theirs to be pretty lacking. There were no fans in the summer and no heat lamps in the winter. Their space isn't particularly large so there are fewer tables than other locations. This leads it to be uncomfortably packed on weekends, both in terms of how close tables are and the lack of distancing enforced in lines.   One weird thing working against them is just how available their beer is around town. Every HEB and bar will have at least a couple of ABW's beers available, so they lose out on the necessity of going to the taproom to try their beers. Even their seasonals get around town pretty well both in stores and on tap elsewhere.   On that note, and to not make this review totally negative, their beer is absolutely phenomenal. All their flagships are good to great examples of the style, my personal favorites are the Sun Shovel (think blue moon but with some hop prescence) and Fire Eagle (leans more towards West Coast IPA, but has enough juiciness to be really refreshing in the summer time).   Their seasonals also absolutely knock it out of the park. Sputnik (Coffee Oatmeal Stout) is an absolute must if you're in Austin in December and is probably the best beer I've had since moving here. The Heisenberg (a combination of a Pilsner and Hef) and Black Thunder (Black Lager) are two other stand outs to me.  The food truck is good enough that if you need something to snack on while you're there you won't be totally dissatisfied, but I've usually felt compelled to go elsewhere for food.  Overall, can't recommend their beer enough, but you don't need to visit the taproom to get the full experience.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: After three months of sheltering at home, Austin Beer Works was a first outing.  They did an excellent job with social distancing, wiping down each table after guests left, and mask enforcement (when not seated at table) in a firm but polite way.    No inside seating right now and the outdoor tables are shaded and a good distance apart. It is reservations only. depending on the time you make the reservation for, you will either get an hour to enjoy your table or two hours.  They go over all the rules with you when you arrive.  They have some great beers, both on tap and in cans. You can purchase some to take home with you as well!  I ordered a sour raspberry-lemon Einhorn.  So summery and refreshing!  I ended up drinking two.  My husband had an Essential IPA and the Small Spoon session IPA.   We didn't care for the Heisenberg Heff-lager (a bit too banana-ish).  The only thing that would have made the difference from 4 stars to 5 would have been some kind of food! Even a bag of chips or pretzels to go with the beer would have been awesome! We saw a food truck parked there but unfortunately it was not open.

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: I don't have anything negative to say about Austin Beerworks other than the occasional difficulty with parking. I've only had that issue a few times though. The staff is incredibly helpful and knowledgable, but I think the best part of the experience (other than the drinks) is the atmosphere. The interior is very spacious which makes it a perfect space for a casual happy hour with coworkers while the exterior has an abundance of seating. I'll definitely be returning if I am ever up that direction!

reviews.author: heather g.
reviews.description: Austin Beer Works doesn't always have Spurs, but when they do, they are THE BEST!! If you haven't tried a Tropical Einhorn and you like spurs, you're missing out!  The staff are AMAZING and the set up both inside and outside are fun. Totally family friendly and they have an awesome food truck on site (permanently)

reviews.author: Novalina N.
reviews.description: Cool that they're open now!  Arrived around 4 and it was busy so waited around 20 minutes before we could be seated  There's no markers on the ground so lines seemed to form in different places when I was there. Didn't particularly like it when people were right behind me (thanks covid). Hope they add these markers soon!

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: I really want to love this place but their service is just terrible. Every single time I come, they make it feel like it's an inconvenience to them that I need a minute to order or if I have a question, they make it seem like I should have their menu memorized.   They do have a larger beer selection for local breweries, parking is hit and miss, outdoor seating is mostly shaded. Inside is picnic seating. There's a food truck here if you get hungry. I feel ok bringing my dogs here.   The service is just that bad that I can't recommend them as much as their beer gives them credit for.

reviews.author: Angelique G.
reviews.description: Terrible service.  Every staff member we came across was rude and unwelcoming. They made it seem like it was an Inconvenience to order water and just ordering in general felt uncomfortable because they seemed in a rush and unfriendly when there was not more than one person else in line. The beer is good but not worth coming back.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: The beer was super mid the best beer I had was a 5/10 and I got a flight. So at least 3 beers were a 4 or less out of 10. I would recommend going to Adelberts instead. Adelberts is a least 10x better.

reviews.author: Savannah W.
reviews.description: We decided to try out a brewery near us since we just moved here. We got here around 6:30 and it was decently busy for a Wednesday night. We waited in line with a mask on and ordered. The man was helpful and recommend the cherry sour to me since they don't have ciders. My boyfriend got two different lagers, one was dark and one was light(I think it was called like the best ever or the most awesome) he liked both a lot but preferred the lighter one, and I really liked my cherry sour. It would be nice to see breweries trying to use class beer cups instead of plastic but with covid most places are doing single use plastic sadly. We took our dog and everyone was friendly. They even give you chips and salsa with your drinks. The ambiance was great, there was a food truck, and a cool courtyard with tables and a kids area. All around a cool place!

reviews.author: Dustin C.
reviews.description: Hidden gem! I'm not sure I would have ever known this place was here. Tucked back in a industrial park it's got good games and great space for groups. Family friendly and even a play area for the kids!  Nice selection of beers, and sell cans to go.

reviews.author: Stella M.
reviews.description: Love this spot! Great little area for kiddos, food truck with yummy Mexican food (impossible "meat" too!) and a great beer section! I'm all about it!

reviews.author: Caroline V.
reviews.description: Excellent citrusy beer with reduced gluten! Really fun environment for hanging with friends and just being around people!

reviews.author: Annie M.
reviews.description: Loving this brewery! It feels and looks clean. There is hand sanitizer on every table, and the staff is friendly. Our beer also came with free chips and salsa! I have never been to a brewery that offered that. I ordered the tropical einhorn sour and it is delicious!! It's sour but not too sour, and it is super refreshing!

name: Zilker Brewing Company and Taproom
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: The space is nice and I love the food truck spicy boys that's there. Overall, the beer selection is pretty good and I love the merch. I was a bit surprised with how sweet their double ipa was, but there are other selections of beer that were more on the bitter side and less on the sweet side.  The outdoor space is really nice and I'd definitely come back here again.

reviews.author: Shaji K.
reviews.description: Stopped by over here on an early Saturday afternoon before the crowds showed up. Large space with both inside and outdoor seating as well as a food truck parked to the side.  Decided to try a couple beers: Marco IPA ($6) and Friends with Benefits ($7). The Marco is well balanced but still had plenty of hops. Friends with benefits is more on the hazy side that sticks with you. The latter paired just fine alongside one of the sandwiches from the food truck.  Service was quick as there weren't many people at the brewery yet. A couple hours later the spot was packed, so best to come early.

reviews.author: Tomas R.
reviews.description: Fun spot to check out whilst in Austin or as a local. Zilker has always been a staple of East 6th even before East 6th became the hot neighborhood. They have indoor and outdoor seating and from my recent visit, I discovered they even sell wine here!  They had a food truck on the day they went so I'm certain there's food to wash down your IPA.

reviews.author: Gabriel M.
reviews.description: Indoor seating fairly tight on a busy day. Outdoor atmosphere is nice. Selection is nice and if your looking for a standard balanced beer this is a good place to go. Priced well too.

reviews.author: Madeline C.
reviews.description: Always one of my favorite brewery spots. They have the best hazy IPAs and great sours and generally interesting seasonal drafts, friendly staff, and a super yummy food truck (Spicy Boys) right in the patio area. Only thing is it gets pretty busy on weekends so it can be tough to snag a table sometimes, but it's worth it.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: All the 4 and 5-star reviews are spot on. Zilker Brewing is a great venue to have a brew or two and people watch from their 6th St patio.  Their indoor taproom is closed and they are adhering to the social distancing guidelines. We had a large picnic table to ourselves and were very comfortable chilling out on a breezy Sat afternoon.   I really enjoyed their Lazy Daisy Hazy IPA. It's a wonderful IPA that has a hint of sweetness and a citrus finish. Plus 1 gave 5 stars to their LA Beer American Pilsner. This is a typical Pils that drinks lite and is a perfect brew for a warm day.   Hungry? Spicy Boys Chicken food truck is onsite and is producing wonderful spicy chicken (Duh). They offer a range of sauces from sweet to hot as hades. We went midrange spicy and felt the heat.   Not a beer drinker, they offer wine, water, soft drinks, and surprise a frose' .  Solid 5-stars!

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Zilker BC is an awesome spot to grab a beer, grab a bite, chill out and enjoy the great vibes of both the brewery and the neighborhood. The space both indoors and out is perfect, and encourages coming together. Great for groups, but would be fine for a date night as well. A few bar stools but mostly community style seating. The food truck permanently stationed out front is great. The beer is excellent, focusing on IPAs but having many other interesting seasonals. Prices are more than fair, swag is cool. Zilker has it all, ipA to Z. Drink local!

reviews.author: Karley M.
reviews.description: AMAZING beer here. We loved the hazy IPA. The outdoor seating is fun and great for people watching on E 6th. There's a fried chicken food truck here as well that people say is the absolute best. Brewery has cool swag too!!

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: There is a reason that this brewery is always packed, the beer is awesome! I've checked out several local breweries in the area and this one is at the top of my list right now. The beer is great and the service is awesome. The staff are welcoming and willing to help you select a beer if you're undecided. Spicy Boys food truck is in their parking lot, so grab a few beers and enjoy the awesome food. Plenty of seating outside with some seating inside. This place is popular, so the seating will always fill up quickly. Dog friendly as well

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: Quite good beer -- loved the coffee stout.   Was told that it's oddly not a normal spot for locals, not sure why.   I loved the food truck onsite.

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: Nice little micro brewery with seating indoors and out, and they are dog friendly. Good selection on tap. I had the Juicie Juice sour, and the Marco IPA - both great craft beers. Also have to mention they have some cool merchandise with very cool graphic designs for the brand.

reviews.author: Jasmine C.
reviews.description: This brewery is outdoors and indoors. Good place to chill and hang out with friends. They also have a food truck outside.

reviews.author: Craig T.
reviews.description: Loved this place. I've tried about 4 of their beers so far and liked all of them. Icy Boys jumps to mind if you're looking for something light and crushable. The Midnight Voyage is also amazing if you like hazy IPAs.  We went on a Friday night and sat outside because of Covid. There was a line but we got lucky and got a table fairly quickly.  The stuff is super polite, and the merch is great. Spicy Boys Food Truck is on site with great Thai Fried Chicken.

reviews.author: Tiffany G.
reviews.description: We loved Zilker Brew when we visited. The beer was great and the atmosphere was chill. The workers were super friendly and there was canned beer you could purchase. We definitely bought some to take home!

reviews.author: Nina T.
reviews.description: Didn't plan the visit but passed by and thought why not! Not very familiar with beers but appreciated the staff sharing the knowledge to help picking on one. Found one high table on the corner, table was clean, weather was breezy, beer was good! Look at that half pint size. Great spot to quench your thirst in a warm weather.

reviews.author: Sam L.
reviews.description: Had a couple pints and hung out on their lawn for a while. Very relaxing, great beers. They share their lawn with a foodtruck which was incredibly convenient

reviews.author: Christa M.
reviews.description: Cool outdoor patio.  I enjoyed the 2 stouts they have on draught.  Very bold and deep with an experience of coffee notes.  Covid has preventing them from opening the inside for tasting, but they had plenty of tables outside.

reviews.author: Sean C.
reviews.description: A couple of friends mine came through this place, mainly for the food truck in their patio, but we stayed for the beer. We ordered the camp beer, parks and rec, and mouth zoomies. All of the beer was great, the vibe was super cool and it pairs really well with the Spicy Boys chicken sandwhich.

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: We got their frozen drinks while walking by. They were strong and hit the spot! The outdoor seating and decently sized with a food truck right there too!

reviews.author: Alexa S.
reviews.description: Went here on the 4th of July as a last minute plan and it was packed! My boyfriend loved their IPA and I had their frozen Hawaiian slushi (I am pretty sure that is what it is called) and omg YUM!!! I had 2 and was feeling goooood!

reviews.author: Bob L.
reviews.description: Austin is rich with craft breweries and 4th Tap is an excellent addition to the mix. I went there recently with my son and DIL to enjoy their beer and treat ourselves to some outstanding Laotian street for from the SXSE food truck. My favorite was the coffee stout but the amber ale was worthy of another taste.   Located in the obligatory warehouse area the facilities encourage family and pet attendance. Inside seating has a wide variety of games for those at  a loss for words. Outside seating is ample with umbrellaed picnic tables.   Also, it's within walking distance of Q2 Stadium.   Will I be back?  Youbetcha.

reviews.author: Melanie H.
reviews.description: Not only does it have good beer, friendly staff, and a good vibe, 4th Tap also has the most well-supplied (and clean) women's bathrooms of any of the Austin breweries. It may be random, but I'm just so appreciative of any business that thoughtfully provides quality sanitary supplies and handy stuff like hair ties and bobby pins. It's the little things.

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: This was our favorite of the breweries in the area. We tried a handful of their beers across the spectrum of styles (everything from a pumpkin beer to a porter to a sour). They hit the mark in every category. We loved every beer we tried and the staff were super friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: 4th Tap perfectly brewed beers definitely helped me get through this past year. Now that businesses are starting to reopen they've begun reintroducing some of their staple events like Good Set. Love seeing local comedians while enjoying a delicious flight. Happy that they still have a great food truck available. 4th Tap is such a wonderful addition to our community.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: First, I must profess.  As much as I love my hometown of San Antonio, Austin really has it going on regarding the microbrewery/brewpub scene.   There are so many options in the ATX and 4th Tap Brewing should NOT be overlooked. From their awesome craft beers, to their homemade pizzas, this place has it going on!  Beer - they have precanned beers, crowlers and growlers to go, as well as a handful of fresh beer on tap if you want to hang out in this cool joint/  On my visit, they had nine beers on tap, and I settled on the "Can You Dig It" amber ale.  It was definitely good, and I would get it again the next time I visit, but it was pretty similar to an amber ale you can find anywhere else. A little sweet, a little caramel taste to it, and just the right amount of hops - but not too much!  I didn't sample them, but they also have a could of IPAs, a sour, and a couple of different stout types.  Now, let's talk about the food! The pizza is SUPERB! They have several pizzas geared toward carnivores and herbivores alike.  If you don't see a prebuilt pizza that appeals to you, you can always build your own custom pizza.  They also have a handful of salads.  My friends from the ATX shared the 12" "Backdraft" pizza for $12.99 with me.  It was LOADED with huge slices of pepperoni, jalapenos, and house made spicy Italian style sausage. The crust was thin and crispy.  Even if you don't like beer, I recommend stopping by here for a pizza - it.was.that.good!

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: Wow 4th Tap was amazing tonight.  I love craft beer but was skeptical with covid. I was so surprised when I saw that I could book an outdoor seating table in advance. We booked a table a couple hours before we were planning to meet up.  Staff was super friendly. Beer was great...loved the Running Man, didn't really care for the gingerbread. Outdoor space was nice and spacious. Definitely felt safe during covid times. Food from the truck was delicious. Props to SXSE because their food is absolutely delicious. I had the beef skewers and upgraded to crispy rice. It was so flavorful and delicious.  Thanks 4th tap for the ease of booking a table, keeping things safe during covid, serving delicious beer and having such a great food truck.

reviews.author: Alysa L.
reviews.description: Here's why I luv 4th Tap  1.) Great drinkable, delicious beer!  My current favs are: ALL OF THEM!  haha I'm kidding.  Try Stay Gold and Kung Fu Robot.  They're so good you will want more.    2.) Great staff.  Really nice, accommodating, and they keep everyone's safety in mind by wearing masks and sanitizing ALL THE TIME!  So no CardiB, I won't get Corona virus here!   3.) Great vibe.  As a woman, I often think of, "is it safe for me to drink here alone?"  when out at bars.  I've never had this concern at 4th Tap.  4th Tap is open and bright and has lots of space to be alone or hang with guests.   As I mentioned the staff are great and wear masks and they look out for their guests in other ways, too.    4.) Great bar seats. Great bar seats are an unrated variable and let me tell y'all, I don't slide off these seats!  They're comfy and allow me to drink more beer.  Cause it's all about the beer!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Pretty basic tap room and smallish brewery, but LOVE the fact they're a co-op! Putting out some decent IPAs and stouts. Offering eight taps to choose from at any given time, including their four core beers and four orbitals. Can order by pint, half pint, and/or flight. Very reasonably priced... and several little options for self entertainment including board games, a TV, and a piano. A must stop if visiting the now named "Austin Craft Beer Corridor" (i.e., there are several breweries in the adjacent area). Support local! Cheers to the shared love of good beers!

reviews.author: Monica D.
reviews.description: I typically like IPAs but 4th Tap has a great blonde ale! The tap room has long tables with a large assortment of board games available. You can also sit in the production area as long as you follow the rules such as "1. Be Cool" and of course, others like don't touch the equipment. The parking area is very limited but the location can be accessed by public transportation. Outside they also had a pizza food truck.    Fun place to hang out!

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: 4th Tap? Well it happened to be the 4th brewery I went to on this lovely Friday Evening. Lots of seating area with lots of great beers to sample. They had quite a few decent beers. But for me, what made 4th two truly memorable was the little gaming area they had. Truly unique and super awesome

reviews.author: Scyenna B.
reviews.description: Got this place confused with another.  There are so many Breweries in Austin, it is too much fun. The 4th tap offered a quaint space that wasn't too busy but offered plenty of seating and a great menu.

reviews.author: Doug B.
reviews.description: The beers are well crafted. The IPA is fantastic. Kung Fu Robot is a well-balanced and sophisticated IPA. Great afternoon.Oh yeah and they're totally kid friendly.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: I'm not a beer drinker at all but I love and appreciate this brewery!! They are a part of our Divine Canine "Barks for Beers" and with their wonderful support we are able to provide free therapy dog service in Central Texas. Purchase a pint glass and get free pours at many Austin and area breweries!  The general manager, Erin, is amazing and strongly supports us. Look for us here every May for the entire month. We bring our amazing therapy pups to the brewery to love on everyone.

reviews.author: Lanie L.
reviews.description: Solid brewery, but I wish there was more varieties of beer offered.  I opted for the flight, which is 5 for $12, but you have to go for the 3 core and can only choose 2 orbitals. It's a shame because I didn't care for 1 of the core items, a really fruity gluten-free beer. (I had a sample and didn't really like it).  Fortunately, I asked really nicely if I could swap it out for an orbital, and the employee said she could. But when my cousin tried the same, she was denied.  +2 Vitality (Core): Spring Ale-and their lightest beer they offer. Smooth and good flavor. Perfect for if you're looking for a light beer.  Zephyr (Core): American Pale Ale-A little more hop to it, but still a smooth and light option.   Long Walk-Grapefruit IPA-Light notes of citrus, hoppy, and refreshing. But in an increasingly crowded market of grapefruit beers, this one gets lost.  Mega-Citrus One-Double IPA-Basically a stronger version of Long Walk. To me, it tasted almost identical, which makes me wonder with such a limited menu, this one is offered. (But then again, why did I choose to sample it? Not too sure myself.)  Brick Top-Robust Porter. I'm not a porter drinker. At all. But once I started sipping, I really enjoyed it. This is a popular and enjoyable one.  Sample cup pours are generous and the prices are really good for the amount you get. (I couldn't finish my entire sample flight!). There indoor seating as well as seating 'outside' in the brewery area. There is a ping-pong table, plenty of board games, and apparently, rambunctious wrestling matches that happening quarterly that brings the whole neighborhood out.  I didn't get to see any wrestling happen this time around, so all in all 4th Tap offers good beer at good prices, but I'm looking for something more to wow.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Was happy to discover this place so close to where I live. Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was moderately full. The space is nice and the AC was turned up, so it was a great respite from the heat. Got a flight of their beers and not a bad one in the bunch! The bartenders were very friendly and knowledgeable and were able to make some solid and informed beer recs for my date who had no idea what beer he wanted.   There is even a piano randomly sitting amongst the tables and a random patron got up from his table, chugged the rest of his pint, waltzed over the piano, took a seat and then started playing and belting out Billy's Joel's "Pianoman". A pint w/free entertainment is always a plus!   Can see myself coming back in periodically to check out the new stuff on the rotation

reviews.author: Christopher R.
reviews.description: I love these beers more than any other brewery in the area. +2 to Vitality is my goto favorite! The Suneater is also a crowd pleaser! The current sixer pickup procedures are quick and easy. I like the way they bring your orders out to you! We bike over there or swing by on the way home! Easy and effortless!

reviews.author: Angie W.
reviews.description: Great little brewery tucked away from the crowds up north.  Beer was on point.  Service was stellar with friendly bartenders and servers.  We at around playing games, drinking beer, and enjoying the company.  Food truck out front if you want something to nosh on.  Check this place out!

reviews.author: Jennifer J.
reviews.description: Great beer and a different vibe/scene than most other places! Hoping to come back the next time we're in town!

reviews.author: Sam V.
reviews.description: Another unassuming microbrewery in a warehouse that opens into a glorious playground for adults. I wish I had gotten the names of the bartenders because they were so sweet to my mother, who is a lightweight and does not drink alcohol, but was feeling adventurous :) They even went out of their way to grab a beer they were out of on tap, but had a can of it in the back for her to try. She loved it, so she got it on the house. Incredible customer service.   There are plenty of large picnic tables in the taproom, and a whole shelf of board games to keep you and guests entertained. There is a grand piano off to the side of the room, so you know fun times are had here.   In the brew house, there is more seating, a wrestling ring (not sure I get it?), and a ping pong table! Game on.   I really enjoyed the grapefruit hints of the Longwalk as well as the tamarind acidity of the Renewal. Tasting is highly encouraged here as well. My family and I enjoyed ourselves immensely. At the end of the night, I paid a $12 tab! Great drinkin' to do on a budget!  Thanks for taking care of us and for being awesome at life!   -xoxo

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: My first time at this spot. You walk in and it's an open space well developed. Bench seating isn't comfy but allows large groups to fit together. You get to taste before you buy. Then there is the back area where they brew. Ping pong, bean bag toss and a wrestling ring. Yep. We ordered pizza and they brought it right in.

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: Good spot to chill with friends. I came here last weekend with my husband to meet up with some out-of-state friends who were visiting. Their guacamole and tacos were good and so was their beer selection. I honestly don't remember which one we got, but just had whatever the servers recommended and they were all good.  The outdoor seating area was nice at night with the hanging lights and is dog friendly (always a bonus for us!).   Street parking is close to impossible to find in the area, but there's paid garage parking. It is pricey, but the only spot we were able to find that wasn't too far from Lazarus.

reviews.author: Shaji K.
reviews.description: Thursday late afternoon - stopped by here to check out yet another brewery on the street. Mostly packed with people working on laptops, but the open air setup doesn't make it feel too crowded.  Was able to quickly get a seat at the bar and order from the scannable menus. Decided on the Prodigal Pills ($6) to go along with a Breakfast Taco ($3.50). Pilsener is light and crushable, though not much flavor. Breakfast taco comes out fast - packed with eggs, cheese, pico de gallo, and bacon. Thankfully not a stale tortilla and even balance of ingredients. Finished the day off with the Double Predestination IPA ($7)- definitely more of a kick, possible some overkill on the hops.   Service is a bit hectic as the bartenders work off the many tables. Fine spot to relax, especially outside where there are tables available.

reviews.author: Al K.
reviews.description: First brewery stop in Austin and it did not disappoint. Great options and loved the atmosphere.  Service was great and staff were nice.  Again, the seating options and drink choices were a huge bonus. Coffee beverages looked delicious. Friend got an espresso and recommended it.  Locale is fantastic as well. Very accessible.  Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Matthew H.
reviews.description: So fancy! We showed up just in time for the great weather. The beer and the food are both equally good! Great patio vibes and plenty of parking for easy in and easy out.

reviews.author: Kayla S.
reviews.description: Loved the atmosphere and bartender. Very kind and patient with our questions! Would come back here for sure

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: A new favorite find! New Year's Eve could not be better remembered. Love the ambiance, including the music playlist. The patio is simply perfect. The beer variety has something for everyone and the tacos are a handy nibble option.

reviews.author: Made B.
reviews.description: This place is great! Lots of beer options and their queso is amazing!!Nice outdoor area with music.

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: If I were a local, this would be my hangout spot. The beers were superb. I got a Disco Prophet, a strawberry lemonade sour, and a Big Sky IPA - delicious and refreshing.  But the real star was the appetizers. We got chips and fresh guacamole, which paired excellently with the beer. But the real winner was the fried chickpeas, which were like seasoned corn nuts! I've never had anything like that, and it's enough for 3-4 people to share, despite only being $3.  The place was clean, staff was friendly, and there was plenty of seating. Definitely a must-see brewery if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Karley M.
reviews.description: This brewery was walking distance from our air bnb when visiting Austin. It quickly became our favorite spot and we went back a couple times. Beer was delicious and staff was extremely friendly. They also offer other things besides beer. There's a lot of space here too. All around gem!

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: Good quality beer with a variety of awesome food. This European style brewery always seems to have something going on.   Showed up on a Thursday evening for dinner and was impressed with the amount of people who were here. There is picnic table seating out back with tents in the front for additional seating. There is also plenty of seating inside. There is plenty of seating but the like to order may take some time to get through, so plan accordingly.   I went with the torta as my meal. The bread was authentic and the fillings inside were great. If I had to change one thing I would have asked to get the torta with chorizo although it isn't listed as a protein for the sandwich.   This is a great local spot to check out and a place I will most likely be a regular at.

reviews.author: Tandis H.
reviews.description: This place has plenty of outdoor seating with fans that keep the flies at bay mostly. The inside was nice and they have everything you'd need to hit the spot. Tacos and beer.   The beer was pretty good. The only sour beer they had at the time was a Rosé flavored one that unfortunately tasted a little too much like wine, but was still digestible. My hazy IPA was not hazy at all, but was still fine. I wish the beers were served a bit colder.   The fried chickpeas were a good deal for $3 we thought they could serve like 10 people. The 2 of us only made a dent in like 1/5 of the bowl. But hey, they're snacky so maybe someone could down the whole thing if they really wanted to!  The carnitas taco was really good. I highly recommend it. The al pastor was alright but didn't pack the flavor punch of the carnitas. I doused my tacos in the free salsa that was in a mini fridge nearby. The red salsa was so good and added a layer of light smokiness to my tacos. But then after a while I thought I sensed some heat? I assumed it was the green salsa so I continued to douse my tacos in the red. Idk it must have been the red salsa that was hot, because by the end of my meal I was feeling sick to my stomach. Never felt that way from spice but needless to say the beer didn't taste too good after that either. Luckily I recuperated by sipping 2 glasses of their Yeti water until I didn't want to vomit anymore.   I can't place my distaste after this meal on the restaurant since it was mostly my own doing . I assume they label their salsas and I just didn't see it.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Super cute spot to hang out with friends! They have a ton of outdoor seating and can accommodate large parties. We had about 20 people in our group and we were able to pull up tables and chairs for everyone.   The place is really well decorated so we were able to snap a few cute pictures!

reviews.author: KC C.
reviews.description: We must have visited on the wrong day.  There were just 7-8 beers on the menu and nothing really intrigued us.  I went with my favorite kind which is a stout on nitro.  I hate wasting beer but I drank just half.  Not only were the beers not flavorful but they were not cold.    I will say their tacos were really good, and the place is super huge.  For a Monday it was pretty packed at lunch, but still spacious enough to stay 6-feet away if desired.  It's not hard to find a seat bc the place is sooo big.    Wouldn't come back for the beer, but for the tacos?  Yaaassss!

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: My wife and I were in Austin for a long weekend and this could be the best tap room I have been to in a long time. Tons of outdoor seating and great free water. I got the 40 Days and 40 Nights and the Lil' Sebastion Bach Maibock and the Walking on Water.   I ordered 3 beers and they were spectacular and the service was splendid. I ordered an al pastor taco and the carne asada tacos. They were super flavorful and perfect, especially for a tap room.  I got a couple of stickers and the atmosphere was just fantastic. You should definitely try this place!

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: Hands down the best brewery experience we encountered in Austin. It's a little bit if everything and that's not at all a bad thing as without exception they are all done well. We saw they were open early so we went in on a weekday thinking we could knock this off our list of a full day planned. We weren't real clear on their hours entailed so there was a not so unwelcome idea of a little day / morning drinking to get the day started. We realized this was going to leave us with the opportunity to have a few small samples or perhaps one nice pour. Upon our arrival we were impressed at how the location spanned the corner of the street and had many "compartments" of seating areas. I'm no way were Amy of them on the smaller side. Street parking was easy enough and we headed on in.   Very impressed to be greeted with smiling faces along with plenty of good morning exchanges. We were very pleasantly surprised to see they offered an array of espresso drinks. What a welcome pivot to our plan. We ordered up and came to realize they had food as well. Pretty happy about that. There were the assorted pastry items and breakfast TACOS! I noticed there was also queso fondido on the menu and that was screaming please try me. I went to order and was told this item is generally served later in the day. I suspect my sadness to hear this news showed as there was a quick offer to fire up the required kitchen equipment to make this happen (the salamander for those curious).   The lattes were delicious. So much so we ordered up a second round. Near completion of those the awesome cheesy chorizo goodness arrived. Bubbly hot and looking superb. It was all I could do to keep myself from grabbing a chip and putting a scoop of this bubbling sub nuclear cheese in my mouth at the price of completely burning my entire mouth. With a little patience I snuck a few small bites being mindful to blow as to not scorch my mouth. OMG was this delicious in every aspect.   Right away we knew this was just fine with a latte but was screaming for a beer to accompany this perfect breakfast fast. Such an awesome selection of beers. The bartender was beyond sweet and gave us many short pull samples of the tappers. I landed on the one that worked for me. My wife found one that worked well for her. By the time the beers arrived it was clear this was not going to be a short stop. Instead it was clear this was our impromptu plan for the morning. Completely five star experience from the word go. So much so we took the liberty of an evening stop later that week. The vibe of this place was so cool with any hint of pretentiousness. I'm no expert on all the brew options in Austin but this was clearly number one for us based on all it included and the absolute outstanding hospitality from the coffee bar to the bartender to the cook who brought us the miraculously amazing queso. No matter you plans I would highly suggest  in fact nearly insist this is a stop not to be missed. This reviews has been locked in draft land fir a while but there is no doubt this place is still thriving and for all the right reasons.

reviews.author: Alexa S.
reviews.description: I love Lazarus! Awesome vibe, good beer, great tacos/quesadillas and ample street parking!

reviews.author: Taylor S.
reviews.description: Beer was good. Staff was incredibly rude, un-welcoming and didn't bother at all to try to accompany our party of 6 when we came to see a friend's band. Instead of leading us to a new table or area, once we sat the staff told us we had to leave or we could stand outside in the 40* weather. We got our beers and were standing off to the side and the cashier told us move out of the way so people can order- we weren't in the way, people were not ordering. While I'm writing this we are witnessing more customers treated poorly in the line. Seems like a lot of non-Texans are working here and it shows. Never will I ever come back to this establishment. Signed- Native Austinite

reviews.author: Yuki I.
reviews.description: Casual atmosphere with a cute outdoor patio area, great drinks, and delicious tacos! I'm not a huge fan of beer, but luckily, they've got ciders! I think the flavors they had when I was there were: paloma, rose, and cherry. I got the paloma and rose ciders, and they were so delicious! Paloma for its fruitiness, rose for its sweetness. I got the carnitas taco with avocado, and that was quite flavorful, hit the spot! :) Definitely recommend for grabbing drinks and bites with a friend!

reviews.author: Tarika K.
reviews.description: I love Lazarus! This has quickly become one of my favorite spots in Austin- whether you're there for coffee and tacos in the morning or high quality brews at night, you really can't go wrong at Lazarus.   I showed up on a Saturday afternoon and ended up staying until after dinner! The ambiance is fantastic- with ample seating both indoors and outdoors and picnic tables for groups of all sizes, Lazarus attracts all kinds, from people working from home to big parties.   The tacos were really great! We ordered the pollo verde and al pastor tacos and they were fantastic. They were a great portion to pair with drinks and while the line seemed long the service was really quick.   Overall, this is a great spot for regulars and I've found myself returning for a reliably good time.

reviews.author: Blake J.
reviews.description: good vibes and what I ordered was tasty. The food menu is limited but I guess that's because it's a brewery lol

reviews.author: Kristella P.
reviews.description: You can't go wrong with any beer here. This is one of the few places I got a flight and didn't not really like any of the beers.  My favorites were the Violet Crown Black Kettle Sour and Gold on the Ceiling IPA! Such quality craft beer

reviews.author: Kim L.
reviews.description: Cute afternoon day drinking spot that we found via Yelp. Bumped a star bc of their limited seating (one barrel table) outside, the main bartender was not very helpful and some of the drafts we wanted to try were out.   We sat outside and people watched and enjoyed our flights.  Really liked wit-tington ale, weiz of TX, short straw stout and violet crown. Bummed they were out of the Firenze estate.

reviews.author: KC C.
reviews.description: The hubby and I are from Cali, so we are spoiled with some pretty good breweries.  Came here on a Saturday for some afternoon beers.  Was so good we came back Monday to finish off the weekend.    There's a good variety of beers so we did eight tasters and ended up with three separate glasses.  They had a special when we were there called the Apple cinnamon sour; it tasted just like apple pie.  If they reproduce it, I highly recommend a glass.    The place itself is super posh, establishment clean, service was great and staff very friendly.  I would def recommend this brewery.  Oh, met Cooper...he's one of their brewers.  He's really nice.

reviews.author: Mylesha D.
reviews.description: Getting there: Located in DT Austin, walking distance from the visitor center. Street parking is all around and there is a parking garage across the street at the hotel.  Experience: We came here to kill time before our flight, and I am sure glad we did. Their selection of beers were right up my alley. They had a variety of fruit flavored beers. The brewers were super friendly and inviting, I even let him choose my last flight choice. I loved the ambiance of the industrial rose gold with the green wall paint, and the live plant accents. It felt like a relaxing place to go work, study or just hang with friends.

reviews.author: Aaron F.
reviews.description: Absolutely wonderful stop off while walking downtown Austin. The staff was super friendly and welcoming. Tried a flight, Wit, Violent Crown, Texas Skies, Affogate. Went with the Wit. You will taste why it is a gold medal winner.

reviews.author: Hani C.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed this spot. Didn't hurt that it was 2 minutes away from where we were staying and pretty much in the center of downtown.   Love any place that offers beer flights, as it's the best way to really know what you like and what your taste buds are in the mood for. I typically go for lagers or Belgian-style beers and personally loved the Lingering Sunshine and Wit-Tington.  The atmosphere is chill, laid-back, and the plants everywhere are totally my vibe. You can tell it's frequented by drinking tours as there was constantly small buses/vans waiting outside for parties drinking inside. Music also made for a nice ambiance and the girls who took care of our order upon arrival were very sweet and informative.

reviews.author: Desiree D.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem in this area of town.   Stopped in 2 times whole in town for the week.   I highly suggest coming here, their beer is great and layered with flavor. And yes they have flights.   Peep the plants hanging too!  Cute decor.  I came in February and they did not have an outdoor section. Not sure if they ever will.

reviews.author: Lynn D.
reviews.description: This was a really cute brewery with great service. They had some interesting beers and offered flights and snacks. Nice central location. Very clean and Covid compliant. I had a cherry lime made beer, a pretzel and a bbq beef empanada. Pretzel was a little over cooked but the empanada was delicious

reviews.author: Aleah H.
reviews.description: I stopped here on a whim while exploring Austin via Lime scooter, and it was a solid find! A no nonsense brewery where I genuinely enjoyed every beer I tried-- A gem!   We sat at one of the handful of the tables they have sprinkled in the sidewalk outside. The street was pretty low key for being to close to 6th, so it was enjoyable on the sidewalk! You still order at the bar which was no problem, and the service was quick and efficient!   Rhythm is a Dancer stole the show for me! It's a sour, but it is muted enough that I could drink multiple without my mouth being pursed from tartness! The Kolsch was great, as well. We also tried the soft pretzel which was SO airy which I loved. It also came with a garlic sauce so not your typical pub pretzel, but a very tasty take on one!  Employee's wore masks and maintained distancing, as well, which is great. We found this brewery on a list of spots still enforcing safety restrictions, and can confirm they were!

reviews.author: Chelsey S.
reviews.description: Love this small brewery in a great location downtown Austin. The space is bright, clean, and nicely decorated. My husband and I both had flights. The standout was the Wit-tington by far. The Strawberry Wayne was pretty unique and had a nice pink hue to it. The  staff was very friendly and gave great suggestions of which beers we should try.
