You can get a crowler of any beer, which was great for us to take home! Can't recommend CDB enough!  Really enjoyed the indie 2000s playlist as well!!!

reviews.author: Stephen S.
reviews.description: The 30+ times I've been to breweries I've discovered that they truly are the happiest places on Earth. Customer service and courtesy are typically top-notch because...well...it's a brewery.   First let me point out this rating is based more heavily on service than the wonderful beer they served( I'd give a solid "B" on that spectrum).  Walk in, bartender says "hi" and starts cleaning mugs. We look around trying to figure out when he'll actually approach us. Ok...oh look menus, guess I'll grab one. Standing there waiting for the "what can I get ya?" Or "first time? Here's our menu, let me know if you have any questions." Bartender jargon. Nothing. My wife says "yeah it's our first time here." "Oh, ok" responds bartender. Finally we decide on our own we'll do a flight and order a pretzel. I'm assuming they specialize in IPAs since they have 4! He takes the order.   I return a beer because a random fly fell in one. I tell the bartender I hate to waste good beer but can I get a new one, a fly fell in mine." No reaction, he just asks which beer and refills it.   Good craft beer, subpar service.

reviews.author: Tala B.
reviews.description: I wish we had a place like this near my home -- I would be here every weekend (once the pandemic is over, of course)!   My sister and I were visiting Austin, TX awhile ago and wanted to do an Escape Room -- There is one right next to this little brewery, so after we finished the Escape Room (we escaped, by the way!), we decided to enjoy some beer and celebrate.  This spot is in a less busy part of the city and there were not a lot of people inside, but I was in love with the interior decor and the ambience. Very calm, chill and relaxing. We enjoyed our beers too! Overall, I loved it and wish there was one near my house.

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: This is a pretty good brewery. I mostly drink IPAs so I got both of them they both tasted very good and smooth not so hoppy/ dry but very tasty and enjoyable. The ambiance is nice and quite very retro with a "we work here" feel which is a good feeling. The bartender was very helpful and attentive. Overall loved the experience and worth the stop if your in the area.

reviews.author: Lexi M.
reviews.description: Being from San Diego we were excited to try some of the local breweries, but literally from the moment we walked in it was severely disappointing. Not only was the staff rude, unhelpful and basically wanted us to leave at 2pm but the beer was ok at best. The bartender was so rude asking loudly why are there people here right now (during normal business hours) but anytime we asked about the beer he would say it's on the list. I get it might be busier than normal but there was no line other than our group, and all they did was pour beer no food running or drink running. Now to the beer, out of the two flights of 8 different beers 4 were tolerable and this is from people that don't leave alcohol behind. The sour was decent but heavy, the wheats were way to heavy and honest can't even describe them lol. Anywho long story but won't be back; if I want to be treated like crap i at least want a decent drink

reviews.author: Hilary E.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday night, and it was pretty empty actually. The guy who served our small group said they're more of a weeknight spot where people go after work. However, I liked that it was fairly empty. We could talk and hear each other, no line for more beer, the guy working was very nice, and it felt like we had the place to ourselves. I'd go back here in a minute, either earlier in the night before the rest of the evening plans or for a break inbetween places. The beer was good, and the place is very clean and pretty inside.

reviews.author: Marc M.
reviews.description: Great little spot in downtown.  They really push the flights which is great because they have quite a number of solid brews.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Came by with good company for some brews on a hot Sunday afternoon. The women-lead space and brewski selections are rockin', but they're missing a key component--wifi.  I know, I hate sounding like your typical phone-using human being, but every time I'm downtown wifi is super handy. It helps us decide where we want to go afterwards! Anyways, Central is set up like your typical clean and succulent-friendly microbrewery these days. They have board games and serve yourself water (sparkling OR still. THAT's a first!!). They don't have outdoor seating, but plenty of seats indoors. They also sell small bites and other drinks like wines and ciders. Their guest list is pretty solid with brews from Zilker and Independence to name a few other Austin loves. I got a taster of Central's own beers. We really did not enjoy the milkshake IPA that had a strong vanilla aftertaste. It was way too sweet, but to each their own.  Their restrooms are clean and they allow outside food too. SCORE! Now if only the owners would install some wifi...our taptender told us that the owners are still getting that set up. So that's a great sign! They also don't validate parking, so if you need to drive to get here...come on a Sunday when parking is free downtown. Pro. Tip.

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Their beer is so good, light and refreshing. If you like sours, they got you covered, ipas? Sure they have that too. You can of course get a flight of beer to taste multiple flavors and I'd recommend doing that...then going back and buying a pint of what you loved the most.   The service was A-1. The woman at the front was very friendly and was open to answering my 500 questions about when they opened, if I can taste different beers, what're those people in the corner with the purple drink drink drinking? In addition to that I'm pretty sure the owners were also just hanging out in there and they were chatting with different guests which made it feel very homey and inviting  Price- on par with other breweries  Great location! Especially if you're just moseying around town ( like I was) and happen to stumble upon it.   The aesthetics are on point. Beautiful Edison bulbs and plan fixtures. Both benches and tables so you can come with a large group or chill on a date.

reviews.author: Andy O.
reviews.description: The jalapeño bread is a must, an amazing brewery right in between 6th st and rainey st with a modern and hipster feel but good for the dad and for the mom looking for a break from The kids as well as the working adults needing a good brew, there's Baird games as well for some quick fun. Electric scooters all around so it's easy to keep bar hoping around. Great spot

reviews.author: Matthew A.
reviews.description: Made a quick stop to grab drinks for a cookout. The brewers were helpful and friendly, made lots of suggestions and let us taste as many different brews as we wanted. In and out in 10min and very satisfied with our selection.

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: One of my favorite spots in Austin. I love the venue under the live oak trees, the open space, and the playground. No hard alcohol, but I feel they make up for it with their creative cocktails and house-made seltzers.   The food trucks give enough variety that there is something for everyone -- pizza, BBQ, Mexican, and the BEST ice cream! But the best part for me is sitting back in the Adirondack, cold drink in hand, watching my little one playing on the playground with a live band in the background.   I hope we continue to get more places like this in Austin!

reviews.author: Dave W.
reviews.description: Wild place, but really fun! Stopped here on the way to the airport for one last beer on vacation, and was blown away at how crowded it was. There was what seemed like a farmer's market, concert, and youth soccer game all happening around this brewery.   Beer was good and there was a lot of food trucks to choose from. We went to the pizza one and it was good, but maybe would go with the BBQ or Mexican next time.

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: Easily my favorite brewery in town.   The food trailers here are all bomb and on point. This is an awesome spot for lunch. You can get everything from world class tacos, great pizza to Texas Monthly Top 50 ranked BBQ.   The beer is absolutely amazing. The collabs with local breweries and bars such as Cosmic and St. Elmo are all cool and tasty -AF.   The to go beer options are always great. You can have a few pints and come home with some amazing beer to finish the night at home watching a movie with.   I've seen a few shows here. Saw Eternal Champion here and had a blast. The venue is great for live music, anytime they have a live show its worth the cover to hang out and see some live tunes and have some amazing beer.   The best thing about Meanwhile for me happens to be that its extremely family friendly. They have a playground a soccer court and large open field that is perfect for flying kites. They are all fenced in so its the perfect spot for me to bring my daughter to play. My family comes here regularly and we really enjoy the family friendly aspect Meanwhile offers.   I could go on and on about how much I love the beer and just this space in general. Its really do not miss Austin location now.   Thanks for offering so much good stuff Meanwhile you rock!  edit: I almost forgot to mention how awesome the coffee and breakfast tacos by Pueblo Viejo are here.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: A very Austin brewery, but I mean that in a good way. A lot of thought was put into design, decor and layout - and it shows. Very chic, but also comfortable . Gorgeous outdoor spaces, this is a great place to hit when we get good weather in central Texas. REALLY good beer, tons of styles - but all really well made. Any beer drinker will love a visit here. A variety of food trucks at peak times makes for a versatile dining experience for your group. Very family friendly with a nice play area for kids. Just a great spot. Drink local!

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: Here's a secret, a lot of folks who go to these breweries don't go because of how good the IPA or the cider is, they have a long list of other factors.   We had an IPA and a cider, they were good, not life-changing, but decent. I have yet to sample the entire beer selection but I will. And you know why? Because of everything else the place offers ensures I'll be back.  The tacos from the taco truck were really impressive, exceeded expectations actually. The pizza was equally excellent.   The set up for the grounds was spot on. The trees, the playground, the environment with families, dog owners, young people, it all meshed well because everyone had a section that fit their methods of socializing.  You can't tell me this isn't a science because significant thought (and money, I'm sure) went into developing this experience. Bravo!  Now I need to drink some more of their beers.

reviews.author: Rachel F.
reviews.description: A MUST go to in Austin!!! Highly, highly recommend. 100/10, great beer, tasty cocktails, delicious frozen rosé and a killer hard kombucha  This is place also has amazing food trucks too (dough boys- out of this world garlic knots with a lemon ricotta dip*drooling) and a beautiful outdoor area for adults and children (there's a playground!). Adults can have a beverage and lounge while their kids get their energy out. Very fun spot!!

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: This is probably one of the best breweries that opened in ATX in 2020 - during a pandemic at that! Since their opening, they've been doing gangbusters business with no signs of slowing.  Obviously, when you visit, you'll notice they have a huge space and $$ was spent to fully build it out. It's not a small brewery that grew up, it was built to be big. There is plenty of seating inside and even more seating outside on the turf + mulch area. But, be forewarned this place is busy. Saturday afternoons are packed with people with pets and families. There is a playscape so parents like this place.   Now, to their beer. Meanwhile brews consistent and good beer. They have a variety of beers from regular German Pils to New England IPAs. Nothing infected and nothing with off flavors. They always seem to have a good rotation of beers.   Don't like beer? They also have wine, cocktails and coffee! Something for everyone.   While they don't serve food, there are numerous food trucks to order from.   Even though the lines can get long, they do move pretty quickly (especially the line that is at the main entrance).   We would come here more often if it were closer to us, but getting across the river is the hardest part. :)

reviews.author: Sally D.
reviews.description: Since my last review about Meanwhile's extraordinary support for the community, we decided to return that support and have hung out in their beer garden a few times, enjoying different brews and chatting while people-watching. There are so many trees to shade the area and a playground in the middle for kids to stay entertained and out of their parent's hair. The inside area is clean and modern and very hip with good air conditioning (so important during the summer, well, really 9 months of the year).  We would have been seated there but are still cautious about the Rona. So, good beer, good vibes, good venue. And food trucks though we haven't tried any yet. Cheers!

reviews.author: Arlene T.
reviews.description: Third time here.... 5 stars for the outdoor area ... super cool and big play area for kids off to the side which is great so that other people who either want to get away from kids or are not particularly into kids running all over the place around them while enjoying beers won't be annoyed by them. #notthattheresanythingwrongwithkids  1 star to the beer servers.... attitude like snobby coffee barristers! I'm always mystified by ANY questionable servers ... don't they know that if they'd give better service, they'd get better tips?!?!!   3 stars to the beer

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Amazing place! Love that it's in the warehouse district, so it's off the beaten path. A TON of shaded seating and room to spread out. There was a kid's bday party there and we didn't notice (yay for our dog). There was plenty of water to help yourself to as well as a nice list of beers. They were all incredible (even the German ones)! They also have some cocktails, frozés and coffee available. We got an iced dirty chai on our way out, since their coffee looked and smelled good. WOW! Nice and strong! I am very picky about coffee being too weak and having to add extra shots of espresso, but this was on point!  We will definitely be back! Great, friendly staff, and we especially loved that we could order beer starting at 10a on Sunday! In early and out early!

reviews.author: Hannah B.
reviews.description: Great IPA's! Great atmosphere too. Lots of dogs and kids, which normally the kids might be annoying, but it's a large space and they are spread out

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: The wife and I have enjoyed the beer in the garden at Meanwhile several times. Its nice to have some variety of food choices with the pizza, bbq, and Mexican food offerings.  It seems no matter the day of week or time of day, one or two of the trucks are not serving food even on weekends.  Speaking of weekends... unless you are into family oriented madness, with kids running amok everywhere, because of the playground equipment and soccer pitch avoid this place. We enjoy dining out or having a couple of beers at breweries to kind of get away from life's madness, not to have to deal with this kind of madness.

reviews.author: Brenda G.
reviews.description: I chose this place for my birthday gathering of around 15 of us on a Friday afternoon and so glad I did!  I wanted to find a Dripping Springs like brewery without making my friends drive out there and this fit the bill.  Some tips below!  Parking - As Austin gets more and more crowded it's hard to find spots for large groups that are quasi central and have ample parking - this place seems to have enough street parking since it is out in the middle of a warehouse district that is empty on weekends.  We were all able to find parking with no issues.  Kids - this place is super family friendly.  My friends with kids felt very COVID safe due to the size of the venue and there is a spaced out area with a playscape.  Drinks and food - I had a few of the seltzer cocktails and they were good enough.  Obvs this is a brewery so I wasn't expecting too much in that dept.  You can order drinks at a window outside which also made us feel safe.  There are a handful of food trucks where our friends ordered.  Also we got there at 2:00 pm on a Saturday and were able to snag a couple large picnic tables.  I think that bc it is new it is not getting too crowded yet.  There was plenty of shade for us once we moved one of the tables around.  There was a ticketed show starting at 7:00 pm that Saturday that required a $10 cover charge so def check their website before arriving if you don't want to pay a cover.  Overall a great addition to the breweries popping up in the southeast Austin area.

reviews.author: Cambrea D.
reviews.description: Me and my husband live close by and come here all the time. This is my favorite place to go on week days in the evening or on weekends. Their beer is so good, especially their hazy IPAs. The vibe is so relaxing and cool, with picnic benches under the trees. I hope they open their indoor seating soon, and extend their parking and outdoor seating area. I always bring my friends and family who visit from out of town and I recommend it to everyone whose looking for a must-try local Austin brewery!

reviews.author: Liz M.
reviews.description: This is my new go-to during the week with my not-yet-school-aged daughter. We're usually the only ones on the playscape, and there's always at least one food truck open, plus the cafe.  There is plenty of outdoor seating (inside too, actually), and it's dog and family friendly. Easy parking in their lot, I've never had a problem finding a spot (again day time during the week).   I can't wait to go here for date night!   Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Darci J.
reviews.description: The space was vibin'. Plenty of tables and chairs. Also a big playscape crawling with tons of kiddos. But off to the side, so they weren't annoying for the hungover heavy drinkers. On-site soccer field with goal, some dudes were playing a fairly serious game while i was waiting in line for the most delightful chicken tacos with guac and fresh spinach from the Pueblo Viejo food truck.  Reason for 3 stars - worst Paloma ever. Like ever. I was suspicious when i realized the Paloma was listed under 'Seltzers' (after i had ordered :/ ). Then grew more wary when the 'bartender' added WAY too many dashes of bitters ((( when a real Paloma is plenty bitter from fresh Texas grapefruit ))) and it was TERRIBLE. Straight gross.  Also one beer was ok, the Tender Robot- Hazy Ipa. Not anywhere near as caustic as Pinthouse Pizza's Electric Jellyfish, fairly enjoyable. But the only other beer we sampled (the Kolsh) was incorrect, no bitter finish, weak and thin.    So, come for the vibe! Come for the food!  Avoid their weird Seltzer Cocktails Choose carefully (or ask for a sample) of their beer before you commit to a full pint.

reviews.author: Tiffany M.
reviews.description: I love this place - day or night. It's so popular that the lot fills up fast and normally flows over onto the street. Parking is still easy though. There's unlimited street parking since it's in a commercial area. The beer is good, staff is so friendly, it's so cute inside, the PLANTS on the shelf are adorable, the food trucks are great...I can't find fault in it at all. Besame is a must-try for ice cream and Dough Boys for pizza. Distant Relative has amazing BBQ chicken!

reviews.author: Andoni S.
reviews.description: Spent a very relaxing couple of hours at Meanwhile a few days ago and was able to try out several different beer options on the menu, as well as fully enjoy the laid-back and friendly atmosphere. The brewery has plenty of outdoor seating, plenty of parking, clean, new facilities and interior as well as nice views of their brewing equipment. To put it concisely, they check just about every box you could ask for!  They have an interesting selection of beer including a few blends I had never seen elsewhere, the most notable of which was their "Moot Point", a coffee-infused amber. Glad to say I can recommend this brewery, the great atmosphere as well as the impressive selection!

reviews.author: Ashley K.
reviews.description: Meanwhile Brewing is a great space in South Austin to hang out with family and friends.  I kept hearing that Meanwhile Brewing was one of the best breweries in Austin to bring your kids, and now I see why!  There is so much open space for kids to run around and even two little playscapes.  I brought my 7 and 2 year old and they both had a blast.  My husband and I were able to enjoy some good drinks and food while the kids played.  I should mention - the brewery isn't just for families.  Parents with kids were in the minority when we visited on a Thursday night.  The brewery is great for anyone.  In terms of food and drinks, I'm kinda embarrassed to say that I actually didn't try any of the beer (I know, I know, I'm just not much of a beer drinker).  I did try the frosé (yes, I'm basic), which I enjoyed.  It had a floral note to it, which I really liked.  For food, there are four food trucks on site and our family managed to try them all.  My husband and son raved about the brisket from Distant Relatives, while my favorite was the Bob-a-rita (margherita) pizza from Dough Boys.  I also had pretzel and strawberry jam ice cream from Bésame.  I know, it sounds weird, but it was awesome.  I loved the balance of salty and sweet.  I highly recommend it!  Overall, Meanwhile Brewing is great and our family definitely plans to go back; there is something for everyone to enjoy!

reviews.author: Monique H.
reviews.description: Great new brewery in SE Austin! Giant outdoor space with lots of picnic tables. Order at the bar with several of their signature brews on tap to choose from. I enjoyed their Kolsch.  They open early in the morning and serve coffee. I could definitely see myself hanging here one day doing some work when I need to get away from my home office. I wish they would partner with some local coffee roasters through. They have four food trucks, so come hungry!

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: above average beer and a really nice atmosphere  came here for a flight and a little snack after work last Friday. First off, I really liked the atmosphere. there is a bunch of outdoor seating, which is always a plus.  For drinks I got a flight, so I got a variety of beers. Overall, they were pretty good, however, they don't have a lot of variety in the styles available. I also got a slice of pizza, which was much better than I expected for brewery food. All said and done, it's definitely a spot worth visiting, but isn't the best that Austin has to offer.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: This is a Highly Recommend kinda place.   Staff - super friendly and knowledgeable about the drinks and food products.   Environment - lots of seating indoors and out. You can spread out and work. You can dine in and chill. Go alone or with a party and still feel like you have the place to yourself.   Food/drinks - i have yet to have a bad food item from these guys. Everything is delicious and surprisingly thought out. It will take you by surprise. And the drinks. There are plenty of options to taste and enjoy based on your preferences.   $$$ - it is a little pricier then you might expect. But truthfully, for what you get, I will continue to come back here and spend the money.    Give it a shot. I do not think you will regret it. I would recommend this place over Pint House pizza or even Dominoes ;).

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10-24-21  As you can probably figure out, I like beer.  This is my drink of choice. And visiting breweries just takes the experience to the next level.  Quality/Quantity - Beer was mediocre. My family did not like the menu here, so I was pressured to quickly finish my beer and sadly leave.  It should be illegal to only drink one beer...  We hit Trader Joes on the way back and realized they carried the whole line of their beer, so as you can guess, I got two more six packs:)  Now, I am happier.  Atmosphere - You need a much bigger parking lot, especially since almost everyone drives a huge truck. We got lucky with a space, but had to share some of the space with the huge truck to the right and the huge truck to the left, LOL. Teri Joyce and the Tagalongs were playing tonight. They did a good job, the place was hoping. Both the inside and outside spaces are large; however, again too large for their parking lot. Can some people carpool? They also had a small outdoor stand to order beer and food. Additionally, there were plenty of seats at the bar. The team seems to be working pretty hard.  Service - The bartender was just okay. Not much to write about, I ordered, he gave me the beer, and I left; still left a tip though :)  Price - $6.50 + $1 tip  Owner Suggestion - Did I say you need a bigger parking lot? Wish I had more time to enjoy your place, but no fault of yours. Hopefully next time. Keep up the good work.

reviews.author: Sj G.
reviews.description: It looks like a really nice beer garden.  The weather looked like rain so we sat inside.  They do have restrooms and they are clean.  Food is hard to decide if you are lactose intolerant.  We found a Pulled Pork and it came with a pint of beer. We also got two pizzas for the rest to share.  We had the wagyu and 2 choice of the specialty pizza cauliflower. That was a good choice.  I don't care for beer so I had a cider.   They were out of watermelon So I had cranberry.  Very tart but refreshing.  The bar tenders were all so friendly and nice.  I didn't see anywhere to get beer flights and my son had his bday.  Nothing special like a drink or come out to table.   It's a nice atmosphere with nice folks.

reviews.author: Dave W.
reviews.description: Cool spot! Can order inside or outside, and there's tons of long picnic tables to sit at. Beer was good, not great.

reviews.author: Eric R.
reviews.description: Such a great piece of the South Austin community. The food is better than it has to be. The employees at all levels are outstanding. Everyone is helpful and friendly regardless of how busy they are.   Food and service aside, this is just a great place to spend time with the people you love/like. Every time I've been here has been memorable.  Showed up on a Saturday afternoon with a party of 25+ and we immediately found a group of picnic tables and spent the next several hours just enjoying each other's company.   Everyone enjoyed their food and drink but what we'll remember and what I'm most grateful for is the ambiance and hospitality at ABGB.   There's plenty of places to go eat, but when you have a large party and want to make memories with an Austin feel, look no further.

reviews.author: Alex M.
reviews.description: Great outdoor place with plenty of seating for medium size parties. The indoor aesthetic reminds me of a disco roller rink, super groovy.   The food alone is worth coming for, it's upscale apps that are absolutely delicious and they also have pizza.  The con (and why I'm only giving 4 stars) is that this is a beer garden that has ONLY SIX beers available - all brewed in house. I wish they at least had some local options that made the beer list a bit longer, after all it is a beer garden. They also have a small list of ciders and wine available. The "Industry" Pilsner was great and a nice light beer but

reviews.author: Clara C.
reviews.description: *COVID Update*   ABGB is a must visit when in Austin. Parking in their lot is ample. Restrooms are on-site in the corner. Seating is self-served both indoors and outdoors, and there is free WiFi! Masks aren't required here, and most people don't wear them inside or outside. The menu is on a QR code, which is posted on each table. The water station is in the back.   I got the beer flight $15 as it was my first visit. The pilsner is definitely my favorite; it's a popular one! It's odd that there's only 6 choices, but it helps especially for those who are indecisive. If you order one beer, it's about $6. When I visited on a Sunday afternoon, they had live music and many couples were dancing along. I totally missed the memo to bring my boots and hat.   I tried the Calabrese and homemade sausage pizza ($3.50 per slice). Both were delicious.   Obviously with the live music, it's loud inside, but it's a fun place to hang out with larger groups.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Really like this gem of a place. Food was delicious with plenty of outside seating.  They now have ordering outside which is a real win and helps with the lines! Live music is another perk of this spot.  It gets crowded i. the evenings so ride share is a smart way to go.

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: I thought ABGB was a good time! I enjoyed the live music on the night we visited, which happened to be their 8-year anniversary. I had the Day Trip pale ale, and I thought it was pretty delicious. The salad I ordered was also yummy; I especially liked the golden beets. But the star of the show was the pretzel with pimento cheese for SURE.

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: Very relaxing place. Smaller than brewtorium but at least you can hear each other. There was no music when I went on a Thursday after work. I did a flight to sample their good stuff. It's 5 five ounce pours so it's filling! The bruschetta was good but needed more salt or balsamic dressing. It was still tasty. But the stuffed peppadews were really good. I'll need to come back to try their pizza. There's indoor and outdoor seating. Staff know their stuff. Parking seems to fill up fast. Right off of south Lamar

reviews.author: Kelsey M.
reviews.description: Great place to take the dogs and have a pint! The beer is great and the pizza is equally as good! Friendly staff

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: We love ABGB.  The pizzas are delicious.  The salad is amazing.  The beer is cold.  Parking is always perfect.  The wait is always minimal.  The staff are super nice and helpful.  The taste of the pizza is ON POINT!  We always have a great time here.  When you first walk in, the smell of the pizza is out of this world.  it's a great place to take friends from out of town.

reviews.author: Josh H.
reviews.description: I have to ability to work from anywhere, which let's me drop on on places randomly. It's nice because I can keep a running list of spots to check out when I find myself nearby and I don't need t hop on a zoom meeting with a client. ABGB is one of those spots. I stopped in here for a quick beer during covid and it was pretty solid, this is my first time back.   The wifi is good, clearly. I'm writing this review and it hasn't faltered at all. The beer selection is small, but what I've tasted has all been solid. Both in flavor and body, they are true to what they are brewing. Quiet and mellow atmosphere is lovely is for getting some work done and maintaining a medium focus. The garlic fries smell delicious.   The only downside is that I'm getting a little bug action. But I'm also sitting under a tree, in Texas, in June.     I'll be back and probably to eat.

reviews.author: Ivan V.
reviews.description: The people in this great hall were happy and dancing, and I saw many children! I had initially come to this village for the sake of disgracing a rival with an extremely low offer. The coward was forced to accept, so my conquerors and I were in the mood to celebrate with ale and song. Our time here was a delight, and I wish them luck for the coming winter.

reviews.author: Takao N.
reviews.description: We ate outdoor.  Social distancing, masks whenever necessary, great food and beer...they've got everything covered.  People were very considerate and we felt extremely safe.  We enjoyed dining out this evening.  Definitely one of the best places if you want to eat out safely.

reviews.author: Jan C.
reviews.description: This has fast become our go to place during these last few months. This is dining during a pandemic at it's best. We have always been happily greeted and shown directly to our reserved table. Servers immediately appear and explain how to order. We write our drink and app order on a slip of paper and they scoop it up and bring it back just as we've decided on our main course. They leave you alone unless you need them but are right there if you place the paper on the stand for more beer or water or a box for leftovers. The website is very clear a reservation is required and it is a 2 hour limit. Once the time escaped us and an employee came by with "a gentle reminder that your 2 hour limit is up" Nothing rude there.   Covid deets out of the way the chef is awesome.  Food is amazing. We used to come only for white clam pizza and beer which is still an excellent choice but there's so much more to be explored on the menu. I had a peach and turkey with brie and avacado that was simply the best sandwich I've had in my life. Specialty pizzas are so so good. And the calamari and stuffed portobello were very tasty. This is better than elevated bar food.    5 stars ABGB. Keep it going! We appreciate you

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Certainly the neighborhood gem! The venue is amazing for live music and dance. The pizza and beer are really good. The parking is a bit challenging, even on a late Wednesday, but the effort is worth it.

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: This is my second time at the ABGB and I love the vibe here! It was super hard not to order more deviled eggs because whoever made those DEFINITELY understood the assignment . There's more than enough room for everyone both inside and outside; literally nothing to complain about when it comes to ABGB, The staff work quickly and make everything' as easy as possible. When we went, there were vendors there with Austin Flea and Hail Marley(Bob Marley cover band) playing outside. Can't wait to go back and try the pizza!

reviews.author: Marco S.
reviews.description: Fun outdoor atmosphere and pretty good food 90% of the time Foxann and Heaven are the bedt!.

name: Central Machine Works Brewery and Beer Hall

reviews.author: Marcus R.
reviews.description: First off this place puts on the WOW factor soon as you walk in. The outside seating is what you will see as you walk into the facility. Ample room both outside and inside to sit with your friends or family members. Either way as you walk in, you want to go to the left of the building towards the Tap Room. Yes, it's labeled on their wall.  The Tap room is where you will order your beer, food, and start your tab. Once you order your food you can pick where ever you choose to sit. They do give you an LED lighted pager. So once they page your, there is a particular location where you go pick up your food. It won't be in the tap room. LOL  Their large pizza holds 8 slices. Feeds two to four people depending on your tape worm's needs. Their pizza is phenomenal!!!   They have a great home brew selection on tap and if you are not a beer drinker, they have a great hard liquor selection.  Parking is a dirt parking lot (so if it rains expect mud) and could potentially get limited when this place is busy.  Again ample seating so it's a great place for large groups.

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: Walked from our hotel down to this place, based on the fact that it said it was open on yelp which is online. Found the place closed and locked after walking all the way there.  Left a message on the machine at this place on Christmas Eve because they said  on yelp that they were open.  We finally found a place that was great called crown and anchor which was open like they said on yelp!  Received a call back on Monday that called my message of trash trash message, and said that I could look their hours up online if I wanted because they tend to change during the holidays. Anyway, very confusing considering my message was specifically about looking their hours up online. Wouldn't try this place again!

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: First of all, the general experience was underwhelming. The only thing this place has going for it is its size and flexibility. It's an easy spot for big groups. I wasn't too impressed with the food, either with the variety of things on the menu, or the flavor of the food itself. The best thing I got was a kids' hot dog, which was an all-beef hot dog on a decent bun, exactly what I was craving, and very difficult to mess up. The pretzel and German potato salad were just ok. The beer cheese dip for the pretzel had a funny after-taste. My friend wasn't too impressed with her drink. We thought it was weird that they have a "Rachel" sandwich that's really a Reuben. Rachels are usually a spin on a Reuben, either made with turkey, or cole slaw, or something other than corned beef and sauerkraut that's on a usual Reuben. Anyways, they didn't get my order quite right, but corrected it. (I asked to add cheese on top of the hot dog, and at first it came out naked.) Missing a special request isn't too unusual, and they corrected it right away, so it wasn't a major deal.  But things got weird with some friends' orders. We were part of a large group. Two people were wearing political shirts. It was at the very least a strange coincidence that both their orders were not fulfilled. They waited and waited for their food and it never came. Others who ordered after them got their food sooner. There's no proof they were singled out for their shirts, but it sure looks suspicious... The staff said they'd correct it, but they were still slow to do so.

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Since my previous post, I've come back and still love it! The fire pits outside are a nice touch on the chilly winter days. I ordered food as well and got the Rachel Sandwich and a friend got the burger. She loved her burger and I absolutely loved my sandwich! The meet was amazing, and the bread was perfectly toasted. They had a slaw as well that was so unique, I would absolutely order again. We also all split the pretzel which was decent, but would probably recommend a sandwich or pizza over the pretzel.

reviews.author: Pascal P.
reviews.description: We came here evening over Thanksgiving weekend. It's a cool spot to get a beer with friendly staff and a cavernous interior space. The outdoor area looks nice as well but the time we came the weather was terrible so we weren't able to take advantage of that. We did not try the food so I don't know how that is but this is a good spot to get a drink.

reviews.author: Nadine L.
reviews.description: Really great vibe. Especially for fall evenings in Austin, sometimes there is a band playing.  Their white pizza that is artichoke and spinach is delicious. They also have cocktails, not just beer, which is nice if you aren't a beer lover.  The blueberry smash is too sweet for me but my friends loved it.  The bratwurst is good too.  I wanted to try their creamsicle pop but it was sold out.  Parking lot tends to be full so you may have to find street parking.

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: Family and pet friendly brewery with awesome beer, cocktails and food.   Stopped in on a Thursday evening for a work event and was impressed with the amount of people here.   Walked up to the bar and was impressed with the liquor selection and beer choices. This being a brewery I was pleased to see a cocktail option. The pizza is super good here too. Definitely grab a pizza when you're here.   The only negative thing is the parking situation. Parking goes very, very quick. If the parking lot was larger this would be an easy 5/5. There is limited parking out front, around back and across the street but a majority of parking is a brisk walk away.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: This place is big! Large tap room, indoor bier hall, and outdoor Biergarten. Plenty of seating at picnic tables with umbrellas outside or tables inside. There were a couple of large private parties there and still plenty of room for the masses. Plenty of parking is a major plus.  They have a stage and outdoor sound system. Dogs are welcome!  Good selection of their own and others' beer on tap plus a full bar. Pizzas and sandwiches are good. The German potato salad is the bomb.   As with many other places, the "stand in line and wait to order each round" leads to me not ordering another round.   They could have used 3-4 more bartenders and a couple of bar backs. Maybe sign up for the TabbedOut app to expedite my lush habits.

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: So prior WW2 factory and now outdoor brewpub that is pup friendly??? We sat yay to this and I saw many fur babies enjoying the ample outdoor space.  Peeps hanging out and dome brought board games. Inside there are hanging plant baskets and outside butterfly plants and giant sunflowers! Lotsa space and social distance is possible. Big parking lot.  Highly recommended but don't forget the bug spray!!

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: I'm a fan of Central Machine's location and concept, but was disappointed by the offerings. We ordered the Pale Ale, Mosaic IPA, Warm German Potato Salad, and a Margherita Pizza.  Let's start with the vibes: pup friendly (even "indoors"), food offered, fans blowing, plenty of seats inside and out and cozy Austin decor that makes you feel welcomed.   The Pale Ale and the Mosaic IPA both tasted similar, both were quite sour, more like a cider in my opinion.   The Warm German Potato Salad tasted like mashed potatoes mixed with a tinge of vinegar. The Margherita, lots of sauce, not enough toppings.

reviews.author: Lauren K.
reviews.description: I stumbled in here on a rainy Friday night and boy was I glad I did! This converted warehouse space is gorgeous complete with cafeteria style tables and leather couches. The outside garden has a stage, fire pits and busy tables filled with students, Texans and tourists. It's all cropped by the traditional TX sting lights above your head.    There was a DJ spinning 45s inside that could be heard both in and outdoors. It was a sound garden of absurdity that wafted through the air. Think, Rosemary Clooney but knocks offs of what he could find at Goodwill of her. (ATX, don't ever change!)  The bar is in the back and after getting the lay of the land, I stepped up to the bar in the back and asked for a recommendation. The bartender asked what I liked and promptly brought me a dark porter in a plastic cup. It was delicious! It was the perfect way to end the night.  Hours and location information can be found on their website. Now scoot along, lil' doggie! This festival of fun is waiting for you.

reviews.author: Tandis H.
reviews.description: Came here on our last day in Austin after living there for the month. We had driven by this place a few times and always were intrigued. It's huge and looks cool! We weren't disappointed. Came when it was quieter on a Friday afternoon and were in awe by the scale of the place. It has a huge outdoor garden area with tons of seating and a stage. Then indoors the main area was really spacious but a bit hot midday, so we sat in the "taproom" where there was good AC. The bar is really nice and features this amazing historic lathe that apparently weighs several tons!  The bartenders were really sweet and they hooked me up with a delicious michelada!! Yum. It was kind of "bloody mary" style but I loved it. The only thing that was a bit disappointing was that each michelada was $10 yikes! And they didn't give you any extra beer on the side which I'm used to. They used their draft beers but it would have been a nice touch to give a little extra on the side especially for that price.  We also ordered a pizza. We got "The Machinist" pizza that was kind of like a Supreme but without the mushrooms, and something I've never had before on a pizza - pickled onions! WOW I was super happy with the pizza. It was huge, super filling for 2 people but so good that we had to finish it. It was $16 which I think was a fair price. The sauce + pickled onions gave the pizza so much zesty-ness it was amazing.

reviews.author: Samuel C.
reviews.description: What a Pleasure Palace!  * * *  Some drinking places are about the alcohol.  Some drinking places are about the food  Some drinking places are about the music on the stage or the games you can play.  Some drinking places are about the people you can meet to take home.  Some of the most legendary drinking places are primarily about the room.  If you are looking for a room, Central Machine Works has two of the best.  The back may have the most fantastic beer garden in Austin.  The front definitely does have the most beautiful grand beer hall in Austin.  As soon as I entered the Central Machine Works,  All I wanted to do was grab a beer or three or six,  Plop myself down in one of the corners,  And drink myself off into happy oblivion  The beautiful rooms carried me away into a dream.  * * *  It is easier to describe what make the beer hall work than the garden.  The beer hall is located in an old machine shop.  The machine shop is huge - an entire factory.  It has eighty feet ceilings.   It has a main room that goes on forever.  It has wings that disappear into more intimate corners.  It has fans the size of airplane propellers on the top  And gigantic open doors on both the front and the back.  There is better ventilation in the main hall of Central Machine Works than you get at most outdoor places in Austin.   The main place they pull your beer, is stuck off to the side.  That way if you insist on watching a stupid football game on TV  You can do so far away from the primary hall.  The main hall retains its quiet and its gravitas.  The main hall is black with warm yellow accents coming from wood furniture.  There are ridged translucent half domes filling the room with 1930's light.   Imagine a reading room in a Hearst mansion at night.  This is what the light feels like.  In the corners of the room are the vast vats where they make the beer.  In the middle of the room are two of the most comfortable plush leather chairs on the planet, with plush leather sofas to make the central rectangle.  Drink can often be the first step to falling asleep in a warm golden place.  This black and gold beer hall is just such a warm golden place.  * * *  The outside beer garden is a circus of the senses.   They actually do have strings of light draped over the top to make a big top.  They have two hundred and forty people.  The two hundred and forty people brought two dozen and fourteen dogs.   The dogs are on leashes but they raise a racket every time they see another dog.  The owners are constantly breaking up Hysterical Dog 1 meeting Hysterical Dog 2.  The owners are also assiduous about picking up the pieces when dogs calm down and finish their digesting.  Watching the dogs is as much fun as watching the people.  There are live bands playing.  The bands are good enough to make everything pleasant and festive.   The bands are not good enough to require that you pay attention.  Want to talk to your friends and ignore what is on stage?  No great sin is being committed against the God of Music.  But the musicians fill the garden with happy sounds.  These go with the circus lights and the shenanigans from the dog owners.  By the way, if you look closely, you will find sculpture.  Keep your eyes peeled.   The more you look, the more you'll see.  * * *  How are the food and the drinks?  The brewing is hit or miss.  But when it hits it is fantastic.  I had three different lagers, the American, the Vienna and the San Francisco.  The San Francisco was undrinkable swill. The Vienna was water-in-your-mouth-tolerable.  The American is a great great great hoppy lager.  You only need one good beer to produce a happy night.  Future trips will probably mean sticking to the American and enjoying life.  But the mixed drink program looks extremely interesting.  There is a lot of exploring left to be done.  * * *  The pizza is everything you could want a pizza to be.  I had a Machinist, which on its long list of ingredients includes pepperoni, sweet red peppers and jalapenos.  The peppers were all that was needed to send this pizza off to the moon. But the background players provided good support.  * * *  If you want a bar with incredible music, go to the Mohawk.  If you want a bar with incredible alcohol, go to Russian House or any of the downtown places with Ph.D. mixmasters.  If you want a bar with incredible food, Suerte and Barley Swine are good.  But if you just want to let the fog roll over you in a beautiful place,   You are not going to do much better than Central Machine Works.  I'm putting in a reservation on that leather chair in the middle of the main room.  Sometimes you can have your happy dreams while being fully awake.

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times with friends and every time I am blown away. The food is terrific, the vibes are immaculate, and the drinks HIT! All of the pizzas are *chefs kiss*. The frozen espresso martini are hands down my fave bev on the menu. The customer service is next level. I had a friend visiting from out of town so we asked what time the fire pits come on and they immediately jumped to light them up for us. 14/10 suggest this spot!

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: Central Machine Works is definitely doing everything right! They bring in good music, provide amazing food and fun drinks.   The inside has an industrial feel with greenery and comfortable furniture everywhere...definitely passed the vibe check.   One drink you must order here is the frozen tequila sunrise cocktail, it's strong and super tasty with a slice of dried fruit that added a nice touch.   I had a pretzel that was to die for and a burger that was so good, I didn't even get a chance to photograph it!   There's a second bar outside, a stage and plenty of picnic tables with umbrellas; I also appreciate the fact that there are several water coolers around for those extra hot summer days.   The awesome and fun staff were the cherry on top for me and I look forward to coming back for more music and food!

reviews.author: Piyush A.
reviews.description: Wow why didn't we come here earlier. A gem of a place with really nice servers.   Ambience- it's a humongous space and the tables are far apart. They have tables outside and inside but the best part is that you can sit inside and still feel safe (from a covid perspective) cause it's such an open space. They have done a marvelous job of using the heavy machinery for their decor especially at the bar.   Food- It's been a while since we had such a delicious, fresh, and hot pizza. The ingredients were super fresh and perfectly cooked. I wish they would have the breakfast pizza during the week as well.   Drinks- I loved their Kolsh and wife really liked the sangria too (see picture)   Couple of things that I wasn't a fan of-  1. The pick up station for the food is setup a little weird. We got a hot pizza (which was awesome) but the fact that I had to carry the hot pan to my table wasn't fun at all. This could potentially cause liability in the future. I was pretty close to docking a star for this but the pizza was way too good :)  2. The parking is a little weird so don't get dissuaded and leave. There is a huge parking lot in the back of the place but you have to go around a little (not a big deal for us but could be for some)  Overall, I'm going here again for sure !!

reviews.author: Meagan G.
reviews.description: My two experiences at CMW have been wonderful! Both times we have ordered inside at the historic bar and taken our drinks outside to enjoy the dark relief of the Austin heat! I loved the Aperol Spritz on tap so much we ordered a pitcher of it the second time coming. The ABV has got to be incredibly low with that drink-- didn't really notice any of the desired side effects  after two glasses.  Live music is over at 10 pm on the weekends. Their pretzel left much to be desired for. Dogs are welcome.

reviews.author: Urvashi G.
reviews.description: Good spot with good food and beer selection!  Some quick notes- Ample of seating indoors and outdoors.  Dogs are welcomed.  Free Parking available. Pager for when food is ready. Self-service.  I think that's about cover it. The people are friendly and the ambience is chill/low-key. They also have live music performance every now and then.   Definitely worth checking it out.

reviews.author: Shannon G.
reviews.description: Came here tonight with a friend for the first time. Huge outside patio. Big parking lot on 5th street. The inside is like a large barn like with super high ceilings. Food is actually really amazing. Had a simple cheese burger, it was like something I would have grilled at home. They were having a special tonight, playing the iconic movie Clueless, with drink specials and food specials along with popcorn. Had the best time.

reviews.author: Kim H.
reviews.description: We enjoyed our Saturday trip to East Austin!  Popped into this place after eating across the street.  Big open space, nice big tables. Seems like it's the stop for bachelorette parties!  I think we saw 2 while we were there for less than 2 hours!

reviews.author: Adam T.
reviews.description: This might be my favorite spot in Austin right now and it is still pretty chill/not well known so I hate that I'm writing a good review.   Some of the best beer out there I think and they've got awesome food to go with it. Burgers are really good along with all of their bar type things.  Pretty good happy hour specials during the week.   Good amount of space inside and out with a ton of parking and it is right next to Better Half so easy to hit both places without having to go anywhere.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: In this town, if feels like there's a brewery popping in every corner. I'm not complaining, simply making an observation. But what this means though is that you have to do something to stand out. You can't just brew your own beer and sell it in the warehouse, those days are gone.  Hold Out has a unique and very advantageous situation. They're next to Better Half (I think they're the same owner or partners?) and make great use of the property together as well as the opportunity to collaborate.  Additionally, Hold Out has their own food. While their menu isn't as complete as Better Half's, it's pretty decent for a "happy hour at the brewery" trip.  But you can't asses them without considering the Better Half contribution, which I've reviewed separately and loved.  The beer is good, although it lacked range in variety as there wasn't much darker beer. A lot of IPA selections, which I'm sure the market loves...but I don't.   I stuck to the lager and a couple other beers, all with weird names but I guess that's the game these days.   I had the vegan frito pie which was way more delicious than expected and had an interesting mix of flavors.   Of course, it all tied in well because we had dinner from Better Half and I don't need to tell you how good that was. You gotta try the grilled halloumi, trust me.  All in all, good vibe, great property.

reviews.author: Sophia C.
reviews.description: Yummy food paired with good drinks, Hold Out is the perfect spot for a late night hangout with friends. They have a spacious outdoor patio that's great for dogs, and a convenient parking lot right across.   I ordered the fish sandwich and a strawberry sangria, and both were a hit! The sandwich came with delicious fried fish and various sauces (with a bit of spice) in between amazing thick toasted slices of bread. The sangria was refreshing and sweet, great for those who like fruity beverages!

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: We've been waiting for over an hour and still have no food. Please give me my food I am hangry. I got charged $2 for an avocado.  Update: food tastes good and is aesthetically pleasing. Not worth wait. Adding back 1 star

reviews.author: Kaitlin O.
reviews.description: I had about 8 people in my group for Sunday brunch. Was told the food wait time would be less than an hour. It took 2 hours for everyone to get food even though we all ordered right after each other. Food tasted good but definitely not worth both the price and the wait!

reviews.author: Jevin H.
reviews.description: I was holding out on writing this review, but after seeing my friends rate it two stars, I had to go ham. My group was around 8 people. We ordered one dish per person. The food arrived an hour and a half later. I am confused how it could've taken so long for food to arrive. To make matters worse, the waiter said "sorry for the hold out" and laughed when he gave us our food. I held out on my laughter for that one. It should not take that long for pancakes or burgers to be prepared. No clue what was going on behind in the kitchen but the chef definitely holding out on cooking or something. Hopefully this was a one off experience, but I'm not holding out faith for this place.

reviews.author: Bernie W.
reviews.description: Wow, I would say this was our favorite place on our recent trip to Austin, tucked away on a side street off of West 6th it is a true hidden gem although no hidden handshake was needed to enter the converted spacious quonset hut.  Out side under cover were rows of picnic tables, beer was served inside and the food was brought out.  While the beers were outstanding, the food was unexpected, beyond the burgers which we did not try, they had a few interesting dishes such as a Crispy Artichoke  and Pimento and a Indian chickpea inspired take on the chili Frito pie, both were excellent and we are not vegetarians, we just wanted to try something new.  The smoky Rauchbier styled Marzen (?) was unusual and worth a taste but a pint was a little over the top.  Note for those who commented on slow service we were there on a Wednesday and there were no issues, I am sure a nice weekend might be another experience.

reviews.author: Jared H.
reviews.description: Super rude staff at the counter harassing me about a mask just to place an order and sit down.  Only place in Austin over a 5 day weekend that refused to serve unmasked people. Apparently covid only spreads when you're in the main building ordering. SCIENCE.  What a joke. Food and beer was OK, but there are PLENTY of awesome open and free restaurants in Austin that don't have arbitrary and ineffective covid rules.  I wouldn't advise walking here with a hungry family in the cold if you're opposed to conforming to mask mandates.  We escaped from Seattle to have a non locked down weekend, super bummed to have caved and supported this place.  They'd probably be checking vax cards like back home if they could.  Disappointing.

reviews.author: Evan L.
reviews.description: It took 2 hours for all of us to get our food. The price was okay for the location + what I got, but personally I wasn't a huge fan of the cocoa crumble with the pancakes. Would maybe come here again and try something else if I heard the wait was less than 30 minutes

reviews.author: Kristine C.
reviews.description: Has a couple of vegan options including the overnight oats and sweet potato hash without the sauce and eggs. We waited over 2 hours for our food to come out, portion size was pretty small and it was pretty average tasting. I got the sweet potato hash made vegan and it tasted okay but definitely not worth the wait/price!!!

reviews.author: Cris R.
reviews.description: I was visiting from Houston and had never been here before. Read some reviews and they all sounded positive so I decided to come. Overall, the food was great and the beers were also on point! Friendly staff and nice ambiance, will be back next time I'm in Austin.

reviews.author: Nan T.
reviews.description: Good place if you're looking for a lively spot to take friends or out of towners into the heart of Austin. Good drink prices and a good selection of beers, but I didn't find the two beers I tried to be anything special. They have a great food menu and the burger is really good, but it took quite a while for my food to come out. The ordering process was also a little chaotic -- long, long lines and loud music at the counter so it's hard to communicate with staff. Parking can be a nightmare if the lot in the back is full, and the roads are very narrow and uneven when you arrive at the brewery. Ultimately I think this is a good place for those looking to get the Austin experience, but I don't think I'll add this place to my usual rotation.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: A modern hip Austin beer scene vibe with a full menu and brews. The beers here were pretty good. They have a spacious covered dog friendly patio. A great food menu that includes brunch. The curly fries were delicious. You can even order food next door at their sister better half cafe and get it delivered to you here. Their restrooms were brilliant. Best signage of this time!

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Beer, wings, and curly fries: the essentials to the ultimate chill weekend. I would suggest ordering your own wings, do not share. I am a huge fan of IPA's. Hold Out Brewing's IPA selection did not disappoint.    TIP: Hold Out shares their private lot with Better Half, it's much easier to snag a table here versus Better Half.

reviews.author: Jay L.
reviews.description: The food is always superior here. Always exceeds expectations for presentation, freshness, and flavor. The kitchen sink salad for $6 is fantastic. Vegetables are fresh and crunchy, the beets are chilled, the nuts crunchy, the small pear shaped tomatoes are excellent and the dressing is outstanding.  1/2 for $6 is incredible value. The burgers are great and the crispy chicken sandwich (during the week ar lunch) is one of the best in Austin and for the price is perhaps best value too. Have had some ciders that seemed very vinegary and perhaps not right but food is always great.

reviews.author: Garrett L.
reviews.description: Great beer, amazing burgers. Super friendly staff and great vibes all around. The new set-up with no reservations and the long benches is great.

reviews.author: Sierra J.
reviews.description: Hold out is a fairly new spot in Austin and is next to better half so we had to check it out! They have mostly Hazy juicy IPA's, so if you love those this is the place for you! My husband is one of those people and had a great time. I love sours and got the "syke!" And I thought it was great. They have food as well which we didn't get to check out but it looked awesome! I grab a cute cropped tank before we left. Hold out has a covered patio with a good amount of seating and seating inside. Our favorite part by far was the bartender that helped us. We didn't get his name but he has red hair and a mustache to match. He gave us some awesome recommendations to check out in Austin. Go for the beer stay for the hospitality!

reviews.author: Mark G.
reviews.description: Velvet tang, coolingly refreshing Beet Salad, amongst a New Juice Goofin' IPA was just the start.  A kid devourable kitchen sink salad merried with a happy Dad chomping on a flavour wheel of a Chicken Bacon Burger, essentially a double merry-goround of chicken with bacon, that paired nicely with a Shampoo Horn IPA.  All on the patio, picnicking tabled with a flurry of blazin fans to keep you cool and a melody of tunes.  All to leave me goosebumps for coming back.

reviews.author: Patricia C.
reviews.description: Recently hosted an event here.  Food was amazing and the service was the best ever!  Everyone had a great time.  The Chef worked with us on the menu selection.  We had 200 people show up all at once and the staff kept the food coming for my hungry crowd.    Wish I could give them more stars!

reviews.author: Nikkita F.
reviews.description: Great new spot for a beer and burger! We made a reservation and check in was super easy. They're doing a great job with social distance seating and ordering. We had the pancakes, curly fries and burger. All were extremely delicious, the burger could use some jalapeños/onions but I'll try to see if that's an option next time. We also tried a couple 4oz sampler beers, I'm a pale ale fan and they have a ton of those.   Tons of parking in the gravel lot across. I'll definitely be back!

name: Oasis Texas Brewing Company
accommodations: Garage Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: Kyle H.
reviews.description: Very cute brewery on Lake Travis with amazing views.  Had a large seating area inside and out. They have a stage for live music. They also have food, wine, and cider.  Orders their burger with truffle fries. Pretty tasty and those fries were crispyyyy! Would go back just for the views.  The beer was okay but that's not the reason you come here.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Made our way to The Oasis during a recent trip to Austin with some friends. It was definitely a bit away from the main city, but a beautiful scenic area. The Oasis is right on Lake Travis, and features a bunch of small stores and outdoor areas in the land surrounding it. We were there on a Friday afternoon, and surprisingly not a lot of stores were open, which was a bummer. Of course though, we were there for the brewery, which we were able to make it to. They offer plentiful indoor and outdoor seating; it was a nice sunny day so we opted for the outdoor seating. It was lovely outside but it was SO windy, even after we tried to switch locations outside. It was hard to keep our food from blowing away! The view was super nice though, so despite the wind, we appreciated the scenery surrounding us.  For food / drink - of course, I focused on beers. I was a bit disappointed to learn that they didn't offer flights - they had a good number of offerings, it would make sense to do flights! Oh well, at least they offered half pours, so I was able to try 2; I went for the gose (kiwi dragonfruit) and the Oktoberfest. Both were OK, not the best ever beer but refreshing; I definitely favored the gose! My friends enjoyed their pours as well. For food, we all split some apps, going for the OTXBC trio, the bretzel, and the truffle fries. The trio was a bit disappointing - it was underwhelming and a little piecemeal (we had thought everything would be mixed together but it was just a pretzel on top of the chips with the dips on the side). The bretzel itself was tasty, but the sauce was interesting; we thought it came with queso, but the dip we received looked nothing like queso and was thick with chunks of something in it (pepper maybe?). It was tasty, but unidentifiable. Lastly, the truffle fries were the best option - they were nicely seasoned and crispy with a large volume. We all enjoyed those! The prices were relatively reasonable for what we got in terms of quantity and quality.   Overall, we enjoyed our afternoon at Oasis Texas Brewing Company. The space is lovely with a great view, but the food and drink is just OK; you're definitely more there for the experience. I would definitely make it back to OTXBC during a next visit to Austin to try more beers and take in the nice view!

reviews.author: Slava C.
reviews.description: Great chill out place with the positive vibe.  Enjoy wide selection of beers and delicious food topping off the amazing views along with the live band performance. What else would a soul need?! Sit back, relax, have a cup of cold one, watch a sunset and enjoy life!

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: 10/10 views, okay food. Heard food was better here versus the Oasis Restaurant. We only ordered apps, so can only comment on these. They were pretty basic, though we really enjoyed the truffle fries. We arrived around 2pm on a Friday and there was plenty of seating. Very windy though FYI.

reviews.author: Jason S.
reviews.description: When I moved from Downtown to Steiner I was a little afraid I wouldn't be able to find enough craft breweries and chill places to have a good burger. This little gem in the corner of the Oasis complex hits the spot for me. Plus the view is stellar.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: The Tap Room on the third floor and the Barrel Room on the second floor both achieve unique ambiance and draw slightly different crowds. We got to experience and enjoy the best of both in a way.   Amazing fresh made as well as barrel aged cocktails, a nice range of food options, and of course, breathtaking views.   The Barrel Room is rustic chic with fancy couches and a pool table. The tap room is plain rustic with a live music stage. The tap room had burgers and sandwiches to accompany the beers brewed on site. The barrel room offered pizza and wings to eat in between cocktail sips.   Oh, don't miss observing the really cool stairs in between the two floors.

reviews.author: Ali W.
reviews.description: Have some family in town and wanted to take them somewhere to watch a good ol Texas sunset. OTBC has some of the absolute best views in all of Austin. Even on this cloudy day the sunset still peaked through and gave us a show.   Drinks are good but food isn't really anything to write home about. Its more about the experience you get here for sure.  They have a large parking garage and parking lot on site with plenty of free parking even on a busy night. There's also a golf cart shuttle to get you from the lot to the entrance if you need it, but it's also a walkable distance.   Really great spot to visit if you want a nice spot to watch the sunset and definitely has that wow-factor for visitors!

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Have a visitor in from California and wanted to show our beautiful sunset by Lake Travis. This is a great place for that and the food is always good.  The space is large and everyone seemed to be following the safety rules while indoors. We were a party of 8 and we had plenty of space.  I ordered the basic burger and they usually prepare it Medium rare. I asked for medium well and wanted only mayonnaise and cheese. It was cooked the way I requested but was very dry since they did not give me Mayo. My wife ordered the Fish Tacos (3) and said they were great. She ended only being able to eat 2 and another guest finished her last one. She said she would order again next time.   All in all is was good just not great.

reviews.author: Van N.
reviews.description: I really really tried for this place. I took my parents here, I took my friends from out of town, and I even came for a birthday party this weekend. The whole experience overall is just underwhelming? If thats the right word. There is always the steps  1. get in line to get on to the wait list 2. once in front be told the wait is 1-2 hours 3. get in line again for the bar  4. finally get seated and wait again for slow service.   One question is Why? Why would you even go here? The wait is 2+ Hours sometimes. The food is cafeteria quality at best. They are SEVERELY understaff. Oasis Brewery has better food and literally the same exact food. The quality of the experience over all does not justify the amount of time, money and effort for this place.

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: An Austin must see! Beautiful views, with many options for eating and drinking. The bartenders were super attentive and nice.   Just knocking one star because I could only find one elevator and it was out of service. I'm in a boot and it was hard to get up all those stairs. If you need help call first to make sure the elevator works.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Views: 5/5. Such a scenic view overlooking Lake Travis. My favorite time to come is when the sun sets. The Texas skies are truly breathtaking during this time and Oasis is perfectly positioned for patrons to see all that the sun has to offer. Come 1 hour early to snag a table next to the railings in order to get the best (unblocked) view.   Food: 3/5. My date and I only ordered the Pico Verde. It was a refreshing snack but nothing special. We would've ordered more but there wasn't a huge selection and nothing that caught our eye.   Drinks: 3/5. Very limited selection of beers. It's almost weird that this place is called a brewery because there are literally like 8 to pick out of. Most people just come here for the view though so it's not a huge problem.   Overall, definitely a gem in Austin. It's a great place for dates or just to hang out with family or friends. It's so pretty here that it doesn't even matter what I'm eating or drinking!

reviews.author: Johnson W.
reviews.description: Family visiting Austin, Oasis is the must go place to see the beautiful lake and sunset!  We were at the brewery on third floor, ordered some beer and food, kitchen was bit slower than normal (they were busy! So that's fine), we ordered 3 items and they only gave us one and the guy took my call alarm and about to walk away, so I asked him where are my other two items, and he looked confused then asked me, else you ordered? So I told him what they were, and took him a minute to look around, and it was sitting right next to the first item, but he just simply looked confused!  I wouldn't suggest to come during busy weekend, unless you don't mind of waiting longer time, and getting mixed up on what you've ordered.  Overall still a great place to take visitors.

reviews.author: Chilly P.
reviews.description: the view is absolutely breathtaking, it's def worth the visit. i went on a random weekday for lunch so it was quite a pleasant experience. the double ipa with a pretzel and beer cheese was really great. my only critique is the service could be friendlier, the employees just seem bothered. i def am looking forward to visiting again.

reviews.author: Jonna C.
reviews.description: Whenever we had friends/family come visit us in Austin, we always bring them here. Oasis Texas Brewing Company has a wide variety of beer selections and delicious food. The views are breathtaking and really romantic especially when the sun sets. With the relentless Texas heat, nothing beats a tall glass of cold brew and a plate of parmesan truffle fries while enjoying an amazing view of Lake Travis with good company. If you're not a fan of beer, they do offer wines, ciders, cocktails, and margaritas. Speaking of margaritas, a true Texan can always tell if a place is good if their margaritas are on point!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: Just go! You won't regret it.   Everything is was amazing! We had French fries and avocado dip to go with our beers. Fries comes with a truffle aioli.   For the beers we had Grand Cru Dark Ale and Samurai Lager.   The Grand Cru Dark Ale comes in a small cup. The server assured me that was a good amount unless I was really found of dark ale. He was right that was a good amount because that beer is strong.   I pretty sure I wasn't going to finish the beer if I had asked for a double sized cup.   Really nice experience over all.   I would recommend this place a million times.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: I truly wanted to love this place.. Texas weather is just right this time of year, the views make you want to make the drive from Cali to the lone star state just to get that perfect pic over the lake with a drink your hand in the free state of Texas....but don't be disappointed when you are greeted by a not so friendly mask police manager that wants to wear his mask under his nose ....   the guacamole had zero taste the salsa was watery and had zero flavor... the chips were the bottom of the barrel... all of the guests seated around us were unhappy and didn't receive good service either but were happy with the views. The fellow guests/visitors we met were super cool and that was the best part... the drinks food and service were way below average... what is it with these places? get it together! the views bring us there but you need to pick it up from there... managers are clueless... bartenders were so rude....embarrassing for Austin...  so many visitors and this is their first impression of Austin unfortunately... we can do better.  We ordered 2 pizzas and left 80% of them on the table....Tasted frozen with ragu sauce.... I can't even begin to explain the regrets I have going here... The guy that gave us a ride on the golf cart up was very nice and now I feel he may have been trying to warn us about going there..  Bathrooms were gross and tables were nasty... nobody was cleaning up after people.... trash and masks everywhere and near the water... I follow not unfollowed their social media page and the pictures are very enticing but it's the exact opposite of what you actually get... from the drinks to the food.. Fire pit was a nice touch.. we stopped to talk to other guests there on our way out... Its a one hitter quitter for all..  won't be back... what a waste of location.

reviews.author: Kenny L.
reviews.description: Wow. Just wow. I wish I lived in Austin just for this place, better said, Oasis on Lake Travis makes you want to move to Austin lol. I was really impressed with the scenery and view of Lake Travis, the fact that parking is free and that this location is really affordable.  This brewery offers an immense and spacious interior and exterior to enjoy your adult beverage and your company with a vining atmosphere and beautiful view. Honestly, this place is the place to be to hang out with friends and family or a date. :)  The affordable local brewed beer is amazing. Fortunately, as I am not an avid beer drinker, this place had a Wisconsin sourced stout and I am grateful they had a seasonal stout to offer to those with a stout palate. That just made me so happy because I wanted to drink with my family. They do have a full bar on the 2nd level but we didn't want liquor.  The bartendar, black guy with nice eyes and hair, was so patient and helpful. He even let us taste one of the crafted beer. Reason for this was because the website (menu via qsr code) was not updated to reflect what they had and we had to select what we wanted again lol. So he was just great and patient.  My brother in law ordered some food which I think is not really worth it BUT if you didn't have the chance to eat and didn't want to drink on an empty stomach, then go for it. Otherwise, if you're hungry and you wanted a meal, yeah, no, eat before you come here.  I can't wait to go back just to enjoy the ambience and energy with great, affordable beer!

reviews.author: Candy B.
reviews.description: Come for the views, they're the absolute best in Austin. You won't top this. The only trouble is it's on the 3rd floor and the elevator has been out of service for 3yrs so whatever you have you're carrying. We got amazing pics and they actually have a nice selection of vegan options! We were pleasantly surprised and stayed here a while. Drinks were just OK.
