My husband has IPA's and I have Rosé and whatever I drank gave me the worst headache. They're not carrying top selections but since people come for the view I don't think they care. Nonetheless - we'll be back for sure! We just can't bring visitors unable to walk 3 flights of stairs. There are wheelchair accessible views on floor one though so still worth the visit.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: There's a reason why the Oasis Texas Brewing Company is the preferred choice. They offer not only great brews, wines, and ciders, but also exceptional food and views. I've been here multiple times now, and every time I've come, I leave with a happy soul, and a full belly.   Patty lovers, the Wagyu Burger. Fries, the Parmesan Fries with Aioli. Brew, the double IPA.

reviews.author: Tim F.
reviews.description: I totally recommend the brewery! Super awesome and chill! The bartenders are very knowledgeable and helpful most of the time. Some of them do have an issue with conversing with themselves and ignoring the customer, but usually are good about that.

reviews.author: Nishanth E.
reviews.description: Absolutely tremendous sours, possible the best I've had in the country! Would highly recommend any of their sours ranging from iLimetastico to Teeny Hopper. Picked up some cans to go as well on the way out, would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Austin and specifically around that area.

reviews.author: John P.
reviews.description: So I'm a big fan of being fair, so here goes. A friend and I stopped by while in Austin and the place was packed. I think we got there at the right time because we were able to secure a seat inside where it was considerably cooler than the outside seating.   The process for ordering was fairly simple and the lady helping me was kind enough to break it down for a new out-of-towner. We got 4 sour beers and they were really interesting. On this particular occasion I had a new experience after I finished my 2nd sour beer. I learned that sour beer gives me heart burn. 1st time ever. I was asking my friend what this fire in my chest was. She loved the sour beers she ordered and we got glasses to remember the occasion. BOB... you'll always be my first.   I recommend checking it out and if you like sour beers Blue Owl Brewing will put a smile on your face. The staff is friendly and hip, and the beer flows as does the good times.   Prohst!!!

reviews.author: Michelle D.
reviews.description: This was our 3rd time being here....as we live in Dallas....but every time we visit we come.  They always have great brews and flavors.  The staff if exceptionally nice and has great customer service. I'm not a beer fan but I do love their Peach and Blueberry beers!  Their coolest thing is for $20 you get a great glass with beer and 3 others in plastic cups. Cool concept and a lot of beer in pours.  Getting a great following and you should go!!

reviews.author: Kelly M.
reviews.description: We loved coming to Blue Owl Brewing!! When we came, they only had the patio open for drinking at the brewery due to COVID, which was nice and very comfortable.   We ordered a glass and got 4 beers with the glass, if you are not able to finish your 4 beers, they will let you take the extras to go in cans! I believe the size we got was $20 per person. They had about 3 different options for sizes of glasses. The girl said we could even share one order if we wanted less beers per person.  I love all the options of the beers (they are all "sour" and DELICIOUS)!! My all time favorite that I tried was the Jubilberry!  The only complaint I would have was parking was a little hard to find but we ended up parking in a lot close by.  We will definitely be coming back when in Ausitn!

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: Great sour beers! You can't beat their deal where you pay $20 for 4 beers and you get to keep the glass. Honestly, you can't go wrong with  any of the beers they have. I'd recommend the little boss or the van dayum.

reviews.author: Kelsey G.
reviews.description: ONLY SOURS- not nice servers. The girls working were not friendly or welcoming. If you are looking for a well rounded brewery this is NOT IT! They serve only sours + 1 Pilsner. Also, policy is not ideal. You have to buy a pint glass for at least $25 in order to drink. Glass was cute, ambience outside was nice

reviews.author: Madeline C.
reviews.description: I don't know how I've failed to review this place yet, because I literally purchase something from here every week and finally got to sit on their patio during a beautiful sunny Sunday. I cannot recommend it enough -- thought I didn't like sour beer, oh boy I was wrong. Absolutely ADORE the Tangerina, Tiki Hop Totem, Plum de Plume, Limetastico and Jubilberry beers. And they had a Plum de Plume + mango beer slushee, so yum! Patio was very full on Sunday so we had to wait to snag an outdoor table but it was worth it. The staff is always incredibly nice and feels safe for COVID. Every Thursday they spin a wheel for a growler deal -- entire growler of amazing beer for $9! And their merch is so cute, definitely have a koozie collection now. Biggest perk of in-person is if you buy a beer glass (pictured here with a very cool design) you get 4 pours for $16. It really doesn't get better than this.

reviews.author: Rebekah G.
reviews.description: The beer is amazing, but I'm not a fan of the 4-drink i policy. I know you can spread them out over a month or get cans, but it makes it a little harder.

reviews.author: Libby B.
reviews.description: A brewery that does only sours! I was so happy to find this place while exploring East Austin. You know, it's been a while since I walked around a neighborhood without my phone constantly telling me where to go. This time I did, and Cesar Chavez led me here and to so many other amazing spots!   You walk in, order a glass that you get to keep! And then you get 4 beers in that glass! The best part? If you are like me and get the cool goblet at 16 oz. you can't drink that much beer at once. You can keep your tasting card and come back for the other 1 or 2 that you maybe couldn't do at visit #1! I think the limit is about a month between visits, but I'm not sure. Honestly, we came here 3 times. One time we didn't have our tasting cards so just did 4 tasting size glasses. Yes, we are big fans and came back to Indy with 4 glasses!   The patio is covered which is great during Texas spring/summer. If you're lucky, and someone leaves and hands you their card, double bonus!   I highly recommend visiting because even my husband, who does not love sours as I do, found a beer he liked (Van Dayum), and we even passed on the love to my sister-in-law who lives in RR! (How has she not been here yet?!)

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: Do you like sour beer? If you answered yes then why aren't you here already?  If you don't like sour beer, verify by trying the definition of it at Blue Owl Brewing because "The Owls are not what they seem." - yep, they're Lynch fans of the best show to make it to TV.  BOB is your uncle and your favorite sour beer. Come in and select a size, get 4 samples in that glass, and when you finish - keep it! The glass is yours.  Heavy rotation keeps its original and I love it. They have some staples for those trying to have a routine.  Buy some swag and get the brand out there! #LittleBossIsMyFav #BlueOwlSightings

reviews.author: Shelley B.
reviews.description: Listen- I love the beers. But the way you have to purchase them is so weird. You have to buy 4 or that's it. Sure, you can split it or take some home but sometimes I just want 1-2 beers on site and not have to buy 4. My boyfriend and I came and bought the 4 but then wanted one more. Nope, buy 4 more or none. We picked none and left. I just wish we could come and buy one or two beers without being forced to buy 4.

reviews.author: Eliott L.
reviews.description: Came here with a couple of friends on a Friday night because of a recommendation from a friend of mine, and it did not disappoint. For $16, my friends and I each got a normal sized glass to take home and 4 pours of any choice (you can do 8 half pours). There are also different types and sizes for glasses, so you could opt for a bigger or smaller glas.   Beer/Sours: Great quality drinks with a wide range of flavors. If you don't like sours this may not be the place for you, but definitely give it a shot if you like beers in general.   Service: Nothing to be said here, super nice and friendly staff! Felt right at home.   Atmosphere: Great! Nothing that prevents you from enjoying your afternoon or your conversation.   Definitely coming here again, hopefully I'll collect all 4 glasses!

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: If you like sour beers, youll love this place. Personally i find it gimmicy. The sour beers dont do it for me. Also they make you buy a pint glass before you can order.  The main draws are that its in a cool neighborhood, i like that the beers are highly alcoholic. Also their patio is dece, but it could use more seating. Finally, their gimmicky ordering system causes people to leave free beer tickets around constantly. I like free beer.  The big gimmick, which I find annoying, aside from the sour beers buying a glass when you to get a drink. When you buy one, you're basically comitting to four 12 oz. pours and possibly coming back in the future. There are other sizes, but the 12 oz. Is the best value and it feels weird drinking beer from a shot glass.   You can bring a glass you already bought, but overall its annoying to bring a pint glass to a bar. If i wanted to clean my own glasses, i would drink at home. Thats why youre kinda commiting to coming back by buying one.  They give you a sheet to check off the number of pours. The sheets are transferable and can be used on different days so make sure to hold on to them. Also, we usually find a sheet of people who didnt use all their pours so youll usually get a few free.

reviews.author: Ricky R.
reviews.description: When we were walking over to this place from Lazarus brewing my wife said, "I think they only have sours". I was like no way, I will just grab an IPA or something... Oh man was I shocked to see that they literally only had sours. With that being said let me start this shockingly high review for a place that only has sours by saying... i do not care for sour beers. So a 5 star coming from a person who doesnt enjoy sours should say something.  I loved everything about this place. This place is in a cool location, has a great logo, has great aesthetic, and a really cool flight idea. If it wasnt all sour beers... I would live at this place.  Let me explain how the flights work here. You pick your glass size... If I were to guess I would say 4oz, 8oz, 12oz... but honestly that is a guess. Then you get 4 samples in that size. You bring up your sheet, they check off the beer and you sample it. Oh and the best part is that after you are done you get to keep the glass. Oh and the prices are not crazy. I want to say it was $6, $8, $10, but that might also be off. This is definitely one of the coolest strategies I have seen for flights at a brewery ever... Oh and the glasses all looked really neat for sure.  Now onto the beer. Like I have mentioned multiple times already, I am not a fan of sours, but I liked the initial flavor of most of these beers. We had the wee heavy, the red, the earl grey one (lazarus colab), and the cherry stout. Everything had a great crafted flavor, until I hit the sour note. I relied on my wife to drink most of these, but I was very impressed by everything for sure. And my wife was happy with everything as well.  I would suggest anyone in Austin come visit this place for sure. Definitely worth the trip and more so if you like sours!!

reviews.author: Matt R.
reviews.description: Listen I'm going to preface this review with I DO NOT LIKE SOUR BEERS but this place still garners 5 stars.  It's got a cozy set up where you're with in ear shot of your neighbor and can easily strike up a conversation.  So the way it works there is you buy a glass and get four pours in that glass.  All of the beers seemed to be wild fermented...sours.  The sour aspect was not overpowering so someone that does not like that style could still enjoy what they pour.

reviews.author: Jeremy M.
reviews.description: Being a huge fan of sour beers I was stoked to visit Blue Owl. Unfortunately I walked away underwhelmed.  Aside from these sour ipa the beers were just ok. The concept though was something I've never encountered. You can't just walk in and buy a pint of beer. You must purchase a glass, which comes with 4 pours. There are a variety of glass sizes from taster to full pint and the prices are actually pretty cheap ($16 for the full size glass and 4 pours). If you are already in the area and want to try something different it's worth a stop but probably wouldn't recommend going out of your way.

reviews.author: Maritza M.
reviews.description: Spent a whole evening here due to the unusual policy of requiring you to purchase a glass that comes with 4 pours. We drank our 4 14 oz pours over the course of a few hours, but it's nice that we had the option to bail earlier and take home a can instead. The patio is nicely set up with distanced tables, fans, and hand sanitizers at every table. We brought over food from Vegan Nom, a couple minutes walk away. My partner and I each tried 4 different beers. All were delicious! This was our first visit to the brewery despite buying the beer from stores many times. I would definitely come back but with the awareness of the policy that you have to buy at least 4 12oz pours (you can split amongst multiple people though). I think the real highlight of visiting the brewery are the frozen beer drinks. They had a "Mexican Marteeny" available the night we went, which is based on the Teenybopper ale with some other things mixed in. Amazing, and a great final glass! The bartender was lovely and was able to answer all our questions, too.

reviews.author: Ryan F.
reviews.description: Visited Blue Owl Brewing on Sunday evening. Extremely different and very bold beers, but even as someone who loves sours, difficult to get into.  Quality: I visit breweries relatively frequently, and I can confidently say Blue Owl Brewing is doing some very interesting things. From the way you order to the explosion of sour, nothing is familiar. We went with the Half Pint Glass and tried four beers, Little Gose, Van Dayum, Hop Totem, and Professor Black. I also got a sip of Cool and The Gang and Admiral Gravitas. And while you expect a gose to be sour, the red ale, IPA, cherry stout, and imperial oatmeal stout are not things you expect to pucker your lips. Does it work? I don't really think so. The standard sours were good, but the other styles are just overpowered and lose their charm. I give credit for going bold, but I think the experiment went too far. Quantity: Guests choose an 16oz, 12oz, 8oz, or 5oz glass, which then comes with four pours. Value: $12 for the Half Pint Glass with four 8oz pours. Ambiance: Blue Owl Brewing is located east of Downtown Austin. The brewery is in a good sized warehouse, but the taproom is relatively small. Most of the space is taken up by equipment. Out front they have a skinny patio area running adjacent to the street. Inside they have a bar at the center and then a few tables with high tops surrounding it. The decor is very cozy and homey. In the background indie hip-hop played along, which felt like a good choice. I will say the collection of games they had to occupy visitors, much like the beers, strays from the norm. With around twenty games, I had never heard of any of them before. Crowd: A few other people, but most did not stay very long. It is a very niche style of beer, and it is not really for many casual beer drinkers. Service: The ordering method is strange, which I am sure is annoying to the staff. However, everyone I interacted with was extremely friendly. Parking: Limited street parking on the main stretch, however parking can be found along the side roads.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Blue Owl is a sour's paradise--but before you click away my sour-beer-haters, let me tell you that I'm also one of you. I'm not a sour fan, even though I've done my best to try it every time I hit up breweries. Blue Owl is different...here's why.  True, their beer menu is all sours. That usually turns brew lovers like myself off, BUT keep reading the descriptions of the sours. They brew the sours with other beer varieties that some may enjoy more--hefeweizen, lager, IPA, you name it, they make it. It's called sour-mashing here at Blue Owl. I KNOW. I was drawn to their extensive menu and had the opportunity to try two that night. I love hefes, so went with the Litte Boss, which was a session wheat sour. VERY crisp and refreshing, almost like a lager, and exactly the perfect start to my beer tasting here. The great thing is, ALL beer drinkers knowledgeable or novice, can figure it out. Their menu has a timeline that tells you what is lighter on the palette, and what might be harsher. Their Little Boss was on the clean/light side, so I knew that would be a great starter...and it was! I also chose the Hop Totem because it was an IPA sour, and it didn't actually have as bitter hops as I thought it would. It was not as bitter, but the sour taste came out more for me...so I preferred their Little Boss more.  We stood at their standing tables, as all the other tables were full. They have board games (SCORE!) and every beer lover's favorite things to hear--A GLASS FOR KEEPS. Yup. Mine is sitting in the freezer in its new home. There are various sizes of beer selections, so take that into consideration when you're deciding what size of your drink to get. Also, you can ask the sweet taptenders if they have any stickers lying around--and you might get one for free!

reviews.author: Mina N.
reviews.description: The concept of buying a glass (to was an interesting concept as we were visiting and didn't want anything else to lug around. However, the pricing was not bad for what it was. I got the small 5 oz. glass and was able to get 4 beers to try. They were all delicious, even the sour hazy ipa (and I typically do not like iPad due to the hoppyness). Definitely recommend if you like sours like I do. They have a lot of different ones so you won't be limited.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: first of all the food truck on site Bonita Los 3 Reyes is delicious as all tacos I've come to love, I can put this truck on the top favorite spots. get food for sure. next the brewery- huge open space outside with plenty of seating. I wont lie to you yelp, I am not much for drinking beers but for this brewery, I might knock one beer out and enjoy the patio more than anything. shout out to the staff for being awesome and helping me find the right beer for me.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Like the space like the amenities like the food trucks like the peeps. The beer not so much. We did two flights. Eight beers. A couple were good. A couple were bad. The rest were just mediocre.  Dog friendly. Plenty of seating inside and out. Good prices. What does this place do for parking?

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: My friend's band was playing for free here as a pre Austin FC party. I was the only person here not wearing green, it seemed. Had 2 beers, 1 was really good and 1 was eh. They had a Mexican food truck in the back and it was meh, I wouldn't recommend. Line inside to get a beer was ridiculous... I would have had more if it wasn't such a wait. Seems they could use a bit of logistical help.

reviews.author: Mr. S.
reviews.description: The beer was not good. 2 of the flight beers were offensively bad. And a couple were okay...Would not return under any circumstances.

reviews.author: Christa S.
reviews.description: Went here on a sunny afternoon with Kelly L. She had been, but it was my first time - although I'd been eyeing Hopsquad as it was building up and it had been on my list to visit. The parking is limited, so plan ahead. The space is bigger than it looks from the outside - as it has an indoor bar as well as an outdoor picnic table area. I tried two beers (can't remember which ones) and they were both very good. The menu had good variety, so I feel like it's a good spot to bring a group that could have diverse beer tastes. The staff was friendly and seemed to be happy working there. I would definitely visit again!

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This is a very wide-open brewery with plenty of places to sit, stand, chill out, hang out, etc.  I had the Cowboy Bevo (which is a brown ale).  I usually love the sweet, malty taste of a brown ale, but the IBU rating on this one was a little high for my tastes.  Not terrible, mind you, and I would consider it again. Just a little hoppy for my tastes.    It's in an industrial park, like many breweries are, but it was a nice, spacious, and clean set up. Service was quick too - so was parking.  On my last visit, they even had a local band playing from within one of the loading dock doors.   Bottom line, great tastes, services, parking easy, and some good live tunes.  Check them out!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: My dog hopped up on the counter to demand a winter porter, but was immediately met with a dog biscuit.  Meanehile, my wife ordered a dunkelweizen whilI ste thw winterbrew and proceeded to a Murcielago.  I loved the later on nitro.  Friendly staff, counter service, plenty of room inside open to air and outside in the sun.  It's my 2nd visit.  We enjoyed the food from Tsuke Hoten and there's a pizza truck too.  We'll be back for more.

reviews.author: Tara K.
reviews.description: What a cute brewery!  They have a decent selection of brews and plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.  They have a big screen tv good for watching sporting games, and they have a food truck for munchies.   I was impressed by the women's restrooms as it had tampons, pads, and lotion.  How thoughtful!  Good mix of clientele too.

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Huge open inside area where you can see the e brewing section. Also large screens for watching sports. Great place to work or for a large gathering. Plenty of tasty brews for any of your tastes.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Design aesthetic on fleek. Open ro ALL customers--dog and kid-friendly! Strong wifi and food truck supported, Hopsquad is going places.  We walked in excited to try their beers. We heard about this spot and it was so easy to find off the main road. It's connected to Circle Brewing and separated by an easily-crossed chain fence. UGH! How convenient. Beer nerds unite! The mural art is very instagrammable and the interior is even more of a design paradise. The chairs, tables, succulents, artwork and all-around ambiance is so calming, zen and open. It's the perfect place to get work done or enjoy a sunny day with your furry friends. We were a group of four, and all of us loved the space. They also have strong wifi, so y'all know this girl would rather get studying/work done with a beer over cafe drinks any day.  The restrooms are also very clean and GET THIS...they have tampons, pads and AVEENO LOTION IN THE WOMENS' RESTROOM. Yee-haw! They have flights of four for the typical Austin price of $10. Everything is wonderful about this place. They also have a little strip of grass for dogs to do their business--and they have a poop bag station too. The food truck looks like omakase (I'm not entirely sure), but they have so many outdoor games/picnic tables as well as indoor activities like fooseball and dog treats.  The aspects that could be improved are parking. Yes, they have additional parking that's a few lots away...but immediate parking is a drag. We got lucky and squeezed in on the side by the large trash receptacles. The beers also weren't everybody's favorites. They did have a selection, but they only have a few beers on tap. However, Hopsquad is so very green still...that variety will take time. GREAT new brewery providing a hip space for all folks!

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Really chill place with cool murals, lots of natural light, nice summer selection (the only hazy was fantastic), lots of good dogs.

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: We chanced upon Hopsquad recently, and I don't think I've ever been more comfortable at any other brewery in Austin. I do agree that their beer is still probably finding its footing (Austin does have a competitive craft beer scene, after all), but I don't think other places can hold a candle to Hopsquad's absolutely chilled out homey vibes.   I'll do a pros and cons list.   Pros:  - I can bring my human +canine children and seat them indoors.  - the staff actually don't mind human children.  -cider and wine available for non-beer drinkers   -the staff like my canine child (and there are plenty of other dog parents who visit which means you can play "I pet that dog!")  - board games  - foosball table  - plenty of space   Cons  - I truly believe there are better beers out there.  - cider portions are small - from a can and a little steep , price wise  So when you weigh the two, the pros beat the cons by a mile. As for the beer- give them time. I mean, no one really cared about a few other noted breweries 5 years ago but look how popular they've become now ! Here's to Hopsquad becoming Austin's next too brewery.   - food truck outside  - plenty of parking

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: Came here on a trip to Austin. After going to a couple breweries prior to this and I was suggested to come here based on the quality of beers. As the name suggests they are very much hops forward. I am not. I came in and asked the woman about non-hop forward beers. She suggested one and I tried it. It was very hop forward. The bar, if you call it that, is very pretentious. Would not come here again if traveling through Austin.

reviews.author: Shveta M.
reviews.description: Hot dang this new brewery is beautiful! It's soooo colorful inside and they've got so much seating that is very comfortable! Bring your pups along too. They're welcome!  We enjoyed the ambiance, hubs enjoyed the beer (I'm doing dry January) and they've got an amazing Japanese food truck out front (Tsuken Hoten) and their shiitake and avocado bowl was fantastic! They'll be serving a limited seating omakase very soon and it'll be reasonably priced!   We've got tons of greta breweries in austin but I think this one is in my top 5 for ambiance, dog-friendly, great grub, plenty of power outlets if you want to work, and friendly staff! I'll be sure to taste their beers myself and update this review accordingly.  Plenty of parking, and you can park in the lot by Circle if you can't find one in their lot. Head on over ASAP (Wed-Sun) only for now.

reviews.author: Kasy S.
reviews.description: I stopped in this past Friday for some crowlers to-go. As this was my first visit, I tried three different offerings. First off, their online ordering is slick and seamless. Secondly, they seem to have adapted well to the pandemic with adequate spacing between their outdoor tables. I would definitely feel comfortable having some pints in their beer-garden. If you are as excited about Austin FC (soon-to-be season ticket holder) these guys are within easy walking distance to the gorgeous new stadium. I can see myself having pre-match beers here before taking the short walk to the stadium.  Now on to the important stuff: the beer!  I opted for their Kate la Quimica SMaSH IPA, Professor Pleasant pale ale, and my personal favorite style Sir Winsor ESB. I found the SMaSH to be my favorite, it was a fantastic representation of the style, 9/10. My second favorite was the ESB, major kudos for carrying this style that is far too rare state-side. It was delicious and my second favorite of that style in town 8/10 (bonus point for a well-done obscure style). I thought the pale ale was fair, I found it to be a bit one-note. Though pleasant on the nose, it lacked a similar nuance on the palate 6/10. All said, I will definitely be back to try their extensive and varied roster of brews. As a bonus, the staff I spoke with were extremely friendly and happy to talk about both their brews and Austin FC. Keep up the great work!

reviews.author: Beth E.
reviews.description: They have great beers! They have a great selection from lagers to ipa's. It is right across the street from the soccer stadium so in game days it's crazy busy. They have a couple of food trucks in the back and just FYI they have no AC.

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: Great beer, great atmosphere, nice outdoor seating as well as open air "indoor" seating (which is key these days with covid), and they had food trucks available for nosh. Will be going back!

reviews.author: N S.
reviews.description: Open, bright, colourful, not too loud, outdoor seating and 2 food trucks, fantastic Pennybacker if you like hazies. Tropical fruity deliciousness, the perfect summer bevvy. Love this spot

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: From the second we walked in I liked the vibes of this place. It is very open and clean, but still warm and cozy. There is a decent amount of space both indoors and out, but I could still see how this place could get packed.   We went around 5 on a Friday and it wasn't empty but also wasn't too crowded. It was nice out so we sat outside. I got a flight which was only $10 for 4 smaller beers and I could pick any of the options on tap.   I'm not a big beer drinker so I don't know that it's fair for me to detailed review each beer, but from the variety I'm sure any one that likes beer could find something they enjoy.   Great place to bring a group! They also have a little food truck/ restaurant out back that looked really good but I haven't tried yet.

reviews.author: TheoHuxtable X.
reviews.description: A decent brewery very similar to all the others in the area. The problem is that it takes longer to get a beer here on Austin FC game days than any of the other places. I know there's a big crowd on game day, but how dumb not to anticipate that and bring in more staff. A brewery exists to sell beer. And you'll wait 45 minutes in line to get one here. Hopsquad just hasn't figured out how to serve beer at a reasonable speed so they are selling half as many as they could while inconveniencing everyone.

reviews.author: Courtney P.
reviews.description: Before leaving Austin and catching our flight home, we made one final stop in the Lonestar state. We came to Live Oak brewing Company on a Monday afternoon for a drink before heading out. It is spitting distance from the airport and a nice spot to wait if you have to kill time before a flight.  They offer a nice variety of beers and I think the main attraction is their disc golf course. We saw several people playing disc golf and enjoying a nice cold beer. They sell snacks like chips and pretzels but nothing homemade. I'm not sure if they have food trucks that rotate through or not.  Plenty of parking and good beers.

reviews.author: Melissa M.
reviews.description: This is my first time at Live Oak Brewing.  I was staying at a hotel near the airport and this brewery came up.   This is what I consider walking distance (under 2 miles) but it would be a quick Lyft or Uber if you aren't someone like myself.   First off, let me tell you about the staff here. As soon as I walked in the door I was greeted with a welcome like I was an old friend that they couldn't wait to see.  I told them I was a new comer and they were so happy to tell me all about their brews.  They explained each brew on tap and I asked which beer they recommended.  They suggested their Hefeweizen which is spectacular. Such an easy drinking wheat ale with a bit of a tangy finish.    It is definitely worth the visit.  It's animal and kid friendly with great seating indoors and outdoors. Looks like they also have a great stage for some live music and fun. Disclaimer it said they take Apple Pay but they do not.  Which is cool but a site isn't telling the truth.  Not their fault.    I will definitely making frequent stops here whenever I'm in Austin! Thank you for such a wonderful experience Live Oak Brewing! Y'all are the BEST!!!

reviews.author: Samantha S.
reviews.description: I was in town to visit my family and we wanted to play some disc golf. We headed over to live oak and had a great time on their 14 (?) hole course that winds throughout their land and is very well kept. After we played, we visited the Black Forest German food truck which is always parked in the parking lot. The potato salad is killer! We also got a flight from live oak and every thing that we tried was super yummy.

reviews.author: Jessie C.
reviews.description: I've always loved Live Oak beers whenever I can find them on tap, and I'm so glad we stumbled upon this on our way into Austin! The brewery is pretty secluded and tucked away behind the airport. The large oak trees that surround it are beautiful, and they have plenty of outdoor seating under the trees that's perfect for a nice day! There is also some indoor seating and the whole place is dog friendly. They have a huge selection of beers - the pils and marzens are my favorites. There's also a German food truck (The Black Forest) that I believe is always posted outside by the outdoor seating, so you have a food option if you need a bite to eat.

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: Amazing customer service and delicious craft beer along with a huge outdoor area makes this place a must go destination.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: Great brewery that I hadn't been to before!  Nice setting outside among the trees (and a secondary large grassy area perfect for dogs and kids).  Large picnic tables. Shade.  Food truck. All Covid precautions in place.  Because of the extra precautions, it does take a while at the ordering/pick up table.  Understandable.  I ordered their sour, The Gose Coriander Salt Sour (where they add a flavored syrup of your choosing to it).  I love sours but just found the flavor of this one kind of weird.   Almost "smoky" tasting.  I didn't finish and got their Oktoberfest instead (much better!).   Plenty of parking and nice clean bathrooms.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Oh Live Oak Brewing Company do I love you so!  You are always friendly, safe, spacious, and shaded for me and my company when we head out to enjoy your delicious and fresh beers. I cannot get enough of the Hefe that is always served ice cold and deliciously the best on a warm spring afternoon.  You keep doing you, boo!  I have had a leaving-to-a-new-gig goodbye party here where there was plenty of outdoor space for us to hang out, drink beer, and enjoy company with coworkers here pre-pandemic. Easy parking, lots of space to move around and/or play outdoor games, and never a fuss with separate tabs and closing out your tab.  Most recently we came for a friends birthday on a late Saturday afternoon and this place was buzzing with lots of other families and parties enjoying their beers under the nice big oak trees.  I highly recommend you lathering the SPF or sunscreen if you are going to be under a tree or even if you are in the shade especially in spring or summer times.  There will be plenty of picnic tables and areas for you to choose even if it does seem or look crowded when you walk in.  I was really impressed with how the set up is at Live Oak now in pandemic times. There is one single line to order your beer(s), 2-3 servers helping at 1 long table, easy and no contact for paying or opening up your tab, and clear signage and offerings on what beers they got on tap, in bottles/cans, and to-go as well.  Everyone in line are very patience and polite in giving you 6 feet distance as you wait to place your order.  There is 1 food truck, The Black Forest, onsite that also offers contactless payment and has the best German snacks and food. I highly recommend the pimento cheese if you see it on the menu. You are also welcomed to bring your own food to enjoy as you sip on some tasty beers. I even saw a large bbq pit, if I am not mistaken, as well that you could probably use or might have to reserve(?).

reviews.author: Liana W.
reviews.description: LOVED this outside seating. Lots of space to spread out- good social distancing. I am so thankful that I found this brewery!   It was a great place to sit outside under a tree and we brought a few snacks because of my dietary restrictions

reviews.author: Jennifer P.
reviews.description: Their hefe is so great but even better coming straight from the brewery. Beautiful property and totally dog and kid friendly. It's pretty neat watching the planes fly into the airport too!

reviews.author: Omar M.
reviews.description: I can't say enough good things about this brewery. Great brew selection, clean, modern-and their outdoor space is quite inviting. Plenty of seating to go around and lots of trees provide ample shade. It's so large that you can take a nice stroll and find cool little hidden spots to just chill. There's even a food trailer onsite serving pretzels and such for those who need help with absorbing that fourth Hefeweizen! So I hear!

reviews.author: Tracey T.
reviews.description: Live Oak Hefeweizen is my favorite craft beer. There is nothing quite like sipping one at the brewery and enjoying the spacious atmosphere. They have plenty of room to spread out and picnic tables outside everywhere.

reviews.author: Christyna B.
reviews.description: Beautiful grounds with a 9 hole disc course! I enjoyed the Gose beer and surprisingly the chips and salsa were super yummy! Didn't get to try the food truck because they aren't open Mon-Wednesday.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: I'm now conditioned to pay a visit to Live Oak before I fly out of the Austin airport. Location is key!  Everytime I've been, I got the tasters. They're a little pricey for tasters. The standard for 4 tasters right now is $10, but Live Oak's are $14. They give great pours, come in cute wooden handles, and are equipped with little paper cards with beer info in it for the true beer nerds. I've never had to wait in a long line when I've come, but to be fair I've only come during the late afternoon. My favorite hands down is their Hefeweizen--there's a reason why it won awards! I really did not like the Smoaktoberfest. I love me some smoked flavors--mezcal, roasted tea, etc. BUT the Smoaktoberfest was not a winner...it reminded me of goji berries, which I do not like.  I wish their German food truck would open when the brewery was open. Both times I've been it wasn't open, and I've wanted to get real food while I was here before heading to the airport. That was a big bummer. However, Live Oak does have some snacks for those who get hungry. I've had their Zapp's potato chips and their pretzels with the green chile flavor. They were alright, but kinda pricey. I would suggest bringing your own snacks. Keep it light though, like chips or something. Their restrooms are very spacious and clean, and I love that they have outdoor AND indoor seating galore. Great space for all group sizes, but I've never seen dogs here. I did see someone bring their kid, so I think that's okay.  There is an abundance of parking for all car sizes. The drive there is kinda shady as you turn off from the freeway (like broken windows in cars that are parked along the road, and oooooold cars that look like they've been abandoned for years), so be sure to keep valuables hidden or with you when you go into the brewery. Can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: This place is off the beaten path, but that's what allows it to be sprawling. Lots of outdoor space, some shaded, some not. Indoor space as well. There's a frisbee golf course throughout and a food truck. So, it basically has it all.

reviews.author: Max G.
reviews.description: I couldn't wait to get back to Austin and visit Live Oak Brewing.  As with my last trip, three years ago, Live Oak does German and Czech-style beers, and does them extremely well.  The brew my favorite pilsner, and normally I shun pilsners.  This time we also tried a number of their smoked beers--all were delicious.   Live Oak features a clean, modern indoor room, where you can borrow board games, as well as an outdoor seating area under large oak trees.  They also have a disc golf course.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: J Warren R.
reviews.description: Live Oak lives up to its name with a beautiful setting and area to drink beer among the old Live Oak Trees.  This is a cool environment.  The tap room is roomy. The outside tables are a perfect place to enjoy mother nature.  Beers tend to be lighter and yellow, although there were a couple of darker variety.  Mostly low ABV.  Live Oak Beer would be very tasty in the hot Texas sun.  Recommend stopping by when you are on the way to or from  the airport.  It is also worth a special trip for beer lovers.

reviews.author: Stephanie W.
reviews.description: The setup- I would give this 4 stars. Huge property with a ton of outdoor seating, and a lot of seating inside. Really nice environment.  Beer- I would give this three stars. It's a specifically German style brewery so I don't expect fireworks or anything too crazy, but I thought it was just okay. The most creative thing they do is the added syrups but I would never, ever add syrups in a beer if it was delicious. Just no. Their beer wasn't exactly delicious so I didn't mind, but I had a hard time finishing it. Too sweet.  Service- maybe 2-3 stars. I had an okay experience with the staff, but they did seem very disinterested. Granted it was busy, and the weather was really off, lots of rain that was driving people inside. However, after being to a ton of tap rooms with extremely personable staff, my bar is set higher than theirs I guess.   Overall, I would say 3-4 stars but lean towards three. Not bad, not wonderful.

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: We stopped here on our way to the airport. I am not a beer drinker but like a Stout once in a while. They did not have stouts but tasted a lighter beer. The brewery had a very relaxing atmosphere with large Oak Trees. Plus they had a food truck on site. This place is kid friendly.

reviews.author: Brian M.
reviews.description: Good place for a small group gathering. Was recommended to take co-workers from out of town here. Was not disappointed. Close to the airport but far enough away to make you feel like you missed a turn. Plenty of inside seating for a group as well as benches outside. Good options for beers. Food truck outside with amazing food. Small shop inside.

reviews.author: Ryan F.
reviews.description: Live Oak Brewing Company was our last stop in Texas. Unique old-world beers and a massive outdoor space make it a great spot for beer-lovers, families, and dogs.  Quality: Live Oak boasts a long history of brewing beers. In operation since 1997, it was the first brewery in Austin. And with its focus on old-world style, serving up beers you don't see on every menu, its no wonder they have had such a good run. During our visit we went through two Flights, getting to try their Hefeweizen, Pilz, Grodziskie, Gose, Kleinesbier, IPA, Helles, and Berliner Weibe. All beers falling on the lighter end. Perfect for summer and a trek on the disc golf course. I enjoyed all the beers I tried, but it was the unique characteristics of Grodziskie, a smoked Polish champagne beer, that truly caught my attention. Do not miss the opportunity to try this incredible beer. Quantity: While more beer usually is not a problem, the larger Flight pours may give pause to folks trying to sample and run. Value: $14 for a Flight of four 8oz pours. Ambiance: Live Oak Brewing Company is located close to the Austin-Bergstrom Airport. It is a unique location, but one that offers massive space to the brewery. They have a good-sized taproom, but it really is the outdoor patio, picnic area, and disc golf course that you want to be on. Unfortunately a hot summer afternoon trapped us inside, but I could imagine the fun outside on a more temperate day. Strange country folk music played, giving true Texas vibes, and the A/C bumped as we sipped on our beers. Crowd: We were the first to arrive on Tuesday afternoon, but slowly the place filled up. The outside is very dog friendly and a few people arrived with frisbees ready to start the disc golf fun. Service: Extremely friendly bartenders who are very proud of the unique beers they brew. Parking: The off the beaten track location has a large private lot.

reviews.author: Todd S.
reviews.description: My wife and I needed a getaway so we loaded up our RV and looked for a place to camp at. We found this brewery just a few miles SW of Austin that just had STUNNING food! I had the chicken tortilla soup which was probably the best I've ever had. I also got a pair of chicken quesadillas while my wife got the pork tacos. Everything including the chips N queso was just great.   The vibe was relaxed and easy going, it was quiet enough to enjoy the Motown music mix, our servers were friendly, the prices quite reasonable, and food was delivered within minutes. We finished off the night with a flight of ice cream. Oh yeah -- the beer was good too. We're bringing all of our friends here first chance we get.

reviews.author: Deb L.
reviews.description: Over the weekend we had the opportunity to travel down to Austin and stay at the brewery in our Airstream. This was a fabulous place! The beer that they are brewing is unique and flavorful, along with traditional street tacos and Mexican fare, which can be pretty competitive in Austin.   When we first go there, I asked for a Topo Chico, which they don't have because they have something much better!  If you want something refreshing to clean the palette before you start trying different beers, order the Hop Water! It is amazing!  I really have to commend the staff, because they were friendly, attentive to our needs, and fast.  That is a challenge in today workforce, and there is nothing worse than having great food and crappy service.   While the beer and food was delicious - the one thing that stood out as exceptional was the ice cream flight. That is a must have if you visit Beerburg Brewing. The seasonal speciality was Atole Ice Cream and it was our favorite!

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: I came here on a Thursday evening, maybe around 7, and there were only a couple other groups there. We had the whole patio to ourselves with just our dog and the sunset! The setting is hard to beat, a nice view of the hills, an area with trees and benches, and a dog park. They have an indoor area, too!  The beer choices were plentiful and varied, and for non beer lovers they have other alcoholic and nonalcoholic options.  We ordered flautas, brisket tacos, and patatas bravas. My favorite of the three were the patatas - great flavor, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Also quite a bit for the price. The flautas were good - the shell was perfectly crunchy. But, the taste was lacking. This was the case with the tacos, too. Also, for the price, I think 3 would be more reasonable vs. 2... Though I was satisfied (not too full) by the end. Definitely order some ice cream! Both flavors we had were great - probably the best of the food tbh!  Overall a great place to hang out with some friends and have a few drinks. Very dog friendly. The food is promising, but will have to try more to be convinced.

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: I think this is my new favorite brewery!   What a quirky little place with amazing Mexican food and great beer and wine. The staff is friendly and takes their time explaining what's on the menu and even provides recommendations.  Their food is fresh and delicious ... every item we ordered was so tasty! I LOVE that they have homemade ice cream ... a variety of flavors and some of them that are seasonal. I'm definitely coming back to enjoy their outdoor seating,  try their other tacos and of course... ice cream!!!  Potatos bravas - nice and crisp on the outside, soft on the inside. Delicious seasoning. Great sauce to dip the potatoes in.  Guacamole - oh so fresh! Again, just the right amount of salt and lime in it. Chips were fresh too.  Brisket tacos - well marinated and cooked brisket (on the spicy side), with caramelized and pickled onions on a semi fried taco... yum yum yum  Ice cream - chocolate with strawberry was great although I did wish they had more strawberries in it. Blueberry cheesecake tasted just like it's name!  Beerburg Brewery for the win!!!

reviews.author: Rachel R.
reviews.description: Hidden gem. I have lived in the area for a little over two years now andand have searched Mexican food several times andand this has never popped up. Food, beer and hibiscus lemonade tea was delicious! Will be a new staple

reviews.author: Samantha G.
reviews.description: We came here over Memorial Day weekend and had a blast. It wasn't crowded which was nice because it was relaxing- although I'm sure that won't last long...  we tried the flight and a variety of beers and enjoyed all of it! The staff was super friendly and the place is spacious and clean.   We got the mushroom asada and the quesadillas and both were amazing. I loved the fried crispy tortillas that both came with. The plates are a little small for the price but I think it is well worth to try the food! We also got pistachio ice cream. I wanted to get a flight but we were already too full. I would definitely come back though to try more as they have some interesting flavors!!

reviews.author: Megan P.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a flight of beers and a snack and was not disappointed! The beers were great as was the food. We loved sitting on the spacious deck enjoying a beautiful day.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Yet another boozy destination on Fitzhugh Road. Should have invested in property a few years ago...  Nice venue with table service! I don't have to stand in line to get a beer! Yay!!!   Hate me if you want...I've decided to stop tipping at beer gardens where I have to stand in line for more than 3 minutes.   Good beer. We tried a flight of the lighter beers - all decent. Hubby liked the Sour but wasn't happy with the prickly pear milkshake IPA. I think he got exactly what he ordered...  Had chips and salsa. Menu looks pretty good.   Love the dog park and the shaded tables. Did I mention TABLE SERVICE!

reviews.author: Grace C.
reviews.description: Great outdoor beer and food. Lovely 15 acres hill country scenery.  If it is too hot, eat and drink indoors.

reviews.author: Sally M.
reviews.description: I want to thank the owner, Trevor Nearburg, for providing a venue for a Celebration of Life for Chase Holbrook and his family and friends. Ricardo Gutierrez, the general manager and chef along with additional staff provided a perfect venue for us to say goodbye to a precious member of our family. They went above and beyond to accommodate our family and provide an atmosphere that our Chase would have loved. We are grateful for your kindness, support and professionalism in supporting our family. Just know that we will continue to frequent Beerburg to enjoy your great beer, food and wonderful facility. You all are the best!!!!

reviews.author: Kirby W.
reviews.description: Excellent brewery AND eatery outside the madness that is now Austin. You can sit among the trees and enjoy a cold craft brew while chowing down on their great, and reasonably priced, cuisine. Well off the beaten path for a reason: It's not over-run by hipsters wearing black! I'm an old white guy and I'm a fan. Go now!!!

reviews.author: Sunita S.
reviews.description: This brewery was just so cool. They have a great outdoor space and really have their whole ordering process streamlined. Loved the beers and the fact that they take reservations.

reviews.author: Lynn Y.
reviews.description: This review is solely about the food since I don't drink. Living nearby we have ordered curbside here several times and each time the food is excellent, better tacos than anywhere else i have had them Today we had the brisket tacos that are nicely grilled with excellent quality meat and great flavor. Not a bit of grizzle or fat. I wholeheartedly recommend their food!

reviews.author: Raymond P.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere  Great service, everyone was so helpful.  Great food  Great location  Great drinks  Really a hidden gem in the hill country. Enjoy now before everyone finds out about it. Thanks for a great experience!

reviews.author: Ty G.
reviews.description: Yes! Another review about the fantastic kitchen and excellent service! But, I first need to mention the amazing music we walked into on a recent, sunny Sunday afternoon.   Michael Samuels was performing on piano, guitar, harmonica and vocals: a true professional. He had two other musicians (bass and guitar) backing him up and the sound was full, refined, joyful, and with a deep groove.  I just felt motivated to give a shout out to some great Austin musicians. Hope to see Michael Samuels back at Beerburg!   Now onto the meal. One order of the Winter Squash Huaraches (the Daily Special) and one order of the Cauliflower Chorizo Tacos. Fabulous! You can really tell this is a scratch kitchen using real family recipes as a foundation. Their corn tortillas are made from fresh masa for each order: the way it ought to be.  My friends were doing the beer drinking and they thought highly of the selections offered. Sorry I can't provide more about the brews, I'm a non-drinker. Regardless, it's guaranteed I'll be back for the food and music!

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: I visited Beerburg for this year's Barks for Beers and was thoroughly impressed. The venue has plenty of seating indoors and the atmosphere was pleasant. So, the beer was delicious and the artisanal ice creams were incredible but when you visit do not forget to try the striped bass ceviche! Holy bajoles it is knock your socks off delicious. I'm looking forward to making the trek out to Beerburg again ASAP.

reviews.author: Celena S.
reviews.description: Everything we had was good. Nothing was just thrown together or slapped onto a plate. Everything we ordered was plated beautifully and tasted good. Because of covid most restaurants I've been too have been sloppy and rushed to get it out the door and not much care places in their food.   The staff were very friendly and took precautions to keep themselves and us safe, which we really appreciated.   I'm not a beer fan so I got a glass if the rosè, it was decent at best. My husband had a cider which was really good.   We will definitely be back with our dog once it cools down some and the full menu is available. It looks like it will be amazing!  Good job y'all!

reviews.author: Madhavi A C.
reviews.description: The cocktails and the food is really good especially the tacos. The desserts they have also good. The only con is that they close the kitchen really early even on weekends like around 7:45 last call. But would definitely go again for the vibe and food.

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: Great smooth beer, tasty tacos, and an outdoor dog park make this a really nice spot for dinner!

reviews.author: Hunter R.
reviews.description: Food is excellent and beer is great too! Staff is attentive and it's never super busy. Forget jester king and support this place instead!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Finally made it to trying out the infamous Cuban Quesadilla and some local craft beer. Both did not disappoint, very tasty and satisfying. The Verde salsa and the guacamole were nice addition to the flavor profile of my appetizer smorgasbord.  It's a little off the beaten path but worth the journey. Check them out.

reviews.author: George D.
reviews.description: Update?  There's nothing to update, just get here it's awesome! Tonight is "Burger Night"!

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Such a cute spot!!! Indoor and outdoor seating that's dog friendly. There's a gravel area with some games. Tables over a shaded grassy area are also available. Mostly hard seltzer's on tap, but fun flavors. Beer selection was small but covered all the bases. The food they have is small portions but soooo good! Not your traditional pupusa or cortido, but I still enjoyed it. The flour tortillas were really good. Cubano is the perfect beer food though. Such a great brewery and I love that it's in Pflugerville. TVs with sports  and a projector playing a movie we're on the inside.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: Great beers, great hard seltzer, and burger night is phenomenal. Cool staff, decent prices, what more do you want? I will be back on the regular.

reviews.author: Travis P.
reviews.description: Great place! Outdoor area is a lot of nice space. Food is a little pricey for how much you get.   Beer is tasty with a nice variety.   A perfect small brewery vibe.

reviews.author: Caroline M.
reviews.description: Great environment, welcoming (and mask wearing) staff, dog friendly, delicious food, great assortment of beverages (beers and tasty seltzer's-- like coconut papaya). Plenty of tables and areas to social distance, while supporting a local business!   While we only visited during the soft opening, we know that Willards will be a fantastic addition to the Pflugerville area!   Willards Brewery features the Mojo Austin Food Truck!! (Separate IG accounts by the way) The Cubano Quesadilla, Braised Beef Taco, and Beef and Cheese Pupusa are allllll a must have!!  I recommend the green salsa since it's nice and hot, as well!

reviews.author: Erin P.
reviews.description: We wanted to check out one of the new breweries in town. The atmosphere here was awesome. Open air tasting room with projector plus great beer garden area. Lots of little games and lighting. I love a place that offers 4oz pours so you can buy ole your own flights. The food was good and fast. Will be back!

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Willards is my new favorite neighborhood brewery. Their beers are all solid and the taproom is a great place to get out of the house safely during covid. I really appreciate that they have a menu that caters to everyone, not just beer drinkers. I love their hard seltzer cocktails and they also have mead and a few guest taps from other breweries. The Mojo food truck is amazing - their pork tacos are to die for!  As far as the physical space goes, the patio is gorgeous and they have campfires going at night to keep you cozy. Everything is very well spaced out, too.

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: Willard's is right around the corner from our home, but we tried it for the first time last night (it won't be the last). The first thing you notice as you walk into the beer garden is the nice outdoor space with a pleasant ambiance. They have picnic style tables in and outside, they keep the indoor space very open (making us feel safer during COVID era). The lights outside provide a nice touch, as well as the music- played at a low enough volume that we don't have to raise our voices to hear one another.   Now as for the drinks: their stout is amazing and smooth and very chocolatey. Their seltzers all have such unique taste combinations and are NOT overly sweet, like some of the big name brands. The strawberry tangerine reminded me of a Haribo gummy bear! The coconut papaya was delicious and I went back and forth between tasting the coconut and the papaya most. They even have cocktail like drinks that are good for those who don't enjoy beer or seltzer. My partner ordered the Hazy IPA and liked it enough to buy a six-pack to take home. George was our bartender. He has such a calm and respectful demeanor. He was really great and made the experience of tasting some of the drinks for the first time so pleasant.   The food truck is so reasonable in price and was delicious! It was so nice to have something other than typical bar food. Austin (chef) brings out the orders so quickly and is super kind! Their guacamole is really interesting and we all devoured it, their salsas are spicy and fresh, and they even have a mushroom taco with a black bean puree for those of us who don't eat meat. Everyone at our table enjoyed the food (other items ordered were pork nachos, Cuban quesadilla, and the pupusa).   Overall we loved our experience, and will definitely be back to visit this hidden treasure.

reviews.author: TD C.
reviews.description: We had never been and had been looking for pooch friendly places and that sealed our decision. Tried the place on a Sunday afternoon and expected more patrons there were only 3 other tables. Great service from the employees offering tasting of different beers and seltzer's and you've got to try the Mojo Cuban food truck - can recommend the quesadilla for sure. Look for us on a Sunday with our Am Staf puppy named Daisy.

reviews.author: Zane Z.
reviews.description: Super cool place in an upcoming area. Great drink selections and a really good happy hour. Had the Fistfull of Fury and October Fest while my wife had the Jenny Lane Seltzer. We both really enjoyed our drinks. They have food too which is an added bonus. Definitely check this neighborhood brewery out!

reviews.author: Jerry H.
reviews.description: I love this place nice  and layed back and my dog she loves it there good brew good food great scene  and great service !

reviews.author: Tara D.
reviews.description: Willard's Brewery has some of the best beer I've ever had! Right now they're selling 3 beers that you can order online or in the brewery for pick-up - a Helles lager, pale ale and hazy IPA. They are absolutely delicious and the can designs are awesome too. The brewery will be opening up their taproom and beer garden in September...can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Dave L.
reviews.description: The little brewery I'll definitely go back wonderful stouts and porters  just waiting on barley wine

reviews.author: Kaitlyn A.
reviews.description: Great new brewery in north Austin!  Had a sneak peak at their offerings and all three beer styles were amazing.  Very excited to try the food truck - Mojo, which is opening for business this weekend.  Can't go wrong with great beer and tacos along with a beautiful beer garden. I'm in!

reviews.author: Danse L.
reviews.description: It was cool. But now apparently it's CLOSED PERMANENTLY. Food court is still open. Hope someone else takes over the beers!

reviews.author: Rosa F.
reviews.description: This is chill and fun-filled local spot!  I almost didn't review because I don't want it to be discovered and "ruined".  There are such few places left in Austin... ::::sigh:::: but you have to give credit where credit is due, and let it flourish!!!   A small drink selection but with variety. Friendly staff, and local music some nights.  There are delicious food trucks outside (yuummm jamaican jerk chicken... enough for two!) which top things off.

reviews.author: Karol M.
reviews.description: The newest trend in South Austin hangouts seems to be converting former homes on a couple of acres into a neighborhood bar, most often with live music and a great outdoor patio. The Barn fits neatly into that trend. Located just a block from the Lowe's on Brodie Lane in Sunset Valley, this old house comes complete with an array of beautiful oak trees, a shady outdoor patio space, a full bar, and an empty (fenced off) swimming pool.   The full bar is open, and still includes a short list of beers and wines by the glass. Prices are in line with downtown venues. The night we visited, a folk band called Days Before Color was playing inside to an appreciative crowd. The venue's online calendar lists upcoming show dates and artists.  There are two food trucks out front by Brodie Lane, one that is mainly BBQ, and neither of which really offer a substantial vegetarian dish. Weirdly, there's a hair salon trailer out there as well. Because why not?  The Barn is family-friendly, which is a plus, but keep in mind that you will need to watch your youngsters closely to keep them safe and make sure they aren't imbibing alcohol. It's still a bar.  All in all, the Barn is a very welcome addition to the Southwest Austin nightlife scene, where we still like to keep things just a little bit weird.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: Super sad I can't review correctly because this place was NOT open  :(. Looks super fun and I was dressed perfectly for a fun night at a country bar! And The web showed it to be open !!  We arrived and found only 2 food trucks open (side note  Oye Taquitos was amazing!) Some other patrons at the food truck said The BARn was between owners - I'm Visiting a friend new to Austin and we LOVED the name and had some high hopes and good ideas for some merch for them if there wasn't any! (New owners let me know!)

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: Wait, what? Double-take. Is that a barn? A bar? Food trucks? Hair salon? All of the above?! If you live in the neighborhood, you've probably had this thought more than once. By now you should know, it IS a bar! It does have food trucks! It also has a hair salon!  This is a cool little spot that they have been improving and adding to over time. It has bar games galore - cornhole (also a cornhole league), pool, darts, put put, jenga, etc. It has a small variety of drinks - a few hard alcohols to choose from, some beer, some wine, and usually a few frozen drinks. It's never too packed, which can be a good and bad thing. They do draw a nice crowd on weekends and when they have live music. They have spacious indoor and outdoor seating.   This bar is set up to be awesome, and I know the owner tries to get more people in here. He really is a nice guy! Ask about the history of the place when you're there, there's some interesting stuff! We've always had a good time here. So what is the problem? People are just slow on the uptake and they have their hands tied with advertising. So y'all need to branch out and try a new (well, not so new anymore) spot. Come hang, play, and be merry with your South Austin neighbors. You won't regret it.

reviews.author: Alexa J.
reviews.description: Was looking for a cold beer while waiting to meet up with a friend. Found this on Yelp, was almost deterred by so few reviews but they were all five stars. Came to check it out and it's fantastic! Had to drop another review to attract more here- they haven't been open long but have an awesome set-up. Tons of space, great layout, super clean and good vibes. Family owned and run- the bartender gave me a few beers to try and clearly knows his stuff, not to mention knows the vendors and breweries, which I always respect. Delicious cold beer, they also have wine and white claw. Highly recommend- my favorite beer garden find in Austin!

reviews.author: Porsha H.
reviews.description: Great bar! They have several food trucks outside on the property with plenty of options. The outside patio is amazing! Lots of bar games and tables. Although some fire pits or outside heaters would be awesome!  the staff was very friendly and there was live music the night I came in. Would definitely recommend!!

reviews.author: Kate A.
reviews.description: We joined some friends who live round the corner from it : Great relaxed space, laid back chatty bar staff, wide range of local beers, yard games, food trucks... ALL MY FAVOURITE THINGS. It was a chilly day when we stopped in - but they had the fire pits blazing so we had a perfect afternoon sitting outside drinking, very good NZ white wine in the fall sunshine. It's not our corner of town, but if it was I can imagine being regulars, it's got the sort of vibe that would make you want to pop in if you were at a loose end at the weekend. Just to see...

reviews.author: Lyndsey M.
reviews.description: Lots has changed since it's opening in terms of drinks. There's now a full bar, a better craft beer selection, and a frozen margarita machine. Cornhole league plays on Wednesdays.  It's still a hole in the wall kind of place but with more offerings!

reviews.author: Scott C.
reviews.description: Stopped by to listen to Blues legend WC Clark perform in a small venue. From the moment we arrived we felt the unique vibe of a South Austin beer garden with food trailers in the lot and a modest $5 cover to have front row seats and a night of unbelievable musical talent. Beer and wine was modestly priced. Mike greeted us at the door and was a terrific host. Service was a little slow... but somehow it felt perfect to go along with the comfortable surroundings. We plan to visit again soon!

reviews.author: Tiffany M.
reviews.description: Super great outdoor space!  Super chill and relaxed, great covid location if you want to go out

reviews.author: Derek C.
reviews.description: Great south Austin local bar. A little hidden but that's a good thing. Also they have corn hole tourneys on Thursdays. The food trucks are bomb!

reviews.author: Chris D.
reviews.description: It's a great space with a lot to offer. Whether you're local to the area or from another part of Austin, I recommend coming in for a drink, some food, and staying for any of the entertainment options/activities. The manager Mike is really cool and makes you feel right at home.

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: I was lucky enough to find this hidden gem. While stopped for traffic on Brodie Lane (in Sunset Valley) I looked to my right at the food trailers parked in the lot. Just passed my view I saw neon signs and one that said BAR.  This beautiful undiscovered oasis in the desert is called the BARn. It has a great divey feel to it, wide-open spaces, a pool table, televisions,  an outside beer garden and a wonderful variety of canned and bottled beer. It also does not have your typical red or white wine, you actually get a few choices. Its also kid and pet friendly too and it's a really a wonderful place for the whole family. They also have live music from Thursday to Sunday and from what I understand WC Clarke will be playing there soon. Look for Allyson, she is as smart as she is cute. She made me feel so welcome and is appreciative when people come in. I'm looking forward to spending a lot more time and winding down at the BARn.  P.S. The other cool part is you have the food truck park right next-door. It's a win win win situation!

reviews.author: Mick W.
reviews.description: So I went to the barn one afternoon waiting for my girls soccer game to start . I had about an hour to kill. I didn't know the area and went into the barn. there was no one there but a bartender and she never said hello, she never said what can I get you, screw you, nothing . she was on the phone when I seated myself at the bar. She hangs  up looks at me  an I say give me a whatever beer. She never spoke a word to me took my money slapped my change down, nada.

reviews.author: Jillian K.
reviews.description: Come check it out! Food outside in the beer garden, wonderful beer selection inside. Full bar! A chill place to relax and unwind after work. The weekends they have live music and rarely a cover charge. My favorite bar in town :)

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: Nice vibes and a good beer selection ! It was a very slow night which Can be a good or bad thing. We had a few beers and listened to a live band. They had some food trucks out front which I'm sure would be great for a late night snack or two!

reviews.author: Scott H.
reviews.description: Came in after driving by for a few months and I think I've found my new watering hole. Staff is super friendly and the vibe is funky chill with a touch of Willie. Family friendly with games inside and out. 3-4 food trucks covering crepes to Soul food will keep your bellies full. It's only been open for six months so get your tail here now so you can be one of the originals!!!!

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: I have been going here to have few beers, listen to music and play pool and darts for about a year.  It is a great bar that specializes in craft beer and live music.  They have several food trucks outside that serve BBQ, Taco's and Jamaican food.  All are quite tasty.  They live music every night and open mic on Wed.  Mike the manager is very nice and inviting.  The best feature of this place is one of the  bartenders.  I believe her name is Jillian.  When she is working you never have to wait for a drink (even when it is slammed) , she also knows her beer and wine and is very good at assisting customers make selections.  She is also very personable and always greets customers with a smile.

reviews.author: Tracy M.
reviews.description: This place is really cool. Local owned. Music Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday for sure the owners are working on having live music other nights too / but just opened in October. They have food trucks right here so depending on what you are hungry for order your food at the food trucks and they will bring it to you as you enjoy a cool beverage .  Currently they only serve beer, AE ciders, wine and yummy alcoholic slushes and mimosas but full bar will be in the future.

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: This is my new favorite spot! Plenty of outdoor, spaced-out seating under the cedar trees. Large playground right in the middle to watch the little ones play. Air-conditioned indoor tables as well.   All the food I have tried is great. The fried chicken sandwich special, pulled pork tostadas(?), the beet and arugula salad... it's all good. Only disappointment was the Mac and cheese, pretty sure it's Kraft. But hey, that was for the kids anyway.   I will definitely keep frequenting this place when I am out on Fitzhugh, and especially once the weather gets cooler. Oh, and all the workers are super friendly as well. Good work, team!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Yet another stop on boozey Fitzhugh.   Good, fresh food. Good, standard and unique beer.  Really good people.   Comfortable setting with room for the kids to roam. Plenty of parking. Shade outside, covered patio, and AC inside. Dog friendly (outside). Great for groups. Competitive prices.   We like. We'll be back.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: The beer is great but the atmosphere is very lacking. When we showed up on a Saturday afternoon, there was no seating. You had to enter (with a dog) through a crowded patio with other dogs. I luckily found 2 chairs not being used at a table to pull aside, but oh lord. There were kids EVERYWHERE. I can handle well behaved kids but there were probably 5 kids per every adult there. It was madness. They were running all over and several times the poor guy delivering food to tables was almost tripped up by them. Our dog was super overwhelmed by parents not watching their kids running up to him.  My husband went to get us beer while I waited outside with the dog, and it took him at least 15mins the line was so long. The beer deserves 5 stars but our dog (and us) were so uncomfortable with how crowded and crazy it was, that we left after quickly sharing a flight. I'd come back, but it would only be right when they opened, and not for very long, considering they're this crowded often.  I definitely don't feel like they took distancing or mask-wearing seriously....my husband and I were the only ones outside wearing them when not at our seated area.  Oh, and the sewage smell is so insane. Rotten eggs bad. Hard to enjoy a good beer with that constant smell. Reminded me of Twisted X Brewing.

reviews.author: Charlene S.
reviews.description: Great selection of brews, good food, wonderful atmosphere and a roomy place! Top it all off with staff that seemingly enjoys working there- makes for a wonderful experience! My husband and I went on a Sunday and greatly enjoyed ourselves. Wonderful to have another stellar local

reviews.author: Allyssa S.
reviews.description: I love Fitzhugh Brewery! I always have the best time and I love how they change their beer options so you can try something different each time. Their food is also delicious, I haven't ordered anything I didn't like. It's a great atmosphere with very friendly staff, and so much space! Go out and support this small business!

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.description: We visit a lot of breweries and this one is top notch.  Great outdoor space.  Airy indoor space.  But the yard.  The yard is where it's at.  Kids and dogs and beer and barbecue on the nachos.  Beer was good, but less offerings than most breweries.  But it was good and we would recommend this place to anyone.

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: Great food, beer, dog friendly, beer, playground, beer, burnt ends, beer, red and white wine, beer, dessert, beers. CRAZY fun brewery to visit.

reviews.author: Seth P.
reviews.description: Great beer with a revolving selection. Same thing on the food, it's reliably good. We try and come here about once a week. The specials are usually pretty special.

reviews.author: Delia S.
reviews.description: The space is a modern farmhouse look with high ceilings and clean, modern lines and the outside area has plenty of seating and trees for shade. Aesthetically it is close to perfect, but I have to knock a point off for the food. We ordered the smokehouse nachos and while they were delivered promptly, they were barely warm with cold pieces of brisket. I have to say, I'm amazed they can find anyone to deliver orders to, since you only get a table card for them to locate you, but in our case, we were seated close to the door, so he came straight to us. The beer was okay and I had the cider mimosa. Another thing I was less excited about, but didn't take points off for, was the number of children running around the place. There is a large playscape outside and as a parent whose child was once young, I get wanting to have places that are kid friendly, but that's just not my jam anymore. Again, I don't fault the place for that, but it'd probably make me less likely to return.

reviews.author: Crystal P.
reviews.description: Great ambience and good appetizers. We had the brisket and it was delicious. Loved that they have a kid play structure and live music out back.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Nice large outdoor area.  Though not sure how I feel with kids on shared playscape (I don't have any but thinking of covid).  Tables are far apart and outdoors. Good food.  Interesting beer.  Don't bother with the Mac and cheese as it's very reminiscent of Kraft that you can make at home.  The fried chicken tenders were just ok.  The sausage sampler platter was tasty.  They had other items on the menu that looked good but we didn't have a chance to try them this go-round.  The Barbados Stout was a fine stout.  The Wee Scottish was more unique but wasn't as peaty as I would like, but was still tasty.

reviews.author: Madhavi A C.
reviews.description: The brewery had a very nice modern farmhouse feel to it. Even on a very hot day the place was shaded, cool and had plenty outdoor seating. The beer selection is good but not many other options for cocktail lovers like me. They had couple of wines and hard-seltzer options. The sandwiches are good compared to flatbreads.

reviews.author: Michael R.
