reviews.description: These folks are one of the best experiences in the Hill Country.  Their beer menu is unique.  They brew a wide variety of international styles and do them very well.  Their food is superb.  We would visit just for the food.  And they are just decent, friendly folks.  This is one of my top two breweries in the Hill Country (the other being RoughHouse in San Marcos).

reviews.author: Joy S.
reviews.description: This is our "go to" place. Great unique beers, good facilities and very good food. Still deserves five stars in my family's opinion.

reviews.author: Christie P.
reviews.description: Great place to relax. Great staff, exceptional food (I recommend the tostadas), and amazing atmosphere. Nathan made it a point to ask about our service and make sure we were happy customers. Yes we are!!! We'll be back! Thank you Nathan for going above and beyond!

reviews.author: Jenna V.
reviews.description: My best friend and I enjoyed an amazing 5 course brewer's dinner this past week. I can't say enough about how thoughtful, delicious and amazing the meal and beer pairings were. The staff is absolutely amazing and professional! The design of the space is gorgeous and reminded us of Magnolia Market. I can't wait to come back on the weekends with our families and dogs!

reviews.author: Lisa F.
reviews.description: Liked it so much Thursday we returned on Friday!  Cannot say enough about the vibe.   Everybody happy and engaged.  Was it the fabulous beer or food?  Or just the perfect setting?  Our new fav.  Thank you Fitzhugh, for adding to the hood!

reviews.author: Al G.
reviews.description: This place is amazing and is going to be our go to place to treat ourselves. The staff is amazing and the inside space is clean and spacious which is great for social distancing. I ordered the Aussie Ale and loved it. I have ordered the specials here and crab cakes and they were amazing. Everything on the food list is great. We have a 4 year old who loved the playscape. If you want a quieter setting away from the kids you can go further back on the property to enjoy your beer. The restrooms were clean and the place is dog friendly. The outdoor area also had shade and tons of seating. I personally am not a beer snob so I can't fully critique the beer but I will say that having a place like this to go to and relax with the pup and kid in tow is amazing. They have also great cider and wine to choose from. Highly recommend all around.

reviews.author: Katie L.
reviews.description: Very cute, kid and dog-friendly brewery. We went for lunch and a drink and enjoyed it. So did our two year old.

reviews.author: Shannon W.
reviews.description: This place was so cool!  We had a couple of beers and food.  The turkey club was delicious and so smoky.  Highly recommend!

name: Wright Bros Brew and Brew
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Christopher R.
reviews.description: We were debating where to go for breakfast, considered several options, many chain restaurants but wanted domething more unique and community based. Brews and Brews is all that plus great food, coffee and atmosphere. Top that off with people behind the counter who were authentically friendly and you get a neighborhood jewel. We'll stop in again whenever we find ourselves in Austin and hungry for great food, drink and fun.

reviews.author: Sara V.
reviews.description: I only eat here when I'm hungover, otherwise it's just ok.  Pro: That aioli on the breakfast sandwich deserves 5 stars all on its own.  Con: If you order a triple shot iced latte, they'll just make a cold brew with milk to save time. I almost stopped coming here after that experience until my next hangover called for a breakfast sandwich.   Do: order breakfast Don't: order coffee

reviews.author: Janelle L.
reviews.description: One of my favorite local coffee shops. I love coming here for a quick breakfast bagel and a coffee on the weekends. The staff is always really friendly and do a good job of making sure that you're taken care of!  My favorite thing to get here alongside a cold brew is breakfast bagel sandwich. They serve Rosen's Bagels, which is the closest thing you can get to an NYC bagel in Austin (not an exact replacement, but close enough).  It's definitely one of the coffee shops that you need to cross off your Austin list!

reviews.author: Kayla S.
reviews.description: Kind of obsessed with this place. I've only been for breakfast because it's BOMB.com! They have dishes for everyone; meat eaters to vegans! I have ordered 2 versions of their breakfast sandwich S.O.B. And I have to say both are delish in their own way.  Vegan SOB made with beyond breakfast sausage and a house made cashew cheese. It's just stacked with flavor. Then their original SOB you can get a few different meat options I went with sausage - there some kind of aioli, avocado and taters! Such a mess but worth it!   They have craft beers you can take to go- I love that they carry the brand Untitled art. It's a traveling craft brewery that makes incredible flavors!   Dog friendly and just a must stop spot! GO!

reviews.author: Andrea R.
reviews.description: What a cute spot. Made multiple trips here during my stay in town. The coffee was great. The flavor options, milk accommodations, outside seating, to go options all made it really inviting. Bagel with lox always a favorite and being from NJ it's a staple I usually judge pretty harshly on but was happy here during my stay in Austin. They also have cute merch, some CBD and beer items too. Local, small business. Would happily come back on my next trip.

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: Nice location, the service was amazing. I ordered the honey lavender latte, made perfectly..it was like a hug in a cup!

reviews.author: Rob B.
reviews.description: Super nice people and a great location. My coffee was good, I think this place has some hidden greatness covered in Covid shroud

reviews.author: Jennifer J.
reviews.description: Fantastic drink menu and friendly staff - we'd definitely stop back in based on the craft beer selection alone!

reviews.author: C R.
reviews.description: I visited on my last morning of vaca in downtown Austin due to craving a hearty bagel. It was easy to find from my hotel and primely located across from target on 5th street. The signage only says "brew and brew" so I was confused but soon confirmed that I was at the correct place. I know I desired the bagel with smoked salmon so I ordered it but was not impressed. The bagel was cold, flavorless and the smoked salmon was flavorless. I love a good culinary concoction but this just kissed the mary. It was pretty yet did not taste amazing. Presentation was nice however and service was good.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Typical Austin coffee and beer spot. Seating is very limited and wraps around the building leading to good people watching. Street parking is available, but limited. Cold brew was one of the better ones I've had in a long time! Beer selection is average, glad they had some local beers available.

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: I actually think I was here the time Ivan down there is talking about. He was being a dipshit about his mask (like acting like he was wearing it, but then intentionally wearing it wrong so the staff had to say something). He took a call and didn't wear it and that woman said something so he got all in a huff and walked out. It didn't seem like anyone threw him out, to me. I did kind of want to toss him myself but guys like that always have some virus. Don't want to get close.   Anyway I've been home to Texas a few times lately. A friend told me to try this place and I've gone every time I'm home. The food, beer (I don't like coffee) and staff have always been really good. Made me feel welcomed home. They do it right. Ivan does it without his mask on.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here to do some work on a Wednesday afternoon. There were a good number of people hanging out, but plenty of available seating with large tables and ample outlets available. The noise level was perfect, not so quiet that you'd be uncomfortable having a private conversation, but quiet enough that you can get work done.   Coffee drink offerings were pretty standard in terms of options and prices. They have a really wide variety of beers available, as with most spots in the area most of them are localish. They could expand a little bit on their food options, especially on their non breakfast items since they seem to lean more towards the happy hour crowd.   I went for the cold brew which tasted great- super smooth and didn't need much milk to get a nice creamy taste. Be warned it is super strong, it takes a lot for me to get a caffeine rush from coffee and this really did the trick.   Overall I think it's a great place for a date spot, to get some work done, or hit a casual happy hour. I can definitely see myself coming back here in the future

reviews.author: Isaac T.
reviews.description: I stopped by here for cold brew today - nothing too exciting about what I drank. I do like the concept of this place offering beer and coffee.

reviews.author: Sama C.
reviews.description: Very unique concept with different types of coffee and microbrew. You can have a boost of some strong pick-me-up coffee made fresh to order by the barista. You can also have a wide range of local craft beers.  This place has plenty of seating; indoor and outdoor. It has a chill flow feel to it so you can unwind, pregame or bring your laptop and do some work.

reviews.author: Sparky H.
reviews.description: While staying in eastside Austin on vacation, I made a point of visiting every independent coffee house in walking distance.  I made it to five in all.  Wright Bros. Brew + Brew was the clear winner!  They had an extensive menu, with lots of choices -- a very big factor for me.  My vanilla latte and my everything bagel were delicious.  The staff was warm and friendly.  Of course, there's no indoor service right now, but you can sit and eat outside on the patio.  And it's conveniently close to Target and Whole Foods.

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: A local biz that I've frequented many times over the years. They help to keep Austin weird as they say.  Surrounded by many new construction projects is a small coffee and brew joint nestled on the corner - you might pass it if you drive too fast - please don't!  I came in recently for breakfast and I was saddened a little as the menu had changed from my last visit. I'm normally chill about this however my wife was excited about the breakfast offerings I described only to realize they trimmed the menu down a bit.  I went 4 stars solely due to the reduced menu from the past. I just wish they did more breakfast on the weekend.  The coffee is great (FlatTrack) and beer even better I'd say. I find going over to FlatTrack gets me a little more for breakfast vs here although the venue is larger.  This isn't a diss but a request to improve is all. The mainstream is coming and I want my local to stay.

reviews.author: Ivan C.
reviews.description: The food, coffee, drinks, are great, but I was treated very poorly twice. The first incident I slightly lowered my mask so that I could use ApplePay, and the lady yelled at me to never do that again.  The second time, I sat down to have a 5 minute call with my boss, and Audrey yelled at me that I had to leave if I wasn't going to order anything. I was literally going to order something as soon as my call was over, but she kicked me out.   TERRIBLE customer service. As someone who comes in every day and lives right across the street, I will never be coming back.

reviews.author: Anthony L.
reviews.description: Honestly this was one of the better pulled shots of espresso that I have had in a while. It was from Burundi. It was lovely! Clean, fruity, acidic. Perfect sip for sitting outside and people watching  I didn't get any pictures of the espresso or store itself.   It is across the street from Target and Whole Foods. What an enjoyable experience! The staff was super helpful and willing to answer all my questions about their beans!

reviews.author: Catherine H.
reviews.description: My favorite coffee shop in Austin.  The baristas are fab, they know me by name and are always happy and friendly.  The coffee is delish and the breakfast SOB sandwich is excellent.  If in the neighborhood, just go.  You'll love it, too!

reviews.author: Farrah A.
reviews.description: Deeeelicious coffee, cold beers, big ass breakfast bagel sandwiches, fast wifi, plenty of seating and cuuuute baristas. What else could any remote employee ask for?  Wright Bros BandB is in a great East Austin location. People are constantly filtering in and out, ordering coffee, cold pressed juices, and beer. I like seeing people drink beer at 11am on a Thursday morning. Makes me wonder what they do for a livin'.   The breakfast bagels are filling, and apparently the breakfast tacos sell out fast. My bagel had way too much dried rosemary on it, but that seems to be a popular bagel trend, so I guess I gotta deal with it or scrape it off (which I did).

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: Holy moly!! This place truly has some of the best ciders!! I've never really been a cider person until I came here. My friend and I found this place on a whim and decided to try out this cider bar. We both got the Cider Flights and tried out their Fried Pickles and Smoked Chicken Wings.  Cider Flights: The ciders here totally converted me into a cider drinker. The flight comes with your choosing of 4 different flavors. We chose: pineapple, black cherry, texas honey, cranberry, blood orange, original, and rose.   Fried Pickles: Comes with a side of ranch. Nice and crunchy and plenty to share.  Smoked Chicken Wings: I'm still not sure if I like these are not. I'd say they are like a 3/5...or maybe even a 2.5/5. It was a little more charred then I liked. Also the sauce that came on top of the wings (some sort of celery mixture) was just "okay". I wish we would have ordered their pizza because the table next to us ordered one and it looked really good.   Anyhoo, the staff here was superb, the drinks were fire, and the music was rockin! Enough to make me want to go back for more.

reviews.author: Kristen K.
reviews.description: I went to Austin Eastciders after spending the hot day at Barton Springs in the middle of August. It's on the main road leading to Barton Springs, so it was just a quick drive over. There's a parking lot in the back that they validate and there was plenty of spots back there.  There was a lot of outdoor and indoor seating at this spot. I liked the lookof the whole restaurant. It was pretty fun and playful, but also clean and aesthetic. We ended up sitting inside at a normal table though. There was also some bar seating inside and a little cafe area for the mornings.   Service was okay, getting drinks was fast but food was a little slower. We went in the afternoon, so it wasn't too busy because it was between lunch and dinner hours. We ended up just ordering some drinks and appetizers since we weren't too hungry.   Drinks:  I split a cider flight with my girlfriend where you get to choose any 4 flavors they have. It was fun to try a couple of flavors since we aren't big drinkers, but my girlfriend likes ciders. We tried Texas honey cider, blackberry, blood orange and peach.   Appetizers: - Truffle Fries - The fries were really good! We shamefully devoured them pretty quickly.  - Baked Goat Cheese - cider candied figs, chili smoked local honey, candied pecans, served with sliced and toasted Easy Tiger baguette. The goat cheese dip was also a big hit. I felt like it was kind of small though and we were wishing for more. A good combo of sweet, crunchy and savory.   Overall, fun little spot where you can try a couple ciders and eat a snack or a whole meal. Good location near Barton Springs, so it seems like it would be pretty popular in the summer.

reviews.author: Ralph T.
reviews.description: Stopped by here for the first time today after walking our pup around the Zilker area.  The patio here is dog-friendly so that was a big win in our book!    The patio is really clean, well shaded, and has a lot of fans.  It was the perfect setting for a quick Sunday lunch.  Living in Austin for many years I'm of course familiar with Austin Eastciders but this was my first time dining at their new restaurant.  The service was great and the overall atmosphere was very lowkey.  We came during brunch hours so there were both breakfast and lunch items available.  The menu is pretty standard with your typical American patio food.  Think burgers/sandwiches/salads/pizza.  I ordered the burger which was honestly way better than I expected.  I would certainly return and have another.  My partner ordered the breakfast on a bun which he also enjoyed.  Of course we had a couple of ciders as well.  They have a rotating seasonal frozen drink which we also tried.  Pineapple passion fruit was the flavor of the season!   The staff was attentive and even brought a bowl of ice water for our pup.    A couple of areas for improvement: getting seated was a little awkward.  All their signs say please wait to be seated.  After standing and waiting for about 5 mins we finally went to find a staff member who told us it was open seating.  Also, once we finished our meal it took nearly 20 mins to get the check.  Not a big deal bc we were not in a rush, but could certainly be annoying under different circumstances.    I wouldn't say I'd go out of my way to come here, but if you're in the area it is definitely one of the best options on the Barton Springs Rd strip near Zilker!

reviews.author: Ruby S.
reviews.description: Stopped by on our way to the airport! The outside has tons of seating and FREE PARKING! Inside has super cute wallpaper even in the bathroom. And they have information about the history and process they use. We got a flight and some lunch. We really enjoyed all the ciders in the flight - the watermelon and blood orange were favorites! The food was impressive tbh. It paired well with the ciders and wasn't super greasy like bar food can be. When I saw that the burger had 2 patties, I thought they were smash patties, I didn't expect them to be like a normal burger size! Burger was cooked great and I upgraded to fries which hit the spot. My husband got the quesadilla and highly reccomend adding brisket!! Service was great and attentive. Would definitely suggest stopping by if you're in town!

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: I've recently discovered this Barton Springs eatery, and my love for cider! Austin Eastciders has some of the BEST cider. The atmosphere is super groovy. Everything is bright and FUN! Plenty of indoor, bar, and outdoor seating. Pet and live music friendly.  As for the food it's delicious. I love the fried pickles and pizza. The staff is always friendly and helpful. Sometimes it's hard picking my cider flavor. Parking is easily accessible in the the parking garage located directly behind the restaurant. You ask your server or bartender to validate your parking, and they give you a ticket to scan with your ticket for complimentary parking. Big PLUS.

reviews.author: Alexia G.
reviews.description: Five stars for just drinks. We didn't order food. Service here is friendly and hospitable.  We had the pineapple cider and the blood orange. Both exceptional. Not too sweet as I am but a huge cider person. With that being said, one the best ciders I've had.   The misters on a very hot day are an added plus. Love the 2000 whatever songs they bring me back to my childhood and teen years. Added bonus.   In the front they have cute swings for the bar area. On the menu you can see pizzas - some say to order well done for crispy. I can't comment on this. They are also known for their baked Brie. Very relaxing place near a lot of key places in austin. Give it a try!

reviews.author: Aoibhistin C.
reviews.description: Deeply mediocre food that seems to inhabit the majority of restaurants these days. Fancy names like truffle fries that are long on expectations and short on delivery.  Keep it simple and pull it off. TheCider is fine. Smells bad (fart adjacent smells) from brewery on site.

reviews.author: Tracey Z.
reviews.description: An Austin classic!  Austin Eastciders is basically at every bar around the city, I'm glad I finally got to visit the flagship store.  Great vibe, very clean, very fun and fresh!  The frozen watermelon cocktail is delicious but STRONG. Let me warn you, you can't really taste the bourbon in there so be careful! But if you go on Tuesday's they are only $5.  The flight is a great way to sample a bunch of ciders! My personal favorites are the Texas Honey and Blood Orange. The honey is sweet and the orange has a delicious orange subtly to it!   The Soco pizza is a great deal if you are going for happy hour - 50% off! Crunchy crust, great way to soak up the alcohol.  Worth a visit for every local and visitor alike!

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: This place has such a fun vibe and their food and drink is excellent! It's definitely a trendy new Austin spot and fits right in to the Barton Springs area. I'm not usually a cider drinker but dang, these are delicious!  My Order: - Traditional Cider - Smooth and not at all overpowering tart. - Pineapple Cider - I'm hoping to find cans of these in stores because it was like a tropical escape in a glass! - Baked Goat Cheese - If y'all know me, you know I MUST order the cheese dish and oh.my.gosh it was worth it! Came piping hot and we scraped the bowl! - Hippie Hollow Pizza - This pizza is super delicious and stuck with our goat cheese theme. It has a thin crust and filled with veggies and cheese on top. Definitely would order again! - Charred Broccolini - Usually broccoli doesn't knock my socks off but this was so freaking good! The sauce pairing was seriously delicious. 10/10 would order again!  Pro-Tip: Have them validate your parking because mine would have been $29 but through validation it was free!  Get over to Austin Eastciders! Might be best to try it on a week night when it is not so chaotic but you won't regret it!

reviews.author: Kerri M.
reviews.description: Love the outdoor area here! They have cute lights, patio seating, fans for those hot summer days, and live music, plus they are very dog friendly! The prices here are very affordable and the atmosphere is laid back. Parking on Barton Springs can be tricky, but they provide a QR code for a few free hours in the garage on your receipt. So thankful for this!  I've tried the drag and lady bird pizzas and both were great! When it comes to the ciders, a lot of the flavored ones are pretty sweet, so I like to just stick to the original.   Overall, I had a great time and will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Mary Ann G.
reviews.description: Love this beer! Tap room had a cool vibe. Lots of ciders and cocktails to choose fun. Had the cheese dip, it was good. Service a little slow, but still friendly and knowledgeable. Had a chill afternoon. Gave us some great recommendations

reviews.author: Anna Q.
reviews.description: My first time having hard cider and alcohol in 1.5 years (breaking pandemic sobriety- anyone else?) and Austin Eastciders didn't disappoint! I've been seeing these offered in multiple restaurants and just had to visit their brick and mortar location. We got a flight of 4 and a frozen cucumber melon cider (on their summer menu). I loved the Texas Honey and Peach Seltzer, and would recommend those for anyone! The honey goes down so smooth and pairs perfectly with the slightly bitter cider. The frozen cucumber melon tasted a bit like green juice and the melon cider was a bit underwhelming (could barely taste the melon at all) so I would stay away from those unless you really like your green juice/vegetables.   Outdoor seating was perfect in the summer- they had fans on for the heat and was a great place to kickback and relax with a friend. Parking in the garage is free (up to 4 hours) with a purchase, and you can easily redeem your ticket on your receipt when exiting the garage. The atmosphere was very Austin and laid back/chill, service was friendly, and I will return again for another round!

reviews.author: Anh N.
reviews.description: Great spot to grab a drink on their covered patio on a nice day! Came on a Sunday evening and they weren't  packed. All your fave ciders are there, cocktails, and wine selections if cider isn't your thing.  Great pizza! And definitely try their skillet cookie a la mode! Parking ramp in back is free with their validation.

reviews.author: Porschea W.
reviews.description: 10/10. Just started coming here, today was my second time and I actually love it here. The ciders, speaks for themselves. So freaking good. I've had the Pineapple and the Spiced Peach (which is currently the top seller), and both are really amazing. Pineapple was in the can last time I came, and the Spiced Peach was draft - I prefer the draft. We came late during brunch, about 20 minutes before it ended (brunch ends at 2PM) and it wasn't too busy. The truffle parm fries are good, but that quesadilla - WHEW! As you can tell in the photos, it's DELICIOUS! They only have one meat in the quesadilla, which is brisket. So worth it though! Plenty of seating, inside and outside. Also, if you park in the garage, make sure to get a receipt so the parking becomes free. But, on Sunday's parking is already free! Not to mention, they play GREAT music, and a mix of music. I literally jammed every song lol. This place is really top tier, and is now my go to spot to come hang out (either solo or with friends) and drink great ciders. Also, very dog friendly. Definitely recommend! Definitely.

reviews.author: Melanie C.
reviews.description: Went to this location for brunch. The brunch dishes were just fine. But the ciders were pretty good! Would probably just come here for a snack and a drink with a friend some time instead.  Texas honey cider - Just the perfect hint of sweetness with a lovely flavor.  Watermelon cider - On the sweet side, but extremely flavorful, like a sour candy!

reviews.author: Makenna E.
reviews.description: The ciders were delicious, and I got the baked goat cheese appetizer, and it was incredible! My only complaint is that they definitely don't give enough bread to finish the cheese. I would have eaten it with a spoon if I wasn't in public.

reviews.author: Jessica G.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out! Lots of indoor and outdoor seating. Ciders and seltzers were pretty good! Didn't get to try much of their food, just the queso which was pretty standard. The staff were very friendly and made some great suggestions. Bonus points for being dog friendly and a free parking garage!

reviews.author: Kathleen M.
reviews.description: I love the cider and the gluten free burgers, but the pizza here is such a sad excuse for pizza.   My sister and I recently came by for dinner. This is a busy location, so plan for a bit of a wait depending on when you stop by for food/drinks. I've been both outside and inside before and there is a cool bar setup with swinging chairs on the street-side of the building which are fun to sit in for your meal or while you're waiting for a table.  The cider and seltzer's are absolutely delicious and they even have boozy ice-cream (the chocolate orange is divine!), but stay away from the pizza. I've tried a gluten free pizza (the one with mushrooms) and my sister has tried the regular margherita pizza - both were flavorless with not enough sauce or cheese and just overall disappointing to eat. I've had better from fast-food pizza locations before, if I'm being entirely honest. My sister also had the cookie with ice cream and said it was decent but nothing to write home about.  I do highly recommend the burgers as the gluten free burger I ate was incredibly delicious, in addition to the drinks, and boozy ice cream. All in all, I recommend this place and most of what it offers, but don't try to order a pizza.   The other thing I would like to mention was the lack of service. There was literally no one around for the last half of the meal and we waited for drinks, the check, etc. Service was great for the first half and then servers switched and the second server was practically non-existent. Very frustrating.

reviews.author: Heather F.
reviews.description: Awesome selection, I got a flight of 4 for 12 bucks and they were all delicious! (Got the Imperial, Blackberry, Texas honey, and Rosé) Also got a banana split which was delicious! Excellent service as well!

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: All's well. The waiters were very nice and wore masks. We sat out on the covered patio, so we felt fairly safe and spaced apart from other tables. The Capital pizza was delicious. My favorite drink was the Frozen Ginger Sour with Eastcider infused apple bourbon with ginger and lemon. Not too sweet.

name: The Beer Plant
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Michelle B.
reviews.description: Great plant based food in the heart of Austin. Versatility and creativity in the menu with an array of beverages, including zero Proof and cocktails.  Would highly recommend and when back in town will definitely return.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Awesome restaurant! We came here for my birthday and it was great. We loved the buffalo cauliflower. Chocolate cake was great. I enjoyed the chicken and gravy dish, but the seitan was slightly too salty and chewy. If the seitan was a bit better, easily 5 stars.  Drinks were delicious - definitely try the cocktails.

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: Read a bunch of restaurant reviews on Yelp before deciding on this place. There are so many great eats in Austin and this one is definitely worth writing about.   I went in on a Sunday evening around 8:45pm. There was hardly anyone inside so I decided to eat at the bar. The bartender (Laura Lee!) helped me dwindle down my options. I had read about the tomato and nectarine salad, but was worried that it would have a mustard flavor in it. She assured me that there wasn't and admitted that she, too, wasn't a mustard fan. SO glad I ordered it! It was such a perfect balance of flavors and I finished the entire thing.   Next up - should I get the eggplant parm or the "crab" cakes. She thought about it and says "go with the crab cakes." Holy moly!!  These were INCREDIBLE! So flavorful and the sauce that came with it - just perfection! Highly recommend!!  Check this place out if you want something a little away from 6th street. It's just a few minutes away and so, so worth it. :)

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: Third visit to this upscale plant-based restaurant and were not let down. Recommend making a reservation especially if you want indoor seating. We enjoy the dimmed ambience, but sometimes large parties do make it loud inside. Our favorite starter: the Buffalo cauliflower with blue cheese. Favorite entree: the spicy "chicken" sandwich with oyster mushroom (nice that it isn't cauliflower). Not a huge fan of their Mac and cheese or loaded fries. On our most recent trip, we tried The 'burger' which was delicious especially if you like arugula. They serve upscale cocktails, beer, and wine. Pricing is pretty fair: $6-$12 for a drink and $13-$20 for an entree. Huge bonus: parking has never been an issue!!!

reviews.author: Katie G.
reviews.description: I had been here once before, right when they opened, and was less than impressed. However, I'm so glad we gave them another chance!!! Portions are very generous and we were happily stuffed. The cauliflower and Brussels sprouts appetizers are amazing. We split the kimchi grilled cheese and I crave it now! The cocktails were also great. A lot of people mention its pricy, but we really didn't think so compared to other restaurants in austin and for the portion size. We'll be back soon!

reviews.author: Allison C.
reviews.description: I went on a weekend for dinner and I can definitely understand why it was packed. I ordered the burger with loaded fries and was impressed with the flavors in both. I also tried a lot of the shareable appetizers such as the Buffalo cauliflower wings and those are also worth a try. The cocktails are also very creative. I loved the Nightwing (pictured below) which visually is very cool due to the activated charcoal.

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: The food was average. The seasoning and flavor was good but I was expecting more based on the reviews. Service was pretty slow. Atmosphere is nice inside.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: This place is pretty good for all vegan options. The food was flavorful and the service was good. We ordered the Nashville hot chicken sandwich and the hill country chicken and gravy. There was a lot of breading on both "chicken" dishes which was a bit much but the flavor was pretty good overall. The mac n cheese was a little bland, but that was the first vegan Mac n cheese I've had. We ordered the loaded fries as an app. Those were my favorite of everything we ordered. This is a pretty loud restaurant, but isn't always a bad thing if you get seated next to the right guests! Overall, I recommend at least trying this place out! There's an extensive drink menu, so it would probably be good for happy hour!

reviews.author: Swati G.
reviews.description: This may be my favorite vegan restaurant in Austin. The cocktails and food are great, moderately priced, and the ambiance is just intimate enough to enjoy your meal with your group without feeling too pretentious. Even if you don't have any dietary restrictions, I'd recommend trying this place out and enjoying an evening in this quiet neighborhood. No reservations required either

reviews.author: Carrie M.
reviews.description: Had my first vegan restaurant experience here for my friend's birthday. We had the loaded fries and sriracha-glazed brussels sprouts for appetizers. The brussels sprouts were SO good. I was very surprised because I usually do not find brussels sprouts particularly appetizing. I had the Hill Country "chicken" and gravy. The fake chicken was really good, and it definitely didn't taste like chicken but like something close enough. The potatoes and gravy tasted weird. The Beer Plant curry had a strange taste. They had a lot of beers on tap, and we sampled around 10. The ciders were decent. I did not enjoy the "when doves cry" cocktail because it was bitter, but everyone else liked it. The atmosphere inside was really nice.

reviews.author: Tracey Z.
reviews.description: A really fun concept. I love that everything here is vegan so I don't have to worry!   Starting off with the Sriracha Brussels - very tasty. I wish there was more glaze on it though and that it packed more spice. It's pretty mild but the sprouts were still quite tasty. The Carolina was a very interesting sandwich. I was expecting them to use jackfruit in a pulled pork sandwich but they used banana blossom instead. The flavor was there especially with the bbq sauce but the texture was definitely weird.  My favorite from this place is the kimchi grilled cheese! Being no dairy I have not had a grilled cheese in AGES and it was definitely something I really craved. This grilled cheese hit the spot. I love that they added kimchi and pear to give it more depth. The kimchi was pretty overpowering though. But overall the sandwich was so delicious.  Great food, slightly pricey.

reviews.author: Claire G.
reviews.description: Great spot- friendly, cozy atmosphere with a really outstanding staff and tasty vegan food. Our server went out of her way to bring us samples of the sauces for our food so we could choose our favorite (and they were so good!) The burger and the heart of palm "crab" crakes were delicious, but our favorite was the seasonal AMAZING tomato peach hazelnut salad.

reviews.author: Blake I.
reviews.description: First visit so here are the parts experienced; Seating:   There are indoor seating options and some options in the breezeway.  Not quite outdoor but it did provide fresh, moving, outside air which made me feel more comfortable eating there. I can see this seating as advantageous during rainy weather  where you could eat "outside" and remain dry.   The food: looking at the other plates, I want to go back to taste what I saw. I ordered the chicken plate. Everything on the plate was well seasoned.  What I would suggest is if you like gravy ask for extra. I didn't have enough for both the potatoes and the chicken.  The chicken was super crispy, you definitely need the heavy duty knife that comes with it. It was great!  Would return for a meal to try other options.

reviews.author: Mansi D.
reviews.description: Some of the best vegan food I have ever had. I am not normally a fan of fake meat or vegan cheese, but this place did it perfectly! Came here on a Saturday for brunch and was really pleased with the service. We got the pimento cheese dip as an appetizer, and dare I say it was better than real pimento cheese! We also got the honey butter chicken sandwich, carrot lox, and stuffed french toast. All were delicious! I will be back to try the dinner menu.

reviews.author: Prasiddha H.
reviews.description: My best friend whose vegan was raving about this place since I landed in Austin and I knew I had to give this place a shot! We came by a few days before and unfortunately this place was packed so I decided to swing by before heading back to Cali. We ended up going for brunch and luckily I was able to call and snag a last reservation. Not gonna lie I was pumped! Once we got there we were promptly seated and ended up ordering:  *Fried chicken and waffles: I loved the chicken here because it was super crispy and it had like hot chicken seasoning which was BOMB! I literally kept eating it off my friends plate. The waffles in my opinion were too crispy and not sure how to describe but they were really bland. Like I have had waffles before and I understand they are light on flavor but this literally had no flavor whatsoever. Had to eat it with chicken to taste something  *oyster and grits: me and my friend were sooooooooo excited to order this not gonna lie but this was  the most disappointing. This was grits with chili oil and grilled mushrooms with seasoning. The grits was one of the most bland things I have ever tasted and not gonna lie I couldn't eat much. Usually I still scarf food down but this just tasted like nothing. Chili oil made it too oily. My friend tried mixing it up to eat it but still flavor was lackluster. I would not order this again.  *Kolache: this was a pastry like thing with impossible meat inside and again did not LOVE. The meat inside was lukewarm - cold. I liked it overall but needed more stuffing and more warmth since its a pastry!!  Overall, the food was okay. I don't know if I would try again unless I came for dinner. Service was great though and really enjoyed the help!

reviews.author: Elissa S.
reviews.description: Fun place to grab a beer and hangout with friends the food truck has good tacos .   Cool vibe and unexpected location inside and outside seating , I liked the music

reviews.author: Laura G.
reviews.description: I made a reservation here and ended arriving late. I called and they were very understanding. The food is absolutely delicious and the environment is awesome as well. Our waiter was very nice and the food was out in a timely manner. I am so happy I got to try this place out on my visit to Austin. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: The most amazing vegan fried chicken ever!!!! I ordered the Nashville hot and crispy, Mac and cheese, I suggest you do the same. I've been obsessed with Nashville hot vegan chicken since going to Nashville and not finding any options there. It tasted like chicken. The perfect combination of crispy, fried perfectly and they shredded the mushrooms to mimic the texture of chicken. I loved that they had options that are soy and gluten free. I ordered a drink and dessert as well, everything is crafted with love here  can't wait to go back. It has limited hours.

reviews.author: Elyse M.
reviews.description: The Beer Plant was open for dine in eating and they have take out options as well.  The food here is delicious! I got the "chicken" platter which came with green beans, mashed potatoes and gravy, and 2 pieces of fried "chicken".  My goodness the flavors were amazing! The green beans had good seasoning and were uniformly cooked, each being a bit crispy. The mashed potatoes and gravy were savory and had a really good flavor profile. The fried "chicken" was a little dry and the texture was slightly different than what I've had at other places but it all worked together. Whatever seasoning they used in / in the "chicken" was phenomenal! Each bite was a burst of flavor in my mouth it was soo good.   The less great aspects of thia place are the food took a really long time to come out from when we ordered. I think it was like 40 minutes, maybe an hour? They also have a system where you put a card on the table to indicate you'd like a waiter to come over and it took 25 minutes for someone to stop by even though there were multiple staff that passed us before that point.   My friend I was eating with also didn't enjoy their gyro as much as I enjoyed the "chicken" platter. She said it was cold and ok but not super great but she liked the fries and cheesecake.  I would definitely order from here again but maybe do takeout instead of dine in.

reviews.author: Cara C.
reviews.description: Delicious food and great service. Loved the "chicken" and waffles. The mimosas were really good as well.

reviews.author: Sergio S.
reviews.description: Tasty brews provided by friendly folks (and a people-loving pup).  Josh provided wonderful recommendations on what to taste based on my likes, and some great conversation for an out-of-towner like me. I was even greeted by Roman, a large unshy black lab.  This is a place I will always come back to whenever I'm in Austin.

reviews.author: Margaret L.
reviews.description: So we've been on the road since last May and this is a place that I'm inspired to review. Great beer. Great space. Great food. Good people. As a nomad from Austin's little sister city (Asheville, NC) we give you a hearty 5 stars!

reviews.author: Jen P.
reviews.description: Beer on point, staff awesome, jalapeño cheddar pretzel...delish!!!  Brice and team have an awesome thing going on here, highly recommend swinging by and checking out their brew.  Porter and Saison were our favorites!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: We've tried to stop by a few times on weekends but it was always packed. Now I know why - this place is great! Swung by for a weekday lunch and it's almost deserted. Plenty of seating inside and out. Mutt friendly. Beer was pretty good. Not very hoppy IPAs but good nonetheless. I like places that don't have pretentious attitudes towards food when food is not their primary business. Paninis are perfect for a brewery - low fuss, easy, fast. And tasty! Had the Reuben and the turkey/pesto. Now that we know this is a midday weekday kinda place, we'll be back!

reviews.author: S J.
reviews.description: Well the sandwiches are bomb, the beer is bomb, but after a year of requesting a changing table.. speaking to the owner and him promising a changing table .. coming back multiple times and no changing table .. I'll have to just go to every other brewery that Can accomdate mother's... sorry of our neighbor booth that had to smell shit next to us but we had to change in the booth ‍

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Neat little brewery tucked away only about a block from Congress Av. Got a flight of 5 beers including the tropical haze, cider, PBB Stout, BBA Stout (11% but still very smooth and wouldn't be able to tell it's that high with how easy it is).  Enjoyed all the beers but went back for 2nds with the BBA Stout, comes in a 7oz pour due to the higher abv.  They serve a variety of diff sandwiches, we tried their Hartie Artie, basically a crispy sandwich with artichoke and tomatoes in it, real crunchy and satisfying! Whole heartedly recommend coming to check this place out yourself!!

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: Much thanks to Simon for listening to my preferences and letting me taste Call Me Sir. I liked it so much I brought some home. The parking is spacious and the bathrooms clean. Service is excellent and lots of seating inside and outside.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: COVID-19: Open! Order by calling in OR you can also order in person. I called in.  I've been here pre-pandemic and during, and I gotta say...I'm so glad they're here to grace the South Austin beer community with their presence. When I visited the first time they had just opened and their taproom was still a work in progress. They still had a good selection of board games, self-serve water and beer/cider in a dog-friendly taproom. Yes, I repeat...bring yo dawgs.  Most recently, I ordered a trio of their 32 oz crowlers. There was a deal going on, and I GOTTA SAY THE SEVEN STILLS OMG. That scotch ale was deliciously dark and creamy without being overboard. I was afraid it would be burning on the throat and too infused with that liquor aftertaste. BUT it was so deliciously decadent. It had a dark chocolate feel with a full and steady mouth feel! Deeeeelish. I hope they brew it again. Their Peak Season IPA was also SO yummy and refreshing. I just checked out their tap list and there are so many creative and interesting beers right now. SO GET ON IT Y'ALL.  Pro Tip: check out their instagram page because there are usually cool deals or posts (like one time they gave free warm pretzels to the first few customers)!

reviews.author: Neal N.
reviews.description: My new favorite brew pub,  the IPA I had yesterday was splendid. I bought a Barks for Beers... for a friend.

reviews.author: Charles W.
reviews.description: These guys, you just have to root for them.  I was here one time while in town for vacation.  If im back in Austin, im back at Nomadic.  Great people with great beer and unsuspecting great food.    Peak season is a top tier hazy IPA.  Radberry was a great sour that was sweet without being fruit juice.  I think it'd satisfy both the tart lovers and Kettle sour seekers.  I was saving my appetite for a BBQ heavyweight but after tasting my girlfriend's turkey pesto I totally regret my decision to not get food.  The whole thing was a delight.  The flavors and texture all come together to deliver one heck of a Sammy.   Definitely a destination to stop at!

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: This was a wonderful experience!  We had the sunrise get down and the stay classy beers - both great!  I had the Turkey pesto panini which was to die for!  It's on easy tiger sourdough bread which I love too!  It was hot and melty - so delicious!  The BF had sweet prosciutto panini which he loved too!  But I liked mine better!  The staff was really friendly and helpful. We're will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Kate C.
reviews.description: A wonderful local business! I am not much of a beer fan, but they were able to recommend one closer to my preferred taste and let me try some other samples as well. Dog friendly, but only a few picnic tables outside. They also have great coffee, if you go during the day it is nice and quiet! Friendly staff as well.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here to hang out with a large group on a Saturday afternoon, they have a sizable space with plenty of tables, space to stand, and games to play while you're there. There was a lively bunch of people throughout our time there, but it never got too crowded.   Their beer selection was fairly limited, but it's understandable given they're quite new to the area. The bartender was super helpful and let my friend and I sample a few of them. Being indecisive I still chose to have a flight after.   My personal favorite beer I tried was the dry hopped wheat, but the hazy IPA and the raspberry milkshake IPA also stood out! Their menu was quite IPA heavy, so hopefully they'll continue to branch out, but it does look like they rotate their menu quite often.   There's also a fantastic Korean food truck out back that I highly recommend checking out while you're here.   Overall, I think the combination of good space to hang out, tasty beer, and delicious food is well worth checking out.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: This place is great! We tried a few beers and really liked all of them! Super cute space- really open and fresh :) Definitely gonna go back to try their coffee!

reviews.author: Robert E.
reviews.description: Great selection of beers and AWESOME sandwiches. Great service. Simon is very helpful. Lots of seating and parking

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Beer. Cheers for beer! And cider. South Austin brewery location that's brightly lit inside and clean with several tables and a bar. They serve their brews in a relaxed environment. The porter was very good!  Picnic tables available outside when the weather is nice. Also has Kimchi Jon's food trailer if you want a bite.

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: Very pet-friendly-- there seemed to be dogs everywhere and they even have a bin of free dog treats. Good beer and good vibes. Indoor and outdoor seating available.

reviews.author: Sarah B.
reviews.description: Nomadic Beerworks is such a hidden gem!! Their beers are hand crafted and taste AMAZING. We were on a brewery tour and we started with a flight. Everything we tried was so mind blowing we had to stay!   The peak season and south swell beers were some of our favorites. In addition the food is a great balance between freshness and greasiness which is perfect for buzzed eats.  I will be taking beers home with me for sure!

reviews.author: Isso T.
reviews.description: Great place for beers. They have live bands When I went . The corned beef was awesome a few months ago. 3/4 to an inch of meat. But these last months, the meat is 1/4 inch . The turkey pesto sandwich is still good.  Friendly staff every time.  The Dessert menu is lacking.

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: After coming to Austin for a trip to my auto detail where I decided to go on a beer excursion. My second stop was Nomadic beerworks. They've only been around for a year and a half but brew the beers like a professional. They were extremely good and the staff knew exactly how to describe them to a discerning palette. I had a stout, golden ale, and red ale and all were phenomenal. I took a 32 ounce crowler to go and will come back anytime I am in town.

reviews.author: Puja C.
reviews.description: Love this place! Great chill vibe, awesome customer service and the beers are great! I recommend getting the meatball appetizer, it's  delicious!   There's a huge TV that's great for watching games!   If visiting during the fall/winter time, they have plenty of heaters and a tented patio area available!

reviews.author: Chelsey S.
reviews.description: Pros: Lots of parking right out front, large space inside, plenty of seating, has a food menu, nicely decorated interior, female beertender was very friendly and helpful, beer was good  Cons: one of the men behind the bar was very curt with me when I asked about a couple of the beers, did not seem interested in helping me figure out which one I wanted to try, he was more interested in talking to one of the other employees instead, also ordered the cheese bread and it was ok

reviews.author: Doug P.
reviews.description: Fun place, but small.  Don't let the arcade fool you, it's a brewery that serves pizza.  The staff are great, the beer was decent, but it wasn't very busy on a Thursday night.  We literally stopped in to check out the options and have some suds.     Worth a stop if you over on this side of town.

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: Who doesn't love the neighborhood pub?  Pizza, creative IPAs, games and patio dining... who needs more?  Well, perhaps one more Brew! Very dog friendly and totally yum!!!

reviews.author: David V.
reviews.description: Great place for pizza and beer (and/or a good bottle of wine). Yummy thin crust pizza with creative toppings.  One per very hungry person or share and get a salad (or have another beer).  Great beers that are not all IPAs.  Also awesome selection of IPAs.  Want more?  How about free video games and indoor outdoors seating.  Big screen TV to watch the game.  Come for drinks or dinner.  Great place to hang out with friends

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: A relaxing laid back atmosphere with incredibly friendly staff. Some quaint outdoor patio space that grew during covid. The brews are OK. Always can find something good here. An Austin brew scene staple. You may as well walk steps up the street to Batch if you are here. A great two step brew experience.

reviews.author: Alex C.
reviews.description: Excellent pizza and a very good beer selection. Full disclosure I play saxophone and love to go on the Jazz nights. If I lived closer I would probably go more often. There's plenty of space inside and outside. The menu is accessed  via a bar code with your phone. Ordering is at the bar and the food is delivered to your table.  People always seem happy.

reviews.author: Jen B.
reviews.description: Lots of patio seating available. Service was excellent.   Covid precautions were great. Distanced seating and masks required inside.   I had Sals Stromboli. Very tasty. Cheesy and nicely toasted.   Cheese bread was also great. On a nice fluffy focaccia with melted cheese.

reviews.author: Nathan F.
reviews.description: Great spot for beers and pizza items in a great location on manor. Plenty of spots on the patio as well as indoors. Nice selection of hazes and ales that many will like. I also enjoyed the Stromboli and the pizzas everyone ate looked delicious.

reviews.author: Megan S.
reviews.description: Great find! My boyfriend and I were walking around town and came across this place. Super good brews on tap and the pizza. My goodness. The pizza is AMAZING! Does it get any better than pizza and beer?! They have a cool arcade area as well that is free play. We had such a great time. Highly recommend this place! Staff was super friendly too. Just an overall great place and atmosphere! They're also dog friendly. :)

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: Good and beer is out of this world! This establishment also has such an amazing ambiance, and friendly staff!

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Wonderful little place. Their beer menu is really wonderful. They always have something I like. Last time I went, I came with a friend and we sat on their patio. I ordered their American IPA called Pop! Pop! - it was very good. I also decided to try their sour menu and had their Foeder Saison (Family Matters) and enjoyed it more than the IPA even. On this night, one of the bartenders had put on an old playlist they had created years ago and I swear it was perfect song after perfect song after perfect song. You get it. A place like this can easily get by without having to play wonderful, eclectic music for its patrons, but the fact that it usually does just makes it that much better. As always, be sure to tip your [incidentally very cute] bartenders. x

reviews.author: Adam G.
reviews.description: I went here with my friend because he said they have good pizza. The pizza reminded me of living in the dorms when I was in college. Sometimes I remember to think about my last and forgot what I was trying to always remember. It's too hard to order on the phone I wanna order like a big boy in your face

reviews.author: Kasy S.
reviews.description: This has become one of my favorite spots on the east side. I've gotten into the habit of stopping in after the gym for a nice relaxing couple of pints while reading a book.  On the Sunday afternoons I've been frequenting this place, the parking is ample and the space is populated but not crowded. I love the diversity of their brews and the frequency with which they change. I've been very happy with the quality and friendliness of service. I think their price-point is spot on for both the brews and the food. I've recently fallen in love with their Caesar salad. It's absolutely delicious and I love the home-made dressing. This will be one of my go-to spots for the foreseeable future and one that I look forward to sharing with my friends. I highly recommend the Bada Bing pizza (meatball) if you love cracker-thin crusts like I do.  They always have a fun variety of beer. I've recently enjoyed their Foeder style beers. They also have a nice selection of hazy IPAs right now that show good variations of the style. Again, I don't have a single favorite as their rotation of brews ensures that I find a new favorite each visit.

reviews.author: Tommy D.
reviews.description: Don't waste your time. Horrible service and they make you pay and tip when you order so there's no incentive for service. Came on a Friday evening and were forced to wait outside when there were open tables inside. Came with some friends and waited over 50 minutes for 2 strombolis and 1 pizza all of which were undersized and overcooked. I could stay at home and cook a Totino's pizza for cheaper, faster, and honestly taste better.

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: My wife and daughter brought me a pizza and a beer from this place on Father's day. They beer was great, a pilsner, and I also enjoyed the super thin crust pizza with crispy pepperoni and spicy jalapeños. I look forward to the day that I can hang out here and sample more beers and try another pie again.

reviews.author: Daniel R.
reviews.description: We just moved to the Austin area and have been hesitant to get out during a pandemic. After reading the precautions this place takes we went for it and great googly boogly am I glad.  This place is amazing. Excellent brews, amazing pizza, and awesome staff. All ordering and paying is done  online from your table. Please support this business. I recommend a pint of the Slice of Fried Gold!

reviews.author: Lauren A.
reviews.description: Came to this place the other night. First time and the food was delicious. Great Greek salad and the large was just enough for 2 people to split. Ordered a pizza and first off I love the crust. It's a thin crust that if you probably asked to have it cooked a little longer for some crispy but not too crispy crust and it would be amazing. Also ordered these Tex-mex style meatballs and they had chorizo in them which was different but satisfying. Next time I'm in Austin I'm headed back to oodwood for a Stromboli.  Service was amazing because you order everything from your phone and pay from your phone so I really don't see how someone could mess up that system lol it's not like your server is going to forget to put your order in.  It's dog friendly and I love that.  All in all I had a great first time experience and will most definitely be back.

reviews.author: Marcus M.
reviews.description: We had takeout multiple times throughout the COVID shutdown but finally stopped by to eat inside. Pizzas are great for takeout but even better fresh out of the oven. Delicious! Also got an Ethics and Standards hazy IPA that was juicy and delicious too. Definitely recommend for a group looking for delicious beers and great food.

reviews.author: Tope E.
reviews.description: I lived so close to this place for a good minute and somehow didn't know about it. Thanks to a friend celebrating her birthday there, I got to finally hang out here. Brewery, bar, and pizza joint all rolled into one. The drink options are pretty legit. I highly recommend the Yule Boi, Imperial Breakfast Porter. It's a whole mood. Not to mention the meatballs on the appetizer menu. I would say what sold this place to me is the arcade lounge area they set up. I mean, they had Pacman and Tekken on deck!! Can I live here? Anyway, please go, eat, and have fun.  P.s. the pepperoni pizza is *chef kiss*

reviews.author: Frankie T.
reviews.description: Hands down our favorite bar in Austin. Every single person who works here is friendly, badass and great at their job. Management is top tier - Chris, we're lookin at you!   We love this bar and are so glad to live so close and to have y'all in our lives.    Thanks!  Frankie and Mike

reviews.author: Devin O.
reviews.description: Friendly place. Got too many shots were given to me that night. I think.  Was a good time. But be careful in the bathrooms that thing is loud as $h!t! So don't slam anything or people will know... mwahahaha

reviews.author: Carolyn B.
reviews.description: Ok, I want to give the 3.5 stars, but I'm rounding down for the blatantly misleading name. This feels a lot more like a sports bar with some outdoor space than a "beer garden." When I think "beer garden," I picture something with more ambiance (for example plants, string lights, communal tables, music maybe). Instead, here you have a patio with many TVs blaring the game and a dark, concrete/rock picnic area. Yes they have some string lights... on the outer edges of the parking lot #doinitwrong.  That said, they have a great selection of beers and the bartenders are really friendly and helpful. We also enjoyed the food trucks out back. Soooo, if you're looking for a chill spot to catch a game with some great beer, this will fit the bill! If you're looking for a "beer garden," like for a casual date, not so good.

reviews.author: Robert V.
reviews.description: The place has a roadhouse atmosphere, most of the staff looked like they were operating a biker bar which at first made me feel a little intimidated, especially when they ignored me. The gentleman at the bar acted like whatever paperwork he was doing was more important than paying customers.  After getting my beer I walked out to the patio to find a place to sit. I was greeted by what I assume was the owner (but again the biker appearance threw me off). He was polite, welcomed me and my party and let me know that he was there if we needed any help.  The seating was comfortable and fun. There was a food truck where we ordered nachos. They were good.  After returning for my second beer I recognized that the beer was flat. I alerted the staff, they gave me another but it was still bad. I suspect the lines need to be cleaned she apologized said she would take it off my bill, I chose another beer and moved on.  Later when lying she charged me for the bad beer anyway, so confused.  Anyway, overall I was disappointed with their beer selection, and disappointed with the staff attentiveness to customers. Had they taken better care of their beer I could have looked past their other shortcomings, but you have to get the beer right if you advertise yourself as a tap house.

reviews.author: Joey R.
reviews.description: Great spot for a chill Sunday with your four legged friends! Staff was friendly and covered spaces when the sun is out!

reviews.author: Kim W.
reviews.description: Least of my fav BG's in the southside row. Staff is no where as friendly and accommodating as the guys in the other 2 spots. Patio area is fine and well covered w heaters... outside open space is small but allows those w kids to set them free. It's fine if the other two are crazy busy, which they usually are, and you just want to hang. Beer selection is  good.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: I don't live down south but boy does this place make me wish I did! Laid back, chill vibes, CHEAP beer (I don't know if it was happy hour or what, but my local hef (forgot the name, but not Live Oak) was only $4 (feel like I'm usually paying between $6-$8 for local draft hefs everywhere else), and there are TVs everywhere playing all the sporting events televised at the moment.   It's super spacious, there are wooden picnic tables everywhere for seating (covered wrap around patio and outside near the BBQ food truck), and there's also a handful of arcade-y games (not sure if they're operational at this time but they added to the backyard fun aesthetic of the place).  Nice staff, all the safety precautions accounted for, and off the beaten path cool.  Stop by just because or if you're making your way to/from Valentina's ;)

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Fun spot, great staff. Had a few buddies from Ireland in town who all said they pour a "proper" Guinness here. High praise from that crowd.   I just wish there were more food options here, that would get me there more regularly.

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: Honestly this is my favorite spot to meet with friends. The bartenders are very good at getting customers their drinks as soon as possible. I've watched a few pay-per-view fights here and it is always a good time.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Swung by on a warm Sunday afternoon. Apparently Raider Nation has found a So Austin home. Plenty of picnic tables under cover and outback. TVs everywhere with all the games on. Full bar with nice happy hour prices. Friendly staff and BBQ from the food truck was pretty good. Dog friendly.

reviews.author: Brenda G.
reviews.description: The SABG is an Austin gem!  My fiancé and I live less than a mile from this place and love coming here to unwind.  It's so refreshing to get a cocktail for less than $16 in this city!  The vibe is also so laid back.  We've never had issues finding parking but on occasion have walked or rideshared here to be safe.  We also thoroughly enjoyed the bbq food truck that is here last time we stopped by.  Additionally everyone we've seen on the property has been safe and masked which we really appreciate.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: This review is mostly for the food. As of June 2020 the food truck on site is HBQ bbq which doesn't seem to have its own Yelp page - which is a serious problem because it needs some serious love! You know the standards for bbq are high in this town, and HBQ holds its own very well for being virtually unknown. My favorite part of a bbq meal isn't actually the meat, it's the sides, so I was excited to see the selection! I ordered a little of everything (well, not everything, but about half the menu... enough that the cook asked if it were for one or two people when he saw a tiny girl come to pick up all of it!) I ordered what I thought would be a chicken salad sandwich, but maybe I ordered wrong or maybe their idea of "chicken salad" is different than mine, because what I got was a typical chicken sandwich - sliced chicken, slaw and what seemed to be mild hot sauce on a hearty roll. Despite the initial disappointment, it wasn't too bad for a chicken sandwich. It was huge! A good deal for the price. However, I didn't want to fill up on it, so I was glad when my friend's son expressed interest in the other half of it. More room for the sides! The hatch creamed corn was amazing - other friends raved about it too. It had a bit of a kick after a few bites, but nothing a spice wimp like myself couldn't handle. The mac and cheese was billed as "sriracha mac and cheese" but was not spicy. It was average in a good way, slightly on the not-so-cheesy end, that would be a disappointment to have alone as a meal, but definitely enjoyable as a side dish. The cucumber salad was surprisingly good. I didn't expect much. Who gets excited about cucumbers? I ordered it out of curiosity and so I could feel good about eating some token vegetables. It turned out to be a real sleeper hit! It was a bit like eating pickles, toned-down enough that I could eat a whole cup of them without being overpowered by brine. When they loaded the "loaded potato salad" they weren't messing around! It had a lot of cheddar cheese and bacon, and some green onion. Apparently they rotate their pie selection, and this time they had peanut butter ice box pie. The cook asked how much whipped cream I wanted on it and I told him not to hold back! It was obviously delicious. Obviously. You're probably wondering about the meats, because this is a bbq truck. I was with a large group, so I got to hear everyone's review of just about everything on the menu, and everyone was impressed. I know they tried brisket, pulled pork, ribs, mac and cheese loaded with meat and queso, and queso as a dip. All servings were a pretty decent size for their price. The queso was the only unusual thing - it was more like movie-theatre nacho cheese that most Texans wouldn't call queso. However, apparently once it was mixed with brisket, it was good, and I saw several servings of it get finished off.  Like I said, I was with a big group, and the venue accommodated is well.  Drinks seemed satisfactory. (I only had water.) I think I heard live music coming from inside. Kids enjoyed the small playground. (And to tell, the truth, at the end of the night, I went and climbed on it too.) Picnic tables, shade coverings, parking bathrooms and all those important amenities were good. I wish this place was closer in to town, but if it were, that might ruin what they've got going. Despite the long drive south, I'll be likely to return! Update: I checked their menu and they have two chicken sandwiches. It looks like I ordered the wrong one. No wonder I was disappointed, but that's good news for the rest of y'all to know that their chicken sandwich is a decent take on a typical chicken sandwich. But I'm still craving a good chicken salad sandwich...

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: We tried this place a while back and we probably won't return as their tequila and vodka options aren't that great. We each had one drink and left. Way too many smokers and even though we sat outside, we left smelling like a cigar shop.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Good service, that's about it.  Shitty management.  Sat at a table for 3 hours worth of drinks and food, then a young group of kids in Halloween costumes came in, slapped a "Reserved" piece of paper on our table and management told us we had to move.  Shipping container restrooms reeked.  Food sucks.  Won't be back.  Much better options.  in South ATX.

reviews.author: Allie T.
reviews.description: The new bartender Ralph is AMAZING super attentive and makes stiff drinks! Love this place will be back!

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Went to the S Austin Beer Garden just on a whim, and was pleasantly surprised. It was a nice chill environment for those living on this side of town. The majority of the building has a patio area, so it's a perfect place to grab a beer after work, on the weekend or even mid day even during Covid. The bartenders are super friendly and helpful. Definitely check them out.

reviews.author: Sandi G.
reviews.description: I came here to watch UFC 248 with my friends and had a great time.  It was rather cold that day but we opted to sit outside so we can have prime view to the TV screen.  They brought out heaters for the outdoor seating so there was some warmth to be had.  The drinks were a bit on the expensive side but they're showing the fight with no cover so it was worth it.  What I really enjoyed was the food trucks out back.  The food was amazing!  I had the BBQ plate and the cream corn and mac and cheese were so delicious!!!  The BBQ itself was great of course.  The atmosphere was really fun and I definitely would come back to watch the next UFC fight.

reviews.author: Rosa F.
reviews.description: Visited for a couple of rounds, and we're glad we did.  It delivers in all the watering hole fronts. Their frozen / machine premix drinks were refreshing.  Their Mexican Martini was a bit tart, but we enjoyed it. Lots of places to sit outside in the shade, and out by the sun (by the food trucks).

reviews.author: Joe Q Pubic F.
reviews.description: First visit... Disappointed... rude manager   Men's bathroom?   The NY Subway smells like roses in comparison....  First and last visit...  Don't like giving poor reviews, but this one is necessary...  Needs improvement

reviews.author: Nichole M.
reviews.description: I love this place! Cool vibe, amazing Mac and cheese, ice cold drinks. I wish I lived closer but I'd be in trouble if I did because I'd be a regular! Lol

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: You can't get any better than this place...and My Goodness...if I knew TBC was so close to my place I would have been here a long time ago! We were greeted with the biggest smile by Megan and she was super sweet! My fiancé started with the Raspberry K9 Lager and he said it was good...a little too fruity for him. Then he had the 9 Banded Whiskey Stout which he says was "Phenomenal!" He absolutely loved it. I had the Slushee of the Day which was like a strawberry slushee and soooo good!! We had our 2 year with us and Miguel, the other bartender, came and brought him like 6 brand new car toys to play with!! That was just the sweetest thing to me and my little one had an absolute blast!!! Beautiful bar, very clean and the best staff! We had an amazing time and will certainly be back.

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: Happy to see businesses supporting PRIDE. Texas Beer Co opened their doors and their hearts to the community. Their IPA is crisp and refreshing, glad they had a non beer alternative (frose), and the bbq was super moist. I visited right as the mayor of Taylor addressed the crowd, speaking in support of PRIDE. Texas Beer Co feels like they really care about their community.

reviews.author: Chelsea J.
reviews.description: Great beer and great company. Many choices of local beer from Taylor and Austin. They also have a good wine selection. Not sure when they have live music, but will definitely be back to check it out!

reviews.author: John N.
reviews.description: This place had a great vibe on a Friday night. Good crowd of locals watching a street musician from the patio. Sipping on some craft beer and enjoying the hospitality from the husband/wife team behind TBC put an exclamation point on our visit to Texas.

reviews.author: Lisa L.
reviews.description: Everything I wanted it to be. Nice Informative guy at the taps-not pushy or a know it all.  They have an amazing visiting tap. There was even a brewery I hadn't heard of. I ended up getting one from Southern Heights I'd never had before, but will be on the lookout for. The tables were clean and distanced. Everyone standing had on masks(CORRECTLY). The Women's bathroom was also clean and easy to access in my walker. (Gold star) We were driving back to College Station-or else I would have stayed longer. I'll be back!!  **it warmed my heart to see the coats and goodies that were there for those who needed them. (I wish I had something to donate.) I love how beer people help take care of their community**

reviews.author: Kent R.
reviews.description: Recently visited Texas Beer Co on a Saturday during their Crawfish Boil. We didn't actually do the crawfish thing but were attracked here by some online advertising we saw.  We were super impressed with how fun our visit was and the service was prompt and kind. I had one of their blonde beers on tap. I am not a huge beer drinker, but it was cold, light and tasty. My wife had a Shiner on tap. Taylor was a quaint little town to spend an afternoon. One of the owners, Amy, stopped to welcome us which was super nice as it was clear they were busy. Several folks told us the BBQ was good so we plan to return soon. All and in all a very postive down home experience. Well done!

reviews.author: Kim W.
reviews.description: Bartender's are awesome (especially Jennifer! You da best), beer selection is on point, atmosphere is welcoming and chill, one of my favorite bars in central Texas!

reviews.author: Sally W.
reviews.description: The beer is amazing but Miguel was so cold and unwelcoming. I don't need my ass kissed but when I'm being served and ask for suggestions and all you do is shrug your shoulders and offer nothing that's a HUGE turnoff. I've been bragging about this place to my boyfriend and begging him to take a motorcycle ride out here with me (I live in the Georgetown area) but I'd rather go somewhere else.  I get my hair done next door and slip over for a beer while my color sits. I'd rather drink water than be treated like crap again.

reviews.author: Chucky H.
reviews.description: Beer was good. Service was questionable. Food was bad.  I had a flight of four different Texas Beer Company beers and they were all okay but to be honest they tasted like beer you can get anywhere these days. I wouldn't say that I'm in a hurry to get back and try more.  Both the bartender and the server gave confusing and unnecessary explanations regarding the food. I didn't inquire where it was cooked, but they both took time to explain something about a "central kitchen" that is next door that serves a few nearby establishments? Thanks for the information...I guess. I ordered a pizza but was then asked if I had a back-up choice, so I ordered a different pizza. It was one of the worst pizzas I've ever had, and I am not picky at all about pizza.  Glad I stopped by to check it out, but probably wouldn't go back.

reviews.author: Bryan D.
reviews.description: These guys hosted our State Firefighters Pension and Relief annual meeting dinner.  They were amazing. We brought in Millers BBQ from Belton and Texas Beer Co took care of all of us.  Stellar service, beverages and support for our organization.  Great place. Great product. Great people.  Thank you and we'll be back!

reviews.author: Rigo G.
reviews.description: Stopped by on a Sunday afternoon. Miguel (our bartender) was awesome as was the beer. They have their own brews as well as a great selection of other drafts. Great place to listen to music or just hang out and have a few drinks...

reviews.author: Marie M.
reviews.description: Solid beer!  This is my second visit and I've been pleased both times.  First visit I had a nice Amber.  This visit I had Oktaylorfest and it was a great Octoberfest-style beer.  They serve decent pizza (from a local partner) if you're hungry.  Friendly staff in this nice open space in downtown Taylor.  Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Davud C.
reviews.description: why have a brewing company? why work at a brewing.company? especially if you aren't interested in people and don't want to talk about the beer? the guy working the counter is rude, likes eyerolling when you ask about the different beers, and looks exasperatedly at the sky when you ask for a suggestion. third time here and the one bartender is consistently the reason why TBC is my least favorite place to drink in town. maybe the owners think it's cute or cool to have one jerk guy, but I'm pretty sure most customers don't like it, and I certainly think it's a poor business choice. I'll come here if I have to show visiting friends the bottom of the service barrel. don't be such a d*ck

reviews.author: Douglas M.
reviews.description: Red is okay. Going to get very competitive with Granger Brewing Company and now the Loose Screw taproom online.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: 2nd visit here, confirmed our first impression - great little brewery, well worth a trip to check out for beer nerds.
