All the brews we've tried are excellent, and my frau really likes their IPA - which is saying a lot, since she is very picky about her hop fix.   Service is fast and friendly, and everything in the place is well kept up. Davis BBQ has a little set up at the end of the bar, so you can also get some quality BBQ with your pint if you feel a little peckish.   Picnic table seating, aside from the bar seats, and kid and dog friendly.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: We enjoyed our evening at the Texas Beer Company.  A band was playing and the place was full of people having a great time.  The Root Beer is tasty.   The staff is very friendly and quick to serve.  I would recommend visiting the Texas Beer Company.

reviews.author: Yum Diddly D.
reviews.description: Hi Max!  I am happy to have met you this wonderful Wednesday.  You are a true brewmiester! Danka!   I started out with a flight, but the house beer had me coming back for a full pint.   I love the decor, and for anyone looking for a "lounge" to quietly gossip in- this ain't it.   This place is cool, loud, and with a live band it should be awesome!!!  I will have to come back when you guys have live music, because that would be the icing on the cake.  Enjoy the drive out there from ATX, and be nice to the staff- they are good people and friendly if you aren't an asshat to them.  Tip well and carry on!  Again, thanks Max for your skills!

reviews.author: Joe R.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out with friends! The atmosphere is very friendly and the owners are good people! The beer is great! Nice to support locally owned and operated businesses!

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: Great selection of Austin and Texas beers! They also have some great selections of their own that they are producing. Lots of good swag available- hats, tshirts, koozies, etc. Neat old building repurposed in downtown Taylor. Cant wait to go back now that they are open!

reviews.author: Marcus R.
reviews.description: My wife and I came over here with our neighbors who were from this area. We really enjoyed our time here. The beer was great, but needed more of a variety in my opinion. They do offer wine for you wine drinkers out there. The noise level is pretty loud with the way the facility is designed inside. Plenty of seating inside and outside. We enjoyed our time sitting outside.  The staff attended to our needs very well and made sure we had our drinks full when ready. Parking is in the street and within walking distance.

name: Oz. Tap House
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: VP Membership H.
reviews.description: Excellent beverages, food and service! We love this place! The staff is so helpful, always going above and beyond. If you haven't been, get up and go! You can thank me later

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: Oz. Taphouse (pronounced Ounce) is my most favorite neighborhood place to go for a quick bite, a variety of drinks, a place for my kids to play, and the most friendly service. They have a shuffleboard and foosball table inside, a playground and outdoor games like corn hole and hook and ring toss outside, AND live music on Wednesday nights.  We have a big family, a complicated order and the people at Oz. TH make us feel like family. The food is excellent (burgers, tacos, salads, fish and chips, and more). We never have to wait too long. If there is ever an issue they are always quick to make it right.  The adult beverages are on a self-serve system and you pay by the ounce. You can get a flight of beer or wine, but I prefer the Fuzzy Navel Hard Seltzer. Yum! We have loved their commitment to the community and love supporting a local business we believe in. Thank you Oz. Taphouse for being a great place to take my family!!!

reviews.author: Nicole W.
reviews.description: My husband and I were in town for the weekend and found this place a short walk from our hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The Bourbon Berry Cocktail was my favorite! We also enjoyed sampling many different beers and wines on tap. Their crispy chicken sandwich was delicious! Very crispy on the outside and moist on in the inside.   They have crowlers and growlers for 25% off everyday. I really wish they had a smaller to go container as I would've loved to have taken some of the Berry cocktail home - I can't justify the cost of it to take home a crowler or growler. We would definitely go back if we were in the area again.

reviews.author: Melissa S.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed this place which was an accidental find on our way back from one of our activities in Austin. It is a self-serve concept, so basically you are given a card to scan anytime you want to order a wine, beer, or a cocktail from one of their many taps. You also place your food order at the counter and they bring it out to you.   The fried avocado tacos were amazing and my significant other really enjoyed whatever tacos he had, which I believe were the Carnitas. Why four stars then? Two reasons. One is I was really confused on how much I should tip. I usually don't struggle with this being a bartender, but since we had to pour our own drinks and order food at the counter , I wasn't comfortable leaving a full 20%. Second, when you are pouring your beer, the price adds up very quick. There was one point my boyfriend poured a pint glass and the beer ended up being $22. That was a bit of a letdown. Otherwise the staff is VERY friendly and welcoming -they run a very tight ship. The bathrooms were exceptionally clean and the layout with a big outdoor patio is a bonus. Highly recommend, just watch the higher ABV beers because they add up fast!

reviews.author: Traci P.
reviews.description: I've ordered from Oz many times! Today I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with slaw on the side and sweet potato fries.  The fries were cold, the slaw was literally purple cabbage not dressed and there were 15 huge jalapeños on my sandwich! Will have to rethink about ordering again.

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: Stopped by Oz. Tap House for the first time after a Vandegrift H.S. football game, recommended to us by a family member.  "Go to Oz (pronounced Oz, like wizard of Oz) Tap House, is great.  First things first, we realized later it's not Oz it's Oz.  Notice the period after the z.  Oz. = ounce!  Makes perfect sense when you see the concept.  Dozens of self-serve taps, pouring cocktails, beer, wine, etc.  Way cool!  We couldn't tell how much vodka was actually in the Cosmos we had, but they were tasty!  The Community brand ice tea off the charts too.  Any place serving Community products knows their stuff ... oh yeah, the food.  Definitely "gotta go back for more" fare.  Fried cauliflower and jalapeños, nice ranch sauce.  Our server, unprompted, brought some buffalo wing sauce, "dip a little in here, then the ranch."  Awesomeness!  House tacos and cod tacos were delicious, depths of sublime flavors layered into top shelf flour tortillas.  Our only observation was using the house taco slaw on the cod tacos may be a better pairing than the sautéed cabbage... at any rate, the tacos were outstanding.  We'll definitely be back, lots more on the menu to explore.  And a special shout out to James working the register.  Explained the concept, led us through the process, and answered quite a few "newbie" questions.  He was great, no need to hire more employees, clone James!

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: The uniqueness of this place really sets it apart. You are given a card to pour any of the beers on top yourself, which I had seen before and always love. What I hadn't seen was also you can pour wine or cocktails! This experience is perfect for all of those people crawling out of quarantine and not knowing what to do when they cant pour their own drinks. But now you can! And despite the setup involving many hands, Oz. keeps the place sparkling clean.  I can't speak much to the food menu. It's mostly a meat-forward fare. They have a vegan burger patty, but I was told neither of the buns are vegan. Since the patty was really soft, I am not sure it would work as a lettuce wrap. It seems weird to have a vegan patty when you can't have a full vegan burger, but at least there is a vegetarian option.  My mom liked her fish and chips.   I am really just here for the taps though!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: How lucky are we to arrive in Texas and meet this amazing place! It was like stepping in paradise. Delicious food and a whole variety of beers.   We tried a few of the beers and had some Tex-Mex.   I tried the sangria beer. I believe it was number 32 on the panel. If you like sangria and bubbles go for it, It's like sangria with bubbles (GF)  Husband had a few other kinds of beers which I tried and oh Man, It was very good! Nothing like I ever had before.   I also had the house tacos (3) with chicken, steak and fried avocado. The fried avocado was definitely a hit for me. It was full of flavor, creamy and crunchy at the same time.   If you are visiting Austin like us and want to drive away from the city you won't regret going to Oz Tap House.   Also, one of the owners is supper friendly we had the pleasure to speak with Sean briefly. Staff is also very nice, patiently explained to us how tap works.   Thanks Oz Tap House for such a memorable welcome!   I recommend this place to everyone!!

reviews.author: Michaela M.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place being so close to home and having a huge selection of beers with some wine. The food was average but the outdoor area was super fun for my kiddos.

reviews.author: Kerri A.
reviews.description: I just ordered lunch from Oz tap house. We got fish and chips, fried pickles,  a baked pretzel, a Caesar salad and a cheesesteak.   The pro's: The ranch dressing that came with the fried pickles was pretty good, As was the coleslaw.   The cons:  The fish and chips portion was small and soggy. It was two pieces of greasy fish, that iterally had no flavor. Fish and Chips is one of my favorite foods and I've had it all over the world. Never had I gotten it without flavor. How do you make something taste like nothing? Granted. I asked that the fish and chips have no hot pepper on it. Unfortunately, Hot pepper is the only spice Oz uses.  The fries were cold inside - clearly not hand-cut. The Caesar salad, was spicy in a weird way. It was not good.  The Philly Cheesesteak was very very spicy and greasy.  The Baked Pretzel - Auntie Ann's does a better job, this was a VERY basic, previously frozen pretzel. Nothing special and not worth the price.  The fried pickles - under seasoned and instead of crisp, they were chewy. Again not good.    Everything was extremely spicy, from the fish and chips to the Caesar salad. Food items that traditionally aren't spicy, were all grossly over spiced with hot peppers. Oz Tap House needs to learn how to use spices without making things spicy. Go back to cooking school - Spiced and Spicy! There is a difference! One more thing,  Read dietary notes. There's a reason why people write them.

reviews.author: Katy D.
reviews.description: This place is amazing. Fun for parents and kiddos! The staff is super welcoming and accommodating. Not to mention the owners are awesome as well. Try the tacos or the crispy chicken sandwich. So good!

reviews.author: Sara O.
reviews.description: Ya know what, I loved this place. We came for the patio,but it was kind of crowded so we sat inside. We were greeted when we walked in,had the process explained etc.  Beers, a couple of ciders,and wines on tap. Pretty cool. I did semi accidentally pour myself 9 oz of wine, so it was a $12 glass, not what I'd typically spend on a glass of wine, but I also typically wouldn't be served 9 oz.  Our food came out quickly and it was really good!  I don't know much it was (folks mentioned auomatic gratuity) bc my husband paid, but it was great and we will definitely come back. They had a playground in the back that we saw,which would be great to come to with our lil people.

reviews.author: Beth L.
reviews.description: Fun atmosphere. Good food. Variety of options.  What really stuck out to us last night was customer service - from the front order person to the in-house table bussers, and the "tap Bosses" or so to speak.  They pay attention to what's going on. They make you feel like you are the most important person that has come in all day... and it was great to see lots of customers supporting this small business.  Plus, of course, there are MANY drink choices to sample and enjoy!!

reviews.author: Lea S.
reviews.description: Pretzel charcuterie board is amazing! Great place for families and they also have most sports games on the televisions as well. You can't go wrong with the selection of beers and wine.

reviews.author: Spencer C.
reviews.description: The idea is great, it's a self pour bar, they charge by ounce, only thing they did was bring out my order. Didn't check or see if we were all right. Overall everything is a little over priced. Food was sub par. Even happy hour there was only 5 cents off the beer. Expect around $8-9 for a 14 oz beer, and $15+ for mediocre food. And when I went to go tip, they looked at me confused as to why I didn't give them a big tip. Well the answer is simple. I did everything myself while all the workers sat on their phone talking in a booth.

reviews.author: Allison R.
reviews.description: I got the Brie berry burger. Everything tasted really good and I was so impressed that the burger was actually medium rare and was very pink and juicy! The onion rings were just okay. The breading wasn't very flavorful and kept falling off and the onions were not crispy. We also got the house tacos and the beef was good, and the fried avocado was amazing! Really liked the sauce they used!

reviews.author: Jack B.
reviews.description: Pretty good food and interesting beverage system. Great bar. Overall great place to have a small meal and a beer.

reviews.author: Stacy C.
reviews.description: Cool concept pay by the ounce tap house. Gives you plenty of opportunity to try all types of beers without having to get a full pint.  Food is good too, the ahi salad is delicious and the aren't skimpy with the ahi :).

reviews.author: Steve R.
reviews.description: Way overrated. Gave this place a second chance today. Ordered delivery: 1/2 bbq chicken salad and Kieran's chicken sandwich. Both portions were inadequate and flavor terrible.  Salad smelled like b.o. and sandwich was one of the worst chicken sandwiches I have had. Quality nonexistent. Taking my business elsewhere.

reviews.author: Rosaura A.
reviews.description: Looooved it, absolutely!  Taking my California family there, when they come out for a visit, from Santa Barbara.    Great concept with "brew tastings."  Food was scrumptious!!!  Going back for date night soon!

name: Hopfields
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Courtney E.
reviews.description: This place has hands-down one of the best burgers in Austin. It's a casual little bar with craft beer and amazing French food. Their burger, covered in camembert or brie, carmelized onions and whole grain mustard is so delicious!! Pair it with crispy Pomme frites and homemade aioli...it's a mic drop moment. The staff is kind and helpful, their craft beer choices and a small but wonderful wine list just rounded out the afternoon. All they have left to do is claim their yelp listing! LOL  But seriously, if you are a foodie, this should definitely be on your list of places to frequent. I'm sure they have many other amazing things to eat there, but their burger is so good that we've never ordered anything else!

reviews.author: Will C.
reviews.description: First visit, so my assessment change over time. My initial sense is that while the food is good, the service needs some work.   No complaints about the food, which was quite good, such as the Heirloom Tomato Tarte and the Salade Niçoise.  The ratatouille could've used a bit more bread, and I thought the toffee flavor of the mango gelato-bread pudding dessert we got to be overpowering.  Drinks were varied and interesting, with French component takes on standard cocktails (e.g. "The Vielle Fashioned") that worked for some (their variation of the French 75) and  less so for others (I believe the Frontera Sidecar).  What definitely fell short was the service. I don't need overly attentive service, but it's not reasonable to be out of water for half an hour, unsuccessfully trying to flag down a waiter time after time.  This is particularly a problem given the small size of their water glasses and the lack of a water bottle for the table. Fixing this relatively small problem would be huge.

reviews.author: Claire G.
reviews.description: Friendly front room  Solid burger  The online menus have several dishes listed that are not listed on the menus when you show up in person  Music was not congruous with the setting  (~2009 top 40's?)  Without a warning on the menu, the fries taste strongly like Pho broth (star anise? Bone broth? Cinnamon?)  Back room felt like a temporary event space

reviews.author: Bree B.
reviews.description: The service is out of this world at Hopfields. Every single employee welcomes you as a dear friend. The beer selection on tap is incredible and every single dish is curated with fresh ingredients while keeping the menu innovative. I think this would be a perfect place to go on a first date or meet up with friends. The ambience is intimate, but also very warm and open.

reviews.author: Vivian P.
reviews.description: I fall in love with this place the first time I tried it after living in this neighborhood for so long. You can come here for drinks at the bar but also sit down for a full dine in experience. Their desserts here are especially amazing. I tried their banana crepe and it's amazing!! I love how the banana tastes didn't get completely covered by the chocolate and also how cute they decorated the plate!

reviews.author: Henna A.
reviews.description: We got here on a Sunday evening and were told there was a want of 30 mins to sit indoor when there were empty tables but we were okay and sat in the back lot where they had outdoor chairs and picnic tables. If you're outside you have to get your food and drinks by going back inside by the bar to put your order. To our surprise, the cocktails didn't have actual liquor which was strange. The boards they brought out after a good hour after ordering along with the fries were a bit lackluster. The indoor dining was very cute however overall experience and food taste wasn't great to come back to

reviews.author: Jenn B.
reviews.description: We ended up finding Hopfields thru Eaters List of best Burgers in Austin! Hopfields was #5! #5 guys and not to be snooty but I didn't even look at anything past P Terry's which was around #15! Hehehe P Terry's is good (it's a local chain, made to order) but it's a drive thru and I was looking for more of an "elevated" experience tonight! No shade to my P Terry lovers!! So the Paschal Burger is $16 Medium rare, and slathered in ooey gooey camembert cheese and mustard! I enjoyed it! I regularly lean toward a sweet burger with carmelized onion (which were included), BBQ sauce, bacon jam and other ingredients like these. This burger is just savory not too bold and a textural delight! See the video for the "unboxing"! I would give it a solid 7/10.

reviews.author: Javier E.
reviews.description: It has a very classy vibe to it, the choices for food and drink reflect it. I wish they had more variety in their menu, with cheaper options. I suppose you pay extra for the upscale vibe of the place.  This is not saying that the food is bad, in fact it is very good. The wine and beer options are the best in the area, now that Vino Vino is closed. The great thing is that you can go there for drinks, without ordering food, and have a great time sitting indoors or outside. The staff are very professional, welcoming, and they use their knowledge about the different wines to make suggestions.

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Came for dinner, without reservations, on  Friday. It was pretty empty and easy to get a table, so we sat in the middle room of the place, which was somewhat of a makeshift library/lounge with old foreign decor.  We got olives and almonds to start, with escargot, which came with small lettuce leaves and was in a red sauce (not your typical garlic butter). It was really good, different and interesting to try it in a different preparation. For the main, we split the steak and frites. It was probably the smallest portion of steak I've ever seen and if I had eaten it myself I probably still would have been hungry. But, it was really nicely cooked and seasoned, as well as the fries. So despite the size it was super good.  Don't know if I'd come again, also because they only had some special cocktails and not a full bar, but it was interesting to try the place.

reviews.author: Lauren O.
reviews.description: Hop fields was such a pleasant surprise given how close it is to UT campus. They have an extensive beer list, but what I really loved was the "cocktails". They are made with sherry and fortified wines. I got one with grapefruit and absolutely LOVED it. It was so creative and delicious. That being said, they do not serve hard alcohol. As for the food, we go the Mushroom Leek Tarte, Moules Frites, and Pascal Burger. We loved them all! The tarte was flaky and perfect and the burger delicious. I wasn't super wild about the fries and a with I had subbed them for a side salad, but I guess I will know for next time! The modules frites were great, but also had quite the kick, so don't order unless you like spicy food.  Overall, the atmosphere with the outdoor patio was phenomenal and the food was superb! A great place for a date

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: A little punk. Lotsa French. Sartre as a bar. Punches above its weight in quality and value for price.

reviews.author: Patrick W.
reviews.description: It's been good for a while, but it got great recently. Wine, beer, and food are great. The vibe is diverse; you can hang at the bar, get a bar table, or dine in one of the funky private books with a server. Good vibes all around.

reviews.author: janet b.
reviews.description: Oh. My. Goddess.!  We love this place! The salad Nicoise is fantastic, as is the Pascale Burger, ratatouille and Steak Frites. It's great to eat inside in the little rooms...or outside....especially for social distancing ! But don't tell too many people

reviews.author: Rose D.
reviews.description: cute dive bar! My best friend and I needed a late night meal and found hop fields after most places had already closed. The Burgers and cocktails were amazing! staff was friendly and the indie/hiphop music playlist was to my liking

reviews.author: Steven A.
reviews.description: One of my favorite Austin restaurants! I'd say kind of a hidden gem, because I've talked to so many people who haven't been yet or heard of it. They offer a great beer selection filled with local brews and some from far away. Their food is delicious and the Pommes Frites are a must. And honestly there's isn't a thing on the menu we haven't tried and thoroughly enjoyed! If you haven't been, go!

reviews.author: Wynona V.
reviews.description: Really great service from Astrid! Thank you so much for taking care of us. Delicious charcuterie board and butternut squash tarte. Will definitely be back ‍

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Mussel fries what!? Extensive beer list wheyyyy?! All the vibes yeeeet!  I've been waiting to go to Hopfields, and I'm so glad I had my first experience with my good girlfriends. Everything from the food, beer, ambiance to relaxed vibes completely made my experience so wonderful. Hilary was our wonderful server, and she was super chill and relaxed. She definitely guided us towards the best menu items. We started with the pomme frites (fries) because they ran out of the escargot dumplings by the time we got there on a Sunday evening. I'll definitely go back and try those. The fries were heavenly. Like crisp, perfect thickness, and that garlic aioli though!! They had a wide array of beers, and I enjoyed their wheat, IPA and belgian options. There was something for everyone...cocktails, wine--you name it! They also serve tap water too.  I was torn between the ratatouille and veggie burger. The mussel frites were the star of the table. My friend said her pascal burger was alright. It could have been more of a medium rare instead of a medium, but it definitely wasn't the "best burger" she'd had. I enjoyed the ratatouille. They give extra bread upon request--there's no way I was going to soak up all of the yummy juices of that flavorful ratatouille dish without BREAD! The food server was very friendly too. We didn't catch his name, but he was very knowledgeable when we asked him what was in the white aioli that came with our fries.   In all, the experience is wonderful for good friends, dates and even family dinners. The place is dimly lit, sooooo those of y'all needing glasses might need to turn on that cell phone light. Super romantic place, without the expectations to dress up or present yourself a certain way. Score! Definitely a rockstar spot.

reviews.author: Debbie C.
reviews.description: The Food and Wine @ Hopfields is true French!  Loved the staff, ambience too!!!  Best Charcuterie and Moules Frites!

reviews.author: Dina M.
reviews.description: Good social distancing in place . Servers are nice and the food is delicious and light . Good selection of drinks as well . It's a very cute place .

reviews.author: Soham R.
reviews.description: Lovely brunch place! The place has an antique vibe. The food is good and so are the servers!

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: This place puts every other beer store in ATX to shame. The variety of options here seems endless. The dude behind the counter knows more about beer than most sommeliers know about wine. That's just icing on the cake. They get every limited release and seasonal that drops. Prices can be a little steep but hella worth it.

reviews.author: Greg M.
reviews.description: Great place to try out a new beer then buy a six-pack or two. We had a couple beers each (they sell singles if you are hanging out) and then bought some to take home. Taco Truck pilsner was great, Mama Pisner, and there was a pickle beer that was probably a tad too pickley for me (go figure).  Great/fun selection, good prices, knowledgeable staff, and lots of picnic tables out to keep you spread out and safe. You can get snacks too, or play Starship Troopers pinball (Do You Want To Know More?!?). We had  a good time just chilling there on a Sunday afternoon.  Oh, and they recycle those plastic can holders that craft breweries use. Bring yours back to help out the brewers in town!

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: If you haven't been to The Brewtique in Cedar Park, you definitely should check it out.   Anytime you stop by, you'll meet either the owner or his wife and they are both nice and very helpful. You can pretty much buy anything they have in singles and they always have their inventory listed online along with the untapped rating for each beer, which I find very useful. They have a solid selection of local stuff and occasionally some more rare stuff as well. If you're immunocompromised, you can call your order in and they'll bring it to your car; they also have a very sanitary setup inside and require masks (of course) and make everyone use the hand sanitizer when you come in. We've been there about 5 times mixing that in with buying direct from breweries but I really love the diversity you can get while supporting local at the Brewtique

reviews.author: Philip J.
reviews.description: Really impressive beer bar and shop in Cedar Park. If you're a bit of a beer geek, head over here and you're sure to find some new stuff you haven't tried before. If you're more beer curious, head over and chat with these friendly folks. They know their stuff and helped me to pick out some new beers.  There's a good range of price points here too so you could find a good gift here.   Website is also really useful and lists out everything they have if you like to head in with some ideas of what to grab.   Good atmosphere in there too if you're drinking in.   Overall highly recommend and glad they are here.

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Review time kids!! So the bride is out of town for business, what does any good husband do???? He meets some buds for suds!!   We all met at another place for happy hour when bud 1 recommend this place for some take home treats. I mean,come on, we know a beer-n-burger nut like me can't say no.  This place is totally chill with a few picnic tables to relax and converse with friends. There is also a couple of other chairs if that's your thing. Sampling on sight is totally cool too.  On to the selection of beers. All I can say is,if you can't find something here that you would like, go home,empty handed and admit you have no taste. That's right, I threw the blame squarely on you! Why? Because they must have better than 300-400 different beers to choose from!  Now go, prove me wrong and try that chocolate oatmeal stout or triple ipa !!

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: A craft beer lover's nirvana. Come here peruse their extensive inventory pick out a beer and enjoy either on site or grab a few brews to go. I could go on but that's it. Come here and drink good beer, but.  These guys got it goin (sic) on where else can you find a Maine Brewing Co beers or a selection of IPAs that will blow your mind.   Folks here are friendly and of course knowledgable and provide a high level of customer service. Case in point I was out of town and a pal informed me that they had a very hard to find beer available. These nice folks held my order until I arrived, almost at closing time.  Nice folks and righteous brews!

reviews.author: Meg K.
reviews.description: Such a cool spot. I don't live in Cedar Park but I'll be making regular trips here to check out the cool beverages!

reviews.author: Whitney B.
reviews.description: I really can't say enough good things about the Brewtique.  They have an amazing variety of drinks and they're always bringing in new items. The team is incredibly helpful, very knowledgeable about their products, and all around just a couple of really cool folks.  Just tell them what you're in the mood for, and you'll absolutely receive a satisfying recommendation.  They're dog-friendly both in and outside, and are super welcoming to well-behaved pooches. They also do some really cool charity events on behalf of some great organizations. There's almost always something going on in the evenings -- live music, comedy shows, football games, game night, beer tastings.  They also have some neat retro arcade games and board games on hand to entertain.  There's always a reason to pop in and have a drinks!

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Great place. Owner always remembers you and knows what you like. They keep an amazing selection that is always changing. If you want to try some beers they have tables inside and outside. Personally love the selection of Texas beers and sours they have.

reviews.author: Catalina M.
reviews.description: Welcome to cedar park the brewtique! Had the absolute pleasure of coming here today. Great atmosphere, awesome beer selection and such a friendly welcoming owner.  The bottle shop that lived here prior (RIP) was great, but the new layout and even better beer selection really sets this place apart! Such a plethora of great beers and a cool little shop you can crack one open and enjoy it right there! Looking forward to my next visit!

reviews.author: Short Fuse S.
reviews.description: Just a fantastic place. I had a friend come in from San Antonio and he kept saying he wished there was a place like The Brewtique in his neighborhood. There's a great beer selection, and the owner is a really cool dude. Plus, they carry my favorite beer even though I'm the only one who buys it. That's dedication to customers!

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Need a beer? I mean a great beer? Do you want to enjoy it while killer music played? How about suggested by avid beer enthusiasts. Well, you're home. Enough said. This place hits all the check boxes. Fast WiFi for work, big tables for games. Endless beer.

reviews.author: Javier A.
reviews.description: What can I say about Brewtique that hasn't already been said? Great and various beers available here keep me coming back and back. Mgmt is top notch, friendly, and above all knowledgeable. I am always impressed with the ambiance. It feels like a great big community. Service with a smile and a laugh makes my trip there memorable. Also they have great events, live music, and  board games to boot! 3 cheers and a beer for Brewtique.

reviews.author: Jarod P.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great selection. Knowledgeable owners.  Fair prices.  If you remember this location when it was under previous owners, you'll find it's been nicely updated, more tables, chairs and such, even arcade games.  Keep up the good work Brewtique.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Cool little place, glad to see that the old bottle shop here was replaced by another. Owner(s?) seem to care a bunch, and have been available to point out new releases/limited beers, make recommendations, and take pics of my dog.   Prices slightly higher than other big retailers, but selection is much better (tip: check their Instagram for limited beers and new stock). Also, a good selection of CBD products for those interested. I have never hung around to drink there, but you can for a small per-beer charge if you want.   Hope this place keeps getting tasty limited beverages and doesn't turn into a vape emporium like the last one!

reviews.author: kenneth m.
reviews.description: The Brewtique has the best selection of fresh beer in the area. Prices are more than fare, and the staff tends to go above and beyond to answer questions.  Bathroom is always clean and stocked with soft and plush 2-ply charmin, they don't skimp on the good stuff! The owner was quite nice and helped me carry my order to my car, even sent me a nice wink and a smile while I was pulling out.

reviews.author: Luis P.
reviews.description: Craft Beer. Wine. Cider. A great neighborhood little store that always has something that the big stores don't carry. All you have to do is to ask, and they'll give a great recommendation. It's probably the thing you'll always want to do as they carry seemingly hundreds of brands of beer.   And it seems like they are trying to bring more cool events to the Cedar Park area like Comedy nights and Movie nights. Check it out and check out their vintage pinball machines!

reviews.author: Justin C.
reviews.description: If you haven't been here, please stop by. This place is absolutely wonderful. Every time I go in, always greeted and asked if I need anything. There is always something special for a random night of the week. The price to pop a top is great, individual cans or packs is really nice. Exactly what a bottle shop should be. Looking forward to the future of this place. Best of luck.

reviews.author: Marion W.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing. Great selection of beers. Really fun to pick out singles and drink them there or take them home for later. They have a lot of fun events throughout the week like game night, comedy night, and brewer educational events. The passion is obvious with the owners, and they're super friendly to boot. They're building a great community in a cool location. We love coming here and are so thrilled to have such a cool place so close to home!!

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: I love this place!  The beer selection is amazing, and the owners are above and beyond welcoming!  Every time I walk through the front door to grab one of their new arrivals, Scott and Jana greet me like an old friend.  Also it has so much more to offer than just beer, everything from game night to comedy shows and little bit everything else in between.

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: ELECTRIC JELLYFISH - okay, if you need me to say more than that, keep reading.  The newest rendition of Penthouse Brewing is NOT a pizza restaurant (honestly didn't realize that until I looked at the menu). Their newest location focuses on showcasing their brewing. The ambiance is really modern and trendy with TONS of space to feel like you can breathe (especially during these COVID times). The beer is wonderful, as always, and if you need a recommendation, refer to my first two words of this review.  Food order: - Texas Pretzel with cold whipped beer cheese - HUGE pretzel, so delicious! Admittedly, I could've lived without the beer cheese as it did not add enough flavor to really warrant the additional cost. - Whipped Burrata - Burrata is my second favorite cheese (to queso of course) so I HAD to order this. Basically it was a deconstructed caprese salad and I am all about it!  - Pulled Porker - To be honest, you could probably get better pulled pork at the 100+ BBQ restaurants Austin has to offer but it was very tasty and hit the spot!  If you are a newbie to the Pinthouse family or a regular, check out their new location - it will not disappoint!

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: When I heard the name Pinthouse, I wasn't expecting it to be as awesome as it was!   The atmosphere was so light and open, TVs mounted for entertainment, swinging chairs and a whole upstairs and of course, a brewery behind the bar.  I came here with a big group for a friend's birthday, the staff were incredible and they accommodated us all without hesitation.   I'm looking forward to the next visit!

reviews.author: Jennifer H.
reviews.description: First off, I love the original Pinthouse. I knew this was going to be a new concept that centers around the brewery and I think they nailed the ambiance and beer selection. I would absolutely stop by anytime for a beer.  The reason for the 3 stars, the food. I wanted so badly to enjoy the food because who doesn't love a snack when enjoying a beer. We stopped for dinner so definitely looking for good food. The Buffalo chicken dip has potential, flavor is good.. but the chunks of chicken are difficult to eat in the dip. Shredded would be easier but no big deal, just wouldn't order again. The real issue is the vinegar overload in the salad and bbq sauce. I love vinaigrette but this one was too strong for me to finish. Same with the bbq sauce on the pork sandwich. The pork was fine. The bread was fine. The bacon was cold. Just overall super average food.  Hopefully I just had a one-off experience. I'll be back to try again if not only for the beer.

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: I am absolutely in love with the new Pinthouse! Their new space is amazing.   Now I'm no fan of pizza so the food at their other establishment was always kinda meh for me. I saw the menu here and at first was like who wants "sandwiches and hummus with beer".. boy was I wrong... I loved the boiled peanuts, the humus plate and the pimento cheese sandwich. All the food I was served at Pinthouse was fresh and tasty and I'll certainly go back for more.   Their IPA's are top notch as they always have been. They have a crowler for to go and do growler refills.   Go here. Have fun.

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: I went to Pinthouse with some friends for a Sunday afternoon lunch and had a great time! We got there in time for brunch, it ends at 3pm, so I decided to get their Rodeo Bagel and a potato cake. Unfortunately, they were out of actual bagels so they gave me a bun instead but it was still quite good. The potato cake, however, was absolutely amazing. It was perfectly crispy and topped with flaky salt, I think I could've eaten five of them alone and been happy. My main complaint about the setup is the fact that a big portion of the tables will get wet. We went during a huge storm and barely got a table because everything was either taken or wet. There was also supposed to be live music but they couldn't play because the stage was wet.   COVID Precautions: Masks are encouraged but not required. All employees were wearing masks though!

reviews.author: Gnet A.
reviews.description: We don't live too far from this place and we were looking for a new spot to take our guests from out of town to but it ended up just being us two. We weren't leaving until we tried some beer and food and we like the ambiance of the place. A person comes to greet you once you walk in and pretty much give you the low down of the place and how its runs. Service is friendly, helpful, and done exceptionally. They are doggie friendly too.   You only need to wear a mask when you go into the inner part of the place. It has a lot of space and a lounge area with a swinging seat, so it has that cool laid back type of vibe. You can scan the code on the napkin dispensers for the menus. I ordered the DEADLUS CHARM (Belgian Blonde) and hubby got the OF SOUND MIND (Fruit and Sour). For food, I got the chicken and Brie sandwich and hubby got the chicken sausage sandwich. They were both tasty and the food was delicious and fresh. We recommend, we will return, and make this spot one of our go-to for our hangouts.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Pinthouse is one of my top five favorite breweries of all time. I am in love with their newest airport location. The space is beautiful. I love the indoor and outdoor dining space! Perfect for my pups to visit with me. The full restaurant menu is also exciting. Recently came here for Sunday brunch, which was amazing! Loved the gluten free breakfast sandwich! My friend loved the croissant sandwich!

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Had been wanting to check this place out and wow, what a beautiful interior, does not give off "brewery vibes" at all.   For a brewery it is very modern with it's decor. Love the seating and the chandeliers and all of that when you first walk in, way to go whoever the interior decorator was!   That being said, let's move on to the real reason you're reading this.....you wanna know about the beer!   Well I decided to try their flight, which came with 5 different beers of your choice.   The most popular beer is the electric jellyfish, which is what I ended up settling on after my flights as well. They had also just released some new beers the day I went, and so I tried the "dude blueberry" which surprisingly as someone who isn't a fan of heavier beers, I actually enjoyed it. Don't know if I would've handled a full glass of it, but definitely enjoyed the trial version.   All in all, a great place to gather with friends, super chill and low key with a nice vibe.

reviews.author: Sarretta M.
reviews.description: We decided to try Pint House Brewing after receiving coupons in the mail. One was for a free salad or sandwich and one was for $10 off. We weren't sure where the location was, but following directions, we were able to find it just east of Woodward at Ben White on the southside access road. They really need better signage because the entrance is on the south side of a large warehouse-looking building.  But it is definitely worth finding! We were greeted at the outside patio which is wonderfully shaded and well set up for live music in the evenings. We were shown to a table and told to remember our table number before we went to order at the bar. All the staff were appropriately masked and social distancing seating was enforced.  To take maximum advantage of our coupons (because we will be leaving Austin in two weeks) we ordered separately. I ordered the Italian sandwich with a side salad and an iced tea.  My husband ordered a chicken Caesar salad, an iced tea, and a blackberry cider. The drinks were all self-serve which made keeping our glasses refilled easy.  Our food came out very quickly, as we were some of the first people seated. And it looked amazing when we got it! See photos. My sandwich was huge! The bread was perfect; soft inside and thick and crusty outside. The fillings were amazing with several kinds of meat and cheese and vegetables with a dressing. The flavor was outstanding and I made my husband try it because I knew he would like it too. My side salad was also terrific. The dressing was an olive oil vinaigrette that was just perfect and the homemade croutons made it that much more delicious.  My husband's blackberry cider was so good that he had me try it, and it was delicious! It was slightly sweet and full of flavor. His Caesar salad was huge! It had the same homemade croutons and an incredible garlic Caesar dressing that even I, a non-fish eater, liked.   Try this place! They appear to be owned by the same company as the Pinthouse Pizza locations in Austin, but they are focusing on their brewery, sandwiches and salads, and they are all delicious!

reviews.author: Fran R.
reviews.description: First time here love there food and amazing  drinks.very clean place and friendly.The atmosphere very nice TV's and swinging chairs.

reviews.author: Jenny R.
reviews.description: Huge selection of drinks. Gorgeous decor and super clean and just really amazing. Staff was super helpful and just great vibes all around! Love it here and their other location Pinthouse Pizza!!!!!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I came here about two weeks ago with a friend. We ordered two bottles of vino to share while we got all caught up. We sat towards the entrance of the establishment so we could enjoy the breeze and people watch. As we only purchased vino, I cant comment on the beer offerings. However, the beer offerings are mostly the same at the Round Rock location (my primary spot)  and beers offered there are excellent!   Happy Dining TX!

reviews.author: Rini S.
reviews.description: Went in for some drinks with a few friends and had a nice experience. What's not to like really? You've got beer on tap, plenty of screens to watch games, comfortable seating with many different options, and friendly bartenders. Will probably come back again and bring my dog this time.

reviews.author: E. B.
reviews.description: Nice location and patio. Not great for watching sports because you can't hear the games. Food is terrible. Do yourselves a huge favor and bring in equipment to serve pizza. When you move to pizza you will fill this venue up. Until then people will only come for the beer and you will eventually get no business. Sorry. I really wanted to like this place.

reviews.author: Valerie A.
reviews.description: I want to love this place so bad! The food is the reason for the two stars.  It's THAT bad. The beer is great and the customer service is amazing, but the menu and the food need soooo much help! Also, nobody and I mean nobody will ever say "I can't wait to get there and eat pickled shrimp". Please work on the menu because it's a great spot with great beer and staff.

reviews.author: Dawn S.
reviews.description: We came here for an "end of school year- let's celebrate we survived teaching in a pandemic-we all have been vaxxed-and finally can be in the same room without a mask"-party!!   We had pre-ordered a bunch of food while everyone got their own beverages. The food was great and so was the service. I believe Stephanie was our waitress?   Ordering drinks was a little slow-they only had two people working the taps. We are on summer break so who cares?!? We had time to wait!  It is a great space: open-clean-and inviting. It has very tall ceilings which makes the space seem much bigger.   A few friends said they would come here back in the day when it was Midnight Rodeo. We heard a few fun stories.   I heard multiple people comment that they will come back- even a few that lived on the other side of town. I know I'll be back.

reviews.author: Taylor C.
reviews.description: This has been on my list to try since it opened and I've heard great things from friends.  I got a random text saying all good and 4 packs were 50% off today. HELL. YES. What better reason to finally visit?  Take out is only available online but I couldn't figure out how to apply the promo. I have an infant daughter who's at the age where she is not in the mood to sit down at a restaurant. I called the location and asked if there was any way they'd be able to take my order but still honor the discount. I spoke to Will and he told me to place the order online and then he'd refund me when I got there to pick it up.  I show up and the place was packed! Apparently everyone got the memo. Will greeted me and promptly went to the back to grab our order and handle the refund. He even offered to carry it to my car since my hands were full.  I am SO impressed by this level of customer service. Especially on a busy day! Thank you Will for making this mama's day.  Food wise -- everything was BOMB. They were packed great and still was presented nicely after the drive home.  - Meatball sandwich. I only ate 1/3 of it and was stuffed. It was still warm by the time we got home and tasted delicious.   - Quinoa mozzarella salad was refreshing. It was a little plain (maybe some pine nuts or something to give it a crunch would've helped) but I loved the Italian dressing.  - Pimento sandwich. How can you go wrong? Another big portion!  - And my husband's favorite: sticky toffee pudding. He doesn't see it on menus often so he freaking lit up when he came home and saw it on the table.  Of course, couldn't leave without my electric jellyfish. Tried the Best Coast also. TBH I just loved the design on the can. I'm sure it's good lol  I want to come back for the burrata (they were sold out) and the pretzel.  The ambiance is lively, big open space, and has a very warm/earthy vibe despite its exterior. Parking is ample and there's a back exit so you don't have to go east on the frontage road to get back onto 290 W.

reviews.author: Trish Y.
reviews.description: Really nice venue for chillin' and jammin' out to some tunes...they play some good stuff! Got an italian sub and an electric jellyfish. Sub was good, but ratio of meat to bread was lacking and bread was really chewy.  But i really did enjoy.  I meant to ask about whether they do tour but i didn't.  They have a water station for humans and dogs and you have a choice of inside vs outside seating.

reviews.author: Brianna E.
reviews.description: Holy moly this place is amazing! I got a coupon in the mail for a free sammie and decided to check it out. Everything was delicious! One of the best Italian subs I have had in texas! Also the basil slaw is the best slaw I have had as well. The decor and atmosphere is super cool. The outside area is fully covered so you won't get wet if it's raining. Can't wait to come back here!!

reviews.author: Kathy M.
reviews.description: Tons of space! Their outdoor area is spacious but incredibly loud. Even though it's considered an outdoor space it's completely enclosed and weather proof in my opinion.  We tried the Buffalo caramel corn and the Party mix which was a sriracha lime Chex mix. The caramel corn has a good flavor with a burn at the end but is very sticky. Our group of four really couldn't finish it. We did enjoy the Chex mix though.  The beer drinkers enjoyed their beers for sure and they will return for that reason. We saw lots of people ordering dinner and everything that went by  looked really impressive.  We felt that it has more of a corporate feel than a local Austin feel to it, so it wouldn't be a favorite spot for hubby and I.

reviews.author: Kaitlyn R.
reviews.description: *Masks Required to enter*  This is the place for Kolaches! The flavors are rich and they're generously filled. Both savory and sweet kolaches were mouth watering. I loved the bread, it's so soft.  My favorites were Pear with earlygrey tea and Lemon (flavor of the day), Pepperoni with Cheese, and Jalapeño Sausage with Cheese.   They serve beer on tap, canned beer and house/brewed coffee.  Outside seating area is spaced out nicely for social distancing and is covered by trees. Plenty of seating, so bring some friends!  We'll be back to try more for sure.

reviews.author: Jazel M.
reviews.description: I haven't been in Texas in a while... So I just want to be clear that they don't really have kolaches in other states especially in the Northeast.... Which is really weird when it comes to people bringing things for breakfast. That means no breakfast tacos and it definitely means no kolaches - just donuts all the time haha  So of course the first thing I did was go to Shipleys but it didn't hit the spot? My husband found this place just driving by and got these. YUM. First of all they're huge. I loved the jalapeño cheese (pictured) I basically ate it in 30 seconds and which he'd gotten me two! Place looks like it has great vibes so need to sit in sometime!

reviews.author: Doug P.
reviews.description: Be honest, wasn't impressed.   I liked the backyard vibe and the picnic table approach, but the beer selection seemed a little unimpressive.  For as highly rated as it was it was a bit of a let down.

reviews.author: Misha T.
reviews.description: Went with the classic sausage/cheese/jalapeno kolache and was not disappointed. It's quality stuff. Great tasting sausage, good dough. Make sure to let them warm it up for you.

reviews.author: Joseph V.
reviews.description: Came here for drinks on a Saturday night with friends. They were sold out of Kolaches for the day. But fortunately they were not sold out of great craft beer! Staff was very helpful and friendly. Would recommend as a chill place to catch up with friends. Will certainly be back!

reviews.author: Stacie H.
reviews.description: Delish! Every kolache I've tried (sweet and savory) has been solid. I always opt to warm them up so they're extra toasty. I recently tried the iced chai for the first time and was really impressed!  The back patio is well kept and now has even more spaced out tables for relaxing. Also a nice option for a quick grab and go.

reviews.author: Patrick M.
reviews.description: Ordered 3 kolaches to go early in the day. Had to go around to the back patio as the interior is closed due to the lingering elements of the pandemic. The kolaches were quite good. I ordered the: jalapeño sausage and cheese, ham and cheese and the pepperoni. I look forward to when they are fully opened again.

reviews.author: Tiana W.
reviews.description: Tasty and delicious! Chocolate wasn't my favorite but the sausage jalapeño was really good w a nice little bite to it. Fresh tasting dough as well.

reviews.author: Carlie L.
reviews.description: Really delicious kolaches and beer! I had the vegan sausage kolache and the hazy IPA. Would definitely return if (when) we find ourselves back in Austin!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Second time at the outdoor oasis of Batch. Incredible bites, brew, and coffee. Escape from the crazy and relax in an outdoor oasis of Batch. Food is good, but done early. Coffee and beer excellent.

reviews.author: Nathan F.
reviews.description: It took me too long to come here, tons of new beers every week plus incredible kolaches is a great combination that will keep me coming back more. Love their collaborations with several local breweries and the various kinds they have. If you love Hazys or stouts in general you'll love this place and their huge patio

reviews.author: Amber S.
reviews.description: Was visiting a friend who brought me here for brunch! Plenty of distanced outdoor seating. Simple but sufficient menu consisting of sweet and savory kolaches, coffee, beer, and more. Ordering was simple, and food and drinks came out quick and fresh. I got the pepperoni kolache, veggie sausage and cheese kolache, and Alishan beer. Both kolaches were fantastic, but I had a slight preference for the veggie one! (It's a vegetarian sausage, not veggies + sausage.) I'd recommend getting 2 kolaches if you're not too hungry and 3 if you are. The beer was light, and I believe it was infused with tea and honey. And they filled it to the brim! Definitely worth the $5. In total, my meal came out to $13-14 before tip. Would definitely come again. Great atmosphere.

reviews.author: Lindsey O.
reviews.description: We were super excited that Batch opened their own food truck and were anxious to try (the bbq place moved). The FT doesn't open until 3, at least on weekends, so we had to wait a little while once getting there. With their new covid- outdoor only ordering for beer it's hard to order anything else but their own brewed beer because the other cans they have are in a window display 6ft away. But, their beer is good, like this new carrot cake beer is pretty unique!  For their sausages, the price/quality is pretty good at around $6.50 each. The only bummer was the bun, it was too thick, dense and the sausage and toppings just sat on top. It was a little difficult to eat, but the flavors were great.

reviews.author: Erik H.
reviews.description: This is a hidden gem. The kolaches are awesome. They might be the best I have ever had. I would highly recommend. Also, the beer is some of the best in town. It's very west coast i I personally think the west coast has some awesome beer. Went and bought some of their HB8 beer that tasted great and helped fight the new anti-abortion laws. What more do you want?!?!?

reviews.author: Yunny D.
reviews.description: Since Covid, we have been enjoying their amazing outdoor space which has a ton of picnic benches that are so well spaced.  Now they have a food truck on site 3-9pm with sausages and Belgium fries, which are so good and so reasonably priced.   Love this place.

reviews.author: David V.
reviews.description: A favorite is back open again with outdoor seating only.  Head straight to the back and get in line with your mask on by the nicely marked spacers.  Take a seat alone or with friends in your pod at one of the amply spaces picnic tables and enjoy your beer, coffee, and Kolaches.

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: So cute and so delicious. Outdoor seating in this fall season is absolutely charming. Such a big, open, and distanced space - great for dogs! Came in the morning and got a cappuccino and Kolache and hung out with friends. Good prices and yummy Kolaches. Love that they have a veggie sausage option.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came by here for a snack on a Saturday afternoon, there was a nice crowd here but plenty of seating available inside and out.   I brought a friend who was visiting for their first kolache experience so we split 2 savory and 2 sweet kolaches to get both tastes. Given how delicious every option sounded we asked one of the employees for their recommendations and tried the brisket and jalapeño sausage for savory and the chocolate turtle and blueberry cheesecake for sweet.   I was expecting the brisket to be the star of the savory ones but we were blown away by the jalapeño sausage kolache. It had a fantastic spice that balanced with the creamy cheese and soft bread nicely. The brisket was tasty, but there's plenty of good places in the area to get good brisket so I'd highly recommend the sausage.   The turtle kolache was much more chocolate forward than I expected, if I hadn't known there was caramel on it I wouldn't have noticed the taste. It came out more like a chocolate croissant (not complaining!) but it was very different than the typical turtle dessert.   The blueberry cheesecake was my favorite of the two sweet kolaches. The blueberry jam was super flavorful while not being too sweet, and the cheesecake had a delicious taste but didn't give you that feeling like you survived a major life event that cheesecake desserts can give you.   Overall, I think this is a great spot to come share a few kolaches, especially for someone's first time as you can try a wide variety of them and be confident they'll all come out tasty.

reviews.author: Cinthia K.
reviews.description: Came here a few weekends ago with the bf when we were in town. It's a fairly small brewery, when compared to others that I've been to, though they have a pretty big outdoor space. They have some vegetarian kolaches, so I decided to get their veggie sausage and jalapeno and cheese kolache, along with a mango kolache, and their mango lassi IPA. The bf got another IPA, and he liked his just fine.   I'm not normally a fan of IPAs, but I thought the mango lassi one was terrific. The mango kolache was pretty good, but the veggie sausage one really stole the show for me. I'm getting hungry just thinking about them again. I kind of wished that they had more vegetarian friendly options, but I can't complain as kolaches with mockmeats in them seem to be extraordinarily hard to find as is. We came during the day, so it wasn't too busy, but we did see a fair amount of people doing work here, as well as plenty of other parties just hanging out. Would love to come back here the next time I find myself in Austin again.

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: A strong up and comer in the atx brewery game. Nice outside seating in back with 10 tables or so inside and live music sometimes. The kolaches are all pretty good and they also have beer to go from other pretty good and sometimes unexpected breweries. They do some really good ipas and sours and a lot of outside of the box variants that I really appreciate. I highly recommend checking them out and you should hit oddwood ales less than a block away too (they have pizza if you need a heartier meal). The attached pics are during the quarantine so they are of batch beers out in the wild.

reviews.author: Sam M.
reviews.description: One of my favorite restaurants in Downtown Austin.  They don't take reservations, but thankfully we were seated right away.  We sat out in the patio area in the back, in which they had the fires lighting.  Ordered the Chicken and Waffles and the Chicken Fried Steak. Food was delicious and portion sizes are huge! I was a hungry boy going in, but definitely needed a doggy bag for this one.  Simply the best Southern Comfort food in Austin. Can't wait to visit again!

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: Let me just share how fresh the food was. I ordered an amazing salad and added a few extra items to set it off.  I believe my friend ordered a steak with grits and I wanted to take his plate as well as mine.    The service was amazing and the atmosphere is on point. I will be returning even if it's a 48 ago but the experience is quite intense and is great for any type of meet up for business and personal.

reviews.author: Lucky N.
reviews.description: Called on Thursday 5:30pm and there was no wait for the patio so the hostess told me to come in. I was there 15 min later and another hostess (didn't get her name but she had a boy cut haircut) told me there's a 30 min wait. When I told her the waitress who answered my call said there was no wait, she then lectured me twice that I should have made reservations. Thought that was rude (before this, I've only ever thought Austinites were super sweet) - my first time here and the waitress on the phone didn't mention I should make a reservation twice. Shouldn't need to be lectured at the host stand and again when seated. Luckily another person came by and said we could be seated right away and luckily, the rest of the experience was fine.   We ordered the chicken fried steak and jalapeño hanger steak. From the photos, I didn't realize how ginormous the chicken fried steak was! It's the size of my forearm and can easily feed 3-4 people. It was my first time eating chicken fried steak and it wasn't bad. I'm not a friend food type girl but it was decent. I could only do a few bites as it was heavy. The jalapeño hanger steak was right up my alley. You have to eat it with the jalapeño; it's the perfect combo. I only wish they gave 2 jalapeños. The mashed potatoes also went perfectly! The popcorn, cornbread and drinks were also good. The Old Fashioned was smooth and the pink drink wasn't too sweet.  The waiter was much more pleasant than that hostess and the ambiance outside was lovely. I love that it's dog friendly and my dog was allowed to sit in my lap at the table (some places only allow dogs on the floor but my dog is a lap dog). They also brought a dog bowl. Overall really like it here and would come back and recommend!

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: New Year's Day, came for lunch. We waited for about 30 minutes, but they have a bar in the back while you wait. It was walking distance from our hotel on Third Street.  We got seated at the patio outside for a party of 5, and they adjusted the shade for us since the sun was in our face.   The service was okay, the food was pretty good. The size of that chicken friend steak was definitely Texas size! The cocktails were delicious. We even got a flight of moonshines, but that was a bit hard to drink. It was way to sweet for me personally.   Overall: Cleanliness: 8/10 Food: 8/10 Service: 7/10

reviews.author: Ria G.
reviews.description: Visiting Austin and decided to check this place out for some wonderful Southern food. Everything we ordered for brunch was extremely tasty and flavorful.   If you're looking for something on the lighter side, go for the Migas. Both the Beyond Veggie Burger and Backyard Chicken Sandwich hit the spot as well. They even accommodated my friend's request to switch the bread to a biscuit. The sauce that comes with the Sweet Potato Tater Tots is phenomenal.   They have great heated outdoor seating (tent style), wonderful servers, and generally a great atmosphere!

reviews.author: Brian B.
reviews.description: On a trip to Austin, we came across Moonshine and really enjoyed our dinner here.  We started with the pretzel sticks and pimento cheese as our appetizer - so good! The pimento was very flavorful and the pretzel sticks were baked to PERFECTION.  For my entree I had one of their fried chicken sandwiches. The chicken patty was very thin compared to most fried chicken sandwiches I've had, but the flavor was still there in every bite. The accompanying fries were yummy as well!  NOTE: on Mondays they have 50% off wine bottles. Just in case that's useful for you ;)

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: This restaurant just kind of pulls you in from the street. Being one of the oldest buildings in Austin, this place is obviously well known, and we were lucky to get in.   The atmosphere inside the restaurant just emanates southern charm and the menu offers some excellent southern comfort food entrees. Any time I find an appetizer not normally seen on a menu, I have to try it, and in this case, it was the deviled eggs.   I typically don't have the courage to try anyone else's deviled eggs because I am very picky when it comes to those, so I swore they better be good and they were very good. They were creamy, flavorful and had no pesky surprises like celery or relish.  One thing I never thought I would eat for dinner is chicken and waffles and being in Austin I decided I had to try. I was impressed with the seasoning of the chicken and the light breading. The waffles were fluffy, they came with plenty of butter and syrup. This entree was the epitome of sweet and salty, and a little bit spicy.  The staff are great, the drinks are great, and the atmosphere is alive. Cheers!

reviews.author: Cal G.
reviews.description: When all the other places to eat were closed on a Monday night. Moonshine was open and bustling.   The shrimp and grits were great. The baguette was stiff and dry.   The beer and bourbon selection is wide and very good.   We had the Pearl Snap Pilsner and the Convoxt Hill Stout.   The devil eggs were beautiful but the egg white had tight flesh. Was either over cooked or too long in the fridge. But we did arrive for dinner after 9pm.   The cobbler dessert looks great. But did not order it. Just admired from afar.   Excellent decor and ambiance in one of the oldest buildings in Austin.

reviews.author: Corrie S.
reviews.description: A fun spot for breakfast, brunch or lunch!  The first thing I'll say...GET THERE AS ITS OPENING. We showed up a few minutes before it opened and had a 15 min wait! Had we gotten there later, I think we'd have had to wait quite a while. Its flooded with customers on the weekend! Curious what it would be like during the week? ‍  Service was wonderful! Our waiter was fun, knowledgeable and attentive! I think that was the case across the staff. They take the service seriously!   The food is decadent! It's heaping portions with a southern flare. I got the green chili hash that was pretty good. My favorite part of the meal was the biscuits we ordered as an appetizer. Delicious!   This is a great spot! My friends and I enjoyed it! The menu is pretty straightforward. You'll walk away full of yummy food.

reviews.author: Alexa F.
reviews.description: Love their popcorn- has really good spice. Had the pretzel w pimento appetizer and it was really good. Had the hoss hot chicken sandwich which I loved but it wasn't actually spicy. Yum!

reviews.author: Amy O.
reviews.description: Moonshine was conveniently located near our hotel. Cocktails were great. Fried calamari was really good and save d the meal. I was looking forward to the fried green tomatoes and devil eggs but was unfortunately disappointed. We couldn't finish either items. The shrimp corn dog was good but the mustard sauce didn't seem to go well with the shrimp. The chicken fried steak was good but a little tough in texture.   I would like to give kudos to the staff! They were extremely friendly, attentive and hospitable. They did an excellent job!!

reviews.author: Mary L.
reviews.description: I hadn't been to Moonshine since before COVID, but am glad to report they are as good as ever.   By the reaction I got from our waitress when I asked, I'm not the only one who misses their legendary Sunday buffet, but apparently it will be back when things settles down, contagion-wise.  I cried a little when my Irish Coffee arrived with no whipped cream on top, but it had Jameson and Bailey's, so it would be churlish of me to complain. And the complimentary popcorn made up for a lot.  My companion was not crazy about her entree, Creole Crawfish and Grits. She was hoping for something along the lines of Shrimp and Grits, but instead got some grits swamped by a sort of stew that had more ham than crawfish. She's one of these incredibly polite people who won't send a dish back to the kitchen for anything less than serious culinary malpractice, so she just picked at it and left most of it.  I was delighted with my choice. The Chicken and Waffles were about the best I've had. The waffles were amazing, as was the chicken, and there was way more than I could eat--and believe me, I can eat!  The dessert my friend ordered made up for any disappointment in her entree. The Peanut Butter Mousse Pie was world-historic, as far as I could tell from the bites I was allowed. And it was huge--most of it went home with her.  The service was excellent, the prices fair, and we even found street parking.

reviews.author: Sandy B.
reviews.description: Got here at 1750 on a Thursday night.  Happy hour ends at 1800.  This place is already packed.  And there are multiple layers and areas to it.  30-45 minute expected wait for a table for 2.  That was about spot on.   Once we were sat, Charlie, the waiter showed up with our waters and a great attitude!   He offered suggestions with details.  I do believe we had to have ordered the two best meals they serve.  The horseradish crusted salmon and hanger steak.   You can't go wrong.     They have a great selection of high end bourbons.  Highly recommend trying the moonshine flight, too.

reviews.author: Ashleigh J.
reviews.description: Moonshine was a great experience all around. We were able to sit quickly. The atmosphere was nice and was a great place to take friends from out of town.   They had a good selection of appetizers and food, all of which sounded delicious. We ended up getting the pretzel, fried green tomatoes and roasted garlic as appetizers. The fried green tomatoes were delicious and I would recommend to anyone!  I ended up getting the club sandwich and it had so much flavor, the bacon jam on it really took it to another level. Portions were good size and each item our table ordered tasted great.

reviews.author: Melody C.
reviews.description: Service was professional, friendly, and welcoming!! Atmosphere was relaxed and clean, yet homey vibes!! Food was delicious and the waiters were very knowledgeable of menu selections which helped when selecting entrees!

reviews.author: Lorrie W.
reviews.description: We recently hosted a rehearsal dinner for 35 on one of the patios and it literally could not have been better. From the event coordinator to the waitstaff, to the food, to the atmosphere, we are 100% satisfied customers. Thank you, Devon, and everyone else, from the kitchen staff to the waiters to the hosts to the owners that made our experience memorable, excellent and meaningful!

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10-28-21  Quality/Quantity - Great Happy hour. We ate so much we had to take leftovers to-go. Free popcorn - excess butter and salt, just the way I like it. It also opens up the liquid appetite (beer!!!). Lone Star Beer - refreshing, especially on a hot day Brussel Sprouts - not as crispy as I would have preferred, but the family liked it Fried Green Tomato - not bad, but once you had Lucille's Fried Green Tomato, others are hard to compare. Cathead Biscuits = 6 stars!! This was a hit. Very generous portions, hence we had to take our entrees to-go. The flavor, especially with the butter and honey, took it over the top. Seared Rainbow Trout - Good, but we were so full that we could not enjoy it, no fault of theirs. They also have a Sunday Brunch.  Atmosphere - Both indoor and outdoor dining. There seemed to have more outdoor dining than indoor...? It looked like they had a private event in the back. Men's urinal was broken, and amazingly there was NOT a line for the one toilet for the Men's restroom. Valet parking is offered for $12 by Austin Valet Parking LLC.  Be careful of where you park in this area, sadly there was lots of car vandalism.  Service - All team members were working hard and offered good service. Hannah took care of us, but the "busboy" took service to the next level. He even talked to us while we were waiting in the lobby before being assigned to our table and gave selling suggestions.  Price - If we did not order our entree, then this happy hour dinner would have qualified under one of our "best inexpensive meals".  Owner Suggestion - Please keep your restrooms in top condition. Or, post signs if you have restrooms in other locations in the restaurant. Other than that, great job, especially with your happy hour menu.

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: We stayed at the Fairmont which was very close to Moonshine. We ate breakfast, lunch and dinner here throughout the trip. The food was good and the people were friendly. We enjoyed the drinks and beer as well. The back bar was cute and offered extra room when it was busy.

reviews.author: Mark B.
reviews.description: Moonshine is a great place for brunch, or any meal, as the menu is solid and the service is on point.  Looking for a quick bite to eat before heading out of town (to return home) we arrived at Moonshine early and did not have any lines to deal with. In fact, we were seated immediately and began to peruse the menu.  It was early, so we passed on drinks (though their whiskey list was well populated and the "little brown book", available upon request, certainly peaks a whiskey hound's interest). Ultimately we decided on a couple sandwiches and placed our order with our friendly waiter.  He returned with our drinks and a basket of DELICIOUS spicy popcorn! What an appetizer! I polished off the entire basket without hesitation and it was everything I could have hoped for and more.  Our meals arrived shortly thereafter and we dug in. Everything was very well prepared and tasty. Personally, I had the Sunday House Club and loved it. One point of recommendation though: go without the bacon jam as I found it to only serve to diminish the flavor of the pimento cheese and make the sandwich more messy overall.  As previously mentioned, the service was great. Our waiter and the bus boys were there exactly when we needed them and we were in and out in no time flat. What a great cherry on top of the experience.  Moonshine can get rather busy as the day progresses so I suggest you arrive early and enjoy the food, service, and ambiance. While we didn't check out the patio it looked and sounded very inviting. This place really serves the entire package and you won't be disappointed in your visit.

reviews.author: Amy A.
reviews.description: I would put this place closer to a 3.5, but I can't quite give it 4 stars. They don't take reservations and we were a larger party. By the time we arrived, the wait was 45-60 minutes. We anticipated that and a table opened up in the bar area, so we order a few appetizers and drinks. The bartender got very flustered with us and at one point just walked away mid-order. Being a large group primarily from the northeast, maybe our personalities didn't jive. We did recover, but it was off putting since that was our first interaction with the restaurant.   The biscuits were a hit with the group. The pretzel was ok. We were seated a little over 90 minutes later. By that point I wasn't super hungry, but I ordered the harvest bowl with chicken. Overall, I found it dry. We did sit outside which was really nice as the night was perfect for outdoor dining. Our server was really good and was on top of everything.

reviews.author: Peyton G.
reviews.description: I went on a Monday and they have the best deals!   A large pizza for $9 bucks or a burger and beer for $10!  The pizza was good and the wings were average. I love wings so they didn't disappoint. The bartender was nice. They have pool and a couple of other games. Beer is brewery price like 6-9. There are sports playing. Single and couple or group of friends. Pretty chill I would come again. They had a stage so I wonder if they have shows?

reviews.author: Yelp Y.
reviews.description: It's a decent spot.  Big warehouse with a nice little outdoor nook populated with picnic tables.  Food in terms of the "loaded" fries leaves a lot to be desired (they're not really "that" loaded, so the price for the product is absurd); the pickles tasted good but the fry was quite irregular; the spinach artichoke dip is delicious but the chips cannot lift the dip without you helping them along, either by doubling up or scooping with a utensil.  Beer is alright.  One of the lagers is so-so but the raspberry sour is pretty good.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Super excited to have another brewery in the South Congress area to go enjoy some tasty as heck beers and get in your order for some Southside Flying Pizza or other tasty snacks and items on their menu!  This location will forever be in my heart as the first time I ever stepped foot here was when we were in desperate need for some warm food, cold beer, and water.
