reviews.description: I'm rating Blue Bonnet 3 stars because while we love their beer and have enjoyed it the very much during their Oktoberfest, we were pretty bummed when we went on a Saturday night. We know that they are popular and were even excited to try Jimmy Vega's Smokehouse but when we arrived half of the available tables were set as reserved. There was literally no where to sit. Every table was packed. We had our 3 yr old son with us, so standing wasn't an option, especially since we wanted to eat too. We asked anyway if any of the tables were available and was told no, they are all reserved for 5pm, but you could squeeze in anywhere else. In the end, we left irritated and disappointed, while I understand reserving tables, but when you only have 10 tables and you reserve 5 of them, that doesn't leave much room for anyone else.

reviews.author: Britt J.
reviews.description: Bluebonnet is a great craft brewery with an outstanding lineup of ales, seasonal lagers, and wheat beers. I really enjoyed the Vienna lager. The owners run a hands on, customer friendly business that is a real pleasure to visit. The perfect place to relax with friends and enjoy some really good beer!

reviews.author: Katie K.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed the beer here. My favorites were the Hefeweizen and the Summer Wit.   The guy at the counter was very friendly and went through a description of all the beers. Good place to get a flight to try multiple beers.  There was a food truck present, too. I didn't get any food, but maybe next time!

reviews.author: Melody B.
reviews.description: Beer is good. Great to sit outside and have conversation but the noise from the food truck generator made it hard to have hear.

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: Locally owned family run business that has delicious beer. They always have at least 6-8 beers on tap and a couple seasonal favorites. They have a solid line up across a wide style of beers. The summer wit is a favorite along with the Kolsch styles they release during the fall. I would love to see them expand to a new location  with a climate controlled tasting room which I think would bring in a lot more clientele.

name: Gourdough's Public House
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Late Night, Dessert
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: Gordough's is a MUST TRY for any sweet lover! The warm fresh donut with delicious toppings is my family's favorite for dessert. My best friend was visiting from out of town during the holidays,. We took her there and she fell in love with the Nutty Valentine (extra pecans). She requested that we go there a second time before she was going to fly back. We of course, happily obliged! My go to is the nutty valentine with a topping of pecans, my son loves the black out, and my husband loves the black betty with icing on the side.  We hope to try the savory donuts the next time we're there, it's just so hard to decide between sweet or savory!

reviews.author: Jim S.
reviews.description: I really wanted to love this place.  The place is cool and the vibe is great - loved the 90s music and TVs playing lots of great random stuff. The wait staff was super nice and helpful.    The menu is also amazing - so many thing we wanted to try. We went for the fried green tomatoes, the Buffalo chicken sandwich and the country fried chicken. When our food arrived everything was beautiful. Really great presentation. But unfortunately when we tasted it we were in for a big disappointment. Everything just tasted like salt. The flavors of the toppings and donuts all just blended together with nothing interesting or any pops of fresh flavor. I will say everything was cooked to perfection, but the flavor was just off/missing.   Bummer.

reviews.author: Micah R.
reviews.description: First experience there.  Waitress really woke up on the wrong side of the bed. We didn't get a phone signal inside for the contactless menus, so we asked for three physical ones, and she came back with two and said "is two okay"? She only had three tables total to work, and we saw her on her phone quite a bit. After waiting about thirty minutes to order, she finally came up and as we were ordering, she rolled her eyes and walked away. It was clear she wanted us to leave, so we did.   I understand being short-staffed, but again she only had three tables to work. All in all, terrible.

reviews.author: Minly L.
reviews.description: There is nothing I like more than mixing sweet with savory. It is extremely satisfying when executed successfully, so shout out to Gourdough's for doing it extremely well.   I was actually expecting the doughnut to be sweeter on my dish, and I'm happy it was not. Everything really paired well together.   The vibe is very Austin-esque and the staff was super friendly. My friend asked for no cheese on her burger, they put cheese, but the waitress happily got it fixed up for us.   I can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Ken D.
reviews.description: Gourdough's answers the questions that you didn't know you had. And the answer is always donuts!    How do you make mozzarella sticks better?   Wrap them in donut dough, aka The Big Cheez.   How do you make a breakfast sandwich better?  Serve it on donuts.  The McGourdough is maple sausage, egg, and cheese (on donuts, of course) with maple on the side (opted not to have the pour-over). There's plenty of maple flavor in the sausage so I never used the side of maple syrup.   Once again, how do you make Kolaches better?  You guessed it, use donut dough, aka Gotchie Yo Kolache  And finally, is it even possible to make a Cuban sandwich even better?  Yup! The Cubano, a Cuban sandwich on donuts.   I'm shocked that they didn't figure out how to serve me my beer in a donut!  That's right, a full-bar to go with all that doughy goodness!  Donuts and alcohol, what more do you need?

reviews.author: Trevor L.
reviews.description: This was my first by time here and was sort of disappointed in what I received; I guess my expectations were higher. The description state "crispy fried fillet chicken breast smothered in honey butter."  I did request to have the honey butter on the side. I got two chicken tenders instead of a chicken breast (not to be too critical but the description should be updated if chicken breast = chicken tenders). The honey butter sauce was not what I was expecting; (not a fan). On the bright side, the donut was pretty good. Even thought it wasn't a chicken breast,  the tenders were tasty and had a good crunch.   I did order the miss shortcake and it was pretty good. But nothing special I suppose. Maybe I'll try a sandwich instead so get a full experience. I'll try them again and see if I get a different experience.

reviews.author: Lia F.
reviews.description: my dad worked here when it was a food truck then they decided they were so cool and wanted a restaurant. it was fun while it lasted. i used to make my own donuts. shh don't tell anyone lol. also that guy from wilfred came there once and i saw him. pretty cool. ok bye.

reviews.author: Mechila B.
reviews.description: I came here with a couple of friends yesterday and there was something off abt this place. The food was AMAZING, don't get me wrong, but off vibes.   1. Smells super weird in there Idk if I'm smelling old oil or what but it's weird.  2. There are lots of people working here, yet getting service or someone's attention was hard. We were approached when we first walked in and then after that, it was half assed.  3. I got the cucumber mint drink and it's like a mojito but with rum and cucumber instead of mint. Wasn't my fave, wasn't sweet enough, just tasted like cucumber water and lime juice.  4. Our donuts were really good but I was told by my friend that they were smaller than the donut food truck which is disappointing.  I got the sin a bomb and it tasted just like a cinnamon roll. My friends got the cherry bombs and peach donut and we all enjoyed it!  5. Vibes were just off and my friends agreed. If you're looking for good food, sure, but if you're a vibes type person like us, you'll feel weird here lol.

reviews.author: Aurora M.
reviews.description: From a small food truck to full blown restaurant, Gordoughs still has it! Lots of variety and still the tried and true Gordoughs doughnuts they're known for. The menu is entertaining and interesting to say the least! We got the saucy cock (LOL) which was amazing! I was looking forward to the Count Gordough Cristo, but it flopped in my opinion. The sandwich arrived cold and the ham was colder so I don't recommend this dish. Other than that, lots of TVs to watch the game and great drinks of all kinds!

reviews.author: Kim L.
reviews.description: Was super excited when I heard about Gourdough's and they did not disappoint. We were seated pretty quickly and our waitress was super nice in getting us situated and being patient with us when we were figuring out our order.  There's plenty of seating both indoors and outdoors with additional bar seating. Lots to offer in terms of a drink menu with beer on tap too. Since it was the middle of the day, we opted not to drink though since there was still plenty on the menu for the day.  For food we got the GPH Mother Clucker (not pictured),  Blue Balls (front), Son of a Peach (middle), and Granny's Pie (back). Would hands down come again for the Mother Clucker. The fried chicken was cooked to perfection and it paired so well with they honey and donut with it. Between all of the donuts, I think the Blue Balls were my favorite because the blueberry sauce wasn't all that sweet and more on the tangier side so it wasn't like I was getting a total sugar high like I did with the other two. I did love all three, just the donut holes a little more. As a side note, the menu says those donut holes are supposed to be blueberry filled but ours came with a blueberry sauce on top. Nothing wrong with that, but for future customers looking to try, it's worth knowing.  In terms of price, everything may look expensive, but the portion sizes that go with those prices are definitely reasonable. Plus, the donuts are made fresh and cooked to perfection, so (again) the prices are justified and reasonable for what you get. Almost everything on the menu is also shareable if you're interested in trying a bunch of things without a singular price tag.  Definitely recommend if you're in the area and looking for a place to eat all your calories and try a bunch of different donut dishes. Will be coming again the next time I come to Austin!

reviews.author: paul m.
reviews.description: Absolutely delicious start to finish and very filling! Enjoyed a brunch on the patio this weekend with perfect weather. A very reasonably priced $12 carafe of mimosas for the wife and I, before indulging in the Rise and Shine. Hand breaded chicken tenders atop a fresh donut, covered with scrambled eggs and smothered in queso. Finished off with pico and candied jalapeños. So full of flavor!! Queso was on point.

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: The donuts here never disappoint! They are so good and delicious. I usually get the black out but this time I got the miss shortcake which was delicious and wasn't too excessive like the black out can be. Excellent dessert spot for sure. The reason I'm giving it four stars is because we had to wait roughly 40-45 minutes to get three donuts? That seems a little excessive especially since they did not seem to be understaffed. And when the donuts came out they felt lukewarm like they had been sitting out for 10+ min which is a bit disappointing. Maybe there was something extra going on which is why I'm willing to give them the benefit of the doubt. Great taste which is why I recommend it but maybe just go to the food truck next time?   Overall: 3.9 stars

reviews.author: Des J.
reviews.description: Country Clucker was delicious I wanted more!! The patio area was nice and has good shade for when it's sunny! Our waitress was so nice she even complimented my perfume !  The boss hog was definitely different I loved the potato salad concept that went on it!

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: This place was a dream come true.  They have coffee cocktails and donut based meals.  We tried the fried kolaches and the triple dipper and they were both a hit.  The chips were kinda not enough for the dip but it was good cause if you got a meal you could use the dip as little kick it up.  The coffee cocktails were the bomb dot com.

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: One of the must do's in Austin. Came here for brunch on a Saturday morning, arrived at around 11:30am and did not need to wait for a table. The place has a fairly large outdoor seating area that is super dog friendly. Parking however, is limited. They have a small lot in front of the restaurant for maybe 10 cars. Otherwise, it's street parking, which is also limited.   The food was 10/10! Tried the Rise and Shine, which is one of their most popular brunch items. The chicken is thick and crispy. The egg and quest were perfect. And I am a huge fan of the pickled jalapeños (on top) too. The El Diablo was delicious too, not spicy at all. Also appreciated the huge portions.   Overall, loved my experience here and will certainly come back to try more!

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: The donuts here are delicious mmmmm! Highly highly recommend the Freebird. Sooooo good. They also have a good truck in another location, but the menu is more limited (and they don't have the Freebird sadly).   There's plentiful patio seating so if you prefer sitting outdoors, they've got you covered.  They serve both sweet and savory donuts, and they also have a big selection of drinks (although I've never ordered any of them).

reviews.author: Ryan G.
reviews.description: This is a sold brunch spot.   Their donuts are the bomb dot com, and a cool atmosphere.   Wake up call was amazing, had more alcohol than should be legal. Gonna get this every time.   Their food portions aren't the largest, maybe since it doesn't come with an automatic side. However the food was insanely good. Not a place to go while on a diet.   Mimosa Carafe is the move at $12

reviews.author: Dan N.
reviews.description: Skylar is an awesome Bartender. Her service was five stars, we were blown away by her attention to detail and friendliness.   The Cuisine was to die for.  BIG DAN APPROVES!

reviews.author: Haley G.
reviews.description: Made a stop here for Happy Hour while visiting friends in Austin this weekend and was so glad we did! We came mid-afternoon and were seated immediately without reservations. We started with drinks. I had the Losoya Street Lemonade, and I loved it! It was sweet and tart and not overpowering at all! We also ordered a Water Moccasin Fishbowl. Fair warning, this one was  very sweet! Good but sweet - reminded us of a blue sour patch kid.  After we made a small dent in the fishbowl, we ordered our doughnuts. We tried the Sin A Bomb and the Heavenly Hash. The Heavenly Hash definitely took the trophy between the two. The doughnut itself was amazing (tastes like funnel cake), but the toppings were even better - fudgy chocolate brownie icing, rich chocolate chips, marshmallow cream, brownie batter drizzle... oh my.... It was so sweet and chocolatey, and we finished it QUICK!! The Sin A Bomb was good as well, but the butter on top was a bit too much for us. If we had ordered it with just the cream cheese topping and not the slew of melted butter, I think we would have liked it more. Not bad by any means, just not our cup of tea.  We never felt rushed and sat their enjoying our doughnuts and drinks (and attempting to make it through the fishbowl) for several hours. It was a super laid-back atmosphere and the perfect place to catch up with old friends. In fact, we were there so long that we got hungry again and ended up ordering mac and cheese - which was also amazing! You can see we are the picture of health going from doughnuts to mac and cheese, ha! I wouldn't come here if you are on a diet... everything on the menu is either a rich dessert or a loaded Southern dish. Would love to go back and try some of the food items like the Chicken Pot Pie or Burgers. Everything that the people around us were ordering looked delicious.

reviews.author: Sheri M.
reviews.description: We were visiting from out of town and really enjoyed this little treasure.  The sweetness of the doughnuts as the bread and savory from the meat was divine. I had the chicken pesto, and it was delicious.  Wait staff was attentive.  Only wish there was a bigger drink menu as we saw a full bar but couldn't figure out what to order.  p.s. The peanut butter doughnut dessert was heavenly.

reviews.author: Chris E.
reviews.description: Very nice place, I came from California to try. Staff was nice, bathrooms were clean and the beer was great!

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: Love this place. Lots of good options. I think 8.5 minutes abs is even better than electric jellyfish.  The people that work there are great! Also they host watch parties for Austin FC. Go Verde!

reviews.author: Nancy Z.
reviews.description: Always a great time here! They have Meade, to hop water to yummy Lovely Day IPA.  Clean place and clean toilets.   Don't forget to check out their food truck!

reviews.author: Rosie J.
reviews.description: Such a fun place to hang out and grab a beer and some food! The hopwater is an awesome option if you don't want to drink but still want to have the brewery experience. The food truck was great too and prices are very reasonable.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Great patio that's dog and kid friendly, complete with the Austin Steam Train behind it.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Whitestone Brewery is a great place to grab a beer and relax after work or watch an Austin FC game. They have a large patio for all their events like trivia and bingo and plenty of seating inside. Head here for some great Texas beers.

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.description: Awesome brewery!, excellent selection. Amazing atmosphere!, great service and the food from Van Dams is Awesome with great prices. Just became a Pub Member for these reasons!!!

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow I can't believe I've forgotten to review here. I LOVE their beer and location. Always great beers on rotation and the flight tray is cool.  Only reason for the 4 starts is today we came for what had to be the 6th or 7th  time and got kicked to the outside patio for having a dog. This is ALWAYS the brewery I go to when it's hot because they allowed dogs inside. I've had every other bartender let my dog in, love on him and have had zero problem sitting inside with him. Even their Facebook has a picture of a dog inside. Today we were told that was never allowed and should have been told to go outside. We have also seen many other dogs inside during past visits. I hate inconsistent rules. Also, super sad that we'll have to find a new brewery this summer. It's too hot to be outside and my dogs nickname is the the brewery dog.  I'll still support them during cooler months-- but dog owners should know the rules have changed. Very sad. Wish they would have posted something about this change.

reviews.author: Ryan D.
reviews.description: A nice flight of light non IPA beers. No food. Only a food truck but nice atmosphere indoor/outdoor.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: Great beer vibe. Plenty of seating inside and outside. Parking kinda sucks.  The menu has a really good range of beers that I haven't seen anywhere else. Beer is cold and food options are good too. We had nachos and loaded tots. The Austin FC bold game was on. They had green beer and if you wore green you got a $1 off

reviews.author: Ellie B.
reviews.description: Phenomenal - amazing brewery atmosphere. Came on a Christmas holiday Friday night they had name that tune bingo going, was so fun to watch! Wish I had known would've joined ASAP  God I love Texas

reviews.author: Alexandra P.
reviews.description: Pretty good ambiance. Spaced out seating inside and outdoor seating available. Place was visibly clean and also smelled very clean! We got loaded tots from the food truck outside that were yummy. All the beers that we tried were good but the mango one was my favorite!

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Whitestone Brewery. The environment felt very relaxed and casual and I loved the outside patio area. We got a selection of beers, I personally really enjoyed the Mango Crazy wheat beer and the Keyboard Gansta IPA. The service was also very friendly and they offered some samples if you are in between choices.   The taco truck outside was also very good! I highly recommend one of their loaded fries. The fries were perfectly crispy and tender in the middle, and super flavorful toppings. The tacos were also yummy and I'm a huge corn lover so the elote bowl was perfect.   I will definitely be back to try more of their seasonal beers!

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: It's been a hot minute since I visited Whitestone- I think the last time I was here was in 2016, when it was quieter and a lot more laid back.  Fast forward to 2021 - the city of cedar park and Leander are booming.  There is a huge influx of population. The tables at Whitestone are full, there is a food truck (which is awesome) as a permanent fixture BUT the overall customer experience has left me disappointed.  Maybe because it's a Sunday with lovely weather, the guy behind the bar is done with people, or, he isn't a people person , or, he just didn't like the way I looked? But man was it hard to get him to give me an effing beer without getting hateful glances. Yeesh. Im kinda scared of coming back here now!  That aside, im not really a fan of their beer selection either - the kolsch is OK but I've had better. I guess the biggest advantage is the proximity to both CP and Leander and for the people who live around here.  So, this isn't much of a review rather than a semi rant ?   Also guys- kids have a tendency to move around from one side of the table to the other. They're not capable of sitting still and neither are you. If you'd rather than families stay away, just tell us to our faces.

reviews.author: Nicolette M.
reviews.description: Ambiance - 9/10 Pricing - 10/10 Staff - 10/10 Food - 10/10   Overall, the service is great! The ladies behind the counter are very nice and loaded with insights about the beers. There's a food truck outside that was delish!! (Tacos and burgers) the al pastor tacos were amazing. We did not try the burgers but from what I've seen/heard it's also very yummy! Whitestone is in a great location in Cedar Park, TX. We are heading to Balcones state park to go hiking but saw this along the way and had to stop in. I'm glad we did!

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Huge covered patio! We stopped by while we were in the area and what a nice brewery to grab a beer at. I had the Blonde beer and it was light and crisp. They had a Food truck hanging outside so if you wanted to partake that was great.   Suggestions- In the guys bathroom the keg should be a little bit higher. Pretty tough for tall guys lol. But, I love the concept.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Friendly, on top of it staff and great variety in beer. Love the hop water too! We've been coming here since the opening and it just keeps getting better! Love our Whitestone Family!

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to hang out in Cedar Park but it is in a busy strip mall. The service is good and you can get some beer flights and the prices are very reasonable. My fiancé and I had a good time here and the live music was awesome!  I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Great local brewery!  Friendly and helpful staff, great tasting beers and a food truck out back - what else do you need?

reviews.author: Theresa S.
reviews.description: We like IPAs and we were  able to get a beer flight with 6 IPAs - they were all delicious!  Able to take advantage of happy hour which apparently starts at 2pm.  Seems to be a very popular spot!  Love the beer names too.  Lovely Day IPA and Ray Ray hazy IPA were some of our favorites!

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Went there last night, the place is awesome! Currently they don't have their own beer, supply issues but they have some amazing Austin, Texas and other craft beers. Family friendly spot (a kids play area with kitchen and all!!),good music playlist and eventually some live music. They just have snacks right now but eventually said they'll have a menu. Oh yah and coffee too. We got to meet Derek and his wife, the owners. This is such a great spot to go and work or to relax at after work! Will definitely be back and can't wait to watch this business grow.  We were having so much fun I forgot to take pictures! I'll update with pictures next time I go.

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: Stopped by this groovy place today, and it passed the VIBE check 100^! First the minute you walk in the music is on point! Then there is Rachel, which she's super friendly and beer knowledgeable! Everyone was so friendly! This is the kind of place you can definitely chill for awhile!

reviews.author: Connie H.
reviews.description: First tried this tasty brewery at Terry Black's and was so happy it is served wide and far around town.  I believe my go to was Native but had some Stash at the ball Game.  Yum

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Wasn't a huge fan of their beers (tried a few and was only a semi fan of one) but I like lighter, easier to drink beers and that didn't seem to be their thing- the two beers that sounded like my cup of tea by description wound up being sours, which disappointed me.  I also felt kind of weird about asking for a flight but then being told uhhh we're not doing those right now- seemingly bc the line was long. It was odd.  Small indoor space, kind of lacking something aesthetically - compared to other Austin breweries.   Good truck onsite but it wasn't that good :/  Overall just meh! But they host geeks who drink if you're into trivia!

reviews.author: Danielle F.
reviews.description: Solid variety of beers, some seasonal, and enough space to bring a group (though not as expansive as some other breweries that have more patio seating).  I went for the Beer My Valentine's event and the Garrison Brothers bourbon-aged Convict Hill and Indy's coconut-flavored Midnight Paradise were my faves.  Tonight there was an open area for dancing and the food truck Killa Wasi was there. Really enjoyed our time there though the great event turnout made the beer line pretty long. Will definitely return to sample other beers and see experience it during a "regular" day. Staff was very friendly and I enjoyed the stouts!

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: I was an idiot when I gave this amazing brewery four stars. It's perfect and deserves no less than a perfect rating!   The beer is great, the monthly metal shows kick ass, and it's a perfect location for me.   If you're near here and want to chill at an awesome brewery do so!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Love me some authentic microbreweries.  I haven't been to a solid microbrew spot since moving to Austin, so this was such a breath of fresh air. It seems like there are plenty of breweries that also double as restaurants and music venues--which is cool, I'm all for that, but deep down I'm a plain microbrew kinda gal.  Getting here got me so excited as our GPS took us to industrial surroundings AKA the location of every great microbrewery. There is plenty of parking, and they had a yummy-smelling food truck parked outside, but we already ate so skipped that. My friend and I walked in and immediately felt the warm, relaxed energy that Independence had. I couldn't decide on what pint to get, so I settled on a taster set of four for $10. Not too pricey. The selections were not really in my favor, as I tend to go for wheats, belgians, juicy or hazy IPA's, or oatmeal stouts. However, I knew I would find something I'd like. One can never be too picky about beer.  They also have board games and free stickers! I love that!! Their logo is the lone star on black fire--super cool. Our taptender was a wonderful and friendly man. I just wish he would have been a little more wordy with his explanations of the beer profiles. I'd assume that microbreweries attract devout beer drinkers and self-proclaimed snobs (like myself), so I would love it if he was able to elaborate more. Anyhow, I will be back even with a larger group (yay picnic tables!), but I hope that they have more varieties of beer, or that they rotate their taps often.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: This is Austin laid back recharge drink great beer! Food truck yes (Good Truck) So after much sampling while listening to live music I enjoyed an amazing burger. Employees are fun and extremely knowledgeable! Lots of seating in building and out. Tucked behind a row of office. We like hidden places!

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Indep brewing has been around for 15 years but this brick and mortar is 5 years running. Cool location, industrial feel. But let's get to the beer selection..  Freak power is going for $2/pint right now! Honestly, you would be hard-pressed to find a deal this good anywhere in Austin TX. It's a hefe and goes down easily, very easy to drink.  My personal fav is the convict hill oatmeal stout, coming in at 8% and tastes like coffee. Also very easy to drink and is a nice addition in "wintertime."  Good place, fair prices, decent selection!

reviews.author: Wajih O.
reviews.description: I stopped by this place on a Friday and it was my first time visiting as well as my first time trying their beer(s). I was a little taken back at how low in ABV their beers were but that isn't a deal breaker by any means. In fact, out of the entire selection on tap, only two were higher than 5% and they both happened to be a staggering 9%. The interior is nice and very spacious.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Victoria W.
reviews.description: This is one of my favorite "hidden" gems. I don't know how hidden it is, but the first time I came, I was skeptical because it is tucked behind some businesses and inside a warehouse. However, once we discovered this great, laid-back brewery, we visit it at least monthly.  Our favorite activity is Thursday night trivia with Geeks who Drink there. We've been a few times and it's always fun! They allow outside food, so it's always fun to pick up some bites and enjoy their awesome beer as we Geek it to random trivia.  I highly recommend, especially on a Thursday night! Hope to compete against you soon!

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: Nice indoor and outdoor areas. Nice selection of drafts. I enjoyed the Freak Power Blood Orange. The Crossroads food truck has a nice selection. I loved the spicy chicken tenders and the Brussels Sprouts. Very friendly service. Located south of 71 and east of 35. Tonight I was inside and it was hotter than the hinges of Hell. Air conditioner was blowing cold so not sure why the room was so hot. At sunset they opened the garage door and it cooled a bit. High today was 100 degrees.

reviews.author: Jennifer H.
reviews.description: Super impressed with this brewery! The beer is awesome, the staff are great and the atmosphere is pretty rad! 10/10 will drink there again!

reviews.author: Greshka P.
reviews.description: Last stop of our brewery tour. This is more of what I'm used to in Florida...  warehouse turned into taproom. Beers listed on the wall, not that many options here but still good beers.  One of the beers I wanted to try ran out so they recommended another based on that selection. Good job, I liked it.  It was a bit sour, so it hit the mark.  But the one I liked the most was the End Credit Chocolate Hazelnut Porter. The hazelnut makes it smooth, and the chocolate flavor comes through as well.    The staff was cordial, not overly friendly, but it's patrons sure are. They made room for us to walk up an order, they asked what I had ordered, and made recommendations based on what they had already tried.  They had live music that day too.  Very entertaining, good set, he even dedicated a song to one of my friends.  Very cool!  They have games like chutes and ladders, Rock Trivia, Oversized Jenga, and more.  Beer and entertainment, can't go wrong with that!

reviews.author: Stacy E.
reviews.description: This brewery is an austin staple. I say hidden staple actually because it took a while to find this place, but once you do, you won't want to leave. With awesome craft beer, great hipster service and entertainment usually on the weekends you will have an awesome time. Try the beers on special, but also try the ones that are mixtures between two beers they are special and only unique to this establishment. The bathrooms are clean and there are snacks by the register, but be sure to eat before you get here since some beers are heavy and you might get full which really isn't a bad thing, but good to know!

reviews.author: Gilbert C.
reviews.description: Nice tasting beer selection. The Convict Hill stout is very good! Nice atmosphere with indoor/outdoor seating. The taco from the food truck was very delicious. Will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: This brewery has been around for several years. I'm not sure what their secret it but Hubby seemed to enjoy their beer. I loved the live music and great t-shirts.   It's a little bit of a trek but well worth it. Pups are allowed so bring your four-legged friend on a leash. Aw, you know beer and dogs go well together!  There is, oddly, a Ceviche food truck in the parking lot. Hmmm. Beer and Ceviche? Kind of like pairing Thunderbird wine and a fruit salad.

reviews.author: Lauren L.
reviews.description: We were looking for a quick drink before heading back to the airport. We grabbed a passion fruit berliner weiss. It was light, delicious and refreshing. No frills. Plasic cup.  There's out door and indoor seating. Parking was a bit of a maze. Worth a stop if you are in the area.

reviews.author: Geoffrey C.
reviews.description: Great beer, great people, great vibes. Be careful on where your directors take you. It took us behind the brewery. But you'll find it on the other side. It's a really large place and they set up picnic tables right outside the brewery.  The Sunday afternoon I went, I believe there was some event wrapping up. DJ was playing 90s RandB/Hip-Hop which contributed to the great vibe. All of their beers tasted amazing. I ended up going with their sour beer. Perfect balance of sourness and fruit. I would definitely come here again.

reviews.author: Christopher F.
reviews.description: Cool brewery tucked away in a wearhouse.  It can be a little hard to find from the road as it is behind retail.  But once you arrive, there is indoor and outdoor seating.  There are occasional food trucks.  Plenty of games including jenga.  I like the chill vibe.  This is a great place for an afternoon drink or three.  The bartenders know their stuff.  Ask as many questions as you like regarding the beer choices.  You can do tasting flights or go right to the pint.  I prefer the Stash IPA which is one of my local favorites.  Other beers are good too.  Can't go wrong here.

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: When I was visiting friends in Austin last month, a friend and I decided to hit up a local brewery for a couple of hours (it's a tradition of ours). I had to pick up my brother at the airport after, so I was looking for a place that was southeast, so Independence fit the bill. When I lived in Austin, I used to drink Independence beers all the time, but I never made it out to the brewery. I was impressed! It's really large! Tables inside and tables outside. They have several beers to choose from. The line for the bathroom was REALLY long, but we happened to choose a day that had an event (puppy adoptions I think) and it was PACKED. All in all, good beers, they were playing good music, and I had a great time with my friend! Great afternoon, and I'd go again!

reviews.author: Al O.
reviews.description: Great pizza, easy to order online and take out - or quick to order and drink beer while you wait! We order their pizza once a week - love the BBQ Chicken.

reviews.author: Sean B.
reviews.description: There is a lot that is planned for this place. Well, that's what I was told. Certainly has a cool canvas to work with.  The beer is good. There are lots of shiny distractions on the menu, for sure, but there are some solid entries as well.   The food is nothing amazing. It's just ok. And wow what a wasteful process to give everyone a pizza box. I guess you are not offering the pan it was cooked on or some other dish you don't need to wash or dispose of, and I'm sure they are recyclable, but you just have one trash, so what's the point. Maybe you are saving water instead of trees.   The events are cool, fun stuff. And like I said, a great space for it.   The bartender/manager guy is very snooty, but I guess if he is that proud of the place, that's good for him. You just get the feeling he'd care less if you were there or not. I can pretty easily choose not to go just to not need to deal with that.   But, I'll be back.

reviews.author: Joe Q Pubic F.
reviews.description: UPDATE::: Greg doesn't put his "Money" where his mouth is... His response 'Will make improvements is BS"  Look at the current review reviews they're keep coming..., the bartenders are still rude, and "The beer is Blah" how is this to operate a business????  You treat a customer with respect and gratitude, guess what they will be coming back.. think of all the repeat customers you losing out on, because of your rude staff...  Do appreciate small business, but if you dont even care about yours and really improving the overall customer experience, why should you...  Setting yourself up for disaster.   I would find replacement bartender with a positive attitude with a smile in their voice..  Whos there happy with their job, not watching the clock for 8hrs to go by...

reviews.author: Jena C.
reviews.description: The hubs and our puppy Bowie were out playing in the park and worked up a thirst! And of course an appetite!!  We've been wanting to stop in here for some time and I'm so glad we finally did! The beer is tasty, I only had a few sips since I'm driving but next time I'm pounding some brews! However the pizza!! Omg!! Now that was delicious! I ate half the pie to myself and sadly I feel I could have ate the whole thing haha the crust is chewy crispy, the sauce tastes freshly made, the cheese actually has that cheese flavor and not some pre shredded cheese bs! Oh and the pepperoni!! It was so flavorful!!  Now for the atmosphere! As soon as we walked in we were greeted with smiling faces!! Everyone was so friendly!! I swear this is the first place in Texas that I felt truly welcomed!!

reviews.author: Paul C.
reviews.description: Suds Monkey has opened its new location and what a great improvement!   Large open air seating inside and out with local live music several times a week.  Fresh pizza to go with a good beer selection. Not just IPA s, Porter, Amber, Blonde, Hazy and more. Wine option also.  Membership options have nice perks too.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: Great warehouse brewery with good service and even better beer.  The coffee blonde was the absolute best.  I would definitely buy that beer again.

reviews.author: James G.
reviews.description: We love Suds Monkey!!!   Your bartender, Kristen, is outstanding!   She suggested the perfect beer for everyone in our group like she had been serving us for years!  Thank you for a great time and we can't wait to come back!   Also the pizzas are amazing!!

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Came here real quick while I was waiting for some friends to show up to our house, and so happy that we did! We parked out front under the shade, and walked around... Then you just walk up and place your order. I ordered the Pilsner, and I can't remember what my boyfriend got and we also ordered some garlic knots. They have indoor and outdoor seating, you just have to walk around the building. We chose to sit indoors and watch the football game, wasn't too long before our food was ready and it was bread-tastic!!!! There is so much flavor, I would definitely order again it... I cannot wait to try more of their food and come back for more chill vibes! Thanks for the awesome experience Suds Monkey!!

reviews.author: Morgan D.
reviews.description: Love this place when we go through Dripping Springs.  Never miss an opportunity to get a growler filled at the least. Enjoying the music and new environment.

reviews.author: Carlos H.
reviews.description: This is a great place to hang out and sip on some suds with your buds. Carter was awesome and feisty, but mostly witty and awesome.  Carter if you see this, please send me the video of the burn out. 301-247-3808

reviews.author: Steve P.
reviews.description: Greg - thanks for promptly addressing the growler miscommunication at bingo.  Great customer service, beer, and venue.

reviews.author: Eric M.
reviews.description: Probably one of the worst breweries I've been to in Texas. The beer is just blaaa. They are unfriendly people too.  I wouldn't waste my time going here when there are so many good breweries in the area.  No need to check this one off your list.

reviews.author: Jaime B.
reviews.description: While at the ROT (Republic of Texas) Motorcycle Rally, we found this place. This place is must visit. Beers selections are great and the service is top notch. Carter livens up the place but be careful she's a psychic, LOL.

reviews.author: David S.
reviews.description: If i could rate lower than a 1 I would, staff is rude, I have been going to Suds Monkey since they opened at original location, new location is bad . They have forgotten how to treat customer. staff is rude, service is bad. do not go there!!!!!So many brewery options in dripping springs, pick another option.

reviews.author: Jim J.
reviews.description: I'll always remember my first bite of their cheesy bread inside my hotel room at the Holiday Inn.   Wish I could comment on their beer, but it's much easier to find a good IPA than a good pizza, so that's all I was interested in this time around.   Dropping Springs is surprisingly weak when it comes to dining options, so this is a no brainer for some unpretentious food after a long drive.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: This small brewing company is a real gem!  The folks here are friendly and happy to chat about the brews.  They have a convenient way to order and pay by phone.  Tables are spaced far apart (covid precaution).  We had The Jugo IPA, a juicy and it was delicious!  Many places don't get the hazies right but this one got it down.  The Punk Monkey Porter, on the other end of the spectrum was equally tasty.  Looking for something to do?  Want to try some great beer?  Check this place out.

reviews.author: Alton M.
reviews.description: Responded to an eventbright invite for a "crayfish boil".  Tickets said it started at noon and would go to 9pm.  Showed up at 12:30pm, crayfish not ready.  Bartender said it would be 10 minutes.  Finally at 1:15 first batch.  It was only then was I told there was a "wait list" I had to sign.  Batches were so small only about 8 people could be served and it took over 20 minutes per batch.  FINALLY, at 2pm I got crayfish.  They had run out of sausage, no potatoes, 1 small piece of corn.  Watching the Laurel and Hardy show of the "cooks" was hilarious.  They had no idea what they were doing.  Between 4 years in NOLA and 25 years in TX, I've been at least 100 crayfish boils. WORST ONE EVER.  Based on how mishandled this "event" was, I would never return.

reviews.author: Lola C.
reviews.description: Had the pleasure of checking out the beers at Suds Monkey. I ordered a flight of 4 and they were all really good. Reasonably priced and a really nice taproom.  There's pizza available too but didn't try that out.  If you've got kiddos there's a playroom to keep them busy as you sip on beer.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: Just ordered delivery for the first time.  Had the two pizza deal with cheesy bread.  Awesome flavor and crust.  We also had the salad which was fresh with tomatoes and peppers and mozzarella sticks  - awesome.  Ordered the Pale Ale which hit the spot.  Five Stars Guys - easy order with perfect delivery.

reviews.author: Troy O.
reviews.description: The beer and pizza are so so good! I recommend the challenger pizza and funky monkey ipa!

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: This pandemic has taken us all for a ride. The folks at Better Half had a nice and cozy building then a worldwide pandemic hit that required you to avoid that.exact.environment.  And they rolled with it.   On several occasions, we used their pickup and it was great. They were efficient, considerate (all the utensils and napkins) and the food was always good considering we would eat it while parked at Zilker.  Well, we finally decided to eat there this time. They have an awesome covered...tent or something, that fits up to 60 folks. They even had a heater blowing in that thing!!  And the food, whew. The grilled halloumi plate was so creative, we loved the mix of flavors. The spicy chicken sandwich was different than at other places, in a good way. I left trying to place all the flavors and can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.  A cool bonus is the view from the parking lot. I was able to take a quick picture.

reviews.author: Patrick H.
reviews.description: Possibly the rudest customer service I've experienced in Austin. There was a drink mixup and instead of accommodating us, they were rude and accusatory of us, as if we were trying to steal drinks from them. When in reality, the mixup happened because their waitstaff doesn't know what their food and drink items are by looking at them. They would just put the items down on the table and walk away. Instead of remedying the issue, eyes were rolled at us, and we were told if we want something else we needed to come inside to the bar and "pay for it ourselves".   We also had brought a birthday cake. It's an outdoor coffee shop and bar with a super casual atmosphere. When I asked if we could use some utensils, they told me that I shouldn't have a cake on the premises (which is "standard for restaurants") and that it would be $15 for us to use their forks and/or consume the cake on site. They said I should have called ahead. If it was a nice sit down restaurant and not a bar that has a Sunday brunch, I would have.   Again, this is an OUTDOOR coffee shop and bar. We had a big group of 20 people who all bought a ton of food and drinks, and we were treated like we were taking advantage. We were super patient (I've worked in customer service and know how awful people can be, so I always treat waitstaff with respect. But this is not that).   Never coming back.

reviews.author: Zach Y.
reviews.description: This place is really good! I really appreciate the outside seating. Coffee is a little pricy but really good. Great place for outside chilling, pet friendly, cabanas for shade.   The inside is really modern and really fast. They get you your drinks and will walk and deliver them to you outside. Great place for a morning coffee with friends!

reviews.author: Shahrzad Y.
reviews.description: The cauliflower tots are a must! Delicious! The coffee is great! Staff are very friendly. I wish there were more pastry/sweet options on the menu. I was not a big fan of the donut balls i tried, though they were hot and possibly freshly made. They were a little dry and dull for my taste . The breakfast sandwich was amazing too and they had a vegan meat option which is wonderful. Plenty parking, which is a plus in Austin and great outdoor seating too. Will go back again!

reviews.author: Tracy K.
reviews.description: We were in Austin for my daughter's 30th birthday and her being a Coffee shop owner herself, she brought us to this place. It did not disappoint us. All the food was amazing... Try the cheeseburger with an egg on top... You'll love it!. Another fan favorite among the group was the spicy chicken sandwich. It definitely has a lot of zing to it. Overall highly recommend the place. Great outdoor space as well.

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: Great place to come for light eats and drinks- my friends and I came here in a group of 6 around 8pm on a Friday and found it easy to grab a table on the patio. Parking was also relatively easy since they have their own parking lot. They have happy hour Tues-Fri and Sunday 3-6pm, with $6 burgers! They also have reverse happy hour 9-10pm daily (also $6 burgers). The patio is very dog friendly and there is a self-serve water jug as well to help yourself. The food was delicious and a good portion for the price.

reviews.author: Arianna L.
reviews.description: Came here for brunch with a friend on a Sunday! They were relatively busy but we got served quickly.  I ordered the waffle iron hashbrowns. The portion was smaller than expected but the food was really good - the had browns were crispy and the Parmesan with the sunny side up egg paired really well with their gravy. I liked how the pickled onions added a sour kick to the gravy, but preferred the dish without the onions.   Would definitely come again and sit outdoors, if the weather permits!

reviews.author: Shelby L.
reviews.description: This is truly one of the most enjoyable meals I've had in a while. We went on Labor Day so it was quite busy and took probably a good 40 minutes to get our food, but it was absolutely worth every minute of the wait.  The Pastrami Sandwich had the best, smokiest pastrami I've ever had and everything from the mushrooms to the bread to the berbere horseradish sauce was just so well executed and damn delicious.   The Big Springy salad was a nice healthier contrast that still tasted interested and decadent (okaay, we added fried chicken, that might not be the healthiest). It was a little light on the cojita-chimichurri dressing so we got some more, and I just wanted to jello shot that condiment cup straight into my mouth it was so good.  I started off with the chagacinno and while it was a tad sweet for my preference, it was still absolutely delicious as well.

reviews.author: Kandice S.
reviews.description: Took a birthday trip to Austin and was looking for a place to have a nice breakfast before I left. I had heard this place was one of the best breakfast spots in Austin and it did not disappoint!   I ordered the chicken biscuit and completely cleaned my plate not a crumb left! I will say the chicken was slightly salty but nothing i couldn't handle. The chicken tastes like it might be brined that would be my guess as to the extra salt (not sure if they use a brine or not). The cocktail was pretty good too went well with the sandwich.   From the description I was thinking there was going to be a spicy marmalade sauce on the side to dip the biscuit in which would've been amazing but nonetheless still a very good breakfast sandwich will definitely be going back the next time I'm in Austin!

reviews.author: Carlson Z.
reviews.description: One of my go-to coffee shops in Austin! I always take my friends and family here on the weekends for brunch. I absolutely love the backyard patio vibes - seems like a very chill spot to just hang out and chat.  I don't really recommend coming here to study or do work as this place can get quite rowdy. The same owners also opened a brewery right next doors called Hold Out Brewing, so you can slowly transition from productivity to drunken stupor if that's your thing.

reviews.author: Ami A.
reviews.description: Delicious food! I came for brunch and loved my meal! The fall salad with fried chicken was an orchestra of flavors! Every bite was an explosion of textures, flavors and a visual masterpiece. Sweet potatoes, pumpkin purée, pistachios, greens, radishes, apples and more. Definitely up there with top ten salads!

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Better Half Coffee and Cocktails belongs in the book of Austin AF restaurants. What does that even mean? Innovative menu using fresh ingredients with high prices.   Our table of 3 split the entrees and shared as easy apps to get the full experience of the brunch AND lunch menu. For brunch, we ordered the Waffle Iron Hashbrown, which was literally a plate of overcooked hashbrowns, topped with coffee and cream gravy, cotija cheese, an egg, pickled onions and scallions. Sadly, this was just basic to me (or as Gen Z calls it Cheugy). Nothing that I would die for...  For lunch, we ordered the Vermicelli Salad, the Chilled Ramen, and a side of the Cauliflower Tots. I could not get enough of the Vermicelli Salad and strangely the Cauliflower Tots! The Vermicelli Salad was refreshing and light, and I enjoyed the Pineapple "Fish" Sauce substitute they use to make this dish vegan friendly!! The Cauliflowers admittedly looked like burnt bite-sized toast when it arrived, but as soon as I dipped it in the beet ketchup, I couldn't put my fork down.   BEWARE! If you order any of the Frozen Sloppee Frozen Cocktails, this thing will mess you up (in the best form possible). I would advise ordering with caution! The Spicy Peach'arita was my poison of choice, and though delicious, if you add Texas heat, it will melt fast and have you only tasting tequila!

reviews.author: Bri D.
reviews.description: Mmhmm.  Better Half was gudt eatin.  There was a line out the door on Sunday morning but it moved quickly.  Parking was easy.  Shout out to my guy, Dylan, the coffee program manager for my latte.  It was slammin, just like he used to make em in HOU.  For eats, I got a biscuit with avo and the cauli tots- like the cauliflower, not the beet ketchup, but I'm not a beet girl.  Great space.  Great color scape.  Plenty outdoor seating to spread out and catch up with ur folk.  I'll be back.

reviews.author: Tiana W.
reviews.description: Ordered for pick up. Got the cauliflower tots and fall salad with shrimp.  Cauliflower tots were crispy and tasty, beet ketchup was good.   Fall salad, tasted good overall. I enjoyed all the flavors. Was a bit disappointed on the size of the shrimp though.

reviews.author: Melanie P.
reviews.description: Love this place!! Great casual date night spot or a place to bring visitors! Such a fun austin experience with the picnic tables. And the food is amazing! Get the cauli-totes and thank me later

reviews.author: Katie S.
reviews.description: A hidden gem for food.   $6 cheese burgers (shockingly good) $7 cauliflower tots (so good we ordered two!) $6 sangria at Happy Hour

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: First time visit on Sunday and I had a pleasant experience. This place is cute and cozy with a decent food and drink menu.   Everything we ordered was spot on, from the chips and queso - the big salad with steak - to the burnt cheesecake with cherry. I am not a huge fan of cheesecake but this one was just right. The pink sangria was delicious - perfect summertime drink.  We'll definitely be back again - I do recommend.

reviews.author: Auston P.
reviews.description: Where do I start?? First off let's just say... yes come here and no it's not like a traditional coffee place. It's a full on restaurant and cocktail bar more than anything and I love it.   Food: I haven't had a bad thing here yet.   The Smoked Pastrami sandwich is absolutely off the chain. Flavor is everywhere in it and it's smoked to perfection. 100% must try.    The burger is off the chain as well, super fresh and clearly made with care and intention.   Service: ASK FOR Kyle, he's seriously the bomb.   the people here are super friendly and after my second visit they knew me by name. Very welcoming and give great menu advice.   Drinks: they have some fun drinks here. Zero complaints.   All in all this place is bomb. I come here at least once a week!

reviews.author: Talitha C.
reviews.description: I forgot to take pictures as I was enjoying myself at this cool restaurant. It has a cozy indoors but plenty of seating outside. We started off with a brunch drink that I can't remember the name of, it had champagne and vodka, but it I was really good.   I was eyeing their creamsicle latte, but I wasn't in the current mood for a coffee drink, so sorry I can't tell you about it. It looked good though. They have some very interesting selections for coffee that I'd love to come back and try.   Food- we ordered the cauliflower tots with beet ketchup. It comes out looking like tofu and the taste is very good. The beet ketchup is a nice addition. My husband got the hash browns topped with Cojita gravy. The gravy was so good, the hash browns were cooked to hard, but a easy fix for next time. For the table we got the Pastrami Chips and Queso, that tasted like a brisket. I got a summer salad which was probably the only thing that we had that was meh. My friend had the chicken biscuit in which she said was really good. All in all I would like to come back again as their menu had some interesting items on it, a good looking happy hour and for the most part the food didn't disappoint.

reviews.author: Ryan G.
reviews.description: What a great outdoor brunch spot. Carafe Mimosa is the way to go if are out with friends.   Chips and Queso are a must. Honestly one of the best chips and queso apps in Austin thus far. Both elements were fantastic.    The breakfast burrito isn't the largest thing in the world so if you're hungry make sure to get a side or an app along with it.   Will definitely come back.   There was a time limit on our table which wasn't preferred and the tables themselves weren't amazingly comfortable.

reviews.author: Dean L.
reviews.description: So many good things to say. I first and foremost am not a cider guy. Came in here on a referral from a friend and was surprisingly impressed with the operation. The cider was good they had some crisp ciders that came off more like a beer if that's what you need. My favorite was the blood orange or the pear. Still a toss up between the two. Also this place has some crazy good wines. They are cheap for a much better quality compared to the ones you get in most stores. They had football running great AC for that Texas heat. Best of all they allow dogs! When I came in my novice skills when drinking wine and ciders were put aside by the owner who gave me a great understanding and tour of his selections. The staff are all super friendly too!  There are no downsides to this place. Except for the hangovers. (Mostly self inflicted) I recommend Sundays. For your visit. There is a cool little coffee shop inside too. Nervous Charlie's was serving up brunch. Soo many good combinations outside of your regular mimosa routine. Do yourself a favor. You are not too cool to break away from your traditions to try this place.  In regards to the cider snobs leaving bad reviews. They obviously didn't come here for something new. Why would you want to go somewhere that copied someone else? Boring.... wish they could get more stars.

reviews.author: Sarah T.
reviews.description: Hate cider. I come here for the wine and ambiance. Both so funky. Also, Spokesman Coffee.

reviews.author: Mr. S.
reviews.description: We bought a couple ciders to try. They were so god awful that my buddy secretly poured them out in the bathroom. It tasted like i was drinking a funky armpit wine. Gooooooooooooo

reviews.author: Khloe P.
reviews.description: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! First of all, these people are assholes. Came here for a bachelorette party and their beer sucked! The manager was rude and I had a bug in my beer! No refund, no apologies and not a sorry member from anyone from the staff!!!! Stay away from this crap shoot!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Support. Your. Local. Cideries.  I'm not even that gung ho about ciders, but a lot of my girlfriends are. I'm so glad we stopped by Fairweather. It's very laid back, intimate, and relaxing with its clean aesthetic. Down in South Atx, we have Texas Keeper (awesome cidery, very different fireflies-on-the-porch and farmside vibes), so it was nice to see a completely different cidery with literally garage-space, elevated, and hipster vibes.   We both got cider flights, and loved the diversity of selections. Their ciders are all hilariously named (Fuccboisen is my favorite...I should've ordered that). I enjoyed their Smell the Van and EZ Tea (it truly tastes like tea!). The EZ tea was so delicious. Quenches thirst, subtle, and very honey-like. Their ciders aren't sickeningly sweet, and the flights give you a great little taste of all of the ciders that you're curious about but are unsure about getting a whole pint of. Their inventory has a clean design too. Their tees are super adorable, as well as their BEVERAGES sweaters. Tempting.  Service was wonderful. Our cider taptender was a wonderful man who was very sweet, knowledgeable and welcoming. The space is small, so it's not recommended you come here with a huge group (unless you plan on taking up the entire space. They have strong wifi, serve-yourself water, and different styles of seating from regular tables to taller barstools. They have little succulents on the table along with a well-designed menu for their "specials" deals. I would usually go to 4th Tap next door, but why not do both and hit up Fairweather too?

reviews.author: Katie G.
reviews.description: Love this cider taproom! Try the rose cider-it's perfect. Tables are spaced 6 feet apart and it's open air so very safe for Covid. Cute decor and fun, upbeat music. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Christopher R.
reviews.description: Frozen Rose "Frozè" is super delicious!   Currently,  they have "PowerFade" as the frosty frozen drink! Super good, kind of like a frozen margarita. This cidery has really good drinks and hosts Austin FC watch parties. Fairweather also has partnered with Spokesman Coffee if someone in your group wants a coffee! If you're here at 11am, which would you pick? Why not both? Good vibes, good music, and a great atmosphere.  Bartenders are super friendly. I like it here! Check out 4th Tap and the pizza truck outside as well!

reviews.author: N S.
reviews.description: Accompanied my cider-loving friends as the only non cider lover and was delighted to not only see a couple of The Austin Winery staples on the menu but also a fridge full of multiple natural wines that the host warmly introduced us to, from sparkling moscato to skin contact. The pet nat was INSANE. Seriously gorgeous, open, airy space with beautiful murals that instantly put you in a good mood

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: I usually am not a fan of cider...at all! But, after some friends who are also beerdrinkers suggested this place and that it wasn't your typically overly-sweet cider (which is what I have the aversion to) suggested this place, I decided "why not?".  The vibe here is super chill and the cider-barista was super nice and everyone there chimed in when I asked about the diff ciders they were offering.   So I will say, while I am still not on the cider bandwagon (I mean beer will always be my first love), the ciders here were actually drinkable! I enjoyed that they were on the drier side so your mouth isn't annihilated by chocolate and you can actually appreciate the different flavor components of each one! I will also give them kudos for actually packing a little bit of a punch w/the abv, which you don't usually see with ciders either!  Definitely enjoyed the vibe and the concept here!

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: I was going from brewery to brewery when I noticed Fairweather Cider company and immediately knew I had to stop by and give it a try. Great ciders in a cute little shop. If you live in North Austin and are a cider enthusiast, this is a good spot to stop by on a Friday night!

reviews.author: Gina M.
reviews.description: Liked how chill this place was! Huge screen for sports. Bench seats with high table and a bar. Some doggos were there and you can bring your own food in.  I think a coffee shop was attached too but it was closed at night. We got two samplers and honestly it's hard to pick a fave and the flavors were fun!   Great place to hang out and have some drinks. *went in the fall! Plan to be be back this spring since the doors will be open * fingers crossed**

reviews.author: Vik M.
reviews.description: First ACTUALLY dry cider I have had while in Texas. Please do yourself a favor and visit this tap room.  It all started with a long wait for barbecue and a guy wearing a cidery shirt/hat. A quick google search later I dragged my family to this tap room so I could get a cider fix (having spent five years in the PNW it is a tough itch to scratch here in TX). The bartender/coowner was extremely friendly and ready to answer all questions. He was adorable and alone was reason enough for a follow up visit.  My sister and I had a flight of their four ciders on tap. Currently:  Common: base for all other cider, ACTUALLY DRY. In lurv Tejano dreams: green chile cider, bomb af. Strong pepper aroma and beautiful subtle Chile flavor. Nelson sauvin (I think).... very strong hop flavor forward with sweet cider finish. A good balance for people seeking hop flavor while trying to expand to cider. huell melon: hop flavor is SO subtle that it almost tastes like sour fruit flavor. I LOVED this cider. I can't wait to try it again.  Opens only Fri-Sun this is definitely a stop to add to your weekend plans. There are big things coming for this cidery. I can't wait to watch them grow.  I loved this cidery and cider and definitely recommend to anyone in the area.

reviews.author: Amber K.
reviews.description: I really love Fairweather's concept and having a new addition to Metric Row that isn't another brewery! (Love to y'all breweries, though.)  I came here the day after opening day with a few friends who love cider (I'm indifferent) to try out their brews. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised!  We each ordered a flight of their four ciders on tap. One was the Common, which is the base for all their ciders. Another was one of my favorites even though it involved a little heat from some peppers! The last two were hopped ciders, and the bartender/co-owner told us if we tried them first in different orders, we may like one over the other. He was right, both both were delightful.  I want to give a five-star review to support a new business, but my only tiny complaint would be the fruit flies. Some kept buzzing about here and there, but you can only imagine they want to get a taste of this dry cider sweetness!  If you're a beer person like me, you may have found a new hangout for your friends who don't love beer as much as you. But you'll still enjoy what Fairweather has to offer -- so much so, I ordered a 12-oz pour of my favorite hopped cider after my flight!  Good luck, guys, and congrats on your opening!

reviews.author: Emily K.
reviews.description: This cider is heavenly! If you like dry, innovative ciders (think boysenberry, blood orange + hops, cider with electrolytes) you've got to check out Fairweather. It's well-priced, and the tap room is spacious and bright. You can even take a crowler home!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Fairweather was a surprise find for me thanks to the wise owner of Sunrise Mini Mart.  That guy knows SO much about all different types of distilled liquids, I wish I had a brain that could store that much knowledge.   I digress, this review is about the awesome family who started Fairweather (super friendly and knowledgeable).  I bought their cans of Common and was blown away.  Cideries claim to have dry cider all the time, but it's not TRULY dry.  Common though was legit.  These guys are making a truly BONE DRY English style cider from apples sourced from the PNW.   It's not perfect yet, but you can taste the potential. It reminds me of Shacksbury.  The fun artwork on the can intrigued me to go check out this spot that was just a few minutes drive away.  The tasting room is TINY! Start small and dream big! Kuddos to them for turning a cold warehouse space into a fun modern hipster community watering hole.  On a Friday night, get here early to even find a spot to sit!  I arrived around 5:30pm and sat at a high table outside and had no line.  By 7pm, people were crowded elbow to elbow, with a long line.  There also is very limited parking.  Be prepared to take time to find a spot and walk.  When they state they are pet friendly they mean it. Not only was my furry friend chilling with others, we were soon joined by a parrot!  I had a great time. I had come by myself, but ended up having several great conversations with people I had never met before.  Truly this place is only months old, and has quickly become a new neighborhood hang out.  The ciders are all 6.5%.  You can enjoy a flight of 4x4OZ for $10, enjoy a glass, or enjoy a guest cider or something from Austin Winery. I love the local support for other local liquid makers. There is a wide range of ciders to choose from.  They have some fun experimental ciders that were not like anything I have tried before.  It's hard to choose just four for a flight.  They have their staples- Common, EZ TEA, and Tejano Dreams, but also some Dry Hopped Ciders, and fruit ciders. My favorites were Tejano Dreams (nice kick), Gin Bot, and Dr. Rudi.

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Fairwheather cider was definitely a surprise and a hidden gem. It's a very small location but it is in the burnet brewing scene, as it's located right next to 4th tap. Their cider is so amazing with fusions with sweet tea, gin, wine and different fruits, it'll definitely give you a pleasant experience you may not have been expecting. They also have so many more flavor options than what they offer in the store so id go to the cider for more options. You can also take pictures in front of the interesting wall art with the unicorn things going on.

reviews.author: Elyse Z.
reviews.description: If you like dry ciders, this place is for you. The Tejano Dreams is my favorite. They also have wine if you are not into cider.   Place is a little small. You can get a flight or by the glass. If you are usually a beer drinker or new to ciders, they will definitely let you try a few so you can find your favorite.   If you are hungry, there are usually food trucks at 4th tap and they let you bring food in. It is not officially dog friendly but sometimes they have a table outside when the garage is open.

reviews.author: Alex D.
reviews.description: Great local cider, in the "brewery area" of north Austin. They're got cute merch and you must try the jalapeño cider!

reviews.author: Angel L.
reviews.description: This taproom has a very minimalistic and industrial aesthetic that makes it a perfect place to catch up with a friend. It's quite small, but there was ample seating when I was there. Their cider is different from most of the dry ones I've had before - my favorite was the common with citrus-y flavors. The Apple flavor wasn't as strong as I was expecting (or used to with other ciders), and maybe that's just the case with a "true" dry cider. It tasted almost like a wine, which is great if you're a wine lover, I suppose!

reviews.author: Leslie V.
reviews.description: Love this place! I had a cider flight and loved all four selections. The vibe is really cool I will definitely be back!

name: Cork and Barrel Craft Kitchen and Microbrewery

reviews.author: William Z.
reviews.description: Friends told us their pizza was great so four of us went last night to give it a try. Turns out they only have one pizza on the menu, pepperoni, but boy is it good. Perfect crust. Sat by a warm fireplace and   Fantastic interior with very nice decor. Very upscale!  Typical pub type menu. Fish and chips, burgers, Reuben's, etc. give it a try.

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: I really like this place. Its interior is beautiful and thoughtfully designed. There a large yard with plenty of space for the kiddos to roam as well.   We had an excellent server and really liked the "Snug" we sat in.  The seating options are pretty and a unique feature actually.   Seating: Large tables, small tables, "Snugs"(private little cubby with plenty of room), bar seating, outdoor tables and cozy seating around a fireplace outside.   The food: Pretzel w/ dipping trio. Yes! These are excellent w/ an awesome sourdough flavor.  The fish and chips was pretty good. Great batter with a ton of flavor in it. The pizza (ordered without the pepperoni). The dough was under proved and under cooked. Ok at best.  The irish stew was pretty to look at but had none of the heart or depth of flavor that you'd expect from a stew. My soul was craving a hot heart stew, no luck. Disappointing.   Drinks: No wells here!! Just a quality selection of excellent wines and spirits.   We'll definitely be back and try a new selection of foods! If you're looking for a place to visit/meet up, this is a great venue. Plentyyyyyy of room!!

reviews.author: Sam B.
reviews.description: Can honestly say I look forward to coming back here. I want to start off by saying I hadn't eaten breakfast, lunch, or dinner prior to arriving there which you could only imagine I was hangry(hungry + angry)    So I park my car and Soon as I step on the curb to make my way towards the door the hostess had already opened the door and was greeting my wife and I with a warm and friendly greeting.   As a manager myself, I always preached that our customers should never have to touch the door and I was so glad to see this establishment have the same values about it as I do.   We sat down and in no time our waiter Homer was at our table greeting us. I must say he was very personable. He truly grasp the concept of building rapport with his customers.   The food came out pretty quick which was a huge plus because a I stayed before I was "Hangry"  My fries were cold, but then again they're fries so I just asked for some fresh ones that had some heat to it lol.  My wife order the 8HR Braised Short Rib and she stated it was just ok.  I asked for lemon pepper wings, My receipt shows that's what I got, but I can tell you that want what came in my plate. Was I made about it NO, why you ask? Because whatever the heck it was taste pretty darn good. I should have asked what was I given because I wouldn't mind ordering it again.  My fish and chips was freaking AMAZING and whatever little SAUCE they give you to dip you food into.... AMAZING!!! make sure you ask for extra so you get enough to dip your fries in it to lol. My wife tried my fish and chips and said she couldn't wait to come back to get that next time.   On our way out the door the host struck again with grabbing the door for us and she did it with a smile. As I was walking my way to the car another employee told me how much they appreciated our business and I'm thinking to myself write your done working your on your way to your own car to head home and you still take the time out to make is feel special. I feel that the friendly service has us excited to come back and eat here again and we are looking forward to it.

reviews.author: Alyssa R.
reviews.description: I've gone twice so far.  First time was terrible. They have us a terrible table when the restaurant was empty. Service was terrible. Out of almost everything we wanted. Food was average and took forever coming out. Second time was a lot better. Nice table on the counter patio. Food was available and came in a timely manner.  I really enjoyed the Pear and Fig Pizza and Wings. As well as the burrata

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: Such a fun new spot! Met a bunch of girls for lunch. Ciara was the sweet host that was so accommodating. We had reservations but switcheroooed on her with the table and she was super nice. Found us the perfect spot.  Angel was our waitress and she was just as great! Larger group... kept her cool... recommended great choices for us.. I had half arugula salad and sandwich and 2 glasses of Sauv Blanc ... the managers came by and checked on us... one lady and one man...  Great service, great outdoors... good filtered water... yes I can tell...  I will be back to try out patio and bar in the very near future!  Would love to try more items on the menu. And I did tell Angel I would be back to see her... I love that it's dog friendly and the outdoor seating is amazing... love the string lights... good ambiance... clean bathrooms...  Great for lunch date, happy hours or large groups!

reviews.author: Chenaniah B.
reviews.description: Our waitress was really nice and attentive to my wife and my needs. Will be back tomorrow to try more of the delicious food and drinks! Huckleberry wheat beer is my new favorite will definitely come back more often!

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Cool spot for inside and outside dining. The outside patio has strings of lights everywhere and a cute "whiskey barrel" table for a couple to sit at.   We had their lemon thyme wings and there so awesome. So crunchy and flavorful. We also had their special pizza and it was good! A little too greasy for us but you can tell everything was extremely fresh.  Our server was super friendly and she even let me sample the Bloody Mary mix that I asked about.  The charcuterie board looked tasty, we definitely want to go back and try it!

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: Beautiful restaurant!!! Service was awful! Food just ok!  The fish and chip is flavorless! The carrot cake was strange!  The lemon pepper was was good!

reviews.author: Michael Q.
reviews.description: Been here a handful of times and it's been pretty solid each time.  Work happy hours mainly for me and the food is pretty good, burger is solid for a choice. The pretzel sticks very good!   The beer selection is apparently good (I don't drink but my peers do). Alcohol menu is good also based on my peers.  Came here one weekend for brunch and brought our toddler not great for them. They don't have high chairs here so not the most toddler friendly place. Think again if you child is learned to sit etc, not a bad spot for older kids though.  Overall decent spot I'm sure we will be back for work happy hours

reviews.author: Mariel V.
reviews.description: They brew their own beer and have a massive selection of good wines and provisions. It wouldn't be an Irish pub without these yummy fish and chips, now would it?!  It's the only time I'm down to go to a pub - I'm not a beer person but I love a good beer battered Irish fish and chips. The only way I'd take beer.  The place is gorgeous, spacious (big groups are welcome!)  We wished we didn't have to leave. Their back patio is beautifully by a creek. They also control the mosquitoes which could ruin any patio dining experience for me. It's a win all around!  I can't wait to come back to this piece of Ireland in Round Rock, the managers told us that a lot of their restaurant decor are from Ireland shipped here. That's pretty personal and lovely in my book.

reviews.author: Brittney C.
