reviews.description: The vibe here is killer! You can totally dress your visit up or dress it down which I love!  The ambiance is absolutely great. Staff is friendly, never have I ran into any issues with reservation or walk ins. If you want to sit outside I would recommend just calling in and making a reservation.   PET FRIENDLY! Same goes with my recommendation with a reservation, if you're bringing your pet just make one so they know where to seat you outdoors. Call before :)  The menu is great! I've tried a lot of different vegetarian/pescatarian options on the menu and haven't been disappointed. You have to try the pizza!   I don't drink alcohol so I can't review on that but from what I see and have heard it's really tasty.   I love going to lunch and dinner here, so much fun.   The patio has one of the chillest vibes in the area.  Go eat and chill! :)

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: First of all, the place is beautiful inside and out. That's the main sell 100%. The food is good and so are the drinks but a little overpriced for their outdoor menu. A guiness draught at any type of irish pub shouldn't go for $9 nor any bar for that matter in my opinion. All food and drink prices could be $1-2 less, especially if it's a limited outdoor menu. If we were dining in (and it's beautiful inside + full menu offered), I could see those prices being fair. If the drinks were to be $1-2 less in the future, we could see ourselves being regulars, but definitely not until then.  Two of our friends ordered the wagyu burger, when asked on how it compares to a non-wagyu burger, they said they wouldn't have noticed anything especially different to a regular burger in comparison if they had not read the menu.  Nonetheless, they seemed to enjoy it.   I would order the reuben sandwich again with the kimchi slaw. I thought the kimchi slaw was very creative and it added nice flavor contrast to the otherwise classical meaty cheesy aspects of the reuben. The kimchi by itself was good, they use older more fermented kimchi, which gave the sandwich a bit of sourness to it.   My wife ordered the fish n' chips, one of her favorite barfoods. The fish itself was very moist and tender and it appears much larger in portion size than what we were expecting when looking at other user's yelp photos. The chile-lime tartar sauce wasn't very 'chile-limey' at all, it tasted just like regular tartar sauce, don't get me wrong - we LOVE any tartar sauce, but they could dial up the chile and lime all the way to the moon if that's what they're advertising.   Lastly, the staff was nice, although our waitress basically dissappeared for the second half of our stay and kept forgetting/taking an unquestionably and questionably long time to get our drinks and takeout box. Service was just OK, there is always next time.   Bonus points for the restrooms, very neat, clean and well decorated.

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: Having brunch here isn't simply eating a meal, it is a complete experience. Yes, the food is AMAZING! The Fish and Chips  and Reuben Sandwich are delicious and portions generous. The craft beer is also the best (Huckleberry wheat).  Plus the place is filled with great atmosphere, and plenty of history. Our server (Jewels) pointed out the wall plaques located all along the restaurant filled with tidbits of information. This contributes to the experience. The music is great and staff friendly. A very happy place! We drove from South Austin to visit, definitely retuning soon!

reviews.author: Jocelyne V.
reviews.description: This brand new brewery is the spot to be lately and I can understand why : great outdoor space and patio,the ambiance is both appropriate for a romantic date or a friends outing.  I had the charred vegetables which were delicious although the portion was quite small. The pepperoni pizza is cooked in a wood fire oven and was delicious. Overall, it was a good experience, my cons would be the service (organization still balbutiating and we waited 30 min for our drinks) and it's pricey for the size of the portions. $14 a cocktail is overpriced, but their craft beers were good.

reviews.author: Ashleigh L.
reviews.description: I've been waiting forever to try this place out. I was so excited to have a kid free evening. The ambiance is great, what beautiful architecture. The drinks were "okay". Not great, but not bad. The food was what was disappointing. I ordered the flaming bacon burger. The waitstaff that brought it over, said "wait I have to light it on fire", and she took off quickly without another word and before I could ask how long I was supposed to leave it lit- We had said we hadn't been there before, so it was all new.  So my entrée tasted like 151. It was gross. The fries were pretty generic, so they didn't make up for the burger debacle. Likely to return? Nah.

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: 5 stars for the atmosphere/design. 4 stars for the manager that tried to help correct some mistakes. 3 stars for our server that seemed to have pushed beyond her limit. 2 stars for a good looking menu that was greatly under-delivered. 1 star for the overall management and organization of the restaurant.   We had a group of 6 that was sat outside on patio. We ordered charcuterie, pretzels, wedge salad, hot wings and lemon pepper wings, a beer flight, the Carrie Bradshaw, the smoked margarita and a few standard mixed drinks.  After placing our order, we were brought 5 place settings for the 6 of us. We asked several times for the 6th set which was eventually delivered after all the food was gone. The servers keep saying that they didn't have any silverware or plates left!  ‍  Our drink orders rolled out so slow that we had to go to the bartender ourselves to make sure the order was ever placed. The manager came over to apologized which was very nice and professional.  The charcuterie was delivered without any explanation  of what everything was. It was a very odd mix of flavors from sweet to acidic that did not pair well.  The pretzels were by far everyone's favorite. But it was also served with no description of the 3 sauces. The thick white cream was actually an amazing garlic butter that we all devoured once we finally figure it out.  The wedge salad looked beautiful and was enough for all 6 of us to have some. I only thought it was weird that they covered it in ranch inside of blue cheese   Both flavors of hot wings were so salty that it ruined the rest of the flavors. The sizes were good though.  All of their beers except the ipa fell flat and not good. The mixed drinks were super yummy and I really enjoyed my Carrie Bradshaw.   The 6 of us were all in agreement that this place was such a sad waste. It looks so cool and could be really something great if they execute their food on a higher level and manage their staff/facility better.  We won't be back unless they can turn it around

reviews.author: Kelsey D.
reviews.description: Ambience= 5 stars  Food=3 stars   Came here during the soft opening week. It's a big, beautiful space with lots of different sitting and hanging out areas. The outdoor games will be perfect for friends, parties and the kids. I know my toddler will love running around and playing and checking out the turtles in the creek down below.   The food was okay. We spent $80 at lunch with water. They desperately need a lunch menu!!! Please add a lunch so the locals can come enjoy the place during the week.

reviews.author: Noanya S.
reviews.description: Nice location, atmosphere and staff. I took a star away for a food preparer not having on gloves.  I started with a glass of caymus since it's $2 off for Happy Hour and although it's yummy as usual the tiny pour made me a little sad but I have to remember some people measure wine to the T. We also had the drink with Tito's and watermelon and the one with empress gin and rosemary, both were tasty and again $2 off for happy hour. For an appetizer we had the pretzels and the short ribs and both were prepared well. Finally our meal, I had the Cuban sandwich and my friend had the roasted vegetables, no complaints about either and I'd absolutely order the Cuban again. I'll definitely be back but may steer clear of wine due to tiny pours unless I get a bottle.

reviews.author: Gretchen A.
reviews.description: We visited again this weekend, our third time since the opening, with another couple who was joining and had not yet been to CandB.  All of us commented how the atmosphere is lively and how we like the decor and that service is good.  But the consensus this time, as at our other visits is that the menu is somewhat disappointing.  The food is a cross between general bar food and a smattering of Irish pub dishes.  What we had was fine but a variety of true entrees is what's lacking.  Maybe more Irish fare would be good like shepherd's pie, corned beef and cabbage, smoked salmon, etc.?  The burgers and sandwiches are okay but just a few more options would be great.

reviews.author: Cynthia D.
reviews.description: We've been here a couple of times already -- we're kind of addicted to the patio space with a lush green lawn overlooking the river forested with beautiful trees. The beer and cocktail selection is fantastic, too. I will have to update my review after we have the opportunity to eat indoors. After two visits, the outdoor menu (while great), was getting a bit redundant. Chicken wings, salads and pretzels all very good.   I believe they have more offerings inside, so again -- we'll try that as soon as possible.  Also: don't miss the restrooms! They are super cool. The women's room was inspired by the luxury restrooms on the Titanic, I believe!

reviews.author: Yashasvi C.
reviews.description: This place is one of the best places in Austin to get pizza. Very fun environment, and the staff are extremely nice. I once got a free pizza because they were busy and they got my order just a little late.   I would recommend to anyone that would stop in Austin.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: This review is based upon the bar and drinks only.  My husband and I stopped in for a drink since we had dined earlier next door and didn't want to overpay for another drink. In retrospect we should of dined here instead because the prices were way better and it smelled amazing.  Anyway, the bar area was nice and plenty of places to stand and or sit in the dining area. The food smelled so good and would love to grab a slice and a drink next time while here. They have gluten free options to include side and pizzas.

reviews.author: Ana A.
reviews.description: This place never disappoints. Food is consistently good! The prices are fair. And the service is straightforward.  I would recommend going in the weekdays because of the wait time.

reviews.author: Andy N.
reviews.description: Wow. Without a doubt, one of my favorite places in Austin, TX. I had grown tiresome of pizza, but Pinthouse reignited my love. Their innovative twists on a classic dish was truly incredible from the first bite when the diversity of flavors exploded on my tastebuds. Also, the price was phenomenal for the amount you get. One small pizza was MORE than enough to fill me up and leave me beyond satisfied. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying all their specialty pizzas. If you're looking for something incredible and affordable, this restaurant is an absolute MUST. Innovative, fresh, affordable, and delicious; it can't get any better.

reviews.author: Leslie C.
reviews.description: Pinthouse is our go-to for when we order, always fresh, everyone is great!  Pepperoni Basil pizza is awesome!

reviews.author: Angela C.
reviews.description: Yummy.  I think their pizza dough is the best in town, which is a requirement for a truly good pie.  I'm particularly fond of The Works.  The veggies have a grilled flavor that is delicious and unique. If I'm going to eat a pizza it needs to be outstanding.  Thanks, PintHouse Pizza!

reviews.author: Edgar R.
reviews.description: I've been to Pinthouse Pizza a couple of times now, but decided to take my family for the first this past weekend.  They really enjoyed the music, loved the food, and liked the variety of draft beer. The people at the bar were really nice and offered assistance with picking different beers for our flight. The lady taking our food order was in a bad mood, but that shouldn't take away from the restaurant's review.  Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Nicole P.
reviews.description: I went once and will def go back! They have an extensive beer menu and the food is great. This was our backup dinner after our planned dinner failed and I was really happy to have a good experience as we randomly chose to dine in. Service was friendly and offered beer suggestions when I asked. We ate chips, queso, and pizza. queso and salsa were great considering we weren't at a tex mex place. The pizza was cheesy with flavorful toppings. They have a small patio and there's parking in the strip center it's located.

reviews.author: Missy F.
reviews.description: If y'all aren't eating pizza from pint house you missing out. Are you kidding me with the drink and app specials. Okay, I'll take 3 please. Pick up was ridiculously easy. Also, the people are so nice. Tip them because they deserve it!

reviews.author: Lorri P.
reviews.description: Oh gosh!!! I had lunch here Saturday with friends who live in Austin and it was nice!!! We are visiting from out of town and it was my local friends suggestion. Both indoor and outdoor seating available, great happy hour prices and AMAZING PIZZA!!! I had the schrooming goat pizza and house salad. So good! My daughter and friends had the pear pizza and it looked amazing. We will definitely return'

reviews.author: Doug P.
reviews.description: Super fun place with lots of cool beers.  They have pizza, pretzels and other brewery food.  The chips and salsa could have bought at the convenience store across the street as there was no creativity for $6.  The pretzel and pizzas were top notch.  We tried several of the beers over the course of two visits in two days.  All were really good and I would have the. Again if I ever go back.  The beer bases are awesome as well. Very helpful in finding the right beverage on a hot Texas Summer day.    Worth visiting!!

reviews.author: London T.
reviews.description: Management is trash. Disrespectful and did not accomodate us. I brought 8-10 friends to this location because the other location was so great but The dude with colorful hair and the other supervisor woman with shaved sides Of her head made our experience so poor that we ended up leaving to find another joint.  I own and run a brewery in Torrance CA and I would highly recommend the beer here but this location in specific has extremely poor management and should receive a major facelift.  0/10 would NOT RECOMMEND to anyone in my Family or any friends.

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Always been such a huge fan of all things Pinthouse...food and beer! Their crust sets them apart from other 'za joints and they craft brews are right up their with any of the big guys (if you know, you know!).   During Covid quarantine, I have been taking advantage of their online beer release ordering and curbside pickup. Yay! Really hope this "new" process doesn't change. I also discussed they sell their dough to go, so I've been getting more creative in my own kitchen making pretzels and other yummies.   What else can I say? Nothing really, except go...just go! If you haven't yet, you're sadly missing out on this Austin institution.   Congrats on all the expansion and continues success Pinthouse! Cheers!

reviews.author: Sandra Y.
reviews.description: I'm a fan! I love this place! Their happy hour is amazing! I want to drink their ranch by the pint!  (I've discovered I only really LOVE love their specialty pies though - Honey Pear is possibly my favorite pizza of all time and the Banh Mi one is so fun and spicy and there's so many textures and flavors but it all works really well.)  Pictured is The Works and it wasn't anything special in my opinion. But I will always go back!! For Honey Pear  Note: Happy hour is M-F from 4-6pm and its $2 off pints of PHP beer as well as $2 off beer mates (cheesy garlic bread). Only complaint is I drink beer too slowly so maybe next time I'll order 2 before happy hour ends ;)

reviews.author: Natalie H.
reviews.description: I've been to Pinthouse Pizza a handful of times now and every time I've visited it's been great. The food is always hot and tasty and comes out fast. The staff are friendly and accommodating. Not pictured is the pepperoni and basil pizza, which I love. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Daniel D.
reviews.description: Not only are the pizzas here at PHP unique, the flavors somehow just work amazingly well. For example, my friend convinced me to try the honey pear pizza (I was suspicious but got it anyways), the tanginess of the pear with the sweetness of the honey and caramelized onion, with the saltiness of the prosciutto made it one of my all time favorites! Of course, they have "regular" pizzas as well, which were also quite delicious. PHP is also a brewery. I won't claim to be a beer connoisseur (it was good beer, that's all I can say), but the combination of beer and pizza here is amazing! Great laid back atmosphere with excellent pies.

reviews.author: Kristine C.
reviews.description: I am vegan so I got the shroomin goat with vegan cheese. Their pizza is absolutely DELICIOUS!!!! The ingredients were fresh and the breading was perfectly soft and the pizza was super flavorful. Awesome place for both vegans and non vegans wanting pizza at a super good price! The small was enough to fill me and to have some leftovers for my next meal!

reviews.author: Soham R.
reviews.description: Nice ambience with a good selection of pizzas. The pricing is reasonable and the servers are friendly.

reviews.author: Angela Y.
reviews.description: Pinthouse makes my favorite pizza in Austin. Unique and tasty pizzas with the right flavor profiles. My go-to has to be the honey pear, but I've tried most of the others and you can't go wrong. Three slices of the large pizza is sufficient to get me stuffed.   The inside seating is plentiful, yet the place is somehow always packed and very loud (think, so loud I have to shout to hear myself). But the hassles of dining in is still worth eating the pizza fresh and hot. You can ask for to go plates and forks for your party if you'd like to eat elsewhere. There is ample parking and employees are all kind.

reviews.author: Sametra B.
reviews.description: The beer and the pizza was AMAZING!!!!!!! My daughter literally kept rolling her eyes in the back of her head raving about how great her pizza was.   We went with the Cannonball and the Pepperoni and Basil. Needless to say, WE WILL BE RETURNING! Truly a must-try. It was really authentic and the sauce was fabulous!!!!

reviews.author: Jennifer B.
reviews.description: I come here for takeaway every 1-2 months. Am stuck on their burger and pretzels with beer cheese, and have never regretted my choice. Food is always hot and fresh, ready when I am and made to order. Wish they would include more beer cheese, but that's just cause I like it so much! Would love to come in for a pint and check out more of the menu and plan to do that soon. Staff are friendly and helpful. Overall a place I will frequent as much as possible when I'm in the mood for a good burger.

reviews.author: Conrad C.
reviews.description: 10/10 white claws. I highly recommend the Mango,  be sure to ask for the reserved ones in the back.

reviews.author: Craig L.
reviews.description: Fantastic beer selection, friendly staff, and welcoming atmosphere.  Food is fantastic, too.

reviews.author: Samuel T.
reviews.description: Was there about 9 pm last night. My companion wanted a really good burger and Yelp gave us this place.   We were the only patrons eating at tables. There were a few guys at the bar. Since I wasn't really hungry, we decided to order their signature burger which is made with ground brisket and ground meat from short ribs. I asked for it to not be overcooked. We talked about the cooking temperature with the waitress and she assured us it would be cooked medium. When it came out it was more like well-done. Pretty dry meat and not all that tasty. The bun seemed like it was homemade and was good, as were all the veggies they put on it. Fries were nothing special.   We will be back and I will try their fish and chips.   Service was good and the prices for what we had were consistent with 2021 inflation prices. I am sure this would be the place to be when a soccer game was on.   Music playing on their sound system was very good too.

reviews.author: Nate T.
reviews.description: Fish and chips is enormous and delicious, best I've had in years. Properly poured Guinness is always a treat. I'll be back as soon as I can.   Also, who gets a margarita at a British pub? Any review mentioning margaritas should be deleted.

reviews.author: Jack K.
reviews.description: I just took a trip across "the pond" for my first visit here. Not really across the pond but 15 minutes away. This definitely brought me back to my Navy days of Portsmouth and London Pub style fish and chips! Perfectly battered and fried with that nice light crunch when you bite into it. The buffalo cauliflower bites was a first time try for me also. All vegetables need too be made this way. Not too spicy but just right.  This was a takeout order and everything was still hot and crispy when I got home. Perfect spot for any occasion.

reviews.author: Jessica A.
reviews.description: The fish and chips were really good.  I have only been once but it was tasty.  The wall art is cool too.  Go and try it.

reviews.author: Taylor A.
reviews.description: As a Brit in Austin, after moving here and finally settling in, naturally the next step was the go on a hunt for good British grub in search of a slice of home. I came across the Fort Kenney Pub in Yelp and knew that the following Saturday would start with a fry up!  When we walked in, the staff were all super friendly and welcoming. It wasn't busy as it was still early but there was plenty of seating and the football could be seen from most of them.  The food was great and everything I had hoped for! I subbed black pudding for an extra sausage which our server was more than happy to do. The sausages were really delicious!  Really enjoyed spending my Saturday morning here eating a yummy breakfast. I would love to come back to try some of the other meals on the menu!

reviews.author: Jeremy A.
reviews.description: Great pub with great food.   Been here 6 times so far.   Just super loud inside.   Very hard to hear each other while dining.    Great beer selection and good cocktails too.   Can't beat the fish and chips and their burger

reviews.author: Adam L.
reviews.description: A word to the wise, the Sunday dinner is insane for a mere mortal.  My wife was definitely a victim of eyes bigger than tummy!  I got a burger that was actually pretty remarkable, tho I couldn't enjoy the pretzel bun thanks to this stupid diet!    The bathrooms are clean and the entire facility is well kept.    The staff was outstanding and everyone was super.on the ball.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: The food is fantastic! We've been to the UK several times and this is authentic to what we get there.  The restaurant itself is a bit warehouse ish. I feel like they could have done better to give it a pub feel. It feels nothing like a pub which was disappointing.  I'm docking one star for the Pimm's Cup. It's made with that awful soda machine Minute Laud Lemonade. It was horrendous! That was all I could taste. Simple syrup and Minute Made Lemonade.  I also docked a star for the music. It was SO LOUD. My husband and I couldn't talk. Literally. Couldn't hear each other. We were starting to question whether we're hitting an age where we say things like "the music is too loud", but no. No no no. This was freaking ridiculous! They had a lady there playing it for an hour before she started what I think was a quiz or game. Music should add ambiance. This felt like we were sitting front row at a concert. It was insanity. To the point I'm totally okay removing a star because of it.  We'll probably go back for the food, but if we're in the mood for a cocktail, or conversation, it won't be high on our list.

reviews.author: Garrett D.
reviews.description: We've ordered from here a few times and quality of food and service is usually good. Today we got the burger, side salad, and chicken tika. Burger didn't come on pretzel bun like usual and meat was basically raw. Side salad was a generous portion but the cucumbers were moldy. Chicken Tika was awful. Looked like freezer bag pre cooked and seasoned chicken, dry and tasteless without the sauce. Rice was soggy mushy, clearly too much water in rice cooker when it was made. Bread that came with the tika had a yellow gel slime. Going to get people sick or worse serving up food like that.. When I called to let them know about the bad produce two different people took attitude with me about it, poor customer service. As someone that works in the food service industry I'm disappointed. Will not return or recommend to anyone.

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: Cool neighborhood British pub with proper fish and chips. Come with an appetite because the large was the size of my forearm. Loved the tarter sauce and Indian curry style sauce which accompanied the fish. The Mr. had the cheeseburger on a pretzel bun with British style bacon. Happy hour drink prices are $2.00 off. Very friendly and attentive service. We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: Today, on this lazy, rainy, gloomy, post-#AustinBlizzard2021 Sunday, Hubs and I were on the hunt for some true comfort food! Thus, we knew that crossing the proverbial pond was a must! This is how we found ourselves at Kenney Fort Pub. Can I just say, y'all, that what we had here was just what we needed? This is true English pub food, and it warmed the very cockles of our very recently frigid hearts!   Hubby went with the English Breakfast! As he was wolfing it down, he looked up at me with an actual sparkle in his eyes, and he said, "Do you know what this reminds me of most recently, honey?", and I said, "Yep!"! I knew right away that he was referring to that Irish Breakfast that he got at the military part of the airport in Shannon, Ireland, on the way to his too long deployment in Afghanistan in 2018! The picture that he sent me on WhatsApp of that breakfast in that airport is burned in my memory forever!   I went with the Sunday Roast, and it was bloody fantastic, as well! The picture tells the whole story! So good! Chris ate 3/4ths of it, which is our usual division of restaurant food, but I just loved everything about it! The horseradish sauce was MAGIC! I could bathe in it!   We ended with the Sticky Toffee Pudding, and damn, y'all! Just damn!  Bottom line: if you've never tasted either of these traditional plates across the pond, but you're the sort that likes little tastes of many things, both of these dishes will be RIGHT up your alley!   And, even if you're not down for little tastes of many things, you'll absolutely wax poetic about that pudding!   What a fantastic find!   p.s. Our server was Noah, and he was a gem!

reviews.author: Alex H.
reviews.description: Came here tonight for the first time, to meet friends, and it was so good. Service with a smile, great appetizers of the pretzel with beer cheese, and buffalo cauliflower bites. The fish and chips is so freaking good. Fried to perfection and so light. While it's not close to me, I'll definitely make my way out again.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: A solid 4 star experience!  I loved the fish (the chips were ok!). The burger was smokey and the meat was fresh. The fries that came with the burger were tasty. Everything was well seasoned. The kids fish and chips was great and my 5 year old ate it up.   I did not like the tikka masala. It was not creamy and felt heavy on the cumin. It was a smaller portion and not very much sauce. This was the only dish I didn't care for.     Also, when you pack up a to go order, please package the naan separate from thee sauce. It was packed together and the naan was all covered in the sauce that I didn't like so I didn't eat that either.    They need clearer instructions on what their pickup curbside process is. It was a little confusing but we just called and the man who answered brought our food out.  Maybe we were supposed to go get it inside?  I don't know.    I'm glad Kenney Fort Pub is in our neighborhood. I am sure  that we will be ordering curbside from them frequently.

reviews.author: Netta K.
reviews.description: I had really high hopes but I left disappointed.  I have had British food in a many locations and this left me wanting.  I feel they either put an Texas flare or their own take on what British food taste like.    The burger was good, you  can't really mess up a burger.. well, maybe. The banger and mash, yall.... no. It tasted like a warmed up Slim Jim, the mashed potatoes had an odd flavor that none of could place. Maybe the mustard?  The staff was very helpful but it kinda sucked I couldn't even get a paper menu, my QR reader wasn't working on my phone.   I'll give it another try but will definitely not get B and M again!

reviews.author: Nancy P.
reviews.description: Can't believe I haven't written a review here yet.  I went out of my way to get here. Was so looking forward to eating real British food.   I was going to be out this way during my first vaccine shot at Dell Diamond.  It was around lunch that I arrived here.  Waited a short time until they opened. Yes, I was the first one there.  First stop was to the loo.  Yes, it was labeled Loo. Started off with an order of iced tea.  Sorry, Brits no hot tea on a hot day. I asked the server if I could possible try the Black pudding they serve with breakfast. Turns out the server was one of the owner. So I got a slice. Ordered up a Scottish Egg and a plate of Bangers and mash.  I have had Scottish eggs before. These were a bit different because they used British sausage.   British sausage is very much leaner than US sausage.  The sausage meat surrounding the soft boiled egg was denser.  And it was served with picalilli (British salsa).  Loved these starters. Next up the bangers and mash and a slice of black pudding. Had to try the black pudding first.  Trust me it is not a pudding but a blood, oatmeal, pork fat, spices sausage. Before you turn your nose up, try it. A little nibble and interesting flavor. Bigger bite and it was good, before I knew it I finished it off and wish I had more. The banger was a Cumberland made sausage.  Lean pork shoulder meat makes it different than US sausages. Once you get over the difference, It is really good. But the mash potatoes, oh wow. They add mustard and cheddar cheese to theirs. Next batch of mash, I plan on adding mustard to mine. Now if that isn't enough, Red Onion gravy.  Take a slice of sausage, dip into the mash and make sure you have the gravy on it.... Prefect bite. I keep thinking the next time I go, I will get the fish and chips. But as I am writing this, all I can think about is the Bangers and Mash.

reviews.author: Jeff U.
reviews.description: We came back   Juju had KF Burger    Dang good burger   I tasted it and it was good   Pyper had pizza     Bland  Uncle Joe had fish and chips-his looked better than what I had first time. He likes it   Molly had kids fish    Not too bad   Shared the loaded chips for appetizer  nothing to write home about   Margaritas tasted  weird     Can't put my finger on it   Still marginal..... but I came back, I told you I would  Expensive

reviews.author: Lauren F.
reviews.description: I was so excited to find this pub! I ordered a lot of different vegetarian foods to go, got home ten minutes after receiving it and was immediately disappointed. The chips (fries), claimed to be triple fried for the ultimate crispy texture, were basically thick limp noodles. My next dish was just a soggy mess. I can't even remember was my third plate was, it was that underwhelming. I might try this again and sit at the restaurant.  The key might be eating it immediately, not in ten minutes.

reviews.author: Priscila M.
reviews.description: First time at Slab BBQ and it's already our go to bbq in the area. First, all meats are gluten free! Yay!!!! Second, their meats are delicious! I had the chicken and the brisket and both were really good , seasoned well and very moist - cooked to perfection. I couldn't finish my salad and took maybe half of it home. So, portion wise, this is also a win. My daughter had the 1/2 ribs and we were all taken by surprise on the flavor. Seriously, TRY their RIBS!!!  They have a selection of different sauces, including a strawberry one that came with the ribs. I was very skeptical at first, but it worked pretty well. However, their mustard based one is my favorite.  We can't wait to be back!

reviews.author: Kara M.
reviews.description: Great BBQ for an even greater price! I was really impressed with everything we tried, and for it all being just under $50, it was worth it. It's not your "traditional" BBQ stop - the menu is really fun and there are some pretty creative treats to try, from Texas-sized sandwiches to habanero strawberry glazed ribs. The meats were tender as could be, the flavor was incredible, and the sauces were amazing. Will definitely be visiting again!   Service: 5/5 Food: 5/5  Individual food ratings: - Habanero Strawberry Glazed ribs (5/5): sweet and spicy (but more sweet), these ribs were perfectly tender and had really great flavor! You can get them without the glaze, or get the glaze on the side. - Smoked Gouda Mac'n'cheese (4/5): pretty tasty mac, very cheesy and creamy, would be great with hot sauce or meat. - BBQ nachos w/brisket (5/5): super loaded, huge shareable portion, and great flavors! Add extra sauces on top to get saucy. - El Jefe sammie (5/5): brisket, onions, peppers, and Fritos for some crunch, this was a great sandwich and super filling! - Twice baked potato casserole (3/5): needed a kick or maybe some more salt/pepper, but was good overall with the dank white sauce on top.

reviews.author: Rose J.
reviews.description: Finally a barbecue joint worth raving about. When you enter you are met with the smooth sounds of  music. Very chill vibe!!!   The menu pretty easy to survey and food comes out quick fresh and hot! Those are the things I love quick fresh and hot. The prices are appropriate and the sides are reasonably priced. Also the baked beans was the business. Oh, yeah the nortorious BIG was delicious! It's topped with Cole slaw and piled with brisket very tender meat!   I love this place and it was a short drive from the hotel.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: Good stuff! I was very hungry in the late afternoon and heading to play many competitive games of ping pong, so I stopped here. The food was yummy. The pulled pork sandwich had very good flavor and the Mac and cheese was fabulous. They also serve beer which complements BBQ , IMHO. The service was courteous and prompt. The dining area was clean, though we opted to sit in their temporary outdoor seating area because it was a beautiful day. Check it out as an alternative fast food option.

reviews.author: Nicole P.
reviews.description: Umm YUM! Checked Slab out for lunch mid week and it was SO good! I crave bbq every once in a while and this spot was nearby so I gave it a chance. The have 4 types of sauces, I sampled them all and my fav has to be the backyard red sauce. We ordered the Texas OG on a tortilla and the Tony Montana. The brisket was meaty and fatty. The Tony Montana could have had more queso on it for sure. We also tried the gouda Mac and cheese amd twice baked potato and it was creamy and pretty good. The potato was just ok according to my boyfriend. They are located in a strip mall with lots of parking.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: This is an easy to find place that gives you a feel of a comfortable locals/neighborhood place. Lots of TVs and some covered outside seating as well.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal! Our party of three started with the double meat bbq brisket nachos, then we shared 1/2 # of ribs, a Texas Tornado wrap with double brisket (absolutely LOVE their brisket) then added an extra large order of the smoked Gouda Mac and cheese, green bean casserole and finished up with a banana pudding .  Gotta say I haven't eaten such great bbq for years AND took home enough for another meal.  This is my new go-to for Austin BBQ! They have a nice selection of regular and craft beers as well.  Definitely a repeater!!

reviews.author: Lorri P.
reviews.description: We hadn't had any bbq since we arrived in Austin for our vacation. We found Slab on Yelp and we were impressed! The sliders, brisket nachos and chicken sandwich were all delicious. The max n cheese was good, it had a smoky flavor, like it was cooked on the grill. The potato salad didn't have any flavor but we just know not to order it, it was a side and not the star of the show like the meats. The music was great! If I lived here, I would definitely be here once a week! Great food and vibe!

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: Stopped by for the Yelp Texas Trending Machine today around 11:30 and it was clear that this plce already has a place in the heart of locals. The line was long, but luckily I was able to head to the to-go desk and place my order fairly quickly...Brisket Nachos packaged with all the ingredients separated so as not to get soggy. They easily survived the drive home to Cedar Park and were super delicious and unique! Like a chopped brisket sandwich on tortilla chips with queso. Um, yes, please.  This barbecue place has a vibe like no other. The walls and music combine hip hop with classic Texas in a way I would not have dreamed possible, but it works. Pretty trendy spot. I really appreciated the clear partitions separating tables as a covid precaution.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: There were brisket nachos involved too but I only got a photo of the ribs as the nachos were halfway gone by then  they were excellent and a generous portion. The St. Louis ribs are some of the most tender I've had.  I wasn't a huge fan of the bbq sauce that came with the ribs but it's on the side and they have other sauces available as well- the one it came with was a little sweet for me. Planning on bringing my small rib aficionado this weekend after the pumpkin patch.  One complaint... the kids meal ribs says it comes with two.. TWO. Mine will be asking where the rest are if I ordered him a kids meal  they do have a great amount of meat on them but I have a 3 year old that eats like a teenager when he has ribs in front of him so these kids meals won't work for us  we will be getting a whole rack and I'll be lucky if *I* get to have two.

reviews.author: LaPeshaa C.
reviews.description: SLAB is one of my favorite bbq joints and that's based off those good ole tender fall off the bone ribs! Ohhh how I love those ribs! Their chicken is good, the brisket is great, but BOY them ribs! Whew! They've got great sandwiches too if that's more your thing. I really like their green bean casserole as well. If you haven't gone yet, GO!

reviews.author: John C.
reviews.description: There's a reason this place has 1.8k reviews on Google. It's outstanding and the vibe is everything you want in a BBQ spot in Austin.   Slider Trio was great, be aware the the third sandwich is chicken, although, still excellent.   Brisket Nachos were a surprise. Probably Top 3 Nachos I've ever had.

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: Hands down. Get down. Low down. They are on the finest point you'll ever hope to find in a BBQ joint. Stop wasting your time scrolling through reviews and check out Slab.

reviews.author: Alysia G.
reviews.description: Brisket Nachos are a must!!! Would like to come back and try the sides, everything looks delicious and staff are super friendly. If it's crowded you may have to eat outdoors, but there is shade at least and they have comfortable seating.

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: I don't know why I haven't already been eating at Slab BBQ, but I'm definitely going to become a regular customer now! Right when you walk in, the smell hits you, and you know you've picked the right place.  Not only do they have great food, they have a bar with beer, several flat screen TVs and a nice-sized patio area. I had the BBQ nachos with extra queso and rib meat; it had jalapeños, diced onions and pickles and one of their signature bbq sauces drizzled on top. My meal was so amazing, and the portion size was enough to get full and still have half of the plate to take home(which is equally amazing after reheating in the oven).

reviews.author: AJ B.
reviews.description: Came for the trending machines and got a bandanna and candle ! We were not golden ticket winners but we did get the complimentary nachos which were super good! We also had a great time playing galaga inside the Pac-Man machine for free!!! Definitely would recommend and return for more nachos!

reviews.author: Kim L.
reviews.description: We found Slab via an Eater list and Yelp reviews and it was pretty good! We knocked off a star bc some of the meat was dry, the smoked mac was very runny and the coleslaw wasn't too good but overall enjoyed our meal. We allotted more time here for lunch bc we assumed there'd be a lunch rush and orders would be slower if meats were being smoked throughout the day but our meal came out almost instantly so stuff was ready to go / could have contributed to some of the meat being dry....  * Slab slider trio - sliders of Notorious PIG, Texas OG and Chicken WA. Notorious was very good flavor and pulled pork was still nicely moist. The Texas OG was kind of a let down bc the brisket was dry and there wasn't a lot of sauce on the sandwich to keep it moist and flavorful. The chicken WA was actually pretty good and the chicken surprisingly stayed moist * El Jefe - hubby got this was and liked it.. the brisket wasn't as dried as it was on my Texas OG * Smoke gouda mac - I love macs and this was way too runny, wish the sauce was more creamy * Cole slaw - my hubby is a cole slaw snob and he thought this didn't really have enough flavor  They had outdoor seating so we got to people watch but it is in a strip mall, so not too much to see.  Woman at the counter was very nice and gave recos for us while we were ordering.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: Surprising really good. The nachos are a must to try. Love the theme of the place. The sandwiches are super yummy also. Great for a hearty lunch.

reviews.author: Maria B.
reviews.description: Great food. I had the St. Louis pork ribs with potato salad on the side . Delicious, and the meat was soft and very tasty

reviews.author: Lisa O.
reviews.description: I liked Slab BBQ. They didn't have any gluten free bread or buns and the only thing on their menu is sandwiches. So I ordered a sandwich without bread. I wished they offered gluten free bread or buns.

reviews.author: Sheila F.
reviews.description: I got the BBQ nachos and they were awesome. ALL NACHOS SHOULD BE THIS GOOD. They are piled high with brisket, onions, pickles, and jalapeños. Then, finished off with a drizzle of BBQ sauce and cheese. For me, the pickles were a great touch. if I had one criticism it would be that I had a lot of empty chips at the bottom. They may want to consider doing two layers of toppings. A little bit on the bottom and then a little bit more on the top, just to get a little bit more coverage of some of the chips at the bottom.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Nice location with plenty of outdoor seating. Food truck with pizza next door. Dog friendly. Tried four of the brews on tap. The IPA and HC Haze were both very good. The Kolsch was okay - a little flat and slightly bitter. None of us liked the Rye Wit - must be an acquired taste.   We likely would have stayed longer, but it was chilly and windy. We'll be back in fairer weather to try the pizza.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: We discovered this brewery after hearing about a new pizza truck opening next door to it.  Hitmaker has a nice outdoor seating area, clean bathrooms, ample parking and friendly staff.  The menu is not huge , but the Kolsch and Hazy IPA we had were good.  Great place to grab a pizza next door and sit outside with a cold beer!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Welcome Hitmaker to the South/West-ish Austin microbrew community!  I love that there's newcomers to the brew scene here in South Austin. I've had Hitmaker on my radar for a while. I came through with a good friend close to closing hours on a weekend. We were stoked to try their flights, which was great to get a taste of everything. Their menu is limited at the moment, since they're pretty new. I didn't feel any sort of type of way towards any beers in particular, but I do love that they had a Belgian called Accidental Trappist. Their rye wit I love too. They tried to have a little bit of variety in their menu which I appreciated.  The brewery also smells new too. I love it. It's like the smell of a baby or a puppy. Weird. So let's move on. They have board games for all, clean restrooms and TVs. The seating options are endless. You can go outside and play outdoor brewery games or sit indoors at the bar or in their many picnic tables. Parking is also super easy, and the taproom is easy to locate with their brightly-lit sign (especially at night). I definitely see us coming back here more often, especially since our taptender was a sweet and informative man who was so kind to stay a little past brew hours to let us finish our conversation and beers. I will definitely be back for the exceptionally kind service and cozy brew times.

reviews.author: A S.
reviews.description: I live pretty far from Hitmaker but have tried to visit a couple of times when I happened to be in the area. I recall both times they were closed when I was near by. My plan was almost foiled again, but this time luck was on my side. Due to Covid-19 the hours online didn't match their actual hours so I got there an hour before they were actually set to open. I didn't want to wait around for an hour until opening time so I was going to head home. As I was leaving I happened to run into one of the workers (maybe an owner) and after explaining my dilemma he graciously agreed to let me in an hour early to enjoy their beer. I was delighted and thankful. I got a glass of the Summer Saison and the Hill Country Haze and enjoyed both. The service was great and the atmosphere was enjoyable.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: A friend recommended that we meet up at Hitmaker Brewpub. Hitmaker? The Google provided some excellent information: "The co-owners started six of your favorite neighborhood bars/restaurants - MugShots, The Hideout Pub, Bender Bar and Grill, Pour House Pub, Violet Crown Social Club and Pour House Pints and Pies." Having been to a number of their locales I looked forward to having a few Hitmaker beers.  The bottom line their beers did not disappoint. My IPA was not excessively hoppy and had that typical fruity citrus flavor. Plus one stepped out of her comfort zone and went with their Kolsch offering. My tastebuds told me this was not a typical Kolch as it was pretty lite and could have masqueraded as a lite pale ale. A good summer beer.   The bartender on duty was very knowledgable and was eager to fully describe their offerings. The taproom is cozy, dimly lit, and cool. Perfect atmosphere for quaffing excellent brews on a hot summer day. Lastly, feel free to bring your mutts.

reviews.author: James B.
reviews.description: Wow.  8 beers tried, and 8 beers worth trying again! The kolsch is such an easy drinker, light and refreshing!  Pale ryeder and rye wit have a bit more flavor but still an easy drinking wonderful drink!  It'd be hard to stick with just one here, but if I did; I'd probably go with French Saison, wonderful taste and a bit stronger than the others.  Coconut Porter isn't the best porter I've had, but if it's cold outside this would be my drink at the brewery. Hill country Haze is an IPA I could drink, but I'm not an IPA fan.  Accidental Trappist is good.  I can't put my finger on it... you just have to try it.   The brown ale is a little heavier than most and I'd be tempted to grab it instead of the Porter.  They have some cans of wine and a cider too.  $2 tastes 6oz.  $4/5 16oz pours.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Terrific place. Numerous delicious beers on tap. Was on site during their grand opening and they handled it well. A lot of activity here. And delicious beers.  We also appreciate your support and Divine Canines through Barks for Beers.

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Review time kids!   What does one do when new to the area? If you are anything like me and the ever so lovely bride, you go exploring every chance you get!   After hitting a farmers market and a flea market we decided to take the route less traveled home by watching the compass and staying off the major arteries. This is where Lady Luck showed us a sign that I almost can never resist,"Tasting Room Open", like a mosquito to a bug zapper ,I'm in!!   I have to say I really dug this place for a few reasons beyond the fresh beer selection. First is general layout,not to big or to small,its just right. Second is decor,simple,industrial,clean. The focus here is on their craft brews not a bunch of goofy crap on the walls. Third is noise, this place was chill. I was actually able to converse with my bride without the aid of ASL!   On to their craftwork, after meeting the very friendly barkeep we decided I'm a picky bastard and he had me try a few samples, all were very good. Landing with the Kolsh really hit the spot!!  Caveman review? "Go here,have beer,bring friends too!"

reviews.author: Blair B.
reviews.description: Delicious beers with lots of outdoor seating! A great find for lovely weather. We were also able to bring our dog, which was a great plus.

reviews.author: Robyn G.
reviews.description: Excellent selection of their own craft beer and everyone is very nice!  Outside seating also!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Non of the beer was disappointing. Came here on a Sunday and it was peaceful. Place is small but clean. Definitely say give this place a try. Kid friendly. Indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Ed J.
reviews.description: Really good beer in a neighborhood bar setting.  Particularly enjoyed the Saison and Porter.  Look forward to enjoying the patio once the weather is favorable...  and love those $2 portions - great for sampling all the options and still being able to drive home (but barely).  Did I mention the beer is legit?

reviews.author: Michael V.
reviews.description: Outstanding beer!  If you are out and about doing some hill country drankin', treat yourself.  You will be glad you did. They have something for everyone.  And the taproom is awesome, too!

reviews.author: Katie T.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I stopped here for a beer after hitting up the nursery nearby. I'm glad we did! The staff was friendly and the beer was fantastic! I got the hazy IPA and she got the kolsch; both were very tasty! We'll definitely be coming back with friends.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: New taproom in the area, no food or anything but the beer is great and they have a small and friendly team. Would definitely recommend it for beer-lovers. Had the Rye Wit and Hazy IPA, the latter was incredible!

reviews.author: Gino G.
reviews.description: Great beer! JC was a pleasure to talk with on my maiden trip to HM. I'll be back for sure.

reviews.author: scott k.
reviews.description: Great beers...... recommend the French Saison, Pale Ryder and Rye Wit.  If you are in the area gotta check this place out!!!!!!

name: Last Stand Brewing
address: 12345 Pauls Valley RdBldg I and J

reviews.author: Sarah W.
reviews.description: I enjoy the beer here and the food from the food truck.  Grilled cheeses, patty melts, burgers, fries - delicious!  You can do a 4 beer tasting flight and they have around 12 or more on tap.  You can buy beer to go in cans or they have growlers available and some cute merchandise.   Be aware the v neck tee shirts they have right now are cut pretty tight/narrow.    They have a nice back patio where you can eat and drink and bring your canine friends and sometimes have local craft vendors back there as well.   I really like their Coffee Kolsch beer!   You definitely need to walk next door  and check out Revolution Distillery - simply fantastic gin and cocktails with a free tasting of a few of their spirits.  Can't buy bottles of hard alcohol on Sundays but they were still open today (Sunday) and they are happy to serve you delicious cocktails!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Fantastic beer and location! Quiet and just relaxing! It's dog and kid friendly but happy there's no playground so there aren't that many kids. All of the beer is fantastic, even if it's not the style I prefer (like pales)).  The food truck is excellent as well. Make this place a priority!

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: First time here and love it! Plenty of space and open seating inside and outside. It's nice to have brewery in south Austin that offer quality drinks and food options. South Side Flying Pizza is also located inside the brewery, which is also delicious!

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: A good brewery that's just a bit overshadowed by its neighbors.  When you're standing near giants, you live perpetually in their shadow. Such is the case with Last Stand. It's a good brewery. It's got old school Hill Country funkiness, as evidenced by their chicken shit bingo games (every 3rd Sunday!)  For better or worse, it's also just down the road from the behemoth that is Jester King. Hell, there's a great distillery 10 feet away! Last Stand's brews are good; this visit I had the Citra Smash, Simcoe Pale Ale and the Fuzzelicious. But I'd be lying if I said I wasn't thinking about Jester King with every sip.

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: Last Stand keeps fundraised money they owe to local dog rescues and uses it to open up a second location. I'll never again support this shady business.

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Way overdue review! Been enjoying LSB for quite some time now. Just a great, colorful, and fun space. Large beer garden with Chicken $**t bingo every 3rd Sunday of the month. That beer tho!  They focus more on the hoppy-side (love their CitraSmash); however, they also make great porters, stouts, and other seasonal brews including barley wine. A flight of 4 - 2oz pours will set you back 10$ if it's your first visit. Then, go for a full flight!  Light snacks available (pretzels, etc.) and food truck on-site at times.   Package available for sell and they also custom fill 16oz crowlers. Cans also available at ATX merchants (e.g., HEB).   Support local!   Family and Fido friendly. Cheers to the love of great beers!

reviews.author: Falon R.
reviews.description: The beer is so good! We went to the south Congress location. The atmosphere was nice. My 3/5 stars is due to the build your own pizza coming with cheese (which we don't and can't intake) so we spent $20 and weren't able to eat it. I'm hoping someone else ate it because it hurts my heart to think a cow gave her milk for nothing. We were told that we had to purchase another pizza. We decided it would be best to go elsewhere for food. My only advice is to inform the customer that the pizza comes with cheese automatically. We wouldn't have known otherwise. We will be back for the Fuzzylicious IPA!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Not a big fan of the beer, but I did enjoy the environment. The staff was friendly. Cornhole outside and plenty of tables for sitting.

reviews.author: Jarrid S.
reviews.description: While the beers are great. The customer service is not amazing. You walk in and have a seat the server greets you and asks how your day is, and then a few minutes later another server says oh if You want to order the line is over there. How about the first person tell you their process, Or better yet - how about a sign hanging from the ceiling with an arrow that says order here. Lots Of people were Frustrated by this because they too had all taken a seat because of no direction. The beers are good but manage your business better if you would like to increase the positivity of your customers experience also the revenue you could generate.

reviews.author: Greshka P.
reviews.description: This was our second brewery on our beer tour, while in Austin. Small place, and not many beers on tap, but you can still find some good ones.  Their beers are listed on the wall on tap, and they also have them in the fridge if you want to take some bottles home.  They do flights, and of course that's what I did to be able to try more. The Coffee Porter was like drinking actual coffee.  Delicious!  I left this one for the end, after one sip since it ended up being my favorite. Imperial Oatmeal stout was just OK, in my opinion.  They also had it in Whisky Barrel Aged - same alcohol content but the barrel aged process always makes it taste stronger.  I wasn't loving these so didn't finish them.   Holiday Ale - was good, tasted just like it's name implies. The one that surprised me was the Smash Citra. I usually stay away from IPAs (too hoppy for me) but this was amazing!  I could have had a second one.  Service is hit or miss.  They were a bit slow preparing our flights.  One of the ladies was really nice and friendly, the other two people behind the counter, not so much.  You can enjoy your beers inside but the outside is really cute. Looks almost like a schoolyard with long wood tables, space to walk, and a cute colorful seating area near the exit.  Across from them there's Revolution (locally mad gin) and another brewery. So, this is a good place to "park" and enjoy a drinking day out with friends, without having to drive around for more.  3.5 stars

reviews.author: Kristen L.
reviews.description: Huge space indoor and outdoor and their menu has great food. Lots of beers and wines to choose from - definitely going back often!

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Came here after a stop at JK and this place was a pleasant little surprise!  Far less crowded than JK and the outdoor patio area was fantastic on a gorgeous spring day to just vegge out, hang w/friends, enjoy some brews, and play a mean game of cornhole!  Their beers were very hit or miss for me. I did the sampler and nothing really stood out, but none were undrinkable, just not really my style. If you like hoppy beers, then you will probably enjoy their selections more than I did. Their stout was ok, but in all fairness, probably not the best choice on a warm day as it was heavy.  I will say, what stole the show for me here was our little discovery of their Revolution Spirits barn. They were doing a free tasting of their gin and Cafecito coffee liqueur, both of which were absolutely awesome!  I really like the gin as the lavender in the batch we tasted was very prevalent. I am usually not a gin drinker, but the mix of this w/the hibiscus tea that they served was perfection! The Cafecito, however, was so mindblowingly good, I immediately dropped the $25 to purchase a bottle on-site! It is made w/Cuvee and packs a delightful, caffeinated, yet alcohol-y punch. I have paired it drizzled over some coconut, chocolate chip, almond vanilla ice cream, and it is what dreams are made of!  I probably would come back here in a few months to see if they have any different beers on their rotation and to restock on the spirits.

reviews.author: Neel A.
reviews.description: Vibes. Awesome venue and a great beer list with a diverse set of brews. Juicy IPAs? Check. Imperial Milk Porter? Check. Barleywine Ale. Check.  The outdoor patio is perfect for hanging out and day drinking. Cornhole and jenga patio games make it a really fun atmosphere. Food truck was outside to add a booze buffer from the beer imbibing.   Definitely will be back next time I'm in Austin! A distillery and a cidery are also located in the same complex so it's a great vacation destination.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: I've been a fan of their Simcoe Pale and their Smash Citra IPA for quite some time now. I've been meaning to check out Last Stand and I finally had my chance recently.  Located off of Fitzhugh Rd- Same road that brought you Austin Beer giants Jester King- , Last Stand is a bit smaller but still has those breathtaking views that we've all come to know and love out there. They also offer a good selection of house beers that you can't find at your local HEB, Spec's, Twin Liquors. I had fun sampling them and look forward to seeing what they have next time I go!

reviews.author: Lana L.
reviews.description: I'm not much of a beer person, but I do try to appreciate it. Came here on a Sunday with friends to check the place out. You can ask to try some of the beers if you're not sure what you want. The samples are very generous and the people working there are nice and helpful. I sampled four different ones before deciding on the pale ale. The coffee one was also great, not like anything I've had before. You also have the option of getting a flight/sampler with four different beers if you want variety. There is outdoor seating too!  Taste | 3.5 Atmosphere | 3 Presentation | 3.5 Service | 4 OVERALL | 3.5

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Good beer. Good burgers. Nice spaces inside and out with plenty of room for groups. Dog friendly. Don't forget your growler!

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: Great new brewery in the Dripping Springs area. They currently have a solid five brews on tap. Our faves were the BPA and Coffee Porter. I will say that I need a session beer from them... something a little less on the alcohol would be good, but that's just my preference.  The location is just a few minutes down the street from Jester King (so if you're already out at JK, come give Last Stand a try!). They are located in a really cool business park. There's also a distillery a few doors down!  There is a couple of places to sit inside and a full outdoor area with seating (if you're allergic to hay, it might be an issue).

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: We were out pub crawling in the Dripping Springs area and found this place. They have quite a few beer choices and an air conditioned section so you can enjoy your beer and the place is very customer friendly. Cool place.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: This was the last stand for us during a wine trip through Hye and Johnson City. As we circled back to Austin, the Mister decided he would confuse his brain after the lovely wine tastings with a beer. This was dessert, he explained.   However crazy this idea was, I am now a fan of hitting all these breweries five minutes before closing. We were the only customers and serendipitously met the owners and their beautiful white boxer! The guys enjoyed their Coffee Porter and Pale Ale and we were on our way home quickly.

reviews.author: Sarah W.
reviews.description: This was a nice little spot in the country with decent beers. The owners were friendly and accommodating.  We loved the outdoor space with a stage for a live band. The inside is rather small if the weather isn't good, you might want to come when you'd enjoy outside. It was easy to find in a business park area. Parking seemed limited . We brought our kids, it was an Overall good experience.

reviews.author: Ang B.
reviews.description: Dear Moontower, I love you.  Great patio, the staff seems to really care about what the company is doing. The cider flights are where it's at the get a full experience of the range being done here.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: My husband and I had seen this place for a while since we moved to this side of town. Usually I am running by it and we decided to finally stop in for a drink on a Saturday afternoon.  We decided to do a flight of a piece of the ciders so we could try them all. It was the perfect choice as we both had different opinions of what tasted good.   There are a few food options but we didn't eat here. They had a guy in the outdoor seating area that was cooking up some food on a grill.   Overall a cool chill place to grab some drinks and hang out inside or outside.

reviews.author: Stacie H.
reviews.description: Moontower is a great neighborhood spot! The patio is mellow and the ciders aren't too sweet. I like that the offerings keep expanding with ciders, coffee, snacks and there's special events held on premise too including one with baby goats. I also stop by for refills of SoCo ginger beer with the rotating seasonal flavors.  Check out Moontower and the personable staff will convert you into a repeat customer!

reviews.author: Paul M.
reviews.description: Fantastic cider and a great atmosphere. The staff are friendly, and we will definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Ashley F.
reviews.description: Really great dry cider!  Nice outdoor space too that's dog friendly.   Would be nice to see a few more items of food on the menu but the cheese plate is delicious!

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: I've only been by once, but they did a great job with distanced service! They gave me a little buzzer for when I needed something, brought my drink out to me, and had hand sanitizer at every table. They're just doing outside seating and to-go as of 9/11.  Their Pomme Blush was delicious--not too sweet. I'll be back!

reviews.author: Christopher D.
reviews.description: Do yourself a favor and stop by the Tasting Room at MoonTower Cider Co., over on Tillery Street, proudly brewing fine cider on the East Side.  I was fortunate enough to show up just after the room opened (2-9 five days a week) and the ambiance and mood was perfect for a cloudy day: French  jazz on the stereo, clean lines in the furniture and understated appointments and the well-informed and cider fan Anne-Claire behind the bar. She patiently walked me through ciders in general and expertly helped me understand one cider from the next from the "core four" and special tastings.  Dog-friendly and laid-back, this is the perfect place to escape from the mayhem of daily life and enjoy an artisanal brew made by the good folks right here in town. How artisanal? They brew their own mead.  Anne-Claire or others will be happy to recommend the cider for your palette and will speak to food pairings as well. All in all, a low-key, friendly no-pressure environment. There are no sales people here: there are artists happy to help you discover and share their fondness for cider.  Go.

reviews.author: Rhys G.
reviews.description: Went on my anniversary with my girl , Great place to hang and try ciders , great selection of ciders and friendly staff . Recommend for anyone who likes ciders and looking for a place to hang outside on these weird times.

reviews.author: A Seal -.
reviews.description: Complex yet approachable, obsessive but laid back, a treat but also something you could drink all day. Moontower really reassembled my brain when it comes to cider. You'll want to easy into this space, try every last thing they've made, and tell all your friends about it. Such a welcome break from all the overly loud, vibe-first, money-grab breweries popping up around Austin. These people care about making an incredible product and giving you a relaxed space to enjoy it in. Kudos, y'all. See you every week!

reviews.author: Kelsey R.
reviews.description: We just tried the two cider flights and cheese plate. Loved our experience! None of the other Cider places were open due to Corona so we were very glad to find a place with out door seating and serving cider on tap. The waitress was very sweet and educating as well! Will definitely go back!

name: Abel's On the Lake
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Hermes P.
reviews.description: I came into use the restroom since Mozart's next door was beyond capacity. I was told customers only. That's fair. I asked if I could just pay for something so I can use the restroom. I was told the cheapest thing was an $18 shirt. Upon checking the menu online, I can see that that was a lie. I would have gladly paid for $12 nachos to eat but nope..the cheapest thing was the shirt. Gotta keep people from not using the bathroom.  I can understand the policy. But lying and turning away a transaction to hold a principle? It deserves a Yelp review.

reviews.author: Nikiba J.
reviews.description: I would really like to give Abel's their 5 stars which they probably deserve but the Restaurant sits at the bottom of a hill. This is not ok when you're bringing in a bus loaded with passengers. Shell passengers at that (Shell has a zero tolerance for unsafe practices). Cars on every side of the street so a bus would have to unload in the street. Luckily for me this time Heaven was on our side by allowing us to get our buses up from the hill. Going down the driveway was just as challenge because we had to turn just right to make the turn to drop the passengers off at the door.  The OS came when we had to turn the buses just right to get out the drive and up the hill onto the street. What makes this even more dangerous are the pedestrians walking in front of the bus, to the side of the bus and in the back of the bus.  It takes a skilled driver (like myself) to be able to get out of the mess I was in. This was the perfect time of all the times I should told my clients dropping them at the door was unsafe. But there I went.  If I didn't position the bus just right getting up that hill a tow truck would have to be called to unstick me. That's what we call bottoming out the bus, when the axil is stuck on concrete enabling the bus to move.  Now my coworker trusted me and followed me right down that forsaken hill and tried to get up the hill as I did.  Now mind you, if we get the buses stuck it will take a tow truck at least 2 hrs to be dispatched and out to our location. It's cost $$$ for a bus pull out, the restaurant is located in a neighborhood so they would have to use an alternate to their homes, patrons inconvenienced, our passengers stomachs full they ready to go to get to their hotel. Shell most definitely will report us for an unsafe practice and we would have to answer for that unsafe practice....just a mess. Anyways, I got my bus out and the other bus as well. There was no bus parking not enough curb parking so we were unable to dine at the restaurant. I forgot about that so I change my rating to 1 star. J/k

reviews.author: Aleric H.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing Experience! Great Food, Great Views and Rob my waiter has been fantastic the couple of times I've come so far!  I have to say that I almost didn't go because of the reviews here, but my experience was totally different. And it was absolutely a 5 star experience.  Overall the Views are objectively great right off the water, the food has been very good both times - I had a really good Salmon dish most recently. But more importantly the waiter Rob has been incredibly kind and attentive - even offering Iced Tea "to go" both times.  I'd recommend you judge Abels for yourself and come to the restaurant -- I actually asked them about previous reviews and they did say they've been really shifting all of their service to be the best and that's what I've seen first hand.  I can't speak to how they were in the past, but today the experience is 5 stars!

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: Great spot for a local craft beer by the water.  Not too many vegetarian items on the menu, but they are willing to adjust on request. The items I enjoy are very tasty.  This spot is extremely puppy friendly, so enjoy your doggie date! The Christmas light show is also amazing!

reviews.author: Karyn C.
reviews.description: We went for dinner with 3 kids and 3 adults. Food was good.  Came out fairly quickly. Our server was nice as well.  Beautiful view and had a nice time.  We got there early and thankfully got right in. :) wish they had crayons and coloring pages for the kids.

reviews.author: D S.
reviews.description: I would give this 20 if I could. Visiting from San Diego, we found Abel's on an idyllic Sunday afternoon.  Although there was a wait for a table, Johnny, the BEST bartender/server EVER, found a couple of barstools and made room for us at the bar.  Johnny makes a GREAT host, and GREAT Bloody Mary!  World class. Perfect blend of spices with other ingredients.  I had the Texas burger (YUM) and my husband had Abel's Tex-Mex twist on a Philly steak sandwich. "Absolutely delicious!" The open air bar on the lake is a beautiful setting, the weather was perfect, multiple football games on big screens, and a great vibe.   Fabulous food, and not at all expensive.  But Johnny made our experience superb.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Each time I come here I'm more and more disappointed. I used to come here frequently when I was new to Austin but I think my standards were lower and theirs were higher. First of all, it's a pain to get parking around here. Once you're parked, you're better off going to one of the neighboring establishments. The food is so mediocre and overpriced, and I've nearly tried it all. It's not bad, but I'd say it's on par with many chain "bar and grill" type of restaurants. The view of the lake is the only asset that draws crowds.

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: My son held his wedding here !  The staff was extremely nice and polite! The food they catered was delicious! The views are great ! It's was extremely cold this weekend but I will be back when it warms up!

reviews.author: Kim B.
reviews.description: I came here for my graduation dinner (NOT on graduation weekend - so it wasn't that busy) and it was honestly one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. It was embarrassing for me because I picked the place. Thank God that my friends and I are pretty chill people, so we just rolled with it.  However the service was abysmal, the Mexican Martini was not drinkable, bathrooms were filthy and there was not a manager in sight the whole night. Well, at least not until we left and saw them all chatting on an unoccupied patio to the side of the restaurant. I guess it was socialization time while their servers are outside floundering. The girl who served us was seemingly taking care of the whole patio (although failing) and said it was her first week. Wild.   Two people from my party didn't get their meals until everyone else finished. We had to basically beg for our drinks. And the food was honestly 2 stars at best...  Only good thing about this place was the ambiance

reviews.author: Amber R.
reviews.description: Bad customer service, I felt like I was being discriminated. Drinks are pricey and don't even taste so great!!!

reviews.author: Alicia R.
reviews.description: I've been to abels three times now and had Carrie as a server every time, she is extremely helpful and attentive every time! She's made very good suggestions for food and drinks and always makes sure we have everything we need! Next time you're in texas come visit Carrie at abels!

reviews.author: MIchael P.
reviews.description: I've been coming to Abel's for years but hadn't been back since the start of the pandemic. I went tonight and I am so happy I did!  Abel's will be in my routine rotation from here on for dinner and drinks.   They have always had a strong kitchen for an affordable bar and grill - so much better than the place next door. Tonight, I was taken care of very well by two affable gents at the back bar, Stuart and Eric. Stuart told me I should try the blackened redfish. He shared it was a new rotating special. I was amazed how perfectly it was seasoned and cooked.  One of the best redfish dishes I have had in months. I immediately asked what I need to do to convince them to serve this on the regular menu. They said let our management know online so here it is.  I was texting friends about how good it was and that we need to come back soon. Please keep this dish on the menu - as often as possible - and give your chef a raise.    Another fun plus - Stuart and Eric know their sports. We had a fun smart conversation about all current sporting events.   Bottom line.  If you are a sports fan, go here. eat the redfish, ask for Stuart and Eric. drink, have fun and repeat. Also, brunch on Sundays for early fantasy games is another great call.   Five stars on this visit. See you soon.

reviews.author: Viviana R.
reviews.description: First time here... and yeah the food was not good at all. Ordered chips and queso, chips were stale and queso was clumpy. I had the chicken sandwich and it was bland. A person of color definitely did not make the chicken, because if they did it would have been seasoned. Best part of the whole thing was the Dos xx.

reviews.author: C A.
reviews.description: Bad costumer service they take 20 mins after u seat just to take u order and drinks are so expensive that they still have no shame to ask for tip and if u say no I want my change back they get all with a attitude and they don't even come back to ask u what else u need and they really racist they were acting like we weren't going to pay so after they brought our 1st drinks they brought the check right away what kinda costumer service is that I'm pretty sure I'm making more money then them and they don't even know it y'all need to work in a lot of things in this place cause that's why it's empty all the time cause of y'all service have a nice day!!

reviews.author: Molly G.
reviews.description: Sweet waitress. She was clearly slammed. That's not the issue here. Sweet potato fries were delivered to the wrong table by someone running food. Pancakes were burnt. Both out of her control. She got them both taken off rightfully so.  The BIG ISSUE was ours and two different tables cards were wrong up wrong, mixed up, and delivered to wrong tables. Our credit card went to someone else's table and we found it ourselves. Still not mad at that sweet girl at all for the record. Our tab came out cheaper and we signed it and got out. Forgive us of our sins. What was EXTREMELY CONCERNING is the manager approached my father IN THE BATHROOM and chased him out the front door. My father explained that a transaction was made and there was a signed document, end of story. Argue that with anyone especially when we were on the street walking to our car. What does the manager do? He THREATENED to call the cops! My husband, who paid the tab suggested to the manager that we go inside and talk privately. The manager proceeded to discuss this private matter  in front of customers IN THE PARKING LOT! Legally, we did nothing wrong. Transaction was made between the establishment and our family. Signed document. Off the property. Boom. If he would have came up to us and started with excuse me, we messed up, can we fix this please- would have been the start to a better approach.
