Chasing my father. Threatening to call the cops. Discussing in front of customers after we left. We could have sorted it out had he not been so aggressive. I was in the service industry for 8 years, he was 1000% out of line. The scenery is pretty nice though. One star fir that.

reviews.author: Aubrey A.
reviews.description: Have no idea what the food is like because I didn't get to try it. Came in with a few friends and sat for about 15 to 20 minutes, after waiting I had told the hostess that we hadn't been helped yet, she then said someone would be out shortly to help us. Waited there about another 10 minutes and still no help. They were not understaffed by any means, in fact there were people standing around doing nothing which was why I was so irritated. I had read the bad reviews and decided to dismiss them and try this place for myself, wouldn't recommend.

reviews.author: Jeff L.
reviews.description: Please don't come here. The managers are rude, servers are 45 year old men who think they have power and are so rude. Don't come here waiters are rude and food takes minimum 1 hour to come out.

reviews.author: Customer S.
reviews.description: Wouldn't recommend this restaurant. Grilled oysters weren't good. Raw oysters were poor quality. Fried shrimp basket wasn't good.

reviews.author: Emma E.
reviews.description: Didn't even get to eat here sat at the bar for 10 mins and no one helped 3 bartenders stood on there phones and didn't even bother to help us. I'm a bartender so this literally pissed me off. It was dead too just simply ignored so they can sit on there phones smh

reviews.author: Tracey T.
reviews.description: I don't know why the 2.5 star average here, we have been to this place three times now and it has been great all three. Service has been fantastic all three times, drinks have been good and food has been fine. What more could one want than sitting on the patio enjoying a cold one here with friends/family, while taking in the lake views?

name: Odd Duck
accommodations: Street Parking, Validated Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking
Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Chris J.
reviews.description: Visited Odd Duck after months of waiting for a reservation, and was met with food and service that went above and beyond expectations. A local farm to table establishment with an elevated twist, I highly recommend Odd Duck as a go-to spot in Austin.   As many other Yelpers have surely noted, Odd Duck's menu is seasonal, so I'll spare you the details regarding the food I ate, as the menu has most likely changed. Feel free to sit back and trust your waiter's suggestions, as they are veterans of their craft.   One thing that I would like to commend Odd Duck on is their extreme attention to detail, which was immediately noticeable to me. From their unique plates and cutlery to the maintenance of their restrooms, this dining experience made it well worth the price point. Additionally, our waiter made it a point to clean our table throughout the meal, which was awesome.  5/5

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: 1,000x yes, go eat here.  Odd Duck was a "must eat at" stop on a specially curated visit to Austin. It is a fun, quirky, farm to table, seasonal and special menu kind of place, with a lovely team of staff and cooks. A team running a dream.  We sat at the bar and our bartender/waitress was super friendly and attentive - we were chugging water since Austin heat is ridiculous compared to New York heat, so she kept us hydrated as we waited for our food. She helped us work through our order and recommended some items and how much food to order since the menu is set up in a specific way with some featured small and shared plates.   As each dish was served, the server explained the dish, which I loved. It made the experience that much better to know the unique aspects of each dish like where the ingredients came from or how to enjoy it best.  Everything was delicious, and yes, the rave reviews of the cornbread are totally accurate.  10/10 stars for sure

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: Pictures of menu on August 17, 2021. Reservations are strongly recommended as this place is quite popular (rightfully so though)! We picked the tomatoes, quail, and cornbread and everything was 10/10. I don't typically eat cornbread but theirs is MAGICAL and a must do! Their service was also A+, they were kind enough to mark the menu with vegetarian options, they even provided ways to alter some of their dishes to make them vegetarian (see photo). The French Toast dessert was also a delight. I'm a big fan of their rotating menus and will happily return to try more.   There is complimentary valet parking. You can also find street parking by the restaurant. They have happy hour 5-6pm daily with drink specials only.

reviews.author: Tiffany H.
reviews.description: Odd Duck is an OG in ATX's food scene; I've known about it since undergrad (10+ years now!) but haven't had a chance to try it until I was in town recently for work.   Before local/farm2table was cool - Odd Duck was doing it. It still feels great to support local farmers and producers though.   The food here was OUTSTANDINGLY flavorful -- bringing it to that edge but showing finesse and balance. I also appreciate that they made vegetarian versions of certain dishes so there are some options for Vegs!   My only regret? Not coming here sooner!   The menu will be different when you visit, but we thoroughly enjoyed each dish! We had the:  *Redfish Ceviche (leche de tigre, persimmon, cucumber, potato chip) *Cajun Pork Rillette (apples, pickles, Sour Duck Market sourdough toast) *Dry-aged wagyu burger (pimento, BBQ sauce, beer battered onion ring) - like an EXPLOSION of flavor.  *Wagyu Sirloin Cap (beef fat papas bravas, soubise, green bean salsa verde)  *French Toast (Vanilla Ice Cream, Cajeta, Apple, Pecan, Brown Butter Cereal) - yes, we had French Toast for dessert! So good and I recall just a pinch of salt from keeping it from being overly sweet!

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: A gem in Austin for their authenticity and willingness to explore.   I loved dining at Odd Duck so much that I'd say it's now one of my favorite restaurants in Austin (first time was earlier this month). I'd go through all the dishes but that wouldn't be helpful because the menu changes seasonally (since they are a farm-to-table restaurant +1). First, I love that it's tapas styled (+1) because it means you get to try more dishes and nottt feel like you're over ordering!   What stands out to me about this restaurants is their sauces. The ones that I had with the heavier items (the red meat dishes) were rich and dimensional. Some of the flavors were unique because it had some aspects of familiar tastes mixed with ones that were foreign to me. I loved being able to try all the dishes because I knew I was tasting a unique dish that was created (or crafted) by a talented chef.   From a bar seat, I could tell that the servers and chef love what they're doing (trust me, it doesn't go unnoticed). I love knowing that my meal was made by people who are exploring, learning, and having fun! I honestly think it's hard to NOT want to support a restaurant like this..   Every foodie's must-try for sure.

reviews.author: Comyar Z.
reviews.description: We had a fantastic dinner at Odd Duck. We had a large-ish group of 6 with various dietary restrictions and our waitress was really amazing about catering to everyone! She created customized menus for each person indicating what they could/could not eat and even came back with variations of dishes the chefs said they could do. The service here is excellent, as was the food.  Food is tapas style, so we were ordering tons of dishes for the table. Their menu changes frequently, so what you get really depends on when you go. Overall, we had a great time here and would love to come back!

reviews.author: Grace K.
reviews.description: Odd Duck is definitely a must-visit if you are in Austin!  This restaurant supports the local Austin community, so it is neat seeing the various sourced goods within the innovative dishes here. It started in a trailer but transformed into what it is today with its farm to table creations.  We found street parking luckily, which was right on Gibson Street W. I did notice there is a private parking lot with valet included in it. I highly recommend making reservations. I found my reservation about ~3 days prior to the date. There are bar top seatings and outdoor seatings available. It's great for dates, friends or family (more for adults).  FOOD: Cajun Pork Rillette (4/5; Apples, Pickles, Sour Duck Market Sourdough): The cajun pork rillette was decent but enhanced with the addition of the veggies. The pickled veggies brought life to the dish. It was my first time trying rillette though, which is pork meat that is submerged in fat then cooked at an extremely slow rate. Another important note was the sourdough (it was baked perfect).  Mushroom Chorizo Tostada (5/5; Squash and Pepita Butter, Radish, Pickled Onions): This tostada was something else! It is very unique, and I loved all of it (including the texture of the tostada). There are 3 pieces, but I ate 2/3. I could have ordered another one for myself. The squash and pepita butter had some flavor, which helped bring another part of the taste element into play. Nothing overpowered another.  Apple Salad (4/5; Smoked Squash, Lavender, Chevre, Black Pepper Pecans): This is a lighter dish. I am not a big fan of apples, but I can assure you that I ate them in this salad! Great flavors that burst in your mouth... even the black pepper pecans.   Wagyu Sirloin Cap (5/5; Papa Bravas, Soubise, Green Bean Salsa Verde): My date loved this. He is an all time meat-lover, and he raved about this. The wagyu was cooked perfectly at medium-rare. It easily became one of my top 5. I also have to mention the pickled veggies with the papa bravas because they were delicious. I did not try much of the soubise (white onion sauce), but it was not overpowering. It added a nice, subtle savory taste with the wagyu.   Service was great and attentive. Everything came out on time. Our drinks never touched bottom.  Would I come back!? Definitely!!! They change the menu pretty often too. I am a fan.

reviews.author: Elizabeth Y.
reviews.description: Great place to eat at while in Austin!   Even when it's hot, the outdoor patio has shade and fans. the inside was blastingly chilly!   We were greeted immediately by the hosts and taken inside. The drinks were amazing. we ordered cornbread to go since we heard such amazing things but I wanted to try so many things on the menu and there were only 2 mouths to feed.   Unfortunately no duck egg for the dinner menu.  We got the wagyu beef which was slightly a bit more raw then I would have liked it.   Drinks were pretty good with the Cucumber Daze and a watermelon drink (can't recall it was one of their seasonal drinks)

reviews.author: Anni D.
reviews.description: Do yourself a favour and just make a reservation here. Odd duck is spectacular.  The happy hour drinks are a steal - $6 for some awesome cocktails. We tried the in house sodas as well and they were really unique.  Our server was super attentive and designed a tasting menu for our big group. Every dish was *fantastic*. My personal highlights were the scallop, zucchini salad, and French toast.

reviews.author: Phuong D.
reviews.description: The food was very good and creative. We love our grilled quail, Aged Pork Loin and Chocolate Fudge pie with a chilli hint. Great presentation too. The kale beignets are not so good

reviews.author: Edgar R.
reviews.description: Celebrated my friends birthday and had a pleasant experience. This is a sharing dishes type of restaurant rather than ordering your own plate.  Service: they offer complimentary valet parking, the valet person was extremely nice, and our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.   Food: LOVED the cornbread (totally recommend it), scallops were tasty, ceviche was ok, and nachos were ok too.  Drinks: were great. Recommend the Nice, Bryce.

reviews.author: Drew O.
reviews.description: Been here a ton back when I lived in Austin and was at Barleyswine when it opened too.   Our waitress completely ruined the night for our family gathering.  Not making any suggestions just telling us how to eat and order.   "Plates are too be shared so you need to order two of everything."  Never asked us if we wanted a second round of drinks.   Worst experience ever and a $400 check no less. Worst customer service and outright rude waitress.   We won't be back.

reviews.author: Casey T.
reviews.description: The praise for this place is well deserved - the food was just as memorable as the quirky name. I had the pleasure of trying the ceviche, cornbread, scallop, and wagyu steak dishes here and each dish blew me away with the creative fusion of flavors.  The pacing that the food was brought out was perfect, leaving just enough time to digest and converse between bites. I honestly was expecting the place to be a bit fancier on the interior given the price point and exterior, however, the quirky decor meshed perfectly with the spirit of the restaurant.  Our server was very attentive and made sure that we were taken care of, and carefully explained each dish, and gave suggestions for the best way to consume them. My personal favorite was the ceviche - although it wasn't traditional, it was one of the best that I've had - the flavors were phenomenal! Please get this if they have a variation of it on the menu.  I'm so excited to come back here again as they change their menu every month so there is always something new to look forward to!

reviews.author: Made B.
reviews.description: This place is not worth the hype! The only thing good was the cornbread.The wagyu sirloin Cap, in the January 2022 menu, was horrible and disgusting! The meat was stringy and hard, not at all what wagyu meat should be.The ceviche was a bite size with what looked and tasted like Lays barbecue potato chips. The worst experience in Austin. The lemon dessert was not tasty even for a dessert lover. It  was just like a bowl of sugar. The lemon cake was dry and the sorbet was just ok really no satisfaction. So disappointed because it had great reviews, but don't waist your money!I was so looking forward to supporting local restaurants especially farm to table, but after telling my waitress Rochelle that the wagyu was not great and seeing how she did not care makes me not want to try a different local restaurant tomorrow!

reviews.author: Edward A.
reviews.description: In town visiting Austin and landed here for our first night out for dinner. After booking I was super excited to hear my colleague confirm that it was a great choice.   We sat at the bar as it was the only thing available a week out when I booked. We took our servers recommendations for the most part. We tried a little bit of everything. Staff was super friendly and even more knowledgeable about every dish. A random runner, manager, chef would deliver a plate and explain in great detail. Watching the cook work the live fire oven was fun and seeing the Waygu sirloin caps getting seared made the mouth water.   Sadly, I'm coming off COVID snd my taste wasn't there as I would have liked but my foodie friend said everything was a 10!

reviews.author: Adela M.
reviews.description: The food and drinks were phenomenal.  The ceviche was by far my favorite item on the menu.  The type of food served here is very eclectic, a fusion of tex-mex, southern and Latin American.   The atmosphere is great for a first date, it's cool, casual, and stimulating to the eye.  The staff is very well versed on their menu and from my encounter with my servers, they are passionate and educated on the food and drink they serve.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: What a unique gem! Love this place because it's farm fresh to table but also just really unique dishes with unexpected ingredients like peach kimchi in the pork loin dish or green chili in cornbread with green garlic butter. Even the drinks have unique ingredients and nice twists.   We made reservations same day on our want to Austin. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were so nice and even made us some special cocktails not on menu.   We had: -cast iron cornbread. Seriously the best corn bread I've ever had. That green chili was such a unique and pleasant touch and the butter was amazing. It was so moist and the salt bits at the bottom were heavenly.  -the pork loin was so tender. I've never had pork a medium or light pink and got a little scared but was reassured this is normal way to cook pork so it's not too dry. Wow I've had pork all wrong all these years. It was so good and the little touches like kimchi peach, the mushrooms and the mole sauce were all just amazing.  -panna cotta was so unique because it had a torched marshmallow on top, graham crackers, mint, and rose petals. So delicious and great "light" way to end dinner. There's always room for dessert no matter how full you are, right?   Make reservations especially if you want a sit down table and not bar top. Love this place, now on my list of recos.

reviews.author: Gabriella G.
reviews.description: What a cool spot! We came here looking for a place with atmosphere, good drinks and good food and YES! This fit the bill!  We were seated at a bar-side table height space where we enjoyed the show of the busy kitchen- and it was a very interesting experience! If you are 2 and up to something different and into cooking: this is the one table for you!  So I posted a couple of pictures of the view of the kitchen... but here is the drink and food review!  We got 2 cocktails : The prickly pear margarita had a bitter after taste that I just had to work through (lol yes I finished it) and the other one was a (something in the bag) sweet and delicious vodka concoction: Reccommend! Then we got 2 appetizers the babaganoush and the nachos..: the babaganoush was green. It was interesting but... mostly tasted of a pea purée. It came with pickled squash that was sweet and delish and some pickled okra that was unexpectedly good! The bread was incredible. The best. The baba was different... Then we got the chicken nachos that were 4 very loaded and flavor nachos. They were very good- it was beautifully stewed or braised or whatever they did to the chicken was lovely! Lol. We were full after but had to had to taste this specialty I've cream we were privy to: an off the menu scoop of vanilla milk tea ice cream served with peach compote and brown butter cereal crunchies: our favorite part! Over all we had a great experience and the table by the kitchen offered us an intimate view of each dish as it was prepared and presented before being sent to the table!  What FUN!! Ask for this table! Apparently they take reservations and we just got lucky today  Enjoy.

reviews.author: Delaney J.
reviews.description: So happy we finally got into eating at Odd Duck. Food was absolutely delicious, and the service was incredible as well. overall a fantastic experience and I will definitely be going back. The ceviche was our favorite, the scallops were a close second.

reviews.author: Jin C.
reviews.description: I wanted my final meal in Austin to be an amazing one, and I did not regret making giving Odd Duck that honor. The menu here rotates monthly with whatever ingredients that might be in season, and flavors are punchy and inventive. All the dishes I ordered were excellent, and I only regret that I could not have tried more  The restaurant itself has a few different seating configurations - you can sit at the bar and watch the chef's in action, or do individual tables.  The cast iron cornbread was an excellent starter with crunchy, caramelized edges and the leek butter gave it a bit of a fresh vegetal touch. The marinated cucumber and watermelon salad with fish sauce and cashews evokes Thai papaya salad flavors.  I really liked the delicacy of the fried whole quail, but especially the creamed corn sauce that came with it. The aged pork loin was stellar - it made pork taste like high quality beef, and all of the little garnishes topped off the dish, the black garlic pecan mole was so flavorful.  I had the Dewberry Lane cocktail, which was very smooth, but a little bit too sweet for me.

reviews.author: Tom J.
reviews.description: Stopped for lunch, great service, good food. I had the grilled chicken salad. It was a lot of food and very fresh. Great server.

reviews.author: Pete C.
reviews.description: Great menu...lots to choose from and a great selection of draft beers  Ambiance outside dining under the live oaks is wonderful

reviews.author: AJ D.
reviews.description: Meh. Went for brunch and was underwhelmed by the menu. Very basic offerings. Also wife is obviously pregnant and waitress was pushing mimosas and drinks. Not a huge deal but kind of weird.   Got the breakfast club sandwich. One bread had burnt edges the other under toasted. Hot as heck outside and no lemonade or "refreshing" options. Again nothing concerning just off.   Wife got the "egg plate". Self explanatory. Not sure what I was expecting but wish I just went to Waffle House..

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: I recently discovered this place, a must try hidden in the back of shopping center. Food amazing  drinks are great and live music! How can you go wrong with this place?! Additional plus is their large outdoor lit patio.

reviews.author: Gina H.
reviews.description: Honestly I really wanted to write a positive review but instead I got very sick off the food tonight and still suffering. When I return this time ithis time it's different I believe the managers are different and is now owned by someone elsomeone else. They know they no longer make the drumsticks like before now they have dried up, comma bad bad dark meat of low quality, comma instead of the succulent white meat of chicken they normally do cook. They served me a very old salad it was horrible I didn't even get to taste it the tomatoes were rotten and smell it was were rotten and smelled you could tell the salad's been in a refrigerator for a long time period period the hamburger was a $22 hamburger small I took a picture so everyone could see a $22 hamburger with little fries. I'm not a glutton I just don't understand why someone would raise a hamburger that high I know that meat cost a lot these days, but but if it is small let it be an amazing tasting hamburger and his hamburger instead of dried up. To my shock I wasn't planning to write a negative review until I got home with a bad sickness my stomach is still hurting I don't know if it's what I ate or the chicken tasted funky. I don't think I can return back to this restaurant ever again I find it to be shocking that these people were very nice to me this time around  and didn't understand Why I felt bad after 35 to 45 minutes still feeling bad is still feeling  bad stomach aches..Hope this helps everyone out there who understands that if you're gonna pay over $50 for a meal it better be a good one instead of a  stomach ache!! New ownership but not in a good way!

reviews.author: Dhwanil S.
reviews.description: We were looking for a lunch place with patio open close by and this came up. We went there and we're amazed to see how big is their patio. Plus it was very nice and clean which is a plus.  We were greeted nicely and made to sit at their patio table in next few minutes. Our server was very good as the water came out fast and after placing drinks order it came out quick too.   For food we ordered brussel sprouts and fried cornbread as appetizers. Brussel sprouts were usual but corn break was too sweet than usual. Than we had aglio Olio pasta without chicken and it came out okay. Though I liked their chicken pesto club.   All in all, it's a nice place to have drinks with big outdoor patio, good service and decent food.

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: Tasty food, friendly and timely services plus good music. Very family friendly, especially at the patio.

reviews.author: Khristina P.
reviews.description: Will have to say I'm sad to leave this review.  I LOVE the ambiance!  They have a great outdoor patio!  Could have an awesome outdoor bar too... service is horrible!!  Food comes out late, and wrong... sometimes cold. Wish they could fix that because it's a really Cool spot. I've been there 4 times and each time, The food and service were the same. :(

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: This was my first visit. They have a really nice patio where we could enjoy the sunset with social distancing.  Service was excellent. They have a very complete beer list which included a local breweries. I had a burger which was good, but not exceptional.   We had a really good time and we plan to come back.

reviews.author: Adao J.
reviews.description: Great environment, taste food and delicious beer.   Really friendly staff is an addition to the delicious food and vast options of beer, drinks and wine.   The outdoor area is cosy with a great view. Also perfect to bring your dog to enjoy a brunch on the side of your best friend.

reviews.author: Bill V.
reviews.description: 3rd time was not a charm. Instead of Hope and Thyme, more like Waste of Tyme. Was there on a Thursday night. Musician who was truly awful playing his music too loud. They tried to seat us at a table that had yet to be cleaned. Then we waited 5 mins for anyone to come by the table once we were seated.  Despite placing our orders right away, we learned 30 mins in that there were still 10+ dinners ahead of us and it would be more time. Best thing of the night was the waitress offering to cancel our order and close out our tab with our drinks only.   Our previous visits were OK but never lived up to any of the reviews we've read.

reviews.author: Regina J.
reviews.description: I will never go here again. Bathrooms are broken and dirty. Food has gone downhill as the prices are higher. Issues with the New ownership relating to several things.

reviews.author: amber p.
reviews.description: Food was bland- their recommended dish. And the other time we were there the wait for our food was insane-like over an hour

reviews.author: Frank T.
reviews.description: Erica is not only a great person but a great bartender. She really makes you feel welcome and knows how to provide great service. The food is ok too. Very thoughtful menu. But all the dishes are lacking something and only the size of a kids portion.  Corn bread was good! Bsprouts were really good!

reviews.author: C. J.
reviews.description: The overall quality of not only food but ingredients and recipes has declined drastically in recent months. The caesar salad dressing went from creamy and rich with anchovy, to a simple blend of olive oil and parmesan cheese. Brunch items consist primarily of store bought premade processed ingredients straight from HEB. Sitting outside long enough you will notice employees running back and forth with bags from the HEB next door as the restaurant runs short on supplies throughout the day. A simple stroll toward the bathroom provides a clear view of the pantry stocked primarily with Knorr mixes and highly processed precompiled ingredients. For example a $22 Eggs Benedict Entree consisted of store bought Thomas English Muffins, pre-packaged ice cold Parma Prosciutto, Ore-Ida frozen potato cubes, and "hollandaise inspired" Knorr Bearnaise sauce powdered mix (almost more powder than liquid sauce). The side of bacon I ordered was unmistakably signature Hormel fully cooked bacon drenched in liquid smoke and processed applewood flavoring. It is truly a disappointment to see a local staple that once emphasized farm to table ingredients transition to a business model that more closely resembles "frozen food aisle to table."

reviews.author: Jim H.
reviews.description: Wonderful eating outside and the music was great. The chicken salad came with a handful of greens with no dressing or croutons as described in the menu. The chicken was placed beside the greens. Probably slightly overpriced in comparison to other venues. The other food item, a chicken sandwich was good, although the choices in sandwiches was extremely limited. The bill was paid on the credit card reader with my tip of 20%. I asked for a printed receipt and saw that the 20% was calculated on the total bill which included the tax. I guess I was partially tipping the government. That practice is not acceptable nor is it standard. My suggestion would be that when you go, put in your tip manually.

reviews.author: Tiffany J.
reviews.description: We had a great time this last Saturday at Hops and Thyme for a late Mother's Day celebration. I wish I would have gotten more pictures of the meal. Their outdoor dining area is so nice and the live music is great! All of their cocktails were great. We LOVED the Brussels sprouts. We got two servings of it. We also got the charcuterie board and fried cornbread and really enjoyed those as well. I had the aglio olio for my main and it was tasty. The bread pudding for dessert was a great finish! We met the new owner while we were there also and he was so welcoming. What a great neighborhood bar. We can't wait to come back to Austin to visit my MIL and go eat and drink here again.

reviews.author: John F.
reviews.description: I wanted to check this place out with a buddy of mine. Their mushroom soup was excellent but their lamb sandwich was like eating a salt stick. Comes with fries. My buddy had an Italian sandwich with chips.. We had ice tea no booze and place is way overpriced 70 bucks for lunch for two ridiculous

reviews.author: chris w.
reviews.description: The Braveheart black and blue is one of my favorite burgers around Lakeway. The cooks know exactly how to do a perfect medium rare, and I highly suggest that.   Hops and Thyme have a great selection of beers to go with this awesome burger no matter what your preference is.   The patio is a perfect place to spend an afternoon munching on great food and sipping delicious beers.

reviews.author: Brenda A.
reviews.description: The food is delicious with a variety from burgers to steak and seafood. The service has always been good as well. Delightful patio dining. I recommend this business.

name: Anthem
accommodations: Hipster, Romantic, Intimate, Trendy, Upscale, Classy, Casual
Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: A cute sorta tiki lounge. Want a micro staycation? If you allow your imagination to suspend disbelief, Anthem could be a tiki lounge on one of the islands of Hawaii...without the airfare to get there. The decor of longboards, hula girl jiggle figurines, and tiki torches can transport you for an hour or two to a tropical paradise.  The service was perfect! I unfortunately did not get the bartender's name, but he was prompt in greeting me, and offering to get me a drink to start my evening. My guy was parking the car so I ordered appetizers and drinks before HH ended. We had blood orange frozen margaritas which were delicious. We tried the fried cauliflower and some guacamole. Both had good sized portions and were tasty.  Another bartender checked on us as she walked by, which was great. I love when everyone works together to provide excellent service. There were two hosts at the door to greet people- they were both professional, warm, friendly, and prompt as well. Good job, Anthem in choosing excellent staff.  The decor was spot on. It felt upscale without the upscale prices. We sat at the bar, and the stools were comfortable enough to have a full meal if you were to choose to do so. Overall, the place was clean and spacious as well. Go check it out and let me know what you think. Aloha!

reviews.author: Brian B.
reviews.description: Before I get to the DELICIOUS food, I wanna give a shout out to our server, Christian. He was super friendly and helpful and made us 2 Austin visitors feel right at home. Thankful for you!!!  Now, the food. The JFC Popcorn Chicken was FIRE. We ordered the honey sesame version that was sooooo tasty!!  The sweet potato waffle fries were a hit too, and so was the chips and guac.   We also had espresso martinis that were surprisingly without coffee beans but still tasted good!  Overall, we LOVED our experience here. Whether it was Christian's incredible service or the amazing food, everything about this place was a treat. Would love to come back next time we're in town!!!

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: This place was great.  I came for happy hour with a friend and we got several happy hour snacks and drinks.  Both of our drinks were so delicious that we each got the others drink order for the second round.   The yummy fries were so so yummy.  I highly suggest.  The brisket wontons also were so great.   The place is super cute.  I would have much preferred to sit in the front more part of the restaurant with the bar. It's decorated so adorable and the booths are intimate and adorable.   The service was amazing. We had several different people waiting on our table so I'm not super sure how that worked out but it did.  It worked very well.  10/10 recommend.  Great place.   It was kinda hard to find parking tho.

reviews.author: Teah R.
reviews.description: I was blown away by this place - Texasian?! I have never heard of that fusion before but I am so glad it exists. I wish this was everywhere!  A group of 9 of us came here for dinner and we were all so impressed with the food. The appetizers are where it's at . The yummy fries blew some of us away - WOW. The brisket rangoon was outstanding. And the miso mac daddy....c'mon.   I would say the appetizers were more star players than the entrees. Don't get me wrong, the entrees were delicious too but I can't get over the apps.  The service was good. Our waitress was attentive and checked on us frequently. However, she did tell us there was a 2 hour service limit....  The decor was very cool and the whole restaurant had mood lighting. We had reservations at 6:30 and it was pretty dead at that time but really picked up 30 minutes later. Once it was a full house the atmosphere became louder and more vibrant. Right on S. Congress, where the bars are, I didn't see many parking options.  Overall, I want to come back here. I want a texasian restaurant in my city immediately! For now, i will just have to recreate their menu on my own.

reviews.author: Kia L.
reviews.description: LOVE LOVE LOVEEEEEE this cute gem! I can't believe it's tucked away on Rainey street. Street parking is hard to find unless you come on a weekend day. They have weekday happy hour which is basically only good for the drinks. Not many shareable food items on it. I'm so glad to have found this spot. The drinks were so great! These two drinks gave me the perfect buzzz. If you like fruity drinks try the Splash and EXSW (East by Southwest) hate the name but love the drink. We ordered the furikake fries which is the perfect comfort food and filling definitely big enough to share between 3-5 people! We also ordered the popcorn chicken, I personally did not like whatever coating/breading. Service was fast. I would definitely dine in again for weekend brunch or an early dinner.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: It's probably clear from other reviews that two of their best dishes are Brisket Rangoons and Miso Mac Daddy. However, don't sleep on the Nam Nom Noodle Salad! I almost never order salads from restaurants, but this one is worth it. It's the most flavorful salad I've ever had, and the balance of textures sends it over the top. Just as I was proofreading this post the manager came by to check that my meal was good. Their attention to detail keeps Anthem at the very top of my favorite restaurant list!

reviews.author: Andy O.
reviews.description: Been here a few times and the vibe + good always on point. The Mai tai in the Chinese to go box is worth the experience. Outside sitting is fun because of the sounds of rainy st

reviews.author: Moquita Q.
reviews.description: I loved dinning out here. The staff was nice the Decore was inviting. It reminded me of the surf restaurants off the beaches of Galveston. The food was great. I would recommend you order their fried shrimp and French fries. They have a bit of spice and come with cole slaw and dipping sauces! You get about 10-12 pieces and a ton of fries. It's enough for 2 people.

reviews.author: Melissa D.
reviews.description: Wooooow this place is awesome. I read about this spot online and wanted to try it because of the extremely unique menu items. It was a fantastic decision. It is a savvy mix of Asian and Latin cuisine with a fun spin, and it's affordable. Don't sleep on the miso Mac daddy -- it's a combination of like Mac and cheese balls and sushi. Truly amazing. The fried tofu app was delicious as well. For entrees, my partner had the noodle salad (yum), and I had the vegan curry dog (comes on a pretzel bun), and you can't go wrong with either. Really, it seemed like you can't go wrong with anything you choose here. Staff are all young, welcoming, and friendly. Added bonus: GREAT happy hour and cocktail menu in general. I'd eat here weekly if we were local.

reviews.author: Darlene K.
reviews.description: Everything was good. Really enjoyed everything about this place.    I would love a little more sauce. I'm just obsessed with all the sauces they used on the cauliflower.  The noodle salad was like the insides of a spring roll with hoisin/peanut sauce. Also, they were nice enough to split the salad for us.

reviews.author: Mitzy B.
reviews.description: What a delightful surprise! I did not really know what to expect when coming here, only that it had a good location and cool photos on its Yelp page.   I wish I had taken pictures of the food, but it was so good (and we were so hungry), that we completely forgot.   I was told you MUST get the brisket rangoons, and they did not disappoint! For the main course I got the Border Salad, which fed myself and my mom. Would definitely recommend. My husband got and loved the Hilo Chicken Sandwich with Furikake Fries (Furikake is a Japanese seasoning - mix of sesame seeds and dried seaweed).   Wish we lived in Texas, this place was fabulous! Great atmosphere, big screen TV's for sports, and an extensive drink menu as well

reviews.author: Roberto G.
reviews.description: I waited few minutes to be seated but once I entered they were friendly and I really enjoy the cocktails and the meal.  The quality for the price is amazing, I definitely recommended

reviews.author: Samuel P.
reviews.description: Amazing restaurant!!! Seated 12 of us immediately, food came out quickly. Service was really attentive and nice. Would recommend the white peach sake, it tasted like lemonade. Ordered the aloha burger - sadly looked better than it tasted but the frukake fries made up for it.

reviews.author: Yvonne M.
reviews.description: Delicious meal and drinks! We were told these were small tapas size but everything is bigger in Texas!  Recommend the shishito pepper queso and popcorn chicken, brisket Rangoon was interesting! Staff is super friendly and my dog was able to enjoy the night on the patio too :)

reviews.author: Carlson Z.
reviews.description: Normally I'm not a big fan of fusion cuisine because the flavors don't always work and it can feel inauthentic but man this place does Texas/Asian fusion right. Went here for Sunday brunch and it was much better than my expectation.  I highly recommend the JFC Chicken and Biscuits... it was to die for! My only complaint is that the brunch menu felt a little limited. There were only 4 entrees and 2 sides.

reviews.author: Alex B.
reviews.description: Wow - so many amazing foods to try! So, we decided to try them all with the sharable appetizer platter called, The Cure! That was definitely the move - 4 of us shared The Cure, the Aloha Burger, and the Hilo Hawaiian Sandwich with 2 sides (Roasted Cauliflower w/ vegan thai green goddess dressing and the Sweet Potato Fries w/ truffle yuzu and miso aioli).  This was the PERFECT amount for the 4 of us to share. The staff even split the burger and sandwich in half for us without us even asking! We were also able to super easily split the bill evenly.  Our server was polite and attentive. The vibe of the restaurant was so fun and unique. We did have reservations for 8:45pm on Sunday night, however, I don't think we would have needed them because the restaurant was not very busy despite how delicious it was!  HOT TIPS: - definitely try the Brisket Rangoons and Hilo Hawaiian Sandwich!

reviews.author: Esther A.
reviews.description: SHISHITO PEPPER QUESO $7 - the queso was good but the shishito peppers did not add anything. Just think of it as good regular queso.  HAPA CHICKEN SANDWICH  $14 and HILO HAWAIIAN SANDWICH $17 - We got these two with an order of the sweet potato waffle fries and an order of FURIKAKE FRIES. Between the two sandwiches I liked the chicken one better. The hawaiian had a lot going on and frankly I think there was too much competition between all they ingredients for any one of them to stand out. Additionally I don't think it was worth $17. The chicken sandwich was simpler, but because of it I remember the chicken. Both types of fries were good. The Furikake didn't add anything to the regular fries.   PIÑA OLD FASHIONED - I never order old fashioneds, but everything else I wanted from the happy hour menu was unavailable. I was not disappointed. it had a tasty dried ginger and pineapple garnish which I munched on and the drink itself was both strong and delightful!  Note: The waitstaff here was not required to wear masks and therefore didn't.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: Luv this spot. Other than the parking problem it's a great stop on Rainey street. Entrance host was very kind and seated us quickly  even in a very busy shuffle of people. Sat down and had a cool view of the outside while enjoying AC. Our waiter was cool and explained some of the hot items on the menu. His suggestions were great.  The chicken and waffle was on point. Hubby had a drink and the DJ was on fire. This was our Sunday funday and we will be back

reviews.author: Julissa M.
reviews.description: Wow! The food and service is amazing! The cutest restaurant with gorgeous Hawaiian modern decor not the tacky kind lol . The music vibe is fire!   My gf and I shared the aloha burger (freaking delicious) and without asking for it our server Dalton  split the plate for us! (Nice touch). We also had the Kung Pao chicken.... One word. Amazing! Mai Tai cocktail is served in a Chinese vintage take out! ( so cool and Instagrammable ). The pineapple bread pudding is so good! Warm delicious and not overly sweet which is great with a scoop of vanilla ice cream!!   Can we go back to our server!?  Dalton! It was a pleasure to be served by you on my birthday! Thank you, the hostess and the manager  for making it special with your awesome hospitality :)

reviews.author: Melody V.
reviews.description: This was my 2nd time coming to Anthem. I got to try some of the brunch items this time. We got the chicken and waffles, chicken and biscuits, and several appetizers.  The service is so amazing here and the food is on point.  If you're visiting from out of town this is a must try restaurant.

name: Growler USA - Austin
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Ryan K.
reviews.description: Great, friendly bartenders... so many options on tap. Great place to try a new, local brew!

reviews.author: Eliott L.
reviews.description: Good vibes, and great location. $3 draft IPA? Sign me up-- they have great daily specials and have a super nice staff. Ask for Sam if you get the chance.

reviews.author: Madison W.
reviews.description: Everything taste so good and cooked so well. Will definitely be coming back! Ordered online and was ready 10 minutes early. Stayed warm the whole way home and is delicious!! The sauce is to die for!

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: Came here with a few friends for the Friends Trivia night.  We ordered some draft beer from the many selections. The waiter was very informed on all of their selections and was able to answer all  of our questions - with a smile.  Ordered some wings, a sandwich wrap, chips and salsa. Food was decent and priced fair. Service was fast even on a busy night.  Pros: Beer selections Staff's knowledge on the products offered here  Cons: Parking - Parking and Parking well rather lack of

reviews.author: Nathan F.
reviews.description: Love this place and one of the only places near campus that provide growlers to go and have a variety of stuff. Friendly and helpful staff and great selection I'm basically a Covid regular

reviews.author: Bethany M.
reviews.description: My weekly go to, I love the friendly service and upbeat atmosphere, and of course beer selection.  Great specials and a full menu.

reviews.author: Roy G.
reviews.description: Average tap house with decent food.  The parking lot is small but there was parking both times I came by.  The beer selection is pretty good.  They capture a broad spectrum of tastes and styles of beer. The food is bar style, wings, fries, tots, sandwiches, etc.  nothing I ate was noteworthy. There is room for improvement on greeting and service times.  There was one person working the bar and another waitress floating but no one approached us so we got up and asked.  Then another gentleman came from the back to wait on us.  There were not enough people in this place for the service not to be swift and great. Especially when I bring a party of 8 that are all eating and drinking. Anyway it's a good stop for a quick bite and a beer if you're in the area.  Just not a place on my list to revisit.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: I'm so glad this place opened in such a safe manner during COVID. Everything is so clean and follows the procedures. Also AJ's playlists are fire. Tap takeover is a must

reviews.author: Rohan C.
reviews.description: Growler is an American classic. If you're not going to Growler during Tap Takeover on Thursday, what are you doing? The staff is amazing, AJ and Cannon are amazing people.

reviews.author: Sirena L.
reviews.description: Growler USA is definitely one of my favorite places to go to for drinks and food. There's a fantastic selection of beer; with something like 100 taps, you're bound to find something you like, whether you want a sour, IPA, or stout. Most of them are Texas beers and the selection is always changing. If you're not feeling beer, there are plenty of other drinks too: sodas, kombucha, wine, cider, mead, etc. A huge plus for me about Growler USA is they have pours starting from 4oz -- perfect for flights and lightweights! -- to the typical 12/16oz, and of course they fill growlers.  There is also decent food that goes a bit beyond typical pub food and is of course more varied than a food truck at a brewery. I'm particularly fond of the tater tots and mac and cheese, but it looks like they've added some new items to the menu in the last couple of months.   Another great aspect of Growler USA is the incredible staff. There is one woman in particular - her name eludes me - but she is extremely knowledgeable about beer of all kinds and can give you some great suggestions based on what you're feeling (or even if you're trying to do a beer and food pairing)!  I believe there is also some kind of special every day of the week. I know Sundays are $1 off sours, happy hour all day (discount on all appetizers), and I believe the tapover beers are discounted as well. Plus they do special events like Beer 101 classes. For all these reasons, I think Growler USA is a great value overall and there really is something for every taste. I know I'm always learning and trying something new every time I come here, and it keeps me coming back!

reviews.author: Lauren S.
reviews.description: Take advantage of the specials and this can be a very reasonable place to get a good beer. The extensive menu and regular Tap Takeovers encourage would-be cicerones to expand their palate.  Don't bother with an entree. Food is mostly overpriced and underwhelming, so maybe get a large appetizer to share with your party. The wings and tots are alright and I hear good things about the pretzels.  The staff is all pretty nice. The price point and atmosphere attract a slightly older crowd for a location so close to a university, so don't worry about this place being flooded with undergrads like myself most of the time.

reviews.author: Clint S.
reviews.description: This place has countless things going for it: a friendly and knowledgeable staff, phenomenal selection of beers, and stellar food.   My partner and I come here at a minimum of once a week.

reviews.author: Tom B.
reviews.description: *MANAGEMENT PLEASE READ THIS*  Whoever you have bartending today needs to be spoken to. I generally write positive reviews, but this needed calling attention to.  I just walked with my wife and daughter for lunch.  We waited a few minutes to be seated, or told to seat ourselves - but were totally ignored.  Finally a guy at the bar told the bartender that we had been waiting a while and she said, loud enough for us to hear, "I don't care, I'm busy."  The place was not remotely packed.    Terrible, and very rude, service by the bartender working today.  Candidly one of the worst experiences I've had, and we didn't even make it to a table.  We headed over to Torchy's for a great meal instead.

reviews.author: Derian T.
reviews.description: This place is outrageous! Every time I find myself in this establishment, I am off-put by the care shown to me by the staff, and how excruciatingly good the service always is. Also another thing that irks me is just how good the pretzel is. Why can't other tap rooms produce a pretzel of the quality of the Food Truck Bavarian Pretzel.  Also the price of beer during happy hours, Friday's, and Sundays is OUTRAGEOUS. $3 on select beers?? What is this? My friends fridge?? On top of this the incredible selection makes me red in the face with frustration, that like that special someone, keeps me coming back for more.   All and all this establishment is painfully well run and makes me smile.

reviews.author: Kathy Z.
reviews.description: This place is great for happy hours for small to medium sized groups. They have a broad selection of draft beers and the menu is organized so you can easily find the type of beer you are in the mood for. The tap takeover beers are $3. I've been a few times when tap takeover brewery is there and they let you sample some of their beer. They also have reverse happy hour on Saturday nights. I've had the tater tots and pretzel, and both are simple but delicious. Parking is easy, and the staff is helpful and friendly.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: Great Lunch Place!!!  Really cool place. I love it. You can get your eats, drinks and growler for later. Yummy fish tacos. The menu was fun. Tots and tacos sound good to me!   I didn't think to buy a growler but the manager told me about their growlers. I now have a glass   free growler that is insulated.    Love the samplers. And they have kombucha on tap that is the Best I have ever had. A few beer and a kombucha for good measure.   YUM!  After a bevy you can go to Malvern's and Oat Willie's.    Thanks!

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Wow oh wow! Free wifi, tons of awesome board games with all the pieces, lots of seating and the ability to raise the windows, plus over 100+ beers on tap?!?!). This is an amazing hidden gem on campus... I can't believe I haven't went to this place before! They have some awesome deals and $3 growler fills on certain days (which is unbelievable deal).  I will be back thirsty to drink! Check this place out for sure! If you come during happy hour they have some awesome deals for food as well (your typical bar fare).

reviews.author: Hillary K.
reviews.description: This place is awesome. It's definitely got that local bar feel. The people walk in and are greeted by their first names. My favorite thing about this place is the selection of beers and that you can get 4oz choices for roughly $2. That way if you don't care for something you didn't spend $6-$8 on a glass. There are TVs and good music playing. The staff were incredibly nice and helpful. The food selection is good and tastes good as well. We will definitely be back. This is a feel good place to relax and have a drink and bite to eat away from the typical touristy spots in Austin.

reviews.author: Laura O. D.
reviews.description: First customers in yesterday,and had a great experience with bartender "AM". She was friendly and knowledgeable about huge beer selection. In the end we bought 2 additional growlers on her suggestion about some rare / different local beer from Live Oak Brewing. Also bought the 512 IPA for my Bro. Honey Sriracha wings and tots were a nice snack while we tasted the different beers. Great place and atmosphere!

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Really good selection of beers.  Quite a lot of double IPA and higher abv pours.  Offer 4oz pours on everything at different prices depending on rarity.  But they also offer samples before you commit to anything.  Didn't try food but it looked like typical pub fare from the menu.  Closes at midnight but kitchen closer to 11.  Free WiFi and about 5 TVs.  Main knock on this place is placement of TVs.  Almost 60% of the seats have no view of a TV.  If at bar you're sitting sideways to see and most high tops look out the window.  Will be back because I really liked the selection, but setup just seems pour for this type of bar.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: I still remember the first time we went there. It was on the slow end of Dirty Sixth, where the old Havana location was.   I recall it vividly because of an interesting Interaction I had with the bartender.  As I looked at the menu, I asked about the pastrami and he said, "Its good. So good in fact, it's the second best in town, behind Pious Pizza."  I remember thinking how it was honest but cocky at the same time. Sure, you may not think it's the best, but you're sure your second best?  Well, he was right.  Fast forward to a cool, hazy night in 2022 at their South Lamar location. First of all, the building is immaculate, an intentional nod to their style and culture. I love it.  My wife had the prosciutto baguette, which was delicious. Although the bread almost stole the show on that one.  The kiddo had the chicken schnitzel and, man, who puts that much effort into a kids plate? Really tasty and well executed.  I, like always, went with old faithful, the pastrami sandwich. My old friend was as delicious as always, as it didn't disappoint. The bread was great but didn't come close to stealing the limelight.   I've always worried about Easy Tiger turning into one of those Austin brands (talking to you Torchy) that loses its way, and I'm sure some may feel that way, but the experience at South Lamar could've been back at that old Sixth Street basement.   Five stars, folks.

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: This one hurts my heart because I had been so eager to come here.   A big group of myself and a bunch of other girls had decided that Easy Tiger was the place we wanted to support this night! I was so excited because, like I said, this was a top place on my list of places to go!  We had called the day of to make sure they could accommodate a large group. They said yes. We let them know when we were coming that night and how many of us it would be. All good (we thought)!  Our group starts to arrive at Easy Tiger and we realize that they thought we were coming the next morning and not the time we had told them. Okay, no biggie, we can fix this. We had also been told that there were only two servers that night. You could tell they were overwhelmed. We had made it clear that we wanted to make it as easy as possible for our server since there were so many of us. We were told that they would be able to give us two long tables next to each other so our group would be at least semi close. This didn't happen. Again, whatever... It just kind of sucked.  Now on to food! Yay! Most of us were starving. I can't speak for everyone else but I decided on the Pretzel. It looked so good in the IG photos. When it came out (fast if I may say), it was cold and not soft :( The cheese and other sides it came with felt like they were just taken out of the freezer. Inedible. Sad Ashley.  I drank a Peach Mule that was A1!! That was the highlight of my time here!  Would definitely come back, sit at the bar, and maybe order something different. I'm sure this was just a case of miscommunication and I'm excited to give them a second chance!

reviews.author: Sean Matthew L.
reviews.description: Easy Tiger has a warm special place in my heart. When their 6th street location closed I was so sad, but then like gremlins overnight they multiplied in the best of ways. Having an east austin, and south austin offering and more is such a boon.   We love their snacking/grazing boards. What millennial wouldn't? They're basically adult lunchables. Meats and cheeses and nuts and jams, oh my.   The pretzels and beer cheese are also legendary. But so much so that they sadly often run out of pretzels like they did for us the other day.   We love the use of covered and outdoor seating, especially in this time.   Wanting more substantial fare, they got you. The sausages, pastrami, the blt, all incredible. Really you can't go wrong. So, go!

reviews.author: Jelexus M.
reviews.description: Okay so, I ran across this post of super cute bars in Austin. Well of course I had too try them ALL. Starting with Easy Tiger.  Location: upon arrival it looks like an outdoor situation but once you park your car around the back you slowly realize it's a indoor/outdoor vibe. Areas have great coverage from the sun and I love that they have fans as well as Heaters on the ceiling!   Food: The Food was Fan-Freaking-Tastic. I won't lie first glance at the menu I was ehh. Nevertheless I asked my waiter chandler what should I order he made wonderful recommendations.   The pretzel  10/10: crispy outside pillowy soft inside   The Cajun Chicken Sausage 10/10: that prefect snap you want from any sausage casing and the home made Chow-Chow was the prefect topping.   The breakfast potatoes  10/10 : It was like the par-boiled the pots then fried them    Brussels sprouts 8/10 : Great flavor just wanted them a little more tender   Our cocktails 8/10  We order 3 different kinds all three were just okay.   The dessert and bread too take home was also really good.   All in All I would definitely recommend stopping by.

reviews.author: Jevin H.
reviews.description: The beer at here was pretty good. I liked the heavenly haze and my friend got the pog-slammer. Haze was a IPA similar to electric jellyfish from pint house. Pog had very citrus-y flavors which I liked. I also got the pretzel which was decently sized. The dips were good for the pretzel.  The bad part... the service. We ordered three beers the first time around, which took around 15 minutes to arrive. The beers weren't really cold at this point. I am not sure how that would be possible but I expect it to be the waiting staff seemingly lounging around talking to each other doing nothing. We asked for the waitress and it took an additional 10 minutes for her to arrive. We then ordered more food and drinks which took additionally extremely long amounts of time. The kicker was that there were two other seated tables so the place was basically empty. I would really recommend going to the 7th location over this one, at least while the current waiting staff is still doing what they did when we went.   Food was alright. Service was shockingly bad.

reviews.author: Dave A.
reviews.description: I went mid-afternoon to pick up salad and bread. They texted me ahead to let me know they were out of pre-sliced bread but had whole loaf of same flavor. I accepted it but had wanted pre-sliced. There is a lot of construction underway and it makes parking cramped.   Also, I could not locate the curbside spots. I went to the host stand to pick up. Nearly got run over by an impatient driver driving around the "Slow Down, Stay Awhile" sign. Ironic.   The Winter Kale salad seems overpriced for the portion size. It is tasty, just on the small side.   The North side location is much better. Maybe this one will improve after construction.

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: We stopped by for a late lunch on a Monday and this place did not disappoint. We decided to sit in the upstairs area. Our food and drinks arrived promptly and everything was delicious. I haven't visited after work which tends to be more lively.   Overall pleasant experience and menu prices are reasonable. If you're new in town or just visiting, it's worth a trip - I do recommend.

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: I like the ambience. During the day time, you can study, meet up with a friend, or go on a date! There is parking, indoor seating, and outdoor patio.   They have great pretzels and drinks. If you go from 7-10 am on the weekdays, they have $5 special of any coffee with pastry!

reviews.author: Sabrina B.
reviews.description: This is a joint review from me and my partner. We went on two separate occasions. I went with my coworkers on a Thursday for an outing/birthday. The place itself is cute. Allows dogs. Twinkling lates. Cornhole off to the side. Just a cute, trendy, Austin-like place. But the experience was lack luster. The food took very long. The establishment didn't own enough cups, so part of us had to share cups or just didn't have water. The food was mediocre, save the fries. In this kind of weather, you should be prepared for flies to constantly fly around and land on your food. The drinks are also weak and the time between them will sober you up.   My partner went a separate time. This time I had three things to eat: a strawberry and goat cheese salad, French toast bites, and ricotta toast to share. The salad was ok, but smelled absolutely rank. Even the vinaigrette smelled super off, and not in a heavy-in-vinegar kind of way. The goat cheese wasn't the best, and frankly you could see the indentation of the packaging. The French toast bites bad poor texture. You'd expect to use a slightly stale brioche but instead was a baguette style. It was not soaked enough in the egg mix before cooking for it to have a fluffy texture. Instead, it was hard and unenjoyable. A poor quality baguette instead of the nice ones at real boulangeries. The ricotta toast was the best part, but still wasn't that great. Texture was also off, like an overcooked steak that takes too much force to rip apart. Not only that, but the food took 1 hour to get here.  At the end, they took his card and forgot to return it for 30 minutes. Couldn't get a hold of the waiter and left very late due to him forgetting about us.  Twice have they been very disappointing! Don't recommend this place unless you just want to waste money on a company credit card or take your young mother-in-law that you hate.

reviews.author: Vivian C.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed the atmosphere! My fiancé and his dad enjoyed the beers here, while his mom and I happily sipped our latte. All great.   We all shared a sourdough bread and wow it tasted so fresh and tasty! It was as if it was freshly baked (which I believe that's what they advertised) and it was more than enough to take home to enjoy for breakfast the next day. We also all shared the sausage sampler with the sauces that go with each sausage which I LOVED. Each of them had their own taste and they did an excellent job pairing them with the appropriate sauce.   As for my entrée, I ordered the prosciutto baguette which was quite huge! Very delightful, but I ended up not finishing it. Their bread portions are very generous.   Would love to come back!

reviews.author: Kasper L.
reviews.description: We stopped by on a lazy Sunday to unwind and check out the place since I've always wanted to stop by. I'm glad we did! I really like the whole look of the restaurant (even though parts of it were under construction). We had a few drinks and really liked them. We decided to snack a bit and ordered the pretzel. My fiancee really enjoyed it! I thought it was good. The beer cheese was delicious!  I wish we had the stomach and time to stay for a meal since I thought the menu sounded tasty. I would love to stop by for brunch one day too.

reviews.author: Linda M.
reviews.description: Easter Sunday and no reservations? No problem. My friends and I decided to check out the new South Austin location of Easy Tiger. It was my suggestion and, thankfully, everyone loved it!  We started with a cinnamon knot, a soft pretzel with mustard, and a round of mimosas. The pretzel was out of this world! Warm, with a light sprinkling of Kosher salt, a crispy exterior and the lightest, fluffiest interior EVER!  We got it with a nice whole grain mustard; cheese was an optional side. The cinnamon knot was pretzel dough in a different shape with a sprinkling of cinnamon (it was savory, not sweet). Good, too, but it wasn't warm, so it got overlooked as we focused on the warm pretzel. As you can see from my photos, we were overcome with hunger and I almost didn't get a picture of the pretzel at all! It was that good.  We moved on to the Grazing Board, a side salad, and avocado toast.  The grazing board was truly a show stopper. It included a blue cheese, guyere, and brie, Prosciutto, sweet red grapes, dark and white raisins, slices of sour dough and walnut cranberry bread, tiny, tiny gherkins, candied walnuts, apricots, whipped butter and other toppings. It was visually stunning, but equally delicious. The house salad had the best, giant croutons and a light, delicious dressing with fresh greens, cherry tomatoes, radish slices. The avocado toast was a thick slice of grilled sour dough topped with a generous mound of mashed avocado, cherry tomatoes, and thinly sliced radishes. Delicious!  The space at the S. Lamar location is very nice, bright and open. There are several outdoor seating areas, so no problem finding a spot to sit. There might be an issue finding parking, as the parking lot is small (and each parking space is tiny!)  I cannot wait to go back and try some other things on the menu as everything I saw coming out of the kitchen looked good. I want to try it all!

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: Long story short, the drinks were good but the food and service left a lot to be desired. I didn't drink much and I really only took a few sips from my friends beers and most were good. I'm not a beer enthusiast but I have nothing to complain about when it comes to the flavor of the drinks. The food was very underwhelming since it left a lot to be desired. The cinnamon twist was super dry and not very warm. It's like they left it out for a while and just gave it to us because even 10 seconds in the microwave would've made that cinnamon twist soft. The pretzel was a lot better since it was softer and the three dips that came with it were good with mustard being my favorite. However, neither felt fresh. It felt like both were sitting out for a while since a freshly baked pretzel would be much warmer and much softer.  Okay with all of the good or mediocre stuff out of the way, I just wanted to say that the service here was one of the worst I've had in a long time. My friends and I ordered some beers and it took 20 minutes for us to receive them. When we got them they didn't feel as cold as they should be which leads me to believe that they were poured earlier and forgotten there. I question how it takes 20 minutes to deliver the beers when we were one of three tables there and you simply need to pour the beers into a cup. Every time my friends ordered more drinks, there was usually a 20 minute delay before the drinks arrived. When we asked one of the waiters if he could get our waitress, she didn't come until 15 minutes later. There was no urgency in the servers and they were just hiding behind the divider chatting it up. Good service needs to be the waiters and waitresses coming to us instead of us searching for them. I've heard a lot of good things about Easy Tiger and I think I'll be going to 7th street Easy Tiger given how poor the service was here.

reviews.author: Piyush A.
reviews.description: What a gem on South Lamar! There are some business that have survived the pandemic, some that have folded, but there are very few that have creatively embraced it. Easy Tiger has gone beyond that where they started the business during the pandemic and built something absolutely majestic.   Drinks - Ofcourse the beer selection is amazing but the best part is that there is something for everyone. They have a great selection of wine and some really cool cocktails.   Food - This was a pleasant surprise. I have never heard my food snob wife utter the words "This may be the best avocado toast I've ever had" .. not just that the Brussels sprouts are a delight and the egg sandwich is really good too  Ambience - This is where they go from being great to phenomenal.. the outdoor area is a perfect setup and the best part is that they have a little kiddie park for the little ones. All this overlooking the green belt.. does/can it get any better?   One thing to add .. on a good day parking lot gets full very fast so plan accordingly!   A must must go for a nice sunny day or otherwise :)

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: I can't complain about the beer. The cinnamon twist I ordered was 1.5/10. It was hard and stale, and the temperature was lower than lukewarm. If they tried to reheat it even just a little bit, it probably would've been much better.   The service was absolutely appalling. We ordered beers, 1 for each person for 3 people total when we arrived. It took about 20 minutes for our beers to arrive, and it wasn't even busy. There were only 2 other tables at the time.   When they dropped off the beers, I asked if I could order another one. He told me he'd get the waitress for us, but she took another 15-20 min to come get our order. The whole time during the wait, I noticed that a decent amount of staff (4-6 people) were standing around chatting with each other in the back. The whole time they were chatting, we were waiting for our waitress to give her our next order of drinks.   TL;DR: Extremely inattentive staff, with very slow and poor service. Staff doesn't seem to care about the customers at all, and the cinnamon was stale.

reviews.author: Aleah H.
reviews.description: Easy Tiger is a pretty popular spot to come up when planning a trip to Austin, so we decided to see what all the hype was about! We visited as soon as we got to town, so we got a bit of a sampler lunch. The server informed us that their bakery was down so anything with their bread was off the menu for the day. This was a particular bummer because that also meant to pretzels which I'd heard a lot about! Regardless, we find some great bread-free options.   We settled on the kale salad, sausage platter, chicken schnitzel tenders, fries. The fried were amazing-- waffle cut and so crispy!! I am not a huge kale gal, but the kale salad was also amazing and made me feel better about the fries!  The sausage platter is a fun way to sample a few things, but the server dropped a couple pieces of the brat when bringing our platter and didn't acknowledge it or offer to replace them which was a bit awkward and disappointing (why I deducted a star). Overall, the brat was the least exciting option on the board so we just enjoyed the rest, but it wasn't ideal.   We also got a pitcher of one of their Austin pale ales which was a great light lunch pairing! Their beer menu is pretty expansive with both local and classic/safe options.   Parking was a bit tight because this spot is so popular! On a Saturday for lunch our wait was 20 minutes which was very reasonable. They also have a little park area for kids which is fun!

reviews.author: Jenny K.
reviews.description: I drove thirty minutes here to check out the kids play area and the experience of eating and hanging out here did not disappoint!  First off, I love how you sit, order on your phone and the servers bring stuff out. Super efficient and felt safe during these COVID times.   Second, the outdoor seating is spacious and has a great view of the kids play area so you can keep an eye on them while you eat and drink.   Thirdly, the food is delicious! I got the seasonal pasta salad and fried Brussels sprouts and both were excellent.   And last but not least, the coffee is awesome! I'm from Seattle and have high coffee standards, and I just loved my cappuccino.   Thank you for offering a kid-friendly place for us to hang out!!

reviews.author: Andreas S.
reviews.description: Solid choice for a beer garden. It's a bit off of the main street which makes it quieter, but it seems like they could have switched the building / beer garden with their parking lot and offered their guest a view too. Either ways, came here on a good weather Sunday and waited for around 30 mins which is OK, plenty of open seats but I suppose they were careful with Covid. Service itself was also a bit slow - you order via a QR code and your own phone, but the food itself took a bit to come out. We had a large pretzel, Bratwurst and a turkey sandwich. The pretzel was great, warm and soft. Sandwich was also good, with a nice brie, very filling. Could have had a bit more of a side with it than the couple of salad leaves. The bratwurst was also decent. We saw lots of people walking out with baguettes and the likes, so supposedly those are good and worth a try.  The beer selection is OK, assuming you're a fan of smaller breweries that do a ton of hoppy brews, nothing really Pilsener like in the selection.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Great place for casual dining.  Views from upstairs are beautiful. We enjoyed the cheese plate and drinks!

reviews.author: Dawn S.
reviews.description: A beautiful fall evening in Austin deserved a patio visit. We sat upstairs and the view didn't disappoint. We just missed the sunset but the sky was still stunning.  We grabbed some menus and decided on drinks and a giant pretzel. We also got the charcuterie board. My friend got a margarita which is said was 4/10 on a scale of margs. I tasted it and to me it tasted like a melted frozen margarita. Way too sweet for my liking. I wanted a cab (wine of choice) which they didn't have...I got a Malbec which wasn't horrible but I prefer a good bold cab.  The pretzel was great as always and the charcuterie board was well laid out. Neither one of us like the almonds. They had some sort of oil on them. What I really was sad about was the jam. I was hoping for a fig jam but it was not. My first bite was not good at all. I even asked the waitress what it was...she very nicely called down to the kitchen on her little mic and found out that it was a strawberry ginger jam. Those two flavors do not go together in my personal opinion. The ginger was way too strong and over powering.  The cheeses on the cheese board from Antonelli's Cheese Shop were on point. The goat cheese with honey was great. The blue cheese was yum and the Gouda was "Gouda".  ba dum tss.   Overall- this place is a no brainer for a casual night with friends over a pretzel and a beautiful view.

name: Whisler's
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Zoey S.
reviews.description: Great bar, great vibes but really why I always go back... tampons on the bathroom. That is a true establishment. Cheers to you whistlers!

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: SHAKE IT TILL YOU MAKE IT!   After dinner last night we decided on going bar hopping. I really don't know the places to go so I trusted my brother and his girlfriend's opinions here. They wanted to show me the places where they have gone on dates and enjoyed.   Whiskers was one of the first stops we made after dinner. My brother told me that this bar had plenty of different rooms that you could go into. So we first walked around and went into each of the rooms before ordering some drinks.   Me being the smart 25 year old that I am decided for the evening since I had already had vodka at dinner I was going to only drink white liquor for the evening because I did not want to screw myself and be really hungry over when my parents got here the next day. (HAHA)!   I looked over the seasonal menu and decided on the Sage Advice drink! It had citrus juices in it as well as vodka. And it was spectacular. All of the flavors in this beverage complimented each other very well. It is definitely one of those drinks I would classify as dangerous. If you had a few of those you might be on the floor. It honestly tastes like juice. So one too many might lead to you not being able to walk. So just be warned.   The inside of the bar was decorated for christmas. They went all out. There were chandeliers at the bars and lights everywhere and even one big christmas tree all decorated in white lights.   It is definitely one of those bars that you need to check out next time you are in Austin. I have only seen it with the holiday decor, but I am sure they decorate it all out for other holidays as well!   The staff and service was great! Very quick and easy. It is a busy bar so you might have to wait a few minutes to get a bartenders attention. But it it all worth it at the end of the night!

reviews.author: Brandon Y.
reviews.description: An East Austin staple with an eclectic and quirky décor.  If you are looking for a quiet, stuffy cocktail bar, this place is not what you're looking for (at least on the weekends). I would characterize it as sort of a slightly dressed up dive bar with some very unique vibes. The interior has the feeling of an old wild west sort of saloon, crossed with an old cathedral, crossed with an old hunting lodge. Past patrons have written messages on the walls and it is interesting reading some of their musings while sipping on an old fashioned. The exterior bar is fairly standard, although there is a random bath tub located in the middle of the backyard area, which is another interesting quirk.  Generally, the cocktails here are quite good; sometimes they pre-make the cocktails in a larger batch, cutting down on the wait time a bit. My experience has generally been positive with the pre-made cocktails.  One downside here is that it is very popular and is therefore quite crowded much of the time. During the busiest hours on weekend nights, you can expect to encounter a line to get in and another line to get drinks. That said, if you're with the right company, a few minutes wait for cocktails is pretty tolerable.  If you are visiting Austin, this is one good spot to check out to experience the "charm" of the area. Additionally, being on 6th, this place is very walkable to other bars and makes for a great place to start or end the night.

reviews.author: Anni D.
reviews.description: Was recommended by multiple people to check out this spot but I was pretty unimpressed. We came here on a Thursday night and it was extreme packed. Waiting 30+ mins at the bar to order drinks is not fun.   The drinks themselves were just OK. Nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary. Not sure what the hype is about.
