reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Whisler's has been a gem on the east side withe great vibes and phenomenal cocktails. Came here on a Saturday afternoon and had the best time getting some drinks while sitting on the patio. The bartenders are awesome and extremely helpful when ordering.   We ordered a few drinks, and we loved each one of them! They even offer happy hour 2-5 daily which includes an old fashioned, a gin lavender drink, mule, and many more. As we were leaving the lines for the bar were getting pretty long, however the bartenders move pretty quickly so the wait was not too bad. Love this spot, especially if you are looking for some unique cocktails.

reviews.author: Swati G.
reviews.description: This is my all time favorite bar in Austin, and the only reason it isn't getting five stars is because of how busy it can be on weekends. The bar upstairs is a mezcal tasting room which has yet to disappoint me. The bartender will tailor your tasting to what you and your guests are interested in trying and also ensure that the space isn't too overrun by other guests. Push through the crowd and add this bar to your itinerary when visiting Austin and I can assure you won't be disappointed with the experience.

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: Whisler's is an excellent stop on E 6th street. Their cocktails, service and music selection are top notch.  It's often easy to find a spot to sit indoors or outside. I highly recommend the Temple of Doom cocktail if you like mezcal and pineapple. Great spot for a drink before or after dinner.

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: A true East Austin Vibe. Great specialty cocktail list, food truck outside, solid bartenders.

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed my drinks here, and the inside ambiance was awesome. It was a hot afternoon, and it got a bit uncomfortable inside (no a/c), but it would be an awesome place on a cool fall day (the four we have in Austin!). I tried the old fashioned first, having heard it was "signature." It did not disappoint! My second drink was not as good (something to do with ambition in the name?), so I will stick to the old fashioned next time.   Also, I feel it's worth mentioning that I didn't feel any sort of discrimination. Having read some of the other reviews, I was a little nervous to visit as older than 30,  but I found no problems at all. I had no issues getting drinks. Only once did an employee act like a jerk because the inside bar was closed, but that wasn't readily apparent, and he got snippy that I was waiting there. He did it with others, too, though. I think everyone's experiences are valid, but my experience was not that this bar only caters to picture perfect 20-somethings.

reviews.author: Joey D.
reviews.description: A little pricey but a great vibe and amazing crafts. Will definitely return next time I'm in town.

reviews.author: Karley M.
reviews.description: Loved the environment here and the outdoor seating. Super chill with lots of space. There's a food truck here but we didn't eat there so I can't comment!

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: This was one of my go-to bars to take visitors in Austin pre-COVID and I am so happy that I have been able to visit now that bars are reopening (safely)! Definitely recommend going after dark because the setting of the inside of the bar is part spooky/part western-y/part old-timey and kinda makes you feel like you could meet a vampire in the corner... but in a cool way! I have had many different drinks from their set menu but admittedly their bartenders know high quality cocktails on and off the menu so order your heart's wishes.   My most recent order: - Twisted Nerve - Fancy, not-too-sweet, and so refreshing on a warm day! - Whisler's Old Fashioned - Smooth and will put some hair on your chest.  Give this bar a shot! Or take a shot... No judgement here.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Whisler's was the best accident I stumbled upon in East Austin. Delicious drinks, no matter what was ordered. The tea + alcohol mix is the best thing that's ever been created. I can't have any thing else! If you're one of those people who say, "I don't like *insert disdainful alcohol color of choice*", trust me, you won't discriminate alcohol after coming to Whislers.

reviews.author: Joe D.
reviews.description: What a dope vibe! It's like being in a castle that serves drinks ;-)  Jessie was a fantastic bartender! There's a burger truck outside that i must say is not bad at all. To top it off, they have a TUB out in the "garden" area. Always remember: what happens in the tub, stays in the tub! I'd give this place 10 stars if i could! It's a MUST if you're in the area!!

reviews.author: Sarah B.
reviews.description: Every time I try to go to another bar.... I always end up back here. Cocktails are fire (menu changes seasonally) and the ambiance is on point. Every person who visits me here in Austin leaves a fan!  They don't have casamigos and you definitely can not get a Vegas bomb! No beer on draft but there are 3 canned options (hans pils, fire eagle IPA, and a golden ale brewed specially for whislers by a local brewery.)   Sometimes it can take a little minute to get a drink but that's just life baby! I promise you the wait is worth it.

reviews.author: Junus A.
reviews.description: Last night my wife and I made the mistake of going to another cocktail bar that wasn't Whislers. Big mistake. ~$30 and 45 unimpressive minutes later, we hightailed it over to East 6th.   First thing I noticed is that they nixed their dinky parking situation to make room for even more patio tables. Perfect. It's not like Whisler's really needed the space, but with the interior bar unmanned and COVID in the air, it's a welcome addition.  I'm always surprised when people say the cocktails here are unimpressive. I don't know where else they are drinking (in ATX at least), but I'd appreciate a clue-in. Whisler's does a damn fine job; we always drink too much here because we can't stop sipping on inventive and tasty cocktails.   Last night's outing had two standouts I'd like to highlight. First, the Drab Majesty. With rum, cachaça (a fermented sugarcane liquer), beet, raspberry and lime, the drink struck a sweet spot between sweet and savory, with some carribean flair to boot. Next, the Feel Good Hit of the Summer, mint julep-inspired with an attitude. Couching the bourbon inside a fruity melangerie of cantaloupe, apricot, lemon and lemongrass made for a supremely sippable summer drink - a sublime libation if I ever had one.   Last note; I love coming to Whisler's and walking out having tried multiple types of alcohol I never knew existed. It's always fun to learn a thing or two!

reviews.author: Walter C.
reviews.description: Bartender Steve made our night. The wife and I are old and this place is definitely hip to a younger crowd but they made us feel right at home. The cocktails were great, the service was fun and the atmosphere contagious!  We really enjoyed popping in here after dinner. Will definitely return.

reviews.author: Amit G.
reviews.description: Must stop place for cocktails on 6th street. It's worth the drive to go on the east side. Great date night spot or to meet up with friends. Plenty of outdoor seating. I got this mezcal drink with turmeric and it was so good. I like the smoky taste of mezcal so I enjoyed it. Btw, if you like mezcal, don't forget to check out the "secret" mezcal only bar they have upstairs. The bartender will help you select one based on whether you wanna shoot or sip (definitely sip it) and your price point. It had cool music playing, there was incense going, and it had a whole hipster surfer tantric meditation vibe going. If you live in Austin or just visiting, go there for a drink or two.

reviews.author: Caroline N.
reviews.description: I had heard really great things about Whistlers. My expectations were that I would have a great drink and prepare to wait for it.   To my surprise, I got a great drink without the waiting part. I had a twisted nerve which was fantastic. Not sweet, not dry, just really smooth. The other patron in my party had an old fashioned and said it was perfect!  The prices are great for how strong the drinks are. The music and energy were reminiscent of the speakeasies. I definitely recommend and will be visiting this establishment again to try some of the other drinks on the menu.

reviews.author: Vidushi S.
reviews.description: Drinks are really good. Patio is spacious and has the regular string light game Drinks are really good. Wait did I say that already?

reviews.author: Olga U.
reviews.description: My first and only time visiting, I happened upon the best Oktoberfest celebration this side of the Atlantic I have been to yet! What an awesome accidental event to stumble upon, although I'm sure I would've had just as great of a time here were it just a regular weekend. Great beers, fun crowd, lively polka music, very cool artisan craft fair, and one heck of a time in a beautiful beer garden setting. Well worth the drive from Austin if you're visiting!

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: This place was recommended to me in a local group I'm in with fellow America lovers!  The only thing I'm disappointed in is not knowing about it sooner. Great atmosphere, great service and great beers and I'm not a beer drinker. There is something for everybody.  When you visit a place like this your faith and hope in our country will be restored. The news and maybe even your own neighborhood/community could be negative or living in fear of what's to come, get out.. turn off the tv, hang around your fellow Americans and breathe in some good ol Texas Hill Country air! Does a body good. If that doesn't make your mouth water then stay home...   Food Trucks! Live Music! Veteran owned! Dog friendly!  Face friendly! Goof folks! Oh and beer!  Cheers!!! Merica!!

reviews.author: Joe L.
reviews.description: Enjoyed Octoberfest at 12 Fox Beer Co in Dripping Springs this past Sunday. What an awesome event with vendors selling all kinds of things, food trucks providing some delicious victuals, the Reed Meisters playing some great Polka music, and 12 Fox serving up some incredible beer. Without a doubt...12 Fox brews up some incredible beers. I really loved the Negro Sombrero. One of the best and smoothest beers I've enjoyed in a very long time.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: The area is nice and spread out with a ton of room for kids. We loved the shade and separation of everything. The idea that this was founded by veterans and gives back to veterans is amazing.  The beer itself, I was personally disappointed in. It was too "heavy", if that makes sense. We tried 3 and one I enjoyed but didn't love. It seemed like they were heavier/stronger than they should've been. Plus a lot of "froo-froo" drinks such as mead, etc. made up half their offerings. I get that you need some for people that don't like beer but they had too many.

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: Yeah, we really dig this place. A wonderful and eclectic variety of beer choices await for you to explore. This is also a pet friendly And kid friendly place too. Sit under the picnic tables and watch the world go by while you enjoy some of the best beer we've ever had. I also would like to mention the food menu it's pretty solid two. Come on out and get some all over you!

reviews.author: H C.
reviews.description: We have so much fun at 12 Fox, every time we go. I love their beer, their location, their food trucks, and the people. It's always a great time, and worth the trip.

reviews.author: Brittany N.
reviews.description: We absolutely LOVE this local (veteran owned) BREWERY!!! They have many of their own beers on tap (featured beers change often) and they also feature other local beer, wine, cider and mead.  It's a family (and dog) friendly establishment featuring an awesome tactical playground!  They have food trucks, live music events, and seasonal family fun events.  We are happy to have them in our "neck of the woods".  The owners are kind and always welcoming! We hope they stay around for a long time to come!  They have over 80 picnic tables spaced outside across the property, so you can pick any table that fits your style!  Clean restrooms! Free to use water and ice machine!  Changing table!  Rona Rules! Great place to have an outside birthday party or celebration!  The list goes on and on!!!  At at time when our local businesses are struggling to stay afloat, and many are threatened with permanent closure, we are happy to support local business!  12 Fox has gone above and beyond to give back to the community, help neighbors, and support other small businesses at a time in need.

reviews.author: Tia H.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful place to enjoy a few drinks. Very kid friendly with a big play area. Super friendly staff and patrons. Lots of cute caterpillars crawling on the tables under the trees. I really liked it here.

reviews.author: josh m.
reviews.description: This place is a little slice of heaven.  Great beer and food and a playground to boot.  To all the one star review Branch Covidians - STAY HOME and leave the place to the folks who enjoy great beer mixed with the freedom Texans used to enjoy uninterrupted by your petty tyranny.  Viva la Fox!

reviews.author: t. h.
reviews.description: This is an amazing brewery located in the beautiful Texas Hill Country! The owners and staff are really great and think of everything to make their customers and friends welcome and safe. Wide open spacing for picnic tables, posted Covid rules, great brews, food options, big oak trees, fire pits, a kids playground and live music on the weekends almost all year!

reviews.author: Sylvia A.
reviews.description: Vey nice away from the Austin and they appreciate all vets free beer discounts outside is the best way for all to go  family oriented and kid and pets are welcomed

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Great out of the way place to enjoy the nice setting, great beer, thank a veteran for their service and sacrifice to our country, and listen to some music. Thanks Aaron for spending a few minutes with me and telling me part of the 12 Fox Beer story.

reviews.author: Holly C.
reviews.description: This 95% outside facility is just the best. They allow more than the needed room based on the restrictions in place, and have so much open space, there is freedom to chose your seating. They are meeting or exceeding Covid restrictions, in every way and every day. Beautiful, well kept lawns, with trees and tables, its just a pleasure to visit. Delicious beer, great people, and the tastiest food trucks I have ever had. I highly recommend them.

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Oh, what a great find! The hubs and were out brew hopping a few weeks back and we saw a sign on the corner of a crossing that stated "12 Fox Beer Co" [insert arrow]. Any of you who know me at all know my great penchant for craft beers, especially local, and I'm always up for a new brewery. So, turn left it was.  Parked in the large gravel lot. Walked up the trail to the building - HUGE kiddo playscape - I wanna slide! :) Very chill, nice place with a great patio and lots of other outdoor seating.   The proprietors/brewers are Army Combat Engineer veterans who learned about and found their love for beer while being stationed in Germany. Hence, they dozen lineup of Euro-styled offerings. They use single sourced malt and rainwater to create crisp, clean suds that aim to please. Of course there's hefe, pils, saison, dunkel...they also do a solid IPA.   Highly recommend! Really great folks, brewing their best, and serving one of the most outstanding charcuterie and cheese boards I've seen anywhere...no joke (and you might know that's also my "thing"). Go hang out in the Texas Hill Country, sip a cold one, get your snack on, and listen to live music on select nights. If a band isn't playing, some locals might start a impromptu jam session. What else could you ask for? Cheers!  Note: at time of last visit was informed they were going to have 2 food trucks on-site. Icing.

reviews.author: Briar W.
reviews.description: Great beer and great atmosphere. They do tons of events throughout the seasons and have live music every week. Huge kid playground. Food options are a little slim.

reviews.author: Stephen M.
reviews.description: Brought the family here hoping to find an outdoor beer garden with lots of space: what ought to be the perfect COVID-safe situation for a relaxing evening. Instead we found a business observing no COVID safety precautions whatsoever other than a chalkboard a-frame asking patrons to stay 6 feet apart, a guideline which I seemed to be completely alone in observing. Not a single member of the staff was wearing a mask, nor were 95% of the clientele while ordering at the bar or moving around the establishment. No capacity controls were in place, and the place was generally indistinguishable from a pre-pandemic beer garden.   A ton of wasted potential here, it's a shame the business owners aren't interested in being responsible members of the community and taking basic safety precautions.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: We've been here a couple times now, and both times we've loved it! It's all outdoors, so if you don't like that I would not show up. Plenty of seating, and you go up to the counter to order and get your stuff right away! This last visit we got the raspberry Meade, it wasn't too bad... Don't think I could drink too much of it though because it is so sweet. There's a playground for kids so parents can hang out while their kids have some fun too, lots of times they have a live band or singer playing. There's easily accessible restrooms, and a food truck if you get a bit hungry. Overall wonderful spot that's out of the way and away from the craziness... Just go here!

reviews.author: Robin S.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place! We are in Cedar Park so we don't get to visit as often as we like but wow I'd give this place 10 stars if I could. Amazing beer (and mead/cider for my gluten free hubby). Super family friendly. There's a big playground and teeter totter for the kids. Nice folks behind the bar. Amazing live music and food trucks most weekends. Came here for my bday because I knew the whole family would have fun - and we definitely did. Bought some beer, food, and apparel. So happy to support this awesome business. Highly highly recommend - you will love this cool little brewery too!

reviews.author: Michael S.
reviews.description: Can't say enough positive about this place.  The folks behind the bar were extremely friendly.  The tables are socially distanced and we felt very safe.  The beer was absolutely amazing.   The beer was absolutely incredible.  They seem to focus primarily on Belgian style beers, which is my absolute favorite, but they have some IPAs that will appeal to the hipsterist of hipsters as well.   We also tried the Cranberry Mead as well as their cider, which was crispy and dry that would appeal to any lager or Pilsner fan.   The outdoor area was expansive and, frankly, beautiful.   The staff were very friendly, accommodating, and genuinely excited to share their knowledge.  It was fun to get their perspective on what I should try.    One thing worth mentioning...that I have seen in comments:   The folks behind the bar don't wear masks.  The order process is 6 foot distances, so no big deal for me, but some may have a problem with this.  Although I feel we are being extremely careful with covid guidelines, for some reason, I felt perfectly safe here.  Overall, I was extremely impressed with the quality of the beer, the beauty of the grounds, and the charming staff. This place will be a regular haunt for us.

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: Great outdoor space! Live music, more than 80 picnic tables spread across their vast lawn, and an awesome playground for the kids! Dog friendly too!   The beer was good, Helles was our favorite. Be prepared to wait in line for a beer on a Saturday afternoon, though.   We loved this place and will definitely be back!

name: Pour House Pints And Pies
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: I've been passing up some awesome food and beers for years.  Don't make the same mistake I did.  I Yelper plead with you!  I also learned two things I've been missing in pizza, too.  I've passed this place dozens of times.  It sits on the fringe of a west Austin neighborhood and several apartments/condos between them and 183.  I believe it is affiliated with a restaurant that has a place in Fort Worth, too, but I might be wrong.  What I'm sure of my first visit there was killer!  I'm planning on going back when I can eat and drink a whole day away!  They have a great outdoor area with plenty of umbrellas and we chose a table.  The server acknowledged us right away.  We QR'd the menu and by the time we'd made a choice of food our beers were on the table and cold (good pour on the Guinness, btw).    We ordered a pizza of our own:  Sausage, mushroom, green peppers and spicy marinara sauce.  Okay, first... You know how some chain pizzas you have the ingredients all coming off together leaving you with less than even a cheese pizza?  Not here.  Every thing is chopped into small pieces and spread evenly over the entire pizza.  Every bite comes with a mouthful of exactly what you ordered.  Second, put some of that marinara on a piece of canvas and I'd eat it.  The spices brought everything together.  We got wings too.  Golden Buffalo.  Perfect heat! Crispy.  Meaty. Those wings were gone so fast I was looking at other tables to see if someone had snatch a couple off our plate LOL  We were licking the hot sauce off the plate.  I'M DOUBLING THE ORDER NEXT TIME!  Great service, cool vibe, good food!  Did I get lucky or find bar food Nirvana?  I dunno.  I'm going to rock a five star and adjust as I need to, but I'm not going to deprive myself of another visit here for sure!!

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: Fun Neighborhood joint.  This feels like a place where you'd walk in and they'd say, "Norm!"...if that were your name and you were on an episode of Cheers.  The beer was deliciously cold served in a thick glass to keep it that way. The pizza was generously embellished with toppings, and the crust was above average. The service was timely and courteous. I really liked the outdoor patio. Part of it is covered with fans, and part was uncovered with tables with umbrellas. The only drawback is there's a lot of road noise. We sat at a table as far away from the road as possible, and it was acceptable noise-wise. When our world health situation is better, I hope to see all the tables filled with large groups of friends enjoying pints and pizzas. For now, come check it out with your close friends and/or significant other.

reviews.author: Mickey W.
reviews.description: Visiting from Seattle and went here with my son this week.  We both ordered pizza which was excellent. Tasty crust on the pie and toppings were top notch.  Tried their "West Coast" IPA, not to hoppy but well balanced.  I'll be back!!

reviews.author: Ralph S.
reviews.description: This pizza here is really good!  Ask for Kate! She is the BEST!!! She always knows what we want and is so friendly!...

reviews.author: Russell B.
reviews.description: Still absolutely wonderful after all these years! They remember our order and pay good attention to our table. Will be back soon and often.

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place. It was way more laid back then I expected (place is always popping outside!!) which was great, I'm not for the "pay twice what it's worth because we are fancy pants".  Everything was very reasonably priced, and freaking delicious! We tried a few of the drinks (I tried a few of the beers) and it's safe to say I left tipsy and happy! Can't wait to visit this place again and try some new pizzas and beer!

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: I hope they open earlier again soon. I miss going there at 1 or 2 after work.   The parking lot area on the right is awful. So park in the back for you don't get hit.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: My friends like this place, but I don't see the draw. The pizza is mediocre. Fortunately tonight I discovered their sandwiches are good. I got the Pourboy, with Fries. Everyone else in our group who wanted food ended up being in a sandwich mood, so the Chicken Parm sandwich got good reviews from two of the guys. The fries were well-seasoned and looked promising, but were a little cold and soft. Other times I liked the Fried Pickle Chips, but could only eat a few pieces before they got overpowering. It's not like we'd eat that many pickles out of the jar in one sitting! I think the server mixed up my friend's beer order. The final blow to this spot is that their outdoor chairs are wildly uncomfortable. I even brought my own seat cushion the last few times I came! This time it saved my butt, but my back still hurts. I'd give Pour House a 3.5 but I'm in a generous mood so I'm rounding up.

reviews.author: Darrel R.
reviews.description: This place has RATS. It's a shame because I love eating here, but after seeing a rat scurry across the dining room floor I will NOT be coming back. This isn't even the first time this has happened. On another occasion, I saw a rat running out from the KITCHEN and into the parking lot. It was disgusting. The owners of this business need to have pest control come in so that their patrons can eat without worrying about rats, and so their kitchen staff doesn't have to cook with pests. I've worked in the service industry and know this is no ones fault but the owners. Do better by your employees and your customers and get rid of the rats.

reviews.author: Loren B.
reviews.description: At first glance, the interior of Pour House looked a little un-maintained. But, then of course, Austin. Where everything is underground. I was excited about the local beer list, though the stout selection was a bit thin. I went with Redhorn, a coffee stout that was a little short on stoutness for me. But, the flavor was good.  We ordered three 8" pizzas to share: El Supremo, Hawaiian, and a Veggie pizza, providing plenty for two adults and two children. The pizza was quite good, as in Austin-good. I couldn't put my finger on it, but there was something unique about the flavor.    Our server was very good, personable and informative. We ate a late lunch, during which a growing number of what appeared to be regulars gathered mostly around the bar. The location is a bit secluded from the rest of Austin. But, it's near the technology district, where I was working for the day.  Parking was a little confusing because we approached the building from a side where the entrance wasn't visible. It's a private parking lot with plenty of space. Outdoor seating is available. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Karan P.
reviews.description: Pour house is a pleasant open patio brewery serving delectable pies and the best garlic bread in Austin! I prefer an afternoon visit to enjoy the sun on the patio. The garlic bread has a nice char and is brimming with heavenly garlic flavour!

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: Wow, what a comeback from Corona this place has had. I've never been happier to see the wait staff and bartenders (especially Justin) return to their jobs. They're really into sanitizing every space that has been used and I've never had a vegan pizza like The Spock. Couldn't be happier with this place's redemption. Come support them, especially at the beginning of the week!

reviews.author: Marcus R.
reviews.description: This was the first trying out this place. My guys from work and I were in training this week so we thought about trying it out. The environment was chill and not too busy during lunch time so that was a plus for us because we needed to be back for training within the hour.  Three of us ordered the Cubano and it was so tasty! I definitely enjoyed the pickles and pork amongst other fine ingredients they packed on that pizza! One of guys ordered the regular pepperoni pizza and he said he liked it a lot. The crust and dough of the pizza was cooked perfectly thoroughly.  There salads were delicious and portioned perfectly. When you arrive the parking is all in the back area pretty much, and you enter through the patio area. They have signs for you and that guide you to entrance.

reviews.author: Lynette B.
reviews.description: The outside patio is nice and has a good vibe.  Unfortunately, Jollyville is busy so you have to speak loudly to each other but there's not a lot Pour House can do about that.  At first, our waiter seemed like he was going to be a lot of fun but we quickly realized he was all show and no action. He forgot to bring one of our drinks the first time around and then we very rarely saw him after that until he was ready for us to pay the bill. We had to find a different waiter to order a second round of margaritas.  The margaritas themselves we're nothing to get excited about and seemed like they had very little alcohol. We ordered two orders of the fried pickles, though, because those were great! (And even here we had to flag down our waiter to place a second order and get extra ranch dip).  We will go back because of the convenient location and nice patio but we will have our expectations set appropriately.

reviews.author: Rachel T.
reviews.description: I just really love this place. Great patio. Absolutely delicious pizza. Good drinks. Great service. Located in an area that really needs restaurants like this and frequented by people who obviously feel the same way we do about it. Comfortable and consistent.

reviews.author: Will W.
reviews.description: My partner and I have been coming here about once a week since we moved to the area(early May). The service is consistently great(shoutout to Kate), the food is awesome(some callouts: fried mozz, chicken parm, veggie pizza, cheese bread), and the seating is wonderful too. They have a large outdoor patio and with how they have it set up, I've never felt too hot in the summer or like there's too much noise from being seated near the road.

reviews.author: Shannon G.
reviews.description: Update. Another amazing dinner here. Hawai'i 50 8inch pizza. Crust is amazing. Thick and light. Cooked to perfection. Flavor in the sauce, and the fresh basil. The Canadian bacon, all so good. Also got a pita bread house made bruschetta. Wow, is that good. Diced tomatoes, with small cubes of mozzarella, and fresh basil. Deliciand shareable. Again I had the cherry limeade drink. It's perfect. The whole meal was fantastic. The waiter we had was super nice. This place is packed. So get there early. It's loud inside, but they have a large patio, but tonight it was chilly. No heat lamps. Parking lot is tight too. Been here twice and I think I took the last parking spot both time UPDATE: I've never been here for brunch, so today is the day! Chicken and waffles it is! I find chicken and waffles such a Southern thing, and I can't get enough of it. If it's on the menu, I'm ordering it. Their waffles are amazing. It's two small waffles with pockets of like brown sugar maybe? They have some kind of crunch to it. I didn't even use syrup because they just had a great flavor already. Chicken is tender and juicy. And it's a big piece of chicken breast. Bartenders are so Southern with their "yes ma'am" and hospitality. I always had a drink in front of me and I was checked in to make sure everything was to my liking. Pour House on Jollyville Road is such a great place to go alone or with a group. Their patio is outstanding, service is Southern as Southern can get. Always had a great meal, an even better cocktail, and the service is hands down Southern and hospitable. You have a great team here, this is my go to place

reviews.author: Priyakshi K.
reviews.description: The pizzas here are simply amazing. Been to pour house several times just for drinks, but every time I couldn't stop myself from ordering a pizza. Very chill ambience and their service is pretty quick.   Their draft beer collection is good too !

reviews.author: Robert R.
reviews.description: This place has a great selection of beers for real beer drinkers.  Great pies also.  Bartender is very good at recommending good beers.  Nice neighborhood pub.

reviews.author: Randyf V.
reviews.description: Always on the look out for new pizza spots. Of course you always take your chances. Unfortunately this was one of the bombs. Picked up 2 pizzas for myself and office manager. Her first response was that it seemed to be frozen pizza. I agreed. Pepperroni was sliced so thin it was almost tranparent transparent. Sauce and crust definitely seemed directly from the frozen section. My large greek salad was equally disappointing - very much so.  Counter staff was very friendly and courteous though.

reviews.author: Justin H.
reviews.description: Ordered a few pizzas over the weekend, and thoroughly enjoyed them!  If you like pizzas that are lighter and refreshing, then this is a place to try. My favorites were the Twisted Rita and Sweet Sow. The Shrooms to the Moon had some good umami to it -- it's the most flavorful, but a bit heavier than the first two. Also -- if you like pizza rolls, then I would definitely try the Rollin' Ronies.  I will definitely be ordering these again in the near future.  Note about ordering: I ordered online and picked up the food. I will say, however, that the order was not ready by the estimated time. Instead, you can wait for a text notification to pick up the order. I didn't know that, but now I do!

reviews.author: Virginia R.
reviews.description: We really wanted to like this place... we live really close by. I didn't want to make dinner and my husband suggested that we try BackDraft.  It took over an hour to get our order. The brewery was having trivia night so maybe they were swamped with orders? Regardless, while the food tasted great, the portions (pizza and pizza rolls) were pricey for what we got. Paid over $50 for dinner (one salad, one small pizza, 3 very small pizza rolls and one dessert.)

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Love getting a pizza from here while enjoying some craft beer at Celis. You do have to order thru the app, you can't just walk up and order. I've had a few different pizzas from them, and they are all good. Definitely one of my go to's.

reviews.author: Ashlynd B.
reviews.description: The food itself was really good. My only gripe is that the photo for the pizza rolls shows 6 of them, and there's nothing in the description to tell you otherwise, but you only get 3. I was quite disappointed to pay almost $8 for 3 pizza rolls.

reviews.author: Marcia L.
reviews.description: This is the 3rd time they canceled!!!!! Horrible service. Don't act like you're taking orders when you can't! Total BS!!!! I will never again try here.

reviews.author: Olivia H.
reviews.description: BackDraft keeps switching up their home on us, but we will follow them all over Metric. Our favorites are the Shrooms to the Moon (Mushrooms, Caramelized Onions, Sausage) and the Backdraft (Sausage, Pepperoni, Jalapeños) pizzas.   They are the perfect accompaniment to a pint of draft beer from whichever brewery is housing them at the moment. But if you're looking to just bring their pizza home, you can also order online ahead of time to skip that 20 min wait on site.

reviews.author: Sam G.
reviews.description: I ordered using Yelp grub hub for my very first time , apparently they never got my the order. I went to them and made me pizza  on the spot I ordered around 6:30 finally getting my pizza at 9:16 and had to pick it up myself  tried to cancel my order and they never picked up the phone . I dnt know where there was a disconnect but it needs to be fixed . Delivery was trash but also no communication with the customers.

reviews.author: Joe I.
reviews.description: I know this review will never make it on the board. The pizza was average at best with no significant flavors, crust or sauce components.  Maybe I have Covid (been vaccinated), but can't agree with all the great reviews about this place.

reviews.author: Olivia V.
reviews.description: Looking at recent Yelp reviews, I was nervous about how this place would turn out. BackDraft did NOT disappoint.   First off, where is it? There is conflicting info on Yelp and their website. I called ahead because going to the wrong pickup spot would turn me into a hangry rage. They did not answer the phone but the host breweries did. CONFIRMED: They are currently located at Celis brewery.   We ordered 2 pizzas for pickup on Grubhub on a Friday night. BackDraft and pepperoni. They were ready in about 30 minutes. CONFIRMED: The pizzas were AMAZING. Like... hands down some of the best pizza I've ever had. Their homemade sausage and humongous thin pepperoni slices were phenomenal.  I can't speak for anyone else's experiences recently. It sounds like delivery may be questionable? But as of April 2021, if you can drive to pick up a pie, this is the place you need to go.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Really nice Naples style pizza with quality mozzarella. Nice crust and supplied parmesan and red pepper. Cute lil baby in the truck.

reviews.author: Christian C.
reviews.description: Oh man.  The pizza here is fire.    It's located right in front of 4th Tap Brewing Co-Op  which is a perfect pair.  We ordered their signature pizza, The Backdraft.  It's topped with House Made Spicy Sausage, Pepperoni, Fresh Jalapeños, but we also added mushrooms on ours.  It's a thin crust style pizza that is PACKED with flavor.  Our buddy ordered the Kale Yeah Caesar salad which he was very pleased with.  The guys that run this truck are really cool and definitely dedicated to their craft.  Backdraft Pizzeria is definitely up there on the short list of Austin's best pizza.  I'd be surprised if they didn't branch out and open up another location in the near future, especially in the downtown Austin area.  I would highly recommend giving them a visit and try their food.  How can you say no to a fantastic pizza and a frothy craft beer to go with it?

reviews.author: Danny H.
reviews.description: I ordered on Yelp App to delivery.  2 pizza and a salad, but I just got 2 pizza. where is the salad.  I called to the restaurant but didn't answer.

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: I'm a sucker for a good cheese pizza, and this place has it. I was super impressed by the dough, tangy sauce, and the perfect amount of cheese. I do wish there were a few more options to kick off the meal but hey, when I'm craving cheese pizza, this is the only place to curve that craving.

reviews.author: Jeannie L.
reviews.description: At noon on a Friday, it only took 13 minutes to get my food. I got pizza and wings to go. This is one of the best pizzas I have had in Austin so far. The crust was very thin and had a good crunch to it. The sauce for the wings had a slight sweetness and wasn't too hot. I also appreciate that they put the buffalo sauce for my wings on the side, so that they wouldn't get soggy before I got home.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: TLDR: BackDraft is back, and they're better than ev-VAH!  I'm a longtime fan of BackDraft, even once calling it 'the best pizza you can get off a truck'.  That's damning with faint praise, as this is some of the best pizza in all of Austin.    Back when I first tried them, the food truck was parked down on 360 near Bee Cave.  But now that both I and they have moved to the north quadrant of Austin, and they're attached to an excellent brewery to boot!  By far, my favorite is a slightly altered 'Shrooms to the Moon', which is a triple-whammy combo of homemade spicy sausage, mushrooms, and carmelized onion. If you look at the picture, you'll see that the crust has the  right amount of 'char' or 'leoparding' as some call it.   Whoever's doing the pizza-slinging at BackDraft knows their stuff. Get down here when they're open, grab a brewski, and you're in for one of the best lunch combos that Austin can serve up!  Some Tips:  1) I said 'best lunch', but be sure to check their hours before you come. I'm pretty sure they just do lunch Friday and Saturday.  Otherwise, they follow brewery peak hours and just do evenings.  2) Try the Shrooms to the Moon but ask them to hold the caramelized onions.  Without the onions, you get a spicier, hotter pizza which goes perfectly with a pale ale beer to wash it down.  You'll end up with a pizza-nirvana feeling of a warm glow in your tummy.  This place scores a 5 out of 5 on the 'CTJ Scale', as noted below.  5 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing away after finishing a plate here. 4 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK being seen eating here by Mother Mary. 3 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus' Dad. 2 out of 5 stars: Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn't have my last supper here. 1 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn't have my penultimate supper here, either.

reviews.author: Terry S.
reviews.description: Pizza very good.  Friendly and responsive staff.  However be prepared to be patient if ordering during peak hours. We ordered at 7 on a Friday night and they were backed up by over an hour which was not represented on the online ordering app.  Info on backup was communicated by staff verbally and understandable, just know you'll need to coordinate in person for true wait time during busy periods.

reviews.author: Uksang Y.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere to enjoy a pint of beer from the brewery and pizza! The outdoor seating was also socially distanced and I felt safe. Too bad the wait for the pizza was over an hour. The crust was good and the topping combinations were fun but probably not worth the wait.

reviews.author: Frank Z.
reviews.description: I've been known to enjoy eating a cold slice of pizza for breakfast. Assuming, of course, that it was leftover from the night before. But this pie from BackDraft pizza ARRIVED cold.  The fact that it was skimpy for the cost pretty much assured that there weren't going to be any leftovers. From one perspective; that could be a blessing. Because while it wasn't the worst pie I've eaten; it would easily place among the bottom three. Two stars is more generous than this deserves.

reviews.author: Gary O.
reviews.description: You owe it to yourself! Great pizza! My new favorite! Great people! Local! What more could you want?

reviews.author: Bob S.
reviews.description: The pizza is truly amazing.  Great crust, fresh ingredients and even better service.  There's a huge beer selection and some unique mixed drinks.  The restaurant and bathrooms were very clean.  I highly suggest you take time to visit here.

name: Whip In
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Marsha M.
reviews.description: Dear Lort, why was it so cold during my visit to Austin when I stopped into Whip In? On an average sweltering Austin day/night I can imagine Whip In being the essential local spot for a quick beer or 5. With a great selection of beers on tap, along with extensive coolers for carry out, this place seems just great.  Apparently they have food too? Whip In should be the norm for corner stores/bars everywhere. Kudos fellas

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: This is a unique locally grown spot that is worth a visit in South Austin. Prior to the pandemic a popular spot to catch bands on the outdoor stage, not too sure about the music situation right now. The Whip In is a corner beverage depot with a quality selection of craft wine and beer. If I may add, a very quality selection of wine and beer. If you want to expand your palette and try  a new craft beer or wine, def stop in. Very large selection of chilled rose, which I found impressive. The selection of beers by the glass is also impressive. This is a very cool spot to come in and meet friends, and grab a pint. The Whip In is also an Indian restaurant. The quality of the food is not a 5, but a 4. If you are looking for great Indian food there are better options, but the overall experience here and what it offers is above average and worth a visit.

reviews.author: Heather H.
reviews.description: Man I used to love this place. But ever since the new owners came in, fired the management staff, TOOK TIPS FROM PEOPLE THAT EARNED THEM, and the outstanding amount of disrespect I see to their employees- I'm never coming here again. Or the Quickie Pickie because they own that too. And they treat those employees horribly as well. I can't believe the things I have seen and heard the owners say!! Cannot support this, and I plead to everyone else to do the same.

reviews.author: Michelle C.
reviews.description: Great selection of local and international beer and wine. The food is fresh, and consistently meets expectations. It's a great environment.

reviews.author: Jessica L.
reviews.description: Love love love whip in!! I always get the nachos...they're the best nachos in ATX!!! Also love the beer selection!!! Whip in   isn't like a fancy place, it's more chill atmosphere.

reviews.author: Hope F.
reviews.description: Really disappointing tonight at the Whip In. I think it was an off night? First off, the draught board which is usually full up to 70+ was very scarce, so not sure what was going on there.  We ordered the chicken vindaloo and chicken shawarma. I was confused when our food came out for 2 reasons: 1) I wasn't expecting a wrap and fries for the shawarma- just was expecting rice since the menu didn't describe it as a wrap, but whatever - my bad 2) it came in takeout containers with only one set of silverware (plastic)  I went back inside to ask for another set and also asked if why (out of curiosity) the presentation had changed to takeout containers. I was told "it's a covid thing". I tried to explain nicely that I understood - but have only been in Austin since covid and have come every week or so since January, always with plates etc. She repeated, seeming annoyed with the question, that it was a covid thing, shoved me two mini plates and some silverware and walked away. Ok, cool!   I'm only giving a 3 because I have been here 6-7 times, always with a great experience. Tonight was a 1 star for service, but honestly food was below par as well. Leaving a sad customer :(

reviews.author: Candice L.
reviews.description: What's not to love sbout a convenience store/taproom/indian restsurant/package store? Efficient and friendly service. Indoor and outdoor seating. Nice, clean restrooms (a very pleasant surprise). Easy parking. Convenient location. It has everything. The food is genuinely good whether you're getting standard bar fare or the tasty Indian specialties. We hope to return when a band plays on stage, but we had the best relaxed lunch on the covered patio on our way out of town. Who knew you could find a little calm oasis so close to the interstate? It's quirky and perfect.

reviews.author: Matt C.
reviews.description: Beers on tap for days, weeks, months, years even! Amazing little spot totally worth taking a break from I35 or the snowpocalypse or COVID or whatever!

reviews.author: Caroline G.
reviews.description: Really disappointed. I've come to the Whip In each time I've traveled through Austin for years, and always loved it for its ambiance and food. Most everything has changed. When I asked about NA beer options for my partner I got a curt "No" and the server left. The layout is much less cozy than it used to be, and sadly, I won't be going back.

reviews.author: Neil O.
reviews.description: This might be one of the hardest reviews I've ever made. I have come to the Whip In for years (I still remember playing a show here when I was a kid in my father's band and having one of best and most interesting Indian fusion chicken fried steaks of my life) and always appreciated (and still do) what they're doing. But the prices are just getting too damn high.        As of the past week, every single beer on tap has risen by a price of roughly $3 on average; essentially the base price for any beer on tap STARTS at $8, and without a doubt that's the highest I've seen at any establisbment in Austin, and I have been to an uncountable number. I also had their $12.99 Kurma (also known as Korma in some resturaunts) and it was good, but more like a $8.99 Korma at Tejis as fas as quantity and depth of flavor goes.        Make no mistake, this is an indesputed historic establishment that's likely also struggling with COVID and I'll still support it, but seeing these changes is just disheartening and it's getting harder and harder for me to justify still stopping in on the weekend.

reviews.author: Andrew V.
reviews.description: Whip-In, what happened? I've lived down the street from this place for a year and have come at least once a week. It has steadily declined. Constant staff turnover, and the menu and beer selection has shrunk to basically half of what it was.   The food in particular is a shadow of what it used to be. Tonight, after finding out they didn't have any of the specials on the board, we ordered chips and queso and after bringing us one order, they brought us a second mistakenly? Both had stale chips and the queso was burnt. I asked for no cilantro in my dish due to an allergy and it was absolutely lousy with it. Tried to drown my sorrows with a beer and was served the wrong one.   Honestly, not sure what changed but this place isn't what it used to be. Hopefully it's just an off night, but I've thought that several times in the past few months and it's only become worse.

reviews.author: Candace A.
reviews.description: I love this place.  From the outside you would have no idea how great this place really... dare I even call it COOL?! The beer selection for purchase might be my favorite in town that I have found so far. They carry my two favorite breweries which aren't found many places and then have a multitude of beers on tap, too! I love the tarot card feel at each of the booths and then the perfect little patio outside.  Dog friendly, live music when the world is allowed to sing again, and Indian food? You would never know.... we brought some friends here recently and quite honestly... this might be my new little "let me take you to a local spot we love....." for our guests. Go. Have a beer. Buy some to take home.... and definitely get some garlic naan.

reviews.author: JR L.
reviews.description: Went here for a work meeting and I truly enjoyed the environment. Pretty relaxed and helpful bartenders and servers. It has a decent selection of both food and beer. I ordered a chicken tikka masala curry along with two beers - Belgian ale and a wheat. The CTM was a decent size and quality for the $12 tag. I'll definitely come back again to relax with friends and my doggo in the future. I thought the fridges in the back full of beer was pretty cool.  TLDR - decent food and draft beer selection - bunch of freezers with lots of beers and shelves of wines - cool music - had one TV inside from what I could see

reviews.author: Marcus M.
reviews.description: They have a really great selection of wine and beer as well as both on tap. I got the Chicken 65 which was really delicious. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Dmitri J.
reviews.description: I'm so pleased the Whip in is here to stay! They have a multitude of beverage and menu options. I got one of the curry's and it was exquisite. They also cater to many different diets. The staff is friendly and location is beautiful. If you haven't been in a while they remodeled the indoor area which is super conducive to COVID-19 distancing. The patio is covered and a great place to grab a drink and a bite. 10 of 10 stars.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Great place to pick up some mainstream as well as your out there beers. This place has a little bit of everything, from beers to ciders, wines, and even serving beer on draft as well. They also have a nice little courtyard on the side which looks fairly pleasant. Overall definitely enough beers in stock to keep you busy, only thing I've noticed is that their price point is a little higher than say Specs by $1-2 on various beers.

reviews.author: Sean M.
reviews.description: Incredible beer selection, great staff. Phil is the best!! Will never lead you wrong.

reviews.author: Julia Y.
reviews.description: Such a funky place with great food! Minus the rancid smell of bathroom near the bar, this restaurant/bar/music venue/convenience store has got a great atmosphere.   I ordered the bhindi (okra), and loved how tomato-y it was. Okra at indian restaurants is my go-to, since I am fan of its texture and all the spices typically used. Whip In did not disappoint; however, I am sure this dish may not be for everyone. If you like the idea of an uber savory, tomato-paste-based okra dish with lots of Indian spices, this is the dish for you. Finally, the okra texture was quite stiff because I suspect they used a rather dry/old part of the plant. :/   The rest of our party ordered chicken vindaloo, and they also enjoyed their dishes. I found the vinaigrette-cabbage side to be moldy, but D. did not think so.   Minusing a couple stars because Whip In seems to skimp on using fresh ingredients. I can see myself coming back here though, since I do love Indian food and live music.

reviews.author: Steven P.
reviews.description: Great place I've been coming to for years. Awesome food if you get there early enough.

reviews.author: Tyler W.
reviews.description: I came in to order takeout today, and while I was waiting, saw that the cook was not wearing a mask -- or, more accurately, was wearing a mask on his chin, but not on his face at all. I watched him plate and manage a series of dine-in and take-out orders without putting his mask up -- on this, a day when Austin has a 9% Covid infection rate, and over 600 people getting infected in each 24-hour period.

name: Culinary Dropout
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Valet Parking
Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Chastitie A.
reviews.description: Culinary Drop Out is a good place to recommended for a hang out spot with good food and drinks. Very trendy place, and there's usually live music on the weekends. The outside patio "pre-COVID" had lots of games for guest to play. There's enough TV's to watch sports from anywhere you're sitting. I recommend ordering the fried chicken and homemade mash potatoes. I think it's their most popular dish. The dish is fried to the perfect level of crisp, and it's very juicy!  I also like their salmon!  As far as the drinks, if I'm not ordering my usual Austin Eastcider, I'm getting their jalapeño margarita! One of the best in town!   The vibes are always good here.

reviews.author: Samantha L.
reviews.description: This is one of the biggest bar/restaurants I've ever been to in America! They have indoor seating and half outdoor seating (it's "outside" of the restaurant but still covered on all sides - great for when it's cold out!   It's a cool bar with live music and games but my favorite part is the food!   We got the cheese fondue that came with a bowl of pretzels and it was nothing I expected at all - pretzels are okay at best usually and most places has cheese that taste gross but this was the best pretzel/cheese combo I've ever had!! The pretzel balls were pretty big in size from what I was expecting, they were warm and perfectly seasoned and delicious! And then the cheese - wow I could literally drink a jar of it if I wasn't my age and getting heartburn everyday as is. I haven't stopped thinking about the pretzels and cheese since my first bite! I definitely want to go back to Austin just for this dish.   And then for entree my boyfriend and I split the butternut lasagna and they were so nice enough to split the dish for us without us having to ask.   Oh yeah and for drinks (I forgot to take a pic) but we got the Smashed Irishman and it was so good we ordered 5 through out dinner.   The staff was really nice and the place was super busy so some things took a little longer to come out and we were forewarned before ordering anyway.

reviews.author: Brittney T.
reviews.description: Wow - this place is SO good. We were in town for the weekend and decided to eat here because it's dog friendly and right near our hotel. Place was very busy on a Saturday night - multiple parties out on the porch.   I still dream about their chopped chicken salad! - so good!    They have a big drink menu with cute cocktails. Staff was so nice and my dog loved all the loving he got from everyone there.   It's definitely a casual/loud/fun ambiance!

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: I originally discovered CD when I used to live in Arizona. It was always THE spot to hang out on the weekends with large groups. I was happy to see CD had an Austin location!  We came on a week night and it was still pretty crowded. Wait time was about 30 minutes, so that gave us some time to walk around and do some window shopping at the Domain. Once we were seated, we put it our order right away.  Pretzels and Fondue: The softest pretzels!!! Perfect for dipping in the provolone cheese sauce. We actually got 2 rounds of these as they were that good.  El Matador: tequila, elderflower, ginger agave, and orange bitters. This is my favorite drink here. Has enough of a fruit taste without being overly sweet. And the bartender made it with a lot of love. Lol. Only 2 drinks and I was finished for the night.  Our server was really great and kept checking on us throughout the night. Fun crowd. Fun music. And a really fun time.

reviews.author: Katelyn W.
reviews.description: Me and my friend wanted to go somewhere to have a drink and visit. This place had the best outdoor area and so we have them a chance. I love Brussels so I had to try their Brussels sprouts. They are delicious and super spicy. Next we ordered some pork belly nachos which were so tasty. However it was too much food for the both of us. You definitely need a large group for them to be worth it. Overall would go back to this place.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: I've been here a couple times now. My favorite thing about this restaurant is the outdoor patio area! It's open and airy but nice and shaded too. I've been here for brunch and got the breakfast burrito. It is huge and it's pretty good! I'd have to say my favorite menu item so far is the fried chicken! The breading is crispy and the meat juicy. The portion is pretty large so you get to take some home! Overall this place is a good go-to spot!

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Originally was going to stop for a quick lunch but got ahead of ourselves when looking at the menu.   Brussel Sprouts (3/5): not crispy like I expected it to be but the flavor was solid and unique.  Salad (4/5): they made kale taste good. that's impressive!   36-hour Pork Ribs (3/5): very sauce-y and therefore, very messy. At least the flavor was decent. The ribs itself were are not very tender.   Steak Frites (3.5/5): not bad but also not great. The salad on the side was great tho.   Korean BBQ Skirt Steak (4/5): lots of flavorrrr. Better than the Steak Frites. The meats on these two dishes actually tasted the same but this one had sauce. I actually liked this main the most out of the ones that we tried!   Overall, chill spot for a nice dinner with friends. I would rate this place a 3/5 for the food but probably bump it up because of the ambiance. There's lots of space and a few games to play so the vibes probably make up for the food.

reviews.author: Nelli S.
reviews.description: Really good food, really hip atmosphere. My family enjoyed watching the food be prepared through the glass. We tried the burgers, the pork nachos, the salmon, and the kale salad. The Kale salad was incredible. I would have given a higher rating accept that it seemed our waiter forgot about us and we waited over 45 minutes for our food and appetizer. Otherwise, I think it is worth a try and the whole area of downtown Austin is great for kids.

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10-25-21  Quality/Quantity - Gochujang Brussels Sprout - I would have preferred the brussel sprouts to have been a little more crispy. Could not really taste the gochujang flavor, not spicy at all. Kurobuta Pork Ribs - My favorite, good flavor. Would have preferred more fries though. Spicy Vegan Curry - My daughter's choice, I guess it was good, but not something I would have ordered. Had a hint of lemon grass after taste, which is a little different from Indian or Thai Curry. Separated rice versus rice combined in the sauce is also preferred, so we can control the flavor.  Atmosphere - This is a very good spot. I like both the indoor and outdoor space. There were a few activities (cornhole, etc) for the guests. I like the choices of seating - regular tables, high top tables, bar seating, couches, etc. Additionally, your huge wrap around bar was nice. Lastly, I am always a fan of an open kitchen concept.  Service - Julia did a good job; she came back and refilled our water often. It was really busy and the entire team seemed to be working hard. I also noticed 2 employees picking up garbage as they walked back and forth serving customers, this is always a positive plus.  Price - $49.80 + tip  Owner Suggestion - Seems like you are very successful, owning quite a few restaurants. Congrats on all your success, and wish you many more. I look forward to trying your other restaurants in the future.

reviews.author: Erin S.
reviews.description: We had a party of 8 at 1:30 pm on the Friday of ACL weekend. It was pretty packed, but they were able to accommodate us. Service was great!  Here's what I tried: - Evil Jungle Princess ($13): This fruity rum drink was good! - Soft Pretzels and Provolone Fondue ($13.25): The pretzel bread was good. The cheese was good. $13.25 is a lot for what it is though. - Gojuchang Brussels Sprouts ($6): It maybe came with 5-6 total brussels sprouts. It tasted good, but super not worth it. - The M.A.C. Burger ($14.50): Their take on a McDonald's Big Mac. It was good!  Fun vibes. Convenient if you're staying in the Domain.

reviews.author: Candace S.
reviews.description: Our experience eating at Culinary Dropout was nothing short of perfection. We went on a Monday night with all three of our very young kids. It was busy but there wasn't a wait if we wanted to sit outside. I was concerned because of how cold it was outside, but they assured us that the heating lamps outside kept it pretty comfortable so we could check and feel it out if we wanted. They were correct; between the heat lamps and the heated seating (amazing!), we faired well.   Our server was very helpful and knowledgeable of the menu. He recommended his favorites to us and we took him up on them. I ordered the Spicy Korean Skirt Steak and my husband ordered the Prime Rib sandwich. They were both absolutely delicious. Like finger-licking good. I seriously can't wait to go back. I also love that they have a kids menu and are more than willing to bring the kids food out first if you ask! We will be returning to try the ribs soon!

reviews.author: Darris J.
reviews.description: This muthafucka is LOUD. You literally have to shout at a person 12 inches away from you. Just ridiculous. Food is alright nothing spectacular, can't comment on cocktails or mixed drinks. Wine and whiskey list is serviceable.   If invited again I'm definitely making up some sort of excuse to not go.

reviews.author: Savannah M.
reviews.description: This place was such a good vibe. We came for brunch, and it would have been an hour wait but open seating at the bar. To my husband and my luck there were 2 seats open.  It was Sunday around 2ish and there was a guy singing with his guitar.  The speakers were amazing you can hear him inside and out on the patio.  Friendly staff. The food was so good. My husband and I are some carnivores but today we both ordered vegetarian options  Don't let that fool you. Both dishes were packed with flavor. My favorite was the vegetarian spicy curry. Holy cow was it good. So good. Would definitely visit again!!

reviews.author: Allison C.
reviews.description: With its large patio, good food, and extensive drink selection, Culinary Dropout is a great place to come relax with friends. The restaurant is large and has plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. I arrived at around 5:45 on a weekday and did not have to wait to be seated.   I ordered the Fried Chicken and Between You and Me to drink. Both were delicious and definitely recommended. The portion sizes are large enough that I had leftovers. My friend ordered the Monkey Bread for dessert. It smelled delicious (and according to him tasted delicious) but I was too full for even another bite.

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: The food at Culinary Drop Out never disappoints. Brunch or dinner, they have great options. I especially love the build your own charcuterie option. I recently went for brunch and we had cheeses, meat, and Brussels sprouts on ours. The Gochujang sauce on the Brussels is amazing. It's sweet and a little spicy. I could have eaten a whole order to myself, they were that good. I also loved the Wellness Retreat cocktail. It has a slight spice and it's a change up from just getting a mimosa.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: It's something about the atmosphere that continue to have my attention. The service is attentive and coming to CD for a good piece of fried anything works for me.   At this point I just need to wait for the games to return. The waitress shared that before Covid they had games for adults like png pong.  I'm ready!!

reviews.author: Alexis W.
reviews.description: The aura was nice. The salmon was meh. You really gotta be in the mood for that. The wedge was good just know that when they say maple glazed bacon, they mean it. It's really sweet. Chopped salad was great! As was "yesterday's soup". I sat outside on the long button tufted couch (very restoration hardware-ish) Favorite part about this place was definitely the energy, sitting outside in dim light, space heaters tufted sofas? Yes please!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: We've heard great things about this place and decided to give it a try for brunch. Made a reservation. Glad we did, as it filled up fast soon after we were seated.   This is a great place for large groups. More bar than restaurant.   Cocktails were tasty and reasonably priced. Large selection of beer on tap. The menu is a little thin, and our brunch items weren't anything special.   Service was top notch. We'd come back for happy hour, but probably not for a meal.

reviews.author: Tara N.
reviews.description: We had been trying to get here for a while and we're excited to finally make it in. Unfortunately, we probably won't be returning.   Food: We ordered the pretzel fondue, the breakfast sandwich, the breakfast burrito, and the hash.   The pretzel fondue was 'meh' at best. The bread that came with it didn't really have that pretzel texture and very little salt. Provolone cheese is a pretty light tasty cheese so it didn't taste great as a fondue.   The other food items were great but all came out lukewarm or cold. Which, relates to the...  Service: It took a long time for the food to come out and my guess is that's why it was cold. Because it has taken so long to get there, we were too hungry to send it back.   The server was forgetful and/ or missed the details. For example, we had to ask three times for a bowl for the dog. Many servers just bring one out automatically when they see a doggo but, even if they don't, it doesn't take three reminders.   Overall, service was slow and not, well, service-oriented. For example, my friend and I both had coffee and my friend asked for a refill. The waitress stepped away and I assumed she was getting the pot for a refill. Nope. She came back with a new cup for my friend and took off. So, I'm sitting there looking at my bear empty cup. As someone who was a server for many years, it seems so obvious to me that you should ask the other person if they'd like coffee as well especially when it's near empty. That's just one example of the just miss when it comes to great service.   Other details: - The ambiance and big open patio was great which *may* pull me back for a drink or something. Then again, you can get the same at other places in the domain.  - They didn't offer corn tortillas which I feel is really strange. My friend has celiac's and can't do gluten but corn tortillas are fine. Since they didn't have corn tortillas (or a gluten free bread option) it limited her options significantly. Granted, they said they could do lettuce wraps but let's not pretend like that's the same.   I don't think I'll be returning to Culinary Dropout.

reviews.author: Kristine C.
reviews.description: Popular restaurant located in the domain! They are usually pretty busy during the nighttime but not too crowded during lunchtime. They had one vegan option - the spicy vegan curry which tasted like Thai curry. It was pretty yummy but the portion was not super filling for the price in my opinion, so my only wish is that there was more! Overall solid place for vegans and non vegans to enjoy a meal in the domain!

name: Crown and Anchor Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Friday

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: After calling a dozen other restaurants and bars, who have posted in inaccurate hours on Yelp, which we found out by calling all of them to find them all closed and they said they were open, we stumbled upon the Crown and Anchor. 38 nicely chosen taps, amazingly friendly, with a awesome atmosphere. Jarrod, the bartender, and Sam, the waitress made us feel at home and I made what was it looking like a pretty bleak Christmas Eve into a wonderful party night. Between the two of them, awesome awesome is the only word that I can use to describe the feeling of hospitality on Christmas Eve, it saved our night and made us loyal customers of crown and anchor whenever we will layover in Austin or visit.  Bravo and Cheers to Jarrod and Sam. We will be back whenever possible! Thank you!

reviews.author: Amanda F.
reviews.description: So, being new to Austin I'm always looking for cool local spots to take my pup that aren't pretentious with some good grub and drinks. Let me tell you...this is hands down my new favorite place. The staff here is amazing!!! They even brought my dog a piece of bacon!!! The fries and BLT were delicious. They even came out to check on me and gave me a free local entertainment paper so I can see what's good in Austin :) Thank you guys so much! I can't wait to be back!!!

reviews.author: Feather F.
reviews.description: This place is the best ! My boyfriend is an alumni and I look forward to coming here more than anywhere else when we come back to visit Austin . Best burgers and fries ever !! See you in November Crown !!!

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: I have been driving by CandA up to 4 times a day on my way to/from work for years now and kept thinking "we need to go, we need to go". We finally decided on a random Tuesday to pop in after work and we're kicking ourselves for waiting so long! This place was so great! They have QR code menus on each table for both food, and beer, and they were so user-friendly, and easy to navigate. The tables are spaced out, and there's seating on the front deck, under the cover on the patio, and some inside as well. The staff was seriously THE friendliest we have encountered in Austin, especially during COVID times. They checked on us regularly, and basically made it so we never had to go in and order anything, because they were SO on it! They are amazingly, over the top, dog friendly!!! It's one of the few spots we can sit under cover with our dog, they have tons of water bowls, free snacks, and they even brought him out a very special snack from the kitchen! They gave him lots of love, and were happy to have him there.  We ordered cheeseburger baskets with fries and they were so delicious! The portions were huge, but the burgers weren't so fat you couldn't handle them semi-gracefully. They were loaded with melting cheese, and the smoked bacon was amazing. There was an abundance of toppings, and a huge pile of perfectly crisped fries. The beer selection and HH is just awesome, we have zero complaints at all! We'll definitely become more regular patrons here, and I highly recommend going out of your way, giving them a chance, and checking out this perfect neighborhood bar!

reviews.author: Jessreen P.
reviews.description: This place is awesome, and the staffs are very friendly. You can also bring your pets here. 10/10

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: A+ beer selection, delicious burgers for an incredibly cheap price and possibly the friendliest staff I've ever met at a bar (and I drink at a lot of bars).  My fiancé is that obnoxious person who walks into a room and immediately tells everyone we're from out of town. Maybe that attributed to the friendliness but I won't complain.  We were trying to see as much of Austin as we could in one day, but if we had more time we would have stayed for a few more beers. Great patio too.  I can imagine this place being a complete cluster during football season. My alma mater plays Texas in 2025 and we may need to be here to find out :)

reviews.author: Néia H.
reviews.description: Been coming here for 20+ years. Best burger and fries in Austin, and always a good beer to go with it. COVID-19 precautious in place,  which we appreciate being in the healthcare for Le. Now we just call in an order to go and sit in our car to eat it. While it's not the same as hanging out on the patio, it's still a great experience.

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: The second member of the grad school holy trinity (the other 2 being spiderhouse and taco joint).  Its basically the perfect neighborhood bar. Basic wooden tables, a nice porch, 3 dart boards and 2 pool tables. You dont have to pay for darts, but you need collateral. They always have a great selection of beer, also they always have a nice deal on some type of beer they're trying to get rid of. Your dollar will go far at this place, especially during happy hour.  In terms of atmosphere, its no frills. Its great for big groups and small groups and hanging out. The porch is enclosed with screens but it is a little hot in the summer. Its great in the fall and spring though.  In terms of food, nothing is really stand out. But, it isnt bad either. Their burger is like the perfect backyard barbecue dad burger. Their fries are pretty good too but there jot artisanal. The cheese fries have a healthy amount of cheese. The nachos are fine too. The prices are a little high compared to the drinks. But, they're not unreasonable.  A lot of researchers at the university have happy hours here, so it gets busy on fridays especially during the semester. People from the neighborhood come too so theres always a crowd. That being said, youll usually be able to get a dart board or a pool table if you want it.

reviews.author: Jonny M.
reviews.description: Looking for a slice of "old Austin"? A large selection of craft beers? Affordable and tasty food menu? Great atmosphere?  Look no further than the Crown and Anchor pub.   If you're looking for an expansive beer menu, they have it. Just about any craft beer you can think of is available.   If you're looking for great atmosphere, they own it. The owner Derven has been operating the place for 25 year and is a true Austinite. He has played gigs with many of the areas legendary musicians back the 80s. You can find him at the register most days haggling regulars and slinging beers.   Food? The food menu has the essentials and is affordable and tasty. It has enough options to satisfy just about anybody including a vegetarian or vegan and the food is always great and reasonably priced.   What else? Pool tables. Check. Darts. Check. Plenty of sitting area? Plenty of parking? Check and check.   Overall Crown and Anchor is a mellow and great dive to try a new beer, eat good burger or to clank glasses and cheers with beers at.   The old show Cheers comes to mind. It's a must stop for the neighborhood.

reviews.author: Kelli R.
reviews.description: I'm new to Austin and this is one of my favorite places.  It's a locals spot right next to the UT campus, so of course it attracts a small college crowd, but it also attracts this amazing group of locals who are super friendly and welcoming.   The people that work here are so nice and they are the reason I went back.  They also have a great beer selection and the bartenders are very knowledgeable about all of the beers.  This place has been there forever and is just a great laid back spot to play pool or darts and just hang out with good people.  Also the burgers are SO good!!

reviews.author: Bill G.
reviews.description: Hey! You have to have some beers here before you walk to the stadium for a football game. Yes, you have to. I do. Many people have been doing it for years and you can see it in the age difference. old and young, people grow up drinking here before Texas Football Games. An Austin tradition and staple.

reviews.author: T M.
reviews.description: This place is the best. Hands-down my favorite burger and fries and ranch in Austin... maybe anywhere. Just a simple down-home delicious burger. There are some really awesome staff here (only one pill to occasionally deal with) but overall pretty good odds. Good atmosphere, really affordable, extremely crave-able food in my opinion. Only thing missing is dessert! The first time I came here I ended up going at least once a week since, until sadly I had to quarantine out of state. When I get back though, it's ONNN! I'll be there twice a week probably! I miss it ALL THE TIME!

reviews.author: Soham R.
reviews.description: The ambience is great for watching sports with friends. I didn't have drinks but the food was not that great - the bacon and toast were a bit overdone.

reviews.author: Troy H.
reviews.description: Spent a moment and made a meeting place for myself and friends. Came here for the burgers and some conversation and we were not disappointed with either.    I am not a burger snob, but I really do enjoy a nice burger and here they have it. You cannot rate it at the top with many others in the area of Austin, but for the price, the atmosphere, the location, and the great staff you cannot go wrong here.    It's a really solid burger that can feed your conversations with friends or fuel your hunger for a long night at the pub. On a side note, the fries were really good as well.

reviews.author: Thomas H.
reviews.description: Friendly staff, good prices, clean bathrooms.   Main downside is they don't serve liquor, as to why? I have no clue.

reviews.author: Ty C.
reviews.description: This is borderline 5 stars, so I'll give the benefit to them.  Nice bartenders.  Great beer selection and beer prices.  The price varies depending on the type of beer and whether it is happy hour or not.  I got a pint of 512 pecan porter for $4 during happy hour.  They also have pitchers available.
