reviews.description: One of our favorite places to grab a few beer. They always excellent elections, we love the space and the people. So beer....good; but man their roasted coffee! We love using their Roadhouse in our French press.

reviews.author: Carrie J.
reviews.description: Sometime I struggle to decide if I want coffee or beer here, and at happy hour I am definitely know to order both! You will not be disappointed. An excellent coffee shop in the morning to meet with co-workers to do some brainstorming with excellent coffee or a wonder patio for a chill evening and great beer or wine. They have a great menu to pick from too, so you not stuck with just pretzels. I personally like the vegetable panini, and my husband like the cheese board.

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: Fantastic coffee house and brewery with inside and outside space located at parmer and 1431. You can get coffee, lattes, and cappuccino served anytime or also buy their beans to go.   They usually have 30+ taps of delicious craft beer which 10-15 being their beers with other guest beers also. They normally have cans to go and they will do growler fills as well. Its unusual to find a place that has both really good beer and great coffee but Red Horn is just that. There are a few slightly more secluded tables where I'll see people working remotely quite often. Most weekends you can find a local artist performing live music too.

reviews.author: Christina O.
reviews.description: I have been going to Red Horn for the past few years and don't know how I've forgotten to give them the credit they deserve! Not only is their coffee delicious they have a great variety of beers to choose from. They have recently expanded their outdoor seating which is covered so great for all hours of the day. Parking is sometimes limited but it speaks for its self on how many people love coming here. It's a great place to study, relax, and meet up with friends but get there before rush hour if you wanna snag a good seat inside. Clean environment and staff is very friendly! Also, great music

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Sat outside on their extended patio that goes onto the parking lot so tables can be socially distanced. Dog friendly and gave water bowls to the pups. Had a pretty solid number of beers on tap! Didn't have coffee but it smelt good. Salads, sandwiches, and snacks are available. We just had chips and salsa and it was decent. Restrooms were super clean! Huge win for me.   I'd come back for beers if I'm the area.

reviews.author: Cindy D.
reviews.description: We used to stop in here almost every weekend to have coffee before my granddaughters soccer game. And today we came in order to 2 hot cup of coffees and they were Luke warm cups. And unfavorable to say the least we have had better.

reviews.author: Preetesh V.
reviews.description: I love the chilled back vibe and the fact that it is so close to my neighborhood. We typically invite our friends to this place if we are looking for a venue closer to our home to hang out and catch up over few drinks. Their options for in house brews is fairly decent. They have decent size indoor seating available where in live music is performed from time to time. Additionally they have small outdoor seating area. During the pandemic, they stood up temporary outdoor tents to accommodate people who wish to seat outside. The food option is decent and limited to few comfort food options.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: This is a great place to go for coffee - their nitro is great and it's a nice atmosphere with a lot of outdoor seating!

reviews.author: Mitsy V.
reviews.description: Since our move to the Round Rock area, we discovered a hidden treasure of Coffee and libations nestled behind a Brushy Creek corner-- Great Coffee but a fun vibe to stimulate mood beyond caffeine.

reviews.author: Laura L.
reviews.description: When we first moved here, the lady was super nice to my daughter. Weeks later, I walked in with our service tiny chihuahua dog (since there's a sign that says "we welcome service dogs" so I went in and ordered coffee and as soon as I began to wait for my coffee to be ready so I could take it to go there is this man that was very abrasive behind the counter and I miss felt like I was in the principals office and he said that dogs are not allowed in the facility.  He was very abrasive embarrassing and in my face. I personally think if you don't allow dogs at all then take the service sign dog off the window. It's a shame because that's very close place for us to get coffee but I don't want to have that feeling again.

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: For a newer-ish brewery this place is definitely headed in the right direction. Sour beers are freaking delish! I wish that they had more food options when you drink and or a bar that you can walk up to, but all good things come to those who wait!!   My second time around I ordered a cheese tray from a local artist and brought it to eat outside. It was perfect. My husband loves their beers and always asks to go their before our date nights! Keep it up Hedgehog!

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Such an awesome place! It's all outdoors with picnic of tables, umbrellas and a few chairs and tables. Dog friendly- they have dog bowls! Pretty flowers and lots of grass for kids to run in. The beer was delicious. I tried 3 five oz pours, all IPAs they were delicious!! You order the beer online and they call you when it's ready. Quick, easy and safe. Will def be back!  They have different food trucks , check their Facebook to see what's there when you're going.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Great addition to breweries in  CP area. Multiple IPA and Farmhouse Ales. Large open patio with picnic benches and yes umbrellas.   They were also cooking up some awesome looking Pad Thai when we visited. Friendly knowledgeable folks and a great beer selection.   CC payment only via their App.  As an FYI this is where the Thousand Oaks brewery was located.

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: Clean, nice owners, great beer! I've tried a few beers here. My favorite one is Mango Tango! It is very tasty! Mango with some habanero (I believe) it is so good! Come out, you can order on your phone and relax outside in the nice picnic table/table seating area! Come on out and give them a visit! You will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Matt P.
reviews.description: Fantastic IPA, Farmhouse, and Saison beers on tap. The beer is really fantastic and the mood is mellow. This place will be hopping once the word gets out.  Thank you for the fantastic flavors. The beer is really above par. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Friendly people, high quality rotating  beers, nice outdoor seating. Like a nice neighbourhood space.

reviews.author: Audrey B.
reviews.description: A great place to go on a summer evening! I tried it for the first time Saturday and loved it! The draft choices were great, Crush ended up being my favorite! Chill vibes the whole night and just overall a fun atmosphere!

name: Yard House
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Tiara P.
reviews.description: I'm a pretty big fan of yard house... Or used to be. But what I'm not a fan of is not cooking my pork burger all the way through. I have not had time to contact or go up to the establishment in regards to this matter but WTF... Y'all are aware that it's a pork burger right?? Make it a point to ask people how we like our burgers because I don't like this... I couldn't even eat the burger.. Just looking at this makes me sick.... I'm so pissed I don't think Ima ever go back to that yard house again.

reviews.author: Manuel C.
reviews.description: Been here a few times. I must say that the waiters and waitresses here are phenomenal. During my most recent experience our waitress was Karisha.  Late 30s early 40s generation like me will LOVE the music selection here - I felt like they were playing my old playlists from high school or something!   (And they actually have a barcode to listen to their playlist on Spotify which I thought was cool)  I ordered the 20 oz ribeye. (I had a very paltry breakfast and had recently worked out so my body was lusting for some bovine carnage)  My better half ordered truffle fries and the Gardein Buffalo chicken - which she absolutely loved - and trust me that's a rare sight - so Thank You Yard House!  Meanwhile, this steak had everything I hoped for - it was bone-in, juicy and cooked to perfection. The server even asked me to cut into it to ensure it was to my liking - I had to ask her to repeat herself because I've never had someone ask me before.. how thoughtful! And cut into it I did, again and again until all that was left was the bone.   The Parmesan mashed potatoes were also scrumptious! Just the right texture and not too cheesy at all, the right touch of Parmesan.   Oh and there was also the healthy baby broccoli. The heads were very good, the stem was a little tough for me to chew but that's probably because they are grilled (as opposed to steamed) but that's fine because I usually only eat the heads anyways.   I don't usually drink but they are supposed to have a large selection on tap as well as bottled beers. I had the Heineken 0 (0% alcohol) and for those who used to drink Heineken I recommend it because it tastes exactly like the real thing! I was amazed they had it, so I guess there's something for everyone here.  I think this place is a keeper and I will return to see what other delicious adventures are lurking inside that menu. I've had the steak bowl before and it always hits the spot! The burgers are also delicious - though sadly I'm watching my carb intake recently.   In the end, you can't go wrong with this place! It can get pretty busy but all you have to do is give your name and number and they text you when your table is ready! Just go walk to Restoration Hardware and look at extremely expensive furniture you'll never buy in the meantime or stroll on over to Amazon books and play with their toys :) the possibilities are endless

reviews.author: Bruce S.
reviews.description: We've come here almost every week, sometimes multiple times a week since we moved to Austin 3 months ago. The hours are great and the food has always been good, you get a full menu and happy hour specials. I'm not sure if we've been here any other Sunday but this past Sunday the food was absolutely awful. I'm not sure if the head chef, kitchen manager, etc. is off or what but both our meals and appetizer tasted like they were microwaved leftovers.   We got the ahi tuna and it was very strange this time, so strange I didn't want to really eat it but the portion was so small this time we just ate it. I guess that kind of shows we're really not picky so when I say something was terrible it's really-really bad. I know anyone reading this will say that's your fault for getting ahi tuna from a sports bar but we've got it dozens of times and it was always surprisingly good. The tuna sandwich and poke nachos are great as well, but we didn't get them this time. We did get the fish and chips and the hot chicken sandwich. The fish was 100% microwaved, it was rubbery and had no crisp to the breading so they're dead giveaways. Also, the coleslaw was brown so that was nice. The chicken sandwich tasted nothing like the chicken sandwiches we've had from there before, and the taste of this one was not pleasant. We still ate most of our food so I wasn't going to complain that it was terrible unless our waitress asked and to my surprise she never did. lol. I think she knew so she avoided that question.   The cocktails and beer selection is great from here and they make great drinks for a sports bar. During happy hour they have small discounts on drinks and larger discounts on food. I don't remember what they all are but I know the cocktails are 2 dollars off, nothing crazy but hey I'll take it. I ordered my first cocktail during happy hour and about 30-40 minutes later another. The waitress took my order for the drink and came back later maybe 10-15 minutes and asked if I still want the drink I ordered. I was confused and said yeah so another 10 minutes or so I got my drink. My girlfriend was on her phone and noticed she came back to ask right after 11 PM when happy hour is done. So I was charged 2 dollars extra for one drink, I could care less. But it was really weird for her to do that.   I don't think we'll stop coming here because of our bad experience. I figured I would take my time to at least let the establishment know of our experience. So they can improve - if they want to. I know a lot of restaurants have staffing issues and there is a massive amount of competition in Austin. A bad meal isn't the end of the world by any means.

reviews.author: Savannah M.
reviews.description: A Must Go!!!... Every time we come visit close to the Domain , we have to come to YARD HOUSE! THE ATMOSPHERE is nice.  Very spacious.  The staff is Amazing and professional but not so much where they're snobby.  Just a kick back place.  While my husband and I sat down at the bar there was a guy watching a game..GO DODGERS!! To our left.. a couple to our right and a blind date across the way. I feeds everyone's needs.   Our bartender KEITH was fantastic...  if your ever so luck for him to make you a drink... you'll be in mixer heaven. He recommended a beer to my hubby some kind of blonde.  Jez I wish I can remember the name... any who, he's gave himself a sample and that was the end of that.  Also, we ordered shots and I ordered a dirty martini.  EVERY.  SINGLE.  DRINK.  Was delicious haha. But also, he was  good company and made sure we're taken care of.   Pros: EVERYTHING!!!! FOOD IS ON ANOTHER LEVEL.  CHEERS TO THE KITCHEN  Cons: nothing. And I always find something that can be

reviews.author: Zoly N.
reviews.description: Me and a friend just having our lunch today and i am in love with their drinks, foods is fantastic! Coming back for our lunch next time!

reviews.author: Hal F.
reviews.description: What a great surprise!  I have passed the Yard House several times since I moved to Austin, and never eaten there.  Finally, last night I had dinner at the Yard, and was so pleased.  First, Miguel, our  young wonderful Server who was just the BESTEST-helpful, kind and patient.  You couldn't ask for more.  Second, the food, the appetizers, buffalo wings and Sushi Nachos were so impressive, fresh and tasty.  The bacon cheese burger were amazing.  Good beef, and delicious fries.  Of course the Beer was good too, and cold.  All in all I am already planning my return until I sampled everything on the menu that appeals to me.

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Yard House in my opinion, is a chain that is highly underrated especially when it comes to their happy hour. In case you didn't know, during happy hour all their apps are half off.! Unfortunately I only took pictures of the calamari and nachos, however some of my appetizer favorites are the ahi sashimi, poke nachos, fried calamari, and the chicken lettuce wraps. I also like the chicken nachos, classic sliders, and have heard great things about the cheese curds. Often times, I come here for the happy hour and don't even end up ordering an entre just get a few half priced apps!

reviews.author: Angel C.
reviews.description: Exceptional service(two waiters were both checking on our tables and made sure we had everything we needed!) and pretty solid food! I got the KBBQ Cheesesteak sandwich, which had decent flavors and nice presentation. I would personally have preferred a stronger tasting gochujang sauce, but it was still tasty as is. My friend got the whiskey salmon, which had great sauce! The sweetness and whisky flavors mixed very well. I had a pretty good experience overall and was really happy with the atmosphere and waiters! Tim and Noah, you guys were cool!  I also had Yard House in the past once at maybe 1am and ordered their pepperoni mushroom pizza and Margherita pizza, both which tasted great! Definitely a great meal after being out with friends. Would recommend as a fun, laidback place to eat and drink!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: This place lends itself to whatever mood you're in whether that is bar, indoor more personal dining or outside patio. The drinks were pretty and tasty cocktails, the poke nachos are always delicious and we went w our usual favorites there, mine was the carnivore pizza and his was the spicy jambalaya. Overall a nice chill vibe and atmosphere and nice little stop in the domain.

reviews.author: Tangela C.
reviews.description: I've been here one time years ago and I had a nice experience that time. I had a good experience this time as well. The front staff and my waitress were nice. The waitress that assisted me was attentive, knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. My order came out in a timely manner. I ordered blackened shrimp tacos that came with rice and beans. The sauce that is on the tacos is spicy. For my drink I ordered a Sangria. The food and drink were great!   I sat outside on the patio because it was a nice day outside. The patio is a nice size that has a lot of tables. The restrooms were clean and they are unisex. It's a parking garage across from Yard House which is convenient.

reviews.author: Anna G.
reviews.description: When it comes to brews and good food, you just can't beat Yard House. Such good wings and the ipa white cheddar beer sauce complemented the Bavarian pretzel so well. Loved the mew offshoot ipa!

reviews.author: Elyssa C.
reviews.description: I live for these nachos. They're SO good and cheap! It's technically an appetizer but I get it as a main dish and it's so filling. Huge plate!  The pineapple Maui chicken was tasty! Broccolini is the BEST vegetable. Period.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: So this is my second visit to the yard house. I enjoy coming here because they remind me I'm home except for the beach is missing. The one I attended back home in California was on the Long Beach Beach sure.   I do enjoy coming here because of the bomb vampire tacos and the atmosphere. I also enjoy coming here and hanging out with my girlfriend. It's been one of our spots!

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: It's spacious. Our server Jess was attentive. 9 oz pour of wines are $3 off during late night happy hour. Some appetizers are also half off including the onion ring tower. I found a really good mushroom pasta dish that two others ended up getting as well. the check out system is manual at the table. so that's nice.

reviews.author: Kacey C.
reviews.description: So so yummy! The customer service was great. Several servers waited on us and made sure we were taken care of in every way (including complimentary dessert for our bachelorette party!). This was a great experience with delicious food! (The magic margarita doesn't change colors like you think it will and is STRONG). The Mac n cheese is the perfect guilty pleasure food. Definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Went for a casual Date night with the hubby!  Let's talk FEWDS!   Feel- late 80s music playing which we loved. Great spots for drinks after work, happy hour, dinner etc   Eats- we started with the spicy tuna roll but was told it was not sushi! Glad they said something! Was very tasty and without the guilt of the rice!   I got the Baja fish tacos (white fish) it was lightly fried with a nice sauce and slaw on it. I wrapped it in lettuce to lighten it up a bit. However it was delicious! Would 100% recommend this! I also ordered brussel sprouts instead of the rice and beans and they were deliciously fried !   My husband got the Nashville hot chicken sandwich with fries! This was delicious and not super spicy, filled with flavor! Fries were good too! Would recommend this as well.   Worth- the whole check was about $100 after tip. We did get a few drinks as well so that added up. However the portions were large and we felt that it was worth the amount of food and quality of food as well.   Drinks- i got a couple vodka sodas and my husband got the half yard of the left hand milk stout. He loved it !   Services - our waiter was very nice. He checked on us multiple times and refilled waters promptly, he also guided us through the extensive menu and helped us narrow down our choices. Loved that!   Would def come here again! I might bring the pups next time and sit on the patio(when it's warmer)!

reviews.author: Nikki G.
reviews.description: Delicious food, horrible service. This was my first experience at yard house and I have heard nothing but great things! We ordered waters and beers, which they were out of all the beers we wanted to try. Our waitress didn't bring us water for 25 minutes! We had our appetizers basically finished by the time we even had a drink. The poke nachos and cheese curds were awesome and really large. The waitress barely checked on us, and when she did the one time we asked her for sauce and she just never returned for over 15 min. We paid and left without ever getting our sauce. Food and atmosphere were amazing but our waitress truly ruined the experience for us.

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We absolutely love yard houses HH! We have tried bunch of there appetizers and they are all pretty good, and most of there appetizers are 50% off and pizzas too. But if it's outside the HH time, I this it's bit pricey.  Chicken nachos: skimpy on the chicken and too much of sour cream.  Korean chicken wings: it was pretty good, it had a nice hint with a hint of sweetness and our kiddo loved it.  Onion rings: I mostly don't like onion rings because it's greasy and feels heavy, but at the YH, it's light, crispy and non greasy.  Chicken strips: chicken strips comes with the small basket of fries, chicken stripes itself doesn't have much flavors or seasoning, but it's good if you dip it in some sauce.  They don't have online reservations, so that sucks. Ordering and paying is with the tablet they have on the table and that's not convenient either, we had to try atleast 4-5 times for payment to go through and it's so confusing, otherwise everything else is good.

reviews.author: Mariah H.
reviews.description: I eat here often and have tried almost everything on the menu, I've never been disappointed, always busy but def worth the wait.

reviews.author: Mai L.
reviews.description: Okay Yard House, I see you! It's a chain restaurant but the food kind. Come here for happy hour. I would recommend the pizzas and poke nachos, but everything seems pretty yummy. Service is great and efficient. This is a nice place to grab a bite with a friend or coworkers - there's something for everyone's taste.

name: The Brass Tap - Round Rock
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped in for a drink or two and a bite to eat. We ordered chips and salsa as an appetizer. It was meh but it filled our bellies so in that aspect it got the job done.   The drinks are where it is at here. My husband ordered a flight of beer. Tons of options to choose from. I ordered Bishop cider on draft. I got the strawberry (my favorite) and also the apple pineapple. All the drinks were good.  We noticed that staff attention to customers had been a little lacking and very slow. I think this has more to do with our crappy country and COVID. But who am I to judge? We just made sure to grab our check before I was even close to being done with my second glass.

reviews.author: Raven I.
reviews.description: What a great place in downtown Round Rock! We met a friend here for drinks late, and the wait staff was wonderful! I don't think I've ever been in a bar with such nice and professional staff. They have an epic beer selection. Though beer isn't my thing, the selection still impressed me! They helped me select a beer, as I said, beer isn't my thing. They were patient and actually found me an option to "get me through the night". I did move on to margaritas though, and were these delicious! So why the 4 starts, well, they kept running out of things. For instance, my margarita went skinny when they ran out of the regular mix they use. Then, they ran out of limes! The margaritas, even the skinny ones, were fantastic! They use A LOT of ice, but still tasted delicious. Decor was wonderful for Christmas. It was just a warm and inviting space. We will definitely go back if we are ever back in that area! Parking was sufficient, as it was a weeknight. I'm sure that helped for it not to be too crowded. Everything was very clean also. Just a great place to go and meet with friends over drinks. If you're expecting tapas, call ahead to see when the kitchen closes. The kitchen had closed shortly after we got there, which was a bummer. Regardless, check this place out if you're in the area!

reviews.author: Kacey C.
reviews.description: I've been coming to The Brass Tap for a few years now and love it! The back courtyard has giant Jenga and other games and there are plenty of seating options both indoors and outdoors. Just recently tried their food and the loaded fries were pretty good! I was looking around at surrounding tables and their food all looked great. Can't wait to try more here in the future. Tons of beer on tap and very knowledgeable bartenders who make great recommendations. I will say that their cocktail availability is slim but definitely a good spot for beer.

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: One of the best bars in Round Rock, TX. Plenty of space and always something fun going on. Look out for employees Angel, Rachel, and Mike. They're very helpful and always super positive / Friendly...  :p

reviews.author: Susan S.
reviews.description: Jeff is the bomb!!!  You are always know  what we want or what to recommend before we do!  I'm so glad you joined the Brass Tap team!!!!

reviews.author: Kevin S.
reviews.description: Monday 4pm.  Only 4 people inside the bar.  Again had to walk down to actually request a beer from the tender.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Thankful that the brass tap is open and serving food and drink. Service is outstanding, they always have A great selection of beer on tap and if you are confused or just can't decide, ask, staff is great and matching your preferences to their current selections. Over the last couple weeks my friends and I have enjoyed flatbreads and sandwiches - Tasty and fresh. The options these days in this area, post Covid, are rather slim - But it is definitely worth you stopping in and staying for a while... They have a nice sitting area out back when it's not too warm outside.

reviews.author: Sterling P.
reviews.description: Came with my best friend tonight and seriously amazing  Michael and Sarah did a PHENOMENAL JOB. They checked on us numerous times, made the drinks to perfection, and were a pleasure to talk to!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND. THEY ARE THE BEST EVER!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I have been to this bar many times and every time I am here, I forget to write a review because I get too hammered after the visits there.   The highlights of the establishment are as follows:   1- Conveniently located close to a lot of parking in downtown Round Rock that is free  2- Mixed drinks are on-point  3- Bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable about beer  4- This establishment is dog-friendly  5- The Brasstap uses toast for their Brew Crew "Drink Beer. Earn Rewards. Become a Beer Guru."

reviews.author: Mary D.
reviews.description: Dropped by late and Elvis was in the building. A lot of fun. Great atmosphere. Had some tasty treats from the late menu: pretzels and mustard and chips and queso. Selected our own drinks for the first round, then went with our server, Tanya's, recommendations for our 2nd round. Particularly enjoyed The Princess Kiss.  Hadn't been there in awhile. Happy we stopped by. Great selection of drinks. Great service. Will be back soon!

reviews.author: Summer M.
reviews.description: I had never been to Round Rock! What an awesome treat. We happened into the Brass Tap and had a really great time. Fun atmosphere with an incredibly friendly staff. The bar back, Matt, was very helpful and made some delicious suggestions for us. Go for the brisket grilled cheese and stay for the warm, friendly, and fun atmosphere. I will definitely make this a destination must stop on my way through town!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I was looking forward to returning to the Brass Tap because I have had a good experience on a prior visit. There were a couple of mistakes by our server at first, but I chalked it up to him possibly being new or simply having an off night. Unfortunately, the service progressively got worse throughout the dinner. From spilling a drink on the table, to telling us he wasn't focused, to the bartender remaking the drink and under pouring it, and it taking almost 20 minutes to receive our check after we asked three times for it, you can't blame it on anything but a lack of effort. Continuous poor service can truly ruin an evening if you let it.

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: Great place in downtown Round Rock. Always great service, no matter how busy the strip is. I didn't play the trivia tonight, but it sounded like everybody was having a blast. I don't know how many beers they have on tap, but there's something for everyone. Great outdoor section. And there's a smoking section outside and with cigars on sale.

reviews.author: Christina G.
reviews.description: My Fiancee' and two friends of ours visiting from Dallas area decided to check this place out on Friday night.  I read the reviews on Yelp (as I always do before going), and suggested this place to them.  I am sorry for doing so. We got there, in what seems to be happening area of downtown Round Rock, which I did not know existed.  There are several bars in this same stretch of road.  Parking was easy on the street.  Once we got in, it has the bar and lot of the front area filled (no social distancing here).  Sign at the front read, "Seat yourself, and we will find ya".  We sat at a table/booth section across from the bar near the back.  Our waiter, seems like he did not know much.  We asked him questions, and he was not sure.  We found out though, if you don't want beer, they are limited on other alcohol.  I wanted a Grey Goose and tonic.  They did not have Grey Goose.  I asked for Ketel One.  They did not have.  They said they only have local vodkas, "Dripping Springs" and "Titos".  I went with "Titos" and waiter asked three times, what I wanted with the vodka.  My friend got a "Apple-tini".  It came in a very small v-shapped glass, that looked like not much more then a shot...and it had ice chips floating in her drink.  She used to be a bartender, and knew that is not what you are supposed to have there.  Also, her boyfriend had a Long Island Ice tea.  He sipped it, and it was not tasting right.  So, she walked up to the bar to get it fixed.  They told her to go back and get her mask and come back (*mind you, no patrons at bar were wearing a mask).  She did so, and ask if they could remake it.  They did so, and brought to our table by different waitress person, and he tasted it, and still not right.  So, my friend asked the waitress if they knew what they put in it.  They went thru all the ingredients and found out they use "lemonade" instead of  "sweet and sour" , which made it taste really sweet.  The food was just ok.  My friend got a salad, and looked like left over pieces of lettuce they had lying around. The nachos were just ok, and the reuben and cuban were ok.  It took us about 15 min or more just to get our waiter to come back to get bill.  They pay attention to bar area, but not much in area around it.  Sorry, won't be back.

reviews.author: Steve S.
reviews.description: After enjoying delicious food and well poured drinks from my favorite bartender Tanya, I was blindsided for having a political opinion. I was shushed and shunned by the staff for having any kind of point of view. I decided to move to the main bar to be by myself and was then questioned by the staff, who blew the whole thing out of proportion. I was told that I needed to leave the premises by some screening bartender because I was "disturbing other people"; all while never raising my voice. If the staff had not perpetuated drama, it would have been dropped. I would not suggest this bar unless you're absolutely certain that you're going to be quiet and pay for over price drinks for underwhelming service from the newer waitstaff. Weak management.

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: Great pretzels. They charge $89 for an ounce of a bottle that costs $350 (Macallan 18). The math works out to that being less than $15 an ounce. I fully understand markup and a business making a profit, but come on. Could still make a killing at $40, and I wouldve actually bought it. Need to take a calculus class at ACC to learn about price optimization.   Good beers on tap, too.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: So, as a visitor to the Austin/Round Rock area, I do have to say that I did enjoy the ambiance and home town feel of this local pub. As per the service, the blue haired bartender/server was THE WORST best bartender that I have ever had! ;) Real talk, if you enjoy good drinks, good atmosphere, good people and great service, please stop in and check it out!

reviews.author: Tony P.
reviews.description: Saturday at 3:30pm, unable to get any service after waiting 15+ minutes. Don't both going. Not particularly busy, just not focused.

reviews.author: Cindy R.
reviews.description: Good beers but not the service is not great. Do not get service from the man with the beard and glasses. He's completely rude, uneducated on beer selections (which is weird is because he works at a Beer Tap), and lazy/slow. If you don't mind that type of service then it's still enjoyable! Great selection of seats outdoors and indoors.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Stumbled on this place while looking for a drinking spot up north. Cool vibe being in old school round rock.  When you walk in they have mostly a collection of not your average beer. For those looking for bud, coors etc time to expand your horizons lol. Every month they switch up which brewery they get select draft beers from, notably good draft  breweries!  This month they were featuring Clown Shoes, a brand that  has some really great  IPAs and high % which is nice. Tried a 12.5% stout while here and it was amazing. For sure a beer lovers bar!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: While you may think you should go here and get a cocktail, you should instead go and get something frozen like the margarita or the boozy popsicle! They were both the icy buzz-inducing beverage one needs on a hot ass day overlooking the water, wishing you could dive right in...but obvs, don't. And don't let too many margs tell you otherwise!

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The Barrel Room has a great selection of drinks, especially those of the frozen variety, too good in fact that I didn't even get a picture. Great view of Lake Travis and you don't have to wait in line like the neighboring Oasis Restaurant. I'll be back to The Barrel Room.

reviews.author: Markeisha T.
reviews.description: Its a full bar with 3 options on tap. Great service. Beautiful view and the top margarita was amazing.

reviews.author: Vlad V.
reviews.description: Sean made the best old fashion I've hd in my 12 years of drinking... its a dog friendly place with awesome waiters and waitresses

reviews.author: Christine N.
reviews.description: The worst food ever. I don't even give one stars but the food was not good at all, the mojito was disappointing. Don't waste your money here. There was a hair in the drink, had to take it back for a new one. My mom said "even if they offer to give us free meals, I wouldn't come back here"

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: So downstairs from the Oasis Brewing Co is this hot spot. The bar has most any drink you can think of, and a list of house creations as well. The bar staff is friendly and accommodating and there is plenty of seating from couches to regular tables. If you're going to be there for a while drinking be prepared for a hefty bill as nothing is inexpensive here. The awesome lake view helps to ease the $$ pain though. This place lends to awesome people watching as well since this area is a big tourist draw, so overall you can't really go wrong by stopping in here for a weekend libation.

reviews.author: Debbie K.
reviews.description: Super great spot on lake Travis. Great cocktails and the view is amazing. Come here and miss the crowd at the Mexican stop!

reviews.author: Anthony C.
reviews.description: I went to The Barrel Room out of curiosity and was amazed by the scenery and view! I wasn't greeted by anyone because you have to go up to the bar to order, which is pleasant for my kind of personality. They have very loud music to fit the vibe of the room and plenty of places to sit! Most importantly was the food; I was absolutely amazed by it and it was so delicious! I ordered the sisig and it was the best thing I ever had. I also, ordered a side of Caesar salad, but this was no ordinary piece of salad. It was presented gracefully and tasted extraordinary. The staff is very kind and fast paced with receiving orders. I am very glad that I came to this restaurant and hope I can revisit this place in the future!

reviews.author: sean B.
reviews.description: This place has it all, great craft beer, excellent hand made cocktails, amazing personal service and the best views and sunset in Central Texas. Try the Perfect Patron Margarita for...perfection. FIVE STARS!

reviews.author: Michelle Z.
reviews.description: Worst margarita I've ever had..definitely not worth the money. You're essentially just paying for the view.

reviews.author: K W.
reviews.description: Beautiful hidden gem at the Oasis complex. It's the brewery's cocktail lounge so not only do they have delicious beers and food but great and inventive cocktails. Can get busy on the weekends even with a full bar staff but the drinks are worth the wait.

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: We went here for our anniversary and had such a beautiful experience. First we were sat ALONE in the outdoor patio which we really enjoyed, we then had a wonderful waiter who was very funny,super helpful and gave us some great recommendations on flavor combinations for desserts. The food was insane and each course was brought out at the perfect time. We both get full very quickly and the time in between each course gave us enough time to digest a bit but we were never hungry. We were super full by the end of the night and spent $230.78 including tip and we ate a good amount of food(We got the Japanese milk rolls,grilled octopus, the Halibut, the NY Strip, Brussels Sprouts, crushed potatoes, 2 apple frangipane tarts, the sticky toffee pudding and the chocolate caramel Breton. We also got 3 cocktails). Thank you for making our day so special, We will 100% be coming back!!

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: Nice place near Zuckerberg Park.   We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. They checked all the boxes.  Service was great. Everyone working there contributed to make sure we had what we needed.  Cocktails are a star attraction. Lots of interesting twists on classics.  The food was very interesting. I had the short ribs which were fantastic. My wife had the harissa chicken which she loved.  Topped it off with dessert and coffee. The apple tart was great. The only part of the evening that was a disappointment was the coffee. I'd definitely pass on this.  Can't wait to go back and try more options.

reviews.author: Kayli P.
reviews.description: Eberly is an eclectic place with a menu full of great food. Everything we ordered was amazing.   Ignore the other reviews complaint of "collard greens" being on the southern Benedict, the Benedict is amazing and the greens are listed on the menu so I'm not sure what their complaint is.   The short rib hash was mouth watering and I highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Cynthia W.
reviews.description: The restaurant is BEAUTIFUL!!  The atmosphere, fantastic!  Service was good.  I was so looking forward to having brunch here but was thoroughly disappointed.  In a haste, I chose my usual brunch fare, Eggs Benedict, without reading the ingredients and questioning what exactly was in my meal.  Prior to my going,  I did see many favorable reviews regarding the Eggs Benedict however, none mentioned Braised Collar Greens.  Yes!  Eggs Benedict with Collard Greens.  I'm a HUGE fan of vegetables but let's just say that after trying it at Eberly, I'm NOT a fan of Eggs Benedict with Collard Greens.    I'll be back, Eberly.

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: Went here for NYE Galactic Rodeo event! It was super fun! The whole place is enormous. They had multiple seating areas and a bar when you step in with plenty of space to walk around. The whole restaurant is designed elegantly and has wood features on the bar. I am really curious to see what it's like functioning normally.  The event had a lot of food, they served us BBQ with a full spread. The brisket, Mac n cheese and potato salad were my favorites. I have no idea if it was catered or if the restaurant made it, but it was really good.  They had a DJ downstairs with awesome decor and lights. Upstairs is Cedar Tavern, which I think maybe partners with Eberly or is owned by the same people? It was a good drinking area, with games and a mechanical bull. They had Symply Courtney hosting the mechanical bull rides and he was very entertaining. We talked to him after the show and he was super nice as well.   There was also a guy doing lasso tricks with a rope! I did not catch his name but, he was very talented.   The rest of the staff was really awesome too.   Overall 10/10 event, would definitely do another NYE here and am super curious to try the restaurant on a normal basis.

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: This is a brunch review only as I've never been for dinner. But breakfast was delicious. I've never thought to add cranberry to my avocado toast before but I will have to try that at home. Breakfast potatoes were perfect - crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The restaurant is beautifully decorated. Great space for a dressed up brunch.

reviews.author: Aarti P.
reviews.description: In person, in dining room, reunion dinner!!! Yes!!  After a long 15 months of not meeting in groups, my original core ATX friends decided we needed, nay, had to meet up.. Eberly was unanimously chosen out of 4 options.  I have always loved the interior of this location, yet to nab seats in the Atrium :(, one day it will happen.   Our evening was just perfect, from the Service, Meal - Starters to Dessert, Wine to Post dinner drinks at the bar.   The reason for 4 stars not 5, the vegetarian pasta entree didn't deliver, the menu description had potential, what I was served paled disappointingly in comparison to everything else that graced our table.   I just noticed that the menu has changed just like our season has. Dinner date anyone? :)

reviews.author: Jessica L.
reviews.description: Love this place!! Great food, yummy drinks, and lovely atmosphere!! Will definitely be coming back here again!!   We started with the beef tartare, good but I would be open to other starters (not a must have for me). My husband had the wagyu for dinner and I had the mushroom mafaldini...which was amazing!! Loved it!! We finished with the chocolate caramel Breton...strong flavors that paired together very nicely!! Such unique dessert!!

reviews.author: Kimberly C.
reviews.description: We got there and the venue is beautiful. They have a huge bar with craft cocktails and the waiters are amazing. My water cup was never empty and they continuously checked in on us to see how we were doing. The short ribs were so tender and melts in your mouth. The crispy potatoes were huge and more than enough for two people. Overall this was a great experience and I can't wait to go back and try the pasta.

reviews.author: Vivian M.
reviews.description: This review is for a previous visit (June/2021)   It was my husband's birthday and they went above an beyond - excellent service! The food was delicious, the place is beautiful. Great selection of wines.

reviews.author: kelsey w.
reviews.description: This was my birthday dinner so I was super excited. The service was awesome and personal. I want to say I loved the atmosphere and liked the food but it honestly didn't blow my mind. I will definitely one again for that poke app though!!!! And the short rib is yummy for sure.

reviews.author: Leena J.
reviews.description: Fabulous pick for dinner and drinks. Super nice and swanky inside, loved the vibe. Great decor and amazing service.  The rolls were buttery, hot and fresh- check them out for an appetizer.  I had the halibut- so delicious but pretty expensive for one piece of fish.  I would definitely go back for the sweet service and amazing vibe.

reviews.author: Anne S.
reviews.description: We came here for a special occasion, and I will say the service side of things was fantastic for that. We were given a card signed by the entire staff (and printed with today's date so we knew it hadn't just been pulled from a stack) and two free glasses of champagne that we could tell was nice quality. At the end of the meal, they also brought out two small plates of dessert on the house, and it was delicious! Tasted sort of like an apple crisp, and really beautifully plated. I'm kicking myself for not having taken a picture of it.  I also really have to compliment our waiter, who said he had some level of sommelier training and had contributed to the wine list. He pointed us to a bottle of 2016 "Sucette," a grenache from "An Approach to Relaxation," a small vineyard in Australia. I'd never had a pure grenache and had never been a fan of GSM blends, but this bottle was absolutely lovely. It's hard to find online, and I love it when I can get a bottle at a restaurant that I can't just pick up at my local liqueur store...makes it more worth the mark-up.  So, service was five stars, all the way. Really nice.  The letdown was the food. First, they were out of the short rib. Guys...this was a special occasion, and I came all the way from Dallas for the short rib. Don't do me like that! I mean...the thought of walking out honestly crossed my mind. Instead, I took the waiter's suggestion and ordered the halibut. It was...fine. No short rib. We also shared the Wagyu sirlion, which honestly wasn't all that remarkable either. For sides, we did the asparagus (very nice) and the shells and cheese (also nice). Oh, and we started with the octopus, which also was nicely prepared. And then, yeah, heck, we went for it and ordered a full dessert in addition to the free mini desserts they gave us. The Chocolate Bar was...eh. Chocolatey? Nothing memorable, really.  At the end of the day, our bill was as sky-high as you might expect with a bottle of nice wine, two entrees (one being Wagyu steak), two sides, and a dessert. However, we both left feeling as though the food really hadn't lived up to the cost. We agreed that if we were going to drop that much money on a meal, we would have much rather gone next door to Uchi...and that's just not a great feeling.  I really do have to compliment the staff and their phenomenal attention to our special occasion. They earned those three stars all on their own. I wish the food had supported a higher rating, but it just fell short of expectations.

reviews.author: Shelby C.
reviews.description: We are always so impressed with the food every time we come to Eberly. If you're looking for a nice restaurant, cool vibe, great food and don't mind the price tag that comes along with it, this is a great place for a date or dinner with friends.   Our group of friends went to Eberly most recently for a birthday celebration and we had the Japanese milk rolls, salmon poke, grilled octopus, short rib, wagyu steak, and shells and cheese. Everyone loved their entree! The grilled octopus and salmon poke blew us away - great starter dishes that I would highly recommend to any group going here.   The dessert was also great, we had the shortcake followed by a round of espresso martinis.   Great food, great vibe, great service. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Julie C.
reviews.description: I am honored to have experienced dining in at Eberly. This restaurant is simply amazing. All their food is fresh and high quality.   For appetizers, I would recommend all the starters. Although, if you have to narrow your choices, my top picks would be the Japanese rolls (dinner rolls), the steamed mussels, and the croquettes. Honestly though, everything is so amazing here that you won't be disappointed.  As for the main course, the short rib with polenta was incredible. The meat was fatty, soft, and full of flavor. It melted in your mouth.   Our server for the night was really great too and took their time to ensure we had all our dining needs met.   Unfortunately, what's preventing me from giving this restaurant a 5 out of 5 is that around 1030 after finishing our meal we wanted to go to the bar in the restaurant for some drinks and we were unable to do so. The bar was basically empty and the bartender told us we had to ask the host if we could sit for a drink at the empty bar. We went to go ask the host if we could sit and they said they would find out. We stood at the front waiting for 15 minutes for them to come back with an answer and they said "you can sit at the bar but can only have 1 drink because we close at 11."   It took them 15 minutes to basically say no to sitting at their empty bar. Also, why would you tell us there's a drink limit? What if I can drink more than one drink in 15 minutes? I am disappointed I didn't get to finish my night at Eberly's bar.   I do recommend their restaurant but probably not the bar since they don't like to seat people at their empty bar.

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: I have been dying to go to Eberly for over a year and I must say, I will not wait much longer than a month to come back! It reminds me of Mad Men meets a speakeasy and I AM SO INTO IT.  My group's order: Cocktails: - Brooklynite - So smooth and delicious! Little tropical escape in a glass without the sugar punch. - Tristessa - Deliciously smokey and sweet, oh so good. - Sixteen Jackies - Favorite drink of the night! So pleasant and gentle you can barely taste any alcohol! - Autumn Rhythm - Classy, sophisticated, and the ice even has Eberly etched on it!  Food: - Japanese Milk Rolls - Its not hard to make bread absolutely divine but this really is something that I am now craving everyday... - Potato Leek Croquettes - Crispy but smooth on the inside with a pack of flavor in every bite. - Agnolotti - Vegetarians rejoice, these tiny pasta pillows are so delicious and tons of veggies to pair with it! - Asparagus - Sides can feed 2 people so share with the table! Cooked to perfection and so juicy. - Halibut - Fresh, moist, and every bit as healthy as you want it to be! - Braise Short Rib - Slightly dry unfortunately but otherwise epic flavors and the polenta was cooked to perfection. - Sticky Toffee Pudding - Wow this really was a perfect way to end the night! Please try this!  Long story short, GO TO EBERLY.

reviews.author: Tom V.
reviews.description: The space is very nice and service was excellent. Definitely a place to have a date. We never had to wait for anything and the server was friendly and courteous.   The reason I give it only 4 stars, is the the food was just good, and not great. When you are paying almost 100 dollars a person including drinks, you expect the food to be excellent. We had the fish and the wagyu sirloin. There was nothing wrong with the food, but it just didn't wow us. The wagyu tasted like a normal filet. Very lean but tender. It wasn't any tastier. I would have much rather have a prime ribeye for the same price.

reviews.author: Ralph T.
reviews.description: Eberly is one of those spots in town I always want to love but seems to fall short.  The interior is gorgeous, especially if you are seating in the glass enclosed room.  10/10 for ambiance and design.  The cocktails are also great!  I've never had a drink here I didn't like.  Unfortunately, the food is where things go a bit south.  The portions are quite small and I find the quality to be inconsistent between dishes.  The price is also pretty high compared to other restaurants in the area.  That being said, the service has always been exceptional.  I think this place would be a lot better if they knocked a few bucks off their food prices (or improved the food).

reviews.author: Ellen G.
reviews.description: TLDR: This is a great spot for a celebratory evening, but is overpriced and shouldn't be your "go to date night".  We went to Eberly to celebrate a friends job promotion. The ambiance was great. We sat in what felt kind of like a beautiful greenhouse. Plants everywhere, cute decor, and perfect lighting. The service was also great. Our waiter took great care of us the whole time. Everyone enjoyed the cocktails and drinks they ordered too.   The menu is not huge and every entree is over $21 a person some going up to $42. This price was okay for a celebration dinner, but it felt like a lot for the portion sizes.   Also, we ordered a side of the crushed potatoes and they were covered in mint. I personally dislike mint and the menu did not say the potatoes would be topped with it or I would not have ordered it. I was surprised and disappointed by my side order.

reviews.author: Lydia A.
reviews.description: Had the best experience here! The food was amazing, service was spectacular and ambiance was on point! Great place to go with friends or co workers!

name: The Butterfly Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Samuel C.
reviews.description: A magical circus of a place.  Never mind they have a real circus wagon out on the side, out of which they serve Italian food.  Never mind the strings of colored lights that make the back yard look like a carnival midway.  Never mind that the Vortex theater is right inside.  So if you are a paying customer, just beyond the velvet door curtain of the Vortex, there really ARE sword swallowers, lesbian ring masters, dancing dryads in water pools, and mega-gods of universal destruction.   Actually what is behind the velvet door curtain changes every few weeks.   When you go it may be nuclear rainbow unicorns, cybernetic tap dancers and the Flaming King of the Empire of the Ashes.  There will always be something interesting behind the Vortex velvet door for sure.  However, it is just as magical out in the bar.  The bar magic goes on all night rather than ending at the one hour and forty minute mark.  Of course, part of the magic is EtOH.  EtOH produces far more intoxicating illusions than anything that goes on in the main hall of the Vortex.  (EtOH is chemical-ese for ethyl alcohol, otherwise known as booze.)  The Butterfly Bar serves first rate EtOH.  Most of the house drinks are girly cocktails of classical or recent provenance. These are fine for what they are.  However, they do one wicked little number called the Whippoorwill which is fine bourbon, cold brew coffee, New Orleans style chicory and foam with secret flavor ingredients.  The Ghost of Sherlock Holmes appears and takes you down all the secret passages of the house.  The magic is generally enhanced by broadcasts of best-of scenes from past Vortex productions, projected on one wall.  There are projections of obscure documentaries on another wall. These have no sound, and I can promise you, you have never heard of any of them.  There is a vending machine on the wall that will sell you thirty dollar forks, knives and spoons that will save the world.  (I am not making that last detail up. Check it out for yourself.)  There are cats who run the establishment and have more authority than the bartenders.  One particular kingly and somnolent feline decided he was going to take his nightly nap at my table on the bench.  He claimed his space where I otherwise would have preferred to sit, and owned half of my table for the rest of the night.  He occasionally roused himself for twenty seconds just to make sure no service dogs had entered the establishment. After that, he returned to his regal slumbers.  The most magical parts of the establishment however, are not the food truck, the colored lights, the video loops, the drinks or the cats,   The most magical parts of the Butterfly bar are the patrons.  This is one of the most fantastical people watching spots in Austin.  It is a world of twenty nine different genders. It is a world of eighty nine different art forms. It is a world of magical costumes to die for. It is a world of back stories that makes your Ghost of Sherlock Holmes seem relatively tame.  The imaginary characters on the Vortex Stage have nothing on the real-life characters that populate the Butterfly Bar  So come to the Butterfly Bar and watch all of the limits of your plain-jane everyday reality dissolve.  Bring your magic hat even if it is just an old Chicago White Sox cap you got as a kid at a ballgame.  After half an hour, you will be able to reach inside that baseball cap and pull out a talking marmoset.

reviews.author: Damon R.
reviews.description: Meh experience, at best. Bartenders don't seem to know what they are doing and can answer no questions about their drinks. They're also relatively expensive for the experience (for not knowing how to explain them). Also, I just don't find them good. Strong alcohol taste, and not in a good way...   On another note... Patrizis is an absolutely banger. 10/10 would recommend.

reviews.author: Kaitlin O.
reviews.description: This review might be a bit biased because I don't really enjoy the taste of alcohol, but here it goes:  I ordered the margarita and added the mango flavor for an additional $1. I couldn't taste any mango as it was all masked by the strong tequila. I'm not sure if all margs are like this, but it could have been because the ratio of tequila to everything else was off. My friends and I all agreed that the taste of alcohol was a bit too strong for a drink like a margarita.   I did like the ease of ordering drinks. We were eating at Patrizis and I liked how you could order and pay off your phone and they'd bring it straight to your table within 5min.

reviews.author: Stefanie D.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time about a month ago. It's definitely an "East Austin" vibe, like a crazy backyard with statues and lights and mismatched patio tables.   I like that they do have a hostess at the front gate to seat you, so you don't have to do that awkward wandering around the yard looking for a table and feeling like everyone is staring at you. They also check IDs and take your temperature at the front.   Currently, all the ordering is done via your cell phone. Scan the QVC code, and then view the menu and place your order to your table number and they carry out your drinks. Note that when ordering liquor, it requires you to order food with it, so they have a menu of $2 bar snacks. After the first round, we notated that we had already ordered snacks, and were not required to buy more with every drink purchase. But they did check for the snacks when the drinks were brought out.  I've only tried the margarita and a dirty vodka martini, $9 and $10 respectively. DAMN. Those margaritas are GOOD and STRONG. I had 2 and i was....feeling no pain. My martini was also PERFECT. Worth the money, and if you get there during happy hour, the margs are only $5! I did also enjoy the little $2 package of trail mix with MandMs.   One thing I noticed was that the cup size seemed to change, one time i went and they were served in these short plastic cups and another time these taller plastic cups. I was a little concerned that there are inconsistent portions but I can't be sure.  Will definitely be back, those drinks are FIRE and i want to try the food truck. Also plenty of non street parking which i appreciate!

reviews.author: Stacie H.
reviews.description: Butterfly Bar has casual, good vibes. There are some fun drinks available, hula hoops and a roaming black cat! It's a great environment to enjoy Patrizi's as well.  As a heads up to anyone prone and/or sensitive, the last few times I've visited I've been swarmed by mosquitoes which has unfortunately dampened the experience. There is now bug spray available outside but they still persist.

reviews.author: Jordan S.
reviews.description: Really cool atmosphere with lots of outdoor seating and entertainment. They were doing trivia last night. The drinks are also really good and they do happy hour 5-7. One of the bartenders was a little snappy but not too notable to ruin the time there. Patrizis food truck is there with really good looking pasta. I didn't get to try because the line got too long and the whole bar was actually very packed especially for a Tuesday. Will definitely be back though!

reviews.author: Jessica U.
reviews.description: Relaxing outdoor Nature scenery, great for happy hour. It's quite a hidden gem. I had a margarita they were delicious, strong and not too sweet or sour. The staff was friendly and they do an awesome job of following CDC guideline to keep their patrons safe with temperature checks and 6ft rule. Did not get to try the food because they were so busy that my food would be taking an hour to get, so don't go starving.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: This review is for Togo drink service only. My work needed 40 bloody Mary's catered. Butterfly bar was super accommodating and easy to work with in getting this order done in less than a weeks notice. We got disposable cups, garnishes, mix, and vodka in very organized boxes. We had to order a snack cause of the covid law in dealing with to go drinks. We messaged the bar directly for this service. Thanks so much!!! These are sure to be a hit for our mindhunter book club social hour!

reviews.author: Sunny S.
reviews.description: Great spot for drinks (and food if you order through Patrizi's food truck). Nice casual, outdoor drinks vibe. It's an assortment of random seating layouts, comfortable for any size group. They have great shade structures, a stage for music, and firepits

reviews.author: Nina F.
reviews.description: I arrived there the Wednesday before Thanksgiving.  Before riding there on my bike from 4 miles away,  i mapped out the route on Google Maps beforehand and Google said it was closed. the phone recording on the bar's answering machine said they were open for business. Still wanting to confirm,  i tried ordering some food/drink over the website and again it let me order food/drink.  So i arrive to the bar and there is a piece of paper stuck on door that said "closed." About 4-5 others were standing around also surprised that it was closed. Butterfly Bar management lacked a modicum of courtesy to its potential customers by omitting  to mention on its website/ answering machine/ FB  that it was indeed closed on a non-holiday. Surprise!Customers are going to rely on that answering machine msg and actually take an Uber or ride their bikes several miles to get there. It would make sense to at least turn off the answering machine completely if you are not going to bother to change the outgoing message. I doubt i will venture out to Butterfly Bar again. Luckily, the very professionally-run Salty Sow nearby gave us excellent refreshments and earned the $100+ we spent that night.

reviews.author: Sasha T.
reviews.description: My friend and I came here on a blind double date for the first time on 9/17 at around 7:30 p.m. and thought the vibe was great until our waitress came up and introduced herself, but unfortunately I have forgotten her name( server: inside B) . She asked for a card for the tab and we asked if we could do two separate tabs to which she basically told us that we could be on one tab and figure out the rest on our own. Then as I offered up my card with a bit of hesitation she made a comment about how some of us in the group didn't know what it was like to go out prior to Covid and open a tab. Her facetious comment was directed at me being that I recently turned 21 and was the youngest. Next we received our drinks, I understand that some drinks are made bigger than others, but when my friends were brought their drinks they were all filled to the top, weheres mine was filled 3/4. I let it go and asked if we could get some more water and our waitress said ok and never came back until it was last call and my friend asked again, then she brought the water. Let me mention that we were not belligerent, we were in a space by ourselves and we had each ordered a single drink and had food. When we asked for our check, my friend asked our waitress how her night had been, thinking that if it had been busy then maybe she was just a bit frustrated and we should be understanding of that, instead she said it had been an easy night, then why rudeness directed at me? All people  in my party (with 2 being practically strangers) noticed the difference in attitude towards me compared to them. Overall it was very upsetting as a POC to get this clear difference in treatment from another POC at an establishment that loudly advocates for POC. I still tipped her, because we are in a pandemic it's the right thing to do, but I felt so strongly about this that it made me write my first yelp review.

reviews.author: Niki B.
reviews.description: A fun, hippie, outdoorsy spot to grab a quality drink.  Kind of hidden from the main road, the Butterfly Bar has one sign and a gate that you follow to an outdoor garden full of twinkle lights and laughing people. There's a stage where there's often performances and a little indoor cabin part where you order drinks. It's almost pitch black outside at night, but makes for a fun date and casual atmosphere.   I ordered a mojito and it was delicious and strong. I would 100% recommend going here if you're in the area! So fun and unique.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Divey but really good service.  Expect cans and full pours here for $5-7 for beer and cocktails $8.  Great service that is quick and active, not the typical where you're standing there trying to make eye contact for 10 minutes.  Patrizi's out back so you got great food with good drink; not best selection of beer but local Texas.  Got a projector on the wall for special showings, but expect a hangout on most nights and not a get-some-work-done type of venue.  Overall a good spot and easy to find parking out back.

reviews.author: Claudia Z.
reviews.description: I love this place! I have only passed by this when driving on Manor like 1,000,000 times! It is truly a hidden gem and super divey! Getting into the parking lot kind of sucks if you are coming from Manor because it is such a small little entrance, if you have a bigger SUV, it might be tight for you. Otherwise, this place is amazing! There are a lot of different picnic tables outside and some w/umbrellas and some without. Also, some of them have heating lamps for when it is cold. They have a food truck here apparently that is supposed to be amazing, we didn't try it because we had already had dinner but the line to the food truck was literally out the fence. The butterfly bar also has indoor seating but the outside seating is more lively and fun! I had a sangria and it was super tasty! It had OJ and brown sugar in it made w/red wine! I love this place. They have a couple cats walkin around too, don't pet them, they don't like it. Cheers!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Pretty sweet spot- super divey, kinda hidden behind a fence off Manor. Amazing food truck. Live music.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Definitely a cool spot! I found my self ordering drinks here when we came to seek our Patrizi's food truck.  I was actually surprised at the selection of drinks they had.  I immediately fell in love with the cocktail menu.  The bartender working that night was great.  My first cocktail was a surprise from my husband, the butterfly nectar.  It was simply divine!  I loved the addition of the flower in it too!  Next I ordered the Blossom cocktail and it was just as beautiful and tasty as the first!  They also have a nice selection of beer and wine too.   The inside bar has a vintage vibe going on.  It was comfortable.  I loved the openness of the outside patio area.  There were several nook and crannies to set up shop outside with your friends.    I am absolutely a fan of butterfly bar and would love to come back here.  I need to continue my exploration of the cocktail menu as it is lengthy!

reviews.author: Jeff E.
reviews.description: Convenient location to partake of the excellent fare from Patrizi's.  However, I could have done without the blaring and vulgar rap music being played.

reviews.author: Nancy Z.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere with an indoor bar and outdoor seating! Asked for a sweet mocktail, and they did not disappoint. Ran into a group of grad students practicing Italian in the outdoor area, apparently they meet up frequently as well. They also have a couple of cats roaming around. Decorations are simple with string lights and everything.  Heard their food truck is also a great Italian spot, will come back at a later time to try it out!

reviews.author: Luci H.
reviews.description: When you're a fan of drinking, you either find loyal spots where you eventually become a regular, or mix it up just enough that people don't think you drink too much. I'm the latter. I love to find new spots to get a drink. Sometimes it will be months before I repeat a bar.   The Butterfly Bar is one of those places that I visit once every 6 or so months and wonder why I'm not there all the time. The servers are friendly, the patio is large and beautiful, they even have a greenhouse you can sit in for a magical evening among the garden. They have a place for everyone. Just sit back and enjoy the music, dancing, or movies.. whichever are going on at the time!   They have a great selection of wines and craft cocktails that alway please. They are a little on the pricey side as 2 margs were about $18, but they were perfectly mixed and not too sweet, so I'll take it.   Definitely stop by with an empty stomach, too, because Patritzi's is killer food-truck Italian spot and it's right there.. waiting..for you!

reviews.author: Lindsey R.
reviews.description: Been going here for years! I love being a part of this space and protected lil piece of Austin's heart. A truly unique, multi-faceted gathering place with folks of all different backgrounds coming together to enjoy life- be that theatre, cocktails, food, or just laid back hangs with friends. A great place for birthdays and meet-ups. A happy hour that for sure puts a smile on your face. Interesting cocktails to explore. A food truck that will fill you up with delicious local ingredients and handmade pasta. And what began it all- the performing arts theatre that has been a part of the community for 30years. It's a special piece of Austin and one of the few left that are still holding their own while the condos encroach. Much magic resides here! (Pro-tip: get a sno.co snow cone from the trailer in the lot and get it spiked! Purrrfect for TX summers!!)

name: School House Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday

reviews.author: Logan N.
reviews.description: This small place was a nice stop while in north Austin. The cocktails were good but the Montreal fries were amazing! Small place so seating is limited. Unique feel to the place... like a hole in the wall but not. Outside seating was nice for the cool night.

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: Its safe! Its socially distant compliant! Its employees are masked and enforce masks! Its Schoolhouse Pub!  This little gem is sandwiched behind Mi Madre's and El Chilito. You'll miss it if you blink! Swing around back for parking or walk up from the front.   Indoor/outdoor seating with puppers welcomed outside.   + Tasty noms (get the fried deviled eggs. Woo!) Classy cocktails Very relaxed vibe Minimal staff contact  Safety measures in place Cute little floating books  Clean bathroom  - This place is smaller, dont bring a big group.  No cash, yall. Its dirty, ya know? Small parking outback   I took my cousin and we had a really nice time. The staff and bartenders were incredibly kind and went above and beyond to be helpful.   Definitely check this place out with a friend or two...or a pupper or two.

reviews.author: Robert S.
reviews.description: I'm surprised this place has a rating as high as 4 overall. It's the worst pub food I've had, and I tried a few of the dishes. How can you mess up fish and chips? A mess. Drinks are basic and uninteresting. If you want a decent site to sit and chat with your friends, it's a good place to hang, but you can find the same atmosphere elsewhere and get palatable food and better cocktails.

reviews.author: Mylan D.
reviews.description: Food is delicious! I came here twice to order their deviled eggs!  It's best if you come during recess hours (happy hour) and check out their discounted menu! Otherwise, expect to pay minimum $14 for your main course. I love that their menu, decor and the restaurant reminds me of an elementary school.   Service was wonderful and food came out about 15 mins on a slow day. It's also conveniently located between a couple of taco restaurants if you need a quick snack!   Patio is Bob and dog friendly! There's water bowls for your thirsty pup on the side of the restaurant if you choose to bring your furry companion!   Bartender made me a cute mimosa to enjoy before heading back to the airport. Definitely coming back to visit when I'm in town again!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Visited for happy hour and wasn't smitten with any dish (except the mac 'n cheese). Everything was fine; just nothing that makes me want to return again any time soon.  I love the indoor seating with its broody, dark interiors and the plentiful outdoor seating on park benches (hard to get in and out of if you're wearing a skirt/dress!) and when the sunset is that beautiful magenta/hot Texas orange color, this venue is perfectly situated to stare longingly at it. I also like that you order from the counter instead of traditional table service because sometimes it's nice not to be interrupted (make sure you have everything you need before you sit down, though, because if the line is long, it makes it difficult to track someone down for something).  A solid place for a drink if you're a sunset chaser.

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: Solid neighborhood bar, but i probably wouldn't come if i didnt live near by.   The best feature is the patio, Manor road is a cool neighborhood and its fun to people watch. The inside feels a little cramped for a group and it can be pretty loud. The neighborhood in general is nice. If your in the area you should stop by.  They also have some good happy hour deals. 6 dollar fish and chips and 5 dollars off bottles of wine. Each day of the week has a different deal and they're all pretty good.  In terms of drinks, they have a decent selection of beers on tap. Theyre selection extends beyond the basic austin starter pack too which is nice.  In terms of food,  Its a step up from bar food, but i definitely wouldn't call this a gastro pub. The fish and chips are good but definitely greasy and the portions are inconsistent.    The burger is pretty good. The patty is pretty thick and they put a jam on top thats sweet which stole the show. I think the jam was made of onions. I only wish they put more jam on top. It has a similar effect as ketchup. be warned, the saten burger is a little tough.

reviews.author: Kerthy F.
reviews.description: BEST BURGER FRIES AND ONION RINGS!!  I live nearby, and this is my go-to when I want a great burger and fries. The orange marmalade/ carmelized onion / homemade pickle combo is so good. It's my fave burger in Austin. And solid cocktails. Nice people, nice service, GREAT FOOD.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Very cool vibes here and super friendly staff.  The food was just ok in my opinion- we shared the fish and chips, Montreal fries, and ravioli. Nothing blew me away, but it was good!  It's more about the drinks and atmosphere- great beer selection and cocktail list :)  Definitely want to go back for happy hour prices and brunch!

reviews.author: Scott L.
reviews.description: Great outdoor seating: $2.50/pint Lone Star is a thirst quencher. But $15.00 Special "Birro Mac and Cheese?" No. I don't care how Much Sirracha you add to Hamburger Helper: fool me once, shame on you. I'll never order food here without looking at the price again. And if you think topping it with grated cabbage justifies the ridiculous price, think again!  Come here for the atmosphere and justifiably cheap beer..

reviews.author: robert t.
reviews.description: Super sad that this pub, which I have always liked on Manor, has a super condescending female working at the bar. Everyone has always been so nice until yesterday, may 19, 2021. Dark hair heavy set lady with tattoos in her 20s was so rude to me three times and while I was simply ordering in line. Rude to others as well, very bossy and not friendly. Reaching out to the owner today. Sad. Covid is no longer an excuse.

reviews.author: Angela B.
reviews.description: Love this place! Fun atmosphere inside (when things are normal) and a great patio for outside eating. The husband and wife owners are awesome people, and their staff are so friendly. Delicious drinks and amazing, elevated pub food! Highly recommend it ALL!! Their location in central Austin near UT. Definitely check it out NOW!

reviews.author: Tiffiny S.
reviews.description: Hated getting a hall pass in school...but getting the hall pass at the School House was amazing! Got vodka rather than gin!  Fresh fruit, yes please! Insane! Their beyond burger was beyond words! Best food and perfect unique house made drinks on the east side!

reviews.author: Meredith E.
reviews.description: This place is a great casual, laid-back, rustic bar to grab a drink and grub with a group. The only parking available is street parking behind the bar in the neighborhood, but you don't have to walk too far. (Less than 5 min)  This bar has a throwback school vibe with chalkboards on the walls and mini composition notebooks for your receipt. They have a good craft beer selection and their food is delicious and higher quality than your average bar food. We ordered the wings and pretzels. The pretzels are a bit more oily, however it being bar food, filled my greasy food craving. The mustard seed it came with was a great pair (although i highly recommend adding a queso dip!). The wings were delicious as well and were mild spicy. There is patio seating out back and picnic tables out front, as well, so there is plenty of space for a group.

reviews.author: Svetlana M.
