reviews.description: love the cocktails here. they are amazing and creative. all the little theming touches are cool too. this place has a really nice chill vibe. totally fun. and the bartenders are all super friendly.

reviews.author: Yiana Y.
reviews.description: Hidden gem of a Sunday brunch spot in Austin and there's usually not a wait, which is hard to come by these days. They even have vegan biscuits and gravy that are SO good. Nice, casual, chill option for your Sunday brunch needs

reviews.author: Angie W.
reviews.description: Came in for the first time the Sunday of the World Cup final.  Friend suggested it would be a fun place to watch. They opened early and there was already a line.  Think it was worth it.   While small the space was great and the food and drinks on point. Loved the smokey blood Mary. Got the potato hash vegan style and it was tasty.   Only thing that was a miss was the way they handled the crowd. Couldn't order food and drink until after a time past open which isn't their fault but there wasn't enough staff to handle the crowd. Food went to wrong people and no one to check on diners.  They did the best they could but poor planning.   Will give them another go on a normal day and think things will be five star worthy.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: I had been meaning to check this place out as it is literally down the street from a friend's apt on Manor and having investigated almost every other place on the block, my FOMO was kicking in when I would see this place packed to the hilt every time we drove by. Luckily, I came on a quiet weekday evening and barely made it for their HH (the bartender was nice enough to honor it since it was but a minute over).   I like the vibe here, it is very trendy eastside but w/o the pretension or self-importance of other places nearby.   I had my sights set on the Montreal fries as I am a poutine enthusiast (and purist, to be truthful) , so I will establish right now these are not traditional poutine, but a conceptualization. First off, the serving was massive and I probably reached my sodium quota for the week by finishing every last bite, but I'm not a quitter and setting this heap of short ribs, gravy, cheese curds, and fries in front of me was instantly "Challenge: Accepted!". It took me almost an hour and a half whittling away one bite at a time and having to take literal breathers in between, but it was ::MISSION ACCOMPLISHED:: (in the unironic non-Bush sense) and I had 0 regrets.  In the 90mins of unleashing my hardcore Fatty for all to see, I got to interact w/the staff and other patrons and I have to say, there were no judgements (aamof, I got several nods and eyebrow raises of approval at my endeavor). I'll admit, everyone I encountered was a very Austin-y version of splendid! We laughed, I cried (when I finally finished the Montreal Fries), and even rebuked the very handsome bartender's insinuation I would even think about a to-go box!   All in all, I enjoyed my visit here and can see myself coming back on an off/quiet night. The seating inside is pretty cozy and the patio is smallish as well, so I can only imagine how chummy you have to get with your fellow "students" when the Friday bell sounds and weekend recess is in effect!

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: What a great little spot! Stopped in during HH on a Thursday and posted up at the bar. Super friendly bartenders and just a great vibe overall. Went ahead and sampled some beers, grabbed a Dogfish Punkin Ale - they guy even threw some sugar and freshly ground cinnamon on the rim! This is the only way you should be drinking a pumpkin beer!   Ordered the fish and chips - $5 bucks on HH! These things came with some serious garlic fries.. I want you to take what you think is a lot of garlic, then multiply it by 83874... Somehow still delicious, the tarter sauce on the side deserves an award.. It was like a tarter/greek tzatziki sauce hybrid! I should have asked for some to-go. No idea why they give you ketchup as well.. Doesn't really fit the plate because of the fry seasonings and garlic. The fish was tender and crispy... perfect balance.   If you haven't had a chance to check this spot out, throw it on your list!  One last thing - if you do order the fish and chips.. Don't go get your game on for the night without brushing and gargling a gallon of mouthwash, throw some gum in for good measure! Be responsible, people!

reviews.author: Nicole J.
reviews.description: Casual neighborhood spot. You order at the bar and they bring you your food. Pretty small but lots of seating outside. Cheese plate was good but needed more cracker. Cheap house wine. There were people eating but also on computers working

reviews.author: Kasy S.
reviews.description: This really is a great little pub. Their beer selection is stellar and happy hour is solid. Monday, all full sized pints (not the high ABV offerings) are $4, which is great. The food is really good as well.   We tried the wontons which were good, though there were only 3 in a $10 order. The kale salad included was fantastic.  We also got the special for the day which was a tempura scallion pancake filled with Korean beef. Really a fantastic little dish. This one impressed me.  We also got the fish and chips. the fish was of high quality and the fries were tasty. Two small gripes, it was fish and frites (though the crispy fries were delicious), and while the outside of the fish was perfectly crispy, the inside of the batter was a touch soggy. The goat cheese tartar was unlike anything I've had before: subtle in flavor and with the consistency of butter. However, when you spread it on the fish and it starts to melt, it was really good.  So, a couple of small gripes about the food can't keep this from being a 5-star. Every time I visit, I am reminded of what a good gastropub can be.

name: Yellow Jacket Social Club
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday

reviews.author: Megan V.
reviews.description: Lots of outdoor seating, good ambiance (I think all the trees and lights really contribute to this), and the food/drinks are really quite cheap.  Took advantage of the full kitchen and bar and got the sweet potatoes! Was pleasantly surprised by how good they were. They came with a curry masala mayo (which my drunk friend loved so much, they basically licked my plate clean). Will have to come back and try the sandwiches everyone is talking about

reviews.author: Anni D.
reviews.description: Cool vibes and bomb sandwiches!!! Taking off a star because my friend waited 45 mins for his sandwich (I think the kitchen forgot the order?).   We tried frito pie (so good!), meze plater and ham cheese sandwich. Meze platter was bit underwhelming but everything else was great!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: My husband and I came here on a Saturday late afternoon. We ordered a couple of drinks and sat outdoors on one of the picnic benches. In total, we had two drinks apiece and slightly more experience compared to other places in the area. I have been here once before and had some fries. They had been pretty decent. Overall, I would recommend and will be back in the future.

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: This is a great East Austin hidden gem. They have an amazing local craft beer selection, and a full bar plus kitchen. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. I haven't tried the food, yet I've heard great things about it. Will definitely return.

reviews.author: Nick B.
reviews.description: This review is long overdue. I first came here 4 years ago and loved everything about this bar. I'm not sure what the building used to be but I just think it's so cool.   The inside is dark and cool, but I love it. The food is amazing, the drinks are cheap, and the ambiance is cool asf. I came back here this weekend and not a single thing changed.   We got to sit outside this time and everything was perfect. Yellow Jacket Social Club is a diamond in the rough.

reviews.author: Al R.
reviews.description: Top notch hole in the wall bar, rad patio surrounded by Crape Myrtle trees and bamboo.  Great menu and food is great.

reviews.author: Aleah H.
reviews.description: We came here on a Saturday night for the open patio seating and the grungy vibe. We got lemon drop shots, Vegas bombs, and Modelo's... Props to the bartenders for making legitimate lemon drops instead of hating us for ordering them.  They had bar service, and line was never longer than 3 people or crowded. We didn't have to wait for a table at all when we arrived. We sat in a table nestled in the trees and although I saw reviews that complained about the birds, the trees were a nice back rest, and the social distancing was comforting! It's definitely not a fancy or experience-based spot, but it has a time and place!   Pro tip: If you get stuck on the wrong side of the really long fence in the street, one of the panels to the right of the entrance is unattached and you can step through!!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: We visited Yellow Jacket Social Club for an after work cocktail and they did not disappoint. From the guy at the door to the bartender, everyone was super kind and helpful. We ended up ordering the watermelon frozen margaritas - I could be wrong but I think they change up their frozen cocktails quite often. If you come across it on your visit, I would definitely recommend it. They had a variety of beer options and even though I didn't order any food, their menu looked appetizing.  They have a cool vibe with an expansive patio setup. If you get the choice between small/large cocktail, get the large. The price comparison is $7/10 and the large seemed like a way better deal. The birds above can be a little bit of a nuisance so try and sit somewhere with less tree above. They were also very Covid safe and instead of having everyone order in the bar, they had a makeshift bar setup outside where you would place your order. I recommend grabbing a patio seat here on a beautiful day!

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Some big improvements over here. They expanded the inside and are adding more outdoor bench seating, but still has that old divey vibe. Also they have Rosen bagels! Brunch is served until 3pm. Nice to be back to a familiar spot after the pandemic and see it's looking good!

reviews.author: Diana B.
reviews.description: Outdoor vibe, so nice! The trees make it nice and shady. high school vibe for sure. The grilled cheese was delicious! The staff was friendly

reviews.author: Ashley V.
reviews.description: Their beet sandwich is what vegetarian dreams are made of. Every component was delicious!   I feel like this is the central version of Little Darlin and i love it. Super chill, patio, dog friendly, yummy food and full bar.

reviews.author: Shaun S.
reviews.description: I came here for happy hour, based on a local's recommendations. There really weren't any deals but the drinks were considerably priced. Bartender was alright but the staff overall and vibe of the place were not as hospitable as other places nearby. The inside is small with a five bar feel, which I'm fine with, the outside area is probably nice on days where it isn't raining but I sat out there during cloud cover and it was just alright. The parking lot gets flooded after rain so take that into consideration, The bright spot of this place was their potato wedges. Not even kidding. They aren't your typical wedges and I was delighted at how good they were. I'd return just for the those, to be honest. If you want no frills and to keep entirely to yourself, this is probably your place. Social butterflied would be best served somewhere else.

reviews.author: B Abigail T.
reviews.description: Very chill atmosphere. Positive vibe and both the service and the drinks were incredible. The watermelon slush was perfection! After reading the reviews I had to have a grilled cheese and I have to tell you that it did not disappoint. Can't wait to go back and have another.

reviews.author: Jabari M.
reviews.description: Very good vibe and outdoor seating. Had an amazing local Blood Orange Cider, and a very well thought out Grilled Cheese. If you go tell them Jabari sent you, won't do anything for you just say it for me!

reviews.author: Marcus Q.
reviews.description: Not my type of music but that's not why I came. I came for the awesome patio atmosphere and the Frito pie. Which did not disappoint! Sometimes you just wanna kick back and enjoy the nice outside vibes and views. I like mature crowds that know how to go out and have a drink and appreciate what that means. I can do that here so  I will be returning.

reviews.author: Nicholas A.
reviews.description: Cool under tree seating kinda out of the way of everything else and good food menu. Good vibes.

reviews.author: D L.
reviews.description: I'm glad I went to this place because now it's on my do not go list. I had high hopes but that changed when I placed my order. We haven't been here and didn't know how the table orders were arranged. We told Christina, our hostess it's either gonna be this number or this number, not sure if it goes up or down but it's out of two choices.  She gave us a blank stare and then walked us over to the tables like a teacher giving us a tour for a field trip. Once she figured out our table she proceeded to take our order. My friend ordered first and left to the table. Then I asked her what on the menu has beets because my friend loves beets and she just stared at me and said look at the menu. I stayed for my friends but I'm never coming back.

reviews.author: Audra O.
reviews.description: I'm from the Philly area and we take Italian subs very seriously. This place has the best Italian sub I've had since I moved to Austin. The roll they use is outstanding. They always have delicious frozen drinks. I also love that they play metal the majority of the time.

reviews.author: Briana B.
reviews.description: almost hate giving this place 5 stars because I want to keep it a secret, but this is the best bar on the east side!! good food, people, drinks, and food :) and dog friendly!

reviews.author: Max V.
reviews.description: Perfectly divey outdoor spot on the east side for a laidback Lone Star kinda night or maybe it's been a day/week/month/year and you need something with more of a punch, they have it all. Also, incredibly underrated kitchen. Seriously, a vegetarian's late night wet dream for noshing (get the beet sandwich and thank me later).

name: The Growler Bar and Kitchen
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: A revisit to one of my favorite spots in Texas, the Growler Bar - 2022 review.   I love coming here when it's not busy, which I'm finding is becoming more and more difficult as time passes. The place has built up a solid base of loyal customers that seem to return week after week and I can't blame them. There is consistency at work here, the staff is always excellent - they make great recommendations to the ever-changing list of beers on tap, the selection of beers is constantly rotating, and best of all - the food is delicious. We often consider ordering take-out for only the pizza/pizza rolls here.   This place has adapted to changing times, they have more outdoor seating so we're able to socially distance ourselves most of the time and feel safe during our visit. I'm happy to see this place thrive.

reviews.author: B T.
reviews.description: Very disappointing.    Phone order was ready 20 minutes early, so by the time I got there the pizzas had been waiting. BUT, the wings were not ready and had to wait longer. By the time I got the phone order home, the pizza and pizza rolls were cold, tasted very average and doughy.   I hope the high rating is for the beer, because the pizza and service was far below any one else....

reviews.author: Laura B.
reviews.description: We got take out and it was exceptional.  So happy to find quality pizza and salad in Pflugerville on par with a couple of premium pizza places in Austin.  Very delicious, black olive and artichoke toppings were generous. The balsamic dressing was good, too.  Check it out!

reviews.author: Jen B.
reviews.description: Popped in on a Sat around noon. Inside seating was nearly full but we managed to snag the last table. There's also plenty of tables outside with umbrellas for those with dogs or don't mind the scorching Texas heat.  The pizza is delicious. I can't remember the name of it but it had Canadian bacon, bacon and a sriracha bbq drizzle on it. Crust was delicious, the bottom wasn't soggy near the center.  Also tried the pretzels with beer cheese. Mmmmmm.   A really big beer selection available as well.   Service was great. You order at the bar, get a number and they bring to your table.   Def worth a visit if you're nearby.

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: In my previous review, I neglected to mention something important. This is one of those businesses which require you to pay first and they hit you with the gratuity percentage upfront before you receive your food and service.  The gratuity should come at the end of the meal and service, not at the beginning and I have found this practice puts more money in the business' pocket at your expense.  Now with that said, their pizza, wings and pizza rolls are quite exceptional. they have an extensive beer selection which is always changing around to keep up with the seasons. So if paying upfront along with the gratuity doesn't bother you then we do recommend the fare, however I find it a turn off. Especially since they forgot half of our order and didn't get it to us until we were ready to leave. So basically, one star for the payment practice, but four stars for the food and beer.

reviews.author: Jonathan R.
reviews.description: Fun local watering hole with an incredible beer selection.   Their pizzas are good, albeit a bit on the doughy side. Wings and other bar food options are surprisingly good as well.   Very popular local spot so this place can get packed. Decent amount of indoor and outdoor seating.   No happy hour which is a bummer.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: The pizza here was fabulous! It reminded us of a place we go in college. The system to get the menu up on my phone hated me so had to get a paper menu from them.  We had a beer called Nola- next time we go I'll get a growler but since we weren't going straight home and forgot a cooler that had to wait. Their beer cheese looks like gravy.. it doesn't taste like gravy though- highly suggest! We will definitely be back next time he visits. Nice large patio and clean bathrooms as well.

reviews.author: Eva S.
reviews.description: Oh where do I begin... GREAT PIZZA!!! Also great for beer fans, clearly. Amazing number of choices. The environment is loud but in the good way that makes you feel comfortable and relaxed. I saw numerous kids here as well so I guess if you have children you don't have to leave them at home for this one. I have to point out, staff wears no masks and they aren't required if you're into that thing.

reviews.author: Ryan C.
reviews.description: Lots of brews on tap. Food is okay, nothing special. Staff is usually great. I personally wouldn't let kids in a bar/kitchen, but that's me. They have video games for the kids.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Decent selection of craft beers, but one thing unique about this bar is that they do not allow customers to sample any beers, unlike most of their competitors.  I undetstand the policy to a certain extent, especially if you had very knowledgeable bartenders, but that is not the case here.  During my most recent visit, one person I was with asked for an IPA that was very hoppy, But instead got something but was very sour and totally did not like the taste of the beer. She was stuck with paying for the pint, despite the bartender's error.  The pizza (bbq chicken) was decent, but pretty bready - took away from the tasty toppings - left me feeling like we were served a glorified frozen pizza - we were hungry so we devoured the pizza, but we were disappointed and will thing twice before  ordering it again.  They had some live music, a young man with the guitar singing cover songs, did a very decent job. It helped make the dying experience enjoyable.  It was a great night to sit on the patio, with a nice breeze, some decent music being played, and the company of good friends.  Perhaps they could think about modifying their policy so that you're entitled to one beer sample, as long as you order a full beer.  The bartender stated the reason for the no sample policy was because of Covid... I just do not buy it, given the fact that None of the bars/restaurants that I have gone to the last couple of months have this type of policy.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: So found this pizza joint in Pflugerville and it did not let me down. Unfortunately I didn't get a pic of the wall of beers since I ate outside to enjoy the cool Texas breeze. The pretzel sticks were hot from the oven. The carnivore pizza had enough meat for four pizzas so come ready to eat. I must say the Hefeweizen was very good and close enough to remind you of Germany if you've been. They have have local bands playing nightly so there's also entertainment. The locals know and if you ever take a trip to the area now you do too.

reviews.author: Wendy T.
reviews.description: Great pizza and bar! Lots of outside seating and lots of options on tap for beers and ciders. I really enjoy their pepperoni rolls.   First time coming here - you order at the bar, they give you a number, and then you take it to whatever table is available and that you choose. Look at the food menu before you come because the food menu is only visible at the counter/bar that you order from. The only bummer to the whole experience was that the number they gave us was not the number they gave the kitchen so the food got lost for a little bit because they were looking for a different number. We got it figured out and it was still delicious!

reviews.author: Evan B.
reviews.description: Service was awesome. Beers were delicious. We ordered Hawaiian pizza rolls and a carnivore calzone. They split the calzone so it was two separate smaller calzones instead which was awesome. The only thing we recommend is the calzone and pizza rolls might have been slightly over cooked as the top of the crusts were very dark and tough. Probably because they cooked it in the same oven and temperature as the pizzas which makes sense. But this wasn't an issue and the food was still great. Loved our experience

reviews.author: Ruth L.
reviews.description: Well the last time we were here October 13, we did not have good service ... we never got our wings and the young lady who took our payment was rude and judgmental... she accused our son of being "sexist " because he ask her about her drinking preference which she responded as wine rather then beer and he simply made the comment ... women generally prefer wine and she accused him of being sexist... very unprofessional but we decided we would give it another try the food was delicious but we again had to ask for our wings... good potential here but they need to make some adjustments to their customer service

reviews.author: Selena V.
reviews.description: LET ME START THIS OFF BY SAYING I AM A FOODIE and HAVE EXPECTATIONS THAT I AM NOT PROUD OF BUT I COME FROM A CULINARY BACKGROUND...  This is my favorite place to come with my fiancé. We bring all of our friends here. Holly is a delightful bartender who has gone above and beyond for us.   Wonderful selections of beer, cider, wine, kombucha, etc..  For food, go with any flavor the wings (lemon pepper and garlic parm are my favorite). The pizza rolls are divine and freshly made. You also can't go wrong with the pizza.   They also have live music and outside seating. Perfect place for date night or to chill with friends. I HIGHLY recommend it.

reviews.author: General Z.
reviews.description: Love the bar haven't tried the food yet but I love their drinks. I always bring my growler to fill it up and sometimes They have different flavors of cider and I'd only drink cider I'm still trying to find my beer That I like. Definitely would go again. hopefully I can try the food when I have the time to stop by and eat. I definitely recommend to people to come here and enjoy the food and the drinks and have good company and A good time

reviews.author: Janice J.
reviews.description: The beer selection here is unmatched in the area....and they have tons of cider, seltzer, wine, and non-alcoholic selections too! The pizza is actually quite good (and I'm a midwestern pizza snob) and the service honestly really makes it. Their servers are so friendly and all throughout the COVID restrictions, they followed the protocols and managed to still make it a fun place to go to. We even hit up a couple of Trivia nights with friends on accident and scored some gift cards and had a blast. My only reason for taking a star off were the wings. We tried them a couple of times but the thick, rubbery fat and lack of crispiness were big turnoffs - seemed like they weren't fried but maybe baked? In any case not good. We've got plenty of other deliciousness there, though, so we just order everything else!

reviews.author: Michelle S.
reviews.description: They have a great assortment of beer, wine and ciders to offer, as well as delicious pizza! The establishment is always clean and a really nice hangout. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable too!

reviews.author: Jennifer K.
reviews.description: We visited here 3 times before posting this review. Underwhelmed is my best description. All times, the beertenders have not been very friendly. This last time, the beertender sat taking our order (yes, he was sitting behind the bar) and had no suggestions or enthusiasm.  There is no way to order without going inside the bar. During covid, there should be options for this!  The pizza is okay. If you are looking for pepperoni rolls, Pinthouse are much better in my opinion.  We may return for specific beers, but it won't be on our regular rotation with other options in the area.

reviews.author: Lauren M.
reviews.description: The pizza here is so good. It's always a hit with the family. This is visit #2 for us and we'll be back again.    During CoVid, you can opt for curbside contactless pickup to make things easy.   You can get 32 or 64 oz growlers along with some delicious food. Pizza and wings were a hit for the family tonight.

name: Leander Beer Market
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Kimberly H.
reviews.description: Amazing Food! I highly recommend the pizza, fried pickles and wings! Normal prices and they have indoor and outdoor seating. Plenty of on street parking. The location is great in the middle of old Leander!

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: It's a local watering watering hole in "downtown" Leander. Why the double quotes around downtown - because there isn't much happening in downtown Leander.   Anyway, cannot comment too much on food as we only had an appetizer and it was alright.   Beer and wine are served in a plastic now which is less than desirable. Not sure how it was pre-Covid.   Staff was fast and efficient but I don't think I could describe them as warm or friendly.  They weren't rude either.   Decent amount of variety. It's charm is that is local and has the hole in the wall personality.   We plan on returning.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: My review is mostly based on service.  I came here with the husband on a Monday night because I wanted a post-dinner beer. I marked this place in my bookmarks as a place I wanted to try based off the reviews. I generally try to be open-minded about my experiences at new places, but honestly I was just rubbed the wrong way here. We walked inside around 7 pm and I only noticed the list of cocktails on the wall behind the bar. I looked at the tap handles to see if I could tell what they had and the bartender finally came over. I figured I'd ask for something easy and see if they had Dos Equis on draft and was told they didn't with a snarky attitude that I guess he thought was witty or funny. I asked where the list of beers was and he stared at me and just pointed up...ok where am I supposed to be looking? OH. Apparently I'm supposed to know there are individual beer names hanging not only above the bar seats, but also sticking out slightly over the seating where you have to get up to see them. I tell him I haven't been there before and wouldn't know those were there. I order the beer he suggested (Alstadt Kölsch) based off of me asking for Dos Equis. He asks if I want to open a tab and I say no. His response: "Only one beer?" with what may as well have been an eye roll. You would think with me telling someone that I'm a new patron the attitude would be better. He probably doesn't care since A) it probably isn't his business, B) I'm sure they have regulars and C) he was probably in a hurry to come outside to vape with his friends on the patio that says "No Smoking".  Side note: if you want to sit outside be prepared to listen to cornhole games underneath the same covering as the seating which causes it to echo so loud you can't hear your own conversation.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: On this past Saturday, we made the adult decision to venture out as LB was open. We decided to visit as they were not busy and were following the separation guidelines. The service is always friendly and it was even better on this visit. Our guest puppy was treated to snacks and fresh water. We sat on the covered patio and watched rerun sporting events and just enjoyed being outside.   I've been an LB patron since day 1 and I remember when it was difficult to find a local venue that offered a large variety of craft beer options.  LB has changed a lot of the years as they now serve cocktails and their patio has been expanded. Venues come and go (see Sheas and AJs across the street) but LB has a loyal following and has remained our go-to venue to have a brew or two and some pub grub.   It's a misnomer to call their food pub grub as you can order a pretty darn good pizza, meatball casserole, fried calamari, artichoke dip, or our favorite their homemade fried pickles. Yes, they pickle on site!   Nice folks, great beer, good cocktails (check out their specials), and food.

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: Amazing food, staff, and regular customer group. The food is fantastic and the pizza is by far the best in Leander. The owners are locals in Leander and always strive to provide a fun environment

reviews.author: Laura N.
reviews.description: Owner harasses people online about politics. He's displayed his misogynistic attitude while bullying of his female staff during meal service. No Covid-safety protocols at all. I miss the sweet bakery that was there before.

reviews.author: Chris K.
reviews.description: This place is great! The prices are set and easy to determine, the staff is helpful and friendly, the food is way better than I expected.  Only draw back is if you go on trivia night seating may be a touch difficult to find, but save that I love this place.

reviews.author: Emily J.
reviews.description: I don't see the appeal of this place but it was busy.   1 bathroom, that smelled like pee and had no paper towels.   The hurricane that I order that was off of there board on drinks that they made was not a good drink.   The garlic bread we ordered was overdone and almost fully burnt on the bottom.   We ordered pizza also. One side was barely done while the other side was burnt. They put a lot of Italian season on top the pizza after it was cooked. Some times you just get a bite full of seasoning, not good.  First bits we thought the pizza had a good flavor but the more you ate the pizza the less tasty it was.

reviews.author: Madi U.
reviews.description: We visited on a Friday night after some late evening tennis because we literally couldn't find a restaurant that's kitchen was open past 10pm. Of course we know that's what to expect from Georgetown lol, but they're kitchen is open until like 11:30 which is fire honestly. Fried pickles were amazing, very nice patio, the music was a little loud but it was busy. Loved that they're dog friendly

reviews.author: Kali H.
reviews.description: Went yesterday for the first time for happy hour. We sat outside had some beers and ordered pizza and mushrooms and the food was fantastic. I will go back

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: The beer selection is always fantastic. The food options are limited, but tasty. I made the mistake of getting an old fashioned here one night-- meh-- but come for the beer and the vibes, and you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Landon O.
reviews.description: I had to post something about their food after all the negative reviews I read before going. We got a pizza, wings, the meatball casserole and a Greek salad. Everything was really good, came out quick and didn't seem like "frozen" meat at all. The meatball casserole was probably the best. The food won't blow you away, but it's great for bar munchies. A solid 4 stars   If they realigned their pool table and got some better sticks it wouldn't hurt.

reviews.author: Jeremy R.
reviews.description: Artichoke dip was great, pizza was just ok.  Nice outdoor area, nice bar.  Would go back again.

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Seek and ye shall find. This tiny hidden spot in old Leander checks off lots of my boxes - but doesn't impress. First off. This is a nice place dont get me wrong. I have been 3 times now just to see maybe it was an OFF day. Good menu , sports , decent tunes. So - those are pretty solid. Let me start with the menu. Pub grub for the most part with $10 pizzas unlimited toppings. So- naturally this is what i ordered each time. Each time it comes out it looks amazing and I'm excited. Like a Pointer Sister ( I 'm so excited ) . But the pizza never tastes cooked. The dough is mushy. Not a big deal. NExt time around I tell them to leave it in a bit longer for me. Comes out -- same. Not a deal breaker. Just need to change what I am eating. My belly prob says same thing. Next lets move onto the staff. For the most part the lady running the joint is on point. Friendly- helpful and witty. The remainder of the staff is quite the opposite. I have noticed this during a lunch visit with us being one of 2 people in the place, and in the evenings like during the sports games and crowds. Just abrasive . Again- I'm not there to make friends. I'm there to have a cold beer ( maybe 3) watch baseball or the slew of people who still have to think if they need to be wearing a mask when they enter an establishment( smh). So - The beer. They have a pretty typical tap list with 1-2 silver and gold medal choices. I saw Aldelberts there last night.. sweet!. But behind the bar is a ghostbuster lunchbox treasure chest of cans and bottles. WARNING! don't try to figure out what's in there. Hard to see them all... and after learning  how friendly the bar staff(see above ) is - I gave up asking and went with an IPA. The crowds are not bad and for the most part follow distancing rules.. but - nothing enforced. This scares me. While I know its MY choice to patron , I would still like to see ppl adhere to the 6ft. Outside- good seating - tv;s good parking and over all fantastic. I will prob go back, just not order the pizza and maybe try and get a spy camera behind the bar to see the other options as -- that's what life is all about. Options. Thanks for eating with me today, and I'll see you next time.  -M

reviews.author: Stephen H.
reviews.description: Fantastic service. Great beer selection draft and cans/bottles. Also have liquor and Red Bull. Lots of TV's and also play sound for the big games. Great food also. Mary is a rock star. TouchTunes could be a bit louder at times but that's probably a good thing based on some of the music selections I've heard. Also have golden tee. Quaint little bookstore next door too. Easy parking.

reviews.author: Ryan T.
reviews.description: Good place fun atmosphere it's like you neighborhood bar with good food good prices too

reviews.author: Erica R.
reviews.description: Wow I'm pretty upset. First game of the season and I was so excited to support my favorite local business. We got here before opening so we were the first to arrive. Sat down at the bar and asked to move because a regular sits there. Ok fine. Told the game was on a certain TV. Once people started arriving the manager said she didn't have enough boxes to play the game I wanted all of a sudden. We had ubered to the bar and now are forced to leave. I guess there is a hierarchy in customers and you have to be important to be treated well. I'm baffled.

reviews.author: Marcus G.
reviews.description: Owner is a jackass who thrives on bullying his staff and customer personnel; have gone a few times to this bar to see him disrespect his female bartenders as well as her clientele while being 'on the job'. A real shame because the place has incredible potential that's obviously being held back

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: This has been a local fav of mine for some years now. The owner is extremely active in the community. The food is great and priced well. Something changed at the spot and for me no longer has that comfortable feel. Seems has if over serving is not monitored as you will have several loud and obnoxious folks who aren't being controlled.   This was the second night in a row that I was ignored while sitting at the bar and watching the bar tender hang at the end of the bar with is buddies.   What was once a nice calm place to eat and enjoy some craft beers is now a place for the high volume drinking and the vocally high volume people.  Bring back Luigi's for the food and leave everything else.

reviews.author: Carly T.
reviews.description: This is my favorite place in Leander.  My husband and I started going every Friday and then our teenagers wanted to join us one night and they love it.  On Fridays everyone in the house is excited for LBM night.  The food is good, the atmosphere is fun, the TouchTunes are fun.  The service is great! We will be regulars for a longtime.

reviews.author: Gergana S.
reviews.description: Lovely French food with excellent cocktails. We went for a friend's birthday - enjoyed the atmosphere, the deliciousness, the service. It has one of the best escargot in town, in my opinion. Our waitress was lovely and very knowledgeable. Unfortunately, we were seated inside and the music and noise level kept increasing over the evening.  They do have free parking at a fairly large lot across the street.  It was pretty expensive so this is definitely not an every-week-type-of-place but would generally go back for other special occasions.

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: Not for me.   I appreciate that you can reserve outdoor tents for your party of 4-6 that have three sides fabric, one open to the common area. It looked like there was also a fan built in for the warmer months. I also appreciate that our reservation (which started at 6:15) let us stay at the table till 9:00 when the next reservation showed up. I feel like this is likely rare and due to the fact that we were a larger party drinking and eating a lot.   I didn't love the service - drinks took 30+ minutes to make it out to the table, yet over-attentive clearing staff kept trying to take the items that did arrive away long before they were finished. We also had to triple check on some dietary restrictions. From an accessibility standpoint the website and menu were nearly impossible to read.  If you don't have a reservation (or once it's over) you're welcome to hang out in the cabana area at the back, but it's 100% smoking, which was not great for some in our party.   It's worth noting 20% gratuity will be added to any party over six. With the prices as high as they are ($15 for a cup of soup), expect to drop $50+ easily eating here. Given the price vs quality of food, service, and prevalence of smoking I definitely won't be back. It was loved by many in my group, however, so I can understand why it has a strong following. Just not for me.  Also, if you're surprised that this place has over 1,100 reviews on Yelp yet remains unclaimed, here's a segment from their website that they wrote in response to a complaint: "We're not corporate, and don't need to sanitize and compromise our ideas to please the masses... We're not the Olive Garden. Our outlook is that by trying to please everyone, you end up truly exciting no one. We may alienate some people, but we make other people happy, and in the meantime, we honor our own principles and imagination." Sounds great in theory, but does mean you get the "go F yourself" feeling from some of the staff. If you love that, you'll probably love Justine's.

reviews.author: Chelsea M.
reviews.description: Hands down, this is one of my favorite restaurants in all of Austin. Amazing food and unparalleled ambiance. Highly recommend for a date night, special occasion or bringing friends from out of town.   Over the last few years we have rotated what we have ordered and have not been disappointed. Some staples are the oysters (seasonal), French onion soup, bolognaise and steak frites.

reviews.author: Nancy P.
reviews.description: Bon jour, pardner. . Parking a block away. Kind of a dirty sixth vibe. Music unnecessarily loud--and not French. But brasserie -ish Ratatouille solid. FO soup--same. The little mister ordered the steak frites and thought it was really good. He loved the fries. Cut us some slack--it's Monday and tbh not really feeling it. Moulin rouge it isn't. The little mister is babbling on about cowboy boots meeting fishnet stockings --have another bite, buddy. Get your own yelp account with so much to say. Well, give it a try it's def weird. Au revoir mes amis

reviews.author: Nicole P.
reviews.description: Had a good experience at Justine's. We walked in on a rainy evening and was quoted an hour wait. No problem, we grabbed drinks at the bar but waited maybe 10 minutes and were offered a table! We were seated at a cabana like tent outside. There was even a little chandelier, super super cute. Service was fine.   The food was good and they had all of the obvious French dishes one would expect. The escargot was quite delish, especially the buttery garlic sauce. The complimentary bread was disappointing. I think it was stale, tough crust, chewy. I would have recommended dipping the bread in the escargot sauce otherwise. The beef tartare was great, looked and tasted fresh. Thought it was a little weird fries were sides for most dishes.   Parking was a little bit of a pain. There is a parking lot but it was full and muddy and I was in heels so I had to be dropped off outside the restaurant. There is street parking but seems that area gets busy.

reviews.author: Jessie C.
reviews.description: Came to Justine's for a celebratory graduation dinner and had a great time! We made reservations for an outdoor table for 7, and it was the cutest little set up. It was a bit humid the evening we went, but they had fans blowing in our little tent-thing that helped. The decor (and all the PLANTS!) was gorgeous - I can see it being an amazing place for happy hour with the girls or a cute date night!   The food slapped. Notable dishes are the escargot - trust me and dip the complimentary bread in the leftover garlic butter. Just do it. We also loved the mussels, steak frites, and bolognese (AMAZING meat sauce). For drinks, their Paloma was very good.  My only critiques are 1) my ankles got eaten alive by mosquitos during dinner, which I can't blame on Justine. Just be aware if you're a mosquito magnet like me! 2) the service was kinda spotty and our server had an attitude when we asked for more bread (I feel like that's a pretty fair ask? We only asked for more bread one time.

reviews.author: Ana A.
reviews.description: I wouldn't consider this fine dining. Food is average.  Drinks, hostess, and servers were lower than average.  We sat outside and there were cockroaches.   I wouldn't come here again. It's more of 2.5/5  We ordered streak frites,  bolognaise, and French 75s. The best part were the fries that came with the steak.

reviews.author: Kim-Jamy N.
reviews.description: I've been wanting to try Justine's  for years. I've stopped by a few times around dinner-time only for there to be an hour-long wait and on top of that, they don't take rezzies for two :(   Last night, we decided to stop by on a whim. We came a little bit later than usual around 9pm.   I thought the ambiance and the service was the most amazing thing. Justine's is an Austin gem!   We came in, put our name on the list and grabbed wine from the bar. We sipped under the green pagoda and then was seated where we promptly got started with apps (escargot and French onion soup). The Escargot was buttery, garlicky and French onion soup was absolutely spectacular! Please, everyone, try their French onion soup!   I had the Marmont rose which I was obsessed with (it has almond notes).   Through the entire visit - I never felt rushed. I'm usually mindful that restaurants want to turn over tables so I was quite shocked and pleasantly surprised when our server took our apps order, let us finish, and then took our entree orders. It was a slow and mindful pace and in a society that's "go-go-go, " this was refreshing.   For our entree, we ended up getting the steak frites, moules frites, and bologonese. The moules frites was my favorite entree.   If we were sitting and talking, our server would just pass by and let us relax. I appreciated the small niceties here.   I AM ABSOLUTELY OBSESSED WITH JUSTINE'S!

reviews.author: Jay L.
reviews.description: Had a good time at Justine's. Alternative, vibey atmosphere and staff made for a fun and festive environment.   Scallop crudo was excellent! Well seasoned and with tasty caper, minced onion, high quality olive oil and a vinegary flavor I could not place.   Escargot was excellent buttery/garlicky as expected.    Butter spread missed the mark. Was supposed to have sea urchin but that flavor and color was undetectable. Trout roe was nice but an ocerall mediocre dish for $15.  Steak tartare with ratatouille was good but not in the top that i have had. The chop was a little large and found some hard fat chunks that weren't edible. Ratatouille was nice but the vegetable colors were washed out brown more than vibrant.  Steak frites was an issue starting out because the online menu lists it as $40 yet on the handout menu it is $48. Online menu should be updated and current! Steak was cooked properly and tasty but somewhat chewy. Fries were heavy pepper flavor, not enough salt for my taste and was hoping they'd be cooked well and extra crispy but were not.

reviews.author: Kelly K.
reviews.description: I come here probably once very month , the service  is good,  the food is great and the atmosphere is relaxing ..i try something new every time..and they deliver  everytime!

reviews.author: Jessica L.
reviews.description: I had the steak frites...I loved both steak sauces that I tried!! The dessert on the other hand was a bit off a let down (Profiterole)...I saw someone that order it and I was super excited to try it but then we didn't even finish it. Giving it 3 stars because it's not on my "can't wait to come back here list".

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: I have to say I was looking forward to dining at Justine's for years and was utterly disappointed this past weekend. So let's talk about what went right first. I will say the mussels were pretty good and the wine selection was solid if you like French wine. Now let's discuss everything that went wrong. It started with ordering drinks at the bar while we waited for our table to be ready. I give them my partners credit card for a round of drinks then come back with no card? I tell the bartender that she didn't give me the card back and claims that she did...Needless to say my partner had to cancel his card only to get a phone call after we left that the bar had the card all along! What kind of establishment can't keep track of patrons cards then blatantly lie about giving it back? This experience alone put a huge damper on the night but to make it worse my partner hated his burger and the charcuterie board was less than appetizing so much we had to ask to take it off our bill. The menu wasn't also very descriptive on some of the menu items which probably led to some of the bad selections but the worst part of it all was how hot the dining area was. I guess we were sitting under some type of tent but there was absolutely no air circulation which in Austin can make for an uncomfortable dining experience. I expected far better quality given how expensive everything was so with such disappointment I can't recommend ever coming back here.

reviews.author: Victoria Y.
reviews.description: We were excited to come to this spot after seeing it on a list of places to visit while in Austin and they just so happened to have reservations available tonight. We were seated promptly and ordered a bottle of wine recommended by our server which was great. We ordered quite a lot of dishes -- the escargots, grilled octopus, French onion soups, duck confit, steak tartare, and mussels. The food was very good and I especially enjoyed the escargots. However, the service was extremely slow and the food took a LONG time to arrive. After we had been served out appetizers and French onion soup, we waited almost 45 minutes for the entrees that didn't end up coming out, so we flagged down our server to ask if we could cancel as we were full and tired (it was almost 10pm and my friend was falling asleep at the table). Luckily, the manager came out and offered to box the food for us as well as gave us a discount on our bill. This is a cute little restaurant and the food was pretty good so I would definitely be inclined to give it a second chance the next time I'm back in Austin but I would probably have our server put in the whole order at the same time instead of waiting for intervals as we finished eating each course pretty fast and had to wait and wait for the next dishes to come out.

reviews.author: Sandra Y.
reviews.description: Enjoyed my experience here but didn't find it to be exemplary. Parking is super confusing if it's your first time but their lot is right next to the Central Machine Works parking lot directly across the street from Justine's.   I ordered the French 75 to drink and the octopus and escargot as appetizers. The cocktail was good but nothing special; very sweet and I was expecting bubbles considering the champagne but my drink was served in a martini glass rather than a champagne flute and not fizzy at all. The octopus was good but again, not spectacular. I wouldn't order it again. The escargot unfortunately smelled better than it tasted. They were good but what made them better was dipping the complimentary bread in the butter they sat in.   For dinner, I ordered the poisson béarnaise. The market fish was cod and the market price was $32. I thought this dish was pretty spectacular. Served with a delightful béarnaise sauce that was creamy, frothy, rich, and a little bit sweet, I couldn't get enough. I was straight up dunking everything on my plate (veggies, fish, everythingg) in the sauce. I even dipped some bread in it and it made anything chefs kiss amazing. The waitress even said the herbs in the sauce came straight from their garden! I thought the veggies that accompanied the fish were great and the cod was good as well. However, I found myself wishing it were a more sophisticated fish on the plate for the price point.  Overall, had a good time. I would consider visiting again but foregoing the apps/cocktails and heading straight for the entree.

reviews.author: Olivia P.
reviews.description: Great experience here. Moody vibe, well curated with so many different textures playing together cohesively. Service was fabulous, food and drink wonderful. We started with the cheeseboard moved on to the salmon crudo, beef tartar, and ratatouille- would recommend all of them. Great fir a date night or just an evening with friends.

reviews.author: Kristen S.
reviews.description: We love this place , we have been going once a month since they reopened , and have loved their safety rules...  We had quite a number of celebrations in June and July , which were incredible... we recently went back with a few friends this past week... I guess we have never gone during the week because we didn't recognize the hostess... her attitude almost ruined it, she snapped at my friend and said she was organizing the seating and made us feel like we were an inconvenience ... she seemed overwhelmed by the heat, grumpy... lucky the other younger hostess changed the energy , talked about her favorite mezcal cocktails and walked us to our table.

reviews.author: Darren C.
reviews.description: Surprised it took me so long to go to Justine's, I know that it's a favorite restaurant of two of my close friends who swear by it.  I went on a Thursday night and was promptly seated at one of the outdoor cabanas. It was quite nice, except there are always bugs flying around outdoors, perhaps netting would be a smart idea. I also added more privacy by closing more of the cabana curtains facing other guests.  Started off the night with with the house red wine to put myself in a pleasant mood. Very good for a house wine.  To start, had the saumon cru appetizer. Can't go wrong with this, delicious and recommended.  I personally ordered the Steak Frites and was unfortunately disappointed. The frites were over fried to the point it was too crunchy. I ordered medium rare for the steak but it cooked a bit longer than needed and I found it rough and tough.  What saved the night was the Moules Frites. The frites were still over fried but the mussels were absolutely delectable. The flavor of the broth is rich and goes well with the taste of the sea from the mussels. This will definitely be ordered again if I were to come back.

reviews.author: Thep T.
reviews.description: Don't need a reason to come here - great for any occasion. This time we came for a birthday and everything from service, ambience and food was on point.

reviews.author: Dakota L.
reviews.description: Austin's niche fine dining at its best! Absolutely recommend this restaurant.   The crème brûlée was DIVINE!

reviews.author: Teri K.
reviews.description: A classic.   Hands down my favorite restaurant in Austin. Perfect for that special occasion or late night drink and small bite.   The ambiance and décor are on point and the food and beverages are ALWAYS amazing.   Bravo Justine's and I'll see you again soon!

name: The Jackalope
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Joseph S.
reviews.description: When we arrived in Austin the Uber driver recommended this dive bar for their food. Can we say they did not disappoint! We did only order a burger and fries but they both were perfect.   Also the drinks tasted to perfection and matched the service. To cap it off the bill was amazing as well!

reviews.author: Sabrina M.
reviews.description: We came from San Antonio to try this place out due to great food reviews.  There are no servers that come to your table, if you want food you have to order at the bar. The staff wasn't very friendly at all and of course didn't have good customer service quality's.  The lighting inside was very dim and dark - more like a bar setting but the variety of appetizers was great. The D.J. was playing some good tunes and when our food came out - They had the best wings and Cheese Waffle fries. We had a couple of drinks and ordered a couple more appetizers but then we saw the WORST - A RAT ran above us on the beams and then my husband and cousin saw another RAT in front of him running along the opposite end!!!  And we all know if there is 1/2 rats their are more to follow. Obviously this is an issue that they are aware of. Needless to say we grabbed our stuff and left! I felt so disgusted and nauseous!!!  Coming out the restaurant we met a couple (locals) outside and they told us they have heard as well about infestation of rats. So if your looking for a good restaurant- Don't come here!!!

reviews.author: Andrew M.
reviews.description: The Jackalope in downtown Austin. It was a blast great drinks and it attracted great people. The food was even good, including the drinks. I would go back for sure, pretty cool atmosphere as well.  When I went I had done research and everything. There are other places to go to but, this was the best for a Sunday. I arrived just a bit before happy hour and enjoyed myself.  I had the Jackalope burger and it was plenary to eat. With the toppings I didn't even need anything else. I usually get honey mustard and mayo, I didn't need it but, I did put mayo on it. There were plenty of pickles and the burger meat was tasty.   I had a frozen margarita, the frozen was out after that and I switched to a hibiscus margarita. I know your thinking hibiscus flower, yea it was even pretty like the flower. I also had the huge Heldarado as well. Man let me tell you now have a few people would help you finish but it was good.   It was just great company we had fun there I met a couple cool people there and it was rememberable. It's kind of what we are looking for when we go out to eat or something. The server was good even when they switched out for shifts, the only thing I will get you don't want us they could use a few more extra service. Great experience I definitely go back.

reviews.author: Gabriel P.
reviews.description: A friend came from California to 6th street and this is one of the places that I took him to. The drinks and music were good, but it was really crowded. Other than that we had a great time. Don't forget to get a picture on the Jackalope!

reviews.author: John H.
reviews.description: This place was really unique.  Came here on a Sunday night. Sandwich was great.   Place had a fun vibe and seemed like everyone knew each other.  A cool stop to make in Austin.

reviews.author: Mike S.
reviews.description: Pretty cool place.  Drinks are weak, music is not really my type, but friendly service!

reviews.author: Britta M.
reviews.description: This bar is located on 6th street and is a solid stop to make on your bar crawl. The giant jackalope inside is very insta-friendly, they tell you to feel free to hop on and take a pic.   Our bartender was really friendly and funny, and served us right away. He gave us a few suggestions, and we ordered drinks and a round of shots. They were all good and mid-priced. The only downfall was they didn't shake the pineapple chaser, so it was lukewarm.   Overall, a solid and memorable bar experience!

reviews.author: Gillian W.
reviews.description: Come on who doesn't love this place? I love coming here when I'm downtown and to/from the airport, always love getting on the jackalope and taking a pic. The menu is limited now, but still good. I love the atmosphere and who you meet here. You never know, you might just find a life long friend. Staff is fun, personable and friendly. Always a regular stop for us when we can! Stop in if you haven't.

reviews.author: Ernest H.
reviews.description: Food was good when it came out correctly but had to send back what was put in the computer versus what I asked for.    Tonight October 30, 2021. I put a food order in for honey jalapeño wings, an order of waffle fries and a dos xx draft. Total came to 22 and was given order number 80 around 8:00 Pm. Order came out as a burger and side of fries which after checking your menu, should've only been 14$ plus what ever the beer was which I'm sure isn't 8$ for a draft beer in a plastic cup.   I informed the food runner it should've been wings and he showed me where the food was rung in as a burger instead, no harm no foul a simple misunderstanding or so I thought. The bartender who rang it in informed me I ordered a burger when I "shouted" my order at him and said I like that with fries. By my calculations, if I did intact order the burger with a side of fries it should've been 11.5 for burger plus 2.5 for fries. Not almost 16 I'm assuming plus 6$ for a dosxx.   I get it it's Halloween weekend. But if you can't fully hear the order then just make sure with customer before finalizing and putting order in and over charge them if in fact you thought I ordered a burger. But also don't give attitude when customer asks for the wings and believes the wings only come with 8 like you PDF menu states. Not from Austin but will not be back anytime soon. Unfortunately I paid in cash or I would ask for a refund for the difference because I'm entitled to that I believe. I understand customer isn't always right. But food costs can't be that high that you need to argue about the wrong button being pressed on your end.   And yes this is the exact same review I sent to the contact us for on the website, I'm sure nothing will change with how orders are put in on busy nights, but just make sure you get your itemized at this establishment so that you know before you walk away from bar.

reviews.author: Rich R.
reviews.description: Very cool bar with an excellent vibe.   Check it out if you are in Austin.  The bartender was great and made the experience even better.    There was an outdoor section in the back of the weather is nice.   I didn't try any food.

reviews.author: Ryan H.
reviews.description: The bartender Tay pulled us off the street to give us a gigantic cocktail!! Great Guy, Good Music and Good Vibes

reviews.author: Alex D.
reviews.description: If you must go to 6th Street in Austin, this is a must stop. Cheap shots, a giant jackalope statute and food that is actually good. Burgers are some of the best in a town with alot of good burgers.

reviews.author: Terry P.
reviews.description: Our bartender "Happy Hour" aka Justin, was the bomb. Just enough rough and sparky. Loved him. He also pour a really good cocktail.   Try the fried pickles. They are yummy and hit the spot.

reviews.author: Tamrynn H.
reviews.description: I used to love this place..the drinks are cheap and the food is good.  It was actually the first bar I went to when I turned 21.  However now, the bald bartender that is on the heavy side is a TOTAL DICK.  HE PRACTICALLY YELLED AT ME!  He seems to always be there too.  I gave a card tk hold and I was going to pay cash at the end...well, during shift change he said he doesn't do that and I need to pay each time.....umm, u have my card, idiot.  I still tipped him but he is an asshat.  I won't go back if he is working.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: Pretty good burger on Sixth St!   The place is a fun bar at night, with a big Jackalope Statue you can climb up onto. However, I also came earlier in the night to grab a bite. I had a bacon and Brie burger, but I substituted the patty for an impossible patty. There was plenty of cheese and lots of pickles on it.

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: This place was absolutely empty due to the cold weather but the atmosphere was modern and inviting. I loved the jackalope that i was able to climb and sit on the most . I would go back, but on a warmer night !

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: IF I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE ZERO STARS - I WOULD.   DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU ARE TRYING TO HAVE A GOOD TIME.   We came here during a BACHELORETTE.  I understand circumstances are weird due to COVID-19.  I get that. We ALL get that. We are in Austin visiting for our best friends bachelorette and on our second night here we decided to take the advice from our waiter at Caroline's and go to The Jackalope.  We went there at 9pm just to check it out and our bartender, Bart, gave us complimentary drinks. We were so thankful, we paid for the giant mixed drink and went next door for a few hours and then went back to The Jackalope because the bride requested it. We sat down for 20 minutes even ordered some drinks (which they never brought) and they were playing the jams -- so naturally we started dancing around our table.   Even the other bartender, Dimitrius, was hitting on one of our bridesmaids HEAVILY and hanging around with us while we were dancing - not even one whole song went by before Dimitrius told us we couldn't be dancing and that we needed to be in our seats. We said okay, that sucks but sure. So we sat down and made sure our butts where planted -- next thing you know some random came up to us and started twerking at our table then on jumped on the couch and started twerking and spreading her legs in the air. Again - SHE WAS NOT WITH US. None of us even knew who she was. Immediately, some angry bartender (that clearly needs to get laid) with a ponytail ran over to us being loud and demanding that WE get out meanwhile Twerker conveniently slinks on back to her table    I can understand if we were the ones doing THAT and you wanted to kick us out - FINE.  But that was not the case. No one wanted to even hear us out, one of our bridesmaids does not drink and she was very civil in trying to explain to Ponytail Bartender but he literally was non-stop raising his voice to us. He even yells at Bart to come over - and this fool just straight up decides to "go with his boys on this one" and preceded to gesture us to get out  Ponytail could not WAIT to kick us out, let me tell you. Like there's some underlying issues there  He yelled at us saying "You're not even ordering drinks! You're not even ordering food!!!" NOPE. Wrong again, Ponytail.   We DID order food and drinks but your stubborn hating ass didn't accommodate us  Meanwhile Twerker (aka THE PROBLEM) is still running rampant inside the bar   Also, the pink haired lady was GOD AWFUL. Not helpful whatsoever.  Bart you were the biggest disappointment, and Ponytail -- you just suck. Thank you for ending our night horribly and giving us a HORRIBLE first trip experience.   I do not recommend this place whatsoever for anyone who is looking to actually have a good time.

reviews.author: Max M.
reviews.description: Great bar, fun service and a good menu. Bartender was super cool and drinks were cheap. Highly recommend

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: Great food, good location, good portions. The only thing that was not great was the bar tender, not the friendliest person. But he didn't ruin the experience and the food

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: All I can say is don't judge a a book by its cover. I needed to run away from Houston just to get a different view so I came to Austin for the day. I wanted to get a drink and I was hesitant to order something to eat. This place looks old and it has a funny bathroom smell but aye so many good yelp reviews so why not. I got the wings and the fries and was super impressed. The mango jalapeño I think was really fresh and good and the fries where hot. I would go back and im sure once this Covid is over it would be a live bar as well.

name: The Wheel
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Victor H.
reviews.description: (from June 2021)  One dope ass bar!  The bartenders, ambiance, drink selection, and people make this place a blast.  They have multitude of whiskeys and beers to pick from.  Plus the outdoor seating and dog friendly atmosphere make this a chill spot for mingling with friends or soaking in the awesomeness of the state capital of Texas.  They also sell awesome shirts.  Sadly the Excite Bike shirt I saw the bartender rocking wasn't available so I settled for the blue shirt.  Please get more of those in!  The Wheel, keep on spinning!

reviews.author: Misha T.
reviews.description: Good bar. Lots of wheels. Indoor and outdoor seating with a solid beer selection. Staff is gruff but responsive. No complaints.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Finally got to try The Wheel after a long wait. Moved to the neighborhood almost a year ago and when I tried to come here, they hadn't reopened. Came today to have a celebratory vaccine cocktail. It looks like they used to have a $4 whisky of the day... well, it's now $5 but the winning bet is to make it as a cocktail for $8. An $8 old fashioned? Can't say I'm mad about that. Jenny behind the bar was super friendly and I gotta say it's nice to sit at an actual bar again.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Wonderful cocktails and beautifully presented! Love the intimate ambience of this place even with covid plexi-glass in place inside. Bar staff was very kind and very knowledgeable which is greatly appreciated. Outdoor and indoor seating options were great. Crowded on a Friday night which is a good sign!

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: Update: We left a cash tip for our $66 tab, and after the charge cleared, we just found out they charged us a $15 tip on top of the cash we left. We have spent a month fighting it with the credit card company. It's disappointing because the staff there was great. And the drinks were fantastic, but this kind of behavior is pathetic and makes us question returning.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Great spot! Super awesome bartenders, very chill vibes. Go have dinner across the street at Sour Duck and then come here for a cocktail :)

reviews.author: Emily J.
reviews.description: Love the dark and divey vibe! Super cool! We live a couple blocks away and I am kicking myself in the ass for never coming here before! Def kinda bar

reviews.author: Melissa H.
reviews.description: I got stood up on a date here but Jenny and the other bar staff turned it into such a fun night! They made me the most delicious Daiquiri and had me laughing almost to the point of tears. My new favorite spot!! Awesome staff, delicious drinks, and guaranteed to cheer you up if you're having a bad night! 10/10!

reviews.author: Winston M.
reviews.description: Big shoutout to the staff at The Wheel for creating a welcoming and responsible environment! They're following all the safety protocols while still offering a relaxed and warm outdoor bar experience. Thank you!!!  Came here yesterday with my housemates to enjoy their cocktails with some ADP. The Layla and Ashley are perfect pairings with the warm weather and ADP's tortas.

reviews.author: Aarti P.
reviews.description: Been here a few times, sat outside, sat inside!! It's just one of those solid kind of places that you know you are guaranteed a satisfying drink served up by a friendly and knowledgeable team surrounded by others who like me just want a nice chill environment to sip on their libations.

reviews.author: Nicholas B.
reviews.description: I really want to like this bar. It's cute, has a nice variety of seating... inside and outside and kinda-dense-in-a-good-way. The bartenders are cool folks with lots of great knowledge. The music isn't too loud - a good volume for talking but still bumping :-)  Unfortunately though... its quite expensive, and the staff isn't super transparent about the pricing. For instance, the whiskey of the day is supposed to be $5. I got it with ice, and was charged an extra dollar. This might be trivial, but it sucks getting charged without warning, especially for something that shouldn't get an upcharge (even if the on-the-rocks pour is slightly more liquid)... kinda like getting charged for napkins. And in general, everything's pretty pricey for a neighborhood bar.  I guess I'm a little too old school for all the new hotness in Austin. But I don't see any reason to visit The Wheel when you have so many other places that are both inexpensive and cool.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Parking can be troublessome, and space is limited, but easy to have a good time here.  More of a hangout spot than a sports bar.  No TV, limited beer selection that runs out quickly (both IPA kegs tapped out on a random Tuesday night), and no food.  You come here to let the night get away from you and order some strong cocktails.  Lots of outdoor space is cool and bring your own food is actually a plus in my book.  Beer selection 8 on draft, but good prices at $7/ish per big pour.  Everyone is nice and vibe seems 20s-30s clientele. I liked the Wheel for what it is, a good starting point nearby my apartment to begin a drinking night.

reviews.author: Tristan B.
reviews.description: In a town exploding in size and popularity, The Wheel retains a strong neighborhood feel. The bartenders are extremely friendly and seemed genuinely interested in conversation beyond just your tip.   They definitely specialize in cocktails so I would probably look elsewhere if you are looking for a nice draft or bottle of Shiner. I had 2 different specialty cocktails, both of which were good but definitely on the pricier side ($10-$15 each).   They have a large patio space for meeting up with friends and the indoor bar is intimate enough to make it a decent  first date spot worth checking out.

reviews.author: Jeff C. J.
reviews.description: Cool vibe, friendly staff, loud music. Great cocktails! Expertly made with detail, unique bitters, and perfectly balanced.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: They redid their patio and it is spectacular! Covered? Check. Heat lamps? Check. Amazing way to spend any giving evening in ATX? Check!  Ok, so this place is just super adorbs in a very approachable, contempo-rustic, "shhhh, don't tell anyone or else the ubiquitous "they" will ruin it for the rest of us" kinda way.   The barkeeps know their stuffs, their cocktails are legend (wait for it) dary without the arrogance or pretension you might expect from a place of this caliber; I think the lack of self-importance this place and the staff exude is one of my favorite things about it!  If you are looking for a low-key place to drink handcrafted, amazing cocktails (the Madison, I'm just saying) in front of a draught-tap water fountain amidst a menagerie of interesting EastSide Austin folk, then come here and enjoy (you can even have ADP delivered!). Just please remember...mum's the word, the password changes daily, and if fratty bros or hipsters catch wind of this place...I will look for you, I will find you, and I will give you the spiciest side-eye of your life!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Sometimes I need .... A little bit of Madison in my life, a little bit of Molly by my side A little bit of Layla is all I need, a little bit of Ashley is what I see A little bit of Lyllian in the sun, a little bit of Avery all night long  Lou Bega anyone? This place is definitely cool for sure! I love the cocktails and all the ladies names, very cute!  My friend introduced me to this new spot.  It is located off Martin Luther King right next to the Austin daily Press.  The inside bar are is small and quaint.  I love the side patio and this is where I spent a beautiful evening sipping on some cocktails and enjoying a sandwich which was delivered from next door.  I had the Molly and the Layla cocktails and both were excellent, refreshing and went down nice and smooth.  The patio has a gorgeous fountain with tons of beer taps spouting out water ... it was cool and creative feature to the atmosphere.    The bartenders here are super nice and professional!  If you are in the area I would absolutely recommend stopping in here for a Molly or Madison in your life!

reviews.author: Oscar N.
reviews.description: A local gem, with awesome bartenders and affordable drink prices. A highlight is their whiskey of the day 4 dollar wells and 7 dollar cocktails. Great indoor and outdoor season and a great place for a date or meet up.

reviews.author: Kim Z.
reviews.description: I was in Austin for a conference and stumbled on this bar thanks to Yelp. I truly enjoyed every minute of the experience, and my tasty Old Fashioned which was a perfect choice to compliment the atmosphere. The bar tenders are super friendly and the place is eclectic, dark and decorated in a vintage style. They also have the best t-shirts I have ever seen at a bar. I was bummed that the Excite Bike 80s Nintendo themed shirt was sold out in my size because I'd be rocking that all the time. Good vibes, great ambience and a great spot to hang after a long day.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: The Wheel was really well decorated, which set the evening off to a good start. The indoor area is intimate, dimly lit, and has a sort of prohibition-era bar feel with its tin ceiling, newspaper clipping wallpaper, and red lighting. Outside, you'll find a large patio with lots tables, and a great fountain made from beer taps. The drinks... well, my beer was way too expensive for what it was (a fairly generic IPA), and their selection for beers was limited (on draft: 8 taps, 1 IPA). HOWEVER, I know that's mainly due to the fact that The Wheel's specialty is whiskey. If whiskey's your drink of choice, I'm sure you'll love it here. They have $4 daily specials, and a number of specialty cocktails.  I'm glad I gave it a shot, and I'll definitely recommend it to my whiskey drinking friends, but if you're looking for anything besides whiskey (or maybe a nice cocktail) I'd steer you elsewhere.

reviews.author: Jon B.
reviews.description: Went in on a weekday, atmosphere is always dead/quiet. I ordered a few rounds and was surprised to see something in my drink. I think the taps need to be cleaned... on top of that the bartender automatically added the tip to my bill. Oh well, I wont be coming back.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Techo Mezcaleria and Agave Bar is a great speakeasy on Manor Rd. If you are a fan of mezcal and/or tequila, this is the place for you. Small bar with a patio too (with a heater). Ian is a great bartender and took care of us. You should definitely try the "stuff in a cup" (Ian's favorite mezcal cocktail with passion fruit). The spicy mango mezcal margarita was also enjoyable or you can sip one too. Great spot to to ring in the new year.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Really cool concept, with mediocre drinks. It was a nice spot that transported one to a LatAm local bar. But the drinks are disappointing. It's a really small space so getting a seat is a coin toss.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: This place is very confusing on how to actually fine. I thought it was connected to meet Madrid. But it is not. Actually go next-door and then to their backyard and then go up and you are at the spot. It's very small it's almost gives you a speakeasy feel. The bartenders were super cool and we really enjoyed our time there. It was a group of seven of us and we took up most of the bar. Drinks are very good as well. If you're not a tequila fan this is not for you but you should still try to experience it at least once. They have frozen on the rocks and other delicious cocktails.

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE! I have been driving by Techo everyday for years, and we frequent the area for the other restaurants and bars, but for some dumb reason beyond comprehension, we never gave them a try. We are completely hooked now! The space is cozy, intimate, and inviting. The drinks are just out of this world, and SO strong! The flavors are unique, and even if you aren't a mezcal fan, some of the drinks completely cover up what's even in it!
