They had a cool nook tucked away next to the bar that we are hoping to sit in once things open back some more, and we would love to hang out inside and enjoy their cool vibe inside! The patio is tucked away upstairs, and even though it's in a busy area right along the street, you don't even notice! They have TONS of misting fans outside that made the 102 degree heat totally tolerable for once!   They had dog bowls out, so I would venture to say they are dog friendly, which we plan to take advantage of very soon!

reviews.author: Alexandra W.
reviews.description: Ambiance is everything here. In an unassuming spot, If like you like mezcal or tequila you won't be disappointed. As an FYI you have to go through school house pub to find this spot

reviews.author: Lindsey L.
reviews.description: This has to be one of the cutest mezcal bars I've been to. The vibe is very cozy and intimate, tucked away above Mi Madre. We sat in this little nook that had seating for four, it felt very private from the rest of the bar, we enjoyed it! I had their mezcal margarita and the flavor was so good, I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: Hands down one of the cutest Mezcal bars I've been to. It's not very big, as most mezcal bars seem to be, but such a nice space. Cool little nook that seats about four. Great mezcal recommendations and the cocktails were delish. I highly recommend the Crudo, Ta Cabron, and Tepache.

reviews.author: Keristen B.
reviews.description: I hesitate to write this review because I love that Techo currently feels like a secret, locals only Mezcal bar. But they have my favorite margarita in town, incredible ambiance and authentic tasting experiences - that you just have to KNOW about it. This is the first bar I bring visitors too - usually right when they open, so we can snag seats at the bar and get guided Mezcal tastings from Techo's very knowledgeable and easygoing staff. I never leave without ordering at least one of their Frozen Guava Agave Margaritas with the chili salt rim (do NOT pass on the home-made chili salt, it is the perfect pair for this sweet/tart drink).  Every one of my girlfriends love that drink! My boyfriend also loves that he can get a strong mezcal centered cocktail from their list (which has 10-12 house cocktails that are great). Their Micheladas are also a crowd fave.   When you start to get hungry - walk to Salty Sow for happy hour apps or down to Patrizi's to share some crazy good home-made Italian food from a food truck! You'll have a line at Patrizi's - but it's a great option for your visiting friends, who have probably never had an Italian food truck experience.

reviews.author: Brandon R.
reviews.description: This place is a fantastic hideout. Kind of small but fits the rustic atmosphere.   Bar tenders were very knowledgeable and attentive. Tried my first mezcal margarita there and have a new favorite cocktail (normally prefer an old fashioned).   Fried crickets are a nice add on as well.   Will definitely go back. A date might be more impressed by this than another random brewery!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Love this place. Perfect date spot. Awesome service, amazing drinks. Very romantic feel, kind of secret and hidden, off the beaten path. Don't even want to post this review because I'm afraid more people will start crowding...

reviews.author: Jacob R.
reviews.description: Awesome mezcal bar, have to go up the stairs. Recommend the Mezcals in the green bottles!

reviews.author: Trish C.
reviews.description: Selfishly I hate to say everything I love about this place because one of the character points is how small and intimate is. But I think the words out because it is really rocking Friday and Saturday night! What I love most... amazing bartenders and mixologist... They enjoy making something to please you if they don't have a line 5 people back. I can go on and on but let's just say if you like Mezcal and tequila this place will not disappoint!

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: Techo Mezcaleria reminds me of why I still love Austin: the unusual, hidden gems that are tucked away all around the city.  Most other folks already hit the highlights. It's tiny, seats maybe 10, and you enter through the Schoolhouse Pub gate, despite Techo actually being on the second story of Mi Madres. Word of caution: Mezcal ranges from "lightly smoky" to "I'm drinking liquid smoke." Personally it's not something I can have a lot of, we had three sample sized shots and that was plenty between the two of us. Just be forewarned.   Our bartender Ian was awesome, we had a nice, rambling forty minute conversation about mezcal versus tequila versus whisky. Unfortunately, we went on a Saturday when there wasn't a happy hour, so we didn't get a chance to sample the margaritas, but that gives us a great excuse to go back.

reviews.author: Kevin L.
reviews.description: My first time here tonight and it's the day of the dead celebration. Just found my new favorite bar. I'm having a special drink they have only for tonight with mezcal and a touch of absinthe. I'll be back.

reviews.author: Abby M.
reviews.description: Mixed feelings, liked the drinks, liked the overall vibe, but will forever be remembered as that place where a guy in front of us in line told my friend and I we should have a man order drinks for us and continue on in a bizarre manner. I feel everyone gave him the "just a dumb drunk pass" but the more I think about it the more I think if he was drunk like that maybe he shouldn't have been served anymore or asked to leave. Also this was around 6-8pm not your average time for people to be so belligerent. Drink pictured is the violeta.

reviews.author: Javier R.
reviews.description: Great place if you love mezcal. Micheladas are also very good! Definitely try their crickets.  Bartenders are very knowledgeable and cool!

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: Awesome selection of tequila and mezcal at this little cute bar found upstairs. Extremely crowded in the evening around 6P, probably due to their happy hour. Enjoyed our drinks though except for the overly sweet frozen margaritas.

reviews.author: Pri J.
reviews.description: Nice decor. Horrible service. Make sure you are clear and repeat the order to the bartender or they will make their own interpretation of the drink, refuse to admit that they didn't hear you correctly, and charge you for both the wrong drink and the drink you originally ordered. So disappointed.

reviews.author: Meredith E.
reviews.description: This is an Austin gem and hole-in-the-wall place if you're looking for a unique, romantic spot. They have a good sized drink menu and also offer frozen drinks, which is always a fun addition.   They have a fantastic selection of Mezcal and Tequila and it's a fantastic spot for a date because they have a few nooks inside great for a few to sit. The ambience is also very romantic-very dim inside with lots and lots of candles everywhere. The place itself is upstairs of SchoolHouse (there are stairs outside to the right of the restaurant). It is pretty small, only seating maybe 20 inside and about the same outside.   However, worst case scenario if you arrive and they're packed you can head downstairs to SchoolHouse for a drink!  This is a must visit and will impress others when you introduce them to a what-feels-like hidden gem.

reviews.author: Alison L.
reviews.description: Nice spot if you're a fan of mezcal, decent spot if you're not.   I enjoyed my La Violeta cocktail as much as I could and the outdoor seating was nice, especially with that couple making out next to us. The inside is dark and mysterious, I really liked all the Jesus candles.  PS - don't be deceived by the bathroom, the door is tiny but the bathroom behind it is pleasantly large.

name: Pete's Dueling Piano Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: Our go to bar on 6th Street!! Excellent talents and performance all the time.   Everytime our friends came to visit Austin, we bring them here and they always have a good time!

reviews.author: Spencer W.
reviews.description: Super fun place to listen to live music.  The performers are entertaining and hilarious

reviews.author: Frank J.
reviews.description: This was an A+ experience! Having played piano before, I have pretty high expectations for performances. These two performers were so fun and I was very impressed by the wide array of songs they could play, sing, and jive to at the drop of a hat. They interacted with the audience extremely well too, constantly making jokes and keeping the crowd engaged. The engagement with the crowd is very positive as well. I'd highly recommend checking this place out! You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Kim D.
reviews.description: This was honestly a cool bar experience, as I've never been to anything like it. The cover fee was $12 (or $3 if you check in on Yelp) and when you enter, you see the two piano guys going head to head having a great time. There were a lot of other people celebrating birthdays and bachelorette parties there and the ambience was very fun and upbeat. I'll admit, some of the songs were a little to country for us, but we had a fun time sipping on our giant cocktail and watching from the floor above!

reviews.author: Patty R.
reviews.description: We had so much fun at Pete's. All entertainers were very talented. It was continuous entertainment. I am so glad we went. Our server was also spectacular. She was the only server for the entire bar. We were there the night of December 7 of this year. I highly recommend going to Pete's for some fun entertainment with talented musicians.

reviews.author: Jona H.
reviews.description: We came to town and we're looking for somewhere fun for a girls night out. This place seemed perfect. Music Started at 9 we got there early and got several tables. The musicians were amazing !!! They can play anything you request. We danced and sang all night. Beverage service was also fantastic they were on top of it keeping all glasses cleared and refilling when necessary . Perfect spot for a group!

reviews.author: Annabelle L.
reviews.description: Wow, came here on a Sunday night and I highly recommend this place to everyone. It wasn't super busy, but the crowd was large enough for the musicians to engage with. The musicians were absolutely INCREDIBLE. We stayed for several hours and they played song after song seamlessly on piano, drums, harmonica, trumpet. We did request "Complicated" by Avril Lavigne, which did stump them. While one musician did some on-the-spot research, the other one played us a medley of similar songs (Skater boi, Michelle Branch) to keep us entertained. Wish we had one of these in Baltimore, can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Lisa H.
reviews.description: So much fun! There was 4 of us. We got there at 8:00 stayed till 12:00am  We drank all night, bill was 240.00. I don't think it was too bad considering we really drank. It was hilarious! Entertaining! Joyful  Uber dropped us off in front!  Next time, I will stay to about 10-10:30pm. Then walk to Velvet Taco and have a late night bite.   6th street was a little rough. Did not feel safe. But thank Austin police dept. They were there in heavy presence. It helped.  If think how much a Broadway show is you are doing good!  A must if you are visiting Austin

reviews.author: Carol S.
reviews.description: Non-stop music and fun. The musicians are very talented and entertaining. Prices are reasonable. Definitely will come back!

reviews.author: Aaron V.
reviews.description: Please please please got to this place!!!!! The atmosphere is amazing! Oh and the service 10 out of 10 wish I could give more stars just for the service!!!! Xavier the door guy omg he melted my heart with his hospitality! Our waitress was also so sweet! Can't with to go back! I hope managers are reading this and know they have some gems in their mist!!!!

reviews.author: Steele E.
reviews.description: This was a fun, upbeat place! Drinks were good and staff was friendly.  This is one of the best places I have found in Austin.

reviews.author: Peg S.
reviews.description: The most fun I had in Austin.    Just like it says, two pianos and two piano players (and sometimes additional musicians) taking song requests for $ that they'll try to play to the best of their ability while also entertaining the audience.  Beware that if they hear you are celebrating something you might be called up to perform.  The fun and liveliness of the crowd and music are infectious.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I had a great time here while visiting Austin. Took advantage of the Yelp check in offer. The musicians here are talented, the atmosphere is fun, and the drinks are cheap. Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: McKenzie S.
reviews.description: First. USE THE YELP DEAL FOR DISCOUNT ON THE COVER!  Dueling pianos are a must for anyone who has never tried the experience. It's definitely something you need to do in a group.   Make sure to remember a few key items before you head out here. First, don't forget the cash! Request are taken by writing down your song title and artist on a piece of provided piece of paper. But no request is complete without some cash along with it. You'll be hard pressed to get your song played without it. But $$ doesn't always guarantee your request, as what happened with our group when we requested some seemingly common tunes - Streets of Bakersfield was out top request. In fact we requested a few times with several dollars. But nothing.   The vibe here was fantastic. Most everyone participated and it was just an overall great time.   As the night progressed the crowds grew and it became super crowded. So much that I started to get a little claustrophobic and anxious that I needed some air.   I will say that most of the tunes were similar. And we heard Journey probably 4 times in 2 hours. I wouldn't expect the musicians to repeat, but whatever!   Come here for an hour or two and call it good. Anything more and you'll get repeat performances.

reviews.author: Aaron D.
reviews.description: Great vibe! Lots of fun singing. However, I counted 8 bachelorette parties. A bit saturated with screaming girls stealing the show.

reviews.author: Raquel F.
reviews.description: I planned to go here for my bachelorette party. When we told them it was bachelorette party, they let me in without paying the admission fee of $12. My gals checked into Yelp and only paid $3 for admission. Thanks, Yelp! I'm a huge fan of dueling piano bars and this was definitely one of favorites. The piano players are definitely talented and can play a wide range of songs. The crowd interactions were fun and I just sung my heart away for an hour or so. It gets really crowded so it can get a little cozy with your neighbor, if you can find a table. Despite all of this, I would still go again. I did request a song but the piano players didn't know how to play it so that was a little disappointing.   The next time in Austin, I'll definitely want to pay Pete's another visit!

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: This was awesome and tons of fun! The musicians were crazy talented. The venue was great. Cover charge very reasonable and worth every cent. Had such a great time, highly recommend!

reviews.author: Chelsea J.
reviews.description: LOVED this place!! The pianists were so fun and really got the crowd going. It was packed on a Friday night and there was a $12 cover per person. The drinks weren't the best but this place is a must if you need some late night fun!

reviews.author: Maria L.
reviews.description: We had the best Saturday night out when we were in Austin's 6th Street. After visiting a couple of bars, we entered Pete's Dueling Piano Bar and stayed there until they closed at 2am because we tremendously enjoyed the talent of the pianists.  They are outstanding! Some of the pianists played the drums as well!! We used the yelp check-in to save on the entrance fee. They serve alcohol only. I didn't see any table with food. We ordered our drinks from the bar coz we didnt see a lot of servers. We will be back when we go to Austin again!

reviews.author: Emma Y.
reviews.description: First time visiting a Dueling Piano Bar and I was amazed even though there were things that could have been better.   The performers are very talented. They could play multiple instruments and sing all kinds of songs.   There was a $3 cover fee on a Tuesday night. We stayed from 9-12pm and there were probably around 10 people in total. Getting charged to enter into a pretty empty bar was a bit bazaar not to mention that we also needed to tip to get our songs picked by them.   I asked for Taylor Swift's Forever and Always. At first, the guy performer asked me if I wanted to wait until the lady performer comes out since he didn't know how to sing that. Then once the lady performer came out, she sorta ignored (or due to some miscommunication) the song, and we had to tip her again for her to see the song and sing it. It turned out that she didn't know how to sing it either. It was understandable that they couldn't know every single songs out there. I would appreciate more if they communicated better about this so that it could avoid us tipping the second time.  The drinks selection was sorta limited.   I can see this place being very lively on weekends as other people described. But I would not come back on a weekday. Definitely want to come back on a weekend again.

reviews.author: Chris K.
reviews.description: This place is a gem right in downtown Dripping Springs. Great beer, nice atmosphere, friendly staff.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Craft brewing at its finest!  This brewery also has a lot of English style beers.  Since it was close to closing we decided to split a flight.  You can pick any four beers for $10.  They are brewing 12 beers on a 3.5 barrel system here so they are busy bees!  Their Karnstein was the best amber lager I've tasted.  Sooo good!  We got these in the flight #8 Barghest English porter, #9 Kobold black lager, #6 Karnstein amber lager, #11 Hans Trapp Bourbon Barrel Imperial Stout (yum).  They also have pizza you can order but we were full.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Acopon was still relatively new when we went a few weeks ago.  It's a great space if you're in Dripping and want a microbrewery to stop through. They're dog-friendly (with treats) and have both indoor/outdoor seating. They also had TV that was playing soccer, and strong wifi. I love that they have flight options 4 for $10, as well as pints. It wasn't busy when we stopped through on a Saturday afternoon. They don't have food here, but if you ask the taptender...he'll tell you what food options are nearby.  Service was kind and efficient. Their beers were across the board--good. My favorite was their Aine Hefe! It was floral and super crisp for the warm weather after a long hike. They seem to do a lot of English style ales, which aren't my favorite...but you can definitely find options that suit your taste buds. They also give free stickers upon request. BOOM!

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: This place has the coolest logo I have ever seen in regards to the various breweries I've been to. They have a really good beer menu and the prices are more than fair! I was actually surprised to see them so decently priced this far out in the hill country.   They do provide half pours in their standard sized glasses, just make sure to ask for a half pour when you order. I was happy to see they allow food from the outside as well which makes staying easier as you can bring your snacks in haha.  Not on overly crazy amount of seating, but definitely enough for 5-6 medium/large parties. They also seemed to follow the trend of allowing owners to bring their dogs inside which is always cool and fun to see.  They also have merchandise for sale and their shirts are super sick...did I mention their logo absolutely rocks!?

reviews.author: Dolly S.
reviews.description: Good beer selection.   Very knowledgeable staff.  Best part I watched them clean ALL surfaces while I was there

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: Really cute place, enjoyed their beers (try the Rye one) and their fun flavors of Walker's British crisps.  They had board games and it was kid friendly.  If you are in the Dripping area and enjoy beer, this place is well worth a stop.  Cool names for their beers and explanations behind the names' meanings.

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: Great brewery in Dripping Springs. The staff is awesome. The choices of beer is amazing. The brewery seems to have a beer choice for everyone. Very people and dog friendly.

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: Acopon's interior is moody, with a strong occult vibe, and I absolutely love it! I bet they would throw a wild Halloween party. The staff is friendly, prices reasonable, though quite a few of their brews tend towards English styles.   On our visit, I had the Norwegian Juice, Bellibone and the Killiecrankie. Careful with that last one, it's delicious, but at 11.4% ABC, more than one can sneak up on you pretty quickly.   Acopon just had a really great vibe, and the fact that it's dog friendly is icing on the cake.

reviews.author: William L.
reviews.description: Nice small spot. Good variety of beer and friendly staff. There isn't much else of a way for me to describe this place.

reviews.author: Jens B.
reviews.description: A nice little find.  My bud who is a massive craft beer dude drove us here on the way back from a visit to William Chris Vineyards.  Located in Dripping Springs and in a small space felt right.  On the day we visited they had 4-5 beers on tap I believe.  I'm a larger guy, so a Bellibone was ordered up for me.  Suz got an English Bitter Gaspipes.  I enjoyed my larger, it was crisp and cool. This is a great nod to Emil Christian Hansen and the use of his Saccharomyces Pastorianus, which he first isolated in 1904.  A year before the greatest footy team in the world, Chelsea FC was started.  And he was also a Dane.  Suzie drank her Bitter and coo'ed.  We would of stayed longer, but staring a gigantic Manchester City flag was making me ill.  Just Kidding Dudes, I'm still ill after that 6 goal slacking you gave us this past February.  Drop in, grab a pint.  Bring the pup and stay awhile.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Mad props to Acopon for allowing my dog to chill inside with me this afternoon! Many places are dog friendly as long as it's on the patio. I walked in thinking the same but was quite surprised to be able to chill inside with my fur-bro. Made for a much better time in this "hotter than average" June we're having this year. I've been here a few times now, have never had a bad time here, and after my experience today I will continue to stop by when in Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Cindy L.
reviews.description: Very friendly staff enjoyed the beer and conversation of the background of the brewery.

reviews.author: Christian K.
reviews.description: Huge cheers! This was my first visit here and I was really blown away by the selection.  The Homunculus is a mild english ale that is so light but dense with flavor it could be dubbed king of session drinking. The Rowan was complex and well balanced, dank and rich while the Rat King DIPA may well  be the best one I have had in a very long time, where the malts are less weighty or chocolate but more supportive. Well done! Forget any reviews that call out IPA snobs, Stout heads or wherever you are from, there is something for every beer lover here.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Excellent. Seven brews. Wine and cider. Friendly owner. Quiet and extremely pleasant.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: The owners of the Barber shop wanted to start brewing something different.  They wanted to focus on creating English ales fresh from the cask. Their goal is to have at least one ale available from a fresh cask each week.  Are English ales their sole focus?  Definitely not! There are a variety quality brew styles.  You will find them here.  Their specialty though will be ales.  Acopon is just a stones throw down the street from the Barber shop in downtown historic Dripping Springs. On the Sunday afternoon I ventured here, this was a quiet and sleepy part of town. The tasting room and production are located in the same small historic building. The tasting room is comfortable, and inviting.  It feels lived in, like a proper English drinking hole should.  A nice change from the hipster modern sleek brewery tasting rooms popping up all over Austin.  The staff member behind the bar was knowledgeable and friendly.  They also have canned mead, cider, and wine options for non beer drinkers.  Outside food is welcomed.  They have some tables available outside to sit at, and are dog friendly.  I enjoyed one of their flights.  All of the beers in my flight were well structured.  I liked some better than others.  The Rowan was a stand out for me.  Good solid beers.

reviews.author: Nowlan T S.
reviews.description: Great brewery in dripping springs. Beer is great and they are super dog (and people) friendly. They always have something different but they do it right. Quality beer and great that I get to enjoy it with my pup inside.

reviews.author: Ajax S.
reviews.description: A short review: The beer was pretty good - but served in plastic cups (unforgivable) - the service was kind of slow. Good prices.  A longer review: We were there during the Songwriters' Festival so this may explain the plastic cups, even so, if you care about your beer you can't serve it in a plastic cup. It defeats the whole purpose. But, looking beyond that, the few beers we tried were good. I particularly liked the porter.  The service was slow with three people behind the bar but it seemed that only one person was really doing the work. (There was a younger lady behind the bar but as far as I could see all she did was stand there and scowl at people.) So, a mixed experience. We'll probably try it again (I suspect the beer really is good) when there isn't a festival going on, and hopefully have a drink in a real glass.

reviews.author: John R.
reviews.description: Owned by the same folks who run The Barbershop a couple of doors down. These folks specialize in British type beers, which I like, but also brew one of the best New England style IPAs I've ever had...but they don't bill it as such. Roomy enough, down home local feel. Always stop here when we're in Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: Nice addition to downtown Dripping Springs.  Nicely decorated, good seating inside - and we appreciated having the UT Longhorn game on TV! They had a wonderful live duo-band outside, but so wished there were more seating to enjoy it.  My ONLY constructive feedback for the owners is to offer (more) simple snack options - and, most importantly, provide LEMONS!  I just love craft beer with lemons. They had zero, so I'll chalk it up to new beginnings!  Worth a stop to have a unique cold one!  (Next time, I'll bring my own Lemons - it helps amplify my enjoyment of the bitter beer and ale flavors!)

reviews.author: Mike F.
reviews.description: Went here this past weekend and may I just say WOW!!!   The place is Fantastic.  I instantly felt a kinship with the folks at and behind the bar.  The beer was to put it mildly scrumptious.  The Rat King Double IPA was one of the very best I have ever had the pleasure of drinking.  Beautifuly balanced, malty, and hoppy at the same time, perfect nose.  Just awesome all around.  The Hans Trapp Imperial Stout was a malt bomb of the first order.  Great Beers, Great People, Great Location.  Great Brewery.  Must Go to if you're in Central Texas ...

name: Hideout Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Trinity T.
reviews.description: The hideout is my favorite place to get a cheap drink and good food. The burgers are bomb

reviews.author: Jen S.
reviews.description: The best neighborhood dive bar around, hands down. The bartenders are all friendly and personable and the food and drinks always hit the spot.

reviews.author: Joshua T.
reviews.description: Great pull off when coming through or stayin a wee bit.  Wednesday night 10:15 seems chill indoor and out. Barsky pours a decent JamoGing. Bet this place is hopping in the summer. Needs cornhole.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: I love that I can come here with a large group and have no problem outside taking over multiple tables.  I have no complaints about prices or service.  This is a good neighborhood bar, and those things will ebb and flow.  Nothing has happened to make me decide to go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Trey D.
reviews.description: Used to be good, which is a shame since I used to love coming here over the past few years. It seems to have gone downhill a bit it seems. First noticed the harsh increase in wing prices (before the shortage) a couple years ago. I understand prices increase, inflation blah blah.   But they used to advertise it as wing Wednesday, and they were cheaper that day. And it was fun. Now, the overpriced wings come out with very little sauce, and the sauce tastes/looks different than what it used to?(referring to blazing sauce, my fav.) Meh, guess the crowd is changing.

reviews.author: Jacob M.
reviews.description: When you're here, you're home. Love this place. Cheap drinks and greatest staff in Austin.

reviews.author: Julius A C.
reviews.description: If I could leave zero I would.. , overpriced, if you're looking for a rip off go somewhere fun at least

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: I finally got a chance to checkout Cat's infamous hideout, and it did not disappoint. It's the typical neighborhood dive bar that I expected it to be, but that's not a bad thing.  Some of the best things happen in a place like this!  TRUST me, it's nothing but fun, fun, fun, with a capital F-U-N!  It's a good place to do some day drinking, or hang out until the wee hours of the morn'.  As Tina R said in her review, lots of interesting characters lurk in this place.  Including "that" guy who likes to butt into your conversation, and then carry the conversation and not give anyone else a chance to talk.  But I won't dock 'em a star for that.  Every neighborhood bar has "that" guy in it.  It's a package deal.  Inside is kind of dark and it takes a minute for your eyeballs to adjust if you enter during the daytime. But after a few minutes, all is well and you'll soon be jamming out to the old school jukebox. You won't find any Touch Tunes here folks - yes, it still uses CDs (who would have imagined CDs would ever be considered old school?).  Here's the most important part of this review before I blather on with all of the interesting factoids:  If you learn nothing else this year, learn this my young Padawans: Many people say it's hard to find, so here's a tip - if you cross the railroad tracks on the access/frontage road, you have just passed it.  Turn right on the last street that you see right BEFORE you get to the tracks, and then take another right turn into the parking lot.  DON'T cross the railroad tracks!  There's a decent outdoor patio with plenty of picnic tables, and a few of them are shaded.  10 dollar minimum for using a credit card (pet peeve of mine).  Wi-Fi password "cheapdr1nks" all in lower case.  12 local and regional craft beers on tap (I counted).  They have about 30 brews in cans and bottles, most of them are from the ATX or at least regional.  The big name brews are only available in bottles and cans, not on tap.  It's a little pricey for a dive bar - pints of Thirsty Goat were 4.50  Full bar - liquor and eraythang!  Six TVs, and a large projector screen (yes I counted).  Yes, they do have food - I didn't partake, but they have tacos, a couple of salads, burgers, sammiches, and the usual bar appetizers.  Every one of the picnic tables on the patio has Cat's name carved in it (she's the current duchess but has fled the city, so it won't last long. Get out there and claim it boys and girls).  Rumor has it that this picnic table vandalism is why she had to leave the ATX, but who knows the real truth?

reviews.author: Nick C.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a great bar in North Austin, this is it. Hideout is spacious and casual, with great drinks and even better food. It's a no frills joint with plenty of room inside and on their patio. Staff are welcoming and the burgers are amazing. Jukebox, TVs, and darts if that's your thing. We'll be making this a regular spot for us!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Great wings--not soggy in sauce, they hold their crisp--and the patio is great!  Honestly, the wings here are better and bigger than Pluckers, and for me that's a good standard--happy hour isgreat here too.  Fall, Spring, Summer--hangin' here for wings and beer outside is hard to beat.

reviews.author: Tiffany M.
reviews.description: I love wing wednesday! They have great wings and all sorts of flavors. They do charge you for everything, which is quirky. It's not expensive at all, so it's really not upsetting. Just a funny thing I noticed. You're charged for condiments and celery. When you're paying 75 cents for wings and cheap drinks, it's a drop in the bucket.   The patio is great and so lively. It is fairly busy. I would even suggest getting there as early as possible because parking is limited. There is a weird gravelly lot for overflow parking, but I have a little sedan and not a 4-wheeler to get over the ditch that is there.  They do allow smoking outside, so if you're sensitive to that then the patio is not for you. At first it bothered me, but had a great time catching up with friends and eating up those wings!

reviews.author: Shannon O.
reviews.description: Came here with a coworker to drink some strong cheap dranks and eat some good food. We were NOT disappointed. Its divey dark spot with plenty of room to chill and hang out. The bartenders were cute, funny and poured some very nice drinks. The long island is only 6 bucks and they had a host of cheap drinks but thats what we were drinking. Now...onto the fooood.  The wings...wangs...were delicious! I got the spicy BBQ and my friend got lemon pepper both well done (I hate a soggy wing). The only downside is that for 7 bucks you only get like 5...well damn! However I saw that they have a wing special every wednesday for like 25 cents or something like that so don't quote me.  Will have to come back on a wednesday.

reviews.author: Phillip N.
reviews.description: They have 75cent wings on Wednesdays and they taste great. Their standard wing flavors are solid, and they always have a new weekly special flavor. My personal favorite flavored wings are blazing (not that spicy).

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I came here for a small get together with my other Yelper friends over the weekend. This place is a dive bar plain and simple. I enjoyed the look and feel of the place and the cheap booze. My only gripe is that it is on the North side of Austin for me.   I will note that my husband and I ordered the nachos here. I wasn't impressed with them but honestly you don't come here for the food. You come here for booze and maybe the people if you are feeling up to it.

reviews.author: Sue S.
reviews.description: So we are in Austin for a family holiday because daughter #2 has a home 4x the size of ours (for the same amount of money!) But I digress...  Daughter #1 is here, too. She once lived in in Austin for a minute; but that was five years ago and so much has changed since then.   She asked to go somewhere quintessentially Austin. Not much of that left, especially in the northern parts, but we researched a bit and came up with The Hideout Pub.   Only juke box music during our visit, so not sure if they ever have live music, which we were hoping for. Regardless, the drinks were good and CHEAP. I mean $5.50 for a Moscow Mule cheap. And that's not even Happy Hour price.   We also had burgers. The Austin burger, ($13) with grilled onions, mushrooms and goat cheese, to which I added the sweet and delicious Moonshine BBQ sauce. Big burgers that come with fries, onion rings, tater tots, salad or chips and salsa. I got the onion rings, she ordered the tots. Both delicious. We couldn't finish our meals and brought half of it home.   Atmosphere is strictly dive bar. Love it! But not "biker bar" as I saw it described somewhere. Dark, low lighting, neon, plain seating, wood floors, tv screens all around. There's also an outdoor, multilevel seating area.   Our server was as sweet as pie, with a faint cute accent to boot. Mixed crowd, mostly keeping to themselves.   New neighborhood if this was my permanent neighborhood.

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: Great bar, been here a handful times and the bartenders always seem to be in a great mood at all times(positive vibes) good prices and great burgers!

reviews.author: Diana L.
reviews.description: BURGERSSSS!  These burgers are better than any other burger place I've had in Austin, and that includes P Terry's, Shake Shack, In N Out, Dirty Martins (does that still exist?), and scattered places here and there.  I got the hideout burger, and waffle fries.  Those FRIES!!! My goodness, my mouth is watering at the thought of them again.   This place truly is tucked away - making the name completely fitting.  The turn off the main road is INSANELY sharp, so slowwww down.

reviews.author: Mark G.
reviews.description: Hideout has a personality to fit the name - it is indeed hidden in plain sight right on Mopac, and it provides its own, secluded little space where you can eat, drink, and socialize, with a vibe that seems friendly, welcoming, and inclusive.  So far I've had burgers, grilled chicken sandwiches, and fish-and-chips that were all above average for dive bar fare. Well-made drinks and a good selection of beer round things out.   Plenty of TVs tuned to different games as well as non-sports stuff, so everyone has a corner to gravitate towards if they wish. Servers are smart, friendly, and efficient.  I'd be here more often if they welcomed dogs in their outdoor area, but aside from that gripe there's not too much to find fault with here... cheers, and see you there!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This is such a cool spot in Northish austin. The beer is cold and the staff is friendly. I also had a burger that was pretty delicious!! They have an indoor and outdoor space and both have lots of seating. The parking is also very convenient. I will definitely come back when I'm in North Austin.

reviews.author: Hillary K.
reviews.description: Gosh we love this place. I'm from buffalo so I'm pretty darn picky when it comes to wings. Hideout is the closest I have found to quality wings. I always ask for extra crispy and they did not disappoint. We also got a burger with fries and onion rings. Burger was great but huge. The onion rings were so crispy; probably close to the best I've ever had. The place is really dark and play some questionable and loud music though. They do have a large outdoor patio that gets kind of busy when it's warm but there's usually always somewhere to sit! I definitely recommend this place, it's a great option to the trendy touristy places that are all around Austin. True neighborhood bar.

name: Mort Subite
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Brian H.
reviews.description: I would have given this place 5 stars, but they covered up the Tintin mural with a refrigerator.

reviews.author: Vanessa D.
reviews.description: Tried two beers and settled with Tripel Karmeliet. Delicious. Sat outside. Cool vibe. 11/10 recommend.

reviews.author: Plucked P.
reviews.description: A fantastic bar with knowledgeable and kind staff and an exceptional variety of Belgian beer a must Stop for anyone visiting Austin!

reviews.author: John F.
reviews.description: Quite the find in Austin for just walking by and thinking of a beer.  Great stop and a super-gal bartender who was really knowledgeable of the beers.  Great draft selection, in fact an OUTSTANDING draft selection.  They even have some bottled selection too. I really like that they don't carry the Milwaukee or St Louis brands and are all craft.  My only criticism would be that beer shouldn't be served in a small (almost) wine glass at $9/beer. That's just too rich that it limits me to one.  If it were a pint the value would be better. Four Stars instead of Five.

reviews.author: Kim N.
reviews.description: We love this bar! Fabulous draft choices in the proper stemware!! Even an outside patio to bring the dog. Talked to bartender about Chimay, Belgium.

reviews.author: Patrick L.
reviews.description: I'm not into Belgian Beers, but I love Mort Subite!  Awesome vibe, amazing selection of beers (not all Belgians) and excellent service.  Not sure what's not to love about Mort Subite?  5 stars!

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: Straight outta Belgium! I love it!  I popped by this place for a beer and found it interesting that I previously and unknowingly walked right past when meeting friends at the TexMex joint next door.  Service here was great during the day - when I stopped in. I presume the guy running the bar was the owner but didn't get into a convo about that. He appeared to have moved from San Francisco a few years back from what I gathered and he was very beer knowledgeable which made for my sour selection.  We spoke of some other sours in the area and such. He was a genuine guy having a genuine conversation. That small chatter right there made me feel like I could call this a regular watering hole in a town usually piled high with trendy pop-ups.  He celebrated 3 yrs just recently and I can see why he's still here. It reminds me of a small establishment I visited in Brussels last year right adjacent to Mannekin Pils (the famous peeing baby statue for those unaware). It had a sense of community and Mort Subite also has that. Maybe it's a Belgium thing but I felt like I was right back there when I sat here.  I really enjoyed myself here and although I had but one drink (i was doing my own beer exploration day), I will be back.

reviews.author: Will S.
reviews.description: Great talk bar with inviting, chill atmosphere and access to the only Belgian beer pipeline in the state, iirc. Like all bars, the bartenders set the standard and, hence, the five star review. Anthony and Piper are a great team and are professional, warm and inviting with customers. The draft beer selection is exceptional and you'd be hard pressed to find an equal rival in the city. Directly across the street from Elephant Room on Congress and 3rd, you get a great mix of residents and tourists, alike. There's outdoor seating both in the front and back (including a solid American fare trailer in the back -- good philly cheesesteak). But I digress, it's all about the ambiance, beer and good people at Mort's.

reviews.author: Peter B.
reviews.description: Worked in Brussels many years ago and the belgian beer selection here is on a par with most of the bars around the Grand Place. Bar tender knew his stuff ... great to see a place that has the correct glass for each beer and takes pride in serving the beer the right way. Will be back.

reviews.author: Crystal R.
reviews.description: The only thing good about this place was the variety of Belgian Beer, which is what they're known for. They had 2 of our favorites, 1 of which is incredibly hard to find in Austin, La Trappe. I do appreciate the beers in the proper glass. The front patio gives nice European vibes. However, the service is horrible. I wish I had gotten her name, tall thin woman, medium length blonde hair. Very rude and short with our group, the birthday boy with us had questions and she wasn't happy to help. She told him to stop talking in the middle of their conversation. Then when we went to close our tab the bill was $135 for 4 beers. Four beers, by the glass. Now some of the beers are pricier than others since they're imported but we were aware of that as the prices are listed on the chalk board behind the bar. We also don't mind paying good money for quality beer. We questioned the tab and the person behind the bar investigated and said the tall thin woman, who was short with us earlier, charged us for the two large bottles of some vintage or specialty bottle, which is not what we ordered nor what she served. She eventually fixed the tab but it was a very sketchy 'mistake' and the entire experience was memorable in a terrible way. We will not be back and are disappointed since we went in very excited to try it out. I don't recommend this bar.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Very cool Belgian ale bar right in the heart of downtown. Can't believe I haven't seen this place while walking around dt.. a real hidden gem if you're looking for Belgian beers.  They have a nice selection of Belgian ales on tap, most I had never heard of which was nice to be able to try all new things. They also have some higher % beers in the frig which appear to be some of their fancier ones, eager to have a go at these next time.   Real cool spot, good for going in and trying some new Belgians to get an idea for this particular subset of beers, right in the heart of Austin.

reviews.author: Tim K.
reviews.description: This place gets two-stars because of their selection. Being from Belgium, I enjoy looking up places in America and Mort Subite might be the only Belgian place in Austin.  To my big disappointment, besides the selection they have, there's not much attraction for a native to come here, unless you want a badly poured beer and rude service.  The first time I came to Mort Subite I can no longer remember, probably because it was underwhelming but after a lot of people told me to go there as a Belgian, I figured to give it another chance as I was pretty excited to have a La Chouffe on draft. When I noticed that the bartender was pouring this high ABV beer wrong, I asked him if I could give him some advice on how to pour it better. His answer was simply "no" and walked away while he handed my my check. Completely mesmerized, I still tipped him, and walked away. When I explained to my friend what happened, he said I needed to have given context.  So I went back in, ordered another La Chouffe and as soon as he placed the glass under the tap, not holding or tilting it, I apologized for earlier and asked him again if I could give some advice as a Belgian who has had many years experience working in bars. He immediately stopped the pour and  looked at me. When I explained him to hold the glass, tilt it and pour the beer on the spot where your finger is, and how that technique is very common and necessary to pour high ABV beer, he just stared me dead in the eye and continue to pour as he started, wasting a lot of beer and giving me a shitty poured beer.  I send management an email since I thought that they would love to be aware about this before I put anything online but after almost a two weeks of no response, I feel obligated to share this experience.

reviews.author: Max G.
reviews.description: If you like Belgian beer, or if you just want to try Belgian beer, Mort Subite is the place you should go.  This cozy bar features about 30 Belgian beers on draft, and has many more in bottles.  Of course, every beer is served in the brewery's unique glass.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  They also have an Indian food truck behind their outdoor beer garden.  Delicious food that goes surprisingly well with the Belgian beer.

reviews.author: Darci F.
reviews.description: Wow...warm beer off the tap 10 minutes and almost undrinkable.But what the choice in music for a belgian bar-Nope it ain't dope.. Learn to pour a good head..this is European beer and they know how to get the beer right.I had Kwak beer in the Netherlands in April it was  great beer out of the bottle this..well I tried it twice at 9 bucks I should have just got a 6 pack

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Absolutely phenomenal beers! After more than a year of experiencing this place, I have yet to try a beer I didn't like. Yes its on the pricier end but the quality of the beer here is worth its weight.  I wish they could pour the beer a bit better. Most of my beers come out with more than half as foam.

reviews.author: Ricardo M.
reviews.description: Please do yourself a favor and come try delicious belgian beer. The place is clean. Service is fast and friendly.  Clean bathrooms and a friendly atmosphere sets this beer garden a step above the rest nearby. Come see what you've been missing! Adam, thank you for the amazing service!! I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: I love all beers Belgian so I have been wanting to come here for a while now.  Came in on a cold Wed January evening and my friend and I, save for whom I can only assume was a regular, were the only ones in the bar.  The bartender was very friendly and appreciated that we concurred on beer suggestions for my friend.   I really loved that they serve the beers in their correct respective glassware (especially the Kwak, which is worth ordering for the glass apparatus alone!).  The prices per serving are a bit on the higher-end of the Belgian Beer spectrum from other bars I have had the same beers at, but honestly,  I liken this sitch to the line from "The Prince and Me"..."you can really taste the extra 10 cents".   For a place that's French for 'Sudden Death', it isn't nearly all that intesnse, but when I had my first pour of their Gulden Draak 9000 Quad, I did kinda feel like I'd died and gone to Belgian Beer heaven!

reviews.author: Jenna F.
reviews.description: Wow!!! A little piece of Belgian heaven in the center of Austin! Amazing selection of Belgian beers on draught and in bottles!  Also super psyched to see everything served in the correct glassware.... it seems like it shouldn't matter, but it does. Also a bonus is the crepe food truck out back and the German pretzel truck around the corner....get your bratwurst and belly up!! Great service and friendly staff here as well!! I'd highly recommend a visit if you haven't been here yet!

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Gave Mort Subite another shot as Belgian beer is the one true god of beers and can't stand not going to one of the truly Belgian bars in the country.  Again, takes a long time to get served as each pour is perfect and looks delicate.  Menu doesn't change often on draft and was 90% the same.  However, this is some of the freshest draft Belgians I've ever had, and have some rare varieties that you mainly only see in bottles.  Prices are very high and 150% of any other bar in town, but this is the quality stuff and high abv.  Now that they have a food truck out back with some good looking Indian, Mort Subite might be worth adding to my list of usuals when in that Belgian mood.  You should expect a long wait at the bar, high bill, but overall a great beer pour.

reviews.author: Kimi F.
reviews.description: Love this place!! Such a nice ambiance, it reminds me of a Chicago bar. Wonderful selection of Belgian beers. I especially love all of the fun glassware that comes with each beer. I like their outdoor patio space as well. Definitely check this place out!

reviews.author: Rachel D.
reviews.description: Typical Lil Woodrow's - lots of beer and sports!   We were here on a Thurs night and it was busy but not crowded. I would give it 5 stars but I can't bc of all the smoking. I smelled like cigarettes when we left after about 2 hours, and no one in my party smoked. This was my first (and unfortunately last) time here, so I was unaware.   Know b4 you go: -Dogs allowed on patio -Smoking allowed -Bring your own food or order from next door   -Great waitstaff   Overall, I won't be back due to the cigs, but that's a personal preference of mine. If you don't mind smoking, this is a good bar.

reviews.author: Nicole L.
reviews.description: Watched as over a dozen unmasked people were served by an unmasked server. You have to be kidding me.

reviews.author: DaLila G.
reviews.description: I really like it here. Every time I go there's live music and I legally like sitting on their patio. It's super chill and always clean. Def a great spot in the neighborhood. Will continue to keep visiting

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: This place is an okay spot for a beer after work.  Cheap drink specials.  You need to get a table near a fan because the AC does not work well.  Also, be warry if you ask the bar mgr dude to turn a game's sound on.  He might tell you "people like you make it hard to be a manager at a sports bar". Overall, on a scale of das to das, it's a little below das.

reviews.author: Shannon O.
reviews.description: I love that this spot is very close...I also enjoy the openness of the joint...they also have decent beers on tap. However..if you want food, you have the option of ordering from a pizza spot a couple of doors down...meh. The biggest thing I don't like is..their mixed drinks are SO watered down!   I've tried at least 4 different ones and the ice and water is the most prominent.   So if you go? Stick to the beer or a shot.

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: This bar is down the street from our apartment so it's our local hangout on the weekends! It can get pretty packed on Friday/Saturday nights but the staff is quick as lighting! We never have a bad time here and they host loads of events that make it feel like we are apart of a community. Love Little Woodrow's!

reviews.author: Mel B.
reviews.description: Great place to sit and have some beverages.  Spent a lazy Saturday afternoon on the patio...beautiful weather and great people.  It's also a great place to bring your doggies.  Very good beer selection...even had three sours on tap, which is hard to find AND my absolute favorite!

reviews.author: Gilford S.
reviews.description: They claim to be a neighborhood bar but they treat the real neighbors... those who actually live and work right across the street like utter garbage.  On multiple occasions.  Done with these amateurs.  PS. The drinks are weak as can be and the bartenders are lame.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Great local hangout always playing whatever game we want to watch. Cold beer, nice patio, decent service and, if you're hungry, Brooklyn pie company a couple doors down will deliver to your table.

reviews.author: Joshua K.
reviews.description: It's always a joy to come here to drink and socialize. Nothing beats beautiful women, alcohol, and excellent customer service! Except for a lack of delicious bar foods!   Although you can bring food into the restaurant, the selection around the area is a bit lackluster. Your only choices are a mediocre pizza place or Mexican cuisine. Brooklyn's pizza will probably be your go to dish if you do decide on italian. Their appetizers are not enjoyable for the value you'll be paying.   All in all, this place has a wide assortment of beverages and a nice place to unwind after a long day of work.

reviews.author: Kenneth B.
reviews.description: I like this place. But I'd like to talk to mr friends without yelling over the loud music. I'm sure the staff rocks out before patrons come in and don't think to turn it down to a reasonable level.  Bad first date spot which is not a good thing to be in the dating app era.

reviews.author: Albert G.
reviews.description: The best neighborhood bar in town. Upon walking in, you immediately feel like you're a part of the family. The management is beyond professional and they take time to hear opinions or just causally chat. The bar tenders are courteous and quick to serve. No matter what day it is, you will always feel like it's a Friday a night when you come here.   P.S.  I highly recommend you get in a game of cornhole! Lots of great players!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: I LOVE this place...great beer selection and dog-friendly...the outdoor patio is shaded, has mistress, and even the bar extends outside to sit at if you don't want a table.  The staff is also a big reason I keep coming back.  I just finished my first run through the Big 50 Club (50 different drafts) and there is more on tap than just those on that list.  Pretty cool!  They don't have food, but the pizza place next door delivers to your table--a slice, whole pie, salads, fries, chips n queso, wings, chicken fingers, subs, etc...so it's not only pizza.  Outstanding!

reviews.author: Christopher S.
reviews.description: Laid back atmosphere. Good beers/drinks. Nothing fancy, doesn't cater to one click or another. This location is new and they have it worked out fairly well. Only minor rub is that the outside patio gets direct sun, which is going to be a bit of bitch in the dead of summer, but for now it's fine. Outdoor bar, plenty of screens.  "Jukebox" (fancy MP3 player is nice). Allows you to bump something that is playing that isn't quite to your liking. Drink prices are fair for sure considering most watering holes are serving watered down and overpriced cough syrup.  This place is clean and seems well kept. The manager is almost constantly walking the place and fixing things. They went out of there way to find me an outlet to charge my phone.   Note: Pet friendly even having a water bowl for your four legged family as needed. Just please mind the leash, one guys dropped his momentarily to grab a beer and his dog tore through the kitchen/bar area, it was hilarious.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: Gave bartender a 5% tip cause of bad service.  She comes outside to chastise me in front of my wife and friends because she expected more. Told her I expected better service and her response was to cut me off. Hey.. already played my tab!  Much better places to have fun in Austin anyhow.

reviews.author: Pam K.
reviews.description: Our first time visiting this venue to see our friends' band play will be our last. It's sad, too, because it doesn't seem like a bad place.  To the juvenile waitress with an attitude: you're in customer service. That means you serve customers WITHOUT the massive chip on your shoulder. If you don't like your job, find something else to do, but DON'T take your mistakes out on your customers.  The waitress got our order wrong and pitched a massive attitude when we kindly asked her to fix it - it was a DIET COKE!!! Slammed the new drink on the table and didn't speak to us the rest of our stay there.  THEN denied it all when approached by my husband, who had to escalate the situation to a manager. Horrible, horrible, horrible. Grow up.

reviews.author: Alyssa D.
reviews.description: I'm biased cos I've worked with them at Brooklyn Pie next door for over a year (they deliver to LW if you call in and the pizza is great) and currently work with LW now. Heads up, you won't be playing on your phone past your first drink. It may as well be Cheers personified. Customers and staff alike are all so friendly and hilarious, you'll get roped into ridiculous convos and debates. It's inevitable. The staff (myself included) will adopt you as our own. 15/10 would recommend.

reviews.author: Celeste R.
reviews.description: I've been to this location a total of three times now, I've tried to love it! Claims to be a neighborhood bar but they're everything short of it. Bartenders aren't too worried about giving good customer service, and their drinks are pretty lame as well. Could easily get their "cocktails" at the Bombshells down the road, with more of a kick and better attentiveness and service. The only reason I'm not leaving 1 star instead of 2 is because they don't care if you're drunk- they'll keep serving you! Lmao and the board games are a nice touch!

reviews.author: That G.
reviews.description: We love this place!! Especially the bartender, Marilyn. We came new years eve and she wasn't even working and she remembered us. Austin is a great city! We hope to move here. Thank you for a great experience!!

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: Love this place... Except sometimes they play THE WORST MUSIC EVER! Just My opinion, not into it, don't dig it, turn it down or off

reviews.author: Thomas C.
reviews.description: I went to this Gastro pub while visiting a friend in the Austin Texas area. I think it's really cool that they have merchandise and a fully running bar and restaurant in the same space. I felt it was very cozy and interesting aesthetically with all of the taxidermy on the walls. I really enjoyed grabbing a drink here with a friend and I would definitely come back to shop or drink in the future.

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: We became members here about four months ago. It's perfect because my wife and I will grab two beers to go, drop a tip, and walk the square/walking trail up the street to get our steps in on our Fitbit. It's always exciting because the beers change daily to weekly. We've hung out inside on occasion which is perfect for card games and relaxing. The apparel for sale is typical of a REI/Bass Pro Shop. Expensive but quality.   Bar: rotating beer, wine, white claws  Bonus: Very dog friendly! And one of the only places open late.

reviews.author: Justine R.
reviews.description: I have had mostly positive experiences here. I like the beer selection and the bartenders are always happy to suggest something that fits the profile I want.  I have been here about 5 times and am likely to return.

reviews.author: Mike S.
reviews.description: Always great beer, great service, great people watching outside. A favorite.  Also check out the fine sportswear.

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: Awesome little place in the square! Very knowledgeable and friendly staff! They have some great beers on tap, some that I would have otherwise never tried! The Eastciders blood orange is awesome! They also have great apparel and accessories. Also, we got a small hint that they love our military and veterans!

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: While many businesses have found ways to make shopping, eating, and drinking safer and in line with state guidelines, there are places that have found their niche catering to the denial or anti-mask crowd. You can make up your own mind based on the trolling I've received from their clientele from my previous review, and the continued crowding on their sidewalk outside with unmasked folks not socially distanced.

reviews.author: Kiva C.
reviews.description: This place has a great atmosphere. They are family and dog friendly. The merchandise is high quality (outdoor gear) and they are open late. They usually have sports on their TVs. Whether you're shopping during the day or stopping in for a drink in the evening. The crowd range is vast. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and the taps are rotating. They even have water bowls outside for your dog. They serve beer, wine, and select seltzer's in cans. It's a great place to kill a few hours in the heart of downtown Georgetown.

reviews.author: Kacey C.
reviews.description: This place is always SUPER packed on weekends, it can be near impossible to find a seat. Luckily there are a few outdoor tables and chairs for overflow but even the sidewalks get crowded with people just standing around drinking. One evening we managed to make it in and see what all the excitement was about and it's a cute little beer and wine bar/outdoors gear store. Cute merchandise but pretty pricey. The bartender told us occasionally a food truck will park behind their store so you can enjoy yummy eats with your drinks, otherwise no food menu. I liked the atmosphere of this place... cute little date night drink spot on the square. But I am a little confused by why it's so crowded all the time. The beer and wine list is good, but not anything spectacular. I don't get it. I'm sure we'll be back at some point if we can find a place to sit.

reviews.author: Jamie W.
reviews.description: Had a great time here. Beer and atmosphere was great. Would love to come back to shop around sometime.

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: I never feel welcomed at MSO. The workers are borderline rude and  act put out with each order. I'll spend my dough elsewhere.

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Short review time kids!  A close friend and local resident dragged us here and promised we would enjoy ourselves! He was so spot on the get a coveted 5 star review!   Atmosphere is casual, relaxed and inviting. Great selection of beers on tap.  Go for a brew,meet some cool people, and get a shirt before you depart!

reviews.author: Mark D.
reviews.description: Good selection of outdoor/fishing clothes combined with a great selection of beer. Live music  on certain nights. Very nice staff.  Excellent place to go on the square.

reviews.author: Archie L.
reviews.description: Spent the Sunday afternoon on the square. This is a must stop when visiting the shops on the square in Georgetown. Great selection of beer, wine, cider. Nice clothing. The selection is somewhat limited but quality. Friendly staff!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Sunday night in the  square. Strolled in and got a tasty brew and some pimento cheese. Then bought a shirt and some shoes. What a great space and friendly service. Thanks!

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: Went there on Saturday to watch the UT game. Not a sports bar, but they did have it on one TV. Lots of fans watching, so the atmosphere was great. They have a good selection of draft beer that changes from time to time. Mostly local. I went back the very next day for the Dallas Cowboys game. Very friendly staff. The next day I sat in a comfortable leather chair. They also have a lot of nice clothing for men. A little too pricey for me, but I understand they have some deals from time to time. I will definitely be going there every time I'm in downtown Georgetown.

reviews.author: MICHELE V.
reviews.description: Love this place!! So, for food offerings, you can order online. The dudes 2doors down will deliver. Lots of awesome beers and wine available here. Those of you who  follow the mask rules (which effectiveness is anecdotal at best....and not scientific), you will be comfortable here. High ceilings, fans, etc.  Tables far apart.  Or drink outside. I'm here for the beer. The people are cool and the staff AWESOME!!

reviews.author: Regine M.
reviews.description: An interesting spot in the Georgetown square. Mesquite Creek is half bar, half clothing and apparel shop. They've got a good selection of beers and wines and are one of the only places around here that stays open late. There's a variety of clothes for men and women however many of their items are overpriced, but I assume most people come here to drink, not shop.

reviews.author: Faith B.
reviews.description: Nice seating area outside. Got the blueberry blonde beer and super good! Bartenders all super friendly as well. :)

reviews.author: Zoe T.
reviews.description: Stopped in yesterday to buy a hat for me and walked out with a hat and two shirts for my teenage sons. I didn't try the beer, so I can't comment on that, but the clothing selection was good. They carry Howler Brothers apparel, which is a company out of Austin that my fisherman husband likes, and Texas Standard clothing, which is a TX-based brand with cool (not kitschy) Texas-themed clothing that gives back to Texas non-profs. They also carry another local brand - Kermode Outdoors - which is new to me, but evidently founded by Georgetown residents. The store has a great vibe and the bar is a place I could see spending a few hours on a Saturday afternoon. Stores like this are what I look for whenever I shop local - a place that sells unique, cool stuff that someone has spent time thinking about.   4 not 5 stars because I didn't try the beer. Next time....

reviews.author: Jordyn T.
reviews.description: Great place to have a beer/wine in beautiful downtown Georgetown! Very friendly staff and great selection of drinks.

name: Perla's
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Validated Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: Obed F.
reviews.description: Every time we come to Austin we stop by Perla's no matter if its for Breakfast, Lunch or dinner. This time we stopped in for lunch. We got there an hour before our appt and host was very accommodating and sat us early. Not to mention we had our 4 month old in a stroller. We took the option to sit outside because the weather was great and they have an awesome patio. The waiter was very nice and very knowledgeable on the whole food menu and drinks. We wanted get something light since we have been eating so heavy on our vaca.   We split 3 dishes a ceviche, the lobster bisque and the wedge salad. All the 3 were very light, tasty and delicious!! It was exactly what we were looking for.   I would absolutely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Gigi B.
reviews.description: Food was decent, but the parking situation ruined our experience and we likely won't return as a result.   There is a parking garage behind Perlas where they supposedly validate your parking. Apparently there is a new system in place in the parking garage that requires you to scan a QR code to pay for parking then somehow you get it validated at the restaurant. However, when you pull into the garage there is no QR code. So I walked to the restaurant to ask how to validate parking. They gave me the QR code but I had to have my license plate. So I had to walk back to my truck to get license plate. By the time I got back to my truck there was already a parking ticket on my truck!   I reached out to the manger of this parking garage, Travis, to explain the situation, but he refused to waive the parking ticket even though I showed him a copy of my receipt from Perlas which proves that my parking should have been free not to mention the confusing process.

reviews.author: Kevin M.
reviews.description: Service was professional and prompt. The server, Donovan, was quite excellent at providing suggestions and information without need to go back and consult a chef or manager. What this says is that the restaurant (and chef) ensure the employees taste what they serve so they can provide info to diners. This is one mark of excellence.   The setting is beautiful. Since it was a pleasant autumn day, we opted for outdoor dining and enjoyed our decision. It's hard to write about the vibe but this is closer to a low-key fine dining. It isn't fancy but the food and service make it close.   We had grilled (or broiled) oysters and they were as good as the ones I had at Felix's in the French Quarter. We also had a sampler of oysters in the half-shell and we were guided by Donovan who knew the types of oysters and sources and showed us that by flipping the shell, the underside gives clues as to the waters they originated from.   Tuna Tartare was excellent (I've only had it as good in Aspen, Co for 3x the price).  Then smoked octopus and grilled red snapper. Both of those were outstanding too.   Price is reasonable for the quality but our bill was over $175 (we ate a ton and didn't care) this restaurant is right on price considering the quality on the plate and from the staff. We will definitely go again.

reviews.author: Mel E.
reviews.description: Erin, GM, was amazing from pre-arrival, arrival and departure. What an amazing young lady! Thanks Erin, for the reservation accommodation and delicious bite.  Jacob, my server, was incredible and every dish he recommended was beyond amazing! It was totally worth the flight. This is huge for me because customer service in my opinion, has declined drastically, so when I rave about an experience such as Perla's, it's #facts! This evening I enjoyed some glasses of Chenin Blanc, from South Africa, some delicious oysters (Jacob chose all of them), fried okra, crab cake and the famous potato crusted sea bass and a sea salt dessert! Thanks Perla's for the amazing experience! Thanks for the warm welcome from the staff outside and the lovely hostesses inside. I'll certainly be back and cannot wait! Be safe. Be blessed. Be kind and enjoy good food! Perla's

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Been waiting a while to go here, and finally got to make it while it was still nice out; We thought there was supposed to be a happy hour, but it turns out/doesn't seem like there is one anymore unfortunately.  Naturally, we got a few appetizers, oyster shooters and oysters, plus the octopus that came with a savory sauce and potatoes. I'm not a fan of bloody mary's so the shooter wasn't my favorite since that's how they were prepared, and kind of spendy at that. The oysters were a small bit still good; again,  no happy hour pricing.  The octopus was my favorite, grilled perfectly, same as the potatoes, covered in herbs and a butter/mayo sauce that paired nicely.   We both got fish, mine had a bit of spice to it, and the ahi was very nice and fresh; Overall, pleasant meal, more expensive than we would've liked but glad to have tried it. Personally, I think it's better to just get some appetizers/drinks and save the entree for somewhere else; while it's definitely good, I think it's overpriced and could make something comparable for a fraction of the cost.

reviews.author: Nada S.
reviews.description: Beautiful place .. was visiting Austin for the first time and I was extremely hungry and could not wait for a barbecue place. Stopped by this and it did not disappoint

reviews.author: Alan J.
reviews.description: Our first time here for an occasion with my wife's second cousins. Two guests split a dozen oysters and loved them. We split the calamari and it was among the best we've had in Texas. Top two, maybe top five ever. My wife had the redfish on the half shell and loved it. I ordered an oyster Po Boy but was disappointed in the size of the oysters and was very salty. The shoe string fries were fine by my tastes despite what some reviews state. Kind of high price for what we got for lunch but that's what you get now with the CA invasion of Austin. Seafood seemed fresh which is rare in Texas.

reviews.author: Jessica K.
reviews.description: Love love love Perla's! We always try to come by whenever we are in Austin. Most of the time, they are very busy and there will likely be a wait. The last time we went was for lunch on a Tuesday and we waited about 30 minutes for an outdoor table, but it's always worth it! The place has a really cool vibe and the staff is very pleasant and we appreciate the mask policy. The oysters are delicious! We usually get the calamari, octopus and fries as well. I will say the octopus is a tad too salty for me, but otherwise the food is good.

reviews.author: Kelsey B.
reviews.description: What a delicious, elegant meal.  The pricing is really steep even for seafood, possibly because we enjoy their sister oyster bar restaurant a bit more.  Sit outdoors for a more casual vibe and indoors for more formal.

reviews.author: Shaunna S.
reviews.description: Yep loved every minute of this meal. We came for my birthday and had originally reserved for indoor seating. However, it was really nice outside so the sweet staff moved us out there upon asking. We came for my birthday dinner and it was a very relaxing, chill, but a little upscale vibe. We all wore jeans and it was totally acceptable. The food was 10/10. The calamari was light and crispy at the same time- just perfect. The creole oysters were packed with flavor, and the main dish lobster bucatini was literally the best dish I've ever had. It was delicious and that alone is enough for me to return. We split it which I think was perfect because I could barely finish my half after the appetizers.  We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Elaine L.
reviews.description: Rhee did not have a reservation when we arrived for lunch but the hostess sat us within 30 min of arriving. The food was delicious. Gumbo was a little salty but it was not shy of meat. Will be coming back!

reviews.author: Sherrill J.
reviews.description: Perla's is just wonderful to visit. We enjoyed Seared Maine Scallops and Semolina Fried Texas Gulf Prawns on our visit. Gulf shrimp have a wonderful sweetness to them not found in cold water shrimp. Margarita's Yes!  Enjoyed the staff greatly!

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: Lots to say about this one! Really lovely atmosphere - trees shade the top of the outdoor seating so you will never get too hot in the Texas summer. Service is good and quick and the patio is just a great place to go with a group. Some items on the menu are incredible - like the ahi tuna tostada. Others are good but not wow - the redfish sandwich. Overall, really really expensive place to eat but a cool spot to eat it.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Love the patio- Superb oysters and ambience. I have always enjoyed the service.  I so wished the had blue cheese - salad dressing and for blue cheese olives!

reviews.author: Lynn N.
reviews.description: Delicious, comfortable, dog friendly, great service. Andrew was such a great server! I brought my dog Sawyer with me; the staff was so lovely to her! She even made it on their Polaroid wall of doggies!!! I had Brussels, crab cakes, tomato/watermelon/burrata salad, and pot d creme. My new fav place in Austin!

reviews.author: Ange R.
reviews.description: I really wanted to like this place more especially after it was recommended to us and we waited 45 minutes for our table.  First, I wouldn't recommend dining with family. It is too expensive and there's not a lot to select on the menu for the younger ones. It's definitely a date night or girls/guys night out vibe.   Red snapper dish was ok. Brussels sprouts were good, had a sweet taste. The prawns were good and I do recommend the calamari for an appetizer.  Complimentary hush puppies were a nice treat, too.   Cocktails were a little watered down for the price. Wine was decent.   Loved the outdoor seating area. If I go back, it will be for a glass of wine and calamari on the patio.

reviews.author: Ebtisam M.
reviews.description: The food here is way overpriced for the quality of food they offer. My family (including the kids) love seafood and enjoy going out. We ordered a wide range of meals and were less than impressed. The sauces were either very bland or very rich...nothing in between. We ordered the sea bass(bland), scallops (scallops and mushrooms were good but sauce was very thick), salmon (bland), tuna tostados and a few sides. I wouldn't waste your money eating here. It's a fun trendy place for drinks and apps but nothing more.

reviews.author: Zia L.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places in Austin! I love outdoor dining and this place has an awesome outdoor space. The king crab grits and little gem salad are two of my absolute faves along with the grilled oysters. It is a popular place so make your reservations early especially for dinner!

reviews.author: Vandesha L.
reviews.description: As someone who is just now getting back to dining out I really wanted to be outside but not at a place that was too busy. Perla's delivered! Parking wasn't easy for the area and I wish I had known the restaurant validates. I could have saved $10. Overall the service and atmosphere was satisfying.
