The brunch menu is not huge but the few items available still left me struggling to decide. I chose the lobster omelette and it was one of the fluffiest omelette's I ever had. Each bite was full of crab. I initially thought the lettuce was a garnish but took a bite and it was a salad with some of the best dressing I ever had. Oh and the grilled oysters are a MUST! I plan to return to try other menu items.

reviews.author: Shelly L.
reviews.description: Disappointing!!  Good but not great seafood considering the prices. And we waited over an hour to get our food which was lukewarm at best when it arrived. Shoestring fries? Hardly! Just an example of how misrepresented this place is. And then to be subjected to a 20% gratuity since we had more that 6 people. Frankly not worth 10%. Crawl, don't run to Perlas. Grab a slice nearby and save a ton of money.

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: I've been to P6 for several dates and the food and cocktails are absolutely fantastic, not to mention the beautiful view over looking South Congress bridge. This is one of my go-to date spots!  My recommended dishes: - Patatas Bravas (a classic Mexican street food, the potatoes are crispy, yet fluffy on the inside. Served with a spicy aioli) -  Roasted Mushroom Fettuccine (very fresh) - Charcuterie Board (if you're a cheese fan, P6 offers a high quality selection)  I've had the chance to try all of the cocktails here, and none have disappointed me.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Visited P6 for happy hour with a friend while visiting Austin and had a good time! We arrived when they were just opening, and luckily we had a reservation - it filled up really quickly after a bit. The space has a great vibe and a great view - even though it's not on the roof, the space offers a lovely view of the city and river and the open concept of the bar makes for a perfect environment to relax and enjoy some sunshine. The space is filled with countless plants and pink decor, which I truly appreciated - it felt quite posh and eclectic yet incredibly put together at the same time.   For drinks, I opted for the ladybird spritz, perfect for a refreshing afternoon cocktail. Featuring rhubarb, aperol, and cava, it was light yet flavorful, really being able to taste the rhubarb throughout the entire drink. Quite good! My friend went for the sundown cobbler, which she also really enjoyed. Since it was happy hour, we snagged some food too. We both split the pita bread with chimichurri and the hummus. We were given a bunch of pita bread, which was much appreciated! The pita was good, but not the best I've ever had (a little dense for my liking). The chimchurri was OK - the ratio of oil to spices was a bit off so it felt like it was swimming in oil. The hummus was quite nice and featured a nice touch of cashews and chili oil. I appreciated the inclusion of various veggies in addition to the pita for a change of pace! The hummus overall was good, but again, not the best I've ever had, but still filling and delicious and balanced our drinks well. While the prices of the cocktails were quite discounted from normal, they were still a bit steep, but to be expected when you consider the ambience of the place.   Overall, we enjoyed our HH at P6! I really enjoyed by spritz and the hummus / chimichurri was a nice balance. The prices are a bit elevated, but to be expected in relation to the space. If you're looking for a nice HH spot for visitors to Austin, I would definitely suggest P6!

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: We came here as soon as the restaurant opened because we knew it would be packed. This place has such beautiful decor and is on the rooftop/patio, so there is a beautiful backdrop of Lady Bird Lake. You will definitely be taking tons of photos here.  We made reservations just in case, but we pretty much had the whole restaurant to ourselves for the first hour P6 was opened. Everything looked delicious, so we ordered quite a bit:  Vegetable Frittata: This was perfect for a light meal. Lots of veggies and the eggs and butter lettuce was perfect.  Shrimp and Grits: Soooo bomb. Every bit of this tasted great. Just wished they would have removed the shrimp tails as most other places do.  Patatas Bravas: The potatoes were great for a side/appetizer.  Sourdough Garlic Bread: I love a good garlic bread, and this totally delivered. And I like that fact that it was pull-apart bread.   Everything tasted amazing and we really enjoyed our time brunching here.

reviews.author: Teah R.
reviews.description: Stop 2 of the night with our group of 9 for a bachelorette party. We made reservations ahead of time and were seated indoors. But we convinced our way out to the patio early in the night which was better (but a little chilly). Why would we want to come to a rooftop bar if we can't be outside, ya know?!  The servers were nice - we had multiple throughout the night. They occasionally came and checked on us. The place was packed on a Friday night.  We all had a lot of fun here and the drinks just kept coming! They were tasty and swanky.  There weren't many parking options other than valet that I saw but I can't remember how much that was. We had to walk through the hotel to get to the rooftop. The hotel looked very nice with mood lighting and modern decor touches.  Overall though, P6 was great - moody and fun!

reviews.author: Angela R.
reviews.description: Came here for a bachelorette brunch. The food was SO FRESH and tasted bomb. The views where we sat was also breath taking. The weather was perfect and our waiter was so nice. He gave us tips on what to do and where to go. I've been recommending this place to everyone that visits Austin!

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a good spot to watch the sunset over the river then this is the spot to check out. With this being downtown it's in a good location to catch the sunset and then adventure parts of downtown. This is a popular spot so being able to get a good seat or table before the sunset may be difficult. The crafted cocktails are very good and the waiting staff does a good job at helping you pick a drink

reviews.author: Dave B.
reviews.description: Hidden away in THe Line hotel is P6.  It used to be a bar and restaurant.  The bar is now all assigned seating, so make reservations to assure a stay.  If you like sunsets, book a seat that can see such.  It's worth it.  Service was good.  Staff was friendly, and when the outside got chill, they kindly reseated us indoors.  Props for that!  You can get a meal or just get drinks.  Just book before you go or pray for the one table free, like we found.

reviews.author: Deborah W.
reviews.description: Rating: 3.5 stars  My friend and I decided to stop here for brunch on Sunday. We didn't make a reservation ahead of time but were able to be seated right away indoors. (If you are interested in sitting outdoors - we were told reservations book out 1 week in advance so make sure to plan accordingly)  Even though the indoor space did not have the same ambience as outdoors it was still very nice and well decorated.   Service was very friendly and efficient.  For our brunch we decided to order:  --PATATAS BRAVAS: Well fried with a great flavor. Definitely a great brunch item to order! My only complaint would be they didn't really give us many potatoes since the portion covered less than half of the bowl it came in.   --FRITTATA: Ours was a veggie frittata that was filled with flavor and topped with a great tomato based purée. It did come with a giant handful of lightly coated romaine lettuce which seemed a bit mismatched. Additionally the portion of the frittata was slightly too small for the price.   --PICKLED PEARL ONION HUMMUS: Really good portion of food. The hummus is just bursting in flavor. There was also a ton of bread and veggies it comes with to dip into the hummus. Definitely a solid order!   All in all, a nice brunch option for the weekend if you are staying at The Line.

reviews.author: Elizabeth L.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped by P6 for appetizers and cocktails while we were in town and we had the best time!!  The cute, Instagrammy interior is only topped by the incredible backdrop of the balcony view over the river. We got a shady table by the edge and kicked back with a rosé and carpaccio. The plating of the carpaccio was gorgeous, and it had a beautiful mix of salty and fresh flavors. The pita chips that came with it were perfectly crispy too!  This was the best view we were able to get while in Austin, and can't wait to come back! But next time - we'll make it in time for their amazing happy hour deals.

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed brunch the other day here on their patio that overlooks Ladybird Lake. Had a reservation for 6 and the hostess was able to accommodate my request of sitting outside, which I really appreciated. The ambiance is very pretty and totally Instagram worthy with their pink overhangs and colorful couches/decor. They also had semi-large fans for each outdoor table which was much needed in this Texas heat.   The food was really delicious and not too overly priced. For brunch, most of the plates were pretty small so, if you're hungry I would recommend ordering 1-3 plates and sharing if you have the ability to do so. We tried the Greek Yogurt Parfait, Patatas Bravas and Hummus and it was all sooo good! Will definitely be returning here.

reviews.author: Christy V C.
reviews.description: I came here with a couple of friends and we had a blast! The ambiance is incredible and I just loved the view! We came during happy hour, which is literally one hour, 4-5pm, and I ordered the Sundowncobbler and Homemade Pita bread. Im not a huge drinker, but I really enjoyed my drink and loved that there was fruit in it. The pita bread was incredible! I loved how soft and warm the pita was. It was perfect with the chimichurri.  Parking- You can park in the garage for the hotel, but they only validate for the first hour I believe, which is only $5. Luckily we found street parking next to the garage which isn't nearly as expensive.  Payment- I actually really loved that you paid online! It makes it very easy to split the check amongst friends without bothering the servers!

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: Views are excellent... IF you even get a table anywhere near them. This restaurant is poorly executed in my opinion. They have beautiful views of the river but there is no guarantee that you will even be able to see it from your table (even with reservations) and yet you're still paying "fancy view prices".   My experience: - Arrived at The Line Hotel (which is way cool btw) to find that there are no signs on how to get to P6.  - The elevator is super sketchy and in the back corner without any airflow at all (seemed like an afterthought or service elevator). - Originally was sat at a "table" (their seating are little vignettes of couches/patio furniture that is NOT comfortable AT ALL and really impractical to eat at) nowhere near the view. The tiny view that we did have was completely obstructed by a shade they rolled down. - We asked to be moved to a "table" with a view and were finally re-seated but still had a difficult time seeing the view as we were further back at a SUPER low to the ground vignette.  - The staff was friendly but the drinks and the menu items were overrated. - Stayed for an hour and a half, took some pictures, and went somewhere else to eat more food.  My order: - Sundown Cobbler cocktail - Yummy, but tasted mostly like sprite. - Paper Plane cocktail - Yummy, smooth, easy drinker. - Whipped ricotta - Way more food than we expected but the olives and the nuts were better than the ricotta. It lacked a lot of flavor and mostly just helped to fill me up.  Long story short - NOT worth the hype.

reviews.author: CJ M.
reviews.description: We were out-of-towners on a dining experience. Seeing the bats was a recommended activity from a colleague. P6 was the venue of choice. The menu is petit and this venue is built for drinks and small apps. However, dinner was good and the views breathe taking. The evening was an overall success and the service was helpful. Strongly recommend for a predinner or after dinner spot.

reviews.author: Jaslean A.
reviews.description: Had a blast at this rooftop!! We went at 6;30pm and it was HOT so I recommend going a little later in the evening when it's cooler- we loved the live music, amazing views of the lake, the cocktails, but mostly our server Cammy (I think that was her name) but she was amazing and really spoiled our friend for his birthday! Giving this 5 stars for the service- I highly recommend ordering the summer Sandie it was delicious!

reviews.author: Mazen A.
reviews.description: A beautiful rooftop space overlooking Town lake and the south Congress bridge. Somewhere I'd recommend for anyone looking to enjoy an intimate moment with some of the best drinks in the city. The view is spectacular, just stunning. The food options are a little limited due to their kitchen size, but we were still able to find a few suitable options. I'd recommend the place mainly for the beautiful view.

reviews.author: Liz S.
reviews.description: A gorgeous location with alright service, ok drinks, and meh food. I have a severe dairy allergy, which they worked with, so they automatically get at least a star. The location is worth another star. But, the drinks and food left much to be desired. My girl friends got the charcuterie board and said it was the worst one they have ever had! Such a bummer, we had high hopes.

reviews.author: Dina C.
reviews.description: Even though this place is not technically a dining spot their food options are delicious! We got some mock tails that tasted great but I don't really like paying alcohol prices for non alcoholic drinks haha. Food comes in small plates so we ordered a few and shared. The potatoes were a hit for the whole table! Definitely bringing my friends back here again

reviews.author: Ralph T.
reviews.description: Came here during the week after work with some coworkers.  They were fully booked on opentable but I called ahead and the hostess kindly reserved us a spot right by the water.  If we're being honest you mostly come here for the view and the ambiance.  However, everything I ate and drank was also really great.  Pro tip: try to arrive between 4-5 so you can order your first drink off their "happiest hour" menu.  My only complaint here is parking.  You can self park for up to 3 hours in the parking garage of The Line hotel and get it validated for $10, or you can find street parking yourself.  I personally don't mind hunting for street parking, but if you're coming with a group make sure your party knows what to expect.  It is downtown after all!

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Beautiful, enticing, mysterious is how I would describe the interior of P6, but that's where the compliments stop. P6 is beautiful for snacks and light drinks, but there was absolutely nothing I would return for (except the views). Each dish is shared with the table. For a table of 3 ladies, we ordered the Riviera Pastry Basket, Patatas Bravas, Spanikopita, the Seasonal Vegetable Frittata, and a pitcher of White Sangria. The Pastry Basket, Patatas, and the Frittata were incredibly dry and bland-- overcooked. I love a good crisp, white sangria, but this sangria tasted like water mixed with fruits...   Stay for the views, stay away from the menu.

reviews.author: Elise G.
reviews.description: This place was so cute! Perfect place to take a girlfriend visiting.  Pros: -Amazing views, perfect for a brunch or sunset happy hour. You're paying for the vibes and views, FYI. -Good pastries - loved the pastry basket -Friendly staff - shoutout to Gabriela (I hope I got her name right, the hostess!) who was so kind -Fun drink options / quick service  -Tables felt spaced out well   Cons: -You have to pay $10 for self-parking, and that's the validated price  -There's an automatic gratuity regardless of party size (not a big deal) and 3% "Covid surcharge for health and safety measures" which none of it goes to staff.  I'd be great with it if it included hazard pay, but considering they were all wearing their own masks and they were only spraying down tables, it seemed pretty shady to me.   Overall, good for a special occasion I'd say.

reviews.author: Mariana B.
reviews.description: We came for breakfast. It's a nice and spacious place. They brew coffee and beer. We ordered breakfast tacos, chilaquiles, bowl and croissant. Tacos is good, chilaquiles are very spice, croissant is good and bowl is ok. The latter and the hot chocolate came cold. The coffee was hot is good.

reviews.author: Brian T.
reviews.description: Okay this is my favorite coffee shop in the Austin area period.  I love how big and spacious this new location is, but the coffee is WHERE IT'S AT.  Definitely come here if you're looking for the perfect date spot, study/get work done, or just to enjoy a nice morning coffee and breakfast.  We ordered a hand pour over, a Chemex, and a double espresso.  The double espresso came out first and this one definitely packed a punch - don't let the espresso size cup fool you.  If I was just here for the caffeine content, this one definitely would've done the job alone.   The hand pour over came out next and the presentation was super impressive!  They bring you the entire carafe with the dripper on top, so it's definitely a lot.  Considering this is only $4, you definitely get your money's worth!  This one was so flavorful and the fruity notes definitely stood out while drinking it.  Now the Chemex...just wow.  For $5, they bring the entire Chemex setup to your table and you pour our of it as you drink.  The fact that they trust their patrons with the Chemex really speaks volumes about how much they care about the presentation piece!  Looks aside, this coffee (I believe we got Ethiopian) tasted amazing and on-par with the pour over.  Don't let me forget the breakfast tacos.  This was such a treat.  I got the Migas breakfast taco and this one was stuffed FULL with eggs, tortilla strips, and pico.  It was delicious and filling and for $3, this one definitely hit the spot alongside the coffee.  I also bought one of their coffee beer stouts to take home...I believe it was the House United coffee milk stout.  If taking home, you either order beer in a Crowler (two pint cans) or a Growler (64 oz).  I can't wait to try their coffee IN THEIR BEER.  But most of all, can't wait to come back here every time I'm in the area!

reviews.author: Thao E.
reviews.description: OH ! High anticipated location! I've been waiting for this location to open since they announced it on their Instagram.   They are having soft openings right now. The space is airy, has high ceilings, and gorgeous.   Being the soft opening, it looks like they are training some new people but they are nice as can be!  They also have Tacomaye on site now for your taco needs. I can't wait to make this my new work spot!  Support your local businesses!

reviews.author: Ru L.
reviews.description: The only thing this location doesn't have from the original is the coffee roaster. Other than that the beer is fresh, the coffee is hot, and the food is good. Tacos came fully filled with protein and veggies with two sides of salsa, one green, one red. Two thumbs up.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: This new location is the bomb! Prime selection of craft beer, coffee, tea, fountain sodas too. Plenty of seating, GREAT service, and super delicious food menu -- our favorite so far are the  carne asada loaded nachos -- a must try! Perfect for sharing . The place is really open and bright. Big screen TVs with sports playing. Family friendly. We love coming here for game night, dinner and cold beers.

reviews.author: Shannon A.
reviews.description: They care about their people because they had no kitchen on Independence Day.  The beer flight is great if your fickle or just want to try all the offing's.  It's not on the menu, but it's great.  Also had a London Fog that was absolutely delightful.  Looking forward to coming back for the soft shell crab!

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Nice location. Very clean and inviting. Knowledgeable and friendly  staff. Not a beer guy but the coffees and teas are solid.  It's not on the menu board, but they DO offer beer flights.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Been to this location several times, for both the coffee and the beer. Both are really good. Breakfast tacos are good. The soft shell crab sandwich was also good. The space is great for either socializing with friends or getting a little work done. Staff is friendly. Yeah, this is goi g to be a regular spot for me.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: Coffee review only. I've tried both locations multiple times hoping each time was a one-off. The coffee here is not good. Like really not good. Service has always been fine. Just really bad coffee.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: Food is average at best and the same cashier always gives me an attitude when I order for whatever reason.

reviews.author: Christy M.
reviews.description: This location is great! Nice open space and a good selection of beer. Haven't tried the food yet, but the coffee is also good.

reviews.author: Eric F.
reviews.description: Great decaf coffee and tacos were awesome but be warned the bacon is thicker than normal but still good.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: This is another place when we come down for a visit we always stop at! The coffee, beer, and food are fantastic! Then there is even dessert coffee.

reviews.author: Teresa M.
reviews.description: 2 stars for the new location - the beer is just as good as the original location and the food isn't bad, but there is zero character and no covered seating  This is Austin - people have dogs. I'm totally ok with sitting outside with my dog since you have a kitchen but man at least buy an awning or umbrellas or something. 4 random picnic tables thrown outside with no shade is an afterthought.

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Great coffee and amazing area to meet with friends or network on Wednesday mornings.  Stop in and support local.

reviews.author: Laura N.
reviews.description: I love the new location, closer to my home. The food and drink selection is superb. Service was fast and friendly. It's a big open room - simple but nice. The outside could probably be served better with some decor/ awnings or umbrellas. It's a good vibe inside and I'll be coming back!

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: Spacious, clean, industrial decor. Friendly service. Delicious coffee and breakfast tacos. The only thing I don't like is that they don't have comfortable seating. It's mostly wood picnic tables. There's one table that has chairs with backs and there are a few counter height chairs with backs. I love to hang out and linger at a coffee shop. This has the space, but it's just not comfortable. Adding  some cozy areas would make this place off the charts amazing.

reviews.author: Bri L.
reviews.description: Great brews, solid grinds and good people! The perfect local spot. Would highly recommend!

name: SLAB BBQ and Beer
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Robert C.
reviews.description: Food is very delicious and always hot very respectful the place is always clean 100 TOP NOTCH PLACE TO BE

reviews.author: Gretchen P.
reviews.description: The pork rib sandwich is to die for. That's all I've had here, but I've had it 3 times in the past 6 months, and it is great. Sides are just ok. My biggest complaint is that they do not serve wine, the bar keep told me they used to but it wasn't selling. So, that's a drawback for me. I am not a beer drinker.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: Back again to our favorite BBQ place. This time I gorged myself on brisket nachos with no onions or jalapeños.  Man oh man. The crispy chips. The tender, flavorful melt in your mouth, slap yo daddy and kick your cat good brisket. Tasty sweet BBQ sauce. Classic queso and what makes the whole plate a hit...chopped up pickles. A little burst of crisp vinegar to cut the richness of the cheese is a bite of what I hope clouds would taste like.   We drive from San Antonio to eat here and you should too. Call up your boo and tell them it's time to get weird and head to Austin.   What are you waiting on? Go on. Austin is calling.

reviews.author: Julia C.
reviews.description: Didn't want a sandwich, so ordered some brisket in a small salad. Yum! Fresh ingredients, flavorful brisket, and some jalapeño dressing with a KICK. The sides were delicious too. Will probably order a larger size if the potatoes...delicious!

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: Phenomenal! Food was so good. Loved the sauces too. The bar side is cute too. Smart idea to have one side more like a bar and one side a small place to eat inside. Didn't care for the plastic barriers but maybe this is required due to covid. I'm stuffed! We even have leftovers for dinner lol

reviews.author: Brad W.
reviews.description: Great local BBQ place. I had 2 meat sandwiches, pork and brisket with a small BBQ beans. VERY juicy and flavorful. Beans were great but slight on sweat side.

reviews.author: Stan V.
reviews.description: I've been a long time Patron of Slab off of the Burnett Location and this New Location doesn't disappoint.   Sometimes when there's a new location, there's a drop in quality, but not here.   Its actually 2x bigger, nice and bright, just missing the Hip Hop Feel of the original location.   If you like BBQ or BBQ sandwiches, then this is the spot for you.   They gots a variety of meats for your meat eaters, sorry, I'm not a vegetarian so I don't know what they got for folks here.   The Nachos are awesome, prob best to share than eat alone.  If you don't know what you like, give the Trio Sampler a try, its a very nice place to start.   All the other sandwiches are massive (and good), and will prob put me in the hospital if I eats them again, so my goto sandwich is the McDowell, oh man, puts the McRib or any Pork Rib to shame, its executed so well.  Always tender fall off the bone rib mean between your choice of bun, bbq sauce, and pickles, so good.   The Sides are ok, but the Desert is the best, the OG cookie is so drip!   Give this place a try, its great!

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: We were looking for a BBQ lunch spot and SLAB delivers! The meats are smoked to perfection and because we couldn't decide on what to try we got two of the best sampler options on the menu - the slider trio (chicken, pork, brisket) and the epic DONK sammich (all the meats - chicken, pork, brisket, sausage and all the sauces). We also tried two of their sides because YOLO - Gouda Mac and the twice baked potato casserole. Legit, UNBELIEVABLY good. My favorite out of the slider trio was the chicken - sauces were on point, chicken was tender and juicy. The Mac and cheese was EPIC - it's a wet Mac which I love. Super creamy, smoked Gouda is just divine. Twice baked tots were also good (but my heart belongs to the Mac). If you're here for epic then go with the DONK. Single portion was HUGE but it delivers on flavor! Stacked high with meats it's also smothered in delicious sauces, crunchy onions and jalapeños. Honestly, will come back for that! Beer selection is fantastic. Get you some SLAB!

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: I tried the other location and decided to try this one when I came into town. Long story short, it's really good. The service and the food. I got the slider trio and it was good, everything tasted fresh. My only issue, which is a personal preference is they didn't have enough bbq sauce. Overall I would highly recommend.

reviews.author: Tim D.
reviews.description: Stopped by for a Sliced Beef Sandwich and Drink, asked for it to be Lean with no onions/pickles and only a little sauce to go. For nearly $16.00 i was very disappointed to find not a single request was met. 1/3 of meat was fat, onions, pickles and drowned in sauce..

reviews.author: Janelle L.
reviews.description: It was my first time having SLAB so I wanted to try the trio to get a taste of the most popular sandwiches. Let's just say that it did not disappoint!  The portion sizes are HUGE, which is always a plus for me. The trio comes with the Texas O.G., Notorious P.I.G., and the Chicken W.A. All of the sliders were amazing, but my favorite has to go to the Chicken W.A.! Their dank white sauce is addicting!!!   For COVID-19, they are currently doing curbside takeout and limited dine in and patio service

reviews.author: Brianna E.
reviews.description: This place is pure heaven, every single time. The sink sandwich is AMAZING and huge! I also love the slider trio. Mac and cheese is great, and so is the potato salad. I haven't tried anything other than those items because they are just so good every time. They make their own bbq sauces which are for sale I believe, my favorite is the dank white!

reviews.author: Ali R.
reviews.description: Omg so yum! We got brisket nachos, the slider trio and we had to try the potato casserole. Definitely appreciate the queso coming on the side for to go orders. The nachos were big. Between the two of us, we had 1 slider each and about 1/4 of the nachos each. I didn't even have enough room to try the casserole... tomorrow's lunch for sure.   We'll definitely order from SLAB again!

reviews.author: Will C.
reviews.description: Got there early and thankful we did. Fills up even on Memorial Day. Brisket pork and chicken all cooked perfectly. We forgot to add any extra sauce as soon as we started eating

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: First time visit to SLAB (about two weeks ago) and we were impressed by the quality of the food, portion and reasonable price. Service was prompt and friendly.   We opted to dine outdoors and food was served right away. The sandwiches and sides were delicious. I had the Notorious PIG (perfect size for me) while hubby enjoyed the Texas Two Step with a side of potato salad.  I do recommend - can't wait to come back soon.

reviews.author: Lourdes A.
reviews.description: Looked forward to great BBQ with the high ratings and ended up being really disappointed with the food, maybe I came on a bad day. The brisket and buns were dry. The sauce made it better. Mac and cheese had a strong smoke flavor and that's about it. The potato casserole were more like bland mashed potatoes and tasted waterlogged. Banana pudding was an average vanilla pudding. The chicken and pork sandwich were okay.  At least the food presentation was nice.

reviews.author: Christopher M.
reviews.description: Amazing BBQ all around. I honestly can't pick my favorite. Sides are outstanding. The strawberry habanero sauce on the ribs are "loose yo damn mind". And finally the only think they don't put on The Donk is in fact the kitchen sink. Hint: I order the Donk in a wrap so you can actually handle it...otherwise grab and knife and fork for this sandwich. Honestly, when visitors come to ATX Slab is absolutely on the rotation.

reviews.author: Karly E.
reviews.description: Wow, that's all I have to say. Such a fun vibe - very young, very casual. We didn't get the chance to drink any of their beer however out of 6 different items we ordered we all really enjoyed it. They had some fun soda options, and great sauces. It was a quick eat so great if you are going out for a quick lunch or dinner. 8/10 recommend.

reviews.author: Imogen S.
reviews.description: Delicious food, good service, great take out packaging and super specials. Definitely worth a try, we go often. The Texas tornado sandwich/wrap is a real standout.

reviews.author: Lorien J.
reviews.description: This was among the worst barbecue we've tried in the region. Two sandwich combos plus tip was $50. We had a brisket+sausage sandwich and a pulled pork+mustard slaw sandwich, mac and cheese, and potato casserole.  Every dish was cold to lukewarm. Brisket and pork were both cold (some lukewarm bits), extremely dry, without flavor of their own, and severely under sauced. It helped when we asked for more sauce, but the meats were so dry that they soaked up moisture, and there was little flavor imparted. The smoked gouda mac and cheese was lukewarm, pure mush, and tasted like artificial smoke more than cheese. The twice baked potato casserole was just dry, grainy mashed potatoes. The mustard slaw had spice-heat but no flavor.  I couldn't finish my cold meal so I boxed it up and took it home, while my friend forced herself enough to be full and toss the rest. Once home I reheated it in a skillet and added more of the red sauce I'd requested, and then everything just tasted like sugar.   Disappointing.

reviews.author: Jack G.
reviews.description: I've been a regular at Lustre Pearl Tuesday trivia nights for a couple months now. First off, five stars to the hosts. I've been to many Geeks Who Drink nights at bars around Austin and the folks who run the show here have the right combination of humor, expediency, and most importantly music taste.  As far as Lustre Pearl itself - the bar food is nothing to write home about. The tacos are nice enough but they have off nights and on nights and for $5 a taco you can do much better elsewhere. The drinks are not terribly priced but just keep in mind this is a nicer bar in East Austin so you more or less know what you're in for. As far as the space itself, it would be nice to have more places to beat the heat but the outdoor space is quite nice - just make sure you grab some bug spray before you head out the door.  Overall, this is a solid bar and a great place to hang out on a week night. Check it out!

reviews.author: Cheyenne H.
reviews.description: This is my favorite bar in East Austin by a long shot.   I joined a cornhole league that played at Lustre Pearl East and it was the perfect outdoor bar setting. There are tons of murals around this bar (perfect for picture taking!) and picnic style tables outside. Most of the seating is outside with 4-5 tables inside, so definitely come on a nice sunny day. Lustre Pearl East also has a private event space that can be reserved. Parking is free and mostly along the street.  As for food, there are quite a few beers on draft and great food options. I order the brussels religiously and have never been disappointed... they're mixed with pretzels and topped with a savory sauce and beer cheese. Best brussels in Austin, and all for $7. I've had their wings and tacos too and both were delicious.  Of course I have to give a shout-out to the AMAZING bartenders at Lustre Pearl. They always remembered my order and welcomed me with a smile. Great people and great environment... definitely check out this bar if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Carl-andre R.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great ambiance and bar food / snacks are awesome. I recommend the loaded tots.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Lustre Pearl has a great location but everything else is forgettable at best. When I was craving a club sandwich, I eventually remembered seeing a club on their menu, so I biked over to try it. I'd been there a few times before, but like I said, it hadn't made much of an impression on me. Unfortunately, the club was a waste of money and a dinner. The menu didn't say it had mayo, but it was drenched in mayo. The bread was limp. The other fillings were fine, but the bread and the mayo ruined the rest of it for me.

reviews.author: Tipsy G.
reviews.description: Great interior, impressive open area. Space fills quickly for games and events. It's a great place close to downtown that is in my groups regular list.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: As summer rolls around and you find yourself wanting to enjoy the weather at an outside bar, one place to consider is Lustre Pearl.  I recently came by for a happy hour with co-workers and got to try a couple of their snacks off the menu as well as a drink such as the:  - Loaded Tots: these are topped with brisket, avocado, cilantro, sriracha, goat cheese, and chipotle aioli - I mean, look at my picture. I don't have to explain how good it was. You got to try this one!  - 6 Chicken Wings: we went with Garlic Rosemary and that was nice since I haven't had a flavor like that on wings before. I like the strong herbal flavor in that one.  - Adult Chicken Nuggets: we went with the Ranch Rub on this and I liked how different it was to the garlic rosemary flavor. This one is stronger and richer, a must try for any ranch lover.  - House Sweet Potato Fries: some sweet potato fries are hit or miss, and this was a hit. The spicy miso aioli that comes with it is a good pairing!  - Lustre Lemonade: as a sweet drinker who's favorite fruit is Strawberry, this is all I could want: vodka, strawberry syrup, lemon juice, and soda water. Great refreshing drink for a hot day.  All in all, I give them an 4/5 since I had a great time! Good food selection, good drink selection, various specials throughout the week, and fun atmosphere to come with friends. I suggest y'all come try them out!

reviews.author: Laurie P.
reviews.description: Came here before and had a pretty good experience despite it being super busy. Here tonight and one of the bartenders doesn't give a fuck. He shook my margarita twice before serving it, not proper or tasty. I'll be sticking with something canned if I get another.

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: I've been to LP twice now, once for lunch (pandemic-ending period) and once post pandemic for happy hour. Both visits were good! Plenty of outdoor seating, I've never seen that they have indoor seating but didn't explore too much. There is a house on the property that may have seating inside. I've had the loaded tots and the cheeseburger and both were excellent. Music is playing over the loudspeakers but not too loud. Gravel and cement flooring. Plenty of free street parking. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This place is definitely stepping up their game! I came back here for a birthday gathering and was very happy with the choice. The loaded tots were probably some of the best I've had, the bar tenders were funny's and personable, the house drinks were great, and the designated corn hole area was a hit. Can't say enough good things about this place!

reviews.author: Tony R.
reviews.description: Went here for lunch and didn't have a great experience. Bearded guy behind the register almost looked put out I came in to order something. Weird. When I got my food I went to get the utensils, loads of dirty knives and forks. I washed my own using their hand sanitizer on the side. Food was ok, had some weird strand of fluff or hair in my salad. Couldn't pinpoint exactly what it was but you have to step up the hygiene factor either way. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and come back again and hope for a better experience. Maybe that guy is usually more engaging and maybe their hygiene is usually better.

reviews.author: April J.
reviews.description: Just go to High Noon, instead. You're welcome.  I rarely leave reviews, but I still can't get over our experience here...  Generally: Vibe was very bro-y (very San Fran). Drinks were subpar. Music was all over the place. Service was disappointing (I'll get into that later). The only thing it seemed to have going for it was the outdoor space. It was nice, esp with right weather. Tho some of the tall tables were awkwardly big, I wondered if they were built during covid to have people 6 ft apart? Either way, we were already looking up a different spot because the atmosphere was quite dull and boring.   Personally: I really dislike being treated poorly, when the alternative is so simple.... so thought I'd share here because it all happened so suddenly I barely processed it.  My 2 friends and I had been there for less than an hour, talking and sitting at the giant table minding our business. Two of us were still sipping on the first drinks we ordered, my other friend had a soda.... When out of nowhere this short rando interrupts us by loudly tapping his bottle opener on the table and just says "YOU GOTTA GO". We look at him, annoyed, waiting for the punchline.  He must have realized we were confused, because only then did he decide to explain himself (in a rude accusatory tone, at that) "you can't stay here if your friend is throwing up in the bathroom". More confused, I instantly checked in with my friend who used the bathroom, to ask if she was feeling okay, because she wasn't even drinking (she literally asked for a coke at the bar). The bro just stared at us, until he walked away..  First off, There's a better way to approach people. Period. Use your words. Treat people with respect. It's really pretty simple.   Allow me to share some tips, for the wyt bro from last night: - Rather than tapping something loudly on the table like a child, an "Im sorry to interrupt you all." Or even an "Excuse me" as you're interrupting a conversation, would suffice.  - Rather than "YOU GOTTA GO" outta nowhere with zero explanation. Maybe an "I'm sorry, to have to do this. It's been suggested that your friend was throwing up in the bathroom, and as part of our policy, we're going to have to ask your group to leave". Use your words. - Or, you could actually do a decent job of assessing the situation and use your skills to read the room and recognize that the person you accused was not displaying any OTHER signs of intoxication because they were not drunk (or even drinking at your establishment). A check-in with our group could have also informed you to make a better decision. You could have also given a warning. There are actually several alternatives than following your ego trip.  But really, how cliché, another wyt bro doing the bare minimum, knowing he could go on in life giving zero effort to be decent. How original...  Secondly, We weren't some blacking out college students barely able to stand on 6th (who, by the way, also wouldn't deserve such a shitty response). We were sitting, chatting, coherent, physically functioning, PAYING patrons, sipping on meh drinks at your boring establishment.  None of us were making a scene. None of us showing signs of being affected by alcohol. My accused friend did NOT even order a drink there. She didn't have to be embarrassed by that bro - she hadn't even shared with us that her stomach was upset, yet. AND she had just shared that there was literally people hooking up in the other stall, like lol what kinda place are yall running?   Also, you do know there are other reasons why grown ass women (who aren't drinking) would gag in bathroom, right? Did you ever think about that? We had just walked over after having a 5 course meal at Intero. She said she was feeling odd and that all she did was gag in the bathroom. Like use your best judgment, vato. Read a book.  Third of all, we are literally sitting there checking out the new Lustre with my friend who is part owner of a bar on Cesar Chávez. We know the law. This was all so poorly handled. We didn't get into it then, because it wasn't worth the energy. But there's a reason there are other MULTIPLE signs listed for bartenders to be trained to spot intoxication: * Slurred speech * Confusion or disorientation * Loss of coordination * Delayed reflexes * Slow, irregular breathing * Unresponsiveness * Nausea and vomiting  And, if as a bartender, you're still compelled to ask a group to leave because their non drinking friend gagged, then at the very least approach people with respect.   Do better.

reviews.author: Alex R.
reviews.description: This place's scenery and outdoor seating were so nice and comfortable. Felt super safe. Their daily happy hour deals are also so good and such a good deal! My friends and I loved it here. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice, chill atmosphere to grab appetizers and drinks!

reviews.author: Thep T.
reviews.description: Great spot to kick it with friends. Low key, casual, and decent food too! The wings are some of the tastiest around.

reviews.author: Caitlin R.
reviews.description: Loved the atmosphere, staff, food and especially drinks. I brought my dog with me and she had a great time. The drinks here are made very well - not too sweet or overtly strong. My table ordered the adult nuggets, tots, sweet potato fries, and the chopped beef sandwich (which is brisket). The tots were definitely my favorite and easily shareable. I had the chopped beef sandwich and it was pretty good - wish it came with a side for the price you pay. This is definitely a great place to hangout or on a weekday - " work from home "

reviews.author: Max W.
reviews.description: We came to this place because of a recommendation from a friend. As soon as we arrive, we sit down at a table, there are no heaters or service. So we are slowly freezing to death in the cold. But hey, it could get better, maybe we can order some whiskey to warm us up right? WRONG! As soon as I leave my seat, to go order drinks for our group, I immediately get harassed by four power hungry servers/bartenders that tell me to put a mask on even after governor Abbot  stated that no more businesses require customers to wear masks. The main reason I'm giving a one star is because we were the only customers in the bar and there were no heaters in the blistering cold, service sucked, and the staff were extremely rude when they definitely could have handled it more professionally. Just be polite next time! Unfortunately we won't be coming back. Cheers.

reviews.author: Randee D.
reviews.description: I really love this bar... the drinks are great, the staff is attentive... but I went in there today and it was FREEZING! I guess their heater's broken or something?? Well... THIS Texan ain't going back till the heat gets fixed! And I love it there, too. BOO!

reviews.author: Cameron M.
reviews.description: I've been playing ping pong at lustre east for 4 years as it's become a staple to the up and coming east Austin bar scene. Great food, great beer and l served from a friendly, well trained staff.   Writing this after just visiting a new and crowded outdoor bar down the road. The staff was so rude and inexperienced. We left to seek the better experience to be had at lustre east.

reviews.author: Michael E.
reviews.description: Fun restaurant/bar located in East Austin. The original house which was on Rainey Street is there and open for business, which is fun.  Ambiance: Good selection of outdoor games and music playing. Nice indoor area as well as a lot of outdoor area. Dog friendly.  Service: The service staff is relatively friendly. I have been here quite a few times and most of the time it is good, but I have had poor service as well  Food/Drinks: I wish they had a better selection of beer to my liking, but they do have quite a few taps to choose from. Their food for a bar is actually really good. Their wings, a little salty, and pretty tasty along with their burgers and tots.  Definitely worth checking out

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Been to Lustre Pearl East twice now. Once for drinks and once for food takeout. Wasn't entirely impressed with either experience. The bar is OK, but I prefer the Rainey location. Food left me less impressed, and I don't understand all the good reviews. I had a torta and it seemed overpriced and underwhelming. Won't be ordering food from here again. :(

reviews.author: Sarah B.
reviews.description: This review is a tough one for me. I'm a Lustre Pearl girl that goes back to its original beautiful old house when it was the only place on Rainey St.  How happy I was when they moved the old house to my neighborhood. It quickly became my normal stomping grounds where everyone knows my name. Cheers.  I could go into a number of things that makes this place imperfect. But honestly what's perfect is the staff and the friendly regular faces.  So now you're wondering why 2 stars???  After countless years of being customers, my husband and I were banned after asking for the lights to be dimmed.  We first asked our bartenders about these odd spotlights at the bar, who told us they were directed by Ryan (manager) that the lights couldn't be touched, against their own wishes as well. The lights were set for "closing time"... get your Sh*t and get out inviting kind of style.  As regulars, we like things to be regular. The same ol' food, the ol' regular drink, and the same neighborhood bar lighting. Ryan's reply was a snarky  "Well I like it the way it is." Which left us to ask for the check in return.  After being a manager for 7 years myself and now an owner of my own business... if my customer asked me for an easy accommodation to make them comfortable, I'd do it in a heartbeat.   We started coming here before people even realized they re-opened. We've watched it become popular over time. My response... "Well I like it the way it WAS." Call me sentimental missing the way things used to be.

reviews.author: Erik A.
reviews.description: Can't say much about the sodas they're good not going to lie but my main go to is the lemonade five stars all day son

reviews.author: Ronnie W.
reviews.description: Maine Root Root Beer has a nice smooth flavor. It tends to be a little more on the spice side meaning the wintergreen and anise really come through when tasting it. Not too strong on the carbonation like some of the mass produced ones can be.  It is an all natural soda using Fair Trade ingredients. Of all the root beers I have tasted and reviewed, this one is at the top of my list.

reviews.author: Dan M.
reviews.description: :::MAINE ROOT ROOT BEER::: Ok... so it's "Fair Trade" Certified with "Organic Cane Juice..." and like most things I've had with those big label stamps... it's not so good...  Oh well... NEXT!!!

reviews.author: Mary M.
reviews.description: I am not a thin crust person. I'm just not. Aviator's pizza crust is the perfect thickness to me, where you can enjoy the bread as well as the toppings. Their garlic pizza is one of my favorites, but the cheese burger and south Austin are also solid choice.   We always have to get their mozzarella bread because the cheese/garlic/butter/crust combination makes it one of the best things on the menu.   They have a huge rotating beer selection and plenty of seating if you're wanting to eat there. I've taken pizza to go a few times too and it transports well.

reviews.author: Sean Matthew L.
reviews.description: Aviator Pizza was solid, not amazing, but okay. We grabbed togo and picked it up on our way home from the gym so we could just collapse and eat some pizza. We got one white pie with arugula on top. It tasted like the greens weren't washed, and they were all wilted and slimy by the time the pizza got home 10 minutes later.   The other pizza was better with a variety of meats and veg on top. But overall the dough felt a little undercooked on both and generally was a bit chewy.   I'd be willing to try this spot again and likely sit down to eat it in person and hope that it's better right out of the oven, maybe it just doesn't travel well? But pizza is a notoriously delivered food item, so I would hope that's not the case.   All in all, i'm not that impressed but willing to give them another go.

reviews.author: Luna J.
reviews.description: The dough need a little more salt but overall there are good pizzas!!!  A little to bright inside. They should dimmer the lights a little.   Great for take out!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place! Variety of pizza choices. All are delicious! Plus beer  Service is friendly. Great date night.

reviews.author: Dan M.
reviews.description: So ... views of photos over past 90 days at record high: 197k, but views of reviews down to 10.5k from 32k over past 90 days. I think this means I should write about pimps and gangsters in purple Cadillacs.   No ... there were no purple Cadillacs here. Sorry! And I was the only one there. But I got me a pizza and a salad (no beer). Then went next door and dropped $300 in a cash game at Shuffle 512 because a Facebook friend/fan sat right next to me and we were having fun and gambling.   If I had gone in to Shuffle 512 first, I might have won. Therefore, theoretically, this was a $300 pizza and salad. I'd leave a woah emoji, but not sure if it will show up on Yelp. I mean, the emoji comes up but I have tried it before and it was just a weird space. And I don't want you to associate me with pimps, gangsters, and weird spaces (purple Cadillac okay).   As far as the pizza goes, traditional bar pizza. Good not great. Salad pretty solid. Atmosphere very good but I was there early so not 100% sure.   Overall, recommended as a feeler to see if it's for you.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: I mean their pizza is amazing!! Chicken bacon ranch! The el nacho Mexican pizza too omg my favorite. Everyone at our table kept wanting a piece of it. It was that good!  We also got the South Austin, the one with prosciutto and arugula which was good but next to the chicken bacon ranch and the El Nacho... it's was just good not GREAT

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: First time here recently; we had planned on 'waiting' here while our daughter got a haircut next door but it turned out we were hungry so we ordered ceasar salads and a large meaty pizza.  I ordered Dem Berries beer and my honey ordered a mic ultra.  The pizza was a-m-a-z-i-n-g!!!!! The bread was out of this world.  The toppings were fresh and had delicious flavors.  The staff were nice however we asked for her to change the TV to the TX/OU game but she kept forgetting.  We asked her again and finally tried to locate it however the cable they had didn't allow the game so we had to watch it on our phone.  We wished they offered nicer plates and flatware; they gave us paper plates and plastic forks but we aren't fancy people so it was all good.  The place was super clean and relaxing.  I would definitely recommend this venue.

reviews.author: Sergio V.
reviews.description: Saw $3pints 7-9PM Tuesdays, on their online menu.. the bartender said that wasn't a thing. When I asked available deals, he also said happy hour ends at 6, when the menu also said 7-9PM. I ordered a 12in/ 3 topping and 2 beers, $30. I saw the tip auto generated to $12, so I lowered it due to false information and frustration w the employees. Today my Aviator transaction is $50 for a 12in and 2beers Definitely felt ripped off.

reviews.author: Stefano S.
reviews.description: Order 2 different meals and receive one food and another one with empty without any grease (pepperoni pizza) and called the store manager, Gerardo and express about what was happened. Suddenly Gerardo felt so lousy and decided to sacrifice his time to make delivery to my apartment personally.  So I must be say this what this is Good Samaritan and I'd recommended this place

reviews.author: Amy-Michele M.
reviews.description: Food is great quality! Has many choices on draft. The staff have been friendly and hard working. The food comes out in a quick pace. Will go again.

reviews.author: Lary K.
reviews.description: Want to give it 3.5 but isn't an option. Love the Pizza when it's consistent.. like the service when it's consistent..  luckily it's been tasty more than it hasn't...

reviews.author: Stacy S.
reviews.description: I have ordered take out and dined in person and have had a great experience every time!! Pizza is delicious and customer service is top notch. We love a local place that cares about their customers!! Definitely will be back.

reviews.author: William W.
reviews.description: Ate here with my sister and nephew. First off the pizza is great and love the beer selection BUT after ordering I used the restroom and there was a crew member that used the restroom at the same time and didn't wash their hands. I brought this up in comments about how they were doing when I had my receipt emailed. It seems whoever answered back did a half ass apology by saying maybe they were washing their hands in a different sink or were intending to wear gloves. I'm sorry but I don't wanna eat at somewhere where a higher up thinks it's appropriate for a worker to use the restroom not wash their hands put on gloves and touch my food.

reviews.author: Eric E.
reviews.description: We just arrived in town on Sunday night and needed dinner. We called and ordered a specialty pizza for pickup. It was ready super fast. The price was reasonable. The staff definitely appeared to be on top of COVID precautions.   The pizza was so so. The crust didn't impress. Sort of like a grocery store premade crust from a bag. The toppings were just kinda blah. The pizza didn't feel incredibly hot for being just out of the oven.   There was nothing wrong. It just wasn't all that. Maybe it was an off day.

reviews.author: Garrett O.
reviews.description: Enjoyed our first visit to Aviator, and we'll plan to try it again on another day.  We grabbed a few beers ($5-7/each) and ordered a caprese salad ($11) to start. Unfortunately, it came out late and exactly with our pizza ($25 for a '18 pie with pepperoni, mushrooms, and roasted garlic toppings).  The beers were great, and they had plenty of local selections to choose from. I would not get the caprese salad again because it's overpriced for the small portion size. The large pizza was great size, and with the salad, we had half to take home. While the ingredients and toppings were fresh, they didn't bake the pizza to order (disappointed because we asked for well done, but it still came out a bit doughy).  Overall, it's a bit of a premium price point, but likely worth a shot at a few other menu options.   Last note- the patio area is perfect for sitting outside on a nice afternoon/evening, so hope to bring a few more friends next time.

reviews.author: Patricia D.
reviews.description: We love this place! The staff is extremely accommodating and helpful. One lady (I'm sorry I don't remember her name) tried three different propane heaters before giving up and calling out her manager Angel, who switched tanks and expertly wrangled the fickle device to make sure we were nice and toasty.  The food is excellent. I particularly like the cinnamon dessert. Best. Crust. Ever. The constantly rotating selection of alcoholic beverages is perfectly splendid. I would recommend some great beers but you likely will not make it in time; you can never tire of the same old selection! (I recommend the Pineapple IPA and the Cherry Sour). I highly recommend gracing this fine establishment during these trying times, and enjoying a great atmosphere with wonderful people and excellent food and drink. Bonus: all this while staying safe with their proactive pandemic protocols.

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: I can't tell you how many times I've thought about this place after eating here last weekend. They have a great selection of craft and local beers. (They even had the amazing electric jellyfish hazy ipa- one of my al time favorites). We ordered the basil and goat cheese breadsticks that came with ranch and marinara, and went straight to the pecan cinnamon breadsticks. The dough here is amazing... it's light but manages to have that slightly chewy texture. It's seriously SO GOOD. And the toppings/garnishes are great quality. You know the food is amazing when I forget to take a single picture because I'm too busy stuffing my face. Definitely can't wait to come back.

reviews.author: Claire P.
reviews.description: We went in with high expectations and those expectations were met! Absolutely delicious pizza and focaccia. Came out fresh, hot, and full of flavor. Draft beer was super cold and a plus was we could bring our pup on the patio! Our waitress was super sweet and service was quick and efficient.

reviews.author: John G.
reviews.description: Ordinary pizza. After reading the reviews, I expected way better. Especially at this price point.  I brought a friend of mine after we hit the range and we had dinner. I was excited after reading reviews about the place. I LOVE pizza! And I'll eat pretty much whatever pizza you put in front of me. But that doesn't mean I can't taste it and don't have my preferences.  The dough is thick, which I like. But, as a result, it was doughy and not cooked all the way through. The curst was not crispy. Not even close.  The toppings tasted good, I'm pretty sure they are fresh. The tomato sauce is pretty good. But my pizza should have had more tomato sauce. It was light on the cheese. The rest, pretty decent.  Again, it's not that it was a bad pizza. But there's people saying in their reviews how this is the best pizza in Austin or how they were blown away or their friends were asking where they got it, etc. So I expected greatness. It didn't hit the mark. There's great potential. Just need to up their game, which includes cooking it better.  And again, at this price point, it needs to be a damn good pizza. I do want to try it again. I hope I just was there on an off day.

reviews.author: Walker F.
reviews.description: Been going here since they opened, and it's been a pandemic staple in our house.   Dine in has always has always been a good time since kiddos can run around outside while we hang on the large (dog-friendly) patio. There are large family-style bench tables indoor, but we only dine there if we are desperate for A/C. (There are two TVs which engage the little one for long enough to eat.) Staff here is always friendly. I love it when they are not busy and I can try some of the beers. It's not huge, but it's a varied selection. (They will let you sample any time of course, but its different when there are people in line behind you.) They do offer growlers to-go (along with menu items of course).  I should admit, as many times as we've eaten here, I only get one thing, the first pizza I've ever tried: The Flying Garlic. It's the best damn pizza I've ever had. The toppings are top notch (roasted garlic!? yaaaas) but the crust is a little like kolache dough: ever so slightly sweet. No crust left behind! I've sampled the Hawaiian (add bacon) my husband and daughter always share, it too is delicious.    Lucky to have this spot nearby!

reviews.author: Zach Y.
reviews.description: Came to this spot right before an Austin FC game! Grabbed a beer and the service was great! This is a really great spot to pre game before the GAME   It also seemed like the food looked amazing!

reviews.author: Tristán Ô.
reviews.description: Aka for Matt.   Came in at 11:30pm on a Saturday night, server Matt was a real f*** boss. Extra cool, hard worker, and sickest service I've had. This is coming from a Californian. Screw downtown Austin pop into Brass Tap w/MATT as ur server n you'll be ready to crush the night.   Ps: most beer ive ever seen available in my life, breweries suck,  Brass Tap the future bb.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: I was impressed at first but then things went downhill. I don't have time for an eloquent review, so here's the quick and dirty...  The good:  Happy Hour deals. The hh burger was good for $7 in my opinion.  Good atmosphere, in and out.  Friendly service.  Live music.  Wide menu.  Kid-friendly until 9. Close parking.  Good place to stay for hours and hours.  Generous cheap side salads.  Pretzel appetizer.   Cookie skillet with ice cream.   The bad: Poisoned my friend by serving her a known allergen.  Forgetful service.  Mushy fries. Did they boil them?! Bland house-made tater tots. Frozen tots would have been better.  Ruined my salad by drenching it with dressing.  Other friends didn't like the burger.  Added things to the wrong tab.

reviews.author: Ruth Y.
reviews.description: My fiancé and I were looking to have lunch at the Domain and happened to see this place close to where we parked. The main reason he wanted to try it was to watch hockey.  We were immediately greeted and told to take a seat anywhere we wanted, a precursor to the excellent service that we received the entire time we were there.  The place is very spacious with a bunch of tables and bar seating, as well as plenty of outdoor seating, and a bunch of TVs. There is also what appears to be a stage space, most likely for their events like trivia and bingo. We sat at the bar and ordered drinks. It was a Sunday early afternoon so it was pretty quiet. We ordered a side of Buffalo roasted cauliflower per recommendation. My fiancé got the impossible burger with a side Caesar salad and I got the smoked pork quesadilla also with a side Caesar salad.  All the food came out relatively quickly and pretty much all at once. I obviously was too excited for the food because I forgot to take pictures of them! The portions were the perfect size and the side salads were not sad like some other watery small portions that you might get elsewhere. My fiancé enjoyed his burger and my quesadilla had a great texture and came with pickled onions, sour cream, jalapeño slices, and shredded lettuce.  Shout out to the service for being extremely friendly and fast, constantly checking in on us. We definitely want to come back to this place!

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: Just can't get beyond these pretzel bites SOAKED in oil. Squishy.... you could pinch them and drip the oil out. I'm at a loss for words in regard to the preparation of this. Check the oil pools in the pictures. I wouldn't recommend this appetizer at all.   - PRETZELS - $10 Fresh baked pieces with white queso and spicy brown mustard (680 CAL.) -   Sooo..... Baked and then dipped in Oil? Also, avoid that queso. As far as ambiance... It was noticeably hard to ignore a certain mildew type odor while sitting. Sit outside if you must! But, plenty of other places you can go instead in that area.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: With a large group. Spot on service - Sam did a great job managing our rambunctious crew! Great selection of beer, full bar. Management should spend a couple bucks to update the menus. Food was okay but not the primary reason we were here.

reviews.author: Bryan D.
reviews.description: For our anniversary we were excited about the other Yelp! Reviews. The queso looked amazing in the pictures.   First off, the service was nice and attentive.  The chips were warm and the queso was fine but not the start we expected. Disappointing.  We were hoping to try several of their beers but since the appetizer was less than average, we had a beer each. The Lagunitas Sumpin Sumpin was nice and the 512 IPA was wonderful.   One of the best IPAs hands down.   We each had a beverage, ate our chips and moved on.

reviews.author: Diego M.
reviews.description: I wanted to grab a quick brew with my boy from college and this place was the perfect spot for that.   The beer here was really good! Come during happy hour where flights are $7. You really can't beat that since they're heavy pours. I'd highly recommend the Texas flight.  The atmosphere and vibe was dope. They had live music and she sang EVERYTHING under the sun.. from 70s to Michael Jackson to The Weeknd. Definitely made the place awesome.   Our server was great too! Highly recommend to stop by and grab a beer.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I stopped by the Brass Tap on a Wednesday night after getting our nails done across the street. Cool vibe, big tables, seat yourself social distancing, and quite a few TVs. Servers kind of rotate between tables to make sure everyone is taken care of so they're super attentive. We had one main server though and she was sweet and personable. They had three different menus, which was kind of confusing, but we realized one was their main menu, the second was someone they partnered with, and the third was for their Smokehouse BBQ only served on Wednesday nights.   Go for the bbq! I was pleasantly surprised how delicious the bbq was. I got the two meat plate that came with two sides. The sweet potato fries and brussel sprouts were both delicious. My friend got the loaded sweet potatoes and really enjoyed it. Overall, we had a good time with some good eats! Would definitely go back again!

reviews.author: Aleta N.
reviews.description: I have come here a couple times now and I absolutely love it here! Good drinks and great service.   The patio is really nice and well lit. Good amount of tables and social distancing is very easy on the patio.   I love the servers here. In particular Janson was great! Super kind and approachable, very attentive. Super great service.   The food is good I've gotten the jalapeño poppers and the fried pickles. Both were really good  The drinks are phenomenal and I love how much variety there is with the beer.   Overall a great time.

reviews.author: Susan W.
reviews.description: This is a difficult review of the Brass Tap Beer and Food restaurant at the Domain. Why you say?  I am getting out more and the Domain is one of my favorite places to shop(carefully), eat and people watch! Sunday I met my two adult grandchildren at the awesome Domain Shopping Center. After completing our initial agenda of a haircut and some shopping we were starving. When the three of us get together and we're going to eat 99% of the time we choose a place we haven't tried before.  There sat the Brass Tap Tavern.  As always, I took a look at yelp for reviews and the majority were very positive-always a good sign! We've gone to a small handful of restaurants that are available at the Domain but in the spirit of adventure we decided to try The Brass Tap.  It was a Sunday afternoon around 430 ... so absolutely not what I would consider prime time for eating. The Decor was beautiful. The interior huge, lots of brass which is beautiful, and a very smart, but earthy feel. A large screen TV on the wall which is standard these days but often takes away from the beauty of an establishment. They also have a decent size patio available and since the tavern is on a corner it wraps around it. At that time of the day on a Sunday there was one table inside that was occupied, and probably about eight tables occupied outside where we sat down. It took us a bit to see our waiter approaching with a huge front and back beer menu, along with a very cool looking food menu. It was obvious that he was feeling rushed however he did take the time to answer a couple of questions we had about the beer menu and he took our order. I let him know we would be eating also as he was already rushing off and said he would be right back to take it. 20+ minutes later he stopped back after delivering beer to at least two tables on that trip. We decided to order an appetizer to share. Due to our elevated hunger level everything sounded delicious so we opted to get the combo platter. It consisted of Boom Boom Shrimp, House-Made Tots with beer cheese or jalapeño beer cheese and Chicken Tenders with BBQ sauce on a bed of House-Made Angry Onion Straws - $15 this was an average size appetizer. I personally ate a couple tater tot's and some onion strings. There were also three different dipping sauces, one a barbecue sauce, one a queso cheese sauce and one that was kind of tangy with a little bit of heat. My grands polished off everything else that was on the platter. Our main dishes arrived shortly after we had gotten our appetizer. My grandson ordered a half pound Angus burger called The Pub it was  Jalapeño cream cheese, smoked Gouda, Applewood bacon, lettuce, tomato, cowboy sauce on a butter brioche bun - 11it came with french fries. The fries looked great as was the construction of the burger and toppings. Sadly the burger was requested medium rare and arrived medium to well done. After waiting on our food over 1/2 hr. the grandson decided not to request it be redone. My granddaughter ordered the PERI PERI GRILLED CHICKEN PANINI with Goat cheese, hummus on grilled Ciabatta bread - 10. It also came with fries. It looked good and my granddaughter really enjoyed it. When I asked her what "Peri Peri sauce was She couldn't explain. Since I didn't want something that heavy(The Panini) but I wanted to know what that sauce was I ordered  the 3 BEER BATTERED COD  Tacos. They were dressed with lettuce , cheddar jack and pepper jack cheeses, Peppadew peppers and drizzled with Peri Peri aioli - 8.5 ,my tacos were served with some chips and tiny salsa on the side. I was glad the Peri Peri was only drizzled over my fish tacos as I didn't care for it. To each his own! So our tab for our appetizer,meal, one nonalcoholic bottled beer one draft beer and one beer described as more like wine was $61.86. For us the food rang out at about a 3.9 (out of 5.0), the beverages, we really didn't think my granddaughter would like the nonalcoholic beer but she tried it and as it turns out she doesn't like it. I ordered what was described to me as NOT tasting like a beer at all but like a sweet wine (I guess I must've missed the wine list because the website says they offer it)-after two sips that was enough of that. This is definitely not the Brass Taps fault as I am not a beer drinker but since I said that out loud before ordering off a two sided menu that looks like all beer I would've wished our waiter would have advised me that they did serve wine. All  of us rated the service a 1.5 out of 5.0.    I am not mentioning the name of the server purposefully. Although he could have told me they had wine that really is all I can say related to him.  The major faux pas for us was how long it took to get anything to eat or drink.

reviews.author: Alex P.
reviews.description: Jake, Holliday, and Robbie were superb. Absolute blast to have tending bar. They made me feel welcome, were supernknowledge about drinks and made me want to stay  forever. Such a great experience.

reviews.author: E H.
reviews.description: Good variety of beers. I wouldn't bother much with the food. I ordered the appetizer combo, it was overpriced and underwhelming.

reviews.author: Don R.
reviews.description: So beer is good but you can get that anywhere. We had the pretzel bites. Worst thing ever. Love pretzels but they seemed to be from the freezer to being cut up and dipped in oil. Inside was mush we told the server and he just let us know how much he loved them. Although we did not eat but 3 still charged.  Bartenders behind bar vaping, not professional.  I would avoid this spot.

reviews.author: A. N.
reviews.description: Came in on a Sunday night as we're staying at the Domain. Place was empty. Two dozen big screens showing the Simpsons. Ordered an app and a flight with the intention of having dinner and watching the NFL game. Asked if the football game would be on and the server said sure. A few minutes later the screens tuned to a soccer game. Funny. We didn't stay. Upside - they had all the beers in the flight.

reviews.author: Ron M.
reviews.description: I've been sitting here for 30 minutes with only getting my beer. The service sucks. It's terrible because they have a fantastic beer selection and they lost my business

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: We chose to celebrate our New Year's Eve at the Brass Tap after snagging a few tickets for the 'Silent Rave' being hosted there that night. Since it was our first time attending such an event, going into it we thought things were going to be awkward, when in fact it was the complete opposite. Everyone had their headphones on, singing and dancing to one of three DJ's that were playing simultaneously on different radio channels. Even on this special night, the drinks were priced normally so kudos to that. This event turned out to be a very social affair.   If you're planning on going to an event like this, especially at the Brass Tap (Domain), I would recommend coming earlier than most to 1) grab a table to have a place to set drinks, otherwise how are you going to dance the way you want to dance? and 2) the line to get event headphones gets decently long and checking out the devices isn't a quick process.   5/5 for a fun organized event, clean venue, friendly bartenders, and a great night out.

reviews.author: David R.
reviews.description: I stopped in while shopping and waiting for folks.  I live in Round Rock so been to that (older) location many times.  The atmosphere is quite different in each location with the RR one being more cozy and pub like.  This is more open and like a sports bar.   Now, on to the pricing.  This location seems more expensive than the RR one.  Other than Happy Hour and Friday fun day when beers and some cocktails are cheaper, the prices were high.  A well bourbon (Evan Williams) and diet was $7.50.  A draft beer was $7.50.  A Bulliet old fashioned was $16.50 (charged as a double). RIDICULOUS for a mid level sports bar (no NFL ticket)!!  So be prepared to help pay their rent at the Domain (which I understand is high).  Overall I like it as I like the one in RR. Different vibe but great selection of beer and cocktails. Great old school video games to play (Galaga, ms pacman, Dig Dug, etc).   The environment is nice and I think they have a DJ on certain nights.  Food seems like high end bar food which is as it should be.  I will definitely come back but it will be for happy hour or some other special.  #discountdave

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: We came for Happy Hour and will likely be back!  I am not a huge fan of the staff here, always seem like they have something better to do. The happy hour started at 4pm and provides lots of tasty options.   We've been into wine lately, so we got the house red and sangria. They offered $4 shots and $7 drink of the day. The food options are priced at $5,6,7 and $8. We ended up getting the 3 Korean BBQ Pork Sliders with fries and 2 chicken tacos with chips and salsa. We were both dumbfounded by how much food you get with the happy hour specials.   Despite the lacking service at this location, we still had a okay time. Go in expecting lackluster and you won't get disappointed. ‍ They have a wonderful selection of beers as well, and a full menu. I provided the happy hour selections in my photos!

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Great service and a great selection of beers. Rotating taps so there is always something new week to week. I've been frequenting this location every Monday evening for the last 6 months and has yet to be disappointed. Great environment

name: Knomad Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Mariana M.
reviews.description: Best local bar/lounge in East Austin, love coming here!!! Such a smooth environment with the best margaritas and good music

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: I've been coming to Knomad now for a few years, and while it's location may be deceiving, the inability to find parking outside should be a good indicator! It's definitely our "go-to" local bar, and we pop in and out usually at least once a week, even it's for just for a quick drink. The management is the NICEST, most gracious bunch you could ask for, and they are almost always present, making sure everyone is happy and tended to. The bar staff is all phenomenal, no matter what time you go in. The have a game room, several TV's/projectors, and even have live music on certain nights.
