They have a great Sunday brunch deal that really can't be beat. They pour a great drink, and have a nice pizza menu to order from as well!   They have an awesome, very large, dog-friendly patio with tv's, heaters, and misters. They have plenty of dog bowls for your pup, and a water cooler inside for you to use. They have a great sense of community too, and often have events going on that are open to everyone. Huge thanks to Miguel, Tammy, Jordan, and Audrey for always being the best bar staff in town!

reviews.author: Jaxon E.
reviews.description: Best local bar for this neighborhood, owner is cool and friendly. Lauren the bartender made me the best long island iced tea i ever had. I even go there alone just to soak up the vibes and atmosphere. Overall great place

reviews.author: Stephanie G.
reviews.description: So here's the thing, we were coming to Knomad back when it was Nomad.  We lived walking distance away in the Windsor Park neighborhood about 3 years ago before moving further north.  This was before kids, a mortgage, and all the other amazing perks of adulthood.  We were just 2 kids in love hanging out at the bar with friends.  But then we thought we'd get married and the very next day had brunch at Nomad.  When we got our first pup together we brought him to Nomad.  Even when I was pregnant Nomad owner stopped by to congratulate us.  So see, Nomad is more than a bar to us.  It's where where our roads crossed, it's where we made friends and created a family.  We don't get to make it there often these days, but Nomad will always be home!

reviews.author: Tisha T.
reviews.description: 4/9 update--- Hey there Miguel, clearly this is still fresh in your mind, since you're leaving messages on here at 4AM nearly two weeks later. I've let this go, and it would be in your best interest to do the same, this isn't a good look from a PR standpoint. Yes, I originally had fun in your establishment nearly two years ago, I wrote an honest review then, just as I wrote an honest review of what happened in your place last month. Let's not continue to rehash this, ok? You refuse to apologize for the behavior of your employee, and I refuse to return to your place, so let's call this square.  Never contact me again.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Update: Since posting my experience here I have received an intimidating Personal Message from one of the "regulars" here that basically said I misinterpreted my experience here as racism because the owner is a minority and that there are sometimes bartenders of color that work here. First off, what I witnessed was racism, plain and simple. And, for someone to try and brush it off as me "misinterpreting" it as "some other reason for your friend not getting service as fast as she would like", just goes to show the type of patronage here.  I also received a comment from the owner about not calling his bar "overtly racist" when it isn't. I am sorry to say I will not be removing that statement from my review as it was my initial experience there. That is the beauty of capitalism, freedom of choice, and having a review site to state your experiences openly and truthfully. I had absolutely no idea of this place before coming here, so there is no ill will or underhanded plot. However, when my friend and I experience something like that, especially in this day and age, I take the "see something, say something approach".   Respectfully, sir, if you don't want your establishment viewed in this light, then do not have employees who selectively treat patrons, especially new ones, in such a manner and then when confronted be a complete jerk about it. This all could have gone a completely different way had your bartender just apologized for ignoring my friend and served her. But, instead, he was the one who chose to escalate it and make race an issue. As a compassionate human person and a productive member of society, I chose the most vocal platform I had access to to bring this to the Community's, which you also reference in your reply, attention to ensure it is addressed and hopefully does not happen again. It is your customer's choice to read and heed my review and if it does have an affect on your patronage, you may need to ask instead of pointing blame outward, to look in-house.  Also, in response to my claim of racism in regards to our treatment here "being a dangerous road to go down", it absolutely is, but not because of the "mob mentality" of me and my fellow Yelpers voicing our experience. It is a dangerous road to go down to think that is in any way acceptable treatment of a customer, regardless of race, and especially because of it! It is a dangerous road to go down to not say anything and to be intimidated or guilted by having that behavior justified or brushed off. Casual racism is not ok and being vocal about it should never be called out as going down "a dangerous road". The danger lies in the complacency, not the action.  As for the $1.75 "honest mistake", please keep the offer of a refund. If that is how you define "honesty", yet another reason I will not be returning to this establishment.  *To clarify, I am straight out saying the bartender that served me and was a disrespectful ass to my friend behavior was racist, and since receiving an intimidating message from a regular here, by proxy the establishment, since this sort of conduct is not only acceptable here, but defensible by the regular patrons.

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: Review of service*  Holy Racism, Batman.   You figure a guy that majored in cultural anthropology would have a little more of an open mind when it comes to hiring staff for his bar...  Hey Bartender... here's the best part... I'M THE GUY YOU KEPT SERVING OVER MY FRIEND who was standing right next to me. I literally walked up, not knowing if she ordered or was waiting, and within 3 seconds you asked what I wanted for a drink. This happened multiple times, we brought a group of 15 people to your filthy establishment, and sadly... the service and negative/racist mindset of the employee's shine through.   Granted... the owner of Nomad made the news a couple of months ago because he's in business with someone who attacked a guy with a Japanese sword and stabbed him with a dagger... but that's neither here nor there, or is that fact that The Department of Justice recently filed a civil rights lawsuit against the owners of many bars throughout the United States, accusing them of discriminating against non-white patrons. Would be a shame if this happened to Nomad.   The fact that I witnessed such blatant discrimination made me sick to my core, maybe the Austin Human Rights Commission should force your staff to undergo anti-discrimination training. Yes, that can happen (at your expense)   Anyways.... 1 star is 1 star tooooo many  - maybe come here if you support the KKK? I don't know.   "No human race is superior; no religious faith is inferior. All collective judgments are wrong. Only racists make them"  ― Elie Wiesel

reviews.author: Jeannette L.
reviews.description: FIVE STAR DIVE BAR!!  About two weeks ago, I checked out Surf by Surf East, which is an annual surf rock music fest, at Nomad Bar. King Pelican was the headliner. I saw them in San Antonio the last time I went to Texas, and knew this would be a great show.   Because I was staying downtown, I took a Fasten to the club.  Nomad Bar is in a mini strip mall near the Target by I-35. I saw a bus stop station nearby, but I went with ride share since I wasn't familiar with the area.   Nomad Bar has an outdoor patio area that's accessible only from the inside of the bar. I checked it out for a bit because it was such a nice night out, but went back indoors. The stage where the bands played is inside. Behind the stage is a projection screen. Most of the acts that night had YouTube videos looping in the background. The sound in Nomad is good for acts. Got some really good recordings inside.   I sat mostly at the high tables towards the front by the entrance. I split a pizza pie, which was tasty (an independent business does the food at Nomad). Drink prices were pretty good here; I stuck mostly to Dos XX. In between acts, I checked out the game room, where there are darts and an arcade game. The game room is well-lit, which is in contrast to the main bar/indoor area that's dark and dive-y (in a good way).   King Pelican were awesome that night (as expected). I would come back to Nomad the next time I'm in Austin. You should check it out.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: I went here last night with a large party of coworkers and sat at a big table in the back. I was hungry so I ordered a pizza. We demolished it and ordered 2 more, each different. I'd go back just for the pizza!  I like the cozy feel to the place and that they have indoor and outdoor service. I also never had to wait long to order, which is rare and fabulous.

reviews.author: Donnie F.
reviews.description: Solid tavern style bar. Parking is a little bit of a challenge., but worth it. The thing that saves this place as a really good bar is the customer service, and really well made drinks. Plenty of sitting, with inside and outside sitting. I would definitely go back with friends! Side Note: Area is a little sketchy, so be situationally aware of your surroundings. I guess you could say that about a lot of places, though. I recommend this Bar!

reviews.author: Mary Mac J.
reviews.description: Knomad is one of my favorites! Great pours and nice, unpretentious people. They have everything you could want in a bar: good prices, pizza, a little sportiness, a little diviness, and live music sometimes. Its a very comfortable and welcoming place to hang out.

reviews.author: Cathryn C.
reviews.description: Knomad's Bar-  a travelers oasis of good vibes and no pretense.  Love the drink menu and the Sunday Brunch. Bar staff is genuinely friendly and knows their craft. Well done ya all!  Thanks for making me my favorite Czech drink, a BETON.

reviews.author: LaPeshaa C.
reviews.description: Oh nooooo! Nomad what is your problem?!  Prejudice much?!! I was with about 15 folks then 2 in our party leave upset. I get word that the bartender kept serving other people (white) although my friend was there first. When said friend spoke up about it she was disrespected and told she'd be kicked out.   Hubs and another friend wanted to see this prejudice for themselves so they both go stand at the bar to order drinks. Two white girls walk up behind them and the bartender points to the girls BEHIND them and ask what they'd like to drink. Wow... Really?...  I come on here to write my review and see many of my buddies I was with wrote their review already. And lookie here, management DID NOT respond to the girl who was disrespected (black) or a buddie who was there with us (black) but seemed to respond to everyone else about the situation... Hmmmmm  Say it ain't so!!!! Don't try to respond now either buddy. Disgusting! Didn't mama teach you people are people and we all sh*t the same?!

reviews.author: Rawhide W.
reviews.description: Is this Dive bar with patio and small game room overtly racist? ..... perhaps. But what is racism?  Oxford states - "Prejudice, discrimination, or antagonism directed against someone of a different race"...... The ironic thing is that the incompetent owner (Miguel) has just committed a racist act as clearly identified in his posts.  The blatant example being, the lack of communication to any of the three African American's that have left negative reviews in regard to this past Saturday's event.  Don't be too surprised, as it appears to be inline with his poorly managed business. Considering I've been phoning the establishment for two days now, only to be greeted with a recording of "the mailbox of the person you're trying to reach is full and no new messages are being accepted, please try your call again later"......... Well Miguel, I've tried my call again for several hours now. Perhaps you should place that book of Mein Kamph down and clear your voicemail.  What has sparked all of the recent one star reviews one may ask?  This past Saturday several friends of mine ventured into Nomad to enjoy a few drinks. Jordan, one of the bartenders seemed to be a little "weathered". I'm not sure if he had too many shots as I've seen him do in the past or what, but he apparently wasn't taking to kindly to the ethnicities standing in front of him, awaiting service. Instead he helped many "whites" and I use this term loosely, prior to them, even though they were positioned first in line. This wasn't an isolated incident. It happened more than once that evening, to more than one African American in our group.  Jordan has waited on me several times in the past, so I approached him and asked what prompted him to threaten one of my friends with being ejected from the bar.  When I mentioned that I've got too many witnesses that have the same recount he replied "this isn't a court room, I don't care about witnesses". Needless to say he was irrationally defensive and had no intention of calming the situation down.   The sad part is that I've visited this location several times for about a year. I initially noticed on my first visit that the establishment carried a slight Riff Raff tone and wasn't an example of "class". As I continued to patronize the location, I'd see female patrons wearing sandals reflecting heels that are in need of major pedicures, customers with dogs inside the bar area which appeared to frustrate some patrons, heck, even the Owner Miguel, was overly tipsy celebrating his birthday recently at the bar, and my girlfriend and I witnessed him acting belligerent and was showing butt crack, while cranking up the music more than once to the point it was annoying.  So Miguel, stop the PR nonsense and clean up your mess. As I look back through Yelp, you've been slapped with one star reviews about racism and poor service in the past. The fact it's still continuing leans more towards condoning your staff's behavior or cementing the fact you're an incompetent manager. Either way, you shall never see me cross your doors again.

reviews.author: Richard A.
reviews.description: I'm sorry but I have to give Nomad 1 star for customer relations and satisfaction.   After an awesome UYE, (Unofficial Yelp Event), nearby with 31 in attendance. I suggested to 15 that we continue the festivities at Nomad, a bar/lounge that I thought would be a great choice especially since to me, they craft the best caipirinhas in town. When I first visited Nomad, Jordan crafted the perfect caipirinha, using a top shelf cachaça, gaining my respect. Last evening, I immediately realized that he was not in good form when he began using lemon instead of lime for my caipirihna, he corrected his mistake and said, "It's been a long day",  and I accepted that but what was unacceptable, was disrepecting a member of my group. It's going to be difficult returning to this venue.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: If there was a 0 star option I would gladly give it to the Nomad bar. Let me set the stage regarding why I have such little respect for this bar.   I attended a post Unofficial Yelp Event event at the Nomad. I noticed one of my friends ( a black woman) abruptly leave the venue with her sister. I was told that she had a confrontation with the bartender over not serving her. I later witnessed my Hispanic friend stand by an empty bar not receiving service even though 3 bartenders looked directly at him, yes they made eye contact. A Caucasian person walked up to the bar not 5 feet from my friend and he was immediately served. After speaking with my friend to validate what I witnessed I was disgusted by this behavior and left the bar.  Please note, as a Caucasian male, I had no issues ordering drinks. I also have a complaint regarding their drinks. If you are a regular you receive a healthy pour if you are a non-regular it's a pretty lite pour. Yes I was a bartender and know the count.  The important fact is that I witnessed discrimination against my friends of color. I really don't give a flying hoot about lite pours for non-regulars.  If you read the other reviews there is a pattern here and you can draw your own conclusions. I Paul Russo will never ever step foot in this bar again.

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: Nomad hosts Second Saturday Surf show (which is awesome) so I've been quite a few times to watch my husband play.   Let's address the concerns about racism:  Fact: there is a dickhead bartender who works here. He shouldn't work here. He's an ass to everyone. He hasn't served me. I'm about as Caucasian looking as they come. He isn't racist. He's an asshole. Assholes are every where. Just look at POTUS.   Fact: my husband (Native American and not mistaken for white) is served regularly. No issue.  Fact: my husband's band mates? Not a caucasian among them. All dark/tan/not white/labels are dumb among them. They get served.   Point of interest: Motion to fire asshole bartender. Your move, Nomad.    Go see for yourself. They have a very chill vibe. Good pizza. Good drinks. Fair prices. And Second Saturday Surf show? Awesome.

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: Ummmm no. I was told their weekend brunch was worth a try. It was not. Very disappointing. It's a neighborhood bar that's popular with the locals. It's in a strip center and has no character. Meh.

reviews.author: Ryn B.
reviews.description: I really like this place... yet another bar I've visited only because of trivia. I don't even know why I like it so much.  I shall describe. It is dive-y and in a really unremarkable neighborhood. There are flyers and posters all over the walls. The inside is kind of cramped and doesn't have a lot of seating; outside can be better although still cramped, but there are heat lamps! Roast like meat under red lights.  The pizza is like really good... again, no idea why. I think of it and dream of fluffy crust, the ideal amount of toppings, and wholesome flavor. They have twice now screwed up our order and brought the wrong pizza out - late and without apology - but I'll keep ordering it.  Dim, not overly friendly, and a little crowded... but good vibes. And good pizza, if you get what you want.  Well, the only thing is - I think they used to be the Nomad Bar and have no idea why they added the "k."

reviews.author: Cathy B.
reviews.description: Nicer than a normal neighborhood bar - stronger on beer and cider than on cocktails. Lots of things to look at and do, and plenty of seating.  Pro tip - their bills are confusing and slightly shady? They seem to bill your drinks based on individual ingredients or something? Very confusing at the end of the evening.

name: Icenhauer's
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: Another great Rainey Street bar!  Great drinks and great live music, at the time their selection of entertainment is what drew us in.   They also have a great food trailer in the front yard, at the time it seemed quite popular.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Rini S.
reviews.description: This place used to be so much better but times have changed. :/ The bouncers are unnecessarily rude and the bartenders serve in the order they prefer versus how long someone has been waiting (no it's not because it's too crowded - I'm talking about situations where there are less than 10 people inside).   Does not pass the vibe check anymore.

reviews.author: Adam G.
reviews.description: Okay y'all this place is sweet. I stop by every time I visit Austin, and have never been disappointed. They have live music on the weekends, and the bartenders are fantastic. There's a front patio area and also a big one in the back with a round seating area and also some tables that they set up during the evening. Their specialty is sangria so make sure you check out the different kinds they offer. In addition, there's a food truck in the front called "Gobble Gobble" that serves up farm to table burgers and other great options

reviews.author: Michelle C.
reviews.description: The bouncer shoved my friend, will never come here again. POC and girls beware of this bar, it is not safe for us.

reviews.author: Maya W.
reviews.description: Worst service I've ever experienced! The staff was rude and would ignore my friends and I before when we were waiting to served over other people who hadn't been there as long as us (even though there weren't many people in the bar). When we finally got served, the bartender made the wrong drinks and got an attitude when we told her (after already waiting a long time to be served in the slowest bar on earth for some reason). One of the worst bar experiences I've been through on Rainey ever. Don't waste your time or money.

reviews.author: Odalys  G.
reviews.description: Honestly go anywhere else on Rainey, BUT Icenhauer's. They literally gave me and my bestfriend the WORST night. It was so humiliating and disgusting. They called the cops on us just for sticking up for ourselves. The bartender (some blonde girl about 5'4) got involved with a minor altercation because this man (another customer) was cussing me and my friend out over us just making conversation. I wasn't able to get the name of the bar tender, but I know Gus and Tony were the bouncers and just made things worse by also getting involved and blowing things out of proportion. They get one star because the green tea shots are actually really good (plus I can't even give less than 1 star lol), but other than that the service is terrible, and the music is garbage. The place is never really poppin anyways so honestly go somewhere else for better service, better music, and a better environment.

reviews.author: Justin A.
reviews.description: Horrible experience. Cameron is a thief. Had a drink made that was horrible. Asked Cameron to remake it and then he charged us and he kept our change. On top of that he lied to a co worker about keeping our $$$$   We will never return and escalate this to management.

reviews.author: Mylon K.
reviews.description: While standing at the bar, I literally had this white guy put his hand on me and push me back to say, "there is a line, and you need to wait." I told him, "dude I'm not cutting the line, I'm talking to my friend."  He then proceeded to continue talking crazy.  What was the bar tender's response, who was also white, "if you can't let it go, I'm not gonna serve you."  I was shocked.  I explained to her what happened, and she said, "just deal with it"  Meanwhile, she is serving the guy who did it and saying nothing to him.  I can't believe I experienced this on a random Sunday in Austin.  Times haven't changed.  So disappointed in this bar and it's staff for how they handled a clearly prejudiced incident.

reviews.author: Tanya L.
reviews.description: I would give it 0 rating.. It was awful!! Tried to go in at 1.15 on Saturday (they said they work till 2am), but was never allowed to come in‍ really??? What was the reason?? Just laziness or other color???

reviews.author: Akasha J.
reviews.description: Such a great atmosphere for our first time in Austin, there isn't much open on a Monday but this place is and it has a great atmosphere and great drinks!! I recommend the Emily if you're a mojito fan and a strawberry fan

reviews.author: Robin C.
reviews.description: Very charming Rainey Street bar!  Great drinks, great service and a hip place. Loved it!

reviews.author: Sheri S.
reviews.description: If you read the previous reviews, this will just continue the crappy treatment of customers. We walked up at 11:45pm on a Monday night and the bouncer started yelling at us that they are closed and "that is why the gate is closed". No, the gate wasn't closed or we would not have walked in.  At any rate, spend your money at the many other bars close by. You won't be disappointed to skip the disrespect at this crappy bar.

reviews.author: Rob J.
reviews.description: Super friendly. Yummy drinks and great atmosphere! Surprising for a Monday night next to our hotel, going to be coming back every night! Food options out front and right on Rainey street!

reviews.author: Sean E.
reviews.description: This place has gone down hill since the night owls left. They kicked an honest man out for checking on  his sick girlfriend in the bathroom.

reviews.author: Andrew F.
reviews.description: Icenhauer's used to be my favorite place on Rainey Street. Unfortunately as Rainey Street has become more and more a college student place Icenhauer's has gone waaaaay downhill. Now there are long waits for drinks, extremely drunk people everywhere and in general a lack of a positive vibe.  We went in -- waited 30 minutes and never even got to the bar to order a drink while college kids pushed us aside. It's a shame as five years ago Icenhauer's was my favorite bar in town.  All things change, and unfortunately Icenhauer's has changed for the far worse.

reviews.author: Charles C.
reviews.description: My wife and I stopped in here for a quick drink on our Rainey Street tour and had a fun time.  Thao was our bartender and she was really cool.  Very engaging and fun.    My wife had a White Claw seltzer and I had a local Pilsner.  Both did the trick and we all laughed at the drunk douchebag next to us who ordered 5 "Water Shots," for his party trying to be funny.  He didn't realize that even his own group thought he was too thirsty for attention.  It made for some comedic relief though.  Fun little place.

reviews.author: Andrew F.
reviews.description: This bar is awful. Do not even try to go. They will not let you in if they think you have a big party. The bouncer was rude and would not let us in. Have fun losing business. Even if one person wanted to go in, they said no even though they were not at capacity.

reviews.author: Julia O.
reviews.description: Bartenders are asshats, slow, and untalented. Hire an 18 year old from a college bar honestly they'll do better

reviews.author: Tracey T.
reviews.description: There really is no bad bar on Rainey in my opinion, but there are a few that stick out and are our favorite to hang out a Little longer than others. Icenhauers's is definitely one on that list. They typically have some quality live music and just a fun overall environment. Highly recommend to anyone looking to have fun, but not  prepared for the madness of the Dirty.

reviews.author: Natalie C.
reviews.description: Rather terrible cocktails in a setting that feels like a frathouse, after the party is over.  Friendly staff and patrons, but pricey and popular enough that my expectations were pretty high.   Maybe I should've stuck to a beer or signature cocktail. As it was, I left my negroni in the glass (undrunk) and found a cozier spot a little ways down Rainey.

reviews.author: Seth R.
reviews.description: Aviator's is the place to find the best pizza around! They always have exceptional service, food and cleanliness!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: Must try pizza place  Food: At first you think is a regular pizza but when you try the sauce and cheese they got it right. I got a margarita personal one and I love it! The only thing is that if you want crunchy Dough, let them know. I have my days that I want that.  Price: very reasonable.  Environment: people know each other a d it looks they are repetitive clients. As soon as I got there I felt very comfortable. It is a layback place, perfect for Family, Sports, Pizza time with the friends and music is super classic. They were playing the 3 Musketeers and II was just great to be there during lunch time.  Service: The server or manager made sure I like and enjoy pizza. I noticed that he will ask the clients on how was everything and he was really interested in knowing.

reviews.author: Scarlett T.
reviews.description: First time ordering here and the pizza is amazing here!!! I ordered the 9" Meat Almighty pizza and BBQ Pizza. The pizza named Meat Almighty say exactly that! It's loaded with all the meat toppings! The sage sausage have a kick and it's such a quality pizza for what your pay for! The crust is crispy on the edges but fluffy and  chewy in the inside. I usually get thin pizza but decided to get regular crust and I am so glad I did! The texture is indescribable good! The bbq chicken pizza is equally amazing! It's unique and the bbq sauce is perfect balance with the feta cheese, chicken, and toppings! This place is a must try! I am so happy this pizza place exists in Elgin! I am excited to try the other pizzas on there menu! Order and pay online was super easy. Pick up time was on point and the pizza was still hot when we got home.

reviews.author: Malory S.
reviews.description: We visit Aviator's at least once a week! Fresh pizzas and grinders and pasta and SALADS!!! Ahh we love so much about this place. Their beer selection is on point too!

reviews.author: Julia C.
reviews.description: Best place, within 10 min of Manor, to get a pizza/salad and refill your growler! Never let me down.

reviews.author: Milton C.
reviews.description: My wife and I were driving home from Austin on Father's day looking for something to eat. I was craving pizza, so she lit up when she saw a sign for some outstanding pizza from Aviator Pizza coming up in two exits.  We decided on an 18" to share and went with the pepperoni and basil with black olives. The cashier, and sole employee on the front side, was very friendly and humored us as we decided through the menu. Nothing really special there, but not everyone handles our humor or weirdness, so props to her. The pizza arrived shortly (plus for time) and we dug in. It was very tasty and the crust was very satisfying. I can't quite pin the taste, but it seemed like a home-made or high end dough because the taste lingered, and in a good way. It was one of my favorite crusts. The rest of the pizza was great as well and ranks up there with the best. Aviator Pizza is nowhere close to where I live, but if I take a road trip to Austin again, I will certainly make it a point to stop in. I'd go so far to say it would be worth leaving the city limits to get some better pizza.

reviews.author: Diana N.
reviews.description: 4.5 stars. Quick, yummy, affordable pizza on the way to Austin! Drive-thru window made it super convenient. Love how you can get 2 different toppings on a 9" personal pizza. Maybe not the best pizza ever (I like Via 313), but definitely good for the price.  FLYING GARLIC (garlic butter base, chicken, garlic, spinach, feta, spinach, crushed red peppers) $9.95 for 9" - slightly preferred over the Brussels sprouts pizza bc I loved the garlic and feta. Only complaint is that there was hardly any chicken, mostly garlic cloves.  SRIRACHA BRUSSELS SPROUTS and GOAT CHEESE (red sauce base, Brussels, goat cheese, honey sriracha, mozzarella) $9.95 for 9" - the goat cheese was the predominant flavor which I enjoyed. Not much Brussels sprouts. Maybe this would be better on a white base rather than red sauce? Still good.  9" pizza comes w/ 6 slices. I probably would've been satisfied after 3-4, but I'm fat and ate the whole thing. Shareable if you're not a big eater. Crust is thicker than MOD Pizza, I love bread!  CINNAMON PECAN DESSERT $7- basically the size of a 9" pizza so it's worth the price. It was yummy! However, I wish there was more icing and pecans on it (compared to other pics), but I have a huge sweet tooth. Plain cinnamon dessert is $5.50  Picnic tables in front if you want outdoor dining. Connected to the gas station (sign is easy to miss). Plenty of parking.

reviews.author: Denise W.
reviews.description: This pizza was amazing. Paired with a nice cold tap I was so happy. I got the flying garlic small which I thought would be too small but nope it was perfect.

reviews.author: Pete A.
reviews.description: The food is decent but very overpriced. IDK if it's Elgin or what the deal is. You can never get a hold of the owners if there's an issue. The staff says they live out of State. Been there several times trying to give the mm biz as there's not a lot out here. Don't recommend unless you hope for the best and get decent service or food.

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: Love the pizza joint, the pepperoni and cheese calzone was really really good. Just to sit and talk and not be rush was great I really enjoy this place and look forward to coming back.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: We enjoyed our food. The girls in the front really made our experience memorable, they helped with everything  from the choice of local beer with tastings and the food which was amazing. We got the Italian sandwich and the calzone pepperoni and sausage. Both were really good, and recommended. So happy we stopped here. Will be back again.

reviews.author: Ivy L.
reviews.description: Was driving back from Austin and decided to grab some pizza to-go for dinner! I called in our order - pretty funny recording (like a captain getting ready for take-off to fit the aviator theme).. nice sticking to the character of its name! We placed the order easily and were told it'll be ready within 20ish mins. It was ready for pickup and packaged when we arrived. The place was pretty large, modern, and clean for when we re-open for dine in. But there were a few picnic tables out front and no one around so we decided to hang out and eat outside. Thick good quality paper plates provided!   The pizza was decently priced and we got the large 18" - half Hawaiian and half Margherita. Can't say I like the flavors - the toppings were alright but the pizza crust was just bland.. zero flavors and maybe taken out of the oven too early cause it was soft and not so crispy along the edges. They do load the pizza with lots of toppings though. Can't say it's the best pizza I've had - not even close - but it filled us up and it was quick. Don't think we'll be making a return unfortunately.

reviews.author: Debbie B.
reviews.description: Our family loves coming to Aviator Pizza in Elgin almost every Sunday. It is our family Sunday outing as we drive from Bastrop which is 17 miles away. We really appreciate Mr. Tomas and crew for great service "with a smile"and consistent great-tasting food. It doesn't matter what our family orders..it is always delicious! I highly recommend going to Aviator Pizza  for lunch or dinner. The Aviator crew has become like our family!

reviews.author: Sara N.
reviews.description: This was our first trip to an Aviator.  We went with high hopes because of the "gluten free" option. Well. It's pretty unfair to paint a restaurant as a good option for gluten free food with just ONE option. A GF crust. But. It really isn't. If you are gluten INTOLERANT,  this is NOT your place. It's really not much of a choice at all. Red sauce or pesto. Thats it. So you can have red sauce on a cracker. That's how the GF crust is. A dried cracker. Burnt crisp.  The other pizza crust... is like one size fits all. They take a single amount of pizza dough for all 3 sizes of pizza. I had a 9 inch pizza and it could have been a calzone. Its was WAY too much dough. I added portobello mushrooms as a topping and got about 10 small pieces. It just wasn't good.   In fact about all I can say that is positive is the Cream Soda. Everything else was just, meh.

reviews.author: Jordany S.
reviews.description: Visited this restaurant for dinner today and the  scenery/environment is beautiful for a restaurant next to a gas station on a highway. The pizza was freshly made and was very good. It wasn't amazing but it was good. I may go back but not sure. I had the Flying Garlic Pizza I think there was not enough chicken and the garlic was everywhere a little too much.

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: What can I say. Everything here is insane! The home crafted beers, the home crafted soda, the pizza, the potato salad absolutely crazy. Kelsi W, was wonderful. She made some awesome suggestions and they were worth it. I highly recommend this place. You will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Annual trek to Elgin for a Christmas Tree. I guess we're making this a habit. Stopped in for pizza after finding the perfect cat fir...  Pizza was great, as usual, and the beer was refreshingly cold - awesome on a warmer than average day.   We've now visited two Aviator locations a couple of times each and always been pleased. Keep up the good work!

reviews.author: Erin C.
reviews.description: This is our go-to pizza place! We drive 15 miles from Bastrop every Sunday to enjoy a mix of pizza, pasta, and salads.  The food is always delicious and consistent!    The greenbelt salad is my favorite - I enjoy it with ham instead  of chicken and the Cabernet vinegrette and toasted pecans are the perfect toppers.  As good as the food is, the service is even better.  Thomas and Ashley always welcome us as soon as we walk in the door and make sure we are happy with our meal.  The Aviator crew is like extended family and make us look forward to our next visit.

reviews.author: Missy L.
reviews.description: We were passing through Elgin and decided to stop and try this place. It was a great pizza, they had draft beer, and the atmosphere was cool.  We highly recommend d this place... it's worth the stop!

reviews.author: Javi R.
reviews.description: The bread of the pizza is amazing. It brings me back to the taste of bolillos (Mexican bread) and it just goes well with all the pizza toppings. One of my favorite pizza joints ever

name: Black Sheep Lodge
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Chaitanya N.
reviews.description: Pros: Open for games even early in the Morning   We waitress are good, cheerful  and attentive.   Cons: Not many to mention - can have a better ambience

reviews.author: Carrie B.
reviews.description: I do love my local Austin Bars! And Black Sheep has given me so many great memories.... Looking for a "unicorn?" you'll find plenty of natives here!  I was a huge fan when they first opened. Music. Community. Meeting new friends! It was great!  I have to say, I'm not a sports fan. And I really don't think we need another sports bar. But I know I'm a minority in this.  Playing important games here and there sure!  But when the TVs came, the Music died so much! The table sharing was less.  But you know what? I still feel like I'm "home" when I come here. And you can NOT beat the cheese curds!  So stuff your face, play some darts, and enjoy the locals! Because here we are!  Only gripe.... Plz play less sports! I don't need 15 TVs! I leave the house to not watch TV. Just saying:)  But I can't help but love them.

reviews.author: Kate C.
reviews.description: Black Sheep Lodge is one of my local favorites for when I'm wanting to watch a game, have a cool drink, and eat food that is going to do some damage to my stomach later.  Definitely like any other bar, but drink specials are unbeatable and, as I stated above, they have amazing food for a bar but it will make you say "diet starts tomorrow" every bite.  Dog friendly outside, but only downsides are the tables can fill up quickly and parking isn't ideal.

reviews.author: Matt P.
reviews.description: Wow...had the most egregious experience in here last night. Lady bartender treated me like a dog that just shit on the floor. They then proceeded to serve me cold chili. When I asked if they usually microwave each serving or keep a whole batch hot, she said they keep it hot. This tells me they dropped the ball and risked my wellness. They'll be receiving a visit from the health department soon.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Everyday Black Sheep Lodge has a special on drinks which is always appreciated for a gal like me who loves to throw them beers back whether it be daytime or nighttime. I really like their Trashcan Tuesdays (all Texas canned beers are $3!) to pair with my very own basket of cheese curds, a plate of burger sliders, and some crispy sweet potato fries! Sorry but I don't share my cheese curds when I come here.  Parking can be a thing but do know that there are about a dozen spots reserved for just BSL in the back behind Cindy's (go around back around the corner). There are also a few spots directly in front by the patio area. Otherwise I would suggest ridesharing to BSL if you got a group of folks who you plan on meeting up with.  This is a place where you can bring large groups for sure as there is plenty of space in the game room area AND inside area. I love the bar area too but it can be get crowded with regulars - which isn't a bad thing but something to note.  Service is fast and quick here every time I come even during peak or major game watching. I have never had an issue with being there to meet friends, having my own separate tab, lack of service etc. Only positive experiences here for me which is what keeps me coming back!

reviews.author: Havalah W.
reviews.description: I am always surprised by this place. Service is always pretty good, and the food is consistent and delicious! The wings are quickly becoming our favorite, and the mimosas are really really well balanced! Honestly that's hard to find for me... there's always too much juice or the bubbles are flat... not here! I like the spring salad w chicken.. not too unhealthy and V-tasty!! Also bringing the pups are an option on the outside patio!!

reviews.author: Sammy C.
reviews.description: This is a friendly neighborhood bar with a fun relaxed vibe. I find the servers to be very welcoming and helpful, and the food is seriously great! This is not your run of the mill bar food; the tenders and wings are some of the best I've ever eaten, no joke. The fried pickles and cheese curds are delicious. The onion rings are absolutely perfect -- hot and crispy, not greasy-- and it's always worth it to get the full basket. The Chicago Dog is one of my favorites too. I haven't tried the burgers yet, but I can't imagine I'd be disappointed in the least. Very highly recommended!

reviews.author: Jordan W.
reviews.description: Not a bad location if you're trying to just go watch a game, chill with friends, or just kick back and let the Austin traffic die down. Lots of TVs so during football season I'm sure it's a full house. The drink choices and food are good, but there are a few minor complaints I have.  There are daily specials on select Texas drafts, cocktails, and other drinks. However, I wish there would be more choices of drafts because it didn't seem like they have any. But I really like the choices I tried, and they even have some others from different breweries. They also have select drinks in cans and bottles.  The food is good, but it wasn't really what I expected. I just had 8 wings to watch a basketball game. The Buffalo medium sauce was excellent, but the lemon pepper dry rub had a little too much of the powder on it, decreasing the integrity of the taste. But I must say the Buffalo sauce and the taste of the chicken wings were pretty good. Maybe a burger or something next time.  I think I'll be back during football for some games, or another time whenever I want to bring a friend. Go try it out and maybe you'll like it. Parking is available in the back by Cindie's, but get there early as spaces run out quick.

reviews.author: Scorch S.
reviews.description: Great patio and surprisingly great menu , good and service were awesome. Definitely will be back

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Best tater tots ever! Worst mixed drinks! Stick to beer, enjoy your burger, don't forget to order the tater tots - I promise you!

reviews.author: Keilon L.
reviews.description: This is a solid bar with plenty of options.  They have a mildly exhaustive beer selection which will please any palate, discerning or otherwise.  I plan to visit more and scroll through the list of options again.  There's also a number of daily food and drink specials and I believe there is a happy hour offered as well.  I typically come to here to watch [European] football  (soccer) with a cold beer and standard American bar fare.  My one gripe is that they have a pretty good burger that they just don't know how to cook at medium temperature. I've ordered it twice and reiterated that I'd like it medium and it comes out well done each time.  That's mad annoying but I'm still holding out faith that they'll get it right one day. The fries are pretty top notch.  Again, you can't loose coming here just on the strength of the beer selection alone.  I'll be back for a better burger experience soon.

reviews.author: Kip S.
reviews.description: I've been going to Black Sheep Lodge off and on for a number of years. For a bar the food is generally solid, but the service can be excruciatingly subpar. The porch is chill and dog friendly though, so there's that. If you've got tons of time and don't mind being ignored and overlooked, it's worth a look. That said, you'd likely being doing yourself a favor by going to either ABGB or Loro, both of which are within walking distance.

reviews.author: lauren f.
reviews.description: Surprisingly good food - don't judge the bar by it's "cover" - the burger was one of the best in Austin! I also appreciate the large number of TVS and the staff's ability to switch one to the game you'd like to see. During football season it can be hard to find a bar playing anything other than the Texas games, which makes sense but can be frustrating. Luckily Black Sheep has so many TVs and the set-up to accommodate many guests with multiple interests!

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: I only came here once and it was on a Friday night during a playoff baseball game. Obviously going to be busy but yikes, I waited 40 min for a single beer...that I never got. Calvin, our waiter, was very quick to run my card, but then radio silence. After it got ridiculously long, I asked him about it. Instead of checking on it, he said something sassy and then stormed off to take care of another table. I walked out $6 poorer and beerless

reviews.author: Jackson W.
reviews.description: One of the worst establishments I've ever been to. Wait staff was very rude and no help. Ordered the little stinkers and they took over an hour and a half to come out and then looked like this.

reviews.author: Michelle J.
reviews.description: Staff are RUDE!  Waited 20 min to be waited on.   Never came back for drink order.  Went to bar to order and gal at bar total BI^^ch!!!   Bar was not busy but no one could be bothered to help .   " I would like a frozen white claw please.  What floater? What are my options?  ( eye roll e/ deep sigh). (Made my Choice). Open or Closed?  What?? Omg open your tab or close it!!!!!"  Close it!  ( I will take my $$ elsewhere!). Please!  Apparently only males under 36 were waited on!  Loved loved loved this bar but 3 strikes your Out!!!!  Waitress only spoke to my HUSBAND!!  Hon I'm paying today;). I'm here too.

reviews.author: Metzli S.
reviews.description: Two major issues: The major one being there isn't any parking readily available for this establishment unless you want to get your car booted in the parking lot that's across the street. They have 2 spaces in the front and parking that is not theirs that even the wait staff says is only available from certain hours. The second issue: on this occasion my experience with my waitress was not the best. Didn't get seen/attended to for about 5 minutes. Then it took forever to close my tab/close out due to her not even acknowledging my table. She would go sit and mingle with other tables. (And they weren't even that busy)   Over all, the wait staff could've been a lot better. And the establishment itself should do something about their shitty parking situation. Nobody wants to pay $100 to get their car unbooted because of the lack of parking.

reviews.author: Dovey B.
reviews.description: This place was absolutely horrible. Waitress was so careless and couldn't be found. The food took over an hour to come out and she made us feel like jerks for even asking when our food would be ready. The actual food was so boring and dry and just not good. Good fries though.

reviews.author: Samantha M.
reviews.description: I came here after my haircut next door and omggggg - got the cheese curds - so yummy. Got the 4ct wings garlic Parm - they have this breading and then tossed in sauce that is so good and the sweet potato fries were so crisp and amazing 10/10 would recommend and tip your waitresses/waiters they deserve it - ohhhh and margaritas are AMAZE and $3 on Thursday

reviews.author: Scotty C.
reviews.description: We stopped by this iconic spot in Austin's Sola neighborhood for hangover appetizers and a little hair of the dog. It was New Years Day so we were in rough shape. It's a rustic and divey sports bar with a happening music scene I hear. We saddled up at a communal table and I ordered some Queso (remember the hangover I told you about) and a pecan porter. I liked the spot and queso was giving me a new lease on life. We intended to come back later but ended up on the other side of town.

name: Doc B's Restaurant + Bar
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert

reviews.author: Lauren A.
reviews.description: I spent the weekend in Austin to enjoy the holiday experiences that they have to offer. After a long day of exploring my boyfriend and I stopped in for an early dinner. Pleasant atmosphere and friendly staff. My boyfriend ordered the bbq ribs which came out absolutely perfect and delicious. I on the other hand orders the chicken parm which came out extra charred however not wanting to be a pest I didn't complain and decided to just work around it. The manager and the server were amazing and even tho I didn't complain they removed the charge for my entree. Overall the restaurant has a great vibe, very clean and the staff are extremely professional. I would most definitely come here again... for a less charred entree of course

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Currently writing with one button of my jeans undone - Doc B's food has me full to the brim.   Not usually a big American-food person but I was curious why this place was so well-rated and wanted to try it for myself.   I asked the server to let me know what are the best things on the menu. She was very familiar with the restaurants' offerings and she killed it with her recommendations. Here's what we got:   For appetizers, Housemade Guac and Oven-roasted Wings are must-gets. The Guac is great because the chips are unique: baked sweet potato chips! I could munch on these all night. Thankfully, the Oven-Roasted Wings stole my attention as soon as it landed on my table. Best. Wings. The Chimichurri sauce is addicting!   For mains, our server mentioned that the West Coast Steak Sandwich is the best. One bite in, I wholeheartedly trusted her. It's cooked to perfection and the bed of greens helps to cut the fattiness of the meat. The Chimichurri Steak was also pretty good but the steak on the West Coast Steak Sandwich was better. The fries were well-seasoned, perfectly thin, and crispy. Oh, we also threw in a Brussel Sprouts Salad, which was needed to balance the heavy meal.   - Our server was knowledgeable about the menu (+1) - Everything came out so quickly, I think in less than 20 minutes (+1) - Our server's recommendations were spot on and the food was great (+1, +1) - Very reasonably-priced for how good this restaurant is (+1)   That's a solid 5-stars in my books. Highly recommend!  p.s. I dined at the bar to skip the wait, which was going to be 45 minutes (7:30 PM on a Wednesday night). Reservations are probably needed because of how busy the Domain gets.

reviews.author: B D.
reviews.description: We were able to get a table right away and our server was really friendly, polite, and smiled a lot.  The food was good, but perhaps a tad overpriced.  I had the chicken parmesan and my husband had a wok bowl.  I felt my meal was good but it didn't wow me for the price.  My husband's meal was slightly oily.  The drinks were priced reasonably.  The decor and ambiance was really nice, and we sat outside which was roomy and cozy.  If back in the area, we'd probably stop in for drinks and maybe an appetizer, but I'm not so sure about paying the asking price for full meals again.

reviews.author: Michelle W.
reviews.description: I fell in love with candied bacon. There I said it. It had the perfect kick to it.   I tried the udon noodles which were great. The server even brought extra sauce without prompting.   My friend had the Cobb salad which looked amazing. Considering she wanted to go mainly for that I'd say it must be good.   We went on a week night which went decently without too much of a crowd.

reviews.author: Andy N.
reviews.description: I came here with some friends, and they surprisingly took us in with mo wait time on a busy Friday night. The food was delicious. It was what I expected, and the service was superb. Although, the small portions with the high prices is something to note. While many of the items were a bit high, the portions were lacking. Besides pricing and portion, the food is what you expect and good.

reviews.author: Trevor L.
reviews.description: Pretty good experience. Decided to sit outdoors because inside was freezing. Server was pretty friendly and didn't have any problems with the food. I wouldn't call the Cajun turkey sandwich Cajun because nothing about it really tasted Cajun.    Overall, food came out hot and tasty, drinks were great (if you know what I mean), and overall good interaction with everyone.

reviews.author: Veronica R.
reviews.description: Omg, I am a picky eater and decided to step out of my zone and choose the homemade guacamole and sweet potato chips.  Absolutely Devine. So much to the point I bought sweet potatoes to try and recreate. Lol  Next was the chicken kebabs and cucumber and feta salad. Can you say I almost licked the plate!   If you have not eaten here then it's a must. I stretched my neck out for what others were ordering and it all looked so yummy. I'll be a repeat customer for sure.

reviews.author: Kelly L.
reviews.description: my friends and I were in the area and wanted to grab lunch. we wanted to come here because they have a dog friendly patio! huge  plus! they're also conveniently located by two parking garages and very close to many other stores in the domain.   the food was very average though in my opinion for the price we paid. the angry meatball was HUGE but tasted very unimpressive after you get through the initial outer crust that is covered in the sauce. the chimichurri steak lacked flavor and seasoning. the only good part I enjoyed was the fries.   service was a little slow but it was also sunday lunch so understandable.

reviews.author: Christa S.
reviews.description: I have been to Doc B's numerous times over the past few weeks and I have to say that everything I've had here has been amazing. It's a nice gem at The Domain where no matter what mood you're in / the size of your group, there seems to be something for your appetite. Seriously generous portions of food, and I've not had anything bad yet (and I definitely try and order some variety from the menu when I do visit). Some of my favorites include Grilled Chicken Salad, Carnitas Sandwich, The Number Six (like an upscale Chik-fil-A sandwich!), Chicken Kebabs (enough food to share or have leftovers!), Crispy Jalapeño Potatoes (seriously dream about these!), Homemade Oreo Ice Cream (always go for the larger portion!). They take reservations, which I would recommend, especially on the weekends. The service is always friendly and attentive. It's got a good sized patio and my only complaint is the last time I was there, I had a patio reservation and they told me there were no tables (even though there clearly were, but were being "held for other reservations").

reviews.author: Smitha C.
reviews.description: Love Doc B's! Great food and wonderful service. We hosted a baby shower here and could not have been happier with our experience. We had a group of 15 out on the patio and it was so nice, open, and spacious. Our server was attentive and efficient, able to accommodate all of our various requests. We were corresponding with the manager, John, for the month leading up to the shower and he was so helpful, sending us pictures, answering any questions we had. He checked on us the day of as well and really took care of us. And of course the food was a hit, so delicious- highly recommend the candied bacon. We'll definitely be returning just to eat!

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: One of the places we went for my wife's birthday week. She had been hearing good things and saw great reviews, we went with another friend who also has a birthday in June.  The place was very nice, you had indoor and outdoor seating, the staff wore masks. We sat inside as it was hot, there is a parking garage, the purple one, right across the street so that was nice.  Service was great and fast. We started with some drinks and candied bacon and chips and Guac. The bacon was very good, agreed on by all three of us. The water did not come with ice which I found rather weird but maybe it's not but they keep it filled.  Our friend has the Cobb salad, Shana had the Turkey Burger, and I had Chicken. They both liked theirs, my fries were really good but unless you dipped the chicken in one of the sauces they brought it was pretty dry. Good flavor but dry.  The food was good, they raved about the chips but the guac was not as great as they were hoping. Overall it was good but not as good as many review make it sound, I admit I expect more when the food it more expensive and two of the three meals being good is great but while I am glad we went, not going to be on my normal rotation of places to go on date nights.

reviews.author: Joanne L.
reviews.description: I had to do a little shopping and returning up in The Domain again today. We decided to go back to Doc's again. Like always, they are consistent and the food is great. Kiddo friendly and we were seated immediately and within a minute our server Tom greeted us. He was great with Jay Jay, hospitable, quick on our requested and overall just a great server. Food came perfectly cooked and was yummy. We started off with the guacamole, but it was devoured once it hit the table......hence why we never got a picture. All and all, thanks for taking good care of us again. See you again ‍‍ PS-Restaurant and bathrooms were clean

reviews.author: Abby A.
reviews.description: Went for the first time yesterday for brunch. They don't have a brunch menu, but their regular menu had enough variety. We started with the guacamole and sweet potato chips, which were to die for. I had the chicken Wok bowl with sweet and sour Thai sauce and it was very tasty. I did ask for sriracha to add because it wasn't spicy at all. For dessert we all split the Cinnamon Toast Crunch cheesecake, which was fantastic, although very rich. For the cocktails, I had the Crazy Beautiful, which was perfectly balanced with a little sweetness, nothing crazy. I look forward to going back!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Solid place to eat. Service was great. Sat outside on the patio with my dog, and they brought out a water bowl for him. I ordered the chicken sandwich and fries which were good. Would probably go again.

reviews.author: David H.
reviews.description: Always great service. Also a place where everything tastes great. If you have room at the end, get the key lime pie.

reviews.author: Traci T.
reviews.description: I meant to post this a couple of weeks ago! Food was simple and yummy. And service was even better! Our server, Gus had such a professional demeanor. You could tell he wanted to be there. More importantly he knew the menu. As a gluten free/friendly patron this is very much appreciated! And one of the menu items that isn't listed on the menu or online is that they have a GF bun option! Much to my delight my meal was fabulous and fresh. Restaurant was clean manager and staff all had great attitudes and atmosphere was fun and welcoming. With all the pretentious restaurants and stores in the domain, that sure makes a difference for me! 5 stars!

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: One thing I would probably order as a meal alone, THE IRON SKILLET MAC and CHEESE. Mac and Cheese fans, this one is for you! SO CREAMY, cheesy, rich, savory and ADDICTING. EASY 5 stars for this meal alone!  However, other than the mac and cheese, nothing stands out. Doc B's serves a variety of burgers, chicken meals and woks.  I had the Crispy Chicken Sandwich, but there was not much flavor to it, even with the panko breadcrumbs.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Was super excited to try this place, but ordered the fried chicken with sweet potato fries for $26, and received 2 small pieces of chicken with fries that were undercooked. I think you would have gotten much more food with the chicken burger which is $10 cheaper? Was not impressed especially for the price! :-/ We also didn't get addressed by our server until about 15 minutes after being seated.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Late dinner with Chris at Doc B's in the Domain!  I got the chimichurri steak with a small salad and scrumptious fries and he got the cheeseburger.  Our app of guacamole and sweet potato chips was delicious as well!  @docbsrestaurant #docbsgiveaway #foodie #yum

reviews.author: Quin T.
reviews.description: I used to frequent Doc B.'s in Gold Coast, Chicago, so I was super excited upon discovering that they have a location in Austin. Man, Austin has definitely come a long way!! Doc B.'s stays packed because the food is delicious, they have just enough of a variety that it is not too overwhelming and they have great food options. I am a huge fan of their wok out bowls, the fried chicken sandwich, turkey burger with sweet potato fries and the brussel sprout salad with salmon. Recently, I tried the chimichurri wings and OMG....bomb! Beware, it has tons of garlic and while I love garlic, garlic does not love me, but for these wings, it's worth the night-long burps.

name: Loro
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Great spot for m-f 2-5 happy hour! Large outdoor area so bring the pups! Heaters and fans were throughout the outdoor area.  $5 happy hour boozy slushees are a must. The gin and tonic was more like a margarita and the Vietnamese coffee was really delicious. Smaller beer selection but there's something for every type of craft beer lover.   Hh chicken sandwich was HUGE. It kind of had a fried fish batter on the chicken. Nommm chicken karaage was pretty good and made a great shareable. Tomato and cucumber salad was so refreshing and had a bit of a spice kick. Got some type of bbq beef that was a bit pricey but tasted good.

reviews.author: Victoria K.
reviews.description: Happy I finally took the opportunity to stop by! A few co-workers of mine suggested Loro's when I first moved to Austin, and after dining here - I can see why!  My sister and I both ordered a chicken sandwich, and crispy potatoes! Wow, we were not disappointed. Both the sandwich and potatoes were delicious. We will back very soon to try more!

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: I've only been here twice but, have enjoyed it both times. I think I need to explore the menu more to figure out what my favorites are. I will say that with it being the new year, I have been trying to eat lighter and one thing I like about Loro is that they have plenty of healthy options on the menu.   I ordered the salmon rice bowl. The salmon was tender, flaked off easily and was seasoned well. It was quite tasty. It came with white rice, cilantro, red onion and a sauce. I thought the sauce/rest of the bowl could have been a bit more flavorful. I honestly think this was because I ordered salmon and salmon doesn't have a lot of fat like pork belly, etc. I took a bite of a friends bowl that had ordered pork belly and of course this was a large flavor difference. Not really any fault of Loros, I just think I will order a little extra sauce next time  if I choose salmon. It definitely checked off the health part though, ha!   We got an appetizer of pickled veggies, which were awesome! They had a variety of vegetables and they all packed quite a taste punch! Very good.   Also tried the Mango Sake Slushie and it was so good! My friend said this is what they're known for. It wasn't overly sweet and tasted natural but, still had alcohol in it! Definitely would get this again.   Giving 4 stars because I simply haven't tried enough of the menu yet, but look forward to trying more of what they have and enjoy knowing they have a variety of foods to pick from depending on my mood or calorie limit of the day!

reviews.author: Leah S.
reviews.description: TL;DR; Really quality food; cocktails are solid; service is nice with an interesting concept; cool vibes. Get the chicken karaage.  My husband and I came here for a date night on Saturday and had a great time. Seating was surprisingly easy (we got there around 6:30pm? We're seated at the bar within 5 minutes). We sat at the bar, which was nice because we didn't have to go up and order food/drinks (which is what you'd have to do if you are seated at a table). Bartender and service was nice and attentive, host was friendly but not annoying.   Originally, we came for drinks and try a few dishes to share, but everything sounded so go that we stuffed ourselves with too food to get to the drinks. I did try the Typhoon, which was pretty good. The frozen drinks looked good, but was too full of food to get one.  Would DEFINITELY come back for the food. We both got rice bowls (husband got the chopped smoked brisket and I got the char siew pork belly), the corn fritters, and chicken karaage. DO NOT SLEEP ON THE KARAAGE. So delicious--the sauce they drizzle on top is *chef's kiss*, the jalapeño aioli was a perfect pair, and it was super tender, juicy, and crisp all at the same time.  Corn fritters tasted great, only critique is that the sweet corn was SUPER sticky/gummy (stick to your teeth in every aspect).

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: A hit Loro was with my out of town family visit. Always happy I am when making the right choice. Nice and easy atmosphere. A taste of this and that with our family style lunch spread.   Each dish was popping with flavors, including their tantalizing "Cucumber and Tomato Salad"; beautifully spiced "Malaysian Chicken Bo Ssam"; and, scrumptious "Loro Cheeseburger". A lunch my family will long remember!  CHEERS!

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: LOVE LORO!!!  This is a restaurant that embodies the vibe of Austin. So laid back and casual but also trendy! And the food... omg so very good! The cocktails are pretty amazing too. Our go tos are the bowls... salmon or chicken if you want something lighter and the brisket if you want something more filling. The karage and crispy potatoes are must tries! The quality of the brisket here is phenomenal. It's not always on the menu but if it happens to be on the menu when you go, do try it out!

reviews.author: Elizabeth J.
reviews.description: Great food!!! Omg the food is amazing !! I would give It 5 stars if the service and cocktails were better. Waited an incredibly long time for our order for the server to finally realize we still hadn't gotten It and then finally reordered It. Cocktails aren't that great. Watered down and basic. But 100% the food was delicious! And the ambiance

reviews.author: Michelle T.
reviews.description: Happy happy happy hour, spiked Vietnamese coffee , mango slushie , best crunchy fried chicken, freshly fried wonton wrappers with amazing sauce, friendly staff, popping music, beautiful outdoor, chill vibe. These are all the things I would associate Loro with. Did you know that Loro is a fusion from the famous bbq of Austin TX - Franklin  and amazing sushi chef from Uchi? This birth child mix of Asian fusion bbq is not to miss or else you'll regret it.  Let's begin with how satisfy I was with the fantastic happy hour price. Don't forget to catch it on weekdays 2 pm to 5 pm. The drinks are to die for and that fried chicken was so crispy and delicious , I'll be content with just eating it for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.   Definitely a must go to for one of the best happy hour deals in town !

reviews.author: Jessie C.
reviews.description: I haven't been this wowed by a restaurant in a LONG time!!!! Picture THAT dish that knocks you off your feet in a big meal....now imagine every dish you have is THAT good. I'd haul it back to Austin just for the bavette!!  Must try's when you come: - crispy potatoes: every potato was crispy on the outside yet flavorful and soft on the inside. I could drink the yuzu aioli  - crunchy sweet corn fritters: the best corn fritters I've ever had??? Again the sriracha aioli was PERFECT to pair with it (overall Loro had mad sauce game) - chicken karaage: perfectly fried and plenty of juicy, slightly mala meat. Def need to get if you like chili oil  - smoked beef brisket: it's so tender, it's difficult to pick up and literally melts in your mouth  - char siew pork belly: the sauce is hoisin with a twist, and it's so savory and cuts the fatty pork belly in the best way - smoked prime bavette: oh my god? How have I never had bavette before this?? This was one of the best cooked steaks I've ever had. It was the most perfect medium rare and literally so tender I couldn't comprehend  They also hit it out of the park with their drinks - the mango sake and Vietnamese coffee slushees were AMAZING (the viet coffee will WAKE you up). Overall an amazing spot to grab a bite with friends or for a date night. Heard they're opening up in Houston and you bet I'll be first in line to check it out!

reviews.author: Piyush A.
reviews.description: Now that is what you call an Austin spot. The outdoor setup is absolutely gorgeous with multiple different types of seating to match your mood. My wife and I usually go for their happy hour and the Yuzu Spritz is our favorite. The food is really delicious too but wish there were some vegetarian food options in their happy hour menu.  This has definitely become our go to Friday happy hour spot.  Couple of recommendations - 1. Parking can get full so you may have to lurk around a little  2. Food and drinks ordering is a little fast food style where yo I go inside the restaurant to order and then the servers will come find you   Overall, a must visit !!

reviews.author: Jonathan C.
reviews.description: The food was sooo good! My friend suggested this place since I was in town visiting. I was confused when I entered because I didn't know if I needed to check in, but it's pretty much self seating and you order your food and drinks at the bar.   Since I was only here to grab a quick weekday lunch bite, I ordered the Chicken Karaage and the Smoke Prime Bavette. They were both so good! The chicken karaage was well battered and just fried perfectly, on top of that, the chicken was topped with their version of a sweet chili sauce and some cilantro and Thai basil. The smoked prime Bavette was delicious! The steak was obviously the tasty star of the dish, but I also that they did a really good job with their coconut rice. The sides, like watermelon radish and red onion. help cut the richness of the rice and the smoked prime. Lastly, my only drawback was the sauce that came with it as it was a little too sour for my tastes, so to anyone who is sensitive to sour, take it easy with your pour!  Overall, I would definitely come back with friends to try their drinks and enjoy this delicious food again.

reviews.author: Darla A.
reviews.description: If I could give them more stars, I would. Not sure why I have not reviewed Loro until now. I was likely trying to keep them to myself. Loro is the brainchild of Aaron Franklin and Tyson Cole and it does not disappoint. They call themselves an Asian smokehouse. The menu brings the best of both worlds to all those who dine there.   Happy Hour is from 2-5. They sell $4 Ty Ku Sake plus Stemmari wines on tap (Pinot Grigio, Rosé, and Pinot Noir). I love the Rosé. They have a cheeseburger that has shredded brisket with red onion jam on top! It is only available during HH or until they run out.  Pro-tip. Order it to go and enjoy it the next day.   Other favorites include the chicken Karage, corn fritters, beef tostadas, crispy potatoes, pickled vegetables, pork belly, and the smoked Prime bavette. The brisket is delicious, but only available after 4 pm. Everything comes with an Asian flair (sriracha aioli with the corn fritters, chili aioli and Thai herbs with the Karage, miso mustard and yuzu aioli with the potatoes, hoisin sauce with the pork belly, and shishito salsa verde with the bavette).  They have a nice large outdoor patio with a combination of picnic tables and smaller tables with chairs. They also have ample indoor seating. You order at the bar and they bring the food to your table. They also offer curbside service - which was my go-to option during the lockdown.  The parking gets full quickly, but there are spaces just south of them in the lot behind the building next door.

reviews.author: Jeff N.
reviews.description: It's about the bold flavors for me. A colleague referred us here. He said it was his favorite restaurant in Austin. I agree! Service is different than expected but we appreciated how it worked out. You order drinks and food at the bar. They give you a pager tracker to put on your table. Runners bring out the food. They have a large outdoor seating area and a large dining room. Great collaboration of BBQ and Asian  flavors. Most are weird  combinations but what else would you expect in Austin? Solid 5

reviews.author: Iris H.
reviews.description: What can I say that's not been said already? Loro is great! Been here so many times and liked everything we've gotten here. Amazing flavors and fun combos of ingredients. Always good vibes so we don't mind waiting. Happy hour here is the best, highly recommend!

reviews.author: Damaris C.
reviews.description: This place is perfect for date night or for trying a different type of food! Loro is a Asian bbq meat meets texas taste! The environment is amazing and the decor is worth seeing. If you have a dog it is dog friendly outside and have plenty of seating area.

reviews.author: Jennifer T.
reviews.description: The atmosphere of the restaurant was super casual. You seat yourself and then order food at the bar. The outdoor dining patio area had spacious picnic tables with some sections covered with tent coverings.  Smoked Prime Bavette ($18.75): The medium-rare steak was tender and sliced thinly. There were some rich flavors from the shishito salsa verde and the natural smoke.  Loro Cheeseburger ($12):  When I bit into the thick beef patty, I knew right away how high quality it was. The burger had a southern flare with the slight barbecue sweetness from the brisket layer.  The red-onion brisket jam added some more  dimension.  Crunchy Corn Fritters ($7.75): An appetizer with an Incredibly crispy outer battered shell and soft sweet corn tidbits inside. The sriracha aioli dipping sauce cut through the heaviness from the fried batter.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: I'm sorry, but I will never get the hype with this place. I've been here three times, and every time I wonder why it is that people recommend Loro. Fusion Asian food is always a huge hit or miss, and Loro definitely misses out every single time.   My friend and I ordered their chicken karaage, cold noodles, and corn fritters. All of the dishes were incredibly mediocre and left us wanting more out of the dish. The corn fritters were only edible with the sauce that they give, the cold noodles were not worth the price tag attached, and the chicken karaage was a mess. The only redeeming items we ordered were their gin and tonic and mint mojito. Those were absolutely delicious.   For some reason, their workers always seem like they don't want to be working there and I almost feel bad for going up to them to order my food. I've never come across a kind server at Loro.

reviews.author: Chris J.
reviews.description: Came to Loro for a friend's birthday, and as per usual, was met with a great experience. We stopped by Friday evening around 7:30pm and waited a little over an hour for a table, but the time flew by with great company and the ambience. The waiting area was equipped with an outside bar, elevating the atmosphere and allowing us to get some drinks in while we waited.  In terms of food, we ordered the crispy potatoes, chicken karaage, smoked brisket, and the malaysian chicken bo ssam (not pictured, sorry ate too fast). The potatoes were delectably crispy and were paired perfectly with the creamy aioli sauce. Needless to say, they were destroyed within minutes.   Moving on, if there's one thing you'd have to get at Loro, it would definitely be the chicken karaage. One thing about Loro is that every single ingredient and flavor you can tell is thought out and placed for a reason. Not only do the flavors of the ginger and cilantro complement the sweet glaze of the chicken wonderfully, it also add layers of flavor that bombard your taste buds in the best way.   I would also highly recommend the malaysian chicken bo ssam which was unfortunately demolished before I could get a picture. It came with lettuce wraps, pickles, pickled radish and chicken. The chicken was tender and topped with an authentic Malaysian sauce that was smoky and had curry-esque flavors. I really enjoyed how light/clean this entree was, whilst still providing a great variety of volume and flavors.   Finally, we also ordered the smoked brisket. I feel like the only thing needed to be said is that you can tell Franklin's was involved in this establishment.   To sum things up, Loro continues to be one of my go-to spots here in Austin. I always walk away feeling beyond satisfied in terms of quantity, and happy knowing the quality is similarly as great.   5 stars.

reviews.author: Spencer S.
reviews.description: Very popular spot from my experience as a tourist. Seems like you'd be lucky to get a table without a wait during prime dining hours. Indoor, outdoor and bar seating. Place your order at the bar, get a number and they bring it out to your table. Asian fusion. Upscale casual atmosphere. Turned into more of a bar atmosphere as time went on - lots of people standing around between tables. Extremely fast service. Friendly staff.  We tried a bunch of different dishes, which combined to be enough for five people. I counted nine dishes and enjoyed every single one of them! Also had a Vietnamese coffee slush, which is alcoholic, to end it. Unique and refreshing!

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: I loved the vibes here. Family friendly and casual. A lot of people were there watching the Ut/OU game (LOL Texas sucks). Anyway the food was pretty good but I didn't get anything mind blowing. The best part was my cucumber drink it was very tasty. I think the Popeyes chicken sandwich is better than this one by a lot. Mine had gristle on it and it was pretty unpleasant.  Overall I'll probably come back again because it's so close to my friends apartment. I've just had better for the money!

reviews.author: Elizabeth W.
