reviews.description: I arrived in Austin, TX on 10/18/18 with no plans until the following day and thought a tour was a good idea. However all the traditional tours appeared to be booked. I stumbled upon the Austin Brewery Tours' website while searching on Yelp for ideas.   I had an awesome time exploring Austin's growing beer scene. I also had a great time meeting and making friends the other tourists on our tour.   I enjoyed all of the 3 breweries but the behind the scene tour at Independence Brewing Co. made it my favorite.   The price is very fair when you consider it includes your tastings and tips for your severs.   In a nutshell, a good alternative tour for those interested in the Austin craft beer scene.

reviews.author: Talia H.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our tour. Our guide James was very informative and friendly. No one In our group lived in Austin so it was good to get some info about the city and neighborhoods. The 3 breweries we stopped at were all unique from each other in size, atmosphere, and beers. At each stop you choose two beers to try which is great. We've been on other tours where you do not pick. We were given about an hour at each stop which was ample time. I would highly recommend this tour company!

reviews.author: Greshka P.
reviews.description: Apparently it's become a tradition that we do a brewery tour when we travel. One of the breweries I was told I MUST visit, while in Austin, was Jester King. Searched online for brewery tours that included this and finally decided on Austin Brewery Tours.  Almost daily tours, online booking was so easy, and we got a reminder, a couple of days earlier to our tour, via email.  Tour starts at noon.  Meetup time was 11:30am. At around 11:25am the van was there.  Out comes Shane, owner and tour guide. He immediately introduced himself, thanked us for being on time and proceeded to ask us our names and where we were from. Once the other people taking the tour arrived, we were all introduced and in the van we went.  During the time we were driving, he would ask us questions to get to know us better, and see the style of beers we liked. He also gave us an intro of each of the breweries we would visit. He made the time driving pass by fast and welcomed all questions we could have.  At each of the breweries, he explained the process and what we had included in the price of the tour. At Jester King, they even had a special release and he bought a sample of each (which was not included in the price but he gifted us with it) making sure we had the complete experience.    You can tell he enjoys doing these tours and meeting the people.   He even took us to Revolution - which was in front of one of the breweries we visited - to try locally made flavored gin.   So greateful he allowed us to do this quick stop - this was delicious, and gave me the opportunity to talk more with one of the ladies on the tour, exchanging ideas on recipes with the gin we had just tried.    Shane is grate at incorporating everyone in the tour and conversations.  He allows you plenty of time to enjoy each brewery and every beer you choose.   He is now friends with the staff at each of these breweries, which works on the advantage of everyone in the tour since we got excellent/ friendly service at each stop.  Best part of this all, is you meet new people, get to enjoy all the beer you can drink, and don't have to drive. Great way to spend a day in Austin.  If looking for a beer tour, look no further, this is it!

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: October 2018. 5 out of 5. We decided to take a brewery tour while we visited Austin. This ended up being a great decision. The tour is structured well. We did three stops which gave us a good opportunity to try three different breweries without having to worry about driving, parking, or any of the attendant Logistics. The tour covers all expenses including tips which is a nice touch. You can tell that the tour is well organized and that the breweries appreciate the business. That means you end up getting much better service at all of the breweries than you sometimes get with such packages. The tour guide also is able to make excellent suggestions so if you don't have a lot of experience with craft beer this is a great way to learn. If you have any interest in a brewery tour while in Austin I highly recommend this tour.

reviews.author: Myriam C.
reviews.description: Best tour ! The people we met were so friendly. Our tour guide Alex was the best . She was very knowledgeable and very welcoming.  She is very passionate about beer . She made the tour very enjoyable. All breweries were great . We got to meet the owner of Independence and the owner of Nomadic. Their stories are very motivating  . I would do this tour again with Alex . She was the highlight of the tour. Alex thank you for your hospitality !

reviews.author: Chloe F.
reviews.description: Took a group of 14 on this tour for my birthday and had an absolute blast! The customer service from when I first booked through the entire tour was top notch. They made it so easy to have a fun day planned. Our tour guide, James, was the best! Great driver, super cool guy, and made sure we had the best experience possible at each brewery. He made the day so fun, stress-free, and kept us all on track.  We stopped at a mix of well known and off the beaten path breweries. If you're visiting from out of town, this is one of the best tours to see the heart of Austin craft brewing. I can't recommend them highly enough.

reviews.author: Zachary D.
reviews.description: So the scene is a bunch of guys down to Austin from NJ/NY for our buddies bachelor party. Of all the awesome people we met and food we ate, our guide Shane as well as the guys at the Lotus Joint food truck were freakin awesome!  SXSW had Austin jammed with a lot to do but Shane made sure we got to see Austin and its beer community like the locals do. He was insanely knowledgeable not just about beer but also about Texas. When you've solo traveled the world like he has, you gain a perspective that makes you far more relatable too which made him an all around cool guy to hangout with.  Most important.. The beers were phenomenal! (Try the goat tacos at Lotus also!)  In town for a day, a week, or a life time - Hands down recommend this for anyone in Austin!

reviews.author: Leslie B.
reviews.description: Thank you, Shane for the awesome tour!!! Knowledgeable, fun and an all around good time. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Kyle A.
reviews.description: Absolutely loved it, had a blast.  Took my dad and step mom on a tour.  Our first time in Austin, rather than just passing thru on I-35.  We went to 3 different breweries, learned alot.  Our driver was very informative and friendly.  Answered all of our questions.  The folks working at the breweries were very nice too.  Lots of fun and great beer.  Highly recommend going on a tour.

reviews.author: Barry F.
reviews.description: I was in Austin for meetings but had some free time prior. I like to visit breweries (who doesn't?) and saw this tour. I was so pleased with the entire tour: Shane is an amazing host who took us around, shared lots of information about the area, along with the breweries. He was very friendly and ensured we had a good time. Even though it was about 1000 degrees outside, he kept the van cool and ensured we were cared for.  We had opportunities to not only sample excellent beers, but also visit several food trucks in the area. His rapport with the brewery owners gave us extra attention and really made us feel special.  I would absolutely do this tour again!  Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Deena C.
reviews.description: My husband and I had a great time celebrating his 40th birthday with a private tour. Shane was great with his knowledge of the breweries and he was very personable. He even made a pit stop for a picture at the "I love you so much" mural for us. It was a great experience and we would totally do it again.

reviews.author: Greg L.
reviews.description: We went on this tour the Sunday before Christmas to celebrate my son's 22 B-day... Everything was absolutely flawless and we had the good fortune of having James as our tour guide... I must say this trip was to be excellent to begin with, but James made it SPECTACULAR!!! His knowledge of beer in general along with his totally chill attitude and attention to every little detail ( making sure we had water along with our tastings to matching our individual tastes in selecting what we should explore ) was over the top customer experience!!! We're looking to do another tour in early 2019 and would NOT HESITATE to use Austin Brewery Tours again!

reviews.author: Victoria E.
reviews.description: Austin Brewery Tours was awesome! This was a Christmas gift for my husband and we both had a great time. Brooke was a wonderful tour guide, and she made good beer recommendations (especially considering that I'm not much of a beer drinker).   We did the Hill Country Tour and visited Jester King, Last Stand, and Skull Mechanix. Each tour had a tasting option (one where we all tasted beers as a group and the others where we each got to pick our own beers to try). After selecting beer to taste, we got to explore each brewery on our own before moving onto the next location. We had enough time to eat (plan on eating at Jester King. The food is awesome and we spent the most time there) and to drink at every place, while still getting to individually wander and see all that these breweries had to offer. We also got to take the Jester King tour, which is really cool.   I'd highly recommend an afternoon with Austin Brewery Tours!! Thank you Brooke for a great day!

reviews.author: Samantha E.
reviews.description: My friend booked this for her birthday and it was a blast! Our driver James way friendly, informative, and kept us on schedule! I would highly recommend! He also took us to a brewery I've never heard of and was great!

reviews.author: Aaron W.
reviews.description: Highly recommend this tour. Our group had an awesome time getting to check out the Austin Craft Beer scene. 3 breweries in 3 hours is perfect. Our guide Shane was so knowledgeable with suggestions.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: Shane took the 10 of us to Southern Heights, Live Oak, and Independence breweries. We were on a bachelor party where everyone loved craft beer, and wanted to find out what Austin has to offer. The breweries we visited were perfect since they offered a wide variety of options, and Shane kept us on time without rushing us.  It was truly a fun and professional experience. I'll be recommending ABT to others who inquire about brewery tours in Austin.

reviews.author: Carl R.
reviews.description: I was in town for a bachelor party and the Brew Tour was the concessions highlight of the weekend. Shane (the owner) made the planning process a breeze. He was extremely helpful and prompt in all of our communications. Also, the van we took was clean and very comfortable.   The tour itself was AMAZING and huge shout-out to our guide Brooke, you killed it! Tremendous job moving us from location to location while never making us feel rushed, so glad it wasn't on me to wrangle the guys when it was time to go :). Also, your beer recommendations were spot on! Same with your suggestions for things to do for the rest of the weekend.   I have been on similar tours in other cities and Austin Brewery Tours is the gold standard now. I have already recommended them to a few people planning trips to Austin and I know others in our group have as well.   Thanks Shane and Brooke!

reviews.author: Leyla W.
reviews.description: This was a super fun beer tour for those who like breweries. Shane, the owner was very knowledgeable about the three places we stopped and knew his beer styles well. He was great at mingling with all the different groups within our group (there were 6 groups!) and was a great tour guide in general. He mixes up which breweries he goes to which makes it exciting if you do this several times. It's definitely well worth the money to get a fun, convenient way to enjoy beers of Austin.

reviews.author: Lauren H.
reviews.description: We used Austin Brewery Tours for a private group tour during my sister's bachelorette party and it couldn't have been more perfect. Shane was very easy to work with, and very responsive to all of my questions prior to getting this booked. We had 2 large vans for a group of 25 girls and it worked out perfectly. Shane picked out 3 wonderful breweries for our group with a wide variety of beers (and some with other options like ciders) - all locations had plenty of space for our large group, delicious beers, and food trucks available when the group got hungry. Overall, our group had a wonderful time. I highly recommend Austin Brewery Tours!

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: My husband and I had a great time today celebrating our 1 year anniversary! Shane was super personable and took us to breweries specific to what we like! We had a fabulous time and enjoyed every minute of it. I strongly recommend Shane and Austin Brewery Tours!

name: El Monumento
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking
Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jody D.
reviews.description: Another wonderful and flavorful dinner at El Monumento!  This has become our favorite place.  Their food is just straight up delicious- always. Had the enchilada trio in the suizas sauce; all of them excellent. And the beans cooked with bacon??  Holy hell- AMAZING.  Great sangria- get the carafe- makes sense and you will finish it.   Trevor was our waiter- what a fun guy.  Helpful, attentive and funny - loved him. Also- do yourself a favor and get the chocolate cream pie

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: Second time coming here and it's a bit of a mixed bag. The staff is excellent, we were seated quickly and chips and two salsas brought out promptly.  I ordered a specialty margarita on the rocks and it was just ok.  The table ordered the chicken fajitas, enchiladas and carnitas plate. The fajitas were overcooked and dry. The edges were burnt and the onions and peppers were sliced way too thin and were over cooked as well. The portion was very small from my last visit, but shrinkflation huh?? The enchiladas were very good and the carnitas were the favorite. The charro beans were awesome. The rice was bland and one dimensional and the street corn was overly sweet. The salsa was flavorful but at least one needs a little more heat. The restaurant itself is really cool and clean. I will definitely go back but on a different night maybe try a different dish and drink

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: Haven't had a chance to return to El Monumento since Covid and didn't know what to expect but the four of us may have had our best meal there ever. We got a reservation a little earlier than normal so we could take in the Christmas lights on the nearby Georgetown square.  Paige was our server and she did a great job. She was very attentive but didn't rush us. We started with chips and salsa, followed closely by the queso flameato, gooey and yummy .  Our meals included tortilla soup, shrimp chili relleno, street tacos and one of the special plates. Needless to say we waddled out... Our experiences in the past were a little inconsistent but this time they were right on point. Looked like there were enough employees to take care of the good crowd they had. It was fairly noisy though. Lots of families and groups.  Thanks Paige, keep up the good work! As I'm prone to say when it's appropriate, this is a repeater! Happy Holidays fellow Yelpers!

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: The food I got was not good, and borderline just plain bad. Beans watery, sour cream sauce slimy, rice tasted like cardboard. I liked the Brussels sprouts and the chocolate cake, but why would I go to a Mexican restaurant for those?  I liked our waitress a lot, as we were a big party and she did her best. But I just can't stand it when water isn't refilled timely, especially since I needed to wash down the nasty flavors I was consuming.

reviews.author: David T.
reviews.description: Passed this place a handful of times and decided to try it out. There's plenty of street parking nearby if the lot is full. Seating was quick for a party of three on a Wednesday night. They do take reservations so keep that in mind if you have a larger party.    ORDER  Chicken Flautas (start) Nachos (cut) Chips and Salsa (bench) Tres Leches   Food Flautas were good as were the chips and salsa. Nachos were surprising as the toppings were added to the chips and they're not the style where you can dip the chips. Not the style I'm used to but could be good for anyone trying to portion control.   Overall This would be a great place to take your out-of-town visitors because the service is good and the setting. I'd come back again and check out the bar area.

reviews.author: T G.
reviews.description: The food was okay but the french press coffee was absolutely amazing! Even if Mexican food is not something that you care for just going there for the coffee is worth it.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: El Monumento is always a solid choice for Mexican food and drinks in Georgetown. I love the decor and the beautiful view from the patio. The queso and guacamole are delicious and I've always enjoyed the margaritas. The hours of operation are a little unusual. They open at 3 pm on Sunday and there is normally a line of people waiting to get in so I would recommend getting  reservation.

reviews.author: Heather L.
reviews.description: Just wanted to add another amazing experience. Took my hubby here for the first time the other night and he loved it as much as I did. The food quality was perfection and our waiter Phillip was very considerate of my need to avoid wheat and talked to the kitchen to help me decide on what to eat. Wonderful service. Wonderful food.

reviews.author: Kasie M.
reviews.description: I can not believe I haven't reviewed this place yet, we used to be frequent flyers here pre covid.   My favorite part about this restaurant is the outdoor seating and ambiance. It's relaxing, quiet shaded, and you can see the water below.   The service has always been pretty good, no complaints there.   The food is very good and the drinks too, their cucumber/jalapeno margaritas are perrrrfecccct.   I agree with many of the other reviews, it's much pricier than its competitors for very comparable tasting food. Post covid, you even have to pay for chips and salsa- which is unusual at a mexican restaurant.

reviews.author: Ron J.
reviews.description: To be honest, I had given up on eating at this place some handful of years ago because I felt that the place was cooking Mexican food for the white-bread taste crowd. The food chronically lacked salt, seasoning or any interesting edge to it. Can you say "Food for the old folks home"?  But last week a friend of mine said to try again. said it had greatly improved, so I took his word for it and reluctantly went in....and can say that I was glad that I did.  They started us off with chips and salsa. Both the green (especially this one) and the red salsas were excellent and actually spicy, thank God.   We also ordered queso flameado with shrimp and chicken tortilla soup, both packed with flavor and quality ingredients.  The guacamole the we got was passable. Not as horrifically bland as is used to be BUT still needs a healthy dose of lime juice and salt which we ordered with it. Even or waiter said that it always needs more lime and salt, so, hey,just fix it already.  Everything else was also very nice, like the great seating outside and the bar drinks. I can see that they finally got some cooks that know this type of food and I am very happy about it. I WILL definitely be back.  My suggestion. You guys are finally on a roll regarding a more authentic taste. Don't rest yet!  You are only a few bold menu changes from being something truly great!

reviews.author: Olivia F.
reviews.description: If you're eating  dinner here Thursday- Sunday you need a reservation... if you don't have one, be prepared to wait atleast an hour. The cucumber margarita is super refreshing, I highly recommend it. The guacamole didn't have much flavor but the blandness of the guac was needed to cool your mouth after eating the salsa. Cool vibe inside, the patio seating is beautiful but will have to wait until it's not 100 degrees out to enjoy the view.

reviews.author: Cindi R.
reviews.description: We have been trying to enjoy this restaurant for years now as it is a georgetown staple and we love to support local businesses.    But I am done with their "we can't seat you here, because we don't serve out here," or "sorry, we can't do that," or " oh, you want salsa for your nachos? That's a $1.50 surcharge...."  Um, Nachos or tacos without salsa??  $ 1.50 to blend up some tomatoes and onions and jalapenos and cilantro??    I am done with this place and I hope that you all have a better experience overall than we have.  And now that you can pay your bill thru an app at your table??  Dont expect your wait person to ever come back.  We will never be back.

reviews.author: Angela G.
reviews.description: We love this place for dinner but not happy hour. Went to happy hour at 5 today and hit the bar area. They were out of pacifico, modelo especial and don't carry corona. Opted for 2 margaritas - not bad but not great. Until I went to pay and 2 mediocre margaritas (not even cadillac)  were over $33!!!! What on earth?! Honestly, unacceptable. These are worse than concert prices. Not going back for happy hour ever and may not even eat in the restaurant for a bit.

reviews.author: Laurel W.
reviews.description: Really like the food here. And the service has always been good!  Looking forward to our next visit!

reviews.author: Christine P.
reviews.description: Great Ambiance and Food Love it for Breakfast and Comfort Food The Pies are the Best Our favorite is the Coconut

reviews.author: Dene' H.
reviews.description: We chose El Monumento last night for my daughter's 33rd birthday. Best dining decision that will now become a tradition and a craving.   We started with chips and salsa as well as queso and one of the monthly special cocktails, the smoky jalapeño margarita. We also enjoyed the aqua Fruita non alcoholic beverage as well. Between the 5 of us, we sampled several dinner options including the street tacos, the enchiladas, and the relleno. They were all spectacular and even though I had no space in my tummy to finish it all, I couldn't stop.   Ryan, our server, made the experience even more special. I can always tell if a server is being nice to get a tip, which I can understand, but Ryan was honestly genuine and engaging without being intrusive.   The restaurant itself is beautiful with a generous deck that provides ample room to dine outdoors.   We will be back, sooner rather than later as I am already craving more Chile rellenos. You won't be disappointed!!

reviews.author: Lance L.
reviews.description: My wife have eaten here many times.  This place is very charming and has an interesting menu with terrific cocktails.  Try to sit on the deck if the weather is nice.  The bar is excellent and the ambiance after dark is very special.  Consider an after dinner walk down to the blue hole only steps from the river.

reviews.author: Kaitlin W.
reviews.description: The atmosphere, food and drinks are so good! Great date night place! You're better making a reservation because it gets very busy, but I like that the bar is separate from the main restaurant so you have kind of your own area to get drinks and apps while you wait.

reviews.author: David C.
reviews.description: Let's just start by saying this place sucks the waiter had the personality of a melting ice cube no social skills at all the food was just ok it was very hard to eat because we had nothing to drink because after our food arrived,we never saw our waiter again until the bill came  16.00 for two tacos and rice no salad or soup and then what Mexican restaurant charges for chips and salsa what a joke keep your sub par food, crappie service and chips and salsa appetizer..... we will stick to what we know "Mas fajitas" for the win!

reviews.author: Derek R.
reviews.description: Tried the Chili Rellano and Carnitas. Great food, service and location. Margaritas were not that great though. Going to give them another try down the road a bit.

name: Stories
address: 575 Hyatt Lost Pines RdHyatt Lost Pines Resort

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: Our first time dining here.  We were impressed with the food. The ingredients were very fresh.  Although the restaurant says classy attire don't let that deter you from trying it out. It's in a resort so resort wear is appropriate. Some people even wore jeans and shorts. Would we come back to this restaurant during our next stay at Lost Pines? Yes!  Appetizer: baked brie (7/10) with candied pecans   Entree:  Kid's filet with Mac and cheese- 8/10. The filet was perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked.   Chilean Seabass with Duck and Brussels sprout leaves - 8/10  Waygu ribeye with truffle butter - 8/10. Steak was pretty good and perfectly cooked.   Dessert:   Kid's chocolate gelato - 5/10 slightly icy and had orange rinds in there I think. My daughter didn't want fancy ice cream and didn't like the taste  Banana's foster cheesecake - 7/10

reviews.author: Bailey C.
reviews.description: Over priced but doesn't surprise me because it's a restaurant at a hotel. Ordered the Chilean sea bass $45 a la carte and it was served on top of this cherry or raspberry sweet sauce, omg horrible! Those two flavors don't go together. The sea bass was cooked perfect and very tasty!   Tuna appetizer was good. The shrimp cocktail still had some of the shell on it, very disappointing!   Jason ordered the filet and he said it was pretty good.   Loved the mushrooms.   Good wine list but way over priced.  Creme brûlée: no vanilla so it's tasteless. The custard part is too thick and not creamy and smooth like a custard.

reviews.author: Janice J.
reviews.description: We got a set menu that came with a salad appetizer, entree, shared sides and a dessert. The salad was a simple green salad with blackberries and corn bread croutons. There was too much dressing though. The salad was pretty standard but the corn bread croutons was a nice twist. The salmon was amazing. I believe it was partially broiled because it was unbelievably moist but the skin was crisp. This was probably my favorite part of the meal. The dessert was a chocolate bomb with peanut butter mousse inside. It was rich and decadent, and delicious. The food was really good, but my major complaint was the service. It was a slow and they mixed up our orders and forgot my cocktail. If you have the time to relax then that might not be too bad but this three course meal was spread over almost three hours.

reviews.author: Jorge G.
reviews.description: This overpriced place deserves no stars. I don't mind overpriced "fine dinning" restaurants, but the food here is a joke. We had salmon, "risotto" (yes, in quotes), and chicken. All horrible. We left in disappointment and went downstairs to the bar hopping that a good Old Fashion would make us forget the bad experience. I'm sad to report, they have no clue how to make an Old Fashion either.  We are wishing we didn't come to this overprice, low standards place.   Save your money, go eat somewhere else.  UPDATE:  The bartender Justin downstairs was very nice about the Old Fashion and asked for feedback. He surprised us all when he came back with a much improved version after Googling the recipe. Great Job Justin!! Thanks for getting our drinks right!!

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: We have eaten at the fine dining restaurant at the Hyatt Hill Country in San Antonio and were blown away with the service, atmosphere and food most of all. We came to this restaurant with expectations that it would be as good or better and were very disappointed. The service was slow and the food was mediocre. For $50 plates that don't come with sides, I feel like I should be impressed. My sea bass was cooked nicely, but lacking any flavor. The Brussels spouts that accompanied it were burnt. My husband's chicken was overcooked. We will stick with the food truck next time as their tacos are $4.50 each and AMAZING!

reviews.author: Christine R.
reviews.description: I ordered a bone in steak well done, but it came out medium. So I sent it back to the kitchen, and it came back almost the same. So, I sent it back for the third time and came out medium well though I wanted it well done. Also, the sides we ordered were cold and they took it back to the kitchen and re-heated it up. Who does that? Ive been to many steak houses and this is the first place that's done that. Not happy with the food and service here.

reviews.author: Leslie G.
reviews.description: We stayed at Lost Pines this weekend and had reservations for dinner at Stories Fine Dining at 8:15pm which we had tried to move up a little earlier but were told that they were fully booked. We walked over a little earlier just to stay nearby and checked in with the hostess. She was very nice and even walked over to us and said our table was ready so we were able to be seated at 8pm. Upon walking in, only half of the restaurant had guests seated. The other half of the tables were empty...but we couldn't move up our reservation? Ok. We were seated and greeted shortly by our server who was very friendly as well. She took our drink and appetizer order which came out promptly however my husband ordered a bottle of wine and somehow that took about 15 minutes to arrive as well. We were seated next to a table of 4 who was very "vocal" which kind of ruined the atmosphere (this isn't the restaurant's fault however it did affect our experience) so I will refer to the as the "vocals". Finally, we were able to order our entrees. Once ordered, our bread basket came out at the same time as our appetizer and the food runners were pretty attentive and quick as well with refilling water, asking if we'd like more bread, etc. We nibbled on our appetizers and got lost in conversation until we realized our food had not arrived yet. Checked the time, 9:15pm. "Vocal" table next to us had already complained loudly about the A/C in the restaurant and at this point had started to complain about the service and why their food had not come out yet either. (Let me just also emphasize that when I say "vocal", I mean obnoxiously loud enough that the guests from across the restaurant turned their heads in attention). They complained about the service to the manager on duty as well who was apologetic and served them with comp'd cocktails and who knows what else. Needless to say, their entrees quickly came out. Meanwhile at our table, our bread plates had been stacked up, empty bread baskets were on the table and still no entrees. Time check: 9:30pm. At this point, the kids are getting restless and still have not eaten and no one had checked on us in over 30 minutes so we asked if they could at least check on the kids' food. They said they would and disappeared once again. Servers continue to walk by without having cleared our table and running food to other tables. One of the guys from the "vocals" has now stood up and beckoned the manager one more time to announce that his food was cooked incorrectly. One more time check for kicks: 9:50pm. Still no updates from the staff on the hold up. We have been seated for almost 2 hours with no entrées. At this point,  with strong understanding and empathy for the staff who has had to deal with the drama at the table next door, we quietly called over the manager and server to ask if we can just cancel our food. The kids needed to be fed, my in-laws were exhausted and we were all losing our appetite with the lack of service. The manager apologized for the delay and asked if he could pack up our food for us and we kindly declined and said we would just pay for what we actually ate/drank. He turned to the server and said, "Take their card." Then walked away. That was the last we heard from his that evening. With heads down in disappointment, we quietly packed up our troops just in time for the "vocals" to turn their heads and complain about something new.   We walked down to McDade's where we knew food was ready to serve and we could quickly buy something for the kids. I'm baffled by the experience we had at Stories considering it's supposed to be a Fine Dining experience and hope that this evening was addressed within their staff as a learning experience to find some improvement in service and management.

reviews.author: C R.
reviews.description: Reading some of the reviews, I honestly think management took the critiques to heart and did some great changes.  I've eaten at some nice restaurants (see other reviews) so I know what good service and food is.  From the lobster bisque and wagu steak to the dessert, it was fantastic.  Great drinks and service was great!    And equally nice, the place is too pricey for families with screaming kids to dine at, usually, so it's a GREAT respite from the zoo this place turns in to in the summer.  Not a bad thing (all the families), but a break from the noise is a nice change.  Would be really nice if it was cooler to sit on the outside deck.  Will try that out when back here in the fall.

reviews.author: Sandra A.
reviews.description: If I could give this place zero stars based on the rudeness and attitude of the two young girls at hostess station I would.  We arrived 15 minutes early and were spoken to so rudely.  There was even a comment made about closed toe shoes.  WTH.  This is a vacation resort.  They obviously were trying to pass off the restaurant as some over the top fancy place and treated us like barefoot peasants.  This should never happen in the service industry at an upscale resort.

reviews.author: Jorge T.
reviews.description: Incredible experience. Great staff and ambience in a small dining room. My wife had the Caesar Salad and Skuna Bay Salmon with the Thyme Horseradish Crème Fraîche. I had the Stories Baby Greens and Prime Filet (8 oz) with Béarnaise sauce. Both were cooked perfectly.  We then split the Chocolate Peanut Bomb. The presentation was almost as good as it tasted. A must go!

reviews.author: Tina B.
reviews.description: I'm shocked this place has such a high star rating. I've been coming to Lost Pines for years and finally decided to try the Fine Dining restaurant since our kiddo is a teenager, but we quickly wished we had eaten at Shellers. The atmosphere is generic hotel/airport restaurant blandness. We ordered drinks which took a good 20 minutes. After we ordered entrees they brought bread and the chef sent out an amuse bouche which turned out to be the best of our choices. Our food took another 45 minutes which was so long considering we had an 8pm reservation. My son ordered the buffalo steak which came out cold. He had eaten several bites when I tried it and was surprised at the temperature. Yikes! Cold steak is not good. I ordered the risotto and I saw it had vegetables but it was literally dripping with vegetables and beets on top which made it a red color after a few bites. Not sure who thought that was a good idea. Risotto should be light and fluffy and not soggy. My husband had a salad and the lobster bisque but the bisque had a weird scorched flavor and he didn't eat that either. We were just ready to go by then because it was so late and I was still hungry. The waiter was nice enough but didn't even acknowledge the fact that we didn't eat our food. I cannot recommend this restaurant except if you're just trying to escape the loud atmosphere at Shellers or Firewheel. But for the price I'd rather eat at Shellers and keep an extra $100 for myself. Hyatt could do much better!

reviews.author: Patrick F.
reviews.description: Perfect date night.   This was a bit of a last minute idea so we did not make reservations...no problem. Excellent table with a view. Staff was wonderful and amazingly attentive. More about them later...  Drink and wine menu was not necessarily large but plenty of good choices at all price ranges. Staff very knowledgable as well.  Menu is limited but more than enough choices for every taste. I much prefer this than those over the top menus that offer everything under the sun.   Deconstructed Cesar salad was very good and light, great start. Chef sent over and delightful Amuse that was very tasty as well. Breads were great.   For proteins both my wife and I went for fish, Scottish salmon and poached halibut. Excellent on both counts, moist and tender, seasoned great. Blue corn grits was VERY tasty.   Desserts were spot on as well.   Back to the staff now...they could not have done a better job.  The attention to their customers throughout the restaurant was fun to watch. Always there when needed, and always with a smile. I wish more high end restaurants would follow this model.

reviews.author: C V.
reviews.description: This is a great place to get that fine dining without having to dress to the nines. Beautiful balcony with awesome views of the pine forest.   The staff are awesome and Chef Ted took great care of us. Will certainly be back.

reviews.author: Wayne W.
reviews.description: WOW!  I have been to many four and five star restaurants over the years and Stories stacks up with some of the best.  The service was great, the atmosphere was soothing and the food was amazing! I had the filet topped with crab and an amazing sauce, potatoes and a sweet tomato salad.     I would drive 2 hours to have dinner here again...what a great experience.

reviews.author: Heath C.
reviews.description: This place is top of it's class, in my opinion.  You won't feel like you're eating in a hotel, with such superb service, perfectly prepared entrees and wonderful ambiance.  There's at least one steak, seafood, lamb and chicken dish available every night.  Not only are the dishes beautiful and delicious, you will also get full.  I must also mention, I thoroughly enjoyed their gellato.  The staff is knowledgeable and bring plenty of hospitality.  $25-$40 per person is reasonable for what you get here.

reviews.author: Kelly C.
reviews.description: It took over an hour for our steaks to arrive after our appetizers so clearly our ticket was lost or something. The waiter never said anything but a gnocchi was delivered to our table at 45 minutes with a "sorry" but neither of us like cream based dishes so I would have preferred they ask us if there was something we wanted while we waited and it would have been nice to receive it at minute 25, not minute 45. My boyfriend's steak was definitely medium rare when he asked for medium but we didn't send it back as we were worried it would take another hour. $16 for 3 shrimp in a shrimp cocktail!  The dessert menu is laughable with 3 items. So a 2 1/2 hour dinner that should have taken 1 1/2 and a $220 bill. I'm giving it a 2 as the hamachi appetizer was wonderful and my filet (although significantly late) was delicious.

reviews.author: Jonathan B.
reviews.description: Service - Awesome. Everything I would expect from a fine dining establishment.  Setting - Nice, quiet and relaxed.  Food - Good to fair. Nothing was bad, but when compared to other top notch restaurants in Austin, such as Uchiko, the flavor was a bit wanting.  Value - Overpriced, especially for very small quantities.

reviews.author: Daniel H.
reviews.description: Well done. Hotel restaurants can be so hit-or-miss. From my experience, those with fancy good reputations are usually the miss, while those that are unassuming and quaint are hit.   Stories at Hyatt Lost Pines resort is hit. From the decor, to the menu, to the presentation, everything here is top notch.  The chef has many creative options on the menu, but the veal chop was my choice. Perfect.  We also ordered red velvet cake that was imprisoned behind a ghastly cage of chocolate. Also, perfect.    If you stay here you must go, and if you live around the area, I'd highly recommend checking this place out.

reviews.author: Tara M.
reviews.description: This restaurant is located in the Hyatt Lost Pines Resort in Bastrop just east of the Airport off 71. I highly recommend this place for a special occasion diner and since it is located in a 5 star resort plan on spending the night..  The ambiance is very elegant with a vaulted ceiling and wood tables  spaced far apart for privacy.  The servers were always there but not not close enough to eavesdrop..  And the food oh the food is out of this world goodness.  We tried several dishes but my favorites were the Salmon with Horseradish crust, Truffled mashed Potatoes and my glass of Frogs Leap Merlot.  Guys if you want to get lucky on the first date I highly recommend this place -  restaurant + beds = great fun!

reviews.author: Dave L.
reviews.description: Just so no one misunderstands me on this: This is one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at and the service is superb.  Period.  For Chapter 1 (it is called Stories, get it), I had Diver Scallops and my wife had Cauliflower Soup.  Excellent. For Chapter 2, I had the Smoked Duck and she had the Roasted Lamb.  Phenomenal. For Chapter 3, we shared the Bread Pudding.  Awesome.  I talked to the owner and the head chef for a little bit.  It's a nice cozy place and they take an interest on how everything is.  The menu changes from time to time, so even though I'd tell everyone to get the duck or the lamb, it may not be on the menu for you when you go.  This place is in the Lost Pines resort.  Another wonderful place, but that's another review.  This place is a keeper and I will remember it to go back to.  Just to be warned, it's not cheap, but like all good things...

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: Great little hangout in an unassuming area.... with great coffee and beer! I was a little surprised when we pulled up here. The building was nice, but wasn't what I was expecting.   The vibe here is great. A lot of young professionals clearly "working from home" but needed to get out of the house for a few hours. Very friendly customers and staff.   I ordered a vanilla latte and it came out wonderful. They had an awesome selection of beers on tap if that's your thing.   If I am in the area I will definitely be back for a visit.

reviews.author: Taylor S.
reviews.description: Great spot to grab a good coffee and get a little work done.  The coffee is legit good and they have beer on tap if you splurge toward the end of the day.  Parking is ample as well.  This is my go-to spot to meet my local rep while working in Austin.

reviews.author: Lilan N.
reviews.description: Love this coffee bar. Going here on a lunch break is the best! There's plenty of seating indoors and outdoors. It's a great place to go get some work done. The drinks are delicious too, I've gotten the Mexican spice mocha latte and it was so good! I want to go back and try the cold brew. The workers are sweet and there is plenty of parking!!

reviews.author: Westin P.
reviews.description: I had to actually spit out my coffee. It was a simple cold brew. Wife also trashed her vanilla latte.

reviews.author: Cyril G.
reviews.description: Cute coffee shop with plenty of places to sit and work. I got their coconut cold brew which was really good and not too sweet. They have some food options too but I wasn't hungry so I didn't get anything. Would recommend!

reviews.author: Olivia V.
reviews.description: Not a fan of leaving a bad review for a nice place, but I think I may have been served slightly off dairy milk here today (I'm not sick, but the taste was bad). I've been here a few times over the past years and it's a really cute, quiet spot for working. Today however I was served a matcha latte with a really funky taste to it. It seemed like the matcha powder used just sat in a thick later on top of the (1%) milk, without being well combined, and the milk tasted a little off to be honest. I regret not saying something but I think I attributed the taste to the matcha mixing issue at the time. The person I went with had a coffee which tasted fine, but used a different (dairy) milk from mine. Really a shame since my drink was so bad from the first sip, we just ended up leaving. Sorry stouthaus!

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here on a weekend afternoon and tried a local hefeweizen, the rose latte, and a brownie. The beer was tasty, and the rose latte was super smooth. The brownie was decadent and rich, with a crisp exterior and chewy interior. I like their patio space, but their inside space could do with more comfortable seating. Overall, service was good.

reviews.author: L P.
reviews.description: This is just the best lowkey coffee shop/hangout place. Every single staff member I've interacted with there is kind and accommodating and seems to genuinely like what they're doing. I'm not usually a flavored coffee drinker but they have a homemade cinnamon sugar syrup that is SO GOOD. I wake up craving it, lol. The golden milk latte is also a favorite of mine, and great for having later in the day when I don't want caffeine.

reviews.author: Magen D.
reviews.description: Stouthaus is such a cute spot! The vibe is very relaxed. The coffee and pastries are above average in taste, the staff were incredibly kind, and they had a ton of seating (indoor and outdoor). There were a lot of people, but it didn't feel overly crowded because of how large the space is.  They followed Covid protocols and everything was very clean!

reviews.author: Kate Z.
reviews.description: A nice open cafe by the highway.  There's a number of seats with surprisingly heavy chairs. The outdoor seating is very spacious but it's pretty loud with the cars zooming past us.   The pumpkin spice latte was okay. Not amazing. My friend says her cappuccino is just like any other.  The WiFi is solid. There are real and fake outlets (literally a sticker on the wall lol). It's a nice place to work or study. I like the temperature and the music is an okay volume.   I'd come back!

reviews.author: Krista H.
reviews.description: I came in on a Saturday afternoon and the whole outdoor patio was occupied so I was expecting there to be a line inside. I was pleasantly surprised when I was able to order right away! I got an iced cinnamon sugar latte with almond milk which came out to about $6.25. The price is a little steep, but the flavor and milk substitute added about $2.   The coffee came out relatively fast and was pretty good! The cinnamon was subtle, but the coffee was smooth and rich. My fiancé and I both enjoyed it! I don't know if I would come out of my way for this coffee, but if I was in the area I would definitely stop by again!   The location is convenient and there are other businesses on the same strip to try out as well. I would recommend coming here and getting some coffee to go!

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We went to stouthaus on Friday early afternoon, they have few tables outside and few inside with socially distanced, lady who took our order was kinda robotic.  we ordered cappuccino, coffee and cinnamon roll, post covid we are mostly doing takeouts but while we were waiting for the order we saw staff sanitizing table and chairs in between each customers so we felt comfortable to sit and enjoy the coffee there itself.  Cappuccino was good but little thin, coffee was pretty good, cinnamon roll was just ok.  Overall, definitely worth a visit and really appreciate the way they're handling the business in pandemic!

reviews.author: Bobbie L.
reviews.description: Cute little spot where you can drink coffee and beer. I would recommend the nitro coffee/iced latte. I wish there were more seating indoors and outside.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: I know Stouthaus is an Austin favorite, but I was pretty disappointed by my experience. They don't have a ton of seating indoors, but they do have a nice outdoor patio area. My friend and I both ordered an iced vanilla latte, and it was pretty meh. Nothing to come back for.

reviews.author: Elizabeth V.
reviews.description: Delicious coffee, friendly service, dog- and work-friendly patio seating. Pro-tip: Stop circling the crowded first parking lot in the daytime, and head past the front of the building to the wide-open north lot! *Masks required for ordering inside as of 9/2021, and there's a box inside the door if you need one.

reviews.author: Warren D.
reviews.description: Covid and Snowvid had me feeling creatively tapped. Coffeeshops have always been good to me but there are very few open for staying inside. Stouthaus was my muse! The coffee is really great and if I'm able to get some good work done I'll have a beer. The selections are priced right and curated well. The views aren't spectacular but that helps me focus on work for a little while. The staff and ownership seem to care about the work they are doing.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: I dig what Stouthaus is trying to do, it's a hip little joint that has coffee and beer which are both things I like.   It's pretty small inside, so if it's cold outside I wouldn't plan on finding a seat, but their patio is a nice addition with a beer garden feel. It is right off the highway though so don't go expecting a nice view of trees, but with the right company I don't think that really matters.  When I went the coffee didn't blow my mind, and they also didn't have any brewed at 1pm on a Thursday which was kind of strange to me for a coffeehouse so I had to wait. But that did mean it was fresh which is always nice.   They have fake outlets (they're stickers) which is kind of funny I guess but wasn't funny to me when I found a seat and my laptop died... they also have real ones though so don't worry.   All in all a cute little place and worth checking out if you're in the mood for a new local coffee shop. Or a low key place for a beer.

reviews.author: Christine C.
reviews.description: This is one of my favorite coffee shops in Austin! Friendly staff, good coffee and a casual, welcoming vibe.  They have a dedicated parking lot that makes visiting it so much easier and less stressful than many of the other coffee shops in the area. It has a decent number of plugs and space to get work done as well as a covered outdoor area. The one thing I don't like is that their chairs are not very comfortable when you're sitting in them for several hours getting work done. Even so, I think this is one of the best coffee shops in Austin!

reviews.author: Cindy W.
reviews.description: I loved how much room there was for people to grab a table to do work or hold meetings. They have really good coffee and pastry selections. We ordered the vanilla rose latte but I didn't really get any rose flavor which was disappointing, but the drink itself was still pretty good.

reviews.author: Heather D.
reviews.description: I come here a lot, to think, to work, to hang. It is my top 3 places to study. I love that they have Kampuchea on Tap. Their coffee really is THE BEST! They focus on Austin Coffee companies, I like that. Note, they close fairly early, 7/8. My only "complaint", the benches...the seats...my booty does not really love the hard flat wood. But, that is a minor problem.  Thanks, Stouthaus!

reviews.author: Natalia L.
reviews.description: What an incredible winery  with such knowledgeable personable staff. Located on such an extraordinary piece of land. Me and my husband each did a wine  flight and picked our favorite sips and ordered a glass each which we enjoyed on the fabulous patio.  I love that with every flight purchase included is a souvenir wine  glass. Flights and by the glass were very reasonable given the type of wine  served.  We ended up enjoying our time so much that we came back an additional day.  I highly recommend this place to anyone looking to sip on some delicious wine .

reviews.author: Shirley R.
reviews.description: This place is so beautiful! Heads up though, make sure you make rezzies for the tastings, we didn't and were unable to since they were fully booked that day.  However, do not fret if you didn't, because the grounds are stunning. You can order a glass or a bottle, no judgment ;), from their double decker bus, that gave me some serious harry potter vibes. Then take it and enjoy the view. There is ample sitting. I would love to come back with reservations of course, and try a flight in their beautiful tasting room.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: Had such a wonderful time here, we went on Tuesday via reservation and were the only ones there until noon. Plenty of outdoor space to social distance along with animals to interact with: donkies, goats and miniature horses! A decent selection of wines with one standing out in particular to our taste-buds, can't remember the name specifically but it was red wine cherry blend, maybe seasonal?   The staff is friendly, place was very easy to find, there is a bit of construction going on in and around the place but it's not too big of an annoyance to take away from the overall great experience.

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: I truly enjoyed my visit to Wimberley Valley Winery. This was the first stop on my wine tour for my anniversary weekend. The tasting reservation process was pretty easy. The tasting price is very fair (5 glasses for $18) and the pours were generous. The wines were very good. I left with a couple of bottles. I definitely recommend the Christmas Cuveé and the Sangria wine. Once you finish your tasting, there is plenty of space outside on the patio or other areas to just sip more wine and just be.  A lovely experience.

reviews.author: Kasper L.
reviews.description: This is a cool place! I'm glad I had the opportunity to visit here. I'd like to come back and try the tasting.   The outdoor seating area was nice and very spacious. I did like the outdoor patio and the arrangement of all the things. I enjoyed the red wines that they had. I really liked the season fruit wines--tasted like juice with how fruity they were (I mean that in a good way).   The food truck also served some pretty solid food. Really enjoyed the chili and cheese tator tots. The pizza was good too! The burger was a little disappointing though.   All in all, nice place to visit! Come check it out!

reviews.author: Kelli N.
reviews.description: Visited this winery today and enjoyed everything about it! The wines were better than expected and the ambiance was terrific. What I really didn't expect was the fantastic food. Finding something a gluten free vegetarian could safely eat and enjoy was beyond my expectations but wow did they surprise. Best gluten free veggie I've ever had! Lovely afternoon here, we'll definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: I was looking for something Covid safe to do outside and to get out of the house. This winery has plenty of space on the grounds to distance safely from others. We made a reservation for a tasting. Well worth it to learn about the types of wine. The staff is knowledgeable and nice. It is a comfortable environment and you can ask many questions. After the tasting we ordered a glass each and went outside. We ordered a pizza from the mobile kitchen. It was wonderful!  I suggest going on a beautiful day and enjoy wine, good food and sunshine!

reviews.author: Eric W.
reviews.description: We went wine tasting with a group of 5. The collection was big and the server was very inquisitive, informative, and kind. After our hour of tasting 5 wines, we bought two bottles and went out to the property to enjoy the day and the live music. We had a perfect spot beside the musicians (who were very very good) and had an amazing view of the property. I was at peace with all the elements in place. I will be back, bringing family, and enjoying a bottle here and there.

reviews.author: Mahwish S.
reviews.description: This is my second time visiting this winery. I loved it the first time and it left an impression on me to go back. Because of Covid, they are doing tastings by reservations only so that they can control number of people and properly space out in their tasting room. I'm sure you'll love a bottle to buy and you'll have ample time and space to enjoy it on their deck or yard after your tasting. Our tasting guide, Robert, was very knowledgeable about the different wines and a joy to converse with! They do have a good truck on their premises that bakes wood fire pizzas. I didn't try any this time because we already had brunch before coming. The port was my favorite wine. You've got to try it for yourself!

reviews.author: Gloria G.
reviews.description: This place is beautiful. Our first time in wimberly. We had such a great time, so peaceful. The live music was great. She kept it PG for the babies. The manager was walking around greeting everyone. The employees gave us suggestions on where to stay. Over all great experience.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Made a rez (required) a day in advance and was prompted seated for my 45min tasting! I decided to go with 5 TX wines to try, and they did not disappoint! My server gave super generous pours and timed it accordingly. Because I'm a slow drinking, I had the last 2 to enjoy in the spacious courtyard area. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Brittany D.
reviews.description: What a great find!! I recommend the wine slushies! Watermelon was my favorite however the red reserve one was not bad either (more dry). They have a food truck on-site which has delicious thin crust woodfire pizza. We got the Lexus of Lactose. Atmosphere was great and relaxing. Definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: We just moved to the area and recently took our out of town guests to this charming winery...what a treat! The wine was pretty good ( i mean it's not Napa, y'all) but the ambiance, scenery and people are amazing! The tasting was very reasonably priced and the tasting room is full of gorgeous local art. The grounds are stunning with mini horses to pet and love on and plenty of photo ops. Definitely put this place on your Austin wi

reviews.author: Brett J.
reviews.description: A year later and Wimberly Valley Winery is just getting better!  Our friends are members here and we joined them to go out and pick up their wine. While we were there we had a tasting.  They now have a full line up of "fruit" wines like Blackberry, Cherry and cinnamon, honey crisp apple, and others. They are on the sweeter side but for me were seriously tasty! I loved the cherry and the blackberry.  However at this time of year it is the mulled wine that truly wins the day for me! If you haven't had mulled wine I suggest you get off your butt, drive the distance, and sample some right now! It is so worth it!  A hearty and loud Ooooh my Goddie toooo Hottie to this wonderful glass of spiced wine that is served hot! It brings flashes of warm fire places, deep snow, thick sweaters and holiday cheer with every sip. It is my absolute favorite!  They are adding more structures to the location, the outside area is a divine place to grab a bottle and just sit and soak up the outdoors while enjoying a good sip with friends, and the inside is a great lush environment of comfy lodge like decor.  It is a great location with good people and a great selection of wines... not only theirs but a plethora of other wines as well. We always enjoy our time here!   One last note.... try the mulled wine! It is the holiday season in a bottle!

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: This place was definitely a one and done. There wasn't anything bad about our visit but there wasn't anything great about it either. They don't even use Texas grapes so these are all from out of state and only a handful are barrel aged. They were basic and not anything special. We came for a tasting so we tried a total of 5 different wines each (10 between the two of us.) They even serve store bought wines here!!! I've NEVER been to a winery that serves what I can buy myself at HEB. They didn't tell you anything about the wines other than "this is dry and fruit forward," no explanation of the grapes used, how long its aged, etc that we've become used to at other wineries. Also the alcohol content must be very low in thier wines, we went on empty stomachs and neither of us felt a thing which is not the case at other wineries we've been to. I'd give it a try if you're in the area, but don't expect much. The grounds are nice and they have a cute double decker bus they converted but for us one visit was plenty.

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: We came here for our anniversary and we loved it! We'd never done anything like it before, and we were not disappointed! And honestly how often do you see blue wine???

reviews.author: Carly H.
reviews.description: Drinks were good but service was poor. Server Gabriel said we had a bad experience because he works for his ex and that we could leave a review about our "shitty experience" on Yelp. Welllll, here I am. When we walked out we got to speak to the owner and realized our tasting came with a complimentary wine glass that the server didn't provide. Owner brought it out, thankfully. Place is beautiful but had a better experience at other wineries because of service.

reviews.author: Kirsten P.
reviews.description: Nice looking place! Amazing vibes and the patio area is just so cute! I reserved a "table" and when I went in I was very confused. No chairs or tables unless you go in the back (where they don't serve the wine) so we stood at the wine bar waiting for tastings. Wine was delicious and our waitress was so sweet and nice!

reviews.author: Erika S.
reviews.description: Honestly, I'm disappointed in the experience of this place. We saw the reviews of this winery and thought it would be a fun part of our weekend trip, so my three friends and I came in for a wine tasting inside their bar and we were surprised about the snooty service and multiple issues we had. First off, when we were pointed to which bar we'd be tasting at, there was a dirty tissue on the ground that was at our station (which I had kicked away, not wanting to make a fuss out of it). It apparently wasn't cleaned yet before we arrived, so our sommelier wiped it down before placing the menus down. In addition, we were placed right by the exit/entrance door to their storage room where we constantly shuffled away to not block the staff coming in and out.   When she quickly put down some menus and expo markers and asked us to pick 5 wines to try and walked away, she didn't really care to pause and help us with decisions, so I stepped in to help my friends who were less knowledgeable about wines. Throughout our wine tasting process, our sommelier also made really strange comments to us, saying multiple times: "This particular wine is really expensive, so that's why you only get a splash." Not sure why that was necessary to repeatedly state that? It wasn't encouraging us to purchase anything, especially when we weren't enjoying the particular tastes of our wine and she didn't bother helping us give recommendations, other than asking if we had any questions after we already picked our choices. When one of my friends asked about the bathrooms not working, she just curtly answered it was because the pressure gauge was off for the whole place due to the Wells. I understand that's not entirely in their control, but she did not have to respond in a rude way, and unfortunately my friends had to hold their bladders until we got back to our cabin bathroom.  Overall, I recommend people skip the wine tasting indoors and just go straight to the outdoor patios to check out the cute red bus that has the express wine bar service. The person in there seemed a lot nicer, and there were places we could've sat down and enjoyed the nice weather, instead of standing the whole time interacting with our rude sommelier indoors.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places EVER!  I'm a member so I go as often as I can, their member benefits are amazing. My niece and nephew love taking carrots for the horses and donkeys and kicking the soccer ball around. The venue is just beautiful and even when their are tons of people there it just doesn't feel crowded, the layout is perfect.    The wine is top notch. I  like sweeter wines so most on the menu suits me but they have some dry wine as well for folks who love a dry red or white.  Slushes in the summer, warm spiced wine in the winter, fruit wines in the fall ... this place has it figured out!  Grab a Cheese tray and hang out for an hour or stay all day!

reviews.author: Taylor B.
reviews.description: Came here for a Bachelorette Party and it was awesome!!! Colt Wayne gave us the best tour and was so fun to be around! Super informative and fun! The beer was great too!

reviews.author: Emilee W.
reviews.description: This was amazing! Our guide Trey, was awesome!  Way more drinks than we expected and was the perfect blend of information, alcohol and sights! We will be back next time we're in town!!! The price was GREAT for the tour and amount of beverages we got. We even had a last minute change in our tour, due to some bar hours changing due to COVID, and the team just picked it up, made it happen for us and got us a partial refund. 12/10 would recommend them again!

reviews.author: Elizabeth L.
reviews.description: Great tours, great guides and stops. We have done two tours with them and both were awesome. Trace and Colt both very personable and funny. The ride is fun and not hard. Got to see a lot of the city. Very reasonably priced.

reviews.author: G F.
reviews.description: If I could give Adam and Bike and Brews 6 stars, I would!!! He was very accommodating and knowledgeable about Austin's history. The tour was great to start the weekend in Austin- Adam had many tips for where to go and how to plan our weekend. He was personal guide for Austin's must-see spots. If you are ever in Austin, we highly recommend going to bike and brews or other tours offered through Adam's company (Austin Bike Tours and Rentals).

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: We did the 3 mile tour with Trace and had a blast!  He is passionate about the culture, beer and history of Austin and it definitely shines through in his guided tour!  I would definitely recommend booking this tour if you're looking to see the less touristy and more of the "hidden gems" (as Trace puts it) along the east side of Austin.   Thanks Trace - we had a great time!

reviews.author: Molly H.
reviews.description: Friends and I an amazing day with this company! Colt was great on the tour and Adam was fantastic to work with for booking. He even gave us some great food recommendations for us to stop and get food before our tour. Colt was super knowledgeable of Austin and took us on an amazing ride around town. At each spot he helped us get set up with our tastings and allowed us to take our time at each brewery. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Seth F.
reviews.description: Absolutely phenomenal day with Adam on this tour. Bruce is selected at killer beers, he had great information about the city, and the food that we ate was all outstanding. Highly recommend this to her!

reviews.author: Tom P.
reviews.description: If you're looking to experience east Austin and enjoy a few beers along the way, Bike and Brew ATX is the way to do it. Trace, our tour guide, showed us around town and offered up some history about the area. The hills are tough but the beer goes down easy. 5/5 experience. Thanks Trace!

reviews.author: Andrew R.
reviews.description: Had a great tome. Pretty good value; about 5-6 alcoholic drinks and three food items. Trace, our guide, was incredible. Knowledgeable and personable. He had connections all over town that provided us with a unique experience we will not forget.   GET THE SECRET BEER

reviews.author: Nikki B.
reviews.description: Amazingly fun! Colt was the best guide! So much fun...and he's super hot! ;) so all you bachelorettes book Colt NOW!

reviews.author: Eva R.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I did the half heart tour in east Austin and it was a great way to explore the area. Adam was an awesome tour guide! He not only showed us some great breweries but also told us some history about Austin and Texas. Really fun tour, definitely recommend it - whether you just moved to Austin, are visiting, or have been here a while!

reviews.author: Claire M.
reviews.description: This is our favorite thing to do while in Austin! Its the perfect mix of sight seeing, drinking, and socializing! We have done two tours with this group and all of our tour guides were so easy going and knowledgeable. They provide you with a huge list of things to do while in Austin so its a great tour to sign up for early in your trip if you can!

reviews.author: Sonia R.
reviews.description: This is an extremely late review- a friend and I did this bike tour with Adam on a cold, rainy day and it was so much fun! Learned a bit about Austin's history, drank delicious beers, and made a new friend. Thank you Adam for a lovely and memorable experience!

reviews.author: Christa S.
reviews.description: We had an amazing time! Trace was an amazing tour guide. He was very knowledgeable.  I highly reccomend this tour!

reviews.author: Shannon N.
reviews.description: Trace was our guide and boy was he awesome! My brother wants to move to ATX after he graduates, which was the whole premise for our visit, and Trace asked him about what he wanted to do and why he wanted to transplant to Austin. This made our biking ride (though cold) feel very personable. We had an amazing time riding, chatting and drinking. Trace was super knowledgeable and even gave us some local recommendations that weren't on the East side map. 100% would recommend to a local or visitor. Bikes and brew are passionate about what they do and it shows!

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: My friends coordinated the Bike and Brew + Tacos tour for my bachelorette and it was absolutely fantastic. Adam had the whole day mapped perfectly, an awesome balance of sight seeing/neighborhood history as well as delicious beers and mouth-watering tacos. This was a great way to spend the daytime hours with friends while checking a lot of "You're in Austin! You have to eat tacos/BBQ/drink local beer/have an Armadillo" check boxes.  There's no need to be a cyclist to do this activity, it is very approachable for people of all cycling comforts. Not a beer fan? They also have wine options and coffee!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: A must-do in Austin! 3 breweries, all tastings included, with the added bonus of biking around town. Colt was a fantastic guide-- we felt safe (no easy feat to corral our large group of ladies), learned some history, and drank great beer. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Belinda F.
reviews.description: My husband and I did the Austin's Gem tour today. Adam was our guide, and although we are native to the area, we enjoyed learning some new tidbits about our beloved city and enjoyed exploring breweries we had not visited. Adam even adjusted our stops to visit some breweries with cider and wine to accommodate different preferences. Biking on the east side was a blast, not too hard, Adam preps you for the hills, seeks out shade and hydrates you at the breweries. Great time!

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: We took the Bike and Brew tour at my bachelorette party, and I'm so glad we did! Trace, our tour guide, was SO much fun and very knowledgeable about Austin history/things to do. We had an awesome time joking around, biking at a leisurely pace, and, of course, drinking. Definitely one of the high points of the weekend, and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Austin!

reviews.author: Morgan V.
reviews.description: Awesome spot to grab a coffee, do some homework and buy a bike. Atmosphere was super chill and laid back. In a hopping part of town so once your done with the coffee study biking you've got the city hotspots a few steps away!

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: The staff always gives a warm welcome when we stop here to eat. There is outside (dogs welcomed) and inside seating.   We have been here a few times and love their food.    My favorite so far is the brisket banh mi and their potato salad. The brisket is smoked perfectly and the bread texture compliments the heartiness of the brisket well.  I love the fresh veggies they put in this!  The potato salad is hands down the best potato salad I have ever had at a restaurant. You have got to try this!!  We have ordered a few drinks in the past - they have a great Happy Hour.  You cant miss it - follow your nose to North Lamar and treat yourself.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty takes the best of both worlds by combining traditional Viet style of cooking with American BBQ to give you a fusion you didn't know you needed... until now. You can find items such as the:  - Brisket Bánh Mì: I enjoy the twist of smokey, fatty flavors from the brisket as well as the creamy cilantro and soy sauce that it comes with. The fries are amazing, too! $13.95 (4.5/5)  - Leaning Tower of Texas: a brunch special that is a stack of 3 hash browns, brisket, jalapeño cheddar sausage, pork belly, sambal hollandaise (sambal is like chile peppers), and bánh mì veggies - this is a lot more filling than it looks, I definitely would suggest you share it. I thought it was pretty good. $23.75 (4/5)  - Pho Queso: you read that right, they take veggie pho broth and mix it in with melted cheese to give you a unique take on queso. The pro here is that it's vegetarian friendly, but the con is that the flavor is a bit faint and I wish they would use a beef pho base instead. It's still good however! $7 (3.5/5)  Overall, this is a great spot to visit if you're craving BBQ, but also want to try something different. They have an outdoor patio if you prefer to sit outside. They also have awesome customer service and the prices are good too. With that said, I give them a 4.25/5.

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: This place was everything I had hoped it would be. Now I just wish there was another one in Houston!  This Texas Tower looks intimidating but just roll up your sleeves, topple that thing over, and dive right in. The jalapeño sausage has some sneaky heat. Perfectly crispy hashbrowns with beautifully salted pork belly. Loved every bite.  We also shared the pork belly and brisket banh mi's and smokin fries. Most banh mi places we are quick to grab the Sriracha and Maggie's Sauce but not this time. It didn't even cross my mind until days after.  The brisket has the most amazing flavor and so moist. Almost a shame to lose it into anything else. But a perfect addition to any menu item.  Such warm and friendly owners and staff.   Parking was easy on a Sunday afternoon.  CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK FOR MORE!!!

reviews.author: Kelsi D.
reviews.description: I really wanted this to be a revolutionary experience. The concept is so cool, but their menu is a little repetitive and the food was just good. Not saying that this wasn't an awesome meal, but I really wanted it to be something to write home about. And it just wasn't.   The banh mi sandwiches were very dry but the meat was insanely tender, though   lacking a lot of flavor. The cost is a little higher but the portion sizes are large and generous.   The real show stopper here though, is the bbq sauce. It's the right mix of Asian flavors and classic bbq sweetness.   It's worth the visit to see this take on two fairly different cuisines mashed together. But don't expect to be wowed away. It doesn't scream fusion to me, it just seems like they took some of the most popular parts of each cuisine and put them separately on the plate.

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty is a fusion restaurant that combines Vietnamese and BBQ cuisine. They have lots of indoor and outdoor seating. They even have live music on some weeknights. You order at the bar counter and take your number to the table, and they bring out your food out to you. We sat outside, but the service was slightly lacking as we had go back into the restaurant for multiple items like silverware and napkins. The meat tasted good, I would favor the pork belly over the brisket- the bread was hard and crispy for banh mi. I definitely would view them more as a BBQ joint versus Vietnamese, although they do have some interesting drinks with Viet twists. Overall, a good place to go especially if looking for late night food. They have they own private parking lot as well.

reviews.author: Joel M.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty fuses Texas barbecue with Vietnamese cuisine. I popped in for the Double Fantasy Bahn Mi (brisket and pork belly). Served on a crunchy, fresh baguette, the meats were perfectly smoked and flavorful, and the pickled vegetables were crisp and colorful. If you prefer a bit of added heat, ask for jalapeños and sriracha. I also tried the slaw which was fresh and bright with Asian flavors.  There is plenty of seating outside. The decor inside is plenty nice with dark wood decor. The restaurant sports a full bar. This is such a great little neighborhood spot.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Ordered online. Went to pickup when was supposed to be available but wasn't ready. There was no parking so had to park with my hazards on and had asked the bartender if she could bring it out to since I had my dog in my car, she said yes. I guess she forgot cause I walked in 20mins later to ask and it was there. Got home to eat my food and it was okay. Honestly tasted better the next day, but probably wouldn't go again with so many other options available.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Came by on a Friday night to see a friend's band, the Lone Star Debonairs.  Also wanted dinner... and this is the second BBQ place I've been to in less than a week!  Smokin Beauty is in the Vietnamese area of North Austin, and is a Vietnamese/BBQ hybrid.  They're a small place but have good outdoor seating and parking, and the weather this Friday night was perfect for eating and dancing.  The food: I ordered their brisket and pork belly salad with a creamy cilantro dressing.  The brisket had nice smoke and a good bark, and the pork belly was soft without being mushy or all fat, and really lightly flavored, showing off the meat.  Fresh, crisp veggies made it perfect  They also have Banh Mi on the menu, and a Viet BBQ plate with Texas BBQ and Viet vegetables.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: I can't stop thinking about this meal. The brisket is perfectly smoky. The pork belly is perfectly crispy. All the flavors pair together perfectly. It was all just...PERFECT!

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: My postal colleague and I stopped here on Mother's Day and I cannot even begin to explain the positive energy Tao had upon arrival. I told her we always carry mail past the pits and always wanted to try it. I ordered the brisket banh mi with potato salad as well as an happy hour cocktail.
