My friend got a two meat plate with slaw and potato salad. The salad was incredible, we both agreed. He loved the pork belly so much!  For the price point, it was absolutely worth it! Discussing the passion Matt and Tao have for opening this business during a pandemic is inspiring nonetheless. Stop on by!

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: Delicious joint serving a unique combo of Vietnamese and traditional BBQ. I loved my experience here, the food was absolutely delicious and lots of interesting drinks to choose from as well. It's also not often you see a bbq place serve brunch on the weekends as well, I will definitely be back to try that.   Some must tries are definitely the brisket and the sausage. The brisket was incredibly fatty and tender with tons of smoky flavor. I loved the sausage as well, the bites of melted cheese in the middle were to die for.   The bahn mi sandwich was pretty good too, the fatty pork belly goes super well with pickled veggies and cilantro. The sides were great as well, I would recommend the slaw for sure.   If you're looking for some drinks I would recommend one of the mimosa carafes. $20 and you get a full bottle of champagne mixed in. We got the guava one but I would love to try lychee next time.   I definitely think bbq and Vietnamese are a match made in heaven and would highly recommend everyone try Smokin Beauty!

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: Vietnamese and BBQ fusion food - delicious. You can get either or a mixed combo. I got a brisket Banh Mi which was perfect. Great outdoor seating with live music on Friday nights. Make sure to bring a coat in the winter time!

reviews.author: Nancy C.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty perfects Vietnamese flavor meets Texas bbq fusion food! I loved the concept from the start and my belly was happy with the results. My boyfriend and I shared the brisket banh mi with slaw as a side, as well as the Viet king meat plate with potato salad and fries. Also ordered the Vietnamese coffee at the end.   Definitely recommend the banh mi - the bread used has the perfect texture - soft and bursting with flavor on the inside and crusty bite on the outside. The brisket was yummy and the pork belly was absolutely unctuous! Def getting the pork belly banh mi next time. Although neither of us are usually huge sausage fans at bbq spots, this sausage was amazing. So flavorful and stood its ground against the brisket and pork belly!  Sides - all were awesome accompaniments. The fries were nice and crispy, the slaw was a refreshing reprieve from the rich meat, and the potato salad had a delicious Asian twist to it.  If I had to provide any feedback, I will note that there was a frozen fry in the mix of the other fries and was quite jarring to bite into lol. But it happens. Also thought the Vietnamese coffee was pretty pricey at $7 even though the rest of the meal was fairly priced.  Overall, I would recommend this spot and will be back!

reviews.author: Michelle N.
reviews.description: We came here on their pop-up mini mart fundraiser for AMA and APA in March 2021. We were very excited to support a local vietnamese startup! All of their vendors were very sweet and they took pre-orders. Next time I go, I need to pre-order  everything was all gone by the time we got there. It starts at 12 and we got there at 130. If you want good parking, get there early!! I suggest taking a smaller car if you're a bad parker. Their parking lot situation is a nightmare for a horrible driver like me.   We ordered the Thai tea boba, Spinach dip, brisket banh mi, king burger, and double cheese brisket burger.   Boba: I know this isn't a boba shop, but I was quite disappointed in the size of the drink. It was basically half the size of a normal sweet tea drink. The drink was fresh. It was hot when it got to me. I had to stir it to make it cold. I usually get it served already mixed and cold. Their tapioca was cooked so well. Usually some places have dry and crunchy boba. Not here! Their boba is well cooked and is very gooey.  Spinach dip and fries: wowza! That tasted fresh. We looked at the spinach while eating and not all of the leaves were fully wilted. That's how you know that they didn't use frozen spinach! You can taste the spinach and the fries are very flavorful. I love the way that they seasoned everything. I might be completely wrong though   The food was amazing in general, but to call it fusion was a bit conflicting for us. We looked at the brisket banh mi and the coleslaw to need a little bit more tweaking. The coleslaw was quite runny and very liquidy. The banh mi needs more veggies. We weren't quite sure if it had the pate. If it did, it was easily overpowered by the brisket. We personally felt that it needed more vietnamese oomph. The french bread was on point though  We prefer the soft bread over the crunch. Other than the fusion part, that dish was DELICIOUS.   The other two meals were amazing. We loved everything about them. Burgers were cooked well and the buns were sooooo soft!   We are a vietnamese family and we love Smokin Beauty! We think you did a great job with the restaurant and are extremely excited about your future. We're definitely coming back in the future and becoming regulars. My brother has asked for us to come here on birthdays and introducing our parents to this place!

reviews.author: Wayne N.
reviews.description: Vietnamese BBQ? Sure, why not? I liked the idea - pickled vegetables, baguettes and smoky meat is hard not to like. Definitely feels fushiony as there's the drink menu but also boba and vietnamese coffee, side dishes that champion more so counterparts to texas bbq. It's a unique cultural mishmash that you just need to try for yourself.  I got a viet style king plate to split and overall it's pretty good. It's definitely a lot of food that I think can be pretty easily split between two people. Brisket, hefty chunks of pork belly and a whole cheddar sausage, baguette chunks and two sides. I would recommend getting an extra side of baguette if you're splitting because you are a bit bread light otherwise. Overall, while each meat was good and smoky, they were all a tad bit on the dry side today. Of the three, I think the pork belly was the best. The sausage has some kick but not that much, with a thoroughly emulsified texture. The brisket has the bark and smoke ring but even the moist was a little dry by the time we got it. Maybe just an off night but it's not disappointing with the sauce.  The sides I think are the best part - the creamed spinach is on point and the fries are crisp, with some extra crunch factor that I love and is great textural contrast to all the tender meat and the spinach. The sauces (jalepeno ranch and bbq sauce) are good too.

reviews.author: Kat L.
reviews.description: Stopped by for lunch, got 2 banh mi's, one is pork belly and the other brisket. I got fries and potatoes salad as sides.   Pork belly is 10/10  Brisket is sooooo good with the jalapeños 8/10 Fries 9/10 lowkey tastes like funnel cakes  Potato salad 10/10, best potato salad ever.   Will be back!

reviews.author: Steve L.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a Blood Bros equivalent and find yourself in Austin, you need to stop by and see Smokin Beauty. This is a marriage between Vietnamese and Texas BBQ that makes a lovely couple.  When we arrived we were really looking forward to trying the Banh Mi's, but after talking to the gal behind the counter we were definitely sold on getting the King plate. We reasoned it would be the same as getting a Banh mi, only it will be less bread yet virtually the same ingredients. That was fine with us since we were heading to a conference and didn't want to get weighed down. But this allowed us to get a real birds eye view of their style and taste, and also to sample all the meats- the brisket, cheese jalapeño sausage, and the pork belly. And oh my, when the King plate came out, we were quite impressed. The brisket is one of the moist and softest I've tasted. The pork belly was nicely charred,  yet amazingly soft and smoked so well. The jalapeño sausage was also good and had a great kick to it.   However the advantage of getting the king plate was the two sides, which included the smokin fries, where they put on generous helpings of brisket, cilantro, onion, and cheese. That was so incredibly good. Combine that with their bbq sauce and the creamy cilantro sauce, and both of these fuse together to really bring out the tastes or the meat. Would definitely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Henry L.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty is a great example of combining two cuisines properly to make something fun and delicious.  We ordered pickup and the process was pretty smooth.  Online ordering is easy and you can see what orders are ahead of you and their status.  You tell them when you're at the restaurant, and they'll walk your order straight to your car.  Staff was great!  I ordered the King Banh Mi with a side of creamed spinach.  I also tried their Smokin Fries as well.  The meats are great, and while the King Banh Mi was a ton of meat, I felt that the sandwich it was a bit overloaded.  Eating it was messy and everything was falling apart.  Still would recommend it if you wanted to try all the meats at once.  Like most BBQ, the meats can get salty and heavy, but the sauces, carrots, and cucumbers offer a nice refreshing taste.  Between the meats, the brisket was my favorite.  It was very tender; the fibers easily separate as you pinch down on the meat.  It had a nice fattiness as well.  The Smokin fries come with the brisket, so I would definitely recommend those as well.  The fries didn't get soggy either, which was impressive.  The creamed spinach was also really good.  The spinach wasn't as pulverized as in normal creamed spinach, so you get a nice texture and slight bitterness from the leaves.  Would definitely get this again.  Smokin Beauty's menu has a wide variety of items, so can stop by a lot of times and still try new things.  Can't wait to be back.

reviews.author: Troy H.
reviews.description: Really good experience for Brunch. Loved the Texas Brisket Hash and the Waffles and Belly. We washed it all down with a really fresh bloody mary and their Bourbon viet coffee.  Great new local place offering really good options. I'll be back for their amazing brisket burger.

reviews.author: Sandi G.
reviews.description: I rarely give 5 stars but this place deserves it!  It's a little bit out of the way up north but the food was definitely worth the drive.  There's an outdoor patio area with a smoker as well as an indoor area that's designed like a bar.  This place is self service so once you ordered your food, you'll need to get water and clean up after yourself.  Since it was my first time here, I got both the bellies and waffles for brunch as well as a brisket banh mi to save for dinner later.  The waffles is more like a funnel cake style dough and I love it!  My friend got the brisket hash and honestly, I wished I had gotten the brisket hash cause it was amazing!  The brisket banh mi was the best banh mi I've ever had.  I don't like traditional banh mi sandwiches cause they're normally cold and I don't like cold sandwiches.  The banh mis here are made with warm meat and toasted.  Even after I microwaved it later it still tasted amazing.  I can't wait to come back again and get another banh mi to go!

reviews.author: Oli J.
reviews.description: Glad to see another restaurant on the Far Eastside, we got a table right away, and the host was very friendly. Our server was great too, she was very personable!   We had their in-house beers, the lager and pilsner, both good, the other is a dunkel which we didn't get to since they serve the beers in a 32 oz mug, for $11, great deal.  We had the currywurst, antelope, and duck sausages, the currywurt came on fries instead of a bun and was my favorite but the duck was soooo good, sweet and juicy.  We'll definitely come back, the atmosphere is friendly and the beer is tasty. Next time I'll try a schnitzel!

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: Oof - I totally understand when a place opens it takes a while to get all the things running smoothly. The wait staff was extremely nice! Unfortunately, it was hard to try any of the menu as they were out of what seemed to be everything including the beers. I will be back to give it another try but the first time wasn't a hit sadly.  (P.s. they have a parking lot which is always great esp in Austin)

reviews.author: Hope F.
reviews.description: I'm pretty sure a literal prince owns this place, but super unlikely that he'd be hauling himself over the host stand to figure out how to get a check... to pay... to leave.   The prince may also not understand the going rate for schnapps these days. I was interested to see what $8 of schnapps gets you. The answer is a single shot of schnapps. I'm from NYC, so I hate when people complain about prices - but that one really cut me deep.   I'd recommend kokos maybe if you're with work colleagues in a large group and just kind of need a place to sit, and at some point may get a beer.

reviews.author: Nick M.
reviews.description: Solid pretzels, but everything else was pretty mediocre.  The latkes were lukewarm and not crunchy at all.  German potato salad was bland.  Currywurst was dry and cold, with mushy fries.  I was bummed.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Yikes, this place is not ready for primetime.  Went with a pretty big group of about 20 people. We were all paying for our own food and drinks, which should be a pretty normal thing, but it absolutely wasn't. But I'll get to that.  I arrived late and our server was very quick to learn my name and take my order, so props to him. He helped me pick a beer to order and it came out pretty quickly. Unfortunately, someone else brought the beer and was going around the other end of the table asking who had this beer. When he got to me, I told him I didn't know if it was even my beer because the server picked for me. Not a great start.  I was hungry but thought $9 was pretty ridiculous for a braut. But my friend was enjoying his and he had it within minutes of ordering, so I said what the hell, I'll try it. 20-30 minutes later it still hadn't arrived, so I told the server to cancel the order and just close me out. Then it got worse.  "What did you have?" I don't know man, just the one beer you picked. He told me he had no idea how to split tabs which is just insane for this sort of a place. After a few minutes of him staring at his POS, I told him I'll just figure out who's paying and I'll Venmo then. Then I watched each person from our party ask the same question as they wanted to close out.  I also watched various staff come out with different food and drink items and constantly not know who was supposed to be receiving it. And not just within our large group... sometimes they brought food to our table that was for a different table. Just complete confusion on where things go. You know, what should be very basic for food service before you open.  I know it's a new place, and I did enjoy the vibe, but geez it was way too stressful to deal with everything that I won't be going back unless I hear they've properly trained their staff.

reviews.author: Andrew B.
reviews.description: I can absolutely see this restaurant being a hit for people who live downtown. The beer brewed in-house is priced fairly and tastes delicious. The location itself is cute and Instagram-worthy. The fries were awesome. As a casual place to grab a quick beer, munch on some appetizers and taste some interesting sausages, and then move on to the next venue, I think Koko's works great. For yuppie trash from suburbia who want a filling meal (points at self), however, it's hard to justify the trip due to the small portions, high prices, and spotty service.  First off, I'm almost certain that my server was high. I personally have no objections to anyone doing what they need to in order to get through their day, but from completely forgetting our orders immediately after taking our orders, to sending our our apps, entrees, and desserts to the wrong table each time, his vibing unfortunately kinda killed ours.  And I'd probably excuse all that if the schnitzels and bee sting cakes slapped, but they were pretty unremarkable in all ways except price. $22 for a small-end-of-medium plain pork schnitzel and a small scoop of potato salad and $10 for a tiny slice of bee sting cake that just did not hit. I've had bee sting cake before, and this one was quite dry, had less cream in the middle, and had nearly no honey-nut topping on top. Not a great way to end the meal.  Some of my complaints will probably be resolved as the restaurant settles and finds its groove, but man I don't know about those prices. Maybe $22 for Jägerschnitzel with sauerkraut and käsespätzle, but not for plain schnitzel served at street food portions.  Again, I think Koko's fills a niche as a great place to grab a pint/liter of delicious German beer while snacking on fries and just vibe, but as a restaurant, I don't think it offers enough value to be worth it. Especially not if you're a German food fan who lives over 30 minutes away.

reviews.author: Vic B.
reviews.description: Beer was pretty good.  Schnitzel was...well--something other than schnitzel. Bring an Austrian or Bavarian cook to town.

reviews.author: Janek N.
reviews.description: We visited with a group of 4 adults and 3 hungry kids on a Saturday afternoon. Unfortunately you cannot order any food unless you have a table... and that is where is problem starts. We waited for 30 minutes for a table, but never received a notification even though there were 3 tables available (+ 6 tables marked as "reserved"). No other group waited to be seated (i.e. not crowded). One patron told us to just grab a table and not wait for a notification since "This is the only way you will ever get a table". When we tried that the waiter appeared to tell us that we could not do that but had to put ourselves on the waitlist (which we already did). When I asked him wether we would have had to make a reservation online ahead of time he told me that he doesn't want to talk to me. Really?!  We walked next door to Central Machine Works where they had plenty of space.  Look, I understand that the place just opened and might not run smoothly just yet. So I hope you make something out of this feedback:  (1) if your tables are freely accessible it does not make sense to have a waitlist since people can just skip the line. (2) If you do not have enough staff to service everyone close down some tables (3) Let people know what the wait time might be. (We we're told 15 minutes. After 30 minutes we were told it's another 30.) (4) If a customer asks a question at least try to answer.  Lastly: The House Lager tasted pretty decent and the food menu looks interesting. Wish we could have tried it. (Or that the kids could have had a pretzel while waiting.)

reviews.author: Tia M.
reviews.description: Tried their duck and rattlesnake, both delicious. The Belgian fries were delicious. Beautiful place to sit outside and dog friendly

reviews.author: Stephanie K.
reviews.description: This place has been puffed up all across Eater and WWW Austin for nothing more than a cute beer hall in an up-and-coming part of town. The food is all Sysco standard trash, not the exciting Bavarian fare I was hoping for. Go to Easy Tiger or Banger's or a food cart to get your fix for German and a more extensive beer list - this place is a disappointment.

reviews.author: Antonio A.
reviews.description: Don't know what everyone's complaining about, this place is great. All restaurants have some service issues when they first open. Excellent beer choices and the currywurst was exceptional. Definitely be back.

reviews.author: Camille C.
reviews.description: Love this spot. Great beer, good food. Stoked to have a German beer garden in the area - tons of options beer wise.

name: The League Kitchen and Tavern
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Michael Q.
reviews.description: Came here for lunch with a few of my coworkers and it was pretty good.  Lunch was solid service was good but I think that was partially because there were only 4 tables occupied when we were there but the service was attentive.  Menu is pretty large and has breakfast items during lunch so no complaints there because I do love me some breakfast for lunch or dinner.  Overall solid place would come back if I'm in the area not making a special trip here but if I'm here I definitely would come back.

reviews.author: Kasti K.
reviews.description: This place wildly exceeded my expectations.   We are in from out of town, it's a perfect Sunday spot for lunch and to watch football. The Sunday crew in the bar was super fun, our server Aaron was really kind   Their Sunday drink special is $3 mimosa and bloody Mary's.   Their gluten free bun is the best I've had at a restaurant, it is nice and chewy and stays together.   The chicken sandwich was great, a huge chicken breast with lots of bacon and avocado. They do a "first timer" complimentary dessert of their chocolate dump cake, my husband said it was great!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Very unassuming from the outside but walk in and you find a upscale gastropub style restaurant. We came at lunch and though I was initially hesitant to bring in kids, there ended up being plenty off other families in there. The menu was upscale American. Given it was lunch time, we went with hamburgers and sandwiches. The main dishes were all really good and a decent portion (not too big, not too small). The sides we got were a bit under seasoned though. Lastly, there should really be a hamburger on the kids menu.   Overall, really enjoyed this place. Will come back for dinner to try more of the menu.

reviews.author: Ken D.
reviews.description: The League is part neighborhood bar, part gastro-pub and I love both parts!    The bar and dinning areas are separated.  Despite both being relatively small, there's plenty of seating.  Choose from high-tops to semi-circular booths to high-back swivel bar stools.  And they have an outdoor patio as well, but not much of a view.   The League is a great place to meet a friend for drinks, a casual date, weekend brunch, watch Sunday football, or to just to ride the bar solo.    Excellent food with new, weekly specials, including a burger-of-the-week. On Mondays they have 2-for-1 burgers for dine in - can't beat that!  They also have cocktail specials to go along with their food specials (in addition to their menu and drink standards).  I wish they had a bigger beer wall, but the selection is serviceable.   The League is one on my regular spots and I've yet to be disappointed with their food, drinks, or service.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: I was so pleasantly surprised when we stopped here for a quick lunch. Friendly service and helpful staff members greeted us at the door and I loved the Prohibition era style and decor. Lots of variety on the menu. I tried the Society burger which was tasty and my husband had the club sandwich. $3 mimosas and they sent us home with a complimentary dessert- can't beat that.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Overpriced bar food.  Fries were soggy. Burger needed basic salt and pepper to give it flavor. It was medium rare.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: This place is our most visited restaurant since moving here thirteen years ago. As a former restaurant owner / operator, I appreciate the consistency and quality of the menu offerings. The facility is always clean and tables are cleared immediately when a party leaves. They have some really good deals, like burger Monday where you buy one and get one free. They also have a mouth watering prime rib special on Thursday that we can't wait to try.  One more attraction is , if you are into science or astronomy, you might be waited on by Galileo.

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: We have been going to The League for a couple of years now. I get my hair done around the corner so it's convenient for my husband to hang at the bar. Sometimes we eat here and sometimes not.   Upside; Bartenders are always friendly and welcoming, they have great happy hour prices on drinks and apps. Also weekly food specials.   Food can be hit or miss. Between the two of us we've had everything on the menu. Club sandwich is always as hit and so is the spinach artichoke dip. Burgers sometimes a bit dry. The salmon is usually perfectly cooked. Fish and chips over battered and greasy. Prime rib sandwich is hit or miss.  Burger of the week this visit was Frito Pie Burger. I had the garlic butter grouper, which was a huge portion, but lacked seasoning on both the fish and couscous. Garlic butter was on the side, but was just melted butter with a chopped garlic at the bottom. No other seasonings.   We will continue to come hang at the bar and eat here occasionally.

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.description: 7/4/21 1st visit.  Already a crowd at opening.   Waitress : Kenza - very attentive, paying attention to details. ( even asked about allergies ) There's definitely a spirit of cooperation- every employee was eager to help out.  Drinks : Bloody Mary's delicious and at $3.00 a bargain. Arron the bartender jumps in to help out in the dining area. Great guy !! Food : Pot pie (basically a biscuit with gravy with a fried egg on top - WOW filling and Delicious!! Wife had the steak salad - steak cooked exactly as she ordered it.  Mother in Law had a breakfast anytime.  All of our food was delicious!!  All and All we had a GREAT experience!! Definitely will come again.  A quality restaurant ! Absolutely nothing negative to report.  As a treat on your 1st visit - we'll show up and ask about it.  Prices were VERY REASONABLE!!

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: The service was great, and the food wasn't bad, it was just meh. We tried several items on the appetizer menu, as well as one dessert.   The beer selection also wasn't very impressive, but it wasn't bad.  Gets the job done; doesn't impress.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: 5 stars for service and 2.75 stars for food. My 4 stars are on the generous side.  We dined here this afternoon. The server was very nice and took care of us. I'd give her service 5 stars.   For our food we ordered the chicken fried pork chop, the full rack of ribs, the southern burger, and the kids Mac and cheese.   Our little guy loved the Mac snd cheese. It was decent and definitely not out of a box. It didn't come with anything else but was only $5.   Hubby had the Southern burger with truffle fries ($2 up charge). The burger was solid. It could have been a slight bit juicer but it was a good burger. The "truffle" fries were not. The fries were limp and soggy and sprinkled with Parmesan but had no truffle flavor at all. Actually when you picked up a fry the cheese all fell off too. Pretty bad fries to be honest.   Older son ordered the baby back ribs and enjoyed them. They were your standard fair. Similar to what you'd find at Chili's but they cost $30 and come with a side of mashed potatoes.  I had the  chicken fried pork chop. It was very over cooked and dry and was topped with jalapeño gravy but there was no heat or jalapeño flavor at all. The gravy made the pork chop less dry though. I subbed Brussels sprouts instead of mashed potatoes ($2). They lacked seasoning or flavor. I like the taste of Brussels sprouts so I ate them but they had no other seasoning that I could detect.   The food was all fine. Not bad but at their prices I would definitely not run back.

reviews.author: Amari H.
reviews.description: Food and drinks were delicious! Tried it out for the first time and I will definitely be back. The food is quality for sure. I had the prime rib sandwich with truffle fries, and OMG! Every aspect of it was amazing and paired well together. I will say I was underwhelmed with the salmon deviled eggs... it just tasted like eating cold eggs with no signature flavor.

reviews.author: Gaye J.
reviews.description: Really good hamburgers and fries. They have a full bar so you can have the drink you want. Great neighborhood vibe

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Give this place a try!! It's a little hidden gem! They have interesting burgers and I have tried a couple of their dishes and didn't have one that I don't like.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: The League is a cool watering hole and sporting some excellent food for the denizens of Avery Ranch.  Two for One burgers on Mondays is a great deal.  We usually pop in for a late lunch early HH and sit at the bar. Check out their small bites menu the meatloaf is pretty darn good. Fish n chips are AOK there are better fish n chips in the area but you can easily split this bountiful dish.   The League pours a good cocktail and their bloodies, according to Plus 1, are right up there with the best. There are rotating taps for you beer snobs (like me).  There is a patio off to the side and a good-sized dining room. It does get crowded hence our late lunch HH visits.  Pro tip during football season Friday nights are packed pre-game.

reviews.author: Barry B.
reviews.description: I took the family there tonight and was looking forward to having a good hamburger.   It was not to be!    It all started with a very aggressive an unkempt server with a bad attitude. We ordered the burgers which came under cooked and had soggy buns on the bottom.   The server was very rude when we asked to have the burgers redone and later literally threw a to go  box at me !  The manager got involved and was very gracious to comp the meal ,but i will not go back again because of the bad experience with a terrible server!

reviews.author: Jeanette H.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed our late lunch there, delicious appetizers and drinks. Great patio. Right as we we're done eating, a truck pulled up behind the building visible from patio and there was a strong sewage smell, it must've been some kind of clean out. Horrible. Thankful we were done or we wouldn't have been able to finish our meal. The smell was horrible.  We'll be back and hope that won't happen at the very moment we're there.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Stopped in for lunch on a Friday. Noticed the outdoor seating was pretty full but indoor wasn't busy at all. Service was good and the place was small but cozy and clean.   We ordered the fish n chips and a burger with onion rings. The burger was fine, very average and a little bland. The fries that came with the fish were also ok but a little cold. The onion rings and the fish is the part I wanted to love but didn't. Taste wise they were good. However, they had so much batter on them it made me feel sick after just a few bites. I know these were heavy items to order for lunch, but the ratio of batter was just too much.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Really clean feeling place with a great bar staff. Bloody Mary was solid and $3 on Sunday. Beer selection was on the better side for restaurants in the area. Lots of TVs. Burgers were tasty and I highly recommend ordering a side of the jalapeño gravy to dip everything into it.

reviews.author: Brad T.
reviews.description: My last visit the banana pudding was off, like spoiled milk off. Ordered the cobbler, it should be called a jam as there is no cobbler.  Poppers weren't really cooked, maybe they were just uber cold because they sat out, see below.  Order was to be ready at 6:58 and brought to my truck. I though ok they are behind...at 7:10 I went in and saw it just sitting on a table next to the door.  No clue how long it was there. They said I could just grab it and go.  Disappointing Brussels spouts we're amazing, the only reason they get two stars.   The last visit they brought it to my truck but the food was mehhh.

name: Lenoir
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jennifer K.
reviews.description: Wow. I wasn't expecting to love this place so much but it was a fantastic experience all around.  The outdoor gravel patio is like sitting in someone's backyard under huge oak trees. They have simple lanterns strung from the tree branches and umbrellas all around. I loved the ambiance.   We ordered the tasting menu and the wine flight. The wine pairings were one of the best I've ever had. I'm not a fan of white wine but the owner picked the best French wines that paired perfectly with each course.   The first course was a hamachi crudo- perfectly light with subtle flavor.  Second course was a green bean salad- this was my favorite of the night. The beans were lightly pickled then charred and served on a yogurt queso fresco sauce- HEAVENLY. I make a mean green bean but theirs was the best I've ever had.  Third course was shrimp and vegetables. This was my least favorite, and it was still amazing.  Fourth course was the char siu and watermelon. Perfectly cooked and the balance of flavors was delicious. I was so full at this point but I still soldiered on.  Last course was ice cream with almond crumble. I'm not a fan of ice cream but this was really good.  Our server Quentin made our experience an unforgettable one. We'll be back for sure.

reviews.author: Leslie K.
reviews.description: Super cute dining area outside. Very limited parking- we parked off of W Annie St.   We were a party of 6. Only offered the chef's choice menu. There were good and less memorable dishes, but we really enjoyed the atmosphere.

reviews.author: Sharon L.
reviews.description: The tasting menu was really good-- a lovely birthday dinner evening in a beautiful space (located right by a creek, so lots of mosquitos unfortunately).   FOOD: Delicious and thoughtful menu. We did the tasting menu for a birthday, and it took about 2 hours (we're quick eaters, too). They asked very intentionally at the beginning if we had any allergies and dietary restrictions, which was really thoughtful. Slight side note that the plates and serving ware was quite cute, which is just an ancillary sort of plus.  SERVERS: Speedy and really quite nice. They had recommendations, provided bug spray, were knowledgeable about the beverages. No complaints.  AMBIENCE: Currently (Oct 2021) only outdoor seating. It was well-lit and covered overhead. Quite good dinner date spot.   BATHROOMS: Gender neutral bathrooms indoors. It's may be a 50-ft walk to the bathrooms? Two single-person bathrooms. Clean, stocked. No complaints.  PARKING: A few (Like 10ish?) parking spots in a lot, otherwise I think it's street parking.

reviews.author: Carmen G.
reviews.description: Lenoir is a cozy outdoor space with delicious food. We came in with 14 people and they accommodated us in the back. We arrived on time and got seated promptly. We had a 5 course meal and only one wasn't to my liking. The char shui was moist and flavored well. I was a little skeptical at first glance but it turned out delicious.   My only gripe was that dinner took 2.5 hours. It cut into our other plans that we had that night. So, if you have a big party, plan accordingly.   PS - Because it's near a creek, please careful of water bugs... As I was cutting the char shui, one crawled across my lap napkin. Imagine a screaming woman frantically waving her knife around as her first initial reaction. Yep, that was me. *Raise hand* I almost stabbed my friend while trying to get it off me.

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: Wow only outdoor seating at this time and food was 4.5 but the ambiance and friendly service bump to a 5 star experience. Go for the HH for 1/2 bottle robes and great mixed drinks the watermelon chiller was pretty and refreshing.  We got the cab franc bottle and was light and paired well with our meals. - HH bread with pimiento was interesting  -HH shrimp boil was different with fresh shrimp and okra and corn and something crunchy on top  - lamb vindaloo was not spicy but tasty and oddly accompanied very well with the sliced watermelon  - mp bass with Goan crab curry was delightful and complex flavors to create a light main entree  Service was so friendly and just stellar and we enjoyed our culinary experience for 2 hours on a Thursday night and in no way felt rushed  Romantic and fun place to be.  Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: The best meal we've had in Austin. We ordered the tasting menu ($58) and 2 bottles of wine.   The tasting menu kept us excited and pleased the whole way through. The opening items (an Amuse bouche of falafel-like crisps with a lovely sauce and a sashimi with a tangy sauce) were so good. Blew us away.   Personally, the third item, gnocchi, was not my favorite. It is made from corn flour, not potato, which is slightly off putting. My friend described it as enchilada in bite form. I liked the spinach.   The steak was amazing. I liked the texture and the taste. It had a lovely chimichurri like sauce with leeks. The cucumber salad bopped too.   Finally, the dessert -- light and pleasing. Highly recommend trying the tasting menu if you come.

reviews.author: Jason A.
reviews.description: I went there with my family for our first night in Austin and we were certainly not disappointed! The ambiance was casual yet classy. We got most items off the menu that they had for that night. My favorites were the crab legs, tuna tartare and steamed fish. We also really enjoyed the Wagyu steak.

reviews.author: Greg K.
reviews.description: While visiting Austin, I chose Lenoir for a romantic vibe with a setting that felt uniquely "Austin." We went with the chef's tasting menu and didn't look back. We received a selection of 5 dishes that we mostly would not have ordered on our own, and we loved each one. Each dish was full of pleasantly surprising flavors and they were all beautifully presented. The tasting menu also left us happily full without being overstuffed.   To go with our meal, we chose a bottle of wine from their ample selection. They also offer a few cocktails, beers, and some wine by the glass, but getting a bottle seems to be the way to go.    Our server, Dustin, was fantastic. He was very willing to hear any and all dietary restrictions or quirks, and was happy to work with the the couple that I mentioned. He was clearly passionate about everything on the menu and his excitement for what we chose showed. He even gave us great tips on places to check out in Austin later that night.   Dining at Lenoir was a highlight during the few days we spent in Austin, the food was phenomenal and the atmosphere was wonderful.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Noticed they were doing their Chef's Tasting menu (five courses) for only $29 during January so booked a table the last weekend of the special.  The wine patio was a perfect happy hour spot pre-COVID, and so it's no shock that with a few finishing touches like a tent and heaters, it would make for a wonderful dinner experience, too.  Anthony was our server and he was so on top of it all night long. In addition to taking care of the dietary restrictions of some of the group, he also was very generous with the wine pours!  I can thankfully eat everything, but just want to give a hats off to the kitchen for accommodating the two gluten-free diners. They even made a special dessert for a friend that is allergic to eggs!  The menu was pretty stacked with seafood options which made it light but satisfying. I am not a huge oyster fan, but Sweet Home Alabama were theirs tasty! The tuna pappardelle was interesting...someone's hot take was that it reminded them of a more sophisticated tuna casserole. Impressive there was no dairy in the dish but it had a creamy, cheesy texture. My favorite was the seafood stew-esque dish with the delightful bread for dipping.   The $40 wine pairing was a steal! Not only were the pours accompanying each dish full (not a sissy tasting pour), but Anthony would just magically top off our glasses like a vino ninja, so I felt as if I had prob consumed an entire bottle by the end. And, definitely not mad at that!  While the half off special may not be a thing any longer, I still recommend visiting Lenoir for a nice dinner out, with all the precautions in place/being observed.

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4 Food: 3.5  Came for the January chef's tasting menu ($29) outside. Been wanting to try this place for some time so there were definitely some expectations after having seen and heard about it. Overall it was a good experience, but the food was not as great as expected.   Started with an oyster on the half shell - how can you go wrong with that? They did it perfectly.   Next up was a winter salad, which had beets, roasted butternut squash, some tomatoes, and beer infused peanuts; the peanuts were delicious, and the squash was nice; I didn't care too much for the texture but the flavor overall was decent and fresh.   A cooked "salad" was next with roasted broccoli, mushrooms, walnuts, and grapefruit, with melted taleggio cheese on the bottom. Interesting mix of flavors and textures, saltiness of the cheese and bitterness of the grapefruit were different, but the broccoli were very large pieces. Nice to try but probably not something I'd eat often.   The main dish was a baked fish with shrimp, arugula, and sliced radish in a tomato soup. TBH it was kind of underwhelming for the main dish and a bit too bitter and salty for my taste. The shrimp and fish were nicely cooked but not my favorite on flavor.   For dessert was a coconut cake, and a rice pudding. I didn't try the cake, and I know that rice pudding should be al dente, but this was a bit undercooked. It was nice of them to whip it up since I couldn't have the cake due to gluten, but it just wasn't that great unfortunately.

reviews.author: Siia K.
reviews.description: This is a nice place with date vibes. The food was great , me and my partner decided to do chefs menu, pescatarian version. Started with hush puppies, strawberry aguachile, avocado tostada, large crab stuffed fish and citron cake.   One thing I'm confused about still is if we got one order of each or was it two servings as everything came in 1 plate for 2 people to share.   We additionally had Pullman bread and peach, strawberry cocktails. Everything was great.   Advice: ask if you opt for chef menu do you get 1 or 2 serving of the item when 2 people are eating. I believe we got only 1 per item to share in which case you are better off ordering from menu yourself rather than chefs choice.

reviews.author: Shari D.
reviews.description: Wow! We had such a lovely time at Lenoir! I was slightly worried when we arrived when the host told us that our table was not available and it might be 30 minutes. I realize they can't remove patrons! But, we didn't have to wait that long and they seated us in a little area while we waited and gave us a pitcher of water (and two glasses!).  We opted for the the chef's menu and wine pairing. We really, really enjoyed it. the ambiance was specular, outside under the Live Oak trees and lanterns. The servers were excellent. We will be back to try other items on the menu. Honestly, we felt like we were on vacation.

reviews.author: Leila L.
reviews.description: Partner and I went to Lenoir for a date night. It's been a long time since I've dined here and didn't realize they had this nice spacious beer garden! They are offering 50% off their chef's tasting which is a 5 course tasting. They serve things family style and had an upgrade to a fish dish for an additional $25. Overall the dishes were good, though the beginning dishes were a little spicy and acidic. I very much enjoyed the whole fish that they mostly deboned. Dessert was a flan and churro-esque cookie that was a light way to end the meal.   During COVID it felt safe dining as it was outside and it was well spaced. They do have a covered area which unfortunately we didn't get to sit under. There was some light rain during the meal which they provided umbrellas for, but awkwardly we had to hold it up ourselves. Most tables had an umbrella but ours didn't.

reviews.author: Tripp P.
reviews.description: Wow, what an amazing place in so many ways. Although it's all outdoor dining, they have you covered for weather. Lots of shade and misting fans to keep down the heat and umbrellas also. Lights strung up to really make the ambiance perfect for dining.  The service was top notch. Thank you Clinton for anticipating our every need and knowing and recommending perfect wine pairings also. You and your team are on top of everything and it's greatly appreciated, especially because you have a friendly and respectful attitude. No snobs here.  Finally, the food was outstanding!!!! Way to go chef. Farm fresh and full of flavor in every bites. Our party of 4 tried 3 small, 3 large plates and 2 desserts and there wasn't a morsel left of any of them. So much flavor!!!  The wines were also outstanding. All natural and bursting with flavor that paired perfectly with every dish.  We will definitely be back and with friends!!

reviews.author: Bobby Y.
reviews.description: Lenoir was by all accounts simply one of the most memorable dining experiences I've had in Austin. The outdoor patio seating is spacious and comfortable, with fire pits at the ready should the temperature drop. The food - just outstanding!! The chef's tasting with wine pairing runs at $40 a person, a value I dare you to best. Service hit on all marks. Parking is a bit limited. I can't wait to come back.

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: Looking for the most adorable friend/significant other date site in Austin? Look no further than Lenior! The food was amazing, service was excellent, and the atmosphere is so classy and Austin-y! My night started with the server asking about our drink choice (obviously) but I had never tried any of the wines on their list and requested a recommendation. She was so patient and kind when choosing our wines and allowed us to sample them before committing.   Here is my order (Chef's choice 5 course meal): - Nebbiolo - Choice of wine for the night. It was light, earthy, and perfectly paired with most of my dishes throughout the evening! - Amuse-Bouche - A delightfully light and airy fish with herbs and greens. Honestly, I wish I knew what exactly this was but due to the volume of the place and the masks, I could not always hear my waiter! - Roasted Butternut Squash and Beets - This salad was DELISH and made me feel so healthy to start off the meal! Typically I don't like peanuts on my dishes but these were so seamlessly worked into the meal that I didn't even notice! - Tuna casserole - Never would I ever have ordered this of my own volition but lets just say, trust this chef!! It was incredibly fresh pasta that was light and packed a flavor punch. Not your grandma's tuna casserole! - Braise lamb shank with chickpea stew - OH MY GOSH! This was absolutely delicious. The meat just fell off the bone and did not taste game-y at all! 10/10 recommend - Coffee Flan - Perfect ending to the perfect night.  TLDR; Find Lenior and give it a try! Take a date, a friend, or impress your parents with your swanky new find!

reviews.author: Cass K.
reviews.description: This January, I discovered the Wine Patio at Lenoir.  I had been to Lenoir in the past, but inside in a tiny little space.  When I was looking for a place to celebrate some family milestones, I found that Lenoir had outdoor dining.    Since I'm not willing to take my chances with indoor dining at this point, I'm much more willing to "take my chances" as to what the weather will be like for outdoor dining and make a reservation.  Also, with most restaurants doing take-out, I'm thinking, if the weather is bad for our reservation, we'll just get take out instead.    As it turned out, I've been able to dine out two lovely meals at Lenoir.  The first was a Sunday evening meal.  We ate early in the evening, and that was great, because we were able to find parking right there at Lenoir, and we had the place to ourselves at first.  We were seated under a tent with propane heaters all around.  The tent is open on two sides, so it's still getting plenty of air circulation even though we had a roof over our heads.  While Lenoir has adapted their dining format to include a la carte ordering, we chose to go with the traditional Lenoir chef's choice tasting menu.    Everything about that evening was magical.  Just going out to eat for a celebration was special.  Then the weather was just fine for dining outdoors, and the wine patio area of Lenoir is so beautiful and romantic.  The tent is decorated with beautiful hanging potted plants, and the uncovered area was dotted with fire pits and chimineas.  Our servers were knowledgeable, personable, and masked at all times.  The food was all delicious and it was a truly special evening.  Through Yelp, I heard that Lenoir is running a special $25 5-course evening dine-in meal through the end of January.  I was looking for a reservation, and could not find any available times that meshed with my schedule, but I saw they now had lunch!  We went for lunch on a foggy, misty day.  We were a little concerned that we would be crowded with too many people within the covered area, and once again, was prepared to get take-out instead of dining in if it looked crowded.  As it was, it must be a well-kept secret that Lenoir is open for lunch, because we had Lenoir to ourselves for most of our meal.  It was once again a super lovely experience.  My husband had a crab stuffed omelette, and I had a winter salad topped with roasted beets, butternut squash, and chicken and the most amazing combination of spices.  For dessert we split a piece of Meyer Lemon Cheese Cake. Everything was super delicious.   When we told our server how we found they had lunch when we were unsuccessful finding a dinner reservation in January, the server asked when we'd like to come to dinner and that he would talk to management about getting us in.  As we were leaving, we were told we have a reservation for early Friday evening.  I can't wait to be back.  Lenoir is a lovely place to safely dine outdoors on some of the freshest best food that Austin has to offer.

reviews.author: Quin T.
reviews.description: Great happy hour deals on drinks and wine. The pinky tuscadero and first blush cocktails as well as the capri sunset mocktail were all refreshing on a hot day. Although it was very hot outside, they do have a big tent that covers the tables and they also have fans with misters as well as candles on each table followed by citronella candles placed just about everywhere which is a must because not only are there trees everywhere, but Lenoir backs up to a creek. The mosquitos are out for blood this year (no pun intended), but if you are hoping to escape them by dining indoors, then Lenoir is not for you until the end of September as the inside of the restaurant is completely gutted. I also stinks because on a rainy day, you are SOL; which happened to us so this was our second attempt to dine at Lenoir. However, please do not be discouraged as it is very nice dining outside and romantic if on a date. Just make sure you bring some type of bug spray. Overall, we were impressed and after starting with the pullman bread, we all decided on the tasting menu which is such a bargain, it really can't be beat.  We were impressed with all of the choices except the chicken liver, peach tostado. I love chicken liver, foie gras and pretty much any pate, but somehow the combination just did not go over well. The dorade with blue crab, pullman bread and hush puppies were my top favorite dishes. Vanessa D. was our waitress and she was lovely. I will definitely come back when they are back to indoor dining and the tasting menu has changed.

reviews.author: Ella A.
reviews.description: Restaurant is very pretty and the outdoor area is charming. Service was ok, but not great. The choices on the menu were very limited and odd. We shared a few plates, but didn't really care for most of it. The shrimp dish was tasty, but small shareable and overly spicy. The noodle choice was horrible and I don't recommend. The salad was good, but difficult to share. I really wanted to like this place and looked forward to going, but left disappointed.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: This place blew me out of the water and I'm not just talking about their seafood! Came here for date night as we were looking for somewhere outside where we could enjoy the weather. Stopped in for their happy hour and enjoyed the sweet potato Pullman bread along with the smoked fish tartine. Both dishes were fantastic and paired well with first blush cocktail and blood orange ipa which were both on the happy hour menu. The star however was the whole roasted dorade entree dish we ordered. Not only was it super flavorful served in a delicious curry sauce but it was beautifully presented and most of the bones were picked out for full enjoyment. The ambiance really pulled the entire experience together for me as illuminating lights hung throughout the trees and the smell of fire burning in the air. Highly recommend this place if your looking for a special date night or Valentine's Day plans.

name: Cover 2
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: My husband and I go here pretty often as it is super close to our place and we love their food! They have a great menu and our favorite thing is the fried pickles! They have rotating specials, soups and flatbreads. The servers and staff are all very friendly and hard workers. I also bring friends here and they have all loved it as well! They have great deals on their happy hour and a good variety of beers and wine that are not crazy overpriced. I have loved everything I have ordered and they have great portion sizes! We usually come for lunch or dinner, but we recently had brunch which was also fabulous. I had the chilaquiles and they were amazing! The portions are also super generous so I've left with leftovers multiple times. If you're a sports person, they have a ton of really nice TVs and always have games on. I am honestly so happy this place is close by and will continue giving them my business! I would also like to add that like many places these days, they have also experienced shortages with staff and when that happens, we have seen the managers out on the floor helping out and also working their butte off! This restaurant has amazing food, service and is such a great place to have a nice dinner, go hang with friends or just pop by for a drink! Thanks for rocking it Cover 2! Oh and the Round Rock location is also awesome as I went their with a group of work friends once they also had excellent service and the food was equally as delicious!!!

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: When Chief was here bar service was stellar. I have been coming here since it opened. Now bar service is lackadaisical, inattentive, distracted and sub standard.   I like this place. The food is good the beer selection is passable and I can watch any sporting event live or read a book or both. But these two are killing the place for me. Ordered a beer and sat for 20 minutes with no one asking me if I might like to order food. Had to literally flag someone down to order a meal. That is not how this business works.   Wearing a mask under your chin until you walk up to a customer is not how this works either. And the tall one did that all night long. Now looking for a different place to spend an evening eating a meal and enjoying a beer.

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: Horrible service today.  Sat in a booth for over 15 minutes while others came in after me and got their orders taken. Person who had seated me brought me a drink then nothing. Though a minimum of 5 different servers were standing right next to my booth.  I understand a restaurant may be short staffed but limit your seating if you cannot handle it.  I've had the similar experience here multiple times.  Last time I patron any of the restaurants in this local chain.  And "the remedy" after speaking to a manager when I asked for the check for my half drank coke...oh no need to pay for the coke.  FAIL ALL AROUND!

reviews.author: Asha T.
reviews.description: Literally the first visit we had and this last visit were like night and day.   If I EVER come back here it's gonna have to be at the bar. Apparently you get service that way.   Literally just walked in and got sat, was busy due to a UT game no problem. And then we just sit and wait and wait and wait. The supposed waiter for our area literally helped everyone around us and kept skipping us. Idk if it was because we didn't have UT gear on or I was basically the only black person there at the time but ppl that just walked in the door got greeted before we did.   We just got up and left. There's no way the dude in the area didn't know we had not been helped as he purposely kept ignoring the table and was serving EVERYONE around us.   Terrible service.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Love this place! They are so accommodating, even in football Sunday!!! The servers are polite and the manger runs around and works just as hard (love seeing that) all the food I've had is amazing. Great specials daily and weekly, worth a stop anytime but especially for football!  Not pictured but worth it: chili and eggs, giant pretzels, wings and shrimp pasta!!!

reviews.author: Colette B.
reviews.description: I never thought I would describe a restaurant as "disgusting", I have a lot of respect for food .... But our experience was just that! We fancied burgers and thought that a sports bar would serve delicious burgers! What a mistaken idea!! We started with a cup of onion soup: it was edible, not delicious, a little strong on the acid side, but ok. Then came the burgers: a 3mm leather sole burnt to death!! Awful! Horrible!! My husband had to leave the restaurant and was sick in the car park!! The fries were smothered in fat... yak! The waiter on the other hand was a sweetheart!! VERY professional! When I mentioned it wasn't good, he immediately offered to comp them, which he did! I am tempted to say that he had been through a similar situation before, maybe several times!!! He didn't hesitate and didn't offer an alternative: he KNEW the food was bad! Shame on management to allow this to happen! It's a Burger after all, and we are in Texas!! Land of Beef!! Cover 2, I'm afraid you will not see us again!!

reviews.author: Chantel C.
reviews.description: We've lived by cover 2 going on 2 years now and decided Saturday to finally check it out. (Previously came here and was seated but waitress seemed like she was just so busy she couldnt get to us and the vibe was just off? so we walked out) but let me tell you I sure am glad we gave it a second shot because the food was absolutely amazing and service was even better! Can't remember our waiters name but he was above and beyond. Everything came out quickly and tasted perfect... the environment was a plus! We willl back yall :)

reviews.author: Bonsai B.
reviews.description: If I could do 0 stars I would... Sunday at 1500 and it's not too busy.. not sure who out waiters name was because he didn't introduce himself, so we will call him island boy.. black island boy hair cut doesn't give a care in the world...He ignores the tables, continually walking by spaced out.. didn't get any service unless i asked. I even had to ask for the check! Why does he even work, just go home and live off unemployment.. he is the face of this bar/restaurant and I won't be back.. good riddance!

reviews.author: Caryn C.
reviews.description: Horrible service and even worse food. The only thing half way decent were the fries and they were cold. The hostess was condescending and sat us in a high traffic area in front on a tv that a group of 6 were watching and yelling. We had to ask to be moved. We had to ask for our waiter to serve us. We went at a time that was not considered busy or I would've understood. We had to ask multiple times for drink refills. We will not be back.

reviews.author: David C.
reviews.description: Goofy loser waiter ignored us because he's racist. Type who says "canadians". You're black and racist toward other black people. Living like that's not good for your soul you rotten little jerk.  Decent game bar if you sit at the bar. Wings were aight

reviews.author: Shelby L.
reviews.description: We always have a good time here, especially during football season. The food is above average. Bar seating can be limited since everyone wants to sit up there.

reviews.author: Robert F.
reviews.description: Cover 2 off research always hits the spot it's got the best shoe string fries I can't seem to find anywhere else in Austin . Even though they may just be French fries and not a main course there is something so satisfying about them . My favorite dish is the buffalo chicken sliders , I personally get the blue cheese on the side with ranch to dip . These are amazing and have the perfect thin not to thick cut of chicken that's battered nice and crispy but stays juicy tossed in tangy but not spicy buffalo sauce. The bread doesn't take over the sandwich so that's not all you get full on and is super soft . They also have a buffalo chicken salad that has a good amount of chicken if your not wanting a sandwich but need to cure that buffalo craving . I've only had the burgers other than that and they are equally delicious again especially with those shoe string fries that are always crispy .  This place is relaxed and a good place to have a beer while you cool off after a long day or just dining with the family.  The staff is pleasant and the deserts are huge . Well at least the brownie is . If you like bars and burgers are in the area and don't know what to eat stop in and try the buffalo sandwich it's my go to and recommendation for cover 2 . If not that than at least grab a beer and some shoe string fries and relax a minute .

reviews.author: Joan B.
reviews.description: It had been awhile since I'd been at this location. While I love the Cover 3 locations on Anderson Lane and Round Rock, this one has never really measured up. Today I stopped in for lunch and ordered the flat top cheeseburger that comes with Parmesan fries. Should have been a safe bet, right? It came out DRIPPING in grease that tasted truly awful. Even the fries, which are always good, no matter the location, were inedible, as they tasted like they were fried in oil that should have changed long ago. It pains me to leave food that I paid good money for, but that's just what I did after trying to force down a couple more bites I shouldn't have taken. I left 2/3 of the burger and most of the fries on the table. Considered complaining, and might have if the server had even asked how the food was, but she didn't ask, and she had to have noticed how little I had eaten. She just left the check by the barely eaten food.  I rarely send food back to the kitchen, and since this wasn't exactly fine dining, I let it go today. But tonight I'm regretting eating those two or three additional bites I shouldn't have taken. It truly wasn't fit for consumption.

reviews.author: Mia L.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I visit this place the other day and wow! It was so good- we got the giant pretzel to start. When they say giant- boy do they mean it. They're drinks are also very very good and the server was very polite as well.

reviews.author: Robby T.
reviews.description: Normally this place is one of my favorites.   Today come I. At 220pm.  Semi full, wait up front for 5 mins to be greeted.    Then wait 15 mins for a drink.   Only ordered 2 appetizers and wait 35 mins for those.   Mention this to the server and she has a near come apart about being short staffed and it is what it is.     Very disappointing, until manager comes by.   Would give Miranda a raise.   Very nice and helpful.

reviews.author: Andrew M.
reviews.description: So today was my first day in Austin. I searched Yelp. I drove by a number of joints. I even walked through Whole Foods. Alas nothing struck my fancy. Heading back, I swung into Cover2. I'm glad I did.  The greeting, Silvana as server, and the whole support staff weekend terrific.  I started with a cup of French onion soup. It was just a tad too sweet for my taste. I'm also a purist in looking for a single crouton under the  hood (of cheese).   The fries and prime rib sandwich were a pleasant surprise. I will typically keg wrestle you to keep the horseradish sauce off the plate. The sauce here actually was mellowed very nicely and didn't fight the meat. The fries were great! Nothing more need be said.   This was a terrific first meal in a new town. This might become my extended kitchen it was that solid of aa performance!

reviews.author: Pamela M.
reviews.description: Would have been nice to actually eat. Ordered our drinks then watched as our server waited on everyone (even those seated after us) without taking our order. I try to give servers the benefit of the doubt cause maybe they're short staffed but after multiple issues with the same server and seeing tables sat after us putting their orders in and getting their food, I'm getting disappointed with the downhill service at Cover 2.   We received our drinks at 6:45 pm. Left money on the table for the drinks and left the establishment at 7:20 pm after our server ghosted us with empty drinks and no food order placed.

reviews.author: Matt S.
reviews.description: Great place to come watch sports, drink, and eat some food.  Staff here was nice and friendly. food was hot and fresh, I had the franks red hot chicken sliders that they had as a special and was good.  Flatbreads were split between the table and were good as well.   Drink prices are not that bad.  Nice walk to our room from here and was convenient.

reviews.author: Steve L.
reviews.description: I stopped by after reading a few Yelp reviews and what a great choice that was. I had the good fortune to sit at the bar and have Miranda take care of me. If I started a bar or a restaurant she would be my first hire (better give her a raise, Doug)!  She's friendly, professional and makes a great martini. The hospitality industry needs more Miranda's!    Now to the place itself. Cover 2 has a nice, open concept with the ubiquitous flat screens located around the bar and restaurant - it is a sports bar, after all.  The people working there are friendly and attentive while the noise level is energetic but not overly loud.    The food.  The Reuben was honestly just okay. The corned beef to Swiss cheese to kraut ratio is off (not enough kraut) and the bread was cooked to the point where it was as stiff as a board.  It tastes okay but the potential for a better sandwich is definitely there.  Ask for fries - they don't automatically come with it.   The fries were good and - just to see for myself - I ate half the Reuben and then ordered the wings.  The buffalo wings are tasty - not the best I've ever had but certainly worth sampling. Pair it with the 512 IPA and you have a winning combination.  Overall I would give Cover 2 a solid 8 on a 1-10 scale. The kitchen gets a 7, the bar an 8 and Miranda a 1o I think my math is right). If you're looking for a good sports bar that's not too sporty this is a solid choice.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Had a very bad experience last night. We ordered apps that were extremely salty and were told they would come soon as we ordered drinks. The apps came at the same time as our dinner. I ordered crawfish special and let me tell you the worst crawfish I ever had. No flavor in the boil and they gave some sauce on the side which was horrible.

reviews.author: Janet B.
reviews.description: We had such a good time at this place! It feels like a neighborhood pub filled with friends. The staff is incredibly friendly and so attentive. We never had an empty water (or beer) glass, and they were just plain nice. With so many restaurants struggling with staff and service, it was a welcome change. The food was top notch as well! I had the brunch burger and my hubby had the mango habanero wings, and we split the queso and chips. (And by the way, their queso was hella good, especially considering they aren't a Tex-mex restaurant!)

reviews.author: Cory O.
reviews.description: This was a nice place to stop on my way home from work. They has a ton of beers on tap and the bartenders were really nice about letting me try different ones before I ordered. Never had the food, but the atmosphere and staff is great!

reviews.author: Juliet J.
reviews.description: Me and my 3 year old were feeling hangry on a Sunday. I didn't want to cook, so we ordered for pick up from Chow Hound. I know there is a no children policy on the weekend. Waitress gave us water while we waited outside. Food was absolutely delicious and worth the extra 10 minute wait. We got the chicken and waffles and sunny side up eggs and home fries.

reviews.author: Joe D.
reviews.description: this has been my neighborhood to go place. My review would have been 4 star originally. I dined there yesterday after not visiting for maybe 2 weeks.    One reason i loved the place was their unique 'curly' french fries. Yesterday, i was quite surprised to see they switched the curly fries to the scoop shape that their sister pub, Brick, serves. Meh. Friends from north Austin would often ask when I was going to Vincent because they liked the curly fries. My friend with me yesterday, said the same thing, whaddup?  i know it's not earth shaking but it made Vincent stand out for me. BUMMER

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Today we wandered into this pub while waiting for an appointment. It was lively with good cocktails and snacks. Their frozen margaritas were smooth and well-blended. I had two different vodka specialty cocktails that were well-crafted. We also ordered the. Shrimp and Poblano Quesadillas which were smoky, spicy and hit the spot.

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: Recently visited this venue for the 1st time - we are always happy to support bartenders or servers during this pandemic. As always we left 25%. The young lady was super nice, kind, helpful and provided info about the menu and venue. We will definitely return!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a chill spot with better then average base food.... this is your place. It's a very casual vibe with a great drink selection. The only downfall is the lack of seating. This is not a big place and it stays pretty crowded. The food I've had so far has been pretty good for bar food. It's definitely a step up!

reviews.author: Nick P.
reviews.description: Great location and nice local bar and restaurant. Not so much! Been here a few times now and it's hit or miss with the staff. NOT friendly for the most part and definitely not attentive. There's maybe 1 or 2 of the girls servers that are good  but overall not worth over 2 stars. Management needs to look into there staff and lack of friendliness and service!

reviews.author: Steve A.
reviews.description: I like this place because of the proximity. The service is slow, but seems to have gotten better. They have a limited menu unfortunately, but nevertheless the food good. The wings are delicious. They were tender and well sauced. Nachos are  crispy and put together. All in all, this place is alright

reviews.author: Glen L.
reviews.description: Been several times. Service is normally slow, although today was a bit better. Overcharged on tab today because waitress lost track of tabs. Got cut off because we were a large group that had a large tab even though no one showed signs of having been over served. Don't plan on returning at this point. Wish something close had a late kitchen, but at this point I'd rather have Top Ramen than go here to get food after 10. Slow service and management that pretends to have people's best interests makes it a no. Food is good, but management that seems judgy makes it a no.

reviews.author: Deanna R.
reviews.description: Loved the vibe of this place. Had their Brodie Smash and Sierra Shandy -- Both great. Bartenders amazing and all ages present.

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: Obviously, this is a sports bar--they have a terrific selection of brews and the atmosphere is fun. Service is hit or miss; the first time I came here and asked for a booth, the bartender became extremely frustrated when explaining their seating policy. They were busy, but still.  The food. It's good but not great--also, it's a sports bar, so it's on par with that cuisine. It's close to our house and nice enough, so we'll keep coming back for a beer and a game.

reviews.author: Myra E.
reviews.description: This bar has the best food ever!  The drinks are so tasty, very comfy place, but the menu is really good. Highly recommend. Nice wait staff too and prices are great. Love this place.

reviews.author: Michael L.
reviews.description: Total dump. Food was average at best. Added bonus: regulars who do not want  you there, and who are pretty clear about that.

reviews.author: Harley D.
reviews.description: Food was good. Staff nice. However my waitress was more concerned with flirting with the boys next to me than serving. Ended up closing my tab with her and just opening at the bar. I think maybe the manager saw it and called her out but still. Service is what sets a place apart. My service here was definitely not up to par at this night.

reviews.author: Kiara D.
reviews.description: This place feels like home to me! Cozy bar, with tasty food and always great company.

reviews.author: Kevin H.
reviews.description: So it's been 6 months or so since this place opened, I've been a handful of times since and thought I'd write a quick update. My first review came shortly after opening and we all know it takes time to get things in a good rhythm and sorted out, especially in the restaurant business.  The menu was a little odd to me when opening but has since won me over. They often have specials and have even opened up for lunch. Last weekend they had a crawfish boil at a very reasonable $7 lbs. The beer selection seems to be somewhat static, fortunately they have several to choose from, but it would be nice to have several rotating handles, given we are in one of the best craft beer markets around. I was a bit surprised to learn a local Pinthouse beer was $7. It's only a dollar more than at the brewery, but still, this isn't LA.  All and all, I like the direction this place is going, nice outdoor, dog friendly patio, food specials and hopefully some new local beers on my next visit.

reviews.author: Hannah P.
reviews.description: Was curious to check this place out because of all the reviews. WOW does not fail to impress. Wonderful staff (thank you  Victoria) and mouth watering food. The nachos looked like a mountain and they didn't skip on toppings. The wings and the shrimp quesadilla I heard are also top notch. Also, affordable! They employ wonderful staff. Look forward to being a regular

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Decent food, great beer and wine selection. My only complaint honestly? Both times I've been there wasn't much seating available! It gets super packed! I guess because we've been wanting a bar in this area for a long time, people are really excited ha ha but I wish there was more seating!

reviews.author: Billy V.
reviews.description: I have been having a tough time finding a place to enjoy an adult beverage and watch sporting events in Austin. Most places are these large indoor/outdoor spaces with music and food trucks. Or located downtown. Or you have to drive 30 plus minutes.  Vincent's Sports Pub is just down the road from home. It has plenty of TVs. I mean plenty. You can stand or sit anywhere in this pub and watch your game. AWESOME. A lot of thought was done here with the placement of TVs.  Service outstanding. A very friendly and nice Team. You like beer. You have choices. Lots of drafts and bottled beer choices. Great feel. Very welcoming pub. Plenty of tables. Great looking bar. Nice crowd. No jerks or muscle beer dudes. I judge a place if my wife would feel comfortable alone. Vincent's Sports Pub passes with high marks.  The food is very tasty. I had most of the apps and was very happy. Tasty. Great to share. Shrimp dish very good. Crispy. Wings have some pull and good. Nice pub menu. A scratch kitchen. I did not feel or taste it was a frozen product.  Vincent's Sports Pub will definitely be my go-to pub for drinks and sports on TV. It has a nice welcoming feel. Combination of design of the restaurant, the bar placement, the tables, food and most importantly the staff.  Plenty of parking. CC friendly. Union payment option.

name: Billy's on Burnet
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: C C.
reviews.description: Love this place.  We were looking for a place to watch the UT game and have a bite to eat Saturday morning and stumbled into Billy's. Great beer selection included our current go-to Electric Jellyfish.   For food we started with the cheese curds. Incredibly crispy. I'd put theirs up against Any I've had in Wisconsin.  Finished up with a cheeseburger and fries. Both were Shockingly good. Not just good for a dive bar, flat out legit.   Can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: Review for Billy's on Burnett  TLDR: a perfectly above average dive bar  For the food: I ordered Billy's "The Shults" burger. The wait time for the food was perfectly reasonable. The burger was well seasoned and well constructed. The only real complaint was the pickle on top was rather small and lackluster. The fries were fresh and crisp, and also well seasoned.   For the drinks: Billy's offers a more than ample beer menu with the common stock, as well as a decent selection of local breweries.   For the atmosphere: Billy's certainly fronts the image of a dive bar, and does so very well. Dimly lit, slightly crowded, and a prominent bar situated directly across the entrance all help establish the environment they want. The patio in the side is well shaded, and has much less road noise than I initially expected. The only complaint is the flies on the patio are out of control.   For the value: Given the location, I can't really blame Billy's for the prices. I feel like I payed a bit more than what I would have wanted for what I got, however, that feeling isn't uncommon in Austin in general, and especially Burnet.   Everything else: there's virtually no parking at Billy's, however there is some street parking within easy walking distance. And yet again, the flies on the patio are on another level.

reviews.author: Susie H.
reviews.description: Good food, quick service, but only have beer and wine. We didn't stay to see what it was a good packer crowd. Lots of packer ppl probably coming but we left because of drink choices.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Really good burgers and sammich's.  Need a beer and a burger then look no further. Support local!!

reviews.author: Mike C.
reviews.description: Austin is at Stage 5 (the highest stage for contracting Covid-19) and Billy's continues to get my order RIGHT!!! They offer curbside delivery and walked my order out to me at my pickup time.  Once I got home I discovered they did everything I asked...
