Grilled onions-yes Lettuce, tomato, and Mayo on side-yes Burger cut in half-yes  The folks at Billy's pay attention to detail and have earned 5 stars and I will absolutely keep going back!  Thank you to the staff at Billy's for getting it RIGHT!

reviews.author: Tom P.
reviews.description: Aaron Franklin has long touted Billy's on Burnet as a superior restaurant for the best in burgers, and once again, he is correct about food.  The folks at Billy's did confirm that the James Beard Award winner is a regular.  The menu's, order source and pickup is at the bar.  We were clearly the only "non-regulars" there that day.  But, we were warmly greeted and walked through the extensive menu of burgers, sandwiches, and yes, beer options.  We will definitely be backed to try many of the other options.  The prices were very reasonable as fries come with the burgers.  The burgers were delicious, juicy and HUGE.  The burgers are served open faced.  If you like to cut your sandwich in half, the basket makes this a bit difficult.  The only downside, I gained a pound.  There is plenty of parking, the inside is much larger than we expected, and yes, it is a classic dive.

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: Billy likes Billy's on Burnet. It's a dark, divy beer bar with a solid food menu including many fried appetizers, from wings to okra, and myriad burger and sandwich options, even hot dogs and an entire column of veg-head choices. I myself enjoy the indulgence of a cobra burger w/fries and a fine Texas craft beer, of which there are many. The burgers are pretty darn good and the beer is cold, so what else do you need? Entertainment? Billy's has you covered with a pool table, darts, several TVs and some arcade games in the back. Other notes: there is a patio and a small parking lot, but there is street parking nearby.

reviews.author: Melissa D.
reviews.description: This is a good spot for trivia and food. Limited parking, so navigate yourself to Lynnwood to find a street spot. Service was really fast, even when all the trivia people arrived/ ordered all at once. If you are coming for trivia/ an event, you need to get there really early for a table. If you are coming to just hang out, double check that there is not trivia/ an event that day. A few folks walked in, saw all of the tables packed and left.   Food reviews!  -Veggie burger: solid patty, hefty amount of avocado. Not the most interesting veggie burger, but definitely solid.  -Turkey Rueben: yum, devoured quickly -Chili cheese fries: Also yum, also devoured quickly. An excellent topping to fry ratio.  -Roast beef sandwich: The person who ordered this said it was good, but wasn't going to order it again. Said it was a little too greasy/ soggy.  - Fries: They are really well seasoned but they are also really unevenly cooked. One fry is perfect, the next one seemed almost raw.

reviews.author: Auntie P.
reviews.description: Very disappointed by our experience for takeout tonight. My husband wanted a patty melt and I wanted a club sandwich. The online ordering and curbside pickup were easy and user friendly. The food, specifically my club was a big let down. I was expecting a traditional triple decker on toast style club. It was on a hoagie and even worse, there was a dark hair in the lettuce on my sandwich. Needless to say, lost my appetite after that, I tossed it. I added, in advance a 25% gratuity because that's how it works ordering curbside and during COVID19 I've been wanting to support local businesses and their staff. Won't be ordering takeout again.

reviews.author: Benson C.
reviews.description: I went to Billy's for the first and last time on Sunday afternoon. They said they allowed dogs on their patio, so I figured I'd bring my well trained 3 year old pit/bulldog mix. Everything was great for 45 minutes. My dog met 3 other dogs and got some puppy rubs from about 5 patrons on the patio, and then everything changed in the blink of an eye.   An intoxicated man holding his toy dog stepped up onto the patio and immediately zoned in on mine. His dog growled at mine while my dog whined and wagged her tail because she just wanted to meet another dog. The intoxicated man sternly asked me if she was a rescue to which I replied "no, I've had her since she was six weeks old." To which he replied "Your dog is aggressive." I told him he was aggressive and he went all in and said "if yOur dog touches my dog, I will slit it's throat." This quickly turned into a heated altercation where I knew something bad was going to happen if I stayed, so I removed myself from the situation.  I went into the bar to let them know that there was a disgruntled patron out on the patio that threatened to slit my dog's throat and the bartender asked who it was. I pointed him out through the window and she said "Oh. He's a regular, that's so weird, he never acts like that....." and just shrugged.  As soon as I took one step out the door, this regular of yours, Stefan, got right back in my face, chest bumping  me, trying to rile me up by calling me insults and slurs. He went over the top and came out with the statement "I can't wait for you to throw the first punch, so I can sue the shit out of you."  I'm a General Manager of another local restaurant and I understand the value of a regular customer, but sometimes if a regular oversteps their boundaries they need to be handled. Y'all are an establishment that's main priority is providing a safe environment for ALL of your customers, not just your regulars. Y'all could have prevented this whole situation from escalating and chose not to. I'm honestly more disappointed in your staff than I am with the situation with Stefan.  Out of my four years here, this was the worst Austin experience I've ever had. You guaranteed the fact that my friend and I will never return to be a potential regular for you because we shouldn't have to question our safety.

reviews.author: Laura O.
reviews.description: You will not regret this burger at all! I hadn't been here in a long time, and it was sooo good. The burger was juicy, and just the right size. The bun was soft and fresh. The burger and fries were piping hot. Fries were well seasoned. I feel like I've found an Austin treasure!

reviews.author: Ashley V.
reviews.description: I was very let down by my experience here. My friends raved how good this place was.   I walked up to the bar and explained it was my first time here and how did it work. The two people behind the bar, a heavily tattooed dude and a middle aged lady, were less than hospitable. I forget his exact words but something along the lines of what you see is what you get. I was waiting for my friend and just wanted to get a starter while I waited. I ordered the chili cheese fries. Lady says no, we don't have that bc of the water boil issue. I said ok. I asked if they just weren't doing appetizers. She said they were only doing fried things. (Correct me if I'm wrong but fries are fried, right?)  I said can I get queso and chips? - no.  Mmm ok can I get a blue moon- no.  I made a joke at this point bc it was awkward and like what the hell. I said I'm really striking out here. She said they had something similar and went to get it. Then this guy standing next to me orders chips and queso from the dude bartender. When the lady brought me my beer back I mentioned this and she freaked out on the dude bartender. I ruined the other guys opportunity to get queso and they made him order something else. Oops. Then I hesitantly asked if I could get frito pie. Finally I got a yes. But that yes makes no sense. I couldn't get chili cheese fries but I could get chili and cheese on Fritos? I walked away confused and put off.   My friend showed up and we decided to split a burger, we didn't even want to ask the employees what they recommended because of their foul, unhelpful, annoyed attitudes. Even my friend was like what the actual F. They were straight rude. We ordered a burger. The bun was soft and that's about it. Nothing special at all. Food was a 2, service was a 0 so as much as I hate to leave reviews like these, they get an overall 1.   Customer service, a smile, a friendly demeanor go a LONG way. Won't be giving this place a 2nd Chance.

reviews.author: Cynthia N.
reviews.description: So I know this place is supposed to be about beer and a good pub to come watch sports or something but I don't care about beer or sports. What I do care about is The Uptown Burger.  Have you ever watched that one How I Met Your Mother episode where Marshall spends the whole episode looking for that one spot where he had the best burger of his life? Well, The Uptown Burger is that burger for me. LOL I came here on a whim just to meet up with my cousin and I was hungry so I ordered a burger at this lowkey spot not expecting much however, this burger blew my mind! I forgot what this place was called so I can have that burger again and just found it. I don't really love the other burgers here but I'm telling you, ORDER THE UPTOWN BURGER

reviews.author: Cassie C.
reviews.description: Had always wanted to try this place and I'm so glad we did. Burger was amazing and the fries were too!

reviews.author: Dao T.
reviews.description: This is a little hole in the wall bar/ restaurant but I love it! They have an outdoor patio if you want to bring your fur baby. We ordered the Uptown Burgers and it was delicious. The size and the fixings was perfect for the price and was reasonable. A sweet marmalade, avocados and bleu cheese - #nomnomnom  If you're looking for great burgers and beers, I recommend visiting Billy's!

reviews.author: Megan S.
reviews.description: This is a nice neighborhood bar with a good selection of beer and food.  As basic as it sounds, the basket of french fries was my favorite. They are mildly spiced and go well with the beers. I used to go here occasionally for the trivia nights.  The bar is divided into rooms/sections. One of them has a pool table and dart boards. There is sufficient patio seating as well. The downside is there are limited parking spots.

reviews.author: Danny B.
reviews.description: My favorite neighborhood bar, grille. Excellent food, wings, burgers, especially the ruben

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Why Billy's? Let us count the ways; great burgers, daily drink specials, a pool table, cool patio, eclectic music selection (blues to beach boys), and TVs for sports. How bout two bucks off any Real Ale draft on Thursdays. Here take your 4 stars Billy. Minus one star for being a Green Bay Packer Bar (kidding).   Billy's is a chill neighborhood bar to grab a bite and have a beer or two. Their draft selection is awesome with all your favorites plus a few that will surprise you. Checkout their burger menu it's pretty extensive. I opted for a boring cheeseburger with fries. Burger was cooked perfectly and served on a bed of spiced up fries and it paired perfectly with my pint of Real Ale amber. Will definitely return but not on a Packer game day (Go Pats!).

reviews.author: Anthony A.
reviews.description: After a couple rounds of Chicken Poop Bingo we stopped by to watch some of the Super Bowl and get a quick meal. We were blessed to find this joint. We had some locals being so polite to us and the atmosphere was enjoyable. Loved every bite if my simple dish beans and cornbread. My wife had a Burger and the quality was amazing. Good spot to support and stop by!

reviews.author: Patricia W.
reviews.description: This is my place. 1.8 miles from my house. Burgers are good and they have food for a vegetarian too! Beer is always cold. Service is friendly. It's a little dive burger and beer bar with charm. What more could you ask for? It's a meet up after work on a weekday joint. It's a watch the game together joint. It's a just wanna eat fried food a chill with a beer type of place. It's not fancy. If you want fancy then don't head to Billy's. Billy's is keeping it real!

name: Salt Traders Coastal Cooking
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Thursday, Saturday

reviews.author: Krasti Q.
reviews.description: This restaurant is a 5 out of 5 for me. I absolutely enjoy eating here. The raw oysters are always my favorite to snack on (tip: on Mondays, their gulf oysters are only $1). I've also tried their chowda fries which are delicious. It's everything you would expect with chowder but better because you also get fries (this dish itself can be heavy and filling). Definitely one to try if you're looking for something to warm your soul. Their lobster roll is good too. I love the lobster meat but I wish they served it as a warm, hot sandwich rather than the chilled one. Nonetheless, still delicious!   Now don't get me started on their dessert which is also worth noting here. All their desserts are made in-house but there is one that really hits the spot. This dessert has a warm chocolate brownie topped with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream and drizzled with caramel. If heaven was a dish, that would be it because it just transports you into another world. Worth saving some room in your stomach for!

reviews.author: Thomas S.
reviews.description: Good vibes and atmosphere and hard to beat the happy hour prices. The wine list was pretty lacking... I mean throw 1-2 nice options on there... it's oysters after all.   Oysters were fresh but not great. The sushi rice was made out of a home rice cooker... come on y'all... gotta step up your game there. Food is a bit salty but overall decent. Worth a try if you live in Round Rock otherwise probably not worth stopping by for.

reviews.author: Jim C.
reviews.description: I mean the food was OK but was a) very very rich, and b) everything was very salty.  I had a half-dozen gulf oysters which were very small, and also had the shrimp and grits which was just over complicated. The shrimp was overcooked as you would expect someplace hundreds of miles from the coast where no one knows anything about seafood, and the dish was overall just rich and higher-flown than necessary.  D had something else for a main dish that neither of us even remembers, and she also had the mac and cheese which was tasty but also a little over-produced.  Neither of us would consider returning. Third star is because the service was good - Kevin was our server - otherwise, and this this is just OUR opinion as lifetime gulf coast residents, maybe two stars.

reviews.author: Angela M.
reviews.description: Always a great visit! The chowda fries are one of my favorite things on the menu. That has a crispy shrimp bowl as a special and I hope they bring it back! The shrimp were luscious and delicious and it was a huge portion. Service is always amazing and they've upgraded their HVAC system so I feel comfortable dining here.

reviews.author: Melissa D.
reviews.description: Good oysters and the half chicken plate is amazing.  Just a quiet laid back seafood joint yes it's expensive but good

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: We found ourselves in Round Rock, TX on a recent Saturday, early evening, so we decided to stop by Salt Traders Costal Cooking on IH 35.  We found a couple of open seats at the bar.  Our first orders were a couple of craft cocktails, the Gin and Housemaid Tonic and The Rum Around.  Both were good, but upon reflection, for the price, regular cocktails would have sufficed.    We kind of went crazy on appetizers, having Gulf oysters, grilled oysters, crab fingers, and the crudo plate, which was yellowfin.  All of those dishes were "off the chart" crazy good, with the exception of the crudo ... the white sauce used was way too sweet for the awesome fish.    When we finally ended up at the main section of the menu, we ordered the fried oyster lettuce wraps and the simply grilled fish of the day, which was redfish.  The tartar sauce served with the lettuce wraps was delicious, but a bit too much was slathered on the wraps.  IMHO put a dash on the lettuce leaves and let the patron add as desired from the small cup of tartar sauce that comes with the dish.  The redfish was terrific, but no one knew why the place would have farm-raised redfish from the Indian Ocean when we have fresh redfish 200 miles away in the Gulf of Mexico?    Keeping it local, we ordered the Becker Vineyard Reserve Viognier, and it was delicious.  In closing, a special shout out to our waiter Nathan behind the bar, service was attentive but not intrusive, so nice to have a great waiter with a great attitude!

reviews.author: Brian O.
reviews.description: We've been a fan of Salt Trader's Costal Cooking in RR since their opening five years ago and not surprisingly we dine there 2-1 over Jack Allen's, our previous go-to place. We've never had a less than wonderful experience there with the diverse menu and bold bright flavors and textures of amazingly prepared seafood and American cuisine and wonderful drinks.  The newly transformed Flat Top Fish Tacos are unbelievably good as the two hearty tacos are prepared Birria style with caramelized cheese crust on the flour tortilla and with substantial amount of grilled black drum with a street corn filling along with the cup of aromatic tomato-shrimp soppin broth and tomatillo-lime rice with pickled chilis.   Other favorites include Grilled Oysters and Fried Oyster Lettuce Wraps for Starters and the  Fish Enchiladas and of course fresh Oysters and Daily Specials and Seasonal Deserts.  FLAT TOP FISH TACOS 17 crispy cheese flour tortilla, street corn,  tomatillo lime rice, pickled chilis,  charred tomato-shrimp soppin' broth

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: We love everything about Salt Trader's.  First and foremost the 512 Cocktail. It is perfection. Sometimes I crave it and we go just so I can grab that drink. Haha! The food is outstanding. Every single thing. We've never made a bad selection. Their crudo of the day is always a favorite.  Dang now I'm craving Salt Trader's again. Haha!

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Hannah made my experience great! She went above and beyond to make sure I was satisfied during my time here!  Parking: there is a parking lot Reservations: im not sure if you can make reservations but I would suggest it. Although, the wait isn't too bad  Food: I got a very basic meal( lol), I got the the fried fish and shrimp and was not disappointed  Honorable mention: tried the New Orleans bbq shrimp and the pasta- i wasn't a huge fan- my taste buds said it was too salty foe me- but my friend enjoyed them  Drinks: i really wanted a spicy margarita and Hannah made sure that she got it to my liking, which I truly appreciated!

reviews.author: Andrew B.
reviews.description: Salt Traders might be my favorite upscale casual restaurant in Round Rock. The vibe here is similar to Jack Allen's, but with a nautical twist. 100% the kind of place where you'll find at least one dude rocking salmon colored shorts and boat shoes. No shade, just facts.  I particularly love their happy hour. All the appetizers are hits (especially the chowder fries), and that $4 discount on apps is really nice. I may be wrong, but I think on either Monday or Tuesday, happy hour is basically all day. If you've never been and want to sample a bunch of things, definitely take advantage of this.  My favorite entree by far is the shrimp and grits. It comes with a savory sauce on top that really sets it apart from other places. The bowl is also huge, and so the price is more than justified. I'm particularly fond of the Bonnabel -- one of my favorite whiskey cocktails ever. Just sweet enough for a guy like me who can't drive a manual, but just whiskey forward enough that it doesn't look like I own a Fiat.   The place gets super busy at the usual dinner times and all times during the weekend. Be a pro and hit them up during slow hours for the best experience!

reviews.author: Jerry J.
reviews.description: Have been going here for many many years. I would say the best seafood place around. Very friendly staff and professional. It's a sister restaurant from Jack Allen's. So you know it's great quality. Enjoy the dishes all the time :). My family and I come here frequently. Best oysters in town!

reviews.author: Big W.
reviews.description: I dunno why i gave this place only 4 stars on my 1st review?! I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Whenever my wife asks me where i want to go for fathers day, birthday etc... it's ALWAYS Salt Traders, and I always get the salad which is amazing and the simple grilled fish.. AMAZING TOO!! I LOVE THIS PLACE, SEAFOOD...AND SALAD.. Dont get better than this!!!

reviews.author: Jack K.
reviews.description: Dining in has never felt so good. After a lengthy hiatus we spun the wheel and what a meal. The service was outstanding as was the food. Fresh and ginormous shrimp on the Cobb salad!! The fish enchiladas and corn are amazing. Make sure you save room for dessert. We had drinks instead. Very refreshing!

reviews.author: Dylan K.
reviews.description: Really high end modern cuisine in an unexpected area. North Round Rock really isn't the place you'd think of for high quality seafood and a great classy bar scene, but that's exactly what this place had.  My wife had the scallops and they were seared perfectly and tender in the middle. Couldn't ask for better.  I had a fish sandwich, but I'm picky so I did it without the slaw, which was a mistake because it needed the crunch and the sauce. I'm sure it would be a 10/10 with that.  Definitely go to this place. We were treated like gold and the food was excellent!

reviews.author: Rick R.
reviews.description: This is my second time here in the last couple years. I started with the gumbo. In my personal opinion it was under seasoned. Kind of bland. I then had the New Orleans Shrimp. Very nice. You can tell the shrimp are fresh. I then proceeded on to the Shrimp and Lobster roll. The roll was fantastic! Warm, fresh, toast yet pillowy on the inside. The Shrimp and Lobster salad was nice and cold. The shrimp burst with flavor and freshness.  My server, (Scott) was elusive to say the least. The other waiters attended to me a lot more than he did. I probably waited 8-10 minutes before he took my order. The restaraunt was probably at 30% capacity at most. I had multiple managers see me looking for my waiter and just walked on by.   Overall, the food is good and they can definitely improve on service. I understand being shorthanded, but some things are inexcusable.

reviews.author: Susan E.
reviews.description: For my birthday, I chose to visit Salt Traders. We hadn't been there in a little while, and good seafood is always a treat.   My husband and I arrived in the early side, during happy hour (3:30-6:30 on a Thursday), so we could enjoy a leisurely meal. We started with drinks. I had the frozen grapefruit margarita, which tasted like a regular margarita. I loved that the salt on the glass also had citrus peel.  Our appetizer ($5 off during happy hour) was pot stickers. They were excellent, and the portion size (6) just right for sharing. The sauce was wonderful.   I ordered one of the day's specials for dinner, seared monkfish. It was served over fingerling potatoes and topped with a great salsa. The monkfish was tasty  but a bit on the chewy side... and the potatoes were barely undercooked. My husband had fish and chips, always a good choice at Salt Traders.  Dessert was vanilla creme brulee topped with peach sorbet. Excellent!   Service was excellent. We enjoyed Patrick's sense of humor and the stories he told.   We will be back again, without a doubt!

reviews.author: Tee C.
reviews.description: This was by far one of the best dining experiences we have had in a long time! Kenneth is an exceptional server! His knowledge of the menu, and every detail of the dishes was impressive to say the least. He can describe a salad and make it sound magical! We were too full to want to order dessert, but after he described each one we went home with almost all of them to go! We had an exceptional first visit! Thanks for the great food and service we can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Angela W.
reviews.description: Super yummy food by the people of Jack Allen's Kitchen. Given that it's by the people behind Jack Allen's, Salt Trader typically gives you a small portion of their Salmon dip to welcome you.   This place is always packed, especially on Mondays when it's all day HH. If you plan on coming on Monday, definitely get a reservation or you might be waiting ~1 hour.   I've had a number of their appetizers and they're all super tasty. My favorite is definitely the fish collar. Nicely seasoned with Cajun spice and the perfect amount of crisp. You can't really go wrong with any of their entree either.   All in all, solid restaurant that I would go to again and again.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: Since this is one of our local favorites, we brought out of state family for another GREAT dinner.  We enjoyed a variety of fresh oysters as an appetizer and then ordered a second round! Super selection so we had to try most all of them  Entrees included the fabulous monkfish special and my absolute favorite, the ciopino! I thought about the monkfish but just had to stay with my favorite, which was soooo yummy as always.  I have to give a shout out to our server, 'Hanna from Louisiana.' She was SUPER! Kept us entertained and was a great representative of the Jack Allen family-knowledgeable, super friendly and totally dedicated to delivering an exceptional guest experience. She is 5 stars for sure.  In summary, we just love love love Salt Traders!!

reviews.author: Cristal Y.
reviews.description: We were in town for a wedding and this was a great in between place from Georgetown to Austin. Make sure to make your reservation online! We made our reservation a couple of days in advance and the only available time slots left were 4:30 and 8:30pm. We decided to do an early dinner and IT. WAS. SO. GOOD.   We got the 2 dozen chargrilled oysters, 2 dozen seasonal oysters, chowder fries. Presentation, portion, and service was great! Our waitress Hannah was attentive and very sweet! I'm not a huge oyster fan, but these were phenomenal! Between the four of us, we cleaned house and walked out with our appetites satisfied. Afterwards, we walked off our fully bellies at the outlet mall!

reviews.author: Mike S.
reviews.description: Great place, good drinks, people instantly seemed friendlier as I was there alone and hung out with like 3 different groups. Highly recommend. Oh, and it was very clean, constantly wiping down tables and grabbing empties

reviews.author: Patricia S.
reviews.description: LADIES, if you want to feel uncomfortable, if you want to be harassed, assaulted and invalidated this is the place to go! The manager Tyler is incompetent and does not care about the well being of his customers.   Never going back to this bar again and I suggest you don't either.   Been coming to this bar for years with no issues, ever and have spent SO much money here (I live on Rainey). The staff have always been great until...  Tonight I had a group of young girls create a conflict with my group of friends for no reason. They swarmed our table and harassed us - pulled my friends hair, STOLE MY FRIENDS PHONE and, on top of that, a man that was part of this group forcefully grabbed my arms. The bouncers did nothing to get our phone returned nor remove a girl who pulled my friends hair and was cursing me out and flipping me off. They made me sound crazy when I asked for help. My voice did not matter. I asked to see the cameras and conveniently there are no cameras located in the front (which is absurd given that this is where all the tables and chairs are). It is one thing that these mean girls tried to start conflict with me and my friends for no reason, but this man grabbed my wrists so hard that I could not move and I had to front kick him in the stomach to get away. This is not okay under any circumstance and the fact that the bouncer and manager turned a blind eye is disgusting.  I wish there were cameras because I would press charges. This is so incredibly degrading as a woman and I am still shook that appropriate action was not taken.

reviews.author: Chad R.
reviews.description: We booked the backyard of Idle Hands for our private event.  It was our first choice venue after looking at he photos online.  When we walked in, everything felt perfect so we booked it on the spot.    We had some random requests like being able to adjust the music volume, film in the space, have dedicated security, and have a custom drink and glass (photo attached).  Idle Hands was able to accommodate everything (thanks Matt!).  During the event, Gabriel from Idle Hands helped ensure all of our guests were well-attended to.  Everything went super smooth, if you're considering a private event, you're in good hands with Idle Hands :)

reviews.author: Sirio B.
reviews.description: Nice joint on Rainey which punches above its weight in terms of drinks and food. Rainey in general is a bit of a mixed bag but this place was surprisingly good.   They have a Cuban food focus and use an interesting ticket system with every drink you get that you can redeem for food (probably to ensure enough food sales to stay open during Covid). I had about 4 Painkillers, a properly dangerous pineapple/coconut/orange and rum drink that was delicious. Summery is the best way to describe a lot of their cocktails.   Had some of the best fried plantain chips I've ever had with guacamole and ceviche. My only complaint was I wish they had comfier seating for hanging out and it ended up shortening our time we spent there (lots of high chairs and hard back seats). They dont have a decent back deck like a lot of Rainey places do so the seating was mainly up front where speakers were blasting, including the neighboring businesses music. So it ended up being a little chaotic.   Either way its a nice spot. Service, drinks and food were great so I think we'll drop by again.

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.description: Love the drinks, menu and staff. Very friendly service and with the bar being mostly outside, a safe space to enjoy a cocktail or a bite to eat. And as a bonus they have live music almost every night!!    My faves: The Painkiller - it goes down way too easy.  The Lover Boy - a killer chorizo-infused burger that will make your mouth water.   Lots of great staff and be sure to save room for the dessert! Tyler is an amazing baker who makes all the desserts for this place. The cheesecake was incredible!!   A few words about Covid restrictions - I've seen most of the bars on Rainey - almost none of them are following the protocols. I feel like this place is the exception. No lines or large groups gathering on top of each other inside. Outside seating spaced well. Staff all have on masks. That plus the food, drinks and service mean I'll be back many more times. The menu evolves some too, always like a place willing to add and try new things while keeping some of the faves on the menu.  Thank you Idle Hands - finally something good out of 2020!

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Didn't go into the bar so keep that in mind. Only did delivery for their burger and fries. The burger was just OK. Read all these reviews raving about it and thought it'd be better. I guess y'all were smashed from the fancy cocktails lol. It wasn't bad, just didn't really standout and for $12 for a burger and fries, I think there's better options in town. My fault for expecting culinary excellence from what I assume is a bar kitchen.

reviews.author: Tara V.
reviews.description: This is a generous two star offering. Love the location, the great local talent playing on the porch and our drinks were very tasty.   Big however...  The food was pitiful. The black bean burger was an oversized sopping, crumbly mess with zero flavor and the fries were cold and uneventful. The ranch may as well been runny, salty mayo. My lady pal got the plantain chips with guacamole. They gave us tortilla chips with guacamole. My guy friend went in to ask for the plantain chips that they were supposed to come with. He took a photo with his phone of the chips and dip to show the bartender and he practically laughed in my buddies face and mocked his photo taking as a means to justify his request (he's in production and art, okay? Let the guy make art and an example of your crappy food).   The man brought us the plantain chips out a few moments later to go with the guacamole. Which was the worst guacamole I've had. Del Taco makes better guacamole. Salt? Lime? Heat? Maybe just try to make it flavorful...  Oh and the quinoa bowl-- that one veggie thing. What the heck even was that? It had no sauce; oil or spices to bind together what was basically a sad bowl of vegetables and bitter arugula.   Way off the mark with the food, guys. Good thing the music was kickin' and the mezcal ritas were nice n' zesty.   Get drinks and an earful or music and skip the food. All 3 of our dishes were very weak.

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: Best bar on Rainey by far. My roommate and I came from SF, CA, and on our second night we randomly stopped here because of the live music - who actually was a contestant on the voice!! WOW!!!! We ordered "That One Healthy Thing" and some very specific drinks made by Brennan. He is an amazing bartender! I hope if the owner sees this, he/she gives him a fat raise. Thanks Idle Hands for making our first trip to Austin above and beyond our wildest dreams!

reviews.author: Angel A.
reviews.description: This is a wonderful addition to Rainey St. Its a casual, modern Tiki spot with great service, drinks and music. Visited two times since they've opened and it's been a great experience each time.   I'd recommend the Mai Tai for sure!

reviews.author: Israel C.
reviews.description: Staff is very friendly and they have wonderful cocktails! We've been here twice and felt very safe during COVID time.

reviews.author: Santiago R.
reviews.description: Cool spot on Rainey, There's a good amount of seating as well as room to stand, and they have a good variety of beers on tap to choose from.

reviews.author: Kenya R.
reviews.description: We stopped in for snacks and drinks. It was one of the few places that wasn't crowded, so we thought it was a win for us. Ummm no, we get there and they are doing contactless payment. The guy said that the app only works on iPhone. I think it was a bad business move to use a payment app that only works on iPhones.

reviews.author: Nicole H.
reviews.description: Great service and amazing drinks! The atmosphere was cool and the staff was super friendly. One of the only places that was open during the ice storm, thank you!

reviews.author: Argenis T.
reviews.description: Love the vibe and crew. The atmosphere was probably the best we've experienced while in Austin.

reviews.author: Savannah S.
reviews.description: This bar was the highlight of our night! We had a big group of people for my birthday and the bouncer made sure everything was set up for us, he even put our table right next to the live music!   The servers were all so kind and helpful! Someone at our table spilled a cocktail and they replaced it quickly and for free!  One cool thing about this bar is that they give you tickets every time you order a drink, and tickets add up to be free food items! Their fries and chips/queso were good. The cocktails were very strong too! Would definitely come here again!

reviews.author: Tommy B.
reviews.description: Don't get a $14 draft cocktail here with the auto 20% gratuity. Walk a half block down to the Tipsy Alchemist, they're $15 -- not only are they twice as big, but also made to order!

reviews.author: Dave B.
reviews.description: This place was really cool. Awesome patio and unbelievable live music by a guy named Josh Klaus. So so fun!

reviews.author: Leeann M.
reviews.description: I understand having hiccups in a new establishment, but I was really disappointed in some of the things they had more control over. - COVID protocols are unfortunately lacking. To order, you're required to download an app. Nobody at our table was able to access to menu from the app, and the staff seemed super unfamiliar with it, too. A couple of employees looked at the app on our phone for a couple seconds before they gave up and took our orders normally, negating "contact-free" ordering. - Our waitress routinely came within 6 inches of us, which is basically face-to-face when youre sitting at a high top. She would pull her mask down to speak and came over at least once with her mask on her chin. - The drinks were great!  - The live music was a nice touch and was a mental break from the whole looming pandemic thing. People were singing along to the acoustic guitar player and having fun.  - Due to COVID, each drink is required to also come with plantain chips, which was not communicated with us. We received our check and had 5 orders of plantain chips tracked on and were super confused. I understand the requirement, but a surprise $22 charge isn't cool. Additionally, they apparently ran out of chips, so we paid for 5 chips we never received.  - When we arrived, we explained that our friends were inside already at a table waiting for us. The ID taker had us wait outside for 5 minutes before allowing us in to meet them. He gave no explanation and I'm still not sure what we were waiting for.

reviews.author: Jim V.
reviews.description: This place is meh. Not too busy should have been a dead giveaway to not patronize it. The stupid TabbedOut app sucks and every drink came with an extra dumb charge. Thanks for the awful experience.

reviews.author: Mitchell J.
reviews.description: Great food. Electric atmosphere. The name sounds like a craft brewery. Best bartenders on the street.

name: The Waypoint ATX Food Truck Park

reviews.author: Mousumi Q.
reviews.description: We visited the Waypoint food truck park this weekend and really enjoyed ourselves. We had some great beers at infamous beer co and amazing food from R19 Taqueria! Next time we will try yardbirds and the Italian ice place. Can't wait to see what else is in store. So exited to have this down the street from us.

reviews.author: Ross H.
reviews.description: Incredible food, with different options available, and a place for my dog to run around and play. They have a playground if you have kids, and pleanty of trees for shade. Connected to a brewery which is awesome!

reviews.author: Blaire C.
reviews.description: Great family-friendly atmosphere and delicious food options....and right next door to Infamous so you can grab some craft beers and enjoy the live music on weekends!

name: Workhorse Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Clint S.
reviews.description: When we went earlier today for lunch and cocktails, we were, as always, welcomed by the same amazing team. We had a Bastrop Burger, a BL sandwich, both with Parmesan fries, some margaritas, a Paloma and a Pimm's Cup. Everyone and everything keeps us coming back.

reviews.author: Will C.
reviews.description: I can't comment on the bar itself since I didn't get the chance to drink there, but it's decent burger at a great price.  The burger itself was overcooked and dry; I don't know if this is normal, if the kitchen was having a bad series, or if the customer can request medium-rare.  Something to consider for next time.  And there should be a next time too, because this is still a great deal: burger + side for under $10.  Sure, it'd be nice if cheese wasn't an upcharge, but that's really a minor quibble.  Inside, the décor is funky and vibey, much like the other restaurants and shops in this North Loop neighborhood.  What stands out most inside is the massive album art print from Stone Temple Pilots's Purple.  Thanks to this, I haven't been able to get "Interstate Love Song" out of my head for the past four days.

reviews.author: Henry Y.
reviews.description: Came here with the coworkers on a Friday right after work. This is a great spot with an outdoor seating area in BOTH the front and the back (which I didn't know at first).  Their drinks are pre-California exodus cheap, so grab a beer or two or three. They also have grub. There's plenty of burgers to choose from, a coworker said their portobello burger is bomb. I got the burger special, which was arugula and blue cheese. My burger was slightly overcooked and a coworker's was well-done, so you'll have to be mindful of that; if you like yours med-rare or medium, I would call it out. I thought they were pretty generous with the blue cheese, but the burger itself could have been slightly larger; they're thick but relatively tiny. Buns are toasted. I think next time I'd go with one of the classic burgers since I felt the burger special was really heavy, the arugula doesn't bring enough balance for the funkiness of the blue cheese. The parmesian fries were alright, a tad too salty for me.  The guys behind the bar were nice, a bee got stuck in my bottle and they kindly replaced it.  PARKING: there's a few spots out front, but there's plenty of parking around the corner in the residential area.  Come for the drinks, stay for vibes.

reviews.author: Junus A.
reviews.description: This place is STILL GREAT. Only ever had one bad burger here (was a bit dry).   I am just going to affirm that this is my favorite bar in Austin. I have lots of drinking experience in Austin. Workhorse nails it. Anyone can come here, feel comfortable, enjoy super-solid food, a great beer selection, and walk away with an affordable tab. It's just perfect..  LOVE the new COVID sidewalk space. PLEASE keep it. Probably 90% of the patrons here smoke cigarettes and the back patio only barely sufficed.

reviews.author: Andrew J.
reviews.description: It's a good dive, with tons of beer on tap and surprisingly good food. Lots of vegetarian options too. Service is pretty decent considering how grungy the place is.   However: I definitely got at least one drink in a dirty ass glass, and the kitchen staff is, shall we say, pretty casual about food hygiene. And yet I still liked it somehow. Maybe because so many other places in present-day Austin are just gentrification normie hellscapes-- this is a nice change of pace.

reviews.author: Endy L.
reviews.description: Quick service, food, drinks, price. Only thing is merch designs seem lazy. Will be back!

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Great bar and grill across from vintage row. BLT and fries were great. Good music too not to mention a lot of beer on draft to pick from  we will be back

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Try the pretzels, you'll thank me. Great neighborhood spot for beers and burgers on the outdoor patio out back.

reviews.author: Mason M.
reviews.description: Amazing food. Definitely get a burger and the Parmesan fries! Tables and atmosphere are a little awkward if you aren't there for the bar part. I would highly recommend it as a bar/burger place.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Was I just transported to a mountain town where everyone just got off their shift on the slopes? Oh, nope. Still in Austin.   This is a cozy, neighborhood bar. The seating is a bit hodge podge cabin lodge so you might find yourself standing if it's crowded, but as is the case anywhere that's solid. All the drinking options for all the drinking types. The burgers look legit, but I didn't have one.  Bundle up and throw 'em back.

reviews.author: Jenny L.
reviews.description: this used to be a hipster bearded ax throwing dude bar.   it's now a whitewashed college kid bar, and packed af.

reviews.author: Shawn M.
reviews.description: The place is a cool dive and seating outside but the drinks aren't dive bar prices and the cooks never wash their hands before preparing your meal.  I guess they don't care about this pandemic at all.  I watched the cook scratch his head, grab his phone and text then started to assemble a burger without a care in the world or concern for cleanliness.  So if I were you I would eat before I go to this establishment.

reviews.author: Kayla H.
reviews.description: Good food. Not great service.  I was excited by all the vegetarian options on the menu. My mac n cheese was good. The fried pickles were soooo good. Definitely recommend those.  We came midday, and I'd have preferred there be a few more non-alcoholic beverages. It seemed there were usually quite a few choices, but they were out of most things. Not sure why.  We'd come again.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: We visited this place last week and are so sad that it hasn't been our go-to all along. It's located in such a chill part of Austin, so it's perfect when you feel like going out, but not going out (if you know what I mean)! They have a ton of beers on tap and handful of yummy sounding cocktails. We didn't eat here, but when we saw their blue cheese bacon burger with huge azzz onion rings on the side we were wishing we did! It was totally embarrassing, but my husband accidentally spilled his first beer on the bar and the bar tender did a great job at not acting completely annoyed at him, although he was. He even poured him another which we were not expecting at all, so that added to our great experience here! Highly recommend, but only if you're not a high-maintenance little princess because it definitely has some grunginess to it ;)

reviews.author: Tiffany P.
reviews.description: This is the epitome of a dive bar so it's not really my scene, but I will say the food looked and smelled delicious and they have the cleanest bathroom I've ever experienced for a bar of this caliber.

reviews.author: Kelly N.
reviews.description: This is a great bar! The food is really delicious and there's a lot of different options for everyone. You can order everything from burgers to mac and cheese to sandwiches. There's even veggie options for those of you who are vegetarian! The fries are great. The beers are awesome and there's a big selection.  It is pretty hot here here though, especially outside during the summer. I love the location and sometimes it's hard to find parking but it's a great spot for a beer and some food. It does get crowded but the service was still quick.

reviews.author: Sylvain B.
reviews.description: It's a dive bar so I'll keep my review short: - extremely cheap beers: down to $1 a bottle and $3 a pint of draft beer - amazing selection of great (local and non-) beers - super friendly bartender who knows his products and gives great advice on the beers to choose form. - great ambiance, nice patron, fun atmosphere and great music.  So it goes in the 4 stars dive bars!  Note: They have an outdoor patio in the back.

reviews.author: Nickie B.
reviews.description: I have been to the Workhorse Bar three times before yesterday, and those experiences were all 3-4 stars.  But this most recent visit was teetering on between 2-3 stars.    I ordered the White Manhattan, which has always been awesome!  This visit it tasted like they poured me a glass of watered down Moonshine and added a twist of Orange.  I ordered a second one just to make sure it was just not a bad pour.  Nope the second one was as bad as the first. The odd thing is they bartender who made them both, was the same bartender who has made them for me on my prior visits.     We were also quite bothered by the loud group behind us slamming their cards on the table as they played some unknown card game.  They were overly loud and obnoxious.  We were not the only customers who were annoyed.  The other pet peeve I have is when large groups of people stand at the front door of an entrance to smoke cigarettes.  On this visit there was always a group of 3-7 people puffing away well within 15 feet of the front door.  People...please go smoke out back on the patio.  The upside of this visit was the music from the jukebox.  For $2 we were able to select 8 tunes.  Music selection is random, but good.

reviews.author: Tina M.
reviews.description: Workhorse is the perfect little neighborhood bar. It has a fairly large and very affordable selection of drinks, an all-around-the-clock "happy hour", great bar food and a nice staff! They also have a jukebox (select 4 songs for a dollar) and a patio in the back.   In the food department, they've got a good selection of sides and appetizers, as well as burgers, salads and fries. Vegetarians will be pleased to find out they have several veggie options, including two types of veggie burgers and many sides. The food is cheap and tasty. I don't know about you, but for me that's getting pretty close to my definition of heaven!   If you want available seating space for the duration of your stay, I recommend visiting between Monday and Thursday. Friday and weekends are very popular nights and you might not be able to find a cozy spot to sit, although that goes for most bars.  If you pass by the North Loop strip one evening, you should definitely drop by and have a taste of Workhorse.

reviews.author: Bill G.
reviews.description: This is a great neighborhood bar. I don't live in the neighborhood but I do love this hangout. Friendly staff and patrons, genuinely Austin. Food and drinks are definitely in the affordable range. Cool art on the walls and an awesome jukebox. Enjoy!

name: Barley Swine
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jorge G.
reviews.description: Highly recommend!  I've been to a majority of the coveted top restaurants in Austin and this is definitely one of the best! There is a reason people love this place.   It is very well managed--huge shout to the Manager Stefan who guided us through the menu and went above and beyond to make our experience a special one.  Their tasting menu is so good and well curated - every plate was perfection and no detail was overlooked.  The tasting menu comprised of the following:  Appetizers:  2 year aged country ham on mini pancakes (yes mini pancakes), Deviled Egg, Tamale and Spicy Beef. The Tamale is like no tamale I've ever had!  Main Course: tostada crudo, black cod, muscovy duck, Dry aged Akaushi ribeye/donut. Everything was delicious but the ribeye/donut is out of this world! Probably one of the best plates I've ever had.   Desert: Caramelized fennel ice cream/caraway/ orange and Butternut cake/curry spice.   Not only is the food outstanding, the ambiance was very thoughtfully curated (lighting, sound and architecture).  We are lucky to have such an incredible restaurant in Austin.

reviews.author: Andrew B.
reviews.description: Currently my favorite restaurant in Austin, Barley Swine offers a tasting menu that beautifully combines Texas flavors with upscale plating and technique. If you want to impress an out-of-towner with a nice meal while also showing giving them an accurate and varied taste of Texas, this is the place.  There are so many dishes with lots of components, and so it's difficult to break down every dish (particularly because the menu changes often enough that any specifics will likely be obsolete by the time you end up eating here), but I can say that in the multiple times I've been here, I've had some iteration of a tamale in the small bites, a fish course, a duck course, and Akaushi steak for the final savory course. Some tasting menus have highs and lows, but Barley Swine's seems to get gradually better with every course.   If you can afford to do so, I highly recommend adding their shiitake dumplings with soft scrambled eggs. It sounds like a strange combination, but it's a shockingly good umami bomb that should be experienced at least once. While the menu changes throughout this year, this dish has become something of a signature for them, and once you try it, you'll know why.  The service here is extremely unpretentious considering the caliber of food they're serving. Servers don't even have set uniforms. Everyone just looks and acts like Austin foodies who are happy talk about and share food with you, and I love that.   If you're as comfortable having wine as you are sipping on cocktails, then the choice between the wine pairing or having their house cocktails is an extremely difficult choice. Both options are awesome, but unless you're looking to get messy drunk in an upscale restaurant, one option precludes the others. Gun to my head, I'd probably opt for the wine pairing, if only because it potentially gives you access to 20+ year old bottles that you'd have a hard time finding. But I'll be damned if their "Follow the Leader" (a corn infused mezcal cocktail) isn't one of the most intriguing drinks I've had in this city.  While the snobs at Michelin don't think Austin is worth considering, I wholly believe that Barley Swine is as good as a lauded place like Gramercy Tavern in NYC, and it easily beats the shit out of some of the formerly Michelin starred restaurants in Las Vegas (stares shadily at Picasso). The atmosphere is inviting; the food is exciting; and the flavors are quintessentially Texan.

reviews.author: Alvin A.
reviews.description: Best restaurant in Austin.  They serve a seasonal tasting menu and have wine pairings available. Compared to other big cities, the tasting menu here is very reasonably priced, but completely delivers on experience and flavor. The wine pairings are on point as well and fully worth adding on.  Reservations well in advance are highly recommended as this place books up. They do have some self-parking both in front of and behind the restaurant, but offer valet as well. The atmosphere is fairly casual, so no need for ultra dressy attire.  The food is thoughtful, creative, and most importantly, absolutely delicious. On top of that, the staff are all extremely knowledgeable, attentive, and friendly.  We've dined here a few times now and have been blown away each time. Can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Mel E.
reviews.description: Excellent tasting experience!  Sat at the bar with Eric and Savannah (the amazing bartenders) vs sitting at the chef's table and I'm very glad that I did! They were incredible and the bonus was getting a view of the amazing kitchen and the crew! This experience was truly remarkable and the price points were perfect! They were warm, welcoming and listened to my likes and dislikes and accommodated accordingly. Barley swine would certainly be one of the key reasons why I would move here. The food was exquisite; an experience worth having at least once a month. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: My husband and I have been watching way too much Top Chef, so we wanted to treat ourselves to a special meal. I'm so glad we chose Barley Swine!   I'll start with the service, which is top-notch. When we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by the crew and shown to our bar seats. I wanted to sit there because you get to see into the kitchen. It was really fun being able to watch the chefs in action. Our servers were both very attentive and knowledgeable about the wine and food. You feel like it's all very personalized just for you which makes it feel all the more special.   As for the food, they're only serving the tasting menu right now, but that's definitely the way to go. It allowed us to try a bunch of different flavors, and it was nice not having to think about what to order. They start you off with four amuse-bouche dishes. My favorite was the (raw) spicy beef over a kerupuk style beef cracker. Then you get a crudo and fish course. The crudo was great but honestly the fish was over cooked. That said, their sauces are bomb so I still enjoyed it. Some of the other dishes that were particularly tasty was their beef and donut combo and the sorbet. The whole meal was nicely paced and flavors were complementary.   Definitely do yourself the favor and enjoy a meal here soon.

reviews.author: Cassandra S.
reviews.description: On a recent trip to Austin, I tried this place based on recommendations from Austinites.   I strongly suggest you make a reservation. We arrived about 15 minutes late, called to let them know, but we were still unable to get the type of table we had originally requested. You should also know, when making reservations they request a $50 per person reservation fee that is later taken off your total bill. For two tasting menus, one wine pairing, and three cocktails, the bill was $500.  This establishment is known for seasonal tasting menus that are in constant flux. They had two (usually there were three but they had run out of one) additional dishes that could be ordered on top of the tasting menu; but to be honest, the richness of the plates was sufficient enough to curb your hunger and make you feel full. The dishes were very creative. My absolute favorite were the small bites. They consisted of pierogi, radish bagel, tamale, and spicy beef. The texture of the pierogi was perfect, and the flavor was perfectly pickled. The radish bagel was fresh, light, and crisp. The tamale was a perfect fusion of Japanese and Latin all in one little bite. I could have used way more than one! My least favorite dish was the halibut, but the wine pairing made it more palatable. The duck was perfectly cooked, but when they mentioned that it was cooked with a sous vide for 48 hours, then seared over the grill, it made much more sense of how perfect it was!! The ribeye was a over cooked, chew, and tough to break down for my taste. It was served more medium that medium rare. My absolute favorite dish of the night was the poblano Texas sheet cake!! It was served with a peach sorbet (if I remember correctly), topped with chamoy, and garnished with sunflower seeds!! This was such a creative dish! And again, I could have eaten three of these!!   Overall, this was a great experience. The servers were attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly. I was thoroughly impressed with creativity behind each dish. I also LOVED that the restaurant is ZeroFoodPrint and Carbon neutral. I highly recommend this restaurant!

reviews.author: Leah H.
reviews.description: I have been wanting to experience the chefs tasting for years and finally had a chance for our anniversary. They did bring Champaign for an anniversary gift. However, the f was good, but not phenomenal, for the cost. We sat for 3 hours, which is about 1.5 hours longer than expected. I honestly don't think I would go back and 100% prefer Odd Duck. I wish I could rate this 3.5 stars.

reviews.author: Stacie H.
reviews.description: Really nice tasting menu experience! The restaurant called prior to my visit and checked for any dietary restrictions. They were gracious and willing to accommodate my preferences.  Once seated, we received a personalized menu with dietary notes and individual mask holders which I thought were nice extra touches.  We chose to add on the shiitake dumplings and were so glad we did. Definitely one of the standouts of the night. The scallop dish was also a hands down winner!  Recommend for a special evening out!

reviews.author: MyMy C.
reviews.description: Had an awesome dinner. Definitely recommend! We had the tasting menu with wine pairing. All dishes were good, and a couple memorable. Our favorite dishes were the tostada, mushroom dumplings (worth paying the extra, total mouth explosion) and the fish. We were celebrating my friend's birthday, and was surprised with bubbly when we sat down. Rina was our server and did a great job!

reviews.author: Kiana N.
reviews.description: Love love loved my experience at Barley Swine! Whenever my boyfriend and I visit a new city, we like to do at least 1 tasting menu and this one was great! In comparison to other big cities, this tasting menu is pretty affordable but still a great experience. The tasting comes with 10 courses with optional add-ons you can choose for about $10-$15 each. Including the add-on's we had a total of 12 dishes: 1. Shrimp Dumpling: Plated very nicely and also extremely flavorful. One of my favorites 2. Radish bagel: The concept of this dish is not very unique but it still tasted SO good, I loved it. Basically a bagel, cream cheese, and a pickled cucumber on top lol. 3. Smoked kohlrabi: small but tasty 4. Spicy beef: Beef tartare served on a rice cracker. Really unique flavors and textures. I didn't expect to like this one (not a huge fan of beef tartare) but this was great! 5. Crudo with Fruit Vinegar: Raw fish with smoked watermelon. The tastes in this dish were so unique and flavorful. I'd never imagine biting into a watermelon and getting that smoky flavor but it worked so well with the fish. 6. Halibut with Green Beans and Pecan: I must say this was my least favorite of the dishes but it was still not bad. The halibut just wasn't too flavorful 7. Muscovy Duck/Cured Leg: This course comes with 2 duck dishes. One is a plated piece of duck, the other is cured duck on a cracker. Both were so tasty! 8. Dry Aged Alaska Ribeye + Donut: This course also comes with 2 dishes. For one, a piece of ribeye which was small but so juicy. It also comes with a donut topped with some chopped pieces of beef which tasted great too! 9. Carrot rainbow sherbet: The first of 2 dessert courses, very unique and yummy 10. Chamomile buttermilk pie + Dewberry: I loved this dessert! Plated nicely and also so tasty Optional Add-Ons: 11. I HIGHLY recommend adding on the Shiitake Dumpling. This was recommended by our waitress as it's one of their classic dishes and I'm so glad we listened to her. I don't want to spoil anything for you because this dish has a nice surprise. Just trust me and get it ;) 12. Dry Aged Akaushi Beef Rib: This dish was tasty as well but nothing too special or fancy. I was already full with the initial 10 + Shiitake Dumpling Add-On so this wasn't necessary for us. If you're super hungry then maybe add it on.  For cocktails, we ordered the Peach Whiskey Smash, Acapulco Gold, and Barrel White Aged Negroni - all great!  In terms of ambiance and service, I'd also give 5 stars. The kitchen is open so you can see all the fun going on behind the scenes. We had several waiters serving each course, giving a great description of each, and answering any questions we had. Halfway through our meal, apparently there was some difficulty with the customers sitting next to us - which we honestly did not notice - but because of this, one of the waitresses gave us a free wine pairing with the halibut dish. I greatly appreciated that they went out of their way to make sure we were having a good experience.  Will definitely come back next time we're in Austin! 10/10

reviews.author: Brad B.
reviews.description: Barley Swine provides a special dining experience! This was our third visit to Barley Swine and each time we indulged in the tasting menu with wine pairing. The food is inventive and each bite an experience. The staff is attentive, wore masks and I noticed extensive cleaning practices to protect their patrons. I highly recommend Barley Swine for a culinary adventure!

reviews.author: Yossef A.
reviews.description: First time trying this restaurant. My family and I went for a special occasion and had the chefs tasting menu.  The decor was great and inviting, they have a theme of pickling everything so a lot of jars around, it looks cool with the lighting.   Staff was very cheerful and pleasure to be around, they were still following Covid distance protocols regardless of the full capacity mandate now. My family and I truly appreciated that.   The tasting menu was delicious, I'd highly recommend if your want to try and not of everything on the menu, the donuts and the braised ribs were by far the star dishes. I would highly recommend this establishment.   Enjoy!

reviews.author: Isaac H.
reviews.description: This is the very best tasting menu in all Of Austin. Austin has incredible food and Barley Swine tops the list. We have been here 6 or 7 times and it is perfection every time. Do yourself the favor and pair the wine.

reviews.author: Evan G.
reviews.description: Had our first experience at Barley Swine and thought it was one of the best meals I've had.  The tasting menu, all pre-defined, was varied and 9/10 with the exception of some pancetta that was tough and chewy. The snapper and crudo were fantastic, as was the duck and steak.   The setting is in a nice strip center where they've walled off the parking lot to create a little patio.  It would have been perfect it a tiny bit more secluded from Burnet or with some greenery.  My only reason for not 5* is that I guess I'm still a little surprised with how $$$$ the meal was relative to others I've had.  This smashed our "record" from Lenoir, Uchi, and Juniper, even with equivalent wine pairings.   It was a terrific meal, but not sure I see us going back but every other year at $160+ pp and rising.

reviews.author: Lee Roy C.
reviews.description: It really doesn't get much better than Barley Swine in Austin. Every dish and drink I've tried has been great and showcases so much of what's good about Central Texas. Plus, the ambience and service at the restaurant are top-notch. My wife and I even had our first "nice date" here, and it's still one of our favorite places in town. We recently tried their takeout dinner package and were again impressed by the quality of the food. The beef short ribs were beautifully cooked, and the sweet potato and slaw sides complemented nicely. For dessert, we had rum spiced pudding and pecan chocolate brittle cookies. Dangerously good! The meal had a comforting and familiar feel to it but with the class and quality that I've come to expect at Barley Swine. Can't wait for this pandemic to be over, so I can try their tasting menu!

reviews.author: Diana C.
reviews.description: Wow, just wow!   We had an Amazing dinner last night... every single course was equally sooo delicious!  Flavor explosions in your mouth.  The wine parings were perfect and a great compliment to each course.   We are huge foodies and have been to many restaurants all over the world (including Michelin star)... and this experience was one of the top ones we've had.   Can't wait to go back when the next seasonal menu is out!

reviews.author: Thao V.
reviews.description: Do yourself a favor and EAT AT THIS RESTAURANT.  The food here is amazing!! We did the tasting menu and they were extremely considerate about our allergies/food preferences.   Every dish was unique and delicious. My favorites were the dry aged ribeye served with a scrumptious donut and meat skewer that was DIVINE, the apple semifreddo (ridiculously creamy), and the crudo. But honestly there was not a dish that we did not enjoy.   We even made a super weird request to switch out a pink knife for a blue knife and they were very supportive.   Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Olympia D.
reviews.description: Vibes are typical Austin upscale.  So like, you can pop a fine pet nat wine in some flip flops and its chill. Servers are knowledgeable professionals. Tasting menu is all interesting (that man Bryce is some funky genius) and delightful.   If you do the wine pairing be prepared to get a lot of knowledge about natural, small production wines that are v cool and make you want to throw your Bota box away. If you are trying to have an intense conversation about your affair or break up with your baby mama or whatever do not do it here because it is a very interactive experience.

reviews.author: Eddie C.
reviews.description: Short hit: MUST TRY!!!!  To date, this his the highest five stars I've ever given. Without question, the best meal I've ever had, and second place isn't even close. The place is so good, that for anyone that gives it less than 5 stars, I begin to seriously question whether or not their review are trustworthy... yeah, it's that good.  Ambiance: Very unassuming. Walking up, I thought the place was quaint, but I had no idea that this place was serving up the best dishes I would taste. This is fine dining for sure, but not in a stuffy kind of way. No white gloves, no classical music, no bougieness. True to Austin, the place is casual, yet refined.   Staff: Very informative and hospitable. Everyone I encountered was super friendly and knowledgeable. Every time a new dish was brought out, we received a thorough explanation from out waitress. The information was very detailed, which I appreciated. You can tell the establishment spends a lot of time training their staff, so my kudos to the place.   FOOD: my goodness, the number of flavors I experienced is phenomenal. If I may be obtuse, I must admit, I had about seven foodgasms. There is no set menu (changes each month), so I won't go into great detail on the dishes, but the flavors were just so complementary. Speaking of complementary, I highly recommend doing the beverage pairing. At $55, it's not too easy on the wallet, but I can honestly say it is money well spent. Eaching pairing was perfect and enhanced the flavors of each dish. Side note: since I was driving, I wanted to experience the pairing, but didn't want to have my own, so I informed our waitress that my girlfriend and I would be sharing a paring. She advised that instead of sharing the 3 oz pour, for $75, we could receive 2 oz each, and honestly I thought that was the perfect amount. I was able to fully appreciate the pairing without feeling irresponsible for driving home.   Price: this place should probably be reserved for special occasions only as it's definitely pricey, but I always said I don't mind spending a few extra dollars on food, as long as I feel that it's justified. In this case of Barley Swine, I am pleased to report that the food and dining experience is well worth the price.

reviews.author: Steve L.
reviews.description: To be honest, I was fairly toasted by the time we actually made it to dinner, so the details are a bit fuzzy, but a friend and I (in town for SXSW...as it was being canceled) opted to swing by for the tasting menu and I DO remember it being insanely delicious. The menu included:  Cured Antelope with turnip and koji yogurt Spicy Tuna with kale and daikon Carrot mouse with beets and sunchoke chip Snapper with spicy greens and radish Grilled oyster with hot sauce jus, kohlrabi, and coppa Muscovy duck with sweet potato, bok choy, fried bun Aged Akaushi ribeye with broocoli, marrow salsa macha Fennel sorbet with gin and orange Sweet potato cake with pecan, coffee, cardamom  I would absolutely do it again (perhaps with slightly less aggressive pregaming lol).

name: Shiner's Saloon
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Marc S.
reviews.description: Had a nice couple beers and flatbread pizza here on a sleepy Sunday evening.  Pretty empty for a while, bartender super friendly explaining the ins and out of the Shiner varieties which I had no idea there were many.  The pizza was surprisingly good.  No live music this evening, but the juke box selection was good.

reviews.author: Kimberly T.
reviews.description: Spent our last night in Texas here.  Patrick and Baccari (sp?) we're fantastic. Loved the rooftop bar, played some corn hole. Great atmosphere and music. Will definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Darcy D.
reviews.description: The bartender is a jerk. They were out of limes so they put "extra Fresca" in my Paloma. The drink tasted like pure soda water. I spent $10 on soda water that I couldn't even drink. If I could give 0 stars, I would.

reviews.author: Heins G.
reviews.description: I love Shiner's saloon. I had my best night in Austin at this bar. Great live country music and wonderful bartenders! Will definitely be returning soon!!

reviews.author: Kerry G.
reviews.description: A necessary stop for tourists and locals alike. The food and drink selection is great, but what sets this establishment apart from any other is the atmosphere and service. All the bartenders were incredibly kind, funny, and knowledgeable. The inside of the bar has a campy western feel, and the rooftop patio has lots of games and beautiful views. A perfect destination for quick drinks, date night, or relaxing with friends.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Love how I was yelled at for "sleeping" at the bar while I was literally looking at my phone. The bartender never even apologized, and even though I ordered multiple items, I had to wait long for a cup of water, until I asked again. Then I had to wait super long for my check, had to ask again, and they were hesitant to give me the industry discount. Dude, I'm a server and my gf is a bartender. Y'all are terrible at your job, get it together. Giving attitude for no reason.

reviews.author: Sabrina T.
reviews.description: Super chill vibes with friendly faces and great drinks. Go see Trevor and he will take care of you!

reviews.author: Carlos B.
reviews.description: Not our first choice for rooftop bars, but it was the first place we started our last evening in Texas! The other place closed it's roof deck on Monday's.   When in Texas first beer choice should be Shiner ... it's what you do. I love Shiner regardless of the obligation. We played a round of Connect Four.   We killed one beer each only to bounce to the next stop on our self-guided tour of Austin's rooftop bars.  Service was friendly, and we didn't use as much as we could've.

reviews.author: Emily P.
reviews.description: This bar was an awesome place to stop into (and which we ended up staying at for quite a while)! Staff was friendly, beers were great, and we loved the games on the rooftop. A very underrated spot in downtown Austin that felt like home.

reviews.author: Wynona V.
reviews.description: Thank you Ashley for amazing service, great conversation, and most of all - for your kitchen being open  We were starving and were told by 6 different places that their kitchens were closed already. Finally happened upon this gem.

reviews.author: Wilson S.
reviews.description: This place has horrible customer service  and is  disgusting , the bartender knocked a drink off the table (beer splashed all over me) and let a cumstomer suck liquor out of his belly button while other bartenders watched. Bartender wasn't wearing a mask and lots of patrons were not wearing mask. I asked how long until my order was ready and the bartender said I dont know and walked off.

reviews.author: A D.
reviews.description: Amazing place! Live music sunday afternoons. Great bartender. So nice to hear live music again! I think the band was called "horses and hand grenades" super talented with the harmonica and trumpet! Cheers!

reviews.author: Dolores S.
reviews.description: Amazing place to have a great time!! Trevor the bartender is awesome!! Do yourself a favor and visit if you are in town.

reviews.author: Adnan M.
reviews.description: Great casual spot. They have live performances. Reminds of old school bars on the country side. Great place to chill.

reviews.author: Elizabeth H.
reviews.description: Shiners is always my go to spot in Austin. Love the staff, the dive bar vibe, price, and the rooftop patio is the best. 4years of happy memories coming here. Also their nachos are life.

reviews.author: Kristy R.
reviews.description: If you're a fan of Shiner beer (like me) you will love this place. Tons of Shiner varieties to choose from, including most that are not available in NY. The entire bar is outdoors but the bar area itself is relatively covered in case it begins to rain. It's also a rooftop setting which gives it an awesome ambiance and makes you want to stick around for a while.  Our bartender (I believe his name was Brandon) was super nice and chatted with us. They have a giant Operation game that actually works, as well as giant Connect 4 and giant Jenga. A few TVs are behind the bar showing sports. They have an old cigarette machine once you reach the top of the stairs and I'm pretty sure it still works.   The entrance is on the sketchy side especially when you're 4 females walking in around midnight on a Wednesday. The sign outside on ground level is tiny and only says Shiner. Inside the door is an ATM machine. Then it's a loft-style staircase all the way up to the roof/bar. Once you climb the stairs it's like Disney World. I definitely would have spent another evening here if we were in Austin longer.

reviews.author: Michael S.
reviews.description: I've never written a negative review before as I typically find them to be petty. I this case it's well warranted.  My bandmates and I played a SXSW show here on 3/16/19. When loading in, the entrance was unstaffed and we simply loaded our gear up the stairs. No problem.  Loading out was entirely different. As I'm coming down the stairs, clearly loading out with gear in hand, I witness a door person yelling at my bandmate "Get the f*** out! Get the f*** out!" and aggressively walking towards him. His tirade did not end there. Keep in mind, it's obvious that we're loading out as we're leaving the establish with guitars, amps and various other gear. And we're doing so directly in front of the door person. He knows very well who we are.  As I'm walking back in, the bar manager is coming down and I calmly tell him that the door person is being needlessly aggressive. Instead of attempting to de-escalate the situation, he begins arguing with us, claiming that we hadn't been ID'd. First, they weren't ID'ing at 4:30 when we arrived. Second, even if you believe him, there's no excuse to respond by yelling, screaming, cursing and intimidation.  What he failed to realize is that under no circumstance is it necessary or appropriate to react in that way. Period.   This place, at least on this occasion, is staffed and managed by people that can only be described as unprofessional and unhinged, and in absence of even the smallest amount of self discipline, potentially dangerous.  There are better places to see shows. There are better places to get a drink. There are better humans at virtually any other establishment.  Don't waste your money here.

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: No one will write home about Shiner's Saloon's food, but they may about their rooftop. It's downtown Austin with a great view of the city. When the weather is nice, it's the perfect spot to kick back and be urban cool. They also have a large beer list that includes a few hard ciders too. However, if you want food, go to another top rated a BBQ spot and then head here for the rooftop.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Flew into Austin on a Wednesday and got a tip that there's a bar that does Whiskey Wednesdays... it turns out it was Shiner's Saloon! The good: a friendly enough bartender that served us $1 whiskey and soda's. I mean come on, that's a great deal. But I was left really disappointed with the brisket nachos. This is a BBQ town right, so where was the brisket? I could barely find it in my plate of chips and cheese. It was good enough for bar food, but I really expected better. Then again, they did have free live music. This place is smack dab inbetween a 3* and 4* review, but the subpar nachos sways me today to give them a 3*.

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: Disappointed with the Steelers bar.  Plenty of fans but kinda dead.     I understand not having items on the menu on a Sunday afternoon.  They were out of sliders and pepperoni rolls. The tacos were OK but not great.  Beer selection was good.   We came for the atmosphere and were underwhelmed.   Win or lose a Steelers bar should be rocking.   Cheers for the turnovers, but no encouragement or even yelling at the TVs.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: | Food |  Excellent!  I had the rainbow trout with brussels sprouts and that is some of the best trout I've had in a long while!  It was perfectly done.
