The brussels spouts were tasty too.  My friend had the pastrami sandwich and she kept raving about it; the pastrami was high quality.    | Cocktails |  Again, a big win.  They were doing a bartender drink contest with several whiskey cocktails and I went for the Peach Tree.  Although petite it packs in taste and was not light on the whiskey!  | Atmosphere |  The patio is typical strip mall-ish.  It's nice that it is dog friendly.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Service here was good and loved the bar area. Brunch cocktail selection was above average. The Vietnamese espresso drink and Bloody Mary were great.   Food is what knocks this down a bit. I got the biscuits and gravy which was wayyyy to much biscuit for the amount of gravy given. Getting the chicken added is a must.   The carnitas poutine was super salty. I get that both things are meant to be like that, but this was just too much. I wish there was more pickled onions and jalapeños to balance it out.   The happy hour menu and times looked pretty good, so I'd definitely return to try that out.

reviews.author: Aaron G.
reviews.description: First, this place is perfectly nice and probably worth going to again if I am back in the area but would easily be convinced to try something else.  My evening began with the Ancho Margarita.   Unlike some places this chili inspired drink isn't like drinking hot pepper juice and is delicious.    The fried cheese curds with ranch dressing were tasty but nothing particularly gourmet as a novice home cook could prepare this with the same results.     The disappointment came with the main meal.  The French fries were cold.   From our vantage point we could watch the kitchen workers.  They kept a big bowl of French fries that the kitchen leader would use to place portions on out going plates.   They rarely sitting it under a heat lamp, so they were cold and unmemorable.   This is probably the easiest and cheapest thing on the menu to prepare well.  The rest of the meal was perfectly ok, but noting that stuck out as particularly special.    The ambiance is nice, but extremely loud when there's a full house so you have to raise your voice to be heard across the table.

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Wife and I decided to try this place out for late afternoon brunch on the patio. We had the Bacon Beignets, Reuben, and Pimento Burger. We had a little difficulty finding good selections on the menu. Citrus pancakes sounded good, but they were out of them. The Bacon Beignets were the highlight, warm, freshly made and tasty. Reuben was good, with nicely salted corned beef and delicious German slaw. Pimento burger was too rich for my taste. Service was good. Overall experience was good. Would be 5 stars, but menu was not great for us. If you find things you like on the menu, then you should try it out.

reviews.author: Keilon L.
reviews.description: The meal was much more attractive than it was delicious. Everything was fresh but lacked flair in the flavor department. This is the kind of place I would come to for dinner but I wouldn't bring anyone here to impress them or to treat them. I only say that because the impression of this place I got from the ambiance and the menu was that I would be in for a stellar meal. I ordered the Brie Burger believing the brie and the flavor profile would offer pizzaz but I was not razzle dazzled. It was just the feel of eating a better than average burger.  The carnitas poutine got me a little eager to taste more flavors as I had that to start.  It could have rivaled a couple of poutine offerings that I've had in Montréal aka the poutine capital of the world (sorry Quebec City).  I am happy that all the greens were fresh to round out the meals well.  I felt like portions and servings were well balanced.  If I lived in the area, I'd dine here again.

reviews.author: William Z.
reviews.description: Stopped by last night wi5h friends. After putting in our name we sat in the bar and ordered beers while waiting for a table. We were in no hurry so we had another beer and looked over the menu.  It was obvious that Oast was short staffed and everyone was doing double duty. Thank the pandemic!  Nevertheless, tHe staff was very friendly and the service was adequate.  However our burgers were not very hot and my pretzel bun was stale. The fries were very good. In better times, this will probably be a very nice dinner option.

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Went to brunch here with some friends. This was a great atmosphere for brunch. I have been for Dinner which is lovely as well. However, it's laid back, chill atmosphere, and modern feel makes it a great spot for almost any occasion.  The food was pretty good. I did get something i could make at home. However everything was cooked nicely apart from the bacon. It was a little bit too charred for my taste. Potatoes were tasty, eggs standard, and the rye bread tasted more like a sour dough. But still good.   Mimosas were a good deal as well!   Overall we had a great time and most likely will return again!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: Can't believe it's been a while since someone gave this place a review.   We came here because we found some good reviews on Yelp, but have to say I was a bit apprehensive about how long it's been since the last review posted for this place.   This restaurant seems to be a family go to place where people just eat and never care to leave a review.   This place a gem! We came in for an early dinner and were surprised by how good their food and drinks are.   I wasn't really found of the butternut squash soup but we were in the mood for trying so we did it.   I do recommend this place for anyone.  Specially if you are looking for food away from Downtown like us.   Enjoy!

reviews.author: Flora T.
reviews.description: A hidden gem! Great food, interesting drinks and friendly and attentive staff. We loved everything we ordered. Food is fresh and tasty. Good atmosphere for either friends' hangout or romantic outing. We had a great time there and will definitely recommend it! We arrived after 9 and could take advantage of their reverse happy hour. We were surprised how small our check was!

reviews.author: Ru L.
reviews.description: Gastropub is what this place is, a place for food beer and good food! The pimento deviled eggs.. oh my were they great and served on a slab of rock, too. I had the beer braised pork and spatzle with a side of coffee rubbed carrots. The food was really good and service was friendly.

reviews.author: Carrie T.
reviews.description: Came here for brunch after church on Sunday. I must shout out Henry because his service was awesome. He was personable, friendly and efficient. His service gets 5 stars (and we made sure his tip showed it). We started with the bacon beignets which were not really like beignets. They were crispy on the outside and more like cake donuts on the inside. Only got like two pieces of bacon in the whole serving.  The food came to the table very room temperature. My father had to send his biscuits and gravy back to reheat (no one wants congealed gravy). My mom and I got the boring breakfast plate. I asked for my eggs over medium and they definitely came fried hard. Also the house cured bacon was bland and extremely dry. My Aunt's chicken cacciatore pasta tasted good and we liked the strawberry pancake we ordered for the table a lot.  Overall, service was the highlight but the brunch options are not worth a second visit.

reviews.author: Nathan F.
reviews.description: Have been to oasthouse before, but not for brunch and there was something for everyone. The service was really good (and timely/efficient) and we enjoyed the covered seating outside. They had a great beer/cocktail/wine selection and had several drafts i had never seen before. The chicken and waffles were really strong, and the chicken was almost like hot chicken which was a pleasant surprise and carried the dish but no complaints there. The carnitas poutine and the Cubano were certainly enjoyed as well

reviews.author: Allison P.
reviews.description: Oasthouse has been my periodic GrubHub treat when my standbys on another delivery service aren't available for several months. What more does one need in life when brie pimento burgers and coffee rubbed carrots with green peppercorn ranch are on the menu? I don't even mind that my average order for one meal is at least 35-40.00 with delivery. Sometimes it's just worth it for something so yummy.   I was excited tonight to share an Oasthouse experience with my daughter and was pretty disappointed at both a mediocre meal and pettiness on my bill. Even though I was happy to spend the 45.00 plus 20.00 delivery charges and tip to reward ourselves after a strenuous and stressful day of work, I felt shortchanged pretty quick when I couldn't even see the pimento on my burger, got an overly dry bun and was charged 2.00 after the fact for some perceived "extra" change to my order.   Whether this was an upcharge because they were out of mashed potatoes (usually substituted for fries since I'm gluten free) and gave me the more expensive brussels sprouts. Or maybe they changed me for the extra pimento I always ask for (#swoon) but didn't get. Since they didn't say what it was for I'm left wondering.   All in all, my highly anticipated Oasthouse indulgence fell kind of flat on a day when I really needed it. I guess nobody's perfect.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: My girlfriends and I met up here for brunch. They have quite a few patios to choose from, a nice inside section, and a full bar. Cool atmosphere and decent prices for food and drinks. We ordered 2 carafes of mimosas for only $8 each, which I thought was a great deal. They bring out your champagne and orange juice in separate carafes so you can measure out how much you personally want of each, which I appreciated.   I was not blown away by the food, but everything we ordered was still solid. Two of us ordered the all day breakfast plate that came with eggs, uncured bacon, a slice of toast, and breakfast potatoes. Everything was good, simply nothing stood out. The other two people in our party enjoyed their eggs Benedict and strawberries field salad. Good service and she stayed attentive the whole time we were there catching up. Overall, good experience.

reviews.author: Kayla B.
reviews.description: We've eaten here twice for dinner and really enjoyed our meals both times! We also had the same waiter, Henry B., and he was excellent! He was able to give great suggestions for food and drinks. We've had the fried mushrooms (featured) and the Reuben egg rolls for appetizers which were both amazing! For entrees we've had the chicken schnitzel, cheesy meatball sub (featured), and the strawberry fields salad which were really tasty. My personal favorite is the chicken schnitzel. Other reviews mention the drinks being so-so but every drink I've gotten has been quality with the alcohol. The hotter melon was recommended by Henry and was very refreshing. We plan to be back and would recommend!

reviews.author: Juan G.
reviews.description: First time here and to start we were welcomed with amazing staff members.   Our waitress Kayla really made the ordering experience truly as smooth and delightful as possible!!   The food definitely brought a smile to my face with the Bacon beignets, pancakes, salad and poutine as our entrees.   Can't wait to be back next time in Austin!

reviews.author: Adriana O.
reviews.description: First timer here and everything was great! The bacon beignets are perfect... nice flavor and crispy outside crunch. The mimosa carafes are great to share with friends! I love that the juice and alcohol are separate so you can adjust to your liking. I had the strawberry greens salad with chicken and it was refreshing and delicious.  I would recommend for a chill brunch spot on a Saturday! Not too crowded at all and we were seated right away at 11:30. Our server Kayla was great! Service was prompt and they easily made us a mocktail for our non-drinking guest! Will be back next time I come to Austin. :)

reviews.author: Helisse F.
reviews.description: We love Oasthouse! The food is always excellent and we have tried many items on the menu. Henry B was our server and did a fantastic Job. Come eat here and you will NOT be disappointed, in fact, you will want to make this your night out restaurant.

reviews.author: Joyce B.
reviews.description: This is my favorite place near my house in Four Points. The food is always very good and made to order with great ingredients. The service is always excellent, even when they are packed.   Today our server Kayla was engaging and took great care of us.  I'll be back.

reviews.author: Jeanne G.
reviews.description: My husband and I were, once again, delighted with the delicious food and competent service via Megan at a the Oasthouse Kitchen.  I ordered the Truffled Prosciutto Bruschetta, consisting of creamy truffled ricotta, argula, mission figs and local honey topped by a generous dollop of prosciutto.  It was a dreamy combo of textures and flavors.  On the side I had the seasonal tomato soup, thick and creamy.  My husband was briefly disappointed when Megan reported that the ribs were sold out.  However, she recommended the Wagu steak and frites.  The steak arrived warm and beautifully sliced with a giant side of shoestring fries, delicate and just fried to perfection.  We topped off the meal by splitting a peach crumble adorned with vanilla bean ice cream - a desert to die for.

name: The Grackle
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jen P.
reviews.description: 7 years later, I stand by my previous assessment.  Tim dealt with my shenanigans as the pro that he is and set the tone for a great night.  I also really appreciated the opportunity to try a few of the new sours on tap - thank you!!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: Hmmm.. okay here is my truth. I came here with my husband and another Yelper. We were told the place shuts down at 10 pm so we had a few hours that we can stay here. I guess the 'Rona comes out at 10:01?  We found a table and ordered a counter near the front. When our drinks were brought out, we were instructed to take them off the tray ourselves. There was a slight confusion over two drinks (which one was which) and I watched the server shuffle both drinks around.  Even though we were supposed to be the ones touching them? Got it.   I did like the large selection of drinks and there was a food truck on the property. I didn't try anything so can't comment on the food.   Overall, I would come back maybe when the 'Rona is done. Some of the staff on site were not the friendliest. Also, be careful if you have to use the restroom, only 1 person is allowed in at a time. I was glad I didn't have an IBS flare up while there because that could have equaled a danger zone.

reviews.author: Annie W.
reviews.description: All the 3-star, 2-star and 1-star reviews made me want to go there! Even more. I mean, I've been before, but like go tonight! Again! Forever!   To Each His Own.  Some of us like to sit at a bar, NOT make small talk with the owner, get served up professionally and just chill. The outdoor patio is great for my smoking friends and it's covered against rain and the hot ass Texas sun. Pool is cool, bathrooms are decent.   What else do you want?  Also, I heard they have a rotation of pretty sick DJs that come through. I plan on going this week!

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: Don't skip the reviews on this one. Not going to beat a dead horse.Other yelpers have said it best. The one and only  positive is they had an umbrella to keep us out of the rain. And if you are hunting for a dark depressing indoor hole to slit your wrists at while listening to your least favorite emo playlist...you've found your gem. Best of luck during the pandemic.

reviews.author: Erin L.
reviews.description: First off the owner was super rude the second I walked in. He had zero knowledge of the menu and ended up suggesting a drink that was awful. When I asked for a different drink and said I would pay the difference he yelled at me and called me petty. I have never been so offended by someone's attitude in my life. There are PLENTY of way better bars surrounding this one.

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: Poor service, poor experience. Trying to support small businesses during this time but stay away from this place at all costs.

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: Love the darts and vibe here, i will be a regular now that i moved in the area. the music is PERFECT for the atmosphere. i can legit play darts here all day and never get sick of this place. i tip my hat off to you grackle!!

reviews.author: Lester M.
reviews.description: Not happy to be in service industry  No coke  No Roy Rogers  Handlebar stache  Hot inside  Lots of foam

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Nothing particularly wrong with The Grackle, it's just not my kind of bar. Good food truck out front and a decent selection of whiskeys along with a pool table or two. But it was empty when we went in, and I think we were there on a weekend. It just seemed a tad on the depressing side. I'm sure I'll end up back here sooner or later and can give them a second chance to see if I can change my tune.

reviews.author: Tim O.
reviews.description: Great whiskey selection. Cheap drinks. Free darts. Three cork dartboards. Three cork dartboards. Three cork dartboards. Cricket boards and chalk. This establishment in Austin, Texas has cork dartboards and provides steel-tipped darts for you to throw at the dartboards.

reviews.author: Mary S.
reviews.description: DO NOT GO HERE. This place has the WORST customer service I've ever seen. Whoever is running this establishment needs to make some serious changes if they want to survive. There are far better options out there with much better service you are not special and that's why we are taking our business literally anywhere else. To the lady in the glasses, bad day or not, you need to learn to not let that interfere with how you're treating people. We take our hard earned money for you to serve us (we were very friendly to you so there's not reason for you to have treated us so terribly) fuck you lady.

reviews.author: Dru M.
reviews.description: This is a kitschy place. I agree with other yelper's though when it comes to friendliness of the bartender. Her personality matched the overall ambience - Dark.  We had one drink and left. In the scheme of dark, dank, and dirty bars, the Grackle is a contender. I'm thinking that public health in Austin doesn't inspect businesses that don't serve food. The Grackle isn't alone in the shithole bar, pub, concept. It wasn't the worst I've seen but it's close. We were expecting a dive bar vibe but this was not even fun.

reviews.author: Jacob O.
reviews.description: Another bar in Austin run by a rude and arrogant asshole.  I haven't had such bad service since GandS Lounge had that crazy dude bartending. I ordered 4 drinks for some coworkers. The jerkoff that owns the bar playing bartender was very rude and had no customer service. I didn't order the drinks as fast as he wanted so he was rude. He was understaffed and didn't have the intellect or maturity not to take it out on his customer.  There are many options in Austin with good customer service. Don't waste your time with a shitty beer selection and rude arrogant bar owner.  I from Austin and been here for 40 years. I don't need more shitty people ruining my town. Time for the Grackle bird and its owner to leave town.  I will never go to this bar again. Go to the many great bars on East 6th. Avoid this place like the plague.

reviews.author: Dan W.
reviews.description: It's a pity that the bartender tonight couldn't be bothered to be helpful or friendly.  Perhaps he was too busy?  There were two people seated at the bar including myself...  the patio had few guests... a couple were playing darts... Whats this?  A girl breezes in followed by her entourage.  "He knows what I want!" she boasts.  At last! The serving action will commence as the bartender shuffles off his brooding reverie and we'll ALL be deep in our cups!  Nay nay!  Only those who know this gentleman can immediately get drinks for themselves AND their friends.  Sure is nice to have friends in low places and you'd be hard pressed to find lower. So, I left.  Ignore me if you're busy but rudeness will not compel me to place my ducats in your buckets...  Good bye Grackle, I'm sure Austin will sweep you away soon enough, thrive or die, it's the Austin way.

reviews.author: Eugene A.
reviews.description: We came by for a birthday celebration for a couple of people. One of them had a bottle of booze in a gift bag. We had been there for about half an hour before someone came up and told us there was no outside booze allowed in the bar. We said, okay it's a gift, no one is drinking it, out car is miles away we took a Lyft. Within 30 seconds the conversation went from, we can't have outside alcohol in the bar, to, literally, "I don't give a fuck get the fuck out". That's literally how the bar guy spoke to us. After a 30 second conversation. I can't even believe that that's how they spoke to us within 30 seconds of saying that you can't have a bottle of booze that's a gift in a bag to get us to leave.  Of all the times I've been kicked out of a bar, that was the lamest, most stupid reason ever. If that guy is reading this, you're a fucking douchebag and a fucking idiot. To not even attempt to find a solution to the situation is absolutely pathetic. Put the bag behind the bar. We'll grab it on the way out.  Literally go somewhere else for drinks. The guys that run this place are fucking dicks. What a pathetic experience at a bar on a Friday night.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Second time here and just as good as I remember from last year. Good sized covered patio when you reach the bar. Pool table, darts and a table top pac man/galaga combo to play. Not a ton of seating inside but enough outside if it's not too hot. About 10ish beers on tap, typically a couple sours which I like! Worth going to.

reviews.author: Catherine M.
reviews.description: A real true grungy dive bars, no frills about. Some place to come shoot pool, smoke cigs, and drink unpretentious beers. I recommend sitting in the patio area unless you like smelling like second hand stale smoke. Also, kinda confused on why the bartender through glasses into the trash, causing them to shatter. OK place, would most likely come back for a cheap brew.

reviews.author: Tommy B.
reviews.description: I've spent several thousand dollars over the last few years at this establishment and have encouraged dozens of friends to come here because it's always been great. Our pups were lying down nonchalantly with their leashes sitting next to them, untied, and the bartender came to castigate us and rudely let us know they needed tied up while they had not moved at all. I won't be back. Gonna miss the darts.

reviews.author: Itsabout T.
reviews.description: Grackle, it declares dive-bar from the start.  Single bar, single pool table and only a few seats.  The bar is stocked and fully. But guess what?  The house bourbon is Buffalo Trace. Seriously it's on the rail at the rail price. Drink up!  I like the place and really enjoyed my visit but I had to leave to visit all of their neighbors.

reviews.author: Kristin S.
reviews.description: The beer is pretty cheap and there are food trucks around for food. I sat outside and unless you want to die from Inhaling massive amounts of second hand smoke don't sit there!!! It's DISGUSTING!!   They have trivia on Thursday at 8pm

name: Tony C's Pizza and Beer Garden

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: This place is a ton bigger than I expected! Picnic style seating on the inside and a great, comfortable bar area. There's TVs all around the restaurant, so you can catch all the football games! Beer selection covers something for everyone and they had frozen wine drinks that looked good. Half off beer pitchers on Thursday's and half off sangria on sundays.   I've never been one to rave about a salad, but omg the dressing on the Greek salad was out of this world. Even my man was in love and ended up hogging it from me.   I was there to kill time before a baseball, but will most definitely be back for pizza and game watching!

reviews.author: Jesse B.
reviews.description: We have been to Tony's C for several years now at the Cedar Park location so when they opened up this one , we were we excited because we only live about 6 minutes away .   Unfortunately our to go order was very disappointing. We order a LG Mama Mia and a $9.99 Caesar salad , when we got home " 6 mins drive " the pizza was cold , and the salad was wilted, looked old . It's a shame because we love this place so much . At almost $40 ? Definitely not worth it .

reviews.author: Elizabeth B.
reviews.description: The garlic rolls were burnt. I threw the Pizza away it was RAW!  Called manager for a refund she said I had to deal with Uber Eats.  It's was Tony's Pizza that burnt the rolls ( tasted like rubber) and served up raw Pizza.   Will never go back!!!

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: We have eaten here a few times and always an excellent dining experience at Tony C's Pizza and Beer Garden. Super friendly staff, fresh ingredients, and all public areas are spotlessly clean! This visit The Mr. ordered a small house side salad, which was was a very generous size. He ordered Build Your Own Pizza: pepperoni, salami, mushrooms, and red onions. I ordered the meat lasagna...large enough portion to feed two people. Love the marinara used in the lasagna. It was very light, fresh, and not sweet. (Some places add a lot of sugar to their pasta sauce not Tony C's). Not ordered this visit, but make sure you get the mozzarella sticks, made fresh in house, not Sysco Foods frozen. Photos of those beauties are in my previous review.

reviews.author: J C.
reviews.description: Their pizza is delicious! Be careful because the delivery fee is very high during the checkout.  That aside we love there food. One day we will dine in to see what else they got.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: We used Door Dash. I added a note to modify my order and they did it exactly the way I asked. Excellent customer service.   The pizza was very different than anything I've had in Austin. Excellent crust, quality toppings and definitely all fresh ingredients. The Carnivore was just spicy enough to make you want to keep going back for more and the Truffle was not your average fake truffle oil flavored pizza. The mild hints of blue cheese and fontina took this over the top!    Support local and eat their pizza - it's delicious!

reviews.author: Felicia L.
reviews.description: I really do enjoy this place and the atmosphere (solid jams happens and my little family loves to sing and dance to them).  I absolutely am in love with the truffle pizza and their pepperoni rolls! Why they have four stars...I hate on the app if you want ranch instead of red sauce it doesn't allow you to adjust and if I'm ordering a family size pepperoni roll dish (which is over 12 rolls) I get two or three small ranches, and any additional I have to pay for (.50 a piece). I wish they would fix the issue or relax on the ranch.

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: Loved popping in to this spot for a quick drink at the bar while we waited for out of town family to arrive. We're from Houston, but have been here to visit several times and...THEIR PIZZA IS BOMB!   Great family place-covers all bases and tastes. Friendly, fun atmosphere with 50's and 69's music playing often. Pizza is even good for takeout, which is quite popular, as well! They also offer salads and LASAGNA! (Marinara or Alfredo sauces) - see my photo of the menu for details!  TONS of seating - long tables for large groups. Nearby, newly-opened LaQuinta Hotel's guests , including sports teams, families, conference attendees, and other large parties, will love coming here, not just for the seating and atmosphere, BUT FOR THE PIZZA!!!  We visit Austin regularly, and always make it a point to visit-whether we dine in, or bring it back with us-that is, provided it makes it back...whole, lol.

reviews.author: Oscar R.
reviews.description: Absolutely phenomenal pizza!!! The wifey and I arrived 30 minutes after they opened, we were the second customers there. We ordered the chicken Parmesan pizza as recommended by our cashier and an order of garlic knots. It was a great recommendation.   The garlic knots came out first. They were so warm, soft and garlic buttery! They came with their house made marinara, which was sooo good! Those poor garlic knots were gone just as quick as they arrived.  When the pizza came out, it looked amazing but I was a little concerned the chicken Parmesan might be a bit dry because it kind of looked that way. Let me tell you, the pizza was spot on! The chicken was well seasoned and cooked, definitely not dry. The crust on the pizza was amazing!!! I'm craving it again as I write this review!  The atmosphere was also laid back. They had beautiful wood bench seating, which could accommodate a large party/gathering if the place is not to busy. Service was also excellent.  Honestly, the best pizza I've had in a while! I highly recommend this place if you're in the mood for delicious pizza!

reviews.author: Michelle W.
reviews.description: Delicious!!! We finally got a chance to try this place out. It definitely looks nice from the outside. Beer garden in Round Rock? Yes please! Ordering online and pick up is easy! I scheduled my pick up order in advance so I wouldn't forget.  Food was delicious. No complaints. Really enjoyed the sauce that came with the garlic knots and calamari. Gelato was satisfying. Looking forward to trying another pizza soon!

reviews.author: Braden W.
reviews.description: Service was A+ and the food was even better!!!!  We went here after all the Kalahari restaurants were booked, highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Brooke H.
reviews.description: Amazing pizza if you are nervous about trying new pizza don't. This place is amazing. perfect amount of sauce. Honestly everything was amazing about these pizzas! Going back every tuesday!! When you walk in you order before you sit down so be prepared for that if you have ordering anxiety but 10 out of 10 recommended!!!

reviews.author: Carol N.
reviews.description: My husband is a pizza snob. Seriously. The staff here recognizes us now. I would say that's a pretty good sign that we go here often.  Here's what I don't like about this place: cheap, thin napkins and stingy thin plates. Also, If you have unwrapped straws, please buy a dispenser for it. It's really not sanitary in the first place, but with COVID, can you purchase wrapped straws please? I do appreciate the conscious effort to recycle. Please ditch the cheap paper goods and maybe use reusable metal pizza pans for plates or something. Also, I don't think I ever see lids for the cups. Again, perhaps consider plastic reusable cups.  What we do like: mozzarella sticks, pizza rolls, THE PIZZA, did I mention the mozzarella sticks ;) I don't like them trying to upsell ranch, but I get it. Also like the availability of pizza boxes for leftover pizza and lids for sauces.  We'll be back. Don't worry about my 4 star rating and comments about the paper goods. If we lived closer, I wouldn't insist on dining in.

reviews.author: Metra J.
reviews.description: I'm not from TX but when I'm here I love to stop in here and get some great pizza and beer.  Pepperoni is my fav but I had to get the motz, basil and tomato on the margarita pizza.  Manager Shanna came by to check on us which was great, she is super sweet and took the time to have a conversation with my toddler as he told her how many rocks he found and how much he loves pizza.

reviews.author: Rhea S.
reviews.description: We were starving so the pizza isn't full and a picture of the fried ravioli is absent. My boyfriend and I had a great time at the the new local pizza joint. We shared the largest size pizza, split a fried ravioli app, and gelato. We also enjoyed a few drinks on HH.  We usually go to slapbox for local pizza, but dare I say it, this place has better pizza in my opinion! Not as greasy and it's closer to us. Their HH runs from 5-7. My boyfriend got 2 October fest beers and I had a glass of PG, a frozen bellini and a sangria, which were all $2-3 off depending on the drink. The frozen bellini was very good and I don't normally drink frozen drinks. I did not care for the sangria at all, though.   Everyone was very friendly. In regards to COVID, everything was very clean from what I saw.   Shoutout to the manager, Catalina! She was very genuine in her table checks and we both believe she's a great asset to their team in QC.

reviews.author: DeAnna H.
reviews.description: Yum yum yum! My family of four shared a 12" pepperoni pizza and it was sooo good! We also orders the garlic knots which were also fantastic but look more like cinnamon rolls than garlic knots. Then, we tried the vanilla, chocolate and strawberry gelato. The vanilla is more of a rich vanilla bean flavor so it's an acquired taste (my husband loved it, I didn't care for it)  my daughter loved the chocolate (said it was better than Baskin-Robbins) and I had the strawberry. The strawberry was so delicious. Sweet, soft and airy with the perfect amount of tart to it. The restaurant was industrial looking, open concept and very clean. All the staff were friendly and attentive. Wish we had one of these where we live!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Stopped for lunch here today. This has kind of a Pinthouse Pizza vibe (but more sterile/family oriented and less Austin-ie). Service was great, place was clean, and they seem to be taking COVID restrictions seriously.   The pizza was pretty good. Not as good as Slapbox/600 Degrees but just a notch below (on par with Pinthouse). Came out quick and was hot. Beer selection was pretty good - had a local brewery Oktoberfest.   All in all, worth returning and will try to nudge my kids into agreeing to go here instead of Hat Creek next door.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Made our way in last weekend to give this place a try. The restaurant was extremely clean and nicely decorated.   Food: we tried the toasted ravioli, garlic knots, Italian chopped salad and pizza. The food came out quickly and was very tasty. While the prices were not cheap, I do think you get a good value for what you pay for.   The only improvement we'd suggest is letting customers open a tab and be able to order both food and drinks on it. We were told they're already working on this though!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: What's the best food when you're lazy and it's cold outside? Takeout pizza! I placed the order Saturday morning for an afternoon pickup. I ordered the 12" carnivore pizza and it definitely satisfied my cravings. The carnivore has salami, pepperoni, sausage, meatballs, pizza sauce, mozzarella, and calabrian peppers. There were a lot of spices, which made it quite flavorful. If you like meat on meat on meat...this pizza is for you!   Service was great! I went inside, instead of using the curbside option, to pickup the pizza from their takeout counter. They greeted me right away and had my pizza ready on time. I appreciated their organization. The inside of the restaurant looks really cute with long family style tables, TVs, and a warm atmosphere. I look forward to dining in the restaurant next time.

reviews.author: Cindy B.
reviews.description: I'll take everything to-go ! I was here for there opening week . Then I got hooked and I visit once weekly. There's lasagna, salads and PIZZA! Also beer if your slightly into that.  Great place for takeout, not sure if they have delivery?  I usually order ahead and pick up curbside now during covid. However, still have gone inside for a sangria or two and wait on my order.

name: The Dig Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Drove by here today and thought I would check it out and I liked it! I ordered a Peacemaker Beer, an ale that tasted good. The next time I want to try the Blackberry beer. The name itself is appealing. Since it was close to dinner I figured I should order food instead of going home and cooking. I got the fish and chips. You can order the 2 piece or 4. I got the 2 piece with cut fries. It was cooked good. The fish was flaky and not oily. The pubs tarter sauce was good.. the fries were very good too..   The service was very good. There was a sign to sit yourself which I did and within 1 or 2 minutes my server stopped by to get me started. She showed me the ropes and got my beer and food quickly. I was really surprised at how fast my food came out. I can say it was just under 10 minutes but I was still surprised at the promptness. There was quite a few customers but the servers were on top of it. They talked to the customers as if they were family.   The place was clean and there was good parking. The beer menu had several types of craft and IPA beers. I'm  pretty sure I will return when I have time. My total cost including the food and beer was only $14, amazing! Thank you Dig Pub for being in Cedar Park and giving up another place to get a beer and some grub in a friendly way!

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: Evening in the suburbs and the dining options were dwindling. I was getting hungry and being out with my buddy meant that I'd have at least one more beer. My friend went through his mental list of places and came up with The Dig.   We arrived there and fortunately got there in time, it was a slow night and the kitchen was about to close so we quickly made our choices. I saw that they had Scotch Eggs and I'm a sucker for Scotch eggs, but unless you're a vegetarian/vegan what's not to like about an egg wrapped in sausage that's then deep fried?  I also ended up getting their Buffalo Chicken Sandwich because...actually why do you need a reason?  The egg was good, a little thin on the sausage side but the mustard dip added a little more savory. The sandwich had a good amount of spice but the sauce was pretty runny so it was messy but otherwise good.  They do have a lot of taps and I appreciate that they try to have a little bit of everything and focus on locals. I get that they have to strike a balance between locals who want a beer that's cold, yellow, fizzy and domestic and crazy whale chasing beer nerds that are into barrel aged, wild/lacto, hopheads but for my visit it was a little more on the tame side. I had a sour from Prairie and a local mead which was great and at the time, that was about it.

reviews.author: Krista L.
reviews.description: In their left side room with 2 booths, the first booth was propped up to look like it was stable, but it collapsed when I sat down ...  my butt literally hit the floor! And I've broken my tailbone twice while playing sports. My wife and I reported this to several staff and received shrugs!! We stayed long enough to finish our beers and while we were drinking, staff propped the booth bench back together. I disassembled it twice but they kept putting it back. This place is just begging for a customer to get hurt and get a lawsuit!  If someone does, then I'm willing to testify.   I've posted photos of the bench c

reviews.author: Will S.
reviews.description: The Dig is a great local place in Cedar Park to meet friends and try out some really tasty brews, or wine if you prefer.  Lots of good seating both inside and out for  those who want a more open environment. Their pub grub is excellent, Scotch eggs to die for and some really tasty cheese offerings as well as some standard fare. The whole staff is friendly, honestly, never had a grumpy server and I really like sitting on a couch...one of the seating options depending on where in the pub you are. Check this place out, you might find that you....DIG it too.

reviews.author: Rainey B.
reviews.description: So...for those who believe that The Dig is run by snotty brats, perhaps you should have some consideration for the amazing service industry folks who have gotten us through the last almost 2 years of Covid he!!. Erik, Sage, Miles, Kayla and the rest of the crew have been considerate and friendly throughout and the food quality has always been outstanding. The beer selection now is better than it has ever been (coming from an Austin beer snob who used to live on Rainey). Don't pass this place by if it is on your radar!

reviews.author: Chris R.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable staff about beer options. Friendly staff. Good food. Plenty of indoor and outdoor sitting.

reviews.author: Lucky N.
reviews.description: This place is interesting. The right side of the restaurant looks pretty nice and lively and the left side of the restaurant looks like they gave up or ran out of money on decorating and just put a few tables out. They also have an outdoor area but no shade so I didn't want to sit out there unprotected, otherwise, it would have been nice because I had my dog. It was a bit busy so unfortunately had to sit on the left side (maybe everyone else there agrees the right side is better and that's why they all preferred to sit there). It didn't look or feel particularly clean and I'm a clean freak so I didn't particularly enjoy sitting there.   The service was fine; the waitress was nice. The food was pretty decent, but nothing outstanding or memorable where I feel I have to come back again. It was fresh though and I appreciate that for comfort food, it wasn't soaked in oil. I think the ambiance had already turned me off so I didn't enjoy my food as much as I would have it was clean.   They are known for their beer but I don't drink beer so take my review with a grain of salt. Clearly I'm not a dive bar kind of girl (unless it's out for drinks and bar hopping) but plenty of people are fine/really like those types of places so if you do, you'll enjoy this place. I'm not knocking this place and I would come back if friends wanted to go but I like more of an ambiance when I go out to eat.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Ordered a two meals and drinks  They brought one meal out and forgot about the other..... asked twice.... they said they didn't want one to get cold. It was clear they forgot... wasn't till we went to leave the brought out the other...  asked for it to go, didn't even do that brought it out plated, we had to ask for a box.  what a joke. Honestly party of two how hard is it to make two meals.  Don't go here

reviews.author: Gregor M.
reviews.description: Wow.  Some rude, snotty young people working at this place.  I don't expect great service from a dumpy joint like this, but I do expect civility and respect.  I am sure it's not easy to find good help these days, and perhaps it's a particular challenge to find young people who display a modicum of tact and dignity these days.  Nevertheless, in that case the owner shouldn't depart and leave the bar to let it be run by insolent brats.  My friend agreed with me as we left that we would never set foot him The Dig Pub again.

reviews.author: Kelsea K.
reviews.description: Good selection of various beers! Lots of tap options. Grilled cheese might have well been on the kids menu, pretty flat and boring... but my 5 year old liked it!  The adults got the Thor's Hammer and BLTA with fries and the table shared scotch eggs and pickle chips for apps. Sandwiches were straightforward and tasty and the fries were thick but crispy outside and soft inside.   Scotch eggs were better than Renaissance festival... but could have more sausage.  Pickle chips were average bar food. Overall, good meal and fair prices!

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: What a great evening at the Dig Pub! We took our dog and enjoyed sitting outside in the casual picnic area. Ben and Ashley provided the best service we've had in quite a long time. The food was fresh and quite tasty. Many choices for beer on tap...wine and cider, too. We will be back soon!

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: Food - Acceptable Service - So-so Friendliness - Poor Chance of a return visit - Zero, mostly due to the unfriendliness of the waitress. Perhaps some training in the area of making your guests feel welcome in your establishment would help alleviate this problem.

reviews.author: Nicki T.
reviews.description: They now have Sunday brunch! It's fabulous and delicious with craft beer. Who doesn't love eggs Benedict? Wonderful. The new owner's getting serious with the menu! Love the beer selection as always. The outdoor area greatly enhances the Dig Pub experience. Can't wait for game nights and dinner club coming up next year!

reviews.author: Howdy B.
reviews.description: Nice place with relaxed environment. I'm not a beer drinker but I saw lots on tap. It's dog-friendly and the food is yummy. Alexander was super friendly and accommodating. We will be back!

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: Very good food. Wings on Tuesday, fish and chips on Friday. Erik does a REALLY GOOD job. Good beer selection too.

reviews.author: Jim O.
reviews.description: The place to go in Cedar Park for a brew. Wife and I went for our anniversary night out to grab a bite and a brew. We had a blast. Service was exceptional with four different staff asking if we were good or needed anything. They were prompt and courteous and just plain nice. Food was served quickly and was delicious. Wife had the patty melt and I had the monte cristo; both were exceptional. The poutine as an appetizer is also on the to do list. We will be back.

reviews.author: Brian M.
reviews.description: We have been craving some loaded fries so we did a search and found this place. Recently they started offering delivery so we decided to order loaded fries, fried pickles, and a few beverages. The order was done fast and delivery was fast as well. Delicious food for a decent price. Support your local restaurants!

reviews.author: Carson C.
reviews.description: You know, I just wanted to come here for a quick bite to eat and a beer after playing disc golf in the area. What I left with was the best, most attentive staff  I've experienced since COVID. The food was underwhelming but filling so, no complaints from me. But again, the staff! I'll come back for them!

reviews.author: Julia Elizabeth Brack C.
reviews.description: Been checking this place out online for months now and finally got an opportunity to go in person today. Wow. What a superior waste of time! It makes sense now why it was so empty when we went in.  You would think that as we're just coming out of a pandemic, pub and bar owners would be over the top happy to have people show up to eat and drink their food.  Well, not this owner! I'm still in shock how rude he was to me and in so little time of me being there! His bar waitress was super sweet and answering questions as it was our first time there. The plan was to order some grub, and craft beer and go sit outside on the picnic tables on this beautiful Sunday.  I was into my second question about one of the brunch items, when he rudely interjected himself into our conversation by trying to answer my question for the waitress where he clearly had not actually heard my question at all. I then corrected him by repeating what I actually asked. He then tried to defend his ignorance by stating something else about the food they serve that was a complete contradiction to half of the menu items. You should of heard the way this guy talked to me, there was absolutely no reason for it, completely unwarranted.  Plus he made himself look like a total idiot in front of everyone and it was so obvious. The more obvious thing was that he didn't want our business. When I say our, it was my husband, 2 yr. old and me. Maybe he felt threatened by our kid? He wasn't misbehaving or doing anything crazy. The nice waitress was chatting with him and everything was totally fine. And then out of no where the owner was just a total dick to me!! So of course we left, I mean who would stay!? But that's exactly what he wanted, for us to leave. With pleasure, Asshole!  I felt bad for the nice waitress, she seemed to be in shock also. Sure hope she finds somewhere else to work since I can bet she gets treated like garbage.  Funny thing is that I can't even comment on the food or beer which is all I was yes to try. This guy should do the world a favor, sell the place to someone who actually wants business and go take a class in The Important of People skills in the food and bev business. Mean people suck and they need to learn how to be nice or just grow the F up.

reviews.author: Jesse C.
reviews.description: First of all, not family friendly. Took my daughter here for a dinner with our dog ... sat outside, and ordered a couple of burgers, and after a long day I wanted a couple of cold, craft beers. Perhaps I shouldn't have expected a family friendly atmosphere, but I honestly didn't think I had to think it through too much. So, a group of men in their 30s-40s began arguing about a patron sneezing , dropping "f bombs". The patron went in to get the owner. I thought "ok cool, the owner will take care of this." Instead, of calming the situation, he comes out dropping "f bombs" of his own, bragging about how he's going to kick all their asses, and how big of a Texan he is. I asked if he could watch his language in front of my family, he ignored me. So, I took it as a way to teach my daughter that this is the definition of a bunch of men that are nothing but losers. I told her, this is not the way men that have any class should act in public. There were also plenty of other women around that didn't need to hear all of this male drama while they are trying to have an enjoyable evening with their families. The guy that actually started the whole thing apologized. Owner, Eric, you should be ashamed of yourself. Dude, have some awareness ... no one cares about how cool and tough you think you are while they are trying to have dinner and spend some time with their friends and family. The people next to me just got up and left, too. You were so caught up in your own ego, you didn't even notice. I spent $42 and still left your staff a 20% tip, mostly cuz I felt sorry they have to work for such a loser. Not sure what Texas you claim to have grown up in, but not the one my family has lived in for 6+ generations. We all make mistakes .. and I rarely leave reviews or waste any of my precious time on this kinda thing .. but this needed to be said.

name: Clive Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Tim D.
reviews.description: Clive bar is nice, but it's really a front for Bar Illegal, which is a private bar for bikers and vampires.   About midnight,  the queen of the damned will come out and dance with a python and if you are lucky she will allow you to drink mezcal off her.  Backroom access requires one must know the secret knock before the peephole opens and challenge  password ensues.  Dont even try without the invitation, but fortune favors the bold.  Should you go crossing the silvery brook, it's best to leap before you look.

reviews.author: Charlie T.
reviews.description: This bar is located on the popular Rainey Street. My visit here was to check out Bar Ilegal, a small mezcal based bar that is located in a small shed-like building in the back.  Both bars were popular as there were a good amount of people hanging out in the area. I ordered a Mexucan Mule and it was great. I liked the bite that it had in the drink. The bartender was super friendly and also suggested a couple of other bars that I should check out.

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.description: Fun place! Great live music and a lot of people played Corn Hole.  The place wasn't obnoxiously loud.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Been to Clive Bar several times, and is usually one of my first go-to's if I'm in the Rainey area. Their bar itself is not one of the biggest bars there is but the overall atmosphere seems to be a mix of chill and lively without being too much at times. Located just a stone's throw away is the elusive Bar Ilegal, which used to be a really subtle and unnoticed mezcal bar before Rainey became what it is today. Overall Clive Bar is a great place to warmup for a night out on Rainey, esp with Container Bar just across the street.

reviews.author: Wendy G.
reviews.description: Oh Rainey Street what can I say about you.......  To be honest, I was wandering down Rainey Street on a Saturday night, with certain bars with lines wrapping the block. Clive Bar though, seemed chill with no line and a decent amount of people where I could still have my own personal space.   Quickly got in and into the bar, bartenders were easily accessible which is a big bonus. 2 specialty cocktails for $20, I'm not complaining. Both drinks were made with love and a little heavy hand but you'll never hear me complain about it.   Another bonus, I was able to snag a table for our group and we were set for the evening. They had an awesome DJ playing 90s + 00s hip hop and RandB. Super dope bar with a cool outside space (Cornhole available) with a mezcal speakeasy as well.   For all the lines and drunk people, I'd come back here for a chill, lowkey night.

reviews.author: Kristen B.
reviews.description: Neat spot - good music, good drinks, lots of space and a speakeasy {Bar Ilegal) to boot! I only visited once while staying in Austin for a week but would definitely come back.

reviews.author: Maria W.
reviews.description: I have some mixed emotions about this place. I went at 2pm on a Sunday afternoon and had a great time drinking and watching the game on the patio with my friend. Well if I'm honest, she was watching the game, I was people watching!  The location is great. It's on a corner and has a good view of the street below. The rustic vibes and good music made for a nice time. The bartenders were all very kind and worked quickly. The drinks were made very very well. I had their signature Mule and my friend had a Strawberry Fizz. They were $10 each and I felt worth every penny. Now by 4:00 a younger rowdy crowd came in and the relaxed vibe changed. They stood in front of the tv and those of us watching the game quickly decided to leave. I am not taking away any stars for this because  I had a really good time and the bar itself cannot be held responsible for the how people act. Just go early

reviews.author: Thomas N.
reviews.description: The Clive Bar is a really fun place to meet with friends when venturing out on Rainey Street. Attentive wait staff, good drinks and music. Also don't miss checking out the Mezcal Bar in the back area. The bar tender knows her mezcal and can create some magic for you.

reviews.author: Muriel S.
reviews.description: Can we talk about the illegal mezcal house outside? Take a step into history into this little stable that is now used as a bar. The bartender told us all about how the building was used and he had a Hiiii he variety of mezcal and tequila. This was truly something out of a movie.

reviews.author: William T.
reviews.description: Came here a couple of times recently and definitely enjoyed myself.  First, the bar has both an inside and outside area - the outside area is reasonably large, so that's where we spent most of our time. One point I want to make is that the bartenders were really nice throughout our visits there. They were friendly, remembered my name, and just did a great job in general.  One fun thing about this bar is that they have cornhole outside. Of course, it's only one set of boards, and you'll have plenty of other people wanting to play, so you can pretty much play a few games max. But a few games of cornhole is better than no games at all! One small negative about the place is that they had some pretty subpar BBQ restaurant serving food there (on a Thursday). Granted, it's not like the bar itself is serving the food, but I would have preferred they allowed a better restaurant to take up real estate.  Overall, I definitely recommend people come here and have a drink. And if you don't like it, you can go to one of the other many bars on Rainey St. :)

reviews.author: Kevin W.
reviews.description: My review will focus on Bar Illegal. My friends and I were on the hunt to find speakeasies in Austin, and Bar Illegal is one of the easier ones to get to. It is visible from outside Clive Bar, but to get to Bar Illegal, you must walk through Clive Bar's outside area and into the small building that is roughly the size of a shed. The small structure seemed to be made of stones, and it had many cultural items representing Mexico that were spread around: religious paintings, prayer candles, skulls, and other decorations. There were only four other people not including the bartender and my group of three. I would approximate the 'comfortable limit' would be 10 people. The bartender was well educated on the topic mezcal! He got a sense of what we individually liked to drink, and he selected a different type of mezcal for each of us. I drank my mezcal as a shot since it's a little too strong for me, but the bartender suggested drinking it slowly. The prices of the mezcal were all under $10 for shot glass sized servings. The bartender was also awesome enough to suggest other speakeasies and tell us 'passwords' for one.

reviews.author: Stephanie Q.
reviews.description: Clive bar is a real chill bar. We sat outdoors and played cornhole. There are also lots of TV screens for you to watch your favorite sports teams!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Clive Bar holds a special place in my heart and is probably my favorite bar on Rainey Street.  When my husband and I started dating in 2011 it was where we would go often.  It was a different Rainey Street all together back then.  There were only like 3 bars in the area at the time.   Clive Bar used to have the frozen peach teas that were amazing!  I still think back to those and wish they still had them.  I usually ask every summer if they will bring them back - I really really wish they would.  All the bartenders here are amazing and super nice!  I love their drink menu and they have a nice selection of beer on tap as well.  They have some infused liquors too that change out every now and then.  Honestly if you don't know what you want just ask the bartenders what they recommend and tell them the flavors you like and they might be able to whip something up for you.    I also love the openness and atmosphere at Clive.  No matter the season it is always good.  They also have a Mezcal bar that is open on the weekends in the back.  If you have never experienced this I would highly recommend trying a flight to taste.    So if you are on Rainey Street - don't skip Clive Bar - it is a must stop for sure!

reviews.author: Adam F.
reviews.description: I'm a huge fan of mezcal, so when I heard a bar had a speakeasy-ish room in the back that specialized in it, clearly I had to pop in and check it out. I do feel like it would make more sense for it to be its own yelp page, as while it is owned jointly and running under the same liquor license, the purpose (tasting high quality mezcal) and menu (just a long list of mezcals) are totally different from the main bar. I didn't visit the main bar, just Bar Ilegal.   Anyway, unsurprisingly, it's tiny (could fit maybe a dozen people before it'd start to get uncomfortable), but when we were there, around 9 PM on a Saturday, it only had about 6 people in it - I suppose a bar for just tasting mezcal is pretty niche (they do have 4 mezcal cocktails as well, but they honestly didn't look like anything particularly spectacular). The bartender clearly knew his mezcal very well, and prices are actually surprisingly reasonable for a spirit-focused bar. I asked to try the smokiest reasonably-priced mezcal he had, and got one - Del Maguey's San Luis del Rio - that I absolutely loved, a half-pour for $6.50 (I also love that they do half-pours, for if your primary motivation is "sample new mezcals" rather than "get crunk"). Based on previous experience with places like this, I assumed it was a truly ludicrous markup and that I had just found my new favorite affordable mezcal, but nope! It's a 70 dollar mezcal. So, happy that I got to try a 70 dollar mezcal (it was delicious), but also a little sad because now I'm still looking for my "can always keep a bottle at home" affordable type mezcal. Oh well.   But anyway, yeah, if you like mezcal, you have to check out Bar Ilegal. Really wish my favorite mezcal bar locally would do mezcal samplings like this one does.

reviews.author: Michele L.
reviews.description: My favorite bar from the whole area from 6th street to Congress to Rainey.  It's located on the corner with plenty of front and side outdoor seating. The interior is dark with leather studded bar stools and a few tables at the bar. The bartenders were friendly and attentive with good pours on our Maker's for $7 each and specialty bourbon drinks for $10 each.  They have an awesome Rock band that plays each Sunday afternoon. Really good set-list, front man, and rockin' guitar jams.

reviews.author: Brian S.
reviews.description: During our first night in Austin last week, we ate at Emmer and Rye and then walked up Rainey looking to get the full experience so we tried out a handful of places. Clive really stood out to me as having the full package.   The inside space is cozy and lodge-y. Coming from MKE, we felt right at home. The outside deck and patio space is huge. Plenty of room for everyone to spread out and still keep a game of Bag Toss going.   Later in the week, we were with a bunch of our KW coworkers and one of our party members thought it would be a good idea to try out Container Bar. Wrong. It was a like an undergrad frat house in there. SO loud, SO sweaty, SO many college kids. No offense if that's your thing. Clive Bar SAVED THE DAY.   Get the Matthew Pecan-aughey.

reviews.author: Jerdal W.
reviews.description: Got absolutely profiled and discriminated against whilst attempting to enter this establishment. Worst experience of my life. I'm sure this is not the norm here, but, one employee can tarnish a representation. This employee was named Matt. And, I am not someone Who post reviews but this was quite honestly the weirdest and most outrageous experience I've ever had attempting to enter an establishment.

reviews.author: Juan F.
reviews.description: This place is like a 2 in 1 bar. They have their regular bar once you enter with their beers and cocktails. You can sit inside or in their pretty large patio with tons of outdoor seating and corn hole. Inside they have darts. However, the gem here is their not so hidden mezcal bar in their patio which is amazing.

reviews.author: Sean Y.
reviews.description: Pretty sure this was the first bar I checked out on Rainey Street. Ordered the Old Fashioned here that day about a year ago and haven't looked back since. Literally just get that drink everywhere now these days, but they make it damn good here. The inside of the bar easily makes this the place you'd bring a date on Rainey, but there is plenty of outdoor seating as well. Pretty sure they have live music on the weekends in the patio area, but it's definitely crowded as hell during those days.  Went out for the first time ever on a Monday tonight and ended up here. Ordered a round of Old Fashioneds for us to start off as usual. The drinks were more generous than on the weekends since there weren't many people on Rainey. Tom was the bartender tonight and actually gave me a free Inside Job cocktail after I talked to him for a bit. The drink was pretty similar to an Old Fashioned, so it was right up my alley. He was definitely a nice guy. Will probably be on Rainey at least a few more times as the semester winds down, and I'll be sure to visit Clive during each of those occasions as always.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: I cannot speak highly enough of this bar! I went in for a couple of drinks and got to meet one of the bartenders named James, he made me a wicked sick drink called the inside job. This place is phenomenal and I recommend anyone and everyone who lives in Austin to go check it out.   Management is on POINT.      I also wanted to give a shout out to Richard. He does a kick ass job

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: We came during peak time on a Saturday evening. This means we are seeing them at their most challenged time. And I was a little "hangey" having to wait a half hour to be seated. But it was worth it. The waiter checked back with us every few minutes (mandatory for a good restaurant). And our order was delivered hot and fresh in a reasonable amount of time (a little slow because they were very busy - but in a reasonable amount of time).  We had chips and queso as an appetizer. The chips were the thick, homemade type. And the queso was their own recipe with ancho cili drizzle, crema, some sort of pico de gallo, etc. Really good - exceptional.  I had a chicken sandwich. It had a lot going on (in a good way). It was not just a run of the mill chicken sandwich. And the sidewinder fries are fresh and homemade.   My wife had the watermelon, which she also said was really good.  Overall, some creative foods that were well executed, and on point service  Definitely give this place a try.

reviews.author: Leena N.
reviews.description: I didn't love this place. I totally understand that with COVID, many restaurants have had to cut back their menus.   With that being said, it seemed like breakfast-y food definitely prevailed during our Sunday afternoon visit. Seeing that they do a Sunday brunch, I get it, but always pictured that included a few other options not focused around eggs or waffles.   My husband ended up ordering their burger (which isn't even obviously advertised as a burger), and said it wasn't anything to write home about. My mother-in-law had their chicken sandwich and seemed to be okay with it. Not much fanfare from my husband's stepfather or his girls.  I ended up ordering the chili and didn't have any major complaints. I would've loved to see more in the "siesta" part of the menu that wasn't a salad.   My other complaint was the noise. The music was so loud that we could barely hear each other across the table, which pretty much awkwardly split our party in half. At first, we tried to get past it by borderline yelling, but that got old.   In between waiting for condiments, I asked our waitress if there was any way to knock the volume down by a click or two. She mentioned that she would see what she could do, but that it wasn't guaranteed since "people pay for it". My brother in law ended up seeing the jukebox in the corner, and while that's fantastic, I don't think it's too much to ask to keep music at a reasonable level in a place where you'd expect your guests to socialize at their table.

reviews.author: Meagan H.
reviews.description: My family and I ate here on Friday. The food was good. I had the special which was a fish. My husband had a shrimp po boy. The kids had chicken strips and mac n cheese. The beers were good and cold. I love how they bring the beer in icy glasses.   We chose to sit outside but soon discovered the flies were way too many to be able to eat in peace. We couldn't stop waving our hands or the flies would land on the food. I'll go back, but sit inside next time.

reviews.author: Tara M.
reviews.description: The atmosphere here is great. Everything seemed good at the start. Then we went to order food. Out of steak. Out of salmon. Out of wings. Out of shrimp. Out of some Cabernets. They were out of everything we went to order. The server could not have been more kind and sweet. She said it was because they run out of a lot of things on Saturday nights so Sundays they're just out. Well, I did a quick review of the comments on this restaurant and this is apparently a running theme. 1. Shame on me for not checking the comments before we came, 2. Shame on them for not resolving this clearly on-going issue. I know times are tough, but just close on Sunday nights if you cannot have more product delivered. We finished our drinks and left without ordering dinner at all.

reviews.author: Kate R.
reviews.description: Great food, great service, great atmosphere, love this place! Been here many times and have never once been disappointed. Great outdoor and indoor seating. Love sitting at the bar!  One recommendation only: maybe put chive tv or something else on just one (of 7'ish) tv instead of just sports

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Sorry this is a little late but I wanted to give a review. I stopped by here a couple weeks ago for dinner. The place was full, but they squeezed me in at the bar. I asked for a menu and a beer. The bar tender let me sample one of the beers on tap. I liked it so I ordered one to drink. I also ordered a patty melt with tater tots. The burger was think and made to order. I had to cut the burger because I did not want a big mess from trying to get a bite into my mouth. The burger was juicy since I ordered it medium and very tasty. I can say it filled me up. The beer was cold, nothing better than a cold beer, well almost nothing.  The atmosphere was as most sports bars are, a little noisy but people seems to know each other and they were friendly. The bartenders were busy but kept getting those drinks. The servers were also busy taking food and refilling cups of the patrons. There is outdoor seating but it was one of those HOT Days so I was glad I was inside. The parking is decent but they share with several other businesses. It was not too far away from the entrance so no need to wear the sneakers unless you want to.  Thank you Republic Kitchen + Bar for being a good neighbor and giving us another option to dine in Leander, Texas.

reviews.author: Polina W.
reviews.description: It was easy to grab a spot indoors. I had the salmon dish- it was spicy and salty for my tastebuds. I must not have read the description very well.  The Kids corn dog was tasty. The chicken steak dish was devoured, as was the watermelon salad.  All in all it was a good afternoon lunch.

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: Decided to try a new place tonight, and glad we did! I had the patty melt, it was good. The only complaint I have about it is that they put the bread on the grill to get grill marks, but all I tasted was burnt toast. They do the top if the burger bun the same but it's not as grill marked. So next time I will ask for them not to do that, I hate black charred burnt toast. My husbands burger was good as well and both the tots and fries were tasty and perfect portion. They have a big bar with a good variety. I had a Hell or High Water to drink, and will definitely order that again. Delish! And last but def not least the service was great! Our server Kelsey was attentive and very sweet. Definitely looking forward to the next visit...word is they have a good weekend brunch, so we'll be checking that out.

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: The chicken fried steak needs seasoning. It was missing some salt and the sauce over it was so much it took off the breading. But the mash and veggies had great flavor and tasted good!  Texas Smash is good if you like a honey whiskey, I don't.  But the old fashion was just how I like it!  Overall good place to try, the service was good. They have tvs on but I'd recommend that they put subtitles on all of them so since we can't hear them we can at least read and know what is going on.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: Great food. Great drinks. What more do you need? I absolutely love the barnyard fowl chicken sandwich. It's seriously delicious. All of the drinks I've tried are solid and they have a great beer and wine selection. Republic is a great option for anyone in the Leander area looking for a nice, trendy restaurant without driving all the way in to Austin. They also have a solid kids menu. We'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Lora O.
reviews.description: First time here. Ethan, our server, was excellent. He did the best he could with working with so many items out of stock. I mean you're  out of Jack Daniels? And steak? And Salmon? Yikes! We had chicken fried steak and the chicken sandwich. Both very good! Pictured is a yummy dessert! A brownie on top of graham cracker crumbs topped with a toasted marshmallow. Along side comes vanilla ice cream drizzled with caramel and dark chocolate with a drizzle of raspberry coulis and fresh raspberries.  We will try you again.

reviews.author: Andrew S.
reviews.description: First time visiting. The drinks and location drew us in. The 3 okra dish ( it's Okra prepared 3 ways) was an instant hit. This was a quick first review and I want to come back for a meal. The Drinks are interesting and a good mix.  Pro tip - parking can get challenging in the evening. This strip mall has a lot of customers, early helps or enjoy the walk :-)

reviews.author: Elaziel R.
reviews.description: Hiding gem in the area, the food is surprisingly really good. They have very unique combinations for most of their meals like spicy ranch and the ambience is great. I will say the staff needs a little bit more guidance because they always look lost or confused about their duties. Beside that it's a great small bar with food options for everyone!

reviews.author: Carrie Q.
reviews.description: This was our first time here and we will definitely be back. The queso was delicious and unique, the entrees were very good, and the wine on tap was great! I had the special (shrimp linguine in a pesto sauce) and my husband had the chicken sandwich. Everything seemed scratch made, which we really appreciated!

reviews.author: T N.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time and was ecstatic about visit. Ordered a salad and asked for ranch. Said salad arrived drenched in something I thought was ranch. Tasted said salad and immediately my mouth was on fire. Asked waitress to verify if it was ranch and she says... "oh we don't have regular ranch, just a spicy one..." that would've been nice to know. I CANT EAT SPICY FOOD!! She proceeded to suggest I use another dressing to bring down the heat. Word of advice to owner... put the dressing on the side. I was sick all day from this incident.   Partner got French toast and it was amazing. Sadly we won't be back..

reviews.author: Donna C.
reviews.description: This was one of the worst experiences we've had in a restaurant in a long time.  The server was rude, the manager condescending (strangely, I don't remember him being so rude at Texican) and the place was dirty.  The table was sticky, and they knew it, even said there was nothing they could do about it because it was "resin"...it wasn't.  We ordered four entrees, and they came out in stages. The first ones to hit the table were cold.  The third followed five minutes later, and mine didn't show up for another five minutes, at which time I told them to just keep it.  The "hash" was runny and not at all hash, the scrambled eggs cold, bacon underdone, and no condiments available; when we asked for them, they acted like it was an imposition.    $92 worth of bad food and crap service.  Very disappointing considering the executive chef was wearing a Fox Hole chef's coat, and Fox Hole is one of my favorite places in this area; I assumed from the get it would be extraordinary after seeing that...I guess not.  Oh, and word of caution, when the server handed my fiancé the mobile payment device, she selected the 20% tip option.  Make sure you watch out for that...there is no signage indicating there is an automatic gratuity so the servers have NO business choosing their own tip amount.  Update: while we were out of town, we discovered my fiancé's debit card had been hacked.  Oddly, the odd charges started AFTER using the mobile payment device, which was WiFi powered.  I cannot stress this enough...BEWARE!

reviews.author: Lisa M.
reviews.description: I finally tried this place and so glad I did! Went with some girlfriends for some much needed quality girl time. This was the perfect place to sit back, chill and enjoy great food and company. I really like the ambience of this restaurant. It boasts a laid back feel with the dim lighting, yet has an open atmosphere. I ordered the Grilled Atlantic Salmon and everything was cooked to perfection. The salmon was cooked on the medium side to my liking and request to the server. We also ordered the James Bowie Nachos. Keep in mind these are not the typical Tex-Mex nachos, but they were still delicious and flavorful with a hint of robust BBQ flavor. There is an option to add chicken or steak and we opted for the chicken...great choice! If you love spicy (I sure do), they have a kick to them, as they are topped with freshly sliced jalapenos. Our server was excellent! She was so friendly, accommodating and checked on us frequently. She alone deserves a 5-star recognition! Try this place that offers locally-sourced, high quality food with its own, unique flavor.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The Republic Kitchen + Bar is a great place in Leander off Parmer/Ronald Reagan. It has been around for about a year and I'm mad that this was my first trip. I guess that means I'll have to make up for lost time. We got the Brussel Sprouts as an appetizer. There was a sweetness to it with the apples and honey and candied pecans. So good! For dinner, I got the Pan-Seared Chicken and had to say yes to that when I saw that the chicken was on top of risotto, my favorite. The chicken was a small piece but very flavorful. I got the tots and also some chili which was spicy! Thanks The Republic, great place. I gotta get one of your large cocktails next time too.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Oh mannnn I thought I took a picture of my drink! Darn it. Get the Pineapple Express! It was taco Tuesday, the shrimp taco was fabulous. They were out of fried salmon (odd bc they had the other way?) or I would have gotten that since you can basically get a shrimp taco anywhere. I'll definitely be back for taco Tuesday again. It was a little cold, I like my food room temperature so it was perfect for me, but I could see someone being disappointed in the temperature of the food. But I'm not knocking off any stars for that since that's how I like my food.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Came here for dinner on Tuesday night 6/15/21 with some family. I ordered the El Cesar Chavez salad with salmon and when they food came out the first bite I took I was fishing a bone out of my mouth from the salmon. So I started to inspect the rest of the fish and found 3 more bones. I informed our waitress and she kindly had it re made but when the second salmon came out I once again found 2 more fish bones inside.   At this point I did not receive an apology nor did a manager come by to check in to if everything was okay so I asked to speak to one and inform him. The gentlemen came over and apologized but really did not seem genuine about it after I explained how dangerous it was that I found a total of 6 fish bones that I could have choked on.
