He also attempted to blame the chef for not cleaning it right and saying "I always tell him to make sure all the bones are out."   Coming from the restaurant business myself and having my husband be on the corporate side of a big restaurant chain - I was very disappointed in how this place dealt with the issue.   Please check your seafood at this place - they clearly are not ordering boneless seafood or properly cleaning they're fish.

name: Main Streat Food Hall By H-E-B

reviews.author: Wes O.
reviews.description: Probably closer to 3 1/2, but I'm feeling semi-generous.  Think mall or airport food court, but with better quality and execution.  The hard part for our first visit was deciding which restaurant to try.  I ended up trying their Japanese restaurant and my dining companion tried the grilled cheese restaurant.  First and foremost, this is not a user friendly experience.  Every one of the restaurants is a self serve counter where you use a keypad to order.  The format of the keypad/menu isn't easy to follow.  More than one diner (besides me and my companion) needed to figure out how to order a drink.  (FYI, you order the drink from the keypad, then you get your cup when they call you up for your food.) Additionally, customizing an order can be a bit of a challenge. A lot of the online ordering platforms have customization options, but Main Streat has a space to enter your requests with the on-screen keyboard. Fortunately, the kitchen staff does a great job of reading and accommodating special requests.  I had the pork potstickers, which are some of the best in town.  They're crispy, but not deep fried and the sauce has a good flavor.  I also liked my noodles with the beef skewers.  The beef was high quality, but it would've benefitted from being flipped on the grill as one side had grill marks and the other side was just grey meat.  My dining companion had one of the grilled cheese sandwiches, which she described as good.  Once you figure out that you need to order the drinks at the same time you place your food order, you'll find the drinks in the limited seating area by the bar.  HEB has its own version of the Coca-Cola Freestyle machine which offers products from Coke, Pepsi, and Maine Root.  They also have sweet and unsweet tea as well as lemonade and strawberry lemonade.  The food is high quality and there are a lot of options available (surprisingly no burger or Italian options, though).   The awkwardness of ordering and very limited dine-in seating means that Main Streat will be someplace that I'd only stop by when in the area and probably during off hours.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped in for a small bite to eat and something to drink. There is a full bar but was a little surprised to learn that there is no cider on draft. Okay, what about cans? Nope, all out even after checking in the pack. FYI, this is attached to a grocery store. I can not have beer due to a barley allergy and I am gluten intolerant. I settled on a red wine blend which came from tap. We live in Austin, it would definitely benefit this place to add cider options.   The overall setup was great and enjoyed a drink and a small bite here with my husband. I can't wait until the weather is better and people move on from the 'rona so they can maybe have some live music or events where people can hang out.  They have a whiskey Thursdays that offers some discounts. If I was a whiskey fan I would probably check that out.

reviews.author: Romy G.
reviews.description: I'm going to start this by contradicting the haters who compare this to HMart and space that was otherwise not making money for HEB. When this store opened, this space was "cafe mueller," heb's first bar/restaurant, and I miss it! They had the best burger in town and really good brisket.  They had an outdoor play yard for kids. A lot of the outdoor seating area was sacrificed to add the Curbside buildout during COVID.   The food hall concept also opened during COVID, and conveniently has you order at a kiosk for each vendor. Very safe. All the seating is in the (very dark and cold) bar or outdoors, and there is less of it than there used to be. Also, I don't think any of the vendors have kids portions, and half the seating is bar height, so I'm no longer interested in bringing my kids here - total bummer, as we all loved cafe mueller. With the kiosks and separate bar, I am definitely not inclined to drag my kids here - I'd have to herd them through all the kiosks and the bar to get everyone's order in, and then pick everything up by vendor, and would be unable to have eyes on my kids at the table while doing so. You now need to go into the bar for drink refills, where I wouldn't sit with my kids because of the bar-height tables.   The pickup part is what makes the food court feel like an airport - everyone is just kind of waiting around. There are no lines, unlike cafe mueller, which always had a line, but the standing around makes it feel depressing.   The food is ok. I like some of the vendors more than others. My favorite is Calle Taqueria. It's a good place to pick up lunch to go midday, or for ordering from Favor.   The one advantage to Main Streat is that it tends to have no delivery fee on Favor, since it's at HEB. However, if you order from more than one place, you get more than one runner, since every vendor is a separate order. I suppose you can make one order at one vendor, and contact the runner to go to other vendors on the same run.   HEB, if you're reading this, I know you're collecting data. Windsor Park and Mueller has lots of families. Is there a way you could once again make this space friendly to families with small kids who want to get a bite to eat while doing the grocery shopping? And more of a community gathering space, with more seating? I used to meet up with a cyclist group here, and I don't think we could do that in the current configuration, nor will I visit with my kids for the reasons described above.

reviews.author: Samuel C.
reviews.description: Main Streat is the Food Court inside the Mueller HEB.  For a supermarket food court, it is not great.  The gold standard for supermarket food courts in Austin is Hmart.  They have a huge roomy pleasant space.  They have six-eight magnificent restaurants each of which would be in the top third of their category in Austin.  They are all Asian but different kinds of Asian.  Restaurants that fail at Hmart Food Court are typically still better than most of the other restaurants in Austin.  That tells you how good the successes are.  At Hmart, you can get really good drinks from two nearby vendors and the TV has fun things to watch.  At Mueller, Main Streat is jammed into a leftover hallway that was not earning any other kind of money for HEB.  The stands are small because there is no room.  The cramped hallway food court is an unpleasant place to be.   You are not drawn to it to fantasize about the wonderful dishes you could be ordering.  You are supposed to eat next door in the bar or in the patio beyond that.   The bar feels like a garage. It has high chairs so you do not sit too long. It is not a nice place to linger.   The patio is okay.  The selection of restaurants is not great.   My Asian food loving vegetarian wife found nothing to love in the one Asian stall.   HEB's barbecue is functional at best.   (The gold standard in supermarket barbecue is Whole Foods. Bowie BBQ is in the top third of the city.)   The Mexican stand is ho-hum.  So the duck-fat fried chicken place would have to be amazing to make Main Streat any kind of destination.  If you are at HEB Mueller anyway and you need lunch or a drink, you could make this work.  It is not a destination draw.

reviews.author: W C.
reviews.description: OK, whoever named this place "Main Streat" should be fired. Please, go word vomit on yourself and leave the rest of us out of it. Other than that, we had a mostly wonderful experience here on Saturday afternoon when we took our daughter here as a TREAT after she got her stitches out at Dell.  We're doing an overall review since we ordered from two places: Roots Chicken Shak (yet another idiotic spelling; why is grammar so uncool these days??) and Calle Taqueria.  We'll start with Roots: --Kale salad: tasty; did NOT appreciate so many breadcrumbs and definitely was appalled to see two whole anchovies on the top (that's a pretty baller move). --Fried chicken strips: Fine. The whole duck fat thing is a gimmick though because we have pretty discerning palates and you absolutely 100% cannot taste the difference. --Original fried chicken sandwich: Amazing, definitely one of the best ones we've ever had. Loved the sweet potato bun and the kale slaw.   Calle Taqueria: We're considering this place one of Austin's best-kept secrets right now because the food was some of the best that we've had in town, especially considering the price point. --Smoked brisket Quesadilla: incredible. Bursting with flavor, loved the cheesy underside. Sooooooo good. Superior in every way to the one that we've had in this style from Vaquero Taquero. --Al Pastor taco: see above word-for-word. DELISH. The only bummer here were the sides. We loved the street corn but the corn itself was limp and sad-looking. The refried beans were also...just weird. Something tasted pretty off in them.  As for the space, it's more like a little hallway than an actual food hall. It was clean and spacious and there's plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. A couple things that aren't intuitive are cups for water (you need to get them from the restaurant vendors) and that the loudspeaker doesn't extend to the outside for when your order is up (which is really dumb considering that's where most people will want to sit during Covid). BUT THEY HAVE NORMAL COMPOSTABLE STRAWS HALLELUJAH!!!!! Thank you!!! And all the silverware is individually wrapped as well. Those small touches did not go unnoticed or unappreciated. We will absolutely be back again.

reviews.author: Jena L.
reviews.description: First time visitor and I have to say the kids portion at the  Yumai Japanese grill was more than enough. I got the chicken fried rice and I could tell they used quality ingredients because the food was fresh and tasty. The rice wasn't heavily over soy sauced either. The pay/self ordering stations were a pretty cool touch, too. Would return to try the other restaurants and even the bar. Docked 1 star because it wasn't anything to rave about but very delicious. Especially before you have to grocery shop (never shop hungry)

reviews.author: Rain S.
reviews.description: I love HEB, but this food court and bar has really taken it to the next level. You get a choice of 5 vendors- bbq, Japanese, fried chicken, grilled cheese, and tacos. There also a bar where you can order drinks if you're in the mood. Another bonus- there are tables where you can dine in or sit outside, so you don't have to get it "to go". So far I've only had the bbq and the Japanese food, and they were both very good! I'm looking forward to my next trip back where I can give the others a try. Definitely check it out if you are in the area and want to get a quick bite to eat.

reviews.author: Abhra B.
reviews.description: First time visitor to the Main Streat, it is nice to have some solid meal options at this HEB now. I had the chopped BBQ sandwich and loaded baked potato, plenty of quantity with great taste. Robert was super helpful making sure we were taken care of. Looking forward to trying the Japanese and melted cheese spots on my next grocery stop.

reviews.author: Carter F.
reviews.description: Nice new setup. Instead of having the one "H-E-B Restaurant" now it's a actual food court with different vendors. I haven't tried all of them yet so can't speak for the food but I will update my review once I have. The BBQ is still HEB's bbq which is amazing!

reviews.author: Bobby H.
reviews.description: Best dive on Red River. Low key and clean. Exactly where you need to hang when you want to be able to hear your friends instead of screaming over loud music. True locals spot. Come for the comedy, stay because you're shit faced.

reviews.author: Colleen C.
reviews.description: I love this bar and hope more people come out to it. Beautiful space, good drinks and music of course. Really hope business picks up here because it's a great spot.

reviews.author: Michael T.
reviews.description: I've walked past this place so many times and never walked in.  Tonight I went in there for a comedy night on a quiet Monday and ALL KILLERS it was the funniest lineup I have ever seen in my life.   This place knows what I want, but who's to say if I'm right.. you'll neeed to decide yourself bro

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: This place is awesome and maybe a little too family friendly.   So 5 soul owns all the property that the brewery is also on. When we went there, they had 2 food trucks. One did pizza and salads and the other hamburgers and other food.   Inside of 5 souls is wicked cool.  We tried many of the red wine and they were alright.    The staff is super friendly and patient.  They also have non alcoholic  daiquiri  for the kids. Just a few flavors, but the kids enjoyed them. Of course they did they are just like smaller but more expensive Slushies.   The wine itself is pretty good and a tad on the pricey side IMO. $12/glass or $36 per bottle. But the atmosphere is so darn cool. It's probably one our favorite places to go to right now. Unfortunately or maybe fortunately they are an hour away.

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: 5 Soul is easily one of the coolest wine bars and tasting rooms I have ever been to. Co-located at the same address on Bob Wire Road as Frontyard Brewing, this facility is an impressive one. Their tasting room had lots of space - both indoors and out.   The indoor space was open and airy with tons of natural light from floor to ceiling windows and a modern interior. The service here is also a highlight as we noticed that everyone = the servers, bar managers and the owners were ALL making sure that everyone's experience was top notch. We found them to all be very friendly and personable - like those cool neighbors that you REALLY want to hang out with. One thing I liked is that this tasting room also had great energy to it - something that is missing from a LOT of tasting rooms and even some breweries.   Outside, the covered patio is large with plenty of seating for friends, families. The yard is extensive - an amazing space to bring your kiddos and just let them play and have fun.  This really is the kind of place that you wish was only 5 minutes (and not 45) from your house - so check them out.

name: Colleen's Kitchen
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Garage Parking, Street Parking, Validated Parking

reviews.author: Kristy W.
reviews.description: I've only ordered through Uber Eats and haven't visited the restaurant so this review is based on delivery only. Everything was packaged with meticulous care. Each item fit three packages and the packages for into the bag without taking over. Not too much packaging and not too little.  I ordered a Cobb Salad, which I thought would have egg crumbles but there were 3 hard boiled egg halves. That was a good surprise even though I ordered deviled eggs too. All shall be eaten in time. I asked to sub dressing and they did. Thank you.  Not many places makes collard greens and it's always different. I don't have a favorite but some address definitely better than others. These were not spicy, not vinegary, not salty (all reasons why I don't like some places' greens). They were maybe a touch sweet butt well-balanced. The biscuits were soft and not dry at all.  I wish you could tip the restaurant, especially BOH, fire such great food. Yeah, I just ordered a salad as the main but everything was MADE by hand, not just prepped. The biscuits, salad dressing, deviled eggs, greens, tomato jam.   Thanks to the staff here! Your food is great!

reviews.author: Mira D.
reviews.description: We ate here for New Years Eve and I was blown away! I saw that it has good reviewes but I am vegetarian so I wasn't sure if it would actually be good for vegetarians. It is. There were vegetarian options on the menu which was nice. We got the fried green tomatoes for an appetizer, I had the roasted butternut squash as an entree and we shared the hummingbird cake for desert. All three items were exceptionally good. My husband had the pork rib and he liked his dish too.   I was really surprised at how much I liked the butternut squash. When I saw it as the only vegetarian option I assumed it would be mediocre. It was actually SO GOOD. The goat cheese melted perfectly with the grits and the semi-sweet butternut squash worked well with the rest of the dish being savory. I also really liked the crunchy pecans and the buttercream icing for the hummingbird cake. It was delicious! I would go here again.... the only problem is they only have ONE vegetarian entree! Also, if you are vegan I would not suggest this place because I did not really see many vegan options on the menu.    If the chef or owner sees this review I have one suggestion for them. They should add chicken fried oyster mushrooms to their menu! It would be so perfect for the southern style theme of the restaurant and it would be a great vegan option for anyone that has a strict vegan diet. Iv had chicken fried oyster mushrooms at honeymoon spirit lounge and it was SO good and I think a spin off of that dish would work well here too.

reviews.author: Keith V.
reviews.description: About two weeks ago, I posted a negative review of Colleen's that was unwarranted. At the time, I had COVID, and was both mentally and emotionally worn out by it. (That review has since been retracted.)  Here's a more honest review of Colleen's: the food is excellent; the staff, from top to bottom, is extremely friendly; and the atmosphere is very welcoming.   If you happened to have read my previous review, please ignore it.

reviews.author: Justyn D.
reviews.description: This place was PHENOMENAL!  We like to try new restaurants when we dine out and this establishment was everything we could've hoped for and more! Atmosphere was  perfect, store decor was beautiful, service above reproach and management's involvement with tables was spot on.  Super impressed with food quality, flavor profile and presentation! I will definitely be back to this Diamond tucked away in the rough! Well done to all of you especially the owners Ashley and company! You guys have out done yourself !! Thank you for a delectable Saturday brunch with my fiancé!!

reviews.author: Valerie J.
reviews.description: Really wanted to love this place but Was a bit disappointed.   Service 10/10- We came here on a Sunday around 1:30p and got seated right away. Service was good. No complaints there. The decoration does give me cute southern vibes.   Food- 7/10- my waffles were so hard. It seems as if they had been sitting out for a while and got hard and they were just warm. I didn't finish the waffles because the were that hard. The chicken was way over seasoned and dry. My bf ordered a bagel and said it was ok not the best but ok.   Restrooms are gender neutral- not an issues.  If you come during 11a-2p on Sunday they charge you automatically 20% service charge on your bill. Considering if you are coming with a big group it could get pricey including 20% gratuity.

reviews.author: Andoni S.
reviews.description: I found the food and service at Colleen's to be as pleasant as the ambience and indoor setting. They have multiple hot sauce options (one of which, as someone who loves spice, was actually spicy!), and it complemented the potato hash well. Their take on deviled eggs was an interesting one, and though I only sampled a few of their menu items, the ones that I did were of high quality.  I did find it slightly undesirable, however, that an automatic tip of 20% was priced into the bill, and a separate line for tip was present for the customer to tip onto the amount that already had tip included. Had I not been paying attention, I might have tipped twice. I personally had a good experience with the service, however considering the volume of reviewers that have mentioned the service, I find it an interesting option to strip the customer of the option to tip how they see fit.

reviews.author: Winfred S.
reviews.description: I will give this place 4 star rating based on the quality of the food.  But, we waited almost an hour for our food.  We were visiting the local children's museum and decided to come here for lunch.  We came at 2 pm on a Sunday so it was packed.    After a 30 minute wait,  we ordered our food at 2:30.     It seemed like the might there might have been a shift change and we got lost in the hustle.   Our waiter and the manager seemed to avoid eye contact.    When we finally talked to our waiter, he apologized.    When got our good at 3:30,  the food was tasty.   We ordered the deviled eggs which were tasty and one of my favorite items in the menu.   The biscuits were warm and flaky.     We were eating relatively healthy which I don't recommend at this home cooking restaurant.  The Caesar Salad with Grilled Chicken and Cobb Salad with Grilled Chicken was also tasty.   The Colleen's Brunch Burger was not too large but overflowed with great flavors.  The Four Cheese Mac and Salad was one of the best I have had.   I even snuck in some Fried Chicken from my son's Chicken Nuggets and they were delicious.    They were kind enough to take off 2 appetizers from our bill.  But like previous reviewers, I was cut off guard with the added on 20% service tip.  I was a little surprised with the service that we got.  The waiter did tell us about the "livable wage" and I felt that he repeated to other customers in the past.  I do support the restaurant industry during the COVID 19 crisis.   I do understand the cost of food and labor has gone up.  I  was also planning on leaving a 20% tip.   However, I think customers may balk at the required tip.   That being said, this is common practice in places like Miami were people don't tip.  I would return when they are not as busy because the food was tasty.  Don't be caught off hard with the required service tip.

reviews.author: Wayne N.
reviews.description: Southern cooking with an expert hand, Colleen's kitchen has been somewhere I've been wanting to try for a really long time, but somehow never made it over until end of the year team lunch. And ya, it's not the world's lightest lunch, but it will definitely bring a lot of joy to you and leave your belly nice and warm and [a little too] full :).  Don't sleep on the starters. The bacon wrapped dates are flavor grenades of salty, pork, fatty, crispy, sweet flavor. They play very well together and other than wishing there were more dates per order, it's very good. The fried green tomatoes are also excellent with some comeback sauce with a kick.  Entree wise, I got my southern standard fried chicken. It's got excellent crunch and is deboned, so double win right there but it's also very well flavored, with hints of cayenne undergirding the bird. The potatoes are rich and just chunky enough and pair amazingly with the gravy. Collard greens have just enough bitterness to cut through the rich heft. The shrimp and grits looked really good too and my coworkers who did get it all raved about it.  All in all, thoroughly impressed and a great place for a meal if you're in the Mueller area.

reviews.author: Mara M.
reviews.description: This is in my top five fried chicken joints in Austin--and might even be my top. Hear me out.  They have a boneless fried chicken breast, friends. Not chicken tenders, but an actual adult person sized piece of fried chicken. It is sooo hard to find this in ATX, I've tried. They also have a thigh, for those of you like my mom who prefer dark meat. And they are both super tasty!  I wouldn't say I tried it and was like "this is the best fried chicken I've ever had", but I've been here twice, and both times it was solid. Also, the biscuits are among the best I've had. Again, nothing fancy about them, just a good, soft biscuit. I'm not crazy about the mac and cheese, but I am vrrrry picky about mac. If you like it creamy you might enjoy this (I prefer it casseroley.)  Our server was great. I was prepared for the mandatory 20% gratuity, and it didn't bother me none.

reviews.author: Sabrina B.
reviews.description: Everything here is a BANGER! Great food. Great location. Great vibes. Able to get a relatively last minute reservation in.  Came here for a Sunday brunch and it's now my favorite brunch spot in Austin. I am thrilled I settled on the fried chicken and fried green tomato. They both came in a sort of biscuit slider fashion and were absolutely amazing. Didn't expect them to be so good, even on the second day. I appreciated the pickles to be a sweeter cornichon. The best side is the Mac and cheese. This is a true southern side dish styled Mac. Went great with the fried chicken. They have a section of brunch drinks as well, and the cocktails I tried felt like a sweeter aperitif, perfect for brunch. If you're having trouble picking something off the menu, I would recommend just copy into my order!  Our waiter was a bit slow, but it was a busy Sunday morning, so no worries there! Overall, 5/5 would recommend to anyone local or visiting!

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: The food was ok. The wait was long probably related to a small number of wait staff available. Which was fine as I got to walk around the area to check out other restaurants.   We had the cornbread, fried green tomatoes, buttermilk fried chicken and shrimp and grits. I enjoyed the cornbread but the others were ok. I felt like there was something missing when I was eating and so sorry, I had to ask for hot sauce. The food was a little bland in my opinion.    Place is cute and staff was nice, food is ok.

reviews.author: Michael E.
reviews.description: A great spot to grab brunch in Mueller. We had both the chicken and waffles as well as the shrimp and grits and both were very well done. The ambiance is really nice and feels very comfortable when you are in there. The staff is very accommodating and friendly   really nice brunch spot in the Mueller area

reviews.author: Shawna B.
reviews.description: We were leaving Austin on our way back to Dallas and found this incredible spot through yelp - thank God! It was freaking DELICIOUS. To try several things, we ordered the fried chicken dish with gravy n mashed potatoes, baked mac n cheese, and tomato basil soup. OMG - I could eat here every single week. The food and drinks are presented beautifully and tastes very homemade.   The restaurant itself is super cute and totally Austin appropriate. Keep in mind they include a 20% automatic gratuity to the bill, which we were happy to pay to our server Rose, who was very kind and delivered exceptional service. We will be back next time we're in town no doubt.

reviews.author: Briana N.
reviews.description: Colleen's kitchen is a super cute restaurant in a newly developing area which I can tell is going to be a great area to visit.   The food was super delicious. The chicken pot pie crust was so flaky and the insides weren't too liquidy, but it was just very homey overall. The shrimp and grits were also really flavorful. I kind of wish the portion sizes were bigger but it's the perfect amount if you want room for dessert there or somewhere else in the plaza.  I visited for dinner and was able to grab the last chicken pot pie, but I feel like this restaurant has more of a lunch vibe, so I would definitely visit again then to really get the full experience.   The servers were super nice in checking up on us, recommending which drinks were in season, and just chatting in general.   And a plus: they validate parking for the garage behind them!

reviews.author: Lauren F.
reviews.description: This place was a cozy delight! After arriving for a show nearby super early, my friend and I decided to find some place to grab a little bit of food and drinks while we waited. Our booth was incredibly comfortable and the staff made us feel like home. Our food was delicious and there was so much on the menu I really want to go back and try! Since you have to pay to park, I won't go back just for the food, but every time I go see a movie, I will definitely plan time to stop here to eat!

reviews.author: Keshante A.
reviews.description: What a cute restaurant! I loved the vintage decor. I went for lunch and got the biscuits, deviled eggs and shrimp Cobb salad. Everything was delicious, but the biscuits were definitely my fav. The shrimp was seasoned really well also. The service was excellent, all staff that came by were so accommodating and nice. Thanks!

reviews.author: Kim H.
reviews.description: First time here. It's very cute on the inside with great cocktails. We started off with the fried green tomatoes. Personal preference I've had better. They lacked a lot of flavor but the sauce made up for it. They are great portion to share. I ordered the buttermilk fried chicken dinner with the green beans, mashed potato's and biscuit. Portion is huge enough for 2 meals. Can't go wrong with any of the above but I'm dreaming about the biscuit. The hubs ordered the pork chop, also very tasty. Will eventually make it back in for brunch.   Covid-Indoor/outdoor dining, tables spaced out far enough, all staff wearing masks and guests required to wear masks anytime not seated at the table. They did start adding an automatic 20% gratuity which is stated on the menu and our server told us it's  "so the front and back of house staff could earn a livable wage"

reviews.author: Allison C.
reviews.description: I am so glad this gem exists in the Mueller neighborhood because Colleen's kitchen does southern comfort food right. For dinner I ordered a trio of little biscuit and cut everything in half so I could try a little bit of each one. Be aware of the fried egg in the breakfast biscuit. It really surprised me when I cut into it but made the most beautiful egg run. I ended up having the equivalent of one biscuit leftover so the portion sizes are generous.   They have a little window off to the side where to go orders can be picked up. Even more exciting, they sell cookies from this window!

reviews.author: Kerri M.
reviews.description: The brunch at Colleen's is amazing!! We ordered biscuits, bacon wrapped dates, and deviled eggs as appetizers and then I got the potato hash for my main meal. Honestly, I could have been content with just the biscuits, they were super yummy! I'm not a fan of tomatoes, but thought the tomato jam that was served with it wasn't bad! I didn't even realize it was tomato, I thought it was something else! The potato hash was good too, but I would probably try something else if I went back!  The aesthetic was also super cute! Very open and bright with fun green wallpaper with chickens and one of the areas had a bunch of old time photos. I thought the location was great as well and we walked around the Mueller farmers market afterwards!  Just a heads up, you have to wait until your whole party has arrived before being seated, even if you have a reservation, and they do an automatic 20% gratuity on your ticket. Honestly, not a huge fan of them automatically putting in the tip because I feel like it should be based on the service you get, and it wasn't super clear so if my friend hadn't said anything, I probably would have tipped twice.

reviews.author: Preslie H.
reviews.description: Tonight was my first time here and a girlfriend (and her dog!) joined me for dinner. Right when we sat down the waiter brought the dog a water bowl -- so nice! The bacon wrapped dates are excellent as an app. She got the burger and loved it, and I got a chicken Cesar salad and baked Mac and cheese -- both were excellent. Our server was Nick and he was super nice and personable. Such a great, tasty neighborhood spot! Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Craig L.
reviews.description: Great beer, huge place with plenty of seating even when they are at their busiest.  I used to not be a fan of their pizza, but these days it's amazing!  Best brewery in the area by far, and we have some pretty good ones.

reviews.author: Victor D.
reviews.description: Cool spot with lot of choices ! I go here if I want to go with my boys and order my food -  You definitely need to plan ahead for TNF and MNF -/

reviews.author: Adam L.
reviews.description: How can I possibly express how awesome this place is.  The food is outstanding and the crew is such a wonderful family.  Every time we stop in we are welcomed like regulars even tho we are (currently) new.  The cannonball is dope!  The tap selection is on point.    Please don't go tho, it's already so popular I can't find a seat at the bar! :)  J/k. I wouldn't belong in the family if I didn't welcome y'all in to join too!

reviews.author: Heather D.
reviews.description: Phenomenal!   The pizza is crafted with fresh ingredients, made quick to order, and absolutely delicious! There is an excellent beer selection, and the staff is super friendly and very helpful. We had a couple of pizzas, garlic cheese bread, a side Caesar salad and 2 beers. Great atmosphere for all ages. Zero complaints. They know what they're doing. We will be back!

reviews.author: Doretta W.
reviews.description: Door is around the side towards the back. It is a very convenient walk from several hotels in the area.  If you want to eat... Walk in and turn left to place your order at the counter.  If you want to drink .. walk in and go straight to the bar.  They have salads, apps and several speciality pizzas ... sized from individual to family. You get soda from the fountain (cherry, cream, cola, etc) or beer from the tap (too many to cover here).   There are a few booths and tables but mainly it is community seating at 20' long tables. Kind of cool I think.  TVs everywhere ... watched baseball and ESPN. I bet this place is lit on Sat and Sun for football.  So the food? I really liked the beer mates .. garlic cheese bread. Good size and flavor for just $5. I had the pear honey pizza .. add blue cheese, basil and pancetta. I really liked the way the flavors all stuck out .. sweet, herby, salty ... love it!!

reviews.author: Josh E.
reviews.description: Queso very watery.  Definitely not a go to item for me the next time I'm in. I'll stick with the pretzel.

reviews.author: Cynthia V.
reviews.description: This is a good spot to come hang and catch a game on the TV while you enjoy some craft pizzas and beers. You order the food and beer separately, food from a walkup counter and beer from the bar in the middle of the restaurant. You get a buzzer puck when you order food so the servers can locate you and bring it to your table. We ordered the Beer Mates and Pizza Roll appetizers to start and two pizzas, the Oo La La and the Shroomin' Goat. Food timing was staggered and the only real hiccup was that the Beer Mates appetizer order seemed to have gotten lost because we had to ask for it after all the rest of our order had trickled out, and it then took about 15min more for it to finally arrive. But, when it did, it was piping hot and fresh, so that's good. Food quality was very good and we enjoyed everything we ordered.

reviews.author: Jonathon S.
reviews.description: I thought the name referred to the beers they serve and while that is probably the inspiration, I find it sad that it also refers to the amount of grease in their pizza (about a pint).  If you love pepperoni or sausage  grease then this is the place for you.   If you don't then don't get these meats on your pizza.  I hope the kitchen learns about skimming  fat off their more flavor proteins to prevent the crust from being a fatty sponge.  Happy Sunday everyone.

reviews.author: Andrew I.
reviews.description: Great food. Friendly staff. Excellent beer.  What more could you want?    For pizza, they have all the traditional toppings, sauce, and cheese along with many others  For beer, it's fresh and crisp.

reviews.author: Fernando B.
reviews.description: I had high expectations for this place.  Have tasted their beer before and they are great! First time going to the location. We started with queso and chips which was good. We had the works pizza. Good amount of topping on the pizza. The sauce was nice and thick but had too much oregano, too much of a string flavor. The dough is to soft, needs to have more chew to it. Overall good but not my first choice for pizza.

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Cool pizza and beer spot (they also have wine too).   Very urban vibes and very popular.  You order your food and drinks at the window and then it is brought to your table. The pizzas are unique and HUGE!   The armadillo was our favorite - sausage and goat cheese?! Yes please!

reviews.author: Natalie R.
reviews.description: Delicious pizza and they have great vegetarian options. The parking is not ideal, hence 4 stars, and why we don't go here as often as we'd like. The side salads are good too. Nice homey atmosphere.

reviews.author: Kristen H.
reviews.description: One of our favorite sources of both beer and pizza in the whole city. Excellent topping combinations, tasty crust with just the right balance of chewiness and tenderness. And the beer is incredible- I hated IPAs until I tried Electric Jellyfish!

reviews.author: Shereka J.
reviews.description: Usually place a curbside order. Process to Order online and pick-up is do easy. Food is always good and never had an issue with my order.

reviews.author: Bryant P.
reviews.description: Vegans - DON'T COME HERE. Their vegan options are trash.  Here's a build-your-own vegan pizza that cost us $25, before tax and tip. It's a sad little thing that deserves a happy home. Not in my belly though...I could've gotten something better and cheaper from the frozen section of H-E-B.  Would've been one star but I know they don't cater to vegans. Still, I'm not sure you can call yourself vegan-friendly if your vegan pizza looks like a Lunchables.  At least their beer is good!

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: Bringing them up two stars from the Father's Day fiasco.   Service today was spot on and very timely. So why 3 Stars? I got the monthly special, The Fuzz. It supposed to be brisket, chopped jalapeños, pickled onions, and a chipotle sauce. Honestly, it was like pizza dough with pickled onions. I had trouble finding and tasting the brisket as it was non existent. The chopped jalapeños were hard to find and taste as well. There were plenty of pickled onions. To sum it up, this pizza sucked !!! I should've stuck to my favorite the Banh Mi with extra sausage and extra jalapeños. Lesson learned and money lost, such is life.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: Haven't been back to Pinthouse since Covid and since we loved the food we wanted to go back.  Glad they were busy but I have to say, while the pizzas and salads are absolutely great, the service seemed off. I know this is mostly a serve yourself model but it felt awkward standing with my family trying to see if anyone would help us find a seat. We stood there quite a while and once in a while a server would walk past us, look at us and keep walking. It would have been nice for one of them to smile and say 'sit anywhere' or something helpful. I knew I'd have to stand in line to order, then go back for refills, and finally to close out my tab. I guess the two things that chapped me most after  the seating thing was first, when we asked the server who brought our pizza for 1 more plate and fork and she said 'sure,' then never came back and second, I was presented the option to pay a tip from 15-25% when I closed out my tab. Now I almost always over tip because I'm in hospitality and try to support exceptional service. I did tip but felt it wasn't really deserved, sadly.  Outside the service issues, we will likely try it again as I know finding enough good employees is very tough now and we LOVE any restaurant that is part of the Jack Allen family because the food is SOOOOO good.  I hope owners will work on the service and keep the high quality of the food and beer.  Cheers

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: Update.   Reviewer is now a regular at  Pinthouse round Rock and has some very biased opinions. Read with caution.   I believe that the round rock location is definitely the best of the Pinthouses. Their beer selection is quite diverse, the food is just hands down amazing and there are also options such as cider, wine, hard kombucha (thanks hipsters) for non beer drinkers.   I'm struggling to think of one bad thing to say and just to say  something- it's the crowds on Friday and Saturday evenings.   I'm chuffed that this branch has gone from strength to strength; and I hope it continues to do so. As long as they're open, my Family and I shall keep visiting !!

reviews.author: Kimberly S.
reviews.description: Pinthouse Pizza was recommended by a bartender at another local brewery when we asked for suggestions for other places to visit while vacationing in the area. We stopped in at the Round Rock location and figured out the ordering process - order at the counter or at the bar, get a beeper, and your food is delivered to your table. If you have questions about the beer, I suggest you order at the bar. We ordered our food at the counter, but when I asked a beer question, I was referred to the bar. The bartender was very helpful. I ordered a flight and she offered some feedback on one of my choices. There was a combination of booth, bar, and common tables. We chose the common table to have the best view of the Red Sox/Yankees playoff game. Go Sox! The queso and salad came out first. The queso was good; the Italian salad was amazing. The individual salad was enough to share. The Shroomin' Pizza was very good too; I thought the crust was phenomenal and enjoyed dipping the end pieces in leftover salad dressing. The last thing I'd like to mention is how environmentally friendly this place is; paper products are compostable, pizza plates and utensils are metal. There's very little waste here! I would definitely recommend Pinthouse Pizza!

reviews.author: Trenton V.
reviews.description: Friendly staff, large enough to reasonably accommodate you at any time, even Friday nights without too crazy of a wait, reasonable prices, high quality delicious pizza with a red sauce that makes my mouth water just thinking about it. Excellent place, highly recommended.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: We popped into this local bar to watch the Masters.  What great place.  When I saw someone at the bar with two dogs I said to myself this is the place. We ordered from the bar and then hung out for about an hour.  If i was in the area again i would seek it out for sure.

reviews.author: Jeff W.
reviews.description: If you're new to Dripping Springs or just passing through, The Barber Shop is a cool little beer bar located in the historic downtown area of DSpgs. They've got a smaller indoor area to sit and enjoy the AC, or the backyard patio has plenty of room with long picnic tables. Many a live music to enjoy the afternoons with. The staff and the customers are a friendly bunch so stop in, enjoy a cold one and enjoy the good vibes.

reviews.author: Everett T.
reviews.description: So it's called The Barber Shop, but it's really a dive bar that's located in an old gas station. Confused yet? Great, glad we cleared that up.  From the moment you walk in, it's clear this spot is beloved by the locals. The crowd was a solid mix of tourists, cowboys, retirees, and working stiffs.  The tap selection is small, but they go out of their way represent Texas brews, even hosting a tap from Acopon, which is literally about 20 ft away. It's dog friendly, with a patio and a small performing space for musicians. This place just oozes history, it's definitely worth a look if you find yourself in Dripping.

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: Don't come here you'll ruin it. Perfect the way it is. Don't want to many new people ruining it.

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: This Dripping Springs spot is stellar for many reasons. Low key, 99.9% percent locals hanging out in the evening. Excellent bartenders over the years. Super cool owner too who I obviously know because of my tenure in this town.   The Barber Shop is so cool in fact that my wife and I chose to renew our vows there for our 10 year anniversary. Complete with a hail storm, cake balls from nearby Well Yeah Cakes, and a Elvis impersonator in his second ever appearance.   Beer is always cold; wine list is tragically minimal to the regret of my wife (think tiny bottles like near the airport). Yet, it's charms outweigh it's negative aspects. Heard these days there is a sammich outlet on site for food instead of ordering from nearby Pizza Cave or the shi*ty fried chicken at the gas station.   Biggest note here: It's little Rooster's favorite bar :)

reviews.author: Kacie H.
reviews.description: Excellent beer bar for a small town. Perfect quaint atmosphere and the picnic tables make it easy to get to know new friends.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Visited the Barber Shop after a full day of hiking as we needed to replenish our Carbs. Sat was their 6th anniversary so the shop was packed with live music out back and a special cask beer being offered.  I have been coming to the Barber Shop for years as a good friend of mine lives in the Springs and we always seem to default here. Take note this is a beer and wine bar only. Yes, they have soft drinks and water as well. This is a dive bar extraordinaire so there is no need to get all decked out to hang out. There are plenty of draft and bottle beers with all the usual craft suspects and always a few surprises as well. The venue is dog and kid friendly so don't step on Fido and keep your cussin to a minimum.  Friendly patrons, good service, and a great beer selection that's the trifecta. Stop by when you are in the area. Lastly don't be shamed by asking for a haircut....

reviews.author: Jon B.
reviews.description: I live in Seattle and have relatives in Dripping Springs -- "Dripping" -- to the locals, and have been coming here for years. In the early, early, early, early days it was a gas station and my dad told me they'd stop here for gas when traveling cross country in the 50's. I love this place because it's got a great history, the building rocks (pun intended), and the beer selection should satisfy most any beer drinker; lots of variation. They also serve wine and some non-alcoholic drinks. Children are tolerated until 9 pm. There's an area out front to gather and stand, an inside area to order and sit down, and a backyard area -- some covered, some not -- with picnic tables and chairs. There's music on some nights, a great after-work vibe, and friendly atmosphere throughout. Easy Texan drinkin' and relaxin' all the way. Stop by if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: Great beer selection and very friendly people. The added bonus is that the smokers have a section for themselves outside. We meet here every month or so for good beers and a good time.

reviews.author: Jordana G.
reviews.description: I can't believe I've never reviewed the Barbershop. It's the quintessential neighborhood bar. Have a beer with friends (or soon to be friends) and enjoy the Texas casual ambiance. They also offer ciders and the wine selections, while not vast, are good quality choices for the major wine categories. The beer offerings are superb. I've been coming here since they opened (5 years ago?), remains one of my favorite bars.

reviews.author: Marshall O.
reviews.description: This place deserves a five star review; it has a great selection of beers in a small town. The beer is cold, cheap, and the bar has a great atmosphere.   I went in last night (Tuesday/Halloween)for the first time in a long time. The World Series was on and I decided to grab a beer and hopefully see the Astros win with other Texans but... they lost. The crowd was small and friendly but I did feel like a party crasher because they all knew each other and were passing the guitar around. I hope this place hasn't turned into a towny bar because it never was in the past.   I'm going to have to go again to make sure or at least that's my excuse to go get good and affordable craft beer.

reviews.author: Christine G.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places in Dripping!   Love to go when they have the pickers circle on Sunday.  So much fun and great local musicians.   Love the beer specials too!

reviews.author: Steve D.
reviews.description: Not anybody but locals know about this place, they prefer to keep it that way. Don't expect fancy artwork, foo foo drinks or any food. Beer, Beer, Beer, oh yeah, wine also (limited selection, tho). A small town converted garage and plenty of oddball thimgs on the walls. Be sure you have a couple of hours and a driver, it's not right around the corner.

reviews.author: Andy H.
reviews.description: This is the best place in town for a beer and some friendly faces.... they treat locals and visitors with the same respect and it's a great pub... this is coming from a "local" Englishman :-)

reviews.author: Dave T.
reviews.description: Taking a side trip out of Austin, we stopped in to visit this establishment mentioned in various travel sites' recommendations. We were not disappointed! The manner in which they've decorated the inside and out provided a cozy, intriguing, and welcoming atmosphere.  There was an impressive selection of craft brews on tap which was explained and served by our courteous server. I will definitely make a point to stop by again on my next trip to The Lone Star State! Thanks, guys!

reviews.author: Matthew S.
reviews.description: Still a great menu of brews, I love the atmosphere, I love this place.

reviews.author: Deana S.
reviews.description: Rude bartender they think because they have a small town they can be rude to people because they have a place in dripping springs bad customer service leads to shut down of a business let's see where you are in one year asshole!!!!

reviews.author: Sage R.
reviews.description: I'm hesitating to post this; because secretly I want to keep this little gem to myself. I'm kinda new to dripping springs, but as soon as I stepped foot in this place, I felt like home. You'll never meet a nicer group of comrades all grabbing a beer at the end of the day. Tip well! These bartenders deserve it.

reviews.author: Marco L.
reviews.description: After attempting to stay local and having cover charge at two other places on Mercer. The barbershop was a place for us!  Great cold beer plenty of tables good service

reviews.author: Emily P.
reviews.description: It's a bar....the hole in the wall variety. Good beer selection, nice selection of sitting areas with different vibes. And the bartender was helpful!

name: Toss Pizzeria and Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Friday

reviews.author: Meredith L.
reviews.description: This spot is great for dinner during the week or for a weekend brunch with friends to watch a game! They've got space and seating for every type of group: Artificial lawn outside with corn hole and lawn chairs (we saw families congregating in this area); outside "bar seating" with view of multiple TVs (we sat here); tables next to heaters outside as well with view of the TVS (good for larger friend groups); seats inside for the faint of heart.  They offer pizza by the slice, half, and whole, which I thought was pretty unique.  We got the half pulled pork carbonara...chef's kiss! Very mild, comforting flavors. The runny egg yolks and perfectly cooked pork made this dish.

reviews.author: Imari W.
reviews.description: Okay the pizza was bomb af!!! I'm a picky eater, I like what I like and if I don't I'm not gonna fake like I do , I've had nasty pizza before so it's possible to mess up a pizza but I played it safe with a regular pepperoni and 10/10  baby I even ate the crust (not much of a crust eater ‍) I got half pie which was 4 slices  (should have got the whole ) I also had a Cesar salad that was really good to the dressing was creamy not watery $8 for a serving great for one or you can split in two like an appetizer which is what I did everyone at my table enjoyed their pizza as well there were no complaints from anybody  Now however I did not order drinks because I'm pregnant so I can't tell you but my husband  got a house margarita and he actually got two so I guess it was good   now if you want to sit on the patio be prepared to share the space with dogs and smokers I feel they should have a designated area for the smokers on the patio it sucks for us that like to eat outside but also have to endure that smoke very inconvenient for us pregnant women as well but everything was perfect  We also got to chat with Logan he wasn't really our server but he jumped in in times as if he was he has awesome customer service he suggested beers for my father in law let him try to make sure he was satisfied my father in law even went to purchase the beer Logan introduced him to from the next door store thank you Logan for your great hospitality!

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: I've been to Toss a few times now and I have to say, I think this place is super underrated. With names like Home Slice in the area, I understand that people may forget to check out other pizza places, but if you haven't tried Toss yet, you're MISSING OUT. I've been for dinner before but the breakfast pizza has my heart. The crust is the perfect balance of crispy and soft, the topping options are endless, and there's a $15 mimosa deal (a full bottle of champagne) to wash it all down. Also, if you're a fan of ranch on pizza, their homemade ranch is unmatched.   Not only is their food good, but I am also always so impressed with the service. One time when we were in for brunch, there was also a large group that had rented out the entire outside seating area. I'm sure the team felt swamped but we couldn't even tell because we still felt like they were paying us more than enough attention. Regardless, our waitress continued to apologize for the "slower" service and even discounted some of our meal.   COVID Precautions: All employees and guests are required to wear masks when not seated. Seating is limited and hand sanitizer is provided.

reviews.author: Allie R.
reviews.description: One of my new favorite pizza places in town! The pizza literally was so fresh and flavorful. The crust was also done perfectly. Be sure to check their happy hour deals before going too because they have a lot of amazing offerings. Great casual environment or perfect for takeout. The indoor dinning is a little small, so if you want a table maybe make a reservation or go early. I will definitely be dining here again soon.

reviews.author: Jenelle R.
reviews.description: Yes, I am that person that came to a pizza joint and ordered a brussel sprout salad. But hear me out. 10/10! So often, I find sides of crispy brussel sprouts to be underwhelming. Not this one! I was absolutely wowed and Toss nailed it! Big fat brussel sprouts that were perfectly crispy + goat cheese, beets, and walnuts. Yum! Also have to give a shout-out to our server Emily. She's the only one who showed up for her shift last night, and you would have never known they were understaffed. Her boss was helping out, but even still, Emily was on top of it. Also, as far as the wings go, my fiancé gave them an 8/10. We had a great experience and will definitely be back for more wings, sprouts, and hopefully pizza too!

reviews.author: Mahesh N.
reviews.description: Great pizza and fantastic outdoor setup that allows for a casual time to eat and watch some games. If you want a fun time with friends and family, come here.   Texas BBQ Brisket Pizza is a good pick. Brisket was tender, but a tad dry. Sauce was sufficient without being over sauced.  Tasted like a sliced BBQ sandwich with pickles and onions.  Yummy.  The margarita was solid. Good sauce.   The roasted veggie did not have enough goat cheese. Also the artichoke didn't go well with the rest of the vegetables. Recommend to hold that.   Only real recommendation, improve the parking. You don't really need 6 curbside pizza pickups?  Neighborhood has parking restrictions.

reviews.author: Stephen B.
reviews.description: Lower than mediocre food, "patio" is uncovered and blasted by the 100 degree Texas sun.   Inside no better luck as bartenders will not change channels if the Cowboys are on, even with screens not being watched by anyone at all.   Pretty horrific overall.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Toss has recently became a top contender for me when considering where I should go for pizza.  The main thing here is they have a wide variety to choose from. For example, I got:  - Texas BBQ Brisket Pizza: what's interesting here is that their full pizzas are 20"!! So, getting a half pie ain't no joke because it's still quite big. Smoked brisket, pickles, onions, and bbq sauce base? Yes please!  - Margherita: they allow you to do Cauliflower Crust for $3 more, so I went with that for a healthier, lighter contrast to the pizza I mentioned above.  - Hand TOSSed Wings: I was very surprised to see that they have 11 flavors to choose from. I got their Toss Sauce which is your classic "buffalo medium" as well as a side of their Spicy Toss Sauce to try out which has ghost peppers in them (warning: they are SPICY!). For the second flavor I got the Bacon Ranch dry rub which takes grounded bacon and mixes it with ranch seasoning - too good!   - Stuffed Pretzel: I got this as an appetizer before all the food came out and it was a great way to dive right in. It's stuffed with pepperoni and cheese. To dip, I suggest you get marinara and queso for the best of both worlds of saucey and creamy.  - Warm Brussels Sprout Salad: now you may be thinking... why go to a pizza place for a salad? I don't blame you for thinking that, however, let me put you on: this was phenomenal. It had no business being this good! Brussels, beets, goat cheese, candied walnuts, and a balsamic dressing? Phew. A MUST try!  - Smores: I wanted to get the cinnamon donut holes originally, but they ran out of cinnamon so by default I got this. They were fine, but I felt this was something I could have just made at home.  - Watermelon Press: I got this because I was looking for something refreshing. I am not big on watermelon, so I wasn't the biggest fan - but if you are, this is something you'd enjoy.  Overall, I enjoyed everything I got. The prices are fair, there's a lot of items on the menu, and the service was good. I also got to see a self-driving delivery robot come by! I had a great time and give them a strong 4/5!

reviews.author: Cecilia H.
reviews.description: This pizza joint is awesome with it's fun atmosphere, very cool patio and great eats.  We usually share extra crispy sesame wings, a Cesar salad and pepperoni pizza and have some for the next day. Great portions, tasty food, can't go wrong with a meal from Toss.

reviews.author: Justice R.
reviews.description: A great atmosphere to just chill out and watch the game or just to grab a bite to eat. Love their outside seating area and it's dog friendly.   The Texas BBQ Brisket pizza is bombbbbbb!!! I'm not a pizza gal at all but I can eat this everyday. Not a fan of their chips and queso.

reviews.author: Vince A.
reviews.description: Been to this place twice and one other things I noticed that one I showed up customer service was terrible I walked in and nobody asked if I needed help even though there was a group of employees gather together went to the bar finally got how and ordered a pizza to go and a beer while I was while she served my beer she try to grab a lime out of the lime jar with her hands I said no no thank you I don't know why they don't use tongs to grab it very unprofessional

reviews.author: Brianna E.
reviews.description: Went here the other night. We had Brussels sprouts for an appetizer and ordered a pizza. The sprouts were good, but the pizza took OVER an hour to come out. Idk if the kitchen lost the ticket or what, but over an hour?? They weren't busy so I really don't know why that happened.

reviews.author: Cynthia D.
reviews.description: We visited last night to grab some pizza. We tried the garlic knots which are HUGE. They weren't garlicky enough for me. I did have the garlic butter which helped some. We also had the Brussels sprout salad and it was AMAZING! Highly recommend. We ordered a half pep for the two of us. It was really good. A little cheese heavy for my liking. Overall great ambiance, service and food. I would recommend to a friend.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: Tried toss for the first time last night after great reviews from friends. Got half pepperoni half spinach/artichoke and the garlic knots. Flavors are good but everything was so burned!! So frustrating to have a burned taste with every bite and unable to eat the crust!

reviews.author: Jessika F.
reviews.description: This has become one of our regular, weekly spots for dinner! I really love the atmosphere and all of the servers are SO friendly, they all deserve extra kudos. Their social media game is strong, they post specials on Instagram that are so delicious looking that I have to come right in. The weekends can get very busy with a super long wait, but they take reservations via OpenTable. Make sure to reserve at least a day in advance if you're trying to visit on a Friday or Saturday.  I love sitting outdoors because they have fans when it's hot and heaters when it's cold. And of course, I love looking at all of the patio dogs. The food and drinks are great! Oh the desserts have been fantastic as well. We look forward to being "regulars" here for a long time to come.

reviews.author: Brooke C.
reviews.description: I would give this place a 3.5/5. Great environment and vibe to watch sports, drink beer, and bring your dog. However, the pizza was mediocre with little selection but if the crust was a bit more sturdy it would be a completely different story. This place is super close to iconic Austin tourist spots! Check it out if you want a friendly environment with mid grade pizza :)

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: One of new favorite sports bars in the area. Socially distant tables but still has that feel of being around people. Cool indoor outdoor areas and 15+ large TVs. They play all the games and are open pretty late.   Food is solid. Sports bar with pizza but also some healthy options and diet friendly with dishes like Brussels sprouts salad and cauliflower crust. Lots of wing sauce choices to choose as well as calzone which is tough to find in the area. Ghost pepper sauce is the real deal here and the Brussels sprout salad interesting with beets and goat cheese. Calzone came out quickly and can feed 2 people for sure. Warm and airy and comes with 3 toppings for $16.   Beer list is fine. Tons of cans but they have 3 IPA on draft including pinthouse and Zilker and they'd even like mainstays. About 8 drafts total and expect $7 max for a pint.   Lots of happy hour and deals every day of the week though to get your fill for cheaper. And you can always order a wine or mimosa or cider if beer isn't your thing. Really solid spot that checks all the boxes. They have brunch and dinner menus and online is to date other than the draft list which may change. Gets crowded quick during game days so plan ahead and make a reservation.

reviews.author: Jennifer E.
reviews.description: Wish I could give 0 stars. Ordered half a pizza for $20, it was horrible, not even edible. H-E-B frozen pizza would have been a better choice. The crust was just plain bad tasted old and dry. I ordered a side of garlic butter that they forgot to put the top on and it spilled in the box. Don't try to call in an order because it doesn't work they don't answer their phone and then when you get there and pull up there's a website to go to that doesn't work so you have to end up going inside anyway. Not going back and wouldn't recommend.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: We've been here a few times. Nice layout. Lots of big screens to watch the games. Nice selection of beer on tap. Full bar. Dog friendly. Pizza is good. Service is good. A little pricey. Not a lot of parking, so carpool!

reviews.author: Mimi D.
reviews.description: Idk im sure the food is fine   buuuut the togo person (with an ungloved hands ) touched several surfaces then opened my food  to put togo ranch when i asked him not to and was ignored  he proceeded any hoots   .i just left but prolly should have got a refund but oh well .

reviews.author: Lukas S.
reviews.description: We spent a weekend at Lucky Arrow for a friend's wedding. It was such a great experience!  Space: There was so much space that we never felt like we were on top of each other. Everything was kept neat and clean, too.   Staff: The staff were all so friendly and accommodating with requests for more fire wood and such.  Amenities/Rooms: SUCH nice bedding with ample room in the courtyard cabins. Loved having the hot tubs too!

reviews.author: Alida R.
reviews.description: I had a lovely few nights stay at Lucky Arrow. We traveled with friends - 3 other couples and their kids - and stayed in a cluster of four cabins. It was the perfect pandemic vacation: we were able to socialize with our friends and still have our own spaces, without being indoors together. I don't think I'd have enjoyed it as much with strangers staying in the cabin cluster with me, especially since each pair of cabins shares a hot tub (which was delightful to relax in!) and all four cabins share a fire pit.  The rooms were clean and modern looking, the beds comfortable, and the air conditioning great. They have basic toiletries and good towels. There's very weak and unreliable wifi at the cabins; I recommend you come here to disconnect. I had good cell phone service with Verizon. The cabins have mini fridges but no kitchens; if you want to cook, you'll have to grill outside. Bring your own charcoal and lighter fluid!  For shared amenities, there's a lovely outdoor pool, and a big space with a large fire pit, grills, and picnic area with tables and swings (and some covered seating if you need shade). The pool has a 1-foot area with lounge seats, and lots of nice floats. We visited during the week, and it wasn't very busy; our group spent a lot of time at the pool and were often there by ourselves. There's a small walking trail, too.  It is quite pricey; I don't normally spend this much on a hotel. I'm not sure if I'd stay again if I weren't going on a group trip (with pandemic friendly housing.) If you're going with a group, call and see if they'll give you group pricing.  Warning for those who are planning to spend most of their time in Dripping Springs drinking: if you visit on a Monday - Tuesday, as I did, most of the wineries and breweries (including Bell Springs, which is attached to the resort) are closed.

reviews.author: Brittney H.
reviews.description: Wow, what a great stay! The yurt that I stayed in was spacious and spotless, the bath house was always clean, and the entire place is well maintained. The staff is amazing; welcoming and very tentative when needed. If you're looking for a peaceful getaway outside the Austin area, this is the spot and worth the price!

reviews.author: Erika F.
reviews.description: Great retreat close to Austin. Connected to a peaceful winery and minutes away from distilleries. Great staff and beautiful cabins.

reviews.author: Felix G.
reviews.description: Exceeded expectations. I love being outdoors, my wife loves luxury hotels. We stayed in one of the cabins and we both got what we wanted. The grounds are really nice and accommodating to friendly conversation with other guests. The cabins are modern and feel like an upscale hotel room. I appreciated the contactless check in and check out process. We look forward to returning.

reviews.author: Gina L.
reviews.description: Phenomenal! Stayed overnight. Happen to book thru Hotels.com. No issues at all. We stayed in courtyard cabin. My two children my husband and I had a great time hiking, relaxing, hot tub,fire pit and more. Already wondering when I can get more time to go again.

reviews.author: Adam D.
reviews.description: Very little privacy and poor management. Had a grounds keeper hop, that's right hop, on to our patio while my wife and I were changing. Wife was and is still pretty traumatized.  Took us forever to find management to let them know we are out and they told us they would pay for our room at the holiday inn. They did not.  Recommendation to LAR:  If you are going to run a wedding at your retreat, maybe consider additional help managing the facility. Only having 1 worker who is trying to run a wedding at your grounds isn't going to cut it.  * to managements response:  You want me to call you again? I'm sorry, but your response to my review makes it sound like this is the first you have heard about this incident. Is this correct? If so, this is disappointing because that tells me you have not taken steps forward to improve.

reviews.author: Liz K.
reviews.description: Came here for a mid-week staycation. We had the place almost all to ourselves since it was mid-week in September. The weather was amazing! We rented one of the breezeway cabins with views+hot tub+fire pit. There was firewood at the cabin when we checked in. We had a fire and hung out in the hot tub to look at the night sky both nights. It was so quiet and relaxing, exactly what we were looking for. The breezeway cabins are beautiful and fun! The pillows, sheets, and bedding were comfy. The breezeway two-seater swing was cute to sit in while sipping coffee. It would be nice if the room with the couch and wet bar also had soap and a couple dish towels by the sink.

reviews.author: Trey E.
reviews.description: Lovely glamping space close to the Hill Country and within an hour of Austin, but ludicrous pricing policies will prevent a repeat visit. This spartan campsite with tiny houses and yurts (with a bathroom space shared with pool guests) offers a close to the city getaway with minimal amenities. But with a per pet fee of $150 PER ANIMAL plus a nightly fee, they don't seem to understand how out of touch they are with pricing policies of similar establishments. With two dogs under 20lbs, you're looking at $350 just in pet fees prior to any rental rates for just two nights, and therefore Lucky Arrow won't be getting any repeat visits from us.

reviews.author: Mandy L.
reviews.description: I just stayed for an incredible weekend at Lucky Arrow.  Not only was the resort gorgeous, it was super clean and the staff was incredibly friendly.  This was the perfect place to unwind and still feel safe during all this Covid madness.  The check in process was all online, so we didn't have to worry about social distancing.    The rooms were so adorable and you could tell they really put time into every single detail to make sure you have an amazing experience.  We were able to sit around the fire pit, have smores and enjoy the quiet starry night with no city noise or much light pollution.    The location was beyond perfect.  It's just far enough away from town that you feel like you are truly on vacation, but there was still an HEB and tons of food options within a few minutes drive.  The gated access to the winery next door was a wonderful perk.  Highly highly recommend staying here!

reviews.author: Kate A.
reviews.description: There are few things more excellent than Texas Spring, and we were delighted to spend a weekend of the best time of year out in the hill country at Lucky Arrow during their opening weekend.  There is a central event space and bar / pool area at the top of the hill with yurts as well as more conventional accommodation tucked into the trees below. We stayed in a 'courtyard cabin' one of four arranged around a fire pit with a hot tub. Which was bright and airy with the squishiest mattress, soft sheets and plenty of space to set up our travel crib for our three month old son (they also have them there if you're coming from further afield and need to borrow one)  We spent the weekend listening to live music and sipping cocktails by the pool, wandering the shady trails, admiring the view and toasting s'mores on the fire pit.   Close enough to Dripping Springs if you want supper /HEB - but far enough out that the stars are super bright and the night is gloriously quiet. They're well-behaved dog friendly, so we'll be back with our (only moderately well behaved) hound. And for a yurt, I only peeked my head inside one but I'm desperate to stay in one soon!

reviews.author: Brittany W.
reviews.description: I will definitely be back here! My group of 6 reserved 3 porch houses and they were lovely! On the inside, they are totally modern and beautiful. There are no TVs which is perfect for a weekend getaway from the world.   The check in and out process is nice, you're provided with a code to a lockbox so there is no need to wait for someone!   There is a communal area with darts, Jenga, connect four, and more by the pool and firepit area. The staff left out snacks, drinks and smore's fixings for us!   This is a peaceful place that I can't wait to return to!

reviews.author: Jessica N.
reviews.description: Had a great time staying in lucky arrow! We stayed in Yurt 3, which was great. Only complaints were that there was no map provided, nor customer service available, so we had to drive around and try to find outlet yurt at 10pm. Which was fine - we found it fairly quickly. Other complaint is that it looks like the person cleaning might of got distracted and left the room, without putting the ac back together or bringing her cleaning towel. Also not a huge issue. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: April C.
reviews.description: My husband and I chose Lucky Arrow for our anniversary getaway and it exceeded our expectations. The yurt was perfection and beautifully decorated. Even the shared bath house was nice! The complimentary beer and wine tasting was great and the crepe food truck on site was an added bonus. We'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Yerlan S.
reviews.description: Great location, great infrastructure, everything is new and well maintained. A lot of activities to do within an hour range. Hot tubs, hot pool, hot showers. Great breakfast variety w wine n beer tastings. Amazing staff.  Will come again, great place for a grate value.   P.S. A/C in yurts was nice, Operational Manager George is a great dude.

reviews.author: Marisa V.
reviews.description: I have finally fulfilled my lifelong dream of glamping in a yurt!    This place was such a cool experience. I had everything I could ever want. A pool, beer garden, campfires conversations with s'mores, and even a complimentary wine tasting at the Bell Springs Winery located right next door.   As for the staff, a big thanks to Mike, Michelle and Zach! They were all amazingly friendly, kind, funny, and helpful. Your hospitality was greatly appreciated.   This place is perfect for events or a staycation. Either way, I recommend visiting!

reviews.author: Allie W.
reviews.description: Beware of the cancellation policy.  Extremely deceiving.  The first sentence on the website says they have a 10 day cancellation policy but you actually can't get a refund at all.

reviews.author: Liz W.
reviews.description: What a fun place to stay!  We stayed in a yurt and it was such a fun experience. The pool was fantastic and the bathrooms were clean. Everyone was so nice that we saw. The yurt was a great experience.

reviews.author: Andrea L.
reviews.description: For my birthday we stayed in one of the yurts. Super cute and trendy however our sheets had like possible blood stains in them? It was odd and a bit gross. Maybe rust? It turned into a guessing game. Also the communal bathrooms are quite a hike from where we were. Almost had an accident just trying to get to them. Wish they had a couple bathroom options. They had a complimentary beer and wine tasting in the beer garden, however the bar tender or person pouring our drinks wasn't wearing a mask. I didn't feel comfortable sticking around.

reviews.author: Lori S.
reviews.description: Wow!  We are finished up a 3 day work retreat here at Lucky Arrow and, I cannot say enough good things about our stay here and I am super sad to leave.  We were able to have our team join us here (from Austin) to prepare for fall + 2020 goals.  It was the perfect mixture of pleasure and work-- we were close to wonderful Dripping Springs restaurants, wineries and distilleries.  We stayed at the Ranch House were we could spread out and work on our planning during the day and hit up the pool for a quick break. And,  you will definitely want to hit up the s'mores/fire pits because-- yum!  In the morning, we had wonderful walks on the property and even did a mediation session out on the outlook during sunrise.  Incredible.  It would be the perfect place for a wedding ceremony!  I highly recommend a trip out here- I definitely want to come back for a weekend getaway in the yurts or cabins... they are so cute!  Oh and take a dip in the hot tubs!  All in all a definite 5 out of 5-- we will definitely be back!  A huge thank you to Michele, Eva and team for their wonderful service!

name: Hi Hat Public House
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Julia C.
reviews.description: Pros: The food is delicious, the service was friendly and great, the venue is small and cozy.   Cons: We didn't experience any negatives...but I could imagine there being a long wait during peak hours.   We loved the tar tar, the burgers, the Mac and cheese, and spicy Brussels sprouts. Yum!

reviews.author: Chelsea M.
reviews.description: I cannot wait for this place to come back! They have an amazing, mouth-watering burger that's the perfect size to leave you satisfied but not stuffed.

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: On the corner across from Livestrong you'll find Hi Hat - an establishment that knows what it's doing.  I stopped in during the week with no preconceived notions or ideas of what to expect. So what did I learn? Its a cool little craft beer bar with some great food items.  The night we came in they had a distributor there handing out all kinds of marketing swag, stickers and such. It wasn't pushy at all it was just laid back and I loved it.  The beer list now that is a headache - there's so many choices! OMG :)  It's around the corner for me and I have already stopped in about 3 times. Each visit has been the same for me - just perfect.  So far it isn't log jammed with crowds of people which I enjoy being able to sit without the typical ATX line w/a 20 min or more wait. Let's hope they are busy enough to stay around but not too much that I can't sit right away! ;)  Thanks for the great local vibe you put on guys. I love it!

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Came back to try a few more things that had been calling my name from the menu. I realllllly wanted to try the soft pretzel because reviews were good and it looked amazing! The first few bites while it was hot were so good, but as it cooled off and I became satiated, it was just alright.
