I wouldn't be surprised if the cheese sauce that came with it was the same as the sauce on their macaroni and cheese. I think it tasted familiar. I gave the tomato soup another try, and it was just alright too. It's got a funny tangy metallic aftertaste. House pickles were fresh and interesting but I could only eat so much before they became overpowering. This time they included beets, green beans, and okra. I checked on their spiciness and was told they had a kick, but it wasn't too bad for me. I hate to say that the best thing I had was a free piece of Halloween candy from the bar. I really want to like this place. The owner was there most evenings and is friendly. However the food never meets expectations and is a little pricier than I'd consider appropriate.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: Popped by Hi Hat Public House on Saturday night due to the amazing reviews on Yelp. Have to admit it, I was kind of underwhelmed. The bar was sparsley populated for a Saturday night, though they did have a live band playing.  I got a Founders Solid Gold beer for $5.50 and ordered the pork belly hoagie for $12. The food came out pretty quick, but it felt like the kitchen staff wanted to get ouf of there and kind of rushed it together. It was just OK, not the kind of food I'd expect from a 4.5* establishment.  Nothing really wrong with the place, but I don't see how the ratings are so high. Perhaps there's people living in the building and they're just pleased to have a better than average bar in their building? I don't live here, so I don't know if I'll ever make it back in.  Bottom line: good bar, but so many bars in Austin, it didn't grab me as anything amazing.

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: Stopped by after work today, not too busy and I got a spot at the bar. They had a huge beer selection and they also had wine.  I had a beer and the special of the day burger, it was cooked perfectly and delicious, just the right size. I opted for Mac and cheese and that was delicious too, I had a big enough portion that I took half home.  I'd come by again. It was worth the trip.

reviews.author: Janny T.
reviews.description: So happy that the Hi Hat is back open. They're doing a great job disinfecting everything and keeping everything tidy. The food is delicious and so are the drinks. For vegetarians, they have the best avocado toast I've ever had and that's coming from someone in LA where we are as basic as it gets. I've also had their shrimp benedict that is not currently on their menu which is so yummy. Lastly, I usually don't like micheladas but they make the best!! The mix is homemade and it taste like perfection with the new Zilker rice beer. Thank you!

reviews.author: Jamel O.
reviews.description: On a recent visit to Hi Hat, our group sat at the bar while a band played music.  I got chicken wings.  They were not your normal fried wings, they seemed like a flavorful baked wings hybrid.  Different but not bad, because I was hungry and they had the kitchen open late.  There is outdoor seating as well.

reviews.author: Leah S.
reviews.description: Cool spot, with good food and drinks. More low key than expected, but still cool vibes. Parking may be harder to find than some places (street parking).

reviews.author: Zain R.
reviews.description: We were walking around on what was quite possibly the rainiest weekend this year so far and went to another place which had a 30-45 minute wait time. We walked around thinking we'll have to go back to our friend's apartment and drive somewhere when we ended up at this place purely by happenstance.   The good, the bad, and the ugly:  The good: The presentation of the food is so pleasing to the senses. Just as pleasing as it is to look at it, it is equally pleasing to your taste buds. I substituted my chips for the beets and oh boy, what a great a choice that was! The guy taking the order (Oh, btw, you have to order at the bar) told me that some people don't like them because they taste too earthy. I have never understood how people cannot enjoy eating beets. The highlight of the entree was supposed to be the portobello mushroom burger served on a bed of creams with some guacamole and aioli but the side of beets totally took the center stage. The vinaigerette they were sitting in when mixed with the cheese totally elevated the dish and give it so much dimension once you really mix it in together. You really want to take pictures and tell your food that this one is for the gram. I'll let the photos speak for themselves  The bad: Portions are a little bit on the smaller side but that could possibly be because we have huge portions in Houston. Or that I have a food addiction. No one else seemed to have that problem so you can just ignore the last statement. But, the service was a little lacking even though the restaurant was pretty empty.   The ugly: This does not necessarily apply to me but my friend is a vegan and they don't carry soy milk. Their reasoning, we put it out but no one used it and we were throwing it away. Solution could be, just give it to people who ask for it?!  I think, overall, we had a really good time over here. The food was great. On Sundays, they have live music where we were told that the music doesn't get so loud that you are not able to hold a normal conversation.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This is definitely not what I expected when walking up. It is more of a hole in the wall type bar nestled in definitely austin. Parking is hard to find so be prepared. The food was just okay and the service was eh. They do have a large selection of beers though. The place is very small inside a d the bathroom are somewhat outside....sucks in a cold night. It's definitely an interesting little find. Not one of my favorites though.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: Came only for the beer. 2 dozen taps and although mostly local, they hit all the types. Packed inside but nice patio that's extremely dog friendly. Parking is street and WiFi available. Free music co Stanton with a stage literally in the corner ready to go on short notice. Specials daily and happy hour until 7pm on Tuesday through Thursday. Food looked good but I was here for the beer. Fresh draft line makes me happy so no complaints here. One TV and friendly service. Floor and tables clean and although loud it's not in your head intrusive. Really can't ask for much more from a neighborhood bar.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Rolled in here for the first time on Saturday afternoon and had my eye on their reuben. I was NOT disappointed! They brine their corned beef for 11days and it is juicy, crumbly perfection! The kraut they use is actually on par as well, w/the perfect balance of sweet and sour.  I am not gonna lie, the reuben here might just hold a candle to my all-time ATX fav at Waller. They are different stylistically, but both hold their own.  While I was here Saturday, I did their little sampler pour of one of my fav high abv beers, Wake up Dead on nitro by Left Hand. It was just what I wanted. At 10.2%, doing a full pour is a bit much, but their little $3 sampler was perfection.   I also discovered their "Wine Wednesdays" during my Saturday visit and after the gracious bartender Phil (who I have affectionately nicknamed "GreenBay") let me sample their 1000 Stories Bourbon Barrel Aged Zin. I was smitten from first whiff and in full lust after the first sip. I knew I had to return to make a half price $44 btl mine!  As luck would have it, my schedule allowed me to come in on the following Wed. I am not going to lie, I was so looking forward to doing damage to a bottle of a 1000 Stories all by my lonesome. However, because my "luck" has always been spelled w/a capital "F", they had just sold their last btl of 1KStories when I walked in. I was heartbroken. But, the wonderfully empathetic staff here not only let me sample the Substance Cab (it was a lovely cab, but I had my heart set on the BB-aged Zin!) before offering me a glass from the last open btl at HH pricing. GreenBay even let me kill what little remained at the end of the night. Great service will always make or break any experience, in my opinion.  It was busier than usual due to it being ATX Beer Week, but even the patrons at this place were gracious. There was not a seat to be had in the house and this kind man at the bar let me have the very tightly squeezed-in seat next to him.  BTW, the reuben here is so nice I had to have it twice! It was just as perfectly delicious the 2nd time as it was the first.  I will definitely be back the next chance I get for another attempt at Wine Wednesday and anytime I need an old school reuben fix. So glad I discovered this place, its vibe, and wonderful staff!

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Wow!  I just love this place ... small menu and all items cooked to perfection!  Weekends include brunch until 4:30 and Sunday comes with live jazz!  Standout items include the veggie taco and steak and eggs!

reviews.author: Jannifer K.
reviews.description: Love, laughter, and happiness. That's what I feel when I come to Hi-Hat. I visited not too long ago and had their eggs benedict for Sunday brunch which was nothing short of amazing. He ordered the Hi-Hat plate which he also enjoyed. We ate and marveled at the talented jazz band that was finishing up their set. This place is cozy, has an enormous selection of beer, and a knockout menu for you to explore (with daily specials). I would come here again and again.  10/10 would recommend this place to others.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: First off, we wasn't planning to come here but looked what was in the area and this place popped up. When you go in, the area is a bit small. You can grab a menu off the wall and then order from the bar. They have a few chairs for bar seating and about 6 tables inside varying from a two seater to a six seater, and there are about 3-4 tables outside and then a bar top around the patio. If it is pretty warm, I would definitely recommend sitting inside. They said that this was the busiest they'd been so food took longer to come out than usual 30 min-1 hour. It was definitely worth the wait! I ordered the eggs Benedict with a cilantro sauce on top and it had chorizo as well! It was greatly prepared and was the perfect amount of food. The biscuits and gravy are also pretty darn good! You can pick how you want your eggs with it, and it also comes with bacon. We only did self serve water, but our total was $26...in the halfway mark price range. WORTH IT THOUGH! The staff are polite and try to do everything to accommodate you and keep up with other customers/work. The only reason I knocked off a star is due to the seating inside, making it hard to fit everyone!

reviews.author: Meagan W.
reviews.description: We rented an Airbnb within walking distance of the Hi Hat. We came for appetizers and beer before an evening tour we had scheduled. The owner greeted us and came over to chat...really nice guy with a lot of well deserved pride in his establishment. We ordered 4 appetizers as a meal. THEY WERE HUGE!!! Easily could have just had two! Everything was delicious. Their pretzels are the best I've ever had, taco was amazing... it was all great. Excellent beer selection on tap, and good live music too!

reviews.author: Lucy L.
reviews.description: The people here are cool. And the food is good. I like the vibe of this joint. We ordered some beer, eggs benedict, Mac n cheese, and spicy brussel sprouts. Can't say that I've ever had chorizo in my Egga Benedict so that was interesting. I'm not sure if I love it but it's def decent. I'll have to say the mac n cheese stole the show hands down. I added it to my order after the bartender and another customer both recommended it. I don't normally eat mac n cheese but I'd def order theirs again!

reviews.author: Rob G.
reviews.description: They had a great 3-man band playing classic tunes. The crispy bacon burgers were delicious and served with rippled potato chips.The beer selection is robust and broad enough for a craft enthusiast. There's decent wine as well. The dessert menu is limited, but that bread pudding though!

reviews.author: Ryen B.
reviews.description: Lunch on the patio while in the area for work. The roasted mushroom sammy with avo spread, roasted tomatoes, and pickles was great. The buttery brioche roll- yum! The side of roasted brussels were also tasty, the serving too big for one person. I'm not typically a sandwich fan, but if you are, this place is a good option.

reviews.author: Robin S.
reviews.description: BBQ is dang delicious. Nom nom nom. Ready to go and all the fringe choices you expect from a convenience store.

reviews.author: Jules C.
reviews.description: I love this place. They have a top notch selection of wine and beer, as well as other non-alcoholic beverages (I Buy my Yerba Mate Tea from them in bulk!). They have your standard corner store snacks but they also have some really unique items, like different types of chocolate and local cookies. The place is always clean and the people who work there are very kind and friendly. Plus they sell Lula Mae's BBQ M-Sat 11am to 8pm and they have a delicious taco truck out front!!

reviews.author: Becky M.
reviews.description: We moved into the neighborhood and we were excited to be able to walk to Brew Market and Cafe. Over the weekend I went in for a late. I ordered the "12 oz" late. When I was handed my late I was shocked at the small size. I asked the guy working if that was really 12 oz and he reassured me that it was. Once I got home I measured the cup because I was certain that it couldn't hold that much. I was correct, it could only hold 8 oz.

reviews.author: Asink A.
reviews.description: Don't be deceive by the outside look. The place looks awesome from inside and has a clean bathroom! I stop here before heading to Houston and got to try some cool Austin beverages and panini.

reviews.author: Laura C.
reviews.description: Nice guys. Gas is usually a decent price for the most part. Just a quick stop and go place.

reviews.author: Stacie H.
reviews.description: Hipside Peddler was way more fun than anticipated! I went on the East Side Ride with a group of friends and Max really took care of us. He was very personable, patient and flexible with how we spent the allotted time. It was a great outing and a very different experience!  On the evening I went it was just our smaller group on the tour so we had full control of the jams, cooler and schedule. We definitely held up traffic a bit when on some of the main roads but the motorists and bystanders we came across waved and cheered us on. Thankfully there is a motor on board so it's not necessary to be fully exerting yourself peddling.  Recommend for a fun activity. Ask for Max!

reviews.author: Rebecca R.
reviews.description: Hipside Peddler is such a FUN thing to do because it is not every day that we get to ride around Austin on an electric assisted bar on wheels, while sippin' on an alcoholic beverage that makes you feel a little bit prettier and blasting your favorite music so loud, that you think you're at the club!! ;))   Sounds fun, right?! :))   Trust me, you WILL for sure get points for creativity if you book a tour w/ Hipside Peddler to celebrate a special occasion.   We booked the "Eastside tour" w/ Hipside Peddler on Saturday, 11/14/2020 to celebrate my friends 40th birthday and we had so much FUN! This was my 1st time so I had no idea what to expect but I can say that I am so glad that we were able to safely celebrate my friend's milestone birthday during this time of pandemic craziness.   Since sharing is caring here are a few of my "Helpful Tips", "FYIs", and "Likes"...  FYI:  *You will be peddling the same way you would if riding a bike so be mindful of your foot wear and you will be getting a mini workout while peddling.    *There are mini fans above each seat that you can turn on, if needed.   *The peddle boat driver does have a plexiglass barrier between him and the passengers as a COVID safety precaution and the peddle boat itself is all open w/out any walls.   *You can tip your peddling boat driver in cash and via Venmo.   *The "Eastside" tour is 2 hours long and we made 3 separate stops at different local bars for 15-20 mins each so you can use the restroom, cool off, take a few pictures w/ your peeps and/or buy a drink while relaxing at each bar.   Our awesome peddle boat driver was Matt and he also made a 4th stop at an Italian ice truck.   *Each passenger must submit a liability waiver and you can do it electronically. Once your tour has been booked, you will get the waiver emailed to you.   Helpful Tip(s): *BEVERAGES~I recommend that you bring your own ice chest already filled w/ ice and beverages (no glass containers are allowed) and there is an open area in the middle of the peddle boat for ice chest storage.  *FOOD~only snacks are allowed and I suggest you bring snacks that are easy to munch on since you will be peddling while eating them. ( ex: mini bags of pretzels, individually wrapped cookies)  *MUSIC~The peddle boat does have a stereo system that is very loud and has a usb that you can connect your phone to for music. I highly recommend that you create a music playlist of songs that help set the vibe that you're going for.   I made a playlist using Spotify of all the songs I wanted to play.   Lastly, I just wanted to give a huge shout out to Matt, who was our p.d driver because he really did a GREAT job of explaining "all things peddle boat" :) and putting us at ease so we could fully enjoy ourselves. This was so appreciated because each of us were newbie peddle boat passengers.   Stay AWESOME Hipside Peddler and for sure I'll be seeing you again very soon!   ~Rebecca out

reviews.author: Rachel C.
reviews.description: The hipside peddler was the perfect activity for our bachelorette party. Alex was amazing and gave us the 411 on all the great bars. We had such a great time and highly recommend at all parties!

reviews.author: Alexandra H.
reviews.description: Alex was such a badass tour guide! Really made our experience worth while celebrating my friends birthday! If you haven't done this yet, DO IT AND REQUEST ALEX!!!!!

reviews.author: Yee S.
reviews.description: Had so much fun with Alex! The bike was super easy to peddle and everything was so much fun. Definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Corinne L.
reviews.description: Had the best time on the Hipside Peddler when visiting Austin for a bachelorette party! Alex was an awesome guide and showed us some great bars in East Austin. Will definitely recommend to friends.

reviews.author: Megan T.
reviews.description: ALEX MADE MY WHOLE ASS BACHELORETTE PARTY WORTH IT. It was so boring until we went on our cycle tour. SUCH a fun time! He talked about his girlfriend the whole time but it was super cute. He even let me drive a little bit.  WE LOVE YOU ALEX YOU'RE A BAD ASS

reviews.author: Michelle C.
reviews.description: We had the BEST time celebrating the bride on Hipside! Alex was the freaking best. Vanessa, you're a lucky gal!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Request Alex!!

reviews.author: Jesse K.
reviews.description: Fabulous Bachlorette party idea! they're so accommodating our party had the BEST time.

reviews.author: Leo H.
reviews.description: Hipside peddler is a great time when you have your closest friends and family enjoying the ride! Alex was a great host and showed us the trendiest breweries in Austin!

reviews.author: Lorely D.
reviews.description: Ahhhh!!!!! Alex is the best tour guide in all of Texas.  we went to the coolest bars with the best beer  touring the city was fun and the bus came with overhead fans. 10/10 recommend

reviews.author: Georgie C.
reviews.description: ALEX IS 11/10. This is the most fun I've ever had. He's amazing, definitely book with hipside.

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Alex was an amazing host for our mother's day shenanigans!!! Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Delaney J.
reviews.description: Easily the best bar bike tour in Austin. Our guide, Matt was so friendly and accommodating. I've had a negative experience with a different bar bike company in Austin, so was worried to  try it again. I'm so glad I did! Would definitely go again! Ask for Matt if he is available!!!

reviews.author: Olivia M.
reviews.description: It was a labor of love! My bride squad and I had a great time cruisin' and boozin' around Austin on our Hipside Peddler. We brought our own personal favorites: music, snacks and wine, but also enjoyed the food and bevs of the places we stopped. A few of our pit stops included: Grackle, Zilker Brewing Co., Yellow Jacket Social Club, and Lazarus Brewing Company. Our guide, Rachel, was fun, full of energy and took great care of our party!   I would definitely recommend this little adventure/bar hopping tour to anyone looking for a good time for a special occasion, or just something fun to do with friends in the city!

reviews.author: Whitney D.
reviews.description: If you're looking for an incredibly fun afternoon sipping drinks and exploring East Austin, look no further! Our group had an incredible time with Matt and Hipside Peddler. Communication before hand was easy and clear. Matt was a great driver and tour guide. Highly recommend to anyone interested in a Pedal Pub!

reviews.author: Nick C.
reviews.description: We found Hipside Peddler after our Float the River tour was cancelled due to weather. We booked the day before our tour with no problems (it helped we were a full sized tour on our own) and we had a blast. We visited three locations: Yellow Jacket Social Club (dive bar), Zilker Brewing Co, and Lazarus Brewing Co. we were able to spend an hour at each of the first two locations and a little less than 30 min at Lazarus. You are able to bring your own beer for consumption on the peddler. Also - bring a phone with music - an aux cord is available. It rained during our ride but it was still very enjoyable. The peddler even offered us each a poncho to stay dry. Definitely recommend the peddle tavern if you're in town with friends/bachelor/bachelorette party.

reviews.author: Kendal D.
reviews.description: You just can't make this shit up people lol!!  Very disappointed with our experience. Went to Austin for a bachelorette party. Was looking forward to this being a highlight of our trip. First bar was very empty and very sketchy. In the middle of a not so welcoming neighborhood (even our Uber driver afterwards confirmed we were not in a good part of town). We left our first stop about 10 minutes in due to it being a total bust. On our way to the second stop our bike started making loud clicking noises. Our driver looked like he was trying to get the motor on board to work by pushing his pedal down over and over and that didn't work either. He tried to tell us we weren't pedaling hard enough and that it was our fault the bike wouldn't move so he was just going to skip right to the last bar.... only about 30-45 minutes into our trip. That didn't seem right. Bike ended up completely stopping in a very uncomfortable area. We had a few homeless men try hitching a ride and both bachelorette parties on board had their brides pushing the bike from behind just to get it off the street. Keep in mind, we had several CrossFit competitors on board who could not get the bike to move when pedaling. Shouldn't have been an issue considering they squat double their own weight. I've been on several trips in different places and never had an issue moving the bikes I've been on even up small hills. Our party decided we would end our experience with this bike and Uber to Rainey street which was AWESOME. But this company refuses to refund us and claims the bike was in perfect working condition. There's just no way! I'm attaching a few photos of what we documented. It's something we are laughing about now that it's been a few days but we were very upset when it happened. Also, our driver/ guide didn't help at all when we were telling him that the homeless people were trying to hitch a ride on the back. And our bike was decked out in Pizza Hut signs as if they were being sponsored. All around, most uncomfortable, unprofessional, and shady experience any of us have ever had. I do highly recommend Rainey street for anyone visiting from out of town, but avoid this company at all costs. We all (both bachelorette parties that ditched our tour) had a blast on Rainey street, but hated this tour!!!

reviews.author: Whitney T.
reviews.description: Hipside Peddler was amazing! They surpassed all expectations. We had a great lead driver- Wesley- and the route for East Side Ride was great. Good fun, music, great spots and an overall amazing time. Perfect for our bachelorette party!

reviews.author: Ann G.
reviews.description: Thank you Matt ! We had a blast on our tour of East Austin.  It was very easy to book Matt was great about answering all our questions.  Plus he was very accommodating overall.    We had a great time and it was easy to peddle (I had envisioned it being a hard workout !).    It was a great time for our group and we hope to back !      Recommend for groups who are local or visiting !

reviews.author: Jules J.
reviews.description: Made our 1st trip to Mueller Farmers Market on 8/23/18 It was over 100 degrees outside and we were all ready for a cool refreshment (my 5 year old twins, 3 year old, husband, and myself). We arrived right at opening and found SoCo Gingerbeer. The girl (maybe late 20's early 30's) did not acknowledge our presence as we were the first and only potential customers. She was also extremely unprepared. After a couple minutes standing there waiting on her (she was adding ice into the large containers) she FINALLY spoke to us. "It will be a few minutes" she said brashly. No smile , no welcome, it was as if we were inconveniencing her.   I felt uncomfortable and completely unwelcome but we stayed because our littles were thirsty.   Finally, after 10 minutes after opening, this gal was ready for us and she gave us samples upon our request. Also, zero empathy or apology for making us wait on her.   The samples were as hot or hotter than the temperature outside and really off putting. She sampled some hot ginger beer herself and remarked to herself in a gloating manner how great it was. It was a joke. She had a huge chip on her shoulder. Perhaps having a bad day, but I have worked years of customer service and you NEVER take it out on your customers. So unprofessional.   The customers thereafter us (a mom with two young girls) were also waiting on this chic and not treated with a welcome as well, unfortunately. The entire time, actually, this employee never cracked a smile or had any intentions of carrying out at the least, mediocre customer service. It was appalling and quite bothersome.   Suffice to say, we left. And I wonder how many others she has turned away.

reviews.author: Kati K.
reviews.description: I have never tried ginger beer and liked it before. This ginger beer is amazing! I went to the Lakeline Farmers Market on a hot day and was very pleasantly surprised how refreshing and delicious the Beet Ginger Beer was great. It would be wonderful as a mixer but I find it just as refreshing as a cool down cocktail. I got an inside word from the young lady Elaine at the booth that they are going to serve a prickly pear flavor next weekend. This time I'm going to pick up two bottles. If you reuse your bottles you get a discount that's so great too!

reviews.author: Will G.
reviews.description: I tried this at the Cedar Park farmers market and instantly got hooked. Now I buy 3 bottles a week. This makes a good mixer with whiskey, specifically Woodford Reserve.

reviews.author: Ann L.
reviews.description: It's very light and refreshing drink- cooled me down on a hot day in Austin! Go for the Extra if you don't like something super sweet and enjoys a ginger flavour.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Passed by this stand at the mueller farmers market and I LOVE ginger beer. And I LOVE hibiscus. Enter hibiscus ginger beer. Soooo freaking delicious. We got a cup, and tried the other on tap, jalapeño lime and the extra ginger- all good (though I don't like the flavor of sweet jalapeños) but hibiscus was my favorite. After downing it we went to the car and got our growler and went back to get some to go. Hibiscus was sold out so we did the extra ginger and it was soooo spicy and good. Kudos to them, they're doing good work in their ginger beer.

reviews.author: Larissa S.
reviews.description: Adorable. Great cigar selection, and so thankful they have wine and beer to sip with it. The friendliness and familiarity between the regulars and staff, which they'll warmly welcome you in on, is what really makes this place special.

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: I really wanted to like this place - as I need a local cigar shop- but you cannot overlook their blatant disregard for local COVID requirements.   First, the shop is quaint and located in a very cool shopping area off of HWY 12. They also have a decent selection of classic and unique cigars. That is the positive.   However, they are selfishly thumbing their nose at COVID regulations. The staff does not wear masks or require patrons to wear them when they are up and about. There is absolutely no social distancing and it is usually packed to overflowing on weekends.   When a business refuses to abide by local and state guidelines in something as serious and life-threatening as COVID, it makes you question where else they ignore health and safety protocols. I do not trust that they keep their shop or the tobacco products safe and sanitary if they are unwilling to adhere to these basic guidelines. This should be a MASSIVE red flag for anyone thinking of shopping here.   I do not trust an establishment with this mindset, nor the local authorities that refuse to enforce these rules. It is shameful.

reviews.author: Dan R.
reviews.description: Great selection of my favorite stinkers...offers of firewater to those so predisposed. Canine friendly, ashHole suppresion available when necessary.

reviews.author: Levi E.
reviews.description: I love Smokey's Cigar Lounge. Nice people, great owner. I disagree with the reviewer who knocked the location due to COVID protocols. We quarantined with each other for months. We stayed 6 feet away from one another. I know; I was there nearly every day. It's difficult for any business who had to navigate the tricky waters of early 2020's pandemic onslaught. It was new territory for everyone and significantly different messages coming from authorities in the "know".  And with all that being said, you have a fairly recently opened small business trying to survive.  IMHO, anyone hating on this establishment is welcome to stay away.    Great cigars, great beverages, great community support. Don't change a thing.  Levi

reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: Great cigar selection and super helpful and friendly staff to a novice cigar smoker like myself.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: My wingman and I were chilling out at Treaty Oak Distillery having a few cocktails and enjoying watching round 3 of the Masters. When by pure coincidence I met a couple who I have not seen in years. We mentioned that we had cigars but it was too windy to smoke em. They said there was a chill cigar bar right up the street. We watched Tiger make a par on 18 and off we went.  We were greeted immediately by Allison, the manager, and given a quick tour of the venue. There are comfy seats and a small bar area that serves beer, wine, and water. The humidor is laid out very well and their cigars are stored perfectly. Allison patiently explained that there are two sections in the humidor the usual favorites and "her" boutique cigars. I selected a beautiful light Nicaraguan rolled cigar. This baby smoked smooth right down to the label.   The lounge itself is ventilated nicely so you are not smoking in a haze or smoking your cigar and other guys cigar as well. There was also a good beer selection. We had a blonde ale from Two Wheel Brewery in Buda. Good choice.   Smokey's is a chill venue, friendly patrons, and professional knowledgeable staff equal 5 stars all day!

reviews.author: Laura P.
reviews.description: Great cigars! And fabulous owner Chris!  So knowledgeable of cigars and pairing with certain alcoholic beverages.

reviews.author: Jessica G.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I enjoyed this place so much. It was quaint and comfortable to relax and try cigars and drinks. My only feedback is for more variety in cigars - they had a lot of local brands which isn't bad but not a strong selection and to choose from. The service was excellent and the place was clean.

reviews.author: Chase C.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem. Allison is a cigar guru, you give her two cigars you like, she will show you three others to suit your palette. Prices are great, and the beer selection is fantastic. (Try the maduro) And if you like a little adventure, try the port with your next stick, a great pairing!

reviews.author: Lyndsey S.
reviews.description: I'm so glad we finally got a cigar lounge in Drip and Smokey's doesn't disappoint. I didn't get to sit and smoke but I saw how relaxed everyone was. I love that many of the cigars in the humidor are made by guys in Texas, especially the ones by a veteran who lives nearby. How cool is that? Make sure you talk to Allison too. She gives you the low down of every cigar and helps you find the perfect one for you. She's really nice and very helpful in her descriptions. My husband and I are looking forward to a date night at Smokey's.

reviews.author: Dino S.
reviews.description: Great spot for cigars, relaxing, and good conversation. Owner is super nice and everyone inside is friendly.

reviews.author: Henry W.
reviews.description: Best cigar bar and lounge I have been to! Great casual ambiance, super broad cigar selection in humidor, friendly staff, cold beer, fine wine. Music, indoor/outdoor seating, and all the amenities (big screen TV, lounge chairs, cutters/lighters, hand sanitizer, more). Meet you there June 13th from 6:00PM for live music!!!

reviews.author: David S.
reviews.description: If you haven't been, you don't know what you are missing. Locally owned and operated, this place has it all.  Great selection of cigars - my head was spinning with how many options but not to worry -  Allison was there with all of my questions. I'm def not a cigar aficionado but with the staff's help I was able to find a great smoke. I was impressed that they support local cigar companies and go the extra mile to make the everyone feel at home.  Can't recommend this place enough.

reviews.author: Amanda L.
reviews.description: I had the pleasure of meeting Chris while he was at Treaty Oak Distillery.  He is so kind has has a wonderful comfortable and just flat out super neat airstream! It was roomy, place to cut and dust off your cigar, a TV for viewing.  It was such a unique find! I would totally have had this at my wedding years ago if I knew him back then!

reviews.author: Jim P.
reviews.description: Excellent service and selection!  Comfortable lounge chairs, friendly atmosphere.  Indeed a hidden gem!  A great place to relax and have a good smoke.

reviews.author: Chanel L.
reviews.description: I was lucky enough to find Chris for my wedding. We thought their airstream would be a fun "man cave" addition to an otherwise very feminine wedding...boy were we misguided! Half the bridal party and many of our female guests ended up checking out the cigar bar and loved it! As a woman, I feel like creating a space where women feel welcome in what is traditionally considered a masculine space is a clear indicator of the quality and professionalism of their business.  Not only was Chris helpful, very communicative and and priced well - he and his wife were so much fun to be around! They both made our day special and unique and I highly recommend them for events. They definitely went above and beyond to ensure the day was special and went smoothly.   The airstream itself is luxuriously appointed and classy. Their cigar storage and bar amenities were top notch and I'm sure their huge tv would be great for sports games and such. Definitely a fantastic addition to my big day and I'd highly recommend them!

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: First, I have to say the ambiance of this place is pretty awesome. Very chill and there isn't loud music. The staff are friendly and the food is even more amazing! I got the Po-Po. This was basically a BLT but they put an amazing garlic mayo spread on it. I think the best combination is to have it on wheat bread. It was so stellar that as I finished and looked up, my bf and two friends were only halfway done eating! Definitely going back to this place!  Street parking, outside patio, bar inside with seating as well.

reviews.author: TJ H.
reviews.description: On a recent trip to Austin upon arriving around lunch time we checked into our AirBnB and were in need of some lunch quickly!  Our AirBnB host recommended Gourmands as a good local spot.  We headed over and found there was plenty of parking and it was very quiet on a random weekday around lunchtime.  I like their system of scanning the menu and just ordering from the table, however it was sort of odd to not interact with anyone upon entering.  The only real greeting we received was from someone poking their head out of kitchen to let us know we could sit anywhere and order with the QR code. I imagine that would be a but different when the restaurant is more crowded though. We ordered some soup in a bread bowl and a couple sandwiches.  The food was promptly brought to us.  The bread bowl was awesome, along with the chili.  The sandwiches were also good, high quality bread and everything on the sandwich tasted very fresh!  Gourmands was a solid place to get some fresh food quickly without having to wrestle with parking and lines in some of the more populated areas of Austin. Good lunch spot!

reviews.author: Terran O.
reviews.description: Gourmands is one of my favorite takeout places in Austin. I usually get the Second Deadly Sin with fresh avocados. The salads can be weird, and I'm not a fan of the soup+bread bowls, but conceptually they are interesting.   Eating in at Gourmands is more fun if you go alone. The atmosphere is very traditional pub, so if you're seated at the bar having a meal and your drink, you'll almost always find good conversation. It's less fun to go with someone for a sit down meal, as it really is more of a bar than a restaurant, even though the food is pretty good. Quirky's not exactly the right word. It's idiosyncratic, and kind of addicting?   After Thoughts for Advanced Listeners: I want to be at a place in my journey where I can eat a Cleopatra and not feel I'm missing out on meat.

reviews.author: kelsey w.
reviews.description: Legit will be craving this Cleopatra sammich for the rest of my life. Nice and light with delish pickled veggies on the side. Fiancé has the Orgy and he loved it. Dig the laid back vibe and easy parking.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: I really wish I loved this place more because I was so excited to bread bowls, but it fell really short of my expectations. My friend and I sat in the outdoor patio area, and there were so many empty tables with eaten food left on the tables that hadn't been cleared yet. Summer is coming, so there were a ton of flies that were attracted to the food that eventually came to bother us when our food arrived.   My friend and I ordered spinach and artichoke dip to share, and I had the clam chowder and Deadly Sin sandwich combo. Firstly, the spinach and artichoke dip had so much cream cheese in it that it didn't taste like artichoke or spinach. It was really thick and gloppy, and I felt heavy just eating it. My clam chowder was really lacking in the clam flavor, and it also wasn't that good. The sandwich was okay. Nothing special about it.   I am pretty sad that I didn't love this place because prices aren't terrible, and the concept of soup in bread bowls is awesome. Not many places in Austin serve that. However, they seem really understaffed and the food itself isn't good enough to warrant a second trip.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: I tried the Broccoli Cheese Soup again and realized the funny aftertaste is probably not from the cheese, but from the beer in it. As a non-drinker my tastebuds didn't compute this right on the first try. The soup and bread bowls are delicious but of course they leave you feeling extremely full! I'd been craving a chicken salad sandwich, so the Foghorn Leghorn hit the spot.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Sandwiches are amazingly good. I get the Cleopatra on rye and it's superb. I love their pickled sides and veggies too. Their soups and salads are fantastic too. Their delivery system is a bit cumbersome and has glitches but they're aware and make it right when it messes up. In person, this place has awesome ping pong table set up as well as a great outdoor space. It's a great hangout. Chill and has great food - the two best things you want in a gastro-pub.

reviews.author: Katrina B.
reviews.description: I love Gourmands! Great spacious patio, plenty of seating inside, relaxed divey vibes, a game room, and parking is pretty easy. The sandwiches are beyond incredible and can't come recommended enough! Right now, you seat yourself and order from your phone at your table via a QR code.   We got the Second Deadly Sin and Chili, and both came out delicious and served with house made pickles and chips. The Black Bean soups is in incredible vegan option I've had multiple times.   Bring your pup when you go to the patio!

reviews.author: Mayra A.
reviews.description: Great food and awesome vibe. This place feels like classic Austin 15 years ago . The sandwiches and soup are fantastic and they even serve 32 oz beers. Highly recommended

reviews.author: Kirsten G.
reviews.description: Super fun place with a very roomy outdoor patio.  The staff wears mask and your order drinks/food via QR Code at the table.  The atmosphere here is relaxed and you can bring your dog on the patio.    I had a Philly Cheesesteak it was super tasty and they have options if you don't drink or want to try something else.  They have a great tasting  Prickly Pear Lemonade.  The rest of the people in my party had great looking food come out too.    And they have a parking lot, but there is also easy street parking too.  And the staff was super friendly!!

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: This place is really gone downhill here right after work on a Tuesday and the bartender seems like half asleep and attentive and pouring very weak weak drinks I do not recommend this place unless you're here they're in or one of his friends in order to get attention

reviews.author: Don E.
reviews.description: Had a soup and sandwich. The portions are a good size and the food is priced fair.   I had the orgy which is a hot peppered pastrami, Swiss cheese, coleslaw, and house-made Thousand Island dressing. Served on pumpernickel rye bread. With a broccoli beer cheese soup. The sand which was ok not great. Bread was a little hard and the soup was a bit too watery.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: A combo lunch that doesn't skimp on portions for only $10?!? Hot dog! Well, more like hot soup and sandwich or salad (no hot dogs on the menu).   The soup is served in a bread bowl (French bread, not sourdough!) and they have four or five options. I went with the broccoli and cheese which was more like queso with a few chunks of broccoli in it, but heck, maybe Gourmands knows me better than I know myself, as that's probably what I really wanted anyhow! I scarfed it down and had to stop myself from eating the entire bowl of bread. The chicken salad sandwich was lovely, but because I went full hungry girl on the soup (and homemade chips), I didn't eat it until the next day for lunch. Again, a lot of combo for your buck!  The place definitely blends in with the neighborhood, it's dive-y looking on the inside with a bunch of cheerful regulars at the bar (also the type of establishment you'd see a baby on a hip and a beer in hand), a TON of tables and booths for groups, and ping pong and skee-ball in the back. They've got a small parking lot, too.

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: This place has a great atmosphere with an equally amazing staff. The inside is a pretty good size, but it also has a big patio which is honestly my favorite.   I was pleasantly surprised by how bomb the sandwiches are here; I think the chips are homemade too , which is a big plus.   My group of friends started coming here pretty frequently and it's definitely a good place to chill; they have ping pong, ski ball, arcade games...it's everything someone would want in a bar experience!

reviews.author: Meg B.
reviews.description: I'm so glad that Gourmands is open and has an amazing patio bar to enjoy during these unique times. Their food is outstanding house made....well just about everything! Their bread bowls and soup are so tasty. Sandos even the boys of letterkenny would crush. Plus friendly staff. 11/10 recommend.

reviews.author: Anna K.
reviews.description: You guys i've been going to gourmands for years and I finally went back since they reopened and it was...awful. We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip which we always do and it was literally milk with artichokes it was pretty gross. Then it took over an hour to get our soups and sandwiches. THEN on top of that i ordered the royal and they gave me mushrooms instead of meat (which I didn't order). I did tell the waiter and all he said was sorry(didn't offer to fix it). It sucks but i don't think i'll be returning there which is a shame bc i tell all my friends and always speak so highly about it.

reviews.author: Frances H.
reviews.description: I am a person who loves a good pub. Dark inside with regulars bellied up to the bar and not a high turnover rate within the wait staff. That's this kind of place.   I can see this place being an awesome, standard spot to grab a drink with regulars on any given day or night, but what we came in for was their highly-rated bread bowl soups and dang - they don't disappoint. The bread was soft and the perfect consistency - sturdy yet edible, which I feel is hard to come by with bread bowls. They offer a lot of great lunch options, like a soup and salad, sandwich and salad, or salad and soup. I went with the cobb salad and their black bean soup. To be fair, the server did warn me the soup was spicy, but I was definitely sweating a bit while sipping this delicious soup. The bread was a wonderful compliment to the spice and really soaked it up so I could keep going back for more!  On the way out, we noticed a room in the back with skee ball. Yep, we will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: The Bucchus was really good, but everything else was average. The Spinach and Artichoke dip was a lot thicker than I had expected, but I did like that it came in a bread bowl (maxed out on carbs this day). The sandwich we ordered was just okay.  The food came out super fast and everything is relatively cheap!

reviews.author: Kimi F.
reviews.description: This place is just LOVELY! They currently have their patio open for full service dine in as well as doing to go orders. They have a great outdoor patio surrounding a gorgeous tree. I absolutely loved my spicy loaded Bloody Mary, it brought me back to life. I really appreciated their drink menu in general, I mean they had Jell-O shots! Yes please! I will be back for that when I'm in a boozier mood. The food was great, it was hard to pick as so many sandwiches looked good. We went with the bacchus, Texas chili, the second deadly sin, and clam chowder in a bread bowl. The plates came with chow chow and house chips. We ate up every bite! I'll be back for sure, and next time I'm getting a Jell-O shot!

reviews.author: Renee J.
reviews.description: First, their hours of operations is beyond the usual " close at 9 or 10 pm", as working late hours loved this.  Second, while a very small choice of items on menu, they are very diverse.  Third, as mentioned in other reviews, service is casual/slow. But the staff is really friendly and I wasn't in a hurry.  Fourth, the portion and quality of food is excellent. I highly recommend the clam chowder. The chicken tortilla salad was good, but it was unexpectedly spicy.  Fifth, you would normally pay twice the amount at lesser restaurants. 2 local draughts, soup, full salad $24.   So, drop by. I know I will be returning.  My Star Ratings:  1 Star - my experience was majorly disappointing. Recommend keep searching for another establishment. 2 Stars - Unlikely for me to return.  3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to.  4 Stars - Really good! This is worth sharing the experience so others will want to try the place. 5 Stars - WOW! You really need to make sure you try this place out, worth planning your day / travels to go there.  If you are curious why I have so many 4 and 5 star ratings, it is because I tend to only seek Yelp reviews at this level.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: I had come across the Beer Museum via a local blog I follow and I initially thought it was going to be one of those lame things that Austin tries to make sound cool and innovative, but turns out to be an overhyped hipster disappointment. I was so glad I was so wrong!  First off, the idea of the Beer Museum is just fantastic! A friend who is adverse to anything museum related actually enjoyed the lil displays and info-snippets when we got to experience the Beer Museum at WhichCraft. So, if you are a beer nerd, then this is the kinda thing that will capture your interest.  Second, there is not a brick n mortar location as of yet (however, you can help make that a reality by donating on the website), so as of now, this place is completely mobile. You can see where their next location will be on their website as well.  Third, Matt and Virginia, the founders and curators of this beertastic brainchild are two of the nicest people you will meet and it was great talking beer with them. Some of the beer memorabilia they had on display was just awesome!  Fourth, you can purchase Beer Museum gear and spread the gospel. Since purchasing and sporting my Beer Museum shirt, I have gotten stopped and asked about it more times than someone wearing a tshirt probably should.  So yeah, check them out and support a beer cause!

name: Aviator Pizza and Drafthouse- Parmer Lane

reviews.author: Blair V.
reviews.description: First time I ordered from here was through Door Dash and we enjoyed very bite of our order. Second visit we decided to dine in. It was crazy packed on a Friday evening but they had plenty of seating indoors and outdoors!  We ordered the Foccacio cheese sticks (basil, mozzarella and goat cheese) - a hit for us when we ordered to go previously. We also tried something different which was the Monty. We also ordered a Caesar salad- pricey for a salad in my opinion but this is a good option if you feel like you need that balanced meal!  The Monty was the least of my favorite. We have stuck to ordering the Flying Garlic Pizza after our first visit and it never disappoints. It has become a must order for us and will continue to stay that way!

reviews.author: Esther A.
reviews.description: Super family friendly with outside play area for kids.  Lines were a little confusing. I ordered the major tom, pepperoni was very crispy but the veggies were a little undercooked would've preffered them a bit more cooked.  The meat almighty was better, pepperoni was crispy and the cooked ham was very tasty (i dont usually like ham that much!) The dough was doughy, and floppy.

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: This is the worst experience I have had in awhile with management. To begin, with follow my pics.. I ordered a major tom (supreme pizza) with EXTRA sauce thru door dash. At 7:55 within a few min I received notification it was being picked up.  I call store to inquire how is that possible if it was freshly made. The store hung up on me. So, I worked w door dash who asked me to wait for delivery to see if there is a quality issue. I did just that, only to receive a pizza that was warm but based on the cheese amount, semi chilled veggies I knew I wasn't too off base when I had my reservations about it to begin with.  I call store - ask for manager, even though I know door dash will ultimately handle. However, I just wanted to know how you can make a pizza in 5 min and say its fresh. Manager says sorry for the hang up like she's singing to a tune of a tiny violin; then tells me they don't have base pizzas sitting around (kind of like Villa in the mall that adds toppings when u order). I ask why is there so much cheese then and no sauce. Clearly cheese is added and is already rubbered up. Short answer and ultimate answer from her was another unbelivable sorry and to work with door dash.   What's sad here..Villa Pizza (mall pizza) is better than this any day. And I'm kicking myself for not going with Salvation pizza instead. Aviator down south was awesome but this Parmer Lane site is lacking customer skills and good pizza.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Pizza dough was undercooked.   Hefty toppings  $10 for a large sized personal pan pizza  You order straight from your table via your cell phone.   Nothing special worth returning.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Absolutely love their pizza! Usually get it to go. I've been at other locations in Austin, and they are all good.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: 2nd favorite pizza in Austin!  I love pizza. If I were choosing my last meal it would be a toss up between pizza and beer or filet mignon and merlot (or Shiraz). I digress...pizza...it must have a great crust-never EVER soggy, a well-balanced sauce, and just the right amount of cheese. Lastly, the maker must not skimp on the chosen toppings.  Well done, Aviator! My friend and I shared the "pizza of the day", and it was fabulous (though I don't remember the name of it). The crust had that initial crunch followed by the perfect chewiness. We each had a light beer with hints of blueberry-um...yummy!  Aviator is new to this location, and still getting established, so it was dead inside. I suspect this will be a popular lunch place for nearby companies such as Apple, Oracle, etc. There is a huge outside play area for those of you who have kiddos-great for birthday parties.  I prefer quieter places, so it misses the mark for me regarding atmosphere. You can see the pizza makers through a glass window, and the kitchen appeared clean. There are ample choices of beer and lots of great food options too. I've been twice and suspect it will be a fav of mine. Give it a try. Let me know what you think.

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Currently writing this updated review in my car because for the 2nd time, my curbside pickup was messed up. My pickup time was 6:20 pm, and it's now 6:50 pm.  The 1st time I wrote off because I thought it was a fluke. Also, I know the staff is busy on a Saturday night and it's tough to find staffing these days during COVID. Maybe I'll try eating in store next time.   But cmon now, my wife is pissed off because I convinced her to get Aviator over another pizza shop. Well, whenever I get my order, I'll eat it in the doghouse when I get back.

reviews.author: Kasper L.
reviews.description: Yay, more pizza! I love pizza, and I feel like there's a lot of pizza places popping up in Austin over the years. So many options but I'm not sure if this will be high in my rotation of pizza places.   I do like the restaurant space. The outdoor area is nice and kid friendly with the playground. Aviator has a wide selection of beers (at least from what I could tell). I think the pizza is good but unfortunately I think there are better places for pizza. Weirdly, I think their normal pies (with red sauce) are kind of lackluster. I did enjoy their non-traditional pies. The chicken bacon ranch and the taco pizza were pretty great!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Today, I ordered a to-go order for pick-up so I could do yet ANOTHER lunch and learn... how much learning do I really need to do?????? I ordered two items: the caprese salad and the black olive and caprese pesto grinder.   Caprese-  Caprese salad is a simple Italian salad, made of sliced fresh  mozzarella, tomatoes, and sweet basil, seasoned with salt, olive oil, or  balsamic vinaigrette. This is a menu item that really can't be 'messed up'. It is simple and to the point. This caprese was accompanied by a side of vinaigrette.  Black Olive and caprese pesto grinder-  This item was unexpectedly good. This meatless Monday treat contained black olives, mozzarella, red onions, baby spinach, and a Roma tomato pesto base. This sandwich provided a balanced mixture of sweet (from the tomatoes and red onions) slightly sour (from the mozzarella) and earthy (from the pesto) bites. Although hearty in its contents, this sandwich was actually very light on the palate.   #supportlocal

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Aviator Pizza and Drafthouse was busy on a week night and sadly understaffed. The dough was pretty good but I did not like the flavor combination in the South Austin pizza with the vinaigrette and red sauce. I did like the cinnamon and pecan dessert pizza. Large outdoor patio and large beer selection.

reviews.author: Jonathan L.
reviews.description: Happy to see a local pizzeria that's in NW Austin and dare I say better than Pinthouse? Two 14 inch / Large pizzas are enough for 3-4 people which amounts to $50 approximately. Pricing is reasonable. Online ordering is straightforward and pick up time is 20-30 minutes after an order is placed. I noticed they had ample seating both indoors and outdoors.   Our personal favorites include: 1. Flying Garlic: Garlic butter base, fresh baby spinach, roasted garlic, grilled chicken, feta and crushed red peppers. 2. The Greek: Pesto base, kalamata olives, portobella mushrooms, artichoke, feta and fresh basil 3. Spinach and Artichoke: Red sauce base, fresh baby spinach, artichoke, and feta cheese.   Another pizza we tried was called "South Austin" (Red sauce base, prosciutto, goat cheese, wild arugula tossed in our home made honey balsamic wine vinaigrette) was also good but not as tasty as the other three.  The crust was the perfect level of crunchiness without being overly done. Toppings were all fresh and VERY generous. We came back a second time in the same week. It's that good.

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: On this deliciously lazy Sunday, the darling husband and I knew that pizza was just the only thing that would do. Jersey Giant Pizza, he suggested? Quick, easy, cheap, and reliably tasty. Closed on Sundays, I lamented. DeSano's, I countered? His eyes lit up, but then I remembered that, although we adore DeSano Pizzeria Napoletana to bloody distraction, we should probably try something brand-new for a little variety...and for me to review! Why not? Enter Aviator Pizza and Drafthouse!  Local? Check! Solid reviews? Check. Hubby's a helicopter pilot and trying out this place is, therefore, too hard to resist? Check. Cute pizza names? Check. Yummy pictures? Check. Let's do this!   (Note: all three are takeout 9-inch pies with no mods, except for hubby's deletion of the green peppers on his Ground Control.)  The Greek: this one was my flavor profile to an ABSOLUTE T! It reminded me a bit of Joe's Pizza at Star Pizza in Houston, but better! A riotous feta, pesto, artichoke, basil, mushroom, and kalamata olive party on a crust! Hugely flavorful! This goes on the culinary Rolodex post-haste!    The Flying Garlic: very garlicky! Shocker, right? Lol! Well, we are garlic people, so we endorse this pie whole-heartedly! The buttery crust, the garlic cloves, and the feta were just unctuous!   Ground Control (minus green peppers): Hubby liked this, but he didn't super-love it. He kept snagging pieces of the Greek and the Flying Garlic. I asked him what his least favorite part was, and he said that it really wasn't fair to judge it on such a small pie. He wants to give it one more shot with a larger pizza! His theory is that small pizzas make the fillings hard to shine. Makes sense!   As I write this, though, he's literally humming Ground Control to Major Tom as he kicks back on the couch playing Call of Duty: Cold War with a warm and happy belly, so I consider this a solid win. We'll definitely be back soon to dine in! Thanks, Aviator!

reviews.author: Glenn W.
reviews.description: Good pizza, if you like it on the sweet side. Today's wasn't quite cooked through, might ask for crispy next time.

reviews.author: Cheyenne H.
reviews.description: I've passed by Aviator several times and finally decided to try it with a friend.  We came at 8pm and the place was fairly busy. Unfortunately, the ordering process itself was very confusing. You can either follow a bunch of arrows to the counter and order (with few menus available), or you can seat yourself and order through a QR code and have someone bring your food to you.  We chose to go to the counter and ordered two Bear King beers that had great flavor- we were allowed to sample before ordering which was a plus. There were 50+ beers/wines to choose from so endless options... you can opt for a flight too. We also ordered two small pizzas (BBQ Chicken and Spinach and Artichoke) that came out in ~10 minutes. The pizzas had a thicker crust and were DELICIOUS! I'd definitely order again.   There were plenty of picnic style tables inside and out, and the outdoor patio had beautiful string lights, a playground, umbrellas, and lots of open space. Parking is easy in and easy out, and the staff were friendly.  Overall, I'd recommend Aviator. Great quality pizza in North Austin.

reviews.author: TJ R.
reviews.description: Ordered a large veggie 'deep' via GrubHub. Arrived early, smelled amazing. Tastes amazing. Very very greasy and heavy and bready. Excellent leftover the next morning. Lotsa flavor and quite filling. Veggies seemed fresh.   Vegans: beware of L-Cysteine.

reviews.author: Andrew B.
reviews.description: Delicious pizza with plenty of options.  Plus they have vegan options too!  I had my favorite type of pizza: jalapeno peppers, banana peppers, and mushrooms, with vegan cheese.  The cashier was warm, enthusiastic, and friendly.    The portions satisfy.  The tap water is delicious.    I don't have kids, but if you have kids, realize they have a huge playground outside.    A delicious meal.  Yum.

reviews.author: Scott Y.
reviews.description: I live on the NW side of Austin, and we don't have a lot of great food places as the South side of Austin has, especially when it comes to pizza. I picked this place solely on my fellow yelpers reviews. They were spot on! I didn't go in as I was in a hurry and opted for curbside. I ordered both the Pepperoni and Basil pizza, as well As the grilled chicken bbq pizza. Both were amazing, especially the pepperoni basil. I now have my go to pizza place for my cheat day when I don't feel like driving all the way down to via 313, pieous, or home slice.

reviews.author: Emily T.
reviews.description: Went here on a friend's recommendation but honestly was a little let down. My husband and mom loved it but I felt they could do morr flavorwise with all the fun ingredients they had going on. The crust was bland and doughy and the brussel sprouts could have been cooked longer. Also their high stools aren't super comfortable so would not recommend sitting on those.

reviews.author: AJ B.
reviews.description: This pizza was very good, but the curbside pick up did not go well. We ordered online a Major Tom, Thin crust cheese pizza, and two sides of ranch. I arrived a little after the estimated pick up time and waited a little over 10 minutes when a waitress came to our window and said they got one of the pizzas wrong and had to remake it. We ended up waiting another 15-20 minutes. Finally we received the pizzas, but they didn't not bring our ranch, which did cost extra so I asked if we could get those. The waitress was obviously annoyed by our request and went to get the then which took another 5 minutes. Pizza was cold by the time we arrived home. Pizza was still very good, but the thin crust was very oddly cut. I would not recommend ordering curbside or online

reviews.author: Mikayla V.
reviews.description: Horrible service. Basically you are your own waitress. After two other parties got their pizza before us after we were first I finally went to the front and complained. My pizza was on the side in a Togo box just sitting there. I said um is that mine cold just sitting there? The girl said oh I'm not sure sorry.    I was also charged a crazy amount for two small pizzas that a five year old could have made better. Don't go here. First and last time for me.

reviews.author: Bailey I.
reviews.description: I felt a little uncomfortable tonight as there was a girl walking around and asking people to buy cookies for $10 and when I said no thank you she suggested I make a donation instead. I'm not sure if she was family of someone working there, but it was awkward that they let her ask for money and since she never left the table we felt pressured to donate money to her with no idea who she was or if she was actually using the money for the purpose she said. Other than that, everything was great!

reviews.author: jaimie L.
reviews.description: Ordered through doordash. Missing cheesecake.  Chicken fried steak had the breading completely separated from the steak and although the breading was good, the steak was tough!  Fries overly salty while Mac n cheese had 0 salt. Best thing was the fried hot Cheeto torpedos. Would not return or recommend.

reviews.author: Anastasia R.
reviews.description: The service here is definitely not the best, it was very slow and yet there were so many waitress walking around talking to other staff... The food was decent and space was comfy.

reviews.author: Ken S.
reviews.description: Being a veteran of the armed forces this place has just a cool connection with my vibes...being able to sit down and have decor to commemorate the Armed Forces is such a treat for me. I just love an establishment that recognizes the armed forces, it has special meaning to me.   The menu is filled with military jargon which is pretty cool when you order.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Waitress brang me the wrong beer, asked for Miller Lite and was brought Bud Lite. Proceeded to ask what our waitress recommended as an appetizer and she said she didn't recommend anything on the menu. Poor attitude, customer service was bad from the moment my waitress began interacting. Seemed like she didn't want to be there at all. Overall would not recommend this spot if you want a good environment while drinking your cold brew.

reviews.author: Elyssa C.
reviews.description: Service was not great :( it wasn't very busy but we were kept waiting a very long time for items even after asking a few times. The food was yummy though! The shrimp tacos were good, the accompanying sauce is great!!

reviews.author: Cashdoll C.
reviews.description: Would only recommend this location through the week and daytime . I went on Saturday at about 11:00 this place had about 10 girls 2 at the front talking while I'm waiting to get seated , which took (5 min) for the girls to even come back from where they were at . So I finally got to the both still not being serviced properly. I waited 30 minutes before I got up and went to the front and asked " So IS ANYBODY GOING TO SERVICE ME" ? Like why come to work if you're not going to work .  I usually come to this place every time I'm in town but tonight was my last .

reviews.author: Captain C.
reviews.description: I don't know what the problems people have with place this are. When I was there, the food was good, the help was friendly and helpful, the girls were scantily clad of course... But aside from feeling ambivalent about that soft-core strip-club feel, it was great!

reviews.author: Angel B.
reviews.description: I see why they only have 2 1/2 stars! We walked in at 3. 3 tables and 3 at the bar. We waited 5 minutes to be seated. (Waitresses having a conversation.) We we're seated finally. Then after about 10 min with no drink order taken from us, a waitress goes to a table where a gentleman was just seated, sat down with him and started taking his order. He wa seated righ next to us. We got up to leave and let the manager know why we were leaving and she acted like she could care less. Have never tried the restaurant out and I can assure you we never will. Good luck with business. You're gonna need it with the staff you have. Sorry I can't rate the food.

reviews.author: Kerri B.
reviews.description: Good food, good service and excellent DJ's. I love to come on the days that DJ Roger works and DJ Kavika are djing. They are the best DJ's ever.

reviews.author: Geraldo H.
reviews.description: It was a pretty pleasant Sunday evening for me. I got out of work after being positively complimented throughout the day, just feeling pretty damn fucking good today. I decided to take a nap, then of course decided to get food to celebrate my day. I went on to take a nice hot shower, freshened myself up, and went out for food.   Initially, I was planning on going to Cheddar's but that wait time there was way too long. We're talking 45 minutes. I haven't eaten all day by the way. You know what was close by though? Bombshells. What was the wait time? 5-10 minutes. I wondered why but I didn't question it. It's kind of like when you need to take a shit, and you're just hoping to go to a nice restroom. Anyway, I was pretty surprised.  There was a younger woman who was the waitress our table. First thing she asked was the drinks we wanted. "Three waters please." I was then asked for my card right away which was fucking weird as shit as I didn't receive any food yet, nor did I get an order placed for food. I just sat there and started to ponder a bit. We get the waters but no offering of a straw for our waters, which I also thought was odd. Not really working out the way I'd like for my first time actually dining in.   NASCAR was on for a bit on the TV monitor screen, and then it changed to Women's soccer for the Summer Series (GO USA!). We finally get an order in. I ordered the Grilled Tilapia entree with Alfredo sauce smothered on, steamed broccoli, and Spicy Mac 'n' Cheese. The thing was that the poor waitress didn't even know that there was an option to top the tilapia with Alfredo sauce and shrimp. She mistook it that I wanted to do two different dishes. I'm just like, "I can guarantee something will be wrong." I kept quiet for a bit because I was pretty annoyed.  The food comes out. No shrimp on my dish. Eh, fine. I proceeded to eat the food and it was pretty decent. I liked the Alfredo sauce a lot. The Spicy Mac 'n' Cheese was okay at best. The steamed broccoli was good. I noticed one thing the entire hour being there--I've never once was asked for a refill on my drink, nor were we properly catered to with the courtesy of asking how everything was during the feasting of the food. I'm now really annoyed and frustrated.   The more I noticed things, I observed other tables and waitresses actually having an interaction with each other. The waitress at my table could have given two fucks about my guests and I. Cold shoulder was given to us several times, with the same waitress kissing the asses of the table served behind me to patrons that came in after we did. She was also missing for extended periods of time.  Little did she know, I actually am a frequent high-tipping gentleman with a whole lot of damn money to blow. Sadly though, she dropped the ball highly. I guess it could have been the way I looked or the stereotype that I may not be worth the time to serve--who the hell knows? What I do know is that I was still nice enough to offer a 15% tip even after all of the shitty service provided. I was thinking about stiffing her but thought to myself, "I think she is new, and they've probably thrown her to the wolves." Mind you, we had to let her know that the ticket was wrong. That shouldn't be something on our end to do but we did because we knew something was already wrong to begin with. First impressions are EVERYTHING, baby.  I'll make it known that having a pretty face ain't going to cut it in a face-to-face customer service field. That has to be backed up with a great demeanor, capability, efficiency, eagerness to perform on the job, and always a solid first impression. This young lady needs to be trained more, and I think it's at the fault of the actual restaurant not properly training staff that I'm seeing all of these shit reviews about the service alone. My ass got to experience that instead of the positive side.   I'm extremely disappointed and just hope Bombshells fixes their BS quickly. This restaurant can be more than just the typical chain, especially if it was better ran with its employees. I don't fault the waitress for not knowing better because for all I know--this can be her first serving gig. However, this spot missed the mark highly. Easily, I'm a customer that can bring numerous guests with me, ordering items on tickets of several hundreds of dollars a sitting quite easily. Not going to happen now after all of the mishaps this evening. I'd rather drink bleach.  .5 stars/5 Stars: Absolute abomination. I certainly doubt that I would ever come back to this spot. I would rather serve life in prison in Angola than come back to this spot.

reviews.author: Bradley B.
reviews.description: Good food and service. A little pricey for a wing place, but very good. Will definitely go back.

reviews.author: Shana J.
reviews.description: This restaurant may have been the worst tasting food I've had all year. I don't know whose idea it was for the fried pickles to be spears but that's a terrible idea. Also the batter that the pickles were fried in was pretty gross. The chicken wings tasted like they were barely seasoned. Drea our server was awesome and had a lot of patience because I know the group I was with was definitely annoying. The bartender was also cool. The drinks snuck up on everyone because at first everybody thought they tasted watered down and then all of a sudden they felt it (lol). Overall we definitely would not go back it just wasn't worth it.

reviews.author: Shawn M.
reviews.description: This place is sooooo damn underwhelming it hurts.  First of all I guess they didn't get the memo that we are in a pandemic since the rent a cops weren't wearing mask or enforcing the rule to   customers coming in and out of the establishment.  They were to worried about flirting with the waitresses.  I get it..they are kind of cute but come on..do your job!  Also there were about 9 of them working last night and only three were wearing their mask correct or even at all.  The bartender had hers around her neck the whole time while breathing directly over your food...smh..very disappointing. The wings themselves were okay but nothing to go back for.  I will be going to a place that the employees know how to actually wear a damn mask.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Place has lost their way. Everything about it has slipped down to poor status. Cleanliness, staff, food everything. Shame too because I used to like it.

reviews.author: Markiesa B.
reviews.description: If I could give it zero stars I would .I'll start by saying we had to wait 5 minutes for a table remind you this was a Monday night around 950. Got seated and literally waited there for 15 minutes and still no server. I walked down to where the kitchen was, poked my head in and said hey can we get a server for our table. A girl came by afterwards and asked did she(the unknown server) come by yet we said no. Five more minutes went by and my brother had to yell at a server to come over and serve us. She was nice enough to do it considering she wasn't are Initial server. We order all our stuff drinks and food at the same time. Btw the drinks were very weak tasted like juice and syrup. I ordered the Philly cheesesteak which was nothing to brag about. My brother told the server it was my moms birthday so she offered to buy her a shot. When it was bill time my brother asked for the manager to come over to explain why we had to wait so long and to at least cut the bill down for waiting so long. She said the birthday shot was considered the "freebie" and that she talked to the server and that was it. No apology no nothing . I will never visit this place again. They didn't deserve my money or time !

reviews.author: Latoya G.
reviews.description: Had a horrible experience We Order 2 Orleans drinks They were watered down Talked to manager and she said that something was wrong with their mixers Took it off our check  Then order pasta It was dry so we asked for a little more sauce They said they have to charge us  Asked for manager again she showed up with security like we were belligerent Refused to take it off our bill cuz we were not happy with the orders!  She do not handle this situation in a customer service way.  Don't put a manager place that can't make things right! I will be calling corporate but don't expect them to do anything about it Chose a better place for date night Forced us to pay for Something that wasn't cooked right

reviews.author: Phuong L.
reviews.description: Do not come to this place. Poor service and serve you raw chicken wings . Do not come to this place !!

reviews.author: Brittney H.
reviews.description: Literally had the worst experience here on Friday evening. First of all the service was terrible, it took about 30 minutes after we sat down to get someone to take our order. We had to go to the front and ask for a server because no one was attending to us. After that, it took another 15 minutes to get our drinks. After we ordered our food, that took another 30 minutes to come out and when it did come out, my food was missing. The waitress didn't say anything so I figured that they were still making it. Only after 15 more minutes passed by and the waitress finally came back did she ask where my food was to which I responded that I had no idea. She then went back to the kitchen and after about 15 more minutes, my food came out. While everyone was eating, they found that my nephews chicken was raw and we had to bring up that issue as well.   The manager ended up coming out and taking my food and my nephews food off the ticket but it was still a very terrible experience. I wouldn't recommend going here to anyone.

reviews.author: Jennifer T.
reviews.description: Awful service first and last time coming here. Waitresses should know how to make the drinks on the menu. I ordered two drinks and they were both bad I didn't bother ordering any food.

name: The Park on South Lamar
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Allyson L.
reviews.description: Overall, a good place for a large group to grab drinks.
