I went to happy hour here with 8 of my coworkers and the outdoor seating was really spacious and well distanced from other tables.   Highlights: Their frozen margaritas (pretty strong especially for my low alcohol tolerance lol), the free tequila sampler my group received (:, the service, and the fact that they are really flexible with splitting checks for large groups!  Needs to be improved: The food was way too greasy and there weren't any plant based options for my vegan coworker. It would be nice if they had a smaller selection of dishes that were better quality and with half the oil added.

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: I was surprised about this place. The food is quite delicious. Whether you go for chicken fried chicken, a burger, or the mac and cheese, The Park delivers. Their menu is quite broad, with many good options.   Good selection of beers, a very large covered patio, and good service. Recommended.

reviews.author: Rose D.
reviews.description: A great, always reliable spot! They have a ton of outdoor seating with lots of shade, and excellent deals on drinks + food. Definitely a sports bar vibe, with lots of TVs, but never gets too loud (at least when I've been there) as it's really spread out. They seem to have a nice separate outdoor space that people sometimes use for private events, which I love!  The food is good -- typical burgers, sandwiches, salad, tacos. I love that they have the option to get any time of burger/sandwich on a gluten free bun or a lettuce wrap. Their lettuce wraps are huge and keep everything together! I got the Hippie with grilled chicken and loved it -- the chicken was blackened and spicy - yum! My boyfriend got the Fat Chick (not what he ordered..whoops, but still was delicious). Fried chicken with gravy, mashed potatoes, and sautéed veggies. They have a "Hot" (adobo) and "Skinny" (grilled) version of this. Nice to see some healthy and more indulgent options.   Definitely recommend if you're looking for good food, strong drinks (and some fun cocktails), and a nice place to hang with a friend or a group!

reviews.author: Courtney K.
reviews.description: Ordered the southwest egg rolls and my order was delivered to the wrong table. The waitress handled it all really well and apologized, the manager came out to tell me it was on the house and again apologized for the delay. I think it says something about the establishment when they handle mistakes with integrity and is 100% a place  I would go back to!

reviews.author: Jeremiah G.
reviews.description: Actually really good, chill spot. At first, I was thinking I was going to be walking into an Applebee's and I don't think I was that wrong but where The Park separates from Applebee's is the fact that The Park is actually has good food. Well at least their burger was amazing.   Friendly staff. Good, really good, drink happy hour. We sat outside and while a normal outside sitting decision is dangerous in Texas heat The Park actually made the sitting experience enjoyable.   If you are confused on what to get, as I was, may I suggest The Rebel burger. A good sized, well done, burger with fried pickle chips on it. My thinking is this. I'm going to get pickles anyways, I might as well get them fried as well.

reviews.author: Kathryn A.
reviews.description: I ordered the calamari as an appetizer and they gave such a big portion that I almost felt like I didn't need an entree, lol. It was super good! I would definitely recommend. The atmosphere was very chill and the service was good as well. Definitely going to come back

reviews.author: Xavier C.
reviews.description: What kind of ship you running? Humble yourselves on a weekday ... not going back cuz they played me

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: Let me tell you what- those sliders were amazing and the $5 frozen mojito's on the happy hour menu HIT and did not miss. It was the perfect late afternoon snack to unwind from the day. We had the sweetest waitress that gave us great customer service.   P.S. there's plenty of parking :)

reviews.author: Robin W.
reviews.description: We went there today, just because so that you could actually sit and enjoy your food instead of it being all to go!   The service was very friendly and she gave a great suggestion on the mushroom burger.  The fries were perfectly crispy and not to large of a serving that I was overly stuffed.  I love that their burgers don't come with mustard and mayo and will only add them if you request it.   The hubby had the park burger with onion rings, which he enjoyed buy nothing extravagant.      I did like that they were playing old music videos.

reviews.author: Crystal Y.
reviews.description: Really amazing waitress, great service, yummy food, huge screens for watching baseball.  Very good sports bar. Tons of outdoor seating. Stick to the burgers here, y'all. I got the veggie, which had a delicious flavor and texture, it was black bean. My bf got the grilled chicken. We both loved out burgers and they have great topping choices too. Huge drink menu. Great mac and cheese and sweet potato fries too. Waitress was the nicest person.

reviews.author: Brandon T.
reviews.description: The Park Has always been my go to spot to get a great food and great service. I love the Sunday Brunch it's amazing and the service is always good big thank you to our server who was amazing. The food was cooked fresh and also prepared well. If you ever come to Austin please stop by.

reviews.author: P C.
reviews.description: Our waiter was really good. Pleasant and prompt. That was the extent of good. The restrooms were "rough" and smelly. The food was average.  Admittedly we were not there for sports and booze.  Have driven past it for years and finally went in.  Not glad we did.

reviews.author: Bo B.
reviews.description: Came here for the Happy Hour menu. I had the Mahi mahi tacos with broccoli and sweet potato fries that were delicious. The works pizza was also very good.

reviews.author: Renae B.
reviews.description: The Gm came up to our table after their host had already sat us and our 3 kids down. She apparently felt the need to make us aware that their back patio was 21 and up only. She told us she'd let it go this time though. The problem we have is that we had no idea. It was her employee who sat us there. It was unnecessary for her to tell us, unless she was planning on moving us of course (which she didn't). It most certainly was unprofessional on her part. It sounds like they need a team meeting to address their issues with seating. We did nothing wrong but felt embarrassed and in the wrong when we had NOTHING to do with where they seated us. Also, we have sat on that same patio with kids many times prior to without consent from a manager...My husband tried to speak with her about the situation but instead of handling it professionally, she automatically banned him from the restaurant.

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: The park is reliable and their brunch is on point. We used to frequent the one on south Lamar but now tend to go to the domain location. Personally, the one on south Lamar tends to be better, but they both have the same menu!   Their chips and queso is to do for. Reliable and we always get this.   My hubby always always always gets the angry chicken penne. It's amazing. Probably horrible for you but it's what dreams are made of. This week I got the Works flatbread which was delicious! I honestly think I have tried everything on the menu. I loveee the garlic fries and the Mac and cheese too.   On sundays they have an all you can eat brunch buffet. Covid and just buffets in general make my weary of eating communal foods but they were handling it smartly. Don't skip out on their happy hour too!

reviews.author: Mohan J.
reviews.description: Mediocre service and mediocre food!  Nothing to distinguish this place at all.  The waitress had half her butt sticking out of her shorts, and an unexplainable and unjustified air of superiority (which always sucks).  She asked us what we would like to drink as we were walking up to our table and what we needed to eat, soon after!  Being seniors we don't intuit such answers and actually have to look at the menu.  The food was equally unimpressive although the drinks were ok because beer is hard to mess us)!

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: Update: I've returned a few times and service has improved - it's a great find near home.  --------------  Stopped by today for a quick lunch with hubby. It's a Monday so I figured in and out rather quickly but boy was I wrong. We placed a simple order and my husband's food arrived within 5mins while my chicken tenders/fries took forever. Not sure what happened in the kitchen but our server, Jennifer, was sweet and super apologetic - took the item off our bill. My order arrived after my husband finished his plate - took my food to go.  Kitchen/cook staff needs to be more alert on orders - especially on a slow day. Otherwise, the frozen mojito was amazing.

reviews.author: Steve A.
reviews.description: Came for lunch on a Friday afternoon. Our waitress was attentive and had a great personality. The food was just okay. I've avoided this place in the past because I've never had a great experience with their food. Once again, food was cold. The chicken fried chicken was tough. The mash potatoes were cold and a little hard to the touch. The gravy was cold and not very very well drenched on the mashed potatoes. Slightly disappointed, but like I said we really enjoyed the company of the waitress. And the bloody Mary!

reviews.author: Hamilton L.
reviews.description: Moved from Washington DC for work and the South Lamar location is my local sports bar. Wanted to highlight that I've never had a bad meal and that the beer is always cold. I'm a huge soccer fan and Marshall has always been kind to change the channel, even on a busy Sunday.  The waiters and staff have always been friendly and enforced the Social distance rules, which has made me feel safe about returning to restaurants. Please give that team a big shout out!

reviews.author: Jonathan W.
reviews.description: Alexis is amazing !!  My phone died and she offered her phone charger as manager without me even bringing up to her.  She is very proactive and always walking around checking on all the customers.  Very impressed with her!

reviews.author: Denise A.
reviews.description: Just left brunch and it was honestly not what I was hoping for. We've eaten dinner there before and it was amazing. Had the tall blonde chick with Cali tats and she basically just guided us through the whole experienced and picked our food and wine out.   This time we waited quite a bit for our server to appear, when she finally did she just asked if we were ready. No hello, or how are you. She didn't seem enthusiastic about the menu and when we told her weren't ready yet the second time she came by, we felt a bunch of attitude. The biscuits are amazing but everything else? We ended up with some mediocre food that probably would've tasted better if we had better service. Maybe the service style is different in New Zealand but I think eye rolls are a universal language. No brunch for us here but we'll for sure come back for dinner though.

reviews.author: Stephanie H.
reviews.description: Highly recommend! It's my birthday week and the girls and I motored up to Austin for wine tasting and fun! We ALWAYS do Sunday brunch so we had to do it in Austin. This place is great for large parties and it's beautifully decorated.  I had the CIDE-car, their apple cider version of a side car... Very tasty and STRONG! Biscuits were big, fluffy and flaky like they came from biscuit heaven and your great grandmomma was the one making them. The deviled eggs were DELICIOUS and I'd like to think of myself as a deviled egg connoisseur. Cinnamon roll. Better than ANY cinnamon roll you've ever had the pleasure of stuffing in your mouth. ABSOLUTELY DIVINE!!! And the chicken fried ribeye with white gravy and collards..... All I can say is babyyyyyyyyyy this was definitely the definition of Southern cooking and hospitality. Our server Katie was ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL!!  Here is what the others in my party had to say:  To start I had a Cide Car to drink, deviled eggs, and a mouthwatering buttermilk biscuit. My entree was the Chicken Fried Ribeye, served with a side of braised collard greens! I finished my meal off with a hot and fresh cinnamon roll! Everything was delicious! I cleared my entire plate! The service was amazing! Katie went above and beyond to build a strong connection! I definitely give everything a solid 5!  It was an amazing experience from the front door to the table. The manager came by to make sure everything was good. Katie (Server) she was so on point and made the dining experience pleasant. If you ever get a chance to go please ask for her. She took pics of us and made sure the table was happ. For me this place was a solid 5 and I will be back soon!

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: The biscuits were so good and fresh- a must try here!! The fried chicken was also tasty with a lightly breaded take on the dish. We also had the pork chop that was cooked perfectly and absolutely delicious. We tried the beet salad which was tasty but a bit plain.   Disappointed in their cocktail list as there were very few options and they didn't have much mixers or fruit to muddle in. The service was also slow but pleasant.

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Definitely come here but get ready to spend!  Service - amazing! So friendly and knowledgeable. I even asked to surprise me with any drink (with a few notes) and all my drinks were also well balanced and delicious.  Food - impressive.  Get the biscuits! Made fresh, so soft and fluffy. Comes with butter and honey. We also ordered the beets, and brussel sprouts. Both were great but the beets were delicious snd had more creative flavors. My man got the pork chop. He took a bite, closed his eyes, and leaned back. I've never seen him do this. Are you ok? Apparently the pork chop is really good. Melts in your mouth. I got the red fish which was tender, perfectly cooked and not dry. Also I don't like "fishy" tasting fish and this one was gentle in flavor. The risotto was flavorful and creamy too.  Parking - they have valet but it's slow. The guy was overwhelmed because he was working Alone in a saturday night downtown. Not his fault at all but def piles up.  Def a special date night spot

reviews.author: Sean C.
reviews.description: My wallet was telling me no, but my stomach was telling me yes! Some friends and I came in for brunch on Sunday and really enjoyed our time there. We started off with a cinnamon roll, which the server explained was made from biscuit dough. It was outstanding! We then ordered some biscuits for the table, and those blew us away. Hot, fresh, buttery biscuits served with butter, honey, and jam. Those might be the best biscuits I've ever had. For the entrée I ordered the Pollo Frito Loco Biscuit, chicken topped with slaw and honey. That was friggin great, super crispy chicken on a butter biscuit. Our server was great as well, he was the bartender, who made some mean mimosas for us. 10/10 would recommend.

reviews.author: Rini S.
reviews.description: Had a great time here but unfortunately, my pocket did not.   The service is great, the drinks are great, and the ambience is great. The food was pretty good but the biscuits were hands down freaking amazing. I highly recommend!  Also got the Brussel sprouts and pork chop. No complaints with either, but not craving a second order of these either. Biscuits were definitely my favorite item out of the experience.   Nice place for date night or dinner with the parents.  Parking PSA: Fixe only offers valet parking but there's plenty of street parking/lot parking nearby. I recommend looking around versus spending even more on valet.

reviews.author: Erika N.
reviews.description: It seems like Fixe Southern House has had its moment already - the empty tables both inside and outside at 7pm were both a blessing and a bit nerve-wracking. I called ahead of time to ask if they were dog friendly on their patio, and they are! I saw no reviews of being dog friendly on Google, Yelp, or on their website, so that was a nice surprise. They even brought a bowl of water for my pup. FYI, you can find street parking nearby quite easily.  The food was pretty great overall - our table shared multiple dishes. I enjoyed the homemade biscuits with seasonal apple butter and the pimento cheese and focaccia dish. The beet salad was so sweet and savory at the same time - delicious! I enjoyed the lobster and crawfish pot pie but wish I had eaten it faster when it was piping hot. The fried chicken was a bit burnt some places but did have a great crisp. The deviled eggs were deviled eggs and nothing to rave about, and the broccolini was a bit salty. I still really enjoyed my time there.  We didn't try any drinks but we did get dessert! The pecan pie was very sweet and heavy, I only had a bite. I did enjoy the blackberry cobbler and ice cream. How delightful.  Overall, a solid service and food selection make this a great stop for southern food. Perhaps an even better place to stop than some other spots in Austin for southern food due to ease of actually getting a table and nice/upscale (although not super modern) ambiance.

reviews.author: Carissa C.
reviews.description: Great food and great service! I went again for dinner on my birthday with family and it was perfect! Not only was our server awesome, all the food everyone got was good and we all shared the biscuits as an appetizer. I got 2 different drinks, both were delish! I would highly recommend this restaurant.

reviews.author: Michael C.
reviews.description: Everything on the menu is great, and they have top 3 biscuits I've had in my life. I love the vibe and drinks as well.

reviews.author: Kim H.
reviews.description: My family and I came here for my brother's birthday and it was such a good decision. The atmosphere was classy and elegant. Lots of seatings. The service was just amazing: our waiter was patient and kind, knew every little detail on the menu and accommodated our needs very well.   Food:  Here are what we ordered and my personal takes on them.  - Fixe Biscuits: MUST GET. So far the best biscuits I have had. They came hot and fresh and have some chewy, crunchy texture. Divine!  - Deviled Eggs: Good but not exceptional. I do like them tho.  - Heritage Pork chop: I love this dish. It was seasoned perfectly: not too salty (this is very important to me). The meat was very tender and paired well with all the veggie on it.  - Texas Red Fish: It reminded me of the Thai sweet and sour fish.  - Lobster and Crawfish pot pie: MUST GET. You can taste the crawfish and lobster in it. The pie came out hot and it was just so yummy.   Dessert:  - Pecan pie - Chocolate truffle cake Tbh, I didn't like their dessert that much. They were just too overwhelmingly, sickly sweet. I like the presentation tho.   Overall, it was such a great experience. My family doesn't normally like heavy, southern food but they cleared the dish here.

reviews.author: Autumn E.
reviews.description: I came to visit some friends in Austin and we went to FASH for dinner. Ok, wow! Their quirky, rustic, cozy, yet modern flair was really inspiring. They brought traditional charm into the atmosphere in a warm and hip way that made you feel at ease and simultaneously stimulated, in a good way. Such a cool place! Our server was Wyn. She was phenomenal! She was professional and friendly! Great sense of humor (dealing with our group, LOL) and made wonderful suggestions. The Brussels were spot on! (A favorite dish of mine, always order wherever I go). My friends had the pork chop and pot pie. They reported the pork chop had fantastic flavor, was cooked perfectly. And the pot pie was better than they had hoped. It was a lovely experience and I hope to return!

reviews.author: Brendin B.
reviews.description: Homemade biscuits are a must here.  We ordered it with the side of gravy which I expected to be heavy and rich but it was light and flavorful. Nice surprise!  Ordered also the shrimp and grits and the old fashioned biscuit sausage sandwich.  Very delightful brunch with a bottle of champagne.  Only one tv in the bar area so choose your seat wisely if you're catching the game.

reviews.author: Kaitlyn P.
reviews.description: This place was on our must-have list when we spent the weekend in Austin. They're well known for their biscuits, so we couldn't wait for this brunch.   Cherly was a kind and attentive server, giving us recommendations as we looked through the menu. To drink, we got the mimosa and cold brew martini-- both delicious!   Because we wanted to experience the biscuits in their true form (they have biscuit sandwiches but we didn't want any other flavors), we got the biscuit side dish. So yummy!! We split the shrimp and grits, which I thought was enough for two people.  Great ambiance and decor, along with cozy, trendy chairs! A perfect brunch. :)

reviews.author: Shonel G.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed my last two lunches and dinner at this restaurant. The biscuits are horribly expensive and terribly delicious. I'm forced by my lack of self control to order them every time we visit.   I've had the pot pie, the fish fry and also the pork chop. All of these meals where great and worth going back for.   There is one issue the collard greens suck. They were gritty and this is the sort of thing that happens when the greens are not properly washed.  I'm an expert on this, growing up we grew greens in the back yard and it was always my job to harvest them, pick the greens off the stem and wash them. I can let the fact that they left some of the tender part of the stems attached but the grit. That is not forgiveable.   So my suggestion is to avoid them at all costs.

reviews.author: Pandy S.
reviews.description: If you take anything from this review, it's that the biscuits here are a must try! Whether you're an Austinite or a visitor, trust and believe these biscuits are worth a try.  The biscuits came with a delicious whipped butter, some fruit preserves, and local honey. They paired so well with the biscuits, and they came in abundance too! You can even buy the biscuits in bulk; Fixe really knows how good their biscuits are!  But, I knocked off a star because the other food was just average. We got a beet salad and fried chicken. Neither was bad, but neither really stood out. However, the price was reasonable, and I would come back to try the rest of the menu!  tl;dr COME FOR THE BISCUITS! They are 6/5 stars :)

reviews.author: Que H.
reviews.description: This pork chop wasn't cooked properly or at all for that matter. I thought this restaurant was going to be great. Turns out to be not so great.

reviews.author: Fay G.
reviews.description: BEST biscuits EVER!!! I came here with my parents for the first time for a weekday brunch. Hardly anyone there, and we sat outside. Our server was incredible and engaged with us. We also shared a carafe of mimosa and were brought 3 different types of juices to mix it with because we couldn't decide on one. I ordered the caviar deviled eggs and they were so delicate and scrumptious! For dessert, we had cinnamon rolls - super rich and delish, definitely shareable. This place is expensive, but it's worth it.

reviews.author: Katy C.
reviews.description: A must go to for a elevated yet approachable - classic southern breakfast/ brunch! I loved all the little "nooks" that made it feel like a private dining experience within a home. The biscuits are an absolute mustand the margaritas + bloodies do the trick. I also appreciated They offer a bottle service/ pricing if the whole table plans to drink the same.

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: Looking for some comfort food during this incredibly uncomfortable time? Look no further than Fixe! I was fortunate enough to have a friend bring me to this excellent restaurant and I cannot wait to return.  My order: - Lemon Drop Martini - Excellent! Not too sweet and the bartender was very attentive. - Biscuit appetizer- ORDER THIS! They are famous for their biscuits and you will see why as soon as you smell them! They are salty, soft, with the perfect crunchy exterior (my mouth is watering writing this). They pair these amazing little fat bombs with apple butter, honey, and honey butter - AMAZING! - Shrimp and grits - So delicious! The shrimp is cooked perfectly and the grits are creamy and dreamy!  - Pear cobbler - Did you think you were eating Southern food to be healthy?? This is a treat yourself night if I've ever heard of one! Order this and you'll be swept away to sweet Southern heaven.  Support this downtown business! It is delicious and the service is excellent! You won't regret it!

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: Called to try and make a month in advance dinner reservations for 10ppl but encountered very poor and dismissive customer service.  Keith answered the phone and as I was asking to make a reservation, he cut me off and placed me on hold for a few minutes.   A girl with an attitude then picked up and as I was asking to make reservations, she too cut me off and places me on hold for a few minutes.  Keith gets on the phone, and clearly forgot he placed me on hold.  I told him on second thought maybe we are not interested in making reservations, he promptly hung up on me.   If this is how they treat customers then I have no interest in supporting their business with my party of 10 ppl.

name: URBAN Eat.Drink
accommodations: Good for Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, Dinner
Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Came here for a quick Sunday brunch with some girl friends! We made a reservation and the put our name on the table which made it feel personalized.   Everyone got pitchers of mimosas but I'm pregnant so not drinking. They all enjoyed them!   All the food that came out looked amazing. I wasn't really feeling anything crazy but the items i got were delicious! The biscuit was fluffy and flakey and everything i wanted.   The sausages were actually huge and so filling. There was a nice flakey crunch to the outside of them which i wasn't expecting but enjoyed. The service was great and so were the portion to cost ratios! Well worth it!

reviews.author: Edward A.
reviews.description: My wife and I were looking for a new place to eat on Saturday after a long day of running around. We found this place on Yelp.  The staff was not friendly.  They were not outright rude, but not very hospitable. Nobody smiled throughout the evening. Definetly did not feel welcome.   I ordered the burger and fries.  It was probably one of the worst burgers I've had.   There needs to be a balance between meat, bread, and veggies.  The burger was under cooked and  too big for the bun.  The veggies were minimal and soaked in blood from the burger.    My wife had the hot chicken sandwich.  That was better, but a mess to eat.    My son had the Mac n cheese with fruit.  The Mac was a thick gooey mess with large elbow pasta. Very hard to spoon out.  Not easy for a 3 year old to eat.  Also, quite salty.   We don't plan on returning.

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Saw really great reviews for this place so we decided to check it out for brunch! They had live music in the outside area.  The brunch food was just average, I think this might be a better spot for dinner. I had a Bloody Mary and it tasted like watery tomato juice with no spice or horseradish. My boyfriend had the shrimp and grits - he really liked the shrimp on it but the grits didn't have much flavor. The best item that we had was the appetizer of chips and queso but we subbed fries instead of chips - SO yummy. The queso was spicy and the fries were so crispy.   We would probably go back for dinner and drinks to see if it's better!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: This place was okay. Had live music which was the best part. This location is only on the ground, no cool rooftop view. The food was okay. The service was slow, I assume understaffed. The drinks were overpriced.

reviews.author: Ramimi T.
reviews.description: I went here only once before and it wasn't too too great. I decided to give it another try and I am amazed! One of the best burgers that I've had in a while! The fries paired perfectly with the ranch and the sweet tea was so good! I only had to wait 17 minutes for my food to get out. I will definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Adam L.
reviews.description: The folks on staff were all quite nice, but that's about the extent of the good for our experience.  I got a chicken sandwich and my wife got the ribs.  Both were pretty much flavorless and dry, even with sauce.  All in with 2 drinks, soups and meals it was $100 before tip.  The fries were great, but otherwise I don't think I'll bother visiting again.  I wish them the best and may make a trip again just to check in and see if they've sorted stuff out.

reviews.author: Hannah B.
reviews.description: This place is cool! The vibe is fun and they have a fair selection of foods. The bacon wrapped quail is to die for!   Our service was a little slow when we ate here. My BLT also had a weird herb flavor to it that I wasn't fond of, others may enjoy it. I personally felt it was a little overpowering.   I recommend eating outdoors as it is in a nice part of downtown round rock

reviews.author: Kevin E.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and our sever was amazing! That's were the good in this breakfast putting with my daughter ends.  Highly disappointed in our actual meal. I ordered Shrimp and Grits and she ordered the Full Monty (American sampler)  Our food was all cold nothing hot or remotely warm. They didn't seem too busy so maybe they are working out some expediting issues. My grits were mediocre at best maybe if they were warm that would be different and the shrimp was fishy and rubbery. I've never had grits that were like a smear on the bottom of the bowl/plate but that's exactly what this was.  My daughter said her eggs tasted off and her fruit was clearly on the brink of, if not already spoiled. The best thing on the plate was the potatoes  I'd give them another shot just maybe not for brunch this time.

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: We hadn't been by here in a little while and we're looking to go somewhere different than "the usual".   The good: We were seated quickly and there were quite a few staff in the restaurant to help so we didn't have to really wait that long for anything. In fact, once's we're done my wife said, "we should start looking for the bill" and here comes the waitress with the bill. This is really surprising in light of the challenges that other restaurants are having with staffing.   I like that this place is in downtown round rock and I like the overall aesthetic with wood beams on the ceilings and the house converted to restaurant feel.   I got a special off of their hatch chili menu and it was very tasty and a pretty decent sized piece of fish.   The not so good: While the food was tasty, I was missing some of the expected hatch chili flavor that I would expect to find when ordering something off a hatch chili menu  My wife's fish was a little tough, but again the flavor was good  If you get cold easily, make sure to bring a sweater. The temperature was pretty frigid and because of the small floor for the restaurant there wasn't really a way to find a spot where the you don't get blown on by the AC.   Wrap-up: All in all the food and service were good. A few tweaks and I think this could be a 5-star review.

reviews.author: Bijal P.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times now I really like the atmosphere it's really calming every time I come.  The customer service to outstanding food and let me not forget the drinks yum.  - happy hour here is a must I paid $6 for my tequila ole fashion yes you heard me right.  It was the most unique drink I've had by far I really appreciate the bar tender going out of her way to make the most delicious drink. FYI I had to have two lmao the ice cube was crystal clear made the drink even more interesting to drink  - overall I always have a great time here whether it's brunch , lunch or a date night great place to a have a good time ( no I did not get drunk lmao )

reviews.author: Jeremy T.
reviews.description: Came for brunch with few friends on a random Saturday and thank goodness we came to round rock. What a charming downtown they have and this place we perfect. Heaters for the fall outdoor seating, amazing entertainment and the food and bev were great.

reviews.author: Paulette A.
reviews.description: Charmingly rustic interior and good food but overpriced for the portion size and mediocre service.    Staff were friendly but noticeably uninterested as some were preoccupied scrolling on their phones and others even hanging out at the bar. Our waitress was at least attentive.   For food I ordered the salmon frittata, and the hubs got the pork belly hash and a $5 orange juice that was clearly brand made and from a bottle that probably cost just as much as the charge of the 8oz we were served. Flavor wise, my food was delicious tho slightly salty. However upon arriving to the table, the pork belly hash looked smaller than my entree. For $16 you'd expect strips of pork belly on top of the sweet potato hash - what you really get is 10% protein, 20% dry biscuit, 30% hash, and 40% arugula garnish. Redeeming quality was the perfectly poached egg.   Definitely a happy hour/small bites spot but wouldn't recommend for brunch or a full meal. For $50, much left to be desired

reviews.author: Madi T.
reviews.description: Here's the Tea. Everyone else's meal looked great. Lots of food everyone seemed to love it. That said, I ordered the eggs Benedict and let me Tell you. What a let down. It was like one thin deli sliced ham on and English muffin with an underdone poached egg and barely any hollandaise. It was more like eating eggs on toast. Now the potatoes; they could've been great. They were fine. But the peppers with the potatoes were not cooked and more thrown in just because. Not only that the music outside was too loud to have a conversation. I wish my experience was better, but mayyyybe I'll try it again with something else on the menu? I don't know.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: My fiancé, baby and I came here for a nice Friday night on the town. We had heard how great it was and was anxious to check it out for ourselves. Upon checking in we were told there was a 45 minute wait...fair enough. We walked to Finley's to grab a quick drink. We were both surprised when we got a text only within 20 mins! When we came back we were greeted by the hostess who was an absolute doll and showed to our table up front. Let me just say - customer service was top notch. Exactly was we hoped for. Our waiter Chandler was amazing! For an appetizer we ordered the bacon wrapped quail. It was superb. We both enjoyed it very much. For our entrees I had a side Caesar salad and the Dry Aged Ribeye (with asparagus and a cheddar potato cake), my fiancé had the Pecan Smoked Pork Chop (with asparagus and a cheddar potato cake) and for our 2 year old we ordered a kids meal with Mac and Cheese and Fries.  Let's start with the Pecan Smoked Pork Chop. While it was the tastiest of our entrees it was just a bit slightly overcooked...but delicious despite that. Okay on to the ribeye. I get this is not a steakhouse so I probably shouldn't have ordered it, but I had a craving. For the $45 price tag we were very disappointed. The thin cut steak very under-seasoned. The "cheddar potato cake" was just okay...its basically a mound of mashed potatoes with a cheddar crisp on top. The asparagus was okay but I like the small asparagus better and these were ginormous.  I noticed the baby wasn't eating his mac and cheese and wondered why. It looked like it came from a generic box and once I tasted it I learned why. Oddly enough the dish tasted like it had vinegar in it!! My fiancé tasted it and said the same thing. We even let Chandler know when we were leaving.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: We were Celebrating my daughters both getting new great jobs this week. We wanted a special dinner and we selected this great place. Reservations for 10 were easy as we called first thing today. They save a great table for us. Very nice touch.   We started with a few apps that was great. The chips and dip was perfect. Everyone loved the main courses and the plates were cleared.   We ate inside but went outside after to listen to the singer for a few songs. We love live music and it is so great to have it back.   Great night with family.

reviews.author: Tia R.
reviews.description: First time visiting Urban but decided to check it out on a whim because I was nearby. When I arrived it was happy hour so ordered a cocktail. Called the Passion Project which was delightfully delicious! A bit on the sweet side but yummy nonetheless. It was a cold day so decided on a cup of tortilla soup... unfortunately I was accidentally bought the tomato soup which is pictured as well... I didn't taste it but it smelled delicious. The waitress was kind when I let her know the incorrect soup was brought and quickly brought out the tortilla soup. The soup seasoned well and perfectly warmed however tasted liked chicken soup with tortilla strips. I also ordered the Urban chopped salad with salmon... it was huge! Lol! The salmon was a bit dry and not really flavorful but once chopped over the salad all of the the flavors blended well together. All in all I enjoyed  my time at Urban... the service was fast, staff was friendly, and the overall ambiance was nice! I'd definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Susan E.
reviews.description: My daughter and I enjoyed a Saturday brunch at Urban to celebrate her Halloween birthday. We arrived a few minutes ahead of our noon reservation but were seated promptly outdoors and were told our server would be there soon. Then we waited...and waited.    Once our server arrived with waters in hand, things ran more smoothly. My daughter had a full Monte and I had shrimp and grits. The food was attractively plated and tasted great. My shrimp was spicy, and there was plenty of bacon in the dish. The only thing that seemed out of place was the redeye gravy around the edge of the cheesy grits. It really added nothing.   There are plenty of menu choices, including vegetarian and gluten free items. Prices are a bit on the high side for some things and reasonable on others. But the food was good for us so I'd definitely return. This would have been a 5 star review had we not waited so long before a waitperson visited.

reviews.author: Yolanda R.
reviews.description: The food was great! Live music was amazing. The waiter was okay ( not too good) but Toya the girl walking around asking people if we needed anything made up for the waiter. Toya was great, she was happy, friendly and had great customer service.  We definitely recommend this place. Toya and the food deserve the 5 star! Thank you Toya!

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Food was pretty decent, service was great, nice outdoor patio, menu had a lot of options and the bartender was squeezing fresh fruit juice for the cocktails. Happy hour has $8 bar bites and drink specials. Would visit again! We got the chicken fried steak, pork chop and fried chicken hot sandwich. The hot honey sauce was AMAZING - spice only hits you at the end, and the dishes had the right level of crisp.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: My wife and along with some friends went to Urban Eats for the first time in a couple years and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. This s not a fancy place but very welcoming and casual. We decided to try the covered outside area and even though it was pretty hot, the fans and breeze made it very comfortable.  We discovered they have a happy hour Tuesday-Saturday which is pretty unusual in my experience. The menu is creative and utilizes locally sourced suppliers and though it is not a huge selection, it is varied, offering some seafood, steak, pork chop, salads, soups and starters. We had  grilled shrimp, quinoa salad, tortilla soup and side salads. Service was very attentive without making us feel rushed. Live music started at 7 which was another pleasant surprise.  We were amazed how much this part of downtown Round Rock has really developed. Parking was easy, the area is very walkable and Main Street entertainment district nearby.  Urban Eats is definitely a repeater for us! Give it a try and support a great local business.

name: Alamo Drafthouse Cinema South Lamar
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: Josh M.
reviews.description: One of the primary reasons I chose to move to Barton Springs was to be close to this Alamo. I go once-a-week. Great vibes to see a movie. I'm not a fan of the food and service (The servers literally interrupt you during the climax of the movie to say "last call"!).   I wish they shook up the menu and did more creative things. As I mentioned, I go frequently, and it's just the same stuff and it's honestly not that great.   I wish they had the the truffle parmesan popcorn or churro popcorn on the menu like the Alamo in SF.

reviews.author: Chloe M.
reviews.description: I love coming to the Drafthouse. Staff is friendly, willing to help, and wearing masks. Theater rooms and bathrooms are clean. They truly take silence seriously so it's always enjoyable to watch a movie here.  The parking garage is a bit tight to navigate, so it helps to drive slowly especially around turns. It's free though so that's great. I wish they had more plant-based menu options but it seems they're slowly starting to add some which is greatly appreciated.  Special events are starting to happen again, too! I can't wait for Master Pancake and movie parties to return! So much fun.

reviews.author: Constantine J.
reviews.description: Such a cool concept! This is how movies should be done! A great movie theater taken to the next level with gourmet food and drink that is brought to you while you enjoy your movie. It's everything that you would want!   They have burgers, pizza, salads, chicken fingers, great appetizers including cauliflower wings, mozzarella sticks, great popcorn and much more. My personal recommendation is to try the milkshakes (adult versions too) makes for a perfect combo while you watch your film.   The staff and service is incredible. They are prompt, kind and super friendly.   This is a great venue and makes for a great overall atmosphere for your movie day or night!

reviews.author: Kasey F.
reviews.description: I visited from out of town, and some friends told me this theater experience was not to be missed. I purchased online in advance (they sell out), picked my seats and showed up early for the previews. We watched the new Wes Anderson movie set in France, so all of the previews were in French and of old French films. Quirky. Our waiter was friendly and attentive, and the popcorn was good. The only things I didn't like were that the volume was really loud in the theater (a plus for some!), and the seats were fairly uncomfortable. Although it seems like a fun place to take a date, it probably isn't. They have a strict no talking policy  and promised to kick out anyone talking during the film.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: Absolutely world class spot for offbeat entertainment. Weird Wednesday, Terror Tuesday, and more. The facilities are quite good. The service is killer. Great food and drinks, and I've personally seen them kick out a movie talker. Thank you, Alamo!

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: If you have food allergies - beware! The menu looks friendly, but the kitchen and staff are not.   I wrote down my order for a gluten-free pizza - cauliflower crust - and the server took it. Well, she vanished. The second server said he would followup on it. When the pizza arrived, we had our doubts so we asked the runner whether it was gluten-free.   The runner swore that the kitchen confirmed it was gluten-free. Well, here I am throwing up my guts because of my allergy - so, no, it was not gluten-free.   The first server was nowhere to be found. The second server tried to convince me I never mentioned gluten-free - well thank goodness I had my order in writing. I can't believe he tried to put their mistakes on me. Especially when I was the one suffering from the allergic reaction.   The manager said we should have received a square plate for a gluten-free pizza, not round. And basically, that there's nothing he can do about it.   Places that don't try to cater to food allergies - I get it. They're ignorant and need educating.   It's much worse when a place pretends it knows what it's doing but screws it up and has no system to fix it.   Here's a first step -- train the employees on food allergies? And please, if you make a mistake, apologize. Don't call your customer a liar? And don't just make it catering to vegan or gluten-free a "marketing gimmick" -- follow through in action.

reviews.author: Brandon T.
reviews.description: Five Star Movie Showings, I finally got a chance to get here because every time I try to purchase tickets here it's always full or sold out. But I honestly went super early and finally got the chance to attend. My movie experience was amazing and the food just complimented an already perfect experience. I will become a regular here now that I have had this experience.

reviews.author: Marlene Z.
reviews.description: Since they opened again waiters do tend to forget food, mess up orders. Also, the theater has gotten rid of the fried pickles and one of my favorite pizzas. I like the other food options though - burgers, pizza, popcorn of course.

reviews.author: Irene G.
reviews.description: Keep the pinball machine. Add another. Place high tables along corner. provide space for lonely Americans to interact a little

reviews.author: Xiao Z.
reviews.description: I've been to other locations and I love Alamo Drafthouse as a cinema for true movie fans. They provide lots of interesting stuffs, including their crafted videos for each movie. The seats at this location are a bit outdated. But the service and the OG environment are absolutely satisfying. I ordered a punch drink, and enjoyed my stay there! Oh also it's not freezing cold inside so I'm pretty happy about that as well.

reviews.author: Mary D.
reviews.description: I love Alamo! The S Lamar location is one of my favorites- the staff is always super friendly and accommodating, and the food and drinks are always something to look forward to. I can't wait for the Highball to open back up fully, what a great concept!

reviews.author: Alysia G.
reviews.description: Glad to be back here and glad they are here to welcome us! Food tasted fresh, and staff are super friendly. My favorite go to is the chicken tendies I am looking forward when they can bring back events

reviews.author: Hugo S.
reviews.description: I recently rented out the theater for a private event, my 30th birthday party.  To say my party was an absolute success is an understatement. I was able to curate my own video dance party and because of the Drafthouse, this event was everything I was hoping it would be.  From the staff being so helpful and accommodating (for ex. every time someone bought me a shot, if I wasn't at my seat, they made their way to find me and deliver it :p), to the help from the event manager David with all the fine details. The Studio 54 themed party I had envisioned came to full fruition that evening and the incredible people at the Alamo Drafthouse really made the night so special.   All my friends and family were just in awe of how well put together the party was and again, I have the Drafthouse to thank for that.  I could go on and on because I'm still on such a high due to the full success of the party.  10/10 would recommend. THE BEST THEATER CHAIN THERE IS. PERIOD.

reviews.author: Steven M.
reviews.description: The Alamo Drafthouse Cinema is one unique movie theater. I came here last week for its "terror Tuesday" event with some friends and since I'm not from Austin, was quite surprised with the movie theater. Upon entering you are welcomed by a giant carpet and screen from the shining and can even take a picture in the tricycle (which is very, very cool). The theater itself is well decorated and gives you the feeling of a real old school cinema that takes movies very seriously. Upon entering the theater you are handed some water which is quite possibly the most thoughtful thing a movie theater can do instead of forcing you to pay $6 for a pop of bottled water. The theater itself is pretty standard minus the ledge in front of the seat. The seats themselves are by no means nice or comfortable, think old school stadium style seats but for what this theater is going for I actually get it.   If you are lucky enough to live near a movie theater that does all these special movie nights and plays old movies, you absolutely need to come and check it out. I really enjoyed seeing "Let the right one in" on the big screen and hope everyone keeps enjoying terror Tuesday's!

reviews.author: Alma B.
reviews.description: Ordered a pizza and loaded fries, coffee and ice tea to drink...once the drinks were empty that was it nobody came by asking if I needed a refill on either. Next time someone came by was much later and it was to drop off the check...by that time pizza was cold and no longer appealing so just left it...Alamo has a clever way of saving money with their "bottomless" beverage policy. Row 4 seats 6and7 on August 27th that server needs training possibly.

reviews.author: Abbie S.
reviews.description: I experienced some of the worst customer service last time I went here. The woman running tickets was rude and when I asked a question, she completely ignored me. I will not be coming back to this location

reviews.author: Jay H.
reviews.description: I never leave negative comments. But I feel like other parents of small children need to know about what happened at Alamo Drafthouse South Lamar after our family was kicked out of a Disney movie because of my 5-year old and they called the POLICE on us. Went with my wife and our three grade school age kids to see the Jungle Cruise last night. A kids movie. About 30-minutes into the movie the manager, MICHAEL WILCHESTER, kicked us out after he had received "complaints from multiple groups" that were upset that my 5-year old was "talking" during the movie. Talking, apparently, is when a small child is watching a kids movie and says things like "dolphins" or "frogs" or laughs when something funny happens. Kid stuff. There was three 20-something hipster wannabe ADULTS sitting to two seats away from my littlest that had already shushed a 5-year old in a kids movie (embarrassing on its own) before the incident and it was made pretty clear that the manager had received a complaint from ONE group before kicking out a family of five from a Disney movie. My wife and I are respectful people and I'd be the first to say if my little guy was being too loud and quiet him down myself. What Alamo Drafthouse did was sad, pathetic, rude, and bad business practice for a company that should want to keep families that spend money coming back despite streaming services and COVID. My wife tends to go mama bear in these situations, but in this case I was the one who lost my sh*t and I don't mind that I made a bit of a scene in the lobby (a few nice ladies came up and said the theatre were being horrible to us) after my 8-year old daughter started crying and telling the manager that she was sorry for her brother. The coward wouldn't even look at her when she spoke to him. NOT OK! Austin PD were call and complete dumbfounded by the fact that they were there over a customer service issue involving children. So Alamo Drafthouse South Lamar and Michael Wilchester like to pick on families with kids AND waste taxpayer dollars by divert public resources away from real crime. Pretty sad they felt like they needed the police to help them kick out a family of five at a movie theatre because of their own inability to do the right thing and tell the complainer adults that it's a kid at a kids move, GET OVER IT! Alamo Drafthouse is pathetic. The manager, Michael Wilchester, is pathetic. Austin PD were great guys. We will never be going back to this establishment and if you have young kids I'd think twice about going there. You've been warned. Be well, y'all.

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: A fun dinner and a movie venue. The a great job curating content before the movie pulled from various popular social media sources. The good is about what you'd expect from a movie theater...just ok-ish. The billing was also misdirected , likely because its hard to see in a dark theater.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: I've been here enough it's tIme I post a review.  :)  It's an Alamo Drafthouse.  Food, drink, movies.  Comfy seats, great digital projectors.  Unique movies and events alongside first-run hits.  Coke, popcorn with REAL BUTTER, and a few hours of entertainment.  What more could you ask for?  Oh, yeah, that south Austin vibe!  I live north and often find myself at Village or Lakeline.  It's like being in a different city, though, as the eclectic and "Austin flair" mixes well with the everyday folks coming to the movies.  We just don't get that at much up north and it's good to remember how pleasantly diverse this city is in taste and style from restaurants to neighborhoods to people.  Will I be back?  Tomorrow night - already have my ticket (go go Season Pass!!!)!

reviews.author: Texas H.
reviews.description: I went here with the kiddo for the Saturday morning cereal party. It's great ideas like this that make this place cool. I had some fruit loops and then some coco crispies. Both were tasty. Service was friendly and prompt. Price was a little high I thought for an adult to eat cereal and watch a kids show. I probably would be more inclined to go back again and be a return customer for the cereal party if adult tickets were cheaper, but it was fun for a one time thing. Cheers.

reviews.author: Jamie H.
reviews.description: Native Experience did a great job planning and executing our two day, custom tour. Michael is incredibly knowledgeable about Austin and the surrounding area. He has a lot of options that will work for any occasion. For our group we had a certain set of things we wanted to accomplish and Michael put together a custom experience for us that 100% delivered.   Michael is fun, knowledgeable and professional. He was prepared with anything we could have asked for and when we asked for an audible he was able to accommodate with zero problems.   I think it's also worth mentioning that his bus is immaculate, new and comfortable. That's a big deal when you spend a couple days traipsing around TX.   Highly recommend Michael and Native Experience for your Austin adventures.

reviews.author: Joel S.
reviews.description: Went on a four-hour Austin tour with Michael and cannot recommend highly enough. Michael - a history buff - was born in Austin and is highly knowledgeable of all things about the area. If you are in town, do yourself a favor and book a tour. Looking forward to coming back and doing a brewery tour with Native Experience soon.

reviews.author: Caitlin S.
reviews.description: Such a great experience!  We were with a large group that hired Native Experience for a full day wine tour.  Michael picked us up at our airbnb in Austin and drove us out to Fredericksburg for the day.  This was such a great alternative to staying a night in Fredericksburg because we didn't need to drive.  We went to a couple of really unique spots and had a couple of hours to explore Main Street in downtown.  It was a fully custom tour based on what our group wanted to do.  Michael really made the experience - he was a super entertaining driver and had a ton of local knowledge about the area.  I would highly recommend a tour with Native Experience and would definitely do it again.

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: Booked a river trip for a friend's birthday, and I still can't get over how easy and affordable it was!  Mike was a great guide with extensive knowledge of the area. It was so nice to not have to worry about parking or driving home. Will definitely book again for any event with travel!

reviews.author: Glenn E.
reviews.description: Michael was a great tour guide -- we got to see three breweries up close, sampled many great local beers, and had a behind the scenes tour at one of the breweries.  A fun afternoon, with personal and personable service in a clean, comfortable van.

reviews.author: Nicole P.
reviews.description: Daiquiris count me in! Small shop with a wide selection of flavors. They also have beer on tap along with a fridge section of beers, wine, ciders. It's super convenient to pop in for some refreshing alcohols.

reviews.author: spencer d.
reviews.description: Used to be my go to spot. Just down the road from me. They used to have a great selection of local craft beers, but it seems to be dwindling each day. The daiquiris are good. One thing however, most of the staff are brutal. I don't think they should be in customer service. One time the lady at the till was wearing her hoodie with the hood pulled tight the whole time. It's like buying beer from depressed teenagers. Basically get ignored until you make the payment. Not a big deal, but learning to enjoy the job might help and give your customers a better experience. Just my opinion

reviews.author: Lynn D.
reviews.description: What an awesome novelty concept! The staff here was very helpful and friendly.  SHOT SPECIALS: Tuesdays (3 for 1) and Wednesdays (2 for 1)  JELLO/GUMMIES SPECIAL: Thursdays (50% off packages).  I got at least one of each for the jello/gummies. They offered watermelon, cherry, ocean breeze, and green apple for the Jell-O shots and for the gummies - peach rings, gummy worms, gummy bears, and sour gummies. I really enjoyed all the Jell-O shot flavors and the peach ring gummies. The other gummies had either a weird texture from absorbing the alcohol or wasn't my preference.

reviews.author: Jason P.
reviews.description: Dacquiris to go. Say no more. I Bought a gallon of something with watermelon  and adouble shot tequila. That was a couple days ago and I still got it in my freezer. Good Dacquiris . Great idea for tailgating, picnics, house parties or just by yourself. I co-sign Eskimo Hut.

reviews.author: Danielle F.
reviews.description: Found this place randomly (had finished skating outdoors with friends) and their frozen alcoholic slushies are AMAZING. Super smooth not overly sweet, and really, really yummy. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Blaise B.
reviews.description: Ughhh I love this place. I'm a fool for their soaked gummies. I can't get enough! The smilies are my FAVORITE. I really enjoy their drinks as well. Perfect for a day at the pool or a fun night with friends P:

reviews.author: Christopher G.
reviews.description: This place sucks says they close at 11 pulled up at 10:30 and they were closed waste of time false advertising

reviews.author: Joseph S.
reviews.description: This place is pretty cool as in ice cool. They've got a great selection of can/bottle drinks and they've got an endless combination of slushy drinks. The only problem with this place is the frozen drinks take too long to drink. They're frozen so they don't go thru the straw as fast as I'd like. The prices are also only alright. If you go on triple shot Tuesday or double shot Wednesday it's a good deal but you could definitely get your moneys worth drinking something else. It's definitely an interesting concept but it's just a bunch of sugary slushees. This place is great if you want a slushy but if you're a real drinker you know what's up.

reviews.author: Cathy W.
reviews.description: No need to travel to the Artic for cold and frozen-Eskimo Hut has you covered! There's more flavor and color drink  combinations than you could dream up, even if it was on one of those long 6-month nights up north! And there are multiple refrigerated cases of beer and other beverages if daiquiries and pina coladas aren't your jam. It's a quick, easy, delicious stop. Parkas not required.

reviews.author: Michael D.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem for craft beer lovers in Northeast Austin. They have a wall of eight rotating taps that is as well-curated as anywhere in town. They almost always have something unusual and delicious that's hard to find on tap, like a seasonal Martin House or Lakewood Temptress variation. The prices on the draft beers are great, and there's something fun about taking a draft beer to go in a plastic pint with a straw, like a milkshake. I live within walking distance, so sometimes my wife and I will walk down there and walk back home with a beer (yes, it's legal to drink on the street in this part of town.)  They also have a really great selection of cans and bottles, ranging from IPAs to Belgians to stouts, mostly featuring Texas breweries. I've repeatedly found 6-packs there that I've never seen anywhere else.  I haven't actually tried the mixed-drink slushies, but I have bought some alcoholic gummies and jello shots when I was feeling ridiculous, and they were as good as you could expect. But really, the beer is where it's at here, IMO.

reviews.author: Lilian C.
reviews.description: Came here on a Sunday and was surprised they were open! My heroes on a much needed fun drink Sunday when all liquor stores are closed. Walked in and a friendly, smiling face greeted me. I let her know it was my first time there and Jodee behind the counter gave me the whole scoop on all their flavors and the most popular ones. She sure knows her stuff! I went ahead and asked for a blue coconut  flavored one (sorry I don't remember the name). She went ahead and quickly filled my order and I was on my way. It was just perfect for a sunny Sunday after mowing my lawn. I really got to enjoy sipping on it while I sat on my hammock during quarantine minding my own. Will definitely be coming back. Prices are reasonable, size is perfect and flavor and amount of alcohol in it is just splendid. I'm looking forward to trying the rest of their flavors!

reviews.author: Deric L.
reviews.description: There's nothing like a refreshing daiquiri after a long day in the Texas heat or any day really lol! They have so many flavors to choose from and the Jell-O shots are a treat. We come here often... the last time, I got a watermelon with the triple shot of vodka added (don't judge me). It was so good! Also try the boozy candy. The peach-oh's are my fave!

reviews.author: Verenise X.
reviews.description: They have good drinks for good prices but they need better employees. This girl had a big attitude. She kept slamming the register, was on her phone the whole entire time she was taking my order. She obviously seemed very frustrated. She didn't greet or say thank you. I wouldn't come back again. Please get better employees that want to work and actually want to take your order.

reviews.author: Scott M.
reviews.description: Tasty to-go alcoholic frozen beverages on a Sunday. Do I need to say anything else? Great service and you can add shots if you need an extra kick.  Staff is A+

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: Brand new location, newly built and I have been waiting for their opening for a very long time.  With new machines, I knew their drinks would not have that wonky flavor so many fountain drinks have with those unclean spigots. I was not disappointed!  I walked in and saw a line as I was not the only one to notice they finally opened. The gentleman taking orders was very nice and explained how the hole thing worked, considering these are alcoholic drinks to go. They have a huge variety of margarita flavors to choose from as well as some cold draft beer, a huge variety of beer in their cooler, jello shots, and gummy bear shots.  They also offer daily deals which are cheap and good.  Between the delicious drinks and awesome customer service - I will be back!

reviews.author: Malenie L.
reviews.description: Prices are reasonable and they appear to have a variety. However the frozen drinks are not that great. They don't taste good and I ended up not finishing mine. Would not recommend this place. I was expecting better tasting drinks on my Saturday night.

reviews.author: LaPeshaa C.
reviews.description: I'll make this quick and simple:  Tons of flavors to choose from!  Cheap!  Nice staff.   Extra shots only $1.50.  No nasty hangover in the morning like at other Daquiri spots.   Moes original is BOMB and pretty to look at while sipping!  5 stars. The end.

reviews.author: Quani C.
reviews.description: First, it's not a drive thru as a lot of other locations are. Now that that's out of the way, Jennie O. and I have been anxiously awaiting the opening of this place because it's conveniently located between where we live! Today just so happened to be that day!  The original plan was a pool party, but a friend's housewarming party was the reason (and the opening day, of course) for our initial visit. A brand new building, everything is shiny and clean and new! They have a solid beer selection (both on draft and in cans/bottles), including a tasty honey vanilla wheat beer that can't be found anywhere else in Austin, currently!  Oh, yeah. Frozen daiquiris. Served in cups in plastic bags for traveling. I tried the Berry Bomb (strawberry and raspberry) and I shouldn't have been surprised at the sweetness, but I felt the need to brush my teeth right away. Jennie had the PPD (strawberry, pina, and mai tai) and it was just as sweet, but had more actual/distinct flavor than mine did. They also have a variety of Jell-O shots and boozy gummy bears (all served in plastic bags, again, for traveling).  The staff is friendly and helpful. There are also a couple tables (they could maybe fit a couple more) in case you want to have your beverages in house. I think.  Long story short, Jennie and I were not disappointed. I definitely see this being a regular place for us.

reviews.author: LaShanna R.
reviews.description: I really liked this place. I ordered a medium Becky With The Good Hair (Peach and Sour Lemon favor). The cashier let us know that the drinks were 117% alcohol before adding any extra shots. I didn't add any extra because I was concerned that the alcohol taste would be to strong. Turns out the alcohol taste wasn't overpowering but the drink was strong enough! It got be pretty tipsy. :-) Not only were the drinks delicious but the atmosphere was pretty lively as well (thanks to the background music).   They have two tables set up to sit. The place is really small but hopefully they can add another table or two in the future. When I visited I sat at one of the tables and enjoyed my drink. The only thing I felt was missing was a few snacks. Maybe they can add some in the future. Overall it was a great experience and I'm ready to go back!

reviews.author: Regina F.
reviews.description: Been a fan of this spot since my oldest attended Baylor and it was the GO TO back then.  Was super excited when I reloed to Austin and found this GOLD MIND!! Will definitely be the local hot spot from now on!!

name: Haymaker
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night

reviews.author: Blair B.
reviews.description: Dom and Justin had the best service! Welcoming and great catering for to the large crowd there for gameday!   They were great at recommending drink options! Five stars for the two of them!

reviews.author: Hayden H.
reviews.description: Marvelous bar, excellent atmosphere. Foot with a higher ceiling than it reaches.  For example, their namesake "Haymaker" entree would be excellent, but someone decided to dilute and diminish that excellence with tomato and lettuce.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: While this place holds the unique position of THE #1 Austin establishment in which you are most likely to find yourself surrounded by belligerent, toxic cis dudes (I mean a specific brand of Panhellenic acolytes who casually and *very audibly* rank women as they walk past), I still on occasion like to come here if I am nearby and a friend suggests we swing by for a quick happy hour bevvie. Their happy hour is pretty great. Still, I never stay longer than an hour, because as I mentioned, it is _toxic_ bro city up in this bar, unfortunately.  As for their food, their poutine is delicious. As is their Wisconsin Wurst, and honestly most of their sandwiches are up to par. The bar staff are always kind and helpful.  I only wish the environs were a bit less nauseating.

reviews.author: Jiyoon S.
reviews.description: Super casual local neighborhood bar vibes here, nothing out of the ordinary but nothing terrible. The food can be hit or miss but you're really coming for the drink specials let's be real.   Perfect place to get a bit rowdy and a bit tipsy before heading to greener and possibly rowdier pastures

reviews.author: Nicole P.
reviews.description: Super chill and casual bar with indoor and outdoor seating. Great service and I love the cherry limeade frozen drink. Parking is a pain in the booty during peak hours but that's expected for the area.

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: Nice bar. Quiet for a Monday around 2. Our server was attentive. My rosebud drink was good and refreshing. Food was good bar food. It got warm inside. I would get the wings again and come back to try their sandwiches but we just wanted a bunch of apps.

reviews.author: Andoni S.
reviews.description: On the whole I was sadly a bit disappointed in the quality of food and experience at Haymaker.  On the experience, their mobile web UI is very dated and not fully functional: we ordered online for in-restaurant pickup, and never received a confirmation via phone or email that our order had been placed. After waiting some time, I went inside to check on our order status, and they indicated it had not been received. Slightly inconvenienced, I placed the same order again in person. A few minutes later, the server let me know that the web order had, in fact, come through, and that they were producing one order and a separate, duplicate order. I asked them to cancel the original order placed through their mobile website, but their system does not allow for reversal of web orders. I had the in-person order reversed, having encountered friction while attempting to simply place an order at several steps along the way.  On the food, their grilled chicken sandwich was substandard quality at best. The meat was rubbery, and the secondary ingredients (lettuce, tomato, pickles, bun) were of pretty transparently low quality. I'm open to giving it another shot, but the first-time experience was, all things considered, an unfortunate one.

reviews.author: Anndie K.
reviews.description: I've never had a bad experience at this place. The service is good and the beer is cold, however tonight I was eating my spinach dip (from a to go order) and bit into a STAPLE. I tried calling about it, unfortunately nobody answered. I am 7 months pregnant so this is kinda scary.

reviews.author: Emma D.
reviews.description: Haymaker is my go to spot. I come way too often, but the vibes are just too good! My friends and I will sit for hours and always have the best time. There is always tons of cute pups around, which is never a bad thing. Everyone is great, but if you get Justin or Abbey... you are in for a treat! Good options for vegetarians/vegans. The pretzel bites rock my socks. Overall, Haymaker does not disappoint.

reviews.author: Mary M.
reviews.description: Great neighborhood sports bar with a dog friendly, outdoor patio, and surprisingly good bar food. You MUST try the homemade potato chips and dip with a cold beer !

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: Pretty cool spot to hang out. Met with a couple friends to play some poker and have some beers. :)   Parking was easy since they have their own lot and you are socially distanced with other tables.  We haven't tried any of their foods, but the beer selection was good. I'd come back here again!

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Been here a couple of times pre covid and once fairly recently. Their outdoor space is a great spot to hang out and watch a game with plenty of tvs and well spaced out tables. They have reopened for indoor dining but when I went in to use the bathroom the space between fairly crowded tables was definitely too close for comfort.   In terms of food they have a pretty nice variety of out there sandwich/burger options along with typical bar fare. While I appreciate the variety I've found most of the food I've tried to be okay at best. Most recently I've tried the wings and Italian hoagie. The wings were super bready and the sauces weren't very flavorful. The roast beef and sausage on the hoagie were also both fairly bland.   They have some pretty solid drink specials (when I last went on a Tuesday all Texas beers were 3$) and compared to similar spots they have a really wide selection of options.   Overall, I think the vibe here is great and the drink deals are hard to beat. But between the less than stellar food and questionable crowd control I can't say I'd recommend coming by in the near future.

reviews.author: Xiao Z.
reviews.description: The sandwich is sooooo tasty! The cheese, turkey breast, ham, with apple slices are really good combination. And the toast was perfectly cooked, a little bit crispy. The coleslaw was also quite refreshing. Service was excellent.

reviews.author: Ryan K.
reviews.description: Such an awesome place with so many quality beers on tap. Had the Tahitian Dreamin'.... wow.  Amazing IPA!! The friendly female bartender recommended it, and it was so good I had to have 2!! Will definitely be back next time in Austin!

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Tried out this place about a week and a half ago with a friend. We were looking for somewhere to enjoy lunch on a weekday afternoon and this place enticed us because of the pool tables on the google pictures, however this was inaccurate and they didn't have any type of games.  The place looked pretty cool so we weren't all that upset about the pool table. We got seated right away and it was very much a bar setting, for those who couldn't tell. The service was honestly not great. Out waiter seemed very impatient and just ready to get off the clock. When asking about the size of the food the waiter over represented the food and it turned out really small.   Overall I wasn't very pleased with my experience and wouldn't come back given the chance.

reviews.author: Sean B.
reviews.description: This place is good for drinking and watching sports. It has a nice, big outdoor yard. So if you just want to hang out, have some drinks, and watch a game - its good for that. The problem is the food is not good. We went the other night. Three of us had hamburgers and the fourth just had poutine. He liked his poutine. The three of us with burgers - not so much.

reviews.author: Bianca J.
reviews.description: Drinks were good. I ordered the Mac and cheese - could've had ALOT more sauce as well as seasoning.

reviews.author: Silas O.
reviews.description: I think the average 3.5 star rating is accurate. I'm bumping my review up a half star because of the positive memories I've made here. The atmosphere is buzzing with social energy, and the drink selection is solid. Quality food is not the reason you visit. It's great for groups. Parking is tight though so you might have to be creative. Service was pretty good during my visits.   Pro tip: eat before you come...grab a drink here instead.

reviews.author: Mike P.
reviews.description: We came here for dinner last night as we do many nights since we live so close. I decided to try something new. I got a patty melt and it didn't come out as ordered. This obviously happens in restaurants and it wasn't a huge deal. However it was how the manager handled it that really was top notch. He went above and beyond to make sure my experience was a perfect one. He bought me a beer and was so nice. The server was great too. It's all about recovery and even my husband said that's how a manager should handle a situation when something happens. I was very impressed and of course we will be back! Thanks to haymaker for going above and beyond to ensure our visit was a fantastic one! My one suggestion is to have a wing sauce that is super spicy! I would eat there every day!  Great place.

reviews.author: Patrick D.
reviews.description: Management has hung it's staff out to dry yet again on a big soccer day.   Went in for the Euro2020 Final on Sunday early enough to get a seat. We had no issue getting our food order and first beers as it was still not packed in there 1.5hrs priort to game time. But low and behold, as soon as we ordered our pitcher about 15-20min before game time we essentially stopped getting any drinks and had to go up to the bar ourselves to get them. This wasn't our waitresses fault as the bar staff was so backed up and the entire place was packed shoulder to shoulder with people probably doubling what the fire code actually allows in there.  When I finally fought through the crowd and went up to the bar, during the second half, I had to bring with me my empty pitcher as they had apparently ran out of ones to use. (Ours was empty for about an hour on our table). I started out about four people deep when I got up to the bar and first thing I saw was a bartender pull about 35-40 tickets off the machine from orders that were rang in. (That also happened the next time I came up). That's how I know it wasn't the staffs problem. They were set up for failure by being overwhelmed with people. Haymaker NEVER has someone making sure they don't go over capacity, so it's just a free for all of people.   I honestly have been just a handful of times in the past seven years since the Fire Marshall shut the place down during the USA/Portugal World Cup game in 2014. And they kicked me and my friends out from our table despite getting there 6+hrs prior to game time and going through a shift change. It's amazing they don't get shut down every big soccer match. Thought maybe they'd learned their lesson but clearly they haven't.  Gave it two stars because the wings were good and our server did what she could. Management just sucks so bad. All you need is some form of a doorman to keep this place from getting out of control. That's it, but they won't do it. So the experience sucks.

name: Austin Taco Project
accommodations: Good for Dinner, Late Night, Dessert
Valet Parking, Garage Parking, Street Parking
Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Seo Youn C.
reviews.description: Admittedly I came here on New Years Eve for some late night munchies before the countdown, not knowing this joint was part of the Hilton Hotel. That explains why the prices were slightly high when tacos are ubiquitous in Texas.   The fish taco was actually really good. I think they might have been a close tie for tacos I've had on my Texas trip. However the old school tacos were kind of boring and a little difficult to eat because they were getting soggy.
